review_body: Excellent Hotel. Clean rooms and quality staff. Attentive and appreciative of my patronage. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends. I will consider them for my next trip to Hawaii.

The room was spacious, clean, and the view was amazing. The staff was astounding. The in room safe didn’t work so that was fixed immediately. My husband was ill and needed a special menu and Tara from the front desk sent upa microwave and checked up on him afterwards to see if he needed anything. Jovita from housekeeping was solid. She did an awesome job and we we returned from a day out the room was impeccable. Ben Hur from food service remembered us from last summer and also sent upA bottle of champagne because we were celebrating our 22nd anniversary. Valet was always professional and greeted us daily. Ihab also made sure to say hello and made sure we were okay. GENERALLY THE STAFF IS TOP NOTCH AND THIS IS WHY WE RETURN. The food was plentiful and there were many choices. We loved the fresh fruit. The food areas were kept clean as well as the dining tables.

Fantastic aloha hospitality by the Hyatt. Even with the corona induced lockdowns, the hotel is well kept, and the staff attentive to the guests needs.Rooms are immaculate, as is the lobby. Friendly staff attend the bar for food and drink, which enhance the visit, as most venues are closed.The GM, Mr. Kherati, is doing a great job leading his staff and facility in providing a great product and service.

Our house recently flooded and we were displaced during the covid-19 epidemic. This stay went above and beyond cleaning to hotel and provided service that exceeded all exspectations. We were treated like family.

My room was not that small like some hotels in Honolulu. However, everything was tired and sad, with the dim lights and grim color. The bedsheet had a hole ; the cleaning staff brought new linens later; but this showed the level of service in this hotel. There was a balcony but there was not much to see, since the hotel and the room I got was cramped among the surrounding buildings. The staff are OK. I don't see some special appreciation for local Hawaii residents.

I will start off with how wonderful and kind the staff are. Any questions while you are at the hotel and they assist you immediately.Cons:-Our first room stunk horribly of mould and mildew. You could smell it the very second you opened the door. I waited it out for a few hours hoping the room was just stuffy from being closed up and I opened the balcony door but it became clear it was unhealthy mould and mildew. I couldn’t even stand to be in the room it smelt that heavily.-The rooms are quite small-Balconies are tiny, it fits only the metal chair.-Floors are quite slippery. I stepped onto the elevator on my second day there and have ended up quite banged up with swollen and bruised knees and broken phone. So be careful walking through as their surfaces are quite smooth. (I was wearing new shoes with a lot of grip on them)- 8 days after check out they are still yet to release the money back into my account that they put a hold on at check in. My bank is now getting involved as contact with Hyatt has not resolved the issue.Pros:-Decent location right near the beach and zoo.-At the top end of the main shopping strip and plenty of places to eat.- Our second room was very clean- Staff are very friendly and always up for a chat when they see you- Laundry services are available - Staff readily fix problems and help with questions (when at the hotel, not once home)- 2 small shops and a dominos within the hotel - early check in and late check out available which helped us tremendously.- bar within the hotel- Pets are allowed. It was great seeing pets walking about every day with their owners.All in all, this place had both its ups and downs.Dependant on the cost of the room and type of room I might stay here again, but there are also other places I have stayed in Hawaii of which I thoroughly enjoy. But I would not rule out Hyatt Place.

A very nice hotel. We spent a week there. We enjoyed ourselves there. Breakfast was awesome. But be awareof the birds in the breakfast area. It was nice to have the use of beach chairs. My spouse enjoyed making lei in the lobby on Friday.

Very friendly and accommodating staff. Especially during the covid19, they made sure to keep us aware of the measures they were taking to ensure staff and guests’ safety and health. Beach is right down the street so you can literally watch a beautiful sunset everyday and walk back to your hotel in 2 minutes. Beds are super comfy and warm, I didn’t want to get up, but they offered breakfast also so that was enough motivation. Breakfast was delicious, and they have rice, which I would recommend, I think it’s infused with coconut. Can’t say enough good things about Hyatt Place, 10/10 would recommend staying here while in Honolulu. It’s a great place to rest and close to the freeways if you want to venture out to the other parts of Oahu.

Great location, only 1 block from the beach. 1 block from the zoo. I would consider this location on the very edge of “downtown Waikiki.” Only about 1 block to the right is where all the shops & restaurants start, and 1 block to the left is the zoo and then pretty much nothing else until you reach Dimond Head. But we never felt like we were out downtown, just a breath away from all the crowds on that main strip. Prefect balance. From our “city view” room, to the left we could see a sliver of the water with surfers in it between two buildings and to the right in the distance we could see a mountain. Free breakfast was great. Alternating some offerings (1 day bacon, the next sausage, 1 day zucchini spice bread, the next banana yogurt bread...), but always: cereal, amazing home style potatoes, eggs (scrambled & hard), toast, rolls. The BEST orange juice I’ve ever had, also apple, grapefruit, milks. Each day they gave us a $5 room credit to use at our will. Nice treat to use at the lobby Starbucks for snacks. Can check our free and depending on availability beach chairs, and they have plenty beach towels. Staff is very nice. ONLY Con: like in other reviews — elevators are extremely slow. Would definitely stay here again.

I had to go to Honolulu because of a medical situation with my daughter. The employees at the Hyatt place knew about my visit and made sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. Ihab ,the general manager, gave me a great room. It could not have been more comfortable. Or more convenient. Angeline, Tara and Aja at the front desk made sure to help if I needed anything. And Nick and Lisa at the front bar were wonderful, both to me and my daughter. A wonderful place to chat after a long day. I can not recommend this hotel more highly. They made a very difficult situation much easier.

Unless you're above the 15th floor, the only view is the other tower and right into someone else's bedroom - literally. Plus, the pool is on the 3rd floor roof, right below the "mountain view" rooms - which tends to get loud at night with teenagers. Breakfast was good the first couple of mornings, but you get tired of eating the same stuff every day in the rain - oh, the breakfast seating area is outside - and it rains in Waikiki - a lot. The staff was courteous, but it took over 5 hours to get the room feather free due to a severe allergy - my husband finally took all the bedding and dropped it off at the front desk before we finally were given a scratchy blanket and hard, foam pillows. I'll take partial blame for this as I didn't call ahead like I usually do. After the first night of pool-side shenanigans, the staff moved me from the 5th floor to the 14th to get away from the noise - still no view, found out the noise echos up the side of the building. On the plus side of the move, we received real feather-free pillows and a nice bed covering. I will say that the beds are extremely confortable and the rooms are a good size for extended stay - no microwave though. On a whole, the location was great - on the far side of Waikiki - but there's a lot of traffic noise all hours of the day and night.

I recently stayed at this hotel with my mom, who came to visit me while I am taking chemo treatments. It was not a planned trip, as my mom is widowed and on a fixed income. I frequent the bar in this hotel because I live quite close, and it’s convenient, clean, and the staff is overly accommodating. Thus my decision to have my mom stay here. I spoke to the GM, Ihab, who was able to give my mom a fantastic rate, the best room in the hotel, PLUS, VIP treatment from himself and his staff!  Check in was a breeze with Tara, who was super nice, and a lei from Heidi! Along the way to the room, mom was greeted by Aja, Angeline, Kat, Lisa, and then we moved to the bar where we were greeted by Nick! Nick made sure we had ANYTHING we needed every day that we saw him, and always made sure to acknowledge us on our way in or out! It was quite the friendly welcome from all! Each person made sure to say something to my mom on her way thru the lobby! The room was much more than what we were expecting! A nice sectional sofa, and a king size bed, a giant Lanai, and a walk in shower! Fantastic! Fruit, water and juice were also waiting for us! We also had a ninja housekeeper, I believe her name was Geraldine. She came to clean the room while we were still there, so we sat on the Lanai and let her do her thing, and next thing you know, we look up and she’s saying goodbye, and to have a great day! Like she snapped her fingers and it was clean! Sheets and all! I’d give this stay a 10/10. For a hotel that isn’t quite on the beach, only a half block away, it’s a great place to stay if you want a clean room, and a friendly staff from the GM, the AGM, Melanie, all the way down! Thank you so much, it was nice to have my mom here during this crappy time in my life! You all made it feel like a vacation for us! Aloha!

Came up from Texas for Spring Break, and spent 3 nights in Honolulu and 4 nights in Kauai. We choose the Hyatt at Waikki based on the location and the cost. Pleasantly surprised on how close the hotel is located to the Beach, about 1 short block. The rooms were nice, large enough with comfortable beds. The bathrooms were well equipped and functional. We enjoyed the open air lobby where you could set and enjoy breeze while being protected from the elements. The daily breakfast buffet was ok and served its purpose with coffee, juices and basic breakfast staples. The breakfast buffet was located outside by the pool on the 3rd floor, which was also nice to eat outside in the fresh air; however the winds at times could be challange. The front desk stayed on top of things and made both our check in and out easy. We had no surprised with our final bill.

Staff was very nice and accommodating. But esp the new tower does not have enough elevators so people usually have to wait for 5- sometimes 10 mins for it. They even tell you what times are horrible wait on a pc of paper in the room. Property targets student groups, so it’s super rowdy.

Aloha! Loved our stay! Great location and awesome staff, from the front desk, the bar, and hospitality. Also, really enjoyed all the choices at breakfast. And oh the Mai Tai’s really hit the spot! Mahalo!

We had our 3 kids and the room was super -comfortable and quiet. Really enjoyed staying here. Great location - kids loved that Dominos pizza was down stairs. Beds/pillows are very comfortable, which is key for my aging body.

We stayed here for 6 nights. Our flight was delayed by a day and we had no problems with the front desk arranging for our arrival the next night. Check-in was quick and the gentleman who assisted us waived the resort fee for the first night, which we really appreciated. The hotel was a short walk to the beach, with an ABC store and Waikiki Trolley stop along the way. We were able to walk to many restaurants along Kalakaua and Kuhio, or when we didn't feel like walking, we took the trolley (using a four-day unlimited ride pass). Housekeeping kept our room clean (aside from a candy wrapper near the bed that was there before we arrived and remained there for the duration - no biggie though). We had a city view room, but actually had partial ocean views, which was a nice bonus! Good selection for breakfast (scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage depending on the day, toast, fruit, cereal, rice, miso soup etc.). This was great as it allowed us to start our day without having to finding a place to eat at first. You can choose to eat outside by the pool or bring your breakfast back to your room. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful and we wouldn't hesitate staying here again. Thank you for a great stay!

We had only a one night stay at this hotel prior to moving to a one bedroom condo nearby.The girls at the front desk were a delight and were most helpful when we needed them.We booked a king oceanview room with a balcony. Balcony was super small but we did have distant ocean views.The king bed was comfortable and whilst the room was on the small side it was quite adequate. It is was also dated but was very functional.Breakfast was included but there are not many hot dish options. The breakfast hot dishes were only scrambled eggs, sausages, potato dish and pancakes. Whilst there is not a lot the hotel can do the birds are a real nuisance and swoop on your leftovers of food once you leave. Breakfast is mostly outdoor so can be a concern in bad weather. We experienced a very windy morning so food was getting blown around.Location is really good and it’s not far from most places along the Waikiki strip. We regularly walked from the hotel to places of interest. We found a great food truck selling empanadas in the side street to the hotel where there are other food trucks as well.The hotel is a reasonable option but the lobby could be made more inviting and the rooms require some updating.

We have stayed here many times, the customer service is exceptional. Our room was beautiful, spacious and clean, with a nice comfy king sized bed. Breakfast is always fresh and good. I would recommend this hotel. We have never had a bad experience here.

Enjoyed our stay and time spent at the hotel. Room was clean and staff was very friendly. We had a beach view and enjoyed it every day. Breakfast is available and had wonderful options. I wouldnt hestiate to stay here again.

the staff was friendly and the location was great for all the attractions that we went to (beach, pearl harbor, airport, diamond head, and downtown restaurants)we were comped a bottle of champagne for our honeymoon which was above and beyond what we expected.

You can't get a better location. The beach is right there and you are in the best part of Honululu. We had a great time! And the breakfast is stellar.... The best I've had as a hotel continental! We would return in a ❤️ beat!

Staff were super helpful and welcoming. The breakfast has lots of variety and it is better than I expected. The property is not on the beach but very close. We enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is the best hotel. Been coming to this location for 35 yeRs. It was Quality Inn, Ocean Resort, now Hyatt Place. The staff is unbelievable, rooms cleaned everyday. Our housekeeper Lei is the best. She makes sure our room is cleaned by 9 AM every day. We give her a score of 100%. The entire staff has the Aloha Spirit very friendly. They have an awesome GM

Best value for families staying in Waikiki. They have spacious rooms with descent views. The included breakfasts are great for starting your day to the beach and not having to decide where to eat with many food options. They provide beach towels and some beach accessories for your short walk to the beach. Best of all the staff is very friendly and especially Cathie at the front check in.

I really want to give this hotel a 4 but it’s so outdated for a Hyatt. And I had a disgusting situation with my bathroom that I was never able to even have addressed because of the constant busy front desk, which is no fault of the folks there. I took care of it myself with sanitizing wipes because I did not want to wait forever for maid service with fecal matter all over a toilet I needed to use. When talking to others who have stayed at this hotel several times it appears to be normal to have a constant stream of large groups so it would seem wise to have more front desk staff to deal with this. All and all we had a quiet room and the best view you can get at this hotel which isn’t much of one. We liked the location and because we are loyal to Hyatt and not real interested in staying right in the middle of Waikiki we would probably return. When we could interact with staff they were lovely.

Stopped in Honolulu on the way to Auckland. Friends recommend the hotel. It did not disappoint. Our room faced the ocean. Spacious and clean. Free breakfast buffet by the pool each morning. Good selection including eggs, cereals, fruit and pastries. Enjoyed the coffee. Very helpful staff.

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach has amazing staff and amenities. No need to buy boogie boards, beach towels, or snorkel gear; the hotel provides that all for you. Hosts are amazingly friendly. I’m returning next year for sure.

I had booked this accommodation thinking that the service would be better than a lower star rating, how foolish am I for thinking this. I thought that I would help the room service lady one morning by taking our dirty towels out to her and she snapped at me and said 'do you mind waiting'. What for? I was only taking dirty towels and putting them in the linen bag.

This hotel is a great place to escape the busy beachfront when you want a break, while being within a 5 minute walk to all Waikiki has to offer. The view of the volcano from our room was really spectacular and all staff were very welcoming.

Breakfast in Hyatt Pace Waikik Beach is included. But the place is always crowded, even at 6.30 am. Very basic. It feels like in a canteen and it's mainly outside on 3rd floor. No fun if weather is bad.

We stay for 1 week in this hotel and everything was great, their renovated rooms was big and really nice. You are close to the beach, they give you towels and other stuff you meed for the day. Service was great. And our stay was really nice

The view was amazing in that room and I guess it was the same for the other one up and down. The room was clean but the sofa/bed gave me red dots on my skin I dont know if it was du to the cleaness of it or something elle.

I just recently stayed at this property for the 3rd or 4th time. I have each time been either upgraded or given a late check out or hospitality room every time. Each visit I have had the pleasure of encountering some of the nicest customer service people ever! On this visit I was greeted by Eloisa at the front desk she was very professional and also very kind (yes they can go hand in hand!) She checked us in and even though I was using a free night and points, she didn't treat us any differently and even fixed our reservation so that is was a seamless stay! On my check out, I was offered an extension of a few hours without even asking! (Thanks Angeline!) All the employees that I encountered were friendly and professional. As for the rooms I am familiar with this property and know the rooms usually have a couch and sitting area aside from the bed (it is a small area but nice none the less) they have a complimentary breakfast which for people like me is a plus to grab something before I take off for the day. The pool is small and there is no hot tub but this is not what I stay there for. The location which is near the Zoo is my preference, I find it easy to get around from there. I personally love this property and would not stay in one of the more centrally located and busy properties. It's definitely a solid property and the employees make it 5 star for me!!!

Great hotel. Good location. Just a couple of blocks from beach. Clean spacious rooms. Loved the "Green" program which gave us $10 per day to use in the cafe. Staff was nice and friendly. Hot breakfast daily. Would stay again if in the area.

This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The amenities are great with access to beach towels, chairs, bar, breakfast (awesome), and close to the beach - it's all there. Definitely try the 'mango lava flow' at the in-house bar, it's the best! There is a food truck next door that sells New York style pizza and it is the real deal and so good. Highlights at this hotel are two hosts that made our stay extra special. Tara, who helped us extend our stay. She was very friendly, fun, knowledgable and great to talk to. The other host is Julie, who was based on the fifth floor and who serviced our room daily. Julie was amazing, she would greet us every morning with a big smile and a happy 'aloha'. Julie had a magnificent way of making us feel welcomed, acknowledged and valued. Thank you, Hyatt Place, we had a great stay and we'll definitely stay again.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki from 1/31 through 2/9/2020, and we thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our vacation.From the easy check in, through the easy check out, the front desk staff were outstanding (especially Aoi) andthe staff at the concierge desk were also very helpful.It is a quick and easy 2 block walk to the beach, many restaurants in easy walking distance. Be sure to take advantage of the fantastic breakfast every morning, always full, fresh, and good selections. They provide beach chairs and towels, just check them back in every day. Walking distance to the Honolulu zoo, Diamondhead is a $10 uber ride. We also got a great deal on Pearl Harbor, I don't feel like we missed a thing! Don't forget to allow time for the sunset pictures, absolutely stunning views every night.If we ever come back,( it is a long flight from Iowa!) We would not hesitate to come back to Hyatt Place Waikiki!MAHALO!

We just want to thank the Hyatt Place staff for our stay, everything was wonderful. The people at the front desk, the car staff, the breakfast staff, the cleaning lady, you guys were all amazing. We are planning a second trip for later on in the year, we will definitely be coming back. Thank you again

We were welcomed by excellent staff. Cathie was very warm and informative. She even sent us a personalized message later to make sure we had everything we needed. Additionally, as my partner and I are celebrating my birthday, Cathie sent a bottle of wine and beers to the room on the house. My partner said she was the “best check in staff I have ever worked with.”

Great hotel and valet, very close to beach and shops and zoo! Breakfast was extremely crowded and difficult to get to at times but it was expected for size of hotel. Would stay again at this hotel if we come back to Waikiki!

This was my families first time visiting Oahu and we did not know what to expect from the hotels. I did a lot of research on location, room size, and dining experience. Hyatt Place did not disappoint. The staff was a amazing and the location was perfectly located in the middle of everything within a reasonable walking distance. Loved sitting in the open air lobby and having an evening meal and drinks. The rooms were a good size that fit four adults very comfortably. I can not say enough about the free breakfast every morning, it was so good and the menu changed every day. Breakfast set the tone everyday, we could not get enough if the fresh fruit and selections, that alone would make us return to this hotel. It was the best choice that made our stay extra special.

Great location. Just 20 minutes from the airport and located just two minutes walk to the main street of Waikiki (Kalakaua avenue waikiki).The staff were all friendly and helpful. The room was large and clean.The bed was comfortable.

Nothing special. Small rooms with old fashioned wall AC unit. Windblown terrace for breakfast. Laundry room small with half of machines not working. Clothes came out with sand all over them. Hotel located healthy walk from heart of Waikiki. Maybe Hyatt Centric would have been better location.

Really close to the beach, shopping, and restaurants of all price points. Friendly staff, solid breakfast, and lots of handy amenities like beach towel, chair, and boogie board loans (for free), and a bottle-filling station in the lobby. I'd stay there again if I were to return to Oahu.

We went for a family vacation and stayed 5 days with the property.The Manager Ihab is wonderful, very kind and friendly to all his guests.He takes care of all the guests very nicely and makes sure the stay is great.The staff is very friendly and wonderful. The two staff members Aoi from front desk and Adelma from housekeeping are great.

We had a lovely room, looking out on the ocean. Breakfast was fantastic. Employees were not only helpful, but extremely accommodating and friendly. Adelma was our housekeeper and she did a beautiful job. She was cheerful and accommodated her cleaning to our schedule. We really appreciated her. Getting taxies for us was so quick. We were near the great zoo, the beach, the bandstand (for a Hawaii State Band Concert), and not too far from Diamond Head for a great hike! Thanks to everyone.We were with a Road Scholar Tour - great choice!

The attentiveness of the staff and willingness to help was beyond my expectations. How many times have you traveled and have the front desk person ensure you got the right meal and then bring your luggage to you in the eating area? How many times has the front desk take your phone and figure out why you can't order Lyft for a pickup? I was blown away by both of these things happening. It was a great experience - mainly because of the customer service!

Hotel was recently renovated on the inside and felt and looked nice. Was charged a daily resort fee for minimal services being offered in exchange, i.e. some classes under resort fee were only offered once a week, and only real service offered was use of beach towels, which at price charged could've just bought beach towels. Would stay again in a pinch but plan to stay at Regency for next stay.

This a very good hotel with one of the nicest and most pleasant staffs of any place I have stayed. The room was of a good size with a comfortable bed. The location was only two blocks from Waikiki beach and convienient to dining and shopping. They provided beach towels at reception and the staff helped with any requests we had. I recommend this hotel to anyone and the price was favorable compared with other hotel options in the area. The breakfast is good with options for all tastes. The only negative we had was a lack of an in-house restaurant, only a Dominos.

My husband and I just went to Hawaii for the very first time and stayed here. This location is walking distance to the beach and the staff was extremely friendly. The breakfast included was much better than anticipated and overall the hotel was great. The only downside is that it smells a little musty in the rooms.

Everything was great! Customer service was amazing! The breakfast and staff were great as well. We had a great time! Will definitely be coming back! The hotel was walking distance from the beach and our room view was great!

Loved, loved, loved our stay here. The breakfast quality was over the top for quality. A perfect variety to please every culture. Not such a huge hotel that takes you for ever to get around. They are well staffed to accommodate any requests without a wait. The location was perfect for us. You won't go wrong by choosing this hotel. If we get back to Honolulu this is where we'll stay.

Clean room, comfortable beds, very good breakfast selection, attentive and helpful staff. Hotel provided towel, snorkeling mask and chairs for our time in the beach. 1 negative: limited # of elevators

The staff was competent, friendly, and very helpful. The decor is welcoming and soothing, making it great for visitors of all ages. The breakfasts were great, especially the Kalua Pork and Cabbage! Rooms were clean and the bed was terrific. Location at the Diamond Head side of Waikiki is prettier and quieter than the middle or ewa end of Waikiki, located a block from the zoo, close to the beach, Kapahulu Avenue, and bus stops on Kuhio. My husband and I had a terrific time here on this visit!

My partner and I stayed at the Hyatt Place for one night while transiting through Honolulu on our way from Portland, OR to Auckland, New Zealand. We used a World of Hyatt Category 1-4 free night certificate to “pay” for the room. As such, the Hyatt served its purpose well. We had a little less than 24 hours to enjoy the Hyatt and Waikiki Beach, but a good portion of our time was spent in traffic getting from the airport to the hotel. All we really had time to do was have dinner, sleep, and walk around Waikiki Beach a little.Pluses:1. Good location close to the beach but, otherwise, surrounded by much taller hotel towers that blocked views.2. Very spacious room furnished in the usual minimalist, contemporary Hyatt Place style. Minuses:1. As is probably typical for most Honolulu hotels, the Hyatt Place is VERY busy. At times the public areas seem like an airport terminal, buzzing with frenetic energy. This is not a calm, relaxing environment.2. Complimentary breakfast wasn’t as distinctive as other Hyatt Place breakfasts I’ve experienced. There were the usual eggs, breakfast meats, etc. but a paucity of cereals, baked goods and fresh fruit. 3. The fitness room was larger than I’ve seen in other Hyatt Place properties, but several treadmills and ellipticals were not functioning. It was also very busy in the morning, and I suspect maintenance of the equipment is not keeping up with high usage. 4. The in-room HVAC system is very noisy. Fortunately, opening the patio sliding door provides ventilation. Unfortunately, street noise is considerable even into the late evening hours.I’m a big fan of Hyatt Place hotels, in general. Most have a contemporary sense of style and design; however, the building in which this Hyatt Place is located is definitely dated. I would hesitate to make this the base for a Waikiki visit of more than a night or two.

We stayed at the Wakiki Hyatt Place for 10 days and were amazed by the staff that were so helpful and went out of their way to make us feel at home! Lisa, Saya, Tara and Angeline stand out the most as outstanding hosts! They would go out of their way to help us with restaurant choices and things to do. Lisa even helped us with the bus stop schedule as we had mentioned we sat at the wrong bus stop for an hour. We were very happy with how helpful she was. Lisa was AWESOME!!! The rooms were clean the breakfast was great and we will return next year!

The hotel is a short walk to the beach. The zoo is one block over. Shopping and restaurants are all close by. Hotel staff are all very friendly and are eager to help with everything you need. The room is small but cost. Elevators are slow but no big deal. I will absolutely stay here again and will recommend this hotel.

Great location and amazing staff. Location is perfect, very close to the beach. Breakfast is very convenient and yummy. Perfect hotel for vacation or business trips. Very family friendly. The staff is always welcoming and polite.

Room was perfect. Bed/pillows were so comfortable. Great having breakfast included.If u r travelling with a larger group, would be better to look at booking a condominium. Such as at the Waikiki banyan

Honest review. I’m going to start with the positive:The staff were very friendly and attentive, always greeting us in the hallway and even gifted us a miniature bottle of champagne as we were celebrating our anniversary. The beds were super comfortable and the breakfast was very good with lots of options. We had an ocean view king room and once you got passed the apartments in the way, the ocean was beautiful. Onto the other side of the spectrum:The hotel was going through some sort of room key upgrade and we had to return our keys on three separate occasions, one time someone was at the door of our room with some sort of device and turns out our key was “expired” and we had been locked out. They did give us a $10 credit two different times for the inconvenience but that brings me to the next downside, their elevators are terribly slow. Normally this doesn’t sound like an issue and we have no problem taking the stairs but when you are on the 14th floor and have to keep going back to the front desk for a new key it starts to get frustrating. There were three elevators and I think only two were in service which was by both staff and customers. Also, their main floor washrooms were out of service during our stay which wasn’t favourable.Overall, I thought it was way overpriced for what you get as the room we were in was quite tiny and the “balcony” left something to be desired. There is no hot tub and the pool is very small. I wouldn’t stay spend another anniversary here again but perhaps it might work out better for you.

The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is great. The location of the hotel is close to the beach and the bus. This was our third time to stay at this hotel. We would return here on our next visit to Hawaii.
user_name:
Neil Bruce R
Independence, United States

review_body: This hotel is less than one block from Waikiki Beach with easy access to the beach and the main street. And at a reasonable price including breakfast. The breakfast was complete with all the hot and cold entrees one would hope to see.

The hotel was centrally located. Easy to walk to beach and stores. Easy to get bus or trolley if you it's too far to walk. The concierge was very helpful in arranging the excursions we wanted to do. The breakfast had a big variety .

This hotel was in the lower price range and for a reason: The pool is small and was out of service one day. There is very little lounging area around the pool. The one day I had a drink at the bar (Gin Tonic) the Tonic was flat. The staff seemed pleasant. The hotel is in need of renovation. Our room was very small. Thankfully we were on the fifth floor as the elevators seemed not all to be working. As we couldn't get a late checkout, we rented a room for the day at the Marriott across the street. It was more money but in hind site we wished we would have upped the budget and stayed there.

We are a family of 4 and we had an amazing time in Hawaii thanks to our stay at the Hyatt Place! Check-in and out was so smooth and easy! We received a complementary upgrade upon arrival for one of our rooms! Staff at the desk were so helpful all the time and answered all of our questions. The Breakfast was really good and they had so many options. Staff serving breakfast were running around keeping the place clean and full with food! The hotel was extremely clean thanks to their nice housekeeping amazing staff. Both our rooms were on the second and sixth floors, and housekeeping staff were kind and professional especially Adelma who worked on the sixth floor and always took care of our room! Location wise the hotel is just perfect! Very close to the beach, restaurants, and a parking garage (if you are renting a car). We enjoyed the location because it was an easy in and out everyday. Their food is also really good and we order a few times from the hotel kitchen and we were really impressed with how good the food was! I really cannot think of any cons from our stay at this place. Everything we needed and wanted was put in place for us. All the staff went on and beyond and what we loved the most was how cheerful everyone at the hotel was. Not sure when we will be returning back to Hawaii but if we ever do it will be at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach!

We have had numerous stays at The Hyatt Place Waikiki and the service is always at a very high level. Special shout out to Aja and Nik who are a couple of the staff that work the lobby bar at Happy Hour.We usually arrive with a group of 12 and they are both friendly and professional in dealing with our group of seasoned travellers.

My Birthday Week was Here... I Had a Wonderful Time! The Staff Went out of Their Way to Make My Stay Excellent and I Am Thankful! I Also Had the Pleasure of Doing their Christmas Statement Tree in the Lobby!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel after the first one we stayed at did not work out for us. The ocean front room was beautiful and watching the sunset every night was a treat, the first night we seen the green flash right when the sunset.Restaurants and shopping are all with in walking distance. Looking forward to our next stay.

The rooms are large and amazing. It is beautiful and fun. It has a beautiful lobby and so much to do. This place is near the beach but still in the city. There are lots of things to do and there are amazing places around Hyatt Place. There is also a great view from the higher rooms. Over all this place is amazing.

Pros:- Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating- $5 credit for food and drink daily- Free breakfast every morning (great food and lots of selection)- Beach chairs and towels provided- Very close to beach and ABC storesCons:- Seems like a very old building- Rooms are kind of small and smell a bit too perfumey/bathroomy- The view for floors 4 and under have almost no view- Elevators are horrible and slow (you better use the stairs if you don't want to wait in the morning because you usually have to wait for the second round of elevators; even worse when checking in)Extra comment:- Housekeeping is sort of on a weird schedule, 10am - 4pm. It's inconvenient in the sense that if you leave in the morning and come back in the afternoon, it may/may not be cleaned which may lead to it being rescheduled because you're in the room. Don't get me wrong though, it's very convenient to reschedule the housekeeping and they do a great job. First world problems I guess...

Firstly, this hotel is in a great location - close enough to walk to the shops and restaurants along Waikiki but far enough to be out of the noise; 1 block away from the beach where there is a walled off section, great for families with young kids.The hotel staff were very accommodative when our flight was delayed 15 hours, providing us with a late checkout so our 18 month old daughter could have her sleep and also a room for 30minutes prior to our taxi to freshen up - all free of charge!Room was big and very clean. All the staff were also very very friendly and helpful.Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Nice location, free breakfast, comfortable rooms. I have stayed there many times. They always have good service. It's has easy access to the beach. I would recommend it for the someone looking for a nice hotel, reasonably priced, and in a good location.

Elle did a phenomenal job taking care of our requests. There is ample seating for breakfast and the location is excellent, especially if you are looking to day trip to various spots on Oahu. The complimentary items that are available from the front desk, such as beach chairs, helps with cost and time savings.

Friendly staff, great location, spacious room. Nice breakfast buffet. Would recommend and stay again. Clean and comfortable. Quiet . Complimentary beach chairs and towels. Waikiki beach was across the street.

We had a great time at Hyatt Place and the rooms were updated. The Hyatt Place is an older building but it was well maintained. The staff makes you feel like family. It's a great locationwith buses at each corner.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Everyone was very friendly and tried (within reason) to accommodate our requests for things like early check-in (coming in off a red-eye), etc. Breakfast was very good for this hotel class (not a huge buffet like at a full service hotel, but definitely better than, say, breakfast at a hampton inn). Lots of tour groups from Korea and Japan - so the breakfast includes kimchee and miso with tofu (as well as eggs, potatoes, breakfast meat/sausage, cereal, bread, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea etc). Pool area is small but the hotel is just a few blocks from the beach. Some upper floors have a view of the water but overall this is not right on the beach (just a few blocks away though). Lots of families here. Rooms are medium size with a mini fridge. Overall, casual, clean and very friendly. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.Parking at the Banyan condo building across the street is only $20 per 24 hour period.

Great vacation with perfect location to beach, restaurants, and local stores. Can't wait to return. Best hotel breakfast. Because the bus stop is in front of hotel easy travel from airport and abc store near so if you forget anything or just need water a few feet away.

The hotel is in an ideal location to nearby walking paths and within 1 1/2 blocks to the beach. We enjoyed the quieter end of Waikiki strip with several restaurants in walking distances. The staff are all very friendly and very accommodating. The breakfast has nice selection of food, including fresh pineapple each morning. The only item to know is that at peak times, the elevators can be somewhat slow.

Great location if you want close to the beach, free towels and chair to bring with you to the beach, 5 minute walk, good and free breakfast, clean room, really good front desk service. Close to all the action, eateries and shopping.

The location is excellent. Our Shuttle bus dropped us in front of the hotel. The city bus stop is crossed a street. We went to Ala Moana Center, Art Museums, and the Palace. We walked to the Waikiki beach, zoo and aquarium on food. So many good restaurants and shops near by. Breakfast is good. Fresh fruits, meats, and sweet breads are all tasty. We will be back for sure.

This hotel is perfect! The location is great. They offer a wonderful breakfast every day. The value is phenomenal and the staff members are all so eager to help and full of Aloha! Great for families or business. You’ll be very satisfied with your choice of staying here.

Wonderful (businesss-related) visit to Hyatt Place Waikiki. The hotel was squeaky clean, well maintained and very safe. Less that 5 minutes to the beach and excellent restaurants. 'Looking forward to my next visit.

We were welcomed immediately and they offered to keep our luggage till our room was ready. Breakfast was included. Food was plentiful and good, but staff were running late in replenishing plates, glasses and forks. The hotel provided beach chairs and towels, $5 credit towards snacks each day and the staff was always very helpful and pleasant. They also held our luggage after we checked out till we were ready to head for the airport.

Hyatt Place is the place to stay. Easy access to the beach with ALL the amenities you desire! EVERY staff member greets you with a smile and an Aloha! All details have been taken care of at Hyatt Place!

It's right by the beach and the strip with great restaurants. If you're too lazy there's a Domino's pizza downstairs that's great. Super outdoor patio breakfast buffet. Helpful staff and comfy rooms. HP Waikiki rocks!

Bad breakfast. Long waits for elevator. Had to reprogram room key everyday. Paid for full ocean view but got partial view. Will never stay again. Size of the rooms was the only good thing about this hotel. Washrooms were small. No one told us about free amenities, we found out from another guest.

The location of this hotel is perfect, just a block away from the beach. Daily breakfast, which I really liked. Had lots of options. Pastries, fresh fruit, hot food, oatmeal, yogurt, cereal, coffee, and a small Asian food area. The room was small, but perfect for just me and my husband. My parents and 2 sisters stayed in a 2 queen room, the only complaint there is that the small A.C. seemed to take a very long time to cool their room. Front desk staff was great! There is a Dominos downstairs, but the wait for a pizza was over an hour! I would recommend this hotel to my family going with kids as the free breakfast is definitely a money saver! Also, they will lend you beach chairs and beach toys for the kids!

The staff go out of their way to accommodate their guests. You’re always greeted by the staff in the hallways, elevators...besides just the front desk. The front desk staff are very detailed in explaining the property and it’s services.

Helpful and friendly staff. Close to nice beaches. Elevators VERY slow...our wing only had 2 elevators and it seemed like too few for the number of guests trying to ride them. Free breakfast very good.

We stayed here twice. The first stay we had a deluxe king mountain view room. The room was nice but overlooked the garbage and the garbage trucks and noise kept us awake. Breakfast was like a zoo. They ran out of everything iand it was so windy everything went cold quickly and there was nowhere to eat inside. Staff tried to help but overrun. Reception staff changed our room for the second stay. Much better. Ocean view. Lisa Catherine on front desk was very helpful. Also it was not explained to us that we had $5 credit at the gallery cafe every day included in our resort fee. Staff were friendly and helpful. Good location. Expedia staff on activities desk gave us misinformation about Pearl Harbour tours but did recommend good local restaurants.

The hotel is in a great area, it was walking distance to the beach and the shopping area. Although, the hotel appeared to look clean, the pillows on the bed had a musty smell. I was disappointed with the breakfast, they only serve pork products. I don't eat pork, but I eat turkey. There wasn't options for turkey or steak and the other breakfast items was the same everyday.

I travel to Honolulu for business at least 4 times a year and the Hyatt Place is my preferred hotel, hands down. The hotel staff makes me feel like a rock star and appreciated. Customer service is great. The location is great. The overall value is great! Highly recommend this hotel.!

Staff was wonderful and hotel was in a very good location being only a block from Waikiki Beach. The only compaint was the slowness of the elevators. there were not enough elevators to deal with all the guests.

We had a wonderful stay! Just make sure to do your laundry early in the morning! Staff was pleasant and housekeepers did a great job and greeted us warmly every morning. It’s one block from an ABC store that has everything you could possibly need - food, drinks, toiletries

Hotel is a big outdated and need a refresh badly.Customer service was great, but no wow factor.Only 2 elevators for such a bigger hotel!!Only 1 elevator working through most of our stay. Ridiculous wait for elevator every time.For the price we were charged per night, we will definitely try other properties next time.

Breakfast left a lot to be desired. For a hotel to offer complimentary breakfast, it would be a good idea to have a weatherproof area to accommodate for this. Most days we were fighting the wind, rain and the birds while eating breakfast. Location was good. Staff were always nice.

We had a city view room on the 7th floor as part of a Travelocity package. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The service offering beach chairs and towels at no additional fee was lovely. The room was quite loud - pipes possibly? After the first night it became white noise, but it took a little getting used to. The pool is quite small but was clean and a nice temperature. Plus, you’re a block from a lovely, clean beach so the pool wasn’t a priority. Overall, my family of four had a wonderful stay.

Though I was on a vacation high (not literally) I am particular about my stay. Rooms great clean. Breakfast amazing fresh. The wife wanted right on the beach and was concerned the walk might be a tad far. As soon as you walk out you can see the water. Less than 3 min walk!

very helpful hotel staff and excellent service. Location to all the attractions on Waikiki was a big plus. Hawai is a very expensive place . This facility was able to have my family of 5 stay in same large room comfortably

This was a family vacation with two elderly family members. I had booked “an ocean view” room. The room was 923. We were told top floors were not available. The ocean view was a joke. Please see the picture and judge for yourself. The hotel or my agent Expedia is misrepresenting what is an obstructed or minimal view. The breakfast is awful (runny scrambled eggs and under cooked bacon, only one type of cake, etc). There isn’t enough covered seating on the 3rd floor dining area for raining days so we were forced to eat in the rain. The bath tub drain wasn’t draining well so we took showers in dirty water. The elevator was really slow and people waited a long time to get to their floors. One night the fire alarm went off at midnight and my elderly mother and another elderly family member were forced to take the stairs down only to be told it was a false alarm. It was a terrifying experience. They were both in tears from their bad knees and bad backs having to take the stairs. Just an awful experience.

Made a good choice this time in picking a Waikiki hotel. Not only was Hyatt Place moderately priced, but it provided a first-rate free breakfast. In addition, we were provided with beach chairs and towels. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. Just a 5-minute walk to Waikiki Beach, and also cloe walking distance to many Waikiki attractions(shopping, dining, parks, the zoo& aquarium, etc.).

Everything was great. Housekeeper was awesome and so was the staffs. Room was clean. The free breakfast could be better. My kids are pretty picky and there was no pancakes nor waffles. The cereal selection wasn’t great either. Other then that, everything else was great. Will be back.

5 min walk to the beach and to the tour bus stop. Easy walk to many restaurants and shops. Even walked to the famous Rainbow Diner. The hotel room was very spacious. We had an ocean view with 2 queen beds. Had a balcony where we could sit and gaze out on the ocean. My only complaint was that my request for a firm pillow was never fulfilled, even though they promised to deliver it immediately to the room.

I highly recommend Hyatt Waikiki, it was my first time with them and it’s impressive how the they care of every single detail, from now on I’ll stay only in one of their hotels no matter what. Amazing experience

Great stay recommending to stay here thanks had big family and enjoyed it everything on point breakfast was great walking distance to everything kids loved it and me and the wife loved it hopefully we be back very soon

Granted we only spent one night at the Hyatt Place Waikiki, but was very unhappy with our experience. Although the staff was nice and helpful, the quality of the hotel was very underwhelming. The hotel appears to be well decorated but when you look closer at the space it’s dated and old. Our room was pretty tiny and you could tell they tried to update it with modern furniture but it still had the old popcorn ceiling and lots of wear and tear along the walls. The balcony was also dirty and old and I had no desire to step out there. What made my stay the least pleasant was the bed. It was one of the most uncomfortable beds I’ve slept on. I ended up tossing and turning all night and feeling so exhausted in the morning. This was supposed to be a nice night away from the baby for me and my husband but we both regretted staying here considering how uncomfortable we were. I’m just glad we were able to use a free night for this stay and not have to pay the full rate. Will avoid staying at this hyatt property in the future.

From the front desk to the taxi guy. They were all very helpful. The breakfast was well done that is free with the room. I would stay here again. Very easy to walk to the beach only two small blocks. Seemed very safe in the neighborhood. Worth the money

Love this place, we will return when possible. The breakfast was delicious but not very muuch selection. I love their sevice. Need more selection like omelet and cereal selection , and very cozy stay.

rooms are big and spacious, with 2 little one, that is ideal. Prime location with no doubt. Breakfast venue is a bit hectic but you can take the tray from the room to take out breakfast to your own room, that is quite a nice and considerate option for guests.

This hotel is an average place to stay in an above average destination. If all you want is a bed to crash in every night, this place is great. If you are looking for a little more, go across the street and stay at the Marriott. Or at least take advantage of the Marriott’s pool and happy hour. It is easy to get to and just requires walking up two flights of stairs. A big plus of this hotel is the free breakfast every morning which is surprisingly delicious.

The location was not good. So we had to walk about 15 minute to go Main Street. However, room services and landscape was excellent!!!! It is best hotel which I have ever stayed. This hotel has happy hour service that any drinks are discounted in 4-7 o’clock.I recommend you to use it. If you use this hotel.

Friendly Staff, clean rooms, great location and awesome breakfast. Beach was accessible and quick walk to many restaurants and shops. Waikiki beach was 5 minute walk and you can see the ocean from the hotel.

We got a room with a sofa bed so our kids got a bed each. Really important for a 7 night holiday. Our kids are 10 & 11 so the location is perfect! Walking distance to everything but just out of the SUPER BUSY main street which was perfect for us. The staff have made us feel right at home and we will 100% be back next year.

The service was excellent the moment when I arrived. The staff was very friendly and made sure I was at home. The breakfast was awesome had a little bit of everything I wanted. I would recommend this hotel to my friends & family for sure.
user_name:
gwenwysote
Listuguj Mi'gmaq First Nation, Canada

review_body: Great location close to the beach. Our room was very nice and breakfast each day was delicious. Staff was very friendly. Angeline Nguyen was very professional and helpful with information about activities and things to do around Waikiki Beach. Highly recommended staying here.

Wonderful wonderful wonderful. Close to Waikiki and people watching, and sunset viewing and many really fine restaurants.This was the perfect end to a Christmas Vacation in Hawaii - wonderful time had by all

All was good including breakfast but watch out for $40/day parking fee and lots of Hawaii taxes. Location is 2 blocks from beach and close to many shops and restaurants. Staff was good but parking valet is slow for $40/day plus tips which is expected in Hawaii

Great family-oriented hotel hidden in the back of Waikiki alley. Loved family-like front desk staff, and valet. Very roomy compared to other hotels. Included breakfast is hard to beat! They offer convenient two breakfast area, near front desk as well as 3rd floor for more extensive menu. Would stay there again.

Pros: close to beach, have beach towel, toys and chair to borrow, pretty good breakfast.Cons: Check in staff could be friendly and smile more. I have pre-paid through hotels.com but Hyatt still charged my credit card for the stay without letting me know. I called them but it would take 7 to 14 days to refund.

Travel Agent issue or mistake in booking request?? 2 Adults and a 15 Year old teenager on check in for which the person at th front desk new, gave us a room for 11 Nights that was so small i immediatly asked for a bigger room. Reception was quite helpful and made the change which was advised complimentary - However i was later charged a holding fee of 2550USD???what the?? as soon as a saw this two days later i went to the front desk and showed and it was again immediatly dealt with but the reversal took like 8 days....no so happy but i was then no longer chargedd the destination fee....off to challenge my bank now as they charged a fee but there is no evidence of service now for that fee....all this added to hassle....However the Hyatt Themselve once all sorted we helpful, acknowledge the error, moved us straight away when we advised our issue, i agree with many who advised slow and painful waits for the lifts daily maybe we should get a discount every time you walked the stairs, which was at least twice daily after more than 15 minute waits for a lift to come you could get into. Rooms are awesomely clean, Breakfast is ok for free which makes it very popular and is a cause of the lift waits as they also start using them as a service lift for staff at the same time. Overall very clean, Great People who are attentive...Oh did i mention Bag stolen from beach on first outing...Make sure you have no valuable's in your bag at the beach people are watching...
user_name:
Chopper P
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Hyatt place Hotel, Great rooms, very spacious and very pleasant staff. Not mentioned on their website is complimentary beach towels and beach chairs. Breakfast food is pretty good and plenty off it. Location to beach is fantastic and right on the Waikiki strip nearer Diamond head end and close to all the places to eat.However, the pool area is very unwelcoming and rarely used and a thoroughfare to the breakfast area. Breakfast is always very crowded and difficult to find a seat and because your on the 3 floor, open to all weather conditions of which wind is the worst. Also full of birds after your food.The lifts are very frustrating and slow , such a waste of your time. Difficult when people start to bring in there breakfast trays.Gym was great and underused.The air con is fairly noisey.
Double occupancy family friendlyAll staff extremely helpful Beach accessTowels and chairs includedBreakfast includedWe enjoyed our stay and will definitely book with this hotel again Thanks so much!

We had booked 2 rooms 1440 and 1441. Everything was fine except the breakfast and its venue.The breakfast was very average. The venue of the breakfast on the 3rd floor was poor. Most of the venue was exposed to the elements and it was windy and cold and even worse when it was raining.If the venue was at a covered place and if the breakfast spread was a little improved this hotel would get an excellent review.

We stayed 12 nights in December. Our room was smaller than other Hyatt Place rooms we've had (really almost too small). We paid extra for "mountain view" but our view was mostly other buildings and a dirty rooftop below. The road noise in our room was quite loud (we were on the 6th floor). The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was much better than usual hotel breakfasts and fun to eat outside. Easy access to beach. We did not have the opportunity to use the excursions services. Overall I would give this hotel a solid B.

Pleasantly surprised with how amazing the Hyatt place was. Breakfast buffet every morning, close location to buses, beach and convenience stores. Parking is 30usd a night so best to use public transport. Workers were polite and helpful. We were given 5$ credit per room (we had 2 rooms) to use in the hotel per day. Has a Dominos connected to the hotel so it's a great go to dinner. Family Rooms fit 4 comfortably but are made for 6 with the sofa bed. Sofa bed wasnt to comfortable so we ended up taking the mattress and putting it on the floor which made it marginally better. Not a big deal really but worth noting.Definitely more perks and positives than not and would stay again.

I’m staying at this hotel for an extended period of time and the housekeeping staff are amazing. Maria and Princess cleaned my room today and did and outstanding job. Very friendly and detailed oriented.

We just finished booking our return trip to Hawaii. Our first trip to Hawaii was at the Hyatt Place and are pleased to rebook with this hotel. My only concern is the lack of accountability when it comes to emailing the hotel. I've had a few issues that needed resolving. Emailing/facebook messenger and calling the Hyatt means absolutely nothing.My personal opinion is that the hotel does care, but just not enough to resolve your issues or concerns. This hotel deserves a high rating but personally I'm not happy with their customer support, but we know this hotel and wanted to stay here. I just wish my concerns were answered and the hotel actually cared about their returning customers.Clearly this hotel is going to read this comment, and maybe they should look through their emails, phone records or facebook messages and start resolving their issues.

We booked Hyatt Place as it was reasonably priced and close to the beach. We booked a mountain view room, the view from the 14th floor was spectacular. The room was nice and big with a seperate lounge to relax in. The balcony was quite small but a good place to sit out of the sun. The free breakfast was a lovely surprise, however it was absolutely crazy trying to get food every morning. It was disappointing that beach chairs were not available every day! It was very evident that some guests were keeping them in rooms. The staff at the hotel are extremely courteous and helpful, I would highly recommend this hotel. Mahalo!

It is a nice hotel for the price with a goo location to beach etc. The staff was all very nice to deal with. The hotel rooms are fairly small but ok for a single traveler like me. You cannot beat the price on the location being one block from the beach.

The location is very good, the rooms are clean, the shower is very good. The staff are friendly.Way too noisy and we could not sleep at night. The rooms are not soundproof, not only outside nose, but the inside A/C wall unit, the refrigerator as well. The mattress are too soft. There is only one light control switch for two rooms/area in the bathroom area, which are open connected to the main living space without close door, that makes other people difficult to sleep if another person need to use the bathroom and keep the lights in the bathroom area on.

I didn’t expect this hotel too much but once I got there my image at this place was changed.Room is clean and so spacious, nice view (I had ocean, diamond head and mountain view)Breakfast is delicious, hotel staff were really nice and friendly, good location.I definitely recommend this hotel.

Overall hotel was good. Parking a little expensive, cheaper parking located at zoo, 2 blocks away. Location is good, just a few blocks from beach. Staff friendly, and always cleaning. Gaps on guest room doors too big, allowing outside hallway noise in, little annoying, also, guest room doors slam too hard, waking you up.

Our stay with they Hyatt was great. Our first trip to Hawaii and nothing worse than staying somewhere and having an issue. This was NOT the case. The people were SUPER friendly and the service provided was spot on. The room was very clean and comfortable. All the amenities were functional and we did not have any problems. The patio had a weird black coating on it, but we didn't go out there much. Just admired the view from inside. Thank you to all for helping to make our stay in our beautiful town fantastic!

It was a Hyatt and it lived up to everything I had come to enjoy in my many stays at Hyatt hotels in London, at Heathrow, in New York, at Grand Central Station, and the Park Hyatt near the UN and in Washington D.C. Hyatt Place is a great place to stay on business or pleasure and I will be staying there again, and again,

They offer breakfast!!! Save a lot of time and energy. The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable! Hyatt hotels are the top choices you should consider when you plan for your trips! Not far from the beach.

This property is beautiful! Staff is very friendly and wonderful...Anja (I think I spelled it correctly, apology if I hadn't) is a gem from check-in, sending up a bottle of champagne for our anniversary and just making us feel welcome. All the staff were beyond accommodating, they all made you feel welcome. We had an oceanview room which was incredible, shower had great pressure with wonderful toiletries, bedding was wonderful and the bed was very comfortable, we had the best sleeps ever! The location was good, Kuhio Beach was only a block away. ABC Store was 1/2 block away. Food trucks in the side street. Lots of dining options just a short walk down the main street. Breakfast was wonderful...fresh eggs, meat, potatoes, pancakes or waffles, yogurt, granola, oatmeal and cold cereals, Asian foods, banana or zucchini spice bread and fresh pineapple and probably more there that I forgot...but it was so much more than I expected. It got crowded in the seating area most days but you had the option of using the tray from your room to bring breakfast back to your room. Laundry facilities were ok, normally I don't do laundry on vacation but I spilled a full glass of juice on myself and didn't want it to stain. It was a fantastic experience at this hotel. We've never stayed at a Hyatt before and I think you might have spoiled us just a bit. Staying elsewhere is going to be hard because you've set the bar pretty high in my opinion. Mahalo!

While this was my first time at this property, I'm very familiar with the Hyatt Place brand. I was only in town overnight and opted to stay at this property. I had expected a standard Hyatt Place experience, but instead my expectations were exceeded. I knew the location was already great. Each room was comfortable, neither cramped nor spacious, with a mini-fridge and individually air cooled with the HVAC unit on the balcony. Internet was hi-speed and stable. With a Hyatt app, you could cast your shows from your portable device to the in-room TV. I didn't use this feature, but this was an amenity I hadn't encountered at any other hotel I've been to.Breakfast was amazing. They had both Western and Asian offerings. It felt like I was in a hotel in Singapore, in that respect. The eggs were definitely fresh (not reconstituted powder) and the breakfast meat that morning was back bacon (versus the normal American pork belly bacon, or what the the Brits call "streaky bacon") which made a nice change. The breakfast lounge was al fresco on the third floor deck, same as the pool and the gym. They had a tray in your room which you could take down and bring breakfast back to eat in your room if you preferred to eat there instead of on the deck.This is a small, intimate property located at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. The beach was a block away, and other decent eateries were also within walking distance.I have no trouble recommending this hotel and I definitely will be back for another stay!

The first thing I look for in a motel is the location which this one was perfect at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, basically a block from the beach. We stayed in room 207 although no view which wasn’t an issue as you spend all day out was spacious and well equipped. I would have liked a microwave though. The beds were soft but still supportive which suited me perfectly. The bathroom is large enough for a motel room with a spacious shower.Breakfast is well appointed with a good selection.Overall this was the perfect hotel for my stay and I would recommend it for any family.

Loved our stay here. Admiteddly it's not as big or fancy as some of these resorts, but we knew that checking in. With that said, the service was awesome (including getting upgraded to an ocean view room for free). Free beach chair and towel usage were a great bonus. Breakfast was good but not great, and the pool didn't seem to get too much action given it's location in the shade. But yeah, we would definitely stay again.

This is an excellent location with great service. Staff was extremely helpful. Would stay here again and highly recommended. Convenient to shopping and various restaurants and the beach. Can’t ask for a better place.

5 minute walk to the beach and zoo! The hotel had a beautiful view! I was greeted with a smile and free drink from the bar! They had a beautiful Christmas tree and comfortable chairs in the lobby. I couldn’t ask for a better stay!

This place is great. Close to beach, hearty breakfast that is varied a bit each day, decent gym, nice lobby bar, work space in lobby. The room was on the small side but there is free WiFi, refrigerator, desk and balcony. Furnishings are up to date. Staff is quite responsive.

The hotel was perfect distance from the beach and close to everything in Waikiki. The breakfast was nice and they tried to change it up each day. The hotel room was very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

The room I stayed in was nice. The staff was friendly and very helpful. This was a business trip and I was not on a vacation or anything so something that would have been nice would be if there was a microwave in the room. And the shower head could have worked better than just trickling out the WiFi was great the view was nice as well the beds were average nice and cleanly made when I arrived. This was a business trip but one of the better trips I have been on.

Hotel is in a great location with easy access to restaurants, shopping and the beach. The hotel is clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel room was comfortable, although not much of an ocean view. Breakfast was a plus with good selections. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Hotel is clean and friendly housekeeping staff. Breakfast included.Convenience Stores (ABC) on every block. Walkable to shopping and eating places. within 10 minutes walk to the famous International Market Place. Lots of different cuisines. If you like Japanese, there is lots!

We thought the location was great and the service of the staff superb. The team tried very hard to check us in very early due to arrival of flight.Breakfast had a great variety.Waikiki Beach was an easy walk as was vicinity of bus stops.

The hotel was great! The staff goes out of their way to help and guide in any way they can. The room was very clean and quiet. Our view was ocean so that was great as well. The breakfast had plenty to choose from and was also very good. Again the staff here at the breakfast area was outstanding.

Love this hotel, this is our 6th stay, we are always made to feel welcome by all the staff. Everyone is so friendly and accommodating! Rooms are clean and well taken care of, and we always sleep soundly! Definitely be back at the Hyatt Place for our 7th stay!!

The location is great, only two blocks to the beach. The free breakfast has many food choices, but get there early as the seating is limited during peak times.Be aware that the listing said there was an airport shuttle. There was no shuttle, but a reduced rate with the local taxi service. Priceline indicated the site didn't say "FREE shuttle" and so the listing was correct. I wrongly assumed there would be a free shuttle.

Excellent rooms and hotel location which includes breakfast. Has complimentary daily newspapers. Clean and modern rooms. Great staff. Looking forward to next stay at this location. Hotel has beach chairs and boogie boards for use at beach.

We have stayed in this hotel multiple times. Service and staff are very good. Location is good for us because we like to be close to Kapiolani Park and beach. Hotel is somewhat away from the hoopla of Waikiki Beach scene. Hotel is older building but well kept. Best rooms are in Pali Tower. Breakfast included which is great BUT the recent experience of breakfast is not as good as past. Crowds of people, limited staff to keep food and dishes available. No veggie/vegan options, except cereals, for breakfast. Overall, we recommend Waikiki Place. It is very good hotel with good service and location.

Except for the free buffet breakfast everything else is not that great, the building is very old, the elevator is super slow and there is a fee for overnight parking. And there are lots of birds trying to get our food while we’re having breakfast at the patio...

Flew into Hawaii at 9:30 am caught Roberts Hawaii and stopped off for some shopping at Ala Moana Mall and used the free Roberts Hawaii lounge to store the bags, as check in wasn't till 2:00pmThe check in person was helpful and friendly.The room was large and comfortable the bathroom was a little dated with a shower over the bath.The free breakfast was basic but did the trick.Public transport was every handy and tour pick ups were out front or across the street.The beach was a short walk and not to crowded.

Our last stop on our 2 week Hawaiian vacation. Great location, easily walk to most of the beaches and stores. The staff was incredible!! Upon arrival was met by a couple employees that made getting into our room quite easy (it was crazy busy at the time)..Bell hops, valets, and check in staff all went above and beyond to see to our wants and needs. Concierge also aided us with great tips re: food, hot spots, and things to do/see while visiting. Also have to give a shout out to the bell hop loading our luggage when we departed. As we dropped off our rental car at the airport, we thought that we left a small bag with a C-PAP in the lobby because we couldn't find it...Worried we didn't have time to go back and retrieve it we quickly called the hotel to see if they could find it. At the time, they couldn't find it so they put the bell hop on the phone to see what it was that we was missing....not only did he remember us, but also pointed out to where in the car he stuck the bag. We quickly ran to the car and lo and behold there it was!! Awesome job!!

We enjoyed our first visit at Hyatt Place and do plan to return in the future. We liked the room, location, breakfast, staff, everything. Our flight didn't leave until the evening so we got a late check-out at 1:00 PM which worked out very well.

Excellent clean resort, breakfast was excellent. When we arrived we were given a room right next to the lift shaft. This was disappointing, so I asked for a new room in another location and the lady at the desk politely found us a new one to stay in for the next six days! Thank goodness!

The Hyatt is an amazing hotel chain, and I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki Beach. Having my room view the ocean was amazing. In addition to the great service, delicious breakfast, and great staff my overall trip was amazing. The only drawback is that on my last night there, I saw a small brown roach on my wall. I tried to kill it, but when it fell I couldn't find the body. That really killed my sleep vibe. I really chose the Hyatt because from experiences in other Hyatts I knew their standard of cleanliness would be superb and I could be sure to avoid seeing roaches. That is why I gave 4 stars. Other than that. I would have rated 5.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is a great hotel in Waikiki. The breakfast in the morning was delicious and there were plenty of options to choose from. All of the staff was extremely friendly and professional. I had communicated with the general manager, Ihab Kherati, beforehand that we were celebrating our honeymoon and he upgraded us to an ocean view room on the top floor! It was a wonderful gesture and while the room itself was a bit small (but what do you expect in downtown Waikiki beach?) the view was great!

Good all round, rooms small though unless you get a bigger one. Love you can take breakfast back to room and towels provided for beach. Very laid back friendly, casual, Aussies would like it, except a small room, unless you get a bigger one

Great staff, nice room, good shower size and nice view of the ocean. Short walk to the ocean. Hotel has chairs, boogie boards and towels to take to the beach which was fantastic and saved us money as we usually buy those.

We’ve stayed at this hotel several times already. I like the bigger rooms. I have Explorist status with Hyatt and they’ve always accommodated my room preference. Hot breakfast is great. Although I’ve noticed some of the breakfast selections have dwindled a bit. But you can still find something to eat unless you have a restrictive diet. Pool is very small, but this is Hawaii, just go to the beach (walking distance). The rooms are quiet, spacious and clean. The lobby can get hot as its not air conditioned. It’s close to the zoo and aquarium if you want to check those out.Restaurants are within walking distance. If can’t walk much, the Waikiki Shuttle Pink Line ($2.00 one way) stops at the Aston Waikiki Beach.

We always stay at Hyatt properties in the country as my husband is a fan of them. We recently stayed at Hyatt place in waikki beach. It was really nice and comfortable stay. The reception girl was nice enough to offer us early check in. This was really important for us as we had just disembarked from the cruise and we tours booked for the city.So we had a place to keep our luggage and relax a bit. They had very nice breakfast area but a small suggestion they can cover the area as open area where we sat we had lot of aggressive birds.

Conveniently situated relative to heart of Waikiki Beach. Free parking on streets nearby if you're lucky and patient looking. Otherwise parking at nearby zoo is cheap alternative to expensive parking structures.

It is exactly three years that, in November we are living with Hyatt Waikiki place and every year the service is truly unique and special. Clean rooms and very large. Continental breakfast (American and Japanese) and it is there because we are still in a foreign state... very good with any kind of mercy. A special Thanksgiving at General Manager Ihab, at Jeff and all staff

The Hyatt Place is just great, all staff was always helpfull and alwasy said hi with a smile. Location is perfect, only a 2 min walk to the beach, ABC store one block away, clean hotel, big rooms with the ocean view's. The Resort fee (which was cheap in my opinion) includeds, beakfast everyday, beach chairs, beach towels, snorkel gear, and a $5 resort credit each day so use it for a drink, or a cookie....Starbucks directly across the the street in the Marriot Lobby, which was great way to take an ealy morning walk to the beach before the sunrise, or all the people,,,,,you can be on the beach, but you will pay much more per night, so for the cost and location, you cannot go wrong,,,save money and spend it on all of the Hawaiian adventures....Aloha!

Booked two rooms at this hotel for upcoming stay. Contacted hotel to get connecting room for stay, because one of the room was for my special needs son who is only 11 years old. All hyatt properties except for Hyatt place can guarantee connecting rooms based on child being under 12. This hotel have connecting rooms available but refused to block them for our stay even though my son is under 12 AND is special needs. Back and forth with hotel rep who was clueless about why it's important to have easy/ready access to my son's room. So insensitive to families with special needs children.

An excellently located hotel (half a block from the beach).The concierge (Abbie) was very helpful and knowledgeable, and the source of recommendations/bookings for dinner and tours.The front desk, lobby and restaurant staff were always polite, friendly and professional. We could not ask for anything better for our stay in Honolulu.

First off all, this is our first time visiting Hawaii. This hotel is a BIG disappointment. I’ve never stayed in Hyatt Place/House, so I decided to give it a shot after reading some positive reviews. Pro (Good): LOCATION: it’s only 2-3 small blocks from the beach, so it’s very convenient. It’s near a bunch of great restaurants.
