Most of the ABC stores along the Beach Road are within a walking distance. There’s one basically right next to the hotel. Bus stop is very close by. COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST: it’s a buffet style breakfast with a verity of selections. My mom and I love it. They also offered Asian specialty food (I’m Asian, so I wouldn’t call this type of food “breakfast”). Food is warm, fresh and delicious. ROOM: beds and pillows are very comfortable. The room is very spacious. They provided LOTS of towels, which is very useful. They also offered beach towels, so that was a plus. Con (Bad): We checked in on November 24th 2019 with two queen beds and ocean view. Heidi Lazo (front desk) assigned us in room 932. Right after we entered the room, I caught a baby lizard (see attachment) on the desk nearby the glass/coffee area and again on the floor. After we talked to the front desk lady about the incident, she assisted us immediately (thank you); however, the same room type wasn’t available, so she assigned us another room on the 11th floor with CITY VIEW instead! Yes, we paid more money for the ocean view and never ever got to see the view of the oceans. She offered to give us a refund for the destination fees, which was basically $21/day. Our new room was 1106 - before our bedtime, my mom found a clear footprint on one bed and an old blood droplet on the other bed! Also, both beds didn’t have the same number of pillows. Inside the shower area, there were also old opened shampoo, conditioner and soap left on the tray...(the shower area was found later - very disgusting) - OK!!! FOUR PROBLEMS within hours after checking in. Again, we walked to the front desk and had to wait for a while due to them being super busy. I spoke with Heidi Lazo about the problems and showed her all the pictures. She was very nice, efficient and helpful. She sent four housekeepers up to change the bedsheets right away, so we could sleep. We didn’t want to move to another room for the 3rd time within hours of each other. Heidi offered $100 credits back to my account for all the problems we had encountered. We took it, but seriously, I wouldn’t come back to this hotel. $100 wasn’t even worth all the troubles we had. We spent more money on the ocean view room but got the city view room instead because the room wasn’t having a lizard and not being cleaned properly. However, when the housekeeping cleaned our room the next day, she didn’t bother cleaning the shower tray (old stuffs were still there, that means they didn’t even clean the bathroom!! We had a trouble taking a shower for all 3 days since we got no tray to put the shower stuff on. We DID NOT want to touch those stuff ourselves, so we had to put all of our shower stuffs outside the shower instead and had to keep opening and closing the shower door to get it! There was also some confusion. The housekeeper cleaned our room one day and skipped the next day. We didn’t even have the “do not disturb” on. I called the front desk, and she said “your room is under the green program, that’s why housekeeper didn’t come in and clean it.” What kind of green program is this when a housekeeper comes in one day and skips the next? Even that, don’t they have to provide the toiletries daily? When we asked them to deliver it to our room, it took him (housekeeper) approximately 30 minutes while I was in a shower waiting for the supplies. He was giving us a little bit of an attitude with the unhappy look on his face - no good!! It was our vacation, but we had to deal with these nonsense problems for the lack of cleanliness and ignorant of the housekeepers. Throughout our stays here, we always observed a few housekeepers standing outside guest elevators on the 2nd floor chitchatting. It would have been better if you could use all these time to pay more attention to the guest rooms. HOUSEKEEPING DEPARTMENT is definitely needing big improvement. I wasn’t impressed!! IRONING: The iron was leaking very badly. I couldn’t wear the dress I wanted because it was soaking wet!!AIR CONDITIONING: it was very quiet, but it was way too cold, and we couldn’t even adjust it. Thanks Heidi Lazo for all your helps, but after all these, we wouldn’t come back.

The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean. The breakfast that was included was delicious.The whole experience at the hotel was awesome. Highly recommend this hotel. The location to the beach and shopping was very close.

Back again for the second time. We enjoyed our stay here last time and it warrants our repeat business. Due to our loyalty status, they upgraded our room to one with two beds and a sofa lounge. The hotel is walking distance to many shops and highly rated restaurants. It's in a very safe location (near the Honolulu Zoo) and only one block away from Waikiki Beach.The complimentary morning breakfast is still great with ample selections of fruits, juices, eggs and meat. The front desk staff is very friendly and accommodating.

I lived in this hotel for one night during my business trip. The front desk receptionist was friendly and helpful. The room was nice, clean, and AC already turned on. The WIFI was easy to connect to. The front desk also helped arrange a taxi shuttle to airport the next morning at 5:30AM, which was very convenient for me, and I appreciated it.

We loved the hotel. Whilst the pool was average it didn’t make a difference with the beach down the road. We loved every moment of our stay. The hotel staff were amazing and helpful and we thoroughly loved it.

It was my birthday, my friends abd I decided to spend 8days at this hotel. It was enjoyable. Close to beach, shops and restaurants.. Staffs are very friendly. Jovie who clean my room, she was fantastic. I wasn't well for part of the day and she came in to ask me if I needed anything, which I appreciated very much.

This hotel is about a half block away from beach. A quik mart is 2 minutes away great for snack food and pop etc. Ocean view was spectacular. Room was quiet. Elevator a little slow but really didn't have much impact. Restaurants within walking distance

We had a great view of the ocean and the city! Our hotel was located only a few blocks from Waikiki beach and from restaurants and shopping. We walked the cityscape which was a great way to explore both the mom & pop shops, street musicians and local cuisine. Hawaii was 87 degrees everyday and so green. It was beautiful!

Great customer service! Heidi was very helpful when we had a small problem. We liked the location and overall value of the hotel. The breakfast is of high quality, cage free eggs, freshly squeezed grapefruit juice and Greek yoghurt with fruits were a hit!. All food is fairly nutritious, although we could have enjoyed a bit more variety, but then - again - it is a much better option compared to 'continental' breakfast at many other places. Kudos to Hyatt

My family and I had an amazing time at Hyatt this past October. We had great customer service from the moment we stepped out of our car. The staff was very friendly and welcoming and went out of their way to make sure that we were taken care of. The rooms were very clean and tidy. There was a big variety of foods to choose from at breakfast. They also had a lot of beach items, like boogie boards, available for day use. The location of this hotel is great; it’s a short walk to the beach and there are plenty of stores nearby. I highly recommend this hotel and can’t wait to come back!

Our 5th time to this hotel. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is a great way to start the day and our 4year old daughter always seems to make new friends during breakfast.Location is great, 3min walk to the beach. Lots of restaurants and shopping close by.

Great service. Longer walk to beach than I thought, but still not that far (2 blocks) . Was somewhat a dated accommodations, but clean and quiet at night. $5.00 off each night at the bar area was a nice perk, as well as a couple of bottles of water in a tote.

Great hotel and value. Close to the beach with an easy walk. Everything you need along with trolley stop 50 meters from the hotel. Close to everything you need in Waikiki with restaurants and zoo along with the aquarium all in walking distance. Would stay again

Short walk to the beach. No restaurants or anything on property. Small pool. Clean and comfortable room with a shower only (no bathtub if trying to travel with kids). Breakfast menu rotates (pancakes, kahlua pork, waffles were three of the "highlights" when I was there along with eggs, potatoes, and one of bacon/ham/sausage). Had a view of the ocean from small balcony (though had to see it in gaps through other buildings). Banyan Waikiki Parking garage across the street is a cheaper place to park a car ($20/night or $80/week) if you are trying to save money and don't mind crossing the street to get to your car. Not a resort feel.

This place was very neat and the staffs are very helpful and nice. We had a lock situation in our room and one of the staff was very quick to call the technician and was able to get it fix within 10 mins. I also want to say thank you to Christopher for taking care of our reservation He was very helpful and accommodating. Breakfast was the bomb. Will stay here again for our next trip!

Stayed 4 nights. Greeted by professional concierge. Check-in staff quickly provided me my room key and provided complimentary water. Room was clean and stocked with essentials such as shampoo and conditioner. Lots of clean towels. Each day the room was cleaned well. I received a $5 dollar a day credit that I used to purchase water at the lobby. One can opt for an eco room arrangement and increase the daily credit to $10 dollars a day. What one trades is the daily cleaning of the room. The hotel is closer to the zoo and diamond head. Lots of transportation options. There is no hotel parking but adjacent to the hotel is a public parking lot. The week pass is cheaper than the daily rate. The hotel does offer valet parking. While convenient is the most costly. Highly recommended!

First time visiting haWaii and was looking for a hotel. Booked Hyatt Place and wasn’t sure what to expect. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff. Check in was fast and easy. Cathy at the from desk was super sweet and helpful. Our room was clean and spacious. The breakfast in the mornings are delicious. Hotel is walking distance to the beach - two blacks away. I highly recommend this hotel.

Location of hotel is very close to Waikiki beach, short walk. Hotel provides beach towel which is nice. Lots of restaurant nearby, all within walking distance. Nice, clean and large room. Comfy bed, and room has enough windows for natural light if preferred. Hot breakfast and in-room fridge are some of the additional great features. Friendly staff and I will definately stay here again if I am in Waikiki.

Many errors on the Hotwire site, it showed that the hotel has an airport shuttle which it does not..that cost us a $45 taxi ride. It did not mention a destination fee on top of the room rate, another $25. Our taxi driver dropped us off the Hyatt Regency which was 4 blocks away, we were not aware we were at the wrong hotel until we tried to check in. The service desk person apologized and gave us each a Hawaiin ley which was nice. When we arrived at the The Hyatt Place hotel we were taken care of by Tara who was amazing. She explained the destination fee (which still should have been in listing) set up a taxi for us the next day at the hotels discounted rate (saved $15) she also set us up with a temporary room after we checked out the next day so we could shower before heading to the airport at 3pm. The hotel itself was fine except the pool was being worked on and we were given the option of going to one of their sister hotel pools...not convienent.
user_name:
Donald M
Fort Thomas, United States

review_body: This hotel is great wonderful service, quiet rooms and great breakfast. Very close to the beach and bus and tour pick ups. Rental car places are within a block and area is safe. Would stay here again!!

Slow elevator service....need service elevator Horrible breakfast.....crowded...Birds everywhere....dirty..need more help to keep up cleaningVery dirty....run down....needs workGood location...clean rooms....nice staff

we stayed 5 nights and had paid for a sea view. we had what we expected i.e we were at the last floor. Except the waiting time of the lift, everything was good.Do not expect a very luxury hotel but a good quality/price ratio.

Great hotel, helpful staff, nice breakfast set up. Parking is a bit pricey but you can find an alternative place to park on your own. Staff is helpful to give hints for things to places to eat at and whatever perks there were in the area.

Nice clean hotel, just a short walk from the beach. The food at breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly and helpful. It would be nice if there were more restaurants around the hotel but plenty of places within a short walk.

We stayed at this hotel for a week, it is convenient to the beach and several very nice restaurants. The hotel is consistently clean inside and out. The rooms are VERY comfortable and clean. Breakfast is buffet style with a large variety offered (I'm not a huge fan of buffet) so it was just ok for me.The hotel is also just down the street from public transportation to the larger shopping areas and big attractions like Pearl Harbor, Diamond-head, etc. The bus system will take you almost anywhere you want to go on the island, it's great for public transportation (and clean with no winos begging for change!)

Adelma was amazing very professional and understanding to my husbands disabilities we will return to Hyatt properties in the future. Thank you for your great service Adelma highly recommend excellent experience.

When we arrived there, Cliff is one of the staff who is really helpful and well-accommodating in the hotel! keep it up guys. This hotel is close everywhere and breakfast is really good. excelllent job guys!

We loved the location as it was walking distance to the beach and many other amenities. We loved the continental breakfast and credit if you don’t have your room cleaned. We felt it was a great stay. We also loved having dominos downstairs hahah. Only thing I would have enjoyed more is a nicer pool. Never once did I see one person in the pool.

Best location..walking distance to everything you need for holiday and shopping.5mins to beach and just next door you have shopping mall open till midnight. Breakfast was not as expected otherwise best place to stay if visiting Honolulu.

We recently stayed at the Hyatt Place. The hotel is located close to the beach and an easy walk down the street. We enjoyed our stay and were upgraded to a larger room when we checked in without asking. The room was a good size with Queen Beds and a good size desk which was larger than usual. We would normally rate this hotel a 4 star however the hotel is very dated and could use an upgrade to make it more in line with the other resorts.Included in the package is free wifi, breakfast and a daily local news paper for a resort fee of $ 21.00/day.The hotel has no restaurants on the property, but there are plenty around the area and of high quality. Another downside was the small pool located at the 3rd floor which was hardly used during our stay.So overall we had a pleasant stay, reasonable priced and good service.

My wife and I decided to extend our honeymoon vacation. We choose Hyatt Place because it has free breakfast and wasn’t too far from where we previously stayed the night before. One thing I did appreciate is that our room was ready a little early. That was a wonderful thing because we has 5:30 dinner reservations and gave us plenty of time to get ready. Will recommend this property to friends.

I liked the hotel but was surprised to find the bottom bed sheet did not cover the whole mattress. It woke me up at night when my feet felt the rough mattress. I left a note for the staff and they made the bed correctly the next day.

We were very happy with our whole experience. All the employees we encountered were very nice & accommodating. Location is about as good as it gets unless u pay quite a bit more nightly & stay on the beach.Fully recommended theis place.

I’ve stayed here several times over the years and still enjoy staying here. The staff is so friendly with much aloha. They all greet you with an “aloha”. They are very efficient at the front desk for check in’s and out. The rooms are cleans and tidy. There is a small pool but in Hawaii I prefer the beach, which is only steps away. The hotel is close to everything Waikiki. Walking distance to the beach, restaurants, activities.

It is a nice hotel and the only issue is time consumption in get the elevator. ther are only 2 for 20 floors and when you are in a hurry it is a problem. Room and cleanliness is excellent and have a very good location to get good restaurants and for shopping.

This is a good hotel the breakfast is good and the people who work there are great. The bar has a good mai tai. Also, there is a dominos in the hotel. Winning. Very close to the beach. And next door is late night sushi in Friday night.

This property is located 2 blocks from an unobstructed beach, Waikiki. It is convenient to restaurants, bus lines, and shopping. The entire staff was friendly, personable, helpful, and accommodating. I would highly recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki, especially if you want a great location, but not on the main 'drag'.

Not spectacular beach views but very close to the beach. We stayed their before our cruise and it was the perfect hotel. Great rooms, friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet and a terrific location that was easy walking distance to everything.

upon arrival we were greeted by one of the most friendly staff members. check in was a breeze! the room was great! very clean, beds and pillows very cozy & bathroom nice as well. the view was mountainside so nothing super exciting, however, we weren't looking for an ocean view. surprisingly, the room is set up like a studio where the living room is separated from the sleeping area. this was very convenient for having people visit and not feel that they are in the bedroom. all in all, i think this my be my new 'go to' hotel.

This hotel is very loud. When they have to provide ear plugs you know there is a problem. THe location is not bad. There is the trolly out front that takes you around. Staff was friendly, Nice breakfast

Hotel was superb in every which way... from the comfort of the room and beds, to the size of the room, and the convenient of having a buffet breakfast as well as a dominoes pizza by the first floor... Hotel was located a block away from Waikiki Beach, and is convenient to many shopping places as well as food places. This is a great place to stay for the family and definitely something that is be recommended.

This hotel was super clean and the staff were the nicest we have ever encountered! It was in a great location, a very short walk to the beach; and they provide beach chairs, umbrellas, towels and all of the things you need for a great beach day. The breakfast was great too, offered many options. I highly recommed this hotel!!

We had a great experience while staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach during our family vacation in Honolulu. It gave us a feel like we are at home away from home . The staff at this location is very professional .We will be back again.

Very happy with comfort of bed & pillow. Location was fine and daily room cleaned. Breakfast was ok not many choices but we were able to fill up on what was on offer. Towels and beach chairs always available when requested.

You're 200 feet from the beach, easy access to the freeway, 20 minutes to HNL airport, free breakfast, friendly staff. Sure, the room is small, but the bed is COMFY! For the price, it's a great value.

From the beautiful lobby to the wonderful (included) breakfast every morning, from the gym and pool to the free computer and printer use, from the free use of beach chairs and towels to the most comfortable beds in the world, Hyatt Place Waikiki has it all, AND beautiful smiling faces everywhere you turn! Front desk is exceptional and professional. Want to especially mention Jade, Eloisa, and Angelina who got us a late checkout, a complimentary room for 30 minutes before we left, and arranged our taxi to arrive earlier than we thought we needed...which was great because traffic caused us to take over an hour to get to the airport! ( 4:30 pm on Halloween ) Our housekeeper Dalisay did an amazing job every day--it was such a blessing to come back hot and tired to that beautiful room! And wonderful Ryan T, who booked the vacation for us, worked his magic to get us the room we wanted, in spite of us changing our arrival/departure dates, and i am happy to call him my friend. Hyatt Place Waikiki and its' employees embody the spirit of Aloha, and you will have a fantastic vacation when you stay here!

Renovation was done poorly. No central A/C.Rooms have mold odor every time you enter.Old elevators and 1970s reception area / shops .Comfrotable bed and nice recpetionists.Do not stay more then 1 night .

When I first stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach in 2013, I received amazing customer service and had a wonderful stay - I was thrilled to have experienced even better service during our stay in 2019!First of all, I want to thank Annabelle at the Front Desk for her outstanding customer service. When we arrived at the hotel, I wasn't expecting a room to be ready, but she got one ready so speedily so that my mom could be comfortable and have a chance to settle in. Although the other Front Desk employees were great, Annabelle definitely stood out and should be commended for her timeliness, empathy, and superb service.THE LOCATION: While the location of Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is definitely close to the touristy parts of Waikiki, my mom enjoyed it for its proximity to restaurants and shops. I did love how close it was to the beach (about 5-10 minutes) and it definitely was perfectly located for my daily runs to Diamond Head! I do like how it's located further off the "Waikiki strip" and thus is quieter than other hotels closer to the water. Additionally, there are plenty of convenience stores (ABC Stores) right by the hotel!THE ROOM: Our room was adequate for our stay! It was extremely clean and immaculate upon check-in. We had a city view, so it was nothing too special, but we did get a very partial view of the beach from our balcony! The bed was super comfortable and having a fridge in the room was a godsend. THE SERVICE: As I mentioned at the beginning of my review, the service from most of the staff was simply marvelous. Annabelle was absolutely phenomenal. Additionally, the Housekeeping staff at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach are friendly and speedy. I would also like to thank the staff during breakfast service who had to deal with so many hotel guests, but managed to make it a stress-free and clean experience!THE AMENITIES: FREE BREAKFAST! My mom and I really enjoyed this part of staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach as it was helpful for meal planning for the rest of the day. The options provided were also plentiful and varied, not to mention delicious! The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach also offers guests a pool, fitness center, amongst other amenities that make it a really special place.Overall, our stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was fantastic. We were blown away by the customer service, amenities provided, and tucked away location from the craziness of Waikiki! Would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
samtanimal
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent 4 nights at the Hyatt Place in a 10th floor room with a partial ocean view. After much research and comparisons my wife and I booked this hotel as part of a package through Expedia, price and location wise it was tough to beat. While not a brand new or super luxury hotel we found this hotel worked very well for us. Our room was very much as pictured on the hotels website, contemporary and fairly new furnishings, basic but functional bathroom, good quality bed and bedding, lots of towels, and a great (quiet) air conditioner.Check in on a Saturday afternoon was very quick and the desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The elevator to our 10th floor room was very fast and our room proved to be very quiet and clean. The pool is small, no real onsite restaurants (Dominos Pizza) but they do have a pretty decent complimentary buffet style breakfast every morning outside on the 3rd floor patio/pool area. There is also a coffee bar by the front desk that serves Starbuck's coffee, juice, beer, wine, fresh fruit and pastry treats.Every staff member we encountered at this hotel was really friendly and accommodating. The TV and wi-fi worked great, the shower was strong, and the washroom has a seperate sink area which works well for two people getting ready in the morning.The location is close to Diamond Head but only a few minutes walk to shopping, and the number of restaurants within a 5 minute walk from this hotel are too numerous to count. The beach is less than a 5 minute walk down the street and was visible from our room. Complimentary towels are available for the beach at the front desk.Overall the price, location, complimentary breakfast and friendly service make this a great choice. We would stay again.

Very nice hotel. Very Hawaiian! Everything you would expect from Waikiki hotel. Balcony had a good view of the beach. Highly recommended. My wife enjoyed lei making class! Heidi made the check in experience very nice and welcoming.

The location is 1 block from the beach! Very clean rooms. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. We booked via Expedia online but there was an Expedia representative in the lobby who was very helpful.

The staff and people here are what make staying at this location great. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Waikiki. Close walk to beach and surrounding restaurants. However, recommend you rent a car to leave the city as the price tag can really add up.

We recently stayed for a total of 8 nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach and really enjoyed our time there. This may not be the poshest hotel at Waikiki but the rooms were well appointed, with everything we needed, the location was terrific - just a 2 minute walk directly not Waikiki Beach and the staff were outstanding. Every time we spoke to the front desk staff they remembered our names and our room number and nothing was too much trouble for them. Compared to a number of hotels we looked at, the accommodation rate was very reasonable and the service was definitely 5-star. Breakfast was not gourmet but quite adequate and varied and this was included in the room rate. Beach towels and beach chairs were available on request at no charge and we also earned Hyatt points for our overall spend. Would stay here again.

My family had a great stay at this hotel. The service we received from the front desk staff was top notch. They were extremely accommodating and polite to ensure that we had everything that we needed for our vacation. Breakfast was delicious and the location of the hotel was very convenient.

My wife and I have been coming to the Hyatt Place for 6 years. There is a reason for that-- when you know you are getting the best bang for the buck in all aspects- why change?Everyone from the first meeting at the reception desk , housekeeping, and what many hotels don't seem to have-- a very visible General Manager all with superb customer service as their priority.This is an annual event for my wife and we couldn't ask for a more stress free and enjoyable hotelto have as our "home base" while enjoying Oahu.

Great location! Two blocks from the beach and right on the trolley line. The lobby and our room was beautiful! Complimentary breakfast was decent, and saved us some money and sanity by not having to go out for one meal. However, if you're afraid of birds you would definitely want to skip the breakfast as it is always attended by a few stealthy pigeons.My only (minor) complaints are that the elevators can be a little slow and the shower pressure was pretty high. High shower pressure isn't usually a big deal, but after a nice Hawaiian sunburn it feels a little like thumb tacks being shot out of a cannon

Have stayed at this hotel numerous times.We find it very convenient to many restaurants and especially the beachwhich is only 2 blocks from the hotel.Depending on which tower your room is the street noise can get loud at times.Would stay there again

Great hotel with excellent staff. Front desk team really go the extra mile to help you. If you need to book trips or events then Nate at Expedia is simply the best. First class advice from him and trips were very good value for money. This hotel and its staff are great and I fully recommend staying here.
user_name:
peter a
St. Neots, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel staff was wonderful. The staff goes above and beyond for their customers. The rooms were clean. Great location within close walking distance to beach and stores. The only downfall is the longer wait for the hotel elevators.
user_name:
Roxy1017
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice Hyatt hotel, typical of what I’d expect from Hyatt, which we love. Free breakfast! The service and location are stellar. Easy 5 minute walk to the beach and a 15-20 walk to International Marketplace. The rooms and property are a little dated but they have done updates where needed. The dominos pizza in the lobby is awesome and you’re practically next to an ABC store for the essentials (water, snacks, sunscreen, alcohol, souvenirs etc.) we would definitely stay here again.

We arrived early from our flight from New Zealand and found check in staff abrasive / unhelpful and had to wait about 5 hours until our room was available (there seemed no priority). Breakfast has a basic range of food and the area is located in a wind tunnel between buildings on the level 3 rooftop which has many birds hovering around. Our room was quite spacious, however the views shown of Diamond Head booking on the website cannot be seen from room (unless standing out on the deck or looking through the bathroom window). Location is a short walk to both the beach and zoo, although would recommend paying a bit extra and looking at other hotels closer to the main Waikiki area.

It is a good hotel, great view of the ocean. A short walk to the beach (one block), accessible to a variety of choices to eat and shop. The pool is small to comfortable and relaxing. There are two restaurants and stores within the hotel. There's a balcony to sit and relax plus enjoy the view. *(the bathroom could use an upgrade but it's functional). Overall, the staff and excursions expertise was excellent.

Great hotel for 5 night stay, close to the beach, breakfast was good- can get windy but plenty of tables near the fitness centre that are out of the wind, tried the pool however it was chilly- due to the wind and is very small- we spent all our time at the beach. Beds were very soft but house keeping was excellent. All staff were lovely and friendly.

Very noisy from road noise. City view was intersection with honking and loud traffic at all hours. Latch on balcony door had a gap.  Very difficult to sleep. Manager called after 6pm while we were out to dinner on our last night. A bit late. Room was a good size.  Pool is tiny. Breakfast was quite decent and a nice bonus. Location is adequate, but property is not Hyatt quality. Have stayed at Aston on beach a few properties down and it was much better. Was expecting a bit better from Hyatt.

I was here on a business trip that happened to span a weekend. So I needed to be able to get the car quickly to drive to work as well as being within walking distance of food for dinner. But I also wanted to be somewhere central that I could enjoy a nice walk, visit different attractions, and relax. This hotel works great for both. A complementry breakfast with a large variety of hot/cold items starts any day off right. Comfortable rooms that are a decent size for all the stuff I have to bring for a two week trip, plus they have great views. It is nice to just relax in the rooms after a long day of work. The centralized location meant I was within walking distance of various restarants, activites, and locations (like beaches and malls). Valet service is quick and friendly when you have to get the car for work. Overall, hotel and rooms are very clean and well kept. I enjoyed my stay.

I had a great experience at this hotel for several reasons. I was firstly upgraded to a mountain view room immediately upon arrival. It was a nice welcome. The room was spacious, very clean, and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also really perfect and I am super picky about showers but this one felt great. The room was great overall, as well as the housekeeping staff. I am also very happy with the staff, specifically Catherine and Cliff, who helped make my stay even better. They were always friendly, attentive, and made sure to help me with whatever I needed.All in all- great stay and not too pricey. I was not a fan of the valet pricing but I think that is common throughout Waikiki.

I had a wonderful experience staying at this Hyatt Place. The proximity is unbelievably close. You can actually walk to the beach in 5 minutes. Breakfast is usually included with your room reservation. There are fresh fruits, hot plates with boiled eggs from the local farm, oatmeal with walnuts,raisins,and shredded coconut pieces. You will not be disappointed for sure. Instead of parking at the hotel for $40US,you may park at the corner parking lot for $20 with in and out privilege. The hotel staff will actually provide you with the information.I stayed at a room with ocean view but you will never get a full view of the ocean because of its location. The truth is booking a city view room is as good and cheaper. Hotel swimming pool is small and located beside the breakfast area. A very poor architectural layout plan. You will feel uncomfortable to swim while people is eating and watching you.The pool is open late at 10 am in the morning. If you use the pool for daily training then you may get very disappointed.

Great customer service and location. Poor pool, we spent most of our time hanging at pool across the street. Chose to stay here for the breakfast but it wasn’t really worth it. Overall we enjoyed our stay but if we had to do it again, we’d chose the Marriott or the Moana Surfrider.

Beautiful hotel minutes from the beach. Service was excellent by all staff, very welcoming and friendly. Rooms are spacious and clean. Found the hotel lifts to be a little slow, however, nothing to stress about. Overall really enjoyed our stay.

We are now regulars at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel and are going to stick to it. Reasons? Great accommodation, good breakfast to start to day with and perfect wifi. Being seniors we got a better rate for our ten days staying.
user_name:
Corni T
Province of Livorno, Italy

review_body: I always like staying here, plus I’m a Hyatt member so I get perks! :) it’s close to everything, and the staff is always will to help with anything you need. They will even heat up your left overs from the restaurants and serve it on a nice box with utensils.

Enjoyed the view from room on 18th floor.Could see the beach between buildings and surfers, Also the street below and activities from all the different forms of traffic, Called taxi for us to go to ship for our cruise. Very nice breakfast outside and weather was very nice for that,

Our family of three stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki in October. We had a room on the 19th floor with an ocean view. Our room was clean and comfortable and the view was great. We were a short walk to the beach, restaurants, and tons of shops. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I would definitely stay here again. My only negative is that the pool area is small, but you are at the beach (in Hawaii) so it’s not a big deal.

We stayed here for five days and enjoyed it. Our room was average size. The bed was comfortable and the ocean view was reasonably good. The hotel's wifi is fairly speedy. It has a fitness and laundry rooms. The buffet breakfast was above average quality, with seating outdoors, on a large patio in between the two hotel towers. One basic rule exists: do not leave food unattended! Pidgeons and smaller birds will attack it immediately. They are in abundance and are aggressive. This is not unusual for outdoor eating in Waikiki. The hotel's location is at the southeast end of Waikiki, not far from the Duke Kahanamoku statue. That means if you want to go to the trendy Waikiki stores, you have a bit of a walk. The beach is only two short blocks away. Our room had some issues, mainly the mini-fridge was freezing everything and could not be adjusted. Two maintenance men advised us that it could not be fixed, nor was a replacement available. The next day, we received a call from a manager, Bryan, apologizing for the inconvenience, advising us that a replacement mini-fridge was ready to be installed, and were there any other issues he could solve? He also offered to replace anything damaged by being frozen. This level of customer focus is too rare. It filters down to other employees. We noticed all the staff were friendly and responsive. Lisa and Nick gave us expert guidance on a variety of questions including restaurants. We would stay here again.

Room was neat carpet dirty, air conditioner needed cleaning and service. Free breakfast was very good and very clean. On site laundry needs work. Staff was absolutely amazing very friendly. Cookies were very good.

This hotel is only one to two blocks from the beach. Lots and lots of restaurants and shopping to walk to. There are two towers to this hotel. The one with three elevators is 14 stories tall, the one with two elevators is 20 stories tall - and those elevators are very, very slow. It was the only complaint I heard from other guests there, and I heard it a few times daily. The breakfast was good - hot breakfast with other items like cereal and pastries too. The rooms are small (if you are sharing with kid(s) get the suite!). But that is how it is here. Great value, very clean, polite staff, ac in rooms.

I booked this hotel because it was within my budget. It wasn't anything extravagant, but it was comfortable, quiet, still within walking distance to most places in Waikiki. Since the hotel was at the end of the strip, there wasn't too much traffic and tons of beach space. They offer shuttles to a ton of excursions and tours and is right next to an ABC store for convenience.

Perfect location, close to everything in Waikiki. Beautiful diamond head and waikiki beach views. Staff were amazing! Very friendly and always exceptionally helpful! Great place! Will definitely stay again!

We were very satisfied with our room; it was clean and comfortable. We appreciated the "green" option. The breakfasts were wonderful. Best pineapple ever! The area in general was great for walking to the beach and various restaurants.

I have never had such a great stay in any hotel in Waikiki and I have visited many times. The recption staff gave me an efficient, professional and friendly welcoming. I was given a room with a mountain view.and a partial few of Diamond Head. (Ask for a Mountain View room with full Diamond Head scene, if available). And the bell boys were so kind and helpful and prompt. The breakfast in the Cafe On the Patio was superb. The choice of fresh fruit, pastries, meats, and eggs as well as coffee was amazing.And they also had asian choices such as miso and tofu, kimchi etc. While it is not directly on Waikiki Beach, it is only a 5 minutes walk away. So many good things about this hotel. Try it and I think you will return again and again.

Stayed one night on our way to Kauai on honeymoon. Friendly, helpful, flexible and informative. Small little perks such as access to beach towels etc was so useful. Hotel located on main strip but at quieter end. Perfect

Very good location, good breakfast, very friendly staff, clean and quiet. Good value for money, beach towels, games and chairs available. Excellent room service. We had a very nice stay in family, we hope go again.

The breakfast is outstanding. The coffee was superb and the pineapple was the best I have ever eaten. We stayed three days and they made small changes to the breakfast menu that was well planned. They kept the buffet well supplied.

Booked and paid for an ocean view room but my balcony was on the side of the building over the street. I had a window with ocean view - but I don’t find this combination an “ocean view”. Disappointed.

Such a good hotel. Breakfast is nice (but food choices can be limited), but tastes good at least, staff are friendly, has a swimming pool and gym, nice and clean rooms, and much more.Location is also good as well since it’s close to the Waikiki beach and many restaurants, bars and malls.I would return to this hotel.

We knew about this hotel before it became a Hyatt property. Hyatt did a really job in facelifting a very aged property, but there still lots of work that needs to be done to bring it up to the expected Hyatt standard. Over a two nights stay, got severely bitten by bed bugs and had to switch into 3 different rooms during a two nights stay. All of the rooms that were visited, the floor carpets definitely felt not cleaned for weeks to months (yes, it was that dirty). You could not walk around the carpet barefoot since it was very dirty, itchy and at times, muddy. It was very obvious that the carpets have not been shampooed for a very long time. All of the 3 sofa beds that were tried in three separate rooms, all 3 were very dirty and could definitely tell that housekeeping did not change the sheets in the sofa bed for a very long time. One had a complete infestation of bed bugs and after the second night, got tired of complaining to the staff about their standards of basic hygiene. The air conditioning filters needed to be changed since the air quality, although cool, had a smell that the air filters were overdue to be changed. Worked with Brian, assisted general manager, who really tried to make things right over our two night stay. If it wasn't for the awesome interactions with the rest of the staff as well as the food quality at breakfast, I would have ranked this place much lower. Hyatt is doing a really good job in trying to improve this property since the previous property could have easily been completely demolished and rebuilt (the condition when Hyatt took over was very poor). Hyatt brought this property from the dumps, but there is no way, close to the condition of other Hyatt properties that I've stayed at.

Very nice hotel. The only down side to our room was the balcony with ocean view, it was small and the air conditioner running made it to hot to sit outside. Very easy walk to Waikiki beach. Would stay again.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for three nights after a ten day cruise from Vancouver. I loved the location - very close to the beach. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was awesome. They were very friendly and so helpful. There is a Dominos Pizza attached to the hotel.

Nice, comfortable room. Not really an ocean view as advertised (too many tall buildings), but we still enjoyed sitting on our balcony. A short walk to the beach and the hotel will supply towels and chairs for sitting. Close to shopping/restaurants. Pick up for excursions is right across the street. A nice breakfast was included. The pool is small and quiet. No trouble getting a chair! Overall, we enjoyed the stay.

I love that they not only have beach towels to loan, but also boogie boards and beach chairs! It is only a short walk to the beach, and to all the stores and restaurants Waikiki has to offer. The staff always has a smile and a "Aloha" to give you! The sofa bed is not very comfortable - but few are. The pillows are wonderful!

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for our vacation. We are so happy we did. Not only is the location of the hotel so central to attractions, shopping but most importantly only mere steps to the beach. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable as well as a small fridge. They have an onsite laundry that you can wash and dry your clothes before going home, lovely gym, small but clean pool if you want to have a quiet day away from the beach, awesome buffet breakfast only downfall was the birds since the eating area is outside. The staff did their best to shoe them away, but they were always there, you could never walk away from the table to get something because the minute you stand up they fly in and steal your food. Special shout out to Catherine and Heidi from the front desk/guest services and Mildred our cleaner who kept our room clean and stocked with coffee.

The place was awesome overall. Impressed with the service and friendliness of the staff. Breakfast items were good. Sitting areas can be a little more indoors depending on weather conditions. Other than that, all was good.

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is perfectly situated in Waikiki for days at the beach and/or shopping in prestigious retail outlets. It is also near historic monuments that I found quite intriguing. The Hyatt Place Waikiki is clean, courteous, and has wonderful amenities that one just has to try. I would recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach to anyone interested in visiting Waikiki for business or pleasure, long stays or short.

Hyatt Place caters for large families and provides a fabulous free buffet breakfast, but what keeps us going back time and time again is the wonderful welcoming staff who go above and beyond to look after us. They really are an amazing group of people. Mahalo Bryan and team.

We have always stayed here for our vacations and the staff is very warm, welcoming and accommodating. Compared to other hotels on Waikiki, Hyatt is reasonably priced and their resort fee is half the cost of the other hotels. The hotel and rooms are very clean and tidy. You won't be disappointed.

What’s best about this hotel is the location. All the shops are within walking distance. The beautiful Waikiki Beach is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel in itself is ok. Stay for the location but for luxury comfort, go elsewhere. For the price, it’s reasonable enough. Drop off/pickup area is not designed properly. Not enough space and one can get stuck when there are two or more vehicles. Service is good so that’s a big plus. The best feature from this hotel is their electric Toto toilet. Hands-free awesome! LOL!

Pool very disappointing, glad my kids weren’t with me. Would not recommend for families. Location was great but otherwise hotel is below average Hyatt. Good value for the price if traveling on business and don’t plan on spending any actual time onsite besides sleeping. Double billed credit card and took over a week to rectify.

Room has two roaches in the bed. They were alive and crawling while we were asleep. Folks were nice and professional. Left after one night stay. No refund offered. First time had problem with Hyatt. Small room yet did have a view of beach.

This is one of my favorite places to stay in Waikiki. The staff is awesome and very friendly. Great location near the beach. Love the breakfast buffet! The place is also very clean. I've stayed here multiple times with exceptional service each time and will return.

I travel a lot for business and pleasure and have stayed at many hotels. The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach had all the comforts of a Hyatt Place Hotel. It was clean, spacious and was a real treat for our short get-a-way. We enjoyed the spaciousness of the entire room and found the mini refrigerator in the room to be very convenient. The Aloha spirit was plentiful as I interacted with several staff of the hotel, especially Eloisa, who made us feel special the minute we checked in and through-out our stay. As a World of Hyatt Member, were were provided with a complimentary daily breakfast. This is very convenient especially for families or travelers on a budget.  We really enjoyed the quality and the selections of breakfast, especially the pineapple, waffles and Hawaiian sweet rolls. The hotel was only 1 block and very convenient to the beach, shopping and restaurants of Waikiki. We will be returning guests in the future due to our delightful and restful stay. Aloha and Mahalo!

Really had excellent service during our stay, from the front staff who checked to see if they had availability for an improved room since we were Hyatt members to the amazing help of Jeff who helped us down with all our luggage from our room (not an easy feet when it was for a family of 7). He even loaded it into our car for us!! Truly exceptional service. The food was great, as always. The only downfall is the bird bombardment during breakfast outside, but even that got fun to watch. When we come again, we will certainly stay here again for our Honolulu activities.

Great rooms, service and breakfast, the only negative is $39 a day for valet car service, not cool. It cost a lot to stay there, then on top of that, $39 for valet is steep. The customer service was outstanding

The room itself was okay, but had major hassles with our credit card being overcharged for accommodation that had already been pre-paid - nearly $1400 Australian. Everytime we queried it, our account got charged again. Got no satisfaction from Reception. On return to Australia received an email to say that the money had been refunded, but there was no money credited to our account. Had to make numerous phone calls to Hyatt Hotels only to be told that it can take up to 14days for the money to be refunded. Also got hit with an international transation fee! Put a very sour note to our holiday.

I truly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt place. It is not a beach front hotel, but it's conveniently located to many restaurants and shops. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Our room had an amazing ocean view. I'd definitely come back and stay again because it was great value for the price.

We booked partical ocean view w/double bed rooms which is super specious, nice and clean.One thing we expect more from staff is they seem very busy so they sometimes forgot my request like a day keeping request, welcome complimentary services requested before arrived.In addition, lundury room is not enough.Overall i appreciate thier hard work and smile.

I love the Hyatt Place Waikiki. It has all the amenities of a Hyatt Place--comfortable rooms, great bedding, etc., in a perfect Waikiki location. Offering a typical Hawaiian open air entry, the hotel is welcoming from arrival, and the staff warmly welcomes also. It is just a block from the beach, and close to plenty of dining and shopping, but quiet enough for true relaxation. It was easy to find, and convenient to get back to the airport. We enjoyed our stay.

Location is great, near all the action, but the room was still quiet at night.Breakfast selection is very good: yogurt, fresh juice, bread, eggs, waffles, potatoes, kimchi & rice, ...Staff was just fantastic, always good for the best experience.

Hotel is a bit dated, rooms are average but service was great and the location is central to everything. If you pay resort fee all beach towels and chairs, snorkeling gear, boogie boards etc are included and you get a credit to the bar each day for $5 which is nice. Overall good experience.

Great location close to everything and a 2 minute walk to the beach. The room was good and quiet. The bed was really comfortable. The staff here were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast included was good however the location of breakfast wasn't great. It is by the pool and outside. Have to watch out for birds and wind. Overall I definitely recommend.

Fantastic clean hotel near Waikiki Beach. Very good value for the location. Close to shopping, the beach and public transport. The room was very clean and comfortable. Our bathroom had Japanese style automatic heated toilet which was great.

it is the best Hyatt I stayed; the staff is most understanding..the location is excellent--have access to a great variety of restaurant--the only thing I wold recommend is to have simple ls a imple service...would recommend to anyone any time thank you

I love this hotel and come in vacation once a year.. it’s at the end of Waikiki Beach so the area is a little quieter ... one block from the beach.... the breakfast is awesome. All the staff are very nice, friendly and helpful.... it’s a very calm relaxing hotel.

Hyatt Place did it again. Great warm service. Felt like being at home. Management and Staff were top notch. And love the free breakfast every day. Kids liked that we were a block of the beach. Rooms are big enough for a family of 5.

Hyatt Place is a couple short blocks to Waikiki Beach. The staff is very friendly, hotel lobby and rooms clean and comfortable. The free breakfast in the morning is a great way to start the day. The buffet style breakfast had a variety of offering with some different choices everyday. The fresh pineapple was delicious and refreshing. We will stay again on our next trip to Hawaii.

Beautiful hotel and close to the beach! They have fun classes and great breakfast. The staff are very friendly and you should really try the mango lava flow at the bar. I will definitely go back to this hotel

It was quiet and peaceful because we where on the 16th floor and the hotel is located at the end of the strip by the zoo. It was awesome to start the day with their complimentary breakfast. Be aware of other hotels high resort fees that offer you nothing. Hyatt's $24 destination fee is totally justified with their amenities. I felt the staff was really happy to see me. To give you an idea of the extent of their love, I left my cell phone at the pool. When I checked with the front desk, the lady(i wish i got her name) was in the process of emailing everyone in the hotel about my phone. That is impressive! Hyatt will be my first choice. Thank you Hyatt for giving me a memorable vacation. Dan SF

Our flight was due to arrive at 6.00am after 10 hour flight from Melbourne. We booked this for a day stay as our regular accommodation was unavailable until 3.00pm on the west side of Oahu.Turns out the plane was delayed 4 hours which meant we could check straight in at 11.00am after an exhausting journey. The room was comfortable and the bed and shower very welcome. We ate downstairs and whilst not fabulous was adequate for our adventures ahead.In all I would recommend staying here for a day use.

I was there with my family including 2 kids. Location is good. Close to Waikiki Beach and the complimentary breakfast food was good. For the parking, you can park at the across the street parking stricter for 20/day.

just a better information on the wireless printer at the hotel we could not find the name of it so we could make a print of our plane boarding passes, so we had to go to the lobby to do that but I think is a small aspect, thank you for all the rest

We did a day stay (11AM - 4PM) and it was a great option. Cruise ship disembarked early and flight was late so this was a great option to swim, beach, nap, shower, and change. 2 blocks from beach. Nearbly Tiki Bar overlooking beach for lunch was awesome.

Room is very spacious and comfy with couch and lots of table space. Service was consistently excellent, they even had a lock breaker (I lost the key to my luggage padlock). Location is within easy walk of beach and is on the south end so I liked that it is a bit quieter. Breakfast selection alternates every two days - the day with pancakes was great, the other day was mediocre. Breakfast is in a weird location next to a pretty sterile pool (the area can definitely do with some decorations) and is accessed via a fire exit door (can do with better signage and a more welcoming entrance). We missed breakfast on our last morning as we had to leave early, we were given a doggy bag breakfast but it was only 1 fruit, water and muesli bar - would be so much better if there was banana bread/pastry. Also there was only 1 decaffeinated black tea in the room, they should provide at least 2 regular black tea bags.
user_name:
Anyastasia
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I'm writing from the perspective of a business traveler to Hawaii, which definitely put me in the minority. If you're on vacation and not in the room much, it will do you fine. The wifi is good, the free breakfast is very good, and the staff is great. They give a great spirit of Aloha, and there are lots of nice touches. They have beach towels available at the desk, which is really nice. The shortfall is in the room itself. It's not up to Hyatt standards. Small and dark, no desk or work surface (I understand most visitors to Hawaii won't care as much), and the bathroom is tiny. It was clean and had nice furniture but I will pick someplace else next time.

I have stayed in a lot of hotel rooms where they tell you something the description but when you arrive you are disappointed. The room actually exceeded our expectations. I would absolutely stay there again.

This was my second time here. My wife and daughter had an excellent time. The staff is friendly and check in was a breeze. I don't see any reason why I would stay anywhere else. Love the morning breakfast.

This stay was very good, service was good employees very helpful. The only 2 issues I have are:1. Lack of access to a microwave - having to use the employees is not appealing to me.2. The pigeons - having pigeons flying around your food is really disgusting.

Very nice hotel and amazing staff. There was a bit of a situation with my reservation when I arrived and I really appreciated how well and fast it got handled. Location is ideal:close to the beach, park and shopping/dining area in Waikiki. Breakfast is really good and has quite some variety

This hotel was only a 3 minute walk to Waikiki beach. If you book tours they don't pick up at this hotel but they pick up at either the Marriott across the street or the Aston just down the street. Both are about a 2 minute walk. The breakfast was wonderful. Nice hot breakfast with fresh fruits daily. The pool was nothing to write home about. It was quite small but the beach is just down the street. The rooms are clean but many times they weren't cleaned until the afternoon. We'd leave for the morning and return by noon or 1 and the room was still not cleaned. They could use more hangers in the closet. There was 1 morning in which we were asked to evacuate at 2am and take the stairs. We were on the 11th floor. By the time we got to the 4th floor they said false alarm. That was rough because we had an early morning tour that day and being woken up and asked to walk out of the building interrupted our sleep.

This hotel is in a great location to Waikiki Beach. It is in need of refurbishment. There are no restaurants in the hotel but they do have a bar that serves some snacks. There is a Dominos on site that needs to look at how they make their pizzas. The staff were friendly and very helpful.The rooms were good, but are showing their age. New furniture and fittings would go a long way to fixing this. Breakfast was very basic and they served the same food every day with virtually no variety.Compared to its competition this hotel is value for money.

We were happy with our stay here at the Hyatt Place. The front end staff (Eloise & Cliff) were very accommodating and friendly. They helped us checked in and out without any issue. I liked how they gave the $5 daily credit as part of the stay, as well as another $5 credit if you don’t use the daily housekeeping (green program). Housekeeping staff there were excellent and very friendly. Maria the housekeeper was very friendly and helpful with our needs. Loved the daily hot breakfast. None of these continental crap. It was yummy in our tummy! Location was great and so close the the beach. Less than 5mins walk. And on top of that, there’s an ABC right beside the hotel. So convenient. The rooms were spacious (we stayed on the 18th floor, and a great view of Waikiki beach). Only downside is that the elevators were a tad slow. We had a minor issue with finding a little bug in our room. The staff was fast to act and check to make sure there wasn’t any infestation or anything. Thank goodness there weren’t. They did a thorough check and cleaned our room. Otherwise, I don’t have any complaints. I would definitely come back here again.

Good value for money.. hotel situated close to beach and shops.. generous sized room, excellent room service.. average breakfast but is expected given its included in price.. staff are helpful.Keep it up.

My overall experience at this Hotel was outstanding. They served great breakfast everyday, the staff was polite and prompt whenever we needed anything. The family and I are planning to next year and hopefully stay here. I will stay a reccomend to others.

This hotel never disappoints. I came here every year because all the staff are so welcoming and thoughtful. I don’t think I’ve ever seen such a bunch of happy people at work. It’s clean and steps away from the beach. Housekeeping and breakfast staff are s wonderful. The manager, Ihab, is truly wonderful and approachable. Please don’t change any of the staff as it really makes this hotel a home for me. I’m already planning for next year!!!!

Staying at this hotel just 3 blocks from our favorite surf-break and one block from Kapiolani park, it is always a convenient and a very relaxing holiday. Not a stuffy-self imposing or self-important hotel, it does have friendly helpful staff and you may luck out to get a room with a view of the surf from your lanai. We've stayed here for many years and it's become our go-to hotel.

The location of property was in great place. Close to beaches and shops and restaurants. Food was okay for breakfast. The hotel rooms are outdated. The rooms could use better beds and king size pillows.

I cant say enough about how accommodating and gracious the staff was. They were excellent!! Breakfast was above average. In my opinion the cereal options were lacking (i love cereal and milk). No microwave in the room was a pretty big letdown. We brought microwave snacks and we were very disappointed that there was no microwave. We had to go downstairs to get things microwaved. this was our fault for not looking into this before hand so still 5 stars. Really close to the beach!!

$5 discount on food, not given at checkout. Pool and area can use update. Better description and pictures of room set-up i.e.: fold out twin couch vs. fold out chair (very small), patio a + but, tiny, window in toilet good. Internet use only 30 min.

My wife and I were simply gobsmacked at the service we received at HPW and the beautiful surroundings and location of this great place.The room and amenities were just right for us and perfectly designed, spacious with a balcony looking out to the sea - best place to be. If we were located beachfront we probably wouldn’t be taking the time to walk to the beach and it’s surrounding shops - HPW was excellent for our purposes - great Staff, breakfasts, pizzas at midnight (when feeling a little peckish), right opposite the bus stop that takes us downtown or Ala Moana Center or Pearl Harbour.We’re planning our next holiday stay at the HPW and this time it’ll be for 2 weeks and not 5 nights.Breakfasts, location, room layout, service, hospitality were next to none. We shall be BACK!

We had the wonderful stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Special mention goes to Annabelle to gave us complimentary early check in at 9am after a long journey, and also complementary champagne. She was a gem, nothing was too much trouble for her. Thanks again Annabelle and all the team at Hyatt. This has been a special few days.

Definitely worth the money! We enjoyed our stay, the hotel is fairly close to the beach, the breakfast which is included free in the hotel offers many varieties of food, the room itself is a decent size and has a beautiful view, thank you for a lovely stay, we would love to come back, would definitely recommend this hotel.

Our stay was wonderful. Front desk, breakfast staff and housekeeping were very courteous and efficient. Our room was quiet and the city view was fine. We used The Bus most days and the bus stop was literally just across the street. When we rented a car we walked just across the street to the car rental location. (We opted to turn our car in each night to avoid the overnight parking fee.) Everything was so convenient! The free breakfast relieved us from making early morning decisions and it was delicious. With Kuhio beach just a few streets away we were in the middle of everything without the press of the crowd. It was a great trip!

I would say the reviews of this place were accurate. Not a luxury accommodation, but prefectly suitable for one night's stay in Waikiki area. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean. Breakfast was alright. I'd stay again, but wouldn't want to spend my entire vacation there. Just my preference. Close to the beach. Chairs and towels available to borrow. All in all, a positive experience.

We haven't found a better deal - and we have stayed in a lot of different properties in Waikiki. The staff is excellent, and many have been there since this was the former Ocean Resort Hotel. Annabelle, our desk clerk, was beautiful and gracious and gave us a fantastic room. The hotel is spotlessly clean, housekeeping is attentive and friendly. The free breakfast is awesome - not the usual junk food that other hotels might offer for a free meal. And the location is perfect - out of the fray but close to everything in Waikiki. Highly recommended.

The hotel was right across from the Marriot Hotel that was a block long and where all the main buses to take you most places on the Island as well as many tour buses stopped. We were the same distance about a block from a beautiful beach and many small shops. We were close to an ABC store that carried most items like aspirins, cough drops food items etc one might need.The staff in the hotel were extremely accomadating and the breakfast was fabulous. Everyday I would go up to the bar and get a glass of cold ice water to take with me. The hotel gave the guests a beach chair and beach towels to use at the beach, I also had a lesson on Friday at the hotel on how to make a fresh flower Leigh. It was really fun and interesting. This hotel is a great value for the price which was less expensive than the Marriot. Maybe not as luxurious looking but an excellent value and in the same location.

Wonderful holidays at Waikiki Place. The staff was excellent especially Phil and Juvie. Phil helped us with a better room as our initial room was not good. Juvie took care of the room housekeeping and kept is clean!!

Everyone I encountered was friendly and genuinely pleasant to be around. I had some extenuating and circumstances surrounding my stay not relating to the hotel, and the staff worked hard to assist me. The facilities were clean and nice. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a clean, professional stay with close proximity to the beach.

The Hyatt Place was a pleasant stay for my family and I. There are a few people that made our trip exceptional, bellman Ryan was extremely helpful in assisting my family and I throughout our vacation. I forgot the name of the woman that checked me in she was extremely helpful as well. Kudos to your staff members I appreciate all the assistance that they gave me.
user_name:
ronaldbass
New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic place to stay. Made our holiday one to enjoy. Relaxing and memorable . Amenities were well maintained and allowed a wonderful holiday experience. I did think the resort fee on top of accomodation was a bit unfair. Maybe we could look for a house or similar without the extra costs next time.

Hyatt Place Waikiki is in a fantastic location, < 5 minute walk to the beach, plethora of food options nearby. It is a hyatt place, so is not luxurious, but you should expect that going into the property. The staff here is outstanding! Eloisa assisted with check in and was an absolute delight. I would definitely stay at this property for future visits to Honolulu.
user_name:
croniet
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Public parking across the street is convenient. Bathroom has no air vent; need to open the bathroom window to let out moisture in the bathroom.Breakfast is great especially the sweet potatoes, and fresh fruits.

the rooms are a little worn looking and need a bit of updating. There were four of us in one room and the bathroom was very, very small. When you went into the bathroom, you could barely get the door closed and be able to turn around.

First time staying here at the Hyatt Place with my wife and our toddler. We stayed there for 7 nights. Upon arrival, a bell man was very friendly and offered to help us navigate. After checking in, the receptionist just gave us our key. She didn’t offer any extra info about the hotel or city. She did however give us a room on the 3rd floor which is the same floor as the gym, laundry room and breakfast buffet. Our room was right next to the gym so we constantly heard people dropping weights. Breakfast was a joke. Same food everyday, they switch up one item a day, they alternated between sausage links, pork kalua, pancakes, and Cinnabon. Everything else remains the same. Elevators were slow and staff members will use the elevators and not let you in with them at certain times, so you have to wait longer to get in the elevators to go to your room.

I would like to thank The Hyatt Place Waikiki for never letting us down & always making our stay amazing & for making my birthday special by sending me a complimentary champagne bottle to my room 4 my bday thank you for the love ❤️
This is a great property with great food, great location and best of all, the best employees.Centrally located near the beach and many eating places within walking distance. Hope to stay there again.

Stay, rooms, breakfast was great. They give you a $5 a day rebate using their green program and a $5 credit per day for their snack bar (great if you have kids). I only wish they had late check out as we had a late flight, I understand they were fully booked. Close to the beach, close to the zoo, and we even walked to diamond head from our hotel with our children 7 & 9. I would definitely stay here again.

Sometimes it time to invest in capital improvements and the for Hyatt Place Waikiki it is that time. The age shows with extremely slow elevators and a less than inspiring pool. Both would require a major renovation. However, despite the aged hotel I found the service to be efficient and cheery. The breakfast was fine but the did not appear to offer the omelets like other Hyatt Places I have visited. The rooms were of a decent size and were kept clean and relatively updated. The location, while not on the beach, was convenient.
user_name:
PerksAdvisor_NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: I know there are a lot of different hotels that are better than this one but this actually fits the bill. Perfect location as it was close to the beach (w/ beach wall w/c is perfect for the kids). The staff are incredible. Can’t say anything bad really. We stayed for 8 days in Waikiki and if not for this hotel then we might not been able to stay that long. The experience was awesome and most likely we’ll be here again next year. Highly recommended!

We have a great view and loved how big our room was. We will be back. Free breakfast was also a big plus. different yummy options. The staff was kind and very helpful. Beach access is literally 2 blocks away from the hotel.

The room was spacious, clean and setup nicely. The location was nestled between the beach and a handful of restaurants. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom configuration was nice. Also, the breakfast was not only free but super yummy!

Enjoyed our stay visiting with family and friends. The room was large and pleasant and very quiet, all a plus. The only thing we would change was the breakfast area. It’s outside by the pool and overrun with birds and extremely windy. The complimentary breakfast would be outstanding but for that.
user_name:
Camper22935313414
New York City, New York

review_body: Very nice hotel. Clean room and bathroom. Staff was very friendly Not directly on the beach, so there is a walk to get there. Our room had a pull out couch, however it was actually a pull out chair. No one larger than a child could sleep on that . Overall, nice hotel

Hyatt Place is a great hotel to stay at, walking distance to everything and the bus is right on the corner.The minute you check in, the staff greets you with hospitality,friendliness and a big Aloha. My second home

Good location, close walk to beach and shops. Staff were very friendly and let us check in early when our room was ready. Breakfast was included in the price and was fairly good. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Overall good value for money

When I checked out and returned to my hometown. I got a phone call from hotel manage and he said I stained bathtub and I have to pay $500. It was terrible. I like to enjoy travel and Hawaii was wonderful. But, Hyatt gave me nightmare. I think the bathtub was very worn and easy to stained. I don't know the exact reason. Anyhow, they charged me $500 and I claimed directly. I will never experience again in Hyatt.

I stay at Hyatt Place Waikki every time I go to Oahu for the past 8 years. The manager Ihab is top notch, professional , hard working, very considerate and understanding . The hotel and rooms are very clean and well kept. The beds are super comfortable.It is one of two hotel that includes all that you can eat hot and cold breakfast. The staff is very courteous and kind. Cliff, who checks in the guests, has a positive attitude, hard worker and goes the extra mile.

Grunt and GrossRoom was not properly cleaned. There was feces on the toilet bowl when we Checked in. After traveling all the way from NY with a tired kid, that’s the last thing I needed. We were compensated with hotel points but, I would not recommend this place at all. The elevators could not accommodate all of the guests and we had to wait forever for them. The rooms are dated and worn down and even being on the top floor, it was extremely noisy outside.

Great hotel located on the east side of Waikiki. The staff were very friendly upon check in and the rooms were clean. Breakfast was more or less the same every morning, but the food was pretty good (miso soup and rice are a ++), so no complaints there!Pros:-Very friendly staff who are very helpful (everyone from valet, parking attendants, concierge, food and beverage, housekeeping)- You get a $5 credit to be spent at the snack bar every day- Free beach towels, chairs, boogie board rentals (2 per room)- Close to cheap parking ($25/night at Sunset Waikiki or the Aston Banyan)- Right next to ABC store!- Really close to the beach, less than a 5 minute walk!Cons:- Beware of the birds during breakfast on the 3rd floor. They steal your food, one even pooped on my sister's head! - I booked a "1 King Bed, Ocean View with Single Sofa Bed" room, the single sofa is no joke. You can't turn or roll anywhere on that bed. Ended up upgrading to a "2 Queen Bed" room because it was too small for 3 people. The ocean view is meh...there are some buildings in the way

This was our first visit to Hawaii.We booked our vacation through Expedia. Hotel: Hyatt Place Waikiki-cannot say enough about our service at the Hyatt.Small things matter....Tote bag presented at check in with water, beach amenities and when we needed, fresh towels and beach chair. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. Arrival at the hotel: Hotel had suggested using Charley’s taxi-flat rate $29. Gave us the number and instructions/ Taxi was quick - no issues.Check in: Guano Was pleasant, very welcoming and upgraded us without asking to a bigger room. we shared that we were babysitting our nieces one night and that was appreciated Guano -exceeded our expectations at check in. (Thoughtful, kind, happy and welcoming) Concierge: Abbie; I don’t think I can say enough about Abbie’s help and insight.She is an amazing asset to the hotel. I myself am from a long hotel background and I can say Abbie exceeded our expectations many many times. We booked a sunset cruise on our first night( the bus scheduled to pick up for the tour was 30 mins delayed and waiting at the wrong hotel for us ..not Abbie’s fault but the fault of the bus company. Abbie called them on our behalf and waited outside with us and called again when delayed further.She remained positive about getting us on that evening and we did!we had the most enjoyable sunset cruise (excellent recommendation) We also booked a snorkeling trip for my family and ourselves. Got travel info on hikes, bikes etc and Abbie was a tremendous help organizing it all. She was always enthusiastic, ready to help and full of info and suggestions. Abbie, you’re amazing. The housekeeping department kept our room clean and fresh ...even when we tracked sand in. Kimberly checked us out. She was also helpful for our travels that day. All wonderful service, and the team seemed genuinely happy to help their guest...Aloha spirit in full swing at the Hyatt place Waikiki.Thank you team for a tremendous stay. We will be recommending your hotel to all our friends and family in Vancouver, Canada

We had a great stay overall, the only challenge was the super slow elevators! The location was great and very close to everything! Staff were super professional-the rooms were great size and clean but just one issue which was coming across a huge coackroach which we reported.

From the moment we arrived this last weekend, we were given 5 star service from all of the staff. From getting water offered while we were in line waiting to check in to a phone call and text to ensure we were happy, we felt like VIP’s the entire time. The stand out was Erin at the front desk who went above and beyond to ensure we were comfortable and happy with our beautiful upgraded room. They even sent up a bottle of wine for my birthday. The free breakfast offered was standard of the other Hyatt Places I’ve stayed at and was well supplied and good. Excellent value for the money and located literally a 5 minute walk to the beach! Thank you! We’ll be back!

Nice property, but the standout was the service and support from the staff. Well beyond anything I have experienced elsewhere, and I travel extensively for business globally. Excellent and caring service.

Stayed at this Hotel after POA cruise trip. Very good location and spacious rooms.Love the decoration and pool area. Staff at ground-floor concierge service desk are really helpful. The staff at check-in desk upstairs was not super helpful. We gave them advanced notices weeks ahead that we would arrive earlier around 9am. But the hotel staff seems not to interested in making efforts to check you in. Have to wait for 2.5 hrs around 11:30am to get our room. There is a nearby Rental Car service. But you need to make reservation much earlier. Christmas time is usually sold-out.
