We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. The hotel was in a Great location 2 min walk to the beach which was fantastic. We were upgraded which was great so the room was lovely and spacious and bed was very comfortable! You could borrow for free snorkels, towels and beach toys which was a nice addition. Pool was small but good enough for a quick cool down. If I got a good price on this hotel I would definitely stay here again based on this, though if your expecting service and 5 star experience I wouldn’t. I found you could hear the noise from the street in the room even though we were on level 10. Lifts are extremely slow. The buffet breakfast in my opinion was disgusting, the food was extremely basic with the bread only giving you peanut butter as a spread and waffles/ pancakes cold. Safest bet was the cereal. I found the staff not very helpful or friendly and at times we would go out in the morning and come back in the afternoon and room was still not freshened up.

Had a great stay at the Hyatt Place recently. Arrived at 8am from Sydney and we were hungry and exhausted, we were very lucky to speak to Annabelle at reception who not only gave us complimentary breakfast but checked us in immediately (instead of 3pm!) and upgraded us to a larger room! Amazing service, thank you Annabelle!!

Locations is 5 min walk from Waikiki beach. clean rooms, exceptional service. great break fast. breakfast is in open location , so there are a lot of pigeons.you get 5 dollar credit per day tp use at little cafe. room service available 24 * 7

The location of the hotel was great, 5 minues walk to the beach. The room was bit enough for a family of 5. The only thing that we didn't like was the poo, it was too small. Breakfast buffet was great, we missed some cheese and ham.

i have stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel many times, and they always provide exemplary service, night and day! I'm a long time World of Hyatt member and enjoy the amenities but i see this same treatment provide to all of their customers. I enjoy seeing many of the same Hyatt Team members that i've seen before and this tells me they're happy to be working there. The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel has many amenities there free to everyone that many other hotels charge for. You see happy employees everywhere, from the Valet members to the Front Desk to the bar and all treat you as if you were lifetime members of Hyatt! You won't find a better hotel for the money anywhere in Waikiki Beach!

Wow. Such a great hotel did the Zoo end of Waikiki and so it’s quieter than the other end .2 blocks back from the beach with an ABC just one block away. Check in staff friendly upon arrival and throughout stay .Dominos pizza also located on the property. .The room was lovely with Amazing water views , to be able to sit on balcony to watch sunset is something special. The true king bed was comfortable , and linen and towels of good quality , bathroom towels all new large and fluffy towels unlike some other hotels. The room also has a mini fridge and an in room safe which is not mentioned anywhere. The room was spotlessly clean with housekeepers being friendly offering Aloha each time you saw them. The hotel Currently has FREE breakfast on offer on level 3 0630-0930 which is a good amount of time. There is ,scrambled eggs, sausages bacon, potatoes, pancakes, waffles, plus selection of cereals and yoghurts , toasts, fruit juice , fresh fruit and teas, coffees. Previous comments have complained about ques at breakfast and seating issues .Well I personally I had no issues with either, the hotel were constantly replacing dishes and so always plenty on offer and the place was cleaned non stop.Some guests need to remember its a buffet style breakfast and you can go back for seconds if need be. Seating also not a problem and plenty of pools side seating. The hotel also serves breakfast in the foyer as the same time to assist with crowding , people have mentioned this has less selection that the main area, this is incorrect and it’s the same selection, so choose what ever is most convenient to you.I did see a sign that from 01Nov that breakfast is only only avail to Hyatt members on selected rates which is good and may stop some people doing their daily shop at the Buffett. People have previously Complained about the wait times and lift amount of people waiting for lifts, I did not encounter this issue. .My only lift feedback was there is never a lift on the ground floor at any time of the day or night .The hotel also has a great gym, and 3 washer and 3 dryer machines located on level 3 behind the gym. The laundry is $3 and takes coins and or credit card which is handy.Beach / pool towels are avail from the pool and reception , they also loan beach chairs and pool/beach toys .As part of the resort fee charged you have a $5 room credit per day to use , and at reception there is a snack bar with food, drinks , Starbucks etc.I used my voucher for a good coffee each day and not wasted. Denny’s also located 2 blocks down road towards zoo .My only gripe with the hotel was the water saving shower head which had decreased water flow and made showering difficult , and the other issue is the resort feee, and yes all property’s in Waikiki charge it , but why just not add it to the room rate and have it as a total include all tax, fee, resort fees, as it is annoying upon check out to be hit with daily fee as total. You can also earn Hyatt points or airline frequent flyer miles on rates , which I did as I booked direct on website. Hotel also sends emails day before and can pay for early check in and or late check out for a minimal fee to save sitting around all day waiting for check in , it was a well worth it price .Would I stay here again? Absolutely Would in recommend this hotel ? Absolutely. All in all I would rate the hotel a 9/10.Having being a previous Hilton return guest , Hyatt place has one me and hope to return soon. I hope my photos help others.

The hotel is very clean. Big open spaces with helpful people. We were upgraded upon arrival without asking! Room was beautiful and very big. There are computers available for use and a nice gift shop.

This is a very nice property in a good location. It's on the eastern side of the beach, so it's a little more secluded and less crowded, which I loved. Nice clean rooms and good service and a typical Hyatt Place breakfast. No complaints here.

From the day we Checked in til the Day we checked out we got excellent service from the whole team. From the front desk, the morning staff for the breakfast buffet are so friendly and always take time to say hello and last but not the least is our house keeping Julie C. she always have a good smile on her face every time we see her in the morning as well clean our room very well. We appreciated her very much:)

The rooms are clean and spacious with a small balcony facing the ocean meaning you can see the see in between the beachfront building. Breakfast is very good and versatile. The beach is in walking distance (less than 5 min walk). Front desk are very kind and helpful providing beach towels and chairs (snorkeling equipment as well). Parking is a big issue and the hotel charges $39/night. There is a self parking lot across the street (diagonal) called 'Waikiki Banyan Public Parking'. They charge $20/day or $80/week. There are of course more options (zoo etc.) but in my opinion it is very convenient.

All staffs were amazing especially for Angeline at the Front Desk. Beautiful property, very roomy and comfortable and excellent breakfast with an abundance of selection. Great location accessible with many amenities near by.

The location was great! Two blocks away from the beach. Two blocks away from Honolulu zoo. You could hear the elephants, monkeys and exotic birds making noise the morning. Great view if your on the diamond head side. Breakfast is continental. Just scrabble eggs. No special order eggs. Domino's pizza is on the ground floor.

A couple of minor issues which when raised with staff were put right very quickly with responses that had us very pleasantly surprised. Any accommodation can have slip ups and it’s the putting right that counts. Well done Hyatt.

What a comfortable place to come back to after a hot day! Everyone was lovely, there were a lot of options around for food and drink. The pool leaves a lot to be desired but we weren’t there for the pool, the ocean is so close and perfect!

Would recommend if you want clean comfy room-however the ocean view we paid extra for was obscured by large buildings and not worth the extra. This hotel doesn’t have a restaurant only breakfasts. The pool wasn’t very inviting so we didn’t use it. If you want more in-house nightlife such as bar and entertainment go elsewhere. Overall the room was great and very comfortable bed and pillows. A short walk to beach - about 200 metres

This location is really nice. It is a block away from the beach. We decided to park a block away in a parking deck which was 1/2 of the price to valet at the hotel. They only offered valet, and there was always a line. When we arrived, there were giant groups of young people congregated everywhere, and we were told it was grad week, and they were a host hotel. Most of the people who were clearly on grad week were polite, but a few were very not family friendly with super loud cursing. My kids are 9, 11, and 13. Luckily we did not spend too much time in the hotel. We did hear screaming and running at hours all throughout the night. The breakfast on 1st floor was not nearly as nice as the breakfast spread by the pool. I would go to only the one by the pool. There were lots of birds, so someone should stay to guard the food at the table. My kids loved watching the birds. Our room was clean and comfortable, but a let down from Aulani which we had just left. We used this portion of our trip to sight see and enjoy the famous Waikiki Beach. There was also a long wait for elevators during busy times. Staff in the breakfast areas were the friendliest.

The hotel is close to the beach and all other amenites, including shopping. Our room was spacious and the housekeeping quality was excellent. Checking in and out was a breeze and the concierge was friendly and helpful. Hyatt Place is great value for money.

Overall we had a great experience staying at Hyatt Place Waikiki. The only complaint is that the only two elevators on the property are extremely slow. The location of the property from the beach was walking distance. We were able to checkout beach towels, chairs, bodyboards, and snorkels on a daily.

Hotel is a block from the sidewalk along Waikiki Beach. Open air lobby. My room had a king sized bed and a “city view”. I did not care about the room view, as I was not on vacation to sit around my room. City view is cheaper than Ocean view. Lots of tour buses pick up in front of this hotel. Abbey Johnson is an AMAZING concierge. The room has a mini-fridge, which I used to store bottled water only. There was complimentary breakfast included with my room. Not sure how long this will be the case. Check the fine print when you book. I don’t have a Hyatt loyalty credit card or account. There is a resort fee. Good overall stay. Being Summer and peak travel time, I have no noise complaints. Only ambient usual “hotel” level noise.
user_name:
Leslie T
Winston Salem, North Carolina

review_body: We got a beachside room with two queens that was a great value for the money. The room was clean and attractive. Only complaint with the room is minor: The bathroom is very small. The service was attentive and efficient. We never found ourselves waiting for any request. Service in the lobby and the front desk was particularly good. We were a large family, ages 11 to 82, and they did everything possible to accommodate our special requests. The breakfast buffet is pretty basic, but it's still a good fuel-up for a long tour or day at the beach. This was our first hotel on our three-week visit to Hawaii, and though our hotels continued to increase in luxury and expense as we moved around the islands, we remained pleasantly happy with this one. There's a cafe/bar on site, but no formal restaurant.

We got a good deal on the hotel for 2 nights and then stayed here again on our way out of Hawaii. The first stay our rooms was tiny but the bed was very comfortable and we didn’t spend much time in the room so it was t an issue and they did manage to give us an early check in as we were exhausted after our night flight. The staff were very helpful and friendly on both stays. Our return stay was different room and was very spacious but again, we didn’t spend much time in the room. Good location, close enough to Waikiki beach to walk and the hotel offers beach towels and beach chairs. Thanks Hyatt Place for a great stay in Waikiki

Great place and awesome customer service. Parking is a little expensive but worth it. I love how they offer chairs, beach toys and snorkeling mask to their guest. Breakfast is a plus, I love they offer a different breakfast everyday.

Hyatt charged us for 2 days stay, where Hyatt was paid for our stay in advance. It was a package deal, booked thru AAA/Pleasant Holidays included Cruise, 3 days stay stay, Taxi Service, Hyatt Place charged our credit card for 2 days stay. Hyatt hopping charges are overseen, buried with other credit charges during holiday. Hyatt is not issuing credit?

We stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for six nights in August 2019. The hotel room that we got has air conditioning that isn't working! Oahu in August is VERY hot and it is nice to have a hotel room to cool down - we asked for maintenance to get it fixed THREE times but it was never fixed! When we checked in, our room was at 20 degrees Celsius but it felt so hot - we had family checked in on the same floor as us and they have their AC unit set 23 degrees Celsius and it was already cold enough. So our first night was rough due to sweating throughout the night. When maintenance came the first time to fix our AC unit, he lowered it down to 16 degrees Celsius, but we were still sweating throughout our second night. When we asked to get it fixed the next day, we were told to wait for engineers to fix the AC unit, so we stayed at our hotel room the whole day, BUT NO ONE came to our room. When I asked for the third time, the maintenance came to clean the AC unit as he said it's dirty that's was it's not working properly so he asked us again to request for maintenance the next day to clean the outside AC unit - at that point after the third time of requesting to get our AC fixed, I got tired of following up.. so I was like whatever there is no point following up with these people every single day. So our whole six nights of staying there was not the best experience.. I shared this disappointing experience when we checked out and the lady said it's weird that no one offered us a different room - well yes I could've asked for a different room but it's supposed to be their job to be the first one to offer us a different room AFTER THREE TIMES of requesting to get our AC unit fixed.

A great place, spacious, clean room and very friendly staff. Only detractors are the breakfast - limited range (a lot of bread and cake) and no gluten free options for a coeliac. Lifts struggle to cope with demand most of the time.

The rooms were comfortable. When we had any issue it was fixed quickly. Only three washers for the whole hotel. Beds and pillows very comfortable. One block off the strip made for a quieter location. Breakfast was boring after the seventh day!

Parking is a hassle. One the hotel charges $40 a night and is not even within the hotel you have to park in a different parking structure. Two the elevators take forever because they only have two for the hotel. Takes forever to go up or down. The hotel has two towers one of them is ok spacious rooms. But the back tower is a smaller tooand they don’t have central air conditioner they have more like swamp coolers. You do get continental breakfast which is alright.

Price is price - you can managed to get high or low price, so my focus is on hotel itself.Very positive stay, quite good breakfasts, friendly team, good WiFi, free of charge renting sun chairs and swimming masks.... But room was not clean up after first night. Quite strange.

Among other Hyatt locations we stayed.... this Waikiki location is the worst! The toilet had pooped stuck from previous guests and had to ask twice for cleaning. Mattress is old. Restroom and room is compact. Elevator is way too slow and room card is malfunction. Breakfast options and seating are very limited. Some staffers are nice and few are unhelpful. The location is not too far from the beach and our room had nice ocean view. Parking structure is more inexpensive than other property nearby.

Our stay was was great. The customer service was top notch. We had a few issues with the room initially and the staff went ABOVE AND BEYOND our expectations to make sure everything was fixed. The were very accommodating and checked in often to make sure we were happy and Satisfied. This above anything else made our stay perfect. I want to thank all the staff. The breakfast was wonderful with many choices and it was well stocked and clean. The room was cleaned in a timely matter and we were well stocked with soaps, shampoo etc. we will definitely return the next time we visit Hawaii Many Maholos our stay was amazing because of you

The rooms were very affordable and the free breakfast is a great addition for someone on a budget. The hotel is a block away from the beach and the zoo. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If they can improve on anything it would be the valet service, it’s small and unfortunately only has about two people pulling and parking cars for the whole hotel. The stay was great and would do it again.

Stayed one night before joining cruise. hotel is in a good location close to beach. It was very clean and well kept. We had a good view from our room. Staff are very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast was a bonus but was a bit of a free for all.

Joined member club as it gives you free breakfast. Big value but breakfast itself needs work. Over crowded and staff overwhelmed (very pleasant people just too much work to keep up). Birds an issue on the rooftop meal service. Room pretty nice for 6 of us. Included ac. Staff super nice. Heidi is you go to for extra nice service. A credit to the hotel.

We weren't quite sure what to expect since we've never stayed near Waikiki before. Hyatt place was located close to the beach. Staff went above and beyond to be helpful. We used the Expedia booking agent Abbie and she was kind and helpful to get is to all the attractions we wanted to see. Have no problem recommending this place to stay for a family.

The overall service is bad. The AC didn’t work in are room and maintenance solution was turn it down to 60. Didn’t work. Valet parking is a joke. Long wait time at least 30 minutes or more (usually more) to get your car. Not the workers as they are going as fast as they can but at most two working. Don’t request anything like towels or a fan because you have to call at least two or three times before they come with at least 30 minutes between phone calls. It took almost 90 minutes to get more towels.

Located on Paoakalani Ave. the hotel has everything around : convenience stores like Coco Cove and ABC, lots of restaurants and fast food. You will find everything you’re craving for, from local, american, mexican to japanese food. Waikiki beach is just down the street. Room was clean and spacious. The pool is small but you have the ocean next. You also have a Domino’s pizza on the ground floor of the hotel next to the elevators. Breakfast buffet is very good and has many options depends on days: waffles, pancakes, french toasts, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, rice, kimchi, miso soup, bacon, link sausages, canadian ham, oven baked sweet potatoes... You’ll feel full for a long time for sure.On the same 3rd floor there is a laundry room with 3 washing machines and 2 dryers very useful when you stay longer. And next to it, gym for the ones who ate too much at the brekfast buffet.Tip if you come with a car, park on the other corner of the intersection at the Waikiki banyan condo $80.00/week.Nearly forgot to mention that staff is very helpful and very nice.

Homeless problem throughoutDrug use on street cornerViolence almost broke out.No parking assistance offered after requestedNo Parking on street changed in middle of night which I found my car towed in morning

Good place to stay with kids, the beach is a 2 min walk, perfect beach especially for young kids. Trolley stop is a block away. I like this area of Waikiki Beach because its tends to be bit less crowded. Everyone at the Hotel (especially Aja and Nick) were so accommodating and kind. The pool is small and can get crowded however it wasn't a big deal for us as we spent most of the day at the beach. Would stay here again for sure.

The location was excellent, room we had was perfect! However, might need to update the elevator - they are too slow for the amount of people staying in this hotel! Many times we have to wait for a long time to get on!

Hotel rate was average but they made all customers wait till 3.00 pm sharp before starting to book-in ALL of us in the same time with only 2 receptionist ! so waiting in ques in the heat ( the lobby does Not have air con) was not fun.. on the last day of our stay the fire alarm went off at 4.00 am and it took them almost an hour to give- all clear although we all saw the firemen leaving the hotel as we came down the stairs ?? staying here was disappointing to say the least .
user_name:
Aliss A
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The hotel has a very good location near the beach, restaurants, shops and so on. It has a decent price, compared with other similar hotels nearby. Rooms are big (+), a bit old (-), reasonably well maintained (neutral), but you bet as soon as they renovate them, prices will increase by a lot, as it happened with other hotels in Waikiki. It could get noisy at times, whenever we opened the balcony sliding door, the traffic noise from Kuhio Ave was very, very loud.The service was excellent, top-notch staff, and breakfast was very good too, included with the Hyatt loyalty program rates. The only problem was the sewage smell. You could feel it walking up to the hotel, whenever you got close to storm drains. You could feel it when using the hotel facilities located by the pool and main floor, and we could feel it coming out of the bathtub drain in our 19th-floor room. I'm not even sure the hotel has control over it, as it seemed to affect the whole street. Other parts of Waikiki didn't have the same smell.

Very close to everything. Nice hotel, not new, but clean. Eloisa at the reception deck was very welcoming, helpful and professional. She really helped us to get a good room and had a nice sleep after long flight. Comfortable beds.

The staff especially Lisa Catherine were just amazing! The premise is clean, incredibly awesome staff and great service truly elevated our stay and experience! Loved it!! Would go back in a heart beat!

We liked the location of Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Room and bathroom were on the small side but bed was comfortable and room was quiet.Pool was very small.Complimentary breakfast was good.We parked in the parking structure caddy corner to the hotel. The price was considerably lower than the hotel parking fee and convenient.

We chose this hotel over the higher priced options closer to the beach or middle of Waikiki. We had been here once before without kids and stayed in a small rented condo. Since we only planned to be here three nights, the relatively small rooms and few blocks from the beach were fine. We highly valued having three beds so our two older kids would each have a bed. We did have a car and made it out to Pearl Harbor, Dole, and the North shore. Getting to the hotel from anywhere wasn’t terrible with easy access to and from the freeway. Valet parking was a slow and expensive. At arrival a tour bus was parked in front obstructing the entrance and another car was blocking the drive securing gear. It took about 10 minutes to get parked and unloaded. The next day, we waited five minutes before someone showed up to park my car. Honestly, I wasn’t even sure it was someone working at the hotel. We had planned to park and leave once a day to make it easier so not a huge issue. The room itself is big for a hotel but smaller than a studio condo rental. For a longer stay, it would make sense to find a larger condo with a kitchen. Although on the 10th floor, the road noise was relatively loud. I would have expected a quieter room.The staff was friendly and helpful including some good suggestions for dinner. Borrowing beach gear is a plus with any other essentials easily purchased at the near by ABC. The breakfast was functional but know that the lobby breakfast has a few less options than the pool option but with way less people and no wind to battle. Honestly, Oahu is our least favorite island however, everyone should go at least once and experience Waikiki and Pearl Harbor. We wanted to take our kids but from now on will go to Kauai or the Big island. Be aware that drivers in Oahu are as terrible as the traffic. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a family coming to Oahu for the first time who didn’t rent a car planning to spend no more than three days before heading to a better Hawaiian island.

Thank you Hyatt Place Waikiki for a great trip! Staff extremely helpful and made sure this trip (and all previous trips) are happy, relaxing and fun. Lucky to have these experiences and have Hyatt on my team.

I used to love this hotel with its lack of resort fee and excellent service. It's still good, but they are now charging resort fees and are about to eliminate the breakfast. They also used to give a small upgrade to repeat customers, but didn't this time. The location is still good as are the double queen rooms. King rooms are on the small size.

The kids are 13 and 15 and had not seen the ocean before. It was the perfect location. The room with 2 beds and a pullout sofa was nice sized and clean. The breakfast saved us lots of money. Complementary towels boogy boards and chairs were nice. All of the people working at the hotel were awesome except for the concierge whom works for Expedia. There's tons of free things to do on Oahu. I would like a concierge that would help people with that. Awesome hotel avoid the concierge that tells you you can't do anything on your own1. P.s. the elevators are slow just deal with it. I will recommend to family and friends

Sounds like if everything is steps away, why rent a car and pay that super high parking fee? Walk to everything and save, save, save!!!! Spend the money on nice meals, entertainment, and BOOZE!! Skip the rental, live life on foot, and "steps" from everything....stay here and save!

Customer service was great but the rooms were tiny! We stayed in the ocean view room and was surprised how poorly designed the room was with regards to wasted space. Like the bathroom shower door would literally be 1 inch from hitting the toilet, yet there was wasted space by the desk area. I'm sorry but I would rather not feel like the toilet is that close to the shower door verses having extra feet of space by the desk. Also, getting the ocean view was a waste of money because there are high tower hotels obstructing the view of the ocean. Customer service was great. The resort fee covers $5/day, and we used it for the chocolate chip cookies. They were the best!The free breakfast for Hyatt members was very underwhelming. They basically had yugart, oat meal, breads, eggs (super runny), bacon or ham depending on the day, waffles, fresh fruit, etc. The bacon was super cheap, thin and full of fat. The eggs were always not fully cooked so it was always way too runny, and in thought they would provide something else like donuts, bagels or small pastries. For all of these reasons, I was not impressed.Finally, I'd like to mention how annoying it was to use the elevators! There were 2 elevators on one side and 3 on the other side. However, it would literally take 5 mine to get the elevator to open. Plus by that time more people are waiting for the elevator so if you are in line that would mean it would take like 10 minutes to just get to your floor. We often used the stairs from the 11th floor to the 3rd floor for breakfast, since we don't want to wait forever to get food.I'd recommend this hotel for the overall value, but personally I do not plan on returning for said reasons.

We stayed 5 nights at Hyatt Place, i was concerned it was going to be too far out of town, however for us it was perfect. Waikiki is busy. Very busy. The main beaches so crowded that sometimes it is difficult to find room on the beach, especially at high tide. Hyatt Place is perfectly positioned at the more quiet end of Waikiki, less crowds and larger beach, one block walk (3min walk).Breakfast was adequate, however the seating area around the small pool is unpleasant. It is literally a wind tunnel, and finding a sheltered table is almost impossible as its very crowded. The hotel provides a tray to take breakfast up to your room.Overall, I would return to Hyatt Place, provided the price was reasonable (although that is wishful thinking, everything is Waikiki is expensive).

This was my first time in Hawaii with my kids and husband. I didn’t know where to stay and I’m proud for finding this place. It was a minute walk to ABC store (which has everything you will need!) and 3 minute walk from the beach! Amazing restaurants all around! The hotel staff are really nice. But the pool is tiny (we never used it) and the elevator system is HORRIBLE!!! We were staying on the 9th floor - so we would take the stairs to 3rd floor (where breakfast is served) and back up. I don’t think I’d been able to walk any more than that and yes, the elevators take that long!!!!

Stayed here for 7 nights and overall a very enjoyable stays. The hotel is insanely busy however. The hotel is conveniently located right near the Waikiki beach and is only a 10 min walk to all the shopping and restaurants region. Would highly recommend it still.

Hyatt Place is conveniently located to the beach, restaurants and shopping. It is also a short walk to the zoo and the aquarium. The hotel is well-maintained and the rooms are clean and modern. The bidet was a nice touch in the bathroom. The 24-hr. laundry room is super convenient. There is no onsite restaurant (unless you count Domino's pizza), so room service is not an option.

Very well located just a block and a half from the beach. Parking is expensive. there is a parking garage across the street that is much cheaper. Investigate that.Heidi at the front desk was very helpful and accommodating.Negative- only 2 elevators for 19 floors creating a long line for the elevator at certain times ie. check out and breakfast.Pool is very smallOur room, 917, was next to the elevator shaft and we heard the roaring of the hydraulics of the elevators non stop day and night.

Be ready to pay a destination Fees at the end of your Stay. But, very Clean and nice location.Staff are very helpful and too nice. hotel is very clean and well positioned. Be ready to pay $39/day for parking or park across the street for $25

Stayed 4 nights in transit through Hawaii. Price was right for family of 5. The sofa pulls out for the additional bedding. Breakfast is good. Location is great. Had everything we needed. Staff helpful and friendly.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place during the 5 days we were in Honolulu. The location is pretty awesome. You’re steps away from Waikiki beach, a ton of restaurants and shopping. They also offer free beach towels, so be sure to ask for one before you head over to the beach. Room: we got upgrade to a mountain view room, but the view was less than impressive. We saw a sliver of mountain between two high-rises in the distance. Both of us slept comfortably, which was good enough for us. Breakfast: we tried their free breakfast and it wasn’t very good. It was chaotic with all the kids running around and screaming early in the morning. The scrambled eggs were soggy and runny.. overall, a poor experience. Parking: they charge $39 for valet, which was the only parking option we had even though we read that there was self parking available (not true). This fee will give you in and out privileges; you’ll just need to ring them up 10 minutes in advance so they can fetch your car. There is also a parking lot diagonal to the hotel, which charges $30 for 24 hour parking. The cheapest option is parking at the zoo parking lot nearby, which is $1.50 per hour and you can park there overnight with no problems. Since we were renting a car and driving out every day early in the morning, we only had to park at the zoo at most 12 hours, so that costed us only $18, yay! If you don’t mind walking for 4-5 minutes to the hotel, this is the most economical IMO. Just keep in mind that there are a ton of tourists in this area and Waikiki Beach, so going there to park at peak times can result in an overcrowded lot and you may not find a spot. Destination fees (via Expedia): this was very annoying. I had another look at my Expedia receipt and low and behold there was a destination fee charge there (which I may have known when I booked it but was outraged when I was reminded upon arrival). How can you avoid this charge? You can’t, if you’re booking through a third party like Expedia unfortunately. We booked one night directly, because I had enough points to get us a free night and with that booking there was no destination fee. Perhaps, they are doing this to recoup some of the cost that OTAs are charging hotels, but it also seems unfair that the customer (us travelers) are suffering as a result. If you get charged, make the most out of it and make sure you use your $10 allowance each day to buy a bottle of water or two otherwise it’s going to waste.
user_name:
jacksonlo
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was clean and comfortable, but it seems like they need more people to do valet parking, we spend more than 30 minutes each day to wait for someone to get our car. I tried to call ahead before I leave my room, but no one answered the phone, so we have to go down to the valet post, there is always many groups of people waiting for their cars. I would not stay here if you plan to have a rental car. And they charge $39 per night for these kind of valet parking. No self serve parking here.

Hotel is in a good location, is clean, friendly staff. Hoping my situation is unique and not the the usual. A solid yappy barking dog in the adjacent room. Walls a paper thin so the dog and slamming hallway doors can be heard ... Very loud hotel makes for a restless night.

Good value. Clean, modern and close to beach. Parking was expensive, $39 /night and additional resort fee per night. Parking should be free, of staying more than 3 nights.Daily breakfast was nice, but will be discontinued in November 2019. Boo!

The building is in need of some upgrades. Elevator, pool, entry / drop off area all could use some upgrades. Service was average for a Hyatt. Room was clean although the bathroom also is in need of fixture upgrades. Probably the worst Hyatt I have stayed at.

We loved Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach Hotel! All staff was great and courteous! Our room's AC wasn't working well on the first date and they upgraded us to a beautiful room with a view of Diamond Head Crater! The complimentary breakfast was great every morning. The beach was less than 5 minutes away so we headed out every day until night time! Lots of shops and restaurants. Absolutely loved the place and the atmosphere! Highly recommend it!

This was the second time we stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. The entire property is excellent, with amazingly comfortable beds and pillows (so comfortable, we stripped down the sheets and pillow cases to take pics of the brands so we can buy for our home!) But it doesn't stop there. The staff and service...undeniably one of the absolute best. I have stayed in more high end hotels whose staff and services cannot compare to that of Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Whenever we are in Oahu, we will 100% be staying at this property.

Loved the proximity to Waikiki beach! Nice updated rooms. Having ya gym and pool is a bonus if you want to take a break from the beach with your kids. Would recommend to everyone I know. Concierge was very helpful booking offsite tours.

Nice hotel, except we arrived early after a long haul fight and they made us wait 6 hours until 3pm check in. I asked for an earlier check in based on the fact we had 3 young children, they made us wait until 3pm on the dot. Have some leniency even though I know check in times are set. Also the pool was average and was blowing a gale with no spa. Apart from that it was great.

I have stayed here multiple times. Near to the beach and many restaurants. The staff is always professional and courteous. Breakfast is an added benefit. The small bar in the lobby is adequate for a pre-dinner drink. I highly recommend this place.

Very old, worn rooms. Need updating. Breakfast was a madhouse, with never enough seating, shade or plates and bowls. The food was good, but not a nice experience - we asked to have more bowls put out for the miso soup every day and received a frustrated response from staff that they were being washed. Do they not know that that many of their guests will be having breakfast that morning? Why would they have enough bowls for the guests that they expect each morning? Disappointing.

My friends and I stayed for a week in this hotel for some R & R, get together. We were happy overall and would've given a 5 star rating if not for a mistake with our tour which we booked with the hotel concierge (or expedia rep?). Although he, the concierge, took full responsibility for what happened and gave us half price refund, it still was a bummer that we missed out on experiences we were so looking forward to - swimming with turtles at turtle bay and hiking to the falls. Lesson learned - do not book your tours there! Hotel itself is clean and conveniently located. Easy access to public transport and within walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

Nice spot : front desk is swamped at all times need more staff. Only 2 elevators for the tower we were in and vvv busy at all times. Service excellent.. . Breakfast fantastic quantity quality and variety. Pool space harsh and unappealing needs some colour and flowers ? Also bar in lobby nothing much just a walk thru space.

Enjoyed my stay here. It's only a couple blocks off the beach and provides a great value in Waikiki. The breakfast was nice and coffee is plentiful! Room was nice and hotel was clean. Staff were absolutely fantastic!

Over all an alright hotel if you don't mind crowds. Free breakfast is a good variety but long lines and long waits for the elevators from 7am right to 10am. for the price of the room we probably will not repeat a stay at this location.

Great stay in Oahu steps from the beach, free towels and breakfast included. Room had a nice little balcony great for drying bathing suits. Parking is expensive but that's the only negative. Friendly staff, great service.

Everything was prefect, particularly, the free-upgrade to PH room with wonderful view. It's definitely worthy the waiting. The location is very convenient with a few steps to Waikiki beach and a parking lot is just cross street. My husband and I also liked the buffet breakfast in an outside porch area.

No complaints at all and the staff really stood out. I have never had hotel staff so genuinely friendly anywhere like this before. The breakfast selection was very large for Hyatt members and smaller for non members. It’s worth signing up as they give you $5 credit for charging to the room and beach chairs and towels and larger breakfast.

Our stay was wonderful! We had an ocean view with a balcony. The front desk was very accommodating when our air conditioner wouldn't adjust. Every employee we encountered was friendly, held the elevator for us and went out of their way to make our stay great. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The beach is just a short block away, super easy walk. The only drawback is they give you a $5 credit each night, which is great, but their is limited things you can buy with this $5. They only stock 3 bakery items and when they are gone it doesn't seem like they restock much. So my advice, is if you see a chocolate chip cookie early in the day, don't wait until the evening. Get it when you see it. Valet parking was full when we arrived (we arrived at 9pm) so we parked across the street for $20 and they gave us a credit for valet the next day.

Only hotel I am willing to bring family too. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room turned over without issues even after regular hours. Supplied more than enough towels for the whole family! Very easy to deal with and highly recommended hotel!

Spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki as our first stop on our 20th anniversary trip. Clifford made sure we were taken care of, and even sent up a bottle of champagne and cookies up to our room to help us celebrate. Loved the spacious rooms and how close this hotel is to Waikiki beach. You will not be disappointed!

Very friendly staff - they helped us feel comfortable after having problems with the Sheraton Princess down the street - even sending up a couple beers and cookies to our room after hearing it was our honeymoon, and we were relocating from another hotel. Great location, nice free breakfast in the morning, helpful, friendly staff, clean, comfortable rooms!

Great customer service, short walk to the beach and all restaurants and stores. Free breakfast but super busy. Resort fee includes beach chairs, body boards, umbrella and $5 dollars on Starbucks. Dominos pizza at the lobby.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 1 week total. The rooms were always clean, the air conditioner worked well and the noise level was always quiet. It is within walking distance of all amenities and attractions but far enough from the busyness of the main streets of Waikiki. The free breakfast is by far the nicest breakfast i have had at any hotel. The staff were always helpful with any requests. I would definitely recommend this as a vacation spot for anyone.

We could not have been happier with the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach! From check-in to check-out and everything in between, we were greeted with smiles, offers to help, and gratefulness for choosing Hyatt. If we make it back, we will definitely book here again!

Location of hotel was great, walking distance to the beach as well as the shops on the strip. Kevin went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. Room was pleasant, only complaint was our carpet was sticky and the towels had hair in them.

Our stay in Hyatt place is fabulous , breakfast is overflowing with pineapple which I like. And would like to thanks our housekeeper in our room name Leonida, who does an exceptional cleaning our room and make sure everything stock fir our supplies , she does a tremendous job , exceptional and always care what we need , she makes our vacation very pleasant to stay . She’s a very hardworking lady despite her age ,she works hard. Thank you leonida for making our stay in Hyatt very good spotless and odorless room always. You deserve to be recognized and get a good review. Thank you very much , Mahalo

Highly recommend. Great price compared to others and perfectlocation. Short walk to beach. Close to zoo and aquarium. Staff were so friendly and welcoming. They went out of their way to correct issues and help find my lost cell phone. I’ll be back!

We loved our stay here. A hotel is typically just a place to lay your head down and rest, not the main attraction of what your there for. With that said the room we got was great. Clean, spacious with a decent view of Diamond head and part of Waikiki beach. Our room had a king size bed, and sofa bed for our two little ones. Main Bed was comfy, Sofa bed seemed a little hard but the kids were cool with it, AC worked great. Breakfast buffet was included daily, decent breakfast, good coffee. There's a pool on the 3rd floor, it isnt large but it's decent. My only complaint are the elevators, they take quite a while when called on. The location is spectacular, short 5 min walk to the beach, right down the street from shopping. The make or break of any hotel is it's staff. The staff at Hyatt Place are definitely on the ball. From the moment we booked our trip before even arriving we called to arrange a ride to the hotel, they don't offer Shuttle service but they do have a deal with a local taxi company that charges a flat rate which is a lot cheaper than anything else we could find. Once at the hotel all the staff were very accommodating. Giving us great tips on places to eat, to visit that are off the beaten path. From front desk, to the bar, from the valet to the cleaning crew they all made our trip fantastic. I had a great time staying there, and would have no problem staying there again. Mahalo everyone

Stayed here for our last two nights in Hawaii. Location is great and the reception staff were fantastic! They made sure our bags were looked after as the room was not ready yet and supplied us with much needed bottles of cold water. Upon departure they even organised a hospitality suite for us in the evening so we could freshen up before our flight.The room itself was a good size and very clean. Unfotunately the aircondition was on the noisy side. The only real disappointment was breakfast. Very basic selection of food, filter coffee in paper cups and no service whatsoever. Futhermore there aren't nearly enough tables to accomodate guest on the terrace (and we didn't see any inside seating area). On the second morning the patio was so packed that we had no choice but to take our breakfast up to our room.Do come here for a nice hotel only a few steps away from the beach, with very pleasant front office staff. As for breakfast - there is a Starbucks just around the corner :)

Flew in a day early to see Honolulu before our 7 day cruise on NCL Pride of America.Booked a room for 5 guests. Most hotels only allow 4 guests. This room was large and could sleep 6 comfortably. I was happy with this hotel. It was very clean and well kept. It was above average. They also had a free good breakfast with scrambled eggs, country potatoes, sausages, variety of beverages , assorted breads, and pancakes. It was the same breakfast served at Hyatt Place in the mainland US.They also have a $5 daily room credit to use at their cafe. So don’t forget to use it to buy a daily beverage or baked good. Very short walk to beach. About 2 blocks / 15 min walk. Very close to everything no car needed.

Every thing amazing clean great free breakfast. Travel agent will return n book my clients. Expedia agent book diner cruise amazing thank you Amber. One block from beach free towels beach chairs. Stay here stay here clean clean Starbucks coffee

This was my first time visiting a Hyatt property but I was pleasantly pleased with how much each employee I encountered was friendly and ready to help me. The hotel itself is situated just 2 quick blocks away from the pacific ocean!!! Its really a quick short walk to the world famous Waikiki beach, but more notable beaches are to be visited if your in Oahu in the North Shore. Front desk and the hotel lobby is an open air setting with no physical wall separating the environments but it works, I never once was turned off by that fact. The front desk hosts were always accommodating, helpful, and go above and beyond in being accessible through text too! Upon check-in your given a phone number to text and it goes to the front desk where you get real live responses. The rooms were amazing. My room had a balcony with a tiny table and two chairs. The bed was really comfy and featured plush blankets. The only grief I would have with the room is the pillows, they are not firm at all, I needed two stacked on each other just to get a decent level of firmness. Bathroom, closet, and entertainment console were perfect, bathroom sink had plenty of room for my stuff, closet was spacious enough and there's a safe in there too that can be programed each time you open it up. The tv has this adapter that lets you connect your laptop to it, so it was nice to take advantage of streaming in the little time I was in the room. The tv also has an app so you don't have to use that dreaded hotel tv remote after you set that up. Breakfast seems to be included with all rates and its served in two spots, on the lobby floor by the business center and the 3rd floor where the pool is at. The pool location has the bulk of seats and I never really had trouble finding me a seat, just word of advice, don't look away from your food for even a second, seagulls and birds will eat your breakfast up quicker than you can react. The food was pretty much straightforward, eggs, potatoes, various meat (depending on day, I had sausage, beacon, and something else) various breakfast breads, cereals, milk, juice, fresh cut fruit, and what appeared to be a Japanese version of breakfast. The meat changes daily, ie beacon was only featured once in my stay, but I think it think it had to do with the fact I was there for four breakfasts. The food can be consumed at either the lobby, 3rd floor, or in the room, a tray is provided to take your breakfast to go to your room if you desire.

This hotel was amazing, and the staff are all top notch. We really enjoyed the breakfast, and the food credit is also a nice touch. Great location, amenities, and wonderful people. You can't go wrong!

The hotel was nice and had a good location. I would stay here again, it’s close enough to the beach.Parking is expensive, the parking garage across the street was half the price. The room was great, lots of space and clean. Most of the staff was great, some were not very helpful. The front desk has large beach towels which is a nice addition. Breakfast for Hyatt members was also a plus.

We have enjoyed our stay. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We have our dog with us and taking him to the bathroom is a lil difficult bc there is no grass on the property, but just a block down is plenty of grass. The breakfast is amazing!!! I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

The place is great, everyone is very nice and friendly, the place is accessible to everything, only 2 minutes away from the beach, food is great, good breakfast, love the pineapple, will highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family, and definitely stay to this hotel again.

Hotel Hyatt place Near to the beach and public transport, friendly staff, clean and calm rooms, good breakfast... Hotel is clean as well as rooms and restaurant. A good deal I love this place! A very comfortable place. Small, comfortable room. Great place ...

We arrived before check-in time. The staff kindly locked our bags up for us until we could check-in. Free beach towels are available at the front desk and made our stay so much easier to drop our sandy towels off and pick up new ones on our way out. The complementary breakfasts were great. The only drawback of our stay was the parking. We had a rental car and the only parking at the hotel was valet only and cost 39 dollars a day plus tax. You feel compelled to tip each time they bring your car to you so this was an unexpected expense that added up quickly. I have never had to pay for parking at a hotel where I was a guest. The location is only a block from the beach though and space is limited so we sucked it up.

Close to beach, zoo. My kids liked the buffet breakfast. The first night we found the king size bed is not comfortable for grandparents, so we requested to change to room with two queen size beds. The front desk staff help us to changed to a bigger two bedroom units without any extra charges, which made us feel so warm. Definitely will recommend this hotel to my friends.

I could not be happier with this hotel and the staff. We are here as a change of duty station for the army. Our trip has been extremely stressful and when we checked in we were totally exhausted and worried. The staff was phenomenal! So helpful, so kind. Our room was beautiful and clean! We absolutely love the breakfast buffet and eating by the pool. We nearly had nowhere to go because the military housing changed our dates without telling us and the staff figured it out for us and accommodated our extra nights we needed for the same price totally stress free! I keep joking that I just want to live here in the hotel forever! I will be recommending this hotel to everyone!
user_name:
Blythe H
El Paso, Texas, United States

review_body: Close to beach, shops, food. Beds super comfy and service great. Buffet breakfast awesome but so much yummy food is definately bad for the waistline! Only downside is the pool. Is small and smack bang in the middle of breakfast dining area so lounging by the pool is not really appealing.

Clean hotel with nice rooms. 1 block from Waikiki beach. ABC store next door. Good breakfast, with hot choices such as eggs, bacon, etc. fresh fruit, oatmeal. Coffee is good. The staff are always friendly and helpful.

Wonderful hotel with many amenities. The breakfast was very yummy & we enjoyed having access to beach chairs & towels each day! Our room was comfortable and quiet & the staff was very nice & helpful! We will definitely be coming back!

my perfect 6days.Our 1st trip to HI. honeymoon was wonderful.easy find location.close to beach.kind people.ice cube despenser in the hall way makes me very happy all days.I got very good memorise from there.

We booked this room about two months out from traveling during July 4th, so the prices weren't too bad (about $180/night) as compared to other hotels nearby. The hotel is definitely dated and I could tell that in my rooms and the hotels in general (not run down or anything, but dated). The King room was small (by American hotel room standards), but still comfortable. Hotel room came with free breakfast (though signs in elevator said this was going away for non-members in November 2019). Free breakfast was good, small selection of hot foods (eggs, bacon, pancakes, rice, miso soup) and fruit and bread. Coffee was ironically Seattle's Best. Hotel is really close to the beach, about 2 blocks or a 5-7 minute walk. The part of Waikiki closest to the hotel is really safe for kids. There's an area that's blocked in by some walls so the water is never too rough. In the mornings (7amish), the water is super shallow and you can walk to the wall and the water only goes up 3-4 feet. Definitely recommended for kids or other people who can't swim. It does get really crowded in the afternoon though. But mornings were peaceful. Hotel also charged $15 a day for "destination fee" which came with beach towels and beach chair rentals (super convenient). It also included a $5 credit to use at the bar (practically one bottle of drink + 1 piece of fruit). The free wifi was good and very strong (we streamed Youtube with no problem). Valet was $39 (there's a $20 garage across the street). Valets were really nice and tried to be quick, but depending on how many people were waiting for their cars, it could take anywhere from 2-20 minutes to park or pick up your car. Overall, great location, but hotel could be slightly updated.

From the get go the employees were consistently so friendly and very attentive. The hotel was beautiful and well kept. We spent our daily $5 gift allowance at the beverage bar. It was something we enjoyed each evening before bed. The expansive free breakfast bar was our morning family gathering place. Huge variety, in fact the best of anywhere we’ve traveled (except for the cruises we’ve been on). Our king room (#705) was spacious and we loved the toilet was separate from the sink area. Big walk-in shower. Ours was a city view room but we actually had a slice of an ocean view which gave us a sunrise and a sunset view each day. The hotel was at the end of the main “strip” of Waikiki beach but was just a short 2 block walk to the nearest beach with swimming access. One block away is an ABC store, The Tiki Bar and Grill (Aston Hotel), and a trolley/bus/etc drop-off and pick-up location is 2 blocks away and just across the street from the beach. There was a small workout center with treadmills, ellipticals, and free-weights. There was a small laundry facility which we used twice. The cost was $3 per load plus laundry supplies. Machines accept cash or card. Laundry supplies are cash only. No dryer sheets available. Next time I’ll take 5-6 dryer sheets from home in a sandwich baggie. You’ll have to be strategic In timing because they are in constant use. One night we were using the laundry machines at midnight. There are 2 gift shops, one more of a clothing type of shop. At one of the stores we rented boogie boards, beach umbrellas, and beach chairs. $5 a day for boogie boards. The hotel also offers free beach chairs and beach towels at the front desk. We used them every day. The only negative I can say is the very small pool size and the slow elevators - both of which are minor in comparison to all the positives. I highly recommend this hotel for amenities, location, and excellent service.

Good location, close to the beach and all shops.Room was clean and tidy, room steward was lovely.Great selection of breakfast items.Staff friendly and helpful. Having 3 children the wifi was our only gripe as it kept dropping off in the evening.

My family of 6 are moving to Hawaii and needed accommodations while waiting for a house. I made the reservation from the mainland in May for arrival in June, staying through July 4th weekend. The room was great, very clean, great staff and valet, and was very short walk to ABC (convenience store that has everything you need/ want) and Waikiki beach. A survey popped up while using the complimentary WiFi provided to Hyatt members. On the survey, I reported the experience as 9/10, only because the parking (valet only) was expensive ($40/day) and there was no microwave (my kids like mac n cheese and warm milk at night). I only complained about parking because I was on extended stay there (18 days). Literally almost immediately after I submitted the review, they called my room, offering me a discounted parking rate ($25/night) and a microwave from the waitstaff (previous inquiries to get a microwave resulted in "come downstairs and we'll heat things up for you", which was conveniently inconvenient to go 18 floors each way every night because my kids wanted mac n cheese or milk). I'm grateful they responded. I had already purchased a microwave for the room, so the concession was unnecessary, but really appreciated the discounted parking for the remainder of my stay. The breakfast was great, pool clean, and bidets in the rooms. Great experience overall.

We stayed here for the day on a stopover between Australia and Canada. It was the perfect place to stay if you don't want to stay near the airport. Comfy bed, clean room, lovely staff, close to shops, restaurants and Waikiki beach. Well worth it!

I stayed at the Hyatt Place in Hawaii for 3 days and rested very well. The hotel offers free breakfast every morning which is a plus whenever you are traveling. I had a little incident in my room(due to my clumsiness) and the manager on duty Heidi Lazo and the rest of the staff helped me recover my misplaced bag. Heidi was very patient and understanding in the entire process. Thank you Heidi and the staff with all your help.

First night was tough, bathtub drain was plugged, swimming pool was dirty and plugged. Room phone didn't work. But staff was great and handled everything asap. Breakfast is great, except for the swooping birds, housekeeping is excellent, and efficient. Counter staff are great to deal with.

Everything from breakfast to the room was well above expectations.Only thing was check in was slow, but that was due to the friendly staff. A block off the ocean, but a high floor makes for a satisfying view.

The front desk employees were terrific for all of our requests and they volunteered to make our trip even more comfortable without us even asking.The breakfast was so convenient and saved us time to do more things.The location to walk to the beach was terrific. The location to get a bus for an excursion was super convenient.

I was a Marriott person, hardcore! For the last 2 visits, one in Charlotte and then again in Hawaii, has totally sold me. I’m very very impressed by all aspects of my stay with Hyatt. No other hotel has been able to touch it. I’m sold!!

I want to say thank you to Annabelle for sending a fabulous bottle of wine to my room for my 70th birthday. She displays the Aloha Spirit with her kindness and lovely smile. I definitely made a good choice in selecting this hotel.

Hotel price was about the equivalent for what you get. The pool is small and the pool chairs are limited. Get there early. The gym was plenty good enough. Our balcony was very small and the air conditioner being mounted on the same level made it very hot. The staff was great and the location was excellent. The valet service was inconsistent. We had to wait for someone to show on many occasions. The overall hotel is fine.

Travelled on points. Excellent property. Excellent reception. Hyatt Employees are well schooled to greet World of Hyatt members, even when traveling on rewards points. My Explorist status carries weight that is appreciated everywhere I go.

This place was amazing. If you ask yourself “why stay here?” Let me tell you1. Location 2. Staff 3. Breakfast4. RoomsBeing a Hyatt member and going to several Hyatt’s, this was spectacular. Even when the key lock battery to our door died, the staff was amazing and helped. Angeline was awesome! So glad we stayed here.

We chose to stay at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki after staying at the same brand of hotel in Niseko, they didn't disappoint, the service and facilities are second to none, and as usual, they think of everything, the food is very well priced, breakfast is included by the pool, laundry and washing powder (for a fee) on level 3 via the gym, computer access in the lobby, free high speed wifi. There is also a Domino's Pizza connected to the hotel, 1 block from the beach, ABC store right next door and a trolley stop out the front of the hotel and a bus stop across the road to get you out to the Navy museum and around town.

Room was huge and comfortable, breakfast was delicious and staff was very helpful! Walking distance to the Zoo, and many eating options nearby! Short distance to the beach, and short ride to Alamoana Mall! Definitely would stay here again!

We came for a week to Waikiki and the service was excellent, the breakfast changed a little every day and was always excellent :) there’s a dominos connected to the hotel lobby for when you get in and you want a cheap meal after your flight late at night, it’s open till 2 am , it’s a great location right on Kūhiō and Paoakalani avenue so you can catch a lot of buses from there to anywhere on the island. It’s so close to the beach , just a two minute walk !

Overall the hotel served a good purpose. Short walk to the beach. Close to the PinkLine trolley stop. Staff was great. I’d probably stay elsewhere for better view of ocean and more updated decor in rm

We booked 2 rooms with Hyatt Place and my grandmother ended up falling and breaking her knee in the airport. The staff was so helpful and got her into an ADA unit for the remainder of our week long stay!

This hotel is in the middle of some dense real estate. It is slightly down the street from the famous beach. It is an easy walk. Pretty crowded surroundings. Lots of shops etc. Some pretty high end shopping nearby. Parking is valet only at $39 per day. Yikes! Staff is friendly and helpful. They will loan t you beach chairs and towels. Small pool on premises. Also workout room. Rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast room is nice and well stocked, but be aware it is outdoors and birds are all over. Breakfast was pretty decent. However it was free for us. Not sure of cost if not. Very international crowd. Driving is a little tough. LOTS of traffic, and anywhere worth going is a drive. Lots of tours that eliminated the need for a car, but expect a health premium to be added on.

- central to Waikiki beaches, shopping, and restaurants - clean rooms- free WiFi- complimentary beach towels and chairs - enjoyed the complimentary lei-making class - parking is available in the Waikiki Banyan garage across the street for $80/week - breakfast area is overtaken by birds/often crowded so they do offer trays if you want to take your breakfast back to your room
user_name:
Melody T
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: A lifetime experience of visiting Hawaii and the exceptional service provided at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach right from checkin by the Reception to the excellence and cleanliness of the room. Every service employee greets with a smile and cheer. They have been selected and trained very well. The breakfast is wholesome and caters for all.

This is a nice hotel with a location close to the beach. Breakfast was included and was really good. The only issue we had was with the air conditioner. It took three complaints to get it fixed. We would stay here again.

from the time we checked in we had been taken care of. Cathrine at the front desk was outstanding on making sure we where as comfortable as possible. the location is awesome and easy to get to the beach. we will be back for sure!!! Cathrine, Trush says hi!

Great price for this 4 star type of hotel. about 1/3 the cost of the on-strip hotels in Waikiki. Pool is a little below average, the included breakfast buffet is quite good. A bit warm in the lobby, but overall, quite nice and super clean.

Second time staying here and it was again great. Was no trouble for them to change rooms when the first one we had was quite noisy with a little one. Checked us in early and nothing seemed a hassle the entire trip. Also very reasonable resort tax that covers beach towels and also sand gear for kids....And the best choc chip cookie.

Pros - Rooms are good. Front desk staff is kind. Location is close to the beach. Dominos right on the ground floor. Cons - Breakfast area is infested with sick-looking pigeons. Elevators are old and take forever.

Staff was awesome - incredible service. Parking is $40 a night - we parked at the zoo. Breakfast is good. Beach towels, water bottles, chairs, were all included. We never went to the pool. We spent time on the island.

Great customer serviceRooms good size and clean, fairly modern Staff hqppy to assist with all requestsPricing greatFree breakfast but repetitive Lifts far too slowOver all in a great location, great prices.. will stay again

Breakfast was free and always good. Housekeeping was not. Paid extra for ocean view (higher floor) and regretted not being able to walk up due to extensive elevator waiting times. Valet was understaffed and always running - but they were nice guys.

Average hotel room. The hotel is a little outdated but the whole city of Waikiki is that way. The location is pretty good it's close to the beach and other restaurants and walking distance to everything.

Will definitely like to stay here again! There was courtesy scanning, computer use and printing. The breakfast was excellent and my daughter really enjoyed all the birds who came to visit for crumbs. It was a short walk to zoo and beach.

Great stay. Great location, Great complementary breakfast.Didn’t like how after paying for the room didn’t cover resort fees. The Resort fee should have been included in the price of the room. Just leaves you with the feeling of frustration and feeling like you had just been scammed

Visited Hyatt Place recently and overall it was a good hotel, but it was very disappointing that in the lobby (where they serve breakfast), they have PLASTIC CUTLERY. The bigger breakfast is on Level 3 where they do have real cutlery, but is it really that hard to have actual knives and forks at both breakfast locations? Hawaii are terrible with wastage and recycling and this hotel reflects that. Also, they had plastic cups and throw away coffee cups to drink from.. just crazy...

I stayed here with a friend for one week in June and there were pros and cons. The room itself was a good, large size - as we were upgraded on arrival (likely to save us from the grad week guests). The lifts are super slow during peak times. I was SHOCKED and APPALLED to notice the lack of recycling in the hotel. They had throw away coffee cups at breakfast and NO actual coffee mugs! That is hundreds upon hundreds of throw away cups a DAY going into landfill for no reason. It’s just crazy! Have throw away cups as an option for guests who want a take away coffee, sure, but provide coffee mugs you can wash and reuse! The sheer amount of people at breakfast just means so much wastage. I found it really sad actually. There is no reason the hotel shouldn’t have coffee mugs. There also needed to be more hand sanitizer at breakfast. There was only one. I noticed in reception it was also empty on multiple occasions.

Everyone was friendly and nice and always asked if everything was fine or if we needed something. It was a 2min walk from the beach which was amazing and at a good loaction with a ABC right next door.

Great location, close to the beach, restaurants, mall and nightlife. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The free breakfast buffet every morning was a huge money saver. Highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here in June 2018 for our babymoon. It's not a bad hotel and relatively central. We upgraded to a Seaview and mountain (corner) view room which has been worth it. We loved the balkony where we could watch the survers.The breakfast has not been that great. Most days we did skipped it and went out for something nice.What we really didn't like though was that the hotel has been full with 16/17 year old on their spring break? The Hyatt really needs to manage their expectations during that time and prepare paying guests. That was really not enjoyable and probably the reason we would not come back.

You can pretty much expect a Hyatt serivce. The staff are amazing! Food can improve hence the 4 stars (Domino's Pizza in the lobby of the hotel!?). The hotel runs smoothly. The staff always has a smile on and are very helpful. Good service and so close to the beach and everything else. Great central location.

Stayed for family vacation for a week. The check-in process was extremely pleasant and the staff were really helpful in getting the right room (and accommodating our needs by changing the room the second day as soon as the room we were seeking became available). The breakfast was better than we expected, and the location at the other end of Waikiki was perfect for us. For the price we paid, the experience far exceeded our expectation.

Do not rely on the pull out couch to be a bed. Room was small but breakfast was amazing. Loved the pool and the front of hotel lobby area was gorgeous. Also they have a resort fee that you have to pay.

Love the location just a couple of blocks from the beach without being too expensive. Great that they have 2 queen size beds for a party of 4 instead of just one bed and a sofa bed. Room is spacious and the free wifi and breakfast is a great bonus; easily saved over $100 on those features alone. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning ladies were very friendly and helpful throughout the trip.

Average hotel that was close to the beach. Room was clean and staff was friendly.Breakfast was included with the rate, they also provided chairs and towels you could take to the beach.Would stay again.

2 minutes walk to Waikiki beach. Basically within walking distance to everything! Will definitely stay again. The only thing is next time I will need check is gradweek. They hosted gradweek at the hotel so there was a bunch of teenagers running around. Some were slightly disruptive but overall ok. So check before you book.

Nice hotel with good breakfast and beautiful view. Our room was super small though, they got a balcony with coffee table, but with those, one can't even turn around because of the limited space. To make it more spacious, the hotel can consider replacing coffee table with bar top and bar stools, so it saves more place and guests can also enjoy the view when sitting there. The room is really noisy at the night, I was woken up twice at least.The noise came from either Bathroom or AC, I am not sure, it's something that urgently needs to be improved

I was very impressed with this hotel. Unfortunately we were not able to upgrade to an ocean view room, we were told since we booked through Expedia, we were limited to our upgrades,,, I found this a little weird,,, if it wasn't for Expedia, we wouldn't have stayed here. We had a nice comfortable suite, and service was exceptional. Anything we asked for, we received without hesitation. The location is good and great bus service just across the street. Restaurants were all with in walking distance. We had a nice quiet stay until all the rowdy kids came in from grad week.. Had a couple of really loud guests near our room, banging and loud talking on their balconies at night,, I can only imagine they're alcohol levels.. Fortunately someone made a complaint and we never had the noise problem after that. Over all, staff here , really go out of their way to make you happy. The dominos downstairs has good deals and specials on their pizza's and sandwiches. The breakfast here, will fill you up and start you on your day, with a great variety of choices. We never used the pool, as we found it quite small. There is a nice exercise room and laundry facility's in which came in handy for us. I found the drinks here to be very expensive outside of happy hour,, I paid $11.00 for a mai tai... found a lounge close by , were the mai tai's are 4.00 all day.. other then that, I did enjoy my stay here, and thank you to the staff and management for making our vacation stay enjoyable!!

The hotel was very nice and clean. It was very close to Waikiki beach. The staff was friendly and helpful. Everything was amazing minus the Gradweek event that was happening. Apparently the entire month of June is Gradweek. This means a very large group of teenagers going in and out causing chaos for other people staying at the hotel. This is just an FYI for those planning a stay at this hotel and other places around this property.

When we arrived, the room we were placed in was very small and not clean at all. We requested to upgrade. they accommodated at a discounted rate. New room was much nicer. Small pool, but decent breakfast.

Found the pictures were not like the hotel. Whilst nice, not the standard we were expecting from the Hyatt. There were a number of hidden costs and upfront monies we were not expecting. We were not able to check into our room until the afternoon. We were promised a city view, but that translated into lower street aspect. The room was fine for our family holiday and we used it for a base for our days out. The room was clean and airconditioned. Whilst the lifts were slow, the stairs were good for access to lobby or the pool/breakfast area. There is a Domino's downstairs - but it is expensive for pizza. Tap water was fine to drink and there is a watercooler in the Gym. Free Breakfast was generous, but we had already paid for it. Access to the beach is okay, just two blocks to the enclosed seawater pools. The pool did not prove useful for us.Access to the main shopping with kids was a stretch and took a lot out of the kids if we walked. The trolley stops near the beach and circles around the main areas - you will be happy if buy a weekly/monthly for you stay to get you to the key locations around the city.Hotel facilities were overstated (there is no room service). Although there is an ABC just around the corner for stocking up the fridge, everything else you have to walk to. We are still waiting for refunds to deposits etc...

Great breakfast! The hotel is very close to the beach and I was worried that the evening noise would affect getting a good nights sleep, but surprisingly I slept sound. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows were perfect!

Staff and property was great. We booked this as an extension of our honeymoon. We stayed 2 nights and were able to enjoy the amenities. The MAJOR downfall was that the hotel hosted “Grad Week” which consisted of 6-7 high schools totaling i have no clue how many ungrateful, entitled, rude, arrogant teenagers. The buffet for breakfast was trashed. The stay would have been perfect if it wasn’t for that event.

I booked our hotel 6 months in advance, specifically with an "ADA" room containing a bathtub as we were traveling with small children. The check in process was absolutely horrible, our "upgrade" didn't had a tub even though I specified before we went upstairs. We had to go back down, spend another 30+ minutes requesting room that did have one, as the room we specifically booked wasn't available (seriously?!). We were told we could stay in that room for one night then we had to move to a different room for the duration of our stay which was ridiculous. We asked for a baby crib to be sent up to the first nights room while we were waiting to get the keys and it wasn't there when we got up, had to wait 40+ minutes. The valet parking cost went up after I booked my stay but before I checked in and they tried to charge me more, but the manager overrode that. We were offered extra Hyatt points for forgoing daily housekeeping, at check out the employee knew nothing about this and we had to wait for a manager approval to get it. I would NOT stay here under any circumstances again. Save your troubles and book at the nicer Hyatt down the street on Waikiki. The valet parking charge is now outrageous (and required to park at the hotel), the resort fee is high for no nice amenities (pool is tiny and laughable), and the employees are not helpful nor knowledgeable about their own hotel policies ($5 daily drink credit for being a member, etc.).

My rating of this hotel would be much higher but its not and here’s why.My family have a tradition of bringing this one stuffed camel that my mum bought when she was deployed to Afghanistan with the Australian Army on holiday with us. We would keep it in the hotel room and only take it out once to get a picture to keep as a memento.My sister and I went on holiday to Hawaii and stayed at Hyatt PLace Waikiki Beach. On our 6th day in Honolulu we came back to our room after a tour and the camel that I had placed on the bed that morning was gone. We looked everywhere. We then went to the hotel staff and told them our concerns and they couldn’t of cared less!We were devastated and told them that we didn’t think it had been stolen, more likely got caught in the sheets when the bed was made. We went back night after night asking if there were any updates and each time they told us nothing. We could see the ——— in their eyes as we asked and knew they just thought of us as 2 silly girls who lost their bear. Not one person took any concern over something that went missing from our room.
