If it had been cash or passports I bet they would have cared more!Only when we asked to see the manager on one of our last nights did she offer to call the laundry! We thought they had done this nights and instead were just calling the maids to see if anyone had found anything.In the end we found nothing and had to go home empty handed. Apart from this horrible experience the hotel was great, and hence my rating of this hotel.Hope this wasn’t too long.If you’re ever visiting Hawaii and see the camel listed please contact me :)

Clean and comfortable rooms. Good location. A/C wasn't cold enough at night. Doesn't have much of a view. Breakfast was good. Coffee was hot every morning. The valet folks were nice. No real complaints here except that the room was hot at night .

I was not aware of the destination fee that the hotel, Hyatt Waiki place charges at checkout. $15.00 per day! The service other than this hidden fee was good. I am curious about the cleaning service. The quality the last few days, was just ok not excellent. The bed was just made and I feel the sheets were not changed.

Thrilled with our stay! Each staff member was friendly and helpful. Room was quiet and cleaned well each day. Breakfast was fantastic, and the team managed the morning rush very nicely. 5 minute walk to the beach.

Great place to stay, the staff is awesome when me and my friends had to get to a cruise in like ten mins and the guy at the front desk checked us in super fast so we got to our cruise with time to spare! Appreciated the extra effort to get us where we needed to go. The location is perfect for the beach and close to drop off zones for day activities and everything you could possibly need!

Hotel is in a convenient location, close to buses and walking distance from the seafront.The staff were very friendly and helpful - big shout out to Catherine T on reception and Dave on the tour desk.There are plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance.Breakfast is included in the room cost, however the breakfast area is next to the pool and is not ideal and gets very busy and congested.

Everyone working in the hotel was pleasant and ready to help make my visit be more comfortable. The free breakfast had many dishes to choose from. My room was very spacious with a lanai looking out to Diamond Head and the ocean.

Thanks again to Annabelle and Jade at the front desk for the fast check-in and genuinely nice service! Awesome rooms, free wifi & breakfast to boot! Right down the street from the beach, restaurants, and live music. Extremely courteous and attentive staff!A Dominos is attached to the hotel and its down the street from cheaper parking at the zoo if you have a car. Right next to an ABC store to get anything you might have forgotten at home. There can be a backlog at the elevators sometimes, but not too bad. The nice staff really made our stay worthwhile. Overall, highly recommend and our sincere thanks to the staff! Next time we're in Hawaii, we'll definitely stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach!

We are from Buenos Aires - Argentina. We’d stayed at the Hotel for 6 days. It is located close to the beach (2 blocks) . They give complimentary breakfast (not expected). They give complimentary towels and chairs for the beach. They gave us late check out and later, a hospitality room before going to the airport. Everybody was so kind. Our special thanks for Catherine , who was special...always smiling, always helpfull, always trying us to have a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach . Sorry if I have English mistakes, but my native language is Spanish. I extremely recommend this hotel! 10 points!! Gonzalo Gilabert Buenos Aires ARGENTINA

There was some lack of clarity in the check-in process regarding the green program and the resort fee and the difference between the two. I was under the impression that stays booked with award points still qualified for the resort amenities (such as towel service, gift bag upon check-in, free water, etc) but was told otherwise by the check-in staff. The room did not have enough body wash for 2 guests and there was no microwave (I had to eat my food cold). The street noise was very unbearable as one Wednesday morning we woke up to a helicopter that was flying around from 6am-9am. I was unhappy about the valet parking which was very high compared to other hotels in the area. However there were definitely some positives. For the price it can't be beat. The hotel is a 2-minute walk from Waikiki Beach which was just perfect if you want to save on beachfront views. Housekeeping was quick to make our room, replace with body wash, and replenish with clean towels. Eloisa was very accommodating with all our requests with water refill and purchasing drinks at the Gallery.
user_name:
spiceymomo
New York City, New York

review_body: the hotel was located right off the main strip of Waikiki beach. the location is great, away from the busy main street and very very close to the beach. the hotel staffs were all very friendly and eager to help. i was surprised at how nicely kept the rooms were and how clean everything is. the only comment i have is about the breakfast area. breakfast is not bad, they had all the basics (toast, yogurt, fruits, eggs, bacon, waffles, assortment of coffee, juices, etc) but the only downfall to the breakfast was the birds. the breakfast area is out in the open and birds were everywhere. they were flying all over people's heads and pecking at their feet and food. it was the most annoying thing, especially when kids would try and sneak food to them. overall our stay was very pleasant and enjoyed the hotel. if you dont mind birds pecking at your feet and being in constant fear of a birding crapping on your head then i definitely recommend this hotel!

The hotel is about a block and a half from the beach and in the midst of dozens of restaurants (try Tiki at the Asotin next door). We stayed in an ocean view room which had a nice view of Diamond Head and Waikiki beach, although the view is obstructed by buildings in some areas. The hotel provides nice beach towels so you dont have to pack them and also rents beach chairs. They provide a decent breakfast in the morning but it is crowded. You will find a second buffet set up in the lobby. While it does not have everything the main breakfast area has it is much less crowded.The wifi works well in the hotel. Our room was on the small side for a Hyatt Place. Expect a line when you check in but it moves briskly. Parking is valet only for $40 a day and it can take a while to get your car brought to you in the morning. There is also a $15 "resort fee" per day so be aware.Overall a pretty good place to stay on the less crowded end of Waikiki and their rates seem to be competitive. I would definitely stay again..

I stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for 7 nights and was very impressed. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly, particularly Eloisa. She assisted us with our check-in and also was very helpful throughout our stay. The free breakfast was also one of the better hotel breakfasts I have had- there was fresh fruit, eggs, potatoes, juices, etc. and the food was constantly being refilled. The rooms were also spacious with a lovely balcony. The location was also excellent- it was great to be less than a 5 minute walk away from the beach, as well as being close to a number of affordable restaurants. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

We booked a room with shower/tub combination through hotel.com website. There was no bath tub when we arrived at our room. The general manager first refused to swap the room because he said this was hotel.com website’s fault. They put up the faulty information which he got no control of. This has nothing to do with him. He required us to sort it out with the website ourselves but refused to help us swap the room. He offered us to pay extra $45 per night for a room with bath tub. After arguing forever, he finally agreed to changed the room. We got $40 voucher for the bar which we did not really care. The most 2 important things to us are bath tub and hotel breakfast. This hotel breakfast tastes terrible with very little choices. We booked all our hotels through hotel.com all the time but never experienced this before. It was definitely the most terrible experience in my life. I strongly recommend everyone not to choose this hotel!

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for 7 nights and were very happy with the friendliness of the staff and they even extended our checkout time without any extra expense. The members breakfast which was enjoyed by all had quite the variety of food with fresh fruit, toast, baked goods, eggs, bacon, pancakes etc. The location is also very convenient with only a 2 minute walk to the beach, restaurants and shops. The room was spacious, we had a view of Diamond head from our balcony. The only draw back of our room was the noise we heard from the street one night, others in our family had an ocean view and that side was very quite.

This hotel, though not right on the beach, is a nice hotel to stay in. The rooms are comfortable and clean, and the breakfast that is included is a really nice breakfast with a variety of options you don't find in the typical free breakfast.

A quiet and clean place but our room was a bit small compared to our last visit last year.The breakfast can greatly be improved on variety and quality.Reasonably priced and location handy to all transport pickups.

My family and I were delighted with just about everything at the Hyatt Place. The staff were wonderful with absolutely NO exceptions. We enjoyed breakfast every morning on the patio and were surprised to find a great assortment of food which were different every day. Our beds were very comfortable.

The hotel is very clean, the staff friendliness is outstanding and their response and helpfulness is superior. This place made me sign up to be a hyatt loyalty member. The staff really left a very good impression on me.

Our stay at the Hyatt Place was wonderful! From the very beginning we received 5-star treatment from the lovely woman checking us in. I believe her name was Lisa. She was wonderful, very polite and carefully explained everything about the amenities that we needed to know. I very much appreciated the wonderful welcome that we received. We usually stay at the Turtle Bay Resort, Aulani and The Kahala, but have also stayed at the Marriott, Embassy Suites, Waikiki Parc and others. The Hyatt Place can certainly teach all of those other hotels how to properly welcome a guest! This may be a 3-star hotel, but the treatment was a solid 5 stars.We were very pleased to find a very clean, modern room to stay in. The hallways and decor in the hotel and rooms were beautiful and had lovely warm tones. I loved every detail! The lobby is very nice too. While the hotel is not on the beach, it is a very short walk to the beach.We enjoyed our free breakfast buffet. We enjoyed a huge variety of food that was out in a very display. It gave us a good start to our day. There are plenty of eating places in the area, an ABC store very close by and a Domino’s Pizza place right in the lobby. It will come in handy after a full day of sightseeing.We look forward to returning next year. Thank you for a wonderful stay! Our only regret was not to stay longer.

We stayed at Hyatt place Waikiki for our Honeymoon at the end of april this year and had a fantastic experience. We booked online and ended up getting a lower level room with a view into someone elses apartment which was unfortunate. I raised my concerns to Guan and he went above and beyond in moving us to a room with a nice view of the hills and even had champagne delivered to us with a lovely handwritten card. Everyone was very helpful!

This was a great location if you want to be out of the fray of Waikiki. It's just a block off the beach but it's right near the zoo and open space. Very convenient if you are not interested in shopping, etc.

We were very pleased with this hotel. They offered free hot breakfast daily, quality ingredients. Great location very good, being only 1-1/2 blocks to the beach. Amazing staff , very professional and courteous at all times. We definately recommend!

A great place to stay just one block back from the beach and close to Waikiki restaurants. Great sized rooms with comfy beds and very clean. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Breakfast buffet was tasty and fresh.

We had an excellent stay in Waikiki at Hyatt Place. All of the staff were amazing, especially Lisa who checked us in. Location is convenient, but do make sure to get out and explore Oahu. The hotel rooms were nicely appointed, as was the lobby area. If I had to make a minor complaint, it would be that the elevators are very slow. That being said, I had a phenomenal stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Overall I had a great stay. Staff's are very friendly and welcoming. The valleys was very accommodating and they work hard. Only complain I have was I can hear other guest closing the room door very loud, but like I said overall it was great

This is my family first trip to Hawaii and we chose the Hyatt Place as our stay. The staffs are nice and patient, and the room is comfortable even it is small. Free breakfast is good but less variety, hope it will change in the future.

The staff was attentive and kind. Aude took care of us at check in...she was fantastic! Kudos Aude for great customer service!Breakfast was good and hotel was clean and modern. The only flaw was parking but I guess that’s a problem where ever you go in Waikiki. Expensive!

Conveniently situated near restaurants and shops. Hotel room itself was ok. My overall impression was marred by my negative encounters with one of the server working at the bar: Kai. When I tried to change my original order to accommodate one of my coworker who joined us late, he was rude and surly to me. His attitude the rest of the time we were at the bar was rude. We were upset about his behavior so we left the bar.One of my coworker came back to the bar later on and told him that he was rude to me. Instead of apologizing, he tried to blame it on me for changing my mind. He attitude was arrogant and totally unprofessional.I also complained of his unprofessional and rude attitude to hotel management but got the standard "we'll look into it" response. I recommend the hotel retrain this server, Kai, to be more professional in his interaction with customers. Hopefully, hotel management will take note and adjust his attitude.

This hotel is located in an inside street, but a two minute walk to the main road. If you are looking for awesome views of the beach... this is not the hotel for it. It had a good breakfast daily at the poolside. Pool is tiny and outdated looking. I was in the Penthouse room, which was nice but still small by my standards of a PH

Great location and staff. All amenities above expectation. But the greeting in reception is a display of dead corals!REALLY? Even if they are copies, they send the wrong Eco-Awareness message. A giant like Hyatt should know better.

A great hotel to stay at and close to the beach and shops. Nice and friendly staff as well. Rooms are nice and have all the usual amenities. Breakfast is nice. A good time to go is after 7.30am as there are less people and you wont miss out on food as it is constantly replenished.

Friendly and helpful staff. Well kept and clean facilities. Great ocean views. Public areas at the entrance well kept and airy. Good sized rooms and well equipped. Elevators rather slow at busy times. Breakfast rather chaotic on some days- timing is everything

From check-in to check-out, the staff were professional and friendly. My room was very clean and typical of what I've come to expect from all Hyatt properties. I am on Oahu every month or two, and will always return to any of these 3 Hyatt locations.

Nice and clean rooms. Good size for Waikiki. Conveniently located. Super affordable!! Definitely get your moneys worth! Staff is amazing and goes out of their way to ensure an exceptional experience! I highly recommend this property.

Roomy, clean, GREAT view from our balcony, & Free Breakfast. The breakfast buffet is great! Received exceptional customer service from the front desk named Aude. She's wonderful! The only downside is the pool, the pool is tiny. But overall experience is great!!

Loved this hotel, the free breakfast was really good and I liked the tray they provided in you room so you could bring your breakfast up to your room if you wanted. The location was really good, hotel was close to Waikiki beaches, shops and eateries. Would recommend.

Hands down the best surprise Mother’s Day get away! Our family was visiting for a short period of time specifically to celebrate Mother’s Day and I couldn’t asked for more in return. Being our first time here at the Hyatt Place Waikiki, I am quite impressed by the staff and the overall generous Aloha they have given us. I had book a package deal through Hawaiian Airlines and since it was my first time doing that, I wasn’t aware of what type of room we would get. The one I had booked originally was for a Standard room with a King Bed and a city view. The first vibe that I got upon entering Room #216 was not what I had expected. It was a little smaller for my taste and the view was not appealing. I was a little heart broken knowing this is what I paid for, 4 nights and 3 days. I was very hesitant at first to ask the front desk for a possible room change because I didn’t want to be a hassle. I just went with my gut and called the operator. I spoke with a sweet lady named Heidi and she was very accommodating to my situation and said that a room will not be available until the next day due to availability with graduation and the holiday going on. That gave me a little hope knowing everything will be taken care of. We went on accepting the room change for the next day and decided to get some late lunch. What’s super convenient is they had a Dominos Pizza eatery right in the hotel. That was a plus! I wasn’t quite satisfied at the fact that the room change wouldn’t be until the next day so I caught a front desk person who happened to be the Manager On Duty named Heidi. She was very comforting and really took the initiative to take great care of us. She moved us quickly into Room #609 with 2 queen beds, a pull out sofa, and a much spacious room. The view wasn’t as bad as the first room but I was instantly relieved and felt right at home with this room. The ambience and smell was perfectly acceptable. Thanks Joan!! The valet guys were very courteous and always greeted us on the spot coming in or out. I will rave about how much I enjoyed the free breakfast from 6a-10am!! It was super delicious and I couldn’t be more happier to the extent of what great guest service I had receive throughout my entire trip. Heidi & Staff, I personally want to Thank you from the bottom of my heart! I will definitely be recommending friends and family to your hotel! The dedicated staff and service is one of a kind!!

The hotel and employees were wonderful. Excellant location with beautiful view of ocean and short walk to beach. Breakfast was excellant with big variety and alot of healthy options. Would love to stay here again.

The hotel was quite central to buses and restaurants. Breakfast was not included when we booked and my friend had paid for breakfast, I did not. Then I found out it was included after a few days as I did not realise. The girl did mention where was breakfast, but as I did not pay for it, it was irrelevant. But then I found out so that was a big surprise and good value. They got a refund . My A/C was not working to a cool temperature and maintenance came to fix on 2 occasions, so I cannot complain about the promptness but it still was not cool enough

We stayed at this hotel after transferring from our original hotel which ended up being not at all as was advertised. The Hyatt was incredible. Right from the checkin with Heidi it was a completely different experience. The staff was friendly, the rooms were great, the breakfast was one of the best we have had with our hotel stays. We couldn’t be happier and look forward to our next visit. Thank you to Heidi, Anna and Kyle who were wonderful to us.
user_name:
Chris P
Playa del Carmen, Mexico

review_body: 1st the positives, our room could not have been better, nice and large, great bed (king) and soft pillows, we also had a 4-5 seat sofa, and often had pre dinner drinks with friends in our spacious room. The free breakfasts were most welcome and a plus is the large tray supplied to each room so that you could take up breakfast to your room if you wanted to!The negatives - there are not enough lifts especially during the breakfast period which result in long waits (and sometimes cold breakfasts!) and finally the room "eco" option, were if you forgo getting your room made up and towels changed you get a $5 credit which must be redeemed at the Hyatt "store" - my recommendation is give it a miss - we opted for a service every second day but had to continually chase staff to do this and after 5 days without a service we opted out of the eco option and still had to chase up staff to get the room serviced!

Great location and the staff was courteous and helpful. But the facility is in dire need of some upgrades. For example, the ceilings are all popcorn textured and the carpets are worn and soiled. We had a nice ocean view but the room was tiny and very cramped. A very noisy air conditioner kept us cool but wasn't great for light sleepers.

The rooms were clean , spacious and staff were friendly and helpful. The pool needs to be upgraded but ok there is the beach down the road. The only down side was lifts can be slow but the staff and the cleanliness and location out way anything else

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was a very good choice for us. we were between ships, cruising back to back, needed a one night stay before boarding. Booked hotel on line, price OK, location a block from beach, a bit far from airport, but when in Honolulu, coming down to the beach area is a must fo us.Price as listed, room amenities perfect. Everything in order, fortunate to obtain an early check-in as we were only staying one night. Used Concierge for lunch recommendations, All very pleasant.

We had a late flight from Vancouver and took a shuttle to the hotel, arriving tired, and a little grumpy! The check in staff were awesome, we were upgraded to a large beautiful ocean view room which was spotless and had everything we needed. Bed was comfy, room quiet so we slept great! We went to the buffet in the morning and found it clean, well stocked and the staff was friendly . We went for a walk before checkout , very close to beach, zoo and shopping. Got a special taxi deal through the hotel to the pier, cheaper than uber but taxi driver super unfriendly, did not answer direct questions, a little weird but cannot fault hotel for that. All staff we met were helpful and friendly. We will stay again when in Honolulu!

Amazing staff, amazing location, wonderful buffet breakfast!!! The hotel is only 1 block from the beach. The staff goes above and beyond for the guests!!! The rooms are very clean and full with toiletries, plenty of towels, and extra blankets. And the breakfast buffet is fresh and delicious!!! We had an amazing time!

The Hyatt Place in Waikiki Beach had the best service of any hotel I have stayed at. When they came in to clean our room they made sure that they put everything back the way they found it. They also were extremely kind when we ran into them. The breakfast food was absolutely amazing. 100% would return

Our stay at the Hyatt place was wonderful! When we first arrived we were greeted by Kimberly T. at the front desk, who was absolutely amazing! She exhibited great customer service skills, and enhanced our experience greatly. One my daughters was celebrating her birthday and Kimberly took the time to leave a nice card with a little cake for her. It is obvious that customer satisfaction is at the center of all that she does! In addition to Kimberly’s wonderful service, we must also include Arlita, who was in charge of our room services. Arlita was beyond nice, she was very accommodating and our room was always spotless due to her attention to detail. Overall our stay was great and we will definitely come back!

This Hotel is conveniently centrally located. It is close to the beach, restaurants and stores. Hotel and our room was very clean. Staff was very pleasant to deal with as well as very helpful with any questions we had. Very good breakfast that was included with our daily stay. We would Definitely stay here again.

I cannot say anything about the stay yet. But I can thank one of the staff members who immediately took proactive steps to accommodate my parents with check-in them in, instead of making them wait for 3 hours like another staff member suggested.Thank You Annabell (sorry if I mispelled Your name) for excellent customer service!!!

I have been to several hotels in Waikiki. I keep coming back to Hyatt Place Waikiki. Why?It is the excellent customer service from Cliff who take the time to get to know you, what you need from the hotel and excellent service and attitude. I have medical sleep issues and the hotel always gives me a quiet room and does follow up. Most hotels would not ask or care.Breakfast in Hawaii is super expensive so the breakfast included with all sorts of assortment is important.

Stayed here for five days and enjoyed almost every moment of it. The entire staff was really friendly, including the valet which we did not use. They did help us unload our stuff and helped us check the bags in so we can explore before our room was ready. Front desk was very helpful throughout the entire stay including the General Manager. They have a 24 hour coffee bar and bar, it was operated by the same front desk person so if they were busy there was a short wait. Was convenient for a late drink or dessert.There was free breakfast, which was nothing to write home about its typical hotel breakfast. Also had free beach chairs, made it really convenient to hang out at the beach.We noticed that there was lotion in the room, quick call to front desk and lotion showed up within 5minutes. Two things that could be improved.-One odd thing did happen, a hotel employee knocked on our door and when we answered, they said "oh never mind." Never found out what that was all about. -The elevators can be slow, they only have two elevators for 20 floors.

Great hotel. It was a spacious room, friendly staff, and they do a great breakfast(watch the birds, they’ll eat your food). Easy walk to a lot of stuff on and around Wakiki, like the zoo and aquarium, and it’s located next to a convenience store that has a little bit of everything you might need or forgot at home.

We were there for only 2 days as we were on our honeymoon trip and the staff just made it so special to us. A special shout out to Anicristy, Barsell and Angeline who took care of us in such a special way. Aside from wonderful staff, the hotel is perfectly located near shops, bars, restaurants. Our room had a view to the city and it was great. It was quiet, clean, and cozy. The breakfast is served on a terrace and on a wonderful sunny day, a great way to start the day. I highly recommend staying here as the price is reasonable for Waikiki. I would stay there again on our next trip.

Stayed here with our family of 6. It’s close to the beach and walking distance to just about anywhere in Waikiki. The rooms are immaculate!!! They are way more spacious than the typical hotel room with 2 double beds and a pull out sofa. Ihab and Bryan provided exceptional service and made sure our stay was perfect! We also ate from the free breakfast and the lounge and were happy with the food. Highly recommend staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for all types of travelers!

We booked our room through AAA-pleasant holidays. We booked an ocean view but the confirmation came back city view. I explained this to check in but she didn’t believe me and put us in city view. AAA said the Hyatt was going to make it up to me when I arrived. No surprise nothing to make up for the mid communication.

I don't usually write reviews on TripAdvisor but I really felt I should write one after my recent stay. We had a room at Hyatt Place Waikiki for ten days during May 2019. I expected just a standard hotel but was very pleasantly surprised. The staff are very pleasant to deal with and the check in/out process was seamless and easy. You can leave your bags in the lobby after you check out and retrieve them when you are ready to go to the airport. I was there for a work conference and also vacation. Our room was one king bed and small-medium in size, but more than suitable for two people. The balcony was nice. I was extremely pleased with the cleanliness of the room and the daily cleaning staff, the room was spotless. The room was quiet at night, there was the occasional siren outside but this is expected in the city. The location of the hotel is so close to the beach, only about one block away. The hotel is at the eastern side of Waikiki, which in my opinion is the nicer end. The whole Waikiki strip is within walking distance. There is an ABC store right next to the hotel for convenience purchases. The hotel buffet breakfast is quite good, there is a lot of selection and fresh fruit. If you choose to eat outside you will occasionally have to deal with some birds but that is just part of eating outside. The pool is somewhat small although suitable for children, I didn't use it myself. There are beach towels available for use. Overall, I would rate this hotel as excellent and would definitely stay there again. I was really impressed with the quality for the price.

Perfect hotel, perfect location and perfect staff. Walkable to almost everything you want and need. Walkable to all good stores ,bars and restaurants. Rooms are nice, clean and cosy. I recommend getting the ocean view room, worth the extra little bit! Catherine at front desk is the star of the hotel and is an invaluable asset to Hyatt. We will definitely be returning!

We stayed at this friendly hotel for 8 nights. The staff was very kind, always saying "Good morning Sir" or "Aloha". When we booked we didn't realize there would be a buffet breakfast included. Excellent way to start our days & it really had everything we would want. Some items rotate from day to day like maybe sausages one day, and back bacon the next. Trust me, it's all there. Very enjoyable. You might have to shoo away some birds on the deck, but it didn't really bother us much. The location is a few blocks from the beach, and with our rental car we ended up parking at the Honolulu Zoo. It's only $1 per hour and we had no issues parking overnight. You can get a text sent to your phone just before times up if you need to extend. The gym was modern and clean. The laundry machines were large and reasonably priced. I believe they took coins & credit cards.Housekeeping staff did a great job cleaning up after us. Sorry for the mess! Bottom line, we were really impressed & certainly would recommend to others.

You can see beautiful place just across hotel in Waikiki areas, including anything you want just near hotel. Hotel might be a little expensive and slightly old fashion but the location is good about a few blocks to the beach..

Good location within walking distance of the beach and attractions of Waikiki, with breakfast included and comfortable room it made a good value proposition.Would definitely recommend for a stay in Waikiki.

Our family of four got a large room for a week. Room was clean and hotel has a great feel to it. Breakfast was simple but really good quality. Lift wait time is a big issue and lack of cover for bad weather should be addressed in dining area on level 3. It rained when we were there and they were totally unprepared. Will try somewhere else next time but this was still ok for us on our first family trip to Hawaii.

We stayed here recently as a family. The room was huge, excellent size for all of us. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with much more selection and a much higher quality than expected. Check-in and check-out was easy. I even had a package delivered and the process was much easier than I expected. The hotel was a block from the Honolulu Zoo and a couple blocks to the beach and shopping, very easy walk. We took an Uber to Diamondhead for a hike and it was a cheap ride (could have taken the bus but opted not to). We didn't use the pool but it looked nice (although small-ish). Overall, I would definitely return and would definitely recommend.

The Hotel is convenient to beach's, transport, shops and Restuarants all within walking distanceGood sized room with Really comfortable beds & pillows. The staff are very friendly and helpfulThe breakfast buffet is good , together with the free Wi-fi makes it a GOOD place to stay

Great hotel and location. Staff were so friendly and Abbie concierge Expedia tours was the best. We arrived on Saturday afternoon and we had our whole week planned within 30mins. No stress and we knew what we were doing. The tours were great. Breakfast is provided. A basic breakfast great quality but enough to satisfy your hunger, better than many hotels but could have maybe an egg station instead of scrambled eggs everyday for a bit of variety and more tables. The rooms are not too large but big enough as you are hardly in them apart from sleeping. Rooms are cleaned daily and are always immaculate. The hotel is a little tired in decor but you feel very comfortable. The pool isn’t very large but the ocean is just up the street. A great location away from the busy oceanfront strip and tour buses are caught from just across the road and the same for the city buses and the trolley buses. Easy. We had an ocean view room which made you feel like you were so close to the beach. An ABC shop is virtually next door and such and easy walk to everything on the oceanfront shops and restaurants. Would highly recommend this Hotel for you next Waikiki stay.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us plan the excursions we were interested in. The busses for the excursion to the Luah was a nice informative ride. The Luah was great. I would also suggest the dinner and magic show. It was fascinating. The room was very clean was a little small but it worked. The city view was very pretty at night with all the city lights. The location was close to the beach,Aquarieum and zoo. The shopping mall was fun to observe in the evening. I felt safe walking around the city.

I've never had a bad experience at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. It's a great middle of the road hotel in terms of price. It's great having the Hyatt brand to back it up. The rooms are clean, the service is good, and I love being at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. The beach is a very short walk away and the area around it has a great vibe. Of course you could stay in a more luxurious hotel, but it's probably not going to be worth the extra cost.

Upgraded to an ocean view room on arrival. On the 11th floor we could see the beach between a few other buildings. The rooms are well appointed but a little small making it a bit tight to open more than two large suitcases at a time. Importantly, the beds are very comfortable, the room is quiet and the breakfast is very good. Add to that helpful staff and the overall experience is pleasing.

Anabelle was extremely helpful getting me checked in much earlier than I expected to be able to get into my room, which was especially great after a redeye flight. The breakfast is great, and the room had everything I needed.

The room was very clean and conducive to resting. However, I was not provided with a toothbrush and bottled water was not complimentary. However, when I mentioned that in the review, a staff called me up and inquired if I needed bottled water. She immediately sent two bottles. With regards to breakfast, I hope they serve different variety of food each day and not the same choices everyday.

I just wanted to commend the housekeeper, Josie. She does an excellent job and is very friendly to our whole family. We want to thank her for her hard work for taking care of our rooms everyday. Your hard work and attitude doesn’t go unnoticed. Thank you!

We stayed here recently and we booked the Oceanfront room with 1 Queen beds. Wow. It was amazing. Very clean, amazing view, and very well maintained. The staff were very friendly and helpful. And building is maintained very well and it’s all nicely renovated. We have stayed here multiple times and will continue to.

We have always stayed at the "far end" of Waikiki. Near the beach and not far from many restaurants and attractions. The large double-queen room with a tub were welcome after 12 days on a cruise ship. Not much in the way of views. Free buffet breakfast by the pool. Very slow elevators.

Hotel is in a good position just a Block to Waikiki beach.Room are big and bed comfortable.Breakfast is poor with poor selection of food,the Breakfast area not easy to find and too small,the door to access this area dirty and hard to open.Lift too busy and not always clean.Valet parking too dear.

Our top priority in a hotel is comfort. The beds are very nice and comfortable, but the room could use some updating. The A/C is wall mounted and makes a TERRIBLE racket when the compressor is running. It sounds like a rain storm is pelting the windows during a hurricane! Ear plugs made sleep possible, but don't expect to get the room below 68 degrees. We noticed some sheetrock in the bathroom below the shower was missing, and they have removed any way to turn the bathroom lights on other than from the main room, which is annoying! They put cover plates over the missing switches. I personally think the room needs to be updated. I will say the location is a convenient 2 block walk to the beach, and it has two nice souvenir shops inside as well as a bar. Don't expect much in the way of a beautiful swimming pool area as it is not resort style in any shape of the imagination. To be honest, the pool was small, ugly, and not very inviting, but they did have plenty of lounge chairs if you wanted to stay there. The balcony on our room had two little chairs facing each other, but it was so small the chairs touched the wall so it was worthless. The staff were all very nice and helpful, and we thought it was okay for the price.

Family of 5, 4 night stay. Close to beach but further away from the main stripe. Being away from the stripe at night is good as it’s not so noisy but during day with young kids it’s a little bit of a hike.Rooms are a spacious for a family of 5 and complimentary breakfast was an bonus

We stayed in Waikiki just to tour some sites, primarily Pearl Harbor. Our room was clean, the location was perfect, we didn't need a car. The breakfast was great! Choice of yogurt, cereal, cooked eggs, ham/bacon, japanese favorites, and plenty of fruit. We were only on the 2nd floor and our view was horrible. We looked at an apartment complex that needed pain and some sprucing up, not to mention the lanai on all the apartments were used as storage.

My stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was great. Everything was clean, the Mountain View double queen room was spacious. Most of all, my experience with the staff was great,especially Angeline. She made our check in smooth and was very helpful and friendly. We were in HI to celebrate my sons birthday. Angeline asked was it ok to have cake brought up to our room to help celebrate. She hand delivered us cake and a few bottles of sodas. She made an awesome first impression for the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.

The hotel is the Diamond Head end of the beach, a couple of hotels back. Depending on room chosen you may still have ocean views. We chose a corner room with two queens and a sofa bed. The room was large snd well kept. The staff were very accommodating and easy to deal with. The pool is a disappointment but a great swimming beach is at the end of the road. Breakfast also provided which is a bonus. The lifts take forever so allow plenty of time when going somewhere.

Very clean n comfy room. Loved thr balcony with ocean view. Walkable to everything. Location great on quiet end of beach. Staff very friendly and helpful. Loved the openness of the lobby. Great tips from the front desk staff on how to get around etc

Among other hotels I would choose Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach because it is the best hotel and especially if you are a member. Loved it!!! Great service. Lots of free stuff like beach towels / chairs and water to go. Definitely will be back

nice hotel, great staff, and perfect location. Walk to everything.Very busy, but great service. Like others, a destination fee( $15/day), but you actually get things: $5 daily credit good on anything except drinks, beach towels and chairs, coffee and tea.

Waikiki always feels like an endless forest of older, interchangeable skyscraper hotels. In many ways, the Hyatt Place feels like another tree in this forest. It is an older property that has been expanded and adapted to the Hyatt Place brand. But it's definitely a better-than-average Waikiki hotel. The renovations make the rooms a little nicer, the staff is a little nicer and more professional, and you get a decent free breakfast buffet (much like at a Hyatt Place on the mainland, but with a few twists, mostly additions for the Asian market). The property is a short 2 blocks to the beach, and they will let you borrow some (bad) beach chairs and towels. The only real negatives are a small pool and slowish elevators. If you have a car and don't feel like paying the hefty parking fee, you can usually find free parking less than 10 minutes away on Monsarat Ave. As with all Waikiki hotels, I think there are better places in Hawaii to vacation (this is an urban beach), but a short stay here can be very pleasant.

So the hotel itself was great, I like where the hotel is located and how nice the staff is, however I booked this hotel counting on a swimming pool and that was a bit disappointing cuz it was a very old and small pool just a not well taking care of kinda pool so I mean sure the beach is great but sometimes I just like to not deal with the sand and in this case that’s all I had to deal with cuz I did not get in to the pool at all, just no desire after I saw it :( so if you want a nice pool with your hotel this won’t be the one, if you just want a place to sleep with a good location and free breakfast then yes it is.

My wife and I stayed here for a 6 night vacation. The room was clean, the staff was great. Easy beach access, 2 blocks away. Beach chair and towel rental at the front desk. Ice machines are not on every floor, but usually only one floor away, take the stairs if there is not an ice machine on your floor. Elevator s were slow at times, as there are only two elevators servicing many floors. Breakfast was a standard Hyatt breakfast with some local influence, it was a great simple way to start the day. For convenience, there is a Domino s pizza located in the same building and an abc store 1 block away. The quality of the stay along with the pricing makes this a hotel that we will stay at again in the future.

We had awesome customer service from both Annabelle and Cliff. Room was super clean with a great view of Diamond Head. Short walk to Waikiki Beach. Very close to some of the best restaurants and bars in Honolulu. Thanks for the memorable stay.

This hotel is a great location on the edge of Waikiki. 2 minute walk to the front gate of the zoo. 4 minute walk to the beach. Pool was small but refreshing. The poolside/patio breakfast was outstanding! Staff were friendly and helpful.

I booked a few nights here prior to leaving for a cruise. I chose this property because of brand name, location, and cost. Overall, I think it offers some major perks to consider for your stay. If you’re looking for an affordable property that is located close to the beach and near a lot of shops and restaurants, this could be a good fit for you. I felt like the staff did a good job of trying to help each guest, and I thought the property offered popular amenities. I would consider this hotel again.

Hyatt place Waikiki was a good experience overall. Breakfast was good but no variety. Pool was too tiny. Staff friendly and location was good. The rooms are bit dated but look decent. Yhis is more like a low four star hotel.

Very clean rooms, i got a mtn view standard room, it was a little on the smaller side but was perect for a couple. Within walking distance to anything we wanted to do. I would come back tomorrow if i could.

The services was amazing and the staff members were really friendly/helpful. Hotel is walking distances to the Zoo, Beach, and Aquarium. Really close to Diamond Head. There is a rental shop two blocks away, where you can rent bikes, scooters and so on.

The hotel was gorgeous! our room wasn't fully ocean front but we still got a beautiful view of the ocean. They served breakfast at the poolside every morning and it was delicious, pineapple was definitely fresh every single time and I was allowed to take it up to my room and eat if I needed. The service was awesome and the internet was fast! Everyone that worked there had a happy and friendly attitude.

We had an amazing one week stay at the Hyatt Place. We are long time Hyatt Members and this Hyatt Place offers a great location, large rooms and complimentary breakfast. But what sets this hotel apart is the service. The staff go above and beyond to ensure that the guests are happy. Special thanks to Clifford for the consistent and excellent service. After learning that we would be celebrating a couple of birthdays there, he had a card, cake and bottle of wine sent up to our room. He also checked in on us periodically during our stay to ensure that things were going well.We look forward to our next trip to Hawaii and staying here again!

Everything was fine about the room and stay, breakfast was good.Left two items in my room and called the day after checkout, only to be informed my items were never found? Hotel management may want to have more thourough security measures with housekeeping. Be prepared to volunteer to donate your items to the hotel if they are left behind as they will likely not be accounted for. Disappointed.

I’m reviewing this with the understanding that this is a 3.5 star hotel. Here’s what I like about it:-affordable price-free breakfast (for Hyatt world members, just apply it’s easy, but when I went seems breakfast was still free for all) They do serve similar food everyday, but they offer gluten free options which was good because my hubby cannot eat gluten. Sausage, bacon or ham, eggs, potatoes, oatmeal, fruit, miso soup, rice, done breads-location: very close to the beach (ask front desk for towels and chair)-reasonable resort fee ($15/day) compared to $30 at most other hotels-$5 credit per room per day, which we used to buy water ($3 a bottle or fruits $1 each). We used it to buy Frappuccino at their cafe ($5ish)-close to lots of shops and restaurants in the Waikiki area.-rooms were clean, staff were helpful-They only give you water on the first day if you are not a tiered hyatt member. It’s ok just buy it for $1 at the abc store next door.-the ocean view is blocked by other buildings.In conclusion I would come back!I’ve stayed at the Aston next to it before, prefer Hyatt place. Stayed at the Modern, double resort free, but prefer this location better.

Stayed for 10 days. Have stayed here before. My first to stay in 2016 was much better, and therefore this time I return to the hotel. I thought that the hotel was dirty especially shared areas like the elevators hallways and breakfast area. Floors needed vacuuming and mopping, was just dirty. Air conditioning did not work, maintenance had to be called twice. TV did not work for the entire time of stay. Bed sheets stained yellow. Bugs in the room which turned us off completely. Will not stay here again.

The hotel is located near the beach and many restaurants. It is a great location, affordable 4 star hotel with friendly staff, clean rooms and free breakfast. It can't get any better than this! Hyatt Place is my home away from home and I will def booking my next visit at the Hyatt!

We had a really good experience at the hotel, and the customer service was outstanding. The beaches, shops and the bus stop are all a short walk away. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant and the free breakfast was average.

The room is clean, service is excellent. Breakfast is excellent. Close to everything. Safety is maintained. No SPA. There is daily shampoo, conditioner, but its more okay if there is lotion and toothpaste too. But overall its okay and highly recommended.

We arrived early and because our Mountain View wasn’t cleaned yet, they offered us an ocean view. The staff was very kind and helpful. The breakfast was amazing and there were plenty of items so I didn’t have to eat the same thing every day. The location is great too.

Very nice place to stay. Kimberly checked us in and found us a room although we were a few hours earlier than check in time. The lobby is an open air lobby. There is a complimentary coffee bar in the lobby in the mornings. The complimentary breakfast buffet was super delightful. It was a full breakfast that got our early mornings off to a great start. Room was pleasant & clean. Balconies are shallow but room width.

Hyatt Place is amazing. The room was very spacious and the beds were comfortable. There different items every day for breakfast. It was 2 blocks away from the beach. The staff was very friendly.the only negative was the elevators can be slow with all the people and I wish they had early check in.

Great location. Easy walking distance to the beach, zoo and lots ofrestaurants. The local transit bus stop is....right there. Staff are very friendly. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. (be aware...there are 3 Hyatt Hotels in Waikiki)

Location was good. Very short walk to the beach. Trollies and buses pick up near the hotel. Breakfast is good. Bed was comfy. Staff very friendly. Really small pool, but who needs the pool when the beach is down the street

Hotel was conveniently located, a couple blocks from the beach, zoo, aquarium, shops and restaurants. Breakfast varied every morning. The pool is small. However, we never used it because the beach was beautiful and only a few steps away. Would definitely stay again.

Actually this is the second time that I choose to stay in this hotel as including breakfast is really attractive, but when I check out Resort and destination Fee were charged again that I paid before the trip. In addition, the front desk staff is not friendly to us as we are Chinese when comparing with other non Asian guests whatever request I made to front desk they will give me long faces or just rudely told me to wait as she is busy (no other guests standing in front of the counters but just me ） Really feel so disappointed about the attitude of the hotel front desk staff，and the 5 dollars everyday redeem, we know it only at the last 2 days via other customers but not the hotel staff! Waste for 5 nights! Also, the showers is not working well and needed to repair. The room is spacious for my babies to sleep and good to provide baby crib thank you so much for that. By the way about the location of breakfast not only me but also other customers also claimed that too windy to have breakfast in there everything either eaten by birds or fly away by wind ！ hope your hotel can re consider to relocate the breakfast area in other place! Also, it's easy to hear next door voices, we stayed there for 7 nights and most of the night we are waken up by other guests staying in next door, it's not really suitable to stay in there is you are having a baby with you as baby or children are easily to waken up by the noise via next guest room, especial when there is a group checking in.

Everything is perfect, the staff is friendly, the room is clean, the food is good. I purchased through COSTCO, it was amazing deal and the price is better than through Expedia. Thank you HYATT PLACE for everything.

Good, nice and friendly staff!! My flight was delayed 7 hours , checked out at 4am and came back and was very much appreciated let back in my room !!!! That was so nice to lay back down and have TV , Wifi instead of sitting at the airport for 7 hours!!!! THANK YOU!!!

Fabulous hotel staff from the front desk all the way to the kitchen staff and all in between. A very fine Hyatt hotel property and location. Easy access to city transportation and a short walk to Waikiki Beach. The Hyatt Place staff should be recognized for their ability to make adjustments to retain customer-client satisfaction. Thank you Aja G and Heidi W. IHAB, I can only hope you recognize what an excellent employees you have working under your supervision. Not all hotels in Honolulu are so fortunate. S. Hicks Tualatin, Oregon

This was my first experience at a Hyatt Place. The room was a king bed and had an office nook. The complimentary breakfast was standard but fresh and tasty. Eggs, Fruit, cereal, yogurt and bread products. the staff was very friendly and helpful. It's a short five minute walk to the beach and about the same distance to Kapiolani Park and the Zoo. I would definitely stay here again

The Location is just a minute walk away from the beach. Within walkable distance to all the restaurants, Shopping etc.. Hyatt Breakfast was above average as usual and staff was polite and eager to help.The guestroom was half the size of what we expected as per Hyatt House standards. Be aware and check/compare room sizes before you book

We Chose Hyatt Place after reviewing the reviews and prices of other hotels and we were not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful and every staff member we came in contact with was pleasant and helpful. The room was sufficient for our 4 night stay. Enjoyed having a refrigerator to keep cold drinks and snacks. The breakfast was free and was always stocked with a good selection of food. There is a bar in the lounge area and Nick, the bartender, was very professional and his Mai Tais were fantastic. The hotel supplied beach towels and chairs for the beach, which was a quick walk from the hotel. The concierge was very helpful when we were booking tours and a car. She mapped out places on the map that were must sees om our ride around the island. Although there are much nicer hotels$$$that are right on the beachfront, this one was excellent for our stay.

25 year Hyatt customer with great long-time history. The Hyatt Place let me and my wife down this time. We came back from a long day out to a dirty, uncleansed room. The front desk told us that they clean rooms up until 10 pm, which I never heard of before. They also charge a resort fee when they are far from any resort that I know of. Their $5 credit per diem is a sham because a small juice cost more than $5, so we actually lose money on the credit. Overall, a very poor experience.

My reservation got messed up over the phone and I ended up getting a small room. They upgraded me rooms for no extra charge. The room was twice the size of the first room. Will definitely stay here again.

This property is a gem. The first thing we noticed is how friendly everyone is from the first person we met to the last when we departed. When we checked in, Aja was very welcoming, informative, helpful, and the embodiment of the spirit of ALOHA. We did not feel rushed and she answered all our questions and offered helpful suggestions. The valet personnel were very efficient, positive and organized. Our room was spacious, very clean and well appointed with nice towels and linens. My husband had a spacious area to set upon his computer and do his business work in and there was even a couch with a sofa bed in it. The wifi worked great. We appreciated the refrigerator where we could store our cold drinks and an ice machine by the elevators on our floor. There are also laundry machines in the building which is nice if you stay more than a couple days. The complimentary breakfast that comes with your stay is more than substantial with hot and cold foods which included scrambled eggs, juices, coffees, teas, waffles, pastries, cereals, fresh fruits, and even miso soup.There is a swimming pool, too. Though this property is not on the beachfront, it is within easy walking distance of the beach and so many restaurants and shopping areas with something for everyone. We found this hotel a cozy place to come "home" to after a fun day in Waikiki and Honolulu. You can get back to your room in minutes as the elevators are right there as you enter the property and have the security of needing your room key to access the guest floors. There is a small bar in the lobby where you can get a limited variety of drinks and snacks, though you are surrounded by more than enough places to have food and drink. This property has everything you need and more. They aim to please their guests and it shows. A big Mahalo Nui Loa to the wonderful staff at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for making our stay a memorable one.

This was a great place to stay for us. Conveniently located near the Waikiki beach as well as shops and restaurants. It was also affordably priced especially compared to some “beachfront” options that cost hundreds more but there right next door to each other. It has free breakfast if your on a budget but it’s not that tasty and didn’t have a lot of options. Pool was basic but no need to use the pool when you have a beautiful Hawaiian beach 5 minute walk away. Very good value would recommend for travelers who want a nice, convenient location at a good price in Waikiki area.

My husband & I vacationed in Honolulu for a short visit. We choose the Hyatt Place for the combination of location & price. It’s just a block off the beach. The room was very nice - clean & large. The complimentary breakfast was very good. We would stay here again.

The main reason I booked the Hyatt was because of the amazing and free breakfast because being a mother of 2 boys and a husband means that they are always hungry but this Hyatt is absolutely fantastic. The location is just a 5-minute walk to Waikiki beach, steps from an ABC Store and literally walking distance to everything including the Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium. There's also a bus stop right by the hotel for transport to farther areas. The customer service is excellent thanks to the staff and breakfast each day was amazing with local favorites like portugese sausage and even a Miso soup bar. The room was super clean, modern and roomy for a family of 4. It's extremely comfortable and we felt safe. They have a small pool and the fitness room has up to date equipment. We will definitely always stay at Hyatt Place each time we visit Honolulu. Travel tip: if you opt into their "Green" Initiative you receive a $10 credit a day for food and beverage at the hotel.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki, because of the price and location. We had a large room facing the ocean. The hotel is a block from beach and walking distance to most Waikiki restaurants and the International Marketplace. Being on the southern side of Waikiki, you are closer to Diamond Head and Hanauma Bay. If you have a car, the hotel's self parking lot is fairly small. Park in the Waikiki Banyan Lot (cash only), less than a block from the hotel to save money or find another option. Room was high quality, free standard Hyatt Place breakfast, beach gear available for loans, a low key hotel: great value for the price.

My family and I had a great stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Thanks to reservation manager Christopher Cadiz for helping us reserve an amazing room with a beautiful view. Thank you to Guan Hua Lin for a very pleasant check-in. Guan was friendly, professional and very helpful throughout our stay. The breakfast selection was very nice. We liked how you rotate the hot food choices daily. I do wish there's a way to keep the food area more clean though. I saw many guests wiping their nose and then touch the food serving spoons. Perhaps there could be more hand sanitizers and wet towels or a hand washing station for guests to clean their hands. We'll recommend your hotel to our family and friends.

Great location on the quieter end of the strip, near the park, zoo, acquarium and less crowded beach. Staff are incredibly friendly and accommodating. Very clean. Included breakfast was a great bonus. Glad we stayed here!!

I stayed in Hyatt Pace Waikiki and it was great, especially for a quick trip! My room was huge! It was clean and super convenient to the beach and shopping. The front desk staff was very accommodating and helpful too! I will definitely stay there again!

Air conditioning did not work in the room. After an hour of waiting for engineering we were granted a new room. Promotional breakfast was terrible. Cold eggs, rock hard pancakes and terrible coffee. You need a treasure map to find the laundry room hidden behind the fitness room. Staff is courteous and the bed was okay.

I have stayed here multie times for a month in total. Staff is amazing everytime. I am treated with respect and have enjoyed every room I have stayed in. The beds are amazingly comfortable and the double queen suite room is fantastic. If you are looking to stay in Waikiki I strongly suggest considering this hotel. I have stayed in 20 of the other hotels that cost a bit less and honestly it's not worth it.

I would like to thank Heidi for helping me with my booking she was friendly and helped me save on my stay by adding my AAA and informed me about world of Hyatt benefits. Next we would like to thank Nick the bar tender for also helping us save on our vacation and telling us about turo an app to rent cars a cheaper way. I loved this app because off them 2 we were able to save an average of $300! Yes amazing who doesn’t love to save right! Last I want to thank the entire Hyatt family for being so friendly and attentive to all our needs for accommodating us and allowing us to do a late check out and letting us use a hospitality room before our flight since our flight was at 1030pm it was really nice to be able to freshen up before our flight really meant a lot to us. Overall everyone was amazing I will definitely be returning to this location (Hyatt place in Waikiki) they all take pride in what they do the entire staff give a true meaning of Aloha to our visit and made use feel like family. A huge Mahalo from Mr & Mrs Llamas.

Pleasant, comfortable hotel within walking distance of the beach at the edge of Waikiki, with good breakfast for Hyatt members, Friendly bar tender and some variety in the food options for dinner or a snack. Like most hotels, the lighting beside the bed could be brighter.

Great location - 5 minutes to the beach; Very clean rooms with comfortable mattress and pillows. Quite outside - important for good night sleep. Most important part - very knowledgeable and friendly people, ready to help any moment! We will be back!

Loved this hotel! Very convenient location but not too uppity. The staff was fantastic - even Nick. If you’re looking for five star treatment this isn’t the place. If you’re looking for a nice, clean and comfortable place to stay then go!!

If you are looking for a place to stay in Waikiki, Hawaii. I recommend Hyatt Place!-Quick check in and out-5 mins walk to the beach-Convenient store next to the place- A lot of restaurants near by- room clean- Great Free!!! Full breakfast every morning including hot and cold breakfast. They serve scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, sausage, bacon, miso soup, rice, Kalua pork, fruits, cereals, breads, pancake, waffle, yogurt and more!!!So if you r looking to decent place with a good location and a lot of stuffs to offer. I recommend Hyatt place

Hotel was great! Perfect location,great service and the breakfast buffet was tasty. Example of the great service was Cliff. We had an early flight to catch so we had to check out bye 4:30 am. Cliff warmed up our breakfast, and checked us out fast and accurately so we can our catch our flight. Thank you for doing a great job and showing us the aloha spirit!

Fantastic breakfast outstanding Staff, small rooms, great location off the beach. Walked the beach and main street every day and this was the best location. Staff was helpful with checking in and check out.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is a great hotel located a stone's throw from the beach and the center of Waikiki. This makes this location an excellent choice for budget travelers as the price is reflective of it. It's only a block away from the Honolulu zoo and a few blocks away from the large mall area in the center of Waikiki. That's not what makes this location shine though.All the staff at this location is nothing but smiles, and not the sort that one comes to expect as the facade of the service industry. The people at this location are genuinely happy to be here, from the Aloha's to the Mahalo's, there is a sense of care behind them. At my arrival I was greeted by Heidi at the front desk who was as happy as they come. She took one look at my tired face(11 hours and a good amount of turbulence on the flight here) and quickly went to work finding my room, thanking me for my loyalty she promptly upgraded me to a high oceanfront room. In addition, she asked me about any celebrations I might be doing and when I told her it was our anniversary she offered us a small celebratory gift. She also provided us with water for our stay.The lobby was and open design with a contemporary feel, with a couple of nice decor elements. A lot of seating was available, and while I did not use the valet, they did appear to be quiet active.So off to our room in under ten minutes, we went. We had booked a standard city view room king, and as mentioned we were upgraded to a high oceanfront room. The room had a large king bed in the middle with a small sectioned off desk(where I'm typing up this review now), and a balcony with a nice view of the ocean. Now, unfortunately, through no fault of the hotel and the staff, that view was mostly obstructed by several large buildings. Still, I had no complaints due to the price paid and the unexpected upgrade. The bathroom is split into the sink area and the toilet/shower stall.The room came with a complimentary breakfast in the morning. The breakfast options were good, offering eggs/meat/waffle/potatoes on the hot side. Cereal/Oatmeal/Fruits/Yoghurt on the cold side. Coffee/Juices/Bread was standard fare. What stands apart is the freshness of the food served. The eggs were fluffy, instead of the usual steamed cakey consistency you get at other chains. The potato was local and the ham was not dry. Four words, fresh squeezed grapefruit juice!!! >.< But in a good way.The only cons that I will mention is that despite the beautiful lobby, parts of the hotel could use some updating. The carpet in our room was showing it's age, the balcony was a bit rough around the edges. The pool could use some touching up, it is quite stained in various parts but considering the hotel is a block away from the ocean. The noise dampening is a little light in the rooms as well. But an attentive staff and it's location to price ratio more than make up for any of these issues. I will definitely consider this location the next time I return to this area.Again, big shout out to Heidi at the front desk and the staff at this location. Thanks for a great stay.

Only stayed one night, but would definitely recommend. Customer service was excellent from check in, to beach chairs and towels, to check out. room was clean and spacious and location is great. Breakfast was pretty good, too!

What a nice property and only two blocks from the beach. The staff is excellent and always customer focused. An awesome breakfast buffet is available for just $15 dollars a room. You can’t beat that value anywhere in Waikiki.

The location was great for access to the beach and shopping areas..we walked everywhere! The room was nice and clean, loved the little balcony and the shower instead of a tub. It was SO nice to have the breakfast as they were so many choices, lots of coffee and it was run very efficiently!

When you go on a trip to where ever... the most important thing is were you stay....how close to all the shops, Restaurants , and of course transport....And most of all how clean it is, l found Hyatt Place to have all the above and much more, the staff could not do enough for you...the breakfast is very good ....A special call out to the concierge...Abbie who would listen to all my questions answer then, help me in any way shape or form and this is what a travelers need to be able to book every thing for you , it was surperb experience....and Abbie made it so easy thank you, this a a place l totally say you will not regret staying at the Hyatt Place.

Clean and comfortable rooms, 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Surrounded by restaurants, shops, etc but quiet at night. Nice breakfast buffet, friendly staff. We Would stay here again if we’re in the area.

This hotel rang the bell It was conveniently located near to the beach and great restaurants and shopping Clean, lovely lobby, very nice outdoor roof top breakfast area and very attentive staff. Conveniently located a short walk to the beach Our room was on the 14 th floor, ocean view and it was just perfect. Loved waking to our ocean view. Very clean and modern. Really top notch hotel !!!!

They Hyatt Place is located on the busy Paoakalani Avenue, just a few minutes walk to Waikiki beach. The hotel is conveniently located two blocks from a trolley stop, and right across the street from a bus stop where many tour buses pick up (including the bus to Kualoa Ranch and the Polynesian Cultural Center). The hotel is a bit dated, but the rooms are clean, and very big. We had a room on the 11th floor that featured two queen sized beds and a pull out couch. The room had a dresser/desk combo with three large drawers. There was also a full sized safe. Our room had a small balcony that featured a partial ocean view (though most of the view was of dingy buildings in the area). The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was a bit old but clean. The showerhead was very powerful, making it nearly impossible to shower without soaking the floor. The hotel had plentiful beach towels available at the front desk, and you also offered beach chairs for loan. There was an ABC store a block away (and several more ABC stores within a five minute walk) if you want to pick up some drinks or snacks for the room. The hotel includes breakfast. The breakfast was very good with some variety each day. Everyday they had scrambled eggs, delicious breakfast potatoes, and one kind of meat (Portuguese sausage, shoulder bacon, and bacon were the choices when we were there). They also had a fourth dish each day (waffles, pancakes, or corned beef hash when we were there). There were also several breads and pastries to choose from, plenty of fresh fruit, and even miso soup and white rice. Our only complaint about the buffet was that seating was a bit tight, but this may have been due to the fact that there were several school marching bands staying in the hotel at the them same time as us. The pool at the hotel was small and dingy. It was very uninviting, so we didn't go in the pool at all during our stay. Overall, we had a pleasant stay here, and would return if we go back to Waikiki.

The staff were excellent in the way we were welcomed and by giving us an immediate room upgrade. The room was clean and quiet (15th floor), but not much of a view. Good for families and convenient so a big thumbs up for this hotel.

Everything was as expected. My chronic back issues with overly soft beds were the only disappointment during our stay. And the long elevator wait times. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki! Mahalo!

Hyatt is a great place to stay. The breakfast was very good, and they changed the menu a little for the hot foods section during our stay there. The customer service was impeccable, and our stay was very smooth.

Hotel is older and rooms are smaller but that is all OK, it was a good price, food service was lacking, good deals on hotel arranged transportation to airport. Great Area, but busy. Probably good value for the money, discounting the lack of good food.Floor maids were Great!

The location is in between Diamondhead (10 minute drive), Downtown Oahu (5 minute walk), and Waikiki beach (3 minute walk).For World of Hyatt members, you get access to their fee breakfast spreads and I gotta tell you this is a huge money saver as well as being pretty dang delicious for what it is. While I definitely recommend hitting up some of the local joints (Yogur Story and Koko Head cafe) for breakfast at least once during your stay, this breakfast can really help stretch your budget, especially if you're traveling with a family!Parking is normally $12 but it fills up pretty quickly. The valet is $35/night and honestly, it's probably just worth it to do that since you won't have to worry about finding a spot and filling meters for your entire trip.Beds are comfortable, rooms are spacious, amenities are fine and the mountain view lanai has a really nice view of Diamond Head.The Hyatt Centric is more modern and a bit fancier, but lacks the amenities that the Hyatt Place (including breakfast), and the Hyatt Regency, while being way fancier, is not necessarily worth the price difference IMO. For all of your point grinders, the point difference is 16K per night which is a pretty significant and means you can book 4 days at the Hyatt Place compared to 2 days at the Centric or Regency.I highly recommend the Hyatt Place on your next visit to Oahu. Whether you're solo, with friends, or with your family, the location, the price, and the breakfast will allow you to enjoy more of the island without spending more to do so.

From the location of the hotel, the staff and food was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to any. When there was a problem the hotel went above and beyond to correct the problem. When we need anything the staff was always there to assist me any my family.David Brooks Stayed Feb 28 thru March 08.

I booked a three night stay using rewards recently, and have stayed at the "big brother" Hyatt down the street many times. I was super impressed with the Hyatt Place, so much so that this may be our new go-to place on our periodic Honolulu visits. The service was consistently and amazingly friendly, and the location is terrific. As a Globalist, I received a welcome message ahead of time, and an upgrade to a great room on arrival. We really enjoyed our stay, and are already working on plans to return. Thank you to Lisa at the front desk, Bryan P, the breakfast crew, and the underrecognized but vital housekeeping and bell staff who really make the place hum. You are all awesome!

We stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for a week long Vacation.We are a family of 5 and the room was good size for us.First of the location of the hotel is awesome.Everything you need is close by.The view from our room was wonderful enjoyed the Hawaiian sunset from our Balcony .The breakfast was sufficient,they had eggs,meats,breads,cereals,oatmeal,yogurt etc.The best part of breakfast was the breakfast carry out tray that was in our room,that just made our stay a little more comfortable especially with kids.The staff Is very friendly and willing to accommodate any request.Resort fee will cover beach towels and chairs which is convenient.Only con would be the elevator,only 2 elevators for 20 floors.Which took quite a while every time especially since we were on the top floor.Other than that it was a very relaxing stay and would definitely stay here if we return to Honolulu.

We went to Hawaii for our 20 yr anniversary, we had booked Hyatt Waikiki Place for a few nights with an Ocean View room . We had arrived early for checkin at the hotel , the room was ready and they did not charge anything extra so that was a bonus. We went up into our room and it was bloody awesome as we can see the beach clearly and it was worth the money what we paid for. Everything about this hotel was spot on and we would def come back to it again. Excellent

The hotel is beautiful just not the location one would hope for when visiting Hawaii. Staff was super friendly and everything about the hotel was really top notch just wish it has been on the beach. other than that it was great

Very nice place to stay; only minor complaint is you wait awhile for an elevator. Loved the location as it was such a quick walk to the beach, lots of shops and restaurants nearby and our tours picked us up right across the street.

Close to the beach and to tons of stores and other hotels. The breakfast buffet was pretty good and saved us tons of money. The staff were supper sweet and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

A good start with the amazing Annabelle on the registry desk.Early room access and easy registration.Room upgrade but average only.Small but clean.Good view of the parking lot.Breakfast basic and incredibly busy.Bar good with Kai interactive and helpful. Location good with one block only to the beach.All in all pretty average except for its staff.

The 2 best things about this hotel is the staff and location to the beach and restaurants. Staff was always pleasant and accommodating when possible. The 2 worse things about this hotel was the smell and the food. Our room and hallway smelled musty/mildewy, much like clothes that sat in the washer for too Long. No matter how long we left the bathroom window open or the balcony door it never went away and unfortunately my migraines are triggered by strong smells. So I suffered from migraines almost my entire trip. I thought it was just our room, however, I asked multiple guests who stayed on the same floor and they had the same experience. You could also smell it throughout the hallways. Also, I've stayed in several Hyatt place hotels and this hotel had the worst food of them all. The best thing about breakfast was the fresh fruit. Most Hyatt place hotels offer breakfast sandwiches that are usually pretty good but this location did not. Even the oatmeal was uneatable. It was always watery.

Amazing place. Can't recommend this hotel enough. Breakfast is superb, room was always perfectly clean, personnel is super kind and helpful, offers a hospitality room to shower before taking the plane back.

Our stay was so fun we love this location super close to wakiki beach and the mall down the street! The staff is very friendly and I was very impressed with how clean they kept it all the time wow! We will be back!

Love this hotel and location. It also provides breakfast which is really convenience for customers.Close to beach and you can walk to central honolulu within minutes. Everything is great. Friday night you can watch firework from beach.

I come to Oahu several times a year and even though i am a Hilton Diamond member I choose the Hyatt Place Waikiki for my stays. The staff is first class, the overall value is one of the best in the islands. It is not a resort style hotel but the attraction is the island not the room. The rooms are super clean and the deluxe ocean view rooms are extremely comfortable. The location is right in the heart of Waikiki and its is a half block from the Waikiki Beach.
