I highly recommend this property.

Location was excellent, staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was clean with an awesome view! The included buffet breakfast had a nice selection of breakfast food and drinks. The coffee was tasty!

I stayed here for 8 nights, great location, minutes from the beach, the hotel concierge helped us plan our trip. Cliff at the helpdesk provided us with exceptional services, he is didicated to make the hotel customers happy, answered all of the questions we had about parking and Hawaii!We interacted with the hotel manager, very understanding and cooperative! Loved our stay here.

I loved staying in Hyatt place. Cliff provided me and my friends with the best service. He was polite and helpful from the minute we checked in till we checked out. Would recommend staying in Hyatt place to everyone.

Asked front desk for my room to be cleaned because we slept in and we were going out for the day. We removed the come back later door card and placed the “please change the sheets” for the bed. Came back 9:45pm found the room not cleaned and then was told it would take 30 min for the room to be cleaned so didn’t get back to the room until 10:30pm. Hotel staff was not helpful. Was promised 12,000 points for the inconvenience but only got 5,000 points and valet parking comped they only had 1 of 2 day valet parking comped.

From the moment we booked the reservation we felt well taken care of and looked after! We are very grateful that we were able to keep our room also after extending our stay twice ! Thanks to exemplary front desk service from Heidi, Angelina, and Dino they made it feel like home; we would also like to thank Geraldine our room cleaner for doing tremendous job and hard work and the breakfast attendants are all so cheerful and respectful ; husband and I plan to be back as often as possible, thank you all for your great contributions ! 5 stars all the way from us ; would give more if we could !

The hotel is located near the beach; great location away from the bustle of Waikiki. Yet, it is easy to walk to attractions on the main thoroughfare. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean. The price is very reasonable.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Breakfast included every morning. We also recieved a bottle of water each day. The hotel was close to Kuhio Beach and Waikiki Beach. The Bus bustop (public transit $2.75) was across the street and the stop for the Pink Line ($2) was down the street. There were also 2 food trucks on the side street. The Argentenian food was outstanding. It was also useful to have convenience stores very close by as well as restaurants, Starbucks, and other shopping. The room was expertly serviced each day. All staff members were welcoming and kind. The property was very clean and public seating was comfy. Room 1119 had an excellent ocean view.

Towards the end of Waikiki, about a block and a half back from beach. You are able to walk to lots of restaurants and shops within a fifteen minute span.Nice open air lobby. Good breakfast located on the third floor by the pool.

Good location, clean spacious room, enjoyed the breakfast with rice and miso soup. Will use it again. Satisfactory stay... Only 5-10minute from the beach and the view from the room was beautiful as well

The staff is great, the hotel is in great need of renovation beside paint. The furniture is suffering from age and use, you find no light switches to control lights and lack of wall plugs. Our first room was so noisy from the ajoining apartment building and the view of the porch was certainly not what I would consier attractive. Hyatt appears to be more concerned about keeping the roomsfilled rather than updated. I can say, their staff is outstanding though, they try their best to make up for what the corporation lacks. Would I stay here again, probably not. the cheapskates at coprate won't even credit me for my stay because we didn't book directly through them. They got paid either way and got paid for parking too, plus whatever else we spent with them. I don't consider them a value for the dollar. I left another hotel in Hawaii for the refusal to update and becoming a dump. The Hyatt Place Waikiki is headed in that direction, no matter what others are raving about them!

Whatever the need the front desk was courteous helpful with a smile. Maid service was quick and efficient. Check in quick friendly. Breakfast was great clean with many selection to choose from. Fresh fruit

The Hyatt Place is a lovely hotel with charming features and an amazing staff! Also, members get a lovely free breakfast! The rooms are spacious and the ocean views are divine, anything you need is within reach! Starbucks across the road, ABC store next door, a pool and gym all included, I really enjoyed my stay!I will return to this hotel next time in Hawaii!

Check in was smooth and quick. Staff was attentive and accommodating. Made my vacation so much better. Would come back again. Hyatt values and rewards their cutomers’ loyalty and they definitely got mine. Home away from home!

Came for vacation and business. Hotel staff were friendly and professional. Clean and comfortable rooms, good breakfast. Expedia excursion I booked was a good value and we got to see fish, spinner porpoises and whales.

Hotel is newly renovated, location is great ( less than 2 mins walk) from the beach. Breakfast included is obove our expectation. The pool area is nice too (roof of 3rd floor). Room for 6 persons are very large. Small fridge in the unit is usefull.

Hyatt Place Waikiki is a great place. The GM and staff is awesome. We stayed in Room 2041, house keeper Lei was awesome. She is a very hard worker and does her job plus more. Our room was very clean. She takes pride in her job, will be back and will request Lei

I’m finally getting around to writing my reviews after being back home for a month now. We LOVED our stay at HP Waikiki Beach and would recommend this hotel to anyone and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again ourselves. We arrived very late at night after a couple of long flights and valet and front desk staff greeted us very warmly and quickly got us into our room for a much needed rest. We were also welcomed as World of Hyatt members and were glad to receive our tote bag and a couple bottles of water since I had forgotten to pack a tote bag for trips to the beach! The room we had was lovely, clean, and had a great partial view of Diamond Head. We very much enjoyed having a fridge for our drinks and lovely balcony that we got a lot of use out of every day. We were drawn to this hotel for a couple of reasons, and one of the main reasons was the included breakfast for WoH members - well they did not disappoint! This breakfast each morning was incredibly impressive for an included hotel breakfast and the staff was so warm and welcoming each morning. We were blown away with the offerings each morning and the fact that some things were different each day, while some were the same. We had monkey bread on our very first morning and were hoping all week to see it again before we left...luckily our very last morning we were able to enjoy it again. ;) Lots of great choices on any given day including: eggs, potatoes, shoulder bacon (yum), sausages, pancakes, waffles, yogurt, cereal (hot and cold), fresh fruit, banana yogurt bread, coffee/tea, and juice. Awesome! We looked forward to visiting the breakfast area to start our day each morning. Location was great. Off the beach, but only a few minutes walk and was no problem day or evening. Felt safe every time. Close to ABC store for incidentals or beverages, etc (although as you will quickly discover, just about everyone in Waikiki is “close to an ABC store”) ;)There were a few “cons” to our visit as well, but nothing so serious that could not be fixed (hopefully) for the future and would keep us from recommending or staying again...1) The WiFi in the room was very poor and sometimes non-existent. It seemed to work fairly good down in the lobby/bar area but that is inconvenient for us and I would rather be able to check email/twitter, research our excursions for the following day, or communicate with our family from the comfort of our room. 2) The elevators to the Diamond Head rooms were pretty poor and most of the time during our week-long stay that tower was serviced by 1/3 elevators. Sometimes the 3rd elevator would be working (but rare) and the middle elevator never operated once (that we saw) during our entire stay. This made traveling to and from your room extremely slow and painful and made for some very crowded elevator rides at certain times/days. It also seemed that there was not an exclusive staff elevator which also seemed to cause congestion and delays - not only for guests - but also for staff trying to do their job. 3) The pillows were terrible. Period. Far too flat and ruined what was otherwise a fairly comfortable bed. 4) Front desk staff should be made better aware of the partnership with MGM MLife program as the person checking us in was unaware of why I was presenting my MLife card and knew nothing of this option to earn MGM tier points and I had to revisit the front desk the following day and although I was assured at that time my number would be added to the reservation, I was not 100% confident with this fellow either. Since getting home I have inquired repeatedly on the status of this points credit and although World of Hyatt has finally confirmed the transfer has been made, I am still struggling to get confirmation of the same from MLife. I feel if this was all entered from the start (as it should have been) I wouldn’t have had to follow up and make sure the points went to the correct loyalty program. In closing the pros most definitely still outweigh the cons and we would highly recommend giving this place a shot to impress you. We did receive a lovely email message back from the front office manager Eian Kim after filling out the hotel’s emailed survey with the same suggestions after our stay. It is nice to know they are read and appreciated as I think this great hotel could be even better if some of these things were addressed.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was a great location, just two blocks from the beach and close to restaurants and walking paths. The hotel was clean and the employees were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was free and very good with several choices,

The hotel is in an excellent location only a short walk to the beach. Be sure to note the extra parking and hotel fees. The staff was very accommodating. The breakfast was very minimal and not what was expected.

Check was a breeze.  ROOM: Water view was great. Room was a lot smaller than normal hotels. Nowhere to put luggage. Can put it under the bed and need the closet for clothes since you only get three drawers. Most people stay a while when visiting hawaii so bring a lot of clothes. Balcony was so small, its literally just a bit larger than the actual chair on it. Way smaller than a cruise balcony. I would say our hotel room was about the same size a balcony room on a cruise. Hotel: Need your key to use elevator and go to rooms and floors. Great security feature.BreakfastLocation: Literally just a block aways from the beach. Not what you think either. I was thinking it was around busy streets and traffic..no. When you walk it, you think it’s right next to it.

We had a great stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Room was clean and comfortable, and staff was excellent. The breakfast buffet was better than expected with a large assortment including bacon and sausage.

overall, all is ok, but...I've had to call housekeeping four times in two days...the room is never cleaneduntil I make a fuss...they don't show up even when a time is given when they are supposed to show.I've called, talked to the front desk and have been promised someone is coming and the director ofhousekeeping seems to continually ignore our requests. At nearly $300/night, this is more than inconvenient, it is detrimental to our ability to enjoy our time...never again...

Good breakfast small but nice rooms in one tower. much larger rooms in the other tower. close to the park ,canal and beach.Staff friendly and professional.could use a public or in room microwave,allowed to use one at the bar.

We Loved our Stay here, right near a lot to walk to and enjoy, although would recommend renting a car for a day or two to explore the North Shore, like we did! After a few days in Honolulu , you need to explore! Dino Besic was Super Sweet, and extremely accommodating, All of the Front Desk staff was Fantastic and Helpful. They have Beach chairs and towels to use and it felt like home with more luxury and none of the work! Our Housekeeper for 2040 Room was Fabulous, So Friendly , Helpful, and really made us feel so at Home! Breakfast was delicious , healthy, and lots of different choices on different days, kept clean and filled and fresh, staff again went above and beyond! Thanks Hyatt Place!!Pool is not that great, but luckily you are at the beach in about a five minute walk!

Had a pleasant stay at the Hyatt. Booked thru orbitz and hotel worked with me when my flight was cancelled due to weather on east coast. Hotel manager texted me about the room and went above and beyond to ensure it was clean and comfortable. I’d definitely stay there again - it’s quiet, no noise from trash truck at 6am etc like other hotels I’ve stayed at in Waikiki. The breakfast was good, especially their breakfast ham.

Anabelle is absolutely fantastic. Thank you for everything. You really made us feel most welcome. We highly recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki to all our family and friends. Thank you so much. You went over and beyond.

This is my second visit to the Hyatt Place in Honolulu and I have always been impressed by the staff. This time I had a situation with my Hyatt points and Catherine T., with the help of Eian, straightened it all out for me in less than 5 minutes. Catherine was polite, helpful and very tuned in to my issue. She couldn’t have been more helpful. It’s a great place to stay in Honolulu !!!

The Hyatt Place staff was all very friendly and accommodating. In particular, one of the managers, Ihab, was incredibly kind and helpful to me and the people I was staying with. Not only was the staff fantastic, but the hotel itself is very nice and super clean. I had a beautiful room with an amazing view and the location is great too. Walking distance from one of the most beginner friendly waves in the world and lots of good places to eat close by too. Would definitely stay there again and would recommend to all my friends. Thank You Hyatt place staff for making my trip to Hawaii amazing, memorable, and comfortable. (also the complimentary breakfast was really delicious!)

Staying at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki just makes everything easy. Our family of four just stayed for the second time and was reminded quickly of why we wanted to come back: great customer service, recently renovated rooms, incredibly convenient location to everything in Waikiki, and an awesome FREE buffet breakfast which makes the mornings begin without struggle. We walked to the beach at Canoes daily and also to the Zoo and restaurants each night for dinner. Oh yeah, the ABC store right next door is a huge bonus, too!

This hotel is one of the properties that tries to get around the waived “resort fees” for Globalists by charging a “destination fee” of $15/day. The destination fee includes a free water per day and a $10 f&b credit. I guess it’s not bad if you want to grab Starbucks downstairs by the lobby. Booked a regular room, was upgraded to a suite.The free breakfast is definitely better than the ones offered at Hyatt place in the mainland. Has both American and Asian food choices.Location is roughly two blocks from Waikiki beach, there’s an ABC store around the corner. Only complaint is they have the world’s slowest elevators

Hotel and valet staff were awesome. Room was clean and perfect for the family. Good breakfast buffet. Location is perfect. Close to beach , shops and Diamond Head Need a microwave in room would be useful.

Great location and great service. Highly recommended! Located just one block from the beach and the property is also near a number of great restaurants. The zoo and the aquarium are also just around the corner.
user_name:
David Russell R
Spring, United States

review_body: We took our 5 and 8 yo sons mid Feb 2019. Had an amazing experience at this property. The rooms were clean, staff was incredibly friendly. They lent us beach towels, beach chairs, sand toys. Exchanged beach towels at the front desk. The building is older (most are there) but clean and well appointed with updated furniture etc. Not the fanciest place we have stayed but 100% met our needs. SO CLOSE to the beach. Carrying all our stuff with our tired 5yo was no prob back and forth from the beach was no problem. Our tripAdvisor concierge in the hotel lobby, Abbie was so friendly and helpful, full of knowledge about the island and helped us plan our excursions and rent our car to go to the North Shore, she even helped us sort out our shuttle back to the airport. Breakfast was well worth it, hubby is GF and lots for him, boys happy with offerings as well. Pool is small but we didn't miss it, won't need it being so close to the beach. Also did laundry, and used the gym which has great cardio machines, although no upright bike. Would not hesitate to stay here again!

My friend and I enjoyed our stay very much especially with the great and friendly staff. Much Mahalos to Clifford at front desk for providing the exceptional service! We will both definitely come back again and recommend friends and family to stay here as well!

Wonderful staff, very clean, with an excellent breakfast. The location was perfect, and our Ocean / Mountain view was spectacular. Nothing but positives to say about the experience and group working the week we were on vactaion here.

I am always excited to stay in Hyatt’s. This one was no different and lived up to the companies legacy. The rooms were very clean. I had great conversation with the staff, and they were very resourceful in helping me find local restaurant to enjoy.

I had to change rooms because I had an allergic reaction to the first room. Maybe mole, pet hair or dirt??? There were 3 false alarm fire drills the first at bed time. The hallway smelled. The patio breakfast tables are full of dirty dishes from the previous guest.

Great place blocks from beach. Full breakfast Pool not heated. Big room. Friendly staff. Rent bikes down the block at today Biki station to ride all over Waikiki, such as Diamondhead and the parks on the other end of Waikiki.

This hotel is just minutes from Waikiki beach as well as lots of shopping areas and restaurants. We were greeted with delicious smells from the Dominos pizza located right inside the hotel when we arrived. We did not eat there, but it was great to have that option right on-site.The breakfast was very good, complete with Hawaiin pineapple and juices. We didn't spend much time at the hotel as there was so much we wanted to do in Waikiki, but the staff was friendly and helpful and our room was clean and welcoming.No complaints!

Great rooms. Comfy beds, big tv, nice lanai, great bathroom and shower. Friendly and accommodating staff! Excellent free breakfast! Location is 1.5 blocks from the beach and shopping and great restaurants! Loved our visit here!

The location is good. A short walk to Waikiki Beach. Resort fees and parking are expensive. While we were there they were still doing a free breakfast but sign indicated they would not continue for all guests. Room was very small. Too small for two people. I was there for business and was very disappointed when I returned after a 10 hr day to find my room hadn’t been cleaned. This was my second stay at this hotel. The first was much better. I won’t be back.

Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Out room was great and nicer than we anticipated. Would definitely stay here again.Get the breakfast package, its worth it and delicious!Location was very good as well. 3-4 min walk to the beach.We really enjoyed the hotel and it has a Starbucks and Domino's inside!

The hotel is in a great part of Waikiki. It is close to beaches, restaurants and many stores. the breakfast is very good and the service was fine also. The elevators are slow for so many rooms but very secure for ones safety.

Booked this hotel based on the decent reviews I read about and that it offers breakfast (although only for Hyatt World customers - and only for those who’ve held membership for 1+years, as informed at check-in). The rooms are spacious, enough for 2 queens and a double-pull out bed. Enough room to still not feel crowded when the outdoor furniture was brought in to prepare for stormy weather. The shower/toilet area is quite tight, but the sink is outside the door, which lets other members of your party get ready at the same time. There’s a balcony with a couple of chairs & table. Cleaning service is efficient and good - requested and received extra toiletries. There is also a list at the front desk of items you can have/borrow/buy. No kettle in the room but I was able to borrow one. Refilled my water bottle at the gym. Got a local paper everyday from the lobby. On the 8th level, facing the hills, we don’t hear too much. And while there’s other families on our floor we don’t hear them either. The location, while pretty much at the end of the beach strip on the Diamond Head side, is in a great location. Just 2 blocks from the beach where there’s a retaining wall so that the water is gentle for kids. We borrowed hotel towels, chairs and kids toys from the front desk. It’s also 1 block away from the Zoo - we bought a membership so we could visit multiple times and go in & out as we pleased. Many great meal selections around, whether it’s açai bowls & coffee from Tucker & Bevvy across from the zoo, Morimoto’s Asia for their Happy Hour specials, and food trucks/hole-in-the-walls along Kuhio. And more food halls with International Marketplace & Waikiki Yokocho a little further down. Breakfast is great, for being included. Some of the items are swapped in/out on different days. Usually there’s scrambled eggs, a protein (sausage/bacon/ham), potatoes, waffles, toast station, hot oatmeal station, cold cereal station, fresh fruit, Asian foods (rice, miso soup, pickles, Kim chi, hard boiled eggs), juice. It is served in an outdoor setting, which is nice to eat al fresco, just shoo away the birds. If you don’t like that, a smaller variation of breakfast is served in the lobby. And there’s a tray in your room so you can take what your want and head back. One day there was very high wind so breakfast was served in the conference room - not quite the same laid back atmosphere as the open air setting!

Overall, we had a great experience. The room was nice and clean. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive. We also had a great view of the ocean, even though it wasn't ocean front. I would definitely come back. Thanks!

Great place, Perfect location, just a block away from the Waikiki beach. Amazing customer service. Rooms are very big and specios, we stayed in King room with sofa bed and it was big enuff for 3 of us to relaxes and for our daughter to roam around. Will definitely go back.

We had a great experience at this location. Hotel was clean, staff were very friendly and helpful. Only two blocks away from the beach, within walking to convenience stores,restaurants and shopping.Transportation such as buses and trolleys are also within a block or two. I would definitely stay here again. Aloha!

We spent two night here last month and enjoyed the hotel and especially the friendliness of the front desk staff. We were provided a sack breakfast when we got up early for a tour. They were very helpful regarding places to see and restaurants to enjoy. It was an easy 3 block walk from the hotel to Waikiki beach.

Easy check in/out process; nice rooms; small pool but at least they had one; daiily credit of $5 toward food onsite; just did not like two fire alarms going off--one at night and one a 6 am. Close to lots of shopping and food.

Front desk is clueless and shower was filthy. Front desk spent 45 minutes telling my I cancelled my reservation, when I had not. Finally I asked to call reservations department who instantly saw my active reservation. Front desk then spent 15 minutes demanding paperwork from reservation department be faxed before issuing me a key at 11:30 pm at night.

I arrived late and was beat! But when I walked in, it was all smiles and a warm “welcome back Mr. Terrell!” I felt better right away! My room was ready and the Ocean View was a pleasant surprise, even at that time of night! The free breakfast the next morning was a great way to start off the day, though it was crowded! But the staff was prepared for that so there was never a wait for food or a place to sit! Even when it rained a few times, they were prepared for it by having breakfast also available in the first floor lobby area near the bar! This is the place to stay when you come to Waikiki in Hawai’i!! They leave no stone unturned to take care of your every need and it doesn’t cost you a fortune to stay in a great hotel!!

Great service! I would like to give a special thanks to Cliff Rivera. He was very nice and willing to help me out, in making sure my needs were met. Would recommend to my friends and family. 5 out of 5.

This is a standard Hyatt Place property - our room (2 queen with pullout couch) was very spacious but the bathroom was laughably small. You literally had to enter the bathroom completely before you were able to shut the door or sit on the toilet. The room has zero sound proofing - the sound of our neighbor entering their room (at a totally reasonable volume) sounded like they were coming into our room. The sliding glass door to the balcony let the same amount of sound through closed as it did open - there's a reason they provide you ear plugs in the room.

Great location and accommodations. Walking distance to everything you need. Helpful, friendly staff with great advice and suggestions for firstimers to Waikiki as we were. We will definitely recommend Hyatt Place to anyone.

Torri gave excellent service , upgrade and early checkinGreat check inGreat room, comfortable bed, great viewCheck out was also great Ordered taxi with only a short wait time Lovely staff, clean and comfortable

Our stay was wonderful. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Always smiling. Room and bed were comfortable. Breakfast was included and delicious with quite a variety. Balcony however was small with a railing at eyesight when sitting. Would definitely stay here again!!

My husband and I are stayed here during our PSC military move to Hawaii. They have been SO accommodating, even with our dog. I can’t say enough great things about the staff and the amenities, location, and cleanliness of this hotel!

I spent several days at this hotel last week. It is right in the middle of the Waikiki beach area. Room was comfortable and the price was reasonable. Tori, Heidi and other staff members were helpful and friendly. Bus 19 stops right across the street and the fare to the airport was $2.19. The pink line trolley also stops nearby.

It was all like we expected, breakfast can be a little bit more, and was overcrowded in some times but it was okay. It’s also not far away from the beach, it was actually 5 min of walking. Beach towels and a chair u can get on reception every day

We stayed for 4 nights at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for our 30th Wedding Anniversary and had a wonderful time. Annabelle in the front desk helped us in many occasions, always with a smile and aloha spirit! We enjoyed our ocean view room and got lucky to get a self parking space (limited). We will go back again.

Hyatt Place was so convinently located down from the beach, right near all transport and tour pick up bus stops. The hotel was in walking distance to the main drag of Waikiki and all the shopping and restuarants that Waikiki had to offer. The breakfast buffet was great making an easy start to our days. Rooms were clean and spacious. Staff were helpfully and friendly and helped in all we needed. Would recommend Hyatt Place, definitely a great place to stay in Waikiki.

o In general the hotel was average; however, I am giving it a below average score because it was below average for the Hyatt brand, even the Hyatt Place brand. As a World of Hyatt member and card holder, most of my travels leave me staying in Hyatts and this one was by far the worst and caused me to lose trust in the only brand name I felt I could consistently trust before. While the hotel room was generally clean it was quite run down. Several walls has chipped paint, the shower door was difficult to slide shut, and the shower drain was very slow to drain. The balcony directly overlooked another balcony that looked quite drab and offered no privacy. Overall we felt our room was a bit sad and didn’t want to spend any more time than we had to in there. The elevators in the building were very slow too. I live in a 70 story apartment building and waited longer for elevators in this 15 story hotel than I do at home. The hotel also charges a hefty resort fee and I cannot for the life of me figure out what that is covering. Parking is still extra (and valet only). The pool is very small and in no way a resort-style pool. Breakfast is included only for World of Hyatt members, so while that was nice I feel I pay for that separate from my resort fee. When I think of a resort I think of a hotel that in itself is a vacation experience, but this hotel was merely a bed for us. It wasn’t all bad though, I did feel our room was clean (a credit to the housekeeping staff) and the breakfast was better than I expected. These positives were not enough though, so I would say with all the choices in Waikiki stay elsewhere.

Had a great time. Staff very courteous and friendly. Rooms clean and breakfast was excellent. Hotel situated in a great area of town that was within walking distance to shopping, beach access, the Zoo and the Aquarium.

What can I tell you except that Hyatt Place was absolutely incredible !Manager Brian and Supervisor Dino went above and beyond the call of duty and exceeded all of our expectations.Very big room which was perfect for my family.Quiet location. ( slept great every night )Very close to beach.Breakfast was out of this world every morning. ( pigeons were never present and if they were it was never an issue )Elevators were fast.All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. ( sign of great management )Would stay again in a heart beat !

What an amazing stay!! The staff and the experience at the hotel was amazing!! Breakfast was excellent with less options but good , room was very spacy and enjoyed staying here. Housekeeping was excellent had two Bilma and Jovelita, they did the excellent job always helpful and beautiful smile everyday. Comes to the bar Cliff was the best always helped to choose my cocktails and with a happy face even though I’m struggling what to drink he will choose for me if needed. Would not recommend Nick worse guy ever never has a smile always with he’s grumpy face . Bryan was awesome dealt very well with my bookings I got what I booked for , Thanks Bryan

Excellent hotel with great location! Reasonably priced with breakfast included. Spent four weeks at this hotel so got to meet most of the staff. Welcoming front desk folks including Catherine, Tori, Guam, Dala and Cliff. Thank you for bar/restaurant recommendations. Special thanks to Kim for extending my reservation during a very busy week. Housekeeping was excellent - thank you Julie! All of you made my stay more interesting and enjoyable. Would definetely recommend this hotel.

I booked this hotel because I have had good experiences with Hyatt in the past.I wanted a spacious room, mini fridge, no resort fees and free breakfast for all. Breakfast was sufficient, food items were varied during my stay (bacon, sausage, pork, ham, etc). Room had large sofa bed. Beds were comfortable, room was clean.All the staff was great, from Check in to breakfast, valet. Housekeeping was great, left the room spotless everyday.My room had a balcony on a high floor facing diamond head, I enjoyed the sunrises.The hotel is only 2 short blocks from the beach. You can get beach towels at the front desk. Wifi was included, fast and reliable. The pool is tiny, cold and in the shade. But why need a pool when the ocean is so much better.An abc stores is located next door where you can find almost anything. The lobby of the hotel has a Domino's pizza.Overall we had a great stay and enjoyed the hotel.

My family and I booked two rooms for a 3 nights before heading to the other side of the island. The location is great as we were able to walk to the beach and the numerous stores and restaurants nearby. The fancy International Market Mall was a good walk to get to and there is a lot to see, eat and BUY. Ala Moana Mall is a bit far to walk to but a short car ride away. The hotel provides complimentary breakfast. It gets very crowded as a lot of the guests are families. Lots of kids as this is a very family friendly hotel. The pool is adjacent to the breakfast area and the small gym is situated in the area as well.As for theroom, it is typical Hyatt Place style but it seemed smaller st this location. The bathroom is very small. The shower kept clogging up, perhaps due to a slow drain. The room felt stuffy, so we kept the a/c on running even when we left the room. It's a simple hotel with basic amenities if you dont want to spend much.

We could’ve stayed at either Hyatt place or Hyatt regency but we chose place because we didn’t want to pay the $40+ daily resort fee and didn’t mind walking the whopping two blocks to the beach. The hotel was wonderful, the staff was nice and the breakfast was delicious. The room was clean and fresh every day and the staff even if bombarded with people were nothing but friendly and professional

Enjoyed all the staff at Hyatt. They were constantly greeting us everytime we saw them and asked how we were enjoying our stay. Leonida, our housekeeper always cleaned our room first thing in the morning and left us extra coffee when we asked. First few days one of the elevators wasnt working which caused line ups and waits. However they did get it fixed which sped up lift time. Rooms very quiet and in great location. Enjoyed buffet breakfast. Dishes always topped up and nice variety.

I stayed here when it first opened and had the highest Hyatt status from a lot of business travel. Always stayed in GREAT Hyatt Places during that time. Had a wonderful room on the top floor here - huge - bidet - lovely! This trip, no status, prepaid, and with a 17 month old in tow. We wound up in 1121, which is a TINY room with 2 double beds that consume the room. It had a wraparound balcony that was the only nice thing about the room. We barely fit our stroller, crib, and luggage in. I wish the check-in staff put us in a better room than the end of the hall too! When we first opened the fridge, it stunk so bad - it was turned off and there was someone else's food in there! The room and hotel definitely showed wear and tear. We both agreed we would not be coming back. Also, no easy access for the breakfast area with a stroller. We had to use the elevator in the kitchen. So glad when we finally left after three nights for our resort hotel on the big island. Probably should have refused the room at the start but we got in after a SEVEN hour delay at the airport and a 3 hr time zone difference. Disappointing b/c it's in a good location in Waikiki.

Great staff, room was big. Buffet breakfast was a plus. Water pressure was great in shower, which you usually don’t get from hotels. Definitely will stay here again. Great value for the money and the location was great for our needs.

I have been staying in this particular Hyatt place for every of my visit to Waikiki . The hotel is well kept , clean and the staffs are the best . Friendly , helpful, attentive and amazing . They make you feel like at home . It may not be as fancy resort like the Hyatt regency but locations is just a block from the beach . Room are quiet , breakfast is great .Overall great hotel .

We checked in on January 20th, left on the 27th. We had flight delays and cancellations so we were behind getting to our original check in day. At one point we weren’t sure if this trip was even going to happen But Haley in reservations was wonderful!! She worked with us and shifted our stay, because she was so helpful we actually extended our trip an extra day. Upon arriving to our room, we found a bottle of wine and a note from her. What a lovely touch. The Hyatt has the best location, we walked to the beach, zoo, shopping, dinner and even walked all the way to Diamond Head. Our room was clean, housekeeping serviced on the days we needed. We stayed in room 1119. The one woman we saw almost everyday of our stay always greeted us, asked us what we needed and was super nice. On the days of service, our room was spotless. We went to the bar and did happy hour a few times and we found the drinks to be very good, our bartenders were very knowledgeable and gave us many suggestions of places to see. We took their advice and wasn’t disappointed at all. We loved sitting out on our little deck and enjoying the sunset. Overall the experience was wonderful. We will return and stay here again. We are already planning it !!

My wife a I decided to plan a trip to Hawaii to celebrate our 25th anniversary. Having come to Hawaii for our honeymoon, we wanted to return to make new memories. We chose the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel and was glad we did. The front desk staff, room staff and valet parking staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable, and you might say it was perfect! Located on the 19th floor allowed for great ocean views. The free breakfast was always fresh and had a good variety of choices. Hopefully, it will not be another 25 years before returning and we know what hotel we will be choosing.

Spent 2 nights here after a work trip. Guan at the front desk went above and beyond to get me an overview room. So appreciated after spending 4 nights at a lackluster Airbnb in downtown. Nick at the bar downstairs is great and so helpful for recommendations. Room was clean and quiet. Breakfast was plenty and nice to be included as meals can get pricey in Waikiki. Would definitely stay here again. View from room 1205.

Ended up here since condos seemed about same price / night and many hotels in this area had just two full beds (we needed two queens for 4 of us). Nice, updated, pretty spacious rooms. Just a couple blocks off Waikiki. An easy walk. Valet parking only but that’s the norm on Oahu. Destination fee gets you $5 at the bar each day.

Location was at one end of the Waikiki strip close to the park just minutes from the beach. We were only on the 6th floor yet could see a bit of an ocean view. Restaurants and amenities nearby including an ABC Store. I'd recommend this hotel at this price point. BReakfast was very good selection and tasty. Limited parking, be prepared to pay $25-35 a day.

Hotel staff was friendly and location was great for its price a 2 min walk to the end of Waikiki beach, and just far enough from all the bustle. Problem was that the hotel is in a bit of need of update. Decor, walls, furniture etc seem a bit old. Only big negative was that the hallway smelled a bit mouldy. Overall good experience for the price.

My husband and I had a lovely 3 day stay here. The hotel is just 2 blocks from the beach and fortunately not in the very center of crowded Waikiki. The customer service is outstanding and breakfast for Hyatt members is lovely. Only problem we had was that first room we were assigned was on floor 11 on a corner facing tthe ocean and was in a wind tunnel! Sounded like we were in the midst of a hurricane! But the wonderful staff, Heidi to be precise, right away transferred us to another ocean-facing room, which was fine. She also arranged for snack bags for me and my husband at 5:30am on the day we checked out since breakfast was not yet available. All the staff were fantastic! We loved the location and the room was very nice too. Be sure to ask for a ocean view room. Definitely recommend this hotel!

Beautiful hotel with access to beach. Only a block from beach. Very comfy beds. I highly recommend the Hyatt place. It’s in the middle of everything, ocean, restaurants, night life, convenient stores, etc....

The best thing here was the staff who were all very nice and breakfast which was great. Food was really good, well stocked and a nice variety. Room was okay but the carpet had a big wet spot and felt yucky. Not so bad that it was worth the hassle of complaining and changing rooms but enough that I wore socks in the room to keep my feet clean. The room rate was competitive but once the Destination fees and parking fees were added in it was on the expensive side.

I booked two rooms for my father's 60th birthday trip to Oahu. We spent our last night here, but Clifford went above and beyond to make sure our accommodations were excellent. My father was very happy with his room. Thank you, Clifford!

Absolutely loved our stay here. Clean, quite & comfortable. Our scheduled tour bus picked us up right across the street. Hotel is in walking distance of all that is Waikiki. Fabulous amenities. Loved the open air lobby!

Checked in early for one night in Waikiki on the way from Sydney to LA. Hyatt Place was a perfect stop with comfort, cleanliness, friendliness and close to Waikiki. I would stay again next time in Honolulu.

I just have to say this hotel is amazing. For as many people that come & go the entrance is always clean and the hotel employees are AMAZING. They greet you always ask if you are doing okay, ask if you need anything. I just want to give a shout out to Heidi & Lisa they remember us and when they are working they ALWAYS acknowledge us. The Concierge’s are amazing Betsy & Abbie are very knowledgeable about everything. Maria our room maid is so polite & from the very beginning we felt she was trustworthy. I would rate this hotel with 100% on everything.Thank you Hyatt PlaceGrant StokellKathryn Elford

Good place and very friendly service! Good effort with breakfast and many choices! Will definitely recommend to everyone. It’s our second stay In Hyatt place( first is in CA Disneyland location). Good job!

great location so close to the beach, food & bus. great staff especially Cliff and Lisa, they were great to talk to for local tips. the room was spacious for 3 friends to stay in - except the sofa bed needs updating. clean room. a little noisy from the street even though 16 floors up. highly recommend staying here. the pool is a little disappointing but the beach is right there.

We had an amazing stay.Great service from Cliff and Lisa, they are wonderful to deal with. The pool area was disappointing, never used it, it had no appeal, glad the hotel was located close to the beach & easy walk to the middle of Waikiki. i recommend staying here!

The staff here are all amazing. Breakfast was great, the maids so sweet and accommodating. We always stay in a hyatt place when we travel, truly the best value for your money. Excellent location and close to the beach. Cliff, thanks for making the birthday special!!

This was a very nice hotel. The bathroom shower head needed some attention but nothing crazy. Overall our experience was very wonderful and would recommend to anyone who is traveling to waikiki beach.

Trip was perfect for us. Weather really nice. We’re supposed to have mountain view room but we were told it’s kinda small for 3 of us, so we ended up staying at 2 queen on the 2nd floor for 4days and they moved us to 1118room where we got king bed separate living room with full sofa bed. We got mountain view, diamond head view and partly ocean view. It was perfect for us. Staff are friendly and nice . Shoutout to Angelina for making sure we are satisfied and comfortable in our stay at this island. Mahalo Hyatt place Waikiki beach. Till next time

Loved it, everything was so great. We'll go back!!!! Breakfast so good everyday. Parking across the street $110 for a week good price for Hawaii. 2 blocks from beach with ABC store on way, love me some ABC store and yes there is one or two every block its so cool.

I stayed the hotel for 4 days on my business, but unfortunately, I lost my priceless tumbler while I was attending the conference inside the hotel. The tumbler was my mother’s memory and she has just recently passed away. I was so disappointed and at a loss. But the miracle was happening to me after I left Hawaii. Mr. Cliff from the hotel found it for me and let me know even after I left Hawaii. Thanks to Mr. Cliff, now I can feel my mom. This is a really 5-star hotel and hospitality!!!!!

Consistent outstanding value and service .Great location - close to beach, shops and restaurants. Complimentary breakfast offered a wide variety of selections and changed daily. Only negative is the elevators were slow.

Customer service #perfect Paul and cliff # best customerserviceexellenceFood @location @rooms beautifulLove x love x love x the hotel.. I love the close walk to shops and restaurants, and all the different beaches, all the staff greeted you every time , they see you xx the hospitality room, since my flight was late..

Have been charged for ressort fees that should have not been charged. The preople at the receiption were ignoring my concerns and basicall told me to get out and shut up. This is not the way you treat clients.

The Hotel is ideally located, perfect distance from the beach, surrounded by good restaurants and bus stop at the door. the staff members are amazingly friendly, they were accomodating and responded promptly to all our needs and requests. breakfast was excellent. There is nothing i can fault in our experience. just one thing, do not stay in level 3 near the restaurant, and the gym. avoid in particular rooms 307, 308, 309. if you can get mountain view, you will get the most amazing sunrise view every morning as the sunrises behind the mountains. the bus will take you anywhere for $5 all day pass, and they are very reliable.

I want to thank Hyatt Place Waikiki and all the hard working people! My wife and I had an absolutely amazing stay ! The place was clean and spacious! The bed was very comfortable and I especially loved the balcony. The breakfast was delicious. A very special star was Nick at the bar! Nick made great drinks and had great conversations which we absolutely enjoyed. We wish him the best of luck and great hope for his future! Julie kept out room immaculate and always gave an aloha when she saw us. Another star at the Hyatt. Hyatt and all the hard working people there have far exceeded our expectations! My wife and I want to extend a hardy thank you and mahalo to all of those for all your hard work. Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach deserves a perfect 10! A rating of 5 is too low!

We stayed for a week. From Canada’s, our dollar is nicknamed the Canadian peso right now. So saving here and there was essential on this trip. The breakfast for all of us was free as long as you are a Hyatt member. If this was not offered, we would have chosen a place with a kitchenette, which the Hyatt does not have. The staff were amazing and very accommodating. They offer beach chairs, beach towels, and beach chairs which saves you a lot there in Waikiki. The area is perfect. 1-2 blocks from the better family beach part of Waikik(not as busy, and has a seawall to keep the water calm). Stored and restaurant within walking distance. Has there own small restaurant with drnks but a little costly for us. Dominoes is attached, so that’s great if you need something quick for the kids. Room was large with decent view. The only thing for us was the parking. We rented a car for the first 3 nights. The parking lot is aleays full so you are forced to pay $35 USD for valet. But I found out that parking at the zoo is $1 per hour. It is only 3 blocks away so I parked it there for $9-$11 per night and just walked to and from. So overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again when we go back. Thanks again to the front desk staff who were amazing.

Upon initial check in, was provided with room 907. When we got into 907, I could tell that the room was not freshened up and not quite ready for a new guest; a few missing bath towels, missing extra bedding linen for the sofa sleeper, mini-fridge was off, and the AC was not cooling down the room (worked more like a fan than an AC). I went to the front desk not necessarily to raise the issue about these room items, but I requested to have a higher floor since from my initial online booking, I had requested for a room at least on the 12th floor or higher. I spoke with Kimberly and she had no problem with providing a higher floor, but could not accommodate the higher room until the next day, which was fine by me and the family (we’re in Hawaii, so it’s not that bad). The next morning after breakfast, I went back to the front desk and spoke with Lisa Catherine, regarding the room situation. She immediately saw the request, and said that we were set to move to the new room 1107. She recognized that we had made plans to go out, and she said to go ahead and enjoy our daily plans, and the staff would move all our baggage and belongings to the new room. We returned later in the afternoon, again meeting with Lisa Catherine, and had our new room keys ready. When we entered into room 1107, all of our baggage and other belongings were set up in the room, the room was freshened up compared to the previous room (with a small welcome note from our housekeeper Leonida), and the view looking out our balcony and as so much better. Leonida took care of the little things we needed for our room, for our 6-night stay. Thank you especially to Kimberly, Lisa Catherine, and Leonida for making a good experience, a great experience. And additional thank you and appreciation to your valet staff and breakfast staff for their courtesy and positivity.

Actually booked this hotel by mistake bit turned out ok. Very clean rooms, modern bathroom (our room had a large shower but no bath). Ocean view room had a tiny balcony but quite a good view of the ocean. Complimentary breakfast comprised of eggs, bacon, oatmeal, fruit, juice, coffee etc. Basic but enough to start the day off. Lots of birds around the breakfast area. HINT - for the better part of Waikiki Beach, go out the front door and turn left then left when you get to the beach go down past the volleyball courts.

It was a short 3 night stay but what a wonderful place to stay. Staff were exceedingly helpful and knowledgable. Rooms were a bit small but nice. The breakfast buffet was just incredible. Coffee is yummy. 4/5 highly recommend

Housekeeping failed to service my room 2 of the 4 days and the AC was inadequate and noisy. The valet service was wonderful. I had previously stayed at this location and was pleased with the service. Unfortunately I found it to be inadequate this trip and saw little concern by management to make it right.

The setting: You are a 20-30 minute and @$35-40 taxi/ride service drive away from HNL Airport. City public bus route 19 stops in front of the hotel, and leaves from HNL; it takes an hour. This high-rise property is one block from the southern end of Waikiki Beach, one block from the actual southern end of the beach. The hotel has a slick feel of a modern, high-rise with a spacious open air lobby with natural stone finishes throughout the lobby, which adds a level of coolness, much appreciated stepping out of the heat of Honolulu. There is a huge sitting area with couches, a bar area serving light fare and drinks/coffee. The lobby is fronted by the valet leading to the reception desk. We arrived at 7pm and check-in was seamless, with the reception agent acknowledging our status with Hyatt, and upgrading us to an ocean-view room on a high floor. She also congratulated us on our honeymoon which was a nice touch. She didn’t, however, explain that complimentary beach towels were available at the reception, during the day, or offered us the slip we needed to grab the daily, complimentary bottles of water. The lobby is accessible to the public, but the elevators to the rooms can only be accessed with a room card. Your card key will give you access to the floor your room is on and the third floor, which houses the breakfast buffet/the pool area, as well as the gym and laundry area. The hotel lobby has a Domino’s Pizza directly but discreetly accessible through the lobby. There is an ABC convenience store just a few yards down the street from the hotel’s entrance, and the giant Marriott Property across the street (has car rental options for easy pick-up, Enterprise is the best option there). The beach front is a long block (few minute walk) from the hotel. There is self-serve parking here for $25 and valet for $35, but no in-out privileges. Street parking isn’t too tough around this property. Upon check-out, which was graciously extended to 2pm, we could store our suitcases in the lobby. The friendly clerk locks a great many suitcases with secure wire through the handles, using a bag check system.The room: Ours was a 12the floor room with two queen beds, facing the ocean. There was a small balcony with two chairs and a small table off the room with a decent view of the ocean. The sunset views were excellent. The room also had a seating area with an L-shaped sectional and a full size coffee table, a desk and a large flat panel TV with a mini-fridge below it. Conveniently and thoughtfully, a large tray was set on this coffee table for the purpose of taking breakfast to go, back to the room. There was a coffee maker in the room, no kettle for tea. The TV had all the cable channels one would want/expect and the complimentary WiFi worked well throughout the property. The large closet had a very large safe, great for laptops, unfortunately, its door fully obstructed the remaining half of the closet. The beds and bedding were comfortable. The sink/vanity with a large mirror was set just outside the shower/toilet room. This was a small but functional shower space, although with poor water pressure out of the shower-head and very slow drainage in the shower. The toiletries were basic; we brought our own. We once had an issue with the mini-fridge and needed a remote control replacement, and the repair man showed up promptly. The food: The large open air breakfast buffet has rooftop seating, some of it around the pool. There is a huge coffee/tea station then a U-shaped buffet with mainly continental, but also a few Asian options. Eggs and home fries are served daily but the choice of meat rotates, with ham, crispy bacon or tasty, local Kalua Pig on rotation. Yogurt, fresh fruit and cereals are also served daily, as is the miso soup, rice, kim-chi and tofu. There is orange and grapefruit juice available but oddly not the Hawaiian preferred Passion-fruit, Orange, Guava mix, or even just guava. On the weekends there are waffles or monkey bread as a treat. The open air seating is nice, but during times of rain and during gusty winds it’s not a functional eating space, good thing most of the time it’s sunny and calm out. Once while indulging some late night cravings, it was super convenient to grab a pizza from Domino's just off the lobby.The third floor: The pool is just beside the breakfast patio, on the rooftop of the second floor. The remaining part of the third floor is a small gym with cardio equipment and a small laundry room with many washers/dryers that take both coins and credit cards.All in all, it was great getting an upgrade to an ocean-view room on a high floor. The breakfast is a nice perk, and the setting and location is good as well. Being at the southern end of Waikiki, you are just a 10-20 minute walk from excellent beach to all the restaurants, shopping and sights of this glittering neighborhood. The southern end of Waikiki means much less densely packed beaches. Walk to the beach and hang a left along the oceanfront It’s 5-10 minutes to a great local beach park, Queen’s Beach, with its great wide lawn with plenty of shade from old growth trees with wide canopies. The sand is golden and soft here and the water is cleaner. There are showers available as well. Just bring your own beach gear to enjoy. The much busier part of the beach is 5-10 minutes to the right after walking down to the beach from the hotel, it’s the part with Duke Statue and giant trees. There are great Asian, local and American restaurants throughout this area 10-20 minute walk from the hotel. I would definitely consider this hotel for another stay in Waikiki, especially when it’s a cheaper rate.
user_name:
Brooklynite_Abroad
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent 5 nights at the Waikiki Hyatt Place Hotel. We enjoyed our lovely ocean view room. The hotel location was excellent - close to everything. The staff were very accommodating. We requested a higher level view room on our first day and were moved to room 1833 on the second day.Breakfast was very good and there were different entrees served each day.We found the elevators fine and didn’t have to wait for more than 3 minutes.Thank you to all of the staff.

I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt and would come back again. The proximity of the hotel to Waikiki is very good. It's just a short walk to the beach or to shopping. The hotel staff is courteous and friendly.

Despite being off the beach—but very close—it was a great place to stay. I had troubles with noise in my initial room, but they quickly moved me to a quiter room. All the staff were excellent and very nice.

complimentary breakfast makes a difference which is the primary reason to choose this hotel, considering the location isn't really at the central waikiki. please considering keeping the complimentary breakfast, I would certainly choose other hotels without it.

Our family of 5 was very comfortable in our room with 2 beds and a pullout sofa. There was plenty of room for 5 suitcases and we weren’t on top of one another. Pros: * terrific location only 2 blocks from the beach* free use of sand toys, 2 beach chairs, and towels - check them out at front desk* laundry facility on 3rd floor (3 washers and 3 dryers - accepts coins or credit cards and you can but detergent from a vending machine)* free breakfast for World of Hyatt members* Domino’s Pizza connected to the lobby* ABC Stores just across the street and you can get anything you might need, from beach toys to sunscreen, souvenirs, shirts, water, food (even healthy food!), and more.* For those with a picky eater like I have, a McDonald’s and Burger King are less than a 5 minute walk.Cons:* only 2 elevators and 20 floors. Be prepared to wait a little bit during morning breakfast peak hours and checkout time* free parking will most likely be full and you will have to pay to valet your car. You do get in and out privileges. I think it was $35 to valet (?) which isn’t outrageous for a city but also not free* only 3 washers and many people waiting. If you see and open washer, GRAB IT! We weren’t fans of Waikiki Beach so used Hyatt Place Waikiki as our base for a few days - went to Dole Plantation, Kailua, Lanikai Beach, Hanauma Bay.

Excellent accommodations! Clean comfortable room and surrounding! Helpful staff. Breakfast was great. I highly recommend this place. We all had a wonderful stay and will return to Hyatt accommodations because of this wonderful stay.

The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond helping us. One member of the family is in a wheelchair so they really took good care of us and had patience with him. Breakfast was really good every morning.

Everything about the motel was excellent from the rooms to the staff. The only down side to our experience was that there are only two lifts to service such a large motel and so many guests. The lifts often took the best part of 10 minutes to make it to our floor particularly during the busy times. The location is great as it is only a few minutes walk from the beach and most tours and trolleys leave from the stop about 100 metres up the road.

We were checked into a room earlier than the check in time. Reception staff were fantastic. Close to bus route to diamond head. Only a short walk to Waikiki beach, but we chose to walk further along to the surf part of the beach. Rooms were quite spacious for Waikiki. Great breakfast was included in our room rate.

This is the third time we stayed at this hotel. This time we made the mistake of booking through a third-party and breakfast wasn’t included. We were very disappointed, so Brian, one of the managers at the hotel, in an effort to make us happy, included it in our stay as a courtesy. Also Heidi helped us with another issue we had during our stay, more than compensating is for an inconvenience. The service provided by these managers and the rest of the staff at the resort is incomparable. They really go above and beyond to make sure guests feel welcomed and appreciated. This is something that isn’t always experienced today, since businesses are often more focused on the bottom line rather than pleasing customers. We will be back in Honolulu next year and look forward to staying at Hyatt Place Waikiki.

Room was ok, spacious but hotel was crowded and is understaffed or so it seems. Housekeeping left cleaning cloth and trash bags in our room, and downstairs at the Starbucks counter people from the reception had to double as attendands. They do make an effort and are kind but it is a hassle for both parties. Also, breakfast is really poor.

We visited to Honolulu, HI last December for celebrating our anniversary. When check-in, we met Cliff and he truly welcomed us. He let us enjoy and give an unforgettable trip!! If you’d like a perfect honeymoon, you must find him!!

Very pleasant stay with a professional and generous staff -- particularly the breakfast and house keeping folks. My only concern was the difficulty finding containers for recycling (there is one by the pool on the 3rd floor). Given the number of plastic water bottles and other paper goods (e.g. newsprint) used by hotel guest, more visible would encourage less waste and more recycling.

I was very happy with my stay. The hotel is a block off the beach, which provides a bit of peace. The rooms are small, but you don't spend much time in them anyway. It has a good size bar/restaurant, but I only had a couple beers there. I would stay there again if I was in the area.

Without a doubt one of my favorite hotels to stay at. The staff was friendly and always mentioned me by name, I was also upgraded to a better room since I was a member and I was always greeted with a smile during my stay. Both Clifford and Andy provided excellent service during my stay and I just want to expend my appreciation to them. Looking forward to my next visit to the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.

Great, friendly staff, convenient location and a great breakfast made the few inconveniences worthwhile for our award stay. But the rooms are tiny for more than 2 people (think: Manhattan tiny) and the “sofabed” is cot-sized. Also the pool is small, shaded and mostly unused. We enjoyed ourselves and our stay but we would probably opt for a different hotel next time because we do spend time in our room more than most. If you’re hardly in the room/hotel, then you can’t best the value for the location.

Compared to what you can expect from most Hyatt hotels, this one falls short. Try the Hyatt Regence maybe? Just don't expect parking or a decent tasting breakfast at this Hyatt. We had to park a block away and we are pretty sure the pancakes are made with soap.

Rooms ok. Hair in shower on arrival. Staff cleaned again. The lobby, hallways and elevators are dirty. They never cleaned elevators or lobby the 5 days we were there. Had to ask them to clean vacuum our floors hallway as I was tired of looking at same trash each day. I don’t need luxury as it is a Hyatt place but they should clean. I was traveling with family and had several rooms. I would have liked to socialize in the lobby but it was filthy and no one wanted to sit down there. Staff nice but maybe finding employees is tough in Hawaii.

Located at the east end of Waikiki, but close to the Zoo and Aquarium. Rooms are nice and clean. Pretty decent breakfast is included. Says for Hyatt members only, but seems that everyone was partaking...

The fantastic location, nice open lounge area, free breakfast buffet and clean room - although the first room we stayed was musty and the bathroom smelled a bit moldy - are the strong points of the hotel. But, most of all, the hotel staff that I had talked to were the best part of my stay in the hotel and possibly in the whole busy and crowded Waikiki beach. Our whole family stayed here for 12 nights and I was having trouble having a good sleep. I let the staff know the trouble and we had to change the room three times. And along the process they were very helpful and considerate. Angeline, Eian, Cliff,Dino and Lisa at the front desk were so nice and did their best to give me a quieter room. And Janis from house keeping was very thorough and cooperative with my special request to clean the bathroom with vinegar water. And Erna at the breakfast cafe was always smiley and kind. This is still a great hotel with wonderful wonderful people and worth staying at but, if you are light sleeper, be sure to bring quality ear plugs and hope the management of the hotel puts better sliding doors to keep the street noise out so that you can get a good night’s sleep. And Lisa! You were so nice to my 5 year old. And I want to say this again! Can you be his grandma? Mahalo to every hard working staff in the hotel !!!!!You guys are the best!!!!! And Happy New year!!!!

We stayed at this hotel for one week. It is conveniently located just a block away from Waikiki Beach. Our stay was pleasant but not perfect. Our room was clean and very quiet, a big plus! The main negative aspect was the slow elevators - there are only two for the entire complex. The wait can sometimes be frustratingly long. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, but we were only offered it for free after we agreed to join the Hilton Members Club. The staff was helpful for the most part. There were a few mistakes, however, that should not have happen in such a high-quality hotel. There were five of us, but the sleeper sofa had neither a blanket nor a pillow case. When we requested those items, we were told that they were out and that we should use bath towels! After another call explaining that my daughter was unable to sleep, we finally received those items. The concierge desk is often swamped and the wait can be long. We prebooked several excursions before we arrived, but the packet was not given to us at check-in, so this caused us to wait an hour the next day just to pick them up from the single concierge. Again, it was a good stay, but not a perfect one.

The two elevators were not enough to handle the foot traffic and even the service staff (housekeeping) were using the same elevators with guests!The free breakfast menu was okay but should change a little everyday to give some diversity. Dining/pool area was very crowded and hectic.

Overall a great option for those on a budget. Staff are great and everything was very clean. Pool area wasn’t fantastic but having the breakfast included is a big money saver! Breakfast area was windy most days but you had the option of grabbing a tray and going back to your room or down to the lobby tables. Overall a pleasant stay - thank you!

We stayed here one night a week prior to Christmas as a overnight layover before our connecting flight to Maui. We had a great experience from check-in, to a nice surprise (champaign) in our room to celebrate our honeymoon, until check-out. We booked an ocean view, but was upgraded to the top floor as a Discoverist. Waikiki Beach was very accessible as others have mentioned, but the walk to some of the other areas of Waikiki (e.g. International Mall for food) could be a bit longer of a walk. The breakfast in the morning was very convenient. Overall this hotel was a great value, and we would definitely consider it again.
user_name:
syjiang
New York City, New York

review_body: Enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Waikiki Beach. Great (helpful and friendly)staff, perfect location (couple of blocks from the beach). Needs improvement with breakfast . A larger dining area needed. There were tons of people eating breakfast but I think that had everything to with it being Christmas.
user_name:
Martha L
Warner Robins, United States

review_body: Outstanding service at this hotel. Maile at the front desk was wonderful. Great value especially with the free breakfast that is provided. You can't beat that. Very easy access to the beach and shopping.

The breakfast buffet was absolutely awesome. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. Towels for the beach were provided in the lobby to borrow which was awesome. Good location. Less than 5 minute walk to the beach. Elevators tend to be slow but it's a busy place. Would stay again!

We had a great stay here over Christmas! Within walking distance to everything in Waikiki. We had a great ocean view room, just know that it’s not located right in front of the beach so there are hotels in the view. However, still could see the ocean and enjoyed watching the boats each day. Breakfast was good each day. Within walking distance to everything in Waikiki. We would stay here again.

we visited Waikiki for the first time away from home for Christmas, and the staff was excellent. they were very considerate and always paying attention to the details...our room was a bit small, but overall was comfortable, especially since we were not spending much time in the room!

Pros;-Efficient layout, and pull out sofabed made it possible to have two older kids stay in separate beds when they wouldn't have wanted to sleep in the same bed anymore. -Breakfast was a nice extra. -Supportive staff.Cons:-Breakfast was passable, got rather monotonous over several days, & became like a zoo when it got crowded. Food & silverware frequently absent for long periods. -Too few elevators, way too slow. This gets very annoying when you end up spending 30-45 minutes/day just waiting for your elevator. -Very limited dining & other services. that's fine, but cost of our room was hefty for limited service. -Location in Waikiki is decent, but being way off to one side and a couple of blocks from Kalakaua made it a long trek to get to other things.

Located towards the end of the Waikiki beach strip, it was still within walking distance (within 10 min) to all of the restaurants and shopping! The free daily breakfast is not to be missed, the food easily matches any brunch restaurant! Room were spacious and clean - the elevators were slow, especially during rush hours, so expect to wait 5-8 min. Beach towels are provided for going to the beach, so overall very convenient! There is some free street parking nearby and zoo parking for $1/hour as well. We would definitely return!

They offer free breakfast if you sign for their membership program and that resulted in an overcrowded breakfast room that resembled a war zone. The restaurant is outside, so it was cold/windy and the birds were all over the place picking on our food. The stuff couldn't keep up with constant demand for food and everyone was fighting for a little space.... Terrible experience!

Currently staying at Hyatt Place and what an amazing place it is. Check in was smooth and easy, thank you Annabelle. Staff at Hyatt Place are very accommodating and friendly. We booked the room looking out to Diamond Head and a partial ocean view and we were not disappointed, the views are amazing. Just a brief walk to Waikiki Beach and you will not go hungry, plenty of food joints and ABC stores around for your everyday needs, including souvenirs.

My wife had a migraine when we arrived and Heidi went out of her way to care for our needs, allowing my wife to recover quickly the following day. She checked on our family the following day and showed genuine care and concern.

This hotl located crose to Waikiki zoo and beach. The room is clean and convenient for families by auppring sofa. At the corner just accross the croo from this hotel, the bus-stops of The Bus to both direction are available. Breakfast is provided from 6:30 at the side of the roof pool, thus you must take care of small birds that eat from the dish on the table no one is placed. However, I recommend this htel to enjoy beach and local hospitality.

I chose this hotel because of its location - close to Waikiki beach, shops and restaurants - and free breakfast. Food could have been better but they had a few varieties including asian food (steamed rice and miso soup). I recommend this hotel for family vacation. The only downside was the room we stayed appeared quite dusty. The room was a free upgrade because our room was not available when we arrived. It looked like the room wasn't used for a long time. During our stay housekeeping made small improvements but I still wondered if they ever vacuum.

Had a great experience last week while vacationing in Waikiki, the hotel was nice, family oriented, very clean, staff very friendly and room big and clean, very quiet, breakfast is included and was delicious with multi choices, i do recommend this hotel for family and people who wants some quite and it's also located very close to the beach, shops and restaurants,

Great location. Beach is 1 block away, easy access to Honolulu and other communities. Breakfast is great and the staff is always accommodation. Easy in and out with the valet. News paper is complimentary.

Very nice hotel. Location is great. Service is great. Room is clean & comfortable. Breakfast is very good & food are so fresh. Waking distance to beach & not far away from Diamond Head & business area.

Excellent place to enjoy with family. Best view and location to see beach. Breakfast is not 100% good. Staff is amazing helpful, reception and parking department is cooperative. Gym, Laundry and pool is also good.

Great location, it is close to the beach, shops and bus. Clean rooms, comfortable beds and a range of pillows. Friendly staff, good breakfast range and tasty food. No heated spa in the pool and slight improvemnts in TV reception, room lightning and hair dryer cord extension would be appreciated. Overall a very pleasant stay, we would use it again so it has our recommendation. MAHALO Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.

Very nice hotel. I will go back to the same hotel. Good location and very nice breakfast. Location is near the beach and walking distance to all amenities. Nice location for the buses and trolleys. Will recommend to friends.

We had a problem after checking n but the staff was right on it, fixed our issue by moving us to a new room. Very caring staff, blocks from the beach and from International Marketplace. We will be back again

Excellent Place for the business travelers, The house cleaning staff is outstanding one person that stands out above all others Ms Wilma 4th floor. She made sure things were done right and on time to fit my work schedule.For a great place to relax the hotel Bar with bartender Kick his excellent personality for a Bartender and he's a all around great person Thank You Mr. Kick. At check in and Check out Ms. Erin a true professional she organized my lodging business receipt in the order that I needed saving me time later when filing my expense account.Thank You Hyatt Place staff DLJ, 24 Nov- 15 Dec .

could not get the phones in our rooms to work.Breakfast service could be improved, ie we had to wait for the cutlery to come out of the dish washer and our breakfast got cold. The Birds are a problem however that is not your fault.I think the hotel needs to be refurbished. Air conditioner very noisy .On the upside the location is great, handy to the beach and bus services.

Hotel was conveniently located to the main hub of town. Excellent restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Hospitality is at a Maximum level! The lobby had a nice place to eat a meal or take something up to room. Awesome atmosphere!!

The room and view was absolutely breath taking! Even with two other hotels in front blocking a full ocean view, we were able to watch the sunset from our balcony. The staff was very pleasant and helpful plus the beach is only a minute walk...if that! I will be looking forward to booking my next stay here.

We found the Hyatt Place exceeded our expectations for our stay. Rooms very spacious, staff extra helpful, close proximity to beach, zoo and Diamond Head. Cheap bus options across street to numerous locations including airport. A great choice

They checked us in early with no problems and all smiles. The employees go out of there way when you ask or request something. The rooms were very clean and the maids had no problems giving us extra towels when requested. The best part is the free breakfast. They have a great spread and all kinds of breakfast foods and coffee and drinks. They even give you a large plate to take the breakfast up to your room if you like. I will definitely stay on my next visit.

Only a short stroll to the beach, this hotel has the friendliest staff. Everyone is always there to help and show it with a friendly greeting.The buffet breakfast could do with a bit more variety but it is plentiful.Highly recommended and if I ever return to Honolulu, will be staying here again.

We were very sick during our vacation, my husband unable to leave the room. The staff took care of us. When the food and beverage manager heard I was having a hard time cancelling our planned trips and getting my money back, Heidi made it all happen. She cared about how discouraged we were about Hawaii and our trip and she turned it all around. The staff were always smiling, the rooms were clean and very comfortable and we felt very welcomed.

We have just spent 13 nights at the hotel and I would recommend it for the location close to the public buses and trolleys but that is all. They promote breakfast for world Hyatt members but in fact everyone gets it. There is no checking so people bring friends in from other hotels as well. The breakfast area is mostly open so birds fly in and attack any food left unattended and when it rained there was only 5 tables under cover to accommodate everyone. The food is very basic and extremely limited in choices. Felt like I was at a school camp having to take my plates to the bench and scrap them down and stack them- plastic plates as well- not even crockery. As for the pool- in the entire time I never saw or heard of anyone using it.. Why... well it is about 6 meters by 4 meters, old and absolutely no atmosphere around it. Stuck in the breakfast area with no view. Our mountain view room faced the building opposite’s car park and only when you looked around the corner of your small balcony could you see it. Our lady who cleaned our room did a good job and took pride in her work. If you pay the destination fee of $15 per day use it to get your 1 coffee a day so much better than the breakfast crap upstairs.
