When getting the cab back to the airport check before you get in that the driver is aware that it is a flat rate of $29 as otherwise they try and get you to pay the full fare which can be anything higher than $50.As I person who stays in many Hyatt Hotels this one falls very much below the usual standard in so many ways. Would I stay again- NO! I even tried on my third day to move to the Hyatt Regency but they were full.

The free breakfast was what made me select this place. Waikiki is such a compact area that it doesn't really matter which part of town you are in, you are close to everything. It's not as flash as the other Hotels but it was definitely clean and tidy and modern. We were able to walk to Diamond as well as the big Safeway Supermarket. Too far to walk to the Ala Moana Mall though. Only 2 mins to the beach and the amazing sunsets...

Jade at customer service was fantastic, we had an issue with our room when we first checked in, she went above and beyond, made sure everything was fixed and followed up. Honestly She made our trip that much better!. The hotel is close to the beach, ABC is down the street, Denny's is a walk away. Its a great location. The bed was comfortable we slept with no issues or back pain etc. They do offer chairs to take the beach with you which is nice. The elevators are a tad slow so you can at times wait for one. The free breakfast was okay. It got us by but if you cant eat pork your meat options are very limited. I would have liked to see more things like to go such as muffins, bagels etc. It was mainly scrambled eggs, pork sausage or pork bacon, fruit salad, bread etc. Honestly I want to once again give a big thanks to Jade, just the way she handled our stay makes us want to stay here again!.

Stayed at this hotel in September. Pro s close to the beach and great breakfast. The thing that really made us have a bad experience was the valet parking. When we booked the hotel a few months prior of our trip there were 2 options for parking-valet and self park. When we got there the option was only valet parking and we were told that self parking is not an option.They expect tips every time when you get your vehicle and not just $1 or 2$ and this added to the High valet parking rate. Dare you not to give a $5 or more you will wait a lot to get a car. The last day we waited almost 2 hours because they said they could not find our car....

This hotel was not befitting the Hyatt brand. Staff are under trained in delivering what they promise. The food quality and variety is sorely lacking. Although breakfast was included on this trip, I only ate breakfast at the hotel twice (2) in the 7 days that I stayed. The food at breakfast was of poor quality and not of the standard expected of the Hyatt or a 4 star hotel. Presentation and food variety was poor: I found the waffles under cooked, pancakes dry and tasteless, the roasted vegetables were also over cooked and dry. The only choice of eggs was scrambled ( which I don't like), the fruit variety lacking (only pineapple and melons) and cut into big chunks. Where were the bananas and berries, apples or grapes? Only paper cups provided for coffee and tea instead of proper ceramic cups??? Come on Hyatt, you can do much better. Table service was lacking as we had to clear our own plates. I HAD MORE VARIETY AND BETTER SERVICE AT IHOP WHICH IS WHERE I WENT FOR BREAKFAST for the other 5 days! The way I see it, the Hyatt place owes me $100 US for breakfast, which is what I spent for the 5 days! Thank God for iHop and the ABC store around the corner! I'll book the Marriott across the road next time!

If you are a member of Hyatt, this hotel offers free breakfast every morning. This feature saved us a bundle on food, and if we were in a hurry, we grabbed something quick just so none of us would be hangry! They have a very good selection. Try the steel cut oats, that is the best with all the trimmings you could ask for! The staff were amazing. They were every bit of a 5 Star Staff, and maybe even better. Lots of smiles, eager to help, what more can I say. Lots of fresh towels, very clean rooms, and super comfortable beds. Yes I would stay here again. Waikiki beach a block away.

The place was awesome. 1 block away from the beach and a short walk to the centre of everything on the strip. Staff was amazing. They were extremely friendly and was able to accommodate anyway they can. We had 2 small children with us and needed a crib. They moved us to a larger room because they knew we would be quite cramped once they pushed the crib in. I loved this place and would definitely come back!

The front desk was awesome and made it special for my bday. Thank you anabelle e and Kimberly so much. The hotelHowever for the price is not justified in my mind. The pool leaves a lot to be desired. Very very small and the space does not look nice. Plus it doesn’t get much sun being between buildings. The fitness center is lacking some essentials. The rooms are very nice and very cute they had cookies for us and waters. When asked for more waters the little Aquafina bottles are 3.50 each. The location is great. Quick walk to the beach. The rooms are nice. Very clean very comfy bed. Great channels on tv. Again great customer service.

It has been an amazing time in Hawaii. It is our first time as a family trip in Hawaii and we love every second of it. We recommend Hyatt Place very highly to other visitors. This place has amenities nearby, very central to the tourist hot spots, and to the public transportation. Speak highly of the staff at Hyatt Place all has been very helpful and made our stay pleasurable and easy especially Annabelle. Thank you Annabelle from NZ family Dec 2018.

Enjoyed my 5-night stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki and would highly recommend it to my friends and family. Location is ferfect with 2 minutes walk to the beach and east access to public transportation. In addition to the perfect location, the amazing front desk staff has also made this place so special. A special call out to Mr. Guan who was incrediblely friendly and helpful. When he heard about the drainage problem in my room, he immediately made arrangement to have it looked at and assured me that it will be fixed when I returned in the afternoon. I was so pleased and enjoyed my time staying at the hotel.Mr. Guan, you are the best! And thank you for my trip a memorable one!

Loved staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Location was perfect-- VERY close to the beach (not even a 5 minute walk). Room was clean and bed was very comfy. Hotel is showing its age-- halways have a musty odor and carpets are looking a bit tired. Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was a great bonus-- food was hot, fresh and tasty and coffee was perfect. We'll be back!!

We just stayed for a week with our family of five. All of the staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly. The room while a bit dated was neat and cleaned and was cleaned very well every day of our stay. The staff at breakfast always assisted us and our three kids and the staff at reception and getting cars for us were so friendly. The breakfast was average and was very dependent on the chef on on the day. In saying that it was free so we were happy to be able to save some money. The lifts are slow and do take a while. We couldn’t use the stairs because we were on the top floor and had a pram. We really enjoyed our stay. Thanks for having us!

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is a very nice place to stay . My family enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Place, we can always recommend this beautiful Hotel. Hooray Annabelle Gyotoku ( Gallery Host ) you’re the best !

We stayed here for two nights following on a cruise. We cannot recommend the staff enough. They were friendly and helpful, always ready to please. We arrived early and were given an early check in at no charge, so different to the other hotel we checked into before the cruise after flying for 12 hours and arriving early morning.... so thank you Hyatt Place. You do understand customer relations and that is important. The hotel was clean and comfortable and handy to the beach and shopping. The only negative was the one meal we ate at the little cafe restaurant in the Hotel. I ordered a hamburger and my husband ordered a pizza. The pizza appeared to be a purchased base and not much filling, the hamburger was dry with very little to excite the taste. Overall we enjoyed out stay.

We chose this hotel because of the location, we like this side of Waikiki rather than the other. We had stayed in a condo right beside it, a couple of years ago and liked the looks of it. It exceeded our expectations, only bad experiences was the parking, since we rented a car for the 10 days, $35 a day for valet was a bit expensive.

My husband had a business trip in Honolulu so I tagged along. My daughter attends UH Manoa and my stay at the Hyatt Place was the perfect location for us to visit. We were close to her apartment and within walking distance to all of our favorite dining places.
user_name:
Erin K
Sedro Woolley, United States

review_body: The Hyatt Place was perfect the friendly staff always willing to help and the breakfast every morning was great just go early to get a table and don’t leave your food unattended the pigeons will eat it the gift shop was also great

Awesome hotel, Excellent service. very helpful and friendly staff. They helped me check in early gave me a nice room.Breakfast was decent.Nice location, overall it was a great experience staying here.

My husband surprised me for my birthday with a trip to Hawaii. We booked our hotel here at the Hyatt Place and it has been amazing. We were greeted with kindness and respect. Our room was very clean and nice. Guan who works at the front desk was first class. He explained everything very well and made us feel comfortable with our stay. He even had gourmet a cookie sent to our room for my birthday. It was a very thoughtful gesture that meant a lot. We have been very happy with our choice to stay here at the Hyatt Place. We look forward to coming here again.

I have probably been to this hotel about 10 times.... I try to go to Hawaii at least 1-2 a year and I always go alone to enjoy a relaxing trip. The hotel is just one block from the beach and is all the way at the end of Waikiki so out of the hustle. I love the open lobby, and I always feel relaxed as soon as I walk in. The beds and bedding are awesome. The breakfast is awesome too. I will be back again and again

I'm blessed to have been to many of the Hawaiian islands, but Oahu holds in a special place in my heart thanks to Hyatt Place Waikiki. My family has been able to celebrate holidays and special occasions in style thanks to Dino and the rest of the staff at the hotel. The rooms and the property are perfect for both the novice and experienced traveler. The valets ever so patient, housekeeping as courteous as can be, the breakfast staff and bartenders make sure people are enjoying themselves, and the entire property exudes positive energy and the Aloha spirit. While I've stayed in other popular hotels in Waikiki to say I've been there, done that, the truth is that Hyatt Place Waikiki is my go to hotel to relax, enjoy and celebrate life while on vacation. I look forward to my next trip to Oahu and staying at my home away from home...Thank you Dino and staff!

This hotel is located just half a block of the beach which is very convenient. They provide towels that you can pick up from the lobby. The breakfast is good with a selection of fruits, cereals, eggs, breads, fresh juices It is not spectacular but it is what you need to keep going during the day. The room is well appointed with a safe, a rainy shower, may be not much amenities, and very spacious room and the people on the front desk is very helpful and friendly and help you with everything that you need. I will totally recommend this hotel if you want a good hotel with a reasonable budget.
user_name:
edustgo p
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: One problem: Needs a quality sit down restaurant with room service.Excellent marks for cleanliness, room size, and bed quality!Needed full size restaurant with room service to be given 5 stars.Excellent on cleanliness, room size and high quality bed and bed linens.

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff from the cleaners to the maintenance were pleasant and friendly. I tried out the breakfast and it was delicious. Everything was presented nicely and the selection of food was perfect. What a great hotel.

We stayed with family and friends for a 40th birthday and they were very accomadating and helpful. A special mention to Wilma the housekeeper who was very friendly and did a great job with the room and any other needs we had.

Our stay at Hayatt Place Waikiki was excellent! Jovalita in housekeeping kept our room spotless and restocked and was happy and friendly, Catherine and Heidi at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. I would recommend staying here.

This is the second time we have stayed here and it wont be the last as we are planning on coming back again next year. This place is such good value for money with the rooms being a good size, balcony and the breakfast is such a great bonus. Waikiki beach is just a few minutes away and so are lots of food places, shops and the heart of waikiki beach. Highly recommend this place for all

Our house flooded so Hyatt Place is where we (my husband, myself, and our baby (aka dog) were sent during repairs. Everyone is amazing at Hyatt Place. They made us feel at home the minute we arrived. Heidi has such a gift with customers. She made us feel like family from the get go... always smiling, remembered our names, took the time to check on us. When you’re going through something like this, sometimes that’s all you need to get through another day. I’d also like to say that the room, breakfast, amenities - exceeded our expectations! We just couldn’t ask for more. Thank you Hyatt Place, and THANK YOU HEIDI!!

Family of 12 had 4 rooms for Thanksgiving Week ‘18. We loved everything about this hotel. The concierge staff was wonderful, helpful & friendly. Housekeeping was awesome. Breakfast was great. Everyone went above and beyond to make our stay as easy and fun as possible. Staff VERY attentive to our needs, went the extra mile several times. LOVE this hotel

Stayed here for 11 nights on a romantic getaway. We were expecting a larger room, it was tiny and not even enough room for our luggage. The shower door was filthy! Bathroom was tiny with sink outside. The room overlooked a derelict apartment complex and elementary school. In short, no view at all. Room and hallway had an odd, musty smell. There was no blow dryer in the room, I had to ask several times to get one that worked. The first two they brought up were broken, the third took hours to show up. When we booked, it said free breakfast. They told us that was no longer the case, but after some encouragement they decided to give us what we paid for. The breakfast was outdoors and the wind and birds were very annoying. In short, it wasn't the best and wasn't the worst. We were hoping for much better being a Hyatt. Room was tired and could use remodeling. For our romantic trip, we would have preferred something larger and more modern for what we paid. Location was good. Underwhelming experience overall.

The hotel provided a safe atmosphere, clean rooms, and very convenient location. The staff were friendly and efficient. The morning breakfast was an added plus. We also enjoyed the peanut butter and chocoloate chip cookies!

Had a great stay at Hyatt Place on our recent trip to Hawaii. Our room was a city room with 2 Queen beds. Plenty of space in the room to relax. Location is excellent, close to beach, Diamond Head & buses. Only issues were the pillows were a bit hard, slow lift & a bit of noise on our floor. Breakfast provided each day was good. Recommend for stay

My family booked this hotel~! Overall it was great experience, the complimentary breakfast is good selection and well staged. Just be cognoscente that their might be line ups in the morning. Not all tables have umbrellas from the shade . The hotel itself is clean and staff were friendly through out the whole stay. Rooms are modern and spacious! You are walking distance to the beach, Kalakaua Blvd, car rentals, malls, entertainment, restaurants, food trucks and free on street parking (Ala Wai Blvd). There is an Enterprise across the street so I did daily rentals to save on valet parking.

We had an excellent experience! The breakfast exceeded expectations and set you up the the day! We usually had a snack mid day and then had an early dinner. The staff friendly and helpful! Location could not be better. We will return to the Hyatt Place.

To Cliff,You are a wonderful employee to Hyatt, and a better individual in life. You are kind and caring, and you made my stay feel like I was staying with family. Please do not lose sight of who you are. To visitors,If you have time, stop by and say hi to Cliff if he is working as he will show you the loving and caring culture Hawai’i is all about. I promise you that a stay here is worth your time and money. Also, thank you Cliff for your service. HOO RAH!!Jordan

Outstanding, best value of any hotel In Waikiki. Terrific location, awesome staff, terrific breakfast, modern rooms. Room 902 outstanding, 100% this is our new go too In Waikiki. Location is perfect a short walk to everything.

So many good things to say...loved the breakfast, friendly service, location, value, coin laundry. Daily maid service was excellent ! Valets were very sharp and attentive. This property will definitely be our "go to" hotel in Waikiki

Stayed at Hyatt Place at Waikiki for 3 nights with a family of 4 to get a taste of Honolulu before heading off to Maui for a week. The location was good being at the southend of the beach and therefore a little less busy/crowded. Every member of the hotel staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and engaging. The hotel amenities are decent--there was a small computer area which I used for airline check-in, the workout rooms and pool area are small but serviceable. The breakfast on the 3rd floor outdoor deck was great--good selection of hot and cold items as well as some Asian fare (Miso soup, kimchee, etc.). The room was very large (we got a free upgrade with a partial ocean view) and comfortable and modern. It was easy for our family to spread out our belongings and still have room. The large safe in the closet was also convenient to store all of our electronics and valuables while we were out. The noise level was decent, but you can clearly hear the nearby doors closing shut. The only complaint I would have is the elevators- security feature where your room card would only allow you to select the floor where your room is located was cool. However, with only 2 slow elevators the wait for the elevators were very long and often full especially in the morning when a lot of folks are heading to the breakfast buffet. I used the stairs (we were on the 7th floor) often. I guess the elevators were on "island time". All in all a good value and location which I would recommend to others.
Great stay! Recommend to everyone. Very close to the beach, everything is walkable. A lot of free stuff included in price of room.....Catherine, Lisa, and Tori took very good care of us on this trip.

This property lives up and actually goes beyond and above the Hyatt experience. Staff were very well trained and very attentive to your needs. Breakfast is good old fashioned way (cooked by chef instead of machines) room is pleasant and bed is always heavenly. Really enjoyed the stay. Will definitely come back

The free breakfast is no longer free unless you're a Hyatt member (membership is free, but it'll mean you'll get more junk email in your inbox). But the breakfast food is top notch, not your typical continental breakfast with stale muffins etc. Bacon, cage free eggs, quinoa etc... The room is on the small side, the roll away bed is even small than a twin! Check in staff can be a little more accommodating. Breakfast staff were the best, friendly and efficient. The hotel is at the end of waikiki beach, about a block from the actual beach, which was fine with me. But if you're into shopping or being in the center of things, then try somewhere else. Would come back for the breakfast, but from the hiccups from this recent trip, I would think twice about staying here again.

Nice hotel with large room. Very clean. All staff extremely friendly and helpful. In close proximity to beach and a short walk to heart of Waikiki. Breakfast pretty average. Big pigeon problem in outdoor breakfast area... if you leave your breakfast unattended pigeons will eat your food... kinda gross.Expedia desk to help with tours but no cheaper than booking yourself with Expedia online and one Expedia person tried to get us to attend a time share seminar.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is my choice when I need to be in Waikiki. It's not insanely expensive, like the hotels that are right on the beachfront, but it's a very short walk to the beach. It doesn't have the fabulous views, either (although if you request Diamond Head view, that side is pretty nice), but you save a bundle vs. the beachfront hotels which you can then use on dining, tours and shopping. The staff is responsive, the rooms are updated and clean, the breakfast is decent, and you are close enough to walk to everything in Waikiki. An additional plus: being on the east end of Waikiki is a bit quieter and you might be able to score cheap parking in Kapiolani Park -- you can walk from there. Walking distance to the Zoo and Aquarium as well. Starbucks is a 5 min. walk, but the Hyatt puts out coffee all day and it is pretty good coffee!

Friendly service with all the facilities we needed for an 8 day stay, during which we celebrated our 50th anniversary. Staff made us feel welcome and valued. Room with king bed and ocean view with lanai was exactly what we enjoy for a relaxed break. Inclusive breakfast had variety and quality, was a great way to start the day.Although the hotel is not directly on the beach, the walk was not far. Local bus stops are right there, providing easy access to local attractions and easy connections to anywhere on the island. We took the local bus on a day trip to the other side of the island and back ... true value for money!!!

Staff was engaging and friendly, valets were helpful and quick. There was a $70 mistake on the bill and the business office just let it go. They missed charging me for two days. The maid service was excellent and friendly. Breakfast was great with good selections from fresh fruit, fresh waffles, oat meal, fresh scrambled eggs and beacon every other day.

In the last five months, I have stayed at four (4) Hyatt Place Hotels. I have to say this one really does not fall into the same category as the other three. This one is in an older hotel that Hyatt has done some updates, but even with those the hotel does not compare. The rooms are small and still felt old. Even though we paid for an ocean view hotel, the reality is that it is a partial ocean view. Breakfast was good and was equal to what the other Hyatt Place Hotels offer. The location is great, as the beach is only a couple of minutes away. Having to Honolulu several times, I have stayed in many other hotels that are much better. Since I had great experiences at the other Hyatt Place hotels this year, I felt this hotel would be the same. The accommodations did disappoint me.

Recently visited Hyatt Place in Waikiki Beach and absolutely loved it!!! The staff was incredible, super friendly, and always accommodating. Maile and Lisa were super informative and welcoming at check in. Leonida always kept the room very clean and assisted us in any requests needed, great housekeeper. We visited the bar for a meal and had a great experience with Kai. I wish I could describe this vacation more in dept and compliment the staff and hotel more. Highly recommend this hotel.

Had a wonderful anniversary celebration here with my boyfriend. The hotel was nicely decorated and felt safe. All the staff I encountered was very welcoming and friendly. Valet service and check in/out process was quick. Our ocean view room was a lot larger than I expected. It was very clean and quiet. It also came with complimentary champagne and desserts for our anniversary. Thank you, service manager Lovely! Overall great stay, would stay again.

This is a comfortable, clean hotel with a pleasant and helpful staff. Breakfast was fantastic and the hotel amenities were great. We joined the Hyatt loyalty program because our stay here was so enjoyable! Thanksfor a great vacation!

Enjoyed our stay. Courteous staff. They made special accommodations to suit our needs. Hyatt Place is close to the beach and evening short stroll to watch the sunset was divine! The place is lively without being too noisy. Our vacation seemed so SPECIAL!Thanks to all the courteous staff at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach

Stayed here a couple of nights with family. The room was spacious, clean and had a mini fridge. We were upgraded from the basic room which was really nice. Full hot breakfast was included. This hotel is close to the beach but not right on it. Only a short walk of maybe two blocks to Waikiki Beach. There is an ABC store right next door that has various foods, toiletries, and souvenirs, and plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Valet parking is $35/day. I believe self park is $25/day. I would stay here again.

Perfect Location; Only one minute from the Beach. Easy Access to everything. Bus comes right in front of hotel. Hotel staff very helpful helping with bus route. Hotel in walking distance to shopping. Great spot.

Our cleaning attendant for the 10th floor was Mildred and she was the best!! Always pleasant and smiling. It's sometimes the little things that make a stay great!! ....this ua only day 2 but I again felt the need to recognize great service immediately!!
user_name:
Erika H
El Tunco, El Salvador

review_body: My husband and I would like to acknowledge and give a special thank you to the following staff at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach: Rey, Erin, Nipo, Catherine and Kay for making our 10 year anniversary very special. Mahalo! From the Moore's.

I've stayed at this hotel several times and have enjoyed my stay immensely every time. I've even recommended this hotel to friends and family. I am now planning another trip to Oahu and started looking into this hotel again however I was told that the breakfast is no longer free starting this month. Say it ain't so! I'm quite disappointed to hear that...

I stayed here for two night prior to going on a Pacific crossing cruise. The employees were super friendly and the hotel lobby was attractive. The room I had was very spacious with a corner wrap around balcony with nice views. This was a older property purchased by Hyatt and totally refurbished. Great place to stay if you want to walk to the beach. So many stores and restaurants within walking distance.

Service at this hotel was SUPERB. Every hotel staff we walked past or came across were so friendly. Everyone from the reception, house keeping, buffet breakfast, porter, bar staff, everyone were so lovely. It definitely made it special to stay here. We stayed in quite a lovely, spacious, very comfortable open plan room on the 10th floor with two very huge and extremely comfortable beds, and a living / tv / lounge area which was cleverly separated from where our beds were. No complaints about the bathroom, toilet and vanity area. They were nice and clean and had that Hyatt feel about it - love it. Our stay came with daily complimentary buffet breakfast. It was great but if I had one feedback, perhaps a bit more variety in the day to day menu would’ve been great. We were there for a week and after three days of scrambled eggs / toast / yogurt staple...something different would’ve been very welcomed! There was also a pool at this hotel. However, it was quite a sad looking one. A nice pool would’ve been lovely. Luckily location wise it was great. An ABC store right outside the hotel, a Domino’s Pizza attached to the hotel, and the beach was literally up the road. Perfect. The main shopping area wasn’t too far away either. Plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. Starbucks just around the corner. Great location without breaking the bank.

Stayed here with the family and was delightfully pleased with the entire stay. The room was nice, clean and spacious with 2 queen beds and a pullout sofa. The free breakfast buffet is fantastic. The location is super convenient and walkable to numerous shops, restaurants, the beach and zoo. The customer service was amazing.....Ihab goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is the best!!

I have been coming to Hawaii for the last 20 years, and the last few years, I have stayed at the Hyatt Place because it is quiet, a great value, free coffee, mellow, and the staff are extremely helpful and nice.

I've been too Hawaii several times. This is my 1st time staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel and right out of the gate I'm loving this place!! My reservation was split(my fault) into different room classes but Guan L. was able to keep me in the better room so i wasn't inconvenienced!! Also, breakfast is free if you're a Hyatt member(which i was not), but Guan signed me up for free and now FREE BREAKFAST!!!! I've only been in this room 10 minutes but had to leave this review!!

We had an outstanding 3 night stay in October 2018 at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a very spacious room. The rooms had free coffee, decent wifi, and good amenities. The front desk staff (Kay, Catherine, Anabelle and others) were very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is well-located - easy walk to the beach (5 minutes), restaurants and shopping. It was also close to major bus routes. The breakfast buffet had an excellent variety of food options. We stayed at this hotel before our Norwegian cruise. After our cruise, we had another almost entire day in Honolulu, as our flight departed quite late. The hotel was able to accommodate us on very short notice with a room after our cruise. In fact, we were upgraded to an oceanview room. It was amazing!! We highly recommend this hotel. It provides excellent value.

My stay here was great. The staff went out of their way to make me feel welcome. The rooms are clean with enough space to be comfortable. I've stayed here before and like the fact that it's a long block away from the beach yet far enough away from the craziness of the center of Waikiki which is a 5 minute walk. Breakfast is above average but make sure that you are a Hyatt member to get it for free. Use the Zoo lot to park.

I love the location of this hotel. It's in the middle of everything and staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful. The place is clean and rooms are spacious and depending on which room you choose, you get great views of the city and the beach. This was my second stay and I will definitley be back again soon. :)

Good location 2 minutes from Waikiki beach. Breakfast every morning. Pool is small but who needs it when you are in Hawaii. Onsite laundry facilities were very handy. The new resort fee includes a $5 cafe credit daily. Make sure you use it each day as it does not accumulate.

I booked through Hotwire. I will NEVER do that again. This is supposed to be "3.5 STAR" hotel. Well, I guess if a Motel 6 is also. Basically, they renovated an old hotel but it all seems dated and very Home Depot grade. My room is very small and smells a bit of A/C or disinfectant or something. Popcorn ceilings - yuck. Spatter textured walls - uh uh. Cheap furniture, bad art. It's all very very common. Maybe I expected too much, but "3.5 Stars" should at least be above average. Not here - not if you ask me.

Agree with the other reviewer it's an older property and seems kind of dirty they probably need to upgrade this hotel and upgrade the rooms it's pretty dated but I guess for the price you get what you pay for

Bed sheets were about the only thing that was clean the hallway and room carpets are filthy, all the corners of the rooms are piled with old dirt and hair, very small patio decks, showers are old and need a serious cleaning!! We even had and upgrade. The lobby is the only thing somewhat inviting, the breakfast is free but it is served in the dirty pool area. Pool is very small about 14 x 20. Waikiki beach area is not clean either. I will not come back here.

We enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Place - I would prefer the Hyatt Regency or another hotel in Waikiki. We were really disappointed with the breakfast as differs to the posters that are around the property. It wasnt appealing and we actually went elsewhere for breakfast on both days. Another issue was the confusion with the parking. There is no self parking so we had to valet. There is notice at front of property advising "$12 parking - no overnight parking, vehicles after 12am are charged $50". This didn't make any sense as they still took the car and charged us $35 per night. I would prefer to be able to self park the car. Overall the room was nice and location was great.

We've just returned home from a 10 day vacation, we stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. We were completely satisfied with this property. Customer service was excellent, we had a minor issue when we first checked in and it was dealt with to our complete satisfaction the next day. The breakfast buffet was of a good quality. Hot foods changed daily, lots of fresh fruit, hot & cold cereal, juices & coffee. Having breakfast included saved us a lot of $ during our stay. Housekeeping staff were friendly and kept our room nice and clean. This was our 1st time staying here, I've already recommended it to a few friends/family members. We will be back. Location is about 2 blocks away from the beach. Location is nice and quiet, especially at night.

The whole staff at Hyatt place is friendly and always welcomes you with a smile and greeting. The breakfast is great and always on time. If you are looking for a great location, this is it. It is close to everything (bus, trolley stops, beach, car rental ABC store) but far enough away to miss the hustle and bustle of the beach. The rooms are nice (they can be small but all rooms in Honolulu are small by other standards). Overall an excellent hotel for our week long stay. We would definitely stay here again.

What a Beautiful Island. My Boyfriend & I visted the islsnd,as an early birthday gift for me & to celebrate our love.We fell in love with the Gorgous beaches. A must do is the Chiefs Luau, the show was incredible. We slso did the North Shore of Oahu & Hanauma Bay Tour to get a good feel for the island and the waters surrounding it.We Admired the views as we drove across the Ko'olau Mountains toward the Valley of the Temples. Enjoyed the scenic shores of Kahana Bay, caught sight of Mokuauia Islet, and visited the legendary Waimea Bay for the opportunity to spot green sea turtles. We Observed local villages, went swimming at the beaches, Snorkeled & Paddleboarded &and visited Turtle Town, Waimea Bay, and the Banzai Pipeline.  We also made a stop at the Dole Plant and had some Pineapple Whip, and saw fields of pineapple, as we journeyed through the island. Great for nature lovers— Get a great feel for Island life in just one day.

Roaches were the main and only problem that I had to deal with. The room was great but needs to be constantly sprayed. The staff was great and extremely nice. They were welcoming and professional. But Bugs!!!

We arrived at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach after a long flight from Australia and received a warm welcome from all the staff here. We hopped into their comfortable bed and slept soundly.The staff were all super friendly and helpful. The place was clean. A short walk to the beach where we swam everyday. Breakfast was good.Our only slight complaint was that the room was quite tight for two of us with our bags.

We had a nice time at Hyatt Place Waikiki, the staff was very accommodating and helpful. Heidi and Gaun were particularly helpful during our last day when our departure flight was delayed and we needed more time at the hotel than originally anticipated.

A family staycation. A block away from Waikiki Beach, near the park and zoo. Outstanding experience from check in to check out. Guan and Janice made those experience memorable is a great way. Professional and engaging! Room nice, clean and with all the Hyatt Place amenities. Plus a view of the ocean. Pool on the smaller size, but who needs a pool when you have the ocean! Tons of good food options too! A very nice get away!

This hotel is in a lovely location, right near the beach and restaurants. We had some noise problems, they were taken care of by the hotel staff. Friendly helpful staff gave us good directions to where things were in Waikiki

The hotel is well situated, a block from the beach at the quiet end of Waikiki, it is nearby convenience stores, and a short walk to restaurants and shopping areas. I was able to be picked up from the front of the hotel for multiple tours or airport shuttles that I took. The staff were accommodating and friendly. The included breakfast, and ability to borrow beach towels (at no extra cost) were very nice extra touches to my stay. I would use this hotel again.

Guan and Heidi took extra steps to make my coworker and I feel extra special during our stay! We had a day to kill before the airport and they assisted us with a late checkout, offered us a hospitality room if we wanted to freshen up and continued to communicate updates to us. It was hands down one of the best hotel experiences I have had- and they did all this in a friendly and welcoming manner too. I definitely recommend staying at this Hyatt and speaking to Guan- he was great to chat with, friendly and down to earth. Loved our experience at this Hyatt!

This hotel is well positioned, close to beach and a short walk to centre of waikiki restaurants and shopping precinct. Good view of diamond head depending on room position, situated in the quieter part of town. all tour busses pick up close to front of hotel.Great friendly staff, nice breakfast just not much variety. if you want secure parking go to aston banyan across the road for long term parking $120 for 7 days.

Everything is beyond resonable doubt. The service was excellent, food is above and beyond expectation, exceptional staff and everything about the experience was mezmerizing, will definitely return and will definitely spread the word.

I have stayed at several Waikiki hotels in the last 10 years and I was very impressed with my stay at Hyatt placeGood things:Staff is very helpful. Dala, at the front desk went above and beyond by showing me my room before I checked in. So helpful. I parked my car with the valet service and they consistently took good care of me. The breakfast was really good, much better that holiday inn express. They didn't have the omelet bar of the Embassy Suite but the fresh fruit and fresh egg and miso soup were excellent. Really greatRoom was quite large with a sofa bed. would be great for a small family, though I was by myself.'Liked the views of Diamond Head and the cityNice location, near the beach, zoo and Diamond Head. Negatives:Elevators were slow.All in all, a great value

This is a fine Hotel which has a few flaws. Number one: There are only two Elevators in this twenty story building. We were on the nineteenth floor and it was a nightmare waiting for an elevator. One time we waited eleven minutes for a ride down. Average time was over five minutes. I figured that we waited a total of at least one and a half hours waiting during our five day stay there.(Maddening).Number two: ice machines are on every other floor. I am handicapped, so I cannot use the stairs. If you are handicapped and want ice, ask for a floor with an ice machine on it.Number three: Valet parking is another nightmare there. At times we had to wait about ten minutes to get off the street to reach the valet parking attendants. Good points: Nice people there. Breakfast was fine and the location was fairly good.Rooms are also nice.

Location is good, close by to all the places you’d wanna go to in waikiki by just walking. Their staff Anabelle is really helpful and accomodating :)Only bummer is they dont have self parking areas, but the zoo where it’s only $1/hr is just a 3 minute walk. They do have valet and for a very reasonable price :)

Room was comfortable and clean. Nice view. We could see the ocean. The free breakfast was fabulous! The best I've ever had. They provided gluten free bread for toast and almond milk. The bed was very comfortable...I slept well

The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and accommodating - we had a minor issue with credit card checking in and the staff patiently went out of their way to help resolve. Property is very up to date and clean.

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is close to all the action of Waikiki but just off to the side where you can have some quiet time. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, our room was clean and tidy, and the view from the tower was amazing. The hotel included a complimentary breakfast buffet that our family completely enjoyed. I would definitely go back.

Great location with spacious rooms. We didn't feel crowded with a family of 4 and we could easily walk to restaurants shopping. My family especially enjoyed the hot breakfast everyday. Would definitely stay here again.

Excellent value for the money. The large complimentary breakfast and clean rooms make this one a no brainer. It would be nice if they made coffee available earlier than 6am, since many people have traveled in from the continental US.

I will say the customer service is excellent. Very helpful, court, and professional. But the hotel is not good. The noise from the streets below will wake you up. The elevators are disgraceful; if you are in a hurry, you’re in trouble. The pool is embarrassing. The restaurant is outside. I would not stay here again.

Nice & clean with a good amount of space in each room. The rooms are cleaned daily & the breakfast is plentiful. The pool is not big, but you have the lovely beach literally 3 minutes walk away. Loads of great restaurants, shops & bus stops nearby. You cannot go wrong booking this hotel & it’s location. The Dominos pizza place in the hotel foyer is very convenient if you fancy staying in after a active day out.

The size of the room we were originally given was not what we were accustomed to for other Hyatt Place Resorts. We were given another room more to our liking after speaking with the Manager. The staff of this establishment were more than accommodating to our nees

Hyatt Place is a great place to stay in whether it is for business or pleasure. My family went to Oahu and decided to stay in the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. The hotel is very close to the beach, great restaurants and shopping centers. The hotel provides a free breakfast which helps start you having a great day.

From the front desk to the housekeepers, our stay was great. AC was not working appropriately and while it required 2 visits to fix, each time they were kind and apologetic. Location was fabulous to both the beach and bus lines. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Hyatt has 3 hotels in Waikiki, Hyatt Place, Hyatt Regency and Hyatt Centric. Hyatt Place is the most accessible, being on the edge of Waikiki. Have stayed at all 3 and like all 3, but Hyatt Place is definitely the best value for the money. Highly recommend

I enjoy staying at the Hyatt Place. The room are clean and quiet and the hotel is not far from the beach and great places to eat. The breakfast is good and there is a laundry facility which is quite helpful.
user_name:
Tracy W
Rohnert Park, United States

review_body: I have been coming to Hawaii for the last 3 years, I thought I would try a new hotel every time but I just love the Hyatt PLACE, last year I did try another hotel for 2 days out of my 7 days but I didnt enjoy it as much. The Hyatt Place for me is perfect, the rooms are modern and clean, the staff in every section are just so lovely, everything is so easy from check in to any queries and I feel so relaxed staying here Maholo!

Nice spot on the east end of Waikiki, a block back from the beach. Very good spot to access/surf south shore breaks. Great breakfast buffet w/ hot meals, good coffee and fresh cut fruit. Parking was a little spendy at $35/night, but super convenient.

Our family of four loved Hyatt Place for the wonderful breakfasts, the cleanliness, the great proximity to the beach and the bus stops, the free beach towels and the great beds. Staff were friendly and helpful.

LOCATIONThe Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach (not to be confused with the nearby Hyatt Regency on Kalakaua Av) is conveniently located on the corner of Paoakalani and Kuhio Avenues; a handy location for the bus stop, a few metres away on Kuhio Av. From here, buses can take you to just about all the important destinations, including the huge Ala Moana Shopping Centre, the Iolani Palace, the Bishop Museum, the Mission Houses Museum, Pearl Harbour or the Waikele Premium Outlets. Bus no 2 seems to be the most popular one going to many of these destinations. The trolley buses do their pickups and drop-offs outside the Aston Hotel, just down the road from the Hyatt, another plus for this location. We used the pink trolley many times to get to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and back again (just $2 a ride). There are numerous ABC Stores close by, the nearest one, on Paoakalani Av, is just a few metres from the front entrance. The ABC Stores, by the way, are the greatest invention since sliced bread: You can buy everything you need there, from clothing to souvenirs, liquor, food, toiletries, snacks etc. And they’re open from early till late every day of the week. Keep your receipts and when you hit $100, you’ll be rewarded with a free bag or a calendar worth 99c! (I guess this is their version of a Rewards program). It’s about a five minute walk to the beach, or 15 minute walk to the famous Moana Surfrider Hotel and the Royal Hawaiian Centre, which seem to me the centre of Waikiki.ROOMAfter spending our first night in a rather small and pokey room on level 11, we were upgraded to room 1006, a much smarter, larger and more elegant room, one floor below, and we couldn’t have been happier. It was huge, airy and light, and with everything in it that we needed. It was just around the corner from the lifts, another big plus, meaning that there was no long walking down the corridors every time we left or returned to our room. It was peaceful and quiet. We hardly heard any noise, either from inside, or from the traffic below us, and we slept well every night. The room featured:- Two large, comfortable double beds- Expansive views of the district, with the mountains in the background- Huge LG TV that could swivel around, so that you could watch it either from the lounge area, or while lying in bed- Three lights strategically positioned in the lounge area, plus a desk lamp and two bedside lamps, all providing decent illumination for reading or writing- A bar fridge, a coffee machine, a few tea bags, but no kettle,and no instant coffee or coffee creamer sachets. But you can buy a small jar of coffee to keep in your room from any of the numerous ABC Stores all around the place, and just grab your milk sachets from breakfast- A single bedside table between the two beds, but with no drawer underneath - Masses of storage space in a four drawer cabinet opposite the bed (it also served as the TV table). Drawers were huge and there are two shelves on the opposite side- A cupboard behind the basin in the “open plan” part of the bathroom. It had two sliding doors which I found a tad stiff, and the cupboard itself was awkward and small. - Some hangers are provided, but the best feature of the cupboard though, was the huge safe at the bottom- Separate sitting or lounge area, which had a generous three-seater sofa with a footrest, a single chair, a handy desk and chair, with aforementioned desk lamp, and a little coffee table- Air con- Two small balconies, each one with a table and two chairs, although too narrow really to be of any practical use, and I also found the railing to be too low for comfort- One case stand- Plenty of power points in convenient locations, to charge all your devicesCompared to our first room, this one was a winner, and thanks to the staff for upgrading us. It made our holiday so much more pleasant and comfortable. BATHROOMI found the bathroom config a bit strange. The toilet and shower (no bath) were behind a solid locking door, but the wash basin is in front of that, in a kind of open plan arrangement. Now I’m the kind of guy that values my privacy in the bathroom, so having the solid locking door, and a toilet and shower set well away from the sleeping area, was a big plus, but the “open plan” basin irked me. I couldn’t understand why they just couldn’t have put the whole thing, including the wash basin, behind the locked door? The shower was fully enclosed in a large cubicle, with strong water pressure, and a sturdy, three quarter glass door to prevent spillage onto the floor. It took me awhile to figure out that the water pressure from the shower head is adjusted by turning the head itself, but once I got the flow right, it was perfect. Water pressure in the basin though was weak and it seemed to take ages to fill it. A small quantity of toiletries was supplied and replenished daily. SERVICEThis is where these guys really excel. Service from all the hotel staff, from the cleaners to the “gallery hosts” (i.e. the guys working on the front desk), the concierge, bartenders, bell boys etc was friendly, polite and efficient. They inspire confidence and look neat and tidy in their smart uniforms. We were made to feel welcome the moment we walked into the lobby. When our Jetstar flight arrived from Syd at 6.00am, we were at the hotel just after 7.00am, pretty exhausted, but fully expecting to have to wait around till 2.00pm or even 3.00pm to be able to check in. We were in for pleasant surprise though. The helpful lady at reception who attended to us, allowed us to go up to our room straight away, after enjoying the free breakfast. What a pleasure that was, to be able to unpack, shower, freshen up and have a nice snooze before going out and exploring what Waikiki had to offer. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff, and any requests, such as for extra toiletries or being able to check-out the night before departure or extra room cards etc were handled promptly and politely. They also have a handy concierge desk in the lounge area, where you can ask the staff member on duty, questions about where to go, what to do etc and they’ll also book tours for you. On their recommendation, we booked an excursion to Hanauma Bay and were very happy with that tour. Our room was cleaned daily to a high standard and the cleaners always ensured that we had plenty of supplies of toiletries. The bell captain and his two assistants at the front, were another useful contact point for basic information such as where to get the bus, which bus to catch etc. And what pleasant and polite guys they were, no matter who was on duty: Always cheerful, smiling and willing to assist. BREAKFASTBreakfast is usually served on the pool deck on level 3. If it’s raining, it will be served downstairs on the ground level. We were pleased to have the free brekky thrown in, when we weren’t expecting it. And everything on offer was fresh, wholesome and tasty, with something for everyone, including fruit, cereals, juices, bread and rolls, sausages, coffee, tea etc. We found the space at the pool deck though to be a bit uncomfortable and overcrowded, and often it was difficult to find somewhere to sit. Staff did their best to keep up, but sometimes we had to wait for new supplies of clean crockery or fresh coffee to arrive. On windy mornings, it was a real challenge to stop everything - from serviettes to paper cups, hats etc - from blowing away, and creating a litter problem. The pigeons were a real nuisance too, ready to swoop on a vacant table and gobble up the leftovers the moment a guest left. Although again, staff did their best - and full marks to them - to keep things flowing smoothly. On our first morning at the Hyatt, it was raining, so breakfast was served indoors on the ground floor, and we found that a more pleasant and relaxed experience; rather than having to eat outdoors in the overcrowded pool area, at the mercy of the elements. Breakfast is served until 9.30am on weekdays and until 10.00am on weekends, but we felt that it should be till 10.00am on all days. Being in a laid back holiday mood, we often slept late and struggled to make it to the pool deck by 9.30am!COMMON AREASSwimming PoolThe pool is on level three. It was a bit of a disappointment, being about the size of a large bathtub. We didn’t bother using it, especially since there is no separate kiddies pool, and I’m not a great fan of sharing swimming pools with young kids. It just didn’t seem like the healthiest space to be putting my head into. Surfaces are quite slippery too.Wi-FiFree wi-fi throughout the hotel. It worked well and was fast and reliable.LiftsThree lifts in our tower. Generally there wasn’t any long waiting for them, and they worked efficiently to get us quickly and safely to your floor and back down again, each time. There’s no light though to indicate which lift was arriving, so one needed to be alert and watching the doors like a hawk.GymThere is a fully equipped gym on the same level as the pool.LaundryThe all-important self service laundry is also on level 3, but in the second tower. To access it from our tower, was a bit of a mission, requiring us to walk through the slippery, wet swimming pool area, through the gym and finally into the laundry, with card access required at each point.There are only three washing machines and three dryers, which is simply not adequate for a place the size of the Hyatt, and we always struggled to find available machines. It became a hassle to have to schlep our washing from level 10, to the laundry on level 3, through all the aforementioned entry and exit points, only to find that no machines were available, then schlep our washing back to our room and try again later. This hotel really needs to double the capacity of it’s guest laundry facilities. When you do however, find an available machine, they’re easy to operate. The cost is $3 for a wash and $3 for a half-hour dry cycle which is usually sufficient for a small load. I found it quite handy to be able to pay with my cc, rather than hunt around for small change and here’s a small miracle: The price you see is the price you pay! No extra levies, taxes, surcharges or gratuities, so $3 it is for a wash or a dry, nothing more to pay. It’s useful having this facility in the hotel, rather than having to take one’s washing to an outside laundromat (if one can find one), so I guess that one should be grateful for that, because not all hotels have them, but we did find it a frustrating experience each time having to wait for a machine to become available.Lounge area and lobbyDownstairs on the ground floor is a bar and lounge area. It’s a cool and comfy space with a homely, laid back and relaxed ambience. There are soft upholstered chairs or firm wooden chairs and tables, a couple of TV screens and newspapers, with both the local “Honolulu Star- Advertiser” and the “Wall Street Journal” available free of charge. We found it the perfect place to chill out, read the newspapers, or just sit and watch the passing parade. You can also order food and drink. The bar has some happy hours deals from 5-7pm nightly. I enjoyed a pint (that’s about 475ml in Aussie speak or slightly bigger than a schooner) of local ale for just under $6. Sometimes, we bought our dinners at the local ABC store and made ourselves comfortable and ate at one of the tables, and no-one seemed to mind. Also, just in front of the reception area, are a couple of easy chairs and tables so you can hang out there as well, although it’s not quite as relaxed, because it can get pretty hectic, with new arrivals, people waiting for their pickups etc. All the common areas are clean, tidy and well maintained. There are toilets just in front of the lifts, as well as a couple of computers for guests to use free of charge (you just need to get a code from one of the gallery hosts).DESTINATION FEES & CARD HOLDSJust a word about my experience with “destination fees” and credit card holds. When I checked in, a hold was put on my credit card for $225, being the $25 a day deposit for nine days. This was no surprise, and I was expecting it. However, I wasn’t expecting that another charge, this time for $210 would be put on my card a day or two later. When I queried this, I was told that it was the “destination fee”. But nowhere on my booking form, nor in any comms that I had with the hotel, was anything mentioned about a “destination fee”. I protested to the gallery host about it. She explained to me that the hotel now charged all guests this fee to cover things like free wi-fi and who knows what else, but obviously, it’s just a rather sneaky method for the hotel to recoup the commission it pays to the booking agency. (And congrats to the Hyatt’s P.R. dept or whoever came up with this fancy, but rather meaningless term: “destination fee”. In Las Vegas they call it a “resort fee” but since the Hyatt isn’t really a resort, I guess they had to dream up another term for it). However, in view of the fact that it was never explained to me and was not part of my contract with the booking agency, the gallery host agreed to cancel it. But that was not the only nasty surprise. On checkout, I was presented with another bill, this time for $100, which the gallery host claimed was also a “destination fee”. Again I protested, and on further checking, it transpired that the “destination fee” only came into effect in April of this year (2018), whereas my booking was made in January. More apologies and another cancellation. But it all left a sour taste in my mouth. And to cap it all off, on the the day that I left I noticed yet another hold on my card for $225, which I presumed was simply a duplication of the original deposit. So I left the hotel with holds on my card totalling $660, being two deposits of $225 each and a false destination fee of $210. Within a day, $435 had been removed from hold, but as of this writing, I am still attempting to have the last hold of $225 removed. My card company advised me that it would take a month for the hold to be released, although I can’t say whether that it their fault or the hotel’s.SUMMARYWe spent nine nights here in Sept and on the whole, apart from the schmozzle with the extra charges and cc holds, everything went smoothly. We were upgraded to a fabulous room that we loved, with a nice view and all the comforts we could ask for. Service was outstanding at all levels, and the location is convenient. Free wi fi and brekky are an added plus, but just watch out for the “destination fee”. The pool isn’t great, but with the beach just a few metres down the road, you’ll hardly need it and it’s best left for the kiddies to enjoy. We loved hanging out in the lounge area downstairs. Having an on-site laundromat was useful, when you could score a machine to use. The place is clean and well maintained throughout and hums along like a well oiled machine.

Our group of 12 consisted of 6 who had never been to Hawaii, 1 who had never been to Oahu and 5 who hadn't been to Oahu in over 20+ years. That is why I picked Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Although not disappointed with the hotel, most of us determined that we would not stay in Waikiki Beach again. Sadly, the homeless population is quite high although I never felt unsafe, there were several incidents when you just had to cross the street or be very observant of your surroundings.As far as the Hyatt Place. When we booked they weren't imposing the destination fee, so that was another reason for choosing this hotel along with the free breakfast.Dino checked us in and provided great customer service. Some rooms, the sleeper is just a chair and not a sofa. My sister, brother-in-law and niece requested to be moved to a double queen and they got a very nice upgrade.Our housekeeper on the 6th floor of the Diamond Head Tower was excellent and very friendly. Breakfast provided enough variety, although I would have liked to seen turkey meat products, more fruit and pastries.It is conveniently located to: the beach, bus line, ABC, restaurants, shopping and the zoo. A Domino's Pizza is connected off the lobby and some in our group took advantage of that a couple times.We rented a van for part of our stay and if you're willing to ride around for about 15 mins or so, you can find free parking in the area. Twice we did pay to park at the zoo.Mahalo for providing us with a great visit to Oahu.

The location was fine...just a short block off the beach and an easy walk to loads of restaurants and shops. Staff was exceedingly friendly and accommodating.  We had a high floor, ocean view room which was very spacious and had loads of outlets for charging, a large safe, and a fridge. Bathroom had shower and toilet separate from sink area. Shower was large stall and had a laundry line. Only negative about the room was that the decor was slightly dated. Breakfast buffet was terrific with lots of fresh fruit. Overall, a great value.

Amazing stay! My only recommendation is with the breakfast, I wish the coffee was a local, not Seattle’s best. Besides that, amazing experience. The staff was phenomenal and the rooms were so comfortable. Hyatt has great beds! Will return!

Stayed for 5 nights during October 2018. Location was good but be prepared to walk a little to the main hub of Waikiki as it is on the last block before the zoo. Included breakfast had great variety every morning. Bed was comfortable. Wifi was fast. Be warned, they charge both a "room/resort" fee every night PLUS a "destination" fee which does add up especially if you're staying for a week or more.

Great location, out of the hustle & bustle of the main shopping strip. Walking distance to beach & shopping. Top spot for Tour & Trolley bus pick ups clean rooms with friendly staff. Would stay here again.

We booked at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for my wife's birthday & our wedding. One of the selling features was the complimentary hot breakfast & location, location, location!!We arrived around 11pm on a Wednesday night. We had a fantastic ocean view room on the PH floor (aka 20th floor).CHECK IN: Our "hired" VIP airport transfer vehicle broke down a few blocks away from the hotel so the driver unloaded our 3 bags of luggage and told us to walk. Tori Cook welcomed us & got us checked in. After dropping our bags off in the room, we headed to the lobby bar for some food & drinks. Erin Lum was our bartender/chef. ROOM: Our room was very clean, well maintained and spacious. More than we were expecting. And how about that bidet.....first experience with that feature & we're now looking at one for our home!!BREAKFAST: best complimentary hot breakfast we've had with good variety and early enough that you could get in/out & carry on with your day. We did have an issue with the scrambled eggs not being a little under done but when we mentioned this to the front desk they were very quick to apologize and offer to "make it up" to us. This was above and beyond...we were simply letting them know to avoid others from a possible upset tummy.POOL: pool deck didn't have enough loungers however I can appreciate that the space is shared with tables to accommodate the breakfast crowd. It was nice to be able to bring your own drinks to the pool....REMEMBER NO GLASS BY THE POOL!!! You know who you are....VALET: we had a vehicle for 4 of our 10 days. Valet was efficient however we did find it strange that the radio was on in the morning when we specifically had it turned off so we could hear "Siri" giving us directions.....EXTENDED CHECK OUT: our departure flight wasn't until 10pm. The hotel graciously gave us a very late check out of 2pm at no extra charge. We opted to pay a half day rate to keep the room until 6pm so we didn't have to store our luggage.Overall experience was great with this hotel! Sadly as of November 1st the complimentary breakfast will only be for Hyatt members who book "a qualified rate"....

Two blocks from the beach. Spacious rooms, great beds. Sea view not expected on the city view. Free Wi-Fi and breakfast. Breakfast not great but it’s free. Customer service is average. The destination fee was sprung on check out. Wasn’t written in any of the booking information as outstanding and to pay, beware! Great value overall though. Spacious rooms and great for holiday

We stayed here in April on a 4 day tour of Honolulu. Overall we liked our stay. Just a little inconvenience, when on the first day the fire alarm went off in the hotel and forced every guest in the hotel to wake up in the middle of the night.Other than that, everything went smooth. Rooms are spacious and modern. The hotel staff is nice and helping. On our last day we checked out and left our luggage with the hotel because our flight was in the evening. On our return they gave us a complimentary room to freshen up. They also arranged a car for us to go to the airport. It was cheaper than the taxi. Hotel serves free buffet breakfast in the morning. It wasn't top notch but wasn't bad either.Overall I would recommend this hotel especially if you are travelling with small kids.

Together with another couple we recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for a week and found the accommodation to be excellent value for money. Great central location, tasty breakfast and extremely helpful staff from reception, bar and tour assistance.

50th anniversary trip, (seven night stay).Good room on 8th floor( "DALA" at front desk was great)Received a bottle of wine as gift with a card wishing us well on our 50th anniversary, signed by staff (erin,dala,catherine,biona Catherine...GREAT STAFF!. Excellent breakfast in morning,(MARY-JANE at breakfast very friendly) large room (pali tower), NO problems with elevators, Clean rooms ,comfortable beds, close to everything, (beach, bus connections ,stores etc....) Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed at the Hyatt Place while in Oahu for 8 days. The room was clean, the staff was great, the full breakfast was awesome. We were there with a wedding party of about 50 people and would meet every morning at the full breakfast buffet. It was a delightful stay.

great place to visit great staff convenient to shops and the beach our second stay and again no complaints I would recommend this place to stay to anyone coming to Oahu to visit even if you're coming from the outer islands this place is pet friendly and that is a great plus

We very much enjoyed our stay! The location is excellent, our room was quite large, the staff was very nice, the breakfast was good, and the wi-fi was fast and reliable. We had an ocean-view room with a balcony, and we enjoyed sitting out there looking at Waikiki Beach. We would definitely choose to stay in this hotel again!

Great Hotel....Exceptional service....Convenient location....Breakfast was included...Great value for money! I definitely recommend this hotel. Rooms were very clean and well designed as compared to other similar hotels.

Had an great three night stay at this hotel. Rooms were comfortable and clean, really nice location (very close to beach and stores) and service was excellent.Guan at the front desk was extremely helpful and very attentive. He assisted me with everything from where to find some good souvenirs to setting up a hospitality room in order to accommodate my late flight home (Amongst a handful of other things). Guan made my last day in Waikiki a breeze, allowing me to plan some fun activities before my late flight home.I would stay here again.

I always enjoy staying at Hyatt branded hotels and the Hyatt Place in Waikiki did not disappoint. For this trip I leveraged my World of Hyatt points for a five-night stay. Here are some pros:Check-in w/ Angeline - Recognized me as a loyalty member, made sure my room assignment met my needs, and texted me shortly after check-in to ensure all was well. - Angeline did tell me the wireless may not be working correctly. After she texted me I let her know I did not have Internet and she connected me with the support staff who was very nice and helpful in getting my devices connected. - Very grateful my room was ready early when I checked in around 10:30 AM since my flight arrived an hour early.Room - Bigger and more spacious than I expected (had the double Queen room). Additionally, the partial ocean view and balcony was a nice bonus I was not expecting. - Appreciated everything was clean and in working order. - Service staff were very friendly and smiled.Breakfast - Great breakfast with a variety of options, even for the health conscious. - Really neat they offer miso soup, rice, and tofu as a breakfast item.Location - Less than 5 min walk to the beach and towels are provided by the front desk. - Walking distance to a lot of food and shopping.A few improvement suggestions for the hotel: - Add a power tower in the gym (simple piece of equipment that doesn’t take up much space that allows for pullups, dips, leg raises, etc.). - Be nice if there was a microwave or two in the lobby for guests instead of having to ask the staff and/or include them in the rooms. - Complimentary bottled water was offered as a daily perk for being a loyalty member (I believe you have to be at least Discoverist). It would be nice if the water was included/restocked in the room instead of having to ask in the lobby.Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and it contributed to a relaxing, solo, recharge trip. Thanks!

Hyatt place Waikiki is a great place to stay if you are looking for somewhere with central location (two seconds from the beach) , amazingly nice and helpful staff and super comfortable and clean rooms. All Tours for us picked up from this hotel so super convenient for sightseeing. Expedia desk is at the hotel and they are great in picking what to do. Was very happy with my stay here and would recommend to anyone contemplating on where to stay. Plus they put on a great breakfast spread by the pool every morning, good fuel for a busy day at the beach.

Stayed for 3 nights and found this to be a well located Hotel. The room provided was a good size and no real issues. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and pleasant, the location is at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki beach and is just a short walk to shops and restaurants. The hotel does have an open air pool on the 3rd floor. This seems to be one of the few hotels which offer a free breakfast 9 around the pool area and it was popular, whilst there were a variety of items available it did not appeal to us so we only used the option once.I would have no issues in staying at this hotel again.

We stayed here for 4 nights and every night we were told that no self-parking space is available, even if it was 11am in the morning. I highly suspect that this was not the reality and was just those valet parking people's excuses and their goal is to persuade us to use Valet parking, which is $10 more expensive. The thing is that we rented a luxury car and we don't want valet people to scratch it. We end up parking at another place for all the 4 nights.Overall, this was a very terrible experience.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 3 days in Sept/18. We have stayed here several times. Location is great. Very central to Waikiki Beach, shopping, stores and restaurants. Very walkable to all amenities including buses.

The hotel and staff exceeded our expectations. We were very pleased with the size of our room and the view. The location was very convenient to walk to the beach and shopping. Juliana did a wonderful job maintaining our room, Dala at the bar/restaurant, the concierge, and the front desk staff and porters were all very friendly and always ready to help. I definitely would stay here again!

The room was just right for size. Amenities in the room were all there for our convenience. Service was efficient and thorough. Hotel location near the beach, restaurants and shopping was also a plus for us. Desk staff friendly and helpful.

Great place and location, breakfast which was included offered a huge variety and changed daily, the guest facilities were excellent with the ability to borrow beach towels and chairs.The Gym was only slight disappointment in that it was limited and staff and guest used it as a short cut to the pool area which was annoying and distracting when using the gym

Overall great place to stay, booked a 20th floor ocean view room with 2 queen size beds. Room was spacious for 2 adults & 2 teenagers & direct ocean view of Waikiki.Breakfast was included, quite basic but has everything you need to start your day, saves a few dollars.Would stay again, the staff were friendly & the overall environment is layed back & 1 block from the beach.The Hyatt place provided everything you needed for the beach, towels, beach chairs which came in handy.Can walk to everything, it is down the Diamond Head end out of the hustle & bustle of the main shopping area.

Great Hyatt location blocks from famous Waikiki beach. Surrounded by other hotels, resorts and restaurants. The view of diamond head was great. Pool was a bit small for such a large hotel and seemed to be crowded always. Breakfast was rushed as crowds hover looking for seating.

Easy access to the beach. Reception staff extremely helpful & friendly, nothing was too much trouble.Room size was way above expectation, & bed very comfortable. The friendliness of Hawaii starts here at checkin.

We are happy we selected this hotel where we stayed here for 6 nights sept 2018. Great location where Waikiki beach is approx a 5 min walk, rooms are spacious, buffet breakfast had a great selection and some items were changed each day to provide variety. Compared to other hotels we found this one to suit our budget as well. There is a gym and pool also. Would definitely stay here again.
My wife and I stay here every year when we visit.As far as we’re concerned there is no better value in Waikiki.From the front desk receptionist to the staff of housekeeping the service is impeccable!

Decent location for getting out and shopping and seeing the water. Stayed here several times for work, the staff is always kind and accommodating, even when I’m trying to order food at off peak hours. Cool, dark, and clean room.

The location of Hyatt Place is very convenient and perfect! About a block from the beach and perfect walking distance to restaurants. Room was cleaned everyday and our housekeeping lady was very sweet and accommodating. Valet was easy and serviced by kind and considerate guys. The free breakfast was excellent and perfect for what one needed to start the day. I would definitely return to Hyatt Place!

We were welcomed by a very friendly young man. Who explained the room would be ready later and he would email us , which he did He has since helped us with our transfers The trip we organised to pearl harbour nwas pricey. But turned out to be worth every dollar

Our arrival set the tone for our stay. Despite the very late hour, Mervyn greeted us personally and quickly settled us into the hotel. The king size room was especially spacious, providing a sense of comfort. The staff are exceptionally friendly and responsive to enquiries. For beach location lovers, the location is perfect. A short stroll to a protected beach. For shopping, The Bus stop to Ala Moana Shopping Center is adjacent to the hotel and there is also the option for the "Pink Line Waikiki Trolley" which is a round trip to the Center, in the same street. You will enjoy your time at this hotel.

This hotel was in a great spot on Waikiki Beach. It was a little further down the beach and was a little bit quieter than the other side - however all of the shopping/dining areas were only a short walk away and was never an issue!We try to stay in Hyatt Hotels wherever we go, and Oahu was no exception. Upon check-in, the team was amazing. We had a beautiful room, with a view - and it was large. The hotel was very clean as well.The included breakfast was good - and a wonderful perk to help you spend less money on food during your travels.We've never experienced this level of hospitality before. The front desk, housekeeping, Gallery, Breakfast, and valet staff were all excellent and went far above and beyond. We spent a couple nights in the Gallery getting some drinks and the employee, Dala, always went above and beyond. She was simply fantastic and we really enjoyed her conversation! We made sure to say bye before we left. Thank you for a wonderful experience, Hyatt. To those that are wondering about this hotel - don't hesitate. Just book it - Its a wonderful experience and a great value.

This hotel was walking distance to the beach. Had a great view of Diamondhead. The staff was fun and friendly. They allowed me to check in and check out with flexibility. I stayed at the Hilton Waikiki and was not impressed with them. I found the Hyatt place to be very welcoming and exactly what I needed.

I often come to Honolulu. It is my first stay at your place. It is not well organized. Bedroom sheet should be changed every three or four days, but today is my fifth day and I requested them to change bedding. Also, there is No writing material. In addition, we are scheduled to stay for 7 nights. There were only five hangers in the closet. No lotion or soap until requested. There were bugs on balcony and I had to request spraying. While spraying they should close from window to balcony. However, a worker widely opened the window. The chemical smell was overwhelming for many hours. We had to go outside for a while.

and the breakfast buffet should be moved inside to protect the food from the birds. The location of the hotel was great because its located on block from the beach, so if you want to take a walk at anytime on the beach it doesnt take much of your time getting there.

This was our second visit to this hotel and we were thrilled with our decision to return.We chose an ocean view room on this occasion and each day enjoyed a beautiful view of the Pacific Ocean. We felt the additional cost was worth it to us.The hotel has a very welcoming atmosphere and the staff are all extremely helpful and appear to be a very cohesive group of people. We appreciated the atmosphere this smaller Waikiki hotel was able to provide.We would like to mention how grateful we were to receptionist Maile, who helped us greatly during our check-in process. The hotel is exceptionally clean, both in the public areas and in the guest rooms, and the lifts are easily accessible at all times.We feel the hotel offers very good value for money and the included breakfast, though basic, is an extra bonus.Greg & Judy from Oz

The accommodation was excellent and close to all activities eg; shopping, transport, beach. The accommodation was clean, friendly service, nice rooms and great view of the beach.
