The front reception staff couldn't do enough to make sure your stay was an enjoyable experience. Highly recommend this hotel.

Once again our stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki beach was Amazing.One of the reasons we chose to stay here has to be the friendliness of the staff. Angelina, Lisa, Catherine, Tori, Erin were very friendly and they made us feel welcomed. The staff makes sure you have all you might need for the beach like towels or chairs. The hotel is about a block away from the beach very convenient to shops,restaurants.

Hyatt Place is about one block from the ocean front and a great place to stay. We had a room with a small lounge area which was great! Staff were very friendly and helpful! Breakfast is included but fairly average - the fruit and yoghurt great but the hot food was not all that fantastic. Still it was included so saved money. Would return.

Kim, at check-in, was fantastic! She was friendly and so helpful with everything.We had a King suite that was very large, clean, and comfortable. Love the walk-in shower.Breakfast buffet is great--one of the best ever. Who could resist fresh pineapple every morning. Staff continuously restocking and cleaning the area.Very convenient location--just a couple of blocks to Waikiki. Hop-on/Hop-off shuttle stop is less than a block down the street. Marriott is across the street and is a common picking-up location for tours. Note too that they have an all-you-can-eat Prime Rib buffet (check them out for more details).Hotel probably has close to half of the guests being Japanese or other Asian nationalities. Breakfast items were available for their tastes as well.Pool is small but who goes to Honolulu for a pool anyway.Definitely recommended.

Overall the stay at Hyatt Place was very good. I very rarely give an excellent rating as I feel that complacency sets in if everyone rates "excellent".A few minor matters: 1. Fuller explanation of timing of room cleaning could have been better. 2. A hand-out detailing facilities available maybe a good idea.

Very nice hotel on a perfect location, breakfast (included) was tasteful, nicely presented and had more than enough choices, our room was spacious and the coffee and tea facilities and fridge a nice bones. The beds were excellent!

I reserved an ocean view and said it better be above tree line also (to make sure of the view) and that is Exactly what we got! We were on 19th floor :) We want to give a shout out to our Housekeeper Jovie, she was awesome and very friendly. All the staff was great and helpful. If we go back we will stay there again. And the free breakfasts were Great also.

Loud noise, had to sleep with a pillow over my head. It was some sort of equipment noise that blasted through the closed window. I like to sleep with the air condition off and enjoy the local weather, but it was too loud. Also, no screen which would keep out the bug population.

My wife and I planned our 20 year anniversary trip to Hyatt Waikiki Beach. We had a great time. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. Staffing was pleasant and tended to all of our needs. I would definitely come back to this location in the future.

We stayed here for 9 nights, before moving up to stay at Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore. The hotel was lovely. It was clean and well kept. The bed was amazing and so comfortable! It had everything we needed for a great stay. It’s literally a 1 minute walk to the beach! Great location! In fact, it was better than the Turtle Bay Resort we stayed in, which was a 5 star resort and we paid a lot more for!

The Hyatt staff are always so welcoming and helpful. Rooms are spacious, clean, and bright. The breakfast offers different options every morning. I have loved every stay I’ve had over the last 4 years.

We stayed at the Hyatt for 10 days, wonderful vacation, the staff was so helpful and the location is perfect. Minute walk to the beach, zoo, diamond Head and the aquarium. Great way to celebrate our birthdays.

So i was there at the end of June 2018. So when I arrived I was really impressed with the lobby. Awesome scene. open air. The staff was amazing. We did arrive about hour ahead of schedule they tried to check us in however our room was not ready. however we only waited 15 minutes and they had the room ready. Of course this was at the height of summer vacation so they had alot of guest. TIP:Make your flight reservations closer to check in time. Once we got to the room it was very nice. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The size of the room was fine. Of course we are not in Hawaii to stay in our rooms. The breakfast is awesome, it can get pretty busy but they have enough staff to make sure everything is kept full. TIP: They have a tray in the room you can bring down if you want to eat in your room. The pool is small but the beach is steps away so we did not use the pool. I read in previous reviews about the elevators were slow. We did not experience that. At times they were small waits but nothing to complain about at all. Now if you are renting a car plan on valet parking fee. I think it's $30 a day but you can call the hotel on the exact amount. There is no place to park, valet is the best choice. There is a parking structure across the street that is cheaper. I did not bother to check the fees but someone said it is cheaper. they do have beach chairs for rent. I did ask the front desk for beach chairs and was told it was extra and it came in some package. I suggest calling about that if you plan on hanging out at the beach and want chairs.All and all this is a great place to stay the staff is very helpful to make sure your stay is comfortable as possible. There is a convenient store very close. TIP: the Hawaii charges for store bags 10 cents if you dont want to pay 10 cents for a plastic bag bring one. For the price you place you do get your monies worth. It's not five star but thanks to the staff they are five stars

This really is a family friendly hotel. The staff made the stay worthwhile and I was able to overlook the fact that my room was dated compared to the other side of the hotel. There's free wifi and breakfast which was a huge plus. We were able to avoid the daily resort fees because we booked during a funky period so that was another plus. Self parking is about $12-30 a day and valet is $37. They also set out beach towels early in the morning for the guests to take out to the beach. Very satisfied with the overall stay.

First didn’t realize Hyatt Place was there so went to Regency! When I checked in at Place it was amazing! Nice room, fabulous customer service! I couldn’t have asked for more. I’m VERY pleased with my stay!

We really enjoyed our stay here. Our flight arrived HOURS before check-in time, but the staff at Hyatt Place were quickly able to arrange a room that was ready for us. The room was lovely and had a small terrace with a partial view of Diamond Head and the beach. We had an island tour scheduled for the following day, and Hyatt Place was a pick-up point. Since this was prior to buffet hours, the gentlemen at the Starbucks counter prepared a few things for us at minimal cost. The hotel is a short walk to the beach and many wonderful restaurants and shopping areas. We were also easily able to use Uber to get around even further. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've been to. Seating was on the hotel terrace, but there was also indoor seating available. The only drawback was that housekeeping disposed of a liquor bottle that had a small amount left and was not placed in the trash. My husband spoke to the management who acknowledged this error, and kindly put a credit on our account. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable and beautiful location during their stay in Waikiki.

I was happily surprised by the Hyatt Place's free breakfast, excellent proximity to the beach and Kapiolani Park, and comfort of the beds in my room. I'd definitely stay here again. Downsides are that the pool is nothing special - small and not nearly as nice as it looks online. But the beach is close and there are other things to do.

This is our second stay at Hyatt Place, staying in room 1633. Check in was very easy and friendly even though we were there very early. Kimberly was very welcoming and allowed us to leave our luggage there even though our room wasn’t ready. We got a text when it was which was convenient. She enquired as to why we were staying there again, which is for my wife’s 50th birthday and we also had friends staying in the same hotel. Our room is spacious by any standards and even more so by Waikiki standards. Nice king size bed, sofa, desk, balcony with table and chairs and standard size bathroom. It is well maintained by housekeeping. The view to the ocean between 2 other buildings is still spectacular. You can see marine craft, planes and surfers while sitting on the balcony. Location is excellent. Walking distance to virtually anywhere. Couple of hundred metres to the beach and the Pink Line shuttle bus stop is very close by where you can get to Ala Moana shopping centre for $2.Now the reason for knocking off 1 star. If the check in staff think it’s relevant or important to ask for a reason for your stay and that reason is relatively important to you (ie my wife’s 50th) then you think they might recognise that on the day. Nothing over the top but maybe a card saying happy birthday. Withstanding that small point we found the Hyatt Place was very good value for money the first time we stayed here and it’s still delivering on that on this stay.

We found this hotel to be very accommodating, staff extremely helpful - especially Angeline on front desk- room was clean and comfortable, price was reasonable with breakfast buffet included. Beach about two blocks from hotel, but towels and beach chairs provided at front desk. More than met our needs for a fairly brief special occasion stay.

We were happy with every aspect of this hotel and our experience. Great value and just a couple blocks from the beach. Valet was fast and seamless, check in was quick and we got an upgrade which was great. Breakfast was crowded but they handled it very well and opened it up in the lobby as well as the normal poolside area on the 3rd floor. Kids liked the open air atrium.

Wife and I enjoyed the great breakfasts, the good attention to our room, the quick vale attention to our car, and very friendly attention to our needs. Thanks! Room was quiet and very comfortable. We greatly appreciated all the attention from the emploees

This is probably my 20th time coming to HI within 3 years period and everytime I come here, I always try different hotels from Four Seasons to a small local hotels just to have different experiences. And so far this hotel has the BEST customer service with great staff and I had such a pleasant stay during my stay. I actually didn’t know about this place until I had to use my Hyatt anniversary night coupon which expires soon, so I decided to give it a try. I flew from South Korea, landed at 9 am, dead tired so I was hoping they let me check in at no extra cost. I used Hyatt Express check in app informing my arrival time would be 11 am, and even before I arrived at hotel at 10ish, I was informed that my room was ready! So I got to hotel, short line for check in, got to my room. As a Hyatt elite member, I get late check out as one of benefits but it’s subject to availability and hotels in Waikiki never let me take that benefit because it’s always busy here but Hyatt Place Waikiki guaranteed my late check out without hesitation. so I really appreciate that.  Location: One~two blocks from Waikiki so it’s super convenient to go to the beaches and other places. ABC store is located next door and there is Domino’s on the first floor so I loved having my late night snack.  Parking: This is VERY important as overnight parking in Waikiki is crazy expensive! Valet is $35 and self parking is $25 but self parking wasn’t available due to space. HOWEVER, you can park at the Honolulu Zoo for $1 per hour, and you can even renew the time via mobile. It’s only one block away so it was really convenient! Instead of paying $25-35 per night, we only paid $10 for overnight parking.  Breakfast: BEST!!! free breakfast is served to all guests, which you can hardly see in Waikiki area. Breakfast is so good and had varieties from Asian (Kimchi, rice, miso soup) to continental.  Staff: Everyone is so nice and makes you feel so welcomed as you walk in. Supervisor Jade is always there to make sure the guests are not having any issues. Angeline, who helped me with check in, and Eian who helped me with check out process were so helpful!  Overall: I am definitely coming back here next time I am in HI, and will also recommend all of my friends and family this place when they come visit. Thank you for your great service and hospitality.  <Korean> 가성비 최고의 호텔입니다.  우선 수영장이 있긴 있는데 작다보니 리조트피를 따로 안 받아서 돈 세이브가 많이 됐고요, 어차피 와이키키 해변이 바로 한블락 떨어져있어서 해변에서 놀면되서 수영장 안가게 됩니다.  주차도 너무 좋았던게 와이키키 주차가 무진장 비싼데 (평균 $30정도) 여긴 호놀룰루 동물원에 주차하시면 되고 한시간에 1불 밖에 안합니다. 즉 하루 왠종일해도 $24 밖에 안해요. 낮에는 차타고 놀다가 밤에 들어와서 자고 다시 아침에 나가니 주차비가 $10 밖에 안 들어서 너무 좋았습니다.  아침식사도 매우 훌륭합니다. 무료제공치고 종류도 많고 든든하고.. 무엇보다 흰쌀밥과 김치, 된장국이 있어서 하루를 든든히 시작할 수 있어서 좋았네요.  방은 어떤 방에 배정받느냐에 따라 크기가 다른데 우선 퀸침대 2개 들어가있는 방들은 대부분 다 커서 한가족 지내시는데 문제 없을 겁니다. 소파도 침대소파 (더블사이즈) 전환가능해서 성인 6명까지 주무실 수 있으세요.  암튼 와이키키해변 호텔 중 가성비 너무 좋았던 호텔이고 다음에도 또 방문할 예정입니다.

I would not choose this hotel if I had read the reviews more carefully. Self parking was always full, maybe consider take down the false self parking information from your website. And claim there is valet parking ONLY!

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was the best hotel we've stayed at. We've been to Honolulu more than 10 times and without a doubt this hotel was a great choice for us. The Staff are friendly and always engaging. The breakfast was excellent. No complaints at all.

I recently stayed at this hotel, due to a package that my niece booked for her wedding guests, so sad that she was sold a bill of goods, and couldn't get out of the contract. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, and if wasn't for family loyalty I would have walked out, 5 minutes after I checked in, the check in process is the WORST! Long lines and only 2 elevators, fire hazard if you ask me, our bathroom was disgusting, scummy bathtub, and so small you couldn't close the door when using the toilet. Also, Dominos on the first floor stinks up the lobby. Very low rent, when you need to call the front desk, its always busy, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE to speak of. There is no many options to choose from in HONO, at the same or better price, this is worse than a MOTEL six! I can't believe Hyatt ( PLACE ), what ever that means put there name on this property, old and not maintained, time for a make over. Emailed manager after stay and didn't get much of a response, just sorry.

Poor condition of AC, made loud noise so could not fall sleep. One day went back with broken AC which required repair. Other than that, it was okay. Great location and good complimentary breakfast. $35 per day valet parking.

Friendly staff, great customer service, very clean hotel and room. Great location and proximity to shopping and restaurant options, and only a short walking distance to iconic Waikiki Beach. Will definitely stay here again.

It’s a really nice hotel and a great value. The location is solid, not right on the beach but easily walkable to anywhere in Waikiki. The free breakfast is nice, gets fairly crowded. The pool is a little on the small side. We had a nice ocean view from our room. Overall, a really nice hotel and stay!

Great location in downtown Waikiki with a 2 block walk to the beach. We stayed on the 12th floor for 4 nights with a great view of the ocean. It is a very congested area so if you don't like having to be stuck in traffic it is not a good place to stay. The hotel website says they charged $25 a night for self parking but upon arrival we were told they had valet parking only for $35 a night. We parked in a garage directly across the street which is $30 a night or $110 for a week but they only accept cash but it is well worth it if you are staying 4 nights or more. Free breakfast every morning on the 3rd floor which is outside dining. The room is rather small with not much area to put your luggage but the rooms come with a small balcony. Overall you are paying for the location but the Hyatt Place is always a good place to stay.

We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms/bed were clean comfortable, and the staff super friendly. I read a complaint or two before about the elevators; we did not have a problem with them at all. There are two separate set of elevators, one set of two elevators in the front by guest check-in/out, and another set of three elevators further behind around the corner by the two gift shops. We stayed at a time that seemed rather crowded, we were told there were about 1300 guests at the time, but everything seemed to run smoothly, even if the breakfast you enjoyed for free got crowded. Well done organizing the by staff to separate it into the 1st and 3rd floor for breakfast to accommodate the crowd, and also allow one to bring breakfast back to your room. Finally, I thought the selection of breakfast was great from hot oatmeal, miso soup, scrambled eggs to toast, pancakes, waffles (it's only pancakes or waffles, and not both on any given day). We stayed here for five nights and the breakfast turned out to be a very welcome value. Would definitely stay here again; it's only 3 short block from the beach, great location. Valet and cleaning and all staff really, were very friendly and helpful. One negative: our room was by the elevators, or the front of a hall. I don't know if it's like this for other rooms, but it seemed like you could hear the wind wooshing through the hall, and it was rather loud. By the 2nd or 3rd day, we got over it, must've gotten used to it. But something I thought I should mention it. Oh, finally, if you have more than two guests in your room, plan to bring small toiletries, as there are not a lot to share. I was surprised no Q-tips or cotton balls were provided. I have just come to expect that at hotels.

We visited this hotel during the time hurricane lane came to Hawaii. The staff did a great job with Service and Info. Despite the fact that it finally did not arrive to Honolulu it was good to know that we can trust the people there that helped a lot Normally breakfast is served nearby the pool but in those days it was inside at the lobby area. This is something that need to care because this is not the proper place for a breakfast. Not enough places to sit and not well organized. Fully understand the situation but maybe a other position would be better. All, it has great potential to enjoy your vacation we didn’t had the luck to do so because of the storm but hopefully next time.

Our party of 9 had a amazing stay at this hotel. Everything from the booking process, arrival and treatment during the stay was top notch! there was not a negative thing about this place. The complimentary breakfast was really good with a lot of choices. The area was kept clean and replenished often by the hard working staff. The rooms were spotless and had a amazing view. The lobby/bar area is a beautiful well kept place to hang out and have a cold one! The location is near many restaurants and 1 block from the beach which makes it a perfect spot. The staff was very helpful with getting cabs and any other questions that we had. Special thanks to Ihab and Dino for making our stay great, see you again in the future!

excellent staffing,laundry room was a big plus. Having a breakfast buffet was great & good eating . Location was perfect near beach,shopping,food,Zoo, & gift shoppes. Buss & cab service nearbuy . All in all a great stay
user_name:
Murray s
Dix Hills, New York

review_body: This hotel is conveniently location a block from the beach . Very short walk to Waikiki beach . Hotel is in good conditions , room are clean, open lobby space , breakfast included, spacious room about 400sqft . Bedding comfortable .Valet parking available . Staffs are amazing , friendly , accommodating and helpful . Everytime I visit Hawaii I stayed here.

We stayed twice as long as expected at the Hyatt Place due to Hurricane Lane. We were already happy with the hotel, we were more than happy after the threat of the storm was past.This hotel is located just off the main drag of Waikiki. It is a very short walk to the beach, the zoo, and a slightly longer walk (half mile?) to the aquarium. Are you traveling with elementary school or younger kids? This place provides a very good value and a great location particularly for families. There are a couple of elementary schools and parks quite close by, which means playgrounds for when they are antsy. The beach directly in front of the hotel is sheltered by a breaker wall, and there is a lifeguard station right there. The hotel has an ample, filling breakfast included for all guests, which is ideal for kids who one day wake up starving and another eat nothing at all. Many, many kid-friendly options like pancakes or waffles every day, cereal, milk and juice, eggs, and a rotating protein. It is served on the third and first floors -- definitely go to the third. More options are out, and it is kind of stuffy in the lobby where it is cooler and breezy on the third floor by the small pool. Free wifi. A dominoes pizza outlet IN the lobby. If you have less than adventurous eaters who need to be periodically run around the park to keep them from exploding, this is absolutely your place.It is comfortable as well. The beds were awesome, we all slept like the dead. The layout of the rooms differs slightly, I liked the one with a small partition between the bed area and a sitting area, rather than the couch facing one of the beds. That second layout is larger, but less convenient. The former has more counter space and cubbies for storing items and is better functionally for hanging out in the room (which one should avoid in better weather, of course!). Diamond Head Tower has a much better elevator set up -- worth paying for if the room option is more expensive. Three elevators service just something like 125 rooms in that tower, whereas there are 2 serving more like 186 rooms in the other tower.The staff were uniformly simply fantastic. Second time at the small, in-hotel bar and they remember you. They showed up without question during the storm threat, and breakfast kept appearing like clockwork while the whole city was shut down.There are very few eating options in the bar, but a vast universe of everything from dives and food trucks to expensive steak houses awaits you just out your door.I would definitely book this again, we were very happy with the hotel in all respects at a much more reasonable price than two giant chain properties very nearby.

The location of the hotel was very good. One - two minute to Waikiki beach by walk.Even almost all the famous restaurants are walking distances.The services by hotel workers were also very impressive.

Just down the road from the beach, rooms are a bit outdated and I hated the shower being in the same room as the toilet. They had two large dogs in the room across from us which made me wonder if our room had dogs in it before. Room was clean and staff were helpful. Breakfast average.

Just spent a week on Oahu and Hyatt place Honolulu was perfect for our needs - family of 4, near Waikiki beach. The hotel is very clean and spacious. Located in a safe neighborhood a short walk to all the shopping and restaurants. What makes this hotel great is amazing stuff! Everyone is very attentive and friendly. We had a hick up in our plans and they helped us work it out in best possible way! Will not hesitate to recommend to friends and family!

Not much positives here with this hotel. I stayed at the Prince Waikiki hotel 3 nights prior to this hotel (read my review comments on that one) and should not have moved! This hotel is closer to the Waikiki beach area (though not in front of the beach. Lobby looks faded and old, and as you walk to the elevator you notice that things don't look better. The worst part was arriving at my floor (i think i was placed in level 4), there was a loud fan aiming to dry up a wet carpet outside the elevator. The carpet looked old, the fan looked old and loud : ( anyways, walked to my room hoping for a decent space...wrong again. The room was old-looking, the shower was unimpressive. Didn't order any room service as I didn't trust the quality of the cuisine by the look and feel of the hotel (or motel?). Anywho, avoid this place travellers. Certainly the price per night of $260 AUD (~$200 USD) was not worth it! Pay extra $100 AUD ($70 usd) per night and you'll find muuuuch better quality hotel experiences that would make your Hawaii experience much more pleasant. Almost forgot, breakfast was free, but as soon as i saw the buffet quality (or lack thereof) I immediately left running to a Waikiki nearby restaurant. Food looked like it was cooked by amateur-hour chef...

My family recently had an extended stay at this hotel recently. First off, the location is one of the best things about this hotel. You are a seven minute walk to the best part of Waikiki beach, the Honolulu Zoo and several eateries. Many tour buses also stop near this hotel. The hotel staff were very wonderful and accommodating. I had great chats with the front desk and the bar staff on quite a few nights.The rooms are fair. Nothing spectacular, but you will find them more roomy than most hotels in the price range. Each room has a fridge, but no microwave. The free breakfast each more was good and can save you money in the long room. The pool was small and could become quite crowded quickly. There are some negatives to the hotel that I encountered. First, the inconsistent house keeping. During my stay, they would come any time of day from early morning to late afternoon or even not at all. Twice, I had to ask the front desk for more toilet paper and was told it would be brought to my room. It never came, so I had to buy some of my own. The second is the noise on rooms that face the street or the pool. I can usually ignore most city sounds, but my window was so poorly sealed that all the traffic sounded like it was coming in through an open window. I also heard the garbage truck every day when it came at 6 a.m. so getting a restful sleep was not possible. The solution would be to use the single pair of ear plugs the hotel provided, but that could also block out possible fire alarms. My friends reported the same issue on the pool side, which became quite loud when people were horsing around. The air conditioning in my daughters' room never worked fully, but the room was bearable. The elevators are extremely slow and you find yourself waiting for a while.All in all, it was an okay stay, but I will be exploring other options on return visits.

Booking.com advertises “free cancellation “ however this is not true. I made a booking for the HYATT PLACE HOTEL IN WAIKIKI and a few minutes later went to cancel. I received a warning IF YOU WISH TO CANCEL THIS BOOKING THE COST IS $2,000 US. I contacted the hotel because I wanted to pay on arrival as I had done the previous year. Too bad I was advised as we have charged your card for the full amount.

I can’t begin to say how pleased I am with my stay thus far. We have been taken care of so well by the staff here at the Hyatt place! We were very surprised that we had to endure the hurricane and prepping for it, we didn’t expect to have this happen at all. Hyatt has been so helpful giving us info on what to do and what to prepare for and give us a game plan. I’m very pleased with everything especially Ihab Kherati the manager he was so great and helpful and put my mind at ease with so many questions I had. Truly thankful for everything!

I wouldn't choose to stay at this hotel again. The street is too busy and the driveway is too steep and narrow to accommodate all the cars going in and out. The most inconvenient issue was the lack of self-parking available due to "too many guests with rental cars", which either forces you to use valet, which is more expensive, or use the parking garage across the street, which is also expensive and inconvenient. Air conditioning in the room didn't work the first two days - I had to request repair twice. The room was very small and could stand to be updated. Disappointing for a Hyatt Place.

Stayed her with my 15 year old daughter. Staff was very friendly & accommodating. Hotel room was very comfortable & spacious. Breakfast included was great. We would use the tray in our room to come back & enjoy our food on our balcony. Walking distance to so many places. Beach just 2 blocks away. Hotel even loaned out beach chairs. We enjoyed our stay here & would definitely come back to stay here when in the area.

My family and I enjoyed our stay...we will definitely return. Many thanks to Guan and the many other staffers who may our overall experience a great one. We hope to return with other family members another time.

I have stayed at Hyatt Place hotels before and knew I would be getting a hot breakfast with protein while other hotels just provide a continental breakfast. Most Waikiki hotels provide no breakfast. Rooms are fine, clean. No frills, no restaurant, no room service. Small outside pool but the beach is only one block away. Staff is very nice and accomodating. I would definitely recommend it.
user_name:
EXPEDIA.INC N
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Sometimes housekeepers don't clean the rooms completely. Small bugs in the room. Don't stay on the street side of hotel. Tour buses and delivery trucks are honking horns and backup alarms start at 6 am. No sleeping in.

What an amazing stay! Ihab provided us with phenomenal service, especially after learning about our brutal experience we had previously experienced at the Airbnb we were staying at. We were given a room upon arrival (around noon) and check out was smooth. The included breakfast was a plus! We were also able to enjoy the services of a hospitality room after check out because we had a late flight - this was amazing because we were able to freshen up after a long day in the Hawaiian heat. I would recommend staying here. The staff and experience at the hotel was amazing followed by the less than 3 minute walk to Waikiki beach! Thank you so much Ihab for providing Money and myself with the best service we came across in Hawaii. We really appreciated it!

We were completing a move from Hawaii to Virginia with my dog and lots of luggage. Nevertheless, we had a great, seamless experience thanks to Guan and Ihab. They went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed.

We booked Hyatt Place Waikiki for our family reunion and it was a highly satisfying experience. Among the most notable were the warm and friendly services provided by the front desk staff, Dino, Erin and Ihab. The spacious and comfortable rooms and complimentary breakfasts, which were excellent. The proximity of the hotel to Waikiki Beach was especially nice! We would highly recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki for your family vacation.

First time visiting Hawaii and it was an amazing experience at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach Hotel! It totally exceeded my expectations. We had the best and most romantic vacations in Waikiki. Great and attentive staff! Beautiful view from the balcony of the room! Super comfy rooms. Loved the batheroom and shower. Loved the daily breakfast, full of variety. Loved the open spaces of the lobby, the orchids, the bar, 24/7 food menu, the souvernirs stores. So close to the beach. Definitely this hotel will be our one and only choice if we visit again Waikiki!

My gf and me have beren on vacation to Honolulu at Hyatt Place Hotel.The staff has been very kind and helpful, the location was great and the cleaness of the room very good.The only, lets say, “negative points” are:- no parking for scooters/mopeds;- breakfast: it would be nice to have more sweet food like croissants/cakes and the time to have it till 9.30 maybe its too early.Overall, i confirm, this is a great Hotel to stay, perfect location, with a kind and professional staff!I would recommend it!

We had a large trip and booked 3 rooms and were traveling with a 9month old. The hotel is in a great location walking distance to waikiki beach and the main street. The free breakfast was really nice. Would have liked to see more covered seats since it was raining in the mornings most of the time (we travelled in November 2017). The staff was very helpful and the lobby and rooms were clean with a great view of diamond head.

Friendly staff, good location, room size was good for a family of 5 and the pool was very clean. Complimentary breakfast every day. $3 ea. washer/dryer machine. Parking $25 or $35 valet. We ran out of our sh/con the last day and we had to use the hotel's shampoo/conditioner, both smells good.

We had a nice family vacation because this hotel was so awesome. Angeline delivered great customer service. We would come back here and also recommend to others due to her kindness and positivity. The hotel is close to the beach and right next to abc which is convenient when you have little ones who needs milk and diapers late at night. Overall we enjoyed our stay here.

My wife and I took our first vacation to Waikiki this year. We had a fabulous experience at the Hyatt Place in Wikiki. Arlita, our housekeeper for the week, took great care of us. We tend to be a little messy when we travel. The room was made up to perfection upon our return from our daily activities. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay here again in the future.

This was an awesome vacation spot - very quiet for being so close the action of Waikiki! The room was super spacious and we even had a peek-a-boo view of the ocean. The only issue we encountered was after being out all day to come back to the room that hadn't been cleaned. One day they didn't come until just before 7 p.m. wouldn't be to good for families.

This Hyatt Place is in a great location a few blocks from the Waikiki beachfront. The hotel's entire staff is very friendly, welcoming and professional. The amenities at this hotel include the included breakfast, which in Waikiki can become a major expense for a family with children. The third floor breakfast area is large enough to accommodate the ample about of guest staying at this property. I also used their computers to print multiple items downstairs. While there is a $15 per day resort charge, you get a $5 per day credit out of it at the lobby snack area, so we purchased something small like a soda or water each day with it, the ginger beers and root beers were very tasty! The pool on the third floor was on the small side, but we really did not come to Hawaii to swim in a hotel pool, so that was no issue for us.We had a mountain view room, which in hindsight was a partial mountain view room, blocked by some of the surrounding high-rise hotels and buildings. Still not a bad view. The room was large, with two queen beds and a sofa bed. Housekeeping promptly brought a pack and play (FYI-not a crib) to our room for our toddler, which he slept and played in with no issue. House keeping was fantastic, including having to completely change one of our beds due to an accident. There was not a bathtub in the bathroom, only a stand-up shower. The room had a small fridge, but no microwave. There is a large room safe also in the room. ABC Store located right next door for drinks and snacks if needed. Grab beach towels in the lobby from the front desk. We used them daily for the beaches we went to around the island. It saves you the trouble of either bringing your own towels and/or purchasing towels. Valet parking is $45 a day. There was not self parking available and good luck finding overnight parking in Waikiki within a reasonable walking distance of the hotel. The valet workers did do a great job in getting the vehicles quickly and giving advice on local beaches etc, and they were tipped well. Overall, a great hotel with a great staff and $45 a day valet parking. We would stay here again anytime.

the location is perfect! the concierges where great they help us get our vacation started the right way we had and event/tour plan everyday and also help us plan our last day there with a road trip around the island which we rented a Jeep with them for a much lower price!

Hotel offers friendly staff, great breakfast. CNN on all public TV's was a negative since I am republican. Parking prices an issue for hotel guests. Location relative to beach and dining was very good.

Wonderful service and attention by all staff. Pleasant ambience in most areas. Always friendly and helpful. Very clean, and great choice for breakfast. Lovely bed!! The only thing needs improving is the pool area - can do with some windbreaks - potted hedges or trees. But with only 5 mins walk to the beach (and an ABC shop almost next door), not a problem.

Affordable, clean and personable staff at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel! From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with prompt service and Aloha from the bell staff. The location of the hotel is excellent given the accessibility to restaurants, shops and the beach in Waikiki. Even with the hotel being situated a block from the ocean, and behind larger hotels, I have a slight view of the ocean from my lanai. The room itself was spotless, and the housekeeping service was terrific. Every personnel I met during my stay there was pleasant and accommodating. The gym provided more than enough equipment options to have a full workout routine, and the size was roomy without feeling cramped. The laundry room was very small but did not have a problem getting a load in during my stay. The free breakfast was fantastic! Each day provided different mains plus your standard eggs and sides. The daily credit of $5.00 from the bar offered me a complimentary latte, which was a nice added benefit.Lastly, the phone call from the general manager of the hotel was an unexpected gesture of a warm welcome. The kind Aloha was felt all throughout my stay at the Hyatt Place. I would strongly recommend this hotel to business travelers and couples.

We stayed here on vacation and overall I would stay here again. The breakfasts were decent and really the birds were not as annoying as some would indicate...in fact it was entertaining when they fought over food. The room itself was really nice, we had a "mountain view" of Diamond Head and plenty of space. Great location just steps from Waikiki Beach and an unlimited choice of restaurants. Only a couple of flaws...the elevators were slow and occasionally bouncy (a little trepidation there) as was the valet service.

Guest room was smaller than expected (smaller than the pictures on the Website). The bathroom was very small too. The condition of the room was older than expected. Maybe I had a high expectation just because it is Hyatt. The hotel is just an average hotel.

We had such an incredible experience. Great customer service and experience. They turned our whole trip experience around after a terrible experience we had in a previous hotel on the same trip. We highly recommend the Hyatt Place.

Family of 4 (dad/mom/17/14) stayed for 4 nights and it was a relatively good place to stay. We almost had an issue right out the gates when we arrived. The first room they gave us had not been fully cleaned when we opened the door. Rather than making us wait for the room to be fully cleaned, the staff bumped us up to the next size room. We were satisfied both that we did not have to wait and a little extra space in the new room made things better also. Housekeeping kept the room clean without any issues.The breakfast bar on the 3rd floor is respectable in terms of the cross-section of food offered. The only challenge with breakfast is finding a table at times.They do have a pool on the 3rd floor and it is small. Fortunately there is that whole ocean thing just down the way. It is a short walk (2-3 easy blocks) to the beach from the hotel and handy to lots of tourist type shops if such things interest you. For us it was a place to stay at night as we did other things in variuos directions on Oahu.Plan on slow elevators. We took the stairs frequently versus waiting for the elevator to arrive. Sometimes it seemed like only one of the two was working.If you rent a car and bring it here, be prepared to pay a lot for valet parking. After reading some other posts online, I bought a week pass at the Banyan that is on the opposite corner from the hotel. I did not have any issues finding parking there but I would be careful if I had a large vehicle and tried to park in there.

A nice place to stay away from home, when traveling, or on vacation. Very close to the sands of Waikiki beach and offers complimentary breakfast on the 1st and 3rd floor; I prefer the 3rd floor. I just hope the hotel add more elevators on one of the wings; it really gets busy and takes a while to get on it in the morning during breakfast and checkout times especially if you have several luggage. Also, a service elevator for the staff too, would help overcrowding at the elevator areas. Other than that, the other services are great, and the price is decent.

Hyatt Place was a tidy and nice place to stay. The people there were helpful and friendly. Beds were very comfortable and rooms looked good although a bit small and not much room for 2 people to sit and eat. Lifts were ordinary very slow

The customer service at The Hyatt Place was phenomenal! We loved how they listened to our survey and accommodated us. The breakfast included was pretty good. The pool was a bit small and there was no jacuzzi. Although, the elevators were very slow.

Great place to stay very central to beach and all that is happening around waikiki helpful staff rooms were clean and well appointed, just disappointed that room did not really cater for non coffe drinkers and it would be nice to have wine glasses available to enjoy a wine on the patio

We need a hotel with three beds in one room. Hyatt has rooms with two queen beds and a sofa bed, which worked nicely for us. Free breakfast was also a plus. We stayed at another hotel earlier in our vacation. Only a mile difference, but the Hyatt felt more safe and it was a block away from the beach. There are stores and restaurants near the hotel. This was our first trip to Hawaii, so it was interesting to note how even a mile in Waikiki makes a big difference. Everyone at the hotel was super friendly. The room was clean and updated. The location was nice as stated. 1) I wish they gave more options for parking. They only provide valet parking for 35 dollars per night. I found out that you could park at the Aston hotel right by the Hyatt at a cheaper rate. 2. Breakfast - The choices were very limited, but it was just enough for us. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express (free breakfast) earlier and their breakfast was better. However, the Hyatt feels safer, chas bigger rooms, closer to the beach, and where I would pick in the future.

We stayed in this hotel for a week during our family vacation. We had three children with us (5yo, 3yo, and almost 1yo), and found the location to be the perfect pace for us. It is about a 15-20 minute walk from the main strip, making it quiet and not as crowded to walk around with little kids. It is only 2 blocks from the beach, a 10-15 minute walk to the Waikiki Aquarium, a 5 minute walk to the Honolulu Zoo, and a block from a large ABC store. The beach nearby also has a jetty, so that the water is fairly shallow with very little waves - perfect for little kids.The rooms are spacious, and we had a wonderful view of the ocean and Diamond Head.The hot breakfast varied daily, but almost always included scrambled eggs, various breads for toast, white rice and miso soup.The staff is incredibly accommodating and helpful. You can pick up towels for the beach or pool at the front desk.Some things that could be improved:The elevator closest to the front desk is slow, especially during check-in, check-out, and meal times.Meals were served in a really nice outdoor patio by the pool. However, it is QUITE windy, so we found the best place to sit either inside (if you're able to get a seat) or along the building wall. And, the local pigeons like to enjoy your breakfast, too. The staff did their best to shoo them away, but don't leave your food on the table for a second, or drop anything on the ground. You will be sorry.Our bath tub and sink were both slow to drain, but that was remedied right away with a phone call to the front desk.Our bathroom fan switch did not work.

Good location with spacious rooms but thats where it stops.- hotel is dated. Old and has not been maintained- elevators are slow and painful- not enough staff to run the place- pool area but no one uses it.- no room service.- very limited breakfast choice- $15 per day per room resort feePositives:- Location - 2 mins to beach. Staff will give you free towels and beach chairs- Starbucks coffee in the lobby- dominos pizza in lobby thats open till 3amI would pay more and stay elsewhere. Not as enjoyable!

The hotel is located off Paoakalani, which is less than a block to the beach, but about a 10-15 min walk to the center of Waikiki where all of the action is. Room size was fair, but the carpet was extremely dirty. The staff responded quickly and vacuumed and provided a second service for the room where we got more towels and then down service. Hotel parking can fill up quickly so instead of the $12 fee we were expecting to pay, we paid $35 for valet. I think this is pretty consistent for O’ahu.

Clean with a great free breakfast. Walk to the beach. Close to the Hop-on Hop-off bus stop. Easy Uber access. Safe neighborhood. Close to shops and restaurants of Waikiki. Largeish room with city view. Checkin desk open to outside as was the breakfast area. Weather in January was perfect.

1 block up from the beach, beach towels provided, free hot breakfast, and an ABC store next door (of course ) There are much nicer hotels, but this is a great value traveling with family. Pool is shallow, 5ft at the deepest, but great for kids. And if people are laying out next to the pool, just expect to get splashed, I mean you're laying next to a pool!

It is a nice quiet hotel but is two blocks from the beach. Staff friendly. Free hot breakfast buffet. Gets you fueled for the day. Computers available in the lobby which is nice food available in lobby or by room service. Rooms nice but small. TV choices limited. Local Expedia expert in lobby. Beach towels available. Views from lanai so so.

Clean, Jade at the front desk remembered all my family need. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. The welcome bag was convenient and they let us borrow towels and chairs for the beach super convenient!!! Block away from the beach and awesome breakfast!

great free breakfast. walking to and from the beach takes some time - we like the beach in front of the royal hawaiian so it is a trek we had a broken elevator and this made accessing the room difficult

We stayed at the Hyatt Place July 14-17th in a two queen ocean view room, room 1935. Having stayed at Hyatt Places in California we had an idea of what to expect. A clean room, a decent buffet breakfast all at fair price. When I mean fair price I take into consideration the surrounding hotel rate in the area. Don’t expect the complimentary breakfast to be similar to ones that your pay for. The breakfast consists of scrambled eggs, at times watery, a meat (Sunday=sausage, Monday=bacon, Tuesday=biscuits and sausage gravy), cut fruit, toast, pancakes or waffles, cereal, rice, juices, milk, tea or coffee. Food was more than adequate for the daily room rate. The room was larger than we expected. The room had two queen beds, a sofa bed, desk, small frig, a worn dresser with plenty of room to spares. We have stayed at the Marriott across the street and the beds and room were much smaller at a higher price. Waikiki is a busy area with lots of traffic noise. Being on the 19th floor was just high enough so that the overall street noise was barely audible with the balcony door closed. With the door open the noise is crazy. That is not to say that our stay was perfect. We stayed in the main tower and at times the elevators took a long to arrive. There are only two elevators, which are small, and the staff also uses them. Also when we were checking in we were told that there was no valet parking available and that I should park at the Waikiki Banyan condos. Not good. I ended up parking at the Banyan parking for my entire stay since it was $30 for a 24hr period, was a short walk and had plenty of parking. Note that the hotel valet parking is $35 a day.The hotel is an easy walk to all of the Waikiki area. I would definitely consider staying at the Hyatt Place again.

Recently spent 2 nights in this hotel and although location is great the room was average but expensive. The bathroom was one of the smallest I have ever seen, when the door is closed it is literally standing room only. I don't normally add photos but in this case you have to see it to believe it.We paid extra for the breakfast which turned out to be a basic selection of cereals and a couple of hot dishes. The kitchen staff did a great job making sure there was enough food for everyone and kept the place clean. Odd thing is the breakfast is outside under a partly covered area so not sure what happens when it rains or is windy.One thing to check is if you have fully paid for you accomodation make sure they do not charge you again when you check in and they take a copy of your card. When I got home I found that they had charge me another night and am waiting for them to refund it.If you just want location then this is a good option.
user_name:
Alfred R
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: in general is a very good hotel, location is #1 strength close to the beach one block away, personnel are very professional and friendly treatment, the deli and the bar are very convenience service for those who want something fast. The valet employees were nice just only they were shorthanded and it took an average of 10-15 minutes to get your car in the driveway.

Excellent location, near all the local shopping areas, lovely modern and clean rooms. Friendly staff and great breakfast incl deal. Highly recommend you stay at Hyatt Place, look forward to staying there again if to visit Waikiki :)

As a family of five we found this hotel great. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. It is only a block from the beach and there is a trolley bus stop just up the road if you wish to make a trip to Alamoana. The staff are all very helpful and accommodating, which is great when you are just off a 10 your flight. The breakfast is great but can be a bit windy if you eat out near the pool. My advice is to make use of the tray provided in your room. Grab what you want and take it back to your room.

This is the crappiest Hyatt I’ve EVER stayed at. -The loud banging door-The tv the shuts off when u open the fridge door-Water dripping down bathroom wall after a few hot showers, making puddles on the bathroom floor-crap quality shower head that squirts out water in all directions, with broken shower mode switch- no shower gel provided - broken bathroom fan- the bathroom floor floods with water after we all shower, told house keeping and they claimed they fixed it....same thing happened the 2nd night- carpet is sticky....2 more nights to go. Can't wait to leave this place.....

The hotel was in a fairly good location, but I expected more for the price paid. Hotel is overpriced compared to most cities in Europe so my standards were different. It is a good deal for Waikiki thou. Our room was fairly clean… they never cleaned for example the A/C and it was covered with dust. As a size, the room is practical and the bed was comfortable. All the hotel is outdated (like the most in Waikiki) and it has a weird “oldie” smell. The breakfast, there is a reason why it is for free. We only ate bread and marmalade… We stayed three nights in this hotel and we only went to the breakfast the first day. It does not worth it to spend time to go for breakfast… it is better to grab something from any store in the neighborhood. The best of this hotel is its location… it is close to everything (shops and eateries)! Regarding the stuff, we had a bad experience with a lady in the reception when we arrived. She was rude and talked to us like they made us a favor of letting us stay there just because we arrived earlier than the check-in time. But, fortunately, the last day another gentleman was very helpful by letting us check-out later because we wanted to go to Perl Harbor. He helped us a lot!

My family and I had such a great time staying there. The hotel is placed in the perfect location: close to the beach and many amazing restaurants, had great customer service, and exceptional cleaning services. Special thanks to Dino, who had all the information we needed about where to go and what to do. Another thank you to Racquel, who did a great job taking care of our room every day. Also, to Nick, Guan, and Lisa for their friendly customer service.

Although the hotel was in a fairly good location, I expected a bit more for the price I was paying. The rooms were fairly clean but the bathroom was not. It is quite dated and the amenities in the room were what I would expect in a 3 star hotel. The room was quite a decent size though. The pool area was uninspiring and having breakfast out there was interesting with the wind and birds, there just wasn’t enough seats in the area to accomodate everyone. The breakfast wasn’t even worth getting up for, which I didn’t on most days. The place is understaffed at reception most of the time and if you want something delivered to your room, expect to wait or have to call back (which happened to me). It is very noisy and although I didn’t experience long waits for a lift - I was in the tower with 3 lifts - the lifts were being used by guests and staff. All in all, would I stay there again, probably not, as I don’t think it was value for money and I could have stayed somewhere closer and gotten more value for what I spent.

Disappointing breakfast venue with birds attacking us each day and very little seating. Not relaxing for anyone on holidays. The venue needs to be changed for hygiene reasons and more seats need to be added.

This hotel was very busy indicating it was popular, a good recommendation in itself. Brand is very well respected, we use it wherever the option is available, over other brands. Large rooms, great location. Ocean beach is one city block from front door. Very respectable breakfast included in rate.

Matt and Ihab are absolutely amazing managers. Every concern we had was resolved immediately. even bikes we were riding they let us storage in a tiny room. only person is Anabelle who needs to change her attitude and rudeness... overall i will always recommend to friends and family. thx all of you for pleasure experience from Minasyan family!!!!

Great hotel, location was wonderful and included breakfast. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Only issue is the elevators. Only 2 elevators for 21 floors and staff had to use them as well (bell staff as well as house keeping). You could wait up to 10 mins for an elevator to get where you were going

We spent four nights at the property, it is located at a walking distance to the beach (1-2 blocks), there are several restaurants near the hotel and you can also walk to some attractions like the aquarium, zoo and even the diamond head hike. Breakfast buffet and the rooms were hyatt place standards. Staff was courteous and friendly.

Just checked in and sat at the bar, Got an awesome Bartender name Chad Castro. He knew his drinks and kept the drinks coming. The food he made was amazing as well. Thank you Chad for your hospitality and making our 1st night worth everything.

Great location. Very clean. Amazing staff especially Angeline at the front desk who always had time to talk to us and say hi to my 11 month daughter. Everything was amazing until the very last day. Our flight was at 10pm. We checked out of our room that day and they kept our luggage till we had to go to our airport. Turned out our flight was delayed till 2 am. We went to the beach that day and Front desk said we would be able to get a room to wash up before we head to the airport. We got our room at 8pm. Myself, my husband and my baby were all able to bathe before heading to the airport. At 10pm when our airport shuttle arrived and went to front desk to check out, a lady dressed in a black dress, assuming she was the manager on duty spoke to us very rudely saying ‘you know you were only suppose to get that room for only half hour. ‘ We apologized sincerely and said we didn’t know. If we did, then we wouldn’t have stayed there for that long. She looked at us and repeated it saying ‘it’s a hospitality room only for half hour and that we would usually have to pay but this time she will let us off’ Excuse me??? Why are you speaking to us so rudely like we stayed in that room for long on purpose? We would have left after half hour if someone had mentioned it to us. And how do you expect 2 adults and 1 baby to bathe all within 30 mins?? This really left us in a bad mood going to the airport. She made us feel like we were taking advantage of them, which we would never do. Other than the one mean manager, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

The Hyatt Place is well located. Block from the beach not far from the central or busy section of Waikiki. Rooms are good sizes, not very modern but we found them to be clean and well serviced. Beds were very comfy. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is free, however menu of food is limited but quality is OK to reasonable given its free - I must acknowledge that staff do a great job to refilling food and drinks. Bus collection for hop on/off is only 3 minute walk to hotel which is good. Hotel pool area is not very inviting, but with beach minutes away this was not an issue for my family. The hotel gym looked good with modern equipment.The hotel car park is busy with limited car spots unless you paid USD35 for valet parking. We found a good parking option at the Sunset parking 3min walk where they charge USD20 per night for Hyatt guests. If your looking for a reasonable hotel to use for a family as a base to enjoy the beach, restaurants or explore at a reasonable price then this hotel is OK - If you want a modern Hotel with modern facilities, inviting pool etc then I would look at other options.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I have stayed at Hyatt hotels all over, I actually stayed at this hotel on my reward points because I use their hotels so much! I will never stay at a Hyatt again. I left $300 in the room safe and it was stolen by housekeeping. The housekeeper originally said she opened the safe and it was empty. Management said they would send an Engineer to check the integrity of the safe. They never gave me those results but sent me to their insurance company. I had to go through this entire process, filing a police report, following up only for the insurance company to turn down my claim because the Hyatt had changed their story saying the safe was locked and they sent an Engineer and it was empty. I am so incredibly disappointed with this company!!!

The hotel is modern and the room was clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly. I think it is a good deal for the money. Breakfast was OK. The hotel is locate a block away from the beach and close to a ton of nice restaurants and stores.

Hotel is pricey compared to most cities , but actually a good deal for Waikiki. Big rooms for family was our draw, but unfortunately it is not somewhere I would stay again. Location is 2 blocks to a great beach and a little further for shops and tons of restaurants, but keep in mind you are in a big city with TONS of tourists . On 10th floor we could hear every bus, motorcycle and sirens most of night. The busses seemed to stop at 1030, but there was still a ton of city noise. Seemed quiet only from 12am-5am and we stayed a Monday and Tuesday night. I would guess the weekend would be worse? The sliding glass door is paper thin as far as noise is concerned. I welcomed the louder AC unit to drown out some noise. Rooms are dated and a little dirty. Beds were comfy, but pillows are hard as rocks....bring a small travel pillow! Shower is small and sink area tiny for a family of five to keep items. Parking is $35 a night.The best thing about the property is the staff. They have all been wonderful.

Firstly let me say the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The price was pretty reasonable too. We had 2 Queen Beds, Ocean View Specialty but not sure what the specialty was supposed to signify as the view was pretty damned crap (see photo). Being on a higher floor (we were on the 7th) may have been better. The first thing that springs to mind here is 'sticky'. Its fairly modern but its not clean, in every corner and along every edge there's a very obvious build-up of dust. The furniture everywhere is worn and scratched. It's a practical room and the beds are comfortable but other than that, I am not sure I can say much else. They have introduced a 'destination fee' - read resort fee which thankfully we did not have to pay since we booked and paid for our reservation before they introduced this. The lack of resort fee was one of the reason I was drawn to Hyatt Place and it was good of them to honour that.The breakfast as many on here have already said was pretty average. Crowded (and I'm not just talking about the people, the pigeons!) and the food is very much what you would expect from a 'free' breakfast. Fruit loops, sugary cereals, vanilla yogurt (nothing natural sugar free), the fresh fruit was the typical chopped up rock melon and pineapple. Some cooked stuff which I did not go near, some oatmeal which looked grey. Bread, some rice and condiments, pancakes. It was fine and certainly for 'free' it was ok but after 3 mornings, I could not face it again. If you are with kids like we were, it does save on costs but I would suggest perhaps if you are a couple, not choosing this place based on that. They do pretty good Acai bowls at Jamba Juice literally around the corner for under $10. The location is the winner here. We prefer this end of Waikiki as you can wander along the beach and get away from the crowds. Everything (shops and eateries) are all on your doorstep.

Stayed here for a few days and moved to a different hotel. I had room 1213 with an ocean view and balcony. The balcony was a joke. Not even enough room to turn your chair to face the ocean. Room was just big enough for the bed and a desk. This is not a typical Hyatt Place room like back on the mainland. Only knock was the rooms. The hotel staff was great and very friendly and helpful.

The staff were all nice but the 2 rooms we had were just average and the bathroom set up has maybe 6 inches on each side of the sink which leaves no room for toiletries. The 2 elevators were ridiculously slow so you have to plan a 15min. wait time & then hope it's not already full. We choose the same breakfast items each day of our week stay and some days they were good but some days not & there is limited seating. You could never make it back to your room with the food still hot. We also wish there was a real restaurant in the hotel.

Location and Room (12th floor) were perfect for my family. We had a beach view with queens and a sofa bed, which was perfect for my family of 5 (3 kids ranging from 6-11). Hotel was down the street from the Zoo and aquariam, and near the end of Waikiki beach.. Daily breakfast really helped save money.I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay in Waikiki. If you've never been to Oahu, I would recommend looking at rental car rates before you come. It's way less expensive to rent at the airport than from the closest rental car place, but it will cost you $35/day to park your car.

We recently stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki for 9 nights. The hotel is located fairly close to the beach; many days we found ourselves walking to many of the surrounding restaurants and shopping malls.We really enjoyed the daily breakfast (get there prior to 7am though to beat the rush) and the fitness facility. Our housekeeper, Amira, was excellent! Our room was always tidied up. We showered quite frequently with all the trips to the beach so we needed more towels, which Amira kindly provided when we caught her. Overall, we were quite satisfied with our stay here. It was our first time in Hawaii and it certainly won't be our last.

We had wonderful stay here. Staff was extremely helpful. We talked to Dino to change our room to upper floor and he did it and not a single second impact to us. Breakfast buffet with huge variety is definitely a big plus for families and we enjoyed it every morning. Tour buses pick us up and drop in front of hotel. Location is just few steps walk to beach and very close to shopping and food. Once again, staff is wonderful.Expedia tour expert is always in hotel and they are extremely helpful even we did not buy any trip from them as we booked online before.

Provides you with value for money. The staff are exceptional and the service excellent. Rooms are very clean and tidy we stayed in the superior queen for extra comfort and space. The beds and pillows are like sleeping on a cloud extremely comfortable and wake up fresh. Breakfast inclusion is tops.

First overseas trip in 20 years & Hyatt Place Waikiki was the first stop. What a way to start, everything went well with no problems. Great facilities. Breakfast was plentiful & delicious too. Thank you very much.

A truly great trip in May 2018. Arlita from housekeeping did an amazing job cleaning up after my family. She did an amazing job tidying up after my two little girls and she was so pleasant to deal with. The breakfast is quite good and of good quality. Just a great property in a great location.

Location great- short walk to Waikiki beach. Ac not cold enough- carpet made my baby’s knees grey with only five minutes of him crawling around -room size good- bathroom small- bed comfortable- breakfast great

Hyatt Place is the best hotel for your family vacation, because it is in good location. It take you just few minutes to walk to the beach, and it also very close to shopping center. My kid love it and really enjoy during vacation.

We chose this hotel mainly because of it’s location to Waikiki and the free hot breakfast they offer in the mornings, the breakfast comes in handy with a family of four. We ended up with a city view that was less than entertaining but we could have upgraded to a better view and chose not to so that’s on us. The rooms were clean but mediocre as you would expect with this price range. The breakfast was great to fill up every morning saving us both time and money. The staff was also very nice and we had no issues with anything. If you have a car use the parking lot across the street as it is only $30 a day or $110 for the entire week. Bottom line is if your looking for a cheap hotel that has a little more bang for your buck this is a good one for that.

Our holiday started off on the wrong foot when we arrived at the Hotel and turns out Hotels.com had cancelled our booking. We are a family of 5 that have been planning this trip for 2 years with a stop over in LA. I couldn’t speak more highly of this place, as it could have gotten horribly wrong with no accommodation on arrival. Matt at the front desk looked into what had happened and went over and above to fix our problem. He booked us in with the same accommodation the best as he could and also matched the rate of our original booking. It’s this kind of detail and service that can make or break a holiday. Your staff member Matt is wroth celebrating. We are home back in New Zealand and will be back in the future. Mahalo team. Well done to hyatt place for hiring such staff.

Too crowded breakfast buffet. Too low elevator capacity. Very noisy AC in the guest room, especially during the night. Too narrow bath room. With reference to the cost per night I will most likely not recommend your hotel to anyone.

I have stayed at a number of hotels in Waikiki including the Royal Hawaiian. I’ve realized over time the crowds have become tiresome and take away the magic of Hawaii. This hotel offers close beach access but is removed enough so you feel more relaxed. Lots of nearby restaurants to choose from including Wolfgang Puck Express and Tucker + Bevy. The Honolulu Zoo is just a block away as well as a quieter stretch of Waikiki beach. Room sizes are good and are well appointed with amenities and the always important storage space. So if you are seeking a more relaxed hotel but still with all the modern amenities check this hotel out! Thanks to Eian and Matt for making our stay perfect!

A good value hotel, with ideal location. Easy accessible to beach & shopping. Comfortable beds, free buffet breakfast. The area was noisy, though. Lots of homeless people on busy shopping street. Honolulu should address this problem as it cann be intimidating

Looking at the pictures on the Hyatt website, I expected a fresh, modern room with new bathrooms and true corner sofa bed that was separate from the remainder of the room. The reality for our ocean view 2 queen room was a very dated room with 2 beds and a mediocre sofa bed all in the one space - just like any mid range chain hotel. The bathroom was tiny and it was clear that glass shower door and tiles hadn’t been scrubbed in a long while as you could see the soap scum all over them. The beds were comfortable for sleep and we did indeed have an ocean view either side of the Aston Hotel, which is directly in front of the Hyatt Place. There was a large safe in the closet area that was useful for tablets, cameras and other valuables. The staff service was very good and very friendly. Breakfast was decidedly average. I love pineapple, but when it is the only fruit on offer each day, it does get monotonous - would some bananas be out of the question. The hot foods were largely unattractive. The breakfast area is open air and full of birds trying to steal your food and leaving their poop on chairs and tables. When the wind blows, which is most days, it makes it even more uncomfortable. The location is good being very close to the beach, shops and restaurants. But I wouldn’t ever return to this place.

Overall, not a bad choice for Waikiki. Location is one block off the beach at the south end near the zoo. Most of the action is about 1/2 mile to the north where most of the new development has occurred. Rooms could use a little refreshing. Lobby is nice and a relaxing place to watch some TV or take a work call. Free breakfast is a nice touch even if the selection is limited. Only two real gripes - (1) valet service was pretty slow. Not sure how far they had to go to get the cars but they were running when they left and sometimes it took quite a while to come back with the car. Staff were hustling but it seems they need a better storage area. (2) elevators need to be updated and expanded. They only have two very old elevators that are slow and when it is busy you can end up waiting for more than 15 minutes to get where you need to go. I was 18 floors up so stairs where not a great option and when we did use them we ended up in an alley behind the hotel and not in the lobby. There is no service elevator either so the bellhops and cleaning crew are using the same elevators which adds to the strain. Top marks for the cleaning staff who were very attentive and always had our room cleaned within minutes of us leaving each day.

We had a wonderful stay with our family of 5. I felt the price was reasonable and the location prime. We were close to the beach, restaurants and diamond head breakfast was fantastic. The only problem is cost of parking at $35 per day. Also guard your food at breakfast since the birds are waiting for you to step away to swoon in on your food.

Hotel was nice, room was clean. I would definitely stay there again. Great location, and comfortable beds. Walking distance to beach, restaurants, zoo, aquarium, and city strip. A bonus treat is, at the hotel there is a DominosD open 24/7.

We where on our honeymoon and arrived on the Saturday. Matt who booked us in was friendly and knowledgeable and went the extra mile to assist us.We went to the room on the sixth floor. Good views. Room good size. Bed comfortable. Nice balcony. Slightly noisy from breakfast guests but this did not bother us as we where up anyway. We went out for food and came back. We where kept awake by teenagers running around the hotel corridors and in the rooms above. Slamming doors. We thought they would quieten down. I was wrong. We left it till 2am and called reception who sent security to investigate. This stopped for 15 mins and continued again. We had very little sleep which impacted on our honeymoon and the trips we had planned.We went to reception and spoke to jade. She was unaware what was causing the issue. Dispute us saying it sounds like teenagers. But we were offered a solution. 1) a smaller room in another tower without a view (away from the kids) but jade did not say why this was offered. 2) Move to the 19th floor again for a worse room without a view. We chose to risk staying in the room and with the lack of sleep we may just sleep when we hit the pillow. They started again in the Sunday night and I investigated. It was an oriental school trip. Our room was on the 6th floor and they had the 5th,6th,7th,8th and 9th floor. We went to book another trip and the guy started laughing as he knew also the culprit of the noise.I decided to deal with the problem myself as I was lied to by reception and security did not do anything either the night before.I spoke to two lads who I caught running around and told them I would be going to see their teacher and they can take me to them if it continues. I asked them to pass it on to their friends as we where on our honeymoon and we don’t mind fun but at 2am is stupid. To be fair the chat worked and stopped the noise at 00:30 hours. They left the next day. I was more annoyed that we where not told the truth and it could have been dealt with better. We paid a lot of money to Stay in the hotel and we could not be moved higher than the eight floor in the position we where as it is classed as ocean view. Very disappointed with how the problem was handled by Hyatt place staff. We should have been upgraded due to the lack of sleep and the upset Caused by the school children. Hyatt staff should have spoken to the teachers and had this been done we would not have the Sunday night fiasco. Did not eat dinner at the Hyatt. The breakfast was basic and not much choice. Pigeons flying into where the food is and this is not very hygienic. On the top where the food was. No staff chasing them out so they where free to roam. Children and customer chased them out of the restaurant.Due to the problem we had I have had to mark down the Hyatt Place. How the hotel was marked. 2.5 stars for the room. 0.5 star for breakfast. This would have been higher if it was not for the noise and the way the problem was dealt with. Why should we suffer due to unruly school children.

We stayed as a family for six nights, had the city view room. Not much to look at but we were hardly in the room long enough to admire the outside scenery. Room and bathroom were clean. No complaints. On our first day, housekeeping didn’t replenish to shampoo etc fromthe previous guest. We told them about it on our 2nd day. Thereafter housekeeping were obliging. Breakfast - a little in the boring side if you’ve stayed for 6 consecutive days. Staples are scrambled eggs, bacon, hard boiled eggs, bacon, waffles/pikelets, yoghurt, fruits, tofu, miso soup. Interest in brekky waned after two days. Don’t get me wrong- food is nice! However food lacks variety! Public transport - truly convenient!! The trolley runs in the same street and the stop is a hop away (going towards the beach)The buses you can catch or be drop off directly opposite the hotel on Kuhio Ave. Price was reasonable. We have no real reason to say it’s a bad place to stay. We will definitely return.

Choose this hotel for a memorable stay in a beautiful, centrally located, and friendly experience! We returned to this hotel because of the wonderful time we had 3 years ago, and we continued to enjoy every minute of our visit this month.
user_name:
Natalie M
Raleigh, North Carolina, United States

review_body: Value for money with breakfast included. Clean and neat with helpful, friendly staff from managers to housekeeping. Location perfect for families with a wide range of restaurants to choose from. Worth the stay.

Great for family holiday. Location close to beach, shops, restaurants. Clean. Staff welcoming, very helpful and friendly. Great breakfast by the pool. Would definitely return. Highly recommended. Good value for money.

We stayed here because it looked nice, didn’t have a resort fee (when we booked, it does now) and it had a free breakfast. Having stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Waikiki a few years ago, this Hyatt wasn’t as good. The room was nice and seemed recently refurbished, but a few things were not good. We arrived at 1pm to check in, we knew our room wouldn’t be ready until 3pm which was fine. We went exploring for a few hours on the promise of getting a call and email when the room was ready, none of this happened so we went back to the hotel at 3pm. They then said our room won’t be ready until 7pm! We were given another room to wait in whilst our was ready which was inconvenient. The next day we went for our breakfast and it was chaos! There is not enough seating, not enough food for a full hotel and the quality of food was terrible and cold, and the restaurant was dirty. We didn’t eat there again which was a waste given it was a ‘free breakfast’ and we had to go elsewhere for the week. I don’t enjoy standing up to eat either. Then we went for drinks in the bar and the bartender was ignorant and preferred to talk to one group of customers before serving anyone else, he was also the chef, so if someone orders food you can’t get a drink as nobody else steps in to serve. We also had a dog barking in the next room keeping us awake. Overall the hotel was ok and not far from the beach, but if you are looking for a relaxing/quiet time then this is not the place, it’s good for young families but I wouldn’t come back.

Family vacation hotel. I can say much about the value as I cashed in years of hotels points to get two rooms for the family, but at the time I made the reservations it was the lowest point required for a stay near Waikiki. The overall appearance is ok, but the rooms are spartan, fairly good mattress and pillows but an A/C with a mind of its own. It did not matter where you set the thermostat. It varied from too cold to very hot and noisy. The included breakfast buffet was nothing to write home about but the outdoor area where it is served is a nightmare. you had to keep one hand on your fork and one hand on something to scare the birds away.
