Spacious hotel room that caters for family of five. Location is down the quieter end of Waikiki Beach. Staff were helpful and professional. Buffet breakfast was average though. Good just for some tea and toast.

Small hidden gem.Wonderful staff all around, the atmosphere is very friendly. Very happy... Summer Vacation for a family of six... so worth it.Walking distance from the beach, downtown ,everything is right around the corner. Thank you Hyatt

Comfortable beds but need choice of firmness of pillows! Our pillows were so soft our heads sunk right in no support. As for customer service very good some obviously more experienced than others to answer questions but for most part were great.

It was such a lovely stay at this hotel! It is very close to the beach and main shopping/restaurant strip! The free breakfast was fun to enjoy every morning; not a wide selection of food but it was a solid breakfast every morning. I do however wish that on the weekend the assortment was a different choice (just like the weekdays) because it was a little boring on the weekend.The best part about this hotel other than the location was the staff! Please give a warm and happy THANK YOU to Rey (who is a delightful, ray of sunshine - as he was such a smiling, happy soul to see most days when he would make our room clean and beautiful! He is such a hardworking, cheerful guy and we appreciated him very much on our girls vacation! Keep it up Rey!) also thank you to Dalisay and Arlita for being friendly and helpful to keep our rooms tidy and lovely. Also, we LOVED having the aloha Friday lei making! Would come back to the hotel for that as well! Overall, great location, happy staff, lei making was fun, breakfast was good (oh except a kitchen staff man (who was not friendly) screamed at me for putting my water into a water bottle (I did not know to put it in a cup - was trying to save dishes) and told me to go to the gym - SORRY eeek?!! that wasn't very appreciated but other than that.... smooth, happy stay here!) We would definitely come back and stay here. Thank you Hyatt and staff. :)

Staff are lovely, wifi good and the rooms nicely renovated but too many downsides to recommend. The queues for the elevator are just insane. Routinely 15-20 people waiting for an elevator which then takes forever to get to your floor. We booked a sea view and while technically you could see the ocean you were mainly looking at the building in front. The staff were super accommodating and moved us to a high floor with a better outlook. But I wouldn't bother paying for the view. The pool area looks like a prison yard. No plants to break up the bleak expanse of concrete. It wouldn't take much to make it look tropical with some vines up one wall or something. Overall could not recommend, especially given the price point.

We spend 3 nights at the Hyatt. We were very impressed with the staff that checked us in. She was very friendly and polite. The rooms were big and comfortable beds. Breakfast was nice but a little bit chaotic. We loved the hotel and will stay here next time we come to Honolulu.

This was a second time staying here at the Hyatt Place. We were upgraded and allowed early checkin. The elevators were a bit slow at times. This place is a great stay, it’s affordable and with a free breakfast every morning was great. Yes it’s not amazing food but we are not too picky. Overall we had another great day at the Hyatt Place!

For a Hyatt hotel this is quite poor. The location is good, rooms adequate however the breakfast is an absolute shambles. Poor quality food, you battled through other guests to get it and then the birds if you were lucky enough to get a seat.

This is a great hotel to stay at. I arrived and the staff was very helpful. I did end up having to take my wife to the hospital as she wasn't feeling well. Upon returning 3 days later and taking with Matt and Fernando they went ahead and allowed me to stay an additional night as I didn't stay more than an hour the first night. Very helpful, understanding, and accommodating! Deffinetly recommend!

The room overall was quite clean, the room we got didn’t really have a view, except a view of the hotel across from us. The beds were a decent size but the sofa bed was quite uncomfortable but there’s not much to expect since it was a sofa bed. The complimentary breakfast had a good variety of dishes, Lots of drinks to choose from. The breakfast area was a little hard to find, we thought it was in the lobby but it’s actually near the pool. It is quite a far walk from the Royal shopping center and the other stores but it was super close to the beach. Overall it was a good stay but the price was a little too much. But if you’re looking for comfort and a place that’s close to the beach, this is the hotel for you.

We stayed in Waikiki for a few days to visit Pearl Harbor before going to Kauai. We would not recommend staying at Hyatt Place Waikiki. The rooms are tiny and the location on the south end of Waikiki is not nice. While they say there is a pool, it’s also tiny and located on the roof of the 3rd floor. The hotel claims to have self parking, but there are so few parking spots you are forced to use valet parking for $35/day. The only reason for 2 stars instead of one is that the rooms are clean and they have a decent free hot breakfast.

We enjoyed our 4 nights stay at this Hyatt. Service was friendly. They let us check in 2 hours early, so that's a huge plus! Free breakfast everyday, and they do offer a little bit of everything. Free beach towels and one block from the beach. Rooms are cleaned well and comfortable. Cons - slow elevator, no sit down restaurant if you want to dine in, parking is $25/night.

Hyatt place served my purpose well.I was happy with location and service. Valet attendants are informed and helpful. Desk attendants helpful.Info desk helpful.Clean enough and great breakfast. Relaxed and welcoming.

lots of Aloha..all over....staff cares genuine and gives excellent service.....Aloha spreads to guests and everywhere a pleasant enjoyable experience......highly recommend also for location...rooms clean, safe and everything a/c etc works well//

We stayed here a month ago and I can tell you it is not what it advertises. I give it one star because we did have a roof over our head and the housekeeping and food service staff works very hard! PROS:Two blocks from the beachTowels for beach/pool available dailyFree breakfast - average but hey, it's freeCONS:Valet - Be prepared to wait and do not expect ANYONE to help you with bags, etc. We had to empty our own car (quickly as others were waiting to get in) and put it to the side of the hotel. Had to wait over 30 minutes for our car to leave for the airport! They are way understaffed! Also, self-parking is a joke. Never a space available so you are forced to valet it every day during your trip. Room: VERY SMALL. Fold out couch is really a fold out chair and the mattress is a little smaller than a twin size. Also, they only have a couple of the bigger one bedrooms (as seen in the photos) so if you didn't get one and there are more than two of you in a room (we had 3) you will be tripping over yourselves and everything else. I asked the desk about changing to a larger room and if they had a two bedroom suite I could move us to. I was told all the rooms were the same size and there were no two bedroom suites. Imagine my surprise when I ventured down the hall to ask housekeeping for an extra towel and saw a two bedroom suite on one side and a much larger king room on the other! A/C: The A/C is set so that it can only be adjusted between 68-72. If you try to change it, it shuts off. A/C is a wall unit that will only come on when the sliding door is closed and the temp is over 72. Pool: Prepare to be disappointed. It's very small and there is NO hot tub. Front Desk: Check in time 3:00pm, several rooms were not ready. They have a "Did you Forget it?" stash of items and they were out of stock on several so I had to walk around Waikiki at 3am to find a 24 hour store to get Pepto-Bismol for my son. The desk clerk was no help with telling me where to go. I was talking to someone who worked there and was told that this hotel takes a lot of big groups and gives them special rates. Grad week was going on while we were there and it was a madhouse. They told me that is why rooms aren't ready by three for check-in (they all get late check-outs and housekeeping has to hustle to get them all cleaned as well as the other rooms). They also had to put breakfast downstairs to accommodate all the kids. We were there for over a week so we saw one group of grads go and another one arrive as well as another large tour group from Europe. The employee told me that the hotel does that to keep it at maximum capacity so if it pisses off us regular "non-group" clients we are but one room to their many. I understand they are a business but when you save all year for a vacation and choose to stay at hotel with a trusted name like HYATT, there is a level of service and accommodations that are expected when spending a lot of money on a room. Next time I'm just going to pony up the extra money for Embassy Suites which has never disappointed us. Live and learn! P.S. Our friends were staying in the rooms next to us. Their rooms had BED BUGS!

Great experience in the busiest part of Waikiki. The hotel is just off the main strip giving a quieter experience. Just a block or so from the beach. Great place for families. Would stay there in the future if returning to Hawaii.

Overall we were disappointed considering the price paid for the room, but there are pros and cons:Pros:Very accommodating staff. Due to a mix up with my credit card the room was cancelled on the day we were to arrive. We finally got there at 11pm and Matt (desk staff) worked his magic to resurrect the booking – Thanks Matt.Well-equipped Gym, air conditioned and very clean.Easy reach of the Waikiki beach and Kapiʻolani Regional Park.Comfortable bed.Good air-conditioning (effective and quite).Reasonably clean sink, WC and shower area. Cons:We were on the 12th floor (one floor from the top) but the ocean view was obscured by 2 large skyscraper (see picture).Sink blocked on arrival (fixed next day by room service).Sink area has no door (only the shower and WC are closed off). If you use the WC in the night, the lamp from the sink area illuminates the whole room (not good if you’re a light sleeper).The carpet was filthy so don’t walk around bare foot or you will transfer it to the bed linen.The room also had a strange smell. Not so noticeable at first but towards the end of our stay I had to report it to reception. The balcony is actually a ledge, little more than a chair’s width.Open air breakfast area exposed to wind and light rain. During our stay the hotel was hosting Graduate week and breakfast became a fiasco. To accommodate, the reception lounge was converted to a breakfast area (you can probably imagine how that looked, you could barely move for students eating everywhere).

Wonderful stay while moving off the island with our cat on military orders. Free breakfast and a wonderful view. The room was definitely small but it was clean. Close to Wall Beach. They took good care of us!
user_name:
Susan B
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: I had a great stay on this trip. I was with my eighteen year old daughter and we loved this hotel. The location seems a bit sketchy coming in at night, but honestly that is downtown Honolulu for you. The staff was great. We had valet parking which was $35, but well worth it. The valets were excellent. Since I am a frequent visitor to Hyatt they offered me a free extended checkout of 2pm. A quick 5 minute walk to the beach. A wolfgang puck less than a block way, and a jamba juice. What more could you ask for. Hotel food was good too.

Rooms were very small. Our room was not serviced in the 4 days we were there even though we requested it. Our room was left open for a number of hours by staff. Our belongings could have been stolen. No upgrades were offered to us even though We had to move our Belongings at 10 PM with our infant son

My only complaint is the elevator. Sometimes we waited 10 minutes or more. Taking the steps down isn't so bad but, we were on the 12th floor so going up didn't happen much. Getting elevator down was biggest problem, especially during breakfast. Breakfast is awesome, worst part is the wind on 3rd floor service area. It's nice being outside but extremely windy most days. Employees great and helpful, informed.

Both Matt and Ihab made our stay very enjoyable and went above and beyond to make sure my wife and I were taken care of. The only downside that we had was over 700 high school grads there when we stayed so the elevators were hard to get. But overall a great experience dealing with the staff. Thanks Matt and Ihab!

This was our fist time in Oahu, but it won't be our last. When we come back, we will definitely stay at Hyatt Place! The rooms are clean, the staff is amazing, and the breakfast buffet is delicious! We were greeted with smiles by every employee we encountered. Wow!

We had our first trip to Hawaii this June and when looking for a hotel we had a couple of requirements ... breakfast included in the price and the ability to have three beds in the room due to two teenage kids who cannot cope with sleeping in the same bead anymore (you all know how kids can get ). So Hyatt Place in Waikiki stood out as it met these requirements. Well after spending twelve nights there I can definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is fantastic, right near the beach so a nice easy walk, fairly close to the centre of town and the restaurants which is brilliant and the rooms were large enough not to feel closed in. We had an ocean view room so it was nice to wake up every morning to a great view of Waikiki beach. The staff were exceptional, nothing was too much trouble, everyone had a friendly Aloha when you saw them and they really made our stay memorable. The cost was reasonable and to be fair considering the level of service I am truly impressed. So all potential guests please read this and don’t hesitate to book here ... we had a fantastic time and I am sure you will too.

Returning from my stay on Big Island I spent two nights at thislovely hotel. It had a refurbishment recently and has a taste forall ages. Chick & Retro.The staff at the check in/ out were competent and efficient. I was satisfied with the value for money. Just a stones’ throw from the beach.as well as Concierge. Food and beverage was very satisfactory.I was surprised at the adjoining Dominos Pizza Place.

The Hyatt Place has been able to maintain a high standard after recovering from a setback a few years ago, the cleanliness and room quality is superb. The staff are friendly and will go above and beyond to assist. The FREE breakfast is a good way to start the day, it can be busy at times, but there is no need to hurry in Hawai'i, the beach will still be there, and the bar will be serving cold drinks every evening.

The Hyatt Place is a solid value for the price, especially since there isn't a resort free and daily breakfast is complimentary. It's located on the Diamond Head edge of Waikiki making in and out access much easier.

Arriving after a 20 hour trip and being called by name is a real plus! The friendly smiles that me helped me relax right away! I was registered quickly and provide bottled water that I was really ready for! I didn't want to visit the bar, so the water was a big help! The warm welcome and smiles of Lisa and Angeline made me feel at home right away!

We arrived at the hotel verrrry early (like 6.30am) and after an almost 11hr flight in discomfort and with zero sleep, we were so very desperate just for a little bit of rest but we knew the hotel check in time was 3pm. Upon checking in, we were so very relieved to be given the opportunity to check in straight away. You have no idea what this did for us, to get a few hours sleep literally immediately made the world of difference! Especially with kids who were beyond exhausted. Location is a little out of the way from the 'heart' of the action so to get to the main area with all the eateries does involve a bit of a walk (families with young kids would appreciate this tip). It was ok for us but by day 5, our youngest (7yr old) was struggling with all the walking. Still considered centrally located but on the edge of the main area. Pool is very small and provides no shaded areas. Some beach umbrellas would be wonderful for the middle of the day swims. Pool towels were always readily available beside the pool.The thing we didn't enjoy was the hotel breakfast. Now we've stayed at many Hyatt Places and their breakfasts are all pretty well the same however, this one seemed 'worse' than the others. There was no fresh fruit, only chopped rockmelon/dewberry/pineapple mixed in a big bowl and everyone takes all the rockmelon so the bowl is just left with pineapples. We came down to breakfast at 9am one morning and there was no fruit left and when we asked about it they said they've run out. Its not hard to swap things around a bit...when visitors are staying 5+ days, the breakfast is almost not worth coming down for. We are on day 6 and we're all well and truly over it and considering heading out to McDonalds tomorrow morning. Beware the pigeons and birds...they are absolutely everywhere at the breakfast area (which is outdoors!!) It gets incredibly annoying for everyone. The birds fly onto your table and peck at your food. We're not able to eat in peace and forever shooing away the birds. Not sure why they don't enclose the breakfast area because you can see how annoying the birds become for everyone. The ladies tending the brekky area need to smile and simply be more pleasant and friendly. We are travelling with a family of 10 people and every morning we love to have a bit of hot chocolate. The hot chocolate sachets aren't readily available we have to request for it. So every morning we would ask for the 8-10 sachets and day 1 they were nice about it but yesterday we sensed a little attitude from the ladies. Then this morning topped it off, when my Husband asked for some hot chocolate the lady replied "this is the 3rd day" - handed him the box of remaining hot chocolate sachets and said "here take this, its all we have left". Gosh its not like we're asking for 10 packets for 1 person, we are a family of 10! Not sure how we'll go about asking for our hot chocolate again tomorrow morning! But the faces and they way they talk to each other (in a way you can tell they're clearly talking about us) is just rude and un-necessary. Umbrellas - well this got me a little frustrated also. For the 3rd day running we've gone up to reception at the beginning of the day (we have approached reception middle and evening also) and asked if there were any umbrellas available only to be told no there aren't any left. Are people just taking umbrellas and keeping it the whole stay and not returning them? One lady even suggested that it had been raining alot the past 3 days (we have not left Oahu and i can assure you it hasn't rained). So it would appear they just don't have enough to go around. Be careful about a 'destination fee'. We were told about it at check in but because we booked some time ago before the destination fee was introduced we didnt get charged. To me its almost like a resort fee which was one great thing about the Hyatt Place but doesn't seem like it anymore with the introduction of this fee (i believe its $15USD/day and covers things like beach chair etc). The lifts - OMG there's only 2 lifts and they are sloooooooow. Funnily enough, this has been the case with all the lifts at various Hyatt Places in the US. Do they all get their lifts from the same company? They're soooo painfully slow. Dont forget anything in the room because to get back up there will take you another 10mins just waiting for the lift. The hotel has a pamphlet of bits and pieces you can buy, borrow or get for free if you've left them home. In the brochure it notes you can borrow water wings and pool noodles for the pool. Our kids got so excited seeing this as they could do with the help of some floaties but when i approached reception i was advised these are no longer offered by the hotel. Its a cost friendly hotel and only one of a few that will take families with 2 adults 3 kids so yes i would stay again but i really hope all the Hyatt Places in the US would revamp their brekky menu - its not hard but it would just make everyones stay alot more pleasant.

The excellent service started at check in. We were very early for check in and didn't expect to be given a room right away. Chris said he would get us in as soon as possible and said we could wait in the very comfortable waiting area. The bellman took good care of our luggage and we thought we would take a walk around town while we waited. The room was ready before we could leave. The room was spacious and very clean. No view of the beach but there was a balcony. Front desk staff were very helpful and gave good advice on restaurants and transportation. Breakfast, included in the price of the room, was excellent. Hot and cold items, good coffee and tea selections. Quick in and out. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for 6 nights because of the great price and free breakfast daily. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by smiling faces. A special thank you to Heidi for such a warm welcome. We stayed in the Diamond Head tower 6th floor and our room was plenty big for the two of us. Comfortable bed, lots of bathroom space, and had a small loving room with a couch and tv. Very close walk to the beach and the hotel provides your beach towels everyday. The pool is small but we didn’t care because we were a the beach everyday. The hotel also has self laundry available and all tours pick up at the hotel or maybe across the street. There is also a bus stop and trolley stop near by. If you are looking for a comfortable, affordable, friendly place to stay this hotel is for you. You can’t go wrong with the amazing staff always there with a smile and willing to help. We were even here during grad week. Sometimes the students could be downright rude but the staff kept their cool and didn’t let it effect their guest service. We absolutely would return to the Hyatt Place Waikiki.

The staff from room care to breakfast staff did a great job. The front desk staff went beyond professionalism to show real compassion when we had a medical emergency!I recommend this hotel because of the staff.

Visited Hawaii and stayed at three different islands, our stay at the Hyatt Place was something never to be forgotten, sitting having breakfast freshly prepared on the hotel patio with Waikiki beach just over the boundary wall, it's truly an awe inspiring place.

Although the facility is showing some age, it is convenient and comfortable. It’s about 2 blocks from the beach and an easy walk from a variety of restaurants. Don’t expect much or any view of the beach, but otherwise it’s fine. And the tour bus for Pearl Harbor stops at the front door.

I have stayed at various Hyatt locations and had enjoyed the great service and facilities. But experience during recent stay at Waikiki was not same/even close to other places.It may be just me and the room I was in. We were on third floor which had poorly maintained/clean areas. Such as the carpet near elevator, in the room had black spots all over-sign of wear etc. Room was decent size and was an upgrade from my original booking, so no complaints about that . Breakfast was decent but lacked variety.Front desk wasn't always available for help. And same for the vallet parking. Too long waiting time.

we stayed at the Hyatt place last October for the first time, so recommended it to our daughter who wanted to stay in Waikiki with her friend from overseas. I had a contact name of Ihab who is one of the assistant managers, he was absolutely incredible throughout out our many communications, as the girls had lots of questions they wanted answers to, he was very patient and also the team that also liaised for the girls stay. my daughter cannot have any certain milk products in her diet due to a health condition, she found that there was enough breakfast items she could have which was fantastic even the almond milk she can have, not many hotels supply this type of milk. Ihab upgraded their room to an ocean view it had huge amount of space for the two of them and the two beds as promised. every staff member she said was great that they encountered and found the expedia staff to be great in helping them book trips. And recommendations they gave. space was always available for breakfast, and thought the tray was a good idea if you did want breakfast in your room. the only negative they had was they didn't realise grad students would be staying the first group were great very respectful no problems how ever the second group ran wild this is not the hotels fault at all but the staff that were in charge of the young adults they ran up and down the stairs to the different floor and were just very noisy not good when you have to be up at four a.m. for your return flight home. they also stole the do not disturb sign from the girls door but the reception soon replaced it, the cleaning staff of their room were great. they absolutely loved the location to where everything was and would stay again without hesitation which is great when its two girls staying in a place. they cannot thank Ihab and his staff enough for their stay and would recommend to anyone else wanting a great hotel in Waikiki for the great rate Ihab arranged for the girls too mind you we are Hyatt members.(parents). and the breakfast was a huge bonus set the girls up for their busy days out.

This was my first time staying in a Hyatt, and my stay was for over a month. The staff went above and beyond to make sure my stay and experience was one of the best ever! Matt is one of the best managers I've ever conducted business with, along with Lisa and Nick being two superb staff members as well! Great location and hotel!

Be aware that what you see in the website isn’t necessarily what you get! The cozy sleeper sofa you’d normally have at a Hyatt Place is actually a tiny sleeper chair, like a third of the sofa! If you don’t mind very cramped rooms, this Hyatt Place is pretty good—nice breakfast variety, excellent location, and helpful staff.

It is very nice hotel with clean modern rooms. Staff is very friendly. Good location close to the beach. Nice breakfast. Me and my daughter have a good time staying in that family friendly hotel. I would recomend this hotel to everybody.

Great hotel highly recommend it for families. The staff are great and greet you always with a smile. A big thank you Dino he was great helping us out with our stay. Fernando you should be proud of all your staff, see you again soon

Pros:-Room was spacious & clean-Breakfast included. -Close to Beach and in heart of Waikiki Cons:- Extremely long delays for elevator. There are only 2 lifts per tower used by service staff and guests. -Pool: small & not enough seating lounges around the pool. Not ideal for relaxing/reading. No drink/snack service by the pool. -Gym:there was often a lot of congestion at the gym in the weights area. The only strength training equipment were a set of dumbbells.

I noticed that the Waikiki Beach hotels were pricy, so I looked for a cheaper option without compromising too much on comfort. The pictures looked nicer than reality, but it was still fine enough for me. I booked a room with sea view and got it and a balcony. There were buildings in front and sea view in between them. The balcony was too hot and not very nice to use, but ok for evening photos as the sunset sky was beautiful from there. The breakfast was average, the area were they served it was not very nice. It felt like being in an all-inclusive family resort. It was noisy, crowded and messy and not very area. I however think the area they usually use were under renovation at that time? And these were a temporary solution. I ended up bringing my breakfast to my room, as I saw several others do as well. The hotel is close to the beach and different tours pick up people right across the street. There are restaurants and shops every where around.

The hotel is in a good location to get just about anywhere near the Waikiki Shore. We have stayed here a couple times and the price and service always make it a good option. While it’s not right on the beach, we like to know we are in a clean decent hotel, but save money for experiences. This is always a reliable choice. We stayed there to celebrate an anniversary, and they went above and beyond in making it extra special. Classy move! The only issue of note- we stayed in a high room on the Diamond Head side and the sounds from the street carried into the room louder than expected.

First time in Hawaii. I was used to newer Hotels, and although initially disappointed with the room PH was smaller and dated, than expected. We had 2 weeks at the Hyatt Place and the Staff, Food and Views made up for the initial disappointment. Sooooo close to Beach & shops. Tours pickup right out side the door. What more could one ask for. PS I was'nt included in the payment of accom. :)

This place needs a 5 Star!! My family was treated so good, we have never been treated with so much kindness and above & Beyond. My mom had a very bad fall at the airport and need to get a wheelchair. The Hyatt place help her get in a Handicap room so she had more mobility. No extra charge. They where just so kind and sweet to us and was always there when we had questions. Only a block away from the ocean and their cinnamon rolls was amazing. I would stay there every time we go there. I want to thank the Hyatt Place for everything you all did to make our family trip amazing.

Don't blink or you'll miss the entrance to this Hyatt. Or maybe you should. This is not what I expected when I booked a Hyatt. More like a Holiday Inn. It's clean. And you have breakfast included. That's where I stop complimenting, unfortunately. It's a bit run down, and the service is very average. Don't have an issue, you'll be sent to your room with a phone number to figure it out for yourself.

I'm a very hard person to please, but Hyatt Place did just that. GREAT customer service, comfortable room.... The only things that were not perfect were 1.) Limited self-parking stalls, 2.) Elevator was not smooth, 3.) Room (with King size bed) was a little smaller than anticipated.... other than that, TOTALLY recommend this hotel. Free breakfast was such a plus!

Location was amazing, 2 short blocks from beach that is closed off so you can easily float around. Free Hot breakfast was great, with outdoor seating. Bed was super comfortable and a big room with balcony.

Great hotel, close to the beach. A little way from the hub of Waikiki but a great mix of quality, location and price. Its worth paying the extra money to upgrade your room and if possible get a sea view. Dont go there for the pool or quality of breakfast.

We had a 12 night stay with the Hyatt. Upon arrival at 6:00am we were able to get into our room by 9:00am which was amazing, the service desk was so beautiful in doing this for us as we had 2 small children that were super tired from a 16 hour travel day to get there.Hotel room was basic, but the beds were AMAZING, worth every penny for the bed. We paid extra for an ocean view which was lovely to wake up to but the balcony was so small you could not sit out there and thoroughly enjoy it. So that was a little disappointing. Not work the extra cost for the ocean view.For us we were at the wrong end of the strip as all the restaurants we enjoyed were right up the other end, so this was a little inconvenient after a day trip out. But the walls were nice something home along the beach when we had the energy.

Due to approximately 500 just-graduated young hotel guests staying in this hotel apparently through July 9th, my two-night stay was less than my usual experience there. From the graduates over-crowding the elevators, causing both elevators in hotel to break down for 35 minutes, and local fire department service called to restore operations, to their loud screaming at 2:30am in the morning after partying all night, to the air conditioning breaking, my stay was less than my usual high quality service. I realize that the young people are guests also, but the lack of respect for the hotel property and other guests by many of them, not all, was palpable. One young man even said in elevator 'Oh, wouldn't it be funny if your dog vomited, sh-- and p--d in elevator while riding it?' This hotel allows doggies and my doggie is the perfect guest. His statement was made in front of a hotel staff person and we were both shocked by his ignorance and lack of regard for his stay in the hotel. Moral to the story-don't stay in hotels with hundreds of new graduates perhaps.

I definitely recommend this hotel for families. The staff was very helpful & courteous and the location was great! The breakfast buffet was delicious and always had plenty to eat. They even provided chairs for us to bring down to the beach.

Grandma leonida was he best maid I have ever had in a hotel. She is truly dedicated to her job, she has great attitude. Always trying to make a conversation with us. Very friendly. She does beyond excellent in her job. Thank you Grandma Leonida !

This hotel was pretty nice, the valet/drop off area is small and gets crowded easily. The valet/parking prices are 25-30 dollars a day but I learned this is a common price for a decent hotel here. They have a Dominos Pizza right off the main lobby which is nice for the quick family meal. ATM in the lobby also. Check-in staff was friendly and we were upgraded to a larger room for free, can’t beat that! Room(2 queen) was spacious with a balcony with 2 chairs. They have a small bar area in the lobby that offers small bits and alcohol which is nice and convenient. This hotel is close to an ABC store and only about 2 blocks from the beach. I would stay here again, price seems a little high but once again this is Oahu and this pricing is how it is here for a nice hotel close to the beach.

Very friendly staff, clean rooms, good location and easy walk to most everything in Waikiki. Concierge desk was great and very helpful. Room was nice size. Open air breakfast kitchen. Gym was well equipped. Pool was clean

the room was clean and tidy. the house staff were all very friendly. thr room was a little on the small side but on a postive its close to the beach and all the shopping you would ever need. wifi was sometimes a bit unreliable but overall the stay was very pleasant.

Good costumer service...delicious breakfast has good food especially the miso soup in the morning!...friendly staff and great customer service...easy check in and out...close to the beach...clean hotel...using computer and printer at no charge...good place to stay!

We stayed there for 6 nights. The location is great, a few blocks from Waikiki beach, and shops and some restaurants nearby. It takes 15 minutes walk to central of Waikiki such as Royal Hawaiian Centre but the bus stop is just In front of the hotel and it takes only 5 minute so no problem. The room is decent size and the bed is very comfortable. I felt the shower is a bit old, and we could adjust the temperature of water but we couldn’t adjust water pressure... Anyway it was not a big deal. Lanai is not nice at all. We didn’t sit there even we had a ocean view room. So small and not inviting at all... Ocean view room was partial ocean view actually. There are some high buildings between the hotel and the beach, so don’t expect fully ocean view. Breakfast is included and that was nice. Not a lot of selection but we enjoyed it. We could take away coffee/tea, which was fantastic.

Great location and staff no need to get an ocean view because ocean cannot really be seen from the rooms (obstructed from buildings). Room could use a little makeover, but they are nice and have everything you would need. Bed was excellent, so comfortable!! Quiet hotel in back tower where the breakfast is served.

This hotel staff was the best. They were welcoming and helpful every single day. The value, location and room size were perfect. Comes with free breakfast which is a huge value and savings for families.

My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights. I have nothing but kind words to say about the helpful and friendly staff. They always greeted us with a smile and came to our room quickly whenever we needed something or to resolve an issue. The FREE hot breakfast was a plus. They tried to mix it up every day which was nice. For those that complained about breakfast need to get a grip---this isn't a Las Vegas buffet. Most hotels on Waikiki don't even offer a free breakfast. I was amazed to see that they provided almond milk as well. I'm glad hotels are picking up on the non-dairy folks. The room was a bit on the smaller size, but was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I only wish they had a bathtub. Overall, my husband and I enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back!

Stayed here on our way to New Zealand. Our maid Julie was especially nice. Always talked to us. Our room was lovely. All of the employees here have been super friendly and helpful. Hotel is close to the beach and can easily walk to anywhere.Also have a nice bar and bartenders. Even double as baristas for the Starbucks coffee shop connected to the bar. Recommend this place. Clean. Close. Friendly. Also, the receptionist downstairs named Angeline was very helpful with many things , including some printing problems. Such a nice girl. Dealing with the public must sometimes get old, but you could never tell from the fantastic staff.

Comfortable and close to everything Waikiki had to offer. Our party of 3 couples in 3 rooms, 2 were upgraded on check-in and were well appointed. The remaining couple left in the originally booked room were a little cramped for space - a fairly basic "motel style" room.Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable but pillows were terrible.Drip coffee machine needs a rethink - difficult to fill and can only do one cup at a time.In-room supplies were sparse but extra tea bags were pretty easily obtained if you caught the eye of the cleaner as she moved around the floor.Breakfast Buffet was really good with excellent variety and plenty available. Could be a bit windy at times on the open pool deck and the "clean freaks" would find it a little off-putting, sharing breakfast with the birds - could always take your breakfast to your room on the provided tray if you found that a problem.Staff were exceptionally polite and accessible - offered some great tips on how to get the the best from our holiday.All-in-all, hotel offered a great base for us to explore the Waikiki offerings and, really, it is just somewhere to sleep - there is so much to do and see around Oahu that you would be crazy to spend too much time in any hotel room.

Far enough from Waikiki to get peace and quite, but close enough to walk and enjoy yourself. Right next to an ABC Store and parking is right across the street. Not the most romantic of hotels, but great value!

The Hyatt Place is located only a block away from Waikiki beach. Attraction wise Diamond Head is a 15 min local bus ride which cost 5 US dollars return (bus stop is located down the street) or a 40 min walk. Ala Moana shopping centre is a 15 min trolly ride which is like a local tram for only 2 dollars highly recommend. Pearl harbour is located about 1 hour away however transport can be organised at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa which is located across the road. The breakfast is very poor however beggars can’t be choosers as it is complimentary however, was a deciding factor for me when booking, so was very disappointed. Early check in was provided however, did compromise our view from a King to a Queen City view on a 2nd floor so we did miss out on Hawaii fabulous city view and still paid for the King so be very careful when they offer you. a “complementary” early check in , because ours was definitely a down grade. However, after a long flight we appreciated the sleep. Happy travels

We checked in early got upgraded by Annabelle who new it was my birthday and gave us complimentary champagne. She was so helpful and a pleasure to deal with. We will be coming back and thanks again...

Very friendly people working there. Not bad location but I expected the room to be bigger. Breakfast was good but birds were all over the place. Payment king was a challenge, you have to find another park place or pay $35 a day

From the moment we arrived at Hyatt Place we were meet the most lovely people at check in they go out of there way to make sure you stay is fantastic.The rooms are very spacious and very clean ,we had a mountain views which was lovely.All the staff are very friendly , we had the free breakfast every day which was great it saved us going out to look for breakfast and it had a great variety each day. We did day tours and had Nate organise all what we want to see and do he did a fantastic job .We had a fantastic time and it was our first time in Hawaii and it wouldn’t be the last no matter where you go Hawaiian people have made our say memorable

Vacation was awesome and the hotel was great. Only issue was the breakfast was sometimes cold and lacked flavor. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. The staff made our stay comfortable and relaxing.

Great hotel one block from Waikiki Beach. Consistent with the type of service I have experienced at Hyatt Place hotels. Friendly helpful staff that are eager to make sure you have a great stay. Large rooms, clean and well maintained. I will stay here again when I return to Honolulu.
user_name:
Eileen B
Playas de Rosarito, Mexico

review_body: We arrived in Hawaii at 6am the staff where lovely and held our bags and happily said they would try and have us a room ASAP they would email /call once it was ready. Once arriving in our room we where surprised at how lovely it was and the value we received for our money. We had a small view of the ocean from our balcony even though we didn’t pay for an ocean view room. The bed was super comfy. Fercitities where clean and well set out. The staff where a real highlight for us when passing in the hall there was always a hello, aloha, or have a nice day served with a lovely smile. Location is so close to the beach and shops. We would recommend and would stay again on our next trip.

The room was very small. It would have been o.k. for 1 but crowded for 2. There is no place to put ANYTHING! The counter tops in the vanity area barely hold necessities. There is virtually no place to even put a robe in the shower area. The carpet felt sticky from dirt and humidity. The balcony is a pure JOKE! It's about 2 feet deep. I believe it was originally made just to hold the air conditioner and heater. The chairs on the "balcony" can't even set facing out, they have to face each other because there is not enough room to straighten them out. The bed was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was pretty good. The pool would probably hold about 10 people total. The staff was helpful, polite and friendly. The location is good, not directly on the beach, but about a block away. If you get a high floor you can "view" the ocean. I guess I expected more from HYATT.

Located about 1 to 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. All sorts of dining choices within walking distance. Public transportation on corner across street. Catholic Church 1 & 1/2 blocks away. Wonderful staff at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach Hotel !! Very clean and good complimentary breakfast ! Would stay there again for sure !!!

This hotel is literally 2 mins away from the beach. I was worried about the distance from the beach but it wasn’t a problem at all. Our room was very spacious (double bed with sofa) for our family of five. The beds were super comfortable since my hubby and i have back issues. We were on the 15th floor with a partial ocean view (the other buildings were in view). We always enjoy the complimentary breakfast Hyatt place provides. Certainly helped with the general high costs of the state. The staff from housekeeping to the valet were extremely helpful and welcoming. The service from Lei and Matt at the front desk were exceptional. We had a car rental and parked it across the street. Great location and walking distances to all the shops. My daughters were in the pool every night despite being at the beach for most of the day.Unfortunately I took away a star due to the inconvenience of the numerous fire alarms going off during our stay...including two nights in a row to vacate our room at 3am. Of course it is beyond anyone’s control and it is safety but an explanation would have been helpful rather than the staff being approached the same question numerous of times.

I booked 2 rooms for my broTHer in-laws 6oTh, we arrived early so was upgraded due To being HyaTT member plus was our 2nd sTay aT This hoTel. EveryThing during our sTay was fanTasTic, greaT sTaff ever so friendly,breafasT greaT. Would like To make a special menTion To The housekeeper Maria who cleaned our rooms 1632 & 1634, she was The nicesT person you could ever meeT & of course did her job professionally. When we reTurn nexT Time we cerTainly will be sTaying aT HyaTT Place. KaTHy

Our first room's air conditioner was not working so we were immediately upgraded to ocean view room. Hotel location great since it was away from all the Waikiki crowds but close enough to quieter part or beautiful beach. Breakfast more than adequate with plenty of seating. Pool small but who goes to Hawaii to sit by pool. All employees extremely friendly. All and all great property for value.

The hotel is in a great location about 2 blocks from the beach. The rooms and beds were super comfy. The breakfast was hot, delicious with changing menu each morning. The staff is awesome and always ready to assist you.

With so many great places to stay in Waikiki its difficult to choose a hotel that has the right combination of atmosphere, comfort, price, amenities, and most importantly a great staff. Without a doubt Hyatt Place gets it right every time I stay. My co-workers and I have been staying here on and off for years and they never fail to deliver a first class experience. Fancy décor and fine dining found at other hotels are great but matter little when compared to the first rate staff employed here. Going the extra mile, friendly smiles, and a genuine concern for me as a guest sets this hotel apart from so many others. While this review is simply my opinion, I recommend you see for yourself. I Guarantee you won't be disappointed!

We stayed for a week from 5/10/18 to 5/17/18 and had a great time. After last years stay at the Regency we wondered if Hyatt Place could compare and were pleasantly surprised. Our room was spacious and very clean, housekeeping did a wonderful job. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet 6 of 7 mornings and it was very good. The hotel is in a great location, with just a short 2 block walk to our favorite part of Waikiki. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

Perfect holiday Straight from the beginning to the end of our holiday, we had a perfect stay at this hotel , breakfast was great , the room was great and the services and staff was excellent, I will highly recommend this hotel .

Overall great stay and representative of the Hyatt Place name. Easy in/out access from Waikiki to travel island or see family. Clean rooms. Happy and accommodating staff. Complete breakfast to start the day.

Great property. Close to everything. Breakfast buffet was good. Was 3 blocks from the beach. Customer service was outstanding. Valet parking did a great job. Quick to get my car. All of the staff were helpful and courteous. Would definitely recommend this property.

We paid extra for an ocean view room and were enjoying a pleasant, quiet and relaxing stay at the hotel until the dogs started to arrive at the hotel as it was pet friendly hotel. Unfortunately for us, the hotel guests in an adjacent room decided to leave their dog alone in the hotel room while they went out to breakfast, dinner, swimming, shopping and enjoyed other tourist activities. Needless to say, the dog barked continuously until its owners returned. Despite lodging complaints with the reception staff on two separate occasions, no action or response was provided by the hotel management. This is vey disappointing for a Hyatt hotel. Hotel guests with pets should not be allowed to leave their pets unattended in the hotel room.

This Hyatt Place is in a great location in Waikiki. Short walking distance to beach, restaurants, and shops. The free breakfast has a wide variety of food to include fresh fruit. The service was great. The staff was very attentive and quick to assist when needed (safe needed to be reset and remote replaced).

We thought the staff went above and beyond from day 1 all of the way until the day we departed a week later. We cant say enough good things about them. We were in room 801.The inside of the room was great for 2 people. The view from our balcony however was not great. All we could really see were surrounding hotels of which some were under construction so the half full dumpsters were always in view. A few of the exceptional staff members were Lei,Paul,Heidi,Annbelle, and Lani who was terrific with the daily room cleaning. These are truly spectacular employees who stand out.

Definitely recommend staying here. From the moment you arrive staff are welcoming and always willing to help. The room was great had everything we needed. Breakfast was great wide variety and delicious! Overall great place to stay.

This Hyatt was the Oceans Hotel 6-7 years ago. Its located at far end of Waikiki near The Marriott and close my favorite sushi restaurant Sensai. The hotel is old like most hotels in Hawaii, but it is super clean. The rooms are large, and ours had a pullout couch. The beds are fantastic. The staff is polite and professional. I enjoyed the free breakfast. Hot and fresh pineapple. I recommend this Hyatt especially on a good rate. Now its not beach front. The pool is small but so are the majority of hotels with pools.

This hotel is great, whenever we needed anything, they were a great help. They booked us a taxi for when we needed to go to the airport, and helped us reconfirm our tours. They always had a smile when we walked in.

Location isn't bad, short walk to the beach at the upper (Diamond Head) end of Waikiki. Included breakfast was better than most. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was accommodating. Price was higher than I would have liked, but for Waikiki, not bad. Overall good experience.

The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We did a family vacation and felt very welcome. Location is great. Just a block to Waikiki beach and many restaurants. Breakfast was very good. We loved the fresh pineapple every morning.

Easy to get to, at the zoo end of Waikiki Beach, it's a convenient home base to get around on foot. The hotel is at the quieter eastern edge of the tourist district and you can wander that area or northeast towards a cluster of foodie hot spots (waiola shave ice, rainbow drive-in, leonard's bakery, ono seafood, side street inn, etc.) which range from 15-25 minutes away on foot. We found ourselves going back to that stretch of Kapahulu Ave many times for the laid back local vibe.KCC Farmer's Market and Diamond Head are do-able on foot as well, but the uphill stretch on Montsarrat may not be for everyone. We uber'ed up and walked down.The hotel itself was just as we expected based on their branding. "Modern Essentials" is how they market this sub-brand of Hyatt and why we chose this place. No stodgy flowery bedspreads or granny-style furniture here, just a spacious, clean, crisp and contemporary setting with all the basics for a family vacation.Check-in was quick and adjoining rooms had been arranged already. Breakfast was decent, lobby has lots of lounging space, and there's a smallish pool if you want that. But the ocean is only a couple blocks away, and the breakwater-protected portion is very close, for those who have kids.All in all, exactly what we wanted from the place. The only real negative was slow-ish elevators (not enough capacity at peak hours), but there were a couple of questionable observations I had that may be something or may be nothing.We found the housekeeping to be a bit too "friendly" (we didn't want housekeeping for the three day stay, but she made a point of engaging us in conversation both mornings about clean towels and emphasizing that she wouldn't be working the day we would be checking out, so it felt like she was fishing for an early tip...we did let her in on day two to do clean-up and left a tip).The other thing was that there was lack of clarity with their valet parking policy (we had a one day rental car parked overnight and no one told us to bring back the paper parking tag hung on the rear view mirror when we returned the car to the agency...apparently, if you don't tell them you're returning the car or bring back the tag, they assume you're still parking there...seemed like there was high potential for us to have a dispute upon check-out if we hadn't run into one of the staff who asked us about the tag...we managed to retrieve it from a small bag of garbage to give back to them).

We stayed for 9 nights. Awesome location. Away from the hustle and bustle but 5 minutes walk away, close to shops, beach and buses. Hotel is a bit dated but no complaints from us. The beds were the best I have slept in. Breakfasts weren't the best as in not much of a variety of hot foods. Staff were great. I would happily stay there again.

My wife and I had a pleasant stay at Hyatt Place. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The accommodations were good for the price with easy access to the beach and parking. I doubt I will stay in Waikiki on any future trips because of the traffic, but my overall experience with the hotel was very good

A lovely hotel with fantastic staff and the most comfortable beds. Great breakfast and facilities. Strongly recommend this as a lovely hotel without resort fees. Location is excellent and very convenient to everything

This is an awesome hotel. Great views and just one block walking distance to the beach. Great for families they have sand toys and beach chairs available to guest. Hearty Breakfast served daily which was a great convenience and savings. Heidi at the front desk had subperb customer service. Will definitely be staying here again. Rooms were clean and comfortable. It was my daughters 8th birthday and they reallly made her feel welcome and special!

Our room on 15th floor was very noisy at night. Both external noise (sirens, people, music etc) could be heard and internally the aircon was very noisy, there was also noise in the sink drain which appeared to glug loudly anytime someone on a higher level was using water (we could hear the water running). Staff were pleasant, wifi was good and fast enough and the included breakfast was nice but not sure I'd stay there again, both due to noise and the awkward room layout with the bathroom being half in the main room. We had a 2 x queen beds + sofa bed. There was not enough room to get dressed in the small shower/toilet area, but moving into the larger area where the sink/mirror is to dress, clean teeth, primp and dry your hair puts you right in the main room and means you are in full view of everyone else. We had never experienced this type of layout before and this could be a real issue for some, I wish we'd known about the exposed partial bathroom beforehand.

Very knowledgeable, friendly, & helpful.Thanks Jake If you come here, most of the staff are very good at answering questions.The pool is small-medium. There is no Health Food or Eggs Benedict either. But it is located centrally in Waikiki & near the Zoo & Waikiki Aquarium & Waikiki Beach @ half the price of hotels that do have fancy food & good parking.The sunsets on the water are nice between the other buildings. It is hard to use the self parking. Recommend Valet @ $35/day or no car, as you can walk practically anywhere from here.

The hotel was at a good location. It's close to the beach and you could walk down there. Its also close to the Waikiki mall about 13mins walk. The staff were great! The breakfast nice and overall my family and I had a good experience.

Good location a couple of blocks back from the beach. Easy walking distance to all of Waikiki. The staff are excellent especially Maria in housekeeping who looked after us so well during our stay. Thanks Maria you are a gem. The pool is basic but lovely and we spent many hours there. The free breakfast is awesome but beware the birds - don’t leave your plate unattended or they will claim it!!!We had a fantastic time and would recommend to anyone. Especially good for families or groups traveling together as the double double rooms are enormous and the beds are the most comfortable hotel beds we have ever experienced (and we’ve stayed in a LOT of hotels).

We booked a room for 5 guests, They provided a room for 4 guests.Aircon was noisy and hardly worked, kept us up all night.Remote for TV hardly worked. Ice machine only on Mezzanine floor had to get the lift downstairs to get ice.Asked to book a taxi for the morning but were advised that the reception would ring for one in the morning. When we requested the Taxi in the morning it took 30 mins to get there and we nearly missed our flight.They charged us an extra $15 RESORT FEE, and they saved a bucket on us not having our breakfast that was included.

We always stay here as the staff and spacious rooms make this hotel. Love Kimberly, Lei, Cole, Christopher and Angeline at reception. Tina and Fred at the breakfast bar remembered us from last time and are always so friendly and considerate. There was another lovely young female with light hair, Gloria maybe? who was very accommodating at breakfast. It is great having the breakfast but would recommend another healthier cereal option besides porridge. Maybe swap the colourful cereal for Corn Flakes? I am disappointed that there will be a resort fee the next time around, but this does not reflect on the actual hotel at all. Thanks guys.

Hotel is abyssmal; will add on charge to park vehicle for every night. Unexpected charges at the end . booked 12 nights, left after first night. Avoid if possible. This hotel was small, cramped, room service could not take orders, loud because of the nearby road.

I can stay at other hotels but I choose to stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. I travel to Oahu every other month for business. On my first stay here I was greeted warmly with easy access to information and amenities. Service, for me, is key and this hotel provides it. I made connections with the front desk, gallery, bar and housekeeping staff. The rooms are spacious, clean, updated with enough outlets to satisfy a techie and close to the beach, shopping, restaurants and night life. Breakfast is included and frankly, quite delicious!I'm ending my second visit now and eager to come back next month. The service is beyond compare. Heidi, Jade and Matt at the front desk deserve celebration along with Lei in the gallery and Nicholas at the bar. These people are the reason I've booked for June and will again for my September trip!Way to go, Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. You guys are AWESOME!

Great location, convenient to beach and entertainment...clean room...great staff! One complaint...room was too warm! Breakfast hadsomething for everyone! Starbucks in the lobby was wonderful! Great ocean views from our room!

Great location! This hotel is very close to the beach along with several other great shops. We rented a room with two queen sized beds and a pull out couch, which offered tons of space for our group of four adults. There's a pool and fitness area along with FREE breakfast. Highly recommend!

The positives here include the location--it is close enough to the main strip in Waikiki to feel safe. Parking is valet only, but was generally pretty quick, and most the the valet staff were very polite and helpful. Housekeeping was definitely lacking--there was an old pizza box on the side of the balcony off of the room, It was there before we checked in and still there when we checked out two days later. Also, the insides of the drawers had definitely not been cleaned; there was hair/debris in all of them. Sheets, bathroom and fridge were very clean. The room is very small, but that is not unusual for this area.Breakfast was good each day, bacon or sausage (one or the other each day), scrambled eggs, oatmeal, pancakes, toast, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, yogurt, milk, orange juice and coffee. They also had another area with options for miso soup, tofu, rice, and kimchi. Elevators were slow, so we usually took the stairs. We were on the 3rd floor and overlooked a really run down appointment next door. The pool was small but nice; it was relatively warm and never crowded when we were there. The eating area for breakfast is outside in the same area as the pool; if you go during the morning rush (around 8/8:3) seating is rather crowded so you might have to stand and wait a few minutes for a table. The best reason to come here is value if you get a good deal, and convenient location.

Clean and spacious room, basic breakfast and decent location close to Waikiki beach. Staff friendly and try hard to accommodate guest needs. Lift times unacceptable and took an excessive amount of time during all hours of the day, to the point where stairs could only be used.

I wouldn’t return to this hotel, not much I was impressed with.The Negatives:-We were told we were given an upgraded mountain view room but had a pretty boring view of the back streets.-Room is outdated and the carpets are stained so bad I didn’t even take my shoes off as I didn’t want to walk on it.-The set up of the bathroom is poor, toilet and shower in one small room with no storage or room to move. The light for the toilet was connected to one inside the room so you can’t just turn on one light inside but light up the whole room in the night.-We were on the 11th floor and could still hear every noise of traffic and people yelling outside, no soundproofing from room to room either.-The free breakfast is awful, food was cold and not edible, we found only the toast you cook yourself to be something warm and fresh. It gets pretty windy down at the breakfast area as well and not many indoor chairs if is rains or too windy.-I travelled with my mom and we were excited to sit out at night by the fireplace they advertised, yet we checked out there every night of the week and it was never on. We even asked once at the desk and they assured us it was on every night from 6-11. One night we found a very nice employee outside near the pool, Manny I believe his name was, and asked him about it. He said it was broken and they were working on fixing it. He was very helpful and got it fixed and even had someone call our room to tell us it was on. Then they turned it off at 9:30 and not 11 as they said. After that night didn’t see it on again.-Don’t go here if you want to use the pool, it is small and uninviting space.-Patio doors in the room really need to be cleaned. Ours was so dirty we couldn’t tell if it was cloudy or raining or what was happening out there.A couple positives:-No resort fee-Close walk to beach and shops and restaurants -Had a huge safe to store valuables in the roomOverall for the price I would go elsewhere next time.

This was our first trip to Hawaii. We choose Hyatt Place based on it's location and price, it was part of an air-hotel package booked through Expedia. The location is great, probably a two minute walk to the beach. Our room was fantastic but you'd expect that for a penthouse room with an ocean view. The hotel staff was great; very helpful, full of good advice, and caring. The inclusive breakfast was very good, scrambled eggs, bacon alternating with sausage, biscuits and gravy, hot cakes, fruit, various breads and the usual breakfast drinks. Restaurants abound in the area, everything from Burger King to Ruth's Chris Steak House is within about a mile. If you are renting a car there is a reasonable parking garage across the street; in fact, the hotel staff suggested this as a better option to their parking. Would I stay here again? In a heartbeat.

The aloha spirit lives at this hotel. The staff is kind and welcoming. Was my first trip to the island with my family. Rooms were clean and location is perfect tucked off the Main Street giving you a bit of rest away from the crowds. I would stay here again just for the great staff. Thank you for all your kindness!

Being a Hyatt hotel, and reading some of the other reviews, I expected this to be a quiet backwater in Waikiki. Just the opposite, once you enter your room you hear continual noise from Bus and heavy vehicles at street level. That explained the pair of ear plugs provided next to the bed side. Breakfast is buffet on the pool deck outdoors on the 3rd floor which sounds good, but be advised that as you eat your breakfast the wind (or rain)is blowing at you, you may be need a sweater, and if you leave your table for some reason, the birds start picking at your breakfast.Rooms were not cheerful, somewhat outdated. Bed was comfortable. The lobby is uninspiring, with no music, just big brother CNN droning on the TV screens, like the airport. There is no sit down restaurant, just a bar (with no-one behind it) that supposedly takes food orders. Overall, the limited staff was friendly, but the place seems to be focused on the tour parties, not on the business traveler, like some other hotels are. Also, a fair number of vagrants in that area that hang out near the beach. Next time I'll try a different hotel and area of Waikiki.

This was one of if not the best vacation I have ever been on. Christopher who checked us in, thanks for the all the help. I wish I knew the name of all the staff because they were all amazing. From Ihab the AGM, to the breakfast setup crew, the housekeeping staff. If you travel to HI and want top notch service you definitely should stay here.

We had a great stay with our family. If you want to be close to the beach with ready access to places like the Honolulu Zoo, Diamond Head and Windward, I think it'd be hard to beat this hotel. The breakfast buffet is ample and includes extras like miso soup and rice, in addition to eggs, potatoes, fruit, cereal, and the like. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Be sure to take advantage of the happy hour and to grab some towels from the front desk for the short walk to the beach.

Our family trip was amazing! We received spectacular service by Anabelle! She was very helpful with all my family she had to make my key 3 times for different reasons hehehehe and never question me what happen very friendly and with a smile on her at all times! This is somewhere I will come again and book my stay! I really appreciate Anabelle and I hope her manager values her as much as we did! Hyatt place is the place to stay in Waikiki

My stay at Hyatt place was a comfortable stay with barley anything to complain about.They hotel was clean and employees greet us as we walked about the hotel lobby. The room was cozy as Hyatt place hotel rooms have always been at any location. As Always they have free breakfast every morning which was very nice as well. I was able to hit the gym during my stay at any time since it was noted as open 24hrs. The only issue was with the dryer which was not working as well as a clothes dryer should. I was immediately advised that they have a sister hotel that they work with that would allow me to use their laundry room as well but it was down the same block. I opted to just take it to a local laundry mat since I was heald out for the whole day anyways and when I had advised them if the issue they did not hesitate to refund the cost of the hotel dryer of $3. Again there is really nothing negate aside from the dryer issue. I would definitely recommend to stay at this location to anyone looking for a affordable comfortable stay in Waikiki with a short walkaway to the Kuhio beach.Also if you have kids along with you on your stay, kids normally love pizza and they have a Domino's pizza in the hotel as well which is convenient for parents.

What a great property! Stayed one night after visiting a week on the big island. We travelled with another couple and all wanted to visit Pearl Harbor. Our flight arrived late morning and they allowed the other couple to have an early check-in so that we could take the Pearl Harbor tour. We had a late flight out the next day and they allowed us to store our bags until time for our flight. The room was clean and very comfortable. The entire staff was very accommodating and friendly, including wait staff, housekeeping, front desk and welcoming staff. There was an excellent complimentary buffet breakfast with a good number of selections. The only downside was that it was outside and you couldn't step away from your breakfast, as the birds with make themselves welcome to it if you did. The bar had a good selection of drinks and had a good bar menu. Great experience!

My six day trip from 17 April until 23 April, 2018 was outstanding in all respects, starting at the customer services desk representatives to room service (especially Adelma who make my living area perfect from day-to-day). The location was prime in that it was a short 3 minute Aloha walk from the hotel to Waikiki beach and all the restaurants and shopping areas but away from the crowd and traffic noise. The free morning buffet is an added plus. My room was spacious and was what I requested (city/ocean view to enjoy the sunsets while enjoying a glass of wine). All in all the hotel was excellent with 5-star service without the five start costs.
user_name:
Willie w
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Perfect location. Easy access to the Zoo, and Beach. There is available and easy access to transportation, local attractions and pharmacy. Lots of great resturants in the area. My family and I felt safe and welcomed. The staff were amazing, treat you like family.

Its my third visit to Honolulu and first time to stay at this hotel. It’s a really really good location as it is a very short 2 block walk to the beach, and easy walking distance to the zoo and aquarium, and food and restaurants and shops. The free breakfast is always filling. They will rotate the food they serve daily but that is usual in any hotel with free breakfast. Our room is cozy and comfortable and just enough space. Has lanai to lounge at and see the sights and view the beach. And the bed seems new and so comfy! I always get a good night sleep. And to top all that, our room is always clean and neat and the cleaning lady Judith is so courteous, always smiling and accommodating and makes sure we have what we need to make our stay comfortable.The front desk people and also hotel security were always nice and helpful. Annabelle, and another guy, forgot his name, both make really good iced lattes with a smile. We would stay here again

Me and my daughter stayed at the Hyatt at Waikiki for about a week and thoroughly enjoyed it. The breakfast had a wide variety of things to choose from, the rooms were clean and quiet. We loved that they allowed us to take towels to the beach and its only a 3 min walk!!!We would definitely stay here again!!!

Had to run away for a quick drop out relax type of a vacation and used my Hyatt points. Having run away to Waikiki beach over a dozen times in the past 20 years the hotels in a good location off the main strip but still close -2 blocks from the beach providing for a little bit of a more relaxed off the strip experience. If you want a predictable hotel experience within two blocks from the beach it’s great and provides a lot of options to keep your trip low on cost and high on beach and relaxation. This hotel is towards the end of the strip so you’re closer to the park and Diamondhead if you like to go for morning hikes going up the road to Diamondhead is a real nice morning activity. You can always walk down the strip and have dinner at Ruth Chris if you like or another of the nice restaurants

Everyone at the Hyatt Place were accommodating and friendly. They even surprised us with a bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary. The room was clean and spacious. The pool area was nice and the breakfast was delicious. This was a great value and a great choice. Hyatt place was literally a 2 minute walk to the beach. THANK YOU to everyone there who helped make a beautiful memory in Hawaii

We really enjoyed our 10 night stay. We arrived early from Australia (7am) and Heidi at reception on the 19th April was extremely accommodating, allowing us early check in after our flight and even access to the breakfast buffet so the kids could have something to eat. Rooms were spotlessly clean, housemaids were super friendly, as were all staff. Very close to the main strip with an ABC store a few metres away for all your needs. Thanks for a great stay! Mahalo!

Perfect from start to finish, when we arrived to the hotel, we checked in and the first impression was great. Very clean, rrally nice people and super helpful. This didn't end there, it continued all the way to us checking out, customer service was above and beyond. Room was massive, wifi was good to have, it did drop in and out a bit most likely due to all the people using it, not a big issue. Breakfast that is included was good, got basics but enough to put some food in the stomach, good variety from hot to cold to make anyone happy, different to what we would see from home but still good. Overall and a great hotel that was walking distance to anything that you need with the best staff. Very happy and will come again, A+++

Stayed here for 8 nights recently in an 8th for room. The hotel is in a good location. It is close to the beach and it is only a short walk to the main shopping and dining precinct. The room was fine. It had a nice big tv and a lanai to dry your swimmers after a hard day at the beach. The only thing I noticed was that the carpets weren't vacuumed daily (or if they were, they weren't vacuumed well) but overall the room was very nice. The room was a little noisy due to wind noise in the building coming up the elevator shafts and fire stairs and howling in the hallways, but it wasn't a huge issue. I had a car but used a public parking garage nearby for about half the price of the hotel's valet service. Parking is really at a premium anywhere in Waikiki so you can't blame the hotels for reflecting this in their parking rates. You just need to hunt around and see if you can find cheap self-parking. The hotel was $35 a night (I was there 8 nights) but I got a 7-day special over there road for $80 total. Yeah it's not valet parking but it's a good saving. The staff at the Hyatt were wonderful. They were all so friendly and had the aloha spirit. The breakfast was ok. Nothing spectacular. The food would've been better if kept in those stainless bowls with the lids on them that you see at some buffet breakfast place rather than on a hotplate in the open. The top of the potatoes and eggs cooled very quickly, but if you scooped from the bottom where it was warmer it was fine. The assortment of breads for toasting, spreads, juices, cereals, coffee etc was great. Overall, it was a great place to stay and I would definitely recommend it to others.

We were place in a handicap room. The baloney was filthy. Requested a different room was not accommodated. Just very disappointed . We paid a lot of money for this trip to Hawaii to be disappointed by the room

First time in Hawaii and I thought a Hyatt would have been a little more modernized. I lobby was very nice but the room was dated. Pool is very small. Love that there was not a resort fee and breakfast was included. I just was a little disappointed for a Hyatt. It was clean just dated. Still had a nice time.

The hotel was filled with apparent honeymooners and rightly catered to them. Unfortunately this lead to the many benefits desired by business travelers timed to force me to rush or simply not use. If your business doesn't require early morning or late evenings, this could be a good selection. Also, the most popular dining options were on the other side if Waikiki making its location incontinent for attending after meeting social events.

We had a room on the 15th floor. Nice big room. Carpet needed cleaning as many have said, but you are at the beach and it is difficult to keep clean. The staff were amazing and friendly. Got several good recommendations for local flavor restaurants. There are only 2 elevators on one tower, so be prepared for a wait at breakfast time and when tour groups come back.

Great location, pretty much everything you may need is within walking distance, beach, great spots to go snorkeling, shopping, entertainment, restaurants, church, zoo, park, etc. I would definitely recommended it!!

Stayed two nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The location is quite convenient. Two blocks from the beach, and free unrestricted street parking north of the hotel. Pros:-Location-Free breakfast (eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, pancakes, juice, cereal, miso, Seattle Best Coffee)-Free wifi-Close to free street parkingCons:-Dirty carpet. Turned our son's feet black after 10 minutes of walking on it.-Card key stopped working. Needed to get it reset.-Our view overlooked the hostel next door. Not a big deal, but not the best view either.

We spent 13 nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach and found the hotel to be an excellent choice. Staff is extremely friendly and efficient; free breakfast and free wifi are nice perks in Waikiki. We would definitely consider staying here again when in Waikiki and would recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach to family and friends.

We had a great stay at the Hyatt Place. Location is great. The service, staff and room were great. It was nice to have a good breakfast before beginning our day. The food and service was excellent that morning.

We really enjoyed this hotel. The staff was very helpful and were so sweet with my kids. They brought us ice cold water at check in. Christopher accommodated my child’s request for a top floor room. The car valet guys let my kids borrow a boogy board for the day. The front desk was extremely helpful anytime I called and asked questions. They exceeded my expectations!

We stayed in HYATT place for a week. The hotel rooms were clean. The staff in general were polite to us. The hotel in itself is average in looks compared to others like Alohilani, HYATT regency and Hilton but the price of rooms justifies it. The location is superb since it is just 2 minutes walk to the waikiki beach. We had ocean facing room but it is not the exact view we were expecting but it was ok. Check the photo. The breakfast was complimentary so it was a positive but choices are limited. They also provide a tray if you want to eat breakfast in our room.
