On a negative note the so called complimentary water bottles in the room are not free except for the first day. We were charged on the second day even though it was written complimentary on them. It seems it is free for HYATT members from second day but it is not written anywhere. The hotel provides beach towels which is again a positive. As a good gesture people do leave $2-3 tip for the cleaning staff everyday but it is not neccessary. Internet is free and speed is good. They have a small swimming pool and gym but we did not use them. Well we had beach in front of us so that swimming pool was insignificant. They have a bar in the lobby but it is not that great compared to the other hotels we visited. Hotel is next to the bus stop. Bus 22 goes to Hunuama bay and bus 2/19/8 goes to ward village, alamoana, TJMaxx and Walmart. Just make sure you have exact change to buy bus tickets as they do not give change back. It is strange that the buses do not accept card or do not have any touch-on card systems there. You can also get trolley service for $2 to alamoana shopping mall. Commute to airport is cheaper ($29 + tip) if you use the taxi service (charley's taxi) arrangement from the hotel. They will be happy to book it for you. Uber will cost you more.

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Place for a week for our babymoon. When we arrived we were greeted by unfriendly and abrupt staff who did not make us feel welcome or give us any information regarding the hotel or Waikiki. The room was a good size and was perfect for a couple. The cleaning staff we had were amazing. The woman who cleaned our room was friendly, courteous and very efficient. Breakfast was average, there were not many healthy options with limited fruit and cereal, however they did provide almond milk which was great.

Highly recommended for families due to proximity to beach, and 1 st class service. The pool is small compared to typical hotel size but that's easily overlooked by the 1st class friendly service. Also no spa, but again, no problem since the hotel is near the beach. Clean facility with spacious lounge in the lobby. The staff is attentive, and we enjoyed the elevator security. Elevator access only available to guests who have a key. The daily breakfast variety is diverse. From yogurt car, cereal, oatmeal, hot foods, including rice and miso soup. The breakfast beverages also diverse, almond milk, juices, and coffee and teas. Highly recommend, located near diamond head, and Kalakaua street.

Location is the best. next to the beach, near the zoo, close to diamond head, near the right shopping areas. Love that Dominos is in the hotel. Hotel also has great activities to do for the family. Bell hop guys were wonderful!

We live on Oahu, chose this hotel due to pet friendly policy, proximity to beach, and access to live entertainment at other nearby hotels. The very close beach has a break wall to keep kids safe, and when surfs up you also have access to a prime location for surfing and bodyboarding.
user_name:
Ricky B
Ewa Beach, United States

review_body: Wonderful experience! My daughter was there to dance and we went with members of her dance school. The staff was kind, helpful and showed us the meaning of Aloha! We appreciated the feeling that they were concerned about making us feel at home. Excellent experience!

My house keeper Amira was awesome!!! She remembered my preferences and always made my room to my liking. I could always tell when she had her days off as the room was not as perfect as when Amira cleans the room

Hotel is the best in Hawaii,Best breakfast,always fresh fruits,and ingredients.The stuff was the best in Hawaii,always smiling and welcoming.Wii stay here next time.Location is the greatest for everybody.

Just back from a 7 night stay. In advance of arrival I had emailed the hotel several times - requesting a lower floor on 3rd or 4th floor as my son will not use elevators. This request was granted which we appreciated. We found 4th floor to be convenient for getting to breakfast on 3rd floor (quickly using stairs instead of elevator). Upon booking with Delta Vacations - they would only let us book a City View room. We really wanted a Mountain View room - I had emailed the hotel asking if we could upgrade to Mountain view on arrival (and pay the difference). I was told we could. On arrival we were NOT given the Mountain View we wanted, but a Ocean View (which I'm sure they thought was better) - being on 4th floor it was a SLIVER of ocean between 2 tall buildings and eye-level with the top of another building. It was not a great view. Plus the room was a 2 queen room but very small - nothing like the "specialty 2 queen mountain view" rooms look on-line. They look much more spacious on-line than what we got. I'm still not convinced we got a specialty room we paid for as our room was very cramped for 2 adults + 2 Teens. I did go back down to the desk to ask about all this and they assured me we were in the largest room they had. I seriously doubt that and ended up paying extra for a room we didn't want.All that being said - the hotel has several advantages:*no resort Fee *Free breakfast *2 blocks from beach *nice open air lobby *very close to Trolley & bus stops *ask at desk for beach towels *ABC store next door *on quieter Zoo end of Waikiki *Staff friendly *Rooms have Queen beds not DoublesA few disadvantages:While we appreciated the free breakfast, it does get a little repetitive after a week. The Lanai's are very small - barely enough to turn around on. Minimal counter space in bathroom. Minimal closet & drawer space - not enough room to put clothes anywhere for 4 people for a week. Very cramped.All in all I would recommend this hotel for those looking for a moderately priced to budget hotel. The hotel has many perks - just be aware you may not get the room you want.

We stayed at your hotel thus time last year. This year we are returning again to your wonderful welcoming venue. Two weeks to go.. Anniversary fun.. Your staff were truly a credit to your organisation when we stayed last year which was the deciding factor for this year.. Can't wait for that aloha spirit you all have in abundance

The ladies that that check you in and out were very professional, and I must make mention of their names, Angeline, Lei and Hydie. This is a busy time over Easter and Spring break but they were excellent.

My family and I love this hotel. The location is ideal close to everything: beach, zoo, surfing and great restaurants. Really good free breakfast. But the best aspect that sets it apart is the incredible service and the excellent people that work here. Friendly, courteous, welcoming and professional. Best hotel we’ve been to.

We stayed here for a night when visiting from Maui. LOVED this hotel! It's not right on the beach, but only 1 1/2 blocks away to Waikiki Beach. The rooms were spacious and included a sitting area and balcony. The staff were friendly and their complimentary breakfast by the pool was really good. They offer beach towels so you don't need to bring your own and it's very close to an ABC Store. Would definitely stay here again.

Stop looking elsewhere and book your stay here! I have stayed here on/off for 3 years -- for 2-4 weeks at a time. I know this place, and they are top notch professionals who stop at nothing to satisfy customers. The location is EXCELLENT (just two blocks from the beach)...there is decently priced food and a bar (ask for Nick or Mylie!). Room service has always been outstanding. My most recent stay -- Amira was my housekeeper. Exceptional attention to detail and fantastic support of my family when they came to visit during a long weekend. I could complain about the occasional noise from the EWA hotel across the alley, but that's not the fault of Hyatt Place. They were very responsive to a complaint I had and did the best they could to deal with it. Highly recommended!

its the second time we stay at this hotel for our holidays , the staffs are welcoming and friendly. especially, Mrs Lei at the reception desk, she is very helpful and friendly . always look after our needs . she deserves to be recognized.

Very clean. Great amenities. Excellent staff. Rooms were in excellent condition. Very comfortable and modern. A two minute walk to beach. Close to all shopping and restaurants. Would definitely stay here again.

For the same price you can stay at the Grand Hyatt up the street, which is what we did after one night here. You are in the middle of a city so we expected some noise. Our first morning we woke to drilling noise. They were doing some construction on the apartment building next-door. Breakfast is served outside so the construction and rilling was very loud. The rooms are large and we were upgraded to a partial water view. Beds are comfortable and rooms are clean. Bath is not separate so sink area is part of the sleeping area. The pool is very small with radder apartment buildings just feet away and broken glass was thrown on the building roofs. Overall, we couldn't wait to checkout and were glad we only had to stay one night. Breakfast is included, which includes scrambled eggs, bacon (sitting in grease), waffles, juice, coffee, cereal, yogurt, all you can eat until 9:30AM.

/stayed here for over three weeks work related.I enjoyed my stay because the hotel location is perfectly right and close to everything. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Specially The cleaning Lady on my floor Ms. Leonida She really took care of room need s always replenished with ample clean towels and maintained room cleanliness. For breakfast its very average. I can suggest to give it a more boost with regards to variety of fruits mix (i.e. banana or papaya, kiwi, strawberry) rather than just pineapple and can taloupe the whole time. Otherwise It would have been rated 5

We opted for this hotel because we’ve stayed at Hyatt Place in the past and been happy. The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach didn’t let us down. The top reason we like this hotel chain is the free breakfast, hands down. With a family of 5, it is a value versus going out for breakfast every morning. The breakfast is great with fresh fruit (melons and pineapple), eggs, pancakes, you name it. To top it off, our room is clean, we have an amazing view of both the ocean and the mountains, the beds are comfortable, it’s close to shopping, convenient restaurants (Subway, Domino’s-right inside the hotel, etc.) and car rentals, two blocks from Waikiki Beach, and the staff have been super friendly. Would stay here again, no question!

The hotel is a block or two from the beach. I had a low floor, so I had no view, but maybe higher floors are nicer? Rooms were small and felt cramped. Was excited for free breakfast, but was disappointed - their hot food was cold, so I dealt with cold eggs, pancakes, and potatoes every morning (along with cereal, fruit, oatmeal, and options like that). Unfortunately, the breakfast area is outside by the pool, which meant the food got even colder. In the hotel’s favor was the wifi (had good signal and it was complimentary), and I thought the bed was comfortable which helped with jet lag. I didn’t particularly like the area where the hotel is - felt gritty and crowded and was pretty noisy in the morning with lots of buses coming through. Parking is expensive - $35 for valet parking and supposedly they only had two spots for self park at $25/night if I remember right. There is a garage across the street for $20/24 hours, but you have to be careful and make sure that you are current. I stayed out late one night and by the time I got back (27 hours after the last time I paid for 24 hours) and I was penalized $20 (nevermind that the garage offers 4 hours for $10). Was not happy about that.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place as a family of three for four nights. We chose this hotel because there was no resort fee, breakfast and wifi were included, and because of the proximity to the beach and zoo. Overall we were happy with our stay except that the wifi didn’t work in our room (it did work better at the breakfast area and in the lobby). We also found the hotel quite busy with groups.The room we had (Diamond Head tower) was quite small but was clean and the bed was comfortable. The mountain view was nice and we also had a partial view of Diamond Head. There is a lot of traffic on the street below (Kuhio) so although the balcony was nice, it wasn’t quiet.The breakfast was good, as others have stated and is one of the better free hotel breakfasts I’ve had. It has a basic selection of hotel and cold items, with the hot items changing each day. The breakfast can get busy at times with all the tour groups but we found the line would clear in 5 minutes and we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a table. The main breakfast area is outside although they do serve some food inside in the first floor lounge.The hotel’s “concierge” is actually paid by Expedia, so he makes money selling you tours. Not a problem for us, just something to be aware of. He was able to rent us a car for the day at Enterprise located at the Marriott next door for $20 less than it would have cost us to rent it on our own.The location of the hotel was good—very close to the part of the beach with a breakwall (safe swimming for children). It’s an enjoyable walk through Waikiki to the shops and restaurants. We enjoyed Marukame Udon on Kuhio, Flour and Barley at the International Marketplace (there is a free cultural show at the International Marketplace at 6:30 as well). Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

First time customer at this hotel and I was impressed by the service, pleased by the location, and ready to return! I've stayed at the Marriott just across the street many, many times and I took a chance with Hyatt Place because I had enough points for a free stay. I am new to the Hyatt family but since I've been staying at their hotels, I've been continually surprised by how lovely and comfortable they are. It's certainly a smaller hotel than the Marriott but that actually made the whole experience much more appealing. I was paying a reasonable rate for parking, no resort fees, a walk-in shower, and even the regular room rates are good. When we checked in, Lei, at the front desk was beyond helpful and kind. She was an excellent welcome to Hawaii. She took her time to explain what our options are and gave us helpful tips. She helped me trouble shoot an issue within a hour of my check-in and I was left with nothing but rest and relaxation for the remainder of my trip. Thanks to Lei!!! This little hotel is perfect if you like a nice spot to stay, enjoy heading out in search of delicious eats, fun shopping and a quick jaunt to the beach for a walk.

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. The rooms are well equipt, but there are multiple towers so its easy to get lost. They have a great courtyard with shopping and restaurants.You are across the street from the beach, so it is not a private beach

We stayed here for a week in November an d it was great! They allowed us an early check in and the room was huge, with a lovely balcony with a view of Diamond Head. The hotel is very close to the beach, they also provide towels which was very handy :-) There is a bus stop right outside the hotel which is very helpful for getting around the city. The staff were very friendly and relaxed. The lobby was open, airy and nice. The hotel also provided free breakfast by the pool, this is always a good option to avail of. The only thing, and this is a very small thing, that could do with improvement was the frequency of the lifts...but I guess being in Waikiki - what's the rush..right?? Excellent hotel - i would love to go back!

This was my first visit to Hawaii and I totally enjoyed every moment I was there. I am already planning another trip. All the staff I encountered were friendly and extremely helpful. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

This property is the best value and location for the money. Very spacious and clean/modern room. Free breakfast is a bonus. We had a 12 passenger full van, and the valet parking was only $35 versus $60 for oversized valet at Hilton Hawaiian Village that we stayed prior to this property.

We chose this hotel because of the Brand and the reviews we saw in advance. The location is perfect - just a few blocks from the expensive downtown shopping district, a very short 2 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and many other locations. Most of the tours pick up right in front of the hotel. We only had a few days in Hawaii - they have an onsite Expedia Travel Assistant who facilitates activities for guests - Ben was great to work with and didn't steer us wrong. We had great tours. The Hyatt Place Waikiki offers a free hot breakfast everyday. SUPER deal and great options that change each day. Since food prices can be pricey in Hawaii, a free hot breakfast is great. Word of advice, get there early (opens at 6:30am) - as seating fills up quickly. There is always an option to get breakfast to go - they have trays in each hotel room for guests to take advantage of. The front desk staff were very hospitable and helpful. We used Charley's taxi for hotel/airport transportation as well as for areas around Waikiki. They were clean and not expensive. The rooms in this hotel are nice. Housekeeping (ours was Leonida) was very good - never had to wonder when the room would be cleaned. The bar and grab-and-go items can be pricey (except during happy hours) - we found the Starbucks across the street at the Marriott to be a better bargain. We didn't utilize the pool, but it is located in the same area as breakfast - not a big pool but adequate to cool you off on a hot day. We found this hotel to be perfect for us - affordable - great location - free hot breakfasts - great staff - clean - nice accommodations. This is a place we will definitely return to!!

Nice service here from front desk to housekeeping. Free breakfast was a huge factor in booking here. We did not rent a car- walked most places, did some ride-share. We booked all our tours with a very helpful and frank concierge. Before one elevator broke down, however, I heard multiple people mention that this place needs more than 2. When it went to one, it was a very long wait. Pool is the size of a back yard pool, but we didn't use it or see others using it. We liked this place a lot, and I would not hesitate to come back.

Loved the property. Excellent location on Waikiki, great breakfast, nice staff. Only wish was that the carpets got steam cleaned... they felt a little under the weather. Otherwise, definitely a place I would return.

The beds were extremely comfortable, the shower hot, the air-conditioner quiet and effective, and the bedside table big enough for a CPAP machine. We really appreciated the great breakfast buffet that provided food that was healthy as well as the standard American fare. They even had miso soup, rice and kimchi! The exercise room was heavily used and provided a recumbent bike and treadmill as well as weights and exercise mats. The pool was kid-sized and right next to the breakfast patio. Not a discreet location for an early morning swim. We really loved dealing with the staff because they were extremely friendly and helpful. I had requested a mountain view room and was very glad I did. Our balcony looked out over the school ground near the zoo rather than directly toward a beach front hotel. We have one major complaint though. Even though the room was large the bathroom was incredibly small. There was one towel rail near the shower that could hold a single bath towel. The counter area was minuscule with no rails, just a couple of hooks (which the towels kept slipping off of) and a hand-towel ring. The toilet paper holder was open-ended so the roll of paper flew off every time I used it! There wasn’t a separate light for the shower/toilet room and the sink area so the light was shining into the bedroom every time we used the toilet. The one plus was the retractable clothes line that I was able to use my travel hangers on for our swim suits and rash-guard shirts. The two of us managed just fine but I cannot imagine 4 people sharing the bathroom.

Stayed here 3 nights before cruise around islands. Great communication when booking and confirming. Room very clean and comfortable. Free Breakfast was really delicious (was a little concerned reading some reviews) and had plenty of choices. Great location. No resort fees and free WiFi. Definitely would stay here again.

Great hotel with people with great respect and attitudes. Guest seemed to be all enjoying themselves and why not, rooms were very nice with comfortable beds and the hot Breakfasts were tasty with many choices. Bring your good attitude with Appetite and relax and enjoy. Thanks to Fernando and all the employees who made this a Great place to stay especially Enda who helped with the car parking and her kindness. You guys made our vacation very enjoyable and a Great comfortable place to come home to.

We enjoyed our stay in this comfortable hotel. Located steps from Waikiki beach. We booked a premium room, very spacious with a sitting area. The staff is excellent. Always smiling and ready to assist, especially Shawn. Also the assistant manager Ihab was outstanding. We will stay there again.

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We loved the location as it was out of the noisy, busy heart of Waikiki and we didn’t mind walking to shops and cafes. There are always people around and shops open nearby such as ABC store, making it feel safe for us to walk at night. The pink line trolley stops outside the Aston Waikiki which is just up the street from the Hyatt and that can take you into main streets of Waikiki, Ala Moana centre etc for $2US each which was very convenient. The actual hotel is very modern and clean, with the comfiest king size bed and sheets in the world! We had room 1405 on the top floor which had ocean views (obstructed), but still so nice to open the curtains in the morning and see the water and check out the weather! We would request this room again! It was quiet, clean and comfortable- everything you want on a holiday. Only thing I would change is the water pressure of the shower was a bit too soft. Hairdryer was provided and really good! The buffet breakfast was limited in choice and quite average so some days we decided to sleep in and miss it. Usually only a couple of choices such as eggs, bacon or pancakes with fruit and toast. But can’t really complain as it is free and included and better than nothing! Didn’t use the pool as it is in a shaded and very windy location, but the beach is only 2 streets away (couple of mins walk) and has the break wall so the water is flat like one big pool. Make sure to buy an inflatable ring or lounge to lay on and relax in the water!!Highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here next time we go back!

We had SUCH an amazing stay!! Our room was extremely spacious, and had every comfort we would need from home. Everyone was so genuinely nice and welcoming, I can see why people want to stay put. We had encounters with Lei at the front desk who accommodated us like we were family. The bellmen Shawn and Ted were smiling the entire time they helped us, as did the housekeeper Amira. The general manager Fernando wrote hand written notes to us, and welcomed us with cold waters.The hotel even held a treasured stuffed animal my son left behind, and had it safely for us for several days. This place is SO close to the beach it might as well be beachfront. The free breakfast is also super hefty, and our room had a convenient tray to bring back room on a he days we were in a hurry. When (not if) we come back to Oahu we will definitely be staying here!! Wish we could give it 10 stars!

This hotel has a fabulous breakfast that is available by the pool or on the first floor. The pool is tiny and very cold and shaded all morning and part of the afternoon. Lots of seating in the area that also has a firepit. The rooms are typical and nothing special. The bellmen were awesome and assisted us wonderfully. The staff was very friendly and full of knowledge of the area. Great for a night, but there are better places to stay.

What a place to stay.We thoroughly enjoyed...great breakfast go have breakfast,early do as you can, as later on it gets skittle harder to find a good seating.Great wi fi in hotel and get a room with a view.Spacious and comfy rooms and bed.Close to beach and to ABC stores and to eateries and transport .Worth the stay great service.Try not to get a room on lower levels as views aren't that good.

My family and I had a great stay here. The hotel was very clean, the food was good, and the staff were all very pleasant and personable,especially, Paul Mulu. He was excellent! He is very friendly and was extremely helpful. Our stay here was so relaxing and enjoyable thanks to Paul!!!Mahalo from the Henderson Family!

We stayed in the renovated tower. Rooms are small but nicely redone. Breakfast was very good size. Lots of options. Little busy but expected that. Can eat on the 3rd fllr or 1st floor lobby. Buffet same in both areas. Server in the lobby lounge is excellent! She is all about great service. Sorry forgot her name. GM in lobby to meet and greet. Nice touch. Would stay here again. Great locaation and short walk to Waikiki beach.

We stayed at this hotel for a week while attending a conference. The location is great for Waikiki and located directly across the street from the beach. It's an easy walk right outside of all entrances to the main streets, shopping, restaurants and entertainment. We participated in an outdoors reception near the pool, which was extremely well done with very good appetizers. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants as there were so many other great choices within easy walking distance. Ross, at the Expedia desk was extremely helpful in arranging tours and making suggestions for places to see. The elevators were slow (we were on floor 11) as they are under renovation. The staff tried to help by allowing use of the service elevator and even playing the ukulele for entertainment while we were waiting.

Kamaaina (resident of Hawaii) family of 4 really enjoyed our stay here. Had to fly to Oahu to visit a family member in the hospital. We booked the night prior to arrival, 12k World of Hyatt points per night. When we first arrived, Robert at Valet allowed us to leave our car curbside so we could unload, check in, and take our bags up to our room. Parking at this hotel is valet only $35 per day, but we decided to self park at the parking garage (Waikiki Banyan) across the street for $20 per day, in/out included. Angeline at the front desk made check in fast, simple, and easy, she also upgraded our room and view (ocean and Diamond Head). Free breakfast is served on the first floor and the third floor. There are a couple of stations of each so it may appear busy but you get through quickly. Stations consist of: (eggs, sausage, pancakes), (fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese), (bread, bagel, cereal), (milk, apple juice, orange juice), (steamed rice, miso soup, kim chee, tofu), (coffee / tea). Staff is constantly clearing tables and replenishing food. Simple breakfast to get you moving on with your day, and FREE! The business center is in the open space on the first floor. Computer use requires a code (front desk will give you a code on paper) good for 30 minutes. There is a fitness center, small pool (no hot tub) and laundry ($3 per load wash / dry) on the third floor.A few other perks are 12pm check out and no resort fee!

We visited with our young family in Feb 2018 and had a great time. All the staff made our stay enjoyable. A big thank you to Tessa and Deborah at the breakfast restaurant who greeted us with a smile and made our young ones feel at home. The elevators were a little slow and had to use two of them to get to different levels with a stroller, but everything was so nice that we did not mind. Great location- close to the beach, the zoo and shops. Our daughters enjoyed the parrots in the lobby (Mali and Kim) and the farmers market (great selection of fresh fruit and baked goods). Will visit again!

Although not on Waikiki beach Initially we had room with a view, sort of. Extending our stay required moving to a room with a view of the city. We were on the 19 and 17 floor.the hotel elevator system is overloaded, requiring long waits. This is a hotel for bus loads of tour groups.It is a short half block walk to the beach.This survey does not allow me to list “Hotel Ratings”If it did I would rate 3 out 5 in the three areas.

Lei at the front desk was fantastic! She never stopped assisting us or pointing us in the right direction! The rest of the staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and very accommodating. It made our stay in a chaotic city, less stressful. This is why I love the Hyatt corporation!

HP was a great hotel. After they changed our room to accommodate us, our stay was great. HP is a clean hotel, the breakfast was very good, and they offered beach towels everyday. Very close to the beach and in walking distance of a lot of good places.

We had an ocean view king on the 19th floor. It had a balcony with 2 chairs and a small table. Great bed. A refrigerator and a desk as well as a couch. It has a very nice free breakfast outside in the pool area. About 1 block from the beach and about 3 blocks from a heavily used beach. Lots of surfing from the shore. Lots of restaurants in the area. Would stay again. Had a great sleep.

Very comfortable room, excellent ocean view. short walk to the beach. Very friendly front desk staff. Couldn't try free breakfast since had early flight. Quite area. Small problem - no signs which elevator should I use to reach my room.

It was our first time in Hawaii and wanted it to be a great experience and since we wanted to save a little bit of money all four of us (2 couples)decided to stay at the Hilton garden inn ( in the same room)for the first five nights then just have our own separate rooms on our last two nights. Well,we picked Hyatt because just like the Hilton it is known internationally and thought well you can't go wrong with them right? Wrong! We booked what was supposed to be 'ocean view' rooms which turned out to be only partial? We paid $315 aud a night per room, yes with free breakfast but seriously you can get a much better breakfast at McDonald's. Our bathroom light was somewhat dim and there was no water pressure. Everything was just old and dated even the ceilings in the whole building. Elevator was slow as anything. Staff were helpful and friendly though but overall experience was just disappointing. They need to refurbish this hotel and need to up their game.
user_name:
Tina1610
Gosford, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Room was quiet and view of the beach. Staff, including valets, helpful and resourceful. Beds comfortable. Free Wifi and hot breakfast, which was a great start to the day. Thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night get-away at this property.

I was looking for a hotel to stay at in Oahu which was not too expensive and offered free breakfast. Hyatt Place Waikiki met both criteria in spades and it is less than 2 minutes walk to the beach. Another unexpected surprise is that they refunded the daily resort fee which sealed the deal. The breakfast was all you can eat. There wasn't a huge variety of dishes to choose from; meat, eggs pancakes, cereal (hot and cold), fruit and hot and cold beverages everyday but it was both tasty and filling. I booked a room with one bed and a couch which was adequate for 2 people but the couch as it turned out was not great to sleep on. The room had a balcony which overlooked a part of Waikiki and the weather was convenient for hanging out on it. There was construction taking place nearby unfortunately which detracted from the balcony experience and the room walls were a little thin. I could hear a hair dryer from another room. They offered towels at the front desk which you could take to the beach free of charge and there was a daily expedia concierge to help with activity planning. The hotel does not have its own restaurant or tour bus drop off but both amenities are literally less than 100 walk from the front entrance. There is also a public transit stop nearby which can take you into the city or to diamond head.

Checked in yesterday and his hotel has superb customer service!!! Heidi is super friendly at the front desk and helped us with a variety of things. They helped us find cheaper parking in the local area, brought a crib to the room for my daughter and even upgraded our room. In days of declining customer service around the nation, this place goes above and beyond. The atmosphere of the hotel and lobby are very relaxing and easy to navigate.

Been coming to this location for 35 years every year. Started out as Quality Inn changed to Ocean Resort and 7 years ago changed to Hyatt Place. We were not sure how we were going to like the change to Hyatt Place but we will say we are glad we continued to return each year. The Front Desk, Bellmen (Dean, Ted, Andy) the 3rd floor breakfast staff (Fred, Craig, Mary and others) are awesome. Each one greats you with a smile and share the Aloha Spirit. Love each one. Housekeeping and our housekeeper Lei (2041) is awesome, she dust and vacuums each day. She does her job great. Really can't say anything negative because the Aloha Spirit comes from the Awesome Management Team, Ihab and Frenando. Could not ask for any body better to Manage the Hyatt Place Waikik. This is in a resort atmosphere and they do a great job. Can't wait to return to my home, all are our Ohana.

I stayed here a few weeks ago and had a great time. Everyone from the valets to the front desk agents were extremely friendly and helpful. They made some great recommendations to help me save some money on my trip. And they were also kind enough to upgrade me to a top floor room with a nice view. The breakfast was outstanding - full continental breakfast. Perfect location - right next to the beach.

We were on the third floor and the room was adequate quaint if you will. The breakfast was always good and hot. Location is ideal and close to the beach and shops and restaurants! Truly enjoyed our stay. Would recommend!

Stayed 6 nights, staff were very pleasant, helpful and friendly. The breakfast was good every morning. Clean and tidy rooms. It's a lovely place to stay. Great sea view room. Highly recommend. The beds are very comfortable. Free Wi-Fi. Great restaurant in the hotel lobby as well as a Starbucks.

My family had a wonderful time at this hotel. It's the third time here and Heidi was excellent in helping us get the room we wanted, even though our booking had us set for a different room. Thanks Heidi! The room was clean. The breakfast is great considering the cost of breakfast for a family of 5 outside. With kids, we we needed the room cleaned at a certain time while we were away before naptime and the hotel was always very accommodating. Another great stay. See you next year.

This hotel was almost wonderful. We had a large, comfortable room with a separate living room annex, great view, balcony, thick lovely towels, location was terrific. Not much to want for. I would have liked the scrambled eggs to be made from eggs and while I appreciate some people love birds I don’t and I don’t want to have to compete with them for my breakfast. A sign saying ‘don’t feed the birds’ would help. So go to the Hyatt Place, have a wonderful stay but don’t hold out too much hope for breakfast.

Went to Hawaii to celebrate my 45th and my mother's 65th birthdays! I booked the double queen ocean view room and it did not disappoint! The rooms are clean and spacious enough for us 4 adults. The hotel staff was very friendly. The walk to the beach wasn't bad at all. Maybe 2 blocks total. They had one of the best breakfast buffets and it was included with our stay! I have nothing but wonderful things to say about the hotel. My only concern was with a little gift shop in the lobby. The 4 of us went in one morning and spent over $200 between the 4 of us. My daughter purchased a pair of sterling silver earrings. When she went to put them on that evening one of the earrings broke. No big deal, we will go down in the morning and exchange them. You would have thought that would be ok, right? They were only $18 but it was the point she never even got to wear them because they broke. The lady in the shop was so happy to see us back thinking we were going to spend more money until we told her of the issue. Then her demeanor completely changed. She asked "how do I know you got those here?" Ummmmmm...because you just helped us less than 24 hours ago when we bought them? Anyways I left the broken earrings on the counter and walked out. I was on vacation and did not want to waste anymore of my time. That was a real bummer they would treat someone like that. BUT THE HOTEL WAS WONDERFUL!

This was my third overnight transit stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach with two young children.The first stay we were fortunate to be upgraded to a larger room, which worked perfectly. This time we were in a small room with a king size bed, which I had booked, with a small sea view. This room had extremely sticky dirty carpet. Previously I would have easily given the hotel four stars for a short stay, however the sticky dirty floors in a small room turned me off.The breakfasts are low quality for the most part, but work again for a short stay. The pineapple is great.The best aspects to the hotel are that it's a little more modern than others, reasonably priced if you wait for a good deal, and the location is excellent.The bed was comfortable.If I were to stay for a longer period I would choose a larger room. That said, I wouldn't stay in Waikiki for an extended period.One other down side for us was losing my youngest sleeping toy. It was handmade by a friend and I accidentally left it in the cot when we left very early in the morning for our flight. Unfortunately I tried to recover it, but wasn't able to.I've stuck with four stars because of the location, price (if you get a deal), and relative modernity, but really should be 3.5 for Waikiki.

We stayed for one week having come from London for the Hawaii sunshine. The hotel is just back from the beach. Small pool, clean large rooms. Staff very helpful. Main drawback were the lifts, they were so slow and this created queues for them. Sometime we have up and took the stairs but if you were on a high floor that is not an option. Good value when compared to other hotels in Waikiki, which is an expensive place. Free breakfast was welcome addition (not usual in US). 3 star hotel (by UK standards)

We always stay here in Waikiki. The staff are friendly, the rooms are modern and clean and housekeeping do a great job. Its so easy to wander down for breakfast (included) every morning and just a stroll down the end of the street to the beach. Its usually a bit of a walk to get to one of the restaurants for dinner but that's a great way to justify dessert!

We stayed at the hotel for five nights and would not stay here again. Here are some of the positive and negative points of the hotel. The Positives:- The location is excellent. You can walk to the beach in 2 minutes and there are towels at the pool that you can take to the beach, so no need to pack any. There is also an ABC convenience store and a Dominos Pizza very close by. - The breakfast buffet is good and is served every morning from 6:30 to 9:30. It varies a little each day and is a nice perk. - The staff is very friendly and helpful and booking excursions is easy and convenient. The Negatives:- The rooms look nothing like the online photos posted by the hotel; they are very small and dated. - The air conditioner does not go below 20 degrees Celsius, which is not enough to cool the room. There is no bathroom fan, so showering heats and steams everything. - We booked a king room with a sofa bed and did not get what was promised. When we inquired at the front desk, we were informed that the small armchair and ottoman in the corner of our room was the “sofa bed.” If you are booking this type of room as a family, there is not enough sleeping space for more than than two people.

I travel around the world for business and pleasure and the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is one of my favorite stays. It is conveniently located a block from the beach...which I like because it affords you a quiet stay but still just a short walk to the beach! The staff there are wonderful and I would match them up against anyplace in the world! From the moment you arrive, you're greeted with a big "Welcome" by any of the staff members you meet, from Angeline at the Front Desk to Nick at the bar! There's not a bad room in the hotel and they will do all they can to make sure you're satisfied. Everything you need is right there in the hotel, from the bar to Domino's Pizza to a souvenir shop! But if you want more, anything you might need is just a short walk away! Besides the great staff, one of my favorites is the breakfast buffet as it has most anything you want and a great view as you watch the sunrise! So...go visit Hawaii and stay here! You won't regret it!

This hotel deserves every single top rating that it seems to get. Yes, its not 5 star but it is very nicely presented with cleanliness, friendly staff and very good hotel rooms only a block (2-3 min walk) to Waikiki beach. Its at the quieter end of Waikiki near Diamond head and our spacious room had an incredible view of this famous crater. The hotel has a dominos pizza next to reception and a scaled down version of a Starbucks with some really nice and cheap Mexican food, salads and sandwiches/burgers available to eat in the hotel lounge chairs. The complimentary breakfast was just ok but who can complain when very few hotels offer that at all.There's also one of the many ABC stores in Waikiki right next to the hotel.Every staff member was so helpful and friendly and I don't think we ever waited more than 1 minute at reception for someone to serve us. A special thanks to Fernando the general manager and the executive housekeeping manager (Paulette) for making our room extra comfortable and ideal for our stay. We are already coming back in October.

Definitely one of the cheapest hotels in the area but the rooms need some work and cleaning, breakfast wasn’t good at all also we did told the front desk agent that it was our honeymoon and she said that they don’t really do anything for Honeymoons she also “upgraded us” for a better room on the 3rd floor next to the stairs and facing the street it was impossible to sleep didn’t have a good experience at al and the only reason we might come back to this hotel is because HEIDE the agent who check us out made everything 10 out of 10!!

This hotel is a gem!! The staff are great and the rooms are good for Hawaii standard. The biggest let down is the breakfast. The food is of poor quality and only good for a piece of toast. The location is on the quieter side, close to the zoo.

I have stayed here several times. I think because of my Hyatt status they always have given me quite nice rooms; or maybe all the rooms are nice? :). Easy walk to the beach, and they provide towels. Also a fairly easy walk to local non-tourist restaurants outside of Waikiki, on Kapahulu. The free breakfast is no better than standard and kind of a zoo because of the size of the hotel. Staff very pleasant.

Great experience! I always come back:) friendly staff. Maile checked us in and she was super friendly and when she found out it was my birthday she sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne which was amazing and also upgraded us too. Valet guys/gal we’re great! Over all great experience. I’ve never been disappointed by this Hyatt place Waikiki .

My husband and I had a grea experience. We walked to the beach, we walked to close by restaurants and took trolley places. My first experience at the hotel was at check in and Lei was super attentive, she made us feel special, explained everything to us, including breakfast hours etc. thank you for a great stay.

Ocean view room with diamond head to side. 10th floor good but very noisy aircons from opposite hotel rooftop. Easy walk to park and also main strip for beach or shops. Buffet breakfast basic 3 repeat stations to avoid congestion. Hot food basic, no a la carte.

For the price of the Hyatt (cheapest in Hawaii in January) and semi decent looking it was actually quite nice. About a 15 Mum walk to the heart of the Waikiki restaurant shopping strip. only downside was our room smelt a bit mouldy due to a gap in the air con and the wind whistling through it at night. But I have no complaints! For The free breakfast we only had it once or twice good if your wanting something to get you through the morning, but don’t expect anything to amazing. The two times we had it there were eggs, potatoes, bacon and one morning there was a Mexican themed breakfast on offer too. All in all I would stay here again

We stayed for 13 nights from January 19th to Feb 1st. Had a long flight and arrived almost midnight, so everyone was just tired and want our room and to settle for the night. But the reception/front desk was very welcoming and accomodating and so everyone started being chatty and excited. So here's why this hotel is awesome and amazing:1. The STAFF. You guys rock!2. No Resort Fee3. Our room is super clean, comfortable & smell so good. A big thank you to our housekeeping lady Leonida4. Location - 2 blocks from Kuhio beach and next to everything.5. Daily complimentary breakfast buffet has good selection, even has Asian specialty.

We stayed at this hotel for 12 Days we arrived at 11:30 pm on Jan 24 and was taken care of immediately until we departed Feb 3The hotel yes is dated compared to others we get that But the plus out weighs the decor we chose this hotel based on reviews which was dead onNumber 1 clean extremely and smells fantastic Hotel exsp our Room 914Number 2 awesome staff 3 location 4 breakfast 5 no resort feesWe can’t say thank you enough to this hotel during our stay Big THANK YOU to Marie Anne in House Keeping on our floor omg what. A wonderful person thank you we will miss you not one complaint if you want a great hotel this is the one

Despite being on the tenth floor, we clearly heard every car and truck on two busy streets and the crunch of gravel in a parking garage across the street. Sleeping was difficult. Also, the shower drain didn't and the bathroom was tiny. Worst of the four or five Hyatt Place's we've stayed at.

The Hyatt Place has friendly staff, spacious rooms, and surprisingly--breakfast comfort foods like biscuits and gravy... Heavenly!!!Our room was amazing... we had a mountain and ocean view.The staff remembered our names and noticed if someone was missing in our party when we came and went

This is a beautiful hotel located within walking distance to the Waikiki beach. There is no additional resort charge at this hotel. Free breakfast isprovided to all guests. There is no charge for Wi-Fi. The hotel is nice and clean. Our room is comparable to one at the five star hotel. We were gloves a room facing the Diamond head, with a partial cocoon view. It is Judy gorgeous.i highly recommend this hotel to those seeking a good vacation in Waikiki with a limited budget. It is a great value for the price you pay.

Hotel was wonderful. Large, clean, comfortable room and bathroom. Came with amazing breakfast buffet included on outdoor patio. Hotel located right on Waikiki Beach in the middle of everything. Great location.

Had a great experience at this hotel, it is expensive as all hotels in Waikiki are but good value for money considering a great location, room sizes are massive and free breakfast is included which is hard to find in Hawaii. Construction was happening in November, in the usual breakfast area. It made breakfast very messy as it did constantly move and we were told the weekend finish time for breakfast but not weekday time so we missed out on the Monday. I think all these problems were only caused by the ongoing renovations. Loved the room, very spacious, nice bathroom and staff at front desk were very helpful.I would stay here again despite the breakfast issues.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place on Waikiki before and after our recent cruise of the Hawaii Islands. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and the complementary breakfast. We enjoyed making Friday afternoon at the complementary activity at the hotel.

Just spent last 9 nights here with my family. Generous size room, great location, staff all very friendly & helpful. They even checked us into our room earlier, which was very much appreciated. Would definately recommend & would stay here next time when we visit.

I visited Waikik on a United States Army Career Counselor Conference Trip. I had to cut the trip short due to the government shut down. The hotel staff were both accommodating and extremely helpful throughout the my two day stay.

The location of the hotel is one block from the beach enjoy that. The breakfast staff were friendly excellent experience . Personal laundry machines were not working properly use my credit card and lost money because the machine will not turn on .

Stayed here for 1 night using an annual Chase Hyatt certificate. It's a good use of a certificate as this hotel is only a category 3 hotel. Hotel is a 2 minute walk from a great part of Waikiki beach, as the beach here is blocked from waves by rocks, so my kids could go in the water and not have to worry. Room was updated and very nice, though bathroom was tiny. The free breakfast is nice, although it was pretty cold out by the pool early in the morning and very windy. We didn't use the pool as it was later at night and didn't seem heated, so it was very cold. It's also a very small pool. Parking is now $35 a night (valet only), though they honored the $32 price that it still said on the website. Lots of shopping, restaurants nearby as well. Would definitely stay here again, but if you're looking for a nice pool and resort feel while in Hawaii, I'd look elsewhere.

This hotel was great for the price. All of the staff was great and helpful in answering questions! They include breakfast in the price and don’t have any resort daily fees!! Nice and close to Waikiki beach!

This smallish motel/hotel has pretty much all you need. It's just a block from the best part of Waikiki's beach, some rooms have ocean views. The price is very good compared to other properties and likely a bit nicer, cleaner, and free breakfast too! Pool is not too exciting and in the shade most of the time, but hey go to the beach. Nice staff, self parking for $20/night at condo across street is also a great deal...valet is much more. Good place to stay if you don't care about hotel services, historical places, or just hanging around.

My wife an I loved our stay here. The staff was very friendly, and made us feel very welcome. One particular person that worked there Lei was very helpful with tons of information when we asked questions about places or asked for advise about areas that interested us.

It was a gift from my son. But if I am paying, it’s almost 1500 for 5 nights. All inclusive would have everything included and beautiful resort for that price for 7 nights. So, I think, they should drop prices in Hawaii.

We have loved each Hyatt Place we have stayed at and the one in Waikiki is right up there with the rest. Our room is just the right size, roomy with a desk area and a sitting area with a couch and TV. They have an outdoor pool which is small but good if you have children along. Kuhio Beach is close enough to walk to and enjoy the beautiful Pacific Ocean. They have a breakfast which is complementary which includes eggs, fresh fruit, cereals, waffles, toast, oatmeal, potatoes, sausage, tea and coffee. I think there was also rice. The staff was very friendly and always helpful with any requests.
user_name:
Rick G
Fond du Lac, Wisconsin

review_body: Despite the insistence of one of the helpful locals, the Hyatt Place is not its sibling, the better known mega resort by the Duke statue - it is a few blocks way, and it is smaller. It is also well worth considering, and is not out of the way being just over a block from the famous Waikiki beach, and is part of the Waikiki Trolley circuit.One of its attractions is the breakfast included in the room fee, and it has a reasonable selection available, including non-gluten items. However breakfast is a bit of a free-for- all, with much competition for limited seating. Snacks and drinks are also available for a competitive fee, there is a computer center, shops, a bar, fitness center and a guest laundry service.Rooms are a little on the small side, however they do have a large high quality TV. They are comfortable and well-equipped. The staff are cheerful and efficient.The Hyatt Place easily earns it three stars. Recommended.

I was pleasantly surprised by the very good service and accommodations of this hotel. Fernando, the manager, went out of his way to make us feel special during our entire stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast included a good variety of hot/cold food and the area was always kept very clean. The rooms was average but very tidy. The lobby is open and breezy. The hotel is only 1 1/2 blocks from the beach and a 10 -15 minute walk to all the major shopping stores/restaurants on the strip. We felt safe the entire time. My only criticism is of the pool which is very small and needs to be updated. But, why hang out at the pool when you can see or hear ocean waves from your balcony!! There were plenty of families at the hotel but it was very quiet stay in my floor. I would recommend this hotel.

This is a great location just 2 blocks from the water at the quieter end of Waikiki Beach. Super convenient for restaurants, shopping, hiking to Diamonhead and beach. Our room had an ocean view broken up by buildings but pretty nonetheless, comfortable beds and good strong shower. Not luxurious but very solid and reasonably priced when compared with other properties. Friendly staff.

Expensive - but isn’t everywhere in Waikiki? So close to the beach and the main town centre, which definitely made this worthwhile for us. Great little bike shop around the corner too, which made it easy to get around. Breakfast fine - always feels like a bit of a mad scramble is going on in the Hyatt places which offer it, but as long as you know that and can prepare yourself it’s fine! Room just what we needed - decent bed and a base to have whilst we explored Oahu.

The location of the hotel is perfect, within walking distance of everywhere around the Waikiki area.The staff was very friendly right from the arrival time and made suggestions for our travel to the port the next day. At checkout time they stored our luggage until we were ready to leave and they had a car ready for us at the requested time with a negotiated flat rate. This is a major feature, since, with the traffic, metered rides can get pricey.The one disadvantage that we found was the seating for breakfast, since most of the tables are outside. If the weather is not dry, finding a place to sit, gets tricky.Otherwise, the room was clean and adequate for the price.

Great location easy checkin and room was ready upon arrival at 930 am which was much appreciated. Great size room plenty of room. Beds are little hard and bathroom looking a bit dated. Shower was not the best. Need more lifts only having two makes a long wait for a lift. Free breakfast was good and no queues. Self service laundry was an added bonus and cheaper than the public ones. All in all good value for money with no resort fee, free breakfast and excellent wifi. Would stay again

It was amazing the location very close to the beach. The friendly staff and when they came to clean your room went above and beyond. The buffet was perfect every morning many choices. I loved my stay here oh and bed were amazing!

1 block to beach, clean hotel, nice free breakfast, large rooms. They gave my daughter a boogie board to borrow for the beach while we were there. Easy out location to get away from crowded city and to other attractions on island. Staff stayed calm during Missile Threat warning morning of 1/13/18 when all the guests were frantic. Wish there was self-parking, they only have valet for $35/night.

Hyatt Regency. There are two Hyatts in Honolulu. There is the main Hyatt that is ocean front. This one is about a mile away from the second). The one we stayed in was Hyatt Place which is an off shoot of Hyatt. This was 1 block away from the "strip" and the ocean. Despite it's location, it was actually perfect! As far as room location inside the hotel - We did pay extra for the "ocean view." If you stay in this particular hotel, I would advise against this. You literally see a sliver of the ocean and although beautiful, I would rather go visit or be in it instead. Most of your time is spent elsewhere, so the little you actually view this - save your money! Things to do and access - This hotel was immaculate and the included breakfast was a great way to start the days. This hotel is one of the main pick up locations for the tours so if you do any of the tours, there is no walking around and trying to find a pick up location! Staff were great, very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about "local" stuff to do. Concierge is a great thing to utilize... although most of the stuff we did we went through groupon! Just plug in the Honolulu location and there are great deals and are easy to redeem! (just be aware that some tours run on Oahu and on other islands. be sure to get the correct island tour local.) Definitely stray from the tours with NO pickup - Uber is great to use but an average cost is about $30 per ride. Rental Cars - you can rent a car affordably but overnight parking is a lot. We decided to plan tours most of the days and left one day, at the end of the vacation, open to rent a vehicle and travel on our own. This allowed us to re-visit areas and shops before leaving.Location of the Hyatt Place - No matter where we went in Waikiki for things to do, it was usually within a mile of our hotel - So if you don't mind walking, this is a great place to stay.

did not expect much but pleasantly surprised. the location was great/close to everything we need (stores, restaurant, and beach). beach towel service and laundry room were very helpful. would love to stay again.

Stayed for 5 nights as a stop over from Canada to Australia. Chose Hyatt Place without much research.Read great reviews after already booked which created a degree of expectation.Communication prior to arrival was awesome.Location - at the far end of Waikiki toward Diamond Head which suited us.Valet guys and reception - awesome.Beds - comfortable.We stayed in a specialty mountain view which was roomy but nothing flash. Greeted with a set of ear plugs on the side table? Not sure if they were for the traffic, lifts or loud closing doors. All of which at times were louder than expected. Had heard great things about breakfast. But found the area awkward and uninviting. Limited table availability and repetitive choices. The hotel could do with some more lifts. So so busy with lengthy wait times.Overall a comfortable stay although would probably stay elsewhere if we were to return as a family.

Good location with excellent breakfast! Quick check in. Mountain view room overlooked nearing apartment building balconies which was no ideal. Valet parking $35, go across the street and pay $20 for 24 hours with in and out privileges.

Hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Rooms are large and relaxing. It is located almost across the road from Waikiki Beach. It is within walking distance of shops and restaurants in Waikiki Beach. Valet parking is quick and convenient

Nice hotel, close to beaches and food. breakfast was OK, nothing great. Mattress was Horrible and pillows got flat too fast. But overall staff were great, the hotel housed us for our vacation and it was not a gross hotel.

Location right in the strip , Waikiki. Rooms are average , pool extremely small, elevator problems ( too much waiting in line to get up and down to rooms ). Check in / out slow , not enough staff . Exterior of hotel looks dated . Parking / valet is tricky , barely enough room to pull in , very tight !

Great location, not far from beach and restaurants. Experience concierge Ben was an awesome help organising activities! Rooms are clean and staff are mostly friendly. Would definitely recommend to friends and family!

The room was nice. The hotel was clean. The breakfast was decent. The hallway sounded like a hurricane was blowing through. The concierge was friendly and helpful. The front desk personnel needs some improvement.

Apart from the location, the staff at check-in (Lei) was exceptionally helpful. We needed to stay an extra 3 days after hearing our flight was changed due to bad weather and she was superb. Got us the room, signed us up as Hyatt members and informed us about all the benefits of membership. All with a smile. As avid travellers, we will continue to use Hyatt Place whenever we travel. Sweet.
user_name:
avidcitytraveler
New York City, New York

review_body: We arrived st the hotel early morning to be offered a $20 a night upgrade to a larger room. As we were there for two weeks we decided to accept and glad we did. The room was very large with a small “den type”area with a couch and second tv. We were on floor 12 so had a great view of the mountains and the beach from the extremely large balcony. The rooms are well furnished and updated. Thought the bed was going to be uncomfortable as it felt very soft but ended up being extremely comfortable and spacious. Bathroom was nothing flash but very adequate (shower over bath tub, sink out of bathroom). Very clean, lovely maid.The breakfast which is included in the room rate was plentiful. Nothing exciting however better than having to leave hotel every morning. There was cereal, oatmeal, yoghurt, fruit (amazing pineapple) toast (bagels would have been a nice addition), miso soup with garnishes and hot dishes of eggs and rotating waffles, pancakes etc. the workers were extremely friendly and happy. The pool is a great disappointment at the hotel but I guess for those who like to sit around you are literally a couple of minutes walk to the beach.The hotel is at the diamond head side - a bit of a long walk to Ala Moana but really fine for walking the strip and close to all the restaurants.Would have been nice if the manager or front desk would have contacted us once in the 2 weeks just to say hello and see if everything going well.Great value for price.

Staff, Lei 5stars! Lei front desk Day manager. One excellent person to count on for any assistance. Wonderful buffet for breakfast. Various items to select from. We had the best room ever of all our vacation stays. We will request same room next time in Waikiki. This vacation was the best for us.

Front desk staff not accommodating ;only to certain people ; plumbing in the bathroom woke us up; they place us on the floor below the washing machine and dryer; night shift crew friendlier; food was OK

Our check in process was quick and easy. The front desk staff was. Dry informative and helpful. The public transportation was close and easy. The room was very comfortable. And we enjoyed the quality and ease of the included breakfast.

Good Hotel in a good location. Service staff is great and friendly. Rooms are large and comfortable. Bed are firm and the pillows are soft. The free breakfast is as good as any free breakfast. There are lots of places in the area to see.

Hotel was very convenient, and close to all amenities... breakfast was very busy most mornings, so get there early. Had many choices, and a little different each day..Our room (#1641) was very roomy with 2 queen beds, and a queen pullout..Great view of Diamond Head...Only negative comment is atheism slow elevators (especially at breakfast time) Definitely would stay here again. Very friendly staff..If you are renting a car, park across the street at the Bayon parkade, only $20/day (they have weekly rates of $80 as well)

Stay with family of 5 during the busiest period period Christmas 2017. Had a great time. Room was clean and located in a convenient location closed to beach and zoo. Difficulty with parkings luckily did not get fine.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 14 nights. We were initially on Level 3 with no view and mentioned this to staff and were moved on day 3 upto Level 19 with a much better view at no extra charge. The hotel is at the far end of Waikiki near the Honolulu Zoo. 2 Adults and 3 Teens in one room was okay, next time I would get adjoining rooms. Hotel clean, staff friendly, a block away from the beach and 10 min walk into city centre, breakfast good and they changed the menu each day. Overall for the price of this hotel it ticked all the boxes, would definitely stay here again.

-Staff: really friendly and caring. -Location: less than three minute walk to the beach, and ten minute walk to central Waikiki-Food & beverage: free breakfast, but no free water-Service facilities: laundry, pool, and gym are small and need a bit of update-Guest rooms: very small (King room will not fit crib), humid, and smell of mildew
user_name:
ykthanos
New York City, New York

review_body: After having to leave the Ambassador Hotel down the street (see my other review), we were lucky to find a room at the Hyatt Place. Our family of four stayed in a room with one king and one fold out bed (the latter for two kids).It was like heaven! The room was spacious and comfortable with a mini-fridge. The location was prime within walking distance to Waikiki Beach and the Honolulu Zoo. The staff was very friendly, especially the valet staff who were always super efficient at getting our car and delivered it with a smile and a "have a nice day". The gym had adequate cardio machine choices and was well maintained.Perhaps the best part of the hotel was the free breakfast in the morning. On the third floor, the place bustled with activity and offered great seating options where you could eat while soaking up the Hawaiian sun. The choices were more than just a croissant and coffee - always had a main protein dish and waffles or pancakes along with a lot of fruit, oatmeal and other healthy choices.The only negatives are that our view from the 3rd floor was an older apartment complex and that the parking was $35/day (but it was in and out and on par with other hotels).Regardless, I highly recommend this jewel of a hotel particularly for families.

Just got back from this great Hotel in Waikiki, with an excellent front desk staff. I command and recommend Penny and Lei for their tremendous dedication and professionalism. These two front desk ladies made my family and I feel comfortable enough that we really desired to stay longer if we could. Thank you very much Penny and Lei you both are 5 star people and hotel management are very fortunate to have both of you!!! The hotel it self it's two blocks away from the beach, we could take pictures of it from our hotel room. ABC Convenience store witch is a minimarket is right at the same sidewalk few seconds from the hotel. beds very comfortable. The only thing I found strange was the fact that I had to asked to change lining bed sheets everyday, other wise they won't do it, so I asked and it was done. We really enjoyed their complementary breakfast reach in pineapple witch I loved very much. Definitely I recommend and go back to this hotel.

I spent a week in Hana and was only in Honolulu because my return flight departed from HNL. I was with my daughter, son-in-law, granddaughter in a nice double with sleep sofa...plenty of room for 4.The hotel is nice, close to the beach, etc.The most outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff. Incredibly pleasant and helpful...it was just before New Years so the hotel was very busy, but they never seemed stressed and took all the time necessary to be helpful...Kudos!

Located at one end of Waikiki, this hotel is located close to the beach, Diamond Head and the pick up/ drop off point for many of the tours and trolleys. Rooms are nice and clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good.

Stay here Dec. 22nd with our 91 year old father and took him to visit Pearl Harbor. He is a WWII Navay veteran who served on a Destroyer Escort in the Pacific. Lei, the front desk receptionist went above and beyond to make him feel honored and special. She even talked to the Manager and arranged a room upgrade to a room that was more comfortable. On checkout she again went above and beyond to make sure he was taken care of and,along with Lisa, made him feel like an honored guest. I can’t say enough good things about Lei and Lisa. They are true examples of superior customer service!!!

We really enjoyed the location & overall experience. Breakfast was a bonus. The staff were very friendly & accommodating throughout the hotel. The hotel offers beach towels to guests for free. The pool is rather small but the hotel has a nice gym. No need to bring or buy a boogie board. The hotel gift shop will let you rent one for $5 per day.

We had a great stay at this location. I felt it was reasonably priced for the holiday season.Centrally located and easy to get to and from places in the Waikiki area. The morning breakfast was a nice plus for us. The coffee was nice and hot. The staff was very nice and cheerful. All in all a great trip. But the title of this review says it all. My new Apple wireless ear buds were lifted from my room. Not to accuse anyone, but they vanished from my room. I was using them while studying a few briefs and by the time I got back to the room it was too late. I tried to locate them using the Bluetooth of my I-Phone but too avail. I reported my loss on the front desk but it was basically a noted item. It was my fault for not locking them in the safe provided, but come on, really? Merry Christmas to me! As a warning to all that travel. Be sure to lock up your valuables no matter how much trouble it is. The temptation is sometimes to great. To all who love travel just be careful. Take precautions. Don't rush.You don't want a lost to be your last memory of a great trip.

Disappointed with the room. We had to pay extra for a room that would properly fit the five of us. We had booked our room 3 plus months ago and was not given the room we had paid for. False advertising for sure. 2 queens with a sofa bed translated into 2 queens with a chair with a very small bed in it. Not impressed at all.

There seemed to be a (kids') convention of some kind when I was there. Perhaps that was issue in terms of housekeeping having trouble keeping-up with trash or debris that seemed to be strewn through the hallway areas. Rooms are OK, a little small and dark. I was in one at the back of the property that seemed to be facing residential condos or something. While some areas of Kuhio can be a bit sketchy to walk at night, this is definitely in a lower lit area like that. As a female, it really makes you want to keep your wits about you, and can detract from an otherwise relaxed feel after a fun day or evening.

Overall, pretty positive. It's a very close walk to the beach and is next door to a ABC store. There's also a bus stop right at the corner. The room was clean, although maybe a little dark. In addition, the bathroom was quite small. The included breakfast was nice, but getting seating was a challenge. We would have appreciated more organized kids activities, but you don't really expect it from this level of hotel. The elevators were extremely slow.

Hyatt Place, Waikiki has excelled in the science and art of Customer Relationship Management (CRM). From the moment you check in, you receive a good karma, helpful and smiling faces. Kimberly and Amanda, front desk supervisor and representative respectively, made our experience memorable. If you want Ritz Carlton Hotel and Peninsula Hotel service and standard at more economic rate you can not find any thing close to this Hyatt Place, Waikiki. I have been travelling since I was two years old! and I am now in my 60's.

We just stayed here for 14 nights. The hotel is close to everything and service is second to nine, rooms are cleaned everyday.... the pool is not usable, it's simp,y too cold and located in shade. However the beach is 3 min walk. The only issue we had, is that we suggest the hotel cleans carpets, it took a while to find out why our feet were dirty, simp,y from walking without shoes in the room....

We love this place and a walk from the beach.. Their breakfast was wonderful and so many to choose from. All you can eat. Very clean and friendly staff. We rested well after a long day out. It was very closed to the tour location where the tour picked us up. Expect to pay for parking down the street for $20 a day or more at the hotel. That was the downside. I didn't like to pay for parking.

Breakfast has good choices, including miso soup and tofu, much better than expectation. Close to beach, and you can see colourful fish right on the dam there. Room is clean and quite, ocean view is good, although some of them are blocked by two buildings ahead. Sofa bed is too soft, we asked for extra blanket to cover it. The Donimo pizza right on the lobby is excellent. There's also food truck within 3min walking distance.

Great choice when choosing the Hyatt Place. Hotel was clean and had a great vibe to it. Staff were helpful and always available for assistance. Room was clean and serviced daily. Breakfast was fresh and well stocked. Great location to Waikiki beach.

Great place to stay! Parking was a little hard to find being that it’s across the street, but the room was nice (no bathtub) but overall a great experience. Breakfast was good also. Would definitely stay again.

My wife and I were looking for a reasonably-priced hotel near Waikiki Beach and the Hyatt Place fit our needs perfectly. The hotel is clean, well-located and modern. On check-in, the staff advised that we had been upgraded to a partial ocean view on the 18th floor. The room was quite large with a partial view of the beach from the small deck. The bed was typically Hyatt and was exceptionally comfortable.The hotel included breakfast with the stay. Available in the lobby or a large room on the second floor, the selection of items was simple but adequate for a quick light meal.Overall, a nice place to stay within easy walking distance of central Waikiki.

I stayed at this hotel with my family for 5 days, I stayed in a good bed and enjoyed it. And it was nice to see the beach in 5 minutes walking from the hotel   The bus stopped right in front of the hotel and it was great to travel

Spacious rooms for a family. Comfortable bedding. Good breakfast included. Great location close to beach, restaurants and shopping. Easy walking distance to local attractions. Friendly and helpful staff. Would stay here again.

This was a Beautiful hotel the staff was great and humble very welcomingThe only thing I didn’t like there was no microwave in the room to reheat food.Other than that it’s right on the strip close to the beach and stores

This hotel has top notch customer service. The employees went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable. I would like to give a special thank you to Lei, Christopher, Heidi, Leonida, Jade and Ihab for my making my stay unforgettable.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent. They offered us the use of the hospitality suite to get freshen up before our late night flight was a very nice touch. I would definitely stay there again.

Vacation stay. Had the pleasure of check in with Lei who deserves 5 stars herself. She was accomadating, friendly, professional. As well as Amica who maintained our immaculant room. Will definitely stay at this location again.

This hotel is a gem tucked away from the busy streets of Waikiki but accessible to all the great places Waikiki has to offer. It is also on the edge of Waikiki so you don't have to battle the traffic to get to and from the hotel. The lobby is beautifully done and very welcoming; the elevators are secure so you know you won't find unwelcomed guests wandering around; the rooms are elegant (with ceramic coffee mugs and glasses, not paper and plastic!); and the free breakfast is a great deal with a variety of hot and cold foods, and fresh fruit every morning. And although parking at the hotel is valet-only and limited, there is a great parking garage across the street. I am a single female, and I felt very safe walking to and from this hotel, even by myself, and even at night.

Our 3rd year staying at the Hyatt Place , same excellent service as passed years! Great room, comfy bed, neat and clean! Very attentive staff. Had a free hot breakfast every morning. Great location, close to a lot of things to do! Beach, Zoo, Shopping etc.

It was our first time in Hawaii and we very much enjoyed our stay at Hyatt place waikiki. It isn’t the fanciest five star hotel but was great enough for us to have comfortable rest while we are in the hotel. But when you are in Hawaii who wants to stay indoors for long anyway!? For that reason, Hyatt Place was perfect for us and more cost friendly. We actually enjoyed that it was not right on the busy main strip. It is one block in where things are not as hectic and crowded with all the cars and tourists pouring in and out. Staff were amazing and always greeted us with kind smiles.We didn’t expect much of the free breakfast buffet but they certainly exceedws our expectations. They have lots of different varieties daily so you aren’t sick of eating the same thing over and over for days. Hot coffee and teas and juices and other beverages as well. We were impressed. Food cost can get expensive in Hawaii, this definitely helped us save ~$25 per day I would say.No hidden resort fee and wifi is free!Thanks for the great stay and customer services. We would certainly recommend you guys to friends and family.

This hotel is not one of the mega resorts, but rather a no resort fee option just a few minute walk to Waikiki. The hotel will even provide beach towels, at no charge. Comfortable and quite rooms. Excellent staff. Clean and quiet rooms. Substantial free breakfast in a nice setting. International clientele.

Stayed at this hotel several times in the last several months and it is a good value for the area. This hotel charges no resort fee and includes breakfast, which seems to be uncommon in Waikiki. Close to the park, beach, and Honolulu Zoo.

Hotel staff were great.Breakfast was a standard one nothing too special but free.Pool not to flash if that’s what you’re after.Room was of nice quality & private. Valet parking was great.Decent gym.I would stay here again.

My wife and are currently here for 8 nights and leave tomorrow. We are Hyatt world members. We are booked to stay here again on the 29th of December for 3 nights. This hotel is interesting in that at times it excels and at other times it’s a fizzer. Our check in experience was very good indeed. The thoughtful and kind Jade checked us in and was able to secure an early check in, much appreciated. Once in our room, a king size ocean view room on the 10th floor, the fizzer started. The room was tiny, the lanai was ridiculously small, to the point you can only have the chairs facing one another.
