The view should be described as ocean glimpses, there are buildings obstructing the view. Unfortunately the room was musty and damp. The bathroom was fine as were the minimal toiletries on offer. There was a good sized shower and commodious sink area. The rooms have a sizeable wardrobe but not enough hangers for two people. There is an iron and board a safe and bar fridge. As for coffee making this is tricky. They supply a one cup pod dripolator which splashed everywhere and is very messy when trying to extract a cup of boiling water for tea. A kettle here would be an improvement. The bed was one of the highlights, firmish and super comfy. I’m not sure how often housekeeping change the sheets but I will enquiry for our upcoming visit in a few weeks. The tv was very good as were the viewing options. There is a one seat fold out lounge in the corner which was rather nice to stretch out on using the ottoman provided. This hotel offers breakfast. Now this is a game of two halves... in that the breakfast offerings are really good and plentiful but the fact that breakfast time ceases at 930am PRECISELY weekdays and 1030am weekends is annoying. What it means is that unless you get there super early you need to fight the crowds and believe me it is really crowded. My advice to management is to open up the weekday breakfast hours to follow the weekend hours and leave it going until 1030am. That way you diffuse the rush and crowd somewhat. The staff do an excellent job of keeping the food and dining areas impeccably clean. There is a pool area but we didn’t use the pool. The hotel has a cute bar area and a happy hour where we enjoyed great cocktails by the affable and cheeky bartender Nick. He was very entertaining and knows how to work a crowd, a real pro. The hotels proximity to the beach and Waikiki attractions is a real winner it’s just so convenient to everything. So we will return in a couple of weeks and have booked a city view room, it will be interesting to make the room comparison on our next visit.

Hyatt Place Waikiki is a hidden gem. Staff was impeccably polite and helpful. Complimentary breakfast was nice. Room was nicely updated and very clean - bed was super comfy. Beach is a 5 minute walk away. Hotel is nicely located at the end of Waikiki next to a huge park - if you are a runner, just a block or two away from nice runs up towards Diamond Head.

Great location on Waikiki even if it is not on Kalakaua. Close to shops and restaurants. Easy access to the freeway. Relaxing atmosphere. Breakfast could use more variety such as hot oatmeal and fresh veggies and fruits

In Waikiki for honeymoon. Hotel located at bottom end of the main strip so it's well placed if you want somewhere a little quieter for your stay. I'm not keen on the additional resort rate fee on top of the room rate it's just an excuse to take more money from you. The hotel is a touch dated but the rooms are adequate enough even if the aircon runs a touch loud in the room. We didn't get acknowledged as a honeymooning couple on check in but were told the next day we had been upgraded when we went to the desk to enquire about our booking. Also requested an early morning wake up call on day of check out that didn't happen and got a poor apology at reception and no reason why the call was never made. The staff seemed fairly disinterested in offering us any decent service at all.

Great people - I go here a few times a year because I can depend on an Aloha greeting after the long flight, a great room, breakfast with fresh pineapple, unsweetened yogurt, and good coffee. Plus, I like this end of the beach toward the Zoo with the adjacent open space and giant banyan trees.

We booked a week at Hyatt Place for our family of 5. We loved it because we had plenty of room, free breakfast, and the location was excellent! First thing you should know is that if you have a car, DO NOT park at Hyatt Place. It's crazy expensive. Park caddy-cornered across the street in the garage (in & out privileges for about $80 for the whole week!). This hotel is located a 3-minute walk to the beach, next door to an ABC Store, and within walking distance of tons of other shopping and dining. The hotel itself is very nice, but not fancy -- to be expected for a Hyatt Place. Our room was clean, well-appointed, and had a partial view of Diamond Head, but we didn't spend much time on the balcony. Breakfast was good! It was served outdoors on the 3rd floor for most of our stay (not much of a coffee view) and had a variety of food that was switched up a little each day. Among other things, they had bacon, sausage, eggs, rice, fruit, miso soup, breads, yogurt, cereal, coffee (but no flavored creamer -- bummer!), milk, and juice. It was great for a family to fill up before heading out, especially since food is so expensive in Hawaii. The last couple of days, they were resurfacing the breakfast area, so they served everyone on the 2nd floor and in the lobby. They struggled to keep up both areas. This should be an issue for future stays because I assume it's long been completed, but I would not have like it if this was going on during our entire stay. One other note... teeny tiny pool... like, don't even bother with it. But... you're in Hawaii, so go to the beach! Overall, GREAT hotel for a family!! Great for couples too, but be advised that it's not luxury. I would definitely stay here again!

Friendly staff, clean and tidy hotel, breakfast was great. Good location, 2min walk to the beach. Really good value for money and staff always will to help when asked. Looked after our son really well and made our trip much more enjoyable

Stayed here for a week in early November, and very happy with it. My first time in Hawaii :) My mountain view room was HUGE, way more than needed or expected. Comfortable beds and beautiful view of DH. A/C worked well. WiFi worked well, enough to FaceTime back home in Canada. Always something filling for breakfast (included) that was set up on a nice outdoor patio on 3rd floor. Pool was unavailable but the beach is only a couple blocks away, and you could use a sister hotel's pool if you wanted. ABC store on every corner (literally) so could grab snacks and drinks anytime for fairly cheap. Main bus line on the corner of Paoakalani way that will take you to downtown Honolulu. Overall, if I went back to Honolulu again I would stay here.

This was the second time to stay this hotel for me. It is located in nice location to the beach and everywhere. Also there are bus stops for the bus or trollies near the hotel. Guest room is very clean and comfortable. I love this hotel.

The hotel is located couple of blocks from Kuhio beach and walking distance from Waikiki beach. Full breakfast is included in the room rate and is a great value. The hotel also has Dominos Pizza located in the premises which remains open till mid night. Overall rooms are spacious and have modern look and feel. Great value proposition for family travel.

Everything about our stay here was great. The hotel is located in a great place and has obviously been updated recently, the rooms are pristine. The staff here are probably the best part, though. They were super friendly, and so helpful (the even microwaved some food for us to eat in our room). Comparatively, the rates here are good and even though it is a Hyatt place, in my book it was just as good as higher level Hyatt brands

Our initial moments with the Hyatt were so-so. We had sent a couple of requests directly to the hotel, and received a response back that was so canned it made us wonder if anyone had read our actual requests (still not sure as they weren't fulfilled, including a special occasion). We also had a strained check-in experience - not the staff's fault - the person ahead of us was pretty angry about their room. When it was our turn, we were advised that the view room we had booked was not available, but we were upgraded! Although the upgrade was to a larger room, we were allotted a "city view" (we were only told this after we specifically asked about the view), and staff said there were no view rooms available, so we had no choice but to accept the room.The included breakfast the next morning was literally a whirlwind. The outdoor breakfast space was really hectic, and it was super windy, so napkins and paper cups were flying around (along with a few birds) Food quality was decent, and to their credit, staff did a fantastic job keeping up with the crowd. Although they did change up 2 of the 3 hot items each day, I found the variety very limited, and they didn't change their side items at all (always the same fruit salad, same breads, etc. etc.) I just wish they had a larger selection, but I recognize with the volume of people and the physical space, the hotel was trying to maximize efficiency. Like many other reviewers, the elevator situation impacted us. Most times, they were fine, but at breakfast time, they could be super slow. One day, we waited over 10 minutes for an elevator. Many people decided to take the stairs, and we finally gave up and did as well (it took at least 5-7 minutes for another guest who HAD to wait for the elevator, to arrive!).Given the above, why did I rate the Hyatt so highly? A number of reasons:- No resort fees. Bravo!- Great location, a bit quieter than other parts of Waikiki, but closer to the beach and very close to bus stops where you can get to almost anywhere on the island (we had extra time on our departure day and took one public bus to the airport instead of a cab which took about 1 hour and cost $5 for 2 people).- Good value for the location.- Rooms/furniture were in good condition.- They had almond milk available at breakfast!- We met our housekeeper only once. Wilma was one of the most genuinely friendly people we encountered and was a great ambassador for the hotel.

This is one of my favorite places to stay when I staycation in Waikiki. It is walking distance to lots of shopping and restaurants and it's just a block away from the beach. The staff is friendly and the room was quiet, clean, spacious, and modern. Parking with the valet was $30something, but self-parking is relatively convenient. Not many hotels offer free breakfast in Hawaii, and Hyatt Place serves just about the best. Everything was fresh and hot and there were lots of choices for everyone.

Stayed here with free night from Hyatt credit card. Called hotel and was glad the lady on the phone was able to accommodate an hour earlier check in. I believe this Hyatt (Place) is the only location which comes with complimentary breakfast along with other chain hotels in the area - so that is a plus! The selection was alright but it's better than having no breakfast. Room key is needed to get up elevator, so security is good. Okay pool but who needs a pool when there is Waikiki beach. Courteous and quick check in and out service. Overall a pleasant stay.

The hotel is just one block from the beach and at the end of Waikiki so close to Diamond Head. The staff is always friendly and nice. I come to this hotel often when I need to escape a few days and chilllll out

Hotel was great,, staff exceptionally friendly. Breakfast should have more under cover shelter as when it rains not many of the guests can find shelter, having to take breakfast up to room and use the very slow elevator

We came to this Hyatt for our honeymoon before heading to Maui. The staff provides excellent customer service and we were steps Away from the beach. Breakfast was good and our room was nice. My only issues were the cab company, which was unreliable and often took 15+ minutes to arrive. Our bed was also really firm which made our sleep a bit rough but overall we would return :)

This hotel is very close to a beach and shops in Waikiki. The room was very clean and modern and also they have excellent custermer service! Our house keeper Maria was very nice and friendly, I loved chatting with her! Very nice receptionists too! I will definitely come back again!

This hotel is very modern and we have been lucky to have been given free upgrades both times we’ve stayed here. The rooms are excellent and comfortable with close proximity to the beach. The free breakfast included is excellent.

This hotel was excellent. Close 3 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Full hot breakfast included. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room was big and very comfortable. Great view from the balcony. We would come back.

Lei and Chris took care of me & my friends. I asked for a connecting room since there was 5 of us. I received a free upgrade of 2 queens beds in each room instead of our 1 king bed. Lei took pictures of us while we attend a free lei making class. Staff is very friendly & accommodating. I would recommend this hotel.

An oasis of hospitality and comfort. Very impressive property. Amazing beds room is very aesthetically pleasing and well put together. Truly one of the very best. Highly recommend this property they have gone to extraordinary measures in creating a complete experience

We stayed here for 5 nights on the 11th floor of the south/east tower. The hotel has 2 towers; the hotel reception, pool and breakfast area are in the north/west tower (on Paoakalani Ave) and the adjacent south/east tower shares the vast lobby space and connects on level 3 (the pool deck). The lobby has a bar with Starbucks coffee, Dominos pizza, 2 boutiques, a travel agent and a small business centre. Level 3 has a decent sized swimming pool, outdoor deck, coin-op laundry and a breakfast buffet area. Breakfast is free. Our room had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed - perfect for small families. There was a small balcony, combined toilet/shower and good sized tv. There’s a convenience store next door and the beach is just 2 mins away. While there isn’t a restaurant in the hotel (except for breakfast) there are plenty of other hotels around with restaurants plus other nearby bars and fast food. Pros:- free breakfast- spacious lobby- proximity to beach- great staff- comfy beds- located in the heart of Waikiki- lovely pool and outdoor space - coin-operated laundry- bus available right outside the hotel- free WiFi Cons:- noisy traffic- noisy air conditioner - combined shower & toilet is TINY and no bath- fridge is too smallDefinitely a great mid-priced hotel and one of the few in Waikiki that offers two queen beds plus sofa bed (most have doubles or one king), so ideal for families. For a family vacation, I’d stay here again.

I've spent almost ten days at the Hyatt, all of them very pleasant. The hotel is perfectly adressed, next to the best restaurants and famous points in Honolulu. The services were offered as expected, by a team always ready to know and fulfill the guests' needs. By the way, Penny and Amanda did specially well, showing extraordinary politeness and competence, enough to make me feel at home. Only negative point was the pool (where breakfast was served), not too atractive (small) and extremely windy.Congratulations on the valet guys and Nate, the concierge, important service also available in the hotel.

We stayed here using points and were upgraded even though we only have minimal status with Hyatt. We were event sent a bottle of champagne after mentioning it was our anniversary. This hotel is perfect for a place to sleep after a long day of exploring or surfing. The breakfast was tasty and free, rooms were large and clean, and location was walking distance to everything. The service was outstanding. Every single employee I encountered greeted me warmly with a smile and offered to help whenever possible.

Location: Short walk from the beach, about 10-15 min walk from shops and restaurantsRoom: The room was huge, the interior is fairly dated and could use some updating, especially the bathroom. Poor water pressure in the shower, slow drain, and musty/mildew smell in bathroom...Elevator: SLOW ELEVATOR!!! This was the most annoying part about this hotel, and is enough to deter me from staying here again. You need to plan an extra 10-15 min just for the elevator ride. Things are worst in the morning during the breakfast rush - I wanted to go down to get a cup of coffee in the morning to bring back to my room, I waited for the elevator to go down, got my coffee (after I line up), and waited for the elevator back up to my room - it was a 45 min trip!!! One evening we waited for an elevator at the lobby, just an average evening - 3 elevators have gone by before we were able to get in. We got back into our rooms 20 mins after we arrived at the lobby. Definitely my worst experience with elevators. And it wasn't even peek season...I cannot imagine how it would be when it's "busy" Breakfast: Breakfast is free, but was chaotic, borderline stressful. I had to fight for a table, then fight for a plates, eating utensils, coffee, food - you need to fight for everything single thing you need. Space was crowded and guests often trip over each other, it's a warzone, and not child friendly at all (think guest holding coffee running over toddler because he couldn't see the little one because it was way too crowded - whether not it's worth the stress is a personal choice, we skipped the breakfast after the first few days. Food selection is very average, nothing surprising - standard scrambled eggs, waffle/pancakes, sausages/bacon (on alternating days), fruits, coffee, juice. It gets boring after a few days.

We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki Beach! LEI checked us in and she was super friendly and so informative! This being our first time in Hawaii and our first vacation in such a long time, she went out of her way to make our stay memorable starting with the fresh orchid "lei's" for each of us plus a room with a better view of the ocean!! The hotel is located just a block off the beach and main strip, barely a minute walk before you hit the sandy beach, restaurants, and shops - and minutes away from Diamond Head - perfect location - we walked everywhere and if needed took the city bus just outside our hotel. The tour buses picked up and dropped off just outside the hotel as well. All the staff at the hotel were super friendly, warm, courteous, and gracious - so eager to help with anything! The Hyatt Place at Waikiki Beach gets a 10/10 from us!!!! :-))

We had a nice experience. Got some issues when checked in, but shortly the problem was solved by the supervisor. Breakfast could have a bigger variety, some more yogurts, cereals, may be omlet and some veggies will get an idea. Would recommend it to other friends.

Pros:Location, walking distance to WaikikiInclude breakfast, but overcrowded and people seems like fighting for the food. Clean up starts at 10am, so, if you have your jet lag make sure to set your alarm, otherwise you will missed the breakfast.Cons:If you book it from booking.com most likely you will get the room near the service room where the housekeeping hangout and stored the cleaning equipment. It was very loud for us, believe me they talking and screaming to each other, thats why we had to change room 3 times. Another room was also near the lift, in front of the street, again street noise. About 20 teenagers had pizza party in front of corridor and lift, again pretty loud. :pAsk for quiet room, although they might want keep it only for the hyatt member only, but ask anyway.One day our room was not being cleaned, we complained at 21PM and the housekeepers came to clean up.Lack of service, well again it is Hawaii, expensive island. If you want great service go to Bali.

Spent a quick Black Friday here with clients. I got a double queen room on the 16th floor. The room had a small "nook" that doubled as a living area and had a lanai (balcony). Best thing about the hotel was the view. For a hotel pretty much set back and practically on Kuhio Avenue, the view from the balcony was pretty awesome. With 200 plus hotels in Waikiki and if you are not on Kalakaua Ave, you are not going to get an ocean view. Somehow, where my room was located on the 16th floor was and no tall hotels in front, i had a pretty nice view of the ocean albeit a bit set back. Liked to see the sailboats going by for sunset. Queen beds were comfy and room pretty much had everything needed: mini fridge, coffee maker and flat screen. The only thing I noticed was that the room ad some quirky corners. I think it's because it's an older refurbished hotel and it's just a bit odd to see some corners and some quarter walls in the rooms. I'm sure they serve a purpose but it's just quirky. Bathroom was a bit tight but the shower had good pressure. Included buffet breakfast was good and lots of fresh fruit. Overall, it's a practical hotel, close to the zoo side and a quick 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and my favorite pau hana spot: Tikis. Also discovered the Dominican food truck downstairs, it was awesome and glad it's there for late night eats! People who run the place are super friendly and the grinds pretty delicious. Hope it stays there for a while!

Great location. Two blocks from the beach. Close to restaurants and the zoo. Rooms are nice but sometimes noise from the street is a bit of problem. Great staff!! Parking is limited and the driveway can get congested as there is not much space.
user_name:
David Russell R
Spring, United States

review_body: Stayed at the hotel with my partner for almost a week and whereas we didn't have major concerns, we were a bit meh about it all.. The room we had was really small, not much room to put your stuff, the bathroom was quite dated, balcony so tiny you couldn't even get outside, and there was a constant draft noise all day and all night long on the whole floor and in our room (we were on the 2nd floor). The breakfast was fine, but again - nothing to shout out about. The best part of the hotel was the very comfy king size bed and the location, which was perfect for us. We found the best available parking at the nearby ZOO for $1 an hour and then the nearby parking lot pretty much opposite the hotel for $20 a night. I'd say if you're in Honolulu for a couple of days or a stopover, then definitely go for it. But if you are there for a special occasion and you need your hotel to be amazing, then maybe look elsewhere.

Stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for one night at the end of a two week holiday in order to connect to our international flight back to Melbourne. Having previously stayed at this hotel in 2016 we decided to return as we had a positive experience.The rooms are very clean and modern, the beds are comfortable. The hotel is located at the end of the hotel strip if Waikiki, next to the Waikiki zoo. This makes it a bit quieter and away from the main hustle and bustle of Waikiki which can get very busy! It's still only a short walk to the main part of Waikiki and possibly just under ten minutes for dinner to places like the Cheer Factory.The receopnist who checked us in was very friendly and even tried to upgrade us to an ocean view room on a higher floor as I'm a Starwood member. However as the room had two queen beds instead of the king we prefer we declined but it was very nice of her to offer an upgrade to us.Our stay was pleasant and as we expected. Nice comfortable room and quiet at night. Would definitely return if we are in Waikiki again.

Great location and friendly staff Would highly recommend this hotel, breakfast was excellent and service was top notch Walk to beach was short distance from hotel and convenient to shopping and dinning

We come to celebrate our 30 anniversaries, We were checked in to second floor facing street. I am surprised by staff told me that all rooms were booked even at 5pm slow season (check in Nov 15th). Staff show zero interests to our need. very disappointing.

Close to beach and shopping, safe and clean, super helpful staff and great breakfast! Good value for the price! Our family thought this was the perfect place to experience Waikiki beach. Room was a bit tight for 5 of us but we made it work!

From start to finish, this was magic. We met family from Arkansas and were accommodated on the 3rd floor in two rooms and 1 room on the 2 floor, this was a very minor hiccup with room allocation and thanks to Christopher and Lei, it was quickly rectified on the second day. The rooms were delightfully maintained and staff happy and courteous, breakfast was a welcoming event every day and Sonia took the time out to talk and welcome guests to the breakfast area, thoroughly enjoyed our stay of 13 days, we would love to go back and we have only just returned to Australia(home). The bed itself was perfect and value for money was very good, within walking distance to town, the beach, Diamond Head and buses outside your door

Aloha! Years dreaming, dream fulfilled. Landed in the tropical paradise called Hawaii with the family and was immediately stuck by the laid back vibe and fantastic weather, water and sand. Set up shop at the Hyatt, Waikiki where we were welcomed when a nice room upgrade and a wonderful smile from Lei our front office receptionist. The hotel is very close to Waikiki beach and a nice place to stay at (Note: traffic starts early here around 5:30a so don't expect to sleep in late for long).  A short time to catch our breath, quick snacking and we were off to the beach in our swimwear (Note: cheapest parking is at the near by Honolulu zoo for $1/hour and best of all you can extend parking straight from your phone - you'll get a reminder to extend via text). The beach was amazing and the water is right there. Clear, fill is fish and best is off all warm... Thoroughly soaked and content, we filled our rumbling bellies when calamari, buffalo wings, beef dumpings and pan fried chicken and spicy shrimp all the while listening to soothing island music player by wonderful duos.... Then reluctantly back to the hotel but excited at the new day that waits... Filled with expectant discovery

We needed to find a hotel last minute and was very happy with this hotel. Back a little from the water but just a quick walk to to the sand and water. Staff was very friendly, professional and accommodating!

The staff were excellent and exceeded even the most critical expectations. The staff would go beyond the call of duty to assist their guests. Can not ask for anything better service. Breakfast was cooked correctly every morning.

The Hyatt Place is close to the beach and the bus stops is at the corner of both blocks. Free breakfast is a major plus. The hotel has been updated and so are the rooms. During busy times waiting for an elevator may take a few more minutes

Well appointed hotel in a convenient location. Walking distance to the beach and transport. Comfortable and clean rooms. Very helpful staff. The included was good though a wider selection would be better.

Hiatt Place very nice property for the price. Two blocks from the beach. Breakfast buffet included, very good. Staff very helpful. Prices in the lounge a little high. Lots of international guests in the hotel. The elevators in the towers are very slow. Two elevators for 20 floors of rooms. Wating sometimes 5 minutes for the car to arrive.

The room was clean and we could definitely feel the aloha spirit from the staff. The Location was good. The Only problems were one Our room did not match the pictures thatwere used by the site when we booked. In addition the hotel had no free parking for guests.

Location was great. Just minutes from beach. Seconds away from an ABC store for food, alcohol, and items. Blocks away from zoo. At end of main strip which made it convenient for restaurants and shops and not too busy.

We stayed for 2 weeks which is a long time in the one hotel. Level 3 was closed for renovations and breakfast was served in the lobby and the pool was closed. We were not advised of this and after expressing my disappointment, the staff were very responsive and understanding. They gave us a hotel credit and also a comp upgrade to a bigger room. The way they handled the situation and level of customer service, it made our trip much more comfortable. Hotel is in a good location, a little further down from the main shopping but only a block from the beach.

I have stayed at this hotel twice. It is very close to the beach and convenient. The hotel is quieter as it is a few blocks off the strip. As I am Sabbath observant, the hotel made special accommodation for me with key cards, food delivery, and floor. The staff, Lei, Christopher, and Andrea took a special interest in me. They were wonderful. There are some identifiable cereals on breakfast buffet, coffee, and juice. All good!

It's not on the water. The pool sucks. But if you want a good night sleep for a reasonable price 1 block from the beach, this is your place. Good continental breakfast. Fantastic staff, some say the best ever. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed 12 days in this hotel and overall it was a positive experience.Raquel, the lady who took care of our room was absolutely sweet and very helpful.She kept the place spotless!The commun space were a bit old fashioned and would need redecoration, everything was a bit simple but working perfectly.We did not expect to pay 14% taxes on top of the bill.

My wife and I stayed her twice over a two-week period and would definitely come back. Full, hot complimentary breakfast, with comfortable rooms. And unless your travel plans demand multiple on-site amenities that are worth $20 per day, Hyatt may be a better choice with no resort fees. Friendly staff. Highly recommended.

I stay at this hotel each month and it never disappoints. The staff is always friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean and in a good location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Hawaii.

Was a little disappointed the pool was closed. Would like a bench/barbell in the workout room. The Valet area is fairly cramped and it's difficult to get more than a couple cars in there at one time. Rooms were quiet, large and adequately appointed. One block walk to beach and nice higher-end shopping. Nice (included) hot breakfast is a great way to start the day. Staff very polite and helpful.

All the good things written about the Hyatt are true, location, breakfast, service, beach towels, etc but it is beyond me why they need to lower themselves to make a few extra bucks. When we walked into our room we saw the bottles of water on the credenza so we thought that was nice and went over to them, opened them. What we didn't see was the 'fine print' on the bottle that they were $3 if you weren't a Hyatt 'super duper' member. Apparently I'm just a regular member since they charged me. I paid them over $1,500 for my stay but they had to sneak in an extra $3. Should have just left a card that said snacks, water etc available in the lobby. I just thought the bottle of water was a cheap trick that was beneath the level of Hyatt. It annoyed me that they did it, especially as they way overpriced the bottle of water.

Hyatt place is located about 4 blocks the main strip along Waikiki, across the parking lot from the Zoo. The location was perfect for us, far enough down the strip to avoid bachelor parties, college parties and other alcohol related shenanigans. (If you are looking for more of a party atmosphere look for hotels around Lewers Street.) Paoakalani Avenue is kind of at the end of Waikiki, but delivers you to the "reefed" swimming area, which is the ideal location for taking little ones into the water. I did hear other guests complain that the pool was small and didn't have a bar. (If that's your thing, look for another hotels.) Personally, I don't find I spend much time at the pool when there are such beautiful natural beaches so close. Staff were very friendly and very helpful, the rooms were great, and the morning breakfast was such a nice surprise. Plus there is the use of complimentary beach towels and daily water bottles. In the alley way, that's west of the Hyatt, zoo side, there is this little food cart that serves Honduras food. If they aren't open when you walk by snap a picture of their number and place an order when they are open, there can be long wait times; its great food at a cheap price (by comparison).I do have to say I love the Hyatt Brand. It's the first "brand" I committed to, they offer quality, clean accommodations from their less expensive to their most expensive and their staff (at all locations) go above and beyond to make my stay fabulous. Belonging to any of their "memberships" just makes Hyatt that much more affordable.

Happy with actual hotel and breakfast. No prior notification that pool would be closed for renovations during our 8 night say, not acceptable. Notice was when I looked out my deck and the pool was under construction, and found letter in room. A lot of time went into choosing a hotel in Waikiki and disappointed in Hyatt for not disclosing in advance.

My family and I, which consisted of me, my wife, and 16 month old son stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. I did a decent amount of research prior to booking this trip, and I chose this hotel for three reasons: (1) I used my Hyatt rewards points (2) No resort fee (3) Free breakfast. For 12,000 points per night, this hotel was a great value (we were also upgraded to a larger room). I also saved about $30/day for not having to pay a resort fee. In addition, I probably saved an additional $30-40/day on breakfast. The breakfast food is way above average for any limited service hotel standards. That said, he opted not to eat there the last couple days of our vacation. I greatly appreciated the fact that they were able to get us in our room at 11am, which is several hours before normal check-in. That was very helpful because of our young child. The overall location is good, but the most prime location, in my opinion is few blocks further west because that's where most of the shopping and restaurant are located. I'm glad we didn't rent a car for the entire duration of the trip. We rented one on two different occasions and just picked it up in the morning and dropped it off that same day, which allowed us to use the car for day trips up to North Shore and we avoided having to pay the parking fees. I booked one car ahead of time through Hertz (Hyatt Regency Hotel) and another car at Enterprise (Marriott Hotel - directly across the street) while we were there. The "Expedia Expert" at the hotel lobby was very helpful in explaining the different things to do with our rental car. We also booked the Chief Luau and a catamaran ride.

Nice room, close to the beach - a short walk down to an area of the beach that is walled off so it feels like an ocean pool. The free breakfast is what you'd expect for something that is free - very average. Unfortunately the pool was being renovated. Our swipe key stopped working on the last day and it was a massive saga for them to let us back into the room, requiring us to do this that and other (just let us back in!)

Good location near the beach. Walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Can’t beat that . Room is spacious. Lobby is not enclosed so when we were there, it was kinda warm. Staff were friendly . Only problem was, you can hear the elevator while trying to sleep at night. But I would definitely stay here again.

This is a beautiful hotel, the room was clean and spacious and the location was perfect 2 mins walk from the beach and plenty of restaurants would 100% stay again...very friendly staff who make you feel very welcome !

Waikiki beach nearby, in a decent and safe area. Stayed her prior to a longer cruise. Rooms are not large or modern decorated, but beds and nice and firm and provide a good nights sleep, besides for the early wakeup by traffic noise. The street is quite busy during daytime. The expedia desk employe was very firendly and helpfull, as was the rest of the staff. The beakfast is plenty, but quite average and located on the deck, that is very windy most the of the time

Close to beach, convenient access to trolley systems and public bus. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The only hotel to offer a breakfast buffet in Waikiki, and it was really good. The concierge in the lobby offered a lot of good advice on what to see and what to skip, and it was on the mark.

Would recommend this hotel - it's value for money, includes breakfast - certainly nothing fancy, but good old-fashioned value. Nice room, clean and everything we needed. Staff at front desk very helpful and friendly.

Our overall stay here was good! We arrived early with kids and luggage in tow and were offered an upgrade for a nominal amount, which we gratefully accepted. The room was spacious for our family 5. Check was easy and fast. Heidi who served us even grabbed us some breakfast from the recently closed breakfast service which our kids thoroughly enjoyed. Serving staff and cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. The only disappointment were the inconvenience caused by the renovations. We'd booked the hotel because it had a pool so were disappointed (especially our children) to arrive and be told it was being renovated. Breakfast was also chaotic because of hosting it downstairs in the foyer due to renovations. We had to wait for awhile for a table to come free due to the limited number of seats. Once the reno is done Im sure these things won't be an issue. The location of the hotel is minutes from the beach and high street shopping. I would definitely recommend this hotel once the renovations are completed.

I just got back from 4 nights at the Hyatt Place. This was the first time I felt sad to leave a hotel...LOL. I stayed at the Hyatt Regency just last month and the Hyatt Place was a much better fit for me. I like that it's at the quieter end of Waikiki and not the bustling section where the Hyatt Regency is located. The breakfast buffet was quite generous with scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes and a nice variety of fresh fruits, cereals and even almond milk for my coffee! I also found the staff to be much more relaxed and amicable. The valet staff was also friendly and prompt. This was a short "staycation" for me and I can't wait to come back. Highly recommend.

A hotel positioned close to the beach.. Close to bus stop...where various buses will take you to various spots on the island.So close to the main shopping areas and a stroll away from eateries.Rooms are spacious and the beds are comfy.....good friendly and very helpful staff who show a passion in their work.I recommend this hotel.

I have stayed here before. They are in process of completing the pool re-surfacing. It should be done by the time I upload. That said breakfast is served in the lobby until the pool area re-opens so a bit of a frazzle during breakfast hours. The staff though is on top of it. The rooms are always clean, quiet and comfortable. Valet is timely although the barcode AP doesn't work for car retrival.

The Hyatt place is a clean convenient hotel in the beach area. Breakfast was incredible and the location was good. We had to use transports which usually met in front or in front of the Marriott. It's a great deal

It is a very nice hotel. We had the ocean view room and it was beautiful. The room was cleaned everyday except for one day. The staff was very nice and valued our business. The staff helped us find stuff to do for the whole week. It is located about 2 blocks from the ocean. The bar food I thought was a little to expensive for what it was. We were going to eat lunch there on day but decided it was to expensive so we went elsewhere. The over all view is the hotel is rated a 10!!!

Great location. We booked a tour to the USS Arizona and rented a car and the pickup and drop off for each was across the street at the Marriott Hotel. Friendly and helpful staff and the concierge was obliging and most helpful. Good variety of breakfast foods; fresh pineapples daily, variety of cereal, breads and even gluten free bread. Enjoyed our stay here and would return.

A great location, amazing rooms (so big and spacious), such wonderful staff with special mention to Jovie in housekeeping and the boys in Valet- Nick, Casey and Oak. Loved it. Perfect for our family. A 2 minute walk to the beach. Will definitely be coming back to stay. X

Breakfast, although self service, required you to do everything yourself including dropping your plate & utensils off to the bin. Another peeve was the plastic utensils. Coffee & tea goes into plastic cups. Everyone knows tea especially does not taste great if isn't served in a porcelain cup. Lastly, breakfast selection is poor compared to most Asian hotels of similar star rating

Location was good as was close to shops and wikiki. Front staff where great. Food from room service was not good. Breakfast was not all the best due to small variety and not enough seating areas. Rooms where not serviced properly

Stayed here for 7 nights.Check - in and check out was less then 5 mins.included buffet breakfast (rare in Waikiki) - currently located in the foyer so minimal seating available. We ended up sitting on the floor eating breakfast so this wasn't ideal with kids.Food was good, plenty of options and tasted fine.Pool was under renovation. We had no knowledge of this however we did book through a 3rd party site. They did offer services at their "sister" hotel, 2 min walk however this pool was very dated and was at a hotel under major renovation so it was impossible to sit by the pool or have a drink by the pool as this wasn't available. The sister pool was simply uncomfortable and basic.We booked an ocean view room, stayed on the 14th floor. I would call it an ocean glimpse view between and over 2-3 other hotels, so that was defiantly disappointing considering you pay extra for a full ocean view room.Staff were friendly and assisted in several small tasks, nothing seem to much trouble.Location is good for most things on the east end of Waikiki strip. ABC store next door and a dominos pizza shop recently opened in the foyer of the hotel.SummaryStaff - excellent and thank you to them!location - goodFacility - views, breakfast, pool - disappointingWould I stay again - No, only because I think if I wanted the iconic ocean view room in Waikiki and paid extra for it I would go and stay somewhere that had that view.

We bought this as a package deal with Hawaiian Air.....don't think it was worth 2 grand for 5 days even with breakfast inc. Staff were lovely and we were upgraded to a larger room as the pool was being renovated as was the dining room. Close to the lovely safe beach or you could walk further to a surf beach. And the zoo. Breakfast was a bit chaotic and not a lot of choice, the pool in the other hotel was nice. You must visit the Cheesecake Factory the food is lovely. Nordstrom Rack is behind the international market place for great bargains.. I actually got a pair of shoes for nothing... designer brand and another lady got a designer leather bag for the same price... can't beat that. The area is full of homeless, all of Waikiki and we saw more police than in LA.. so it is safe. Not sure I'd go back to hawaii
user_name:
Heidi H
Engadine, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: My daughter and I had a grand experience at the Hyatt Place. Their Customer Service is beyond superb as they tried to accommodate me with a chair in the shower since I am disabled. I wasn't able to get the disabled shower chair in our first room, but the Front Desk staff was extremely helpful in switching me to another ADA room. The Valet Staff is also incredibly helpful as they were always there to assist me and my daughter with my wheelchair from and to our Rent-A-Car. I would definitely love to come back here next time we are visiting in Waikiki. As a bonus, they have a GREAT free breakfast every morning from 6:30am - 9:30am that you are able to bring back to your room (tray provided in room). ** I also would like to give a shoutout to OUTSTANDING customer service to: Kevin (Valet Attendant), Lei + Jade (Front Desk) and Jose + Ihab (Assistant Managers). Thank you all for all your help! :) Cheers,Trudy

We found the staff to be extremely friendly and professional from the times we dealt with them. Breakfast was great a huge variety accommodating for everyone to be able to find something.the staff who worked the breakfast shiftbwere the mist hard working staff I have ever seen.condtantly clearing plates and making sure all breakfast items were constantly filled. Mind you some people annoyed me when they would just get up and walk away leaving dishes for the staff to clear how lazy I know were on holiday but come on. We chatted with other guest's during breakfast. Mind you we found that seating could be hard to find during the renovations of the pool area. And felt a little squished in. Mind you during our stay there were a girls volleyball team and boys baseball or basketball team too and they would lounge area in the seating areas. Unfortunately we couldn't check in till 1pm and we arrived early due to our early flight out of Australia. But the staff tried. We had a room on the 12th floor loved our ocean view.mind you the balcony was on the tiny side which was a shame. The bed was huge and comfy. And cleaning staff always had an aloha if they saw u and had always cleaned our room by the time we returned.only small negative I have is our room didn't seem to get dusted or vacuumed at all which I found Strange?? Lifts could be slow occasionally but nothing to bother us. We received a bottle of wine for my husband's birthday which was lovely. I would stay at the hotel again it was nice an Close to everything and nice and quiet away from the madness of the main streets. Loved the safety beach too. Plenty of good place's to eat and abc store Close byand most ouvks were at the hotel or outside the Aston Waikiki.a nd it's extremely good value for money?

Despite some of the shortcomings of this hotel (the pool and formal breakfast area were closed -no indication of this when booking), I would still recommend it. The breakfast was relocated to another part of the hotel- a small room and most of the same breakfast options for the entire week. The rooms was very spacious and the bed comfortable. The lobby could be more inviting. The concierge desk was manned by professional and friendly individuals. The hotel location was probably the most positive aspect.

Check in was quick and was told the breakfast area and pool were being renovated, but could use the pool at another hotel.Room was comfortable, although housekeeping was not the best, for the first part of our stay. It did get better. Wifi worked well.Breakfast was a bit disorganised due to it being in the lobby area, not enough tables, and some guests looked in horror when we asked if we could share the tables. This was at 6:30. When passing back through about 9:30-10:00 it was rammed, so going early was better. Thankfully this was only going to be temporary. A basic selection of food hot and cold and it never run out, but it gets you going for the day.Did not use the bar as there are so many choices near by.Hotel provides towels for the beach which is a nice gesture.Beach, bus stop and ABC store only a short walk. Location is perfect.Staff were always polite with smiles on their faces. Would I recomend the hotel, of course I would even though the stay was not as perfect as it could have been, and it's a bargain.

Staff courteous, professional and accommodating. Shower in adjacent room noisy. Other guests from another country can be impolite and overbearing but tolerable. Politeness of staff overcomes this minor irritation. Some renovation currently being done; no inconvenience to this guest.

The very best accommodations with the very best service. Highly recommend staying at Hyatt properties around the world. Have enjoyed the Hyatt and Japan South Korea Germany and all over the United States including Alaska

Perfect location at one end of Kalakaua Avenue, right near a Trolley station that’ll take you around Waikiki for $2. All the tour company buses pick you up from right out the front or within a minutes walk. The beach is seriously 5 minute walk, and the price is fantastic.There is a Dominos right down stairs that closes at 2am if you have a late night out (which is actually pretty good). The hotel staff were fantastic, they held our luggage while our room was being ready as we landed really early. Staff were super friendly. Rooms were clean, beds and bathroom and showers were spotless! Definitely recommend for the price.

Whether you are visiting for the first time or having a repeat adventure- this is by far one of the best hotels on the island.The rooms are clean.. decorated well.. comfortable and most of all-- quiet.The staff is polite and makes everyone feel like friends.How many hotels do you know that have the general manager and assistant general manager mingle among the guests during breakfast? Always smiling- checking to see if there is anything that is needed?I have selected the Hyatt Place for the last five years and plan on selecting it on every other visit we have in the future.From check in to check out- we did not have a single negative experience.The value for the dollar is also in our opinion - top notch. It's only a block off the beach-right next to the bus stop- and close to almost everything.If you want to pick a hotel that you feel that you are valued as a guest- but treated as a close friend then select the Hyatt Place--- you will not be disappointed.

We returned back to Waikiki for our 30 years anniversary. Hotel was nice, walking distance to the beach. Had enjoyed the hot breakfast. The staff were very friendly especially love the lady (sorry did not get her name) who always loudly saying "Aloha, Aloha" during breakfast times. Everything was nice including front desk at check out "You have zero balance" We were home already but still enjoying our experience in Waikiki until husband reconciling his online checking. We were charged $3.00 for a bottle of water in the room that we did not use. When we first got in the room we were happy at least they provide a free water till we read the note attached to the bottle. Unless we belong to certain credit card member, it would be $3.00 ,so of course we had been getting 1.5 liter bottle from ABC store a block away for $0.99 each. Just a suggestion, bottle water is very cheap, less than $.30 from Costco. Just put the first two bottles in frig with a note saying "complement of the hotel" It will be a refreshing welcome from your hotel after all the traveling. We got free water from lesser stars than your so I am sure you can afford to do that. It was nice of the gentleman who said "as a courtesy" took off the charges, but i am still mad because we did not use the water. Why did the housekeeping not record accurately? We only let them clean twice during our week stay, so it's not that we let them work extra hard to get even. I asked if the housekeeping turned in my 5" magnifying mirror I forgot to get from the bathroom mirror, he said no one had turned it in. If it not for the two incidents, I would rate the hotel excellent, but I will insist that they check the room while I am checking out so no more surprises big or small.

Although not beachfront we were happy with our stay here. The room, an oceanview (between the buildings in front) was spacious. It was very quiet and the king sized bed very comfortable. The shower/toilet was very small. Breakfast is basic buts it's included.

The hotel was nice and maintained well. The valet people were friendly and were quick to bring our car ($30/night). The front desk clerks were also nice and helpful when I asked several questions. Right now, the pool and breakfast area were under renovation but guests had access to another pool nearby (we did not use the pool) and the breakfast buffet was set up in the lobby. It was tight, but it was not as 'packed' as I expected from reading prior reviews. Basic breakfast (eggs, pancakes, sausage, cereal, breads, quinoa, kimchi), but it was good and tasty. We had a 1 king size room facing the mountains, not much of a view, but we were on the 15th floor and the patio was big enough for both of us to sit outside and enjoy a drink. The bed was fine, pillows were too soft for us (all the pillows were soft), everything was clean. Shower pressure was amazing!!! There was a mini-fridge, but no microwave. Good location - 2 blocks from the beach, but not in an area that's too busy or loud. Would definitely stay here again!

Staff are on the whole pleasant and helpful. We booked a room with a sea view and balcony, however, the balcony was just wide enough to stand on, not somewhere you could sit and enjoy the sea view which is just about visible between the other high rises. The decor in the room and hallways was very dated, this my husband tells me is typical for a lot of American hotels, no neutral tones and the bathrooms could do with an upgrade. We booked to have breakfast included but I would advise against this. We were told the breakfast room was being upgraded and they had a temporary breakfast room on the 2nd floor. We only opted for this on the first morning as it was like a cafeteria and not a nice place to be first thing in a morning! We were told there was also an overflow area they set up breakfast in the foyer so we opted for that the rest of our stay, finding somewhere to sit though was a bit of a problem. The breakfast itself was the same cold offering each day. Fruit, yogurt and cereal were cold options and the the only variation to the warm option was bacon and sausage on alternate days and the same with waffles and pancakes. To top it all there was no silverware we were given plastic cutlery! Not impressed with that at all! Forget the coffee! Starbucks is just around the corner.I would suggest to book room only and get breakfast locally of which there are a number of options available within walking distance.Rooms being a short walk from the beach are quiet but the air conditioning can be a little noisy on the higher settings.There was also no bottled water provided for guest use, but perhaps I am just used to hotels in Asia which have a much better customer service attitude.

The room was very clean and well maintained. The outside of the hotel needs some maintenance. No one told me the pool was under maintenance and that was one of the reasons I selected this hotel. I used the gym which was okay. The breakfast was typical for a hotel with breakfast included. You stay here for the location and the view from your Lanai. It is located near the zoo and the beach.

Was a great location, trolley tram comes down the street and there's an ABC store practically next door. The hotel is lovely, just walking into the foyer was delightful as it always smell nice with a beautiful fragrance to greet hotel guests. The staff couldn't do enough for you. The room we had was huge as we were upgraded, unfortunately the view was much to be desired but who spends all day in their room looking at the view. The rooms were very clean and always topped up with amenities and the bed was so comfy I wanted to take it home. The breakfast was plentiful and very tasty so no way you could go hungry before going out for the day. There is a laundry so we were able to wash our clothes before coming home. Within walking distance to the Zoo, only a 5 minute walk if that. Highly recommend this hotel.

This is my second stay at this property. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are comfortable. We upgraded to ocean view. The pool was being upgraded while we were there and had to use one at another hotel. It is 1 1/2 blocks to the beach and main streets.

The hotel was nice and the staff was great. However the breakfast that was advertised is not what you get. We were lead to believe it would be of higher quality and more variety. Unfortunately we were given plastic cutlery, felt like we were in a cafeteria and it was reheated pancakes and waffles depending on the day. This is was the deciding factor on why we chose this hotel and it was a disappointment. You should also not expect to have much of a balcony, you would basically just stand on it, there was no space to sit and enjoy the view. The balcony was extremely narrow and the air-conditioning unit took up half the room.

Hubby and I just stayed here for three nights, using points plus cash, as we have a Hyatt credit card. Great location - sort of at the "end" of the strip. Easy access, but away from the really busy street. Room was VERY comfortable, but not fancy. Bed and linens were fabulous. Quiet room and great housekeeping service. Breakfast which was included was mediocre, but it did solve morning hunger. Staff member were extremely accommodating, and there was also a concierge desk available. Busy hotel. Busy town. We were pleased with the hotel. Thank you.

Enjoyed our 7 night stay at the Hyatt Plaza. Room was a nice ocean view as promised and was quiet and clean. Close to the beach and transportation.Bed was comfortable and towels changed daily. Breakfast was good to start the day.

I would like to thank the entire team for an outstanding service. Special thanks to Amanda (the front desk agent). She was very sweet and courteous. She definitely knows what the customer service is all about. She went above and beyond when it came to our requests. Wow! What an amazing experience.

Large room with ocean view awesome, clean and very good bed. Coffee on the room, bathing towels were provided by the hotel, the breakfast is ok. Very friendly staff, good located in the middle of Waikiki recommendable

Being our first time to Waikiki we were uncertain of where was a good place to stay for convenience. We arrived at 6am in the morning and the hotel were great at checking us in and checking for a room that was available for immediate checkin. They stored our luggage & offered for us to change & freshen up & offered us breakfast and then text us when it was ready, we were in our room by 9am. We had a king ocean view & had mentioned it was our 25th anniversary so they put us on the top floor for view and sent a bottle of wine with a card to our room. Buffet breakfast was great, hot and cold food and always plenty there and you have a tray in your room if you want to take it back to your room. It doesnt have an actual restaurant in the hotel but they do have a small food area you can order meals & coffee from that you can eat in the bar/lounge area or room service. Its a 2min walk to the beach, 1min walk to ABC store and plenty of eating places around, we walked most places and felt very safe. The staff were very friendly & the room spacious & very clean every day. The balcony is not very big, you would fit any more than 2 and it is cosy. We would definately recommend this place to stay.

I have a 3 nights reservation with Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel but decided quite last minute to add an extra night (to arrive a day earlier). Even though they weren't able to give me the same room (very understandable), the concierge arranged so that my luggage will be transitioned to the new room (I am away on an excursion the next day).All my expectations were met (and exceeded), place is very clean and best thing is its proximity to the beach. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel!

The Hyatt Place Waikiki is a great hotel. It is not far from the beach and close to trolley stop. Also, the hotel is clean and quiet. Breakfast is included with the stay. The variety of breakfast options is small, but, is good to get the day started.
user_name:
Tracy W
Rohnert Park, United States

review_body: Had a great stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki! Staff was great, helpful and friendly. Room was neat and clean. The housekeeping staff did a great job! They were one of a few hotels that included a breakfast.

Once a year i take my family and enjoy a night or two there at this hotel. Always greated with aloha and a smile. Service is great too. They Always make sure if we need anything they be there or get it done.

Nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Awesome location—walking distance to many restaurants, stores and of course the beach because it is in Waikiki itself. Good spread for breakfast. Free waters and even got a room upgrade for being a Discoverist Hyatt member—thankful for that! The manager even left us a personal note in the room. It’s the little things you know! Only valet parking available, which is about 35$/ night so opted to park accross the street (located diagonally to the right of the front entrance of the hotel) for 20$/night with in and out privilege. We’ll definitely be back!

Overall pleasant. We live only 15 minutes away. Since it was my daughters birthday, we wanted pool access at night. Unlucky as the pool was under repair. We had to find alternate plans. They did provide access at a nearby hotel -- but taking a child at night not an option for us. staff we great
user_name:
Brian L
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We celebrated our 20th year Anniversary at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Upon our arrival (after 12 pm), we were greeted by Anabelle (front desk receptionist) and gave us early check-in with a great big King size bed (extended space corner-room with separated living room (2nd TVs and large sofa bed), large balcony with the view of Manoa Valley, Diamond Head and partial Ocean view)) from our 10 floor in the Diamond Head building. The view was spectacular and the wind/breeze felt so relax. Anabelle even sent us a bottle of chill champagne and 2 glasses to our room as a gift of our 20th year Anniversary celebration. The Room is big with spacious space, with a mini-fridge and updated/modern furniture. The bed is very comfortable and the A/C system is super quiet and cold. The safe in the closet is also very big for storage. Our room had daily cleaning by Mildred and her crews who kept the room exceptionally clean and left us daily extra bath towels and 2 daily bottle waters. The provided free daily breakfast was excellent (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, rice, miso soup, kimchee, oatmeals, pancakes/waffles, toasts, cereals, yogurt, cottage cheese, fresh cut fruits, coffees/teas/juices). The service was also great provided by Sonia who helped clear/clean our table and gave us some insight information about local favorite attraction to do. On our last day, Anabelle had arranged for late check-out at 2pm since we don’t leave to HNL airport until 5:30pm. Anabelle also arranged a Hospitality room for us. Amanda provided us a Hospitality room at 4pm to freshen up prior to leaving to HNL airport. All the staffs (Anabelle, Mildred, Sonia, Amanda, and Ted) at the Hyatt Place are so nice and provided exceptionally services. Anabelle should be employee of the month/year. We love her kindness/help and most of all - her Ohana spirit. We will definitely recommend the Hyatt Place to friends/families and will stay here again in the future. It was a great place to stay celebrating our 20th year Anniversary. Thanks for everything!

The hotel was located in very central place closer to the beach, Zoo and other attractions. Staff were excellent in attending to your queries. Very clean and tidy place. Special thanks to Dino who was friendly and helpful.

This hotel and it's staff gets my highest recommendation! My daughter and I arrived after a full day medical procedure, exhausted and hungry. The staff, especially Lei at the front desk, were exceptional! They treated us like family. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast excellent. Will look forward to staying here again very soon. Many Mahalos!

Recommend to stay at this hotel. It was very clean and staff were fantastic. We had amazing time with the staff and the location was excellent. We highly recommend this hotel for families or couples. Book now.
user_name:
Sandra Roxanne S
North Bay, Ontario

review_body: My family and I had a great time in Honolulu and part of that we atribute to Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach...great place to stay with friendly staff which looked after us so well - thanks in Special to Amira (daily looked after our room so well), Anabelle (always so friendly in the reception) and Fernando Vazquez (GM). Definately my family and I will stay with Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach again in our next Hawaiian trip!! Mahalo!!

Would highly recommend this hotel but if you want a true sea view room Hyatt have a hotel nearer to the sea front. View was just a gap between 2 other high rise buildings. Staff attitudes made up for that though. Housekeeping staff were so lovely

Past three trips I've always stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but decided I was tired of getting nickeled and dimed and also being so far from the strip, so I tried out the Hyatt Place and it was fantastic!!!!!!!!I stayed on the top floor in 2041. From my balcony, I could watch the sunrise, diamond head, and the ocean. The hotel is perfectly located just a few blocks from the strip, which made the nights very quite. The breakfast was free and very filling! Can't beat feeding my two kids for free when some mornings they eat 2 plates and other times 2 bites. Also, loved that they had computer access in the lobby for free with printing. The only option for parking is Valet, but since they don't charge a resort fee, it was a great balance!!! The best part is the front desk let my 3 yr old borrow a boogie board and I have pictures of me teaching him how. Wanted to give a special thank you to Oak in Valet and Lei in Housekeeping. They went above and beyond in making our stay so enjoyable!!!

The hotel is located on Waikiki. The rooms are very modern and clean. You have a great view of the ocean. Breakfast was wonderful. I highly recommend booking this hotel.service at the front desk was efficient . very knowledgeable about the local attractions to see. Go to dukes restaurant for the lunch buffet. It was reasonable priced.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Arriving at 07:00 I wished to leave my bags at the hotel until check in time. To my delight the gentleman at the front desk on the morning of Sunday, September 10th 2017 was able to find me a room and I was able to check in straight away. Brilliant!! The rooms were spacious and cleaned daily. The free daily breakfast was good but it was repetitive for a number of days. Location is great only 1 block or a couple of minutes walk to the beach. Only negative would be the lifts can be very slow at times. An ABC store is next door. NO resort fee!! I would be more than happy to stay again.

This hotel is located about a block from the beach. The hotel is in excellent condition and the staff went out of their way to assist in any way they could. Always got an Aloha if just passing by. It’s also a great value because it includes a very good breakfast. Never ran out of food.

Hotel was comfortable and clean. Décor is up-to-date. Bed is comfortable. Stand up shower. Rooms are small. Elevator has security for entry only to your floor and buffet floor. Ocean Views are really not a complete ocean view, but partial at upper floors. Breakfast is included which is a hot and cold buffet with, eggs, meat, potatoes, waffles, assorted breads. Also cereals, fresh fruits, yogurts, oatmeal, and Asian table. Fresh coffee, juices, and milk.
user_name:
Candy C
Tucson, Arizona, United States

review_body: There is usually something that bothers me about a hotel, rare that I would give a full 5 stars but the Hyatt Waikiki Beach gets just that!We are a family of 5 and had a lovely partial ocean view room (2 queen plus sofa bed). Great modern room with good aircon. The small balcony was wonderful to relax on for an early morning coffee before heading down to the full buffet breakfast (included in the rate). By far the best buffet breakfast we had at any hotel during our trip. A wonderful selection of cereals, cooked food, continental, fresh fruit, juices and coffee, also caters to the Asian market with rice and hot food. All staff so friendly and greet you whenever they pass you, always smiling! Big stand out is no resort fees and free buffet breakfast which is very welcome as Hawaii food is very expensive. Wonderful to get beach towels to use from the lobby. A very quick walk to the beach (was no problem for us with 3 kids and all the beach paraphernalia that comes with it). Straight across the street is the perfect family beach as there is a surf breaker which means no large waves on that part of the beach so super safe if you have kids. The main beach with good waves is just to the left and right if that's what you prefer!Location is just perfect and easy walking everywhere in Waikiki. Eateries everywhere, we highly recommend choosing the wonderful local eateries and avoid McDonald's etc which you can get anywhere! Shrimp is the local dish of choice and I never had a bad meal of it!A perfect stay at this hotel.
user_name:
Erin M
Cromwell, Otago, New Zealand

review_body: Room was clean and tidy, had a partial ocean view even though I didn't expect it which was a nice surprise. Fridge made an annoying sound when it was working which disturbed my sleep on occasion. Bed was comfortable and wifi worked well. They do not provide milk for coffee and tea so you'll need to go out a buy some. All in all we had a great stay but just a few things could have been done better like being given plastic cutlery for our cooked breakfast {difficult to cut bacon and toast) and our room was not serviced on one occasion. The hotel is just a short walk from the beach, there is an ABC store just in the next block and it's close to the main street of Waikiki and it's shops, bars and restaurants.

The staff here were very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help me. I found this to be the biggest difference compared to many hotels. I even left something in my room and the housekeeping staff immediately notified the front desk and they chased me down before I left the property to return it to me. The early check in and late check out made the stay even more pleasant.

Overall a good stay. Good size room with comfortable beds and good amenities. Included breakfast, acceptable food. Helpful and friendly staff. You can park valet or public car park across the street. Walkable to all the Waikiki key tourists spots, restaurants and stores.

We were 5 minutes from the beach. The check in we easy. We expected a room with a city view and got a partial Ocean view instead. We were surprised by the beauty. We were referred to so good local food at Rainbow drive in t hast we could walk to.

Being a category 3 Hyatt Property, this is the only Hyatt that I can use my annual free anniversary night for here in Honolulu. The Hyatt Credit Card after all, provides you with a category 4 or lower night annually. Being that this was a lower category than the other Hyatts here, I was a little concerned. But, I had nothing to worry about. As you can see from the photos I've posted, the property was in excellent condition. The rooms were clean, nicely appointed, and felt fresh and new. The room was amply sized with a desk, a sitting area, and a large king sized bed. There was a TV provided with a bevy ports for connecting your own devices. I initially arrived at the hotel at 2:45pm for check-in. There was a short line, and I was greeted by a very friendly staff. The member checking me in acknowledged my Discoverist status level and provided an upgraded room on the 15th floor with an ocean view. I was initially booked for a city view. Having a view of the Ocean was a nice touch for an 'off the strip' hotel. As I had mentioned earlier however, the walk to the beach is just a quick 5 minutes away. Parking is an issue most people have when coming to Waikiki. After some research here on Trip Advisor and some travel blogs, we discovered that the Waikiki Banyan (entrance on Kuhio Ave) offers $20/24hours of parking. If you do a Street View on Google you'll find the Waikiki Banyan Parking entrance easily on Kuhio Avenue between Paokalani and Ohua.The bed at the hotel was soft and very plush. I think for those of you that like soft beds, you'll love the bed. I prefer firmer beds, so the bed was a tad too soft for my liking. But, it was undoubtedly still quite comfortable. The air conditioner was also powerful and kept the room sufficiently cool. The complimentary breakfast buffet is a nice touch, and the hotel provides you with a tray in your room so that you can bring the food to eat in the comfort of your room. I partook of the scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, and oatmeal. Well, my wife and I shared those things. We also drank the coffee and juice provided at the buffet. Overall this was a very good stay. My wife and I plan to stay at this hotel again when we run the half marathon in April of 2018. I almost forgot to mention this - you can contact the front desk via text message. It was SO nice having the option to correspond without having to pick up the phone.

The Basics: Room is outstanding (comfortable bed, room well appointed, well maintained, hotel staff very attentive), reception group cordial and helpful same for staff in general (cannot praise Ms. Heidi, "our" receptionist, Ms. Josephine our daily room service person, enough). Breakfast buffet has plenty of good American breakfast fare to "power one up" for a day of sightseeing: eggs, bacon one day, sausage the next, juices, as well prepared as any top restaurant that you'll find. Hard to avoid seconds--which ...I did not avoid.Better Yet: My wife and I had also enjoyed just sitting on the balcony--just like the photo in the TripAdvisor section for this hotel--and watching the surf and ocean after a busy day on Waikiki Beach or going sight seeing.

Had a great holiday. The people are very friendly and the weather was just wonderful. Hotel was comfortable and reasonably priced but not central to most restaurants or shopping places. Close to the beach and bus line though.

The location of the Hyatt Place hotel was great - just off Waikiki Beach. Hotel and room were modern and clean. Room was large and very comfortable. Staff could not have been more accommodating. We felt as though they really wanted to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. I'd recommend Hyatt to anyone traveling.

Affordable hotel, rooms clean and looks fairly newly done . Building like most of Waikiki needs revamp .staff are so friendly and helpful . Block from beach close to diamond head . 50m from the pink line pick up got my vote. . Free breakfast is ok wouldn’t pay for it

Dated room but refurbished.Great location. 20 mins to the city on the trolley.Great sea view.Get Ocean view Room.Pool Bar and Terrace has great views.Tue and thurs has market stalls in the mall.Good salads and fruit and snacks.FYI night is hyatt s Luau night.

I had a recent business trip to Pearl Harbor, and decided to stay over and be a total tourist in Hawaii. Because I didn't want to change hotels, I picked one in Waikiki and accepted the 30-minute commute for my work days. The Hyatt Place was perfect. It was an interesting 5-minute walk to the beach. My balcony had a close-up view of Diamond Head, but also an ample peak at the ocean. My room was the LARGEST hotel room I've very had outside of a suite. It included a separate sitting area.and LOTS of open space. A delicious breakfast buffet was included. The food was fresh and well-prepared and appealed to several cultures with its varied offerings. The room also had a serving tray should you want to bring breakfast back from the hot buffet.Service was always with a smile and genuine "aloha" feel. The "Galllery" seemed to be the whole lobby area and allowed staff to help you at the desk,snack shop or bar, so there was rarely any waiting.A first-time experience for me was the concierege provided by Expedeia. He was knowledgeable and committed to making sure we had a great time. We booked three excursions--super tourist time for me, but EXCELLENT. Our selections did not disappoint: A great magic show, a sunset cruise--with appetiizer buffet that was ample and reduced cost from dinner cruise--and a luau. A footnote to the cruise was the two sailboats on the horizon that crossed in front of the sun just as it was dipping into the water. People captured stunning pictures.Perhaps the best part of the week was not needing a car. I am so glad I chose not to rent, Lyft was easily available, even at 5:30 a.m. when I went to work, (Uber's competitor and my personal favorite), and the excursions provided pick-up and drop-off buses. No parking fees or stress!

Hotel in a great location near to beach, restaurants answer bars. Short drive to Historic Town centre and the Arianna Memorial transfer point.Great breakfast, spacious rooms and very clean, ocean views, professional staff would return lucky enough to visit the Hawaiian Islands in the future.

Nice location, acessable to the beach and freeways. Free breakfast with room was great. It will be nice to have Domino’s there on premise will really help. Having Starbucks there was excellent also. The work out room is somewhat ok they need to add equipment that older people could use also. The parking employees are excellent and very polite and also helpful.

Extremly satisifed. Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, high tech air condition, breakfast super. The pool was abit small BUT hey, IF you are planning to use The pool when staying in Waikiki beach at The ocean, you sir have à serious problem.

Our two-week stay at Hyatt Place in Wakiki was exceptional, with friendly and energetic staff, excellent service, and wonderful food. We especially were appreciate of the young lady who provided housekeeping services to our room. She was terrific in every way.

I only have positive things to say about this place! We were greeted warmly, with cold water for refreshment. Only stayed here for one night and had an odd itinerary. Planned to leave the hotel at 5 am for a Pearl Harbor tour, then come back around 2 pm. Heidi not only accommodated a late checkout for us, but, having learned that we would miss breakfast, sent some fruit and granola bars to our room. So thoughtful! Full disclosure: I am a platinum Hyatt member, and I did get a room upgrade too because of this, but something tells me everyone would have gotten a kind, genuine hospitality experience here, even if without an upgrade. Obviously, I can't comment on the regular breakfast, but the building, the room we stayed at, and certainly, all staff members we interacted with, were great. This is a 3.5-star hotel, so it's not opulent by any means, but the hospitality it offers is beyond some stuffy experiences I had at more upscale places, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed at this fantastic hotel based on its great price. It surpassed my expectations and was even closer to Waikiki beach than I thought it would be.The rooms were large, clean and comfortable and the facilities were top notch. Highly recommend! We would definitely return.

I missed my flight leaving Oahu, so I booked a room here last minute. This is a nice, pleasant hotel with friendly staff. My room was clean and the breakfast buffet was impressive, including scrambled cage-free eggs, and it was pleasant to eat outside on the rooftop dining area. The location is good, within walking distance to the main shops in Waikiki and the zoo - but it's slightly set away from the hustle and bustle. It's not a bells-and-whistles resort, but if you need a clean, comfortable room to stay in while you explore the island or go to the beach, or for a business trip, it's perfect.
