We travelled to Honolulu for a 10 day holiday to celebrate our retirement....this was a dream location for us so I was hoping everything would be good. I chose the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach primarily for its free breakfast and no resort fee. I did not want a large resort-type hotel since we did not want to spend a lot of time in our room. The HPWB fit the bill perfectly! One block from the main strip with safe swimming at Kuhio Beach, lots of restaurants and shopping. We did a circle island tour, all-day Pearl Harbour tour, a sunset cruise, a luau, walked the length of Waikiki Beach, enjoyed beautiful sunsets every night. What struck us the most was how nice the people are at the HPWB. From cleaning staff to room attendants to the breakfast staff...so nice. A special shout out to two staff members... Angeline at the Reception desk who is a genuinely sweet girl and cares about her guests ...and Nicholas at the bar....we enjoyed our pre-dinner drinks and chats...you are a great guy! We had a fantastic holiday in Hawaii....until next time...Mahalo !

Looked up information on this hotel before we booked and was not disappointed. The staff was great from my conversation with Heidi on the phone to our first day checking in. They were so helpful. Thanks Matt and Mallie for great coustomer service. The location was close to the beach, zoo and trolley which gave us easy access to everywhere.Great location.

My husband and I have visited Oahu many times before, but this was our first time since we have had a baby (16 months old). We typically have stayed at more upscale hotels towards the Royal Hawaiian Center, but we knew we were going to need more space since we were bringing our baby (and what seemed like waaay more stuff). We both had concerns about not being right on the beach like we had in the past-but it's seriously like a 2 block walk to Kuhio Beach and so not a big deal. (Esp considering we had the little one--Kuhio was great for babies!) We had a speciality city view (2 queen) room. It was very spacious with room for a full size crib (rented from a third party. Hyatt place offers pack n plays). The mini fridge was great for milk and snacks. We had a bathtub too (which was important to us with the baby taking baths--the hotel told me not all rooms have bathtubs, which is why we picked the room we did. So if you're looking for that-I'd call them to verify before you book). The room was clean, and let me tell you--everyone was SO NICE. Yes, I know, usually everyone is nice but every single person we encountered was so sweet and helpful. (Valet, front desk, housekeeping, people that helped at breakfast, etc). Amanda (at the desk) even remembered our names - and I'm sure she encounters lots and lots of guests all the time. Free daily Breakfast was a plus. It wasn't anything that was super delicious, but it was quick, easy, and convenient, and definitely not bad! We typically do light breakfast and then save up for lunch/dinner--so this was perfect for us. (Eggs, potatoes, biscuits/gravy, etc rotated with the standard toasts, cereal, fruit, yogurt, rice and also miso soup). Only complaint would be location. It's located really close to Kapahulu and we felt like we were needing to walk at least 1/2 mile to go places we liked to usually go to. (Think more midway down kalakaua. But really, we ate enough a little walking wasn't going hurt us. Plus, you're walking around HAWAII.) so we would definitely stay here again with a child. It was perfect for our family!

The Hyatt Place is around 150m from the beach and I really enjoyed my stay. The room was exceptionally clean and well presented and the housekeeper, Leonida was so friendly and caring.The bar/restaurant was a little restricted in menu with mainly snack-type food but my word, it was superb!!! Heaps of alternative eateries and watering holes within a short walk so don't take those remarks as a negative. In this area, Heidi and Maile were brilliant and I really enjoyed our lengthy chats.The pool was fairly small but enjoyable and with the famed beach so close, not a drawback.A good breakfast was part of the tariff.I certainly commend this hotel to you.

Amazing hotel. Great location, friendly staff, delicious breakfast, great rooms, not pricey. The check-in was fast. We even got cold water bottles for refreshment. Pleasant fragrance in a spacious lobby, clean and new room. We felt very appreciated. The breakfast has a very good choice of food. We enjoyed our stay. Our every wish was granted. Thank you, Hyatt Place Waikiki!

Very attentive hotel staff, porters and management. Housekeeping kept rooms clean. They had a good breakfast. Close to beach and shopping. It was a great experience for our first time in Hawaii. I would highly recommend staying there!

The hotel's staff provided exceptional service during our stay for a family wedding. Housekeeping was attentive and accommodating with our needs given that we were traveling with 2 kids under the age of five. We took our vehicle in and out of valet multiple times daily and the bellmen were expeditious, courteous and helpful with suggestions for the fastest routes. The hotel even provided complimentary bottles of champagne in honor of the wedding (which was held at another venue). Given the property's close proximity to the beach, the zoo and great local restaurants like Rainbow Drive In, this was the ideal location for our trip. Their fantastic service was the icing on the (wedding) cake!!

Stayed here for 2 nights in an ocean view kingsize room. Room was clean and bed very comfortable. Pool very disappointing and breaksfast as much as its complimentary isnt upto scratch peoplea food been attacked by birds an pooped on. Staff aren't very attentive or welcoming and this was the major let down for me. For as much as you are paying you feel like an inconvenience to them. Wont be returning here again

was kinda noise at night a lot of traffic never wait for the last minute elevators very slow at times they have 2 shifts to cleaning the room a couple of times came back to room around 2:00pm room wasn't clean yet. We Loved our breakfast every morning!

Great stay and very near everything Waikiki! The hotel pool is small but accommodating if you are there to just relax awhile from the ocean. Beds are comfortable and the shower pressure is great. I like the house keeping

First time to Hawaii, beautiful place, We had something on my list that we did every day. Rode around the Island and went to the pineapple plantation.Saw Pearl harbor.Laid out on the beach, and did some snorkeling.

Originally we booked one king bed with the city view. Lei upgraded us into two beds with a little sights of the ocean. She was very kind and helpful. Thanks to her we had a very nice vacation. Also, Shena keeps our room clean. Thanks for it. A very nice experience!

Great staff and clean place to stay. The food is pretty good, as well. The location is only two blocks from the infamous Waikiki Beach and Tiki's restaurant. The pool is nothing to really take a look at, as it is way too small and not a place you really want to lay out at. The breakfast buffet is really good. I would give this a 5 star rating if the location was in the heart of the shipping district, but this lazy butt didn't feel like walking 1/2 mile to most everything. Great place to stay, though.

This is a great place to stay with family. The room is large than average with great location being close to the beach ans the zoo. The cost is affordable with breakfast indeed a big plus. We arrived at 7.00 am after a long flight from Sydney. The staff at the front desk was so helpful to give us a room immediately though our room was not ready. Her name is Anabelle Gyotoku. For that we were very greatful, as the kids were very tired. It would not be a good start of the holiday if we had to hang around for a few hours. By the way, wifi is fast and realiable. We all rated it very highly!

Located only a block from beach with not much of a view. Other than the view, the location is great! No Resort Fees and the included Breakfast Buffet is actually good (But watch out for the Birds).The Beds ... an A+ for comfort.

We put a lot of research into getting the best value for money on accommodation (as first timers to Waikiki). Pleased to say Hyatt Place met the expectation. Location, cleanliness of the room, staff (esp mention to Nate on the concierge who's actually an Expedia employee). Breakfast was really good spread of hot & cold, with variations each day. Nice to see the place has had money spent on appearance. 3 mins walk to the best part of Waikiki beach. Also our favourite bar Tikis is right on the corner poised to capture the magic sunsets. No hesitation coming back.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Hotel for 5 days before our cruise. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms have been recently renovated and the cleanliness is of a very high standard. Breakfast was included which you could have sitting by the pool or they have a tray in your room in case you want to grab something to take back to your room. The swimming pool was quite small and there were only a few deck chairs but not a problem as we were so close to the beach. The fitness centre was really good. Plenty of workout equipment to choose from. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Seeing the cheap prices online kind of scared me at first, but once I entered the property, I was blown away.Service amazing , food amazing , upgraded due to Hyatt member perfect!Usually all the hotels are expensive with roaches, didn't see one. Lots of towels,Great view of diamond Head, 2 blocks from the beach, here was nothing i could've asked for to.make it better (maybe free parking )Will.return, I love Hyatt!

Very pleased with my stay. Very good room with a partial ocean view. Breakfast was excellent and included at no charge. Great value for a reasonable price, and a great location, - only a short walk to Waikiki's swimming, snorkeling, surfing beaches.

Very nice stay Concierge staff ready to assit. Centrally located Breakfast always welcome as an inclusion. Walking distance to major attractions and close to the Zoo. 5 blocks to major shopping areas close to the Cheescake shop and close to our favourite store for top quality goods ROSS, always go home with an extra suitcase or 2.

The staff was welcoming and very efficient. The room was clean and comfortable. Why the three stars? Our room faced west, the blinds were open when we got to the room. So, the room was hot. The a/c thermostat was "adjusted" so it would not go below 69 degrees. The room finally cooled off about midnight.

Great standard hotel - most comfortable bed i have slept in since my own - would recommend. Close to the beach. Good selection of food at buffet breakfast. Great assistance at check in. Good to have Expedia rep in lobby who organised a few tours for us.

In the last week of August, we were in Hawaii to spend our 6th anniversary and we spent the first 2 days in Honolulu. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Waikiki beach, the Zoo and a variety of dining options. And we are super happy with our choice!We had a rental car; and the staff were very open to recommend the parking building diagonally opposite to the hotel as the parking fare is cheaper ($20 per 24 hours) compared to the Valet parking (the only option - $37 per night). We had initially booked for a Sea view room; when we were shown the room but when I noticed that it didn't have the bath tub (as we had a 4 year old), the front desk staff was extremely cooperative and caring to change us to another room, with sea view and a great bath tub! (THANKS guys!) The room was super clean, had a great balcony and amenities. Housekeeping staff were great too! On the breakfast: we didn't have great expectations; but to our pleasant surprise, the breakfast buffet had a lot of variety for both vegetarian and non vegetarian ; and had kid-friendly choices (pancake / waffles) too :) There were a number of dining options; for extra water for our day trips (it was summer), there is an ABC store a block away from the hotel. On the whole, it was a great stay which gave us a great memories! Thanks a bunch to the great staff!!

If you're looking for a luxury hotel that goes all out with amenities and is located in the heart of everything this isn't the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for a clean, decent hotel that provides all the necessities, then go for the Hyatt Place Waikiki! This hotel is a block from the beach and located at the end of the Waikiki hotel/shopping/restaurant strip- so you have easy access to everything by walking a bit. It has a pool, though it's a small, no frills area with a handful of lounge chairs. It offers free breakfast daily and again, no frills, but fine (eggs, cereal, pancakes, yogurt, fruit, coffee, etc.). There is a Starbucks and a bar in the lobby and computers. Free wifi. Parking is $32 a day valet, but there is a public self parking garage across the street (more like directly diagonally from Hyatt Place's main entrance) that you can park in for $20 a day. So all in all this hotel provides you with the necessities with a pretty good location for a very reasonable price.

Stayed for a week in August. Felt overcrowded - elevator waiting time was sometimes even 5 minutes! Nice rooms, a bit too loud. Very good location, 5 minutes walk to the beach. We parked at huge Waikiki Banyan Parking just across the street for only $80 a week (instead of $32/day at Hyatt)!

We use Hyatt Place all the time. I love the free breakfast buffet. 24 hr bar/food in the lobby floor. Great staff! To me it's prime location to all the local eatery. Open air lobby. The local bus system is right next to the hotel and if you do any activities the pick up spots are with in the radius of the hotel.

My Name Faizal and I just took a trip to Hawaii with a family member. I have been to Hawaii several times but by far, this is the best hotel in Waikiki. The rooms are extremely clean and up to date. The staff provide superb service and are extremely welcoming. They frequently asked me if I was enjoying my stay and I could see that their requests were made with sincerity. If there was a problem, which was rare, they were very quick to fix it. The hotel it self is on a quiet beautiful street which is a block away from the best beach and away from the hustle and bustle of the strip at the beginning. My expectation of the continental breakfast were low. To my pleasant surprise, it was like eating in a 5 star buffet. There were pancakes, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, waffles, french toast, quinoa and wonderful fruits like pine apple and melons. And the staff at the breakfast are so lovely and pleasant. The housekeeping staff were also top notch.We were initially greeted by Cole at the front desk and man is he awesome. He was kind, caring and sincere. I cannot say enough about himA very special mention goes out to the manager, Jose Fernandez. He took every opportunity to get to know both myself and my sister. I could tell that he wanted to make our experience a memorable one. The funny thing is that his sincerity is so ingrained in his personality, I suspect that he did this for all the guests. I would highly recommend this hotel over any other in the strip, especially the Sheraton. The Sheraton is like going to stay in Vegas, impersonal and cold. I truly felt appreciated and welcomed at Hyatt PlaceTo Summarize:Service: 5 out of 5Hotel Cleanliness: 5 out of 5Location: 5 out of 5Breakfast food: 5 out of 5Please please do not change the way you conduct your business as I look forward to visiting this hotel for years to comeGod BlessFaizal A.

We came to Hawaii to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. From check in to check out we had a very good stay. Check in was a breeze. Our guy was friendly and helpful. We asked about places to go eat. He told us about a few places. Our valet guys were fast and friendly. Our housekeeper,Justine, was an amazing cleaner. We were on the 18 th floor. She was very friendly and accommodating! Never needed a thing! She kept everthing clean and plenty of toiletries. Check out was nice and easy as well. Thank you. Our first stay in Hawaii was wonderful!

start to finish no negatives have read other reviews and cannot understand some of the negative comments. one must expect lifts to be busy at the prime time of day or night,FREE breakfast more than adequate plenty of options. Location very good, room view very good must remember one block from beach.

We had a wonderful time staying at the Hyatt place Waikiki Beach. Breakfast was wonderful. Room was very comfortable and spacious. Location of the hotel is very good, it is 2 blocks away from the beach, lots of restaurants close by, bus stop close by.

Our stay at the Hyatt Place was very lovely. All the staff were very friendly no matter where you ran into them they never forget to say aloha. The front desk agent, Lei was the one who helped us check in and upgraded us to a "half ocean/half city view." However, the ocean view is blocked by surrounding buildings (I wouldn't recommend paying extra for an ocean view room as Hyatt Place is blocked by tall buildings). The room itself was very nice and clean. The room had a balcony, fridge, and a couch. The hotel also offered a complimentary breakfast buffet which was okay, nothing special. The breakfast buffet usually had your usual eggs, bacon, toast, cereal, etc. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from Waikiki strip, beach, and the zoo. There are many restaurants in the vicinity. Lastly, the hotel does NOT offer parking other than valet which is quite pricey - $32 a day with in & out privileges. The men who work at the valet are also very friendly. We recommend parking at the Banyan which is a 2 minute walk from Hyatt Place. They have a weekly rate for $80 or $20 for 24 hours. Overall we would recommend Hyatt Place if you aren't looking for anything luxurious as it was a very pleasant stay.

Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in August with my family including a toddler. The service at the hotel was fantastic at all times. From check in to room service and check out, I cannot commend the hotel enough on the professionalism of their staff.The rooms were clean and well maintained. We stayed in the specialty city view and were very happy with the size of them. One of our rooms did have a much better view than the other. The other actually didn't really have much of a view at all other than the pool.The hotel pool definitely looks a lot nicer in the photos. It is quite small and does need some major work to make it look more appealing to the guest, especially in Hawaii.The breakfast was very disappointing. It was almost the same thing everyday and not appealing at all. Pretty much what you would have at home when you are in a rush to head out to work or get the kids ready for school. The boiled egg was really cold, which wasn't at all pleasant.

Overall a wonderful vacation for my sister and I and our families. My niece was married while we were there and they did a beautiful job. The weather was perfect and the people we talked to and worked with were amazingly friendly and helpful. Out of 9 of us, NONE of us wanted to leave.....

The hotel rooms were a little small and the hotel was a little on the dated side but over all comfortable stay and the breakfast was really good. Staff is also helpful when we needed them. We did like that it was on the edge of town which made it a little bit easier to get out without having to go through Waikiki which can take a while.

We loved this hotel as we had a nice relaxing break here on the way back to the UK after a rather hectic holiday in Oz. Lovely rooms breakfast was ok I would recommend having it downstairs in the lobby after nearly being dropped on by birds on the pool floor where the main breakfast bar is. But apart from that great hotel staff were great getting us into our rooms early as we arrived at the hotel at about 0700, highly recommend great location short walk to the beach.

The staff at the Hyatt Place are superb. They are all super friendly and nice. The rooms are very clean and they make every effort to keep the hotel clean, looking fresh, and new as possible. I saw workers repaint the bathroom doors on the ground floor during my stay. Also, they changed the A/C filter in my room and carpet cleaned the hallways while I was there. We didn't have to worry about breakfast every morning as they offer a continental breakfast. They have an outdoor pool on the 3rd floor (it's not very large), a 24 hr gym with weights and exercise machines, and coin operated washers and dryers for $3 each. All this without an additional fee like surrounding hotels is great. The best part is that they're located less than 2 blocks from the beach and only a 4 minute walk to the Honolulu zoo. Lastly, they're located across the street from the public bus, so getting around Waikiki and Honolulu is pretty easy by public bus.

Good and helpfull service. When we arrived we where welcomed with a smile and flowers. Nice room (we where upgraded to a bigger room that included a sofa), little pool on the 3rd floor of the hotel, 3-5 minuts walk to the beach, close to food, shopping and busses.

Anabelle at the front desk was our first impression and she knocked it out of the ballpark! It was my daughters 21st birthday and she made it special. Our room was amazing. Our room attendant Josephine was so attentive and sweet. The manager Fernando checked to be sure our stay was fine. Great location too!

My new husband and I had a wonderful stay here for our honeymoon vacation. The room was spacious, comfortable, clean and cool. We slept well, except for the first night, I had to get used to the city buses passing through on the street under our room, we were on the 11th floor. But after that I had gotten used to it, and was able to get good rest. It was near everything, we walked anywhere we needed to in Waikiki, and also had a rental car for longer trips. Valet was nice, but we were told to call ahead 15 min. before needing the car, so that they may work through heavy traffic of requests that could come at once. The one day we had a time constraint, we followed those instructions of calling ahead, and when we got down to the lobby, there was no car, and the valet acted as if he never knew of our request, and it wasn't in process. So we had to wait another 10-15 min and we were almost late for our appointment. There may have been lack of communication between staff members. But other than that, we had a good stay.

Great and convenient location. Should have more facilities and a clubhouse for VIP guests. The swimming pool is too small and not very impressive for a Hyatt Hotel. But overall a very good hotel and great value for hotel in Waikiki Beach area.
user_name:
Francis T
Culver City, United States

review_body: I had a wonderful experience at Hyatt Place. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Nice to have coffee and a cocktail bar inside the hotel. Easy walk to beach, restaurants, parks and even Diamond Head if you are adventurous! I ran from the hotel to the top and back one morning.

Hotel is located near the famous Waikiki beach at reasonable rates. We want to highlight the friendly and helpful staff. In our opinion this makes the difference between an OK summer hotel and a great vacation hotel. Rooms are spacious, clean and beautiful. The breakfast buffet was healthy and tasty. I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.

We stayed here for a week, it was great. Service was fantastic. The included breakfast was good for what it is, no complaints. Bed was very comfortable and room very clean, made good use of the balcony also. Location is fantastic, beach only a couple of blocks and bus in front. Just out of the hustle and bustle so it's quite but close enough to have a great time. We would definitely stay again.

Stayed here for 7 nights with 2 families, called a week before to ask for rooms near each other and the hotel accommodated us with two rooms next to each other. Flying in from Australia we arrived at 8am and the hotel gave us one room ready to use which was great after a long flight. We had a lovely big corner disabled room with separate lounge area, the room was so spacious and we had plenty of areas for all the things we brought for our 6 month old. The rooms are always immaculate and clean. Hotel breakfast has great variety every day. Lots of seats too. The pool was good for the kids with lots of lounges, if they had a bar there for the adults that would have been a bonus. Food and drinks in the hotel does were yummy, we tried the tacos and pork sliders. Hotel staff were very pleasant and friendly. Very short walk to the beach. My only thing I didn't particularly like was the noise of the road facing the city. Highly recommend for families.

Great location; updated and modern facility; super clean rooms; professional, service oriented staff; incredible courtesy breakfast facility with extensive selections and with a sizeable staff to maintain quality and cleanliness. Our stay was a super value for the dollar.
user_name:
Randy P
Mill Creek, WA, United States

review_body: This was a great hotel, close to the beach with free breakfast which was excellent. Also, no resort fee at this hotel. The room was very comfortable and quiet. Free beach towels and everything we needed. They even had a laundry we used which was great. Our room attendant Julie took such good care of us. She even arranged a free bottle of champagne and a card when she found out it was our honeymoon :-)We would definitely recommend this hotel for those wanting to be close to everything but not pay a fortune. Thank you Hyatt Place for a great holiday.

Excellent value for the money. Spotless room with great amenities. Nice buffet with a good variety of food choices. The option to take your food back to your room is also very convenient. Friendly helpful staff. Free internet and best of all... no resort fees!!!I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone., especially families. The hotel is close to the beach. Towels are provided. Overall the location is central to all of the activities available in Waikiki. I would wholeheartedly recommend Hyatt Place. It was fabulous. Next time I will forgo the pricier options and stay here!

This hotel is conveniently located within a block of Waikiki, right on the local bus line, a block from the Honolulu zoo, and among as much shopping and fast food as anyone needs. Staff bends over backwards with courtesy and service. It was a pleasure to tip them. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, immaculate, and quiet. Relax at the pool or work out in their spacious fitness center. And this is one of the few places on Waikiki that offer a complimentary hot breakfast. The only extra daily cost was parking. Cannot expect free parking on Waikiki.

We spent five nights at this hotel and really enjoyed our time there. It's very close to Waikiki Beach and not far from Diamond Head. It's a bus ride away from Ala Moana and a walk away from lots of shops and restaurants. There's even an ABC store just about next door!! The bus comes past the door. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was on the 18th floor and it was spacious, very clean and tidy and looked like it had been recently refurbished. Breakfast was included which was adequate, had lots of choice and plentiful. Would definitely recommend.

Friendly staff, clean hotel. A little far from the shopping, International Marketplace and Royal Hawaiian shopping center but great location if there's an event at the zoo or kapiolani park. The hotel is a walk through a non busy street so not too safe for a single woman or teen to be walking around by themselves.

A quick stroll to Waikiki Beach, lots of shops, eating choices and bars nearby; combined with clean updated decor, thoughtful inclusions like earplugs and in-room tea/coffee facilities, ocean views and security made this a great choice for us.

The hotel is relatively new, so some taxi and uber driver are not familiar with the name. It is 5 mins walk to waikiki beach, a very convenient location. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed the fact that they have both western and asian cuisine for breakfast.The room is a bit small, not really much of a view. But it's really clean and tidy. I really had a good quality sleep during my stay. No complains from my side. Definitely a great place to be if you are planning to stay nearby waikiki area.

Close walk to beach, convenient to a lot of restaurants, great breakfast, well-maintained rooms and extremely attentive staff! Only one front-desk member was a little rude. Jovelita who was part of housekeeping did an exceptional job. Pillows too soft and carpet a bit worn, otherwise, no cons. Nothing else needed for a good vacation.

Central location,few minutes walk to public beach & Waikiki, International Marketplace, Cheesecake Factory, close to shopping malls & transportation (Waikiki Trolley & pickup points for tour buses). Hotel staff courteous, helpful and efficient. Breakfast provided . Good internet/wifi connection

Excellent buffet breakfast, free wifi, outstanding customer service. Close to beach, restaurants and shopping. Staff goes out of the way to take care of the guests, make you feel like a VIP. Allowed extended stay without hesitation. Best hotel experience overall.

Beautiful facility! Only a short walk to beach, zoo, aquarium, Diamond Head Luau, restaurants, shopping. freeBreakfast buffet with a large variety of breakfast foods and lots of tables. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. An added bonus is the large safe to keep your valuables.

Hyatt Place was a fantastic affordable alternative to some of the other hotels in Waikiki. Breakfast included was a great way to start each day and, given it is at the end of the beach where there a no hotels right on the beach, wandering to the beach for some R&R was very easy. The staff were fantastic, friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. A short walk to all the restaurants made dining out each. Would recommend and stay again

Wonderful location. The breakfast was a plus. Short walk to Waikiki Beach just a block away. Staff very welcoming Very clean hotel comfortable beds too Pet friendly. Wow next time brining my doggy. Thank you for a great stay Hyatt

great place and close to Waikiki beach , breakfast include.has pool on the 3rd floor . Coffee is great . Nice view and high speed internet. good hotel for stay if you want to enjoy whole days on Waikiki beach . walking 5 mins to the beach

We changed our destination from Cabo to Hawaii due to a storm coming. We have to fly standby. Since we were originally staying at a Hyatt in Cabo, we booked 3 nights at Hyatt Place in Hawaii to test it out before committing to our 8 night stay. Thought it was nice to keep it in the Hyatt family. We had to change our arrival to 9/3 from 9/2 due to flight/transportation issues. Things are tough now in Texas so we had to change some things, but we have been looking forward to this vacation for some time so are scrambling to put something together still. I started the online change to a 9/3 arrival just before 5pm my time (12pm Hyatt time), but being at work I was interrupted. When I went back at 5:25pm, the page refreshed and told me I'd be charged $204 for violating the cancellation penalty. I tried reaching out, but they would not budge. Really? You'd rather lose a definite 2 night stay, potential 7 night stay and 2 happy guests so that you can keep a 1 night cancellation penalty? If you need the money that bad, you can keep it. We will be looking elsewhere, both for this trip and future ones! Shame on you Hyatt!

I love the location of this hotel, in Waikiki but at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki so it's more serene and quiet but still walking distance to restaurants and shops.... And when time to hit the ocean, you can choose which beach you prefer....go left and go to the quiet empty Kuhio Beach.... or go right and hit Waikiki Beach that's way more crowded but not in a bad way.... Best Sunsets ever! I love to have a Mai Thai followed by swimming during the gorgeous sunset ...it's the most relaxing experience.....

4 stars more like 1 star being generous. staff are great but facilities old boring and just feels cheap. nothing special. pay more and choose another hotel.if you have a baby and need a highchair just so you know they only got one which they share between two floors .

Nice enough hotel, well located near the beach, restaurants, shops etc. Rooms nicely appointed, however our air-conditioning was very noisy and not consistent. We ended up turning it off before going to bed, not using the bed covers and then turning it on again in the morning. The lifts in our building were not at all reliable in the morning. We often needed to use the stairs to get to breakfast, 5 flights of stairs down then up when finished. Overall just an OK stay made better by very pleasant and helpful staff.

When we booked, we were concerned it was far from the beach and main strip, but it's close to the beach and everything! Great spot just outside the big hustle and bustle. Excellent beds! Our King bed was the comfiest bed I've stayed in, and the pillows were good, so that was a big plus. Breakfast was awesome too, they have everything you need. Coffee is very average, but that's the norm for the USA when comparing to Australia, but lots of good food. Worst thing is the very strange housekeeping times. We retuned twice to our room not done at 6pm, which is not good after a big humid day out. After ringing down, we were brought fresh towels straight away, and room made up, but they apparently have schedules. I'd recommend more cleaners if that's the case as I've never experienced this before. The lifts took ages too, but expected given the size of the hotel. Only ever 2 tea bags in the room and it's decaf. Sought more and was brought up more decaf so they only had decaf and earl grey, so take some from breakfast if you want a normal English breakfast tea in your room! Aside from those few things, the front desk service was excellent! They brought around free bottles of water if you waited a tiny bit to check in or out. Those little things matter. Definitely stay again as it's value for money and overall a good hotel with comfortable beds!

Our room defined as a 'partial ocean view' was very spacious with a functional wardrobe and drawers. Very well located across the road from Waikiki Beach. The highlight was the outstanding service of the pool staff especially from Robert and Barbara. Only negatives:often long queues at reception due to not enough staff on dutylong wait for lifts which I think may have been due to maintenance

Stayed here for 4 nights with my girlfriend celebrating our 10 year anniversary. Booked our vacation package through Costco. Two key points why I booked our stay at the Hyatt Place. No resort fees and complimentary breakfast buffet offered everyday.ROOM - Arrived at noon and our room was available right away. Jade checked us in pretty quick and answered all of our questions. We stayed in a standard size room with a comfy king-bed on the ninth floor. Some extras included are a mini refrigerator, coffee maker, safe, and a love seat w/ottoman. The room is a bit on the smaller side, so next time, I will opt for a larger size room. There are two chairs and a small table provided on the balcony. We mainly used it for drying our wet swim gear after coming back from the beach. Not sure if the towels were brand new but they were very linty upon using them. We didn't see housekeeping on the second day there until the late afternoon around 5:30. I saw her in the hallway and since it was almost evening and we wanted to rest for a couple of hours before heading back out, I just asked for a couple of fresh towels and mentioned that she could just come back the next day while we were out.HOTEL GROUNDS - Pool is small, but you come to Hawaii to go to the beach and not the pool so that didn't bother us. There is a lounge/waiting area next to the check-in counter, dining area, an espresso/cocktail bar, business center w/computers, and two gift shops where you could purchase souvenirs. Free Wi-Fi for hotel guests. Complimentary breakfast provided every morning from 6:30 am to 9:30 am on the first and third floor levels of the hotel. It is buffet style. I noticed some of the food items were different each day so that was nice having a variety of options. We really enjoyed this perk before starting our day on a full stomach. LOCATION - We loved that the hotel was only two blocks away from Waikiki Beach and pretty much walking distance to shopping, restaurants and of course ABC stores! The ABC store is on the next block so on the first day we arrived, I went and bought snacks, bottled water and other necessities that we needed for our stay. We booked a couple of tours so we were either picked up curbside in front of our hotel or across the street at the Marriott. The hotel is also located along a bus route if you choose that mode of transportation. We didn't rent a car so we didn't use valet, but I noticed it was $18/day to park. We used Uber and Lyft a lot as well. It's also located on the last block on the strip right before the Honolulu Zoo so it's not as hectic as far as crowds so that was nice.Overall, we had an amazing trip! Hotel staff was great and helpful. If you head down to the beach, you can ask the front desk for towels to borrow if you don't have any of your own. Like I said, the daily complimentary breakfast and no resort fees are a big plus if you're on a budget and want to stay in a nice and clean hotel.

Very professional staff, friendly and respectful. At the front desk Lei was handling our check out , same at check out when we were leaving. She provided all the information we need during the stay, and was helpful any time we need it.

My points were not honored just because it was booked thru Expedia. It should be since that I had selected Hyatt. It was NOT Expedia who selected it for me. Again, My points were not honored just because it was booked thru Expedia. It should be since that I had selected Hyatt. It was NOT Expedia who selected it for me.

Great hotel, Lei was very helpful checking us in which we very much appreciated. Good Location, clean and comfortable. Stayed here for 2 nights 26-27th August on our way to the North Shore of Oahu. Will stay again, Thank you

This hotel is located close to Waikiki Beach while not right on the beach. this helps with cost. Staff was VERY friendly and helpful. after our first day they would recognize us as guests and reacted in a way that made you feel more like family. Always greeted with a smile. Breakfast was included in our stay and was always good with variety. Serving time was perfect. Café near front desk had great staff and wonderful food as well. The only concern I would mention is the noise level. while the noise was not in excess to keep us from sleep or hindering relaxation, it was louder than other hotels we have stayed at. There was a group of younger people staying next to us for a portion of out stay that were really enjoying themselves resulting in the noise. We were next to the pool a few floors up and could also hear the noise from there, which is expected. Please note this noise level was not to a complain level but only negative I can note about this place.They have an Expedia Expert on site that was amazing! Anything we needed he helped with. We tried to rent a car on our own and every place told us they were booked solid. He was able to get a car for the next day and at a good price.

The check-in process went very smoothly. My party arrived a little early but the rooms were available for immediate occupancy. The customer service was friendly and efficient, as well as helpful in suggesting places to see, activities to participate in, providing information of the local transportation system, and places to eat.

The hotel was located a short walk from the beach - not quite the 'main' Waikiki beach, but close to the sheltered part of the beach which was great for families. The room was clean and well sized. We didn't spend much time in the room itself aside from sleeping, but it was a great place to come 'home' to. The staff were very helpful and friendly. There is free wifi and a free breakfast (slightly limited on the healthy options for us health nuts, but probably standard 'American' breakfast style - if you like waffles and pancakes you're fine!). Also, free beach towels which was great!There is a pool, but it is relatively small and we didn't end up using it as it was a little 'tired'. Overall a great stay though - and a big thank you to the friendly staff.

My family and I recently stayed at this hotel while visiting Hawaii. It's ideal in many ways: 1) close to airport (about 45 minutes with heavy traffic), 2) close to the beach (about 7 minute walk to the ocean, very easy walk), 3) beautiful balconies and views of the ocean, and nearby Diamond Head, 4) great breakfast, 5) exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. We're ready to go back!

We stayed at Hyatt Place for 4 nights and were really impressed with this hotel. As we arrived into Honolulu early morning, we were unable to check into our room until 3pm. However, by 2pm we thought we'd check to see if by chance it was available. Not only was there a room available, but we were upgraded into one of the larger rooms in the hotel. The room was immaculately clean and spacious and the bed was comfortable. One of the reasons for staying in at Hyatt Place was that breakfast was included. I have to say, this is one of the best hotel breakfast offerings I've experienced to date. The buffet style breakfast is served next to the pool area and has a wide variety of hot and cold foods. I liked that there was a choice of healthy options to choose from which is sometimes overlooked by some establishments. Hot item choices looked to be rotated on a 3 day cycle.The swimming pool area was perhaps a little small given the size of the hotel however we didn't have any problems getting sun loungers. We found that in order to grab those extra few hours of sun in the late afternoon, we had to physically move the sun loungers to the far side of the pool as the light is blocked by the hotel building. I also had the chance to use the gym facilities which were also impressive with a larger than expected room to cater for possibly up to 5 people.The hotel is situated slightly outside of central Waikiki however is only a few minutes walk to the beach and about 15 minutes to the central hub of restaurants and bars. Overall we couldn't be more impressed with this hotel and would definitely stay again if we return.

Breakfast is served in the lobby and 3rd floor. Lobby is basic fare, less crowded. 3rd floor is a feast, with great selection plus Asian/vegan choices. I especially appreciated the gluten free bread. We had a nice view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. Great location. I loved this end of the beach, less big hotels, mre kid-friendly.

Been travelling to HNL since 1996. Without a doubt the best place I have stayed. Breakfast on weekends, room cleanliness, room size and staff friendliness made it a nice stay. Had some elevator issues but the rest made up for that.

We stayed at Hyatt Place for 2 weeks and thought it was a great hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. Julie with Housekeeping on the 5th floor was amazing. She remembered our names, asked if we needed anything several times and treated us very nice. Enjoyed daily Breakfast and the location was perfect. Easy to walk almost any attraction or Trolley stop needed. Thank you!

We really enjoyed our stay here for a very good price. Of course this isn't an upscale resort, but you aren't paying upscale resort prices either. This place is very reasonable along being VERY CLOSE to the beach! The staff is extremely friendly and courteous. And the breakfast was AWESOME!

if you looking for a quiet hotel with a great breakfast in Waikiki, this is THE hotel. Frindly staff with perfect location (for us) in Waikiki. Near to the Zoo and just 2 Block to the Beach. Your out of the city in about 2 minutes if you do some Excursion by car.

Perfect location. Walking distance to Kuhio Beach. Friendly staff. Good breakfast. Clean rooms. Try to get anything above 2nd floor for city view if you can. You get towel to the beach at the front desk.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was a very good place to stay for me and my family. Its location is superb, just about a hundred yards from the beach. Rooms were very nice, spacious and breezy. Staff was top notch! Breakfast and breakfast area outside offered a very cool and urban vibe. We had pre booked at The Embassy Suites, so we couldn't stay more than three days, but really regretted not beeing able to stay at Hyatt Place for the entire trip to Honolulu.

We stayed here for our honeymoon for 10 days. The location is fantastic, don't be fooled by the fact it's at the "end" of Waikiki beach - we found it super easy to access everything, and a lot of the tours etc all left from the hotel directly across the street, so we barely had to walk very far! The staff are really good, and the bed was SO COMFORTABLE, we loved it. The decor in the hotel needs a bit of an update in some areas, but that said, we thoroughly enjoyed our time here and will most definitely be back one day.

A wonderful hotel with fantastic, friendly staff. Location is great and so is the condition of the hotel and the service. Breakfast is a little limited so this needs to be improved. Other than that, we loved our stay.

So we stayed at Hyatt Place for 9 nights and we are actually about to check out. I have truly enjoyed our stay and I am sad to go. From the start our stay has been great. We were greeted by Heidi who was amazing and gave us great tips and recommendations and she even sent a bottle of wine to our room for my moms birthday. The hotel staff in general were very attentive and always willing to help which I found to be reflective of the aloha spirit. The hotel offers free breakfast but I recommend getting there as early as possible. The hotel is situated in a great location as well. It's off the main strip and nearby there are bus routes that will take you to diamond head, ala moana mall and many other places. On Fridays the hotel offers a complimentary lai making class which was fun. As for the room, we had a speciality room and it was very spacious with a great view of diamond head. There are also a lot of great food options up Kapahula Ave. I will most definitely be returning to Hyatt Place, my home away from home.
user_name:
Tyler2020
New York City, New York

review_body: don't pick your room from a picture on internet. Be very careful my room was small and the bathroom I needed to get in the tub to close bathroom door and I had a special 2 queen bed room. Will never go back to a Hyatt.

Good pick to stay.Breakfast in reception area and on leave 3 on the 3 Rs floor try and stay away from the right hand side of the pool with tables and chairs the wind comes through there.If you like eating in a wind tunnel Plenty of food for all.Good Wifi Bed was so comfortable. Pillows were goodAnd plenty. Not looking forward to going home my bed .Pink bus pick up just 3min walk up the road 5 min walk to beach . Starbucks x 2 in the Marriott across the road. We stayed on the 12 floor views were great Will come back again staff is friendly and professional.

2nd time staying at this property and did not disappointalways a pleasureexcellent daily breakfast and kitchen staffwalking distance to the beach,shopping, and public transportation.Even better if your a Hyatt Gold Platinum member.

Their staff is friendly and they are helpful. Good location, close proximity to the beach and the walk to the Waikiki beach shopping center isn't too long. Free breakfast and free wifi is always a good thing.They did however forgot to give us the complementary bottle we were supposed to get. However I guess I could let it go because they were so helpful to us on our first trip to Hawaii

This is a fantastic hotel Such good value in great spot Easy walk to beach and lots of restaurants Trolley stop practically out the front a bonus as well Really lovely rooms spotless clean ( Thankyou Josephine) Super friendly and helpful staff And if that's not enough Breakfast is included and no resort fee What's not too love

Thoroughly enjoyed the stay, room was neat tidy and well maintained, staff were excellent. Breakfast included in room rate was basic but nice enough but needed more options. Hotel well located outside centre of Waikiki near Zoo but only 100 metres to beach and 50 metres to Waikiki Trolley stop. Overall great hotel

We enjoyed our stay we recommend and will be back again when you vacation around this area, Hawaii is free laid back and this hotel added the extra touch. We look forward to doing business again, hopefully next summer.

I vacation frequently to Honolulu and have stayed at the Hyatt Place previously. I like this hotel for the following reasons: a) Location is close to the beach, Kapiolani Park but just out of the mass amount of tourists b) The breakfast is included . c) No resort fee d) Great staff

There is not many properties I have stayed at, that could say I had perfect experience.This is one property that excel at every turn.First off, The Staff was fantastic,From check in to randomly running into staff that greeted me and ask if they could help me.Room was very comfortable, clean and room service outstanding.Very close to amenities just a couple of blocks from Waikiki Beach and is central enough to tourist hotspots.High Speed Internet wifi complimentary and free and breakfast buffet was included with my room - which was standard to above average fare, but at least changed from day to day.From a price point good value for money and certainly feel very new and welcoming.Overall a very good experience and certainly would stay here again

This hotel is in a great locality. Close to the beach and diamond head. Lucky enough to have a birthday upgrade which was great, the ocean views were fabulous. The breakfast it basic but filling, I didn't like the area breakfast was in, so many sparrows eating the leftovers and there excrement on food areas. The pool doesn't seem to be used but with the safe beach just nearby it isn't really needed. Beds comfortable wifi complimentary and efficient.

The hotel is well appointed and clean. We stayed for 7 nights and had an ocean view room. It is two blocks away from the beach and Waikiki strip. Walking distance to many restaurants including the International Market. Banyan parking garage is across the street. Weekly parking rate is $80 or $20 per day versus $32 valet per day at the hotel. No problems at all at the garage. Plenty of parking spaces there. The hot morning breakfast includes eggs, potatoes, French toast, waffle, toast, lots of fruits, cereal, rice, miso soup, coffee, juices and milk. The type of meat/protein is rotated between sausage, bacon and corn/beans. It is served on the 3rd floor with a similar set up on the 1st floor but at a much smaller scale. Front desk staff and housekeeping were very helpful, friendly and even let us their baggage scale. Overall, very impressed with this hotel.

We were looking for a PET FRIENDLY hotel, within budget for an extended stay, with decent reviews in Waikiki. Not an easy feat but we eventually found this place! So glad we did! We had a king bed city view room with a sofa bed on the 12th floor. The room was a decent size, very clean and modern. The street noise wasn't too bad considering you are in the middle of a loud city! The view from our very small patio was of the city and mountains. We had a very handy safe, small fridge and coffee maker but unfortunately no micro-wave. Their was plenty of storage for our clothing. The breakfast was great! A wide selection including cereal, fruit, porridge, yoghurt, breads, juices, milk and even almond milk, various teas and coffee. The hot food is rotated each day but normally included some form of eggs, meat, and potatoes. Staff do a great job of keeping the dishes cleared away and the buffet stocked. The buffet is served inside with seating around the pool area. Some reviewers mentioned the birds being an issue. There were quite a few little sparrows around but no big messy pigeons. They didn't really bother us, they stay away unless you leave your food unattended and then they will swoop in and help themselves! You can also take your food to your room. Parking is expensive for longer stays but you can get cheaper parking at nearby parking garages. All the staff are very friendly. The location is very close to the beach and all waikiki has to offer.

The customer service was good, Check in was done in a timely manor. The room to small to enjoy and just not worth the money. The breakfast was great, always plenty of food. The shower had mold which made me uncomfortable.
user_name:
Debra Sue Cole C
Sulphur, United States

review_body: The room was nice and clean, and the location was excellent and very close to the beach.The breakfast was not good at all, very few choices with low quality food and dirty tables.We asked for an adaptor from the reception and they didn't provide us with one.The tour desk was good and provided us with the necessary information.

We stayed here for 8 nights during our honeymoon, and it was incredible. When we arrived for our very late check-in after a delayed flight, we mentioned it was our honeymoon and we were immediately treated accordingly! I enjoyed their free breakfast every morning (although my husband, who doesn't like runny eggs, did not - it's fairly similar fare each day so you may want to plan to eat elsewhere for a day or two during the week) and also loved coming back to a very clean and quiet room each evening! The hotel also allowed us to keep our luggage with them until our late 10:30 pm flight back home and gave us access to a "hospitality room" for half an hour in the late afternoon so that we could shower after a sticky day outside before our flight. Two thumbs up for a great hotel!

Great staff always friendly ready to assist at all times..Rooms were spacious , clean and beds were so comfortable..Would definitely stay again..I usually don't fill these surveys but I felt like I had to let everyone know my review on the hotel..

This hotel is great, staff are lovely, great location, good size rooms, all you need in Hawaii, clean, friendly and close to the beach. The breakfast area is not my favorite area, but you could take your breakfast back to the room.

Enjoyed a great stay at this family-friendly hotel. Well-located, 3 blocks from the beach, near the zoo and aquarium, this hotel was very clean and comfortable with a plentiful breakfast buffet with a good variety. Easy access to highway. Best not to have a car; because it is expensive to valet park, just rent a car for the day (start early) if you need one to drive to North Shore or elsewhere.

This hotel is a mere block away from beautiful Queen's Beach. You can get towels from the front desk. An ABC store is few minutes away. The 2 main streets which run parallel offer multiple shops and restaurants for everyone's taste and budget. They are each a few minutes walk from lobby. The room I had, 1636, has 2 queen beds and a pull out sleeper sofa. The sleeping was great! The room itself is so very spacious but the bathroom with toilet and shower/tub was tiny. The fridge is very cold - drinks put in door formed slush with the dial set to max. Balcony had birds come visit. They love Cheerios and Rice Krispies breakfast cereal. Overall the breakfast offering was kinda lame. Not enough variety. But it was a decent start to the day. Didn't use the pool or exercise room - both small size. Laundry facility only offers 3 washers and 3 dryers at $3 per use each. Detergent is sold from a vending machine. I've learned to bring my own on travel. Go early or late in the day as it's always busy. I went to put my wash in dryer, arriving 5 minutes after the cycle ended and there was a foreign woman complaining to a hotel staff member and wanted to take my wet clothes out onto the table so she could have the machine. Really?! The Honolulu Zoo is nearby as well as the Aquarium within walking distance of 15-20 minutes respectively. Walking in the area is picturesque with the flowering trees and Banyan type trees. Many photo ops along the beach walk and pier. The tour desk is run by a representative from Expedia who is very friendly and helpful. Most of the tour buses pick up/drop off at the Marriott directly across the street. The drivers are chock full of information - too much to remember. Always a good ride. Have the front desk staff order you a cab to the airport. They can guarantee you a flat rate of $29. Other wise you'll pay the meter rate close to $50.

Great stay! Excellent central location, very close to Waikiki beach, friendly helpful staff, loved the breakfast buffet. Walking distance to the Luau. Highly recommend this hotel. We stayed at several different hotels on other islands but this on was one of our favorites.

Of course we knew that Hyatt Place is not the Hyatt proper. But, with Hilton Garden Inn and other cheaper brands of 5* hotels, they're pretty good anyway. Hyatt Place felt cheap however. The rooms and beds were comfortable, but reception felt quite bleak, check-in was not great and the overall feel was more like a motel than a hotel.That said, it was quite close to the beach and breakfast was included in the price, so overall it was not bad.

Great place to stay. Free breakfast, 2 blocks from the beach, and located in an area that is less busy than central Waikiki Beach. If you're vacationing with younger kids, the zoo is 2 blocks away and the aquarium is also nearby. There's also a section of the beach (straight shot down the street the hotel is on) that has a break wall (?), which creates kind of shallow, calmer area to swim. Staff are very friendly and the hotel was great with any issues that arose for us (tub clogged, but was taken care of right away!).

Great Waikiki location-next to bus routes on Kuhio Ave and also close to beach and water on Kalakaua Ave, free breakfast a real winner, room large with super view of diamond head as well as ocean, room very neat and clean with exceptional maid service (Josephine)

Everyone is friendly and does everything they can to make your stay comfortable and the best experience. Wherever they could accommodate our requests, they did. This hotel staff exhibited the friendliest Aloha Spirit!

Our first time to Waikiki,spent hours searching on the www. net and after narrowing down (drum roll) we decided on this place. Taking in all the cost, location , blah,blah, blah we jumped in and stayed here. Weren't disappointed it depends on what you want to spend at the end of the day. Could write about more but the bar not getting any closer & we're on vacation.

The complimentary breakfast and no additional fees was why we originally chose this property and the amazing service and cleanliness is why we'll choose to go back anytime we're in Waikiki. I highly recommend this hotel!

Hyatt is a good place to stay, not far from the beach. Staff was friendly, I got there way to early and had to wait, one of the staff members who I check in with was very nice and kind she upgrade my room without even telling me! Nothing to special but the room was more spacious, I was the only one checking in I thought that was really nice. I was shock with a surprise when I came back to check in haha. Overall the room was nice and clean. Compared to other hotel valet parking expenses it wasn't that bad $32 a night. Breakfast was good in the morning, save a few dollars. I do recommend this.

This hotel has all the basics and is located a short walk away from the beach. The free breakfast is very handy and very convenient, but not super great. Could be a bit healthier.The lifts are super slow.The beds are big and comfy but the rooms are basic. I felt awkward that the bins weren't ever lined but that's their choice I suppose. Room service was great, but inconsistent. We never knew when the room was going to be cleaned, it was often around dinner time/early evening.The Expedia desk in the lobby was very helpful and we booked all our tours through Nate.The free Wi-Fi was great and convenient.The gym is good, but doesn't have an exercise bike, which is odd.The laundry room is also handy and we used it twice, it's busy and isn't free to use unfortunately.This is a good hotel, great location but is basic.

Member for years, I have stayed in many properties all over the world. Everytime I have traveled anywhere if there was a Hyatt I would always stay in it! This one was the most disappointing ever... I have moved to Hyatt Regency after just one night, rooms were extreamly small didn't look like in the picture at all!!!! Sheets and towels clean but full of stains... this is not the quality I'm expecting for such a high class hotel chain.

Hotel is located a short distance from a great part of Waikiki Beach. Hotel provides views of the city, ocean and Diamond Head. Hotel has a pool, sun deck, bar, restaurant, and several great common areas where guests can hang out. The staff is very friendly including housekeeping, bar, restaurant, and car valet service. The hotel is close to mountain climbing, swimming, aquarium, shopping, eating and drinking options.

We booked Aug 1 - 5 at Hyatt Place. We appreciated having the room earlier than checking in time with the condition of upgrading to ocean view of $30 a day. We accepted the offer and was disappointed with the view because Hyatt Place is 2 blocks away and is not ocean view location though you do get to see the view of the ocean in between buildings. We declined and stayed with our original booking. The room is decent size and the beds are soft. Why we booked Hyatt Place because of the breakfast buffet included and no resort fee BUT the breakfast buffet is only basic scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, pancakes, fruits, yogurt, cereals, toasts and miso soup with kimchi, coffee, Tazo teas and juice.The price for this hotel is on the high side perhaps with included the resort fees and breakfast but the location is a but too far. It is near the end of the main strip but it's right next to the zoo and closer to diamond head.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki during our annual island getaway. It was a pleasant experience from the beginning to end. The staff members(check in staff, valet staff, and housekeeping staff) were all very kind, friendly, and helpful. We were given an upgraded room with no charge and it was great. We were also informed about a less expensive parking option at the Banyan parking structure.It was very clean and oh so very spacious. It's very close to Waikiki beach and the hustle and bustle of the Kalakaua strip.

Overall good experience. Liked the location, like no resort fee. Did not like the $32/day parking, seems excessive. Included breakfast was appreciated. Some public areas (especially areas in and around the pool area/breakfast area) need serious attention--paint, new umbrellas, etc. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Room just had basic amenities (shampoo, soap) but when we requested additional items it was brought to the room promptly. Liked that we could check out beach towels for the day.

Nice hotel only 3 -5 mins from beach. Big rooms with balcony. Elevators are slow and often waiting time. Very good breakfast but very crowded. Breakfast 0630-0930 at 2 floors. Good value for money. The only negative thing: We stayed 4 days and 3 days we had to complained that at 6 pm the rooms were not cleaned - complained and got good service at the front desk. Yes there are many good hotels but Hyatt Place is ok.

After a 5-day visit to Island of Hawaii, we revisited Oahu for 2 nights staying one night at Hyatt Place and one night at Turtle Bay visiting north shore. We fly in/out of Pittsburgh airport frequently and stay at Hyatt Regency Pitt airport. We booked this Hyatt Place using Hyatt points and selected the hotel due to its close proximity to where the Ukulele Festival was held. Initially, I was uncertain about the hotel not being beach front and debated between points covering a room at Hyatt Place compared to using the points and paying the difference to stay at Hyatt Regency Waikiki. There were no doubts about choosing Hyatt Place after checking in. The hotel is a 2 minute or less walk to the beach, only the Aston Waikiki Beach is in front of the Hyatt, and there is ocean view from top floors. If we choose Hyatt Regency, you do have to walk across the street to the beach, so there isn't that much of a difference. Unless someone has difficulty walking, will most likely walk along Kalakaua Ave. that location on Kalakaua Ave. won't matter either. Upon arrival, as every hotel does at check-in, staff asked for my ID and credit card. After looking at my drivers license, the staff were prompt to acknowledge it was my birthday and arranged to have champagne sent to the room to further acknowledge my birthday. This gesture was such a surprise and later I noticed it was not only the check-in staff but all the staff was friendly and focused on guests having a pleasant stay. I agree with previous reviews that the rooms are small, but we previously stayed at Outrigger Waikiki and rooms were small size there too. At Hyatt Place, the rooms are modern, clean, breakfast is included, valet service prompt, and there is convenience of having an ABC store next door. Previous reviews have noted the $32 parking charge. The cost to park in the garages is high too, as it's cost associated with visiting Waikiki and there isn't the in and out and valet privileges as the hotel offers. Our only suggestion for improvement is offering more hot items at breakfast. If uncertain as I was between Hyatt Place and Hyatt Regency, I can confirm there will not be disappointment in choosing Hyatt Place.

My family and I spent a total of four nights at Hyatt Place and found it to be an ideal place to stay in Honolulu. The beach was a short walk and there were places to eat that were close. The breakfast buffet in the morning was a real plus and a great way to start the day. The staff was very helpful and rooms were clean and roomy.

Maile was such a pleasure. When we arrived, she asked how we were after our long flight, offered us bottled water and was quite accommodating to insure we would have a nice stay at their hotel. The Hyatt Place is lucky to have such a great employee.This isn't a resort so don't expect those luxuries. However, remember, you won't have those resort fees so you can use that saved money for other things. The hotel is very nice and clean and located just 2 blocks off the beach in a nice area.

The room we stayed in was very nice and had a partial view of the ocean and from the balcony Diamond Head. The balcony we had was almost as big as the room. This was an exception because we went with other people and their balcony was smaller. The breakfast is on the third floor and you can eat outside by the pool. The breakfast was very good. One day was eggs, waffles, bacon, oatmeal, fresh fruits, oatmeal and other cereals and juices, coffee and milk. The next day they had pancakes and breakfast tortillas instead of bacon and waffles plus all the other things. The employees there are very helpful and friendly. They allowed us to check in our luggage before the room was ready and also kept our luggage after we checked out until after 6:00 PM. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is a very short walk to the beach and they supply beach towels.

we were couple of blocks away from the beautiful beach and commercial area. never a dull moment. hyatt has always been our hotel whenever available. staffs are fantastic. maria our housekeeper is always available when u need something. 5star for such a wonderful experience

I've been to Oahu/Waikiki a hand full of times. I've stayed at same rating hotels and even better rating hotels but I think this is probably the best one I've stayed at so far. First of all they don't charge a resort fee, which really adds up. And those of you who complain there are no free parking around....then YOU probably haven't really looked. Look around the zoo area....look closely! We always try to stay around this area because there is free parking. Many hotels in waikiki are pretty dated. Even the better rating hotels aren't really that nice either. Our room was clean. I really liked how our bed was made that the sheets don't separate for our entire stay! The cleaning lady was always outside in the hallway at 7am in the morning and I'd always ask her for stuff if I needed it (I don't like calling down to front desk to request for things) and she was always so nice about it. I like how all the hotel staffs were very sweet and greeted us all the time. Breakfast is served daily at 6:30-9:30am in the lobby and on the 3rd Floor (pool area). They served the same food but the 3rd floor has a bit more selection (rice, miso soup and pickled veg). The pool is small, but since it doesn't get too crowded, it's good enough. We had friends who stayed at the Hyatt for two nights and then moved to the Sheraton for the rest of the trip and they missed the Hyatt because they thought it was better. One thing I didn't like was how there wasn't a light switch for the bathroom. I'd have to turn on the light from the vanity area which was outside of the bathroom. There's also no AC in the bathroom. These aren't huge issues but just a bit annoying. Will definitely staying here again.

Mold in the rooms and showers. Mold in the rooms. Mold. Mold. Mold. Mold. Mold. Mold. Don't stay here- you will get sick. Mold. Mold everywhere. Mold. Mold . Mold. You were warned. Stay away from the mold by staying elsewhere- do not expose your children to this mold.

This hotel is in a great location- you can literally walk to everywhere in Waikiki- the beach, restaurants, shops. It is also easy to get to Pear Harbour and the North Shore. The rooms are very spacious and extremely clean. All of the staff are so friendly and it is great having towels to take to the beach. The breakfast was awesome- cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, rice... anything you could ever want! I highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Waikiki.

Great for families. Close walk to many different activities. Beach is a 2 min walk. Zoo is a 5 min walk. Parks and restaurants everywhere. Only negatives are parking is limited and expensive. Plus homeless everywhere in town.

The hotel is good value compared to the other ones in Waikiki and the rooms are really comfortable, clean and new. It is in a close location to the beach and there is a convenience store right next door and Starbucks and other restaurants and cafes nearby. Definitely a good choice if you don't want to pay an exorbitant amount.

I booked this place for one night (only night on Oahu) based largely on TripAdvisor reviews, and I'm glad I did. Super clean, large, updated room (very comfortable for two adults and two teens), great location, friendly staff, excellent complimentary breakfast. We arrived before check in, they were happy to hold onto our bags while we went to the beach, and they got us a good deal on a taxi back to the airport the next day. I would highly recommend!

Our family spent 2 nights at the Hyatt Place. Good location close to Diamond Head, clean, quiet rooms, excellent breakfast selections. We were able to walk to Teddy's burgers for supper. We never felt in danger.

The rooms are clean, ok size, nothing special, beds comfortable. Lighting in the room terrible. Balcony area cleanliness bad. The buffet breakfast... I've never had anything as bad as that. I felt like I was on a school camp, lining up with trays for fake eggs, everything had sugar in it - cereal, yoghurt, bread. The Asians are catered for well with their soup and rice. The fresh fruit was pineapple everyday. Location wise it's ok, short walk to beach but that's it. Had issues checking in my card was charged incorrectly, took days to sort out & left me with a maxed out card on a holiday - just brilliant!

We loved this hotel. Very nice rooms, clean, and spacious. Perfect location being 1-2 blocks from the beach and less than a 15 minute walk to dozens of nice restaurants. Car rental was located right across the street. The continental breakfast was one of the best we've had. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Nice hotel about a block from the beach. Very comfortable beds (we are pretty picky) and excellent staff. Parking options are across the street for $20/night (if available) or valet for $32/night. The valets were sometimes a bit slow with the cars due to high demand. Provided breakfast was just ok.
user_name:
Michael C
Saratoga Springs, United States

review_body: Nice and clean place to stay. The elevators take forever and there's not really any place to eat lunch or dinner but they have a great breakfast in the morning and the staff is friendly. Parking is expensive if you rent a car but it is everywhere. We had a great ocean view from our room.

We were very impressed with this property. The hotel was beautiful and the staff members were very friendly and courteous. Everything was top notch, from the room amenities to the food. Breakfast is complimentary and the room service menu options are very reasonably priced. The location was also great...just steps away from the beach. The mountain views from our room were breathtaking. We took a hike on Diamond Head and made it to the top. The views from the top were well worth the intense heat and the steep 200+ steps. There were plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance and getting around was very convenient on public transportation as well. We had an amazing time and we will certainly make plans to visit in the future.

The hotel was very clean- breakfast was good- good location - easy to get around on city buses. The hotel was near the restaurants and stores for shopping- near the beach.We signed up for the transportation from the airport- The hotel was in a good location - close to public transportation because it is too busy to rent a car around there. The hotel was very clean- friendly staff, The breakfast was very good. We went to see Pearl Harbor- took the bus there. Then we took the bus to Diamond Head and climbed to the top. The hotel is located right near the beach and near restaurants and stores for shopping.

This hotel was outstanding. The service was good and the gallery hosts were super nice at check-in and check-out. Our rooms were made but Maria. she is so nice and comes at the right time when we are out. She is quick when she cleans and is perfect every time. My family loves her.

We had two rooms at the Hyatt. Both rooms were spacious with couch area and end table plus bed. We had one king room and a double. Maria in housekeeping did a wonderful job keeping our rooms tidy and fresh towels. The checkin was easy and front desk staff friendly and helpful at all times. The men working valet service were very accommodating, twice we left something in our car and they were very nice to retrieved the items. Breakfast was included and had a range of choices from hot eggs to fresh fruit.Only negative is the elevators were slow. There are only two elevators in our building with 16+ floors of rooms and a full hotel.

This is my 3rd time staying at this hotel. I chose this hotel due to value, location, free breakfast and most important of all, NO Resort fee. Any hotel that charges resort fee is a scam. I saved at least $35 per day per room. I booked 4 rooms for 8 nights, you can calculate how much $ I saved. Yeah, this hotel is not as nice as the one across the street like Marriott. Who cares, I spent more time outside, not inside. Try this hotel next time when you visit Waikiki. Mahalo.

This is not a 5-star hotel. It is a great, well maintained, simpler, clean and well managed and MUCH cheaper alternative. Rooms are very nice and free breakfast make it a great alternative to an expensive hotel. One block from nicest area of the beach, easy to get in and out! Staff is exceptional!

Stayed at Hyatt place for 2 nights, excellent location only 2 streets from the beach.Room was clean and available on arrival, free breakfast and no resort fee. Staff were friendly and gave excellent recommendations- thanks for pointing us to LuLu's for the best piña coladas and a great value feed

Maria, she did fantastic service for our room and friendly with big smile when we requested 2 extra towels each day, we are staying 7 days. We are so blessed to have her for servicing us, thank you so much for the best service and roomy place

You're experience with this hotel is going to be amazing. The people here are really friendly and the breakfast is superb. The room service is quick and they are also friendly. We had a room cleaner and her name is Maria. She's really nice and we loved her. She's the best room cleaner we've met. She's also quick and fast so that you can go back in and take a long shower after a nice day at the beach. Maria is so nice and friendly and everyone loves her!!

Don't be fooled by the pictures on line. Especially those of the pool and breakfast eating area. The area is very old and dirty. Rooms were clean but the hallways were dirty. We actually checked out early and changed hotels.

I loved the fact the hotel charges no resort fees and it is walking distance to the beach. The food is included with rates and it is all healthy. 24 hr food orders and it was all delicious. My room on the top floor over looking the ocean was a great view!

Stayed for 2 nights with a friend after attending a work conference at Moana Surfrider. Accommodation in Waikiki was expensive we initially thought. We found the Hyatt Place at a good rate including breakfast and wifi. Just a short walk to the beach and nice to be away from the hustle and bustle and less busy area of Waikiki. The room was big with 2 queen beds and plenty of room. Everything was clean and no issues. Staff were AMAZING and very helpful. The pool area is nothing amazing. But 2 minutes walk from the hotel is Waikiki Beach !!

My 2 adult children and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The staff was friendly, the location was great, and the room was spacious. We were right in the middle of the activity, with the beach across the street, and the shops / restaurants along the surrounding blocks, yet our room was peaceful at night. The only downside was the breakfast could have used more variety.

When we first walked into the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach back in November 2016 we were greeted with a smile and, “Aloha!” from Lei, the Gallery Host. Lei treated us as if we were family. Our room was clean, spacious and had a very contemporary décor. Everyday housekeeping visited to make our beds, change towels and vacuum. Latisha was assigned to our floor and provided exceptional customer service. She was always kind to us and we enjoyed chatting with her each day.Every morning we enjoyed the breakfast buffet on the third floor. They have a variety of food options available and change it up daily. The location of Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is very convenient with The Bus stopping right on the corner.
