We did not need to rent a car because of this, and saved a lot of money using The Bus and Trolley. It costs $2.50 to ride The Bus, and only $2.00 to ride the Trolley. The Pink Trolley right up the street takes you to local dining and shopping centers. It is only a short walk to the beach and there is an ABC Store right up the street as well. You will find many ABC Stores in Waikiki, and they sell basic necessities, meals, souvenirs, etc.If you plan to do any excursions/ tours, like going to the Polynesian Cultural Center or Swimming with Dolphins (etc.), most companies will pick you up in the morning right across the street in front of the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach at the Marriott Waikiki Beach Hotel. We loved our experience so much at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach that we came back to stay in July 2017. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Lei, and she was happy to see us once again!  We highly recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach if you are considering staying in Oahu. You won’t regret it! Mahalo for reading this review!Sincerely, The Beedon Family

The hotel is located really close to Waikiki beach. The area is surrounded by good places to eat and stores. It also has a friendly staff and good breakfast. The only problem was that we had to pay 32 dollars/day to park our car at the hotel.

The room was nice. Shower could use some work but it was clean. The best part are the employees! Christopher and Hidelisa both went out of their way to make a stay wonderful! Would stay again. Note: this hotel is about two blocks from the beach. You don't have the view but since we were seldom in our room we didn't mind.

Modern hotel. Excellent value. Good location. Very clean rooms. Breakfast is included in the rate. Easy access in and out of Waikiki by car. Just a heads-up, the only parking option offered is valet parking.

Just two blocks from Kuhio beach, the best beach for kids. Rooms and lobby are very nice and feel brand new. The pool is a bit dated and small, but is nice enough. Breakfast is tasty, but the options are somewhat limited compared to similar hotels. This part of Waikiki is very quiet, but there is plenty of shopping and dining just a block away.

We usually stay at Hyatt properties but never tried a hyatt place. We chose this place because it was close to the beach and it included breakfast. Breakfast was very good and it served on an outside terrace on the third floor. There's many choices to choose from with the fruit and cereal's and more. The hotel is immaculate looks like it's brand new. It is only two blocks from the beach and close to everything. You will not be disappointed I asked for an upper floor room with a corner because the views are much better and the room is bigger, and it was well worth it. If you're traveling with family it's convenient to have breakfast right in the hotel included with the room. And if you have more than two kids it's nice to have a pull out couch which the room provided as well

The Hyatt was a great place to start our holiday in Waikiki. The room was spacious, very clean, and modern. It had all the comforts and enough space to keep all our shopping bags. The free breakfast every morning was a bonus, and a nice way to start the day. The roof pool and gym were a nice addition, if you were too lazy to head down the block to the beach. The staff were so friendly and were more than happy to offer advice on everything Waikiki. All in all this was a great place to stay.

Close to many family friendly activities and restaurants, Really enjoyed the comfort and care to our room. Our room was kept impeccable by our main housekeeper, Lovely. She made living there for an extended period really worth it. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and did an incredible job making us feel welcome, but Lovely went above and beyond! Will stay here again if given the option. One other shout out is for Nick, the bartender, Very personable guy enjoyed chatting with him over our stay!

This is to notify Trip Advisor and its potential customers that The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is not honoring a prominently placed promotion. Our experience showed that the Hyatt Place is taking advantage of the traffic the offer is sending them, but they refuse to honor it, as explained below:The promo is for free parking for government employees with ID card (official travel papers not required) thru March 2018. The customer is told to call hotel directly and that the offer is "based on availability". Anyone seeing this would understand it as meaning if a room is available then free parking is available to the target audience.When I first called, the hotel the rep stated there was no such offer. So I explained that is was on the Tripadvisor site and that reservations were to be make thru the Hotel.The Hotel rep then responded that no reservations were available in March. I hung up, easily found a date in March 2018, and called back.This time the hotel (same person I talked to before) said that the offer did not cover March. I sent them a screen shot and also sent the customer link.After faced with the details earlier denied, the hotel said the promo was at their discretion and management had decided to "have no availability for this promotion regardless of room availability". At this point it was obvious the hotel was not going to honor the Tripadvisor promo. In sum, the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach management is taking advantage of Hyatt's and Trip Advisor's good names. The whole experience turned out to be a great disappointment and a waste of time.
user_name:
IDKJM
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel was beautiful and clean. The location was perfect for shopping, going to the beach, finding restaurants, using trolley transportation. The breakfast buffet was great each morning. The price was good with no resort fee!

clean spacious rooms, two queen beds with sofa bed worked really well for five people. Good views, good breakfast buffet, very comfortable beds, very helpful staff-beach towels etc.One block from beach, very close to shopping and food.

Was expecting for a queen sized sofa bed as seen on Expedia ads, but wasn't even informed by the staff that we were given a solo-sized sofa bed. Till we get to see it ourselves. Very disappointing! They promised to move us to a bigger room but it's up to us to follow up. They never initiated.

Was extremely pleased with our stay at the Hyatt Staff was courteous and friendlyHotel close to the beach, restaurants and shops Free breakfast daily was wonderful Only thing is that we had the suite and the bathroom was very small Mahalo Hyatt

My stay here was perfect! It is one block away from a convenience store and two blocks from the beach/food. You cannot beat the free breakfast here! Scrambled eggs, meats, potatoes/quinoa, fresh fruit, oatmeal, yogurt, coffee, tea, rice, kimchi, Miso soup, peanut butter and jelly, bread including gluten free, granola, almond milk and more!!! Each day they change the main part of the meal. Staff was nice and the room was clean. I thought the bed was very comfortable. I stayed on the 16th floor with a mountain and partial ocean view and it was fairly quite. I also had a 10month old with me. They provided a pack n play and high chair which was great to feed my daughter breakfast in (she loved the eggs and tofu provided). Housekeeping does come later in the day but that only effected us once and on that day I just called them and they came to clean up the room when we left. Didn't use the pool with the beach so close but it was clean although small. CONS - parking is $40 a day! We got a car to explore the island. however across the street parking is $20.

The hotel staff know how to take care of you. The breakfast each morning was a great way to start our day of walking. Conveniently located to the tourist destinations and also local eateries. I did not know that I could get so much sleep and still have time to meet all of touring goals.

The room was clean. The breakfast was good and had plenty of choices. The walk to the beach was very easy and about 2 blocks away. They need to post a sign about leaving your breakfast unattended. The birds will get your food! Great location!

We have stayed in a number of hotels in Waikiki over the years, but we finally found a room large enough for luggage and the family at Hyatt Place. It is only block away from Waikiki Beach, and comes with a complimentary breakfast with plenty of variety (more that just fruit, danish, and cold cereal). Also, our cleaning lady, Maria, was super friendly and did a superb job tidying the room. Valet parking prices are on par with other valet services in Waikiki, but the valets themselves are very courteous and make it worth the cost of parking your car there.

Out of 4 nights, we stayed at Hyatt place for the first two night and it was amazing. They provided complimentary breakfast which was above than average, and the room condition was clean and excellent. Although I felt like the room was too small, I realized Waikiki hotel rooms are all out of dated somewhat and very different like from Las Vegas. So overall, I am pleased to stay at this hotel and I will be definitely coming back! If you find this hotel with a good price, you won't regret it. Thank you!

Overall, the room itself (city-view) was smaller than expected, and furnishings a bit dated, but service from the staff was excellent. We did not happen to use the laundry machines, pool, or valet parking during stay.

Stayed here in December 2016. Open lobby is unique (not sure if all Hawaii hotels are like that). You can enjoy the nice weather while sitting in the lobby waiting for a ride, or room, or just chilling.Price: it's Hawaii, prices are gonna be high. Even then, I felt Hyatt Place had very fair prices for what we were looking for (two beds, one pull out bed). No complaints here!Location: felt central to a lot of areas, definitely on the south part of Waikiki though. Still walking distance to plenty of places. Think we walked along the beach up to Fort DeRussy Beach Park and back. Not too bad at all. Uber drivers could find the location, same with friends picking us up.Check-in: quick check-in. Could not accommodate early check-in, but it was during the holidays and...well, it's Hawaii. No points off there for that.Room: elevators are SLOW. We were kind of high, probably the upper 3/4 of the building. Not the very top, but not in the middle either where it'd be easy to climb stairs. We had a nice view of Diamond Head. Balcony with glass sliding door was the only natural light into the room. It wasn't dark, but we had light coming in from one side of the room. Standard hotel bed, sheets, and pillow. Pull out bed was exactly what we needed, so it was very convenient finding a hotel in Hawaii with two beds and a pull out bed.So here's the thing with the room. We were high up. Hawaii has winds. Dunno what it was about the floor plan, but there was definitely a wind howl in our room that high up. After investigating, we realized it was coming from the bottom of the door - the crack between the door and the floor. I called the front desk and they sent someone up. The solution was to place towels along the bottom of the door and block up that crack. It worked.The wind howl was noticeable. Probably would not have been able to sleep with it. When we came in each time, we quickly put the towel back in place. Not a fancy solution, but it worked. But I also expected a bit more.Amenities: wifi throughout, no complaints. The gym was adequate enough with some free weights, ellipticals, treadmills, and bikes. There were towels, water, and a restroom in the gym. The pool was very tiny. Didn't bother swimming in the tiny pool when the beach was close by. Buffet breakfast was nice each morning. We took some snacks with us as we left for our daily activities - helps when you don't have immediate access to a restaurant for lunch. It can get packed, so sometimes we saw people just bringing food up to their rooms, which appears to be acceptable since no one stopped them.Check-out: quick and easy check-out. No charges, no hassle. We left our luggage with the hotel since our flight was at night, no issues there either. I thought I forgot something in my room and they helped me get back up into the room and look for my item. Couldn't find it, housekeeping was looking too. Turns out it was in a pocket in my backpack...oops! But housekeeping and front office was very accommodating.Overall, I enjoyed the stay here! Would I instantly rebook here? Can't say that the hotel won me over THAT much, especially when a place like Hawaii is so competitive with so many hotels. But for a family needing two beds and a pull out bed, Hyatt Place was the place for us. I'm going to still shop around, but I'm going to keep this hotel in mind.

I stayed here during a recent trip to Hawaii for a wedding and the Hyatt Place hotel was great. The room (2 bed + sofa) was spacious and housekeeping was excellent - they managed to remove all the sand we accidentally tracked in every day. We were on the 15th floor and had a 'City' view which came with a nice balcony; the room itself was fairly standard, but was large, clean, and had everything we expected - I didn't come to Hawaii to stay in the room anyways! Hotel breakfast was delicious - lots of options and great fresh fruit. Hotel staff were all very friendly, and accommodating through our stay.

Beds and pillows were excellent and I am very picky! Location was perfect for the beach, shuttles, and shopping. Having a laundry facility on site was very helpful. I Loved the outdoor seating for breakfast and the food was quite good. I especially liked the greek yogurt and fresh fruit. Friendly and helpful staff.

My wife and I had a wonderful time during our stay at the Hyatt Place Wakiki Beach. One of the best vacations as a couple that we have had yet! The buffet breakfast was very enjoyable. And the location was great! Very close to the beach! Thanks Hyatt Place Wakiki Beach!

room wasn't clean ,I can the lady's long hair on the bed and dust probably didn't I swing the room for little while. ........ and also during the breakfast location was too many birds so it war so irritate so much......

We (five of us, including grandparents and a 6 y/o) stayed at the Hyatt Waikiki which is just a little over a block from Waikiki Beach. It is a quick and easy walk to the beach, and just across the street there is an ABC store which has souvenirs, beach toys and food/beverages. We only stayed for two nights, as we had plans to stay at a different hotel in another part of the island. Other than the location, the highlight of this hotel was the BREAKFAST. As you know, breakfast can easily run you $40-60 for five people, so we were able to save money (and use it towards other fun things) and enjoy a FULL breakfast, including eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes/waffles, toast, fruit, cereal and miso soup, plus all kinds of juices and coffee/tea! They serve the breakfast buffet near the pool, and the set up is very clean and comfortable. The staff is also very friendly and quick to clear your dirty plates. They served breakfast from 6:30am to 10am, so we woke up early for breakfast and then went back for a snack after swimming at the beach. The hotel lobby is nice and crisp, and the staff greeted us promptly to check us in. Because the lobby was so open, I liked that fact that you needed a room key to operate the elevators for extra security. Speaking of the elevators, there was quite a bit of a wait especially at breakfast and check-out time. There were only two elevators servicing 20 floors of rooms. Our room was on the 19th floor and had two queen beds. It was snug for the five of us but I did like that the sink was outside the bathroom so we weren't always fighting for bathroom time. It also had a nice partial view of Waikiki beach and a partial view of the rolling hills behind. It was also very clean and surprisingly quiet, even though we were close to the elevators. The pool was a bit disappointing. It is located on the 3rd floor, so it is shadowed by the surrounding hotels. It also looks outdated and it was small in size; when we went down there were about 4-5 adults and 6-7 kids and felt super crowded; bumping into each other as you tried to swim or splash around. Luckily, the beach was so close, we spent more time swimming there instead of the pool. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be close to the beach. They offer clean and comfortable rooms, and a hearty breakfast. But, don't plan on spending a lot of time at the pool.
user_name:
Dee K
New York City, New York

review_body: The room we were placed in was loud. Maybe because we were between ally and you can hear the cars/motorcycle at night. And then if there's strong winds, you can hear it. I can't remember the CS that checked us in, but she was nice. She was really really patience with my mother in law. Checking to see if there were any rooms available close to us. Super nice. Our room were rooming. Beds were OKnow. The hotel is close to an ABC store so if you need a late night snack, just walk a few steps and you're there. A walking distance to the beach and a few blocks (6-10) to.the international mall.

Our hotel stay was great. Pleasant and helpful staff. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Small pool. No parking deck, valet service is $32 per night. They have nice bakery treats. Two gift shops within hotel. Room was nice and the bed was very comfortable, had a small balcony.

My family was there early June 2017 and we were very impressed with there "above and beyond" service. In particular, Angelin at the front desk made sure our accommodations and needs meet our expectations and made us feel like VIPs. This personalized attention from Angelin, large clean rooms, free breakfast, and no resort fee helped make our visit to Waikiki at the Hyatt Place great and memorable. Highly recommend this hotel and we will be back in the future.

From the moment we entered the hotel we felt at home. That feeling continued throughout our stay. Room was comfy, clean and well taken care of by staff. All other staff, from checking us in to helping us clean up after we ate breakfast were awesome.

Price is very good. Staff are kind. Breakfast satisfying. They should add spam with breakfast. Walking to Waikiki beach very close and within walking distance. Plenty of towels for pool and beach. We'd stay there again.

Family trip and it was the best experience. I would recommend this hotel. Staff always so helpful and after a few days they know who you are. I liked that because other places they just don't acknowledge you.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The accommodations were great. The beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was a plus and tasty. Thanks Dino for helping us out when we arrived. The proximity to the beach was incredible. If you have small children it is so close to the zoo and aquarium. Very reasonable price. If you are thinking of visiting Diamond Head it is near by. There is an ABC store just down the street. Would definitely stay here again.

Excellent hotel, staff, and location. The 24/7 Gallery was very convenient for meals any time of the day and the breakfast buffet was very good. We were here for 5 days, 3 whole days in Waikiki, mainly to recover from jet lag. Very restful and convenient. The place to stay in Waikiki!

We came here for 7 nights, The location was excellent less then 5min walk to the water, the services were great, everyone was friendly, our rooms were spotless everyday thanks to Arlita who was our housekeeper she was very friendly and would talk to us everyday and made us feel very welcome. Would stay here again and recommend this hotel to everyone!

This was a great hotel! Staff are very friendly and helpful made everything quick and easy. Not far from the beach they provide towels. They offer a free Lei making class which was fun! Breakfast was delicious and plentiful they had different variations of what they served each morning. What I really like is if you need anything you are able to text the front text and you get an imidiate response. I was having trouble with the AC I wanted it cooler in the room and text the front desk they were able to set it to my desired temperature remotely. Also if flying in contact the hotel to let them know you need a cab you can get a cheaper rate!

The hotel was clean, rooms were large, location was perfect both for the beach and shopping. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. Walking distance to shops and restaurants.

We stayed in Honolulu for three nights after my husband attended a convention. As Marriott Reward members using our free points, we were very pleased with our room location with its peek-a-boo view of the city and ocean. It was also in a quiet section of the hotel removed from the noisy crowds. The beach was an easy two block walk and wwe preferred being in a less busy side street. Although the room seemed small, the layout and quality of the bedding and mattress was excellent for an older but updated hotel. I was not excited about the pool area which was unfortunately located on the third level adjacent to where breakfast was served. It was not the oasis I expected and was surrounded by concrete and concrete buildings. Not very Hawaiian and I could have been anywhere in the world. We did take advantage of the free breakfast but were a bit disappointed in the selection, especially the coffee. The last morning we opted for breakfast in the lobby and had Starbucks coffee which was available for purchase. All in all, a good choice for families, budget travelers, and couples seeking a place off the beaten path.

We were travelling as a family for two special occasions,8 of us in total. three rooms, we were located together the rooms were spacious, light, and situated looking towards the ocean. The continental breakfast was good - id possibly say don't have the tortillas not so good but everything was hot fresh and tasty- I especially liked that they do not season the food so it allows guests to season to their own taste. (i'm a chef by trade - personal hate of mine) location wise was good a short stroll to the beach, close to the trolleys ($2 per person fee). It is the staff who make this property great - always happy and eager to help , i have to make special mention to Robert(bell desk, Cole,Lei and Hidelisa (front desk) to Ikiaka (Bar man you seriously make the best drinksand made us laugh - superman is what i nicknamed you) Happy friendly and genuine.Shout out to you guys for making it awesome - Sorry Cole - but Ikiakia's Burger was better haha - food is reasonably priced Limited selection but a good choice - the pizza's were not bad either Laundry facilities are available - $3 per load - maybe a change machine i there would be good The only bad thing i would say about this hotel is the lifts - took forever toAll in all a great family hotel also good for solo guests on business

Clean, great customer service, awesome daily breakfast. Perfect location, minutes from the beach. Enjoyed the night life. Employees friendly and courteous. Personal thank you to Amira, 3rd floor housekeeper was so adorable, and friendly.

Hyatt Place was a great choice for our trip. We were with the band and choir. While we were thrre, there were also a basketball team and a soccer team. The breakfast provided was absolutely wonderful, but I never felt crowded, in spite of the number of people that needed served. The room was exceptionally clean, the staff very friendly and helpful, and the lobby a comfortable relaxing place. Hyatt Place is a short walk to the beach, which is actually a plus. A competitor hotel has beachfront property, but those visitors had to tolerate others walking in front of them to reach beach cruises. Hyatt Place is conveniently located to a number of other attractions, as well. I would stay here again, and hope to very soon!!!

For two weeks of business travel, Hyatt was the place to be. The room was great and the valet parking was fast and prompt. The included breakfast with the resort fee was good. Always plenty of food and different choices each day. I probably would have preferred a floor higher than 7th as the street noise was pretty loud in the middle of the night. Something the hotel can't really control.

A great place to stay. only 1 block from beach, ABC store, trolley pickup, rental car available right across the street ,tour buses pick you up right out front. The staff was very friendly & helpful. The room was very clean the beds were very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again

We always stay at the Waikiki Hyatt place. Decently priced, great free breakfast, good upgrades for hyatt members. Best if you're looking to relax and enjoy Waikiki. Easy walk to the beach with free beach towels.

Having stayed in Waikiki many times before for work and on holiday, I wanted more of a home base to use while hitting up all my favorite spots in Oahu. Hyatt Place was the perfect choice! It's great for those who like me are resigned to staying in tourist-filled Waikiki when visiting the island but would prefer something a bit away from the madness. There is no resort fee and valet parking is available for a reasonable price. Breakfast is included in the cost and has both hot and cold options and plenty of coffee! There's a smallish pool near the breakfast area as well as a gym which admittedly I didn't use but offered the standard cardio machines and weights. The room itself was lovely and was big enough to feel that there was a bed/sleeping area as well as a comfortable living space with a couch and desk and chair. I also really like that the toilet/shower and sink area is separated by a door and I imagine that it's more convenient if you are staying with someone. Being a Hyatt rewards discoverist member my room was upgraded and I also received a free bottle of water daily. This all being said, it's the service at this Hyatt as well as all the other Hyatts that I have stayed at that keep me coming back. From a lovely welcome note in my room from the general manager to the folks at check-in to the car valets everyone was so warm and welcoming! There's a lot of hotel choices in Waikiki but it's the Hyatt employees that will keep me coming back to their properties. Tip: Those looking for more of an all inclusive resort with direct access to the beach should look to the Hyatt Regency a couple of blocks away!
user_name:
LolaHaze20
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We had booked an ocean view room and was first given room #1212 (Or one close to that). This should be considered a partial ocean view room (there were options for this selection). This room was smaller than it appeared in pictures when I booked and also the view was a little ocean and a lot of buildings. It would have been nice to have had a more truer idea of what we were getting ourselves into because, we were there for our honeymoon. That is the one time you want things to be as perfect as possible. I spoke with someone at the front desk about my concerns and she nicely switched us to another room but, it couldn't be done until the next day. Which we were okay with as long as we got a better view. We were switched to room 1205 and this one did have a better view but, still not a full ocean view room. We were advised that since this hotel was just off the ocean front, they don't have full ocean view rooms but, this wouldn't be something you knew unless you were local or unless they told you in their descriptions. I recommend you replace 'ocean view' in your titles with 'partial ocean view', so that people get what is marketed. The hotel itself is very nice however, the rooftop/pool/breakfast area (floor 3) was lacking. On our first night there we went up to the pool to check it out and the deck area was a disaster. The furniture was all out of place and cushions were off. It was dirty and was not at all like the pictures. Since they have breakfast up there, my assumption is after breakfast things just don't get cleaned up or put back together as far as the patio furniture. The breakfast was good, it is a nice selection. The staff was excellent. All were very polite and tried their best to accommodate us with what they have. We ordered food from the hotel one night and it was okay. Maybe just a little pricey. I think a flat bread was around $12 and it was not very big and seemed as if it was cooked from a box. We were unaware that valet parking was the only option for parking and that it was $32 a day. That seems a bit extreme. Especially since a few times we would wait around 10 minutes to get our car because, there would only be 1 or 2 people working valet and a lot of people down there to pick up or drop off their cars. For the times the valet was not busy, it worked fine and was quick and easy. On our last day there, we planned to sleep in a little because, we had late night flights that night. We were woken up by the fire alarm going off. We made it down 12 flights of stairs to find out it was a false alarm. Don't get me wrong, we are better safe than sorry but, no one apologized. They just said it was a false alarm and that everyone could go back to what they were doing. People started piling onto elevators and just before we were to get on one, an elevator got stuck and was stuck with people in it for quite a while. So in fear of getting stuck in an elevator we walked up to the third floor to eat breakfast, where there were tons of people due to everyone being woken up. We had to wait in a long line for food and even utensils. It was just a cruddy way to end our stay. Overall we did have a great time in Hawaii on our honeymoon but, there were definitely things the hotel could have done differently to make our stay what we anticipated it to be.

We really enjoyed staying in your hotel. The breakfast was really good. We have never had a continental breakfast like this before. We will stay with you again. The next time we stay we will upgrade to an ocean view. The staff was very friendly and were right on top of things.

I booked a three night stay using an award night and points for the other two nights I was upgraded to a high floor room with a beautiful room of the mountains due to my Discoverist status, and received two free water bottles every day. The room was large and comfortable with a couch and a really nice TV and balcony, a great place to rest when dealing with jet lag coming from the east coast! The room was quiet and the bed was comfortable. Front desk staff were great, I was given a lot of good advice as well as a steady supply of beach towels! Valet staff was wonderful too, service was quick and efficient. Breakfast was delicious, great variety and I liked that there was a tray in the room to bring breakfast up to your room if you preferred. I loved the location on Waikiki beach, so easy to step out with a towel and lay near the water. So many wonderful shops and restaurants within a few blocks. Really fantastic stay, great service and location. Would definitely recommend!
user_name:
zztravelerzz
New York City, New York

review_body: Disclosure, spelling of names maybe incorrect and I apologize. I stayed here on a business trip for 11 nights. When I arrived the staff was very friendly. Millie greeted me in a way that made me felt welcomed. I had made 4 separate reservations at the hotel and to avoid having to check out / in I asked if it could be made into 1 sole reservation. It was explained to me that the way the reservations were booked, that it could not. However, that I would be kept in the same room (in which I was upgraded to a larger room, even though I have no status at the hotel, which was a nice bonus: Room 318) and that the day before / day of the new reservation that I would have to get my key redone (not a big deal stopping by the front desk). My room had a king size bed with about 3-5 feet of room on either side of the bed. It also had it's own "living room" of sorts that had a couch and additional TV. I did not use this room, as there was a TV on the dresser about 8 feet away from the foot of the bed. The bathroom and sink area was very spacious. The only negative thing I have about the bathroom, is the old shower head. The residue from the water usage was very visible, which also caused the water stream to go in a few different directions. I would encourage the hotel to update the shower head that has better flow. The hotel is situated about 2.5 blocks away from Waikiki beach. It is located on the opposite end of Waikiki from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and takes about 10 minutes walking to get to the International Market Place. However, it is only 2 blocks away from the Honolulu Zoo in the opposite direction. Needless to say it is situated a little further away from most of the popular shops and restaurants, but nothing a short walk cannot fix. Upon returning from work, the hotel staff was very friendly and made for good conversation. I would like to identify specific staff (in no particular order): Heidi, Lei, Millie (as mentioned before), Angeline, and lastly the bartender Ikakia. Ikakia is the main bartender and made for excellent conversation for after work drinks or after dinner. When Ikakia was on break or not available, Heidi, Angeline and Millie served as backup "bartenders". They also made for pleasant conversation and were always very friendly. I only interacted with Lei a few times, however, she was always friendly and cheery as well. I only have 2 complaints of the hotel. The first is that of the pool. It is very small, maybe 10 feet wide by 20 feet long. If there is more than 5 people in the pool, it may seem very crowded. My other complaint is the valet service. It is run by another company (Elite Parking). There seemed to be a disconnect when dialing the front desk to ask for my car ahead of time when I needed my vehicle. The first 2 days, even though I called down, the valet either did not know I asked for my car or did not have it ready (when calling 15-20 minutes in advance). However, after I found out about the text service (408-724-9288), if I texted that number the night before with what time I wanted my vehicle, it was always there. I do think there needs to be some improvement to the valet service though, for those that do not know about this option. The text service also works for anything that a guest may need (laundry bags, towels, etc). It goes to the computer at the front desk and will continue to flash until someone acknowledges it. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.

Close proximity to everything; nice room setup perfect for a family. Free breakfasts. Great amenities and cordial staff. Could improve on more elevator accesses and the wait time on valet parking. Would definitely visit again

Very comfortable and elegant place. Mi wife and I had a wonderful My wife and I had a wonderful vacation week, we received a very good service . Our experience was very special, excellent customer service, and very nice staffattention and very nice staff staff. We highly recommend Hyatt Place at Waikikivery nice staff

WE spent 11 days at the Hyatt Place and were extremely please with the resort. The help were very accommodating and very friendly.. Our house keeper was also one of the best. The only thing that they lacked was a restaurant. If you are looking for a hotel that is with in walking distance to the beach this is a good one.

Used free night cert and booked this hotel (only category 1-4) on Oahu. Great location, a few minutes to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, shops etc. Very spacious 12th floor corner room with a sectional sitting area and lanai view of mountain. Comfy bed, mini fridge bonus, and usual bathroom/vanity setup. Noise factor was an issue for my sleep when a/c goes off/on, trucks driving by, pipes noise from surrounding guests'. Breakfast is good and fresh with adequate hot and cold food choices. Friendly, attentive staff.

The Bartender saved the day when ordering food off of the 24 hour menu. We had to leave around 3AM before the free breakfast and he made it happen with no problems. There is only valet parking at 32 dollars so be prepared if you have a rental car.
user_name:
Eric M
Goose Creek, United States

review_body: A pleasant place to stay with amenities close by. Excellent location with bus stop right out the front of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and willing to help with questions. All up a fantastic experience

My friends and I attended the 3-day concert at the Waikiki Shell and stayed here for the weekend because it's walking distance to the Shell. We also went night swimming after the concert on Friday night at Waikiki Beach which is also walking distance! Our room was spacious, enough to fit 6 of us- girls! Valet was great too, those guys were always quick and never complained about us coming and going throughout the weekend. And we probably had them fetch our car about 6(ish) times in the 2 days we were there haha! We remember Mark and Christopher always serving us with a smile. Unlike other (picky-eater) people that reviewed the FREE breakfast, we on the other hand LOVED IT! It kept us full til lunchtime and it was Ono! So many varieties. Eggs and bacon or sausages, had rice too, pancakes or waffles, cereal, fruit, bagels, toasts, oatmeal, they had SOUP even! We loved it, its better than spending more money somewhere else. We all felt that we saved money because of the free brekky the other bad review I read below, they were at the hotel the same weekend as us! And they didn't like the breakfast? well- maybe it's cos they are too high maintenance to begin with but if your country girls like us or in a big group- u will absolutely love the ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT FREE breakfast! don't listen to the other reviews when they say you will save by going to a hostel and eating out- r u frekkin kidding me? LOL. How u going be high maintenance eaters and stay at a hostel. LOL and the price to just eat McDonald's can be expensive too- it's Hawaii- the prices are high! One way to save money is to NOT BE A PICKY EATER LOL. But the food was delicious so I don't know what they were talking about We also wanted to thank an employee for their hospitality and Aloha he showed us while staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. We only know him as Josay, I think he's from Africa! He greeted us warmly at check-in and gave us cold water bottles while we waited in line. And was just so kind and funny every time we saw him throughout our stay. Mahalo! We will be back!

WOW! I was very please with my room, service and food. It was like living in a condo. I had a lovely view of the beach and enjoyed fireworks from my room the first night. Room service was excellent/outstanding, clean towels, extra soaps, friendly personalities, etc. The breakfast was the deciding factor for me selecting the Hyatt and it was always delicious and awesome each morning. Even my family members who stayed across the street at the Marriott Resort and Spa agreed that the Hyatt had more to offered, reasonable and was amazing. The beach, zoo, aquarium and other things to do was right up the street.Thank you for making my visit to Hawaii fabulous.

This was my third hotel in Hawaii, we had a long holiday so we wanted to save on our last three days In the island. We book Hyatt thinking of a good breakfast deal. HoneStly?You Are Better off in a hostel if you want to save money...I stayed In an upgraded large room, which wasn't bad. But the Free breakfast is such a let down that you rather have booked a hostel, travelodge or a holiday inn or paid for breakfast elsewhere. So my breakfast for three days Ended up being 5 boiled eggs, porridge and coffee. That's all I could eat, I was still happy though, my husband wasn't as he's a fussy eater , he had only Rice Krispies for the three days and toast. We didn't save on lunch as other places you stay where you have a good breakfast that keeps you going for hours. This wasn't the case for my husband and my son. I got told off for not taking my plates from the table. Wow...Like a McDonald ( which is better in my opinion) felt like I was back in school. No tipping I suppose ?Appalling ! Valet parking was good. You have no choice of self parking unless you go to a private car park, and it's the same price as in some self parking hotels In Hawaii.

Our stay there was so delightful and so helpful. One of us was quite sick and yet the staff supported us in every way and made it possible for them to just relax and recover I'm going to enjoy their whole holiday.Complementary breakfast was the greatest ready I never seen it was constantly for one full of choices the place that we were able to eat was delightful and made eating outside a treat I had to

The Hyatt Place was a clean hotel. Breakfast is very basic and you cannot order anything as it is a set menu each day. You cannot order any drinks or snacks from around the pool. This is a dog friendly hotel with many dogs on the premises but always on a leash. We were on level 4 and when we had our sliding door open it was very noisy outside. We chose to sleep with our door open as when it was closed the air conditioner came on automatically. Overall we had a lovely stay and the position was perfect. Very close to beach and walking distance to bus, shops and eateries.

I haven't stayed here in a while and some minor changes to improve the guest experience. They offer a wonderful buffet breakfast experience and healthy!! They have a HH in the lobby area with tap beers, etc. I don't think you can self park just valet and sometimes you have a bit of a wait. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. They have moved the location of the concierge for travel tours which is a plus for vacationers.

We found the location great as it was off the busy strip but close to the beach. Just a short walk to swimming and a short stroll to an area where we could snorkel. Also having the pink line bus service almost stoping just outside the hotel so we could travel around Wakikki was great. The hotel had everything we needed our stay included breakfast and no resort fee!! I would recommend this hotel.

Had an excellent customer service with a nice view to Diamond head mountain and block away from Waikiki Beach. I can't thank enough to Lei, Dino, Maile, and Justin.Dino - You have a gifted customer service skill always thriving to ensure the customer needs and making the travel so pleasant.I will for sure return to this place in future and recommend anyone going there to stay at Hyatt Place at Waikiki.

We recently stayed here for 3 nights. The staff was friendly and accommodating right from the start. We had a King bed on the 14th floor. Our room was clean and well appointed. The hotel is a short walk to the beach, restaurants, and shops along the Waikiki Beach strip. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet which contained numerous hot and cold items. So glad we selected this place and return again if the opportunity comes again.

we stayed here in May 2017 great rooms and brilliant breakfasts, it is in a great position only two block from Waikiki beach, one block from the pink bus route and two blocks from to the Zoo, so central to everything no need to hire a car

This was my first trip to Hawaii...something that I had wanted to do for many years...The water was beautiful and I enjoyed the great view from my balcony and the short walk to the beach...I was able to take many photos of the beautiful Waikiki Beach. I had a great time...thanks to all of the Hyatt Staff.

We loved our stay. The room was very pretty, very clean and comfortable....with a great ocean view! The staff was very friendly and super attentive. Especially Heidi!! The food from the gallery was available 24/7 and was really yummy. We wouldn't hesitate to book again.

What can one say about the changes to Hyatt Place, Waikiki, The difference is amazing.In the 12 months since my last stay what a turnaround, the staff are again smiling, going out of their way to enhance the customer experience. The property is again sparkling. Well done to all involved in the change, it must have been hard going at the start, but the results are credit to the current management and all the staff who are now taking pride in their workplace.

Stayed for first six days of trip. This is a great location with only a short walk to beach. Enjoyed the stay, great for families, breakfast is OK with little tweak it will be better. Staff were awesome.

Had an amazing experience from start to finish.After coming in totally exhausted after a night flight from Las Vegas, Jade and Kimberly were very welcoming. Jade located an accessible room and since I was ok with accessible checked me in at 6:30 am. Joey and Mitchell at Valet were both very good.Got a beautiful personal note from the General manager Fernando Vasquez and later met both Fernando and his assistant Josay.Josay was instrumental in getting me an early checkin at my next hotel.There are so many awesome people, and I tried to get many names as I could. So many at buffet was unable to get their names.Matt at the front desk was extremely nice and efficient at checkout.Chris, Lexiann, Lei, And Justin were also very helpful at the front desk and preparing food to go. Being a small hotel each Employee wore several hats.Breakfast was very good as was all the staff at the buffet.Even after checkout Josay and Janice assisted in locating a lost item my friend had left behind.Thank you for taking such good care of us and making us feel like family
user_location: North Las Vegas, Nevada, United States
user_name:
j0anie0
North Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: Great location. Great value. Highly recommend.Staff were very friendly and always helpful. Breakfast included makes a perfect start to the day. Pool, gym and laundry facilities available if you need.

Stayed here twice and really enjoyed it! Easy and quick walk to the beach and to all the local shops and restaurants. The only downside is the elevator is incredibly slow and it's an older building. Overall, very nice place!

For the price it was clean, friendly, good location and breakfast was included. Room was small for family of 5 and ocean view was mostly blocked by another building but the service was excellent and we could see the ocean by looking down the street.

Very clean but average hotel. Nothing special except very well located near the beach. Very expensive relative to other hotels but might be good at Waikiki. Beds are very comfortable and clean but plain vanilla in appearance. No views of the ocean.

If your looking for a budget hotel in a great location, then this is it! The service is great, the rooms were always clean and the beach and shops are only a short walk away! this hotel ticks all the boxes.

The staffs here are very friendly and accommodating. There's only valet parking which wasn't much of a hassle because we were able to call ahead of time to get our car so by the time we came down to the lobby it was ready for us to take off. Breakfast was included and it was a decent breakfast- pancakes/waffles, sausage, potatoes, eggs, cereal, and juice. The room was clean and had a fridge so we were able to store some fruits in their during our stay. Overall, very nice hotel during our stay with welcoming staff.

We arrived well before check in time and expected to check our luggage. To our surprise, Annabelle checked us in to a lovely room with a view of the beach and Diamond Head. We were given beach towels and referred to a local beach equipment place that was only a few minutes away from hotel. Was given the WiFi info and was told we could print all boarding passes right there in the lobby. Breakfast was wonderful, staff was fantastic and all just a five minute walk from the beach. The flat taxi rate to the airport was a pleasant surprise. Can't ask for much more. Had a wonderful stay. Highly recommend this hotel.

Perfect in every sense. Great staff clean rooms. The breakfast is awesome start for your day. Couldn't be happier. The pool was refreshing. Very close to the beach. Great views and the valet parking is very nice as well

Celebrating my 50" birthday on Oahu. After searching nice hotel we decided for Hyatts Place and that was a good choice. Just a block from the beach in a more quiet area than central Waikiki. The hotel is also close to the Kapionali Park, nice for good morning run. The hotel offers nice and delicious breakfast at patio. The service was excellent. Special thanks to the nice cleaning lady on 7th floor and excellent service at front desk Will definitely stay here again. A bit far away from Sweden unfortunately

When we arrived the staff made an error and charged the wrong card. It was resolved and we were upgraded to the 16th floor with great views. Thank you.The hotel room was huge with a very comfortable king size bed.Despite having a upset stomach from a prior trip in Grand Canyon, I managed to enjoy the breakfast. The staff were super friendly. The pool was nice, great gym and hotel. We would stay here again. Thank you :)

My partner and myself had a great stay here The rooms are kept very clean the staff are friendly and accommodating with all your needs Location is great really close to the beach and all shuttle busses for premium outlets etc stop right at the front breakfast is great everyday with a lot of different selection I highly recommend this place if you're planning a trip here

Lovely clean hotel within short walk to Waikiki beach and strips. Staff are amazingly friendly. Rooms are well appointed and clean. Breakfast option great considering it is free. Great value for money.

Running trails right outside in park, easy access to beach and all the shopping without the noise. Great complimentary breakfast, friendly staff, an Expedia expert in the lobby. Nice clean rooms great choice.

We got there a bit earlier than our check-in time but they still managed to give us a room that we preferred. Room was spotless everyday. Would recommend it to my family and friends, it's close to the beach and close to the waikiki trolley pick-up.

The hotel is very central and very close to the beach. Staff very friendly and room was clean. Great value for money. Hotel expedia representative very helpful with excursions and tours of the area and surrounding islands.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first part of our honeymoon. Heidi and Fernando were super friendly when we checked in and willing to help us find whatever we needed. Heidi was even able to upgrade our room after asking if we were celebrating anything special. All of the staff was very friendly no matter who we crossed paths with or talked to. Our room was amazing! We were on the 17th floor with a beautiful view of diamond head and the ocean. Breakfast does get crowded but I thought the food was good and you always have the option to take it back to your room if seating isn't available. We didn't use a car because the hotel is only a block from the beach and within walking distance of a lot of restaurants and shopping. If we come back to Waikiki we will definitely stay here again!!

while on honeymoon me and my wife stayed here during our final 3 nights in Hawaii. we did 8 nights on maui and 3 nights on Oahu at the Hyatt place in May. we stayed at the place because most of our stay we were away from the hotel and just used the place to sleep. we arrived at 1am with our rental car and paid the 30.00 a day fee for valet/parking.  I used the points I earned staying at the Hyatt andaz on Maui to pay for our 3 night stay. we were given a king partial ocean view on the 10th floor. the hotel and room was clean and fairly modern. a Hyatt place is generally a hotel someone on business would stay at so don't expect pools and spas etc. but this Hyatt place was better than some Hyatt places I've stayed. since we were here in the middle of May the hotel wasn't very busy (slow season)  we slept in every day except one and did the free breakfast, went down at 8ish and easily got a seat. the buffet is better than average for a free breakfast ( pancakes,sausage,bacon,waffle, French toast, ham, couple Asian choices, donuts, cereals, breads, muffins, oatmeal, orange juice, apple juice, milks, water, red juice, etc). the pool deck is where breakfast is served with many tables etc but if there is rain or it's very busy the hotel gives you trays so you can load up and enjoy breakfast in your room or your rooms balcony. I did not visit the gym at the hotel but heard it's nice. the hotel is only minutes walk from Waikiki Beach and the zoo.  during the day we explored Oahu and went to pearl harbor and explored and did activities. we even went to a indoor fun park called tikis I think, that was next to a movie theatre so we saw guardians of the Galaxy 2. the movie theatre validated parking so free parking. we also went to Kuala reserve where Jurassic Park was filmed and rode ATVs, went to a macadamia nut farm, chiefs luau, etc. imention this because all this was within 30-45 minutes by car. we didn't leave the hotel till 11a each day and didn't come back till 1am or later. we did utilize room service for some snacks and early meal a couple times. (I highly recommend one of their chocolate chip cookies and ask for it to be warned up....sooo good)!  my only negative was when we left each day sometimes it took awhile for the car to be brought around and I think this was because they only had 2/3 valets working.  next door to the hotel is dks steak house. make reservations and go hungry. they have dry aged steaks and sunset view dining of Waikiki Beach. either indoor or outdoor on patio deck. I recommend the chocolate bomb dessert. the hotel also has self service laundry but we didn't use that. the hotels bar is pretty good but there's plenty of hopping bars close by if that's your thing. anywhere you go if they have a drink called a lava flow you gotta try it. Hyatt regency on Oahu does it best imo.

This hotel is steps away from the beach, offers complimentary breakfast, and has a pool and 24hr gym. Housekeeping and front desk was always helpful and even gave us a complimentary upgrade which we were extremely grateful for. The hotel offers valet parking for $32 a night which seems a little steep so we parked at an alternate parking garage for cheaper. Overall, I would love to stay here again.

Let me begin by stating that we had a horrific experience in booking through hotels.com. They booked us a room in a difderent hotel and when we got there to check in found out no rooms were available at all. After waiting 5hrs in the hotel lobby where we did not have a room we were relocated to the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. When we got to the hotel, hotels.com did not upload a reservation at all. The Hyatt Place staff member Cole, stepped in and literally handled the situation which he was not obligated to do so. He saw how tired and frustrated we were and placed us in a room even though he did not have reservation in his system for us. He handled everything, from working with hotels.com to fix the errors they made to making sure everything with our stay was stress free. The rooms are quite spacious and clean, but the staff at this hotel is one that will leave a lasting impression on anyone who stays on the property. They treat you like family, call you by name, it's just put plain and simple: EXEMPLARY! Thank you Cole for taking such good care of us and making us feel like the only guests in the hotel during our stay

Great Waikiki location. Can walk to beach. Lobby and rooms are excellent and quite cozy. Pool area is tucked away between buildings, so not that exciting and needs some refurbishing on the deck area, but otherwise decent.

The staff of Hyatt house were friendly and helpful, from early check in, valet to reception, their customer service was always on point. My family and I enjoyed a stay action for my daughter's birthday and had an absolute blast. We would recommend Hyatt house to all of our family and friends with no hesitation.

The Hyatt Place is on Waikiki Beach one block from the beach. A very friendly staff who provide exceptional service to guests. They were always helpful in giving us tipsy us on how to see the numerous spots on the island. Very comfortable large rooms with again impeccable service. Breakfasts were exceptionally delicious and a wonderful way to start the day.

Totally enjoyed our stay.Great location, with the beach, zoo and aquarium just around the corner.Thumbs up for Robert (valet) and Matt (reception), for providing exemplary service to us, during our stay.Both guys are great ambassadors of Hyatt Place.In addition, the retail store at Hyatt Place sells affordable items at great prices.We would recommend this hotel for your stay at Oahu.

We had a staycation at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki, and had a great experience. The room was really nice, and all of the staff at this hotel were exceptional. They were so friendly and accommodating, had great attitudes, and made us feel very welcome. The breakfast was also pretty special, and not just a run of the mill continental breakfast. It was a full breakfast with natural ingredients like cage-free eggs to boot. Coupled with the really nice and spacious room that we had, this hotel provided us with a great stay!https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60982-d87040-r487583380-Hyatt_Place_Waikiki_Beach-Honolulu_Oahu_Hawaii.html#

When I was booking my trip, the fact that the Hyatt offered a full breakfast sealed the deal for me. But what will keep me coming back is the incredible customer service we received from the moment we arrived until the day we checked out. Everyone went above and beyond in ensuring that our needs were met and our questions answered. I can't say enough about how much my children and I enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Pros- Location: At the bottom of Waikiki Beach so you avoid much of the central Waikiki traffic. You are a one block walk from the beach with a convenience store on the way so you can get water and knick knacks before you hit the strip. - Free breakfast: Good selection of food that changes slightly every day. Food is expensive in Hawaii so it is nice to at least get one filling free meal a day.- Room service: The menu prices are very reasonable, the selection is decent, and it is 24/7, so what more can you ask?- Staff: Everyone is very nice and attentive. Had a kind bartender (Nick?) that chatted up my husband and me one night.Cons- Location: No view because you are a block from the strip.- Free breakfast: It is a madhouse because it is free... So many people...- 20th Floor Room: Not sure if this is an issue in other areas of the hotel but our room was a wind tunnel. We had to put a towel at the base of the door every night to muffle the sound of the wind because it kept waking our son. - Pool: It is very small. I think it was put there so the hotel could say it has a pool. I doubt anyone uses it.

This hotel is very luxurious for the location, service and price. The staff was so friendly and helpful. When we checked in, Mailie knew it was our anniversary and said she wanted to check into upgrading our room because she wanted our anniversary to be special. We had a VIP room on the 16 floor! We told the concierge that we wanted a good happy hour place and he sent us just two blocks up to the beach to the Tiki Restaurant which was just perfect for us. The breakfast is plentiful and well organized despite the number of guests. I can't imagine paying more for a hotel when this met all of our needs.

We loved our stay at the Hyatt Place Hotel. Information pack in the room would be an extra help. For example. any local events and shuttle services available from the hotel. We will definitely recommend the hotel to friends and will return ourselves.

This is a great property. They offer a really hearty complimentary breakfast and no resort fee. Clean, quiet property, very friendly staff and great overall experience. I strongly recommend this hotel.

I stayed 3 days at Hyatt Place in Waikiki on vacation. The checking was great. I was warmly greeted by hotel receptionist Cole and I got a very nice room. Hotel location is excellent only a short block from the beach. Hotel pool was small so I went to the beach. I was provided beach towels. The beach was clean and warm.Staff are really helpful and friendly. Cole , Dino, and Lei were very helpful.On Saturday I visited KCC Farmers Market near Diamond Head a short ride with public bus. It was an amazing experience. I purchased ripe tropical fruits and food.The bus stop is at the corner of hotel and found very convenient to go to any where in the Island including Down Town Honolulu, and Alamoana shopping center. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

We really are enjoying our stay at this hotel! Check in was a breeze. Heidi made sure of it! We are celebrating several milestones this year with this vacation and they even sent us a bottle of champagne to say Aloha! Room stays clean, bed and pillows are comfortable. Some of the other buildings near you are a bit run down but Ocean view is still worth it! Short walk to not only the beach but tons of eateries and shopping. Trust me when I say you won't be in your hotel room much, but when you are, you are taken care of here!

Booked on Expedia at a good price for a king ocean view (top floor). Room had nice view over water, modernised compared to many other buildings in vicinity. Clean and comfortable. Easy walk to Waikiki beach. Waikele outlet bus stops right outside and pink trolley to Ala Moana also stops nearby. I found it to be a mid range hotel, very well done.

Stayed here during the Easter weekend. The hotel is located about 2 minutes walking distance from the southern end of Waikiki beach and a mile or so from Diamond Head crater. Nice clean room and friendly staff. Good breakfast but minimal, not much choice for vegetarians. The overall experience was quite pleasant.

The Hyatt Place was a wonderful stay. We were on the 16th floor of the tower and had a view of Diamond Head and the beach. Just a short walk to the water and businesses.. The free breakfast was very good and there was no resort fee which most hotels in the area charge.The staff was wonderful. Heidi and Ikaika were especially friendly and helpful and made our anniversary trip very special.

Once the hotel knew it was our honeymoon we were served with more attention and all was clean when the rooms were cleaned during the day! Great places to walk for lunch and or did we, perfect spot to walk to see the sunset.

Excellent hotel! Great staff,quiet rooms and phenomenal location. Parking lot across the street is cheaper then hotel parking though. We would definitely stay here again. Breakfast buffet was also a huge plus!

We recently stayed at the Hyatt for a quick overnight stay on our way to Ko Olina. Beautiful hotel, very short walk to the beach. Excellent service. We requested an ADA room and they provided a large, comfortable room. Service here is excellent. My husband is a Hyatt member, which ups our benefits somewhat, but truly they're standout for everyone. We did have a room on a busy street, so there was quite a bit of street noise. Didn't bother us, but if you're picky about that kind of thing, inquire about your room location on check in. Beds are to die for comfortable. The hotel is located at the Diamondhead end of the strip and is a couple blocks from the beach. Easy walk. They provide a great breakfast (please start offering cream instead of liquid coffee mate for creamer) served outdoors. We didn't use the pool, but it's small. You're in Hawaii, go to the beach! We love it here and will always stay when in Waikiki. Oh! And, another positive....no resort fee!!

The Hyatt Place was a wonderful stay nice room very clean . The staff for everything was friendly and was able to take care of everything we asked . The Price was reasonable and only a short drive to go to the Airport .They have a good breakfast for their guess to top it off .

We spent 2 nights in Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach after arriving to Honolulu and before heading to North Shore. Nice tidy hotel only a block away from the beach - few minute walk.Location was excellent - just outside the business area, but still only short walk away. Restaurants, shopping, beach all nearby.Hotel staff was very friendly and we felt welcome from the moment we stepped in.Nothing fancy, nothing missing. Met all expectations. For a family on travel, the self service laundry was excellent. Only a few bucks and half and hour and all traces of adventures were gone before the next day.

This hotel is conveniently located just 2 blocks from the beach and was great for our Family of 6. The staff was great and the rooms were clean and in great condition. We did not enjoy the breakfast because it was extremely busy, and the food was mediocre. I would stay at this hotel again, close to the beach, the zoo, aquarium and so much more. Overall a great experience.

The Hotel was ok but it doesn't live up to the Hyatt brand. Elevators and breakfast dining area needs updating. Breakfast options are limited. Staff are friendly. The location is great, quiet end of Waikiki beach and within walking distance to most things.

Definitely recommend this hotel as a value for money option. Hotel staff are exceptionally friendly and nothing is too much for them. Good location and amenities are adequate. I would recommend this hotel to anybody seeking a value for money option and I would stay here again.

The Hyatt place was a great hotel it was centrally located to restaurants and clubs, and only one block walk to the beach. Bus stops for the tour buses and city buses were also one block away. The staff was outstanding one In particular was Lei at the front desk.

Hotel was very central to all the restaurants and clubs, and was one block from the beach. Was also convenient to both the tour bus stops and city bus stops. Hotel staff was very professional and willing to help you at all times.

I like that this hotel was near the zoo and aquarium. Almost everywhere in Waikiki is still walking distance. You would need to drive to Ala Moana mall. It has a nice sunrise view if your room faces the north side.

The Hyatt Place in Waikiki is a great hotel with friendly staff. We enjoyed one week stayed, the king size bed was comfortable, hot breakfast every morning which located on the 3rd floor. Only a couple minutes walk to the Kuhio beach on the Kalakaua Ave., and many restaurants are on that same street.

While the rooms were clean and fairly recently updated, they still held the outdated feel at the core. The artwork was definitely recycled from pre-reno. According to some friends, the room was a decent size compared to other properties. The hotel is not on the beach; it is across the street from the beach. The beach is very narrow, so there wouldn't be room for the property. It was a very short walk. The location was great. Walking distance to pretty much anything on the main strip. The pool was way too small. By 10am, there were enough people in it to make you not want to go in. By 2pm, the pool was overflowing with children and adults to the point where water was splashing out constantly. The pool bar was outdated. We didn't even bother to stop for a cocktail. The lobby was outdated, though it was nice that they had a local market inside the mall you could walk through, that set up a couple days a week -- so that was very convenient. The elevator situation is horrendous. Not enough, and inefficient elevators for the number of rooms.

Great hotel with super service and amenities. Staff was very courteous and they even offered water at check in and also at check out. A call came in from Hotel management in our room after we checked in about - if every thing is ok in the room! Great breakfast. This is called service.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki for 6 nights. It was very close to the beach and main street alongside Waikiki Beach. The service was wonderful - if we asked for something like more coathangers or shampoo it arrived at the room minutes later. We had lunch there a couple of times and the pizza was fantastic - also we shared a salad and they were thoughtful enough to put it into 2 bowls! The breakfast was not as good as we had anticipated as some items didn't appear every day. The bananas were marvellous but weren't on every day. As it was included in the room rate there was not much to complain about. The self-serve laundry was useful. We went on a couple of coach tours and the pickup was right opposite the hotel so that was good. We had a top floor room with an ocean view. All in all very satisfied and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again or in any similar Hyatt hotel.

Great hotel and staff. We had to check in early in the morning and they were very helpful in getting us into a room. The front desk person, Leisina T., was a pleasure to work with. She was very friendly and professional.

Great hotel. Parking is very much needed. Why even have public parking just for the day time and no overnight parking except for valet? Besides that the hotel stay was very great. I'll recommend to family

We enjoyed a lot, by staying at Hyatt, having a free full breakfast, friendly service, very comfortable bed, on site swimming pool and very close to Waikiki beach and eating places. Walking distance to major activity centers surrounded by excellent neighborhood

All the staff at the Hyatt were very nice and super cool and they made my stay at the Hyatt Place a wonderful experience. I would definitely recommend this place to her people. Although it hasn't been updated in a while how are the staff make up for it and I really had a great time!

Having read previous reviews on this hotel, we were a bit apprehensive to book, however we went ahead with the booking and it could not have been more different from other reviewers. We found the breakfast offerings to be more than adequate, the hotel is only a 2-3 minute walk to the beach and nearby parks to have a picnic lunch or just relax. Will definitely stay again.

Here on business. Comfortable enough, very helpful and friendly staff, good location, clean but not that interesting if you are looking for anything close to a local experience. Two blocks from beach and all that is Waikiki. Beware of the street noise - I had difficulty getting a good night's sleep after spending several days in the peace of more rural Hawaii.

Great Location! Near the beach and freeway access. Very good morning breakfast and food was always fresh. I would like to know the brand of beds being used. It was the most comfortable sleep I have had in a long time!

We received a beautiful room with a view on the 17th floor. It was our 40th anniversary and we were given a nice bolttle of wine. We have been members of Hyatt for many years. The breakfast was very nice outside near the pool. They had a nice selection of fruit, yogurt, eggs, pancakes, bacon and cereals, juice and coffee. Only one block from Waikiki beach. Good location.

Great price and well located. Bus stop literally across the road from hotel which provides convenience to visit all tourist attractions. Close to local take out and amenities. Efficient and affordable on site laundry facilities.

My Hyatt Credit card makes our travels to Honolulu from Kauai a breeze. Great service and comfort are consistent. Why stay anywhere else? I like the location because we can use Ala Wai to head West and Kahului to hear East

We recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach and really enjoyed our accommodations.Our room (11th floor ) was quite spacious and had views of the ocean. The room included buffet breakfast that was tasty and abundant.Very close to the tour pickup spots as well as the local bus.Will definitely stay here again!

I have been staying at this hotel for more than 3 years now. It is the best for location, friendly staff, room quality. I would promote it so much more but then if it gets too popular, I would have to find a new place to stay. If you are a simple person, like genuine staff, and keeping it real. Stay here.

I was at the hotel for a work week. There were large group conventions during my visit, but the staff seemed to handle them very well. No unhappy faces! Everything in the hotel was clean and comfy. Staff were very friendly, professional and helpful.
user_name:
Sandra H
San Francisco, United States

review_body: Hotel is in very good condition and staff friendly. The price I paid was good considering how expensive Waikiki hotels are. There is no self parking so, be ready to pay $32 for valet. Location is close to the beach but most restaurants are west of it since the Hyatt is one block from the zoo.
user_name:
Jose S L
fishers, United States

review_body: Staff was very accommodating and friendly! Good location (near Waikiki beach, close to restaurants, good breakfast). The hotel room was clean and comfortable. I have no complaints! It was a great deal!!

We have a wonderful room with all the amenities we could ever want. Our housekeeper (Leonita) does an amazing job of keeping it clean daily and being pleasant and cheerful everytime she sees us. We have breakfast every morning included with our stay, the food is delicious and there is a whole lot to choose from. Awesome gym with cardio machines and free weights. Clean and bright lobby, close to the beach, amazing and helpful front desk that give us free towels daily. Love this place!

The hotel is in a great location but there are a couple other hotels in front of it which partially narrow or block your ocean view. Also the elevators are incredibly slow so get a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor where you can use the stairs. Overall though friendly staff and very well kept. If the view isn't a huge factor for you then this is a great option.

This hotel was amazing! It was next door to parking, had a great continental breakfast, walking distance to the beach, and was close to all the pick-up locations for our activities. The elevator was slow sometimes, but with lots of people staying there, it's understandable.

Enjoyed my second stay here as much as the first time. This hotel is conveniently close to the tidal pools, swimming beach, beachfront bars and restaurants, trolley stops, ABC Stores, and a laundromat. Tours pick up and drop off at the Marriot across the road so you don't need to get to another location which is a big plus as some start early in the morning. Airport shuttles pick up and drop off. Balcony rooms, beach towels at reception, and free wifi throughout the hotel, not only in the room. Computers available for guest use in the lobby. Inclusive breakfast isn't the flashiest, but offers a variety including fresh fruit and eastern cuisine. Lack of cover for breakfast at the pool deck can be a problem. Overall, a good value, pet friendly family hotel.

Out of all the chain hotels, it is in my eyes ranked on the bottom tier. The clientele obviously are looking for value than extravagance. Comfort - 3 This hotel is weathered and customers don't care to keep it clean. Location - 3 On the very end of the "strip" and there are way too many tours leaving from the front of the hotel that just builds congestion. Misc - 4Staff is great but it just can not make up for the lacking aspects of this hotelThere are other options that gives a better "vacation" feel. Sorry guys, won't return here

Stayed with my family for just under a week and absolutely loved this hotel! Pool was on the smaller side but no other downside to our stay here with our 3 kids. The aloha Friday lei making was a hit!

Just returned home from a lovely stay in this hotel. Our 25th anniversary was our trip we saved for. This hotel gave such good value and service. A quick walk to the beach and resturants. Breakfast was good and simple. Staff so helpful. A big thank you to annabelle at reception. We would love to come back and enjoy your ohana again. Hopefully not taking another 25 years.

Accommodations were adequate although room a bit noisy (wind!, drain girgles, fan). Used earplugs. Close to beach, and they loan you towels etc. Free breakfast saved us some money and was middle of what we have experienced elsewhere. Not as good as the best we had in Greece and Canada and not as bad as a basic budget US hotel that gives you premade mystery meat breakfast sandwhiches and a boiled egg. Main areas and bathrooms a little tired. Front lobby needs update, but not enough to knock the rating down. Good value for money in Waikiki.

Hyatt Place is located one block away from Waikiki Beach in a great location. My room was spacious and had a beautiful view of the water. The beds were comfortable and the staff was friendly. The AC unit worked great in the room perfect for those hot humid days in Hawaii.

Friendly staff very helpful. Room was noisy from the a/c unit. Food could be better. There were long delays getting the car ar certain times. The hotel was clean, he rooms were very clean. The bar tender Nick was outstanding.

Annabelle from reception and coffeeshop is the best quality customer service we had the fortune to meet here at Hyatt Place Waikiki. Most of the staff are really friendly and the place though sparse is clean. We would be looking forward to coming back here.

First trip to Hawaii and I had to remind myself this is one of our states, not a foreign country. I expected for the price of my travel package that I would have a mediocre hotel and breakfast buffet. I was pleasantly surprised by the very clean, modern, and well appointed hotel premises. The staff upon arrival was welcoming and helpful. We received a free upgrade that we requested before travel, so started off on a positive note. The staff is well trained to make the guest feel they are the only one they are assisting. I even extended my stay a few days since I felt secure and well taken care of. This was the best travel experience I have had so far due to proximity to the beach, freshly prepared and varied breakfast buffet, clean and comfy room, and friendly atmosphere. This for a great price on top of it all would make me want to return and recommend this fine hotel to others.

I would have rated this hotel three and a half stars normally but I am giving it four stars mostly because of location. I like Hyatt Place hotels because they offer suites with 3 beds - which is perfect for our family of 5. Hotel amenities are good - pool is on the small side but the breakfast is above average with some different choices every day. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Valet parking was over thirty dollars per day - seemed a bit excessive for hotel guests. Best thing about the hotel is the location. It is at one end of the Waikiki beachwalk - and only two blocks from the beach. This means you are a bit away from the most of the noise and traffic but close enough to walk to the beach with small children. The beach close by has a sea-wall protecting it so the bigger waves won't sweep your little ones out to sea. For those looking for the waves they are just steps away as well. Honolulu Zoo is two blocks away as well. There is a convenience store (ABC) just down the street for incidental items/food you may need. Restaurants nearby and lots of shopping along the beachwalk. Hotel supplies guests with beach towels at front desk - so you don't have to bring our own.
