Pleasant stay at the Hyatt, booked two rooms for 6 adults ended up on different floors which was annoying, staff didn't really bother to upgrade or offer anything else. Since there were three males and three females we didn't fuss too much and separated.Rooms were average, shower pressures were low in one room.Room service was okay, there would be days we'd come back in the evening and the room wasnt serviced which was sort of annoying, im guessing we stayed for 6 nights so they only bothered on every second day. Had to call reception for towels every second day.Breakfast was average

The free breakfast was on the patio beside the pool. Birds were all over the place. As someone got up, the birds would land on the tables and eat crumbs that were there. To me, it was very unsanitary.

Hotel is great location close to Waikiki. View out of room balcony was of beach-beautiful view. Do have to pay for parking at nearby parking garage-would be nice if $20/day rate was discounted for hotel guests.

Had the choice between here or the Marriott across the street, so glad I picked Hyatt! The good- breakfast excellent! Full layout of fresh toast, eggs, oatmeal, etc! Even Miso soup! Location was a plus for me, maybe less than 1.5 blocks to beach but away from the craziness from the main Waikiki strip. Beautiful lobby outside to relax. Cookies in the lobby are a must!!Free beach towel to use during your stay. Stay attentive and hotel is clean.The bad-- not sure if it was just our room but as soon as we checked into our room there was an overwhelming "old carpet smell" ... either they need to be replaced or shampoo'd heavily. Other than that, no other complaints.Will definitely be staying here again!

We were really happy with the hotel and staff. Great people - good location. Hotel could do with new lick of paint here and there but still good condition. Breakfast was ok - could do little better on the variety side - but its not a major complaint - just an observation.

This is a great hotel in Waikiki. The rooms are very clean and modern looking. Breakfast is delicious and there are a lot of options. It's just 1 block away from the beach. I would definitely recommend it.
user_name:
Hm515
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My stay at the Hyatt place was enjoyable thanks great staff and clean room with a real Hawaiian feel. The breakfast was very good my kids enjoyed it a lot and the #4 coffee helped wake me up. Our view of the ocean was exceptional along with a small view of diamond head. The location made it so my activities planned were accessible. If visiting Waikiki the Hyatt Place is where i would say is the place to stay.

Great place to stay, nice and close to the beach. Staff are really friendly and breakfast is included in your stay. Our room was massive and has a great view of Diamond head. Breakfast was a mixture of cereals, fruit and cooked with hot and cold drinks. Would go back in a heart beat.

Great mid-sized hotel on the end of Waikiki about 1 block from the beach. This was our first time at the property and we were happy with the accommodations and loved the location. There's a hearty breakfast each morning from 6:30am - 9:30am. The hotel is very close to the Honolulu Zoo and beaches across the park. It's actually a bit less crowded at this end of Waikiki which was perfect for us.

Stayed here for 2 nights using free night certificates. It’s a solid hotel and a good value. We were upgraded to an 11th floor ocean view, which was nice but the apartments in front of us were 11 floors as well so you had to look in between buildings to see the ocean. (I will take the free upgrade still though!) a few blocks from the beach and lots of shops and restaurants all around. They do provide beach towels to take to the beach. They are lots of hotels nearby so the beach that’s closest is pretty crowded. The pool on the 3rd floor is just ok, pretty small. This is also where the free breakfast is. While it was sufficient, it was nothing great and all the seating was outside. But there was a tray in our room to take back upstairs. Hyatt was nice and even at the standard rate would be a good price. I don’t know if I would stay here again as I would want more resort luxuries (which comes with a price though)

The room, staff, and breakfast were amazing. This is the perfect vacation spot. This is a hotel no one would regret booking. The staff work around your schedule and personalize your stay. The stay was impeccable and made a perfect vacation!!! I highly recommend this hotel.

Great hotel and staff that value you as a customer! General manager was extremely helpful and does what it takes for you to enjoy your stay. This hotel was very clean and maintained very well. If your looking for a great hotel in Waikiki look no further!!!

Great staff - very welcoming and great hospitality. The room was beautiful and very comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was wonderful, with lots of great choices, and some different items on a daily basis. The only problem we had was at check-out with the gift card that we were using to pay for the stay not working correctly and it took seven days to get a resolution to that issue. Otherwise, this is a wonderful location and great hotel to stay at.

We came all the way from New Jersey to visit the island for the first time, and received an outstanding service from Matt at the front desk. Upon our arrival, we were assigned the room we had paid for in advance, but felt that the room was rather small, and the sofa bed (for our 16 y/o teenager) was very narrow (1 person space as opposed to three persons); not what was showed in the pictures (the pictures displayed a sofa bed triple that size), prior to booking the room. We expressed said concern to Matt at the front desk, who immediately took care of us, by finding us a much larger and more comfortable room ..without any additional cost! We felt that Matt cared about us enjoying our stay, and we observed many surrounding happy customers, feeling comfortable and cared for. Thank you again Matt for your help, time and care! 5 stars, thank you !

Always stay with The Hyatt Place for my traveling needs and The Waikiki Hyatt lived up to all I expect from Hyatt. No resort fee and free breakfast was a plus. Looking forward to our next stay here with this property. Aloha!

This hotel is just a couple of blocks from everything, shopping, dinning and the beach. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful and went above and beyond to make sure your stay was what you expected.
user_name:
Missy B
Richfield, Minnesota, United States

review_body: Overall this hotel is small but absolutely lovely. It's the perfect spot for any couple just looking for a nice relaxation. Location is at the end of Waikiki so you have everything ahead of you to look towards! For sure you're gonna love the bed the most

We stayed at this hotel for four nights. While the staff was friendly and the place was clean and relatively quiet, it was nothing special. The hotel needs amenities and upgrades. The pool is very small and not in a good location. The breakfast food was OK but you have to fight off the birds and very windy conditions. This would not be a family friendly location. Just OK if you need a place to sleep.

Not really soundproof rooms, so traffic in the morning will wake you if you are in the lower levels. Large spacious room and breakfast was alright. Very helpful and friendly staff. Very close to beach and restaurants.

Very nice and the staffs were very friendly. Only wish there was a microwave in the room. Hands down this is a 10. Will recommend to friends and family. Breakfast was a little less variety then what I expected but it was okay. Next trip I will definitely stay here again.

It's very convenient to the beach, quiet and safe to walk around. Nice and friendly staff. Free beeakfast, also have a tray in the room for you if you want to have breakfast in the room which is a very good idea. My son loved it.

The location of this hotel is great. Beach is close by as is shopping/cafes etc. The staff is the reason this place is worth it. They are friendly, helpful and they really go out of their way to meet your needs almost anticipating what you need before you ask. This is truly one of the personal hotel stays I have ever had. Complimentary breakfast is also a nice touch.

Friendly staff, was able to get a free upgrade, so don't be afraid to ask when you check-in. Clean hotel. Beach is a 3-4minute walk. Perfect location, away from the busy sidewalks of Waikiki. Room was very clean, sheets fresh, slept very well on extremely comfortable beds.

Nice clean close to the beach helpful staff and walking distance to restaurants shops hotel can also be reach by local bus from the airport 5$ for my daughter her friend and myself, you can't beat that in a city that is very expensive, small pool but with a beach like Waikiki who needs a pool

There's a variety of hotel to stay in Waikiki , with beach front views , but Hyatt place Waikiki has everything and more than you need and also the breakfast is amazing , the two assistant managers and all staff members will treat you with a five star accommodations and service . There are people that complain about there rooms and view , and the real answer to there comments are you need to pay for an upgrade , it's very cheap to upgrade and I stayed in the 14 story tower with the ocean front view , it came with 2 queen beds and a sofa twin bed and a single sofa bed , and the room was very. Wry clean and huge ! Also everything is within walking distance . You can try other hotels but this hotel has everything you will need and more , other hotels you are paying for things you don't need , at the Hyatt place Waikiki you get the best stay and price is absolutely perfect . Also they provide you with pool and beach towels .

Only gripe was that housekeeping service was a little slow. Probably due to the high volume of guests during our stay. Also wish that there was a hot tub. Other than that, staff was nice. Great lobby environment. ABC (convenient) store next door. There is a bus depot across the street (Marriott) for tours. You will most likely be the last pick up and drop off for any tours that have big buses. Had an ocean view room. There were some buildings in the way but might be better to stay on the Diamondhead side. Wi-Fi connection everywhere in the hotel. This hotel is up to date with security measures for the elevator, rooms, and lobby restrooms. That, meaning you need to have your card key. Decent gym. Laundry room takes credit card, which was very convenient. There is also a local expert Expedia worker in the lobby. The Waikiki strip is only a mile so walking to any Waikiki places was easy or you can just Uber/Taxi it. Breakfast buffet was pretty good.

We were a family of five with teenage kids and stayed in a family room for 5 nights (Apr 14-19 2017). The room was spacious enough not to be on top of each other, not the we spent a great deal of time in the room as there was so much to do. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel clean and neat. The hotel is located at the southern end of Waikiki but only a short walk to shopping, restraints and beach (for those with little ones the closest beach has a sea wall so no waves). Also close to bus stops if you don't have a car so it's pretty easy to get to those places further out.Breakfast was an included buffet style and interestingly on the pool deck. Only a couple of tables were undercover with a few large umbrellas covering a few others. So not sure how it would go if it was raining but we didn't have that issue. It can be quite busy and the service areas aren't overly large when there are a lot of people be patient.We only had breakfast at the hotel. If you want to save a few dollars we found an awesome place near the hotel that we went to a couple of times. Walk out of the hotel and turn left towards the beach, about a block down turn left on Lemon Rd and go to the Waikiki Beachside Kitchen at the backpackers. They do fantastic plates and burgers for $5-$8. Again if it's busy you will need patience as there is only one person serving and cooking and it might take a little while to get ready but it is simple/great food cheap.Overall a great place to stay.

Upon arrival staff was exceptional in greeting, checking and seeing to our needs. They continued throughout our stay. Loved the singers by the elevator, the male singer has a super personality!(Which my wife loved). The breakfast was the best I ever had. Location is awesome, love the ABC stores and shopping walking distance. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends!Mahalo

Relaxed Friendly Happy HelpfulChill & SmilingSuper location away from busy busy but accessible walking distance everywhereRelaxing place to return to after day at beach or sightseeing.Will definitely return

Staff is very friendly, cleaned hospital, the breakfast is very good great lobby with a bar to enjoy a lovely drinks. They have agent on site that we can book tours this is very helpful specially when you are from other state

I stayed for 3 days and 2 nights and the service was good. The rooms are nice and clean. The breakfast was good. The workers are kind and nice. I will highly recommend this hotel to my friends becuase the service are really good.

Hotel is awesome and amazing staff. Was there on vacation with mother for 5 days. Excellent ocean room view. Breakfast was good. Very clean hotel with walking distance to beach and shopping. I recommend

I love staying at the Hyatt Place! Not only is the staff amazing people, clean and comfortable rooms, and beautifully decorated, they also have breakfast included!! I used to stay at the Hyatt Regency, but found that I prefer the staff here! The location is great for me, it's not directly in all of Waikiki traffic, but still walking distance to tons of things!

Rooms at this Hyatt Place are half the size of other Hyatt place hotels. The Hotel lobby is very nice but rooms are bad. The AC in the room was not working and engineer could not make it work. No room switch compensation offered by the front desk. This stay changed my perception of Hyatt Place

Free hot breakfast every day; the staff was very friendly. On our last day we had a late flight out and they extended our check out to 1 PM and offered a hospitality room for us to freshen up and rest prior to our flight. Short walk to beach, shops and all that Waikiki has to offer.

Our stay was above perfect. Staff were very friendly. Each morning at the breakfast Mary Jane would help us out so much (as both our children are celiac) my whole family loved seeing her each morning. During the morning breakfast Craig would interact with my children and brought them hot chocolate and the loved that. Each morning the front desk had towels ready for people to head to the beach. Our room was very clean everyday we arrived back from the beach. All the staff always asked us how our day was and asked how our stay was. When we come back to Waikiki I would stay again no question.
We love everything about the hotel!Breakfast is free from 6:30am-9:30 am.We had 2 rooms next to each other withmy family and it was so convenient. Security is Great and all the staff was soFriendly!

This is a great property with a great staff and an excellent location in Waikiki. My room was very clean and the breakfast buffet was well stocked with plenty of options. The staff was very welcoming and was always eager to go above and beyond what was being asked of them.
user_name:
David Russell R
Spring, United States

review_body: Recently stayed at this hotel for a week in March 2017, was very impressed with this hotel and would stay again here in the future. We arrived at the hotel check early in the morning after being a long international flight and was well welcomed by the staff, who was able to check us in early and allowed us to have complementary breakfast. Room was a little bit smaller than I had expected but had everything we required and was clean. Daily included breakfast was a plus but found there was not much variety and got messy pretty quick in the area. Hotel was central and easy walk to the beach, shops, zoo and public transport. Pool was well sheltered and temperature was great for cooling off after a hot day out and about. 24/7 galley cafe had good food options which could be purchased for room service and was well priced. Would highly recommend this hotel to future travelers to the area.

First stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki. Other than the slow valet experience on Friday, the Front Desk and Housekeeping team provided great customer service and hospitality throughout our stay. I thought the hotel was strangely placed, but it's actually quite a convenient walk to the zoo, some bars and restaurants, Waikiki Beach, the International Marketplace, and the Waikiki Trade Center. Lots of ABC Stores nearby to grab some snacks. Definitely considering staying at this hotel again!

Centrally located if you like the hustle and bustle of a city, great service with very polite and friendly staff, quite clean and tidy. Moreover, everybody was really helpful and was willing to assist us with anything we needed. However, breakfast was quite poor.

Checked in with Christopher at front desk and was very nice and helpful. My room was very comfortable and clean and I was able to rest up for my flight the next day. The complimentary breakfast is great especially when traveling with the whole family. Can't wait to stay at this hotel again. This is my favorite Hyatt .

My family and I love this place. Walk to the beach and wonderful surfing. Family and kid friendly with the warmest and most friendly staff. Great breakfast included and really clean and well appointed rooms. I was so pleasantly surprised with my overall wonderful experience.

My family and I came to Honolulu to participate on the Hapalua Half-marathon 2017. We chose this hotel because of its location to Waikiki beach, plus it was going to be only walking distance, start/finish line, to the race. The check-in process was very pleasant, Jade helped us and she was very friendly. We booked an ocean-view room and she gave us a room on the 12th floor and when we got to our room, there was an unexpected surprise, Jade had delivered cookies and refreshment to our room to welcome us to Hawaii..We definitely are coming back to this hotel. We loved personal touches and the staff at this hotel go above and beyond customer service. Thank you!! Jade and the whole staff at the Hyatt Place you are all an asset to this hotel. My family and I appreciate your service, THANK YOU! for making our Hawaiian holiday and unforgettable memory.

Always a wonderful stay when we're in town (usually every month). Won't ever go anywhere else! Staff always remembers us and our preferences, rooms are clean and close enough to walk the strip. 5 stars!

Had a wonderful experience again at this property. Have stayed here a few times and our only complaint was the breakfast but this time the food was great. Will definitely be back at this property again in the future.

Excellent hotel with a great location! Bar options are excellent with a solid happy hour They will also lend you towels to take to the beach which is a thoughtful option Greeting as you arrive is always excellent

Excellent stay room was clean, old building but kept up. Excellent comfortable bed and great pillow. Only downer was the safe was broke, unuseable. One of the buttons was missing, I'm sure another renter had told them t was unuseable, no matter sure if they fixed it

It was my 40th birthday and this was the best place to celebrate and hotel staff and room very clean and nice View from our Balcony was excellent .All the attractions are so close to this hotel and food is really good too

Don't stay at this hotel unless you want your processions stolen from your hotel room when you are out! My family traveled from Australia to celebrate my 60th birthday in February 2017. We were there for a week. My engagement ring was taken from my hotel room during one of the days we were out and never found. I informed reception and had to ask to put a report in and speak to the housekeeping manager. I felt like we were just going through the motions. My daughter's partner's hat also disappeared from their room when we were out. Nothing was done to find it. We all came home very upset. We would never stay in this hotel again.

It was only a one night stay so this will be short and sweet. The place, though tucked on a corner on a side street near the beak in Waikiki, was clean, inviting and the staff were very nice, genuine smiles and rapid service all around. The room was a lot more than expected, even for the price, large, warm bed, large screen HDTV, free wifi, great lighting, excellent service on the hotel phone for any questions, mini bar, mini coffee machine, comphy couch, good bathroom amenities and heck, there was even an auto single use program coded safe in the closet for anything precious as well as complimentary dry cleaning services in hotel if needed too, I was honestly very pleased by all the services available, 24hr bar and kitchen too, though I didn't use it then, I definitely would on a longer stay. Everything made me want to do said longer stay so yeah, I definitely recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki for anyone visiting Hawaii! Mahalo and aloha! J-F Masson

Was very surprised and pleased by the exceptional service and the overall quality of the hotel. It was a great experience, and the service, room appointments, and food were all great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an awesome, affordable stay in Waikiki.

We stayed for 2 nights before our cruise. Great hotel. Great location. Very close to the beach and shopping. Walkable to the beach. Excellent healthy and warm breakfast included with the rooms. Lots of fresh fruits. Very reasonable rates.

Nice location. Very friendly staff, especially the concierge. My wife, my daughter and I stayed at The Hyatt Place hotel in Waikiki on our vacation for the first time in Hawaii and we had a wonderful time at this hotel.

Nice family friendly hotel that has everything you need for a budget friendly price. The breakfast was good too with many choices and daily changes to the menu. The hotel staff was awesome and brought us extra towels upon arrival. It was close to everything!

Lei and Justin are such incredible employees. They deserved to be recognized! It's our first time in Hawaii and they made sure our stay is a memorable one. Will definitely stay here again and I highly recommend this place

The wife and I chose this hotel for our honeymoon. It's about a hundred meters from the beach. The service is great we can't complain about that. It's close to everything that you need. The rooms are nice but not that big. Have stayed in better hotels before and I think it's quite expensive but I think that's the case everywhere in Waikiki. All in all a good hotel.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place in Honolulu. It is only about a 3 minute walk to the beach. The staff was wonderful. The room was clean. We really appreciated the cold bottles of water we received as we checked in. We loved the breakfast. We have a very picky eater and even he found things he loved to eat! Great hotel for a family to stay in! Staff are wonderful!

We stayed at the Hyatt Place during spring break with my children's High School band and it was wonderful. The rooms were spacious and clean. The breakfast every morning was outstanding and so much to choose from.

We stayed at Hyatt place for a week. The staff were very courteous and it's proximity to beach is a plus point(200 steps) all the shopping centers are walkable distance. Free breakfast is high light of this hotel

So refreshing to walk into and to be greeted by such wonderful staff, like Matt!! Matt made our vacation and stay at Hyatt Place even more amazing! Very nice and open and welcoming!! From the rooms, to the bar, to the staff.. All GREAT

Great place to stay , fast check in and i was surprised when told I was given an upgrade :) , Staff are very friendly and helpful , loved the Expedia Tour desk and the many options for day tours even to the other Hawaiian Islands. Loved the 24 hr restaurant with reasonable prices ! Close to the beach and shops , only negative was the free breakfast ... would have liked a bit more variety in choice of food but that's just me. There are plenty of restaurants close by for your choosing to have a big breakfast.

Close to beach, on quiet end of strip, bus stop outside door. Lovely staff, excellent housekeeping. Nice rooms with new furnishings- a little small but livable. Skillet kitchen a little hit and very busy.

Great staff and great location. About a 10-15min walk can take you to great local restaurants and shopping. Hotel room was comfortable and breakfast was good (but lacking in variety). Great stay for the price.

I was really disappointed with this hotel. We paid extra for a double Queen ocean view room and I can honestly say the room looked a lot more "tired" than the pictures would lead you to believe. For me there was no "wow" factor. We were treated i would say "average" at best on check in. No smiles, or happy welcome greeted us. They weren't rude but they weren't overly friendly either! I thought this was a 3 star hotel at best. The breakfast selection was very small. 3/4 hot items, toast, fruit, cereal, coffee, tea, juice. Not the normal buffet breakfast I am used to when checking into hotels. the pool area is not inviting. Its all concrete and needs some plants! I wouldnt want to sit and drink cocktails by this pool.

I couldn't have been more happy with the location. It had low traffic and a very short walk to the beach!! The hotel was always clean!!!! The staff was wonderful and polite; we felt very welcomed. Breakfast was delicious everyday we were there!! We enjoyed eating outside on the deck. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!! Can't wait for the next visit!!

Short walk from the lobby to the room. The exercise room is spacious but does not have much for core and upper body muscles. Breakfast is a treat. On a one-way street. Very few parking options for visitors.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable. I can't wait to come back and stay here again. The hotel wa s very close to just about anything you might want . I wold definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Nice hotel in Waikiki. Hotel is clean and room is big. It includes breakfast. Staff are helpful and pleasant. It was Spring Break so the hotel was busy and a bit noisy in the lobby. Other than that, we are happy with our choice of hotel.

We spent two nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. We were upgraded because I chose to use my two free night credit award here. I could have stayed at the newly opened Centric, but they did not offer a free breakfast and I believe there were other fees as well. The room was clean, comfortable and so were the beds. We were very pleased with the breakfast selection and service. There was plenty of food both mornings of our stay. We picked up a six pack of water at the nearby ABC Store. We had a refrigerator to keep it cold. The main reason for the short stay was to visit the Arizona before visiting Maui and Kauai. There is a bus stop right outside of the hotel. It took us about an hour by bus to arrive at our destination. Seniors get to travel for a dollar. The lounge at the hotel was nice. It was great for people watching. The hotel is not on the beach, but it is walkable. Overall we were very satisfied with this hotel. We would not hesitate to stay her again.

hotel is located two blocks away from Waikiki, approximately 3-4 min walk, friendly staff who is willing to work to make their clients feel welcome and comfortable. the only cons was the noise outside in the early morning

Stay for several days, close to beach, hotel provides towels, good breakfast in pool area which is on 3rd floor and very windy, Overall I would stay here again as all went well. Elevators are good but place is very busy and elevators sometimes can take quite a bit of time.

Hyatt Place is what others say...a good value, particularly if you're buying multiple rooms. It is on the East end of Waikiki, so the location isn't great, but once we got used to that the pluses the hotel offers made it the right choice for our family of 6. We saved over $600 by not having to pay resort fees for 3 rooms and hundreds more with the free breakfast, which was better than most with multiple options each day. Staff couldn't be friendlier. Hyatt Place has figured out their niche and fulfills it very well. It wouldn't be my first choice if it was only me and my wife, but needing rooms for the kids I don't think we could have found a better deal. Great beds too.

It was an average overall. Compare to Cuba and Mexico where we have all inclusive for much, much cheaper price, I would choose all inclusive vacations. All you can drink and all you can eat under $1100 abroad.

Security: good Cleanliness Good Restroom: OK Food: Good Distance to the beach: Short Ocean view: Not available Convenience: Easy to take a bus, walk to shopping. next to ABC store. Thank you in advance for letting me to do a feedback. I will look forward to go back to Hyatt Place soon. Sincerely,

The original room on the 2nd floor was quite noisy due to being so close to the ground/street. We requested a change which we got at an extra fee and not too much understanding from the staff. The new room was spacious. The room was cleaned well everyday. I feel the air con was quite loud in the room. The elevator services was quite slow. I felt that I was always waiting and if my room wasn't so high up I would just take the stairs. Overall it was not an unpleasant stay as the staff and room were nice but I think it was not bang for buck given the variety of other hotels in the vicinity.

If you are on a staycation or vacation. This is the perfect place to stay. The hotel is awesome and pet friendly. The food and amenities are on point and very impressive. Close to everything. We will definitively stay here again and even bring out dog!

Very good location and good price. Trolly transportation next door that stops at all the hot spots. Free breakfast is good and is a big cost savings. Customer service was excellent. I really have no complaints. It is also right next to a mini-mart and only about a 3 min walk to the beach, which is great.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki is a great place to stay. It is comfortable, clean, in a great location, and the staff goes out of their way to make your stay comfortable and pleasant. I would highly recommend it. Their complementary breakfast is much better than any we have experienced in other hotels. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. We had no problems, but I feel sure that if we had, it would have been addressed quickly.

It's a very clean hotel and the staff is very polite. The hotel room was very clean and we had a spectacular Oceanview from our room. The complementary breakfast every morning was not only excellent but convenient. This is a great hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in the heart of Waikiki.

The room was great - the location was okay. Kind of a wonky enterance but super close to the beach and zoo (which was worth the price of admission!). The included breakfast offered a good selection. Our room was a little (big!) oasis :)

If you're looking for a place to park for a short time in Waikiki, Hyatt Park Place is fine, but it wasn't my favorite spot in the city. I needed a room for one night, my last, and for that purpose it was fine. The room was clean, comfortable and well-appointed. But the hotel is not well situated, being several blocks from the beach. It's also located at a busy intersection with lots of street noise. I requested a quiet room after reading reviews here, which was granted. The view from the room was of other dingy buildings, with a peek at the water in the distance. Hyatt Place appears to cater to large groups looking for cost-effective accommodations. When I arrived at the free breakfast at 7:00am, it was already packed...and I mean PACKED. I've never witnessed anything like this crowd, at that hour! People were already situated around the pool, the food lines snaked through the length of the room, and there was nowhere to sit. Fortunately, I brought a tray from my room, and hot-tailed it back up there once I got my food. Way too much stimulation for that hour! Though the staff was hospitable, I wouldn't use this hotel for more than a pit stop. There are prettier, quieter places in nearby Waikiki.

Very well- kept property with nice quality renovations. Location good for beach, restaurants, etc. Rooms typically small but comfortable and very clean. Had no issues with noise, although hotel was full of kids on spring break. Nice outdoor breakfast area and nice lobby bar/cafe with many food choices--better than other similar properties run by the competition.( i.e. Marriott Courtyard, Hilton Garden Inn, etc.) Room price is high, but typical of other similar properties in Waikiki. I will stay again, and recommend it to others-- especially those looking to avoid the high "resort fees" of hotels right on the beach.

If you are looking for a warm, friendly, place to relax this is the place. Great staff, comfortable beds, good location and value. The general manager may very well greet you in the lobby , at some point, too.

Very good hotel to stay at Waikiki, good breakfast, nice room. I have reserved a king bed room, the hotel updated my room to two queen beds with mountain view. I am very satisfied with the room condition and the hotel service.

Hotel is conveniently located in Waikiki, with the Waikiki beach only two short blocks away and many restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Several public transportation/bus routes, including to Pearl Harbor and the airport) stop right across the street. The hotel is pretty clean and well maintained. The complimentary breakfast is excellent. Elevators seemed inadequate.

Lovely hotel with very friendly staff. The beds and pillows were dreamy, I slept great (even the first night). It was nice to have a full breakfast every morning. We stayed 7 days and it became our second home.

Situated in the far end of Waikiki somewhat far from action places. Breakfast included is ok, same items every day. Not great, not bad. Breakfast area is crowded and windy. Parking is pretty much only valet although they said they may have self park. Rooms are standard. Great that there are no resort fees. For the price it was a good value. Wifi was included.

This is a great hotel on budget. Very family friendly and offers a hot free hot breakfast buffet every morning. Located just one block from the beach and all of the hot spots right off the strip. If you are looking for a great hotel in Waikiki that does not break the bank, this is the hotel for you!

Location is perfect, few mins walking to the beach, kid really likes it. Room is clean. We did not get the nice floor though, only 2nd floor. Breakfast is ok, but a little bit more choice would be better. Overall is good experience.

Bring your own bottle water. You will be thirsty, no water in the lobby and the water in the guest rooms are not complimentary. The beds are very, very comfortable and the rooms are clean and friendly. I do like the premium channels provided. Don't come here hungry either, the prices will burn your wallet. If you can stay at the more expensive Hyatt, you are better off. I guess Hyatt Place is budget Hyatt.
user_name:
Ric D
Deira, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We just arrived here. Family of 4. The staff is awesome. Lei at front desk checked us in with kindness and even upgraded our room. This is our first time in this Hyatt place in Waikiki and it felt like coming home. Rooms are clean and nicely set up. Staff members very polite and helpful. So nice to have staff members like Lei as she is so sweet and answered all questions and checked us in a timely manner. Thanks guys. Singh family

Close to beach activities. Valet parking was best option- in and out service. Close dining was good. Traffic noise was a bit loud with balcony door open, but to be expected in this location. Free breakfast was good.

We stayed here twice between island hopping to the Big Island and on both occasions, although our stay was short we thought the hotel nice. We stayed in each of the 'towers'. On our first stay the room was a bit older but still pretty clean and tidy with good beds and a small balcony that you could sit on (with no impressive view). On our second stay we were in different section (different set of lifts) and the rooms were bigger and seemed more recently renovated. Having said that the air con seemed noisier and there was more street noise. Breakfast was rather ordinary and one morning it was raining which meant there was no where dry to sit and eat. We were presented with the option of going back to our room to collect a tray and then come and get some food to take back or to try eating in the lobby, which is what we did. The servers couldn't keep up with restocking plates and cups and the variety/selection for the breakfast was very sparse. Disappointing for a hotel of this calibre.Service was always provided with a smile. They also responded to an email that I sent following our final check out. Unfortunately, unlike most hotels,they do not provide free bottled water. Instead they have bottles in the room with a big label saying 'drink me' and in fine print a price of $3. For people with poor vision in dim rooms the price was not clearly readable. My elderly parents thought they were drinking complimentary water and it wasn't until after check out when I was checking my credit card statement I realised I had been charged for something from the minibar. When I emailed asking for an itemised receipt I discovered it was the bottled water.

Went for anniversary to get away from the kids. The staff was great.sent a bottle of wine to the room .everyone was nice and friendly and ready to help .close to the beach and food and the shop more fun people watching.

The staff was great, especially Jade at front desk. We checked in and found that our room was too small and they were able to accommodate us with a larger room which made the world of difference for a longer stay vacation.

Nice hotel. Room was nice with really comfortable beds. We liked the layout including having the small refrigerator and outlets everywhere. Room service was thorough and they did a nice job each day. Great shower with unending hot water.

Wifi was free and fast with no code needed. Breakfast was free with lots of variety. The beach was a quick walk across the street. The noise from the hotel across the street and the trucks did. It allow for me to sleep in. Bathroom was small with no tub. Bed was super comfy with great pillows. Staff was super friendly. It was a positive experience.

We enjoyed the stay at the hotel it was not on the beach but was only a block away. Staff was very friendly. The room was pleasant. There were times when we had to wait long period of time for elevator. The cooked breakfast was also good. Wish there would have been more variety of eggs. The waffles are
user_name:
Linzie B J
Lynchburg, United States

review_body: Went with my mom and 5 year old and we stayed on the 18th floor -had a large room with 2 queen beds. Room was clean, modern and our cleaning lady provided excellent service. The 'free' breakfast was above average -lots of food to chose from that they kept well stocked and the outdoor eating area had lots of seating and was well maintained. Items of annoyance -the hotel swimming pool is small and old, which was a disappointment as small children like swimming pools and the beach. The cooling/hvac unit in our room was pretty loud and at times there were long waits for the elevator from the higher up floors. I am not sure if I would stay here again, it is definitely good value for your money and it is well maintained and the staff/customer service was good..I might be tempted to spend more and get a nicer pool and a few other amenities like an evening bar/lounge area.

This is a good place in a good location rooms were that small but they all have refrigerators bathroom was a bit to be desired air-conditioning did not work well at all. Think it's a good place to stay would recommend for anyone looking for a basic hotel with decent amenities and a good proximity to the beach nice and close to shopping As all.

Wonderful experience! Exceptional staff! Staff are very attentive and genuinely care about your stay. Free breakfast was delicious. Rooms are clean and comfortable! I highly recommend The Hyatt Place!

This hotel is located at the end of Waikiki. If you are looking for a reasonable price property without resort fees and not all of the hustle of Waikiki, this is the hotel for you. The staff is always smiling. Very accommodating! If something needs attention, the staff is on it! The ocean view is breath taking, especially without the crowds!

This is a great hotel close to the beach. The beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. They have a room where if you have a late flight to still hit the beach and come back and shower. The breakfast was better on the third floor then the first.

We had a great time during our stay from 3/17 to 3/22. It exceeded our expectations. Will be coming back! Great locationFree breakfast Free wifi Friendly staff Close to BeachClean RoomsNo resort feesValet ParkingBeach TowelsFitness Center

I've now stayed there a couple of times and have always enjoyed the hotel staff. They are friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and their free breakfast is good. If you are staying in Waikiki this is a great spot for families. The beach is a very short walk and there is always something going on on the streets.
user_name:
George M
Salt Lake City, United States

review_body: Excellent hotel and most accommodating staff from check in to check out. Have been staying here every time I visit Hawaii and have not been disappointed thus far. It's centrally located for walking or taking local buses

Excellent hotel and value for money. Close to all amenities, beach, local and tourist bus services. Pleasantly surprised by the breakfast made available - was expecting a very basic service but offered fresh fruits, variety of cereals, juices and hot foods. Staff were extremely helpful and happy. Would stay here again and recommend it to family and friends.

Great location, close to beaches, restaurants and shopping. Rooms were very clean but a little small for a couple with an infant. Perfect for a short stay, great value with breakfast included. Staff very friendly

Hotel - It was updated and was very clean which is what we look for most in a hotel. The room layout was a bit odd but besides that beds were very comfortable and everything worked well. Exactly as we had expected from the pictures online which is always nice. Food - We ate the complementary breakfast every morning. It was one of the best free breakfasts at a hotel I had. Not the highest standard to beat but definitely a great money saver and they had a very large selection so you should be able to find something you like. Coffee was Seattles best, fruit was always fresh, they always had either pancakes or waffles (the waffles were really good), and usually sausages, as well as a breakfast open faced sandwich. They did also have a asian breakfast set out every morning. I did not eat it but my wife did and she said it was really good. For those who want just simple the had toast, bagels and cereal as well. Staff - This is where they excelled well past any other hotel experience that we have had. I don't usually write reviews mostly because I am happy enough with everything. The sole reason I am writing this is to say how great the staff was because they deserve the praise. From start to finish they were amazing. Check is was standard, quick, easy and not issues. If you need some advise on what to do around and a great drink Nick at the lobby bar was great. Super friendly and he asked very good questions which helped him both make really good recommendations for drinks he can make you as well as what you might like to do while you are there. He pointed us in the right direction on a few good spots to eat based on what we had a feeling for that day. Angeline who works at the front was super nice and sent a bottle of white wine up to our room just as a gesture of hospitality which was super nice of her. Julie was our house keeper and she was very nice to use during the trip and kept our room extremely clean. The icing on the cake for us with the staff was that we had a late flight out that night. We had decided to go hiking all day and were in need of a shower. They were 100% booked so they had already cleaned and prepped every room for the new batch of people coming in. Instead of just turning us away they went well beyond and checked and found a room for someone who was checking in late and let us use that room to clean up. This was super nice of them as obviously this meant the cleaning staff would have to come in right after to clean up again before the new guests arrived. Again I can't say enough about how great the staff was. Location - It is basically beach front. You walk about 1-2 minutes to get to the beach. It is one the end of the main strip which we thought was perfect. Extras Gym - The gym was very clean and had good machines that all worked. Free weights were limited up to 60lbs and no racks but that is pretty expected in a hotel gym. Car rental - There is a enterprise right across the street which is very convenient. Pro tip rent new each day instead of one big block as it is $40 a night to park overnight there. They were very accommodating and just let us take the same car each day anyways which just saved us $40 a night. Recommendation - Go here for the staff, clean rooms, and the value of the breakfast is overlooked as it is great value because food is a bit pricing in Waikiki in general.

My friends and i love to stay-cation in Waikiki so we can party it up care free without driving. We live on Oahu, but love to be tourist once in awhile too. Hyatt place is perfectly located with upgraded rooms, excellent reception with friendly staff and the breakfast is surprisingly full of variety. Highly recommend the stay.

Great location, awesome views. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was delicious, had a good variety and was well tended. Location is awesome with the beach very close as well as the zoo and park.

Very friendly and helpful staff, they ensured all our needs were met. Great location, just a block off of the Waikiki Beach. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends. As a helpful note, ask for a room on the lower floors due to excessive wind noise on the upper floors.

The Hyatt had a very friendly staff and went above and beyond to make sure our family had a comfortable stay. My only concern is with Expedia (the desk that books Hawaii excursion) I hope their poor service does not reflect on this great hotel.

Stayed in this hotel for more than a week. It seems that I haven’t paid enough ($200 plus) as my room WASN’T big as some other rewires reported so there was not even enough space for two suitcases to be placed/opened. If one didn’t know one could guess that, that was a Motel 6 room!!! Horrible design of the sink space – there isn’t a door to protect one sleeping party from the light that the other person has on in the case of getting up during night or earlier in the morning. Bed was comfortable (that is why are two starts) as well as was my pillow and bedding. There is a fridge that was welcomed to keep my milk and fruit cold. The pool is old and appears dirty and certainly NOT inviting. Gym was smelly. As $200 and up is NOT enough for this hotel they “had to charge” $30/day for valley parking… REALLY??? Almost ALL of the hotels that I stayed at had parking FREE, HOWEVER NOT THIS ONE! Location is about block and a half from the beach and it is in central location to go shopping. There is NO “DO NOT DISTURB” sign only the sign that says something like “Come back later” – I didn’t want them to come later – I wanted them to leave my room alone. Maid on my floor was a young Hawaiian man who was friendly and polite and provided me with items that I needed. Breakfast was included in price and it o.k. – problem for someone who stays longer and it is the same thing every morning, BUT it was good to have it available. There are two shops on the bottom floor that have some gifts at prices that are doubled from the stores that I found on the main promenade. There are two individuals who can help with tours (didn’t utilize them). Would NOT stay there next time!!!

The hotel has a good location within walking distance to he beach, dining, tour pickups, and many other attractions. The free breakfast is good and no resort fees like many of the Walkiki hotels do. We'd stay again!

The rooms were very large. We had 2 beds and a sofa bed. Plenty of space to put luggage unlike most hotel rooms. Great place to stay for families. Would stay here again. Walking distance to main restaurants and shopping. Very close to the beach.

We had a great stay. The rooms have recently been done up, they are very nice and very big. The hotel is older, but it didn't feel too dated. We stayed in a peak time, I thought we would wait for ages for lifts, but they were very quick. Location is second to none. Staff were friendly. Room had a good sized balcony and we had excellent views. Room was very clean and bed was very comfy! Wifi was free and the speeds were the best I have ever experienced in a hotel for the free service, I was getting 95Mbps download and a staggering 110Mbps upload. The upload speeds were amazing, it was great to upload all my photos and video to the cloud.

We were unfamiliar with the MANY hotels in the Waikiki beach area so trusted the Hyatt brand's reputation when making our booking. We were totally pleased with the cleanliness, comfort, and amenities provided by this hotel.

We were at Hyatt Waikiki for Spring Break 2017 and overall was excellent and appreciated for us. Definitely, we recommend this hotel for your next Hawaii's vacation. Near to the Waikiki beach and also public transportation

One block off the beach but still with amazing ocean views. Great breakfast buffet included and fabulous valet car parking service. Ok if you want something minimal and basic at the bar. Very clean. Would book it again for sure :)

I have just checked out of the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. (3/12 - 3/18). While it is true that it is not a beachfront property, you are about 1 1/2 blocks from the sand. I was able to score a killer rate for ~$200/night plus taxes. The hotel is valet only at $30/night but is totally worth it. (Driving/finding places to park is horrible in Honolulu). Hyatt Place also scores bonus points for 1) No nightly resort fee, 2) Complimentary full breakfast, 3) Extraordinary housekeeping staff.More on #3...We stayed in room 902 which had an obstructed view of the beach (but who stays in the room?). Our housekeeper MaryAnne couldn't have been more nice. Every morning as we left for the day she smiled, said hello, asked how we were, etc. She even joked "leaving so soon" as she saw us checking out. We came back from our day trips to an immaculate room with plenty of necessities for both of us (soap, towels, etc). Being a former housekeeping manager myself, I know 1st hand how difficult this job is, and how difficult it can be when guests don't treat the room with respect. MaryAnne is a true asset to this hotel, and you'd be lucky to have her as a housekeeper if you stayed here.I would definitely return to this hotel in a heartbeat given the opportunity.Mahalo Hyatt Place Waikiki, see you next time!

Hyatt Place exceeded all our expectations.The spacious room was clean and well serviced.The staff were,friendly helpful.Location was ideal with convenient access to the beach,shops,resteraunts and tour pickup.

Great large rooms. Little balcony. Wife loved the soaps. About 125 yards from the beach. Both public and private/tour buses come right by. Great shopping in the area. Nate Jackson, the expedia expert in the lobby is great and will work with you tirelessly. Fine pool and workout room. Right near an ABC store where you can get food and beverages and stuff you might need. I stupidly left my in room safe open with electronics, camera, cash, passports, and the cleaning person didn't take anything and neither did anyone else so we are very thankful to Josie. Good wifi. Great breakfast with a carb everyday (like french toast) a meat every day, fruit every day, an oatmeal station, small pastries or muffins, four cereals, toasting station, yogurt, juices, milk, tea/coffee, water, and some sort of Japanese soup station I didn't really understand. It can get crowded at breakfast. If you are with someone somebody should get a seat first. If it rains it will be even more crowded, but you can bring things back to your room. Nice fridge. Great tv situation. Tons of staff. The elevators take forever.

My family enjoyed our stay. Just a few minutes to the beach. Very close to restaurants, shopping and Honolulu zoo, breakfast was included and there's no crazy resort fee so that was a plus. We had this option to "text" their hotel staff if we had any questions or if we needed anything while checked in, that makes it a little easier. My mom loved the beds, she said they were very comfortable. Over all it was a good experience.

My wife and I had a great stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki. Great location, close to everything. Breakfast was great, as it had good healthy food selection (fresh fruit was the best) and saved us a lot of time every day ( we did not have to run around looking for a breakfast place). Hotel staff was great and made us feel like home during our stay.

A great place for families and business trips looking for great value and excellent service. Elevators are a bit outdated and slow if you're in a rush. Hotel employees are very friendly and helpful with any request.

Leision Teo Front Desk is very help full and knowledgeable person. We enjoy our stay. Our room was clean and roomy. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. Public transportation is just Right around the corner very help full.

Thank you for a really nice stay! We really enjoyed our time there. It really is just a couple blocks from the beach, and the proximity to the queens beach area (in front of the park) is perfect for snorkelers as there are lots of tropical fish hanging out between the two jettys. You can walk easily from one end of waikiki to the other with no trouble at all. And the side street the hotel is located on doesnt get a lot of traffic. The staff was extremely helpful and very nice. They got us checked in early (to an upgraded ocean view room for a fair price hurray!) and when we let them know our outbound flight wasnt until the late evening, they got us a few hours later checkout at the end and held our bags securely so we could wander around for the day. That was a really really helpful, id even say essential, part of the service! We were also really happy with the housekeeping, and the front desk staff was just awesome. They were really friendly and helped us with daily beach towels and were ready to help accomodate any request it seemed. I kept wondering if I was bothering them with questions, but if it did they are real pros and didnt show it. Everyone we interacted with made us feel welcome and comfortable. Our room was clean and everything in it seemed to be good quality. The bed especially was sooooo comfy. We slept really well. It was great to have wifi and ample cable channel options as well. The only downside was the room could be noisy from the lanai, as the airconditioners from nearby buildings below and the construction nearby really echoed up (we were on the 11th floor, maybe a lower floor would get less echo). But we understood this is something out of the hotels immediate control, and it didnt stop us relaxing with coffee out there in the warm mornings. The view of the ocean was between the buildings in front of us, but was actually pretty nice! You could see the ocean all the way across the horizon, and we sort of just forgot about the couple of buildings interrupting it. Its hard to capture it with a photo.The hot breakfast wasn't gourmet but they did a really good job considering how crazy busy it was every morning. Huge shout out to the breakfast staff. I wish there had been a tip jar. They were working really hard. i was especially happy to see kimchee, rice, and miso soup offered too! Overall everything was really great, especially for the price. We will reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in waikiki for sure.

My Ohana n I enjoyed our stay. Our room was so clean n roomy. The staff at the front desk was so polite n gave us a lot of information about the hotel and where to find things. Also the Continental breakfast was very satisfying.

Quiet, clean, inexpensive. Excellent service. Spectacular location. Front desk staff was very accommodating. Beds were really comfortable. I'd recommend this hotel for anyone looking to spend a few nights by the beach in Waikiki

Hyatt Place Waikiki is at eastern end of Waikiki Beach. It's about a two block walk to the beach and the beach is less crowded in that area. Our room was 407 and we had a minimal view of the ocean which wasn't too important. Room was comfortable, good TV cable, good bed, shower (no tub), refrigerator, all needed amenities. Don't confuse Hyatt PLACE with another Hyatt that is also on Waikiki. Service was great. Included in room rent is an excellent buffet breakfast on 3rd floor every morning that usually included eggs, sausage or bacon, sometimes French toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, fruit juices, coffee, etc. You can eat outdoors on a patio. Protect your food from the birds which will be present. Hey, it's Oahu. There is also an indoor buffet breakfast at "The Gallery" for the party poopers. We had a rental car so avoided the tour desks. Parking is $20 CASH for 24 hours around corner at Banyan Garage so we avoided hotel garage. Matt at the front desk was exceptional in demeanor and service provided. I recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki if you're needing a hotel in that area.

Our first hotel stay in Honolulu and are very pleased with this hotel. Staff were always available and helpful. The morning breakfast was great, but would of loved to see more pancakes and bacon offered. Loved the fruit and had it every morning. The room was always clean and well kept. This hotel is in a great location, walking distance to the beach, zoo, aquarium and plenty of shopping. Hop on Hop off stops located close to hotel. Would stay here again.

We had a wonderful time at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach! The staff was incredible, and took really good care of us after we had a slight issue with a smell in our room...it was likely because the air conditioner wasn't on but after turning it on it felt like everything was back to normal. They went above and beyond what I expected and really took very good care of us -- I will never forget this experience. The room and view was amazing and we really want the same room again next time we come back to Oahu. The breakfast and options were delicious and the service was really top notch. The service in the lobby and staff were so friendly, I cannot thank them enough. A huge THANK YOU to the following staff members for making our stay extra special and really taking care of us: Lei, Heidi, Justin, Ihab, Matt and Cole. And of course the most recognition goes to Geraldine who did a phenomenal job for us in getting our room ready on a daily basis. Everyone was great and treated us like VIPs. We will be staying here at Hyatt Place next time we come and I'm so glad you guys have no resort fee, and have a complimentary breakfast! That itself is a reason to stay but the service was above and beyond what I had expected. So thank you thank you thank you!!! :) Completely satisfied customer and an overall 10/10 rating. Hyatt Gold Member!

We have stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach several times now and we enjoy staying here because it's close to the beach & main area of Kalakaua, which is convenient. They have free wi-fi and breakfast and no resort fees! Their rooms are very clean, comfortable and roomy. Jade checked us in for this trip and she made it so easy, quick and was so nice, friendly and helpful. I can't thank her enough for helping me extend our stay one night and made it so easy for us since we were there for our mom's funeral. She made a difficult time more bearable. Her great customer service was very much appreciated. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Stayed here last weekend and a week back in September and it's a great hotel for those who don't need the full resort experience. We're always out and about in Oahu so it's nice to be able to come back to a clean, friendly hotel with easy access. This trip we received a lovely handwritten welcome back letter from Jose, the Front Office Manager, which was a really nice touch. We usually head out for breakfast but the one they offer is really solid, and it's always super easy to hop downstairs and grab a coffee and muffin while we're getting ready in the morning. Park across the street at the Aston Banyan for easy access and in/out privileges. WiFi isn't the most reliable though.

Supper location. Staff extremely helpful everything at you door. Male consiege was fabulous full of information but not pushy Staff almost always willing to help. Breakfast was basic but still reasonable. Liked to two different areas and that you can take your food back to your room. Enjoy

Due to a nice experience I had back in September 2016, I decided to stay here again. Don't get me wrong, the front desk staff (especially Matt!) and the valet staff were very nice. What I found disappointing was the cleanliness of the room. I stayed a total of 9 nights at this hotel. I don't know if the hotel is understaffed in the housekeeping department or not but it looked as though they only make the beds and change towels for you. Other dusting or vacuuming tasks are not part of it? The room was pretty dusty and day after day, it never gets better. Maybe the 7th night in, they finally cleaned the room a bit more as one small piece of rubber that was on the floor since I checked in was finally gone. That was my marker. But the other areas such as the desk, breakfast tray, etc were still dusty.There were also times when the room was not cleaned around 5pm! I got off work and wanted to freshen up before heading out for dinner. I was very surprised to see that the room was still not ready....at 5pm. On the bright side, the front desk staff was very friendly. Matt, who checked me in, helped resolved a problem for me. When I initially booked, I booked it for myself. My mom came along with me in the end. I asked if it's possible to change to a 2 queen bed room. He took care of that for me and even checked in on me after I went upstairs to see if the room was okay for us. Now that's customer service!The breakfast option was nice. They had both hot and cold items. I like that they serve different items each day. They also serve miso soup, rice, and other side dishes for breakfast as well. The fruit options were also nice because there were pineapples! Gotta eat pineapples when you're in Hawaii right?Overall, it was just an okay stay this time.

Again, another pleasant stay at the Hyatt Place. I left additional comments, and hopefully there will be improvements, but for the most part, it was a nice experience. I look forward to booking another stay. Mahalo!

The reason why we chose this Hotel was because they had a free breakfast, free wifi and no resort fees. Because of that it's GREAT value. We previously stayed in a hotel that offered a kitchen because we have a small child, but found it really only came in handy for breakfast as we find breakfast is always over priced and tend to eat in our room. There are tons of great, fairly cheap options for eating lunch and dinner in Waikiki, like Me BBQ, Marukame Udon and Hi Steaks. The breakfast was up there for best breakfasts I've had in a hotel. It has all the staples: eggs, waffles, french toast, yogurt, cereals... the works... Plus a miso soup station. The highlight for me was that the cooked food was presented on Le Creuset skillets. A nice touch. It's outside so could be a little breezy. It's not the nicest outdoor setup, but also not bad. The room was modern clean and spacious (we had the 2 queens). You could tell that some of the renovations were 'cover ups' but that's okay. It's still a great looking room and we're pretty simple people so for us it's actually pretty high class. The one huge drawback for me was that the mattresses were an atrocity for a place as nice as this. You just... sink right in. My back was out of whack the whole trip.The service at the hotel was also top notch. Please give the cleaner on floor 4 a HIGH FIVE for us. What a doll. I asked for some extra cream as my hands were quite chapped coming from a cold climate. She gave me one from the cart and then when we got back to our room there was a little baggie hanging on our door with a few more. Little things like that are one of the main reasons I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The rest of the staff were chatty and courteous, though they surprisingly knew very little about the surrounding restaurants LOL.The location is near perfect for small families. If you need a comparison, the Hyatt Regency (we never stayed there) would be perfect for us as it's just right smack in the middle of everything. The Hyatt Place is a little bit further away from the shopping district, though it's right by the toddler beach, zoo and aquarium.

Good place to stay and don't need a car. Close to beach. We took the 23 bus to Diamond Head for a hike. Walking distance to almost everything on Waikiki. They provide beach towels and thete is a nice swimming beach just down the block.

We were extremely pleased with our stay at Hyatt Place in waikiki. This hotel is walking distance to the beach as well as all main shopping and eating areas. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are well kept and clean. The daily breakfast is great with plenty of food and choices. The staff is extremely kind. While we were waiting for our car the GM came and visited with us and was extremely kind as well and gave a few great recommendations for places to see and eat! If we ever return to Oahu we will be staying here again.
user_name:
Brandee R
Saratoga Springs, United States

review_body: The hotel is very close to the beach which is a plus. The rooms are not sound proofed enough to keep out loud street noise. Also the doors slam loudly. But rooms are very attractive and well equipped. The buffet breakfast was excellent.

What a perfect location! Close to the beach and pier and far enough away from the main strip but still perfect time walking distance. My boyfriend and I went for my birthday and overall we were greatly satisfied (they didn't do anything special for my birthday but a great stay either way). Room service food was great! (Tomatoe bisque scrumptious). Complimentary breakfast was surprisingly delicious. Yes, it was continental breakfast but just better than anywhere I've had before. They even had a little miso soup station with rice and kimchee. Grounds are clean, staff was friendly with smiles. My room was on the 3rd floor and was only a city view but the noise was quite loud from the street. If the balcony door was open it was incredibly loud all night and all day since we are so close to the road. Elevators closest to the reception take forever on some days and stairs are locked since u have to use your room key for elevator security. Parking in wakiki sucks but we got lucky a bunch of times and got a free space on one of the side streets that don't use meters and have no special parking sign. The parking at the zoo area is only $1 an hour and it's super closer walking distance to the hotel. Will I be back to this hotel ... YES!

I have stayed here both times I have visited Waikiki. A hotel with no resort fee and breakfast included just adds to the already top-notch customer service you experience when you stay here. All of these items set this hotel apart. I would highly recommend.

The Hotel was in a great location with a very friendly and helpful staff. It was an easy walk to shops, beach, zoo, public transportation, restaurants. loved the free breakfast. Wifi connection was great.

The breakfast was a great treat and tasty, very good location, comfortable beds, big rooms ,the staff were very helpful and pleasant and the Hotel is clean ...the pool was not the greatest, it was very small and not much sun hits the pool. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family.

From the first warm welcome as we stepped out of the car, to the last aloha as we entered the cab to depart, the staff were all warmly welcoming, gracious and kind, eager to solve any problem and answer any question. Truly fine service. I was frankly amazed at how good it made me feel to be so well taken care of. We used the pool, the Cafe, the laundry facilities and exercise room and were impressed with the cleanliness and perfect working order of everything. I wished we could have stayed longer. Highest recommendation!!

We stayed here for family vacation for 5nights. It was much better than I expected. I was really satisfied with whole time when we were there. Also it is good value to stay there if you use points or p+c.

A very nice hotel, fairly modern, clean & excellent staff...Buffet breakfast was good but is outdoors so needed a jacket some early mornings...The hotel is located at the end of Waikiki near Diamond Head & only 300 meters from the beach, it's still a little noisy at night but nothing like what it would be in the heart of Waikiki..Consider parking costs if your hiring a vehicle as we were told general hotel parking (park yourself) was limited & cost $25 which was only $5 cheaper than Valet.. In sure this is similar cost at other hotels as not much in the way of street parking..We would go back..

Hyatt Place Waikiki is a very nice hotel. Hotel located walking distance to Waikiki beach and surround with ABC store and lots of restaurant. Hotel provide free breakfast is a big plus to save time. Parking is not included, but there is some of street free parking if you are lucky(I got 2 nights free parking of 6 days stay). You also can park at zoo which is $1 per hour. Of course you can choose hotel parking($20 per day). I have 2 kids(2&6 years) and really enjoy the stay at this hotel. Overall, I will come back to Hyatt Place Waikiki again next time.

We decided it was time for a real family vacation because we were going on almost four years since we did the last one. We did all the due diligence we could online but since I'd never been to Waikiki we weren't sure about the choice until we got there and got to know the hotel. This is a great place if you have a Family to travel with, the rooms are large, we had two queen beds and a sofa sleeper, perfect for our family of five. No resort fees, this was huge. The other hotel we were considering was right on the beach but the resort fee was an extra $40.00 per night, in the end this is closer to the beach then you think, like a really short walk and it was easy even with three kids (one a toddler), plus the hotel has plenty of fresh beach towels at the front desk and there is a convenience store next door on the way to the beach. We spent a lot of time doing touristy stuff but a couple of days just at the beach by the hotel and everything you need is a close walk from this hotel, we rented a car to go to North Shore and some other excursions and the hotel concierge got all that squared away for us. On the days we didn't travel we just had lunch and dinner at the hotel in the lobby, decent prices and good food. If you want something more food wise there are a ton of choices to walk to. On the free breakfast this was a huge plus with the kids, I've read a few reviews saying it could be better....Are you kidding? Pancakes, waffles, fruit, bacon, eggs, granola, yogurt, cereal, pastries, muffins, sausage, eggs benedict (one of the days but still), orange juice, apple juice, coffee, milk, french toast, bagels...I mean seriously for a breakfast included and no resort fees? I've paid for breakfast buffets in Vegas that weren't this good. Did I mention it's free? Some people are snobby I guess. One extra note about housekeeping, the service was good but when I lost a hoodie that happened to be very close in color to the beach towels they give out at the front desk housekeeping went above an beyond, found the hoodie, it was cleaned and folded neatly on the bed the next day with a nice note attached. I think I probably tossed the hoodie in the towel return by accident, or maybe they grabbed it in the room in a pile of towels when they cleaned it but nonetheless nice service. The gift shop in the back is independent, but he does have snorkel gear and boogie boards for $5.00 for all day...very handy. On top of all this the hotel on the beach we almost stayed at? We still used their beach front restaurant twice and saved all those resort fees...based on the reviews online the rooms were dinky there as well, so the Hyatt Place was perfect. The gym wasn't spectacular but gets the job done, laundry onsite if you need it and a pool on the smaller side, but it was never too crowded and the ocean is right there. One night they had wine tasting in the open lobby and lei making another afternoon. If you want the touristy trip like we did this works, they also have a deal with a local cab company, $29.00 to and from the airport plus we used the same cab company for Pearl Harbor and other places, always with a deep discount.

Each time I stay at a Hyatt I leave happy. This is a great chain. The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is a nice, clean hotel with friendly staff. They offer a free, hot breakfast. The parking is a little expensive at $30/night. A platimum-member discount would be awesome. There is almost always a wait for the elevators, but not sure what you can do about that.

PCSed with two pugs and stayed 40 days. Great staff and everyone was super nice. Lots of group stays at the hotel but staff handled it well.Nice gym. Super breakfast. Great happy hour mai tais!Parked across the street for a much better rate.

I was very excited about this hotel because of the price and its relative distance away from the main hubbub of the city (knowing Waikiki is very crowded, I was seeking something a bit quiet) and it was, quiet. But, when I arrived - there was a big issue - the ocean-front room with balcony I had paid for (and saw a photo of in the description when booking) was replaced with a semi-ocean front room where the balcony faced the street and it was more of a peephole window to the ocean, which was disappointing. The front desk agreed to move me to a proper room that had the balcony but it'd have to wait until the next day. This delayed my opportunity to truly feel relaxed on this trip. Additionally, the parking - there is a claim of self parking which I quite enjoy but here, it was only valet. Had I known that, I might have chosen differently. Regardless, the hotel did offer a comp on the parking in light of the room snafu, and recovered well, hence why I upped to a Very Good rating.

We chose this hotel for the price in comparison to others on or near Waikiki Beach, it's proximity to the beach(less than a block away) and free hot breakfast every morning. The staff at the hotel understand the service industry and are, to a man and woman, exceptional. Our room had ample space, which is not the norm in Honolulu. The hotel has been obviously upgraded and looks fresh and reasonably new. The bus stops in front of the hotel on Kuhio Avenue. All buses from there will take you directly to the airport, downtown, Pearl Harbour and the Ala Moana shopping mall, all without transferring buses. The bus costs $2.50 per person each way. There are scores of restaurants, bars and food trucks within a five minute walk of the hotel. The shopping is also a 5-10 minute walk away. We stayed for 10 days and compared other hotels for future trips. We found very little options for the same price that met the quality of the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.

Nothing special for a Hyatt. We came here for our honeymoon and requested a high floor. But because our flight didn't get in till late we ended up on the 3rd looking out to some low income run down apartments. So we asked if we could move but they were full. So they said they would move us the next night. The next night the moved us to the same view just up about 6 floors so we could see past the ghetto. A few days in we decided to extend our vacation by 3 days because it was rainy a few days and wanted to enjoy Hawaii a bit more so we changed our flights but the hotel couldn't accommodate us so we ended up moving to Waikiki resort hotel for quite a bit cheaper and same quality if not better... even when you take Hyatts breakfast into account. Probably wouldn't stay here again.

Now days most people would not do what Cole did for us, he truly went out of his way to make our trip a success , the place is awesome also.Clean and fresh. 1 Block from the beach and center of town. Cole is an asset to this place and for you that matter any place,

We had a great experience at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. We asked for an upgrade to an ocean view room when we checked in and Cole was able to help us out. The food was great, service exceptional and all of the staff were very friendly including Him, who made our day! We were about a block from the beach and close to busses/trolleys/shops and the zoo. Staff helped us with any questions and the room was always clean after housekeeping. The morning breakfast during the week we were there had things like waffles/French toast/fresh fruit/sausages/bacon and eggs. We were also able to leave our bags at the hotel on our final day so we didn't have to carry them all over the place before our flight. If you're looking for a nice place to stay check out the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.

convenient to restaurant, the beach, and shops staff very helpful, close to all the fun activities in waikiki close to park and diamond head also i would recommend the farmers market at the community college

One week stay at this two high rise resort overlooking Waikiki. Check in was well over a half hour when we arrived at 3:30 on Wednesday afternoon from Vancouver. Requested a view of the beach which we obtained on the 8th floor. Fully air conditioner made it comfortable for sleeping given the noise from the beach traffic. Two Queen beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was excellent. The hotel advertised as smoke free. Every afternoon Smoke floated into our unit from the neighbors. So NOT smoke free. The two towers are joined by a pool desk. Lounging pool. Thought the pool would be bigger. Barbara who served us almost daily was awesome . Engaged you could tell she loved her job.
