The only complaint I had on the pool deck was the occasional smell of the sewage pipes . Not sure where it came from the streets 3 stories down or from the building but it was not isolated. While a boarding pass kiosk was provided in the hotel for our return flight it was not working and we were informed to use the business centre. Unfortunately there the printer was out of ink and could not be used. Technician were apparently coming to fixed however the hotel could not specify a time frame. Staff were friendly, towels provided to go to the beach without question. For the price that I paid not having a SMOKE environment was clearly a disappointment. I have stayed at the Hyatt before but might need to try something else the next time . Unfortunately I have to downgrade to a 2 star which is surprising given the Brand name.

We had a room overlooking Diamond Head and could see the ocean from our balcony if we looked right! The room was spacious, clean and had everything we could have asked for, two big beds, a seating area with TV, a little table if we wanted room service and a well equipped bathroom. We had breakfast around the pool, we were there during Spring Break (quite by accident) so didn't quite get down to breakfast early enough for the full buffet but what we had was good and the proximity to the beach, shops and everything going on in Waikiki made this hotel a very good choice indeed.

I stayed 9 nights in Honolulu at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. Each and every single staff member I interacted with was extremely friendly and offered to help with unloading/loading my luggage, holding opening doors and elevators, breakfast items, laundry, room service/cleaning, and general directions.Super close the Rainbow Drive-Inn and Diamondhead Grill is a plus!Also, right around the corner from Lulu's and across the street from the beach!

With having so many hotels/condos to choose from in Waikiki - it's definitely confusing when researching hotels.I must have read 1000 reviews and websites trying to figure out a good place with free breakfast and wifi etc... and really feel that this hotel is exactly what we were looking for.We stayed in a room near the top floor, 2 queen beds, ocean view, with a balcony. Our Balcony did not directly face the ocean, we faced another large hotel across the road from us, directly facing North.However, our room description did say "ocean view" and it is technically true, there's a large window above the desk that faces the ocean.The Breakfast area is around the swimming pool, and can get very busy if you don't time it correctly. and depending on the other groups staying at the hotel, can get interesting when different cultures collide and "politeness" is thrown aside.Being Canadian, we found ourselves often trying to sit as far away as possible from a couple of the groups, as they just didn't care how many chairs blocked the walk ways, how much garbage they left around hem, or how they blocked the entire buffet.But the mornings we beat those groups, it was lovely. Siting by the pool, with so many breakfast choices, we were very happy to have this free meal to start our days.We had a rental car to tour the island, and he parking was by Valet, which was extremely efficient and so nice - offering suggestions and help every time we grabbed the car.You don't need a car in Waikiki though - this hotel is right near where the tourist buses pick up passengers. We could have just walked a block and hopped on the bus to go to Pearl Harbour, the outlet mall, pipeline - it's a handy spot to stay.We also loved the sunrise walks along Waikiki beach, and encountering the bird man at the end of the wharf. He has food so you can stand and have a million birds fly around you and land on you.We're planning our return trip this summer, and will be staying here again.

Our stay couldn't have been long enough. The hotel is well maintained. The bar is very nice and the valet is great. I hope that we will be returning again soon. Staff was always pleasant and helpful..

Our family spent 4 nights at Hyatt Place with a 2Q bed Ocean View Specialty Room. The room was very spacious and comfortable. Staff was v friendly and service was great. We arrived before the regular 3pm check-in time and they allowed us to check in early. The staff also gave us helpful tips for transportation. WiFi was free and quality was decent. Complimentary breakfast with good variety was a plus. The hotel is not located in the heart of Waikiki but still convenient and very close to the beach. Will definitely stay here again.

My wife and I had a great time staying at Hyatt Place Hotel. The hotel is located Honolulu, 2 minute walk from Waikiki beach and all of its shopping and beaches. the hotel staff was great from beginning to end. I would definitely stay at Hyatt Place again.

Great beds, second stay here excellent staff, free breakfast. 200 meters from beach. Good coffee maker in room with free coffee. Local bus across road with direct routes to Ala Moran shops and many other attractions. Beach towels available from pleasant concierge staff. A really good experience.

When my son's cell phone was left in the taxi from the airport, Justin, who was checking us in, went out of his way to phone around until the phone was found and returned to the hotel. All other staff were equally helpful. We found the room met our needs well, and we really enjoyed the breakfast that was included - great variety, fresh fruit, hot selections that were delicious. The location was excellent - an easy walk to everything we wanted to do.

Hotel was good, overall service was good. Only issue was that as a Platinum member with Hyatt hotels I still had to pay $30 for parking per night. Ultimately only was there for 2nights but since had booked this on points seems like a bit of a ripoff they need to bill you for parking. Overall I would recommend this place to stay, close to main beach, etc.

Great staff, clean rooms, and great service. It doesn't get much better than this. The cleaning staff went above and beyond which allowed me to focus on my work. Breakfast was always plentiful and delicious. The parking attendants were polite, speedy, and helpful. Just a short walk to restaurants and the beach. Diamondhead and the zoo are within a 5 minute drive. For the price you get great accommodations

The Hyatt Place is an excellent choice! Its location is close to the action without being in the middle of it. This gives access to whatever you want, but also maintains a lower key. We had a room with a view of Diamond Head and the mountains nearby and loved it. The balcony wrapped around so we could also see part of the ocean. The bed was very comfortable and the room was always kept spotless. We had excellent and helpful interactions with all staff, from front desk, to the concierges, to the housekeepers. Two thumbs up!

Staff is great, Ihab is great. Just love Hyatt Place Waikiki. Was coming to this Hotel when it was Quality Inn, changed to Ocean Resort than to Hyatt Place. Total of years coming is 33, my home away from home.

Great location and great hotel. What put it over the top was the staff. So friendly, and genuine and attentive. They made us feel very special. They have a deal also worked out with Charley's taxi service for a special rate from the airport. Did I mention how amazing the staff was?

Great for a quick getaway. We stayed for a sports trip for the kids. Check in staff was really nice. Really liked our room. Perfect spot on Waikiki. Close to the zoo and the Duke Statue. Free breakfast was a bonus.

We spent one night and two days in Waikiki, after a week on Kauai, so we could visit Pearl Harbor and see a bit of Honolulu. Hyatt Place Waikiki exceeded our expectations on all fronts. Staff was super helpful and nice (especially Matt), room was clean with comfy bed and beach was only about two block walk. We didn't rent a car, but Charley's taxi has fixed price from airport to hotel ($29) and there is public transportation easily accessible. We arrived early morning with normal check in st 3pm. We were given towels so we could enjoy the beach in the meantime. The staff worked hard to have a room ready shortly after noon, even accommodating our ocean view request! When we asked for breakfast restaurant suggestion, we were offered their hot breakfast right off the lobby. It is included in the cost of the room, so we didn't expect much. We were pleasantly surprised with scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon and French toast or pancakes. Being able to enjoy it even prior to our room access was especially appreciated. The pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and juice were also yummy. We commented several times to each other how pleased we were with our hotel selection. And the best thing was it was free - by using Hyatt reward points!!! You won't be disappointed if you stay here. Aloha.

Breakfast was excellent every morning. The service at the front desk were very helpful! Love the towels ready for us everyday went we go to the beach! Location is great, just minutes way to Waikiki Beach.

The room is clean and not outdated. This was my third time staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The location is good and only blocks away from the beach. restaurants close by and close to the zoo. And will come back next time definitely.

Upon arrival into Honolulu airport we received a text from hotel staff that our room was ready for us check in. That was very nice for the staff to let us know the status of our booking. Convenient location to all local Beaches, transportation, shops and activities. Honolulu Zoo, Aquarium, Diamond head crater, Farmers market is very near to this location.

Main lobby smelled of rotten food, and breakfast had bugs and flies crawling all over it. It was very unhygienic and substandard I don't know how is this possible in USA? Staff here needs to pay attention to cleanliness and quality of food you serve to your guest. there must be some regulation. when complained to the front desk they simply said 'SORRY' and gave me $3 water bottle for free. There was no concern from the staff of getting food replaced or further investigation. Room had a pecular smell as well, and it was very noisy, even at 18th floor. I would not stay here in future.

Very friendly stay, very willing to make things right. We had a small problem upon checkin and management was very quick to not only upgrade our room but also give us a credit to the in hotel restaurant. Excellent!

Nice hotel and staff. Felt very safe. Nice lobby. Close to the great shops and lots of restaurants. Bed was comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was really nice. Great fitness center, had several elipticals, bikes and treadmills and weights (no weight machines though). The only negative was the parking fee at the hotel -- bit pricey. We ended up parking in the garage kitty corner to the hotel - it was pricey ($20/night) and iffy - meaning we had to chance being able to park there each day (if there was space).

The highlight was definitely the complimentary breakfast! Great selection of hot and cold foods. My daughter loved the pancakes, french toasts, waffles, sausages and bacon. While I loved the miso soup, kimchi, fresh fruits and yogurt. They have 2 locations for the breakfast every morning, so it was not THAT crowded.Service was great. The room cleaning lady on our floor was so nice, same with the concierge staff, they really took the time to talk to us and get to know us.Location is a bit far from central Waikiki, but it's not too bad. It's right by the zoo and the toddler beach area.

This was a 37-night extended business stay. The following comments is based on my personal experience that I felt needed improvement: 1. Self-parking is not available and valet parking is $30/day. That is a huge expense that my company does not pay for. Customer service representatives tried their best to assist but management states they cannot compliment the parking. It's unfortunate that Hyatt Place Waikiki couldn't comp the parking when a 5-star hotel like the Sheraton Waikiki can. 2. Room is small and noisy; insulation is pretty non-existent. It's hard to feel tranquil in the room. The hotel has a funny smell in the hallway and you can tell is old. Bed is very comfortable and the housekeeping crew is fabulous. The crew always had a smile and said, "Aloha !" 3. Food and beverage is like most hotel; expensive for average quality. The breakfast has a nice selection but the bacon is paper thin. Seriously, it's paper thin. Breakfast does not change except of the main meat which differs 4-5 times out of the week. After staying for so long; it became monotonous so I just skip breakfast at the hotel. 3. Staff really cares but management has not shown they care the whole time I was there. Craig would pack me fruits when I am not able to stay for breakfast or when they are closing the breakfast bar. He was great; always so friendly and thoughtful! Joshua did his best to assist with my parking situation but everything stops at management level. For some reason, management only works M-F 8-5 in a 24-hour operation so it was difficult for me to connect with him. As a matter of fact I didn't see one before 7 am or after 5pm.

Spent ten days at Hyatt Place in very nice king room with a sofabed. View of mountains plus two blocks from the beach. Zoo nearby as well as transit services. Can easily walk along Waikiki main strip. Only concern was with slow elevators.

Spent 2 weeks at this hotel and it was wonderful. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. A big shoutout to Heidi and Nick who were absolutely fabulous, they are an asset to this hotel. The location is great, only a few minutes walk too the beach. We would definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed staying at Hyatt Place in HNL with free breakfast, bus stop at each corner, friendly staff and updated and clean rooms. A major plus is to be a Hyatt card holder which may upgrade your room,free internet and bonus points. Parking is only $18 per day and a few blocks away from the beach.

I was in Waikiki for a week on business. All of the staff was very helpful and courteous. The valets became familiar with me because I was in and out of the hotel multiple times in a day. They were helpful in suggesting a different way into the hotel from the interstate as my GPS was taking me way out of the way. They always had a smile. My room was very comfortable and I enjoyed an upgrade to a balcony room. Breakfast was well stocked, fresh and nice variety. You eat in the pool area but there is plenty of room for everyone. All of the staff were friendly and were always asking how my stay was going. The hotel is close enough to the beach that I was able to walk down to it even for an hour or so. I will definitely stay here on my next business trip to Oahu.

Was our 40th Wedding Anniversary trip and this hotel helped make it all we had hoped for. Great accomodations, very nice professional staff, so friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. Only downside if I must pick one is they could use a few more elevators, a bit of a wait when it was busy.

Booked this when our flights changed and we needed to add a few nights on at the beginning of our trip. Here is the + & - list:+ Breakfast was good - waffles plus at least 2 other hot dishes (sausage, breakfast sandwiches, eggs), yogurt, granola, cereals, tea, coffee, juices, bagels, toast+ Breakfast opened at 6:30am which was good when you want to get up and go- Breakfast is crazy busy from the moment it opens (but there is tons of seating! Also they have a smaller version available downstairs in the lobby, less crowded here)+ Service was good, everyone was very friendly and helpful ****A special note about the service. Due to allergies we always have to call/email ahead to ensure our rooms don't have down/feather pillows or duvet. Our requests are seldom completed ahead of time (in 10 years and 50+ hotels I can list the 3 who completed it or met our needs)....not only was this hotel accomodating but it was completed before our arrival and confirmed with us (without asking) during check in!! Attention to detail - A++++ Free wifi+ Bar fridge in the room- Pool is crazy small, not really a great draw to the hotel+ only 2 blocks to the beach+ABC store is behind the hotel for anything you need, prices are reasonable (we found they were actually cheaper than Wal-Mart for bottled water)+Room safe is huge - approx 18" tall, fit all of our electronics with tons of room left+ Good location, we walked to Diamond Head, beach, Zoo and Waikiki easilyRooms are not huge, actually a little tight with a family of 4 and luggage. That said we had 2 queen beds and a chair that was a pull out bed. The chair was comfy (according the child!) when it was pulled out and apparently "you can't feel those bars that dig into you on some pull outs" Take that for what it is worth from a 10 year old :)

Just not up to the standards of other Hyatts we have been in. Breakfast not up to their standards, Not a view when you look at a apt. building next door and a concrete slab outside your window. Very strong deodorizer smell when entering each time.

Had a wondering 4 night stay. Diamond member and room was clean and as I reserved. Service was great from everyone I encountered. Hotel is very close to beach, just a couple minutes. Would definitely stay here again. Room was spacious and had nice balcony with view of ocean.

If your idea of going to Hawaii is going to the Waikiki beach, and being in the middle of Waikiki action for a decent price then this hotel is for you. Directly behind the Marriott, where all tour buses stop; 1 block from the famous Waikiki Beach and the Zoo. They offer a full complementary hot breakfast, not just bagels, clean and comfortable rooms, and a fantastic staff. An ABC (similar to 7 Eleven) is right beside for all your beverage and other needs. If lounging by the pool is your idea of going to Hawaii, then don't choose this hotel, but why would you go to Hawaii to lie by the pool?!!

We had a great stay on the 14th (top) floor. in January 17 this year. The location is great and just a short distance from all the action. Staff were very friendly. Bed was super comfy. The only suggestions I would have would be a functioning kitchen for fresh food/ bar food(not processed reheats), more sheltered seating in breakfast area and a bar area with a bit more atmosphere that made you feel like spending some time there. Just felt there was not alot to keep us at the hotel and found we just ate breakfast and slept there. All in all a fantastic holiday and yes I would recommend this hotel.

We booked this hotel through WestJet Vacations and we're very pleased with the results! We stayed 8 nights and used the Travelocity desk in the hotel to book our excursions including Pearl Harbour, Polynesian Cultural Centre and Diamond Head Luau (highly recommend this one!). The hotel was modern and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfasts are included which is a nice touch. Menus changed daily and the coffee was superb! The hotel recommends Charlie's Taxi ($29 flat rate to/from the Airport) and we found this worked very well. During our stay, our "City View" room required work and so we were upgraded to an "Ocean View" room. I would suggest that these rooms are well worth it! Beach towels are also provided at the front desk, do no need to bring your own! Have fun!

We had been here in September for 2 nights and these guys went above and beyond to make our stay the best pleasant. A Huge shout to asst manager Mr.Ihab who did everything he could to ensure everything is going nice. Will return!!

This hotel has the friendliest and most accommodating staff in Waikiki. The free breakfast is nice and fresh. It's a nice hotel less than a block from the beach with a great value. Short walk to International Marketplace and lots of restaurants. Convenient location.

I booked a standard room on Priceline and they upgrade it to be a 2 queen beds room. Great!The free breakfast is nice. Also staffs are friendly and helpful.The main complain is that the AC in room is quite loud.

Had a great time good food be back soon tell my friends how much fun we had a great time be back soon as possible thank you very clean room and front desk lobby was a some we will be back to stay longer next time

Came here with friends for a vacation from work. When we arrived check in was very smooth with pleasant staff. Our room was on the 4th floor. Definitely noticed the slow elevator during peak hours, but staying on the 4th floor meant we could just take the stairs if it took too long. Room was a great size (2 queen beds and a sofa bed). We didn't have much of a view but we didn't mind because we literally only used the hotel to sleep. Rooms were very clean. We had no trouble sleeping and I don't even recall if it was noisy as some others have commented. Of note, you can't have the AC on if the balcony door is partially open! We had a great time trying to figure this out (thought the door was shut but it wasn't completely and AC wouldn't work).Breakfast was basic but a huge plus and we were always satisfied afterwards. Pretty much the same thing each day, but still a good variety of stuff so you could change things up. I don't think people realize how important a free breakfast is until you are trying to find a place to eat and walk out paying 25 dollars..We didn't use the pool nor did we have any desire to but it was quite small. Also didn't have a car so can't comment on parking. Location is excellent. Beach was minutes away and it was a nice, quite area of the beach (as opposed to further up where it is ++ crowded). Free towels and umbrellas were well appreciated. Our flight on check out was at 11h30pm. We checked out at 11, left our luggage with the staff and they gave us a hospitality room for an hour to freshen up before our flight. This is a HUGE plus because it means you can still go to the beach on your last day and come back to shower and freshen up. Price wise I don't think you can get any better. Great location, great hotel with NO resort fee and a free breakfast! Would definitely stay again!

Located in a nice quiet end of Waikiki Beach, near Honolulu Zoo, the hotel was just what we were looking for. The room was amazing with ocean views and stunning views of Diamond Head. Staff were all friendly and willing to assist whenever possible. The hotel made our vacation one to remember. Highly recommended.

My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. The location is convenient at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki and 2 blocks from the beach. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Our room was smallish in size but very clean and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable to the extent we are considering purchasing a similar one at home. The breakfast was included and of good quality and variety. WIFI was fast.

The hotel was close to the Waikiki beach and the staffs were very friendly. The room was also cozy and clean. Free breakfast was good enough. It is totally worth every penny. Recommend this hotel for everyone!

The Hyatt Place is one of the few hotels that caters for a family of 5 in the one room - this in itself saved us over a thousand dollars. Becoming a Hyatt member is also beneficial saving dollars of the rack rate. Breakfast is included in the room price and although it's not going to win any awards - it is sufficient with a number of hot dishes plus cereal, yogurt, fruit, toast and an oriental option. The coffee is instant but this is to be expected in an American hotel! Just drink tea or juice if your a coffee snob. The hotel is in a great location just a block back from the beach, parking is available at the hotel and the valet staff are friendly and helpful. There is only 1 restaurant at the Hyatt which serves simple and light meals - which is perfect if you're tired and had a big day or if you prefer there are plenty of restaurants near by. The hotel is equipped with a tour desk offering plenty of things to do and see - tours either head out from the Marriott across the road or right out front of the hotel . The Pink Line Trolley stop is just down the road near Aston Waikiki Beach. All in all a great hotel for a family of 5.

Hyatt Place provided a wonderful and friendly place to stay. Location is great not only for Waikiki area, but also proved to have close freeway access. Great Staff - Clean and comfortable room. Next time in Honolulu would stay here again.

Good hotel. Close to beach. Some rooms are more modern that others. Need to update cable to have HD channels as most stations weren't. Clean room. Limited menu as hotel really doesn't have kitchen. Free breakfast is nice.

I can't say enough good things about The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Our room was so comfortable. The bedding was soft with plenty of fluffy pillows. There were lots of thick white towels and washcloths, too. We loved the breakfast buffet which had new offerings everyday. The lobby and the bar are very attractive with a modern vibe. Over all we had a great stay and would recommend The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach to anyone.

Very clean, comfy hotel with the convenience that breakfast is included. It is located just one block from the ocean. It has nearby restaurants and bars such as Tiki's and Lulu's. The rooms have plenty of space and have a fridge. An excellent choice for families traveling with children to Waikiki.

It was our 2nd time in Waikiki and I would highly recommend the Hyatt Place. Friendly staff, close to everything and you could hear the surf breaking from our balcony. The breakfasts were always fresh with no shortage of food or coffee. Thanks to all the staff for making this a memorable holiday.

The Hyatt Place was very clean and well maintained. The staff was extremely courteous and responsive. Hot breakfast was included and was a nice way to start the day. Pool is small and the area around it is very sparse. I didn't see many using the pool. Close to beach though. Self parking was full all 7 days I was there.

Our first stay with Hyatt Hotels and overall an excellent experience. As with any property, it is the "people" that make or break the stay. Hyatt Place has "hands on" management that run the property very efficiently and you can tell that the staff all love their work. The hotel is very clean and with a well appointed breakfast in the morning it really hit the spot. And I almost forgot; who wants to pay a resort fee! (there is none at this hotel) I would love to see a more Hawaiian influence in the lobby, but otherwise the decor was fine and most importantly, clean! You know you are staying at a property that cares when staff address you by your name. Thanks to Jarren, Lei, Joshua and Fred for your superlative service and smiles!! Thank you Mr. Kherati (you are a star) and Mr. Vasquez for a wonderful visit.

Loved staying here! Super close to everything- plus a free breakfast!Beds were super comfy. Great food and awesome shopping right out front door. Kids snorkeled and played volleyball at the beach - less than five minute walk away.

Excellent accommodations for the area. Close to restaurants, shopping, beach, transportation and anything else that you would like to do on Waikiki beach. The sunsets are amazing from the 3rd floor of the hotel and the gym facility is adequate for its size.
user_name:
Kirk G
New Port Richey, United States

review_body: I stay in hotels about 7-10 nights a month and having to come to Honolulu for work this week I really had to search for a nice hotel that had the business amenities I needed like free WIFI and a full breakfast yet was under $200 a night. I booked my stay at the Hyatt and now having to come about 3 times a year for a week at a time this will be my home base in Honolulu. I booked an ocean view king bed room and go exactly that. Super clean rooms with plenty of work and lounging space. Filling breakfast buffet and great location. The staff is 1st class and treated me everyday like I was the most important guest here. Special call out to all the valet folks, Cole and Christopher at the front desk and Fernando the GM from Chicago! Thanks everyone for a great stay and making my business trip one of my best

First time to Honolulu and our family of 3 stayed here for 5 nights. We would have stayed longer but the manager never returned our call in regards to staying longer so we headed to North shore from here. The location is really great to Waikiki Beach. Easy walking to many areas including the zoo.  Room was of nice size BUT not the washroom. You cannot close the door if you are on toilet. It's very cramped. Also the view we had was of the Marriott across the street. It was very noisy with traffic and sirens. Thank goodness for ear plugs. But like I mentioned the size of room was nice. One of our mattresses was old and worn out to the point I had to sleep in the other with my 3 yr old. We mentioned this to manager and they quickly changed it out which was great. We did have something go missing from our room and we mentioned this. They gave us a small monetary discount but that really wasn't the point. The breakfast was really lovely. I looked forward to this every morning with our 3yr old. He enjoyed the fresh fruit, rice Krispies and yogurt. I enjoyed the bagels, pastries and assortments of juices. The coffee was fantastic. We ordered food downstairs after hours and felt the portion size was very small for what you paid. Flatbread yummy. Didn't use pool but it was outside breakfast area and is small.

We are long time Hyatt Platinum members. This Hyatt Place was just like all the others: consistently clean, friendly staff, plentiful breakfast, comfy beds.It's located in the southern part of Wakiki, but still close to everything. Beach is one block away. But don't go there...rent a car and get out of town to see the real Hawaii.Only downsides: valet parking $30/day, but with in and out privileges; room was the smallest Hyatt I've ever seen; 14th floor ocean view was not the best, big price for nice view of other hotels.

Small rooms, but clean and pleasant. We were on the 8th floor with a partial mountain view. The street noise was tolerable, but the loud air conditioner required me to wear ear plugs all night and I slept poorly.The included breakfast starts at 6:30am and was quite nice. The hot food selection varied in our two mornings there, and the regular offerings included small delectable pastries, yogurt with toppings, various breads to toast and things to smear on them, and tofu and hard boiled eggs. My husband said the coffee was good. The staff keeps things cleaned and stocked.As for the rest of the hotel, the elevators didn't require too long of a wait and everyone was friendly. I had requested an early check-in when I booked, and we were able to check in as soon as we arrived about 1:45pm. The hotel is just a block from the beach and right on several major bus lines. It was easy to get to and from Ala Moana and Diamond Head using the Bus.

The depiction of the room wasn't completely true: the ocean view was tall buildings and roof tops, very little ocean view, with high price tiny room.The room was very little, but clean. Internet showed large room with unobstructed view that wasn't the reality.

great experience traveling for work then extending into a vacation. expensive for what I'm used to, but probably quite average for Waikiki. 3 minute walk to the beach. not luxurious but kept perfectly clean and rooms are made perfectly. great staff with amazing customer service, everyone makes an effort to welcome you. all interactions with staff were extremely positive. very comfortable beds and the best pillow I have ever slept on. I wanted to offer to buy my pillow but forgot in our rush to leave.

I cannot praise the staff of the Hyatt Place Waikiki enough. In particular, Edna made us feel like family. She is wonderful! Everyone we interacted with at the Hyatt Place made us feel special and valued: Matt at check-in, Kimberly helping us with check-out, the front desk folks who offered us beach towels and collected them again, even the smiling folks who served and bused at breakfast. The hotel was comfortable and very clean: the housekeeping staff did a marvelous job of taking care of our room and keeping up with any requests. They carefully arranged my kids' stuffed animals and made sure we had plenty of everything. We had a marvelous view of the beach from our ocean-view room on the 20th floor. The rooms were pleasant and very quiet -- we never heard any other guests. Lest you think I am just all sunshine and roses, the air conditioner was a bit loud, I would have liked a desk drawer or two, and some of the guests at breakfast had no concept of personal space (and were obnoxiously pushy). It seemed that the earlier one went to breakfast, the fewer obnoxious folks were there. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in a very good value. It is one long-ish block from the beach, half a block from the nearest ABC store, across the street from public parking, and within an easy walk of dozens of places to eat.

The hotel was well located and easy to get around walking distance to most places. Friendly staff and very helpful. Breakfast was great. Rooms where clean maybe need an update more modernised. Overall would stay there next time

We enjoyed Hyatt Place in Waikki immensely. The hotel did not have a resort fee (many others do) and offered free breakfast which was excellent (lots of choices). Two blocks from the beach (a part of the beach better for families). The room was spacious. Our only complaint was lack of recycling containers but that could be a City issue. The room had a fridge so a trip (4 blocks?) up Kuhio street to the Food Pantry for groceries is recommended as there aren't many affordable restaurants nearby. Inexpensive things to do include: Diamond Head (go by cab or bus) (do not take a tour, there is nothing a tour does that you can't do and Diamond Head only costs $1 to get in), Hanauma Bay (by bus), $7.50 adults, kids are free, Dole Pineapple Plantation (by bus, though it takes 1.5 hours each way), International Market (this has been transformed into a highly commercial outlet with high-end stores but some of the original market with its huts and Hawaiian wear still exists at the side of the Holiday Inn.

Had an upgraded room on the 15th floor (not "club"). The hotel was satisfactorily clean (not sparkling new, but I did not have to shower in flip-flops). The staff was very responsive which was the best part of the entire experience. Having only the two elevators is a little frustrating during peak times. The "mountain view" is a bit of a joke because you see only a sliver of mountain between two other hotels. The breakfast arrangement on the third floor is also a bit undesirable, with an outdoor setup only satisfactory on the most beautiful of days (they need a better back-up plan for rainy days). The location is NOT good if you want to be close to the high-end Waikiki shops (they are a 15 minute walk away from here). But to be honest, who really wants to be located where it's so busy? We quite enjoyed that it was at the far end of the stretch of beaches - we could walk to the nearest beach (2 blocks away) and find a space in the sand without crowds. Pedestrian and street traffic was also less. I know that it seems like this is an overall negative review, but I think that for a traveler that wants to do Waikiki for a reasonable amount of money this is a pretty solid option. For someone who has to stay in Waikiki but wants to avoid the hustle-bustle of Waikiki, this is as good a location as any. BUT, if you want beautiful ocean-front views, then sure, the Surfrider would have this place beat.

I sept great and I usually have trouble sleeping in a new place. The people are friendly and gave us great places to eat. Check in and out was easy. The hotel was two blocks from the beach. Great experience overall.

This was our second time staying at this hotel and I highly recommend it. The rooms are clean, large, beds are comfortable, and the rooms are quiet. The hotel is very clean and the staff are extremely helpful. It is 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and we walked to the beach daily. I would suggest to find free parking on the street if possible it can be quite pricey if you use their lot. Shops and food are within walking distance. The free daily breakfast was ok, but it does save you money. You are also able to take it up to your room if you don't want to eat it there. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Employee's were all pleasant and service was good. Room too small and was noisy from street traffic. View poor. No bathroom fan. Not enough furniture and storage. Restaurants were very limited and we had to walk to other hotels to find what we wanted.. This hotel has less amenities and services than nearby hotels, The Mariott and Aston Waikee Beach had much better restaurants. Had to stand in the rain to eat at the breakfast buffet, not enough covered seating. The Valet ramp was very small and buses and shuttles could not access it so you had to walk, same with bellhop service for bags. Overall, I would pay more to get a hotel with more services and larger rooms.

Good Hotel, near the beach and other places, you can go walking to restaurantes, shops, etc. Efficient and kindly personal, very good rooms and beds and services in general. They try to please in what you need.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and i am pleased to say it wouldn't have been the same with out this hotel. The building itself is BEAUTIFUL just a few blocks from the beach and a short walk to the Honolulu Zoo. The kitchen is open 24/7.

Keep in mind that the check-in is not until 3 PM which is a problem if you arrive early. Rooms are clean and the location is very good. Breakfast was included which is but some days the food was much better than others.

Hyatt place is a very solid hotel. Good location to the beach and Continental breakfast comes in handy. You get good value from Hyatt place given price, location, breakfast and no resort fee; however if the beach experience is the utmost importance for your trip, you will need to stay at an ocean front hotel otherwise you have to bring chairs, towels, etc to the beach compared to another hotel where it's available for you right there. The public beach 2 small blocks away from the hotel is okay, just not as good as in the middle or upper part of waikiki beach. So it just depends on what you are looking for out of your trip. Pool at Hyatt place is nothing to call home to mom about either. The poor rating I gave for sleep quality was just my experience in the room, we could not quite get the a/c at the right temperature on a consistent basis and a prior guest left the alarm on for 3:25am, so my sleep wasn't the best but that doesn't mean the next guests won't.

Good choice if you want a price lower than beachfront but still close by. Clean, good breakfast buffet (included), only a couple of blocks from Waikiki. Some of the Waikiki Trolley routes stop close by at the Aston Hotel.If you have stayed at other Hyatt Place hotels, be aware that this one doesn't have the typical room layout. It is a more traditional hotel room.

This is a very nice large Hotel that feels not too large and lost, which makes it perfect for longer stays. Excellent friendly management and staffing making a personable friendly, comforting and calm environment.
user_name:
mariamF7892BH
New York City, United States

review_body: I forgot my wedding ring in my room at check out and after giving up hope of ever seeing it again a day later the manager had not given up and had gone the extra mile to check every possible nook and cranny and was able to recover it. The free breakfast is great with lots of fresh fruit and healthy options as well as bacon and eggs. The hotel has excellent amenities and location is excellent close to beach and lots of great restaurants.

Excellent location, just 5 minutes to beach, away from traffic, great breakfast each morning, great lobby, good people, internet lounge was good, 29.00 flat fee to airport with Charlies taxi , close to many convienent stores, restaurants, shopping, main bus stations

hotel is beautiful. has friendly staff with vast knowledge of the going on on island. they were happy to help. helped us book day activities. make sure to call reception for cab services. charged a flat rate of only 30$ to the airport. consider this before paying individual fees

This hotel is very well located for any visiting the WAIKIKI beach area, only minutes from the beach. All amenities are with in close walking distance including public transit. Daily breakfast is served at this Hotel at no extra cost . The customer service Rep who check us in & out was very accommodating and went out of his normal call of duty to make my wife and I enjoy VIP type of service.

We stayed at Hyatt Place for 5 nights. Our room had city view but we could see the ocean too. Hotel is well located (5 minutes to the Waikiki beach, Starbucks, ABC store and the bus stop). Room was spacious, modern and clean. Breakfasts were quite good, various choice of food, but the biggest drawback was the fact that there were not enough tables for everyone so sometimes we just had to take food to our room. I highly recommend this hotel.

We sent one night at this property at the end of our vacation to get closer to the airport than where our condo was located. Great access to Waikiki Beach, Diamond Head, and the Zoo. The room was fantastic, and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

We went for our honeymoon and it outdid our expectations! As soon as we approached the front desk to check in, we were told congratulations and that we had been upgraded to a better room. The front desk attendant asked us if we liked red wine and sent up a complimentary bottle for us to enjoy! The room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathrooms have been updated and the shower was tiled and big enough for two. There was complementary breakfast every morning with lots of choices (eggs, bacon, french toast, fresh fruit and pastries) a great option if you're looking to save some money. Waikiki beach is right down the street just a quick walk away, there are a variety of places to eat within walking distance and lots of shopping options as well, there is an ABC store basically right beside the hotel.

Probably one to avoid if you can. Spend the extra 20-50 dollars a night and stay elsewhere! Housekeeping did not attend to our room for two days in a row (level 11). The second day was even worse as we had left over buffet breakfast sitting in the room all day. The reason we had to bring the buffet breakfast on a tray to our room is because the breakfast area was crowded. The area itself has zero ambience, you feel like you're eating between four concrete walls, it has minimal space around an uninspiring pool. It is literally a rectangle with water in it, nothing else (nothing what the photos make it look like!). The main thing that has been disappointing is the service, it is very hot and cold which says a lot about the management of the place, extremely inconsistent. An example of this was on check in. At time of booking 6 months earlier I politely requested for an early check in. This wasn't to be which is fair enough however I was not communicated with. I arrived at the hotel at 830am, was told the room might be ready by 12. Went for a walk up and down the beach, did some shopping, ate and then returned at 12, the room was still not ready and I asked if any efforts could be made to get in a little earlier at 2pm as opposed to their suggested 3pm. I fell asleep on the lobby couch which was (embarrassing but) comfortable, only to wake up around 2pm and be told the room is still not ready... They tried to upsell me another room which was available immediately for $30USD per day, and over 7 days it adds up so I politely declined. Why not give it complimentary and show some service or acknowledgement for me waiting so long!!?? I eventually got into the room at 2:45pm however it was on a level below as the original room was still not ready. At the end of the day you get what you pay for but I have not had a good experience at this place, next time I'll be staying elsewhere and spending a little extra for what will hopefully be a better place with better service and housekeeping. Oh and one other thing, being very picky here, the shower water pressure is missing, it's a bit like their housekeeping, MIA!

Why is this hotel a little less costly than most of the other big chains? The service is excellent, rooms are big and the location is good, one block from the beach. Even better, breakfast is included! But . . . breakfast was a mob scene, by the pool at seating that is inferior to everything else at the hotel. The pool itself is very small and uninviting, always in the shade.

We enjoyed our brief stay at Hyat Place Waikiki Beach. I always appreciate Hyatt Place properties when I travel. The only weak link in a very strong chain is the breakfast. It could be improved a bit, quality wise.

Have stayed here 4-5 times in as many years. Previous stays were OK, as location is good, room and service adequate, and received good value for $$ or points used for stay. My last stay presented nothing but issues - poor elevator service (has always been an issue much more so now), terrible breakfast (overcrowded and poor replenishment), and room condition average at best. Street noise unbearable from low floor. Management unresponsive.

Our stay was notable for courteous treatment, helpful comments and casual conversation throughout our visit. I doubt they remembered us from our first visit 15 months ago, but it seemed as if we were more than the usual guests. Small things such as asking if we had gone to the dining area to enjoy breakfast (40 minutes before termination) and repeated inquiries to determine if we were enjoying the area attractions were appreciated. We look forward to our next visit.

The staff is so helpful and friendly, the rooms clean, the breakfast great, always beach towels available, everything is really good in this hotel. Excellent location. I recommend this place for everyone.

Lili best. She was so helpful and so sweet. She spoke Chinese to my friends and told us if we need anything let her know. Nice room and coffee maker in room. GreAt view and nice staff. Beautiful rooms

Not too big a hotel, just a few minutes walk to the beach. Super friendly staff and the biggest room for our family we've stayed at. Huge!! Great breakfast though we wish there was more seating or the other tourists wouldn't linger as much! Slight ocean view on a small balcony but honestly the location is spot on you're hardly using it. Worth booking.

To me it looked like this hotel had been newly renovated, or at least recently gotten a new coat of paint and some new furniture. I've stayed in several hotels in downtown Waikiki, and this one was the nicest so far (for the price level). If you're searching for a htoel in downtown Waikiki and this one comes up a little bit higher than some of the others that you've never heard of, FOR SURE go ahead and book this one. Breakfast was also included which was a nice touch. I may not have had a view, but I had a large balcony, a couch, comfy bed and nice decor. The staff was friendly and again, it was well priced. You're super close to the beach, but also Diamond head which is nice.

- complimentary breakfast - 1 minute walk from Waikiki Beach - early check in available upon request (room was ready for us at 8am) - free wifi - worth the price and affordable - helpful staff (making bookings and suggesting activities)

Small gem conveniently in walking distance to Waikiki beach, Honolulu Zoo and shops/nightlife. Ocean view without the noise and crowds. Hotel and room were cozy modern tropical, clean and fresh. 24 room service and bar. Check in and check out were quick and easy. Free breakfast was surprisingly pleasant. Besides the typical cold foods that are only present at "free breakfast", hot foods and Asian foods were available. Only drawbacks were one small pool with no hot tub but then again beach is literally a block away. Also the only parking options were to valet for $30 per night or a public parking structure across the street for $20 per night or street parking. I found the parking structure convenient since the walk across is about the same amount of time the valet would have taken to retrieve your car, safe since there is a 24/7 security guard on site and not overly crowded with available parking. Depending on your type of vacation and who you are with either parking option will suffice.

Friendly and accomodating staff all around. Great location. Clean rooms, good free breakfast. Fridge in the room. Small balcony. Comfortable bed. Next to Wolf Gangpuck express restaurant where the food is quite good. Walking distance from the beach.

Whatever your reason to be on Waikiki, the Hyatt Place will enhance your experience. EXCELLENT value for price, including friendly, helpful staff and a wonderful hot breakfast. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Location off the main drag means rooms are quieter than most and away from the crowds.
user_name:
Arlene E P
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: If you are looking for a nice hotel, competitively priced and breakfast included in the property fee, then this is the place for you. The rooms are nice, fairly spacious and everyone is very nice to you. The bar serves HH and pupus, so if you want something light you don't even need to leave!!!

Top 5 worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was over an extremely busy street, noisy 24/7. The hotel or apartment complex's smoking area was same level on top of a garage. The bus stop across the street had a homeless encampment. I didnt realize when I booked my room when it said city view, thats all i could see, the street city view. The air conditioning when it came on sounded like a plane taking off. The bathroom was so small you had to step into the shower to open and close the door. I wont ever stay here again and I will tell everyone dont stay here, especially since I used 3 years worth of points to book the trip. Why be a member of the Hyatt program when this is how they take care of their members?

Great place, great location and caring staff. The breakfast was awesome, if any downfall would be the valet parking. Go 10 minutes earlier for your car, but overall outstanding. Also, the bed was just right and room very clean!!

Staff was friendly and hotel rooms were clean. Great location for all activities in Waikiki. We would go back there again. Very modern rooms close to the beach. We would recommend this to anyone looking for a great hotel with a reasonable price.

Having stayed at the Hyatt Place when it first opened, we were fortunate to see how it has changed and grown with both towers and more facilities in the lobby open. This was our fourth stop on this trip, two on the Big Island and then Ko Olina and ending for my husband's birthday at the Hyatt Place for 4 nights to end our trip. We were thrilled at Hyatt members, to be upgraded to an oceanview room with a balcony in the new tower! Check in could not have been easier and the reception staff very helpful. Our room was the smallest of the 4 places we stayed, but it was well designed and had everything you would need, included a very large safe for all your valuables and computer. The room included a most thoughtful tray to take down to the lovely included breakfast in case someone wanted to take breakfast for themselves or others up to the room! Hot dishes for breakfast and pastries changed daily in addition to all the usual staples. The fruit was fresh and delicious and perfect ripeness.. They were very accommodating to us for our request for a custom benny with no pork. The pool is quite small, but you have Waikiki Beach at your beck and call just blocks away including some very good snorkeling. Shopping and all sites within Waikiki were walkable as well as great restaurant choices. The shopping scene has also escalated to world class with the newly redone International Marketplace including Sak's Fifth Avenue and Laboutin and much more.. Ala Moana's extension was jaw dropping with the new restaurant level and Shirokiya and Sears were replaced by Bloomingdales and every other name boutique you could think of. While Shirokiya was gone, the epic food floor was replaced by an expanded Japanese Walk that was all kinds of Asian delicacies and their famous $1 beer. Beach towels were available at the desk, newspapers around, 2 gift shops and there were snacks for sale and Happy Hour at the bar in the lobby with several tvs and welcoming couches was very inviting, in addition to the computers for guests. Hyatt Place was an excellent value and a great brand point as part of the Hyatt family while getting the benefits of breakfast and wifi and nice amenities in room. No bathrobes. You will be made to feel at home and Hyatt Place's location is excellent. We did not park in the hotel, but we always found space along the canal or down the street .

I booked here for a conference and stayed for a vacation and wish I'd stayed anywhere else. Just a few examples of what was awful: Stale bread used for breakfast French toast. Burned coffee. Getting breakfast in the poorly laid-out, dirty, self-serve poolside area was like running an obstacle course. The only thing palatable was the pineapple; after a few days of trying this and that gross piece of breakfast fare in an unpleasant environment I started eating out every morning. Everything I ate everywhere else was delightful, whether I paid more or less. Bear in mind you'll be eating poolside, three stories up, listening to the racket from the street and defending your breakfast food from attacking pigeons no matter the hour or the weather. If you have to be up and out early and it's raining, you'll be sitting in the dark and the rain listening to trash compactors eating stale, soggy, bland food while you shiver and wonder what bad karma sent you to such a dismal place. If you try to use the pool as a pool after breakfast, you'll find it's just as cold and noisy, because by the time breakfast is cleaned up this "roof side pool" on the third floor of the building is completely encased in the shadow of the towers in the same hotel. Poolside area is dank, floors stained, no one uses it except for the forced march of breakfast. And yeah, kids throw food in the pool during breakfast. So that's nice. About the room: there was sand and mold in my shower on arrival--and not cleaned for the next week. Cracks in wall in bathroom. Dirty footprints on my pillowcase and bloodstains on the sheets. I kid you not. In other ways, too, housekeeping was appalling. The whole room (and I hated it enough that I looked at others, but none I saw were any better) was terribly designed. It's large but laid out badly so it feels like a prison regardless. The desk is tucked in a corner with no windows and no light from the windows reaches it. The desk lamp creates a pinpoint glare on its own base but no actual illumination for the workspace. The ground is not level and the chair is a swivel seat, which keeps swiveling away in response to gravity, so you literally have to anchor yourself with a limb or tie yourself down if you want to sit facing the desk. In other words, the space is totally unusable. The king-sized bed was somehow way smaller than any other king-size I've slept on. A faux king, made just for the Hyatt? The bed and sofa face each other. Neither, oddly, faces the TV. If you want to watch TV, get used to it being at an off angle and crane your neck accordingly. The bathroom mirror/sink area is super dark. Ladies and metrosexuals: you won't be able to do any detail work on your hair or makeup in there. The whole place is dark dark dark. There is a small, grimy, uncomfortable balcony attached to the room. Not a fun place to spend any time, and recessed in such a way as to block both the view and the light. There is an in-house bar. Order beer or something. Don't try the cocktails. I tried the overpriced mai tai and it was the worst (at best second-worst) cocktail of my life. There is no room service. You can pick up and carry back to your own room any food you'd like to order--but don't. The alleged "grilled chicken pesto panini with goat cheese" that I ordered was the worst sandwich I've ever paid $14 for. I wouldn't pay $4 for that bait-and-switch sandwich. What they did is toast some flavorless Wonderbread-variety bread (not the "panini bread" they advertise), put some apparently boiled or microwaved chicken in there (not "grilled" as advertised), melt some greasy flavorless white cheese on it (not goat, as advertised), omit the pesto (as far as I could tell), and keep the proportion of the vegetables advertised so low that you basically won't know they're there. Worst. Sandwich. Ever. If you're going to serve a grilled cheese with boiled chicken sandwich, just call it that. Grrrr. Let's see, what else... the elevators are so crowded you have to wait a good long while to use them. I was not on a low floor but ended up taking the stairs to save myself the wait. Saw other young, able-bodied people making the same choice. The gym exists. Better than nothing, but barely. Stinky and poorly ventilated, so I didn't manage to get in a good workout after all before feeling lousy and leaving. Book at your own risk. Oh, and repeated miscommunication with the front desk staff to top things off. Just hated this place. Getting out of there was like being released from prison. I'm so glad to be home!

We are so happy with this choice of hotel. I'm really picky about my hotels as I don't see them as "just a bed". I spent ages reading reviews and weighing up pros and cons before finally booking this hotel. I booked through Booking.com but due to some of the negative reviews on here, I contacted the hotel directly explaining what I was looking for, especially as we were spending 11 nights here and wanted everything to be right. We were offered a $15 per night upgrade which gave us a much better room in size and aspect. This was totally worth doing. The hotel responds quickly to emails and are very helpful. We arrived at 8:30am and as I'd let them know we were arriving early, they kindly had 1 room ready so we could get on with enjoying our time here. The room we have is spacious, clean and modern. The bathroom is not large but adequate and clean. We have no complaints with breakfast, I'll post photos to give you an idea of some of the options. There's plenty of choice and we have saved a lot of money not eating breakfast out. The breakfast area is busy, we always wander down 1/2 an hour before it's due to finish so that might explain something! We could take a tray back to our room but we've always found a table for the 5 of us.The hotel is a short easy stroll to the beach. We stayed at the other end of the beach last time but much prefer this end. It's still lively and there are some excellent restaurants and fast food places including Starbucks very close by. There's an ABC store about 2 doors away for snacks, alcohol, sandwiches and essential groceries. We are in there a lot! The pool area is small and not luxurious but it's pleasant to lie around if you want a break from the crowds of Waikiki. We've had it to ourselves at times. The family have loved using the gym. It's not too busy either and has enough equipment to keep everyone happy. We are very happy to be staying here and can totally recommend this hotel.

The hotel is 2 blocks from the beach and any main street. So it was quiet place to sleep and close to the beach and two main streets to catch a bus anywhere you wanted to go. A good breakfast is included with large trays to carry enough for 2 back to your room if desired. The room was a little smaller than most but quite nice.

We are loyal Gold Passport Members and try to stay at Hyatt properties - especially Hyatt Places - whenever possible. However, the Waikiki Beach Hyatt Place did not meet expectations. The staff - starting with the valet (and $40 a night with no self parking option seems very steep - and it did take 20-3- minutes, even after calling down, to get the car) to the check in/desk staff were not overly welcoming. The room, with the partial, mostly obstructive ocean view, was itsy bitsy - especially in the bathroom, but I do have to say it was clean. But most of the frontline staff did not go out of their way to be helpful. Breakfast - one of the reasons we love Hyatt Place - was a bit of a disaster. It is served on the pool deck (if you can call it that - will address that in a minute) was extremely crowded and other guest were hovering waiting for you to finish. I get it -- it was Christmas week, and the hotel was booked -- but one of the days we were there, it was windy and rainy, and 95% of the seating was open air, so there was nowhere to sit to eat, and the covered area was packed. We ended up taking our plates and bowls up to our room and eating picnic style on the floor. And because the hotel was so crowded, breakfast staff worked very hard to keep clean bowls, plates, silverware, and cups out (which was made more difficult since everyone had to run back to their rooms). They did a good job in restocking the breakfast items and drinks. The pool was miniscule. I guess it meets the minimum size to being called a "pool". I asked if the hotel had any type of reciprocity with the other Hyatt (four blocks away) or resort to allow HP guests to use their real pools with pool side services for a nominal fee. I was met with blank stares. A lot of guests maybe would not take advantage of it, but it seems like it should be a viable options to those who did not want to go a very crowded, narrow public beach. (the bigger and nicer beaches seemed to be associated with the bigger hotels on the beach.Next time, we would opt to pay a little more and stay at one of the bigger resorts.
user_name:
Shelliedc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location to the beach and all facilities in Waikiki. Very friendly and efficient staff. We had two rooms booked and we were thrilled to have rooms next to each other with connecting doors. Great to have buffet breakfast included.

Hotela location is very good for shopping and beach, you can walk al of sightseng place in waikiki beah.Rooms doors noise is very high at closing.Selfnparking is not enough and valet parking is expensiveValet staff is very good and fast

Good hotel, just off the main beach street but not too far. Ocean view is above floor 15 because there are other buildings in the way. The room was spacious but the bathroom was tiny and difficult to maneuver.

We enjoyed the service and everything we needed was in walking distance. The staff was exceptional. I've never experienced such happy and helpful people. The breakfast was just enough to get up and get going for the day.

Our stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki for about week was a wonderful experience. Ihab Kherati, Dino and the other gallery hosts were very friendly and helpful at all times. The room was very good,clean and peaceful with a great view of the Waikiki beach. The hotel is ideally located, a couple of blocks from the beach and just minutes from anywhere in Waikiki. We loved the free breakfast. It saved us time and money. Once again, a big thank you to the staff for making this stay so enjoyable.

Except the room is big enough, overall service is not qualified to be warm hospitality. Location is good but not the best. As the rate I book has the option to select others which is closed the beach.

We are staying here for 4 night(2 nights in right now). We needed a place as we couldn't get into Aulani for our whole stay. The customer service here is excellent. We arrived late(really late) and our kids were starving - they were able to have muffins and a drink which was great. The first room we checked into had a large wet area in the carpet.. Probably a spilled bucket from cleaning staff. We were immediately put into another room - actually a better one.. This next room was great. The breakfast has a lot of selection and a lot of volume - if you go late you're not dealing with nothing left. The views from this hotel are okay.. Not spectacular.. But who's hanging out in the hotel all day??

I would stay here again for the following reasons: -- Room was large, roomy, comfortable, and slept 6 (with pull-out couch) -- Complimentary breakfast -- Quiet -- Exceptional cleaning staff who kept our room tidy, always came after we'd left, and even left us extra towels without being asked. -- Close to everything if you don't have a car. I would change the following if possible: -- Breakfast area is outside with VERY LIMITED cover which was uncomfortable because it misted every morning during breakfast. They need more cover. -- We rented a car, but were unable to park at the hotel because it was full and the parking attendants didn't seem too empathetic. We parked across the street at the Banyan hotel and in the end, preferred doing that because it was cheaper and more convenient than the Hyatt, but that first night we were concerned. -- During busy times, it can take a long time to get down or up with so many floors and only 2 elevators.

Beach view was misleading and blocked and was frustrating to have buildingsome blocking the view. Otherwise I was happy with food and variety in it. Also, no flowers or hawaii stuff were there to welcome.
Good value for money Clean and great staffing Clean room Good breakfast Close to Check in and check out easyGood security Price was reasonable Swimming pool was great post days trips for relaxing

Good place for families. Good range of choices included for breakfast. Plenty of pool towels available at the front desk if you forget them. Cafe in the foyer and our room was good with lots of space.

Our family absolutely loved our recent stay at Hyatt place, Hawaii. Very friendly staff, great amenities and great view from Ocean view room. Wonderful buffet breakfast with great variety in options, good service, good venue, and very clean.

Other than the fight for breakfast & a place to sit, this hotel was awesome. Front desk staff are great, rooms are great and location is great. The pool is no good but you're in Hawaii so I'm sure you'll be at the beach anyway!

Nice weekend away for New Years. Close proximity to beach and stores. No hot tub, but nice, clean and mostly quiet - especially for a holiday. Staff is efficient and attentive. Buy water or other drinks to put in the mini fridge from the ABC store about half a block from the hotel.

We checked in to the hotel on January 1, 2017. The check in was easy. The "partial ocean view" was very much just that - there was another building in front of us and we could only see glimpses in between buildings. The room was very clean and the beds were wonderful. They charged us over $400 for a one night stay. The water was over $3.00 per bottle, there is no room service (they have a service you can call and go retrieve the food but they do not deliver it to your door) the breakfast was included, but they didn't open until 6:30 in the morning and we had to be at the airport by 5:30am. For the amount of money that we paid it was not worth the stay and I would not waste money there again.

The kids loved the complementary breakfast and I found the beds very confortable .The hotel is close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. The room was spacious. I liked being able to go down to the lobby and and have a coffee made to my liking! Room service food was very good and not to pricey!!

We stayed over New Years Eve for 3 days, visiting from Kona. We were absolutely thrilled with our stay. We arrived early and were happy to find they could accomodate us with an early check-in. Our room was clean, the bed was comfy and we had a nice ocean view. The rest of the hotel was equally as nice. The breakfast was fine and exactly what you would expect since its included. The staff was sooo friendly. Everyone! Heidi even ran and grabbed us some breakfast as we were running for our cab to the airport. The location was great for us. We were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go. I would recommend this hotel!

Great family place, includes breakfast, close to the zoo, Kapiolani Park and good beaches for keiki. Easy access to city bus system and taxis can be arranged through the front desk. Recommend for family groups and those not looking for all the frills of the Hyatt Regency.

This hotel needs a good cleaning....the bottom of the shower door had mold and the room needed a good cleaning from dust. The pool had debris that looked like toilet paper on the filter for 3 days. The breakfast buffet was ok, but the eggs were very bland. The location of the hotel is Great.

This hotel is well located. That is really the only positive. The bathroom is the worst hotel bathroom that I have experienced anywhere in the world. The basin is in a space just inside the door. There is one basin and virtually no hanging space for towels. The toilet and little shower are in a separate room not much bigger than a cupboard . Cheap finishes and basic tiles. There is no room for 2 suitcases and the decor is basic. Budget hotel is where this Hyatt should be classified.

We spent a week at the Hyatt Place over Xmas 2016 and must say that the hotel is not worth the money. Location is good, staff are great and that is where it ends. Facility is tired for the price of above USD 600 per night and with tax nearly 700. For that price, you would expect room service, faster elevators, a range of restaurant facilities including a decent breakfast and a spa for eg. Hyatt Place had a limited breakfast area, on the third floor next to a pool you would see in a suburban back yard. Food range was as basic as a motel and no offer of an omelette or a cappuccino for eg. Was amazed. For the price I would consider other options in Waikiki closer to the beach to get the supposed Ocean view premium. Very disappointed.

My husband and I spent two one night stays during our two week trip throughout Hawaii. Both nights were just stopovers before and after our flights in and out of Honolulu. Though our time was brief at the hotel, it was clear this place is run well and has a staff that really takes service seriously. Everyone from the valet and the front desk to housekeeping was courteous and efficient. The front desk was terrific when it came to addressing Diamond Gold Passport members. They remembered to ask about the bonus points and late check out perks; something that did not happen during a recent stay at the Park Hyatt in Chicago.The hotel is in a good location if you're looking to stay around Waikiki and go to the beach. You can definitely walk to many of the tourist locations in that area. Rooms were clean and a decent size, on par with the Hyatt Place brand. Breakfast was also decent. It was the typical spread at a Hyatt Place with eggs, some sort of batter dish, grains, breakfast meats. What was nice was that this breakfast had a bit of Hawaiian/Asian flair with rice, miso soup and Japanese/Chinese trimmings. It made it seem less like a typical cookie cutter chain.

I'm a frequent traveler and I'm really not someone expecting a lot. I'm ok with most of hotel reviews.Regarding the Hyatt Place; I'm a little frustrated on how bad the breakfast is organized.We've selected this hotel mainly because they offer free breakfast which is really a plus. The breakfast is good but the location and organization of the breakfast is a nightmare.Breakfast is outside on the 3rd floor terrace. Be ready with a lot of wind and even rain. Not really nice to have a breakfast under the rain.Hard to get spoon; cup and plates because need to wait that they are clean. Probably a good recommendation to the hotel director would be to buy more cups; plates ; fork and knife.Back to the breakfast location; because it is so crowded that many people take back the food to their rooms.I'm sure the hotel could easily improve the breakfast management at minimum cost.You're in Honolulu for the beach but be aware that Hyatt swimming pool is really really small.On the positive point- Kind staff.- Location is good. Close to everything.- Close to Waikiki beach.- Few meters from Pink Line.- Clean room

Hayat is good hotel to stay and enjoy our travel. Employee and all service team are very kind as well as sastify customer. We certainly go out back to Hayat when we travel around the world. We do like to stay at Hayat hotel whenever we travel

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki in December. We used the Senior discount to book the room. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet for 2 mornings. We used the fitness room once. We would recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Great stay! Nice room, tasty breakfast, friendly staff. Parking was cumbersome in the mornings. Lots of people waiting for the three valets trying to bring cars around. Show up early. Overall loved the location and great staff!

great location, amazing breakfast, friendly service, room as were very clean, WiFi was great, great amenities at hotel, hotel was easily accessible by local transit and waikiki trolley, beach was close

This was a great hotel for several reasons it was very clean and the staff was very friendly the price was right and it was to beach and the pink line trolley was right outside of hotel the ABC stores were also very close by

I have stayed at Hyatt Place in Waikiki and even before it was Hyatt Place (formerly Ocean Resort). The Hyatt Place is always a great place to stay and one employee makes you feel like your family. Her name is Leisina Teo. Leisina also worked at this property before it was Hyatt Place. Leisiana is very professional and also has a great personality. One day I was in Waikiki and she was so nice as to ask me how I was doing and if I have any questions as places to go/eat, etc...The Hyatt Place is always a great place to stay, all of the staff are always eager to please you and very nice. The rooms are very nice and very clean. The property is very well kept. Again, the Hyatt Place is home away from home and with great employees like Leisiana (Leisiana treats you like family), I will be staying there again.

Beds are comfortable and clean. Staff willing to help at all time.We had 2 nights under 2 different names,Jade made sure we had the same room so we didn't have to move around. Location very close to Diamond Head and parks. Swimming pool is very small,we did't need the pool. Hotel is one block from the beach. Everything is super clean in the room. The room size is huge. Free breakfast with soup,etc. location very close to bus stops.

The hotel was nice but the hotel was very noisy. When other guest entered or exited their rooms, the hotel would literally shake when their doors slam. Breakfast options are very limited. Quick to charge an upgrade fee.

Not a beach front hotel but still quite close. The room was very spacious and clean. The elevator was a bit slow. Very good customer service. Not enough parking spots close by. Had to valet park for $30 / day. Overall, we liked it and will definitely consider staying here.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 days only as part of the last leg of our Oahu trip (before heading to Kauai). The hotel/building is a bit dated but the rooms have been upgraded with modern furniture (typical HP style). Our room was big for Waikiki standards. There was plenty of space for my family (myself, husband and 2 young boys aged 7 and 9). The lanai is nice to have but nothing to write home about - small and narrow but has patio furniture for you to sit and have a coffee/beverage. I asked for city view and boy did I get that. We were on the 5th floor and our lanai was overlooking the roofs of other buildings...and other people's apartments! The room, while spacious, was showing its age especially in the washroom. The bathtub showed wear and tear and so did the grout/tiles in the bathroom. The biggest complaint I had with this HP is that it isn't on the greatest side of Waikiki. It sits between Kuhio Ave (which is apparently pretty sketchy at night) and an alleyway. You can hear the noise of people and cars coming and going at all times of the day/night but I guess I should expect that in busy Waikiki. The alley way where this hotel is beside has one other hotel across from it (Ewa Hotel) and beside that hotel is a hostel or two!!! There's an ABC store right beside the hotel which is quite convenient but then again there's an ABC store on everyone corner in the Waikiki Beach area. I noticed that there were a few homeless people walking/hanging out near the area too...Location is close to Waikiki Beach closer to Diamond Head. It's less than a 3 minute walk away. The hotel is close by to fast food joints like Burgee King and McDonalds. It's a few minutes (7-10 mins) to the International Market Place. The HP is so close to Honolulu Zoo - less than 5 min walk. I made the mistake of hauling my fam to walk to Diamond Head from the hotel. It is a good 50-55 minute walk to the entrance of Diamond Head park/trail. And another 1-2 hrs to do the round-trip hike up and down the DH trail. Wear sneakers (no flip flops); it's rocky and some areas are steep. I saw some ppl in their flip flops and I'm not sure they were comfy at all. If you walk to DH, entrance fee is $1 per person. If you drive, the carload is $5. There's an awesome food truck at the base of the entrance (the only one, so bring cash with you. I guarantee you're going to get thirsty or hungry after you've made the round trip up/down Diamond Head...shave ice for $4, hot dog for $4, fresh coconut for $6, etc. We rented a car and had used the valet service for the entire stay at the HP. I wasn't about to try to find street parking. The hotel charges $30/night which I thought was reasonable for Waikiki standards. (We stayed at Aulani and it was $42 per nite for baker). Valet service was great and quick. The guys were attentive and polite. I don't know how they do it because the entrance to the hotel is so narrow and tight. The hotel staff were really pleasant and truly customer service oriented including the room attendant. We wanted to warm up food (leftovers) and because the room doesn't have a microwave, I went down to the main floor/bar area where they warmed it up for me. They offer a free breakfast too. We took advantage of that for the 2 mornings we were there. They switch up the offerings every day and I can't complain. With HI prices being so expensive in general, it was nice to have a free breakfast to start your day ie. cereal, yogurt, fruits, bagels, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. I used the fitness room during my stay. It was tricky finding it at first but when I did, I certainly took advantage of what they had to offer. (The fitness room is on the same floor where they serve the buffet breakfast which is where the pool is too). There are some free weights, a few treadmills (6 I think), elliptical, etc. There are towels for you to use as well. Love that it's also open 24/7. During my last morning there, I woke up early because we had to catch a morning flight, and I was the only there at 515-600am. The pool is tiny! The days we were there, no one was in there.
