There is some seating around the pool but it is very limited. Noticed that it really isn't kid-friendly. I think the shallowest end is 3.5 ft. Although I didn't take advantage of the pool, I saw that the hotel offered towels. We took advantage of the laundry room. There are only 2-3 washing machines and 3-4 dryers. Anyway, we did 1 load of laundry. $3 for use of each. Detergentsis $2. They only accept exact change or credit card. Used my CC and it was very convenient. Washer is about 30-35 mins per load and the dryer is about 45 mins per load. While we enjoyed our stay at the HPWB, we will likely try another hotel if and when we do come back to Waikiki (concerned about location...with kids). Maybe we will try the Hyatt Regency off Kalakaua instead? If m husband and I are the only ones travelling, I would certainly consider staying here again. Overall, we have no major complaints with this HP - for me the reason I'm giving them 4 stars is due to location. Mahalo for a pleasant stay!

Great location at end of Main Street. We walked everywhere. Surrounded by dining options and the beach is two blocks away. We would definitely return in the future. We did not like the fact that there was no self parking or that it was 'full."

When I was assessing Waikiki area resort options, Hyatt Place was not on my list. But after having experienced Hyatt Place, it will be my 'first choice' next time. Thanks for a great experience! It met our room requirements, it was priced reasonably, and it was located perfectly for our tourist needs. Hyatt Place's concierge / travel desk folks were invaluable in helping us develop our itinerary.
user_name:
Leslie D
Marietta, Ga., United States

review_body: Took our family of four to the Hyatt, we were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the room, view and the location. It is in walking distance to everything in Waikiki. We stayed in two hotels while in Honolulu, Hyatt for the first 7 days and Hilton Hawaiian Village for then next 8 days, the Hilton is definitely a lot nicer, but also a lot more expensive, with no breakfast included. I would definitely recommend the Hyatt for shorter stays of less then 7 days, but anything more I would recommend a resort like the Hilton, due to the activities available there.

Absolutely the best hotel with the best service. We arrived in Honolulu late on the 18th of December. We unfortunately went to the worst hotel I've ever been to the "Ambassador Waikiki," check out my review on that. Early in the morning of the 19th -and i mean early- like 4 or 5am because we were not used to the time change, we began the search for a new hotel. Luckily we found this one.It is hard to get a room in Waikiki because it is the holidays, especially one this close to the beach. We arrived around 10am, we left our previous hotel as soon as possible, and they let us check in right away. We were three adults and the lady at the front desk took notice of this and upgraded us to a suite with enough beds for each of us. We walked in to the suite and our mouths dropped. What a beautiful room. I was taken aback by the generosity and hospitality that was shown to us by the staff at this hotel. The lobby is beautifully decorated, the rooms are immaculate and clean, the beds are like sleeping on clouds. The breakfast is beyond amazing, something for everyone. Some reviews on here have complained about the elevators being slow but they always arrived quickly for me. The concierge lady named Mackenzie is also so friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is amazing. Very close to the beach and close to many shopping centers and places to eat. I honestly couldn't have asked for anything better and although our tropical Christmas vacation started out rocky, I can thank this hotel's incredible service for making the rest of it a postcard perfect adventure. We don't check out until the 24th and I cant wait to see what else this amazing island offers, all with the comfort and help of this amazing hotel.

My desire to book this hotel came from a place that most hotel bookings come from; lack of sleep and desperation. I had just arrived in HNL for a quick stopover before traveling onward. I saw pictures of this hotel and saw it had an affordable price for the area. I wasted no time in booking it. I got off the bus to find the hotel is right next to the bus stop which makes it very convenient and safe. I entered the building right off the street and it was like stepping into an chic oasis. The check in area was very clean and pretty. The check in staff was very friendly and gave me tips and suggestions on how to make the most of my 12 hour stopover. The check in process was quick for those of you who like that, however, as a transportation and hospitality worker, I enjoy talking with fellow workers.The elevator can only be used with a keycard, which gave me an extra sense of security. My room was very nice and very clean, with a decent view and balcony, as well as a great selection of hygiene products. The morning breakfast service was great with a large local selection and clean dining area with good views of the city, and even a lounge area. The check-out process was a breeze and I had even had an express-check out option. I took my quick 1 minute walk to the bus stop to the airport and went on to my next destination. I typically stay in Marriott hotels as Hyatt does not have any in the destinations I travel, however, I will definitely be staying here again the next time I visit Honolulu which will be soon. I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Honolulu and wants a close and convenient hotel near the beach.

Great staff, nice rooms, definitely a wonderful place to make return visits! Close to Beach, shopping and restaurants! Fresh hot breakfast served daily. A Hotel worth recommending to family and friends!

Bed was old, uncomfortable. Lots of outdoor noise. Pictures of hotel and pool did not resemble the real pool and area. There was a sour smell in the shower. It was your usual hotel breakfast buffet, powdered scrambled eggs.

To begin, I like Hyatt Place Hotels, I use them frequently. One reason is the room configuration, a separate living area and a work desk. The facility in Waikiki has neither!!! You get a big closet for a room. No couch no desk. The air conditioning is a heat pump so it never gets cool. There is no electric ventilation in the bath room. they expect you to open a window when you shower. You book a Hyatt place because of the extra room size and this place is as I said a large closet. Staff are great, but they did skip room clean up one day. The food, breakfast is acceptable and the facility is clean. The 24 hour food service is a good option, especially in Waikiki, good value. Problem is service they do double duty so if someone happens to check in you starve. Great location to walk or use the bus. But for the closet room I would consider staying again, but not with the present room configuration.

Maids were very disrespectful by knocking continuously like immature kids until I answered the door or until several minutes went by and they gave up. It really ruined the experience of a beautiful hotel.

Great hotel and location. okay breakfast would prefer if it was served freshly as guests ordered as it was always cold and needs more variety.Nice staff and we had a great cleaner.Gave us everything we wanted and tried very hard to please us!Thankyou

Nice location just a few blocks from the beach and near the main strip. Helpful and friendly staff, clean rooms, and good breakfast with pineapple, and free wifi...no resort fees. across from bus station...and non-smoking!! good for families and couples!

Just back from a 9 night stay at Hyatt Place and it was truly terrific. Every staff member we encountered (starting with Troy at check-in) was friendly and helpful. Lots of aloha spirit!We had an Ocean View King room on the 14th floor of the shorter tower and, while a bit small, it was modern and maximized for space. For example, no bedside tables but rather bedside shelves. We stored our carry-ons under them. No lamps on the shelves but rather wall-mounted. More storage room! Same goes for the unit in the bathroom. There was plenty of room to store things. The room was clean and cleaned efficiently. The best thing was opening the door to a view of the ocean right in front of us every day. Breakfast was wonderful and had lots of variety: cereal, pastries, juice (apple, orange, tomato), milk, eggs/egg sandwiches, breakfast meat, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, granola, yogurt, toast, english muffins, jam, peanut butter, waffles/french toast....if you can't find something to eat here than you have a problem.My only issue with the hotel is a small one and that is that I wish they would have had Hawaiian music playing everywhere. The lobby, the elevators, the breakfast area, etc. It's something I was really looking forward to and I only heard it in one place: the 1st fl bathrooms by the elevator bank. (Oh, and if was in management, I'd talk to the management of the Aston hotel next door about all of their smokers lining the sidewalk. Having to run that gauntlet on every trip to Kalakaua Ave and/or the beach was annoying).All in all, a great stay and I would definitely stay here again!

I thought this hotel was exceptionally great in terms of its customer service and accommodations. I would recommend the Hyatt Place mainly for short business trips because it's secluded at the very far (Diamond Head side) end of Waikiki which offers much relaxation and peacefulness after a busy day at work. But if it were for a personal leisure trip, I would choose to stay elsewhere closer to the action and attractions in the middle area of Waikiki Beach.

Great vacation spot, beautiful destination spot, walking distance to the main strip & beach just a few blocks away. The staff @ the Hyatt Place Waikiki were very attentive and thorough to all of the Hyatt guests & visitors, not just Hyatt loyalty members. For one of the first times ever, I experienced a Hyatt Hotel offering a complimentary breakfast with the stay, which was a terrific buffet-style breakfast with all sorts of foods hot & cold, along with juices coffee, teas. This was a great addition to a service that I think should be offered to Hyatt guests everywhere. If you can get a complimentary breakfast and juices with a stay at any Holiday Inn around the country, then you should be able to get it at the Hyatt Holiday Inn rates are only a $130 per night and less, and we pay so much more to stay at the Hyatt Hotels, often over $200 per night! Thank you Hyatt for stepping up your complimentary guest services!
user_name:
Richard T
San Francisco, United States

review_body: We found that the Front Desk to Valet Service and Breakfast Buffet staff very friendly and helpful. Our experience here was very relaxing. We definitely would come back and stay here tge next time we're in Waikiki.

I have stayed at a lot of hotels on the island but Hyatt Place definitely has the friendliest staff. When I checked in, I was greeted with an incredibly warm reception by Joshua. He was an extremely nice guy, knowledgeable, and willing to provide assistance. I was totally blown away by Joshua's warmth and friendliness until I met Fernando, the general manager, the next morning. It's unusual to see the general manager in the lobby greeting guest but apparently it's common practice for Fernando. He was friendly, helpful, and absolutely displayed the right example for his employees. I also rode the elevator with a group of 10 woman from housekeeping. They were by far the most cheerful and energetic group of housekeepers I've ever encountered. Many other things about the hotel are absolutely terrific but the people are exceptional. I stayed at this hotel before and will certainly do it again.

We were more than pleased with this charming hotel so centrally located, elegant and warm, the staff went out of their way to accommodate every wish! Great lobby. 24/7 cafe, rooftop pool and terrace cafe for breakfast!

I have stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki on two occasions, both for 7 days or more. The hotel is clean, comfortable and an easy walk to the beach (about 3 minutes away). I was lucky enough to have a room with some ocean views, which was lovely. Bar staff are friendly and helpful

We stayed in a vrbo on the north shore and finished with one night at the Hyatt in Waikiki. Staff was very helpful and we loved the hospitality suite which staff let us book for one hour to shower up after we hit the beach on our last day before we headed to airport!

It's now 3:30 pm. I've been out of my room since about 9am. Got back, tired and grungy and in need of a shower. To my dismay, the dirty towels are still in the room, the bed is unmade. UGH. What a way to run an operation!!!

After many visits to Waikiki, I expected the hotels at the east end of Waikiki to be run down and dated. This Hyatt Place is the largest Hyatt Place in the chain so it was a nice surprise as it fell in line with all the other Hyatt Place hotels.

Excellent service at this hotel with staff that were always friendly and helpful. The Hyatt free breakfast is a nice offering, sans the typical 'fake' eggs used by many chain hotels. Room was clean and the maid did an excellent job each day & greeted me when she saw me. The bed was too soft for me but I still slept well. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Stayed at this hotel Nov. 27-Dec. 4, 2016. Overall, very pleased with the stay. They knew we were there to celebrate a birthday, got an upgrade to room, nice! The room was good: beds comfy, but the pillows were too soft for me. I think that was the only thing that didn't work for me, but it didn't ruin the trip, right? I'm very glad we found a nice hotel that did not have the ridiculous resort fees attached. And the breakfast was good, and saved us money, which we appreciated.The hotel is at the far east end of the strip. That may be a bit of a deterrent to some, but I thought it was a great location; close to the beach, close to the public bus and Pink Line trolley, close to the zoo and Diamond Head.I found the staff very helpful, and friendly. I was waiting to buy a coffee, and it took the server a moment to get to me. He was so apologetic, I told him it was no problem! They seemed genuinely attentive and interested in making the stay a pleasant one.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice hotel in the Waikiki area. Mahalo to the staff.

I stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach in early December this year. From start to finish this is a good hotel. Check in was really easy. We were a little early so we went off and had lunch down at the beach. We received a text from the front desk when the room was ready. This was a nice touch and my 3 kids (not really kids anymore) soon learnt that the hotel liked texting you about things. Not just how we rated the hotel bla bla but about things that were important to us. Our room was great. It was big and the 4 of us fitted in easily. Good wifi which worked well in our room and all around the hotel. ...wifi is important to me as I'm constantly in touch with work and of course my 3 kids live on it as well. Nice bathroom with lots of towels. The TV is good and well placed in the room so no one has a problem seeing it no matter where you are. All the beds were firm but comfortably - I like firm so suits me! Even the sofa bed was comfortable. The complimentary breakfast is a real winner. Nothing over the top but good enough for a start to the day. The hotel is handy to the beach - maybe a 3-4 minute walk and I must say it's nice to be at the relatively quiet end of Waikiki. We were in Waikiki at a busy time (75th Pearl Harbor Anniversary) and the the other end of the beach for me is simply too busy. We are beach people and I must say that each time we went we were supplied with beach towels which was handy as we'd all forgotten to bring towels! I think the only negative I would make is that there are only 2 lifts and with 19 floors (I think) they were very slow and crowded. That's pretty much my only criticism. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. ...oh and I can't comment on parking as we did not have a car.

Amazing stay...rooms were comfortable and well kept...Valet service was very efficient, the front desk was extremely knowledgeable of the area and very helpful...the upkeep of the hotel was also great. From the staff maintaining the lobby areas to the staff in the breakfast area. Everyone made us feel welcome and at home...like family. Mahalo...you will see us again. Until then...Aloha

The hyatt place has been a pleasure to stay at.. our time was made better by our beautiful house keeper Rheamay who looked after room 1139. She greeted us every morning with a smile and was always so polite and pleasant to be around. She is in and out before you can blink and leaves the room spotless. Thanks to Rheamay's amazing hospitality, we will be recommending this hotel to everyone back home. Best housekeeper we've come by so far xx

Great place to stay! Parking is expensive but seems expensive everywhere around wakiki. Room was nice. My only complaint is that we were placed in a handicap accessible room that could not be changed because of our late arrival. Otherwise, excellent stay with friendly staff.

I don't usually write a review for a place that has 100's of reviews, but I had to for this hotel. First, the location is perfect, especially if you have kids. There are numerous restaurants, the zoo is 2 blocks away, and the beach is 2 blocks away. This portion of the beach has a sea wall so the waters are very calm for the little ones.The staff is even better than the location. From check-in to check-out, they were attentive to all of our needs. They genuinely seemed to enjoy working there. My 2 year old was having trouble with the four hour time difference, so we would go down to the lobby at 4am every morning, where each member of the staff would try to keep him happy and content.The hotel is very reasonably priced, has no ridiculous resort fees, and the breakfast will save you $15 per day/per person.Finally, we used King Airport Shuttle to/from the airport to the hotel. They are the best.Overall, solid hotel, with great employees, and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki Beach.

When we arrived, the Bellman unloaded our bags onto a cart. I gave him $5. We checked in and were told that we had to take our own baggage uo to our room, and to bring it back down. Our beautiful room was quite average for a Best Western, but Not a Hyatt. Our beautiful view was the back of another hotel. Breakfast was exactly what you would get at a Best Western, with a slightly better setting. I was chastised for not bringing down the tray from my room. They gave me another one, but again a reminder to return it. Most of the staff were not friendly and gave the feeling you were intruding. Expected more, got less.

Our family stay for 3 nights was to breakup the trip home. Hotel was ok with included breakfast delivering a basic start to the day. One block back in a straight line from beach so no issues walking to and from for kids. Recommend using TripAdvisor restaurant booking system to get tables at nearby places as this hotel has no onSite restaurant.

Overall ok. Rooms were not very clean and housekeeping always always done unless you called. The drawers were dirty and had to be requested to be cleaned before we put our clothes. I wish the rooms were cleaner

What was a last minute layover overnight stay selection, using my Hyatt points - which was very reasonable. Was not expecting much, but it turned out to be a very pleasant one night stay with a room better than expected, very comfortable bed and a large sofa and desk area, polite and welcoming friendly staff from check-in, valet service, breakfast and checkout - with the complimentary breakfast being a surprise bonus, we (with my wife and young daughter), really enjoyed our one night there and wish we could have stayed longer. Location is great, close to beach and all of Waikiki shopping and hot spots, across from Honolulu Zoo and close to Diamond Head side as well. Pool is small and pool area a bit old and outdated. If they can modernize that and create a bit more exotic atmosphere there, it will be great. A bit noisy street area - but maybe cannot be helped as it is a very busy tourist area.

very nice hotel. Great location. close to the beach and close do the main avenue. good size rooms and bathroons. breakfast was included and has good options. there s a public parking lot 1 block from the hotel, just beside the zoo, that you can park the car paying US$1 / hour.

This hotel made our Hawaii experience one to remember! Friendly staff, excellent accommodations, great view! Easy access to the beach, yet far away enough from the crowds. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a Waikiki hotel.

Needed a place for my wife to concentrate on finishing her grad school papers at the end of the semester. Mahalo nui for the ocean view upgrade. I know it it not always possible but always appreciated. My wife loved the Hawaiian sunset straight from her work desk.

Champaigne and room upgrade for a honeymoon stay. Very welcoming staff. Close to waikiki beach and other shops. Overall great stay. Buffet breakfast average. Parking expensive and not much else around. Park at the zoo for $1 per/hr still cheaper than hotel parking

With a family of 5, Hyatt place was fantastic for our 14, 12 and 9 year old, we had two double beds and a sofa bed.Location is great, 3min walk to the beach, breakfast is very handy as it’s included in the rate!Free towels to take to the beach was very handy.Service was great, the only let down was ‘Charlie’s’ Taxi Service, we had a fixed rate of $30 to the Airport, but the guy charged me $40 on the meter, I called his supervisor to let him know, please make sure you confirm the rate with the driver, as soon as he knew we were from New Zealand he put the meter on, knowing we may not question him.I wasn't prepared to argue with the guy over $10 and ruin my awesome holiday.Other than is minor indiscretion, we had a fantastic time.Great stay for a larger family as you pay for one room rate!Stayed November 2016, travelled with family

I have been an elite Hyatt Passport member for many years - I have to say this stay was simply OK. The facility is average - the primary breakfast area was very windy and often wet due to morning liquid sunshine. The food choices were carb centric - powdered scambled eggs on egg days - sausage was passable, but the bacon was that nasty precooked stuff - Hyatt can do better than that Spring for the Hyatt Regency next time - you will have a far more enjoyable experience for not that much more in price.

Nothing spectacular. Friendly staff. Room could use better sound proofing, you can hear the wind howling. Breakfast buffet needs more daily variety. Parking was valet only; this wasn't indicated on Expedia; valet were all nice and courteous though. All in all good experience.

We recently stayed 6 nights and had a great time. The kids loved the pool and the breakfast was excellent. The parking for $30 a day was disappointment but other than that a great hotel and we will definitely return soon.

The Hyatt Place was a great choice for our two nights in Oahu. The location was perfect - close to Waikiki Beach, shopping and restaurants. A delicious, extensive complimentary breakfast was included. Large rooms with 2 beds and a pull out sofa made our family stay perfect.

Hyatt Place, that is. We took King's Shuttle from airport, arrived early, yet Annabelle at the registration desk had our room ready for us. We had an ocean view room, we were on 12th floor and could see the ocean between the other hotels. We knew going in that the Hyatt Place was about a block and a half from beach, but that was fine with us. It turned out to be an excellent choice, with free buffet breakfast each day (their skillet breakfast) which had many hot and cold choices. Our room was a king and seemed quite spacious, with a nice bathroom and glass front shower. A good sized closet and a safe were useful. The breakfast was near the pool area on the 3rd floor, and at times quite windy, so the hotel provided a tray in our room in case we wanted to bring the food back. Every single staff member we encountered was smiling, pleasant, and genuinely happy to be there. So refreshing! The location is great, near the zoo, a quick walk to the beach and all the shops, restaurants, and ABC stores you could want, as well as the lovely Banyan trees and a view of Diamond Head. We went to Pearl Harbor, then rented a car one day and went up the coast to Kailua, the Byodo-in Temple, and Dole Plantation. Tiki's a short walk for appetizers and drinks with beach view. With no resort fee, and breakfast buffet included, this Hyatt Place was the clear choice, and if we are ever so lucky as to go to Waikiki again, this will be our hotel.

excellent location and friendly staffs. right on waikiki beach and lots of restaurant around the area. room is very clean and quite. we had a very wonderful stay at this place and would go back there again anytime

Staff were wonderful and friendlyGreat location just outside the bustle of the strip but still close enough to walkAlso just a short walk from the beach, zoo and aquarium.Complimentary breakfast everyday was great!

Very nice hotel. The room was clean, had a refrigerator, coffee machine, free wi fi, free newspaper, free breakfast. The only thing lacking was a microwave in the room. Great staff ... friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

Great location, close to the Waikiki beach within walking distance. Free hot breakfast. However, breakfast location is next to the swimming pool and in the open air, so when the weather is really windy, it is difficult to enjoy breakfast and will need to protect our food from not being blown away by the strong wind.

We really enjoyed our two weeks at the Hyatt Place, the staff went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable. It's only a block to the beach, close to great restaurants and you can shop til you drop. The complimentary breakfast was great, we saw parents taking breakfast to the rooms, very convenient as they don't have to drag the kids out of bed. if you are not sure about something, don't hesitate to ask any of the staff. They are knowledgable about everything! Thanks again everyone, special thanks to Heidi, Lei and Angeline! You are absolutely wonderful at what you do. We appreciate your kindness and friendship. See you again

Wonderful experience. Would highly recommend staying there. We were treated by friendly staff and especially appreciated the care from Lei, Heidi, and Angeline. All the staff were friendly from our room attendants , kitchen staff, Joshua, and Jose the AGM. The rooms were clean and quiet, and restful.

My husband and I and our 14-year old shih tzu enjoyed a wonderful staycation at Hyatt Place to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. The location of this property in Waikiki is great...just steps from the Royal Hawaiian Center and the International Market Place.

The hotel was a couple of blocks away from Hyatt Regency and Waikiki Beach. I was glad there were street food on the way to the beach. The hotel room was spacious, good for families. The staff was very helpful and patient answering questions. Checkin and checkout took no time. Only Valet parking available by the time we arrived, $30/night. Some hotel guest mentioned the self parking building across was 20$/night. The free breakfast had good choices, but was very busy around 9 am. There was sign on every table asking guests not to leave the food on the table (in 4 different languages). But once someone managed to leave the food the table, some disturbance was inevitable. It was fun to watch though.

Breakfast includes only scrambled eggs, bacon or pork sausage no substitions, very disappointed if you don't eat pork, they definitely cater to the the Japanese traveler, miso soup and rice available for breakfast

My husband and I each have over 1,500 nights in hotels all across the US and the world. The staff at the Hyatt Place Waikiki are among the best! They certainly practice "aloha"! Especially Angeline at the front desk, Otto in the lobby and Lei who cleaned our room. They each went above and beyond any expectations! We will miss them and their warm welcome every time we see them when it's time for us to depart the hotel.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for 5 days in the middle of November 2016.The hotel is what you would expect in Waikiki, simple, accessible and designed for people to spend most of their time outside.The room was nice and modern, all features of the room seemed to be fairly new and worked perfectly. We had a partial view of the ocean from the 14th floor (there's a few buildings blocking the way as its one street back from the beach).The pool is pretty small at the hotel, we didnt use it after coming from staying in Maui for 10 days we were ready for some shopping. The free breakfast is great if you want to load up, just keep in mind its pretty basic, after a few mornings we went elsewhere to look for breakfast and found some great options at iHop which is just near the International Market Place.We used the travel booking service in the lobby to arrange pick up and drop off at the shopping outlets which was very convenient, there were always people there booking tours there.The hotel is away from the middle of Waikiki, its right next to the zoo which means its a bit quieter, we really enjoyed this as after dinner it was nice to get out of the middle of the chaos 9it gets pretty busy) and walk back to the quieter end of the hotel strip. Waikiki is lovely but after staying on Maui its hard to compare, next time we will probably only stay a day or two in Waikiki just to shop and head to the islands for more days there.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates pure hospitality and aloha. The staff is excellent and the accommodations are modern and comfortable. From the moment I was greated and welcomed by Matt at the front desk, I felt like I was visiting family. The manager Jose was also very hospitable.

Great staff. Willing to go above and beyond.We arrived early at 6 am and they have us a room for a minimum charge.. Rooms are nice. We had both a city view and ocean view. Buffet breakfast gave plenty of choices and it switched everyday. Great location. One block from the beach. We would come back!

Great place to spend quality time with a special person. The Hyatt Place was close to the beach, shopping and food. Great place to save on a rental car since there are so many activities so close. This is diffidently a place we will return to in the future.

Had my wife join me after some business in the islands. Wonderful location close to the beach. The staff were exceptional to a person, friendly and helpful. We had a great room facing the beach. I particularly like the convenience of 24 hour meals offered by the Hyatt Place brand. This hotel had more than the usual service amenities with a valet, convenience store and on-site activities booking for the area, usually found in the large hotels. We had a great and relaxing stay! Thanks to all!!!

We had a great stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. We were there for one night before our cruise began. We arrived around 7pm and was given an upgraded room. We had a great complimentary breakfast the next morning. We were allowed a late checkout till 1 pm. Everyone there was helpful and very friendly and professional. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Hotel was clean staff was awesome. Met every need. This is about as good a hotel as I am ever stayed at in a resort area. Definitely recommend to all just based on customer service alone. We actually booked another place to stay before our visit there and then canceled due to our above expectation experience at this Hyatt place

Excellent hotel, 5 night stay. Perfect location, Close to everything and the trolley stop is just outside the hotel. Good breakfast selection that changed daily. Nice clean tidy rooms. Wonderful staff that were very friendly.

Nice location..so close to the beach. Front desk people, valet people, and housekeeping are superior. We had no wait times for the elevator, valet was quick, and our room was always sparkling clean when we returned to our room in the afternoon. The FREE breakfast and WiFi, as well as, NO RESORT FEE is a terrific bonus!! Would definitely recommend staying at this hotel!!

The bed! Oh my goodness the bed just cuddles you each night, it really is one of the nicest I have ever slept in. The hotel is in a good spot where all the tours have pick up and drop off's right out the front so you don't have to travel far for activities but it is a bit out of the heart of Waikiki. Originally I was disappointed that this hotel was closest to the rock pool area of Waikiki Beach but by the end of our stay I loved it and much preferred it over the actually beach part of Waikiki Beach. But for value for money this was a good hotel to pick. It's not really negative, but if you can afford to stay at a hotel closer to where all the action is then do it, but if this is in your budget then you won't be disappointed.

We stayed here over Veteran's Day weekend 2016. At $219/night I expected more.The rooms were small. For example, the toilet is right up against the tub and the sink is outside the bathroom. In addition, parking was $30/night. However, when we called down to the valet, our car was not always ready. For that price, I would have expected a daily wash.I was going to rate this place 2 Stars until we received late checkout on Sun, 11/13. We were allowed to stay until 1 pm which was gracious given that normal checkout is 11 am,I wouldn't stay here myself again. However, if you are looking for a place close to the beach, and close to locals places like Rainbows, Leonards and Side Street Inn, this place will do the trick.

I booked two rooms initially initially for two people in each room. And the reservation was changed to two room each for 4 people by the hotel in last minute before we arrive. We arrived with 4 people, hotel did not change the reservation and refuse to admit they are wrong about the charge. WORST hotel experience EVER. This hotel is trying to trick you in. AVOID.

Great location and very nice hotel. No problems or any issues. Breakfast was good and high floor gets you a nice view of the beach. Pool was pretty was not the business.Pool could be bigger and deeper for this hotel.

Location is a block from the beach, walking distance to Diamond Head trail. Excellent access to dining and shops. The hotel also provides excellent comfort for working if you are on an working vacation.

Got here late around 8:30pm. Staffs were very friendly and helpful. Troy is very nice gal and make check in so easy and gave us couple tips. So far the room is nice and very clean. It took us around 12 mins walking to International markets. They have Expedia person inside the hotel to help us with activities.

This hotel was excellent value for the accommodation and the complimentary breakfast was an additional bonus for the morning start. The location was within walking distance of the main road and all the other amenities that were needed

The breakfast area is jammed at 0630 when it opens. Breakfast on the very windy patio. A lot of carbs, no fresh fruit, which is a shame in Hawaii. Rooms are standard. Nothing spectacular. Computers and printing available in lobby. All staff seemed friendly. No problems waiting for elevators. It was okay, but not outstanding. Close to beach and ABC store (3 minute walk). At all times of day, the lobby was packed with tour groups.I put in a request when booking to have no feathers in room, the concierge replied that the request had been processed, this was 2 months before our stay. When we arrived, the pillows were all feather. Called to have them changed.

I have been here twice but will most likely switch to a different hotel. The staff is amazing but the room quality is pretty low. Not a great place to eat but you have the option. The gym only has cardio equipment and dumbbells up to 50lbs.Washer and dryers are next to the gym as well. You may want to avoid bring a car if this is for vacation. Most things are in walking distance.

The hotel was located just by the Waikiki beach and you could easily go from the hotel to the beach in 3 minutes. The staff was very helpful and supportive, the room was big and clean, and the daily cleaning of the room was excellent. The breakfast was good with some thing changing on the menu each day to get some more varaiation. I will definitaly stay here again if I return to Hawaii.

This trip was a special one for our family. We were going to be able to spend good quality time with our newest grandson. We chose the Hyatt Place because of its location and the morning breakfast. The first meal of the day is very important and the breakfast there is great.

Excellent location near the beach, Excellent modern decor, Excellent breakfast, Excellent value...Excellent in every way. In an area where hotels can go for double the price or more, you won't be disappointed in choosing to stay here.
user_name:
Craig S
Saint Charles, United States

review_body: Only 10 rooms per floor so very easy to get from front door to room. Staff were excellent. Swimming pool is too small for exercise. The gym does not have strength equipment for torso and legs. About a ten minute walk to Cheese cake factory.

Great place to stay! Great staff and hot breakfast. If your allergic to feathers make sure you tell them as there bedding and pillows have feathers. Staff came and remade my bed since I was allergic! Highly recommend.

Larger area for check in parking would be nice. Everyone was pleasant. However no microwave in room and had to go to lobby to warm up food, which was not convenient. Hot breakfast was useful, but got bored of food after a few days. Staff was nice and helpful.

Like I said we shall return. That was our 3rd time staying in this hotel. I love the location of my room because it's close to the gym, laundry and the breakfast area. <3 <3 <3. I requested that I don't want the housekeeper going in our room everyday and they respected my request. Thank you

Actually, better than we expect after reading reviews here. Maybe because it was not the high season, but had no troubles with elevators. Rooms are specious. Bed are very comfortable and bedlinen are changed every 3rd day. You have large LCD TV, fridge, mini-safe and iron board in every room. Staff in reception is superb, helpful and friendly. Since check-out is already at 11am (an we had flight at the evening), hotel offers you (if you ask) for a 30min hospitality room, where you can have quick shower, changes your clothes and get ready for your long flight back to home. You can also ask for late check-out (6pm), which costs half of the price of the standard room rate for that day (in our case 120USD, which we thought to be unreasonable high). Room cleaning was still more like pretending to do some cleaning, there was dust and dirt anywhere which didn’t disappear during our 9 night stay. As well we couldn’t figure out the time for room cleaning, once they run in our room before 9am at weekend when we were still sleeping, then some days they didn’t show up till 8pm till we asked reception for a change of the towels. Free WiFi was usually working well. In high-peak usage time it got slower. The complimentary breakfast was extremely modest and you got fed of the same food already at 3rd day. There was really nothing to put on bread (no ham, no cheese, not single vegetables), mainly cereals, juice and yogurt, bread. Hotel is 2-min walk from beach. Beach is sandy and nice. You can ask beach towels from reception. As it seems typical in Waikiki, the parking is unreasonable costly in all the hotels. Hyatt offers overnight parking for 35USD. But in Kapiolani park (which is 350m) from the hotel, there is free parking 24/7. Huge traffic jams starts in all around the island from 4pm and last till 6pm. Avoid driving at that time, since you just waste your precious time in sitting in slow moving traffic for an hours. The bus stop is just near to the hotel. If you need to travel within Waikiki, then by foot will be faster since bus stops are in every 50m and as well traffic-light in every 100m. 5km of travel by bus takes approx. an hour or more, which is rather same with walking.

They said it’s “everything You Could Want out of Waikiki Beach Hotels in Honolulu” and I strongly agree! Great for solo travelers, business travelers, popular with families and couples. Rooms were clean, updated. Professional and very friendly Staff. WiFi and breakfast included. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Hotel and staff very enjoyable. Location was steps away from beach, shops and food. Room was spacious with great ocean view. Free breakfast had many choices and food was hot and fresh. We love Hyatt Place!!

Rooms are small, when booking I was informed that they were the same Hyatt Place rooms that come with a seperate living area/sitting area. Not so much. I'm not impressed, I expect a better standard for Hyatts having stayed at countless Hyatts over the years. I can't wait to check OUT. This is terrible. Stay at the Marriott across the street. I wish I had just booked there. Will update with more details and photos of the rusting bathroom.

Hyatt Place was far more reasonable than other hotels on Waikiki this long weekend. The hotel is just a block away from the beach. Airport shuttles drop off and pick up from this hotel plus other tour Buses too. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Since we were here for sports tournament, the receptionist arranged for an early check-in and late checkout process actively. Our room is oversized with two lanais. Shower and toilet is very clean and enough space in the powder room. WiFi is pretty good in the hotel. The gym is good for a work out. Pool seems to be smaller than other Hyatt pools. 24/7 Cafe is good for a quick bite and drink. Breakfast has some pastries, bagels and North Asian fare. However, almost no vegetarian option and dishes need to be labeled. I skipped some of the pastries this morning since I could not tell if they had bacon or jam in them. Breakfast being included with the room is a big plus. Highly recommend this hotel for business or tourism.

We arrived very early in the morning and staff happy to store our bags and allowed us to use the breakfast buffet which we were grateful for. Our room when ready was large, well furnished and clean with a balcony with partial ocean views. This is a block back from the beach though but the Aloha festival was on so hotels on the beach were hard to get. The only criticism was the pool and breakfast buffet area is in need of updating and breakfast limited with choice.

lift under maintenance so had to wait up to 20minutes for lift. Room large and clean. Had trouble with light in bathroom. Great location if you have a hire car very easy to leave town. Staff very friendly.

A good location, quiet, but with an easy walk to the beach. Great breakfast with a variety of items each day. Nice to eat in the sunshine by the pool. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

clean rooms friendly staff wonderful vacation. breakfast was different everyday and there was enough for everyone there. the pool was an added bonus. just two blocks from the beach and it is priced right.

The hotel is great for the price, breakfast included and no resort fee. Great location in Waikiki. I wish the pool was nicer but that's okay. Stuff is was wonderful. We had a room with two beds and a sofa, great views of Waikiki
user_name:
Paca93
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice hotel, the food is very good and they have free internet available in all hotel. Is very close to Waikiki beach and easy to find shops everywhere. The staff is very kind and the rooms are confortable.

An excellent choice in a great location. Walking distance from the beach and the malls. Spacious rooms. Across the street convenient parking. Staff helpful. Spacious lobby with all amenities. Computer stations and food service.

Nice hotel on Eastern edge of Waikiki, close to zoo, beach, and Diamond Head as well as quick access to highway. This is a great location to walk around town and also travel to rest of island.Rooms here are generic but clean and comfortable with the normal accoutrement. AC works well and most rooms have a balcony (odd rooms for partial ocean views). A lot of foreign tourists stay here so the front of hotel can be congested with people and busses but I have rarely had to wait long for check in/out.  Staff here is very friendly and helpful but They can be undermanned at times with respect to their small but adequate bar. They also have a nice activities/tours counter which is quite helpful.  Though free and best described as edible, I don't recommend the breakfast here. It is usually very crowded and being open air is constantly under attack from pigeons. It can be entertaining to walk down get a cup of coffee and watch unsuspecting families get their waffles and toast stolen by dive bombing pigeons! Better to take the short walk to LuLus, Wolfgangs, Eggs and Things or the iconic Rainbow drive-in.

So close to the waikiki beach. Really clean and dead quiet. Concierge was so nice as well and allowed us an extra hour for checkout. King sized beds were great even though they didn't have double twin beds at the time. Very reasonably priced. Definitely be back again. 1st visit to Honolulu!

We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights recently and found it to be excellent value for money. Wonderful staff that went out of their way to assist with nothing being a problem and making our experience easy to enjoy. The rooms are exceptionally large we had booked an Ocean View but we 4 rooms in the group and everyone had large rooms. The location is great with 1 minute walk to the beach and the Buffet Breakfast included in the rate was a special bonus.

Clean, dependable property. The rooms are decent sized and nicely refurbished in Hyatt Place's current decor. They include a mini-fridge, a microwave would make them complete. The buildings themselves are a little old, so while nicely refurbished, they do have old/slow elevators and simple bathrooms.. Staff are extremely friendly. The included breakfast is standard Hyatt Place offerings ... simple but good enough for breakfast. They do also offer an Asian soup (Miso ??) choice. The breakfast area itself is a mess with the crowds and outdoor eating area that offers strong tradewinds (sometimes with light rain) and birds. Just not a good place to eat. Despite the breakfast area, this is one of my favorite places to stay in Waikiki. The rooms are just as nice as the nearby "big" Hyatt, the employees friendlier and the beach is only a couple blocks away. And no asinine "resort fees".

The Hyatt Place is located in the heart of Waikiki Beach, within walking distance to the beach and shops. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed. They offer a free breakfast buffet in the pool area, with a nice variety of foods, including bacon and eggs, as well as fruit, yogurt and other items. I would stay there again.

We stayed before and after a cruise and we're able to have easy access to the beach, parks, zoo and aquarium. No problem with early check in. Lulus around the corner has great food and overlooks the beach and of course the ABC store next door for anything you may need. Great location for us.

Awesome spot, staff very attentive. Flew in at 6am check in was not till 3am but they were able to get us in at midday. A room with two doubles and a pullout was plenty enough to accommodate our family of five. Valet guys were awesome as well as housekeeping Geraldine always kept our room clean and stocked. Would recommend to families as it's close to the beach walls, and just a couple of blocks from the international marketplace. My family and I were here for Halloween, a must experience!

Great location. Walking distance to the beach, restaurants and stores. Free breakfast and it was awesome. I enjoyed staying at this hotel and I will come back again. Good value and I really like the services and hospitality.

Loved this hotel, not quite beach front but only 2 minutes walk, Rooms are lovely and clean, spacious, cleaned everyday. Didn't like the breakfast arrangements it was more like a free for all, we ended up taking a tray down and taking food to our rooms, the food was good though and a pot of choice,but apart from that it was lovely, Staff were very helpful especially Nick on the bar, he was very polite and chatty. We spent some time in the bar area either before we went out for dinner or on our way back in, either way the staff were always ready to serve us. I would highly recommend this hotel. The only other issue with this hotel is we paid for a mountain view and got a sky scraper instead,

Ideal location on the edge of Waikiki, easy access to beach, or HI Fwy. Also, very personable and helpful long term staff. Rooms are clean and adequate. If you're looking for "in hotel" restaurants, this is not the best choice. We prefer to go to where the locals eat. If you stay at a beachfront hotel (in this ideal location), you must cross the main drag to reach the beach regardless. For an additional 3 minute walk you can save a lot of money staying at the Hyatt Waikiki. Great hotel for any experienced traveler.

Room overlooked elementary school and unattractive apartments was very loud in Daly am withbttsffuc sndvschool and trash trucks. Parking expensive 30$ per night and traffic was bad location of hotel good and besides parking hotel price

The staff immediately treated us like family, the room and balcony were clean and pretty! The location was spot on and walking distance from everything Waikiki has to offer! We will definitely be going back!!!

I'd love to stay again and this time with my kids as there is everything nearby; the GrayLine bus picks you right up there! All types of food right next door and it's like you are enjoying in downtown with benefit of tons of other folks walking around safe and fun!

The hotel and property were nice and clean. I liked the open air lobby. Great downtown location a few short blocks from the beach and shops. Only issue was the road noise from the streets. Small pool but a good free breakfast over compesated for that.

Weekend Family Trip -A thumbs up for no resort fee's , free Wi-Fi & Free breakfast in the AMExcellent Value & nice modern Hotel & very friendly / pleasant staff - at check in was upgraded to larger room very roomy With 2 teenage girls more room is nice 1 block away from the Beach & stores Excellent Location - will stay again on next trip

Excellent service staff, clean and spacious suites and fluffy towels but the rooms seemed dated. Centrally located, great view of diamond head. Parking was a nuisance because I had to go across the street to a parking garage which was less expensive to park $20 for 24hrs but the one way streets make navigation tricky. Having more accessible parking would enhance the hotel experience. Otherwise the location is terrific and Waikiki property is most likely expensive.

Whether it's really a secret or not, I'd like to think that the Hyatt Place is the best kept secret in Waikiki. After multiple visits, It consistently provides a great experience that is full of value. 1. No resort fee & free-wifi that actually works. 2. Clean, modern, comfortable rooms at a reasonable rate. Don't forget the lovely beds! Also a big fan of the decor in the lobby/bar area. 3. Free breakfast with rotating hot entrees such as waffles, french toast & breakfast sandwiches along with cereals, breads, fruit, juices, coffee and more. 4. Barely 1.5 blocks from the beach, at the quieter end of Waikiki, but still an easy walk to the heart of Waikiki, lots of great restaurants, ABC stores, coffee, shopping, etc. It is all within easy reach. Beach towels are also available at the front desk!  5. Lovely staff. Plenty of smiles and aloha spirit. Loyalty that's recognized. Matthew (I think that was his name???) who checked in all three of us with ease even though we were all on three separate reservations. He also was able to accommodate us all on the same floor in the same tower which was much appreciated. And Bartender Nick, who is such an outstanding employee. He's a true ambassador for Hyatt and also for the island. Don't be afraid to ask for island recommendations as you enjoy the delicious happy hour drinks. That's if he doesn't ask you first. :) 6. An on-site staffed Expedia tour desk to arrange a multitude of tours all over the island. We've used them twice now and have had excellent experiences both times. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to everyone. So much value. So pleasant. We'll be back.

The service was great , location excellent, parking was steep as is all the other places nearby likely. Food was ok for breakfast, great value for the family. We didn't expect a free breakfast to be five stars but I would give it a solid four stars

The Hyatt Place is a short walk to the beach and many restaurants. It is also adjacent to city buses which provide an inexpensive way to get to Pearl Harbor, Bishop Museum, downtown Honolulu, etc. The hotel and rooms are comfortable and up-to-date. While our room was small, it served our purpose. The complimentary breakfast had a good selection and was well-stocked. Staff at the hotel was very friendly.

I was more than pleasantly surprised by the beautiful accommodations and the warm and welcoming hospitality of the staff of the Hyatt Place and its location on Paoakalani Avenue which happens to be near my mother's childhood home on Cartwright Road many, many years ago. Being able to stay at the Hyatt Place to be closer to the meetings that I needed to attend on Monday, October 24 and Tuesday, October 25 relieved me of the stress of commuting from my home 36 miles away in Waianae on the leeward side of the island of Oahu.

We stay at this hotel several times already and every time has been great Staff is very friendly and helpful, their 24/7 restaurant, amenities store are all great. Excellent and would always recommend it to anyone travelling on business or pleasure.

My 3rd visit to this hotel. Haven't been let down once !!! The staff ! Location !!!! Rooms. Are all great !!!! You won't be disappointed ! The staff makes this my number 1 hotel pick when I'm visiting Honolulu.

Stayed here at the Hyatt for 7 days in Oct a great location easy walking distance to everything.The hotel is off the main strip and very quiet at night getting a good night sleep on the roomy king size comfortable beds.The room on the six floor had a partial ocean view which was a surprise as we did not expect it. at all.The lady on the tour desk was most helpful in giving us directions on how to get to pearl harbour by bus.The free wi-fi works well in areas of the hotel, and the breakfast is ok..,ABC store next door,beach five min walk.This is the hotel we will stay again most differently next time in waikiki.

This has been our selection for a hotel 4 years in a row.Customer service is impeccable from all levels of the staff.My wife and I travel extensively and have never felt so welcomed in any other hotel than in the Hyatt Place.It seriously is like meeting our friends again upon each annual visit.The breakfast that is offered daily (which is included) would cost dearly in any other location. You eat "open air" in the wonderful Hawaiian weather enjoying everything from fresh cut pineapple to hot entrees , fruit juices and coffee. If you are looking to be treated as a very welcomed guest without the high cost of some other hotels then look no further.We have absolutely no desire to change our hotel accommodations and see ourselves staying here indefinitely every year we travel to Waikiki.

Great location 5 minutes walk to the beach. Friendly staffs and they tried their best to accommodate your requests. Complementary breakfast is a plus. But bathroom needs to be renovated - small and old

Stayed here 2 nights in October--great property! Breakfast is little windy, but we just took it to the lobby. Room was very comfortable and staff was amazing! We had a stunning view from our room--pay to get the ocean view! My pic is from 12th floor.3-5min walk from beach and close to great restaurants and tourist attractions. Would stay here again--looked at the more expensive hotels nearby, and they just don't add up to the value that we got at this property.

Arrived at Hyatt Place after a long flight from Toronto, greeted by Matt at the front desk. Even though we arrived prior to check in time, he quickly found us a room on a high floor. He also answered all our questions and suggested local places to eat at. All staff members here are friendly and extremely helpful!Hotel is only a block from the beach, next door to the Honolulu Zoo and close to all your shopping wants/needs. My boyfriend and I are big on walking, so we also made the trek to Diamond Head and Ala Moana shopping center from the hotel. If you're up for an hour long walk in the Hawaiian sunshine -- go for it!Would certainly stay here again :)

Over-all, a very clean, well maintained Hotel. Contrary to some other reviews, we didn't experience any negatives at all. The staff were very attentative to any of our needs and extremely friendly. Close proximity to Waikiki beach, buses & restaurants. Would recommend.

Super location approx. 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Hotel is very clean, staff is exceptionally friendly/helpful. Great stay. The food is solid and the free breakfast buffet is a huge perk. Pool was a bit cool for our taste, but close enough to the beach not to mind too much. This was our second stay here and we will certainly stay here again
user_name:
Andrew B
Placitas, NM, United States

review_body: I requested an allergy free room-no air freshners, and the room was blasted with chemical scents - I believe from the laundry. I had to sleep with a towel over my pillow to minimize the scents! Also had to sleep with window open the scents were so strong. My fiancé not chemical sensitive and he too had hard time with scents, headache in am. So very bad place for allergy sufferers. Sorry Hyatt, I love the brand but this is inconceivable in a clean, green era!

Wifi and breakfast included, very well located, room super comfortable, staff super friendly, nice environment! I don't think you need anything else. You can also count in good sightseeing advice from the agency at the lobby! All good stuff!

Had an opportunity to visit Honolulu on my way back from Maui so selected the hotel based on location. I was pleased that they upgraded my room, the room was fresh and clean, and the staff were all friendly. Met my expectations and then some.

Perfect Staycation ever taken, enjoyed every moment from arrival to departure. The minute we arrived we were greeted with a warm smile and the most genuine hello. We can't wait to return to stay at the Hyatt Place Hotel.

This hotel is a block away from the beach. Only that our toilet filled itself up every 5 to 10 minutes. Very annoying in the middle of the night. Staff is outstanding. They helped me for wifi, bus ride direction, tour booking. They told me about the firework (5 minutes) every Friday night from Hilton Village. We watched it from the beach area. We walked around the area to eat at the local eatery. Went to one small Japanese take-out place for dinner, Musubi Cafe. There is ice cream place around the corner. Don't know how much the rooms are in Marriot, which is next to the beach. Hyatt Place is one block away from the beach but close to bus stop that can take you to Alona Mae Shopping Center or you can catch another bus to transfer to North Shore(55). I took the bus(19 or 20) from airport to the hotel. It took longer but it is just like you ride on the trolley or the double decker bus. So you pay $2.5 for the almost the same experience for those hop on hop off or trolley. Drove to North Shore then came back to airport.

This hotel had the best service by far from any place I have ever stayed at. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the staff and quickly helped by the bellman to assist us with our baggage to our room. We were treated like royalty by giving us an upgrade to our room and placing us on the same floor as the "All you can eat breakfast buffet"!!!! The staff was extremely friendly, and very accommodating to our needs . We had two great evenings here, which obviously also added up to the experience. Special thanks to Jeff, Chris, Matt and Manager Ihab for the best hospitality experience ever!!!!!! We definitely will be back at the Hyatt Place again.

We were here for the weekend for the Pride Parade. We are so glad we chose this hotel. All around service was excellent -Chris, Matt, and Jeff were awesome. Special thanks to Ihab the manager. He was very kind and accommodating. We will definitely stay again!

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Hiedi and Anglina! The staff made sure we were taken care of. We even were able to get a great deal on a spacious room the day we flew. I went for a meeting with my work and ended up staying at this hotel. Thanks Hyatt!

The staff was always so welcoming and ensured your stay met all expectations. You were greeted with a smile. To have the breakfast included in your rate is a plus. I thought continental when booked but I was wrong. It was an amazing spread to surely meet all needs. The king room was huge and comfortable. Only downfall is the view, but who's in the room. I'd never been to Waikiki but I was 100% satisfied with location, the breakfast, beach and overall stay. It's a busy area so to be further down and away from the strip was a sure plus. You're still walking distance from all interests.

I absolutely recommend Hyatt Place Beach Waikiki.Location can't be better everything is within walking distance.Room was great at first the one I booked online I didn't like it because I was traveling with my parents and felt small but staff were amazing trying to help us in every little detail and they moved us to a better room.Bed was suuuuper comfy! The 24h food service great. OMG breakfast exactly what you need ! They always keep it filled! People in the tour agency at the lobby give you the best tips of the sightseeing !And here the super plus Staff is extremely friendly, always smiley but most of all efficient! Special thanks to Dino and Lei they are hearts. My parents 40yr anniversary was a total success!

When we stayed here in January we thought this place was pretty close to perfect. This time was a bit of a letdown. We have a much smaller room than we had during our last visit. The view is still good, the free breakfast is still good and filling, but the smaller room and bathroom are hard to get used to. It doesn't help that we just came from four nights in a suite at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. There is a nice walk in shower and the place is modern and clean. I would come back but only in a larger room.

The location of this one is really good, with less than 3 mins walk to the waikiki beach, and easy access to everything. Pro: 1. Location location location.2. Hyatt place comes with simple continental breakfast. And the hotel even provided a tray in the room for easy take-out of the breakfast.3. No resort fee. This is truly a plus!Con:1. Old and annoying A/C system.2. Too family friendly. The so-called pool is tank-sized.

Location was awesome! Short walk to shopping and the beach. It was quiet and comfortable. The valet service was amazing. We will stay again. This is my Third time to Hawaii and I've stay all over Waikiki and this place is on point.

I stay at this hotel 5-8 times a year for business and the staff for the most part is consistent with giving great service. The location is awesome too! A skip to the water and a hop to the shops! I enjoy my stats!

Found this hotel via Costco. Amazing value and perfect for myself and three kids, ages 7-12. They provide breakfast in the morning which has many options and is very tasty. It is two blocks from the beach and very close to the main area of Waikiki. I would highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel has a friendly staff that are always to help you. The room was very clean, and one of the housekeeper, Kim Tyau was very professional and pleasant.Front desk exceed my expectations. It has a perfect location near to the beach.The only thing I was not very impressed was the free breakfast. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I would recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki, and next time I will to stay there.

The hotel is in a great location, not far from the beach and easy to walk to a variety of different places to eat. The morning breakfast is good, the variety is not the greatest but, does offer hot food, The staff is very friendly and helpful. I also like the fact the hotel has guest laundry.
user_name:
Tracy W
Rohnert Park, United States

review_body: The front desk clerk Lei was so very helpful, she recognized our birthdays, and gave us a great room. She is very professional and exhibits the focus on customer service She demonstrated the Aloha service, that type of service is why we return

My husband and I found our home away from home at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki Beach. It's the perfect location near the beach and restaurants and just far enough from the crowds. We were fortunate to meet Jose Fernandes who exemplified the meaning of friendly hospitality. We felt genuinely welcomed by all the staff. Our room was well appointed and kept immaculately clean. We would recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki to everyone.

Hyatt Place Waiki is very welcoming, it is clean and modern. The staff are very helpful and welcoming. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning and my husband loved the workout room and happy hour at the bar :)

Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Everything was well maintained and location is perfect. A block from beach and walking distance to all major Waikiki restaurants and shops. Convenient and less expensive parking garage across the street at the Banyon hotel, instead of using Hyatt valet.

Overall, we were very satisfied during the whole stay. (4 nights in total)1. Location:-3 mins walk from Kuhio beach (right next to Waikiki beach, much less crowded and still beautiful)-6~7 mins walk from Waikiki beach-7~8mins walk from both Alamo and Hertz rent car center-3 mins walk from Honolulu zoo (has a nice park to get some rest and a public parking lot with comparatively low fee)-3 mins walk from the Green line Trolley Bus stop2. Room Condition: We booked a standard room, but the staff from Bosnia kindly upgraded our room to a two queen bed room with a sofa bed and a bath tub. (FYI, we checked in on a weekday during the off-season) The room was very spacious and clean, beds were comfortable and the bath tub was very useful after a long day of strong sun and hot weather. Some more bathroom amenities and lamps would have been better. Coffee bags were complimentary, but 3$ for each bottle of water.3. Service: All the staffs were cheerful and eager to help guests. They lent us the 110V adaptor, provided hot water for coffee, told us directions for main attractions etc. One thing - one of staffs told us to go the T galleria DFS to buy tickets of the Green line Trolley Bus, which about 16~17 mins walk from the hotel. But it turned out that we could have just hopped on the bus and buy tickets from the driver.4. Complimentary Breakfast: There weren't many favorable reviews about the breakfast, but in fact it was much better than expected, though the menu wasn't so varied. We really liked the scrambled egg, plain yogurt (had it with granola), cinnamon bagel and pineapples. Kimchi was different from what we usually eat back in Korea (it was merely salty), but both Miso soup and rice were good. I could see some of Senior Asian guests around me enjoying them.

Our arrival started with a free upgrade of our room. The room was twice the size of the room we had paid for. Needless to say, this was a welcome surprise and gave us much needed room for our belonging. The staff all have a good sense of humor, like the work they are doing, and attended to everything in a fast and professional manner. I would stay here again. Additionally, the hotel arranged for our taxi ride to the airport which only cost $29 USD to go out to Honolulu International Airport. This was much cheaper than going in a regular taxi which would have cost $50.

Stayed here for a week. On check in we were told by Joshua we had been upgraded to a larger room but it didn't have the king bed I had booked. When we got to the room it was on The mezzanine level and looked into the lower level of a condo, the room was dark and unappealing and the TV didn't work. I went down to the desk and Joshua wasn't there so I dealt with Troy who is VERY customer service oriented. When I explained to him what I had booked and what we were given he said " let me see what I can do for you". We ended up in a very nice room with my Kingsize bed on the 9th floor. Troy, I Thank you again. The hotel is older but very clean, the staff is friendly. It is close to the beach, but be prepared to walk if you want to walk to some of the nicer restaurants. The breakfast buffet was good, lots of it but be prepared to have a lot of repeatition of the hot dishes. Overall great value for the money.

They hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Buffet was great, as it was located outdoors. Room was spacious and clean. Not far from the beach and restaurants. We were pleased with everything except our view. We expected a full beautiful view of the mountain, but could only see it when standing in the corner of the room.

We stayed here one night before a cruise departure. The hotel was relatively clean although room had slightly mildew like odor. Hotel had snack bar, great breakfast buffet and good fitness room in good condition. Don't expect much of any view with this hotel. CLOSE to middle of beach... lot's of places to eat/drink/hang out within short walk.

We stayed 3 nights at the Hyatt Place Hotel last week. We really could not fault it. Every time we approached the front desk we were greeted with a smile and a friendly approach. The included breakfast outdoors on the deck was very good with a variety to suit all tastes. The green apples in the bowl at reception were well re lived by all in our family! We were 2 adults and 4 children in one room. It worked fine with the 6 of us sharing 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. Initially there were only 4 bath towels in our room so we phoned for another two. About 10 minutes later, housekeeping called the room to check that we had received the towels and finished with a promise to ensure there were always 6 in the room - lovely service. Thank you to all of the staff at the Hyatt Place, the only hotel I have found that will have 6 in a room - you saved us a lot of money by not having to get a second room! We will definitely recommend this hotel. i should mention that Valet Parking was also a terrific option for US$30 per day - saved lots of parking hassle with a family. The beach is about a 3 minute walk and great at sunset - the hotel provides beach towels.

Front Office staff were not accommodating and did not feel the Hyatt touch experience.The location and room is great. The pool is small.Housekeeping Staff were greeted us with a smile.Breakfast is good although it's mainly same dish every day. I will still recommend the hotel for room cleanliness and location wise.

One of the few hotels in Waikiki area which offers free breakfast and the choices are surprisingly plentiful, better than any of the US hotels I've been to. There's always rice, miso soup and kimchi for rice lovers; waffles/pancake/French toast (only one kind of each every day), sausage, bacon, eggs, oatmeal (with plenty of toppings to choose from), cereal, milk, fresh fruits (every day it's pineapple, cantaloupe and honey dew), pastries, bagels and muffins are among the choices. Room is not as spacious as I had expected it to be (from what I saw on the pictures) and the countertop space of the vanity is too small, you'd have to use other space of the room to store toiletries; but, the bed is really good for sleeping. Hotel staff are polite and courteous. We got there at least 30 minutes before check in time but they took us in and gave us our room key so we were able to get into our room immediately and we were so thankful of it after a long flight. On the day of our check out, they hold our luggage too until we were picked up by our airport shuttle, which is a really nice service.

We had the pent house and it was lovely oven view . The only thing was the tall tall buildings in my way to see all the ocean view .and maybe a microwave be nice to add in it when travel with a lot of kids . Other then that we where great .

Great hotel for the price. Every staff encounter was very good, valet was quick. Overall, a very pleasant experience. Continental breakfast was good, had good variety of items and kept well stocked and serviced.
user_name:
Ranae Sue B
Salem, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki hotel for our visit to Oahu and the hotel delivers all the amenities we needed to make our trip a memorable one. I would definitely recommend anybody that is looking to visit Oahu to stay at this hotel.

Awesome room and bed. Front desk was very nice. As I was checking in she talked with me like I was no stranger. Breakfast was great, couldn't ask for anything better. Location is great and the bed was nice, lots of pillows

Nice hotel. Very clean and quiet. Convenient walking distance to everything. The view of the ocean is there, but you're looking at the tops of some really ugly buildings. No matter. It was nice. The room was small, but we didn't plan to stay in the room. Small (I do mean small) pool, but when you're a block from Waikiki Beach, what's a pool for? We heard about the traffic and the cost of parking so we opted to ride the bus and shuttles. This location lets you do that.There appears to be two sections of the hotel. One section (perhaps an addition to the original) faces the street with no view, and then another part where we stayed and those rooms have an ocean view. Not sure about this, but like I said ... we didn't go to Hawaii for the hotel experience.
user_location: Oak Ridge, North Carolina, United States
user_name:
Mike S
Oak Ridge, North Carolina, United States

review_body: A fabulous place to stay close to everything. A clean hotel with a friendly staff. The breakfast in the morning was good and convenient. When staying there ask the front desk about local restaurants they will give some great suggestions!

The hotel is close to the beach, zoo, and within walking distance of the center of waikiki. There is a towel service where you can borrow towels to take to the beach or pool. Breakfast was good but by the 3rd day you really should really explore the rest of what the city has to offer. Views were somewhat limited as you are surrounded by other big buildings. But hey, you dont stay in a hotel for the views... My room was a little small. Wifi access was a little spotty at times. Biggest issue was limited parking in the building. For my 7 day trip, I essentially parked across the street at the banyan garage which is 20$ for a 24 hr period. I had to go out at 10pm every day to purchase a new permit. The location is fairly close to the freeway entrance and you dont have to drive through the hustle and bustle of waikiki area to get to it. There is no resort fees and overall costs less than other properties right across from the beach. Overall a great base location to explore the entire island.

The hotel is in a very convenient location. It is a very quick walk to the beach and there are also plenty of shops and restaurants in walking distance. It is also easy to get to/from the hotel. Charlie taxi company will take you from the airport to the hotel or from the hotel and to the airport for a flat rate of $29 each way. When we called for them to pick us up, they were there within 5 minutes. The room was clean and adequate, but nothing special. Our city-view room had a very small section of the beach visible from our balcony so that was a nice surprise. There is no extra resort fee added to the cost of the roomThe breakfast was good for a free breakfast. Each day the hot offering changed.The first day they had bacon, eggs and pancakes. The second day there was sausage, eggs and waffles. The third day there were biscuits with ham and egg on top of them and French toast. The fourth day there were English muffins with egg and ham. Every day they had fresh fruit and yogurt and bagels and some kind of pastry and some Japanese food offerings. They had milk, orange juice, apple juice, water and coffee available. There were a few tables indoors but most of the seating was outside. That was not ideal when it was raining or sunny and hot with no shade. There were trays available in your room so you could take your breakfast back to your room. The fitness room was very nice. The equipment all looked pretty new and there was a lot of it. I never saw anyone in there though. They had a bathroom and filtered water cooler also in the fitness room.Our room was very dark. There was no overhead light. There were two little lights on each side of the bed, a small desk lamp and one other little light. There was a blinking light in the corner by the ceiling that was annoying at night. The air conditioner also made a beep periodically throughout the night too every time it was about to kick on so that was annoying. The room was otherwise quiet at night. When we arrived, the sheets had old blood stains on them which was disgusting so I left a note for them to change them the next day. They did, however they didn't make up the room until 4 PM and then didn't leave us any clean bath towels. On our last day I asked the cleaning lady at 3pm if she could do our room next because we didn’t have any towels and wanted to shower before we left. She was very polite but said no, because she had to do all the check-outs first. She came by an hour later at 4pm and offered to clean the room then. We told her she didn’t need to anymore because we were already packing to leave and all our bags were all over the room since our flight home was in a few hours. She did provide us with clean towels at that time.The pool is very tiny but no one was ever in it so you could have it all to yourself if you wanted to get in. I dipped a foot in and it felt very cold. They did have towels by the pool and you could borrow them to go to the beach. There are rental chairs and umbrellas available nearby on the beach but they are expensive to rent. It was $40 a day for an umbrella and chair and $20 a day for just a lounge chair. Instead, I bought a chair at the ABC store for $20. It was not a lounge chair but it had good back support. I gave it to someone else to use on our last day.I gave it 3 stars because the location and breakfast were good, but the 4pm daily room cleaning really bothered me. I like to have the room already clean before 2pm when I return from the beach.
