Had a family of five. We booked at the last minute there Specialty Ocean View, Two Queen Beds (sofa bed). Surprisingly very spacious, good bathroom and separate toilet. Loads of storage and fridge with free wifi which was great for the kidsOcean view was more like you can see it. Check in was easy and we decided to stay an extra 4 days which they kindly did at the same special rate we got onlineLocation was fantastic with most tour pick ups right outside the hotel. The public transport also had a bus stop about 100 metres down the street which added to all the convenienceABC store just across the road was useful for bits and pieces.Bit of a walk into town and all the shops but as close as you can get to the zooThe hotel breakfast was pretty good. Did get awkward when it rained, not so much indoor but more outdoor space. Took breakfast up to room when it rained. Selection varied throughout the weekLaundry was good, away from everywhere next to the gym and the hotel can organise for a flat rate to and from the airport really cheap taxi, just query on booking Great stay for the family, would stay again

This hotel whilst not having sea views is a very short walk to Waikiki Beach, shops, restaurants and the buzz of Honolulu. There is a flat rate taxi charge of $29US from and to the airport. Staff were very helpful and there is a dedicated onsite Expedia consultant to assist with day tour bookings. Breakfast is included in the tariff, and there is a good selection of food choices (though it can get crowded). Just a simple thing, the hotel has an onsite coin operated laundry,which after travelling for over a week was a real bonus. We would stay here again.

The hotel is on the south end of Waikiki beach, about 2 blocks off the beach. The room was equipped with a fridge, flat screen tv, and king bed. The bathroom only had a shower, but it was fairly large. Our "city view room" actually had a partial view of Diamond Head and the beach from our large balcony. The pool is outdoors and somewhat small. Breakfast is served near this pool, which is pleasant. Breakfast is good for a free hotel breakfast, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, cereal, pastries, fruit and some Japanese entrees as well. Service was good, typical Hyatt. The hotel is within walking distance of the zoo and Queen Kapiolani Park and Garden. We also walked to the Diamond Head monument from this hotel, but this was a long walk.

We really enjoyed this place! In Waikiki but away from madness of city center, close to zoo and beach. The beach at the end of the street is great for kids, shallow and no waves. The breakfast buffet has a very good selection and made it easy for us each morning; all very clean and well kept. Thank you to the staff that prep and work hard to provide great customer service!The only slight issue was the elevator ran slow so we took the stairs often- hey, good exercise! Will definitely stay here again!

The rooms were very clean and adequate for our needs. As a couple our room was good but a little more room would have been nice. Having a balcony and sliding door was good to let in the breeze.The daily breakfast was pretty standard in this type of hotel, but was absolutely adequate. The option of taking your breakfast back to your room was great with the tray provided in each room. We liked this idea.The hotel is a one end of the main tourist street in Waikiki which we were unsure about, as this was my 3rd trip to Waikiki, but the location was great. All the drivers we had, knew exactly were the hotel was located and the one way street made it easy to exit the Waikiki area with out having to go through a lot of traffic.The beach is only a short walk (3 minutes max) away with a nice protected beach great for kids or those no wanting to be battered by waves.There is an ABC store located next door which is very handy to stock up on daily essentials. The staff were very friendly at check in and at the lobby bar area. There are also daily activities on offer as well as tourist operators located in the lobby.The hotel also has the daily transport to the Outlet Shopping leaving from the front of the hotel. We highly recommend this Hotel for any one wanting to stay in Waikiki.

This property is conviently located within walking distance to Waikiki Beach. Rooms are clean and spacious. Currently offers free daily breakfast as well. Would definitely stay again if needed - great hotel!

As this was our 3rd visit to Waikiki I had a reasonable idea of the location. I was concerned it was a bit to far from the action, however it was ideal. The hotel was known by many local drivers and it also proved popular for transport pick ups etc with many leaving from the front door. If traveling to the Out shops or other locations it was easy to get to and from. The beach is just a short walk with a safe walled beach for kids and the like. There are many eating locations nearby. There is an ABC store next door which proves very popular as they do.

This hotel gets 9's and 10's out of a review of 10. It was clean,close to everything, but most important. I've been in customer service for 40 years, and it's customer service was the best. We will stay here every time we go to Ohau
user_name:
Louis T
Waikiki, Hwaii, United States

review_body: Although one member of party had a convention to attend at Hawaii Convention Center, this "place" made sense for rest of group. Good location away from busiest part of the main shopping/hotel area. That was a plus because it opened up a lot of beach space only one block away from hotel. Staff is professional and not intrusive. OK restaurants within walking distance but nothing "spectacular." Not sure there is "spectacular" in Waikiki because this part of the city totally caters to tourists. Miss the local flavor that is known to exist in other parts of the city. Locals seem to know to avoid these mass marketed restaurants. Breakfast at Hyatt Place is obviously free. It is a feeding frenzy by tour groups who act like this is their last meal on earth. This seemed to be worse at 6:30 a.m. when the "restaurant" opened. Plenty of staff needed to clear tables immediately before birds attacked. Obviously a challenge in every beach restaurant as signage is everywhere..."Don't feed the birds." Many tourists did not read or ignored it, making the staff be doubly vigilant. They definitely were and it was appreciated.Pool is really small. For those complaining, it should be noted that there is no $30 plus resort fee at this hotel. For those on business or always out and about, this "place" should be top on the list. For those looking for a resort, go somewhere else.Note: Hyatt Place 24/7 "Gallery" Restaurant meals are terrific. Fresh, well-presented food and packaging. Room delivery ($3) or a call to your room when the food is ready. Immediate pickup at counter. Food is always hot/cold due to that process. Excellent idea with terrific staff.

Found the location convenient to travel on buses and short walk to beach. Staff were friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast was enjoyable. Our room had a beautiful view of the beach. Easy walk to downtown Waikiki. Close to local ABC store for supplies.

I've always been a Marriott person but due to a large convention in the area, I had to book elsewhere. This was my first time staying at a Hyatt and I was not disappointed! They gave me a room with two queen size bed and a separated living room. The room was larger than other Marriott hotels in Waikiki and I love it! As for the bathroom, it's another story. It's definitely outdated, small, and needs more counter space. Elevators were super slow. Breakfast was included with the hotel, if interested. I did stop in for some fresh pineapples...yum!Location was pretty good. It was very close to the beach, eateries, and the ABC store.Valet was nice. The staff were pretty friendly and serves you without expecting a tip. But the wait can be long depending on what time you're getting your car.Overall, it was a nice stay!

Jarren provided excellent front desk service and he even remembered my name from my February stay...WOW. The hotel is conveniently located in a spot where there aren't too many tourists yet convenient to some great restaurant...shout out to Sansei Sushi.You wil not be disappointed in the service and location. There is an ABC store one block away and the beach is only a few more. Thanks Hyatt Place....this is best one I've stayed at so far.

I've always been a fan of Hyatt hotels and this place was my first time in HI. The location is good in the sense that the beach is less than a 3min walk away and there's an ABC store along the way. They have valet parking. And the rooms were clean and cozy. The semiprivate TV room was cool add to the room. All the staff were friendly and inviting too. The free breakfast is always nice. The spread was the usual and they mixed up the main dish daily. But they blew me away when I saw they were serving rice and miso with kimchi. Only thing keeping it from 5 star though is poor elevator service and they had three. Elevators moved slow and took to long to reach floors.

Our stay was very pleasant. Room and hotel was clean. Big room, modern, and FREE WiFi. Loved the fact breakfast was included. Nice air-conditioning. Staff was very friendly. They have several desktops available for use, as well as a printer.

This is a basic hotel located 3 blocks from the beach so easy walking distance but like so many hotels in Wakiki it is outdated and needs refurbishing.The sliding door in our 14th floor room was so old and worn, there was a sizeable gap where the air could get in so the room was noisy from traffic and wind.The lobby area (which contained the bar) was open air as most hotels are but there was no circulation so the area was too hot and uncomfortable to be usable.The "pool" area (pool was tiny and unheated) was dirty and in disrepair and not pleasant to use. Breakfast served in this area was not enjoyable. This hotel needs a makeover if they want to compete with the dozens of others in the area. We would not stay here again.

Great value for the price, though the local pigeons (who know a good thing when they see it) make the outdoor breakfast area something of a challenge. Rooms are spacious, clean, & the beds comfortable. Highly recommended

A completely uninviting hotel in Honolulu with staff who care little of your accommodation and your stay. Two elevators will make you wait and are guaranteed to be crowded. Staff with give you conflicting information if any at all

While during our trip to Hawaii, we decided to stop by Oahu before heading home. After much extensive research and debating on what hotel to book (if we were going to stay along the beach, or be more inward and if we wanted to pay more to stay on the beach/pay for the ocean view). Knowing that since we were going to be in Kauai first, and we didn't want to spend a ton of money on a hotel, we decided on Hyatt Place, with the number main reason being that a hot breakfast was included with the cost of the stay. I did find a cheaper rate online than what was listed on Hyatt's website, but they have a great price matching process, so ended up getting a really good deal. The hotel is only about 2 blocks away from the beach. There's a lot of stores around (ABC Stores) so if you ever need anything wise, you can always go out and buy stuff. Also, if you forget certain toiletries, the front desk does have some that you can buy or they'll give you for free. I'm so surprised at how great this hotel was. Very clean and very modern. We stayed in the newer tower, on the 10th floor. We had a semi view of the ocean. Granted, one of the reason why ended up with this hotel was because we figured we'd be out more than in the hotel so we didn't mind that we had a semi view of the ocean (which was true, we did not spend a lot of time at the hotel). Room was small but I do like that it was very clean. We had so much luggage since we just came from Kauai so trying to organize all of our luggages was a challenge. Like most places there is no self parking at this hotel - it's all valet. I also liked that they had a texting option if you had any questions or concerns, and they were very responsive. I would highly recommend this place to stay if you don't want to shell out a lot of money on a room!

Pros: - Hotel is located just a half block from Waikiki beach (we had a nice view of the water from our room) - Staff are all incredibly friendly - Free breakfast is terrific (note - it's a bit of a wind tunnel, so best to get seats along the sides of one of the large buildings) Cons: - It's a open aired hotel (ie - the lobby is not enclosed by wall or windows on all sides) so it can get a bit humid on a hot day - Elevator was a bit slow during our stay. - Parking costs $30/day for vallet or $18/day in the lot across the street (note- you have to pay for parking almost anywhere in Waikiki anyways, so this isn't too much of a con)

If you want to eat .. do not stay here.. If you want to use the internet do not stay here... Room are OK but NO view.. At the far end of good places to visit . spend the extra money to be closer.. Rate not worth it
user_name:
Gerald August R
Melbourne, United States

review_body: Staff was excellent. Location is great - very close to Waikiki beach. The breakfast provided was also very good and in a nice setting. Only issue was that there is not a full service restaurant on the premises.

I was pleased with location. Take the bus on khulio to diamond head park and downtowm honolulu. Very easy. Drivers honored our transfers. Everyone one was super helpful and accommodating. It is worth walking along thw beach front in the evening. Homeless are harmless.

My room on the 9th floor (901) had couple roaches, I was notified the front desk, and they were apologized to me and decide to change another room for me right away. This hotel is not on the ocean front and no resort fee, but you can walk to the Waikiki beach for 5 minutes. The beach is good and clear. Breakfast was good, they change the menu every morning. Overall, I am happy with the service and the staff(s), I would recommend the people to book this hotel.....

The hotel is two blocks from the beach and close to all the restaurants and stores. Hotel was comfortable and quiet and the staff was extremely nice. Your rate also includes free wifi and gym which was a great bonus. In Hawaii they charge you extra for almost everything

I was with a group of nine friends and we had a great time at this hot\tel. The location was great. We could walk to the beach as well as use the hop on/hop off bus to go to the Ala Moana Mall and other places. Due to the weather we could not do the blue line on the Hop-on/Hop-off shuttle which is the scenic route which was a big disappointment.

Big cockroaches in rooms A new room was given. Lost some sleep Expected in HI I guess First the room was sprayed Made it worseIf you don't want big bugs in your room don't stay hereAlso check your bag before leaving

Stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for a business trip recently. I'm a huge fan of Hyatt in general but was a little disappointed. Arrived after an extremely long at of traveling. I was told valet was sold out because they were so busy but you can park across the street in parking garage. Went to check in and they had checked somebody else unknowingly into my room. They kept saying I had already checked in. They did rectify the situation and found me another room. The elevator situation is awful! There was always a long line of people waiting for 2 elevators. The wait time was extremely long so as long as I did t have luggage with me I opted to walk the flights which was much faster. The room was clean. Wifi was awful and kept kicking me off which was extremely frustrating given this was a business trip. The hotel is in a good location if you want to be close to the beach. Overall, it was an average property.The employees were friendly.

We are fairly easy to please so no guarantees on this review for all you world weary travelers! Maybe take half a star off! However..We had a sea view room (balcony to get a view past the other hotels) and it was clean, well maintained by very lovely housekeeping staff, and had a spotless bathroom.Breakfast next to the pool was restrained in its offerings (i.e., not a great range - especially for my vegetarian wife) and we always got a table despite the full attendance every morning. Could be tight at times for a larger party.Beach towels always available to take a block or two to the beach, and it was a good spot to start the walk to the markets on the way to Diamond Head and the Head itself.Enjoyed the stay with no hassles, and a friendly concierge service. Taxi to the airport arranged by the hotel was a good deal made better by a great driver.

This was my first time staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. I was impressed. It's a beautiful hotel close to the excitement of the main strip, but the vibe is serene and relaxed. My room was spacious, clean, comfortable and lovely. The staff were so friendly and helpful. I will be returning!

Pretty average bare bones heart of the crowded city hotel. Nothing special here. Don't get your hopes up if you need gluten free breakfast. We enjoyed our stay but had low expectations. It was clean and the staff was nice.

Very good hotel.Great location, 3 minutes to the beach.Nice bar, with great Maitais!Unfortunately, during our stay, one of the two elevators was broken. Wait times for the single remaining elevator was long.Also, the way the fitness club is indicated send everybody (families, elders) in it, thinking they're going to the breakfast area.This could be improved.

This is mixed. There was a lot I liked and a lot I didn't. The room was huge, nice and comfortable and we had all we needed. Staff were amazing and the breakfast ample and delicious. However....the photography set a different level of expectation and this was not what I was looking for this trip. If I Had 'accurate' pics, I would have been fine with it - maybe. The pool is teeny tiny. My kids were so bummed. I know you don't need a pool with a beach so close (location is great!), but it was what I was looking for this time. Side note, there is a hotel diaganol that had a lovely pool and deck area with outdoor seating and a spa and even a playstructure for kids. had I known....They also advertised wine reception but when we got there it was over $20 each. So, know what you are booking. It is nice for the price but don't expect a resort.

Desk staff need to advise customers that the concierge is located further at the back out of sight as the desk staff when we told them we wanted to do certain things didn't advise of the concierge and we missed out on doing activities because it needed to be booked thru the concierge

Hyatt Place was a nice affordable option for staying at Wakiki beach. Although not directly near the beach, it was 1 block walking distance. We originally booked for a king sized bedroom but really needed a room with a tub since we were traveling with a toddler. Upon check-in, we got upgraded to a room with double beds that had a tub. I really appreciated the accommodation as it really helped us. The check in service was prompt and Lei was extremely helpful. Only downside to our stay was when we found out that only one elevator was operating. This made the wait times long to get up and down. Our room itself was clean and nice. The ac unit was loud and noise from the outside could be heard despite our balcony door being closed and being on the 10th floor. The ac also seemed to be weak as we needed to lower the temp significantly just to feel cool. The complimentary breakfast was good and had several hot and cold options. Another downfall to our stay was limited available parking at the hotel and so we had to use to parking garage across the street that charged about $20 a day.

I have stayed at this hotel many times, and because I'm a Diamond member I often get upgraded. Up until this trip, however, my upgrades included a bigger room or a good inland/mauka view. This time, I got a great ocean view and was shocked because I didn't know they even existed from this property! This place is definitely a good value either way, and I will be back.

Nice beach hotel if you remember that most are there for the beach so you may get some 3am partiers close by. This happened to us on 9th floor and people were very loud from about 3am until around 6am. I was tempted to turn my TV on LOUDLY around that time as I know they were sleeping then! All that being said, when I mentioned it at the front desk they quickly got us another room. Even sent people up to help move our stuff up to the 14th floor, a corner room. Absolutely wonderful customer service, they bend over backwards. Stayed farther down Kalakaua Ave last time at Embassy Suites which is a quieter area, but much more expensive. While this area is a bit noisier but prices are very reasonable. I would stay here again. Breakfast is nice.

Hyatt Place is moderately priced and has comfortable conditions and surroundings. If you want to be centrally situated in Waikiki it's close to the shopping area, beach and restaurants. Breakfast, provided with cost of hotel, is adequate and saves you the cost and hassle of finding breakfast establishments.

Stayed there for 1 week September 2016. When we arrived at the hotel, I was told they were overbooked but had arranged for me to stay at the Queen Kapiolani hotel for the night. They would refund me for the night and we would be checked into the Hyatt Place the next day.The Queen Kapiolani "Upgraded room" we were given was a dump. The hotel is dated and dirty, not the quality of hotel I had paid for. I went back to the Hyatt (midnight) and complained. They were able to move us to the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. The Hyatt paid for the taxi to take me from the Queen Kapiolani to the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and provided a taxi chit to take us to the Hyatt the next day. The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani (very nice hotel) also gave us 2 free breakfast buffet vouchers. The staff at the Sheraton were amazing. Thank you.The hotel room we were given the next day at the Hyatt was on the 18th floor. It was very large and well appointed. The staff were amazing. The free breakfast was satisfying but not extensive. I enjoyed the food I had there.The fitness room is well appointed but the outdoor pool is quite small. The hotel has laundry facilities $3 for the washer, $3 for the dryer and $1.50 for laundry soap & softner (payment all in quarters or by credit card - expensive if you are from overseas with card fees each time you use it). The front desk was able to give us a roll of quarters ($10).The Hyatt is a short walk from Waikiki Beach near the Zoo. There are lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The nearest supermarket is about a 10 minute walk on Kuhio Ave. Wolfgang Puck's at the Ashton has great Pizza.Even though we had a rocky start, I would stay there again. If you go, say hi to Christopher at the front desk. He is so helpful.

I was happy during their stay. In particular, the staff were so friendly. Staff were happy everyone. It conveyed to me with happiness. While it is entertaining guests. I hope the breakfast menu more diverse. But I ate a good breakfast. Thank you for being happy memories too. Thank you very much. ^^

A touch of the tropics is what you will feel when you arrive at this hotel. We had a grand time in Hawaii (On a Tour package) and this hotel is part of that MAHALO feeling. The staff are excellent, though the hotel is not modern compared to those in Vegas, but the service is great. Surrounded by tons of restaurants, shops, convenience stores etc., so it's highly recommended for travelers. Again Mahalo and stay Chaka... : )))

Great hotel in a good location close to the beach and transport outside the door. Buffet breakfast was good and had a good variety of food. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this place to friends.

I strongly recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach to those who spend most of their time out and about and prefer the excellent location on the edge of Waikiki Beach, next to the Zoo, close to H1 Fwy., and a 2 min. walk to the beach. Check out Hyatt Place before booking any room on Waikiki Beach.

From the moment the valet opened the car door, until the final time the valet closed the door for me, the entire experience with the staff at the Hyatt Place Waikiki was an incredible experience. The staff have been so attentive, friendly and welcoming.

Walk 5 min to Waikiki beach and all convenient places. Bus stop nearby. I would recommend taking bus and trolley to places in Honolulu. You don't need to rent a car in Oahu. But If you wish a room with Ocean view you may need to reserve earlier.

I was there for a wedding and a vacation. All of the staff was amazing. They helped with everything that I asked for. It was clean and just steps away from Waikiki Beach. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

This hotel is so close to Wikiki beach. Very busy hotel. Tariff includes breakfast which is good, reasonably priced. There is a mini super market at the door, and 5 mints walk to beach..all day busy hotel, very clean though very small rooms, You need to be careful when giving Credit card details. Staff works in shifts so you have to be careful in bookings if you have to make any. They help bookings taxis promptly. They have Archid Flower making free sessions...interesting. As said very close to beach and food places..and big shopping malls..

This hotel has welcoming staff and is approximately 500 yards from the beach. It offers a complimentary breakfast buffet which is very busy most mornings. The rooms were spacious and the AC very good. The pool is disappointing, too small and only seven loungers available. Used the beach and lagoon instead. Overall, was good but would stay somewhere with better pool facilities for families.

Arrived early am to find the airline has lost our bags.Hyatt Place surprised us with their emergencies package of toiletries etc, as it was Ann's birthday, a beautiful bottle of wine, a birthday cake and a hand drawn birthday card from the concierge - amazing.Only 100m from the beach, the front desk, cleaning and general staff are so thoughtful and professional.If we ever trave to Hawaii again, we'll be sure to stay here again.

The hotel is a couple blocks from the beach and very close to many eateries. It's very quiet. The hotel staff is very accommodating. This stay was very nice. I strongly recommend this hotel for your next day at Waikiki.

Location and price were the criteria. You can walk everywhere around Waikiki from this hotel. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and they serve a free breakfast that is very good. However, the city view looked right into the run down apt complex across the alley. Valet parking was recommended at $30 a night plus tips.

We came to Hawaii with last-minute intention to enjoy our last bits of summer. It was a real struggle to find hotels with affordable prices online. Luckily, I was able to book a room for 5 days, 4 nights and it was ocean view. I called the hotel a few times before we check in just to make sure, and every single time I was grateful getting such a hospitable service. My room located on the 16th floor, and the view was spectacular. The staffs were very friendly and let us in early since the room was ready. When we needed help with daily necessities or tours to travel around Waikiki/Honolulu, the Gallery Host staffs and Nate at the travel desk were happy to help us. The complimentary breakfast was okay, even though it was a bit windy at times. Maria, if I remembered correctly, was very friendly to us. Thanks to Hyatt Place, I thoroughly enjoyed my short trip at Hawaii and I am looking forward to a longer vacation here.

We stayed here for 60 days-with our 3 pets. That is quite a long time to stay in a hotel. We did learn some tricks during our stay. Signing up for the monthly parking plan at the Banyan (only $180 per month) instead of $25 a night was one of them. You must go during their office hours (they're open Sat morning), and it's only good from the 1st to the 31st. Also, taking the stairs is sometimes critical if you're in the Pali tower- either stay on a low enough floor, or stay in the Diamond Head tower. Pali only has 2 elevators, and we have waited as long as 15 minutes to catch elevators in the past!!!There was a one-time pet fee of $175. That's it. No nightly fee, nothing else. We loved the staff, and still talk to them when we're in the area. Great job guys!

Summary: Need to make a good arrangement... don't wait until the last min to infor us. I was asked to stay at the same Ocean View room for two days and switch back to mountain view for next two days. They asked me to switch room first and decision to let us stay in the same room at the afternoon. They don't inform us until I called in to confirm when and how they are going to move my stuffs at the last min. Furthermore, I had to rushed back my room before 11 and and packed my stuffs and ready to do it. In conclusion, it is not acceptable of the arrangement. It wasted my entire morning and cannot plan out for other things. Attention to mgr team: We are platinum member and we felt like a rush cat and running around because of the inconvenience that you staffs had made. They should offer me to stay in the same room at the first check in just like other Hyatt that we where stay in the past. I am not happy for this staff interactions at all. In addition, we had asked my fr who also booked the same hotel at the same period of time, because we love Hyatt, but the arrangement was very disappointed.
user_name:
Tze C
San Jose, United States

review_body: Good hotel to stay and easy commute to all the places and very near to the beaches. The only problem if you have a car you need to pay for the parking in the hotel which is weird.. For a customer it is better to make the parking free. Other than that I recommend this hotel
user_name:
Marella V
Union City, United States

review_body: Customer service was very disappointing. Just average. I messaged the hotel through Facebook before my honeymoon but no one replied to my message even though it had been read. Customer service was average - nothing extra was done for my honeymoon, and nothing extra was done for check in. For a hotel chain like Hyatt I expected better customer service - for them to take that extra step to welcome their guests. At other boutique hotels, drinks and a wet towel were provided upon check in. They also provided beach supplies and water which were accessible at anytime.

This was my husband's and my both first visit to Hawaii and were hesitant about staying on Waikiki, due to family/friend recommendations about the tourist hot-spot, crowds, etc. I chose this hotel on ratings and reviews and did not regret it one bit. We spent some time at Waikiki, but had a car and traveled around the island. The hotel was generally easy to get to, towards the end of the Waikiki beach area, and was close to restaurants and convenient stores if needed. It was a great place to start and end our day, and had options when we spent our day there. The rooms were clean, service was unimaginably considerate, and I seriously loved the text feature for requests and checking on our stay. A big perk was the free breakfast, it was varied and extremely good every morning, and the eating area never felt over crowded. We would definitely stay here again, and have already recommended it to family and coworkers that are going to Oahu this year. Thank you!

Loved this hotel! Was super clean,staff was amazing, breakfast was a huge bonus too! The beach was close to this hotel and everything you needed was so close...including an ABC store:) I just want to thank the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach- you and all the staff were awesome!!!

Nice hotel and close to the beach. Great for families because it offers free breakfast daily which is a huge savings. It's also walking distance to the beach. Staff was very nice and hotel was very clean.

I've stayed in many Hyatt Place hotels and the Hyatt Place Waikiki is one of the nicest. We were upgraded to a suite on the top floor and the view was incredible. Unfortunately one of the walls were against the elevators so you could hear them. I asked to be moved which the staff promptly did but it was to a regular non-suite room. It was still nice but not as nice as the upgrade. So lesson learnt - if you get a free upgrade don't complain about noise that really isn't that bad. ha ha! The staff were incredible friendly, the tower I got switched to had one elevator closed due to renovations but really didn't take too long. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to friends and family.

It is good location to go out.There are a bike rental shop and the bus stop near there. If you have kids, there is the zoo near the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and kind. The bar was really nice. Everything was perfect for us.

This hotel was an incredible place to stay in. The service from the staff was fantastic from beginning to end. They were genuinely nice and very helpful with everything. The location was one block away from the beach and it was a safe neighbourhood so I didn't have to worry about staying out late. In terms of food, we had breakfast included with our stay which was great. They had lots of variety and the food was fresh. If you want to go out and eat, there are many great restaurants to go to around the vicinity so you don't have to worry about meals. I thought the room was a little small but we were only 2 people and were just in the room to sleep so we didn't care. Even though the room was small, it was clean so that's all that matters. There was also a helpful gentleman downstairs who helped us plan our activities so you we didn't have to worry about finding things to do. Honestly, I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

From peeling off paint in the bath tub with a rubber mat to age showing interior, I think I like the Hilton Waikiki just next block better for almost the same price. The staff members are caring and friendly. That is pretty much only the pleasant thing for this hotel.

We are loyal Hyatt customers and this hotel was great! It offered free breakfast with a variety of menu items, was super clean and staff was friendly. It is super conveniently located to all we wanted to do and the beach. We will definitely return next year!

We spent two nights here before heading up to the North Shore for the rest of our trip. Location is great. Just a couple blocks back from Waikiki beach. Room was small but well laid out and fully efficient. We were in 1401 which had excellent beach views and sunset views from our wraparound balcony. I am unsure if the view would be as good from lower floors since there would be buildings blocking the beach. Breakfast was delicious and served on the 3 floor, out by the pool. Seemed very well staffed and items were constantly being replenished. The pool is small and we didn't use it but many people seemed pleased with it and I will say that it had beautiful tile work on it. The bed in our room was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever had at a hotel. All of the staff was pleasant and welcoming. There is an ABC store next door which is nice when wanting snacks or beverages. On top of all that, the price couldn't be beat either! Overall, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat but would say it's best suited for those who have seen Waikiki before or don't need a luxury resort feel. This would be perfect for business travel or those traveling who don't need to be right on the beach at Waikiki in an overpriced resort.

The Hyatt Place in Waikiki is one of the best values in the area. Hotel staff are super friendly and helpful. The only drawback of this hotel is that there is no whirlpool/spa pool to go with the typical swimming pool.
user_name:
Michael C
Brea, CA, United States

review_body: My stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was fantastic. The location is close to the beach and to the pick up locations for all excursions. It's in the heart of Waikiki beach which made it convenient for us to walk around and did not have to rent a car. The rates were reasonable and the complimentary breakfast was fantastic and I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to go to Honolulu.

Very clean hotel and the location was perfect, is within a walking distant to stores and waikiki beach. My bf and I enjoyed our stay here. We had breakfast every day but there was not a lot of variety and could be crowed early in the morning. Parking was 30 dollars a day, but we found another place around the corner for parking for 10 dollars less. I would advise to rent a car so you can explore the island, there so much to see!

We stayed in Hyatt Place in Anaheim in November last year and loved it. So when i was looking for a hotel in Waikiki and discovered Hyatt Place at Waikiki, I had no hesitation in booking. Hyatt have incredibly generous sized rooms and complimentary Wii Fi and Hot buffet breakfast. The staff were very helpful warming and welcoming. My only grizzles are the buffet breakfast is outside around the pool, it was windy and the sun was biting making for eating breakfast frustrating. Some days the variety was pretty average. There was only two elevators in our tower. They were very slow. They couldnt keep up with the demand. I personally didnt like the shower head. It wasnt strong enough to rinse soap and shampoo off. But other than that it was a very nice stay and we would certainly return again. I also would recommend the Hyatt to anyone looking.

It was a pleasant surprise to stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki. I chose to stay at a mix of hotels in Waikiki area including Sheraton and Hilton and my experience at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was far better than staying at other hotels. I especially liked the room - It was spacious, modern, up-to-date. The hotel also doesn't charge for the resort fee while providing the free but decent breakfast. Ah, the bed was exceptionally comfortable I highly recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach

Had a great time, the staff was great especially the GM Fernando who was very attentive to the guests. The hotel is located a block from the beach and within walking distance to restaurants and Leonards bakery for the famous Malasadas.

This has been my 3rd time staying here. It is my 1st choice in Waikiki for the price and overall experience. I hesitate to say this and give them such a great review only because i don't want them to get booked up when I need them. Selfish me! You guys are awesome Hyatt Place employees. From Valet to front desk to housekeeping. Thank you.

This hotel is by far the best ones that I have been to. It is very close to the beach which is about 2 blocks of walking distance. I love the free breakfast which is perfect for the kids. It is only 1 block from an ABC store which is very good.

This trip has been amazing. The staff was extremely helpful. The room was very comfortable and had a great view. Breakfast each morning was AMAZING. They had hot and cold items including some of the best fruit I have ever eaten. I would definitely stay here again!!.

Very nice location, only a block or two away from beach. The staff were really professional and kind....they all seemed really satisfied with their job. The room was clean and modern. The bathroom was slightly dated...could use a little remodel . Balcolony was a nice added touch .

Great place to stay. The only issue I had was the bathroom design is a bit unfriendly. The door placement does not allow for you to open it without stepping back into the shower. The rest of the room is great.

Overall great experience close to the beach. Your in the middle of it all and being just a block from the beach you get a great deal. If your spending all your time outdoors this place is perfect. Rooms aren't large but get the job done..

The location of the Hyatt Place is good - only a block to the beach and lots of shops very close by. The hotel does not have an on-site restaurant, but does have a snack menu to choose from. The pool is a real let down - it is very small and surrounded by concrete - no plants, no umbrellas or shade provided, some sun lounges are lined up, but it is not at all inviting and during my 10 day stay I did not see anyone using the pool. In fact we went to the hotel over the road and used their pool. The rooms are good - we chose a king premium city view room which is little bigger than the cheapest room. Great bed, rooms are quiet, free wifi throughout the hotel and breakfast is included.

We spend the last two days of our vacation in the Hyatt Place and I have to admit that I love it. The breakfast was the best and all the Staff are amazing. The hotel is very close to the beach, the zoo and shopping places.

Service from beginning to end was just outstanding. We'd have a family staycation again for sure. Check in was a breeze. Getting more pillows, blankets, shampoo and conditioner were fast and easy. Staff members are very prompt.

Pretty average hotel. Nearly the thing going for it was how the 10-15 min walk to Waikiki beach and nearby shopping/zoo/aquarium. Beds were comfy. Hope you're always up for the beach, the pool area is very small and was filthy with trash and dirty towels (when we were there). I would have liked to have been able to take our toddler swimming in the pool when the beach was overstimulating. Personally, did not think it was worth the price.

it was ok,i recommend the hyatt regency,a lot better hotel for a little bit more.close to the beach,hyatt place,be careful of the elevators,either you have to wait 10 mins or you get stuck.the elevators will start bouncing out of nowhere and big snapping sounds,if you stay here use the stairs if your on a low level,have fun wiakiki was very nice!
user_name:
Marcus James P
san jose, United States

review_body: This is a large hotel on the far side off Waikiki beach, a 10 minute walk from the central part of the beach.Rooms are on Hyatt standards with partial sea view from our 14th floor room.Breakfast is rich and nice served on the porch near the pool .Staff are friendly and helpful. As expected in Waikiki, parking is a problem and they do not have enough spaces for all rooms, so the first come first served system is sometimes a problem. On our first night we had to go look around for a parking spot. Once you do get a sopt it is onlt Valet for $30 a night.

I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The location was great since it was minutes from the beach and we were able to catch buses right outside of the hotel. It included breakfast where there was a lot of variety and they were constantly refilling it. The staff were very helpful and friendly all the time. There's an Expedia travel desk in the hotel too which helped us book many activities. They also held our bags the day we were leaving since we had a late flight and allowed us to access the bags multiple times during the day without complaint. I would definitely stay again!

Front desk was efficient and friendly. The employees for valet were fast. Our deluxe suite was clean and comfortable. Close to the beach. Breakfast buffet was good. Pool was clean but small. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

The rooms are nice and comfortable, the only bad thing about this hotel is the elevator is so slow, and the pigeons while your eating. This is my go to hotel in hawaii. Close to the beach. Nice balcony.

Had a five day stopover in Waikiki on the way back to Australia from California and stayed at the Hyatt Place. Staff were fantastic and very helpful, but the room (King ocean view) whilst clean and comfortable was a little smaller than we had expected. Daily breakfast was OK but hated those powdered eggs !!

Everyone was very helpful and smiling. The breakfast was different every morning. It was nice to not got to a complementary breakfast and it not be the same thing every time. The only thing I would change is the slow elevators.

This was a great find when our flight was cancelled. The Hyatt Place was clean, comfortable, with a contemporary touch. We even got an upgrade to an ocean view room that was a nice surprise. We had to leave early and missed the breakfast buffet. We'll be back for sure.
user_name:
Wendy M
Las Vegas, United States

review_body: This is the place to stay! It has an awesome free breakfast every morning that saves you a min of $10 per person, for food that day. It is one block from the beach and we had an ocean view room that was unbelievable to wake up in every morning! Updated and clean rooms, secure elevators, with key access. 24/7 food and drinks, you can't ask for anymore!

The hotel is in a great location; very clean, great staff. It is a perfect mix of beach, action, and quiet. The staff was very warm and welcoming and helped with any requests. The location is great because it is across from the beach; but car accessibility is better on this side of Kalakaua than the other due to traffic.
user_name:
Laura M
San Francisco, United States

review_body: The hotel and room condition was very good,. the location was not bad and it's easy to find. I couldn't see the beach at the room but it was close to go the beach. it takes 3 minutes to get there. They served breakfast. it's also good.

Later refurbished Hyatt-branded reboot of the former Ocean Resort Hotel, a perennial tourist staple of affordable packaged vacation vendors. The property itself nests behind the Aston to the makai side, and the Marriot on the eva side of the street, and is a classic twin-tower rectangular floor-plate high-rise with a connecting lobby and drive-up port-a-coche in front. This is, in fact, a sweet spot location with just a short stroll to one of the better beaches for swimming and surfing, and also walking distance to all Waikiki has to offer.....as such, recommend you do not bring a car as daily hotel parking is $30, and valet gridlock as well as wait times can get lengthy during crunch periods. TIP- daily car rental independents are on Kuhio Street just behind the hotel and many cost less than the parking fee; you can also find national brand outlets in many of the nearby major hotels.I had a higher floor ocean view king accommodation in what appeared to be the newer tower. Room size was listed at 300sf but it did feel smaller with larger dresser, desk, sofa chair, bedding and night tables all in toe. Bathroom was classic 60s micro-tel layout with commode and stall shower in water closet, single vanity behind a curtain wall cutout in the sleeping space. Room furnishings and fixtures were contemporary and in good functional order, but upon closer inspection you will see knicks and bruises from heavy tourist traffic on walls, corner beads, and furniture. Bedding and linen was very good; pillows were below standard; and room cleanliness was somewhere in-between. Personal pet peeves of WiFI, water pressure, and TV were all above standard, especially the flat screen; AC, however, was grossly inadequate, and while not intrusive from a noise perspective, simply could not keep up with the cooling demand, which was hampered by a governor-controlled 68 degree setting too. There is a small refrigerator and after-thought coffee maker in the room but I did not use either in what was a shorter 3 night business junket. Onto the warts supporting the "3" score.....1. Room in fact did have a view corridor sight-line peering between the Aston and other structures, but with the hotel planted next to a pack of mid-rise apartments, aging SROs, and budget hostels, water stained roofs and the sonorous-zooshing-echo of air-conditioners abound....so any expectation of scenic beach-scapes with rolling wave tranquility is an oversell. Moreover, with a 28" wide balcony serving as a lanai and AC docking pad, you will only spend a few moments trying to enjoy the trade winds and moonlight anyways. 2. I would describe the comp breakfast as "adequate but unremarkable" with an alternating egg dish and either french toast or waffles every day as the main event, as well as the usual supporting Japanese faves. The real issue is the size of the breakfast breeze-way and its inefficient layout that drives people-frenzy during the morning rushes. There is also 24/7 food option and a bar in the lobby, but the trade winds circulation is blocked on that side and without AC in the space, it had to be almost 90 degrees there, if not hotter....certainly not comfortable enough to sit and enjoy a meal or drink. 3. Lastly, and most denigratingly, this hotel should be called the "House of Slamming Doors." At all hours of the day, especially the morning, you will hear the heavy fire-rated steel doors on every room slamming and in some cases, physically shaking the building structure. I actually don't even think it is intentional, but with the wind vortexes tunneling through the tower envelopes and poorly adjusted door closers, it is way too pervasive and atrociously unnerving. BL-- Rack up the Gold Pass Points for shorter stays of business travel or a quick couples junket at a reasonable price point. The staff is really great, super-courteous, and very aloha-centric too. But the place is just too compact for larger families IMHO, and you will need look elsewhere for a relaxing ocean view, lounge, or resort feel.

Just at the end of our USA holiday we stayed at Hyatt Place and it was fantastic. Service was very friendly and the room was big enough to be comfortable. Complimentary Breakfast on the balcony was amazing.Highly recommended and will come again.

Great location with very good customer service! We stayed for 3 nights and 4 days and wish there could've been an extension. The beach is located just two blocks away and is centrally located to some really good restaurants. A couple of close restaurants we visited within walking distance were Cheese burgers in paradise, ME bbq and Tanaka Tokyo East.

I vacation in Hawaii frequently and was pleasantly surprised to find the Hyatt Place. It's in a great location in Waikiki and they don't charge a resort fee. The front of the hotel is on a side street which makes it safer and quieter than many of the other hotels. It's close to the beach and other activities. I loved the free breakfast and did I say there isn't a resort fee.

The location is excellent. The rooms very small- really only good for 2 per room. Looks like it has had a cosmetic upgrade. We paid extra for a mountain view that sadly did not exist- it did have an excellent size balcony with what we would think of as a city view from the 8th floor. At check in the staff were not helpful at all in regards to us asking about the missing mountain view- we were really brushed off. This started our week poorly & caused us great stress when dealing with the staff. Also do not count on a wake up call. On a day we needed it to get to a bus pick up our wake up call did not come- making for a very rushed am. The best thing about the hotel is : The great skillet breakfast- not fancy but has a good selection that you can also take to your room if you do not want to sit in the pool area and it is also where the best service in regards to staff is.

Hyatt Place waikiki beach is located on a side street near the main area of Waikiki Beach where there is good beach swimming. Hotel is used by several tour groups and college athletic teams. Rooms are typical Hyatt Place arrangement but this location provides a basic breakfast included in room price. Small swimming pool on 3rd floor, good exercise room, free computer use in lobby area. An acceptable place to stay on a budget or work but not for a special vacation trip. Two elevators for 16 floors meant slow service.

Hotel has a great location. Parking is a bit of a hassle if you don't valet ($30), but manageable for $20 at the garage across the street. They provide beach towels which is a great perk. Waikiki Beach is a short walk away. ABC store nearby with good selection of beverages and snack which we could put in the room refrigerator. We had a big crew in our room and the maid noticed right off and started leaving plenty of extra toiletries and coffee. Room was very clean and pretty spacious with a sofa bed in addition to two doubles. Lobby are is very inviting place to hang out, they have a decent happy hour in the bar area too. We arrived on a Friday and they offered a lei-making class that day with real flowers for free. Our girls loved this. Elevators are fast and seldom crowded. There are people in the lobby from whom you can purchase all sorts of tours and activities. Plenty of room in the closet and a good sized safe also. We were overall extremely pleased with this hotel and would come back again for sure.

great, central location for shopping, business and beach. No need for the rent a car - just grab cab or shuttle, once you are at the hotel you can walk everywhere. I recommend this place to all vacationers and business visitors

Hyatt Place is an average property one block from Waikiki Beach. Hotel needs an updating, especially the limited elevator service. Rooms typical of Hyatt Place; one unique benefit is the complimentary breakfast with limited selections.

This hotel has a very modern look and great breakfast included in your stay. My wife and I have stayed in this hotel once before and both times we had a great experience. Because the hotel is a smaller hotel you do not have to deal with the crowds of people as in a larger hotel.

Excellent service, comfortable bed, great location - 1/2 block from beach. Had an ocean view room, but had to look over 3 shorter building roof tops and in-between 2 high rise hotels. Room size was ok, but bathroom was really small. Balcony was tiny even for 2 people to sit and enjoy.

Hotel is very nice and comfortable. Great place to stay Waikiki down by the zoo. Easy to catch public transportation. This is a newer hotel in the area that is not too large or outdated. There is a breakfast that is included in your room rate every morning. Wow and the food was delicious. The only downfall to this is that it is noisy and very crowded. The staff does a great job keeping things clean and flowing smoothly.

Hotel is nicely situated, five minutes walk to the beach. We had a large top floor ocean view room with sleeper sofa with plenty of space for the five of us. We also enjoyed the breakfast. We very much liked our stay at Hyatt Place in Waikiki.

I have stayed at a number of hotels on or closer to Waikiki Beach, but if you want to save some money but still stay in modern, stylish, nicely furnished rooms then this is your hotel. The beach is only 1 block away so it's still very quick to get the beach and there's an ABC Store along the way if you need snacks.The cool thing about this hotel is the free hot buffet breakfast every morning, that's right: free! I never tried their in room dining menu, but there are many dining options within walking distance including a food truck serving local asian fusion food! The bus stop is just across the street on Kuhio so there's no problem getting around. Staff are friendly and quick to assist with any questions you may have. Rooms are always cleaned well. I also like this hotel because it's away from Kalakaua so you are just slightly away from the crowds. This is my second stay and will return when I'm back in Waikiki.

Great Hotel very conveniently located to everything downtown walking distance to most attractions, nice Hotel clean friendly and knowledgeable staff great restaurants very comfortable rooms... highly recommend

Stayed here for almost two weeks. It's a great base with free breakfast buffet. Close to the beach, walking distance to most Waikiki shops, all tours we went on offers pick up at our hotel, and it's close to trolley stops and bus stops.They also have a deal with a taxi company that offers a flat $29 ride to/from the airport. Check their site for details.Would definitely stay here again.

Hyatt Place is a great place to stay in Waikiki. It is clean, quiet and comfortable. Very friendly and helpful staff. This was my first time at Hyatt Place and I would definitely return. I highly recommend it.

Enjoyed my stay here & will do so again. Close to the beachfront, Waikiki Trolley stop, ABC Convenience Stores & a laundromat. Tour buses picked us up either outside the hotel or the Marriot across the road. Airport shuttle dropped off and picked up at the hotel. Lovely clean balcony room, beach towels at reception, and free wifi throughout the hotel, not only in the room. A minor issue is buffet breakfast is at the pool deck and a problem when it's raining. Needed to take tray down and eat in the room. Good value family hotel.

The hotel is well situated very close to the beach, but in a more quite area in Waikiki. The room was clean and breakfast was fine. Unfortunately during our stay one of the two elevators in the tower we were accommodated was not working. We had to wait more than 5 minutes to get to our room or get down to the lobby. It was very inconvenient for 20 store tower to have only one elevator. We have problem with the breakfast too first day of our stay. At check-in the receptionist told us that breakfast is served starting from 6.30 till 10.30 a.m.. We were very surprised when we enter the breakfast area at 10.15 a.m. and there were just 3 plates with meal left. Everything else was returned back to the kitchen. I had to ask for drinks and fruits so I can have normal breakfast. I was informed that breakfast usually is served between 6.30 till 9.30 a.m. and because it is high season they extend the breakfast time till 10.30. However the manager decided to return the food earlier, because there were to few people. In my opinion the time which was announced by the hotel staff has to be kept no matter there are people at breakfast area or not. Next days the announced breakfast time was kept.Except these two issues our stay was pleasant and we enjoyed our vacation.

Thank you for taking care of us. Josephine G. was very helpful during our stay at Hyatt Place. She understand our needs and deliver them. We like her service and will come back and stay at Hyatt Place again.

This modern Hotel is located east end of Waikki Downtown, close to Honolulu Zoo and Main Beach of Waikiki. The beach is located within walk distance. Main shopping area is a littele bit far from this Hotel, but this area is not so noisy. For peape to be rilax, this hotel is convenient. Also this Hotel serves complimentally breakfast including steamed rice and Miso soup, these are convenient for Agian people, it is confortable for travelers.

We absolutely loved the Hyatt Place, the rooms were spacious and clean, the staff was helpful and always greeted us back to the hotel with a smile, the assortment of food was awesome. We can't wait to be able to go back to that hotel.

On the positive side, this is my second stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki and again, I was very pleased with my experience. With continental breakfast included, the value is excellent. On the needed improvement category, this hotel includes breakfast and draws a large crowd. More attention to detail is needed by wait staff to replace empty utensils and empty condiment ketchup containers. Birds are also a negative annoyance and a health issue especially when you place your food on your table, walk back to the buffet area for more food, and come back to a flock of little birds eating the customer's meal.

This hotel met our needs. We actually rented 3 rooms for our family of 10. Two rooms were said to be "double queens with sofa bed" and the other was a "King with mountain view with sofa bed". The sofa bed in two of the rooms were just chairs that converted into a bed one was an actual sofa size. So if you needed to have 2 people sleep in the sofa bed....make sure you ask for that. One room was 1421 and it had a beautiful view of both ocean and diamond head from the balcony.We were in the tower with 14 floors. This had 3 elevators and all worked and not much wait time. The other wing apparently has 19 floors with 1 working elevator and was awful--glad we were not there. The breakfast had many choices. It was well worth having it available for the kids. The pool was small and we used it multiple times and the kids loved it. My granddaughters went to the Lei making class on Friday afternoon. They use real flowers and was fun. There are beach towels available at the front desk. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They even moved one of our rooms so everyone was together. The walk to the beach was very doable at about 2 blocks. We used the valet parking and it worked out fine (even though it was pricey) except they need a bigger area for cars by the entrance as it was very crazy when they brought our cars back.Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel as it was more reasonably priced than others and very handy for walking and activities.

The Hyatt Place is a decent choice. Our biggest complaint, and this would make us seriously consider not returning, is that the elevators take FOREVER!!! There are two elevators and 19 or 20 floors. Waiting to get to the room was excruciating. I did not attempt to take the stairs to the 18th floor but I seriously considered it. Other than that, the place was pretty decent. Friendly staff with one exception. Maybe she was just having a bad day.

The staff were very kindly, one of them helped me to print out document by use of his personal email address,Thanks, Troy Richardson!I can see clearly that every staff is trying to do their best to satisfy their customers, the problems that I experienced are summarized as belowaste e t3 points, 1st is that the room was too small, which size reminds me of Japanese business hotel.2nd is that the breakfast menu is not only so limited but also the taste was also bad,you don't have to think about what to eat, just eat wahtever you have seen.3rd is that the swimming pool is so small, it's just like a bathtub. By all means, I don't regret my choice for Hyatt place Wakiki beach, but I will challenge other hotel if I visit here again.Thank you.

A short walk from Waikiki Beach, the very busy Hyatt Place is worth considering. The staff did a good job keeping up with demand. Even though its a side street, Paoakalani Avenue can be noisy. City buses stop on the corner of Paoakalani & Kuhio, very convenient for getting around without a car.

This hotel, located 1 long block from Waikiki beach, offers a free hot breakfast that counteracts the expensive parking.The lobby is modern and offers a bar and food. The pool is nothing special, but walk to the beach! ABC store right next door.

If you are looking for a resort hotel, then Hyatt Place is not for you. However, if you are looking for a nice hotel in downtown Waikiki at a reasonable price, then this is your hotel. It has a good location, just off the beach by 2 blocks, and when on the upper floors has a good view of the beach and is quiet. Not much here in the way of food and drinks though. However, there are some really nice places very close by where you can get that anyway. Just keep all that in mind when chosing this hotel. And the hotel is clean with a very good staff.

The hotel is right across the street from the beach and there is a designated area for Hyatt customers where you can receive service, such as lounge chairs and towels.The rooms in the hotel, especially the ones facing the ocean, are large, comfortable and quiet.The high end paperless Toto washlet toilets are in the bathroom.Buffet breakfast is excellent. There are a myriad of choices and dining outside on the terrace with the ocean view is quite magnificent.

this is our second time to hyatt because of their complimentary breakfast. not all hotels in waikiki offers complimentary breakfast. one block away from the beach. i washable to get the corner room that had a unobstructed view of the ocean. (room 1834)
user_name:
Allan T
Daly City, United States

review_body: one of the best place to stay. Very good staff, food. Hoping Hyatt Place gives us again a best promo so i can bring my kids to get experience Hyatt Place in Waikiki. My birthday is coming, one of wish is have chance to stay, and relax this place. Thank you, Hyatt Place.

compare to price I paid services were not so good specially housekeeping. Morning breakfast area is full with birds around people who are eating their food which was unhealthy and gross....;( They should keep a net over that area.

What a nightmare our 10 day stay here has been... We trusted the other TripAdvisor reviews and, well, I guess we just got unlucky. They have 2 elevators for 19 floors and one is broken and won't be fixed for at least 2 more weeks. So, it takes (clocked it at 17 minutes yesterday while holding my breakfast tray) forever to get anywhere in this hotel on a good day.Had to stand in dog pee because another patron's large dog got scared in the elevator...Not joking...Guest below us smoking weed so we couldn't sit on our balcony and enjoy the ocean view we're paying for.light in bathroom only turns on if you jiggle the switch.Air-conditioner didn't work when we got here.Guests steal your chair when you leave your table to get sugar for your coffee. People are savages, watch out, always have one person at your table. lol. I had contacted the hotel before arrival and asked if there was anything we could do for my daughters birthday at the hotel and was told they'd give her a complimentary cupcake and card delivered to our room. That never happened. They wouldn't accept our TLA form. We've had our car in valet for 10 days and at $30 a day it's not worth it. We were told they had self parking, but when we arrived they told us, that's not available, so we were forced to valet and they don't have enough valet and they take forever. 24 minutes this morning and it wasn't busy. They also are only nice to certain people and open doors for certain people. Valet treated us like crap. The pool is tiny and in a wind vortex between several buildings on the 3rd floor where breakfast is also served. Be prepared to get rained on, hold everything down, have birds in your food and bring a sun visor while you eat.The only good things about this hotel are the breakfast staff that work their tail off and people, please put your dishes away, they aren't waiters and this isn't a restaurant so don't treat them like crap and our housekeeping lady, she was awesome sauce! If you want a hotel that really takes care of you, go to the Outrigger Reef on the Beach!! They are AWESOME!! We stayed with them for 10 days also and they were AMAZING! This place, not so much. I wouldn't stay here again if it was in the PH and free.

Great service all around. Spacious clean rooms. Delicious breakfast buffet. Room was quiet. Pets were welcomed and housekeeping were excellent. The hotel was located near the beach with stores nearby - very convenient,

We were chased off the Big Island by a tropical storm and went to Oahu on the fly. Nice stay, I would recommend this hotel. Location is great, just a block off Waikiki Beach. I appreciated the fact they stored our luggage after check out

Room was okay. Food okay. Wait on seventh floor for about 30 minutes for the elevator was inexcusable. Finally had to go up in order to go down to ground floor. Could hear elevator go past the floor several times.

Hotel is modern, clean, and well maintained. Staff was very helpful. The staff and management were able to find a left behind item. It was promptly sent back to us. Only negative is that with only 2 elevators, there can be excessive waits at certain times of day.

ive stayed here on several occasions. the rooms are spacious, beds large and comfortable, staff very friendly, business center accomodating, the lounge area spacious, drinks from the bar are great not watered down, For me the best part in the free in house breakfast......eggs fluffy, links cooked just right , oatmeal was like grandmas moist and creamy and stayed creamy, juices, coffee french toast excellent work......

Stayed here for 6 days, my family and I enjoyed our stay. The room was big and spacious, beds were comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was good. The staff went above and beyond, were friendly helpful. Convenient location, beach is short walk away. This was an excellent choice and will definitely recommend.

We had stayed at this hotel for our family vacation for a week and appreciated the cleanliness of our rooms due to the attention to detail from our house keeper Ina Pagtulingan. The rooms and beds we're beyond exceptional and so were the staff at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Much gratitude from the Gacusana family room 407 & 641.

Stayed here on a layover to Honolulu and found that they hotel was very comfortable and in a convenient location with walking distance to most attractions. Room was clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. Recommended.

Often you find the hotels around Hawaii to be dated and out of touch, not here at the Hyatt place though. This hotel is super modern and set in a great location. It offers a gym, pool, shops and more importantly 2 minute walk to the beach. The pool is small but when there is a beautiful beach so close who needs a pool. The rooms are very clean and functional with big screen tv and amazing aircon. Only down fall of this hotel is the street noise on lower levels which are unavoidable in Waikiki really. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a fuss free stay.

This Hyatt Place Hotel was very clean and well kept . The entire staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Hats off to Annabelle and Lynn for making us feel at home,always busy, but always took time to say Aloha and answer any questions we had. The hotel served a nice variety of food and drinks for breakfast, which was complimentary with our stay. Not only was the beautiful beach just a short walk away, there were also shops to browse along the way. If you are considering a vacation to Waikiki Beach, staying at this Hyatt Place Hotel would be an excellent choice.

Please keep doing the wonderful job you are doing. I want to send a special thank you to Lei, Bernard, Julie and Ihad. These employees have exceed their expectation in customer service. Because of that you will see me again and again. Also I'm sending a lot of referral on your way. Julie.

Good hotel for price and great location to the strip...friendly and accommodating staff. Would stay here again. I only stayed for one night, but would stay here multiple days if needed. Good breakfast as well..

Everything is very nice with the exception of the food. No restaurant and the breakfast buffet is below average. If you do not care about the food I would rate it 4 stars. The hotel staff is great and they have excellent valet parking. It is 30.00 a day but for Hawaii that is good. Hotel rates are very good for the area.
user_name:
Eleanor N
San Diego, United States

review_body: When searching for a hotel that could accommodate the sleeping arrangements for my family - Hyatt Place Waikiki was the only hotel that had the right bed configuration for us. Such a lovely hotel offering a big spacious room and the best buffet style breakfast included in the room rate. It was perfectly located for us and our needs. eg: moped hiring, organised tour pick-up and drop-offs, car hire and snorkel gear hiring facilities within walking distance, as well as Waikiki beach front, shops and restaurants all on your doorstep.

I have never experienced such a wonderful atmosphere at a busy hotel. Everyone seemed so happy to be there and welcome me to their ohana. The bar at 24/7 was a major asset as my schedule kept me in and out at odd times and I could always get a nice meal at reasonable prices.

Comfortable room and bed in a great location for the money. Pet friendly. Nice hotel staff - friendly and helpful. Breakfast, fitness center, and laundry were solid. Pool was small and shaded. Lobby food and drink was minimal. Hotel was packed so the wait for elevators was frustrating. Minor maintenance issues in the room.

While this hotel has the Hyatt brand name, the quality of the hotel and service is far below what one expects from Hyatt. There is no separate service elevator, so guests have to wait upward to 15 minutes for an elevator. It's understaffed so there's usually a long line to wait for someone at the counter for help (including order food from the bar). Luggage would get stored randomly around the lobby while waiting for them to be put away. The lobby (open area with no A/C) is tiny and the only seating area when it's under the afternoon sun can get incredibly hot. The swimming pool is smaller than most backyard pools. The driveway to check in is so congested that I'm surprised I didn't see an accident. On the plus side the breakfast is nicely done with good selection. The staff is courteous when you finally get to your turn.

For being my very first time in Hawaii this hotel was sure to impress me. The check in process was smooth, the bar was never crowded,peaceful hotel,clean pool,clean rooms,well kept,friendly staff,good breakfast. Enjoyed our stay.
user_name:
Lecia R
Inglewood, California, United States

review_body: For the money difference you can't beat this hotel. The breakfast is changed enough you don't get sick of the rotation. We stayed 7 days and could have easily stayed more. Clean and friendly. The maps don't do it justice, it is actually much closer to the beach than it looks and closer to the shopping strip. I priced out many hotels for our trip and I am very happy with this choice There are a couple food trucks in the side street that are well worth a visit also. Tasty and cheaper

I travel on business to Waikiki quite often. This was my first time staying at this property. They upgraded me to a nicer room without asking, which was a great welcome gift. The hotel is located on the west end of Waikiki, about a block or so from the Honolulu zoo. There are plenty of restaurants and eateries around there. The staff was great -- very attentive and helpful. From the front desk, to the valet, to the housekeeping staff they were all first class. The room was very clean. I never had to call the front desk because the housekeeper forgot to replenish towels. I use the ice bucket, and she was nice enough to clean and dry it daily and provide a new liner. The complimentary breakfast is a full-up breakfast buffet. Hot breakfast sandwiches, oatmeal, eggs, juices, yogurts, fruits -- as well as some Asian congee (rice porridge), diced tofu, and kimchee -- were readily available. Hot coffee and tea as well. While the food is under cover, the eating area is poolside with umbrellas, so maybe there are some issues during a rainy season. The hotel has a decent gym with a number of aerobic machines (treadmills, bikes, etc.) as well as some benches and a full set of dumbbells. I would have rated this 5 stars, but there were two reasons that kept me from doing that. Reason Number One: The elevator. There are two elevators for each of the two towers. The hotel is 19 stories high (I was on the 17th floor), so you're waiting, and waiting, and waiting. On the plus side, the hotel realizes this and publishes a notice of peak elevator times so you can plan accordingly. I noticed that the staff has to use the same elevators, so there probably is no staff elevator to move large carts and the like. Reason Number Two: On-site parking. It's limited. When I couldn't get in the first day, the very polite valet directed me to a garage across the street at the Banyan Tree Resort. That worked out okay, but they only take cash and it is day-by-day. This is the first hotel of many in Waikiki that I experienced this, so I mention it as significant. Having said that, the Banyan Tree parking was fine. Monitored by security and safe. So if you know this going in, it is not such a big deal. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at Hyatt Place in Waikiki and it is on my list of solid properties when I need to travel there again. If you are headed to Waikiki, with the exception of waiting for the elevator, you will be very happy you stayed there.

I had a most enjoyable stay. The staff was excellent and courteous. The rooms were clean. A bit small but more than adequate. The bed comfortable. I enjoyed being on the East side of Waikiki. It was a less crowded yet with adequate dinning and other facilities near by. Exit and entry to the hotel with respect to traffic was very easy. The room rate was withing Government Per Diem. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Francis J K
Washington DC, United States

review_body: Lot cheaper than the five star hotels, well located being one block from the beach. Has all the basic features and good free wifi speed. Friendly enough staff.Only criticism would hAve to be the softness of the beds but I guess that's a subjective thing

I stayed here 4 nights while doing business in Honolulu. The location was good (far end of Waikiki near zoo) within easy walking distance of beach and business, including a Starbucks a few steps away (one my my must-haves). There's a scooter renta place at the corner and many places to eat and shop nearby.I was able to use the free annual night that comes with my Hyatt credit card and was given a "senior" rate. Part of the deal was my willingness to accept a "handicapped accessible" room on the 5th floor. The room was fine and the walk in shower and extra large bathroom areas were an added benefit from my perspective. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the furnishing were all in good order (including corner couch).I did not avail myself of the free breakfasts as I was out very early each day. Don't come here for the (small) pool and also be prepared for a potential group influx. For two of the days I was there a large group of rowdy adolescents from Australia and New Zealand interested water sports adventures clogged the lobby areas (sometimes lounging on the floors). The hotel staff showed no initiative in asking the teens to unclutter walk-through areas or behave in a less rowdy manner. Fortunately, there were gone by the 2nd day of my stay and the nois did not go upstairs to the sleeping rooms.That said, the staff members were friendly and helpful, the free WIFI worked well. The housekeeping was well done and efficient.One fun feature on this trip: Hawaii 50 was shooting an episode across the street one night.I'd probably use them again.

Breakfast was great. Best of Hyatt Places I have stayed at. Service from staff was good as well. In some cases staff had to do things outside of their station because of the crowd. Location is near Waikiki Beach at end of the strip so it was less busy.

I have been staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki annually since 2012, and over that time I have noted the service and standard slipping, particularly over the last two years, the reduction of staff is leaving huge holes in service and cleanliness.
