I said after my last visit it would be my last but I did stay again for 3 nights checking in on 29 June 2016, I was in room 608 and noted the following: • The bathroom light globe was blow when I arrived (this was replaced the following day) • The lighting in the room is very dim, cheap wattage globes, making the safe almost impossible to use in daylight with all lights turned on you can’t see the buttons. • The balcony was unusable with the bird droppings; the balcony was not cleaned during my stay. • The shower has serious problems, the water pressure was to say the least very poor and the floor waste did not drain the water, I find this to be extremely unhygienic. The hotel was near full capacity one night, and very busy but the service in the bar area was almost non-existent one night, the staff were busy checking people in, preparing food, people including myself got up and walked out. The hotel has some magnificent staff on the ground, many have been there as long as I have been staying there, but in the last 2 years something has gone wrong. This last trip I stayed a further 4 days around the corner a Park Shore Waikiki, the service was impeccable, the rooms a tad smaller but first class in comfort and cleanliness. Maybe it is time your current management take a look around at other properties in Waikiki, and get tips on how to bring the Hyatt Place back to life.

Just the way I stated, the room were good, clean and simple. No frills type of property and the lines were very clean and modern. Break is included which is a plus! I would come back again as the bang was worth the buck. Nice location at the end of Waikiki, not really central, but you can walk everywhere.
user_name:
Danielle Theres... G
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Nothing less then wonderful. Great place for the money I spend to stay here. I will definitely tell all my family and friends about this wonderful place if they're ever coming to Oahu. Very clean, close to a beautiful beach, lots of places to eat and chose from. Overall had a great time in Oahu...Mahalo

I am a big fan of Hyatt Place brand that I always book at a Hyatt Place hotel whenever I travel to the U.S. mainland. I've stayed at Hyatt Place MD, Kansas, and OR and truly enjoyed consistent quality of service Hyatt Place is known for. Recently, I was in Hawaii for medical reasons and stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki for ten days. Valet service was fast, quick, and efficient. Although I checked-in without any delay, the front desk staff failed to explain to me how the new Hyatt electronic key system works. Just as I expected, my room was spacious, clean, and equipped with all the standard room amenities of a Hyatt Pace. Room is unusually warm, even with the AC set at 68 degrees. Housekeeping staff, Geraldine Stevenson is excellent -- she is fast, efficient, and follows the standards of cleaning. Thus, it was a problem when she was off as the other two are not as good as she was. Because of my surgery, I was cooped up in my room and had no choice but to order room service . The quality of service and food are hit and miss and portions are not standardized. Breakfast items on the 3F are good if you're only staying for 3 days, but if you're staying for 10 days -- you will be eating the same items over and over again. Worse, the cook does not know how to make a good pot of rice! The night prior to my departure and for some odd reason, two gentlemen in suits were checking into my room. Fortunately, my door was double-locked. I called the front desk and told them what was happening. They never called me back to offer any explanation.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after 2 weeks in Maui and we only selected it because we had enough loyalty points to get it for free and the photos on the website looked reasonable.....The check in process was good and the staff were very helpful and friendly but the reality is that this is a very very old building that has been given a basic renovation. The room was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed at in my life and that is a big statement as I have stayed at hundreds. You literally had to walk sideways to get around to dodge your suitcase or family members. The sofa fold out bed was so small that our 6 year old daughter could not comfortably fit on it so she stayed in our bed. Our room (on the top floor with ocean views) was so small that my wife and I (and our daughter) were actually laughing about it like crazy people. The pool area were they provide the free breakfast is old and dirty. This hotel may suit many people and under normal circumstances I would have never booked it so I don't want to get too critical as I know that not everyone can stay at 5 star hotels. If you like spacious rooms in new hotels that this place is not the place for you.

Great hotel; recently renovated, the rooms are brand-new, clean, and very comforting. The WiFi is free and fast, free skillet breakfast is tasty, and the service is friendly and timely. Would highly recommend for those wishing to stay at a clean and very nice that is in the immediate vicinity of Waikiki Beach.

I spent 22 nights in your hotel in July 2016. Every one of your staff was pleasant and thoughtful. Each definitely demonstrated the aloha spirit. I would like to make special mention of two of your staff who stood out as especially kind, friendly and helpful: #1 - Jennifer at the front desk who really made me feel welcome and special upon check in; and #2 - Leonida was part of your housekeeping staff on the 11th floor during my stay. My room was always immaculate, and when I chanced to see her in the hallway she always checked with me to make sure my room was in order and greeted me with alohas. I hope their kindness and professionalism can be recognized. Sincerely, Bryan Moyers.

The location was great - close to Waikiki beach, restaurants, The bus stop, Diamond head and the Zoo. But - in the begining there were not really clean ( hairs and parts of cuted nails of previous guests in the bathroom and in the room, used soap etc.). it was better during our stay ( without any our comments - just better staff probably). American breakfast was to sweet but the pineapples were great. Swimming pool is small and just in between the tables where the breakfast was eaten ( what was strange). But staff very friendly.

Had a great staycation at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. From check in to check out, it was a wonderful experience. Forgot my razor and texted them. they asked what color I wanted...pink or blue! Within minutes I received my razor. Great customer service!

It's a short walk from the famous Waikiki beach - lots of activity, people, restaurants and shops. Very convenient. We had a ocean view room with a small balcony - which was nice to get a feel of fresh ocean breeze and the sounds! The room was smallish but comfortable. Bathroom was tiny. The hotel itself is quite average in all aspects. Small pool, very average breakfast served on the open terrace with lots of birds. Staff very non-engaged. Some waited near bins waiting for customers to empty trays. Check in and out was quick. Front office staff was helpful. Should have paid a bit more and gone to a full service property!

The hotel was a beautiful place to stay and a short distance to shopping, restaurants, and the beach. The clean hotel also offered nice views with a beautiful pool area. The concierge from Expedia gave us great advice for our Norwegian cruise.

Hotel is great with a short walk to Waikiki Beach and the Zoo. It's at the end of Waikiki so some other favorite spots to visit may be a hike. Room was a good size for Waikiki and it was very clean except for the shower glass. Parking/Valet was horrible. Valet damaged my car and I filed a report but no response recevied even after I called and left a message. Disclaimer: Valet is NOT operated by Hyatt but is in the hotel. Furthermore, there was no convenient self parking option. either.
user_name:
Michael Z
Fort Worth, United States

review_body: Excellent location being near to the beach and shops. The room had an amazing view of the ocean and cleanliness to its best. Staff were very helpful and friendly with any issues we had. Rooms amenities are minimal but ideal for those who spend most of their time out than in. Other facilities such as gym, swimming pool and laundry were available to use with outstanding cleanliness. When visiting Waikiki, would stay again.

Would be good place to return to if not for parking. The parking was so bad it is not worth it. We parked in back, then were told Valet had to park for us (I was OK to just pay, but they said no). After driving around, all the Valet had gone on break and we had to wait 10 minutes for them to return. A pointless inconvenience.
user_name:
Erik P
Cathedral City, United States

review_body: My wife and I recently got married in Hawaii and stayed at some other more expensive hotels, but the Hyatt Place was just head and shoulders above any other in the area. They have very friendly staff, always willing to go the extra mile, even to dry clean my friends suit for the wedding when the iron he was using had some black gunk on it. The location is the BEST! Right across from Waikiki beach and walking distance to all the shopping and excellent tour packages. The breakfast isn't very good quality but good for what you pay for and there is plenty of it! We would definitely stay here again!

This is a great hotel. We stay at Hyatt Place in Honolulu all the time - great Staff, excellent rooms and nice breakfast. Location is perfect - close to new International Marketplace, beaches and all Waikiki Attractions.

After a lot of research on a place to stay in Waikiki, we stayed at the Hyatt Place Beach. The value of the over sized rooms, no resort fee and breakfast included was outstanding. Located 1 block from the beach, made going to the beach easy. The staff was outstanding. This Hyatt smaller size gives you a personal experience then the larger hotels and resorts but has everything you need with in walking distance to restaurant and shopping.

This is a fantastic hotel. We stayed there for 7 nights and the staff was friendly and helpful no matter what time of day it was. We will definitely stay there again. The location is great as well because it is within walking distance to the beach and one of our favorite hangouts...LuLu's. Do not hesitate to stay here.

We recently spent two weeks at this very nice hotel. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, the food was good so it was just a very pleasant stay. The only issue we had was with the valet service which I understand is a separate company. One morning after the valet brought the car around we noticed a HUGE scrape on the bumper of the rental car. We brought it to their attention and they admitted it was their fault. We had a police report filed and they promised to take care of the problem (filing insurance) but we had to keep calling them over and over to get anything done. We finally contacted our travel agent and he called the manager who assured us the problem would be taken care of. Well needless to say two weeks later after we were back home we got a notice in the mail from the rental car company. More phone calls!! Hopefully the problem will be handled now but who knows. Wanted to mention also that we used the concierge service and they set us up with some spectacular tours/activities to do. I know it's more expensive but we had the best time and they handle everything.

The hotel was a very nice place to go to sleep after a 20hr trip they were very accepting of the fact i got there at 1am in the morning the bed was very nice and comfortable. The room it self was clean and homie. Overall the hyatt place was a very nice place to stay. Basic but good breakfast included

I had a 24 layover on a business trip and chose Hyatt Place as one of the few places with a government rate available. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was pleasant. I liked the location near the beach. I just wish they delivered room service (you can only pick up food from lobby).
user_name:
laureno650
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The inclusive breakfast was great, nice clean room, and hospitable staff. Highly recommend and would definitely return. The staff helped by providing good information, such as restuarants nearby, transportation to get around.

free breakfast was excellent.. staff was great and very friendly. . walk down to the beach.. our whole family stayed in the room with 2 queens.. great place to stay.. parking sucks.. but that was expected... I would recommend this hotel!

Location was perfect, close to the beach, restaurants, and other attractions. No resort fee. Recognized Hyatt Gold Passport members. Staff are friendly and provide good service. Towels for the beach and good spread buffet breakfast although variety could be improved. Provides personal amenities if you forget to pack them. Shower water pressure could be improved.
user_name:
fellow_traveler2
New York City, New York

review_body: We weren't too sure what to expect but from arrival to departure 17 days later, the hotel ticked the box for all our needs. We were in a ,mountain view deluxe room' and the room was large, clean and everything worked as expected.The daily breakfasts while 'relatively' basic, were quite adequate with the highlight being the fresh cut pineapple in copious quantities. We took a bowl each of pineapple back to put in the room fridge for snacks during the day.The pool is a basic affair without too many bells and whistles, but is clean and supplied with copious clean towels. It's fine for doing laps and whatever it was like its never going to compare with Waikiki beach 200 meters down the road.The king size bed was comfortable and the room makeup each day was meticulous.A really nice place to stay.

We had a very enjoyable stay at the Hyatt place. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by many nice employees and a very nice lady on the front desk. We immediately received an upgrade also to a superior King room which was nice.Our room was quite large and included a couch, although it did seem a little empty with a lot of wasted space. It was very clean and quite modern. Seemed more 4 star than 3. Breakfast each morning was different, at least the hot food selection was. You would not leave there hungry. There are many places to sit and eat although later in the morning bigger groups may find it difficult to get a table. I personally had no trouble finding a table for two at any time of the morning. The other amenities at the hotel were also quite good, although the pool was small and always filled with kids so never used it. The bar was pretty good and had some good happy hour prices. Wifi was great too and good selection of tv channels. We used the washer and dryer also. $6 for a total cycle and the ability to pay by card so don't need a bag full of quarters. The worst thing about this place was the lifts. They were so slow. If you're not up high I'd suggest taking the stairs. Only bad thing I could think of. I'd recommend this place if you want a laid back hotel. Only 1 block from the beach and the main bus stop is literally right across the road from the hotel. Oh and no ridiculous resort fees or hidden taxes. 5 stars for my whole experience here. Highly recommend.

Pros: Quick walk to beach, gorgeous city-mountain-ocean panoramic views, clean rooms and public spaces, comfy beds, nice staff, good breakfastCons: super long elevator wait timesSuch a comfortable experience overall. Every staff member I encountered during my week-long stay was very friendly. I love that the entrance to the hotel is wide open, but it's secure since you need to use your room key to get to any of the guest floors. The poolside complimentary breakfast was great and even when a downpour occurred one day, someone was out quickly to wipe down tables and chairs as soon as it stopped.We were lucky to be placed on the PH level (really just the 20th floor) so we had an amazing view. While the view was great, that meant extra time in the elevators. There are two elevators for the 20-floor tower right by the front desk, which staff also shares (think - housekeeping cart takes up at least 1/2 the elevator). They are very slow, make many stops, and are often very crowded. Heading up and down, there were several instances where no one else could get on as it was already uncomfortably full. Plan ahead for a long elevator wait/ride if you're trying to get somewhere on time. Seriously. I still give the hotel an excellent rating as this certainly did not ruin my trip, but I think if enough people complain about this, they may consider adding another much needed shaft (if the space even permits?)

the hotel has a very good breakfast that's free. It is very close to the beach. Great shopping within walking distance and near the zoo. the staff is very helpful with setting up activities. can't wait to come back soon!!!

Hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly. At night they only had one person manning both the bar and the check in desk so that wasn't great if you needed help but otherwise good experience. Only bad thing is the water pressure in the room is not that great.

Is the Hyatt Place Waikiki a secret discovery?? I don't know, but it's a really pleasant surprise for a great stay to be sure. There is no detail about the hotel that isn't clean and practically perfect. My bed was lush, comfortable and immaculate - the bathroom was spotless. (I honestly thought to myself, there isn't a single thing out of place or wrong with this room). I loved it. And the complimentary breakfast has everything you'd expect, PLUS real eggs, sausage, 'McMuffin' type sandwiches, and fresh pineapple, honeydew melon and cantaloupe! The best 'included' breakfast I've had. I'm looking forward to staying here again!

Great customer service. Great location (3 minute walk to the beach, 10 minute walk to major shopping and plenty of affordable fast food restaurants within walking distance). Rooms are very clean. Nice family atmosphere.
user_name:
Shirley K
Las Vegas, United States

review_body: Travelling solo this hotel was perfect for me. It is more of a business traveller hotel but there are plenty of tourists there as well. There is no"resort fee" that most other hotels charge which usually covers things you don't want. This hotel had the things that were important to me such as free Wi-Fi throughout, an in room safe big enough for a laptop, a really good breakfast, 24 hour "gallery" for drinks, light meals and snacks, beach towels were provided and free use of computers and printing facilities. The location is good. It's a little way back from the beach but a very short walk away. It is at the end of the main beach walk but still central to everything. Very close to The Bus stops. The Bus system is excellent. Cheap and easy to use. I had a mountain view room. All views are a bit obstructed by the other tall buildings around but I think that's same for any of the hotels. My view was OK. I didn't go there to spend a lot of time in my room looking at it! The bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was really quiet. I had no trouble sleeping. I had a couple of problems in my room, one of which was my fault relating to the safe!) and both were dealt with immediately. The staff are all really friendly and efficient. I was made to feel like an old friend. In particular, Angeline was very nice and helpful. The gold star goes to Nick, Gallery host/bartender extrodinaire! He mixes a mean cocktail, cooks great food and works very hard to make sure everyone is happy. Nothing is too much trouble for him! I will definitely stay here again.

We booked this hotel for 2 nights prior to our NCL Pride of America cruise. It was a great choice. The room was a beach view. While our definition of 'beach view' is different, we could see the water from our room. However, the beach is a very quick 5 minute walk to the water. It is very convenient to great restaurants and shopping. An ABC store (glorified convenience store) is right next door. ABC is a very reasonable place to purchase drinks, etc. The FREE breakfast was just fine. The choices were plentiful and varied. If you want gourmet, to find a restaurant. This hotel was perfect for our 2 night stay.

Really enjoyed staying at this hotel, found it to be very homely and comfortable. Breakfast is included which seemed not to be in other hotels in the area. Staff were wonderful, nothing was to much trouble and you were always greeted with a warm smile and a friendly word. The room had views of the ocean and was very comfortable. We would definately stay here again.

Used this for a layover before going to our hotel. Mistake as the housekeeping leaves much to be desired. Shower door which was glass stained and dirty, shower head had little water coming out. Complaint to front desk resulted in being informed that it was lime deposit on the glass and soap residue on the shower head. asked for GM and one of the managers had shower head replaced and had housekeeping clean the shower door glass. Amazing how glass became and shower head worked in this renovated Hyatt Hotel. Hyatt seems to have little or no concern for guests.

- Large comfortable room , strange layout - basic breakfast, skillets are made every other day it seems, unlike at other Hyatt Places- inadequate elevators, long waits- run down corridors- dirty and chipped tub- Staff is very friendly and professional- $30 valet parking with 2 people manning it, be prepared for a wait in the morning rush hours- Hyatt can do better

Recently stayed at hyatt place waikiki for 7 nights and really enjoyed it. Our room was small but adequate (after all, you don't really spend much time in the room anyway), most importantly it was clean. The buffet breakfast was nice, it does get busy, but we were always able to find a table for 2. We stayed on the "diamond head" side on level 7 and didnt have any issues with waiting for elevators.

Great stay at the Hyatt Place, about 7 blocks from Waikiki beach. The free breakfast was really good. The staff was very accommodating and the room they gave us was very spacious, with a nice patio deck overlooking the mountains. We were pleased with the location and the condition of the hotel!

Arrived early on a Sunday morning and although we did not expect to get into a room Dino found us a clean vacant room which was a big bonus after an overnight flight with no sleep. We found the hotel to be clean and well maintained and although only basic we made good use of the fitness centre and pool. The hotel was very conveniently located just a block back from the beach and also right on a bus stop and convenience store. All of the staff we dealt with were friendly and professional and we would happily stay here again.

We had an unfortunate stay at the Hyatt Place: the A/C did not work upon entering the room. Maintenance came down and told us to leave the fan set on high, which was quite noisy. I would have liked them to proactively offer a different room, which I heard a manager doing for other guests at the check-in desk.The valet situation was quite amusing, when not frustrating. Buses, limos, and cars lined the street and valet area making drop-offs and pick-ups slow. Unlike most hotels, there is no valet number to call for your car. The ticket tells you to use an app to request your car. The app doesn't work (and the valets acknowledged it hasn't for a while).On the positive side, the in-room internet was fast and free. Also, breakfast was bustling and servers were hustling to keep the food stations re-stocked. I appreciated their efforts.If the A/C worked and the valet were easier to use, I would consider this a good value for a hotel blocks from Waikiki beach. As it is, this hotel is best for heavy sleepers and patient travelers.

Location, Customer Service, Presentation and Cleanliness of our Hotel exceptional. We arrived earlier than our check in time and were looked after as soon as possible, staff always accommodated any request with assistance and were always courteous and sincere. Our room was in good order very similar to photos on web page which is always of concern when booking online. Thank you to all staff at Hyatt Place for helping to make our holiday in Waikiki a memorable one

The hotel was very accommodating. We arrived at the hotel early because of the time our plane arrived and the front desk allowed us to check in to our room before 3. They were also wonderful about cleaning our room each day around our schedule. The hotel is also in a great location- only a couple of blocks from the beach.

The Hyatt Place was a wonderful home base for our high school band during our recent trip to Hawaii. The location was within walking distance to everything we needed and the accommodations were comfortable and relaxing.

Hyatt Place hotel offers perfectly nice services, like cleaning, breakfast. What i like the most about the hotel is that the staffs are very kind to customers. I've never seen something improper in their service. If i have a chance to come to Waikiki beach, absolutely i would stay at Hyatt Place.

We spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach and the hotel was in good shape with very helpful service. Our rooms were big and well maintained. The complementary breakfast was good. We didn't eat at the hotel. It was centrally located in Waikiki Beach. Excellent shopping within 4 blocks. The beach was a block away. Walking distance to many activities and several restaurants. I would recommend this hotel. The fitness center was a little small but there were still enough equipment to get a workout.

Highly recommend the Hyatt. Friendly staff, everyone was always extremely pleasant. Great location: walking distance to the beach and restaurants. I'm health conscious so breakfast was awesome and made time workout since the gym is open 24 hrs. No regrets.

i would definitely recommend, and the lady at the tour desk was amazing as well as the rest of the staff! hotel was clean and close to the beach and buses and central of Waikiki but on the quieter side which was great, do get a higher floor if you can

This is the best place you can stay. The staff are sooo nice here. It was so clean, modern, with an open concept. Breakfast comes with your stay and it was just perfect. Something for everyone. If you get a chance, stop by And have a Mai Tai with Nick And Tony(his real name is in samoan so we called him Tony), The bartenders have all the inside info on were to eat at little local restaurants. Ask for Josephine as your Housekeeper. She was soooo Sweet. She knew what you needed extra and you never had to ask.

The only downfall is that they dont allow the air conditioning to go below 68, which is fine for most people, but I sleep hot so I need it at 67 and so I woke up sweating several times. Everything else is nice. Staff is wonderful. Breakfast is delicious (and free!). Wifi is included. The room is a little small so we didnt set up my son's pack n play for him to sleep in or there would be no walking space but we didnt care because we had a king bed so he slept with us. Just letting others know who get a 1 bed king bedroom.

Very impressive - from check-in, throughout the stay, to check-out! Most helpful Front Desk staff and management - Christopher, Lei, Lynne, Dino - simply wonderful and very thorough! Additionally, housekeeping and the breakfast staff were excellent as well, all very much on point! Kudos and thank you to both excellent staff and management!
user_name:
Alisa D
State: AZ, United States

review_body: We have had wonderful days at Hyatt Place. At first we where a bit wondered about space in the room, 3p in that space for 6nights. But that was no problem at all. Wonderful sitting outside having tasty breakfast is very nice for us from Sweden.The hotel is close to beach and a lot of different restaurants. Best of all the food truck just outside hotel Special thanks for really good service to Dino at front desk and to Nick at the bar for chat and ideas what to do on our next stop. Not to forget the sweet cleaning lady on 11th floor.Mahalo, we will return ☀️

This hotel is built way too big for the number of people it can handle We arrived at about 3:00 on a weekday afternoon, and could not even enter the entrance driveway. If there's a large SUV parked at the entrance, no one else can get in. I kept circling around the building and couldn't get in, so I dropped off my wife and kids on the street and parked at the zoo and walked over to check in. The line to check in was so long that I understood why the driveway was backed up. Even the hotel parking garage was full, so I had to shuttle my car around parking spots and feed the meters until 6pm. We waited forever for elevators, and there were so many people in the swimming pool that evening that we went back to the room, put on our clothes, and just left for dinner. We were very apprehensive about a free breakfast being offered at a hotel like this, but were pleasantly surprised that the crowds were handled well. I'm not sure what to say to fix the traffic problem in this hotel, except to fir the architect that designed it. Maybe it would help to not rent out the top five floors of the hotel so that the elevators work right, the front desk and the lobby can handle check-ins at peak times, and the parking garage has enough spaces for all guests to park.

The room was very spacious and clean! Free Breakfast was tasty andgreat, hotel location was perfect and the staff were superb. Extra Thanks to Christopher and Justin and Lay for making us feel at home with the parking, dining and best beach spot recommendations it really helped in making our trip greater than it already was. We look forward to returning here and highly recommend this hotel. Thank You Hyatt place.

I have to give this hotel 5 stars all around! The staff was very courteous. Hotel was in a great location. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious each morning. I would definitely stay here again.

The included breakfast is excellent with lots of options from hot food to cold and the lanai has partial view of the ocean. We enjoyed the 2 queen beds with fold out sofa bed. Parking was $25-30 daily rate so it can get expensive so we used enterprise car share option at Waikiki sunset nearby ( 0.1 mile) was our alternative since zipcar was sold out that memorial day weekend. Zoo public parking is also an option for car rentals about $1/hour. I took the lyft as well going to tea 1024 in china town to meet up with my lady friend for afternoon tea. It is close to ABC store if you forget anything such as incidentals and walking distance to the beach. The pool was small but enough for getting a quick swim. My brother took the airport shuttle to the airport for $29 plus tip which the concierge can set up for him.

We booked this place mainly because of it's affordability (no resort fees or Wi Fi surcharge!!) and good Trip Advisor reviews, and were pleasantly surprised when we saw that our room was neat and tidy and breakfast buffet was diverse and tasty (breakfast included). Our room had a good view out into open space, was very close to Waikiki beach and zoo (free parking close to the zoo), walking distance to Diamond Head reserve, close to all the major bus/trolley lines and only a 10 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki. It was far enough to escape the noise and the hype, but close enough for an evening walk, dining and entertainment. Staff were friendly and helpful, always approachable and willing to answer any questions we had. The bed was very comfortable.The location meant that we did not have to rent a car to go to Hanauma Bay (only a few bus stops away), Ala Moana shopping centre (around 25 - 30 minutes ride), and many other tourist attractions.

The Hyatt Place hotel was a nice place to stay based on its location and price. The hotel was only about 2.5 blocks from the beach and the overall look of the hotel and the rooms was very nice. The staff were extremely friendly.
user_name:
Paul S
Charlotte, NC, United States

review_body: All the staff were very courteous and helpful. The room was large and clean, and the bathroom was very nice. At checkout we wanted to leave our luggage for the day and a bag of fruit and milk; the front desk person suggested she put the fruit and milk in the refrigerator and gave us a second tag for it!

Exceptional service, hotel ambience and cleanliness was the best....this is definitely a must stay hotel...you will not be disappointed. I travel a lot and this hotel gives you a sense of home and not a feeling of getting lost in a huge hotel. You really must experience this Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach....Just a short walk to the beach and shopping all over.

We utilised Hyatt Place as a sleepover venue when heading back to Australia from the American west coast. We found the location exceptional, the staff really friendly, and the room and breakfast very good. We would happily recommend this hotel too all.

this hotel is lovely and room was nice and clean. bed was soo comfortable. Breakfast was provided which was a bonus.. the only problem was there was always such a long wait for the lift. great location and lots of great places to eat close by. beach is only a block away.

best time ever Waikiki Beach was soooo nice will go back went for work conference but it was the best time ever room was very nice and if you needed anything they will bring it to you. water was nice and clear

Hotel located a block from beach. Valet parking. Very affordable. Our room very clean and tidy Housekeeping was there everyday on time. Very friendly staff. a block away from the Zoo. Walking distance to all the shops and stores and Beaches. Highly Recommended....

We upgraded our room at check in and loved the extra space, sofa area, laini overlooking the zoo and Diamond Head. Lovely pool, very good breakfast on the pool deck outside, lovely. Comfortable in everyway, we quite loved our stay!Also they let us check in at 10:00 am with no additional charge, super service!

On a recent trip to Honolulu, we spent 3 days at the Hyatt Place near Waikiki Beach.. The property is only a few years old, and done very well... The location is perfect for taking in all that Honolulu has to offer, just a block from the beach... The staff were friendly and professional, and addressed any questions or concerns we may have had... Our room was QUITE SPACIOUS on the 15th floor with a balcony, beautiful view of Diamond Head and the city..The decor was modern, clean, comfortable.. offered us everything we needed.. Ample closet space, separate vanity area from the main bathroom.. The beds were very comfortable, especially after a day of excursions.. Our rate included the breakfast which was served on a terrace off the 3 rd floor... It was the usual bill of fare, lots of people and BIRDS wanting to share..The only downside, which the night manager was very proactive about, was the contracted valet service.. If you return after dinner and an evening out, valet parking could be an issue...The space in front of the hotel fills quickly, and hopefully there will be several valets available, or you may have a long wait... Hopefully the hotel has taken steps to staff up for prime hours in the afternoon/ evening.. There is self parking available in a parking garage nearby...

Very good hotel and breakfast is plentiful ! (I wish they had blueberries to put on a cottage cheese) Location almost on Waikiki Beach really walking distance of 3 minutes, Buses next door very calm hotel Definitely I'll be back, happy with the service

The view in the room was not so impressive. It was supposed to be city view, but we only saw the back of the poor apartment buildings with the laundries hanging outside. A good thing was we were so busy with sightseeing, so we didn't have time to stay in the room and open the curtains.
user_name:
Jessica C L
Hoffman Estates, United States

review_body: Check in was a breeze, status recognized. Professional, friendly front desk eager to please. Asked for a quiet room & was put on the PH top floor. Spacious 2 bed room, cold a/c, comfortable bed, fluffy pillows, large bathroom. All amenities, fridge, coffeemaker, blow dryer, safe, large flat screen tv. Sitting area with couch & tables. Free Wi-Fi worked great. Asked for a electric fan which was brought up within 5 minutes. Slept like a baby. Elevators were fast. Floor security option a plus. I enjoyed the comp breakfast with many options. Pool was relaxing. Easy walk to the beach & ABC store close by, Plus was a food truck that set up next to hotel @ lunch was affordable & good. Hop on & off trolley picked up/drop off close by. Staff helpful with printing boarding pass & holding luggage until ride to airport arrived. Late check out granted. Only downside was hotel next door had a jumper 2 hours after I arrived put a damper on my stay. Aside from that I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Would stay again & recommend.

Great well priced hotel in Waikiki. Great location closer to the quieter (and nicer) end of the beach yet still close to everything as only a block away to the beach. Initially I was hesitant to book a hotel not on the beach but was happy I didn't after staying in the Hyatt as the beach hotels are noisy and not at all private from what we observed. As for the much discussed breakfast for a free breakfast it's great. Not your 'all you can eat' high end hotel breakfast buffet wit everything but for the price of the room it's a great inclusion and caters to all. Only negative to staying at this hotel was our room seemed to be a wind tunnel from the air conditioning, annoying but easily fixed with a towel. Didn't bother to bring this up with reception as we liked the room however I'm sure they would have moved us should we have asked.Would definitely recommend this hotel to others. I've stayed at many Park Hyatt's before and for the price the Hyatt Place is amazing value and a comfortable stay.

I was quite disappointed in our hotel stay our first room had a bad smell to it. I complained the first night and was told they could use ozone to rid the smell the next day. After being out all day we arrived back to check that the Ozone was out of the room and they sent housekeeping to check. The guy they sent wasn't sure if it had even been put in (although reception say it was) he said that the room still smelt really bad was happy to know it wasn't just in our imaginations. The hotel was booked out that night and it was late so we said we would put up with it for the night and they organised to have us moved the next day. All was good or so we thought our next room was so noisy right next to a cleaning cupboard and the elevators. We could continuously hear the bell of the elevator all night long and the banging of the cleaning cupboard door from the early morning.

It was our first time to Waikiki or Hawaii for that matter. We checked in early and was assisted by Heidi who was welcoming and helped put us at ease after feeling tired. We did not expect to to check in as we were early, but Heidi stepped up and helped us out and helped us get into a great room that we wanted. Valet parking gets crazy, but the valet attendants were always courteous despite being overwhelmed, we only have praise for them. Breakfast has great selection, but suggest that more variety, currently the menu cycles back every 2 days, it would be great if it cycles every 4 days. Room was spacious and clean and housekeeping did a great job. We were very happy with our choice of going with Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach rather Aston. We would stay with your Hotel again when we visit again. Thanks for a great stay.
user_name:
Gerard Luis Zos... L
Newark, California, United States

review_body: The staff are so friendly and can't do enough for you. A few people been moaning about the lifts but we have had no problems, you wait a minute the lift comes. The hotel is very clean and always kept clean. The hotel is in a great location by the beach. We were on the 10th floor and the noise level outside was OK not a problem. Everything was great about the hotel except for a few things.1. Breakfast was below average sorry to say there's so much you can do.2. At the bar there's no staff. I ordered some food and the bar staff is also the cook, so when he/she is cooking no bar staff.3. The food menu is below average you have a busy hotel but everyone seems to be going out for a meal, keep them in, don't serve fries and asked for a pizza and no dough.4. My wife is a vegetarian all the places we go to from Europe, New York, Chicago, LA, Las Vegas, Texas everyone does vegetarian burger. We had to go out almost every night and then we stay there and have drinks.5. Your bar menu for drinks is bad get some cocktails on there not just 2/3 it's your hotel the menus are free advertising.I have another few days here and I hope things get better as this is a good hotel with some great potential.

I ended up staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel for a few days because my regular spot (Hyatt Regency) was completely booked. I was actually pleasantly surprised. The rooms were nice, clean, and quiet. The complimentary breakfast was served on the rooftop and seemed standard with the exception of the delicious pineapple that you can only get in Hawaii. The pool is very tiny and not that appealing BUT the beach was beautiful and only a block away.

Great location, staff is attentive, central to Waikiki Beach, and restaurants!! Nearby you will find, Hy's restaurant, Tikis, Sky Waikiki for cocktails, and other eating spots that locals enjoy. Beds were comfortable and love the living room area and color scheme. Can't wait to return!!

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for 6 nights during our recent Hawaii vacation. Location was good, only couple blocks from Waikiki beach, a very short walk. The room was spacious and clean. The lobby was casual and nice. The pool and elevators need improvement. The staff at front desk was wonderful, they were friendly, personable and provided excellent services.

Warm & Friendly atmosphere , Terrific staff & well within walking distance of everything without being in the central mayhem of the centre of town.would definitely stay there again.(Only downside would be the pool , very shallow & small but beach only one block away)

Driveway to hotel not convenient; no self parking; no special accommodations for children; not enough elevators for number of guests - waited extremely long time for elevators; breakfast outside is very windy and pigeons everywhere.
user_name:
Genevieve L B
Westwood, United States

review_body: Very nice place to stay and very close to Diamond Head. Many restaraunts close by and the beach walking distance from the hotel. The staff was very professional and helpful with anything. The morning breakfast had many choices and was a great way to start off the day. Room service was prompt and professional.
user_name:
Karen B
el cajon, United States

review_body: We spent 2 nights here at the end of our honeymoon. We got room 1001 which had a nice sized balcony. Although we did not have a direct view of the ocean in the room as soon as we went on the balcony we had some good views. The property is not right on the beach which was fine as we got this at other places we stayed with nicer beaches. The hotel was perfect for exploring waikiki and was at a quieter end of the town. The room was quite a bit smaller than other places we had stayed but I think that was partly the fact there was a lot of furniture crammed in and we didn't mind for 2 nights. Staff helped receive mail for me and also helped when we couldnt get in touch with our shuttle company. Breakfast was ok and there was something different each morning.

Stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon. Great for a part of vacation if you don't need to be beachside and you have non-Waikiki things to do during the day (e.g. North Shore, hiking, etc.). A block away from restaurants, bars, and the beach. But definitely not a "beach side property." Rooms were a bit smaller than most Hyatt Places. The balcony was well sized. Breakfast is free and decent-good like most Hyatt Places.

I always stay at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. Great location and great people. The staff goes the extra mile. Lei at the front desk took the extra time to set me up with an excellent room. Looking forward to going back.
user_name:
Todd O
Park City, UT, United States

review_body: I get to Honolulu every year or so on business. I've seen a trend of big-chain, lower-level properties taking over older properties in Waikiki and making them their own. Since they are not "new" builds, you are dealing with the various idiosyncrasies of the older buildings.Hyatt acquired the Ocean Resort Hotel at the east end of Waikiki and converted it into a Hyatt Place. I can always use Hyatt points and the Hyatt Regency was priced way beyond my pay grade. So, Hyatt Place it is. Approaching the property by car is a bit tricky. The vehicle entrance is off of one-way Paoakalani Ave. Don't drive on Kuhio to get to it; use Kalakaua Ave, make a left on Paoakalani and the Hyatt is in the last block on the right. The driveway exits onto Kuhio. It is a short narrow driveway that can be crowded with taxis, valet vehicles and service vehicles. The valet staff does an efficient job of moving cars into the driveway. Valet parking is $30 per day. There is self-serve parking at an independent garage in the next block up for a lesser daily fee.Hyatt Places are fairly minimal service operations. The "hosts" run the desk and serve food off the 24-hour menu, as well as tend bar. I received good service from them during my stay. Unlike mainland locations, this Hyatt Place also contained a concierge and tour desk, as well as a couple of well-stocked gift/curio shops. The friendly proprietors of those shops are not afraid to bargain in order to make a sale so you might not have to venture over to Duke's Lane to pick up a Hawaiian shirt or souvenir.The hotel has a modern feel in furnishings and carpeting that is found in all Hyatt Places. However, the layout of this hotel is far different than the cookie-cutter mini-suite rooms in mainland Hyatt Places.The rooms can be fairly large or really small. My 11th Floor even-numbered room was tiny, with a dinky little balcony occupied by the room's air conditioning system. It was reasonably clean, with a large shower and lots of hot water. There is a refrigerator, coffee maker and room safe. The bathroom vanity area was really small. Few hooks to hang things on, and very little space to place my toiletries on.Note that most even-numbered rooms give you a partial mountain view, and overlook busy and noisy Kuhio Ave. The noise from city buses and other traffic could be heard at the higher floors. If you're a light sleeper, consider asking for an odd-numbered room; most don't overlook any street and are a bit quieter. The odd-numbered rooms have either a full or partial ocean view (on a higher floor) or a view of the condo building next door (on a lower floor). If you want a decent view of Waikiki or Diamond Head, you might try for a room at the ends of the higher floors. My room overlooked Kuhio, an elementary school, and a number of shabby apartment buildings below me.The air conditioner in my room was controlled not by the wall-mounted thermostat, but by a hand remote unit which takes some practice to work. Compared with external wall-mounted HVAC units in most Hyatt Places, this unit was reasonably quiet but it was difficult to find a comfortable temperature.Decent-sized desk to work from, adjacent to a set of drawers holding a massive flat-screen TV. The room could have used more light. The room also could have used a decent mattress. My king bed mattress was lumpy and there were cavities at least three inches deep, which made for a less-than restful sleep. I did bring this up with management and received fair compensation. Thanks, Hyatt Place.Your room card key can be read by readers on your room door and in the elevators, where you must swipe the card key against a reader to access guest floors.As with other Hyatt Places, this one offers a free hot breakfast. My choices during my stay were scrambled eggs and sausage, a sort of open-faced breakfast muffin, cinnamon french toast or waffles. There is also fresh fruit, yogurt, hot and cold cereal, pastries and bagels, and the usual selection of specialties for the hotel's Japanese clients.The dining area is the open terrace separating the two towers of the hotel on the 3rd Floor. Breakfast can be an adventure. Doves and other birds dive-bomb diners with abandon and you are encouraged not to leave food unattended on tables. I took two plates with me, one containing breakfast and the other to cover it up while I went for coffee or other items. The terrace can be extremely breezy and not particularly warm. It can be really crowded at breakfast. Each room contains a take-out tray for carrying food back to the room.I did not use the pool or fitness center. There are several computers/work spaces in the lobby and a fairly comfortable lounge.Waikiki Beach is a two-block walk away. The hotel is one of the closer properties to the Honolulu Zoo, Kapiolani Park and Waikiki Aquarium, as well as Diamond Head. Everything else along the Waikiki Beach strip is no more than a 10-15 minute walk. The nearest stop for The Bus is across the street on Kuhio Ave.If you don't care about a view or big-hotel cachet, this Hyatt Place can be an exceptional value. But check the quality of the mattress before you accept the room...

Recently spent 8 days at this hotel and was very impressed for a mid range motel. Nice rooms,very friendly staff and good amenities. The breakfast bar was very good. Centrally located with close access to the beach and cbd.

A great choice whatever your purpose for being on Oahu. Staff is friendly, courteous and efficient in responding to requests. The hotel is bright, comfortable and clean. Breakfasts are far better than other hotels. Pricing is fair for what you receive. Rooms are small, but well thought out.
user_name:
Arlene E P
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: The staff at the Hyatt Place Waikiki was so far the best. They were the friendliest. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great location, close to the beach, restaurants and the zoo. This breakfast area is location on the 3rd floor and has many place were to be seated.

We have stayed here for a week. It is the third hotel that we stayed at.We were on the 5th floor Diamond Head wing.The traffic noise is shocking, this is the quieter wing so I hate to think what the front building was like! We were offered higher floors at a cost of US$10 extra a night. We had already paid top dollar for our room so sucked it up.Whilst queuing to check in we were all given bottles of water as there is no A/C in the foyer so it was hot.Our room was spacious with 2 queen beds. There was a chair, a 3 seater couch, coffee table, large computer desk & chair. The tv is flat screen & can easily be turned to face the lounge area or the beds.Lighting is good. There is a coffee peculator with which to boil water. My tea tasted like coffee so they happily brought us up a kettle. There is a bar fridge that is great & roomy.Breakfast has changed only a few times in the 7 days.The eggs are made with powdered egg which almost made me vomit no matter how it was served. Why they need to use powdered egg is beyond me. I have travelled a lot internationally & have NEVER come across powdered egg before & hope I never will again!They alternated with sausages & scrambled eggs to muffins with egg patties & ham.There are a couple of bread choices, spreads, cereals, yoghurt & fruit which was always pineapple with some melon. There is milk, OJ, tomato & apple juice plus teas & coffee. There are also pastries. They have a tray in your room so you can bring breakfast back to your room.The breakfast area is outdoors among pigeons & birds that take your food if not looking. It is also very windy.The hotel provides towels for the pool and or beach & has an honesty return system.There is free wifi which is unlimited for devices & works well.The concierge desk has always been busy so we weren't able to get help from them.The beach is a 2 minute walk & it is located in easy distance to Waikiki or you can catch the Pink Trolley for $2 which stops at the top of the street.During my stay it was my birthday. The staff sent up cupcakes & a lovely hand written card.The staff here are so helpful it was a pleasure to meet them!

stayed here for a fortnight, hotel is in a great location within walking distance to the beach, the zoo, aquarium, supermarket (food pantry) and most Waikiki attractions. staff are very friendly and very accommodating, we traveled with our 10 month old who they could not do enough for. Breakfast selection was good and while the pool is small it isnt needed with the beach so close. fantastic facilities and a high level of cleanliness. we would stay here again

Breakfast was more than what other hotels offer. Slightly different every day. Plus no hidden fees, no surprise resort fees. The room inside was really nice, really clean. And it was less than 5 minute walk to the beach. Close to restaurants and shopping centers. Enjoyed our week stay there, will definitely book there for next time. Plus, already recommended to family and friends.

Very friendly great values for money, clean and modern - we will be back - thank you.Breakfast was included and very close to wikikiki beach. An ABC store 2 mins up the stree. Happy hour from 4 - 6 daily and a Starbucks within the hotel. The Concierge is very helpful and will help you to plan your excursions in Hawaii, give advice on restaurants etc.

We used to stay here when this property was the Ocean Resort Hotel. The location is perfect - close to everything but out of the fray and noise of Kalakaua Ave. And it is greatly improved by Hyatt! Beautiful renovations and clean rooms. Very quality breakfast for being complimentary. Excellent coffee, fresh pineapple, eggs, pancakes, and even Japanese selections like Miso soup, rice, and cucumber. We loved our stay.

The hotel is well located in Waikiki. Staffs are friendly and they serve free hot breakfast every morning. Just a short walk to Waikiki Beach. Room is spacious and well keep. We have a great time with our stay.

Such a nice hotel and very good localization. Staff is amazing and very gently. Breakfast worthy of take some vacation time to enjoy. As my flight was late they let me do the check out at noon and provided me a room so I could take a shower, W-fi service is also good.

Not a 5 star hotel, but overall great value for the $. Quick walk to ABC convenience store and beach. The price was good considering the location. Highly recommend eating elsewhere as room service quality was subpar. Tiki lounge on the corner was much better quality for the prices.

Stayed 2 nights prior to a cruise. Great location, just a short 3 minute walk to beach. Near the zoo at east end of Waikiki. Upgraded for $30 extra per night to ocean view. It was worth the extra. Very large room with full sofa and coffee table. Plenty of room to entertain another couple. A separate desk area too. Good free wi-fi. Breakfast is also included, hot and cold offerings, along with Asian choices. Plenty of choices, plenty of seating on the patio by the pool. I would return. The front desk personnel. Were very helpful. Heidi was super! Only downfall is slow elevators ( and only 2 in the towered were in). But I have found this to be common in Honolulu.

My wife and I stayed at the hyatt Place in Waikiki for 8 nights and it was great. Upon our arrival and check-in we were upgraded rooms to an oceanview room instead of city just from asking. Matt was the receptionist who checked us in and we both think he really went above and beyond to make our first impression of the hotel the best. We really started off our trip to O'ahu the right way. Matt was really kind, talked to us like we had been friends for a long time, gave us some great ideas on where to go and was overall a really cool person. He helped us with our luggage and in conversation we told him we were in town for work and our 6 month wedding anniversary. After he dropped us off at our room he said he would be back in a few minutes with something for us. We weren't entirely sure what he was going to get but he came back with 2 lava cakes and 2 hawaiian sodas! We were surprised and very excited. Things like that don't happen very often and it might seem small for other people but we were very impressed by Matt's character. Because of him, we will definitely be staying at the Hyatt Place again. Other than Matt's service everyone else was great. There was a hot breakfast served every morning with pancakes, fruit, eggs, oatmeal, granola, yogurt, tea. It was awesome. The hotel wasn't directly on the beach but it was a 2 minute walk. We didn't mind the lack of ocean view because we were barely in the hotel. I think we slept in until 10 one day, the rest we had breakfast and were out by 730. Everyone was friendly and gave us many ideas for where we should visit or get food at. It was a great trip.My only suggestion for the future would be to get softer towels. I understand that could be a huge expense but they were a little rough, especially on sunburned skin. Other then that we were very happy with the prices for the rooms, the service of the staff, and the overall atmosphere. The outdoor feel of the lobby was awesome too.

I was completely satisfied with my stay here. I found my room was bit smaller but it had mountain view. City view room was bigger as my friend stayed in that.Room was clean,nice and cozy. Friendly staff.Breakfast was very nice, there were multiple options for vegetarian options. I don't eat meat and staff helped me with no meat omelette. Good day to start with awesome breakfast.Hardly 5 min walk from waikiki beach.Bus stop just 1-2 min walk or just outside hotel across the road. Wifi signal were pretty good.

Great location only two blocks from Waikki Beach, one block away from ABC market. The staff were professional and very courteous. Room included hot breakfast buffet every morning, which was a very nice added bonus.
user_name:
Ryan T
San Ramon, United States

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights at the Hyatt Place and the hotel was nice.We had 2 issues, one we were assigned an adjoining room, which we complained about and they moved us to another room quickly.The other problem was a false alarm right as we were leaving.We had to carry three bags of luggage down 10 flights of stairs.The hotel is one long block from the beach, which was convenient.The breakfast wasn't bad.All in all a good value.

Staff was good. Location was not bad. The ocean view is not existent. The room smelled old and the carpets looked dirty. The showers were dirty and the showerhead was terrible. Definitely would not pay nearly $200 to stay here. Breakfast buffet sucks and birds are all around you while you eat. You don't have to take my word for it, go experience it yourself.

This is a beautiful hotel and is within walking distance of everything - the beach, shops, and restaurants. The staff is best part about this hotel. They are so beyond wonderful - we loved them. Cannot say enough about all of the staff members. The food and drinks were also great. The 24/7 menu is very good and the daily breakfast is good also, with the exception of the eggs. Those are not good.

Spacious, comfortable rooms, and great location in Waikiki. Close to beach and park. Best of all, no annoying resort fees that most of the Waikiki hotels charge for basically nothing extra and this hotel includes free breakfast.

This is a great hotel, in a great location and the room and facilities were of a high standard. We had one of the "older" rooms - but it was plenty big enough and the view was as promised.The included breakfast was adequate - but not exciting, we did like the tray in each room so that you could carry breakfast back to the room if you preferred.The surprise was when one night as we were about to go to sleep we heard a dog bark from the room across the hall. (We then noticed a sign on the door advising housekeeping that a dog was in the room).While it was not a big issue - the dog did not bark too much, the soundproofing was not enough to block out the noise and if the dog had have been noisier it would have become a real problem.To be honest - while I am a dog lover, if I had known they let dogs in the rooms I may have chosen a different hotel.

This was the 2nd hotel out of three I tried during my Honolulu trip. It's nothing special, but I was comfortable for my three nights. Pros: I scored a huge room with a little lanai (may have been due to my status with Hyatt). No complaints about location, if you're here to Waikiki. Convenient to the Honolulu bus (which is amazing and efficient, btw). The amenities (soap, shampoo, etc.) are decent. There's a gym, a (slightly neglected) pool, and even a laundry room (used the gym; didn't use pool or laundry). There's free breakfast (it was just that, free food; don't book for this alone) and a basic bar on the lobby level. Housekeepers were sweet and friendly. Cons: Elevators are aged and take forever--and this not-tiny hotel was booked up. I thought the lobby furniture (and maybe the bed linens, too) could use a refresh.I stayed in one of the fancier, more expensive properties on the beach as well as a comparably priced "boutique" hotel that absolutely sucked, so in all honesty I'd probably give this place another shot if I was looking for space to spread out and the consistency of staying in a Hyatt.

Nice hotel; accepts 5 people in one room which was a big plus for us; all the "5 star hotels" wanted us to book 2 separate rooms since we have 3 young children. Good location approx 100m from Waikiki beach. Free wifi which is so slow it's hardly worth having. Pool is average. Buffet breakfast is included which is a big $ saver, it's nothing flash (powdered eggs, American bacon is pretty bad) the bagels and coffee were good.Good sized clean rooms, big tv with plenty of channels. Valet parking is $30 per day, or park yourself for $25. Perfect place to stay for families with more than 2 kids...

Stayed here with points and couldn't have been happier with my room (with a view of the ocean) and the staff was most helpful. Would stay here again without any hesitation. Great location to the beach and shopping. ABC store located 1/2 block away with any thing you may need.
user_name:
W - Tommy P
San Antonio, United States

review_body: Very accomodating staff, good location close to beach and main drag, rooms clean and comfortable. Pool is small and no hot tub but plusses outweigh negatives. Included breakfast a real positive. Parking expensive but no resort fee so cost evens out with other hotels.

I was in the Hawaii for business and stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for six nights. The hotel is a little small and typical of older Hyatt Place location. However, the people and staff make you feel wonderful and like family. I want to highlight three superstars in hospitality ( Lani, Ted and Hedi). Thank you for making my work life great in Honolulu.

We arrived late and stayed one night at this hotel. The hotel is a bit roomer and newer than a typical Hyatt Place.. Almost a blend of Hyatt place and a Hyatt Regency. Only parking available is valet. Breakfast area is very spacious, with 2 stations for everything so it was easy to access the food even though the place was full. The dining area was partially outside so we got to enjoy the Hawaiian morning.. Very nice.  The staff is very friendly, with their nice Hawaiian shirt uniforms. We were treated to exceptional service by Ihab Kherati. Due to my daughter's food allergies, we brought our own frozen breakfast for her. He was kind enough to take it to a different floor and heat it for her. Afterwards, he informed us of different food options for her and brought us some gluten free bread.. My daughter was so happy to find out Hyatt Place has it!!

We stay at hotel for two weeks breakfast was great location is great , again thank you Mattq Heidi for all the help and manegare Stephen Weldone you show clas heandly my wife small injury great hotel to stay

The hotel room was very comfortable and indeed, had a balcony, but it overlooked a side street. Not exactly what we booked. The breakfast was great, the employees were extremely friendly and helpful. It was just across the street from our tour pickups and only 3 blocks from the beach. Yes, I would stay there again.

Rooms and staff good however breakfast left a lot to be desired. No pineapple juice which we found surprising in Waikiki. Needs more variation of continental food choice at breakfast menu. Good location and close to swimming beach.

Very nice hotel and staff with spacious rooms. Great location to beach, shopping and nightlife. Breakfast could be improved with just a little effort - cook the food don't microwave it! We would book here again for sure.

We booked a room at this hotel after reading good reviews on it. It was even better than expected. No resort fees, free breakfast, quiet location, 5 minute walk to the beach, clean rooms, friendly staff, a shower big enough for 2 (what?), etc. We were in town for a wedding and got to see some other hotels that friends and family were staying at, and we would pick ours again. The only complaint would be that the pillows were too soft!

The daily breakfast was surprisingly good with hot selections (even miso soup and rice!). The staff is warm and make our stay comfortable and fuss free. Short 5 min walk to the beach and the jetty to see the surfers. ABC store and bicycle rental are just next door. Does not have the bells and whistles of her sister hotel down the road (Hyatt regency) but at a very good price for what you get. Would come again.

The hotel was clean and enjoyable .Close to shops and the beach. Every request we made was acknowledged and taken care of. The view was not as great as I would like but we knew this going in. I would stay there again without any doubts on safety and care.

Excellent and very clean hotel. My wife and I have been staying at Hyatt hotels ever since the kids were small; the kids are all grown now and we still love the Hyatt. We have never been disappointed. The rooms are clean and a good size for a fair price. Thanks...

I have frequented this property over a handful of times each a week at a time within the last year and I can say about half have been pleasant. My last two trips have been awful. On the first of my most recent two I was there on business. Well on this occasion the whole building was out of power due to a scheduled maintenance. The rooms were so dark I couldn't complete any work and even accessing the bathrooms was nearly impossible in a pitch black room. Only the emergency halway lights were on. I ended up setting up in the hallway to do my work into the night. When I complained because I didn't receive any notice I was offered points to come back and give them an other opportunity. These points took multiple emails of follow up with Ihab their assistant GM back and fourth with him saying it had been processed. When they finally came they were for 1/3 of his promised amount. I couldn't believe it. It all finally was sorted out and I have returned for an other trip. One this most recent trip the whole building was evacuated due to a false fire alarm. After joining the crowd downstairs with no direction on where to go and what was going on I returned to my room. Once in my room I called to retrieve the wifi access code and no answer on their phones. Here I go again down the stairs to get the password. Not a friendly hotel for working professionals looking to be comfortable while away.......

Nice place to stay at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. Large clean rooms and friendly helpful staff. Nice breakfast included - a step above most discount chains but not quite as nice as some 'buffet' style breakfast. Small pool with no views from pool area. Overnight parking a little expensive ($30) but probably no more than other Waikiki hotels.

We had a great time visiting waikiki beach, this hotel is about a block or two from a very nice beach, the staff are wonderful and the hotel very clean. The breakfast is served outside on the third floor by the pool and it is included in your stay, it was a very nice breakfast. We would certainly consider this hotel again.

Loved it, been there before, but I got the broom closet thing time, and had no time to move. Otherwise, awesome. Beautiful ocean view, but my luggage took half the room, literally. SMALL New tower has HUGE rooms,

We were very pleasantly surprised with an upgrade when we arrived. Our room was on the top floor, with a wrap-around balcony, so that we had both a view of the mountains and the beach. The room was large, clean and modern. The location of this hotel is terrific - only a short walk to the Waikiki pier to view the sunset or to visit the zoo. It's also the closest hotel to Leonard's. The staff was amazingly attentive, both on check-in and check-out, even holding our luggage for us while we toured the city.

I booked a room with this hotel that had a balcony and seaview. This was totally misleading as yes it did have a balcony that looked straight across the street into another hotel, and yes it did have a seaview, this was thru a tiny window placed up high on the otherside of the room. So be warned you dont always get what you are booking.I complained to the front desk who didnt seem to care and they did offer to move me, but it was somewhere that no better and by then I had secured a room with a proper seaview in another hotel.We did however have to spend the night here (as arrived late after a really long journey from the UK). The room itself was spacious but dirty and tired the bathroom was really poor with a bizzare toilet that had a heated seat! There are always queues for the lifts and they even give out a rush hour warning and ask you to avoid using them then. We went down to the free breakfast next morning which was a complete free for all with food left all over the tables there was even food that had been chucked into the pool, so we did not eat there, and then had to walk up the 27 flight of stairs as it was rush hour!~This is definatly NOT a luxury hotel, the only good thing about it was its location.I would not recommend staying here, as it poor but still pricey.

Overall, it's a good place to stay, rooms are clean. Breakfast included is certainly a plus, it saves you both money & time! To us, the down sides are: our room temperature was preset to 68 degree F (20C), which we found was too warm, and, there weren't enough racks/hooks for hanging damp/wet towels.

We were celebrating my birthday and were given a very nice ocean view room even though the building is back from the ocean a couple blocks. Breakfast was excellent every day and varied a little bit every day as well which made it nice for the 4 day stay. It was nice to be on the quieter end of the beach for part of our trip.
user_name:
Susan J M
Menlo Park, United States

review_body: It is a nice place, comfortable and with great people. it is walking distance to the beach. it has an ABC store very close if you need to buy something. Great location. The breakfast is included and that is good, although everyday it is not much different, it helps to start your day.

My partner and I stayed her in March for 5 nights, then one night after island hopping. We booked an ocean view room and requested a high floor in our booking however we were very disappointed as the room we were given looked directly into the balcony of the apartment block in front of the hotel and we could only see a sliver of ocean between the buildings in front. I called Reception right away and asked to be moved to a room on a higher floor and am happy to say that this request was met and the next day we were moved to the 14th floor where the view was considerably better and above the balconies of the apartment block. Thanks to Angeline and Matt on reception who were both lovely and looked after us. On our last night after island hopping, we were given the same room (at my request) which we were very happy with.Our room wasn't huge but it was beautifully appointed, lovely bathroom, very comfortable. Location is superb, a minute walk to the beach and on the quieter end of Waikiki Beach. Close to a beautiful park, zoo and aquarium. Breakfast was fairly basic but adequate. It was always chaotic with guests scrambling to find a table in the breakfast area which to be honest was too small for the number of guests. It was fun people watching though!All in all, we loved our stay here and would definitely stay here again if we are in Honolulu again.

Nice full breakfast with great selections of items , near beach, shop and local bus. Shop and restaurant inside hotel. Friendly staff, clean and great location. and tour agency available. Great location and safe area.

We loved the hotel. The room was very spacious and the complimentary breakfast was great, The hotel is close to Waikiki and lots of restaurants. All the staff were brilliant excellent service. I would recommend booking a room on the quite side as it can get noisy at that end of Waikiki

We had a wonderful week in this hotel. Staff was very friendly and very helpful especially Manny and Christphor they went out of their way to help. Hotel is in a great location just one block from the beach.Next to an ABC store which will have all of your needs...sun lotion beer, spirts and snacks - very responsible price Breakfast in the morning was a bonus lots to choose from eggs,fruit,cereal and assortments of breads.Hotel was immaculate, very clean great comfy beds and pillows. Rooms are on the small size but that did not apply to our needsThe pool is very small but has nice sitting area around the pool deck. Bonus is the gas fire with outdoor seats - ask Manny to light . I recommend to park across the street in the under ground it is only $20 a day with in and out. Valet parking was $35. If you can find a meter after 6.00pm you can park for free on the street until 7:00am next day

I don't mean that title in a facetious way. I was in town for a local friend's wedding and her house was full for the first part of our trip so we stayed here knowing that we'd be spending almost no time at the hotel. The rooms were very clean and our balcony even showed a sliver of the ocean. We ate breakfast in the outdoor seating area (which IMO rather awkwardly flanks the pool). The pool area is very small, which may not be an issue since you're walking distance to the ocean.There is a large sitting area near reception on the ground level and a Starbucks counter. There is also a little convenience store adjacent.If you're not planning to do much at the hotel itself (which why should you?? you're in paradise!!) then this hotel fits the bill. If you want more of a resort/luxury experience, you'll need an upgrade.

This hotel was great! It was centrally located about 2 blocks off of the beach. The room was fantastic! We had an ocean view room, and although there are other hotels closer to the beach, we were able to see the ocean while laying in bed due to the floor to ceiling windows. Our included breakfast was pretty good! It was always quite busy, but food was always available. The beds were very comfortable, and the hallways were quiet. We did spend some time at the pool, but it was a little bit windy and not all sunny due to the building layout, but we weren't concerned because we're from Minnesota. The pool was almost always empty, because i'm guessing most people head to the beach.

The hotel was clean, spacious, and very nice. Having a breakfast included was a plus as it saved us a lot of money. The staff was very nice and friendly. We rented a car in the hotel which was easy to do.

Our vacation was excellent at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. The staff was great and the room stay was very clean as well. The breakfast in the morning was great also. I thank the bar staff serving excellent drinks and the time they to talk to me.

Friendly staff, close to the beach, great place to wait for shuttles or tour buses, breakfast was good, the lounge on the main floor was open and very relaxed. I did find the room cards sometimes a bit tricky to activate the elevators.

- Wonderful free continental breakfast - Only minutes from Waikiki Beach - Great value - Liked that there were rooms that accommodated more than 4 people - The valet parking was exceptional - The hotel was very clean and inviting
user_name:
Kelly N
Spanish Fork, United States

review_body: We had a lovely ocean view room, and can recommend this hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful. It's one block back from Kalakaoa Ave but easy distance of the beach, shops and restaurants. Would stay here again.

We only spent one night at the Waikiki Hyatt Place but wish it would have been more! The room was clean, well cared for, large and spacious. Having the breakfast was a wonderful addition too. Just 2 blocks from the famous Waikiki Beach made it a perfect fit for us.

We had 2 nights in Waikiki, pre-cruise. Was planning on touring the North Shore on the full day we had there, so a hotel on the beach was not a priority. Was also not interested to pay the famous "resort-fee".HP ticked all my boxes -- location, hot free b'fast, free wi-fi, reasonable senior rate.The reasons I'm not giving it 5* -- the room was tiny, the "ocean view" was partial at best, with a building right in front of our balcony, and a very loooong wait to check in. The moment I checked in, all the staff we met couldn't be more gracious and helpful.

My room was very clean and the staff was professional and very welcoming! The variety of food that was offered was great. Only one block to the beach and the ocean views were amazing! Will definitely be returning again!

My mom, sister and I stayed here and had a fantastic time. For the price it is unbeatable for the area. The breakfast each morning has every food under the sun. You will not go hungry. It's steps from Waikiki beach and the shopping area. The staff was friendly and the rooms were immaculate.

The hotel has really comfortable mattress' so we were able to get great sleep. Clean hotel. So so free breakfast which was usually somewhat cold but its free so what do you expect. A few minutes walk to beach and right by ABC store.
user_name:
Heidi Jackson A
Las Vegas, United States

review_body: The room was clean and the ocean view was wonderful. Only one short block to Waikiki Beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early and they stored our luggage until room was available. Also helped in obtaining a rental car.

The location was great. Convenient to everything in Honolulu. Waikiki beach is a walking distance from this Hotel and it is also surrounded by lots of restaurants and shopping. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and were able to do all the activities we had intended to do and also had lots of time to relax.

This hotel was gross. The lobby was from the late 70's dirty and out dated. Very depressing. But maybe that is Hawaiian style? There was old dried up urine left on the toilet seat from the previous guest. That was so disgusting. The hotel didn't do much about it.
