The most disgusting thing was that I'd been there all night before I noticed it and had sat in it! GROSS. #dirty Hyatt.

I recently stayed at this location for 5 nights. While the rooms were gorgeous, the hotel was always clean, and the location was great, I am not too sure I would stay here again.First off the elevators in this hotel are ridiculously slow. From day one, complete strangers were warning us about how bad the elevators were and to make sure we planned ahead for the elevator wait time. We quickly learned that these strangers were not joking! You would wait for the elevator for 10-15 minutes! When the hotel has over 16 floors that is just too long of a wait. Also the breakfast space is not in a good location, it is on the pool deck. At peak times the breakfast line will be all the way out of the door and wrapped around the pool deck. There are two entrances to the breakfast area but staff just watches as giant lines form in the one entrance instead of helping direct the chaos. There has to be a better location for this or a better system. Further, there is not nearly enough seating on the poor deck to accommodate the number of people in the hotel!Lastly, the staff was pretty rude on a variety of occasions.

A very nice hotell near the Waikiki beach. It´s also near the Zoo and the Aqarium. Its easy to buy souvenirs, water and food in the ABC-store. It´s ease to get on a Bus for visiting for exampel Ala Moana department store. It´s also a lot of stores not far from the hotel. Breakfast and Fitnesscenter Ok

This hotel is located towards the end of Waikiki, close to Zoo, Aquarium and Diamond Head. Only 3 min walk to the beach. Close to the shopping centers and restaurants. They have valet parking which is awesome. I would recommend couples or adults to stay in this hotel.

First, big shout out to Kimberly and the lovely front desk agent who checked us in. They did everything they could to make us comfortable and happy. My boyfriend and I arrived at the hotel at 11:30am and we were given 2 choices because our king room was not ready. We could either volunteer to stay for free at Hyatt Regency (2 blocks away) for one night (and some petty cash), or wait 2-3 hours for our room to be ready and it would be on the 2nd or 3rd floor (which according to Trip Advisor is not a good idea). We were exhausted but we chose to do 1 night at Hyatt Regency since it was a total upgrade anyway. I work in the hotel industry, so I understand why overbooking could occur despite management's best ability to avoid that. FYI about the free breakfast: It is extremely crowded, even early in the morning. The food is really not enough to get you started, it's powdered egg, waffles, OJ, the miso soup was bland, and the dining area is kind of dirty (I.E. By the pool that needs scrubbing). The room was decent, however the lights are dim, small stains on the towels and carpet but unnoticeable to the average eye. the trash wasn't changed daily, and the bed is TOO soft. Both my boyfriend and I were sore the 3 nights that we stayed.FYI about the Valet: Call down ahead if you plan to get your car pulled up so you avoid any waiting time. The service was not the best, as some of the older attendants didn't even offer to take the luggage in/out of the car. Free wifi is excellent.We chose Hyatt Place knowing that we wouldn't spend most of the day in the rooms, but seeing how nice the Hyatt Regency was it definitely made a difference in convenience and comfort.

Located two short blocks from the actual Waikiki, across from the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort, the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach provides great value, excellent service, and a perfect location for a budget-conscious stay in Honolulu, especially as a base for extensive exploration of the island. (We were in Oahu for a friend's son's wedding at an estate on the north shore of Oahu and extended our stay for a vacation.) The facilities are even more than adequate for business travelers as well.In terms of basics, the rooms are very clean, beds are very comfortable, the staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating, and both wireless internet and hot breakfast is included with all rooms. The wireless internet provided excellent bandwidth (typically, 12mbps up and down) and was even suitable for business use (well, even on vacations, some work typically needs to get done).As one would expect in this very urban area, parking is NOT included with the room rate. You can self-park ($25/day if I recall correctly) or valet park for $30/day (charged to your room); I would strongly recommend the valet parking given both the convenience and the relative small difference in price. If you don't have a vehicle, the hotel is amply served by buses, taxis, and shuttles.The “hot breakfast” is a buffet available from 6:30am to 9:30am daily. It is a grade above of what you would expect at a Hampton Inn or similar hotel, but not high cuisine. Food is fresh and continually refreshed. The breakfast area is on the third floor by the pool. Seating is fairly limited though; based on feedback from previous guests, the hotel provides trays in the rooms such that one may bring the breakfast back to consume in your room (although that can be somewhat tricky given the need to use your room's card key to operate the elevator floor selection).Some additional important considerations:The Hyatt Place is in a very urban area with the typical noise accompanying such a location. The hotel is not particularly well sound-insulated. If you are a very “light sleeper” and sensitive to noise, you should bring ear plugs or consider some other hotel. (Both my wife and I were aware of the noise, but had no problems falling asleep and staying asleep through the night!)The Hyatt Place is neither a full service hotel nor a “resort” hotel. Although the hotel does have a 24/7 snack and beverage service, there is no full service restaurant in the hotel itself. And although the hotel has a swimming pool, it is small with very limited seating / lounging areas in its vicinity. However, there are literally hundreds of restaurants ranging from inexpensive fast food / snack bars to some of the best dining in Hawaii within a square mile of the Hyatt Place. Two excellent restaurants (Sansei and DK) are open to the public in the Marriott across the street). And in terms of swimming and other water sports, Waikiki Beach is two short blocks away.That having been said, if you want the amenities and privacy of a “resort,” the Hyatt Place will not meet your needs! There are plenty of “resort hotels” available in Waikiki specifically and in Oahu in general for which you can expect to pay much higher rates and “resort fees.”The only real glitch that we encountered in our 10 day stay was that one of three elevators in the Diamond Head tower of the hotel was inoperable for at least one week and was still broken when we left. That tower with over 250 rooms does not have a service elevator and staff must share the remaining two elevators with guests — long waits for elevators were common during our stay (management's response is that the elevators were from some company in Germany that doesn't stock replacement/service parts in Hawaii!)Also, if you are a hotel loyalty program addict, be aware that the Hyatt Place doesn't offer any “goodies” associate with Platinum or Diamond Gold Passport membership. In our case, there was no “recognition” whatsoever of my Platinum membership. C'est la vie!All in all, we would seriously consider staying at the Hyatt Place again if we travelled to Oahu again and would recommend it to others who need basic, high quality lodging!

5 stars. This was a great place to stay. The room was very clean. The breakfast was great. The location is perfect. I always stay here. Mahlo I am not sure what more to say but I I can not submit this until it has 200 characters

Pros: Walk to the beach in three minutes, spacious rooms, free hot breakfast, no resort feeCons: 19 floor tower has only two elevatorsI recently stayed at the Hyatt Place for three nights and I was delightfully surprised. I would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel to families who want a hotel that can accommodate four or five people easily. I checked in quickly and stayed in the taller of the two buildings. Most hotels in Waikiki charge $25 or $30 for a resort fee that includes everything that you don’t need, don’t want, or should be free (e.g., wireless internet, long-distance calls, newspaper). The Hyatt Place doesn’t charge a resort fee, but they still provide outstanding amenities and service. You can get towels to take to Kuhio Beach, which is a block away. They serve a free hot breakfast everyday, starting at 6:30 AM. When I was there, the entrees included scrambled eggs, hotcakes, waffles, and breakfast sandwiches. They also serve miso soup, steamed rice and kim chee, a nice touch. Think of how much breakfast costs in Waikiki: at least $15 to $18 per person. That’s how much you’ll save at the Hyatt Place. Families want room to spread out, and the hotel offers plenty. We were a family of four, and the room came with two queen beds and a sofa bed. The bathroom was good-sized, as well. The room came with a desk for working, a small terrace, and a refrigerator. If you find that you need something, there is an ABC convenience store a few steps away.The hotel is a block from Kalakaua Avenue, the “main drag” in Waikiki. It is adjacent to Kuhio Street, another major street in Waikiki. The hotel is on the eastern edge of Waikiki, within walking distance to the zoo, Kapiolani Park, and other major attractions in Waikiki.
user_name:
WashDCRoad_Warrior
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Just spent 9 days in Waikiki with the family of 5 with teenagers. I had planned to stay a couple days at Hyatt Place as a landing pad for a few days then move on. I found the hotel pleasant, the service exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room accommodated us well. Very comfortable. The location is very convenient, couple of minutes walk off of the main street and easy walking distance to everything. We ended up staying at this hotel for our entire stay! I walked through the others (Marriott, Sheraton, Regency, ...). They were a bit fancier and nice pools but really offered nothing more than what we already had. The pool is nothing to go for, but who needs a pool when the Waikiki beach itself is 1.5 blocks and 5 minutes! Free breakfast and free wifi -- a must and huge bonus when travelling with teenagers.

Good location and value for money. Easy going and friendly atmosphere. We were upgraded to a room on the penthouse floor which was great. The beds were comfortable and rooms cleaned daily. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would recommend staying here to my friends.

Stayed for ten days , relaxed ,casual and quiet would recommend to families .Breakfast included and a small pool.Walking distance to beach and bus stops to attractions out the front of hotel.Easy walk down to the shopping and restaurants.Quite a popular hotel.Take away diner and ABC shops just a few steps away on the same street

It's really hard to find a hotel that will accommodate five people in one room so we were happy find one that does--two queen beds and a sofa bed. (This is a very late review as we stayed here the week of Christmas two years ago.) The hotel is located at the end of the Waikiki strip, close to the zoo, and only two blocks from the beach. The staff were always friendly. Breakfast was okay--we couldn't complain, it was free! There was always two or three hot dishes along with rice, miso soup, fruit, danishes, cereal, toast/bagels. It's better to go early or near the end of service so you can find a place to sit. The servers were helpful and would bring me soy milk upon request. Our room view was of the alley/old apartments but we didn't plan on staying in the room all day so it didn't bother us. We stayed on the third floor which was great because breakfast is served on that level and we didn't have to deal with the elevators. The elevators are slow! There are only two elevators that can't fit that many people so we used the stairs most of the time. It was great to have free wifi, no resort fee, and beach towels to use during our stay. It's not the most luxurious hotel but it was clean, comfortable, and easy on the wallet.

Friendly hotel suitable for the whole family or honeymooner. Rooms are spacious. Staffs are very friendly. Only two blocks from Waikiki beach. It is quiet and very convenient to access nice restaurants near by.

This hotel is in a good location close to Waikki and within walking distance to the zoo, shopping and restaurants. The view from room 241 was the worst ever, looking into the apartments across the alley and the hotel trash. I suggest staying higher than the second floor. We did a lot of waiting for the elevator as they were very slow. The size and comfort of the room was good. The breakfast was wonderful but always very crowded as this seemed to be a popular hotel. The staff was great and very helpful. I would stay here again especially for the price but would stay away from the second floor.

The Hyatt Place is a great value, very clean, great location, and the staff excellent! The management is very hands on and the staff respects that. Your not just objects that will be gone soon but visiting friends. The Third Floor breakfast has something for everyone with, very nice beverages.

Great place to stay. Staff was very friendly and they provided a room for us after the check out to take a bath after a day in the beach before taking our flight. The staff was really friendly. We did a late check in and we had our room upgraded.

Good, clean, at the far end of the beach but close to everything and with the best lagoon area very close. Huge breakfast and very friendly staff. Parking was extra at $20 a day but that's kinda standard there.

had a great stay! this property is 2 blocks from the beach, dining, shops. Staff was very helpful. No resort fees are charged at this hotel!. Breakfast was also included and was a hot breakfast with plenty of variety.

We were pleased with the hotel. Parking is expensive at $30 a night. The rooms didn't have a bath tub, only a shower. We had a room with a king, not a lot of space inside the room, reminded me of a Microtel motel room. The pool was small and no hot tub.

The rooms are very nice, quite large and well furnished. The pool was rather Uninviting with the deck needing a good scrub. The breakfast, while free was very industrial in quality and certainly not a highlight. The location is decent, being 2 blocks from the beach but it is towards one end of the main strip so getting to the main shopping area is a bit of a walk. Staff was only so so and not very accommodating with a request for an extension to my stay. I would likely stay here again but would not factor in a breakfast in my decision.

This review is so late--we actually stayed last year, and now because of our awesome experience at Hyatt we have just booked another stay in a couple of weeks! It was a last minute trip last year, and our first ever to Hawaii. We loved the open air feel to the lobby and the landscaping. Our room was a mountain view King, and while rather small the view in the morning of the sun and clouds coming over the mountains was breathtaking. And the bed was so exquisitely comfortable any time we sat on it we fell asleep! I loved the water pressure in the shower and the toiletries the housekeeper left were wonderful. Our room attendant by the way was incredible--we would come back to the room to find our leis shaped into a heart on a wooden tray, we would exchange friendly notes, just something special every day. But this is how ALL the staff are. Ciamar at the front desk was so kind and helpful to us our entire stay__I had to hug her goodbye at the end because she felt like family. Breakfast was a highlight every morning__chocolate croissants, fresh fruit, spinach and egg omelettes, oatmeal with cranberries, and the coffee was SO good. The lovely lady (Yuki?) and the gentleman who oversee the breakfasts are so friendly--the gentleman taught me all about Miso soup and what each component was and how to eat it like the Hawaiians do. It is an easy stroll to the beach and you can pick up busses to everywhere really close to the hotel. We took busses to the palace, the shopping mall and the Royal Hawaiian village, and diamond head and hanauma bay for snorkeling. Also we took the trolley one time which was fun. Our last day our flight didn't leave until 8:30 at night. The front desk staff, and again our friend Ciamar, told us we could leave our luggage with them and hang out at the pool or walk on the beach one last time--so we got some beach time, had some lunch,came back to the pool, and freshened up a little. Then we sat in the lobby waiting for our return airport shuttle, and the front desk girls brought us some bottled water! Every single employee we encountered even if it was just in the hallway went out of their way to be friendly and ask how our day was going and where we were from--we were just blown away by the treatment we got and THAT is why we re-booked again this year. Thank you Hyatt Place!!!

Couldnt have a better eastern holiday.The hotel a 4 stars from the wellknown chain stays almost at the end of waikiki close to the zoo but waikiki front strees is quite small so you are in the middle of everything.Hotel is quite confortable, i booked a standard room was given a big room with sitting room, king bed very excelent matress, cleaning everyday and changing of sheets every 2 days. Much people using waikiki hotels complain about the noise of the traffic. Ok you listen a little but nothing that limits your sleeping, believe me i am a bed sleeper, and since long i'vent been sleeping so well like i did in this hotel.From the very wellcome arrival till the departure staff mainly of reception is very friendly, aiming to please you in every sense, helping you whenever needed, giving you informations of all (buses, atractions...) it looks they are trained people, i might consider the staff the jewels of this business.Excelente wifi free, with 6 pc desks and free printer on the ground floor.Excelent and fast room service even the menu is a bit too american .Rooms have good eletronic safe.Breakfast is good even very american standard, i think they could improve a little:scrambled eggs are made by eggs powder, pooridge is not made with milk but water with almost no flavour. But there is always very sweet pineapple and other fruits, good fruit juice not natural , different sorts of bread, some pastries, cereals, coffee and tea and eastern hot food(rice, meat...)I loved Oahu and want to go back to Hawaii in the future, even i leave so far away in Europe, but i definetely will be back in Hyatt Place Waikiki. Thanks Hyatt Place team.

We were really pleasantly surprised by how nice and reasonably priced this hotel is for Waikiki Beach. Rooms were good, location too. Everything is so expensive in Hawaii, so this was a real treat. Everyone who worked there was so attentive, friendly and helpful. they made you feel really welcome.

What a warm relaxing week at the Hyatt Place Hotel in Honolulu. Everything was perfect from the moment we checked in for our 8 days stay until we left. The staff, the accommodations, the food at the 24/7 Bar and Café was above the norm: gourmet delicious. The service when we needed something was always accommodating.

Excellent location near the beach, restaurants, and shopping area. Friendly and very helpful staffs. Room was very clean , very comfortable bed and free wifi was great. Breakfast was included which was great. No additional hotel fees.

Our stay was perfect. We were 1 block from the beach. Loads of really goods restaurants. The tour buses stopped just across the street. The concierge from Expedia was very helpful. Breakfast is free and really good. Rooms are big and there is a safe in the room. Overall everything was great. Make sure you go to the Polynesian Centre best day ever. Charlie's taxi is the one to use from airport

The room had an ocean view. Although it was a bit small, it had a balcony with chairs. We were a block or two from the beach. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. There was always some hot entrees and fresh fruit with regular plates and silverware. Although they provide a tray in case the tables are all full, we always found a table. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The only thing I didn't like was that the switch for the room with the toilet and shower had to be turned on with the light in the area of the sink and closet which then flooded the room with light. It would have been nice to have a separate switch. We found the room to work perfectly for what we wanted to do. The tour buses picked us up in front of the hotel or across the street. It was a short walk to the beach (2-3 blocks).

We spent a couple of weeks on Oahu during the first two weeks of March and stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The quality of our stay was outstanding and the value was unmatched. Very competitive rates. The staff was very friendly and professional and the room was perfect for our needs. We slept well and enjoyed the breakfast that came with our rate. We will definitely choose this hotel for future trips to Oahu.

Been here one night out of 9 and yes, the bed is great but the rest of the room is small and not well thought out. I wish now we had stayed somewhere else. Location is close to the beach and breakfast is free so can't complain. Free wifi is amazing!!!! Dino was very nice at check-in, but never said where the pool or amenities were located and there is nothing in the room on paper that tells you. The air conditioning in the room is difficult to figure out how to work; we could not get it to cool down and there are no instructions anywhere! The one thing I strongly hate about the room is that there is no light switch for the toilet (which is located with the walk-in shower, separate from the sink area) without lighting up the front area of the room and disturbing my husband. This room is definitely made for some who traveled solo.

Found our room to be quite noisy. Having said that the staff were really good and a special thanks to Cole who managed to get us suitable accommodation as our first room didn't suit our needs. The hotel is close to the beach but its at the wrong end of the strip for a lot of your dining options, having said that they are only a 15 minute walk away. The Hotel runs along a one way street which is always busy so watch your kids as you cross the road. The complimentary breakfast is OK but get in quick as its always busy. There's no resort fees at this hotel so this always helps the budget.

We had a room on the fourth floor and found it to be rather noisy. Barring this the staff at this hotel are really good and they helped us out when our first room wasn't to our satisfaction. The location is only minutes from the beach but its at the far end of the strip if you want to get to the really good dining options, having said that its only about 15 minutes to get to these. Its not a resort style hotel and as such you don't pay a resort fee so that always helps. The free breakfast is OK but get in early as its always packed. We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place.

Second time at this hotel but stayed longer this time. It is still a great hotel with excellent service and nice rooms. Beds are comfortable and had no problem sleeping. Short walk to the beach with lots of amenities nearby. We will return without a doubt.

This hotel is very nice, employees are very nice and attentive. It has a small but good lobby, a tiny pool, fitness center. The value is unbeatable because it includes breakfast and towel service which is very handy and with no resort fee which can be up to 50 usd per night on some hotels!. Breakfast buffet included was very nice, it has eggs, sausages, waffles, french toast, cereal, yogurt, juices, milk, fruit and some pastries. It can get crowdy at some hours though.They serve Starbucks coffee in the Lobby cafeteria.The Hyatt Place is located at the end of the Waikiki strip one block of the beach. Walking distance to everything although if you want to go to one of the best beaches in Waikiki, Kahanamoku Beach, its 20 - 30 minutes walking. (is the beach in front of the Hilton). The room was super clean, I asked for a crib for my baby and they gave me one quickly and was comfortable. The bed was so comfy!!!, awesome mattress. Bathroom was super small though, the shower was very uncomfortable. The room is fully equipped with a tea/coffee maker, an empty fridge so you can put your food, and the AC worked good. There is only valet parking for 30 usd per night but you can park across the street for 20. We stayed in a room in the Diamond Head tower, and had no problems with slow elevators. (Always saw lines of people waiting in the other tower waiting for the elevator).This is not a "resort", it doesn't have that feel. It is more quiet, laid back, small and not inviting pool, etc... But I spend a lot of time in the beach in front of the Sheraton and Hilton and is so noisy and tons of people that I preferred my hotel in the end of the day.Overall I would recommend this hotel. But if you are looking for a full resort with infinity pools and all that, this is not the place.

The location is perfect for the beach or shopping options. We arrived to discover we had been upgraded. The room was spacious with a lovely view of diamond head. The only downside was the wait times for the elevator.

All was great....nice to have breakfast when 9 in group, with 3 children ages 18-3. The rooms we got were connected since 2 families...this adjustment made at last minute and hotel was great about setting it up. Breakfast is a plus with 9 people in family there on vacation together.

Rooms were on the shabby side and very disappointed with service as compared to other Hyatt's I have stayed with. Refused an up[grade and assigned the oldest tour with a room at the end of the corridor. Strange entrance as you had to enter a door where the entranced to your room was straight ahead and on the right entrance to another room. Very weird, Would not stay here again although location was decent.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki beach is located at the end of the Waikiki strip off Paoakalani Ave near the Honolulu Zoo. Easy access to beach and transit, walking distance to shopping, bars and restaurants along Kalakaua Ave. Similar to other Hyatt Place locations, this hotels offers great value for the money and includes free breakfast.We had only 3 minor complaints during our stay: 1) slow elevators; 2) traffic noise; and 3) parking. The hotel is comprised of 2 high rise towers, the Diamond Head and Pali towers. If you have a choice of rooms, I would suggest the Diamond Head tower because it has 3 elevators, and further away from Paoakalani Ave and Kuhio Ave which are noisy with bus traffic. If you are unlucky enough to stay in the Pali tower, be prepared for long waits at the elevator, especially during high traffic times like breakfast and check-in. Really odd that the tallest tower has only 2 elevators. If you have a rental car, parking can be expensive and difficult to find too. When we first arrived, Hyatt valet $30 parking was full, so we ended up parking accross the street at the Waikiki Banyon for $20/day. However, I soon discovered that you could park 2 blocks away for free during the evenings and weekends along Kapahulu Ave (across from the Zoo). Alternatively, the City pay lot at the Zoo is $1/hour or $24 for the day.Notwithstanding the 3 minor complaints we had with our stay, overall I would recommend this hotel. You will find clean and comfortable rooms with Hyatt quality beds, friendly staff and free breakfast.

We originally booked our stay in Waikiki at the Vive Hotel but found the rooms too small and it had no gym or pool, so we switched to the Hyatt Place. The hotel is about two blocks back from the beach and is at the end of Waikiki, close to the zoo. However, nowhere is really far from anywhere in Waikiki and the hotels and shops are a lot closer together than it appears on the maps. The bus stop is just over the road and we caught buses every day, so it was very convenient.I was travelling with a work colleague/friend so we wanted a bit of space and two double beds. The hotel itself outside and in the foyer looks a little tired, but we had absolutely no complaints at all. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a suite which had two very comfortable double beds, a large living area, big flat screen TV and overall plenty of room. It was great. The staff were friendly and seemed helpful for those who needed it. The pool area is only average, a concreted area on the 3rd floor, but it was OK and had plenty of deck chairs for getting some sun. Breakfast was included and this was served each morning on an outside terrace which was quite pleasant, however I'm not sure what would happen on rainy days.The breakfast food was pretty average. Powdered egg patties on non-toasted muffins with plastic cheese was the only protein option, alongside highly sugared cereals and toast, Danish pastries and some fresh melon and pineapple etc. As Australians, we find the super highly sugared cereals and sweet bread really hard to cope with and would have been happy to pay a little extra for some more protein choices like bacon and eggs. However, for those who like their carbs, it was probably fine. We ended up walking to the esplanade and having brekky at one of the cafe's which was great.The rooms were serviced promptly every morning. We didn't end up using the gym so I can't give any sort of review, but overall, we had a great stay and really can't say anything bad about the place.

Free breakfast and no resort fee was why we chose Hyatt Place. Free breakfast buffet was amazing! First morning - French toast scrambled eggs. Sausage links and oatmeal available. Bagels toast dry cereal fruit yogurt cottage cheese. Juices..coffee...2nd morning same except pancakes instead of French toast and 3rd day waffles. Some guests loaded up and took tray to room. We ate on balcony which was crowded and a little chilly. No tub only shower and my son stopped up toilet twice. Maintenance came right away. We had city view which was quite a bit cheaper than ocean view. Not sure ocean view would be worth extra cost since hotel is about a block from ocean. I will stay at this hotel again!

This is a great hotel in a great location. Just a 5 min stroll to the beaches of Waikiki, Hyatt Place offered affordable, spacious, modern and clean accommodation that comfortably slept our family of 4. Two large beds plus the option of a pull out sofa with breakfast included. The room views were a little obstructed but we got a glimpse of the ocean and we weren't in our rooms long enough to care. Breakfast is simple but sufficient to start your day. We were more than satisfied with our stay at Hyatt Place

We came to visit UH Manoa with our daughter - this hotel was a perfect home base for us. Room was excellent, breakfast was delicious and the surroundings for breakfast was beautiful! On the east end of Waikiki but that is a good thing - out of most of the chaos but close enough to walk or take a bus. We will be back (especially if our daughter ends up at UH!)

Never ever by mistake book this hotel!!! You might get robbed!! Me and my husband went to Honolulu to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. First we were not given the room we had booked. We spent the first night in another room which was inferior to what we had booked. The staff gave us the room the next day.After a day, we went to Waikiki beach. We left all our expensive belongings including our phones, wallet and iPad in the room thinking we had done the right thing. We had the keys to the room with us, a camera and towels in the bag we carried to the beach. Within 10 minutes, our bag was picked up and those people sneaked into our room. They ransacked the entire room!! Our clothes from the cupboard , our cell phones, our credit cards, driving license , iPad, camera, purse and even the toiletries !!!! We reached the hotel with 15 minutes of the entire episode and the people had fled. Since we had lost the room keys we went to the reception and told them about the theft. Very calmly they said, " oh so your room isn't secure! I will issue new keys and send a man with you to your room!! " we told them we wanted to lodge an FIR with the police. The police arrived and we were told that the there CCTV Cameras were not working!!!!!!The staff was so calm and was acting as if nothing happened. We were so distressed and no body was bothered!!! We contacted them so many times and they just turned a cold back. It's such a reputed hotel and has such a big security breach!!! Our celebrations were ruined!!! To top it all when we checked the phone locations after theft, we saw that the phone was in the hotel for 3 hours after we reported the theft!! How is that possible!! Without the help of staff how can someone get the exact location of your room and engage in theft so smoothly within 10 minutes!!! Think!!!!Shame on the this hotel!!!Sent from my iPhone

Had a difficult check in. Gold passport member, using points and free reward, cash for weeks stay at the Hyatt. Had stayed last year and no issues, but was told room wasn't available. After walking away in tears and having husband handle things, finally got a room. So don't bother calling in advance or planning months in advance because it didn't matter. Room was great, top floor, shower did break but they were quick to repair. Fantastic location, comfortable beds, breakfast wonderful, parking across the street at garage saved time and money. Overall would stay again if I was assured of a better check in.

I was in Honolulu for a quick three-night trip. My room was on the 14th floor. There was a large balcony. The weather was mild (mid-70s) so it was a nice place to hang out, although I can see where it might be too hot at other times of the year. (The picture was taken from the balcony). If you really want scenic views, this isn't the hotel for you; it is surrounded by taller buildings. You mostly get peekaboo views of water and mountains as you look between the other hotels.Waikiki beach was just a block away, as was the main tourist thoroughfare with high-end shops, fast food places such as McDonald's and Burger King, and about a gazillion ABC stores. (ABC stores are convenience stores that cater to tourists; they are everywhere in Honolulu, including right next to the hotel AND at the end of the block). Hyatt Place will supply beach towels at no extra cost if you ask at the counter.The service was great, and there were some unexpected perks I didn't expect. For example, there was a free lei-making class that I stumbled across in the lobby, so although the hotel doesn't supply a lei when you arrive, you can make your own!The provided breakfast is very basic with standard mainland fare such as waffles and scrambled eggs, although it did have miso soup for a little variety. I was sorry not to see any papaya juice or pineapple juice, however; I would have liked some island flavor.Honolulu is a big city with big city traffic, which means street noise at all hours. Normally I would run the fan to cancel out the noise; however, the wall-mounted A/C unit didn't seem to have a 'run fan' option. It was a type that I wasn't used to, so it may have been my own ignorance. The room had a comfortable King-sized bed with a small toilet and a shower stall that included a retractable clothes line for hanging bathing suits, which proved very useful.Check in and out was easy, plus the young man who checked me in saw me in the lobby and greeted me by name the next day. Did I remember his name? I did not; that's why it impressed me!I enjoyed my stay and would stay here again. No frills, but it was comfortable.

I recently stayed for 8 days at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. My room was clean and well kept (though not "luxurious", which is OK by me) and had a great view of Waikiki beach. It was quiet and the staff was generally quite pleasant. Breakfast was included with the room and while the selection was pretty much constant day-to-day, but it tasted pretty good and there was sufficient variety offered. It is in a great location - slightly off the beaten path but a 4 minute walk to the beach and main drag, and is located close to bus routes. The only downside I noticed was the the elevators are PAINFULLY slow. If you can plan around that (and practice a bit of patience), it is a very nice stay.

Breakfast was more than I expected, we got to try japanese miso soup with rice, plus they had other stuff, good selection of juices, overall more than enough to get you going.Very good internet connection, both breakfast and internet included in price of the room, which was a big factor in process of making my decision.Staff is very friendly and helpful, special thanks to people tending the breakfast area, they were constantly working and making sure things flow very smoothly, consider the fact every day breakfast area was very busy since 6;30 am.Gentleman name Chris got my special attention , he was always smiling , very courteous and always busy.Young gentleman in reception checked us in , as a Hyatt Gold Passport member I got better than expected room on 20 th floor penthouse.His work was professionally done , no complaints as far rest of the staff.Everybody was doing what they suppose to do.Hotel itself is a 3 star hotel, not a luxury at any meansJust a Hyatt Place like this one in my neck of the woods would cost little over 110 bucks per night ,but because it is Honolulu price is more than doubleHonolulu is a big city with lack of parking space in Waikiki and Downtown so be prepared to spend quite a lot of money for parking.We managed to park overnight at paid public parking next to ZOO, it cost 1 dollar an hour.As far as location , it is not bad , not directly on the beach but very close.Breakfast is served on 3 rd floor in outdoor area, could be windy but you can take a tray and go to your room, complaints about elevator I will dismiss, for a gods sake you are on the vacation,waiting 20-40 seconds for an elevator is not a big deal.To splurge little bit I would consider Sheraton Waikiki or Outrigger but this one carries lot of value.

We had an excellent time at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Wish we were back there right now! The hotel was clean and sooo close to the beach. Loved the kimchi and pickles on the (free!) breakfast buffet. The staff was very accommodating. Lynn, in particular, was incredibly kind and welcoming. After my husband and I checked in, she walked us to the elevator, pointing out all of the features of the hotel along the way. Throughout our stay she greeted us and always asked if we needed anything. Sometimes we did, and she was always eager to help us out. So friendly and kind. We will definitely be coming back to this hotel!

The hotel is not directly on the beach but only a 3 minute walk to it. Most hotels on Waikiki, except the very expensive high-end ones, are across the street from the beach and the Hyatt Regency (more expensive) is like that. The Hyatt Place is 2 blocks removed from the beach but offers all the amenities you need for much less - including a free breakfast every day The staff were very accommodating and relocated us to a larger room with more space. The hotel offers free beach towels and there are lounge chairs on the beach for rent. Overall a good value. If you want directly on Waikiki beach there are a few, but be prepared to pay a lot. If you want directly across the street, there are several but they too are more expensive. We found the Hyatt Place very convenient to the beach, the strip and all of it's amenities for a great price.

Nice hotel (friendly front desk and attentive valet). BTW: You have to valet if you stay at this hotel (a little pricey, $30 per day). The real downside was construction that started in the adjacent room at 8am (it was low drilling, hammering, moving of furniture). The situation was discussed with the manager, but no follow up was received.

When I arrived, the bell man said only valet parking available. I asked how much and he said $30. I was staying 9 days for business. A few days after I checked in, I saw a sign that said guest parking $18. This is the same parking garage Hyatt was charging me $30. Does that make much business since? I spoke to the front desk and they lowered the price to $20 a day. This business practice is wrong, you charged your guest more money to park than daily guest to park. If I hadn’t said anything I would have been charged $30 a day. Oh by the way the staff was tell me the only parking was Valet. I am very disappointed.
user_name:
Kevin Thomas F
Harwood, United States

review_body: Had a great experience at this hotel, good location within walking distance to the beach and the Main Street for Waikiki, breakfast was pretty good.Staff was friendly and helpful, hotel is clean and modernWould stay here again if we ever visit Waikiki again

Just returned from a one week stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach Hotel.Checkin was prompt and we were given an amazing room on the 11th floor.The views of the mountains and the ocean were spectacular.We thought the location were great.Close proximity to the beach and the zoo.Also what was great about the location of the transit close by.All the staff were encountered were great!Always pleasant when we were asking questions!Special thanks to Leonida in housekeeping for her pleasant nature and care in keeping our room clean.We had a great week and will definately return!Also we never had a problem with waiting for the elevators as previously mentioned in other reviews!Mahalo!!!

Very nice hotel. Staff very friendly and happy. Rooms very clean. Breakfast was excellent. The only thing is the pool. A bit small but no a deal breaker. Overall I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is close to beach, buses, and trolleys.

The room was beautiful and well maintained. Breakfast was okay, but needed more protein and fresh local fruit choices. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The nice lady at the front desk upon check in upgraded us to a ocean view, which was very kind, because it was my children's first trip (they'll remember, they were too young before.) We were able to get towels for the beach, but some sort of beach chair would have been nice to rent/borrow from hotel during our visit. More info about what was going on around the local area and maybe some help with finding good local food without spending $100 per meal for 4 would have been great!

My stay was very comfortable. Situated right were you would like to be in Honolulu. However, the breakfast provided was not of good flavor. It was very windy this morning and breakfast was served on the balcony, everyday. It made it difficult to eat besides my food turning immediately cold.

The beds, the beds!!! I still think about the beds. Super comfortable beds. Great checkin, lovely staff all over. Breakfast was good, enough options to choose from if you wanna make it till lunch. Coffee shop open 24/7

A good place for families because the price of breakfast is included in the rate. Easy walking distance to the beach and public bus. At check in was told I was given an upgraded room--arrived to find 2 beds, somewhat tired looking room. Return to front desk and was told the king I booked would be standard, small and I would need to wait a few hours.She stated she had given me a room "better for me". I told her I would wait and that I did not book a standard room. Second room assigned was much nicer--large, king, newly refurbished, sofa (although the cushions slid off when you sat on it)--the category I had booked. Bed/pillows very comfortable. Refrigerator & safe in room. Elevator situation is a disaster. Long waits, especially at breakfast, because there are only two for the entire building. Breakfast was like a cattle call, masses of people in a frenzy to get food. Pool is very small. Depending on who you get at the front desk, they can be very helpful with bus schedules and travel questions. Don't bother with the Expedia travel desk--their goal is to sell overpriced excursion "deals". If a decent rate is offered I would recommend this hotel, also keep in mind there is no resort fee as is the case for most other hotels in the area.

This hotel offers what is essential, a very comfortable bed, a quiet room, convenient location, near great dining and shopping and the ocean. It is affordable and you do not pay for the fluff that you do not normally use.

The hotel is well managed, clean, comfortable and very convenient to the beach and other facilities. The rooms are very clean and comfortable although smaller than the the conventional Hyatt Place; however this does not detract from the other benefits.

From the moment I stepped into the open foyer at check-in, Jarren took great care of me. Professional and pleasant to deal with, he guided me through check in and explained the hotels amenities.The front desk, always smiling, can answer 95 percent of your questions and the location is great to the beach and good restaurants.Would definitely comeback and stay.

We stayed here a few nights. You get what you pay for here. Nothing special. The rooms we small and noisy, and ours had a mildew smell. The bed was quite uncomfortable. You could hear everything in the halls, the wind, and people coming and going from their rooms. The location was so-so. They also don't have enough parking, forcing to you to pay high fees for valet or use the parking structure that is catty-corner from the hotel. So be prepared to shell out extra money for that. Also, be careful with the valet. First time we dropped off a brand new car with 15 miles on it, they tired to say that the trunk was dented and scratched. Completely untrue. I felt they were trying to mark the car because of how they have to park multiple cares so close together that they were trying to cover themselves if something did happen. And when we questioned them about it and had them bring the car out to show us the damage. When we should them there was no damage they just said oh it must have been a mistake. We are so use to seeing scratches and dents on the back of vehicles because of the way people handle their luggage. Not sure I buy that. After that I stated that their had not be any damage to our car, as it was brand new. So if you do use valet, check your car carefully each and every time. Also, be prepared to wait some time for them to bring your car. Not quite the standards I'm use to when it comes to a Hyatt hotel.

We decided to book into the Hyatt Place in Waikiki which was just off the main strip in Waikiki. Less than 2 blocks down to the main Waikiki Beach. Our check in was easy and since our room was not ready, they upgraded us to a different room which was much higher up and had a great view out to the ocean. The room was clean, and for something this close to the beach did not have any of the normal musty smells that some do. The hotel staff was excellent from the maid service all the way up to the front counter staff and event planners. Everyone was very helpful and did whatever they could to make sure our stay was excellent. We loved the ease of our location to everything along with the fact those nights we came back to the room early, we could sit on our balcony and watch the beautiful nights. The room rates were excellent and equal to one of the 2 star hotels, but never losing the Hyatt standard of excellence. We will definitely look to stay here again on our next visit and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great hotel close to everything.

Tidy, clean, but rather small room. Bed is too soft and could hurt the back. The ocean king room on the 12th floor (second to the top) has an obstructed view of other hotels near the beach front. Around midnight and early morning, noise from cars reverse for parking nearby is heard very annoying while sleeping. Swimming pool on the 3rd floor is tiny and impractical. Breakfast is OK, but not the full one. Hotel's personnels are kind and eager to help. Overall is positive if do not mind not being on the beach- only reality is a clean three-star hotel with high price (though without ashamed "resort fee", most other hotels will charge).

We enjoyed every aspect of our stay: the room décor, the spaciousness, the décor of the lobby, the lovely business center, the quality breakfast, nice fitness room, friendly staff, short walk to the beach, the restaurants and shops. Our only complaint was the consistently long wait for the elevator. I would have preferred to take the stairs, but the staircase exit is outside and there is no way to enter it with the room key.

Arrived late and parked in the structure that is catty-corner to the hotel. $20 in advance (cash-only) with in and out privileges. Assigned room 1421 which was perfect (top floor corner room looking at Diamond Head). This had two queens (soft) and a single sofa bed (ridiculously soft). Massive safe in the room and very good AC.The buildings around the hotel look a little ghetto but the area is safe. There is an ABC store to the left of the hotel which sells huge bottles of water for $1 ($3.50 in the room).Complimentary breakfast is served on Level 3. It was okay but the eggs were nasty. Interesting addition of a Japanese section to cater for the majority of guests. It was a great place to stay for a night (I like this end of Waikiki) but I couldn't imagine spending too much time here.

This was my first time at the Hyatt Place. Honestly, I didn't expect to be impressed but the greeting that I received at the front desk was genuine and friendly. When I got to the room, I was indeed surprised that it felt new and clean and well-kept. Although small (which I did expect), it provided me with everything I needed. No frills. I would return to this hotel and explore the surroundings on my next visit.

The good:- Nicely appointed, functional rooms- Free breakfast and wifi- Friendly staff- 24/7 pickup food service - No resort feeThe bad:- Slow elevator- Overwhelmed valet- Water pressure could be a little better- Seems to be favored by tour package companies Recently the wife and I need somewhere to stay thanks to a (private) sewer line break where we live. Now, my primary chain of choice is Marriott, which I hold elite status with. But I like Hyatt too and have status with them as well. The price of the Hyatt Place was comparable to the Courtyard Waikiki, but the Hyatt Place comes with free breakfast and slightly cheaper parking, so we decided to give it a try.We arrived at about 8pm, so there was little traffic heading into the hotel. The valets helped us immediately and even asked (I'm guessing since we were dressed in business attire and since we're local) what time we'd like to have our car in the morning and they'd have it out by then! At check-in, the staff greeted us warmly, acknowledge our status, and proactively offered an upgrade. For this stay, we were assigned room 1739; a deluxe king room with a city view. Now, I'm not on vacation, so I could really care less what the view is. I do appreciate the high-floor, which helps cut down on street noise, though the elevators are fairly slow... and there's only 2 of them (at least for the main tower). When we hauled our tired bodies to our room, we were pleasantly surprised to find a rather large room with a nice sofa, a large safe, generous storage space, a large mini fridge, a 42" HDTV, a cozy work desk, and a plush king bed. The bathroom is a little small, but is functional and isn't claustrophobic like some other Waikiki properties. The a/c was a little noisy for my liking, but definitely not the worst I've experience, nor was it that much of a bother. The water pressure in the shower could have been better, but again, not a deal killer. Unlike many other similar limited service hotels, the Hyatt Place has a 24/7 pickup dining option. The menu isn't HUGE like at some full service hotels, but it has a nice decent selection and the food was of surprisingly good quality/taste (especially compared to Courtyard by Marriott's Bistro concept) and value! The wife ordered the soup + half chicken caesar salad, while I ordered a bacon cheddar burger with fruit (choice of fruit or chips). My burger actually ended up coming with both (score!), but the burger itself filled me up and I took the fruit with me to work the next day. The wife liked her meal as well, though the half salad actually looked like a full size! On our second day, we got out of the hotel quickly, but had to skip breakfast since it starts at 6:30 and we needed to get to work! Upon return later that evening, however, the porte-cochere was jam packed and we ended up waiting almost 15 minutes to drive up. It took valet another 10 minutes to get our car to their garage. A similar issue arose on our final day when we left mid-morning (I took off from work), with a bit of a wait to get our car. I don't blame the valets for this; I simply think they're overwhelmed. The final day we did get to the breakfast too, which consisted of link sausage, scrambled eggs, french toast, several varieties of cereals and baked goods, yogurt, cottage cheese, oatmeal, assorted pastries, toast, fruit, rice, miso soup, juice, milk, coffee, and tea. It was a nice spread for a free meal for sure! So if I ever have a need to stay at a hotel again or simply want a staycation, I wouldn't hesitate to return to the Hyatt Place Waikiki. I think it's one of the best deals around with good quality and value. It certainly ranks high on my list!

It was our first time to stay @ Hyatt Place and we love it. Great stay, definitely would come back and recommend to others. Excellent customer service, housekeeping and love the free wifi and breakfast.

I stayed in Hyatt Place in Santa Fe in 2014 and I truly enjoyed it. Therefore, I want to give a try on Hyatt again. And I have to say this one is truly disappointing.First of all, there is no good ocean view from most hotel rooms because the hotel is surrounded by a bunch of old buildings. I am a Hyatt Platinum member and I asked for room upgrade around 2pm. And the staff told me they cannot find any room for me.Second, parking is quite expensive. No-self parking available although they advertise that. My suggestion is to park your car in the Zoo public parking. The walk is about 3 mins.The worst thing of this hotel is that no greetings from hotel staffs when you walk through the lobby. We have been in & out of the hotel for more than 6 times. A few hotel staffs passed by us without any greetings. I am truly confused reading other guest comments saying this is a friendly hotel.....The only good thing I want to comment is the bellman service. Those guys are much more polite and helpful than the hotel staffs staying in the shell.

We wanted to avoid a big resort and the resort fees. This was perfect, short walk to the beach and The Bus but quiet location. Breakfast was included, a big plus for Waikiki, all fresh and well stocked. We had a large king suite, very nice but the lanai was small, probably the only negative. Staff was friendly and helpful. Parking is reasonable for the area, but plenty of free parking from 6pm to 10 am on Monsarrat and nearby side streets. Would definitely stay there again.

We found this hotel to be very good, in an excellent location, and worked out well for what we needed. I think the Hyatt is always well cared for with quality staff. Our room was very clean and the beds comfortable. We ordered food, (salads and soup) from the Gallery, and it was well prepared.

Had a spacy ocean facing room with glorious views. Just off the main strip but still close proximity to the beach and many popular shops/bars/restuarants. Convenient tour pick up spot across the road. Staff incredibly helpful at all times during our 7 day stay especially the concierge folks who were great with their local knowledge and recommendations

Friendly helpful staff. Clean room. Smallish room but nice. Large tv. Free breakfast is ok only, but will get you started with the day. Hotels in honolulu tend to be expensive. This was one of the ones that I'd stay in again. Pretty good for the price.

Can not say enough about the staff. The front Desk, Bellman, staff at the breakfast, housekeeping. All a great bunch of people. We stayed in 2041, housekeeper was Lei and she was wonderful. Always had room clean by 9:00am very polite. Went for breakfast and Craig and Fred had all food filled. They have a hard job to keep everything clean with guest leaving the tables dirty. The staff have a wonderful Assistant GM, Ihab. Can't wait to return

Probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at!! Stayed here for 7 nights and was very accommodating and comfy. A very nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and professionalThe complimentary buffet breakfast is a great way to start the day, which is a large area and beside the pool.Our room was cleaned everyday and the balcony overlooking the ocean is great although there were other hotels in the way you Can see the ocean through the gaps. I would recommend the higher the better whilst staying at this hotel. The elevators do take a bit longer than usual, but dont let that ruin anything. The concierge booking the activities is very helpful and would recommend going to the lady there she is friendly and very helpful, we booked 3 activities with her.5 min walk near the beach, McDonalds, burger king, little bars10 min walk from the shops, restaurants and cafes.I would definitely recommend staying here!!!

We loved our stay at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki, simple design new built, friendly and helpful staff, a special thanks to Annabelle and Jade...We enjoyed the generous and great quality breakfast every morning which was included in rate, must try the Santa Fe bagels!.The location is ideal two minutes walk from the Waikiki sea front, so in a quitter spot, but if you can still get a sea view depending what room you get.I would definitely return here when in Honolulu!

The staff at Hyatt Waikiki go above and beyond and ensure they are meeting every need. However, the building which was clearly not designed as a Hyatt makes the overall experience stressful. The elevators are a primary complaint if you are staying in the first tower, it takes at least 7 minutes to catch one and they do not have a service elevator for the staff. If you attempt to get on the elevator when cleaning staff is coming on shift, forget it, they pull their carts on and make it impossible to load. That coupled with the fact the primary clients are large families-- the elevator experience, crowds and time lapses make this a hotel to stay at only if you are not in Hawaii for enjoyment, or have zero interest in the Hotel.

As a business traveler, I often (meaning monthly) have the pleasure of visiting the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Hands down, a very comfortable, clean and convenient place to stay. Easy access to Waikiki, & even easier access to get out and about. My home away from home.
user_location: Elk Grove Village, IL, United States
user_name:
Christopher C
Elk Grove Village, IL, United States

review_body: Booked a room for 3 adults going by the photo's on their web site. We were given a small room with a king bed & a sofa bed which was "WAY" smaller than a standard single bed, so our son who is 23 hardly slept. Also gave us 2 of everything although 3 adults were staying.

Staff is gracious, friendly and helpful. Cost savings by staying 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach is substantial. Place is clean. Breakfast is large a varied buffet. Rooms are about 500 sq feet. With 2Q's and large pull out sofa, can get 6 in a room.

The hotel was Very nice, they upgraded us for free, our 25th Anniversary Vacation. Beds were So Comfy, the View Was Great, Could See the Beaches , Diamond Head and all along the Hotel strip area. Didn't care for the Parking Fee's but parking is at a premium.

Great location at the end of the Waikiki strip, Ocean just steps from entrance, many quality restaurants within a few blocks, Bus routes very close by. Continental Breakfast always very well laid out and a great selection. Highly recommended and we will come back to this hotel in the future
user_name:
Dale E J
Columbus Ohio, United States

review_body: The location was great. Primarily I booked this hotel for its location - I didn't want to be too far out of Waikiki Beach. You walk around the corner and you're immediately facing the beach and the street lined with shops (stores) and some eateries. The staff that I've talked to have been friendly and they go out of their way to help you. The room was definitely big enough and the bed was super comfortable. The only thing I'd point out is because I had a city-view room on the 2nd floor, it was a bit noisy from the street (especially on Friday night) and noisy outside my room (sounded like wind howling). I would still recommend this hotel for its location, free buffet breakfast, comfortable room and helpful, friendly staff.

A couple of blocks from Waikki and across the street from a pickup area for many bus tours, this is an excellent choice for families and couples. Daily breakfast is varied and good...and, best of all, part of the deal! From the moment we arrived until the last day, each staff member was friendly and informative. We had LOTS of questions which we asked over and over...they were patient and kind. The rooms were clean and well appointed. I highly recommend this hotel!

Comfortable, two blocks from the beach. Nothing fancy. There is limited bar and food service on premises, but those are available in abundance a few steps away. The breakfast buffet is quite good, with items for Asian as well as standard Western tastes. This hotel is good for smaller business and academic conferences.

It located at the east end of Waikiki beach and near to it . Employees are friendly and helpful . Since my room is not suitable they changed for me. That's good . It's also near to the Honolulu zoo which is a good place for children . There are several restaurants nearby . The breakfast is poor . The views in room is not so good for it surrounded by buildings.

I was here for a business trip and the Hyatt Place was perfect. It is one of few hotels in the area that offers a great rate with no additional resort fee (most hotels tack on top of the cost of the room). The wi-fi was also included which it great for someone like myself that need it for business and it is vital that I have access to the internet. The free daily breakfast offered many choices that will satisfy any palate. It was nice to sit outside to enjoy breakfast before heading to work. This hotel is about 3 short blocks from the beach and all the shopping and activities available to you in Waikiki. The staff was very friendly and many addressed me by name throughout my stay. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. I had dinner in the cafe two times and both were delicious and satisfying. The valets were also prompt when retrieving my car and very friendly. Several evenings we would sit in the open air lobby and work...it was lovely to be able to enjoy the fresh air after being inside all day. There is a pool on the 3rd level of hotel but unfortunately it is in the shade for majority of the day, so if you are trying to sunbathe, I suggest walking to the beach. The hotels has towels available for you take to the beach. The housekeeping staff was extremely helpful in returning an item to me that I left in my room but did not realize I had forgotten until I was home. I appreciated the effort that was made to return my property.The only negative and I cannot even say it is a bad thing, but the in room air conditioner's lowest allowed temperature setting is 68 degrees. I like a very cold room to sleep in so that was not quite cold enough for me. :-) I left the fan running at all times so that helped.I will definitely stay here when I return to Waikiki. Whether it is for business or pleasure it is a great place to relax and to work!

A very nice hotel. The staff were very friendly, professional and accommodating. There were a few issues, but nothing that would prevent me from staying here again. The breakfast is awesome and sets the day off on a positive note. The hotel is clean and the rooms were clean and nice. Close to the beach! Also, close to affordable places to eat (e.g. Subway, Burger King, Jamba Juice). I'm not advocating fast food, but if you have the time to explore further, healthier options are also within walking distance. Very close to the beach! It was a great place to stay!

There were 8 members in my family and the hotel was able to comfortably accommodate all of us with the 2 queens / sofa bed for each room AND the rooms were adjacent. The hot breakfast offered just enough food selection. We were able to use the lounge area to visit with our family that lived on the island. We were able to always find parking for our SUV in parking lot across the street from the hotel despite all parking restrictions in waikiki.

Great hotel - Great Staff - Wonderful value for the price. We checked in and were upgraded to an ocean view room. The front desk staff were personable and helpful and the valet staff were very efficient and friendly.

I live on island, but sometimes I want a nice gettaway. Hyatt Place usually has very good rates for the quality of the hotel. Even though I can get cheaper rooms, nothing in the same price range compares to the luxury and cleanliness of Hyatt Place.

I was there a business but I would definitely stay at this hotel again with the family. Facilities are nice with an outstanding staff. All your needs are meet by this outstanding staff...Nick will pour you an awesome MaiTai or cold draft beer and the breakfast on the 3rd floor is very nice (can be a little windy though). I suggest you go early. Your walk to the beach is very short and all venues are nearby. You'll like this place!

We were looking for a place in/near Waikiki to stay while we took in the sights before heading off to Maui for a week. I had stayed at this hotel for work about 6 months earlier and enjoyed my brief stay then, however as we booked our room through a discount travel web page we didn't know where/what hotel we would get. I was pleasantly surprised to find upon booking we would be staying there again. It's a great hotel with a fabulous staff, very professional but friendly too. I highly recommend it!
user_name:
Gerald B
Lancaster, CA, United States

review_body: Probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Excellent room, great staff, terrific buffet breakfast, served outdoors. Very close to the beach and shopping. Strongly recommend. Price seems high, but is in line with Waikiki hotels.

I've been to Oahu now 5 times since 2010 and have stayed in 6 different upscale properties in Waikiki because of promotions each was running. I've gravitated towards the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach because of:1. Great Staff2. Great Rooms3. Location, Location, Location 4. Awesome Valet and Concierge Services5. Aloha Friday Happy Hour on the 1st floor6. Great value for a good price 7. Both towers I've stayed in had great views from each roomI parked across the street at the recommendation of the valets for $20 a day with in and out privileges -- the hotel parking was full. No worries though, because although the garage is not owned by the hotel, the location across the street was close enough for a single traveler. I'm going back to Oahu at the end of the year on a trip with my parents and siblings, and I'm excited to show them one of Oahu's best kept secrets. Thank you Hyatt Place Waikiki for another amazing trip...Mahalo and Cheers!

Clean, up to date, friendly staff and fantastic location. Lots to do within walking distance and close to the Bus stop. The complementary breakfast was nice, however, not a whole lot of variety. The business center is handy and the excursions were easy to book.

Its my 5th time on the island but my stay at the Hyatt place Waikiki Beach bring a whole knew experience at a higher level, great welcome, clean and wonderful hospitality. I will definitely recommend my friends and family to stay at the Hyatt place Waikiki beach.A+++

In Hawaii, hotels and resorts tend to be pricey, and this one perhaps is if you only look at price. Comparing Hyatt Place Waikiki to other hotels in Waikiki, we found this to be an excellent choice for us, a young family of 5. Here's why: 1) 2 blocks from the beach - specifically the part of the beach that has been made into an artificial lagoon which makes it perfect for young kids who don't necessarily know how to swim. 2) Walking distance to almost everything you need which eliminates the need for a car rental. 3) Hot breakfast every day on the rooftop patio - aside from eliminating the cost of a breakfast at a restaurant, it also has the benefit of not needing to leave the hotel to have that breakfast. Our routine for the weeks that we stayed here was to wake up, go down to the roof patio have breakfast, go back to our room and get ready for the day's activities. 4) Clean, modern hotel - many Waikiki hotels are old and show their age (pastel colours, limited wifi access, odd room layouts, etc.). We found Hyatt place to have modern clean decor, good wifi access, modern TV which allowed us to hook up our camera's to see the photos we had taken and our room was spacious enough to fit our family - 2 queen beds, and plenty of floor space for the crib. The staff are friendly and helpful and they go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your stay. All in all, this hotel was a big part of the reason we enjoy Hawaii so much. This isn't the first time we've stayed here and it won't be the last!

The hotel looks like it is new. The staff are friendly and helpful. Their breakfast is great. The hotel is only about three minutes from Waikiki Beach. It is a great place to stay in the Waikiki area.
user_name:
Neil Bruce R
Independence, United States

review_body: We were looking for a good place to stay but did not need the Resort-styled places since we planned on being out most of the time. The hotel was clean, reasonably quiet, good location close to the beach and close to frequent bus routes. The room was spacious, had fairly new carpet, and was well maintained, except for the AC. I had to call upon arrival because it would not cool the room. A prompt service visit got it working for the evening. They came in the next day while we were out to fully fix it.I would consider staying there again.

Helpful staff, 2 blocks from the main street and the beach, close to zoo. Very busy hotel. Charlies Taxi has a negotiated rate from the hotel to the airport. Breakfast was OK . Good wi-fi. Snack bar on site but food is expensive

My family stayed for 5 nights, including 5 adults and a toddler. I am a Hyatt Diamond guest and they were extremely accommodating. The staff remembered our names throughout our stay, took the initiative with offering beach towels, and helped make transportation easy. The valet guys were friendly and let me idle in the driveway while waiting to pick up people. It has a great location, roomy and modern rooms, a good breakfast, and it was very family friendly. Loved our time here. The price was reasonable, and it didn't feel like a budget hotel.

We have just left the Hyatt Place which we stayed in for 2 nights while we waited to get a room at the Hawaian Hilton village. Our check in person ( Lynn) was very sweet. But our surprise came with the room at the Hyatt. It is smaller then a New York hotel. Wow was it small. I would guess about 180 square feet which included the bathroom. Shower only. Water was 3.50 a bottle parking across the street was 20 bucks a night but the hotels was 30 dollars it was a savings of 10 a night. Walkable to the beach. We had 4 huge buildings between us and the ocean. Positives. Room was clean. Bed comfortable. Staff very nice. Negatives. Rooms extremely small. Balcony was about 1 1/2 foot wide. I kid you not. We had two sideways chairs on this balcony because they could not be turned front out. And there was this funky unit on the balcony that looked like an old generator For the cost it was not the greatest value.

The location of this hotel was perfect! Easy walking distance to the beach and lots of shopping and restaurants. The rooms were very quiet and beds were actually comfortable! The complimentary breakfasts were amazing and full of good choices! The only negative we hade was the size of the rooms themselves. They were a bit smaller than what we are used to or expected, however, we didn't vacation here to stay in the room! The rooms provided a quiet and comfortable place to sleep. Also, the shower was tall and not too small as my husband is 6'4" and that is usually an issue, but not here! Would definitely stay here again.

This is an excellant hotel. Offers free breakfast with a huge selection. Staff is wonderful - so nice and helpful. Our room was nice (ask for a higher floor). Free beach towels to use. A block and a bit from the beach, but not a hassle so we would make trips back to our room throughout the day. Close to the bus stop and many restaurants. I would definately stay here again.

We stayed here for the week ending 02/06/2016. This hotel gives good access to the Waikiki beach area just two blocks away. It has an ocean view but it is limited by some other building in your line of sight. The hotel condition was very good and clean and well kept. The breakfast buffet was good with typical hotel buffet selections of eggs, bacon, sausage, pan cakes, French toast, lots of pineapple, oatmeal, and bread types. Parking was expensive at $25.00 for self parking and $30.00 for valet parking. I would advise taking the city bus to get around $2.50 a ride anywhere you want to go.

We found the staff to be very pleasant no matter who we spoke to. Our flight was delayed coming home and we had to extend our stay. They were very helpful in changing our transport and checking our flights as well. Our room had all the facilities we needed as well as a very comfortable bed. The buffet breakfast was run like a well oiled machine with food and drinks being replenished constantly.

Once again a fabulous experience staying with you, all your staff are so helpful and courteous. I love the location and the fact it's just that far away from the beach. The place is quiet and rooms are spotless

The Hyatt Place is a good value for most travelers. I would suggest it to most. Like anything else, there are good and bad members of the staff. Matt, at the front desk, provided superior service and represented the staff well. He should be rewarded as he was able to pick up the slack for the rest of the staff. The location of the hotel is good, and the rooms are nice and clean. I would recommend it to others. I've had the opportunity to travel around the world and stayed at some of the best places including luxury collections throughout the various chain hotels as well as boutique operators. Honestly, I would rate the Hyatt Place in Waikiki a very good place to stay for the average traveler.

I had contacted the Hotel prior to our arrival as we were arriving from Australia on an early morning flight and I was hoping for an early check in. The hotel promptly replied that they would try and give us an early check In and advised that we could use all the Hotels amenities until our room became available. So on our early arrival at the Hotel unfortunately our room was not ready. The receptionist (Jade) was very curt when I asked to use the Hotels amenities and told me that I should have booked the previous night stay if I wanted todo that. She was most unhelpful and unfriendly and had it been just me & my husband traveling we would have left and tried another hotel. it's not like you are short of choice for accommodation in Waikiki. However as we had our children with us who were tired from the over night flight we decided to wait. Jade didnt take our phone number in order to call us when the room was ready, she just told us to come back in a few hours to check if our room was ready. So we did and were able to get into our room a couple of hours early. The room was a good size but it was at the front corner of the hotel and very noisy from the traffic. The air conditioning was also incredibly loud. Next morning I decided to see if there would be another room. This time I was served by Matt who was absolutely fantastic. He Arranged for us to be shifted to the other tower. The room was much smaller but quieter so we all got a good sleep. Thanks Matt you restored our faith in reception staff! Our housekeeper was Lani, she was very particular with how she left our room and we noticed the difference in the housekeeping standard when she had her days off. The rest of our stay was great. The Hotel is right on the bus route and it's easy to walk to most places. The breakfast area is quite small and it was hard to get a table at times but the menu had something for everyone. The Hotel is near the Zoo, and the beach area there is great for kids. We would return there without hesitation( and hope to get Matt on reception)

Travelled with my mother and two teenage daughters. We had requested adjoining rooms and were delighted with the rooms we were given. Great size rooms that made our 2 week stay really enjoyable. Daily cleaning done well and the breakfast each morning was a great way to start the day. Local bus service right outside the hotel so really easy to get around. So pleased with our stay have decided to return again this time with my husband to celebrate my birthday. Can't wait to stay again hope it's as good as last time.

Stayed here for 5 nights during the pro bowl and enjoyed it very much. It was a short walk to the beach and the Pro Bowl Beach activities. The daily breakfast was a nice bonus and was usually pretty good with a good selection to choose from. The staff was nice and helpful, nice room, a little small but fine for a couple. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Place. The staff were friendly and helpful, they generally had a smile on their face and were more than happy to provide recommendations on places to see and things to do. The facilities and services offered were great, especially the 24/7 gym and free Wi-Fi. Furthermore, the buffet breakfast was an added bonus and a huge range of food was offered to guests to keep them satisfied.

My wife and I have been staying at Hyatt Place even before it was Hyatt place, many upgrades have been made and the breakfast is out of this world!! The staff are always helpful, kind and courteous...never a bad thing to say about the staff. The room we had this time 316 was a bit cramped and the view was not desirable at all but didn't really spend much time in there and the bed linens were clean and bed comfortable. We contemplate staying somewhere else when we make our yearly trip but we always end up back at Hyatt Place and are never dissatisfied with the choice!

As I stated the house keepers stole a GoPro from our room while I was at a work conference and my fiance was sleeping after a morning hike. Once we asked for the security tapes the GoPro showed up at the front desk. Absolutely the most disrespectful thing I have ever experienced.
