First for them to come into the room while my fiance was asleep, and then to take our personal property. That is criminal.

This hotel is about 2 blocks from the beach, with a few ocean views if you are on the upper floors. It was convenient to many restaurants, the ubiquitous ABC stores (have everything including fresh takeout foods) and the beach. The pool is minimal and not meant for daylong lounging. Ample breakfast buffet comes with all rooms-gives you a good start for your day.

This was my 3rd time here and I've always said I would write a review since my first visit but always get too lazy to do so...This hotel is always a great stay for me. Nice comfy, clean, and very modern style which I love. Free breakfast on the 3rd floor and the pool is up there too. The pool is small but that doesn't matter cuz the larger pool is literally a min away, the beach! I like that it is a non smoking hotel and pet friendly. That is a huge plus for me. The staff were awesome as always. I think her name was Lyn who checked me in this time. I always take note of the person I check in with or anyone who helps me because I like to write things down to help me remember my experiences. She was great and so was the bell man Ted who also helped me last year. Such a energetic nice man he is. The valet was a bit slow but that didn't really bother me. It did bother some people waiting around to get their car. The last time I visited, a young lady Ciamarr checked me in and was very kind, professional and probably had the best guest service I've ever come across in all hotels that I've stayed in. Another young lady name Chris was very helpful as well. She made a latte for me and was very friendly. Both of these young ladies smiles always brought light to my stays. I was sad that I did not see any of them this time. Very very friendly staff! The store that used to be in the lobby is no longer there. I forgot the name of it. The bartender also always provided great service. I. The third floor kitchen everyone was helpful too. I still find it funny what they do to try to get rid of the birds. Does not bother me at all but I am sure that it will bother some other people. There is one guy who I used to always see cleaning the lobby but I never had the chance to get his name. Overall I would recommend this hotel. The service is always great which is the number one thing that matters the most for me. I will be visiting again late this year!

We stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt Place at Waikiki Beach, and really enjoyed it. Staff was friendly and helpful, room was big and clean, and breakfast was plentiful and well orchestrated. The offered a lei making class in the lobby that my wife took advantage of. Beach is a block away, and they had free towels to lend you. We had a car one night, and self parking seemed an issue, but we were able to use a parking structure across the street of $20.

Hotel was nice enough if you do not plan on spending a lot of time at the hotel which should be the case as you are in Hawaii. The pool was tiny and the food options were pretty slim. The hotel was a bit outdated and the noise from the ally running next to the hotel was really loud. If you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and very few amenities

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for four nights. It is a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach, but we didn't plan on spending all of our time there so that was fine. We could walk to nearby entertainment on kalakaua ave.It is a three star hotel. The room was basic/nice with two comfortable queen beds, terrace, small fridge, no microwave. A/C and wifi worked well. Bathroom was basic. Good for our family of 4. We had a mountain view facing the Diamond Head crater on the 14th floor. Breakfast on the 3rd floor was nice with all you would expect. The pool is near the breakfast area but was much too small. They have good valet parking for $30 per day. Nearby $20/nt. self parking lot only takes cash, so I went with the valet service. Service was friendly and prompt from the front desk, housecleaning, bell captain, maintenance.Would come back again.
user_name:
Avi G
Highland Park, New Jersey

review_body: Our stay the hotel was great- the staff was very friendly and accommodated to our needs. The room was very clean and we really liked the layout of the room and how spacious it was (two double beds, separated by a living room area with a queen pull out). The beds were also very comfortable! We certainly enjoyed the free complimentary breakfast every morning, it was a decent selection and we thought it was a great value for our stay, as not every hotel in waikiki offers this. The location was also preferable, because it was on the end of the strip that is not as congested and busy- but do get prepared to do some walking and bring some good walking shoes with you, if you choose to explore more of the strip. For the rate we got and the positive experience from staying at this hotel- we would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

The temperature in our room was too warm for our comfort. The thermostat was set at 68 and the A/C unit was blowing cool air but not very hard. I would guess the temperature was in the mid to upper 70's the entire time. We didn't use any blankets at night to sleep. We called the front desk the 2nd night and told them our room wasn't getting cool and they connected us to a maintenance technician who remotely adjusted our thermostat to 60. But that's not going to make the room any cooler when it wasn't able to reach the 68 temperature it was set at before. This was really the only negative aspect about the stay, besides the crappy view off the balcony.

We stayed here from January 20th-25th. I was a bit concerned when I saw the tall buildings between the hotel and beach. However, my worries were for nothing. We received a warm welcome at reception and were quickly in our room on the 18th floor looking out the window at an amazing view, To the left was Diamond Head and to the right was the ocean. The tall building was in-between. The room was large, super clean and had two queen beds, a desk, nice dresser and a large screen TV, The Hyatt beds are super comfortable. The bathroom was small but well laid out. There was a separate room for the toilet and shower. The shower had a great arcing curtain rod and two shower heads. The toilet was the fanciest I have seen. It had a heated seat, front and rear washing options and dryer. The hotel is a short block to Waikiki on the end near the zoo, which is much less crowded than the other end. We enjoyed the free breakfast each morning. It consisted of breakfast breads as well as yogurt, oatmeal, bacon or sausage and eggs. There was something for everyone. All the staff were very friendly, from Nick the bartender to our maid. It was a great stay and I would return. I thought it was a great room for the reasonable rate.

Clean and convenient. breakfast was brief but acceptable. a cozy pool, my kid enjoyed plying in it. in summary everything was good but room was a little bit small and we had parking issue, but used valet parking for $30/night.

We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. We love the free breakfast and the location. Some of the rooms are small, but ours was great. Our air conditioning on this trip didn't work great. But otherwise it was a good trip.

I stayed overnight here and found a mostly comfortable room at a good location and a good price (if any price at Waikiki can be described that way). Room: Large and comfortable, except the bathroom was cramped and just barely large enough for me to function. Ample hot water was instantly available without wait. Wi-fi worked well. Valet parking is mandatory, and it added $30 to my overnight stay. Had to wait about 10 minutes at check-in for the valet to take the vehicle, and about the same wait at checkout.Front desk service was excellent.Not quite so good: Long waits at the elevators. Not easy to get up and down quickly. The breakfast bar had ample choices but not laid out well to handle the masses of people getting food, beverages and finding tables. The staff was doing its best but really the problem is the space -- there just isn't enough of it to handle the volume of choices (all were good that I tried) and the volume of people.All things considered, I would still choose this hotel if I came back to Waikiki.

We live in Honolulu and my husband and I did a staycation in Waikiki for a night. We were very impressed with the Hyatt Place. It isn't a 5-star hotel, but it doesn't have 5-star hotel prices either. What we loved:- Decent sized rooms with good amenities. Comfy bed and pillows, strong air conditioning, good sized bathroom area, coffee maker with complimentary coffee and tea- Complimentary buffet breakfast with eggs, bacon, baked goods, yoghurt and fruit- Free wifi- Clean and spacious lobby with many TVs and computer terminals - Friendly demeanor from every hotel employee we ran into- Great location; off Kalakaua and away from the noise, but a close enough walk to the beachThe pool is small and unimpressive, but you're in Hawaii...go to the beach!

We stay in Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach Hotel for 4 nights on our 23rd Marriage Anniversary. The location of the hotel is very good. We arrived at around 11 am and found that our room is not ready. For that we went out to the nearby park where we took our first picture on our honeymoon 23 years ago. After having lunch, we returned to the hotel at around 1 pm and found that our room has been ungraded and a complimentary bottle of Champagne was send to our room. As we do not drink alcohol, they replaced it with two bottles of Hawaiian Mango Soda drinks. The room was of good size with a narrow balcony. We could see the ocean from our room. Both the room and the bathroom were clean. The bed was comfortable. Air-condition in the room worked well. Breakfast was ample and delicious. The wifi was fast. The hotel staffs were very helpful and courteous.There is a tour desk in the lobby. We booked our tours from there. The tour buses starts just outside the hotel. If anyone has a wish to do shopping in Honolulu, I would suggest to go to Waikele Premium Outlets where one can buy brand named products at least 40-50% or even more discounted rates. Travel to Waikele Premium Outs can be done by bus (more than 1 hr ride) or by Roberts Hawaii tour bus which leaves from just in front of the hotel. The public bus stop is just across the road at the corner of the hotel. One can go to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, Wal Mart, Ross Dress for Less, Target store from this Bus Stop. Each ride is $2.5. Do not forget to ask for Transfer Ticket if you need to change bus or return. The transfer is usually valid for 3 hrs. The ABC store is 2 mins walk away and the famous Waikiki Beach is 4 mins walk away. There are many restaurants on the Kalakaua Avenue. There are Mc Donald’s, Burger King nearby.This is a fantastic hotel with a very good location and good service. I definitely will recommend others to stay in this hotel.

All staff were very accommodating and pleasant; rooms were clean & spacious. The hotel was located at a more quiet end of Waikiki. I enjoyed staying there very much and would recommend with no hesitation. Greg L
user_name:
Gregory L
Chaska, mn, United States

review_body: Overall loved this hotel. Had good sized room for all the family. Was a bit to close to the lift so heard all the comings and goings. Breakfast was perfect and in a great open area. Very close to everything. Bathroom and room spotless clean.

We chose this hotel for its price and location. This hotel is a short walk- literally only 5 minutes away- from the beach. We stayed in a queen double bed room with mountain view. View wasn't all that great but room was spacey plus you get free wifi and free breakfast. Ignore the complaints! People love to complain about things like poor wifi connection and the fact that breakfast eating area is semi-outdoors. Who cares? Wifi and breakfast are free. Most other hotels, you have to pay for every additional thing. Plus, this hotel doesn't have additional nightly fees like others do. The wifi worked just fine for us plus if you really need to get online, there is a business area you can use for the computers. Breakfast had a variety of options and was just fine. This hotel is GREAT and worth its price compared to other pricey hotels nearby. Hotel is located near the Honolulu Zoo at the start of Waikiki Beach. Restaurants and shopping centers are all within walking distance. We were able to walk from one end of the beach to the other end near Hilton and total walking distance was about 20-30 minutes. Not bad at all if you don't mind the walking. We surely enjoyed the location and accessibility of this hotel. Plus, staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay at this hotel again. It's surely a bargain! Parking fee was $25/night for self parking and $35/night for valet with in/out privileges.

Clean hotel with accommodative service representatives. Free breakfast is a plus! Cole from front desk gave us a nice room and excellent service such as free champagne for our honeymoon. The only two complaints are the noise of the elevator and the tiny swimming pool (just good to look at). Good location to Waikiki beach. I recommend!

This hotel is a great place for small families (3 people) and foreigners. More mid-high prices. Staffs are super friendly, they upgrade from a tiny room to a suite. Rooms are standard clean not filled with sands like other beaches I visited. Not complimentary water in rooms, they put in on desk and charge $3.50. Large rooms here, no electricity or water problem. Shower Toiletries that I use at home. Other basic stuff are charge like toothpaste or toothbrush. Public areas are overall perfect 24/7 gym, 10am-10pm pool, and international breakfast. Breakfast are good, feel like home, everything is in its proper containers beautifully prepare, not take a carton of milk from the fridge or peel your yogurt, and you don't eat in foam plates. If you are from Asia or prefer Asian food, there's some kimchee, and miso soup. If you are going to Waikiki ask the front desk for beach towels. Overall you get a lot of facilities because you pay a lot. It's balance.
user_name:
Tannertan
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Perfect spot to stay. The room was big with a seating area and the beds super comfortable.They provide beach towels which is great and there is no resort fee.The pool is small and functional but we went to Waikiki to swim at the beach not a pool.Breakfast was good enough to get you started for the day with a couple of hot choices everyday.The bus runs right past the hotel on the corner which we found very handy. We hopped on the bus to diamond head, Pearl Harbor and alamoana shopping centre with ease.The staff were helpful and friendly.We couldn't of asked for a better hotel.The beach is at the end of the street which is about a 3 min walk.Free wifi too!

The hotel and their excellent staff will make you feel that you become a part of their big family. The hotel location is at the heart of Waikiki and the rooms are significantly larger than any other rooms that I've been of the same category. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

This was an ideal hotel for our family trip to Waikiki. It was walking distance to the beach, the zoo, outstanding restaurants and great shopping. Free breakfast was excellent. The only disappointment was the pool, which is tiny and drab, but you don't a pool when the beach is warm, close, calm and uncrowded.

We stayed here in lieu of rushing to get a flight back to Maui after visiting Pearl Harbor. Don't be fooled by getting a room on the 20th floor, though it may have just been the location of the room but we could hear the elevator throughout the duration of our stay. Not the noise the elevator makes once it reaches the floor, but just the elevator whooshing to each floor. They do have a 24/7 eatery with some decent options, but you have to order and then pick up (no room service). The beach and some shops are within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and informed us of the flat rate for cab service to the airport (be sure to take advantage of that at $29 flat rate). The views of the city and mountains are attached.

We were looking for a nice hotel, but low key and found it here. We had a very short stay on Oahu, so were looking for a nice location for walking to restaurants, easy to navigate in and out of and nice amenities. This hit all of our needs. The staff was great, the room was lovely large and clean and we were able to walk to all of our needs. The breakfast was filling and they had plenty of it and yummy coffee. All and all a great place indeed.

The hotel is located in the quieter part of Waikiki next to Kapiolani Park and within a few minutes walk from the beach. Excellent spacious rooms, plentiful breakfast buffet is included in the room price. Staff are very welcoming and accommodating. Have stayed in this hotel three years in a row.

At a recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki, we found the room in the Diamond Head wing to be exceptionally small with perhaps 250 sq ft and an uncomfortable bed with a mattress needing replacement. The exterior A/C unit's temperature was pre-set to a minimum temperature of 68* and was insufficient to keep the room cool at night. Did not notice any distracting or bothersome street noise on the 6th floor but our room was facing a side street. The floor we were assigned did not have an ice machine so we had to always go to another floor for any ice. We purchased a 16 oz soda in the lobby that costs over $3.00 which is totally gouging customers. The pool area was the setting for the hot breakfast buffet that was included in the room price and was exceptionally good. The food supply was constantly replenished and area provided enough space for all to find table seating. $18 hotel parking was modestly expensive but easily avoided by parking on the street nearby. Contact me if you need details.

My wife & I stayed for 3 nights on our way back home to Australia & found the whole package including breakfast fantastic , only a short walk to the beach, very clean rooms & friendly staff, upon check in we were upgraded, as the larger room was vacant , the hotel is very central to transport & shops , a lovely experience to finish off our holiday

We are huge fans of the Hyatt Regency, but we were not disappointed by the transition to Hyatt Place. Hyatt Place had everything we needed and more. I booked us in this hotel because I was attending a conference. My fiancé and I planned to move to the Hyatt Regency after the conference. We were so pleased with our experience, we stayed at Hyatt Place. I arrived a day before my fiancé, and Lynn (at the front desk) was friendly, efficient, and extremely helpful. She allowed me to check in a bit early. Every person I interacted with at Hyatt Place was gracious, kind, helpful, and full of smiles. The room on the 11th floor was spacious and clean. It had a king sized bed, a sleeper-sofa, desk, small chest of drawers, a mini fridge, and a lanai with an incredible view of Diamond Head. When I stay at any hotel/resort, I look for amenities that make my trip smoother. Hyatt Place hit my entire checklist. 1. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Pillows were the perfect density. 2. The cooling unit was quiet. I slept well every night in our room, a rare experience for me when I travel. 3. Great bathroom. The shower head had multiple settings. There was a retractable clothesline in the shower. The bath products were effective and had a pleasant, gender-neutral scent. 4. The lanai was big enough for two people to relax on while having breakfast. We watched the sunrise from our lanai. beautiful! 5. The mini-fridge was big enough for drinks and snacks. 6. Room had large, easy-to-use safe. Outside the room, I was very pleased with special touches Hyatt Place offered its guests. The daily breakfast included eggs dishes, bread products, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, yogurt, cereal, rice, miso soup, and more. We often used the tray from our room to take food upstairs to eat on our lanai. The gym was exceptional for a hotel. It had quite a few cardio machines, a dumbbell rack, yoga mats, disposable ear buds, clean towels, and antibacterial wipes (a big deal for this gym rat). I used the gym nearly every day. Hyatt Place is one block from the beach and the zoo. It is close to stores (ABC!!) restaurants, and nightclubs. We walked everywhere. One day we rented a car to go to the north shore. We parked the car across the street. It was easy and affordable to park for the night. The closest beach had surfboard and umbrella rentals.After several days, Hyatt Place felt like home. It is not a resort, but it provides comfort, amenities, and amazing hospitality. During our stay, we interacted a lot with Lynn. She answered all our questions and took genuine interest in us. She was truly the gem of Hyatt Place, and we look forward to seeing her next year.

I actually really loved this place...even though it's not right on the main street...(literally 2 feet away though) it was close to all the little local cheaper amazing places to eat...the staff was so accommodating to me!!! And so happy and welcoming!!! Thank you for an amazing time!!! Will stay again soon for sure!!!

Best hotel because of the friendly staff, clean hotel, great room service, great breakfast, perfect location, and I return to this hotel year after year. The pricing for this hotel is also very affordable for the Waikiki area. Great people who work at the hotel that makes you feel at home.

We overall enjoyed out stay at Hyatt Place. The location was great for where we wanted to go and the staff was very nice and were very pleasant to deal with. As I mentioned before the only issue we had was we usually had to wait 5-10 mins for the elevator in the Diamond Tower. Other than that our stay was perfect and I would stay here again on my next visit.

This was a sound hotel, with polite staff, ect. However, the hotel does not really live up to the Hyatt name (But you will pay Hyatt prices). The location was good. About a 3 minute walk to the beach, and 5 minute walk to the zoo. The hotel was just off the main strip, at the top end and was in a fairly quite area. The rooms where very spacious, and where cleaned every day to a high standard. Breakfast was a massive let down, and was completely bog standard, with little variety. Having booked into the hotel for 2 weeks, after the first few days we opted to have breakfast else where. The breakfast area was kind of small, though we never waited more than a few minutes for a table to become available on the days we did head down. We did have to wait for the lifts on a few occasions, during peak times, (breakfast ect), but never over long.The swimming pool seemed to be an after thought, and was so small for the size of the hotel. My children were really disappointed. We used the laundry room a couple of times. (3 washers and 3 dryers). You can purchase soap powder in there. The prices were reasonable, and the machines took cash or card. Overal this isn't a bad hotel, but it's definitely not the usual standard of Hyatt.

It is not really a Hyatt standard hotel..bellboys don't bother to help you even though you are dropped at the side of the road. Breakfast..don't bother even if it is included in your stay..can't understand why Hyatt are involved??

Expect to wait to get a table for breakfast. When try to get some sleep you will know why they've given you some complimentary ear plugs. Not what I expected from a Hyatt. Other than the hospitality of the staff they were the only positive, Sorry.

I had a great stay. I asked for an ocean view room and I got it! The every staff was very helpful and they were always smiling!! The room was nice and quiet. Very clean. I will definitely come back to the Place!!

I stayed at this hotel for a week with my family and it is so clean and modern. Their breakfast buffet is so delicious and filing. We stayed for a week and never got sick of their food because they would change it up. This hotel is only about a five minute walk to Waikiki beach.Their rooms are very spacious and their mattresses are comfortable too. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and would stay here again in the future.

The room was nice and clean, the hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. Very close walk to the beach and right in the middle of Waikiki. Areas of Improvement: You will more than likely have to valet your car since there are only a handful of self-park spots (maybe 15-20). The coffee tasted burnt and there was only one option- dark roast. It would be nice to get alternatives or at least have a light roast option available. Please invest in foam rollers for stretching. The fitness center was limited in that regard.

It was a great place for the two weeks of vacation. Close to the beach and yet quiet. The bus runs behind the building and so easy to travel the city. The staff was exceptional. They knew what I liked and asked about me each day.

NICE SPACIOUS ROOM it is not luxurious hotel but if you are looking for day hard touring and resting in night at very decent place it is for you. Very near beach.very nice efficient and polite staff. excellent

My family (9 of us) reserved 3 separate rooms at Hyatt Place for 12 nights. The location was great. The tree rooms were all in the Diamond Head tower. These rooms seemed relatively new or newly renovated. Two rooms were the largest rooms with ocean view. I would recommend these large rooms with ocean view. The buffet breakfast is open from 6:30am to 9:30am. The breakfast would have busy times and could get crowded. The breakfast eating area is also outdoors so if it rained or was very windy, I would recommend bringing the tray that was in the hotel room and bringing your breakfast back to your room. The hotel staff was friendly and the lobby was comfortable. I would stay here again.

I´ve been there for a convention and stay more days to visit the island. Everybody in hotel seems to be waiting you (and only you) to help in anything you need. A taxi? In one minute? A good sushi? There´s one very good on the hotel... Flowers to learn how to make a lei? They have and teach you how to do it. Tour guides, touristic information... it´s all for you, with a large smile....The room is very quiet, too big, clean, beautiful view and the bed is too confortable... well, I said that I had nothing to complain, right?

We really enjoyed our stay, staff were considerate, helpful and kind. The hotel is close to the beach and the pool clean and fun for the kids. The room was spacious and beds very comfortable. Would recommend it

Adjacent rooms accommodated our family of 4 adults well. Convient walk to many restaurants and bars in addition to the beach. Breakfast buffet is perfect for everyone to get their own breakfast at a different time before heading out for the day.

The hotel is clean, the staff is courteous, room are clean, but there are 2 Hyatt..Hyatt Regency and Hyatt Place....Make sure you know the location and what you are getting into. An average of $400-$500 a night it is not worth it. That is a $200 a night hotel. There are other hotels you can spend the same amount at a better location. Do your homework so you will not be as surprised as I was.

Stayed here our first night on Oahu before we checked in to Aulani. This allowed us to do our favorite Waikiki attractions, Diamond Head, brunch on the beach, etc... Hyatt Place was great! Room was clean and comfortable. Front desk was very friendly and free breakfast was plentiful.

In the past have been paid to do extensive hotel evaluations. This vacation was a just a vacation with no third party evaluations outside of you, a potential guest. Stayed at the Hyatt Place in late December, early January. This was our families second stay at a Hyatt Place, the first being in Orlado Florida.So why would a guest want to stay here over the many other choices on the island?As this hotel has someone that reads and replies to reviews, lets start with the ugly which has an easy fix. There is a door that is between the third floor elevators and entrance to the breakfast area and pool. On the inside of the door is an enormous amount of built up finger prints and dried dude that may be dried food. The outside handle also has food on it. Guests push on this door to get breakfast. This door is no doubt crawling with germs and potential pathegins. It has been this way for the seven days that I have been here. On behalf of all present and future guests, have someone thoroughly clean it. Tip for guests at any hotel. The tv remote can often be the dirtiest item in a room, ever more germs than a toilet seat. I bring wipes with me and clean it thoroughly before using, regardless which hotel I stay at. Here the remote had dust, hair and crude on it. The lobby, spacious, lots of room for guests and visitors to sit and relax. There is work area with computers and a printer. Computers do not allow downloads. Thus some boarding passes that require downloads can't be printed.The lobby has a Starbucks, $5 for a muffin, ouch.Staff are friendly and there appears to be a layer of security. We often had staff come into the elevators with us.The elevators can have some wait time, average for us was 3 minutes. Many times a lot quicker and only once about 7 minutes. The lobby and elevators, floors were vary clean. The goodThis hotel is clean and convenient. Rooms are spacious and it is a short walk to the beach, ABC store and many restaurants. The Zoo and Aquarium are about ten to fifteen minutes, beach about five minutes, restaurants like the Cheese Cake Factory about fifteen minutes. The Marriot just across the street has a very good Italian restaurant and there is a Burger King, McDonald's within ten minutes. Parking here is $30 a night or kitty corner from the Hyatt is a parking lot inside the banyan hotel for $20 a night. There are car rentals, budget or hertz at the Hyatt Regency, about three blocks away. Book ahead of time as cars are often sold out.The really good. Unfortunately this hotels puts added pressure on you buy not having a charge for breakfast and no resort fee. Now you have the added burden of how to spend all the extra money you have. Typically resort fees can be between $25 and $35 or more per night at other hotels. On a seven day vacation thats an average of $210 extra that this hotel doesn't charge.Breakfasts at McDonald's can be about $10 a person, buffets at hotels over $20 a person, in a week breakfasts for family stay at other hotels can overage $400 plus taxes, at the Hyatt Place $0. So you have an extra $700 in your wallet by staying here.Breakfast buffet. Varies by the day, at least four food items for the Asian diet including soup, tofu, greens and more. Other dishes include hot and cold cereals, some mornings bacon and eggs, have and eggs, waffles, pancakes, toast, bagels, fruit , mostly fresh pineapple. Coffee, tea, juice, not freshly squeezed. Lots of places to sit including get a few places around the pool, an open air area and a small covered area. Birds. Any open area has them. There aren't many I counted 8 sparrows and 2 pigeons. There are signs on every table to not feed them, but kids do. If you do not want birds while you eat ( be thankful there aren't mosquitoes) sit in the covered area, get here before 7 am or bring a tray from your room, load it up and take it back to your room or the downstairs lobby. There are no chefs to individually cook omlets, no freshly squeezed juices but lots to fill you up for a wonderful day in Hawaii. Pool. Smaller, perhaps 5 ft deep. Has a lift to lower handicapped into it. Clean Security. You need a room key to operate the elevators. There are a number of staff in the lobby area as well as the desk for parking. Each room has a safe. This appears to be a safe place to stay.People that stay here, multicultural, I met guests from Japan, India, other areas of Asia, USA, Canada, Australia, Europe, New Zealand and other areas of HawaiiGuests feel there is value in this hotelThe bad, I paid for an ocean view with a king sized bed. I got two queens and a partial ocean view or what might better be described as an ocean glimps. Not great value to get less than what you paid for.

I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel/rooms appear to have been renovated tastefully. It's not a BIG hotel like some of the others in Honolulu. The Pool and gym was small. The mattress was a bit on the soft/lumpy side though. The hotel and rooms were very clean. But overall, i was happy.

This hotel was just what we needed. We didn't fly all the way to Hawaii to sit in our hotel room, we needed a convenient, quiet, clean place to stay, this was 100% it. It's two blocks from the beach and cost 75% less than other hotels closer to the beach. Splurge on dinners or experiences and save with this hotel

The Hyatt Place offers a great location 1 block from Waikiki Beach at a very good price, with half price government rates. Very comfortable rooms, awesome beds, and great views. A large breakfast is included each day.
user_name:
jsaundco
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Hyatt place is a great choice for families. The room was large and the breakfast was great. The location is close to waikiki beach and close to restaurants and shops. I would recommend it for families who want close access to the beach and shops.

Great place with a great breakfast, block to the beach. Worth the extra to get ocean view if spending any time in room, you can use the balcony and enjoy the views even at a block away. Use the valet parking since it almost costs as much to park yourself. Room is comfortable with great beds and nice shower.

We stayed there for 2 nights in a nice size room. The beds were comfortable and we had a nice view of the ocean. We enjoyed the outdoor breakfast which had had hot options (eggs, bacon) and cold options (cereal, rolls) but prepared for wind and birds. Even though we were close to the elevator the room was quiet. I believe this was a good value for the money in the area.

Arrived at the hotel very late - friendly check in and assigned mountain view room. However, the room was very, very hot and the AC didnt seem to be able to cool the room. Went back to front desk but no other rooms available so had to spend the night in literally a sweat box.Bed was pretty comfortable and room was OK but why only 1 coffee cup between 2 people?Breakfast on terrace was typical HP fare so not great food but adequate. Good location but expensive compared to other hotels in the area given it's only a four star property.

I stayed in this hotel 14 days, Location to beach is 1 block. hotel on busy and noisy street, elevatiors very slow. room noisy from street. maide service very slow, food service bad. bathroom very small. patio door leaks creates noise in room. was very disappointed with room, front desk told me all rooms are the same when wind blow sand it was windy everyday. Breakfast is outdoor by the pool area and it is very windy .which makes it very hard to have breakfast Tables are wobbly.

Nice big rooms, clean and comfortable. Great staff. Good breakfast, enjoyed the free WiFi. Lift was a little slow some days. Our rooms were on the 4th floor. We didn't have a view of the ocean and it was hard to enjoy sitting out or having the window open as it was very loud from street noise.

Great hotel, within walking distance to everything, 3-4 minutes walk to beach. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, large room with good view of Diamond Head and super comfortable bed. Free breakfast and WIFI was great!

We had a family trip to honolulu and had stayed there for three nights. It was a good location, and free breakfast is definitely a plus. The room was a little bit small, and the sofa bed wasn't great, but overall I liked the hotel.
user_name:
Kyunghyun S
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Excellent service and affordability in a very nice hotel. The staff were very accommodating and remembered our preferences after an initial visit. The beach towel service was exceptional and just what we needed. The staff was sincerely grateful for all gratuities provided and bent over backwards to give good service.

Our family stayed a week during Christmas. Our room was comfy, clean and had views of the beach and mountains from our window and balcony. Breakfast was included and there was always plenty of food. Location was excellent... close to beach, ABC store, restaurants, bus and freeways. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Valet parking is expensive, but we were able to park at the Banyan across the street for $20/day. We also appreciate the use of a hopitality suite before our evening flight home. Recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki!

The free breakfast is high standard and impressive. It has more choices and food quality is high. It is very close to Waikiki beach. The room is spacious and can accommodate for 2 adults and 1 kid. If we come here again, we will stay here again. Thanks.

Traveled with family for a Christmas vacation right before the holiday. Loved the location, it was far enough away from the crowds on the street, but close enough to the beach, shopping and restaurants.

Please issue me a refund. This is a waste of not only money but also precious time, energy and other resources. I booked an exorbitant one-night stay worth $400.00+ upon reading this online advertisement: "Room Details: View: Diamond Head Mountain." Instead, I got a "Sorry, I am not giving you a Diamond Head mountain view."

The hotel located only 5-6 minutes walk from Waikiki beach. All hotel staffs were friendly and helpful. We really appreciate the sofa bed and size of the room. Hyatt Place is a great choice for family with children or like us -3 adults. The room also clean and has balcony. It was very easy to go around the city by bus. The bus stop is only a minute away from hotel entrance.

I stayed here for a week and enjoyed it. My room was large, quiet, and clean. The staff was helpful and nice. The breakfast was so-so but definitely cheaper than going out. I took my breakfast up to my room and sat on the lanai, very nice. I honestly can't say anything bad. I will stay here again.

It was a good help for my three kids. We have three kids, so we need extra bed. And also, we enjoyed free buffet breakfast with all family members. we saved a lot by that offer and enjoyed family togetherness.

I came to Honolulu for a conference and this hotel was one of the options offered by the organizers. The location is pretty good, although not as good as Sheration, Hawaian Village, etc. The hotel is clean, the staff is very polite and friendly and they really want you to be comfortable. On the good side, wifi internet is complementary and fast, which is not frequent in most hotels. On the bad side, it is a little bit pricy, but I guess that is the normal trend in Honolulu. This might be exceptional to my room, but there was a very bothering noise created by the air currents passing below the main door.

The hotel location is very noisy overall because its in an intersection where public transportation is always running no matter what time of day and night. This is not a hotel you want to stay at if you want a restful sleep.
user_name:
Christina L
Culver City, United States

review_body: Very comfortable and quiet hotel, good bed, excellent breakfast, near to the beach, ABC store near by. ATM maschine did not work, but ATM at Marriott next door did. Nice balcony. A smoking area with roof protection please.

We found this hotel to be close to everything, but not on the main street which is much busier. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Hot breakfast and wi-fi are included. The rates are reasonable for the Waikiki Beach area. One thing to note: the hotel has 2 towers and the rooms in one tower are bigger than the other. If you want the bigger room (almost like a suite) you have to book the "Specialty" room, at a higher rate. (Our friends were in a regular room, and they found it to be adequate.) If we are back in Honolulu sometime, we would definitely stay here again.

Would recommend this hotel to anyone especially with kids who are traveling to Honolulu Hawaii!! Very welcoming and enjoyable. Kids loved the Lei making class that the offered to guest for free!! Parking rate is $35 with valet but guest can park across the street for $20/day. Walking distance to Waikiki BEACH and shopping centers. Diamond Mountain is about 10 minutes drive with traffic and 40 mins from Pearl Harbor.

We just spent 7 nights at Hyatt Place Waikiki. We stayed in room 1535, the room was HUGE! Perfect for our family of 4. 2 queen size beds, 1 x sofa bed, ocean view from both the window and the balcony. Air con worked very well, maid service fantastic, free breakfast daily - not a huge variety, but it's free so we weren't complaining. Wifi was fast. Front desk staff always helpful and pleasant. Quiet end of Waikiki, but we didn't mind that, still within walking distance to everything.Elevator was a bit slow at times, but not too inconvenient.We would definitely stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki again. Thank you for a very enjoyable stay.

The front desk are very friendly and accommodating. There is free wi-fi, free breakfast and the rooms are very clean. There is a Expedia booking agency on the ground floor which is very convenient when you want to book all your extra activities. Not far from Waikiki beach either.

My husband and I stayed here before a cruise and would come back to stay longer. The people were very helpful and went out of their way to accommodate you. The room was comfortable and it started our trip off better than expected! We will be back!

This property is fine and was a good deal for the price, but when I'm in Hawaii I want a view. It was a bit noisy - street noises and the wind could be heard whistling through the hallway. Not a bad experience it was fine, but who goes to Hawaii for fine. Chat with Paolo one of the valets ...he's got the aloha spirit!
user_name:
Joseph V L
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Hotel is in a fantastic location only short walk to lovely beaches. In a quiet location but only a short walk to the busy shopping of Waikiki. We stayed in a double room that was on the top floor with ocean view. View is obstructed by the two hotels in front but still was nice to wake up to see the ocean. Nice to have a small balcony to sit out late afternoon & watch the sunset. Room was very spacious and clean. Separate large sofa was a bonus to have in the room. Beds were very comfortable, best I have ever slept in :) and I am fussy. Large TV & small fridge, which was great to use as we stayed for 11 nights. Bathroom had shower over bath & a toilet in it. Was nice to be able to have a relaxing soak. Vanity was just outside which was a good size. Enjoyed the breakfast each morning and couldn't understand why there had been reviews saying there was not much choice, was very happy with choices available each day. The only negative thing was the pool a little uninviting surroundings & was not sunny in afternoon as it is blocked by the building but it did look clean. Very good Wi-fi too.

My son and I stayed for 4 nights in the double queen city view. We loved our visit. The room was big and extremely clean. The staff was wonderful friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast. It was incentive for my son to get out of bed in the morning. We would come back again!The beach was close. And the location was quiet even during marathon weekend. I would recommend to my friends and family. I just wished we were one of the lucky ones to get upgraded to an ocean view room. Maybe next time!

Location is perfect as we were running the marathon and it's near the finish line. Rooms are very well layed out and have all the necessary amenities. Pool is small but the shallow end is good to cool your leg muscles after the marathon. However breakfast was disappointing. Weird ham and egg on muffin dish was unappetizing. No other hot selection except French toast which I didn't try. Only thing worth eating was the fruit salad. Coffee was good.

We stayed there for a week. We had booked a city view room, but only got view of the apartment building. The room was very tiny too. When asked, they told us that this is their city view. Requested to change the room and after two days got room with actual city and partial mountain view. The rooms were pretty clean. Breakfast was good but not many options for vegetarian. I only had to eat bread. Coffee was the best at the breakfast. The only drawback was that they have breakfast in the open area, the napkins would fly and it was bit uneasy as it was mostly windy. Wish they had covered breakfast area.

I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfy and quiet. The complimentary hot breakfast buffet was amazing and had a large variety of foods to choose from. The location is great and only about a 2 minute walk to a kid friendly beach. The only thing that I didn't like as much as the $30/night parking charge, however that's most likely the norm at most of the hotels in Waikiki.
user_name:
Jason R
San Diego, United States

review_body: It was a pleasure to be in this hotel, the staff is super friendly and the breakfast is a plus and the amenities are included. If you are planning vacations in Waikiki, Hyatt Place is a really good choice.

Very comfortable and clean. Short walk to Waikiki. Hyatt Place is very comfy. The hotels on the way to the beach aren't as worried about your stay with the smoking gallery on your walk to the beach. Hyatt Place is great but if you're walking to the beach cross the street at least by the ABC store. You'll miss all the hipsters chain smoking and picking their noses and spitting on the sidewalk.

My daughter & I stayed for a week.The staff remembered us from the year before. Clean & comfortable rooms, we had a beautiful view of Diamond Head & could see the ocean, we watched the sunrise every morning. We felt very safe at this location. We both enjoyed the free breakfast and plan on staying here again our next trip.

We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights with 3 small children. We found the staff were very helpful and the location was great for us and access to other attractions was easy! eg walking distance to the zoo and aquarium.Would definitely stay there again!

We originally booked a standard room and upon check in we were upgrade to a king beach view suite which was a pleasant surprise. Room was spacious, bed was massive and veranda views of Waikiki beach were amazing. Will definitely visit again!

We stayed here for our honeymoon for 7 nights before heading to Maui.The location of the hotel is by Kuhio beach and is a little bit of a walk to Waikiki but it's not really too far. We stayed in an Oceanfront king room, which was very spacious on the 14th floor. The room was excellent, clean tidy and lots of room, we couldn't fault it. We had a good view through the other buildings of the beach and hotels. The hotel offers free wifi and free breakfast. Great wifi connections throughout hotel couldn't fault it. The breakfast however is very average and cheap. They served different things on different days, bacon that tasted like cardboard, scrambled eggs which tasted average, the French toast was ok, toast, yoghurt, oatmeal etc. the tea and coffee was ok. I couldn't actually drink the coffee it was far too strong, I know Americans love strong coffee but I actually couldn't drink it more matter how much sugar or milk I added which was disappointing. There is an ABC store close to hotel. A laundromat not far away either. Overall the rooms & wifi were graft, breakfast and location average. Staff were friendly enough.

I have always wanted to visit Hawaii and now am retired. I decide to come. I had a great time. in the sun. I enjoyed the food and beaches. I took two tours one to the polyonsia cultural center and pearl harbor.

Read all the reviews before we got there and was surprised at how wrong they were.Firstly a special mention of Heidi at reception who possibly is the friendliest person we have ever met .Heidi "MAHALO" for the upgrade - top floor ocean view absolutely fantastic, travel adaptor , umbrella and anything else we required no problems for her. Now the review;Breakfast - busy at times but never had an issue finding a seat ,plenty of choices mini muffins were nice ,bacon sometimes , eggs , juices ,toast coffee etc but always lots of supply and we were there for thanks giving when it was very busy.Elevators - never had an issue ,but we were in the tower with 3 elevators.Staff - friendliest on the Island always smiling and happy.Location- one block to the beach, close to busses, pink line trolley and ABC shops.Stayed in room 1409 - great view , room was enormous TV was huge and room very clean always.Wifi - excellent strength and very fastAll in all we had a fantastic time and will definitely be back next time.

This hotel is great and the staff is very friendly. Being able to be less than two blocks from the beach was great for being able to quickly take a stroll at night. Also the access to H1 from the hotel was quick and easy to remember which made getting around the island simple and easy.
user_name:
Johnathan G
Mountain View, United States

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. The service was excellent. The check-in process was very efficient and comfortable, and they designated a contact representative in case there were any issues. The room was clean but there was some noise from the outside and the breakfast has a good selection of items.

Matt at reception was friendly and brisk at check in. I booked 2 nights with points and my 3rd night via Hotels.com (Hyatt rate 2 months out from stay was more expensive) My second booking was already linked on arrival which saved us having to move rooms which was great. The building is old and has been converted/ renovated. It's evident in the ceilings, balconys, doors etc. I liked the open Hawaiian feel of the building over their Mainland type properties. We've stayed in heaps of Hyatt Place locations, and the room was as expected. Big issue I had is there was no self serve laundry on site, instead asking $19 to wash & iron a dress. $3.75 for under garments. Seriously? This is not the 5 star Hyatt brand, but their budget 3 star version. Prices are unrealistic. I also paid $5 for a ginger beer. Whoa, it's a soft drink guys. Happy Hour prices were expensive- $7 for a real beer... Their Gallery Host menu is also more expensive than the Mainland, but not by much.Breakfast time was busy but I took the tray from my room and returned there to eat. The beach is a block away and you can grab a towel before heading down. Wifi was pretty good and the computers in the lobby are password protected.We arranged a taxi with them for pickup to the airport. It would only be value ($29 + tip) in busy times. For a 6am pickup it took 15 mins and Uber would have been way cheaper. It cost us $7 via Uber to get to the Mall.Generally a well located comfortable stay. It's nice and quiet down this end but for a few days around Thanksgiving we found food options very limited.

Staff is wonderful. Hotel is very clean. Rooms are small. Pretty much have to unpack using the dressers and put empty suitcases in closet in order to have room to get around. The complimentary breakfasts are a plus considering the cost of meals. It's like a $20.00 saving per person a day. Close to the beach & the Zoo. Lot's of convenient places to walk & shop & dine. Would definitely stay there again. Other reviews have indicated that the elevators were slow, we did not find that an issue at all.

I am a Platinum Hyatt Member. As such, I was upgraded to a room on the top floor with an "ocean view." That was appreciated. Although another hotel blocks your central view of the ocean, you can see the ocean. The room was clean and comes with a mini fridge. The daily breakfast was delicious and had cold choices as well as sausage and eggs. The free Wi-Fi was an added plus and worked quite well. Food Pantry is a brief walk up Kuhio Boulevard, and the beach is a block away. I considered going to the Honolulu Zoo, but many of the exhibits were closed from what was posted on their entrance sign, and for $14.00 a person, I decided to skip it. (Besides, I had been there previously, and it is very, very tiny, so with exhibits missing, it did not seem worth the time or fee.) Anyway, I digress. My room air conditioning unit made a sound like a combination between pouring rain, high winds coming through a cracked open window, and a jet reversing its engines on landing. All three sounds are accurate in that it cycled through the sounds, mostly at high volume. I went down to the front desk after enduring two nights of the noises, ( I would have gone sooner, but I did not want to appear ungrateful for the "room upgrade.") I was offered a change of rooms. I explained that this was very inconvienant since I had my belongings all settled in and spread throughout the closets, dresser drawers, etc. They sent up a maintence man who told me to put the unit on low (quiet) and keep the fan running continusously, not on auto. When the noise continued, and the room got stuffy, I visited the front desk again. The noise had now kept waking me up for three nights. This time, the maintenance man gave me some sort of remote control to try different settings. It made no difference. I expected more from Hyatt. Upon checkout, the agent asked me how my stay was, and when I told him about my experience, he said he would give me 10,000 Hyatt points for my trouble... big deal. I expect more from a Hyatt. I sent a message to Hyatt, and never got a reply. I took two videos of the A/C unit making the terrible noises.

This is a gem of a hotel! It's nicely located away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city and about a block away from a gorgeous local beach. I say "local" because it doesn't have the touristy feel of other beaches. The hotel has a 24 hour coffee bar which is great for jet lag! Also a plus is a free breakfast. The rooms are very comfortable and have nice balconies. All in all I am very pleased to have discovered this lovely hotel!

I'm giving this place four stars just because it's off the beach in kind of an urban setting. Let me also say our rooms were comped from a charity auction, so it's hard for me to make a value comparison. I will say that the booking process was a little complex due to the charity auction (no fault of Hyatt) but Jade in reservations was so very helpful and thorough with us. The hotel is clean, the rooms are decent, and the staff is really friendly and helpful. Just don't expect a resort experience with an outdoor bar on the beach. There is a small pool, but it's surrounded by a lot of tall buildings. They serve breakfast, but I really wouldn't say there's a restaurant on the property. Although they say there is self-parking, it was always booked up for the four days we were there. You can valet, or park in an independent garage across the street. That garage was kind of a pain as you had to pay $18 each day and then you only got 24 hours (to the minute) after you paid, So you ended up scheduling your day around it. Again, I realize this was not a Hyatt operation, but it's where they point you if you don't want to valet. Overall I would say the Hyatt Place is a good choice if you are on a budget.

The first time we went we stayed right on the beach. However, the prices have been going up and we were looking for something a bit cheaper so that we could spend more on activities opposed to a room you are barely ever in.This hotel was great. It is a few blocks from the beach, but very walkable. Lots of places to eat nearby and breakfast was included in our package. The breakfast was quite good.We would go work-out in the gym every morning and then head straight out the doors to eat. The rest of the day was always spent exploring the island or at the beach.The rooms were clean and quite and the lobby staff was always very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again or recommend it to people looking for a place to stay at a good price point.

It was the perfect getaway from work and home to enjoy the comfort of Paradise. The rooms are well located and each have some views of someplace in Hawaii. love live like little island paradise. You could see the ocean and all the boats passing to and from

Our first stay at Hyatt Place and we had a very nice time. Location is great, beach, restaurants, shopping and transit are just out the door. The staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean. Was nice to have free WiFi and an area to set up a laptop and print out things if needed. The free breakfast buffet was very nice and it was nice to meet and chat with other people staying at the hotel. Myself, wife and baby had a great relaxing stay in Hawaii (our 5th time to the island) we will definitely be back and stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki.

Our stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki was enjoyable. The location, just south of the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki chaos was perfect. Close enough to walk to the major Waikiki attractions, yet far enough away that you don't feel like cattle walking the streets. The Hotel is modern, the rooms are clean and quite large for Waikiki standards. I would highly recommend this hotel, and expect to stay there in the future.

For a first time visit to Hawaii, we were very pleased with the Hotel we had booked. The staff were great from start to end and were happy to help with anything. The Concierge Ron was amazing aswell. We stayed for 7 nights total and would start off our day (every day) with a delicious breakfast with mulitiple options that vaired every day. We would then take a 2 minute stroll straight to Waikiki beach. The taxi from the airport to Hyatt Place cost roughly $45 USD each way.Overall, great experence, good location - would book again!

I stayed here 11-18 November for a tourist break. The rooms are clean with good linen, decor, tv connectivity and good wi-fi signal. The hotel also offers a free service to print documents. No bath but a serviceable shower stall that is a bit dated. I had a city view room. I was satisfied with the room and the cleaning staff were very friendly and patient when I left the room late so they could clean the room. There are safes, ironing board an iron in the rooms also. A/C worked well. The breakfast area is on the third floor beside the small pool and gym facilities. For me the breakfast could do with improvement. Sliced breads and 2 types of bagels supplied with packaged cream cheese, peanut butter or jams, no wholemeal/grained breads. Fruit salad with pineapple and melon, could be improved by a selection of whole fresh fruit. Cold meats & cheeses would have also improved selection. I do not eat pork so the 'hot' offering was limited to pre-made scrambled eggs that was not very hot, there were pre-made waffles but I did not try them as guests were using serving implements that touched pork to serve themselves. Fruit juices, yogurt, cottage cheese also provided. With my food taboos (pork in particular) breakfast was limited. Miso was provided for the Japanese guests. The dining area was very windy in the mornings so this could be a challenge. The reception staff were very helpful and can arrange transport to the airport at a fixed rate of $29 through Charley's Taxis. The tour desk staff are extremely helpful and knowledgeable and a good resource and can provide a map of the area. The carpeted hallways where the rooms are make it quite difficult to draw luggage arround that has wheels. Location is excellent and on the route of the Waikiki trolley bus route and a stone throw away from Waikiki beach. I felt very safe here. Top marks for cleanliness and friendliness of the staff (reception. cleaners, tour desk). Breakfast needs improvement. Good communal ground floor area with coffee shop, TV, sofas.

Stayed for 3 nights, beds were comfortable and the room we were allocated was large with 2 x Double Beds. Bathroom was a little old. Breakfast was included on the Level 3 pool deck area but we chose to eat elsewhere after the first day because it was not good. The pool area is not somewhere I would want to sit out and sunbathe, it's a very old building, small pool and wedged in between buildings. It's located in an okay location down the far end of Waikiki.

Stayed 7 nights at hyatt place, great breakfast, friendly staff, fantastic location for The bus and tour buses, easy walking distance to beach, located near connivence stores, large rooms cleaned daily to high standard

The Hyatt Place was a great place to stay in Honolulu. We were always greeted with a smile by the staff. All our questions were answered in a clear and concise manner. We had a very enjoyable stay in Waikiki made possible by the Hyatt Place and its staff. Thank you.
user_name:
William G
Bloomsburg, PA, United States

review_body: This is a pretty basic Hyatt, don't have too high expectations. It does the job though, large rooms, friendly staff and very comfortable beds. My room had an L shape lounge as well which made the room seem huge. I didn't try the free breakfast, wifi connection was free and fast. Check-in was excellent and I found people very responsive, friendly and polite whenever I needed anything. It's about average age for hotels down this end of the Waikiki beach . It could have been a little cleaner, dust in closet and no bath. I booked online, not through Hyatt and it was expensive for what you get. I really appreciated Charlies fixed rate cab to airport on my way home. I wished the lobby had more lifts as only two for tower I was in about 17 floors so a long wait at times. Overall, I'd definitely stay there again, but only if the room rate was much lower.

It was a great room with a view of the ocean and Waikiki life. They made it possible for us to wait comfortably before checking and offered waters. Breakfast was good, but it was outdoors and it rained every morning so that was a little tricky. You had to wait to get a table with an umbrella.

the staff is warm and eager to help. let me borrow a phone charger from the "forgot it list" at NO CHARGE! rooms are well appointed and we will be returning often and making sure our family starts staying here as well

It is so refreshing to know that there are still hotels out there that understand what it is to provide good service. The Hyatt place is conveniently located and very close to the ocean. Very clean rooms and bed was so comfortable. Breakfast was excellent aand great new choices every day. What a great experience!

Great location only a few minuttes walk to Waikiki Beach.Great rooms that is well maintended and clean.Good WiFi.Hotel staff is friendly and helpfull.Good and tasty breakfast.Food for roomservice is just great and tasty.Will stay with them again.

My lady and I came to Hawaii on November 4th thru the 11th after she closely researched this Hotel. I really didnt know what to expect but I must say I was absolutely relieved once we arrived here. From the moment we arrived after a long flight, we were greeted by the most accomodating staff. Our room was not ready yet so we passed the time with out first Mai Tai at the Tiki's bar and grill across the street from the beach. We were tired but excited to start our first real vacation together. A short time later our room was ready and we eagerly went upstairs. Walking in, I was very suprised by the modern, clean, and great view of the ocean even from a block away. Keep in mind we were on the 12th floor. We thought that the A/C was broken and called the front desk. I'm telling you they were at our door before we hung the phone up. The service guy was friendly and knew just what to do. The A/C Switch at the unit had simply been switched off at the unit. Cold air in minutes after the call. The next day my lady called for a few supplies, soaps and shampoos etc. and again it was less than 5 minutes before a friendly belhop was at the door with a bag of supplies. In short, the service was undoubtedly outstanding. The room was clean, smelled fresh, had clean modern linens and the bed was a pillow top and was like sleeping on a cloud. Large 55 in LCD tv in the rooms too. I cant say enough about the room. We did enjoy happy hour a couple times between 4 and 7 when Nadine served us perfect Mai Tai's until our faces went numb! Ask for Nadine, you wont be dissapointed. The Hotel is in a great location in Wakiki and easy walking distance to the beaches and dining. Parking??? Ok guys listen up. We did not pay for parking our entire trip! Here is how we did it. The hotel charges $30 bucks a day to park the car. DO NOT DO IT! The metered parking on the streets is free every day from 6pm to 7am. We would park the car in from of the hotel on Paoakalani Ave, Ohua Ave or Kapahulu Ave every day after 6pm. You just need to have patience and drive that circle a bit and you'll no doubt find a spot every day. Then every morning at 630 am, my lady and I woke up to go move the car to the Wakiki shell free parking lot. you can park there all day until midnight!!. Do this daily and I promise you'll love the early walk and grab a free coffee in the lobby on your way out! Sounds like a pain in the rear, but trust us, you'll love not paying for parking and you'll be up early for a wonderful breakfast on the 3rd floor every day. So that brings us to the free breakfast. This hotel has a great free breakfast every day on the pool deck patio in the fresh open Hawaiian air. They served eggs, bacon, sausage, all the fruit you coul want, yogurts Pancakes and french toast, oatmeal, bagles and cream cheese as well as an assortment of great apple croissants, fruit juices and coffee. A very healthy breakst but good. A beautiful way to wake up in the morning. This hotel was an absolute delight to stay at. We enjoyed every bit of our stay and the staff took good care of us, even offering us two unbrellas free of charge to use during our stay for the occasional showers. The pool was not even used by us but there is a small, clean pool. Not Hottub though. No matter because you can simply go to one of the beachfront hotels and sit in the hottubs there as we did! We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good location without spending a fortune. Enjoy!

When we arrived in Hyatt Place, we were greeted by Angeline and Kimberly. They both helped me at front desk with reservations. They were warm and friendly. Also, when I didn't have certain amenities like toothbrush and lotion that I left at home, they assisted to pick up and get those items I needed the most without hesitation. Even when searching for a wheelchair for my father they were most accommodating. Thank you for your great customer service. Ron at the Expedia travel desk too was helpful and had a awesome personality. He knew exactly what we needed and our expectations were met. He did a great job setting arrangements for my father who needed a wheelchair at Polynesian cultural center and Hoku Hawaii tour. We had fun on our family excursion. Thank you for your awesome customer service.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Hotel is full of tourists and is not really focused on serving the needs of a business traveler.The location is great for a tourist, but for a business person the traffic in the area is horrible and the parking rate of around $30 per night is high. The free buffet breakfast is a nightmare as it is loaded with tourists.Internet is spotty and not great at certain times of the day. The A/C did not work well. Rooms are dated. The hotel is a conversion form an older hotel.If you are in the area for business try and stay away from Waikiki area.

Hotel is comfortable, guest check-in was fast and efficient. Generally hotel staff were above average in friendliness though room closet/ elevator was a little dirty. Overpriced for what you get. Location is good and Charlies fixed rate taki service tio airport was very good. There were only two elevators which made wait for lift long at most times. I like the room layout, though no bath. Free wifi was fast and reliable.

Highly recommend Hyatt Place for your next trip to Hawaii. Very clean, comfortable rooms. Free breakky and Wi-Fi. Easy access to beach, shops, restaurants, bars, transport. Helpful staff. Could not fault it.

Great hotel, ocean view room, convenient location for access to shops, tour buses and local buses. Hyatt Place was 1 street back from main strip which was perfect if we wanted to avoid mass crowds. Tour bus pick up point is right out the front of the hotel also.

View isn't great but we were never in the room! Beach hotel, hotel beach!!! Lynn was super helpful in changing us to a double after Expedia put us in a king room. Us two friends wanted our own beds!!! Breakfast is a bonus too! Little breezy but hey it was free!! The noise is better away from the main drag too!! I'd stay here again!!!

I had scrutinised many options for my stay in Honolulu, but particularly wanted a room that looked towards the sea. I had stayed previously over the years at many other establishments but all had a side sea view, not full on.I was attracted to the Hyatt option but sadly it did not fulfil my entire expectations. Although the room was high level it had very broken outlook. The sales image on the website is deceptive and I found I was in fact some 3 blocks back from the beach, and the water view was sandwiched between some 3 high rise buildings in the foreground. The only real advantage was that I had the late morning and early afternoon balcony sun whenever in my room.I was impressed with the friendly and easy check in and subsequent dealings with staff. Unlike a lot of other establishments, my room was serviced very early each day by exceptionally friendly staff. I was most impressed The room was quite spacious, the bed was comfortable and everything worked. Perhaps as an aside though the room was somewhat utilitarian and plain.A bit of downside is the very basic and ordinary breakfast serviced poolside at the 3rd level. The breakfast seating area is adjacent ( outside - although with umbrella shade) in a very small area beside a somewhat miniature pool. Again the website is deceptive.The hotel is located some 15 min walk from the main central area of beach side Honolulu.Notwithstanding I had a very relaxing stay to reacquaint myself with Honolulu and the weather was fine.

Hotel nicely located close to the beach offering an excellent service and a very good breakfast buffet. Personnel knowledgeable that provide excellent advices. Having the breakfast buffet included in the price of the stay was a plus creating no hassle will travelling.

I stayed there for 11 nights during my vacation and i really cannot complain about anything. The room was nice and clean, the location is great and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nice and the wi-fi was good and you don't pay extra for it.

Great stay at Hyatt Place, Waikiki. Rooms are clean and comfortable and only a few minutes walk to the beach with good security in the hotel. Swimming pool was nice to cool off in and was it was nice to wake up to a buffet breakfast daily. Staff are friendly and helpful. Would definately stay at Hyatt Place again. Recommended stay +++++

checked in on nov 10 my brother had a free awards nighta lovely girl name chris front desk checked us inshe was so curteous and very professional really an asset to this hotelshe went over everything and also being platinum has great perksbut i know hyatt does their best in treating everyone equallythis hotel is beautiful nice lobby the ocean view room greatfree breakfast parking for a fee next doorabc store very close to hotelwithin walking distance of many businessesalso prior to going there spoke to jade she was very helpfulagain thank youChris, Jade and the rest of the staff

We stayed for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and the rooms are very clean and tidy in all areas. The breakfast Menu can be improved in some areas but overall was good service. Enjoyed our stay thank you.

They have excellent wi-fi in a great location close to all Waikiki action so you can walk to almost anything. Modern clean rooms with "custom" AC. Free breakfast could be improved but hey it's free. Good customer service too.
user_name:
Erin S
Ladera Ranch, United States

review_body: Great hotel 5 minute walk to the beach couldn't have ask for better bargain nice staff clean rooms breakfast in the morning no resort fees internet included valet $30 the hotel staff when i checked in the lady at the front desk upgraded me to ocean view being that I'm am a platium member she went out of her way it was nice to see

Hyatt Place is a short walk from the beach with a lot to offer. The room was nice and clean, and breakfast was included in the stay. The menu was excellent with a lot to choose from, including bacon and eggs, fresh fruit, oatmeal, yogurt, etc. I would definitely recommend Hyatt Place as a good value.
user_name:
Judithe H
Palm Bay, United States

review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place for 3 nights when I went to Honolulu for a friend's wedding. The hotel is about a block away from the start of Waikiki Beach. There is no direct beach access from the hotel. The service was good, but the facility is quite average. The self-parking lot was extremely small and was always full, so the only option was to pay for valet parking or to find parking at another hotel's parking lot. We were fortunate to receive a free upgrade to a deluxe room which was very spacious. Cleanliness was average -- I found a hair in the bathroom on the hand towel rack. The free breakfast offered eggs, bacon, french toast, bread, fruits, and cereal along with coffee and juices. Ambiance of the breakfast area is nice. Free wifi!Overall, this is a great budget hotel. I was told that this is the only hotel in the area without resort fees. However, it does not have any Hawaii "feel" to it. No glitz or glam, but it is practical and conveniently located.

Rooms are well appointed but extremely small. Good internet. The free breakfast not worth having. You'll need to use Google Maps to find. Its fine for just sleeping, not for relaxing by pool in Hawaii.

Booked and when arrived they had me booked for a different month then insisted that I had to pay an extra 40% as there was no booking for the day of arrival. To cap it off, a month later they try to bill me for a no show for the wrong first booking. Poor service, poor communication, poor response.

Had to spend the night in HNL on the way back to LA from Kauai. Chose Hyatt Place as I am a loyal Hyatt customer. Property was great, but getting a little dated. Food choices in hotel limited and barely passable quality for the price - go out and eat in the neighborhood - much better choices. Stayed on Penthouse floor, but didn't really feel it a special offering as compared to any other hotel room. Staff is impeccable for the most part but harried.

Hyatt Place on Paokalani avenue - it's a good bargain if booked early, anywhere from $500 to $2000 cheaper than the other options. Last minute the prices rose however. No extra resort fee. Feels like a good business hotel. Not a resort. Location excellent - two blocks (around 5 minutes walking? Less?) from Kuhio Beach, just south of Waikiki Beach proper. Kuhio is pleasant, with a seawall making it calmer. Otherwise you could easily walk north to Waikiki, to check out the main drag of shopping along the beach (which is open late, til 1030pm, for tourists), or check out Waikiki beach. You can grab free clean beach towels from the pool area, then drop them off when you return. Staff were in general very friendly - from the front desk to the car valets. Only exception was one night when we went down to the front desk to ask about how to get around to see the Honolulu city area, after the concierge had left for the night - the Japanese guy at the desk was unfriendly and didn't even make eye contact. Rooms were clean, very spacious (with a separate sofa area). Sink was outside the toilet / shower room. Beds were big and comfortable, though I found them too soft - softer than your average mattress. Maid service was friendly too. There is a breakfast included in your stay! It's a buffet near the pool area. There were a couple of hot items - one egg / meat based, one bread / waffle / toast based, a station with rice / miso soup / kim chee / tofu, a set of a couple types of pastries / bagels, and fruit / yogurt / cereal. Free juices, water, milk, coffee and tea. It wasn't super delicious or anything - kind of bland mass produced food - but it was free, good, plentiful and filling. WiFi was free and very fast, another nice bonus. Facilities are okay. Pool is kind of lame, but you're not there to stay at the pool. Parking is pricey, as it is everywhere in Waikiki - $25 a night for self park (which was never available while we were there), or $30 a day for valet. The valets were all very friendly, and took the initiative in helping with luggage. They seemed genuinely pleased when I slipped them a couple bucks each day. We called form the room before heading down, at usually didn't have to wait long. There was a mix of guests. Americans, Aussies, lots of Koreans, some Japanese and Chinese. Some families, some business travellers, some couples. It wasn't overrun with kids, if you want to avoid that, I think because there wasn't a lot of on-site resort stuff. Overall - if you book early - it's a relatively inexpensive place to stay in the Waikiki area. Not a resort - has a basic pool, but no attached shopping mall. Restaurant seemed basic - never tried it. Rooms aren't very fancy, but are nice. But you're in Hawaii to see the beach, not stay at the hotel - and this place was perfect for that. Book early for a god price. Free breakfast and WiFi. No resort fee. Big clean rooms to sleep in, close to everything. Recommended!
user_name:
John K
Boston, MA, United States

review_body: This was the first time I stayed at Hyatt Place. When I arrived earlier than their check-in time, I was greeted and given a room. Even though they only had the room with 2 queen beds available when I asked for King size bed, my other request honored. The room with King would be available later. I just decided to take the 2 queens since I would like to rest from the flight and settle everything. When I got in the room, I found it to be very spacious, more than a usual hotel room in Hawaii. There were 2 queen beds, and a sofa sleeper. Lots of space to walk around. The Lanai was clean and beautiful. Next morning breakfast had some variety, including miso soup, white rice, juice, egg, sausage, fresh fruit, coffee, etc. Simple but good. The seating was all outdoor, which was fine. The beach is only couple of minutes walk, and convenient store and restaurants very close by. Mini fridge in the room. I would recommend this Hyatt Place. The service was good, and location is awesome. There were some street noise but not bad. Being in the middle of Waikiki, the noise may not be avoidable. Ask for a quiet room if you prefer.

This had everything I needed for a successful business trip to Oahu. Right price, no resort fees, breakfast included, and a workout room. Location is good to explore Waikiki after work.
