Only complaint I had was that I didn't like the coffee at breakfast. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and secure. I'd stay here again.

Hotel was clean with good amenities. Free breakfast buffet was included, so although limited, it was a nice perk. Close to good restaurants. And easy, convenient valet parking. Would stay here again for business and pleasure.

Great place that is both close to all the attractions and the beach.. Only a 5 Minute to both. With numerous restaurants and shops that are close by. The room was very clean and came with coffee/tea maker. A bus stop is about 3 Minute walk that can get you to the rest of Waikiki.

I have never written a review about a vacation stay, but I have to say that my stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki hotel was definitely one of the best I have experienced. The rooms were clean and spacious. The location to the beach, activities, restaurants and shopping was excellent. The staff was also extremely helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Great hotel location ....close to everything. The Hyatt Place Waikiki, HI was great. Room was excellent and the bed was comfortable. Continental breakfast was good and had different options. Staff were all courteous.
user_name:
Edmund S
Coronado, CA., United States

review_body: This place has nice big rooms! We had breakfast included with our room and it was awesome. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our room faced a street and the noise was distracting at night, so next time I will ask for a higher floor. Overall we had a great stay here!!
user_name:
Stacy C
Ewa Beach, United States

review_body: Nice hotel. Very well priced. Clean and neat as a pin. The breakfast was complimentary and very good. Staff very friendly and helpful. And close to the beach. Free Seattle's best coffee an Tazo teas first thing in the morning down in the lobby. The Starbucks located in the hotel is pricey...but that's Starbucks, right.

very nice hotel, close to the beach and shopping center , close to Diamond Head volcano. I liked outside set up for the breakfast we can enjoy the weather. The only thing I would add it is water and coffee in the lobby. IT would be very convenient ,,especially when you come back from excursion or beach.

We had a very enjoyable stay for 7 nights. A suite upgrade on arrival got our stay off to a great start. We had asked for a room with an ocean view and the hotel was able to accommodate our request. The staff were very efficient and most helpful - nothing was too much for them. The location is very good - away from the thronging mobs on Kalakaua Avenue - but a very short walk to a lovely clean beach and with public transport at the door. The inclusion of breakfast and free wi-fi enhanced our stay and the lack of resort fees was great. For anyone wanting a less costly accommodation option Hyatt Place is worthy of consideration.

The Hyatt Place in Waikiki is a wonderful place to stay. Complimentary breakfast, only 2 blocks to the beach, and is quiet compared to the bigger hotels off Kalakaua and Kuhio streets. Comfortable beds, great staff. Cannot compliment our stay enough! Will definitely go back.

There are many hotels in Waikiki Honolulu, but not too many that include a healthy breakfast buffet in the price. Besides this bonus, the hotel staff aligns to a high customer service standard making you feel as a value entity.

The staff at the hotel was very helpful with whatever we needed. We had a later flight and they kept our luggage safe as we enjoyed our last day after checkout. They also called a cab for us with a flat rate to the airport, so we didn't need to worry about that. I think it was Charlie's Cab service which was very prompt and helpful.

We have stayed at many of the hotels, big and small, along Waikiki Beach over the years. This was our first stay at the Hyatt Place. It turned out to be pleasant overall. We were greeted warmly by Chris ( female) at the front desk, and that was the start of finding that hotel personnel were uniformly pleasant and polite.Our room, on a high floor, was clean and light-filled, and we had a partial ocean/Diamond Head view. The entire floor seemed well-cared for by Josephine, a friendly staff member.The only obvious minus was the breakfast, which was included with the room. There was nothing Hawaiian available on the lines. No Guava juice or guava jelly/jam, for example. The jelly/jam was standard Smuckers, Welch, which can be found in most any hotel breakfast anywhere. There were no bananas, no papaya. What was available was good, but limited.

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Place for the last week.We stay here every October for good reason.The service is excellent/the rooms are up to date and clean.The staff on all levels are always glad to help in any instance from a tourist question regarding restaurants to great places to visit.I highly recommend the Hyatt place from couples on a romantic vacation or families with children.The breakfast that is offered daily is unbeatable. Fresh fruit,all normal breakfast beverages, and various breakfast entrees is fantastic.Do yourselves a favor and book your next visit to this wonderful hotel.

Very pleased with our stay in this hotel. The location is convenient to restaurants, shopping, and beach. Just a walk of 5 minutes or less to the beach. Our room was very comfortable with 2 queen size beds and a sitting area with a sofa bed. The included breakfast was adequate and convenient. I would recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Alfonso L
Boston, MA, United States

review_body: Clean, modern & comfortable hotel in a great location. Friendly staff. Large rooms. All of the staff were friendly & helpful. Free buffet breakfast, food was of high quality. Guest laundry. Very close to a great beach for the kids. We had a nice view of Diamond Head from balcony. No negatives worth mentioning. I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed for a week in October and really enjoyed our stay. It is only a block from the beach and on one of the streets were all of the buses go past (very handy when going to Ala Moana or Waikele Outlets) the hotel. Breakfast was great, alfresco eating and different selections every day. Close to a number of restaurants and bars.

We booked this trip last minute so we were really nervous about what we would get for the price we paid and were amazed when we got there. It was a block away from the beach and about 5 minutes walking from a major shopping and eating area with amazing shops (Prada, Omega, Tiffany's, etc) but they also had super inexpensive shops on the same road to buy souvenirs, provisions, etc. The bed was sooooo comfortable. it was like sleeping at home. The rooms were clean and big. The breakfast was amazing too...such a great selection. The staff went above and beyond what I expected. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Fantastic service, hospitality and location. Everything was above reproach.... Short walk to beach that was not too busy and had a sea wall so great for just swimming leisurely. Also, many great places to eat just a short walk away ..

This is the second time we have stayed at this property. It is very close to the beach and many restaurants. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We incurred a problem during the visit and was resolved by the manager Jose Fernandes. I would consider returning here on my next trip.

This hotel is in a great location. Walkable to beach and Lulu's (our favorite spot for dinner). Our kids enjoyed the waterfall on the wall near the check in counter. Also, area was safe. Parking was a bit steep, so we wound up parking across the street at the Waikiki Banyan. No prob! The two shops on the first floor had excellent prices and quality for their products. The hotel rooms were clean. Breakfast attendants were attentive. Only thing I would complain about is the size of the pool. But who needs a pool when you have the beach!

My wife and I were very pleased with the hotel. From the very beginning the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The on-site travel coordinators were great to have there as well. They really made booking an all day trip to Pearl Harbor easy. I could see someone posting a less than stellar review if they had a mountain view room on a low floor but we booked an ocean view on a high floor and it was awesome and worth a few extra bucks. The hotel is within walking distance to everything we wanted, including a 3 minute walk to the beach. We also took in the Honolulu Zoo which is a 5 minute walk as well. Breakfast was great every day. How can you beat a free hot breakfast in Oahu with the prices there? The pool was a bit small but there weren't many people at the pool anyway. Would definitely stay again on our next trip.
user_name:
Samuel R
Orange Park, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Hotel for 8 nights this month, which we booked as part of a package on Expedia.We loved the location of this hotel, the beach was at the end of our street and many of our favourite eating places were close by. Our room was huge, with 2 Very plush Queen sized beds, very comfy pillows and a separate lounge area with a three seater lounge and a single chair. We also had 2 balconies, both with a table and 2 chairs,which were great for drying our clothes. We didn't have much of a view as we overlooked the side street, but there was no street noise even though we were on the 2nd floor. The room had a Tea/ Coffee machine with coffe pods and tea bags supplied, my only complaint, was there was no milk supplied. Buffet Breakfast was included and was basic, but adequate. Most of our evening meals were at restaurants on or near the main strip, but we did order room service a couple of times and found the prices quite reasonable. For basics, like snacks, milk and alcohol we went to the ABC store a few doors down, these stores are everywhere and stocked just about everything, including food, souvenirs, clothing, alcohol, sunscreen, medicines and beach inflatables. The hotel staff were always smiling and friendly, our house keeper Julie, was very attentive and went out of her way to help us.

Good location, friendly staff, but not to other Hyatts standards ... little disappointing. good size room. No club floor, breakfast disappointing and little messy. Pool not great. Overall average but not as good as other Hyatts i've been to.

A couple of regular hotel issues we faced were dealt with quickly and very graciously - we were lavished with sincere warmth through the entire hotel - staff in every department seemed friendly and accommodating day after day. We got to know our room cleaner Adelma which was nice too.

Great location, just 2 blocks from the beach... Easy walking distance to all that Waikiki has to offer, room was large, very clean, with small bathroom, the vanity was in the bedroom, a little strange but didn't really bother us. Breakfast was a good spread, something different everyday, but be prepared, it's very busy and finding a seat can be a bit of a struggle! The parking situation is a bit annoying a sign outside states $18 parking, and at the front desk they quote $25 for self parking which appears to be always full or $30 to valet... We chose neither and parked at the zoo, just 2 blocks away and $1 per hour...

Caring Staff... wonderful stay. Thank you I enjoyed my time in your Hotel. Every Staff member I met greeted me with a smile. I will be back because of the friendly staff. Job well done! Thank you from the bottom of my Heart.

Our room was lovely and clean, All the amenities were kept clean at all times.Staff were always happy to help and always greeted us with a smile. We always had plenty of room and I felt safe in this hotel.The room itself had a massive TV that could turn 360 so we could either watch it in the lounge or in bed. The hotel itself is only about 300 meter walk to the beach.Can't wait to travel back to this hotel.

Staff were great, with the bus stops just outside shops 2 paces away eatery, beach just there, friendly staff who go out of there way, happy hour every night, bar staff, reception staff, house keeping, travel advisor Cameron so helpful eager to help. Would definitely recommend so central to everything... Definitely going back... Can't really fault anything... 1 block back from beach which stopped the noise.... When 1st booked we weren't sure where we would b but found the location to b perfect.... Aloha ;)

Recently stayed 1 night prior to cruise. Allowed early check in which after an 18 hour flight was lovely. Room was spacious, clean and easily accommodated 2 adults and 2 older children. Breakfast setting was not ideal, but would consider staying there again.

Situated just far enough back from the beach so you aren't in the thick of it but you still get a glimpse of the ocean from your balcony. The tram to the shopping centre ran from just outside the hotel. We were there during spring break so breakfast by the pool was a bit of a bun fight but other than that, highly recommended.

I was at the Hyatt Place in Jan. 2014 and was impressed w/ the facility that I immediately had no second thoughts about this trip with my husband who is in a wheelchair. It was the perfect place! We highly recommend this hotel.

Finding 2 Queen beds without paying for a suite in Waikiki can be challenging, but Hyatt Place offers 2 queens (and some with sofa sleepers as well) and includes breakfast and wifi at a very reasonable rate! The beds are excellent Hyatt beds! This was our second stay at Hyatt Place and we were not disappointed. Great choice for families or groups!

Our room was at the very back of the hotel in what appeared to be some sort of annex. It overlooked really run down apartments and we were pleased we hadn't booked for a week. It would have been a really depressing beach holiday.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place for our second visit to Waikiki. Front desk service was always friendly and helpful. Rooms in fantastic condition. Great location near the beach (and one of our fave restaurants, Arancino di Mare). Breakfast was fine and free in-room wifi was a huge bonus (can't believe you still have to pay for wifi at most hotels). Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Nice clean hotel with great beds, fresh complimentary breakfast each morning by the pool, close to the beach and shopping, close to The Bus stop on Kuhio, but not always the ocean view you request. Had a little difficulty adding one more person, because they tried to charge a different original rate, instead of adding $50 per night, but we got it straightened out.

Very enjoyable trip. Had a great time. Hotel was close to where we were picked up for our tours. Within walking distance of the Waikiki Beach and the Honolulu zoo and the stores. Would recommend to others to stay here Thank you

Stayed here for 9 nights in early October and was surprised at how great this hyatt place was! :) I am a diamond hyatt member and knew that since it was a hyatt place that it would not be a 5 star like perhaps the higher end brands of Hyatt (Regency, Park etc) - however this place was wonderful! We were on the 20th floor with a view of the ocean although you see some buildings - but it was great! The beds were super comfortable as were the pillows. And that is saying A LOT. I travel everywhere with my own pillow due to past experiences so I honestly don't recall a hotel that I enjoyed their pillows (even high end 5 star hotels that cost 5 times the amount). Also air conditioning worked well and housekeeping kept our room spotless every day. Bonus was the Toto washlet toilet seat cover - not sure if all rooms have it - but it was nice. If you don't know what it is - google it :P Breakfast was included every day and while it may not have been 5 star it was decent! I was happy with it! also there are free towels that you get to take with you to the beach from the front lobby which is only a couple blocks away (not very far at all). People and staff are so friendly and welcoming!! I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's great that there is no additional resort fee and wifi is free! :) How awesomeTHANK you for a wonderful stay and a special shout out to Lei who was a great housekeeper with such kindness and does an amazing job. I highly recommend the hyatt place. I've stayed at condos before and this is way better in terms of cleanliness and while it doesn't have stove, there are lots of restaurants to try out by checking out tripadvisor or yelp that are not too pricey. I also stayed at the Hilton hotel as well - I still prefer the hyatt place in Waikiki.

This is a very nice hotel with an excellent location. Only one block from the ocean with several resturants within walking distance. The hotel was room was very clean, but the a/c could have worked more efficiently. The overall appearance of the hotel was very appealing. The breakfast offered was just okay.

I just returned home after spending September 30 - October 11 at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. I arrived at 6 am in the morning and asked the front desk to hold my luggage for the day since check-in isn't until mid-afternoon. They had me wait for 2 minutes and then surprised me by allowing me to check-in at 6 am which was amazing. I had time to go upstairs, unpack and make it to the 3rd floor for the 6:30 am - 10 am complimentary breakfast. I have read mostly negative reviews about this FREE breakfast. Yes it is mostly outdoor seating, maybe 20 chairs with tables for outdoor covered dining and then another 100 or so chairs outdoors mostly with large umbrellas to protect you from the sun. I ate outside 12 mornings and 2 mornings had a very light mist sprinkles which was not a problem. You can also use a large 24" x 16" tray to bring food to your room or the lobby dining area to enjoy your FREE breakfast. Breakfast every day includes steamed rice, kimshi, variety of bagels, English muffins, toast, choice of yogurts, granalos, pastries, cereals, milk, apple juice, orange juice, scrambled eggs, amazing pineapple. Every few days they rotate pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausage, and breakfast sandwich with spinach, ham, egg, cheese on an English muffin. I am sure I am missing a few items but these are the foods I enjoyed at breakfast. Now you can go to the Hilton Hawaiian Village buffet and get a few other items and made to order eggs but you will pay $34 per person for breakfast. The Hyatt also does not charge for wifi, they have computers and printers for FREE, local phone calls are free, fitness center free, no resort/hospitality fee, on the 3rd floor they have washers & dryers for guest use. I had a meeting room at the hotel 9 days from 8 am - 8 pm. Every morning the room was unlocked on time for me, they replenished my beverages, trash was empty and they checked on me at least once per day to see if I needed anything. My sales Manager Michelle is AMAZING to work with and as a person. The front office/lounge/valet staff is 5 star. The room size is standard, very clean, and in excellent condition. The lunch/dinner food available in the lobby was good and beats walking to another place, waiting 30 minutes for a table after a long 12 hour work day. Having "Stella" on tap was great in the frosted glasses. I spend 100+ nights a year in hotels and have stayed in 5 star resort and business hotels. However, the staff at Hyatt Place Waikiki is the best overall staff I have EVER experienced in all of my travels. In 8 days I will be in San Diego on business, and I am cancelling my reservation at another chain and will be staying at a Hyatt Place or "sister" property. Mahalo to my new Hawaii home Hyatt Place

I decided to take a trip to Oahu for my 37th birthday and I booked everything via Priceline. The reviews of the Hyatt Place were great which is why I chose to stay there. We checked in and Troy was so nice and upgraded our room (Happy Birthday to me!) and the room was beautiful, the view was of the gorgeous mountains and a view of the beach and it was amazing. The breakfast buffet each morning was great and I loved the variety of food and the pineapple was amazing!! The service was great and I love the fact that the hotel is non smoking. I appreciate the wifi which was very helpful. The location is 1 block from Waikiki Beach and I plan to stay there again during my next visit.

We booked our one week Honolulu vacation with Expedia. We reviewed most of the hotels along Waikiki Beach and finally selected "Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach". So let me share this with you. Which hotel along Waikiki Beach has these offerings : [1] No resort Fee [2] Free WiFi [3] Breakfast included [4] Hospitality suite for guest with late departures [5] Waikiki Beach is just 5 mins down the road [6+7+8 ... see their website]. None that we have come across except this Hotel with a Heart ...Hyatt Place ! OK, do understand that this hotel has a Hyatt brand and it's designed with a resort ambience. If you are expecting to see the hotel designed like a Hyatt in New York or Singapore, then, its not. Maybe the Hyatt Regency down the road may meet your expectations. So, let me share with you. The Hyatt Place is located at the tail end of Waikiki Beach strip [just round the corner from the zoo]. It may not have the beach front but Waikiki Beach is just 5 mins away from the entrance of the hotel. Walk out onto the street turn left and the beautiful sandy beach is just 5 mins away.About the hotel. In my opinion, it is a high 3.75 star resort property. And what is important is that this property is very professionally managed. The service team, from the front desk, to the F&B service and the housekeeping crew they are really outstanding. Everyone is very polite and has a smile on their face any time of the day and all ready to assist you. We like Andre at the front desk..super helpful.Smiles and a friendly team definitely adds to any wonderful experience. There are 2 towers. We stayed on the 3rd floor of the tower that served breakfast. The carpeted room was a good size furnished with the expected hotel furniture. Nice and functional designs not old, not worn-out furniture, well maintained as we understand that the hotel was upgraded just a few years ago. Good size vanity area and good size toilet cum shower cubicle. Night curtains and sheers added to the ambience of the room. Air-conditioning quiet. We had complementary 5 bottles of locally brewed beer in the fridge and a plate of fruits. That was a very nice touch. Otherwise all the necessary bells and whistles are provided in the room. We did not have to request for anything that was missing. The room was clean and plenty of towels available. Beach towels available at the front desk. Housekeeping and maintenance crew are on the ball, everyday. Breakfast by the patio on the 3rd floor. A Very good spread [you will be surprised]. Different menu daily. Plenty to eat. Fresh pineapple galore. Was looking forward to papayas but apparently not served. Anyway, if you are a breakfast person be assured you will not starve. The kids will have a ball. Coffee is Seattle's Best which [in my opinion] yuks !. Maybe the way the coffee was prepared. Needs a serious review by the management. Take your breakfast to your room if you like. They are easy with that. Because the hotel does not have a beach front, the rooms on the lower floors does not have any great views. You're facing the property next to this hotel and that was our only 'X' mark on our list. The location of the hotel is just outstanding. Everything you will want to experience is within walking distance along Waikiki Beach. ABC stores[convenient stores] are located around every corner [just like Starbucks in Vancouver]. Finally, check out is at 11am. And if your departure flight is a late fight in the night, the hotel offers a hospitality room [ 45 minutes] for you to take a shower etc, free !. Now that's really nice. I highly recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki and I wish you a very happy vacation if you're on the way there !

Hotel is a short walk to both the beach plus all the activity of Waikiki including many restaurant options. Most importantly I appreciated the friendly, helpful staff. Every hotel staff member whom I encountered greeted me with a smile plus a hello and offered to assist me in any way. We also enjoyed the daily buffet breakfast and the convenient, reasonably priced 24/7 Gallery menu options.

The Hyatt Place offers very reasonable rates (for Waikiki standards) and good amenities, located at just one block from the beach.The property is well maintained.Rooms are comfortable and with all the required amenities. They were also well insulated.About the breakfast, there is definitely room for improvement in both location and food:- it is served outside, by the pool. It doesn't seem to have enough chairs and tables for all the guests and the disorganization along the food stalls is obvious;- there are eggs, sausages, bread, fruits, yogurt, milk, oatmeal and cereals, coffee. But the food tasted quite bland, and at times, some of the food was not timely replaced. Parking is only available using a valet, so the hotel entrance gets very busy, since it hardly allows two cars to go through simultaneously.Both check-in and check-out were done quickly, by friendly and helpful staff.

I stayed in Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for 3 nights on the way back from Australia. The location of the hotel is excellent, 2 minutes to the beach. Rooms are nice and clean, bed is comfortable and great linen and pillows. The staff at the front desk are friendly and accommodating, check in was fast. My arrival time was earlier that the check in time but I received my room immediately upon arrival and on my last day I was allowed to stay in the hotel after my check out time until my departure which was late at night. The price includes breakfast which is a great addition, however the variety is poor and in my opinion the breakfast needs improvement. Other than that I enjoyed the stay very much and I recommend this hotel.

I need a room for just one night and did not want to have to pay a resort fee of $25-$50. This is one of the reasons I chose the Hyatt Park. Although we only had a partial view of Diamond Head the room was clean and very new. The breakfast buffet was excellent and even included a small section serving miso soup, kim chee, rice and other condiments. This was a very unusual and nice touch. The other breakfast items were also very good. My stay at this hotel was very relaxing and most enjoyable. The location was situated close to the zoo and I did not have to spend too much time sitting in traffic.

The staff and possibly contract employees were courteous and helpful in all matters. The complimentary breakfast was superb and plentiful, the room was spacious and attractive, and the hotel was located in a somewhat tranquil area. I look forward to the next visit in a year.

Reasonable rates, good amenities such as pool, free breakfast, fitness room, free wi-fi, close to beach and shops, very friendly and accommodating staff. Overall cleanliness in the room was good except for the bar fridge which was quite dirty. Some chairs in the lounge need serious cleaning.

This was our first time at a Hyatt Place. What a wonderful hotel. I am now eager to stay at another one to see if they are all this great. Staff was wonderful, friendly and very helpful. Public areas and guest rooms were pristine. Free breakfast was delicious and free happy hour wad a plus too!

Location is 1 block from the beach and relatively close to everything. Trolley bus stop only about 100m away and at $2 per trip is a good way to get around.Friendly and helpful staff. Nice clean room. Comfortable bed. Modern complex with wifi and separate computer desks for clients.Rooms were a bit small but still big enough. Serviced daily.We found the breakfasts to be very average, especially the egg meals. Still, does kick start you in the morning!We would stay there again.

Wonderful service, great breakfast that was included and the menu changed daily, 1 block from the beach and local transportation. Would highly recommend.We went to all the surrounding tourist attractions using the bus system and it was flawless. Staff are always ready to assist in any way they can.

Good Location, very friendly staff and very good service, housekeeping was excellent and very clean. we enjoy loung area at night time bar sever was very good. room was lovely and so easy acces to everything.

My experience at the Hyatt Place Waikiki was wonderful. From the first interaction at the front desk to check-in, I received excellent customer service during my entire stay. Great happy hour and quality service at the lobby bar too. Very comfortable room and convenient location with easy access to the beach, shopping and restaurants.
user_name:
Tanya N G
Folsom, United States

review_body: Booked through an agency, I wasn't sure what to expect. We got the two double beds requested, and were pleased with the breakfast options. The skillet was adequate, but we liked even better the scrambled eggs and bacon the next day. Other cold choices (cereal, muffins, bagels, toast, juice etc.) were plentiful. Being so close to the beach was a plus. My friend enjoyed the Blue Moon bar special, but not the price ($7).

we enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Beach Waikiki . Staff friendly. Breakfast was good. could have been better. I would stay again we could see the beach from our room. And it was a two blocks away. We were on the beach by 6.30a.m. most mornings.

Spent a week at Hyatt Place Waikiki, very happy with choice. Beautifully looked after hotel with great staff. Our room was quite spacious - great corner lounge in room to watch TV. Views from balcony were great - afternoon sunsets the best!! Great breakfast included in price. Positioned in quieter end of Waikiki which we prefer.

Great location and the staff was very nice and helpful. Especially Hiede at the front desk. The maid service did a great job. Also Ron did a wonderful job helping set up activities and planning our trip's activities.

Great place to stay very near the beach. Great staff, nice rooms. There was a slight glitch with one of the elevators, but that was nothing the staff could control. I will look to stay here again when we return to Honolulu in the near future.

Just off the main drag and easy access to get in and out of Waikiki. Elevators have a minimal wait and the room was very comfortable. The air conditioning was functioning well and kept the room cool despite very hot temperatures. And since you are away from the main drag, it was quite quiet. The staff was friendly and attentive.
user_name:
Joseph Richard B
Honolulu, United States

review_body: The staff was professional and caring. Close to the beach with a very good breakfast buffet! The rooms were very quite so I did not hear my neighbors at all! Love being able to walk to the bech in 4 minutes also good take out very close by.

I have stayed at numerous Hyatt Place properties for business. They are mostly the same and always a pleasure. That's why when I found one in the area we wanted on vacation, I jumped on it. Our options for rooms were typical King/Queen with Choices of City, Mountain or Beach views. We chose the city with sofa bed. They all advertised the sofa bed. We didn't care about the sofa bed, but did care about the extra space and seating, something we have come to expect from these properties. All of the photos showed a SOFA bed AND all descriptions were of a SOFA bed. When we arrived the room had a chair for one person, tucked tightly in the corner, that COULD become a bed. When we asked to move to a room with a sofa bed, they were accommodating and honored the original rate, but assigned us an identical room! That was a serious error. On try 3 we received the room we expected. The rest of the stay was pleasant with good service but it should also be noted that the elevators are VERY slow and not adequate for the size property. They also advertise a self-park option as opposed to their valet, but when we arrived that turns out to be a private garage down the street that is not affiliated with the property and is cash only.

This was a really nice room with a view and in an area that allowed us easy access to the activities we were looking to enjoy. The staff were excellent and helped us in getting transportation when needed.

It was a CLEAN Hotel we could see the ocean from our room, fresh fruit on the complimentary breakfast was AWSEOME! Staff was Very Friendly it is located close to Everything. Felt safe staying there.Would stay there again!

We came to Waikiki for a friends' wedding, we travel to Wakiki at least once a year for business and/or pleasure and have stayed at many hotels, the Hyatt Place was a great choice. We were greeted by the friendly staff, checked in to our room right away, the room was nice, everything worked well and had a nice (partial) view. The free breakfast was well done, a decent variety of food and good coffee, most hotels do not provide a free breakfast. The hotel is located about 3 blocks away from Waikiki Beach, close to many interests. The staff was very helpful and nice, also great to have a place that believes in customer service. I would recommend Hyatt Place.

We stayed here for one night until a rental home on the other side of the island was available. I picked this location vs. other Hyatt Honolulu locations due to the reviews of other travellers. If you're redeeming points it's pretty good value for the number of points you need compared to other Hyatt locations in Honolulu. We used the valet parking which was fine and only cost a small amount more than parking it across the street ourselves. All in all, it was a good experience and I would gladly stay again.

We stayed here 3 nights in September. Overall the place was OK. Very reasonable rates for the Waikiki beach area and located near the beach, the zoo and many restaurants. My only issue is that it rained almost every morning during our visit, making their breakfast area which is outdoors unusable. Perhaps covering the breakfast area with a large canopy for use during the rainy season would help! However this aside, I would stay here again if I were visiting the area in the future. we were happy with our stay here.

Our recent stay at the Hyatt Place was perfect. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The AC worked well (Yay)! The included wifi and breakfasts were wonderful perks. The staff was helpful and the hotel was in great condition. Great location, too! One block to beach, one block to canal, one block to the zoo. And a bus stop right outside. Perfect. Would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends.

We were not expecting much from this place, but we were pleasantly surprised with what this place offered. We booked a ocean view room and it had a decent view of that. The room is on the small side, but efficient enough. Free breakfast was really good with outdoor seating. The best part was that the lobby lounge area was not clouded at all like other hotels on Kalakaua, but walking distance to a lot of things. This place is really convenient and quiet. If you need a parking, you can park at Waikiki Banyan for $20/day.http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60982-d2410134-r313440869-Henry_s_Place-Honolulu_Oahu_Hawaii.html#

We loved the beds and pillows, hyatt was handy to all transports, beach and restaurants. Small enough to be personal, but still had all facilities. Good internet & air con. Staff were excellent, our day trip consultant knew all his products and did not try to oversell / up sell any products.

1) Very courteous staff2) Included hot breakfast with good variety and quality3) Very conveniently located relative to the beach, Honolulu Zoo and Diamond Head4) Very clean and well maintained5) Keeping the room rate in mind, very good rooms and bathrooms6) NO RESORT FEEHonestly, you can't go wrong with this hotel. For the price, I challenge anyone to suggest a better hotel in Waikiki. We loved our stay.Mahalo!

Stayed here for four nights, in an ocean view room with balcony on the 12th floor. The room was clean, and the king bed was comfortable (but a little too soft for me). The ensuite shower room was clean, with good water pressure. Very quiet air conditioning unit in the room, fast wi-fi, and there was a large safe in the closet. Breakfast was a bit of a bun fight, because it rained every morning of my stay, and there was limited seating available due to most of it being outdoors - but they provided a tray in the room, so I could take breakfast back to it. Housekeeping did not clean the room on one day, despite me being out all day, except for two hours in the afternoon. The hotel is not right on the seafront, but it is only two minutes walk away from the beach, shops and restaurants along there. I would stay here again.

Room smelled like mildew.The Breakfast space was completely inadequate for the number of guests and the hours need to be longer. There was 20-30 people waiting at 630 AM for breakfast. They should start at 530-600 AM. The breakfast space was over crowded because the lack of cover from the rain made 2/3 of the area worthless. Very poor infrastructure to be unable to accommodate more guests and protect them from rain, since it rains quite often in Hawaii. Valet parking issue with the front dropoff area being waaay too small. Valets were nice and prompt but the space is very small. The staff was pleasant, space was convenient.

Love the HPWB. They know their property and clients very well. Rooms are beautiful and great for business travel. Very convenient location, with lots of excellent dining options nearby. Always feel like I'm a VIP guest. The valets are really helpful.
user_name:
Laurel A
San Francisco, United States

review_body: We brought my 91-year-old WWII veteran father to Honolulu and this turned out to be an ideal hotel for our visit. It's only a block and a half from the beach, has a terrific breakfast buffet (a big timesaver in the mornings), the room was spacious, the beds were comfy, and even though our room was just above the breakfast dining area, we were able to sleep in because the room stayed dark and quiet. It's also only a block from one of the main tour bus pickup spots. The texting system works great for getting quick answers from the front desk. Our only complaints were that the in-room refrigerator wasn't cold even on the coldest setting and the bathroom fan only worked sporadically. But these are such minor nits. I would totally stay here again.
user_name:
Michael B
Santa Clara, United States

review_body: Overall, a very good hotel and I would stay here again. The staff was great and the facility was very nice. The room is a little on the small side, but very nice. But the fixtures and furniture all appear to be new. The breakfast area staff was outstanding and They have a large nice outdoor dining area. Unfortunately,The lobby and bar area are not enclosed and are uncomfortably warm. Also, they did not have enough on site self parking, but we were able to park in a parking garage across the street. This hotel has very good rates for the Honolulu area with breakfast included and no resort fee!

Excellent stay,- exceeded our expectations. Staff is obviously trained to make customers feel welcomed. Beautiful hotel in great location. Free full breakfast. Large room, one block from beach. No resort fees. Did a lot of research before choosing this hotel and it paid off. Best deal in the area.
user_name:
Charlene C
Coral Springs, United States

review_body: I stayed alone and felt safe. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great. If someone complains about it they must eat at The Four Seasons in LA every day. The room was clean and the view was wonderful. I am already planning to come back next year.
user_name:
Cheryl Ann C
louisville, United States

review_body: Wonderful staff, very close to the beach. There was just enough variety in the daily breakfast throughout our weeklong stay. Elevators are a little slow given the size of the hotel but not enough to be a big deal. Be prepared however that you cannot turn your A/C lower than 68, when the humidity is high in HI it is very stuffy/hot in the rooms but for most people you can probably make do. Loved our stay very much and hope to return in the future. We loved taking part in the Lei making session the hotel provided in the lobby on one night of our stay. We went to several attractions including the Big Kahuna Luau, Diamond Head, the Dole Plantation, Lanakai and Sandy beaches, the North Shore and the Hollywood Movie Tour (You can see where Jurrasic Park and other big movies were filmed--very cool) Oahu is so beautiful! Mahalo!
user_name:
Gino Anthony H
Milwaukee, United States

review_body: The room was large and very comfortable. The room cleanliness and house keeping services were excellent but the many plusses were undermined by the breakfast service. Regrettably, it rained on both mornings we were there. I acknowledge that the hotel cannot control the weather. However, the breakfast dining room is in an open and exposed area in the hotel and there no capacity to provide any undercover seating for the substantial number of guests who turned up for breakfast on both days. That meant that most had to take their breakfast back to their rooms. No trays provided - we were advised to go back to our room and bring our own tray. Guests were standing in tight groups all around the breakfast buffet making it difficult to access the various foods on offer and to obtain and eat breakfast in a calm and orderly manner.The selection of breakfast foods - both hot and cold - was limited and basic. For the price paid for accommodation - I would have expected much better.

The staff at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach makes one feel "at home and at ease" from the moment they check-in to when they check-out. The location is a mere five minute stroll to the heart of both shopping and beach front activity. Plenty of things to do for all member of ones family or group. No need for car rental (IMO) as the public transportation is abundant and diverse.

We first booked another hotel which seemed to be a crappy one when we arrived. We started looking for another hotel and we end up at the Hyatt! Friendly staff, nice rooms, nice complimentary Breakfast, good location! I reccomend this hotel to everyone!

Great location and friendly staff. Great for families. Will sure return to this property. Loved the double balcony in our room. Easy access to beach and ABC store just 500 feet away. Enjoyed our stay!

The location was fabulous, walk to beach, trolley and several restaurants. The employees at this hotel would do anything they could to make our stay the best! We got a great deal at the last minute and since they weren't full they gave us a free upgrade due to a great assistant manager Ihab and a bartender Heidi, they both were looking out for our best interests and helped us have a beautiful stay. We also had wonderful service all the way around to include a housekeeper named Pacita and a fellow at breakfast that saw to our every need. The people make the place!

Hotels in Waikiki have generally been of 2 types: super expensive "resort" type hotels or average budget friendly hotels/motels. In the past, for both cases it usually meant dated rooms or lightly renovations in an old (sometimes moldy) shell. The HP Waikiki is an example of a good renovation of what was once an old "budget-friendly" hotel (I believe the old Ocean Resort). In this case, the owners did a good job of doing a gut renovation of the property so that most everything is new. The rooms are good but depending on which tower you get, you either get the standard (larger) HP room or a much tighter and smaller version of it. From what I could tell, it seems that the rooms closer to the ocean have the smaller rooms (a tradeoff for views?). I found the smaller rooms definitely tight for 2 people while the larger standard rooms were a nice surprise to find in Waikiki.Staff here is very friendly and helpful. On one occasion I needed to pay with multiple gift cards and the agent needed some extra time to process them but did so cheerfully. Beach towels are obtained from the front desk and are readily available----it's a short 7 minute walk to the (nicer) beaches in Waikiki. Plenty of food options are nearby (the onsite restaurant is more geared towards breakfast pastries and prepackaged sandwiches). As for the complimentary breakfast buffet, try to avoid prime times as it can get extremely busy with long waits in line and low table availability. On a side note, if staying multiple days, you may get tired of the sameness of the buffet (the hot egg entree changes only slightly each day) so either don't try everything the same morning or go elsewhere to break up the monotony.The best thing about the HP Waikiki besides location and friendly staff?? NO RESORT FEES! Let's hope they hang on to that as it's a huge plus from the rip-off prices at the other places.

Perhaps our expectations were high but we were disappointed in this Hyatt. The staff was friendly and helpful in every way. Our room was clean. But we had reserved the deluxe superior room with a ocean view and we were disappointed. The view was between two hotels so it was a very narrow view of the ocean. We are relatively small people and our bathroom was very small in the shower and toilet area. We do accept some responsibility for not checking to see if we could have gotten a better room for, as I said, the staff was very accommodating. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot speak to a dinning experience except for the breakfast brunch. We felt the breakfast was very carb loaded with very little protein which was not to our liking. We also noticed that the sound level room to room was not great as we heard the toilet from the neighbors room each time it was used. The location was very convenient to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Getting out for touring by car was easy enough. Probably if there is another visit to Hawaii we would not stay in the Waikiki area.

Excellent property with good staff service, but needs improvement in the buffet breakfast included in tariff. After 2 days of a 7 day stay, breakfast proved tiresome, particularly the hot items offered.

I am a diamond gold passport member so have stayed at Hyatt place all around the country. This one is true to form - good room, good service, good breakfast, etc. I normally stay at the Hyatt regency down the street, but wanted to give this a try. As long as you are aware that this is a value play - not a resort - you should not be disappointed. I would definitely stay there again.

Overall, our experience was great. I usually stay at Hyatt Place when traveling for work, so I had certain expectations. Those expectations led to one major disappointment with this location. At every other Hyatt Place location I have stayed at, there was a nice sized sitting area adjacent to the bed. At this specific location there was only a small desk & small sofa. I did not see anything online indicating that was the case, and wished I had known when booking.  The staff was nice and friendly. There was an issue when we arrived, with them not having our revised reservation. They stated that there was an issue with new system my travel site used, I had paperwork showing the revised reservation. It took over an hour to figure everything out. The hotel was fully Booked, but they were able to find us a room.

Had a stay cation at Hyatt Park Place with an awesome view of the incoming surf. Very quick check-in and desk clerk offered a late 2:00 pm check out which was really nice. We had an opportunity to visit the Okinawan Festival at Kapiolani Park and to casually walk around Waikiki. We appreciate the central location of the Hyatt and it's great customer service.

Good place perfectly located. Breakfast for European customers could be improved to have fresh bread (baguette for example), butter and hot or cold chocolate. Would suggest to cover the breakfast area with a grid to to not have all these birds flying and walking around

Though it was only overnight we really enjoyed our stay. Quite location but still within walking distance of the beach, transport, restaurants and shopping. Very clean hotel, we got upgraded to a lovely size room. Breakfast buffet was good too.

Pros:- Location is great. Close to many restaurants, shopping, Waikiki Beach and Honolulu Zoo.- Easy check in and hotel allowed us to check in nearly 3 hours early, which was much appreciated.- Nice, new rooms. Decorated tastefully, clean upon arrival, and beds and couches are comfortable.- At 12,000 points a night, this is a steal for Hyatt Gold Passport members.- VERY fast internet, which is far better than most Hyatt Places.Cons:- Marketing pictures of the patio are a bit of a joke. The pool and patio areas are a bit small for a hotel of this size, which led to very crowded conditions for breakfast.- Parking charges are very high. This is not uncommon for the area, but still something to prepare yourself for.- Elevators can be very slow and are quite small, which can be somewhat frustrating.

Extremely gracious staff, pleasant, updated yet peaceful décor at Hyatt Place Waikiki Hotel. Very close to Waikiki beach, yet a more reasonable price for a 4 star hotel. Free breakfast buffet for Hyatt members. Front desk person escorted me personally through lobby and to guest elevator.

As far as the usual amenities goes the hotel was adequate.. its a Hyatt Place.. pretty standard across the board. The staff was nice, the room was what we needed and the location was good.. the valet on the other hand.. TERRIBLE! We arrived at Honolulu airport,picked up our car from Hertz and drove straight to the hotel where we handed it over to valet. Around 8 pm we needed to pick up some medicine so we asked valet for our car.. it arrived back to us with a large dent and several deep scratches on the front right fender, down the passenger side of the vehicle and the passenger side mirror was scratched up. They were fresh and the white paint from the walls of the parking garage were still attached. It appeared as if the car had hit a median or curb at a decent rate of speed then dragged up along a wall.. you know.. while parking in a tight spot in a crowded garage by young and gung ho valet boys. When we pointed it out the valet guy was like.. "ohhh dang.. another one!! That's our second one for today!" The other valet then proceeded to tell me "I bet I know who did it.. it always happens when we have to juggle the cars between garages to accommodate the hotel guests and the beach goers who pay for parking here.. its not uncommon. That sucks!" Apparently this is not a rare thing and after filling out an incident report we were assured by valet that they have cameras showing our car arriving and leaving the lot & that we would be covered as our rental car was not delivered to them in this manner. It was a stressful thing to happen on the FIRST day of your vacation and I went to bed that night not relaxed and not happy that I would now have to contend with Hertz and cut my vacation short to spend the time sorting it out with them at the airport. Upon returning from our vacation we received a letter from the valet company that said they were not responsible and were not going to pay for the damage. No reason was given other than we are not responsible. I was absolutely gobsmacked with this response. How would they not be responsible?! I was also taken a back that the hotel basically says "not our problem, we contract out the valet service.." well you might ant to let your guests know this info prior to handing over the keys to their car :-/ I would def have found a self park lot if I had known how many accidents that actually happen and that neither responsible party would take responsibility. Because of this lackluster and stressful experience that ended up costing me $600 I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone who drives a car and needs to park it for the night.. and if you do then make sure and use one of the paid self park lots in the near vicinity to the hotel.

Nothing fancy but clean hotel. Rooms, bed, pillows and bathroom are ok. Breakfast buffet is so so. Lot of carbs, not serving real eggs the scrambled eggs for breakfast is the faked eggs. Pre mix kind. Low end Hyatt with a very high price. We got a much better deal with Hyatt Regency for the rest of our vacations.

Excellent service by a friendly staff. I love that it's pet friendly and I saw several well behaved dogs on the property. The beds there are the most comfortable I have ever slept on in any hotel. It's close proximity to the beach is a big plus. The breakfasts are awesome.

good pool, but not very new hotel not beach front, besides that hyatt is always hyatt I love more the beach front hotel, like moana surf rider the hotel offers good drinks in the lobby like fresh lemon water

We did get upgraded to a Deluxe 2 bedded Ocean View. The view was nice. The room size was good. The AC in the room was very noisy. The bathroom with the tub/shower and toilet are very small. The toilet did have a heated seat and cover like in Japan.We did not make breakfast the first day since we left the the hotel at 615am for a tour. They start breakfast at 630am.Our only issue is with the breakfast area, there was only one waitress cleaning the tables that morning. There were birds flying in and taking leftover food from plates, and getting messy about it. They need more wait staff to handle the influx of guests.The location was great with the protected swim area on the beach across the street, and a Starbucks around the corner for that breakfast for an early tour departure.

Hyatt Place is in an ideal location. About 150 metres to the protected area of Waikiki Beach so safe to swim in for kids and adults alike. Trolleys stop at beach corner and 'the Bus' stop is about 150m in the other direction. Both of these provide transport to all the shopping areas. You are also only a block from the zoo and 200 metres from other bus stops that take you to all the other attractions Honolulu has to offer.The hotel itself is lovely and the rooms large and well insulated. Very little noise can be heard from inside, on the 10th floor anyway. You might here music from the nearby Tiki Bar if on lower floors.The included breakfast buffet is simple but tasty and all you need to start the day. The pool is not huge but a very comfotable temperature with deck chairs to relax in. There is also a gym and laundry facilities available. Frre Wi-fi throughout the hotel and in your room.The staff are all super friendly and helpful, but I find most people here in Hawaii are lovely. It is a very pleasant easy going place to visit and I cant wait to come back.For food, you are spoilt for choice here. You can dine in the hotel, across the road at the Marriot, or stroll along the beach front where you are spoiled for choice.I feel very safe here, even at night.

bg: i used my hyatt gold passport points for the stay and i'm a hyatt diamond member.i really enjoyed my stay at hyatt place waikiki. for those looking for point redemption opportunities - hyatt place waikiki is a great value. for 12,000 a night you get a spacious suite that is roomy, comfortable, and relaxing. if you're paying with cash, the rooms are about $150-$200 per night. given how large the rooms are and the complimentary breakfast and wifi, i think it is a great value.the staff was friendly and welcoming - i was requesting things left and right - parking fee questions, more towels, more shampoo/conditioner, later check out, etc. and the staff (Cole and Jarren) were patient and addressed my requests. the location is great - only a block away from waikiki beach and right in the midst of all the food, shopping, and bars. i stayed in the mountain view room. i was a little disappointed at first that i wasn't going to be staying in an ocean view room; however, the mountain view room is quite beautiful, especially at night. the lights from the surrounding residences and hotels make it a special site. i got a peek of the ocean view room and can say the view from those rooms are amazing - especially at the hyatt place waikiki price point!the breakfast was your usual continental breakfast fare of breakfast meat (sausage, bacon, etc.), eggs, and pancakes/french toast/waffles, non-alcoholic drinks, carbs, cereal, yogurt, and fruit. it was nice to not have to think about preparing breakfast during my vacation.parking is steep with valet at $30/night and self-parking at $25/night. i think it's on par with other hyatt properties and hotels in general but it still hurts everytime.i'd definitely recommend hyatt place waikiki to anyone visiting honolulu!

Loved the hotel especially for the staff which was superb especially Lynn at the front desk who gave great dining recommendations. Room was large, spotless with a wrap around balcony. Staff even gave great tips on the breakfast. Towels without hassle for the beach, how can they do that and about two short blocks from the best beach in Waikiki. The staff was great from the valet to the chambermaid to the maintenance staff.

We felt very fortunate to find this hotel. Although we only stayed for 1.5 days prior to leaving Hawaii, that stay was very pleasant. The staff were both very friendly and helpful and made us feel quite welcome. The room was clean and very spacious and the rate was reasonable for such a nice hotel in Waikiki ($219/night including all taxes and fees). The decor is contemporary which we prefer. The room had 2 beds, 1 queen, 1 king as well as a dresser, desk,and couch with ottoman. The only drawback was that the sink was located in the sleeping area as opposed to the bathroom which housed only the toilet and tub/shower. There was a good-sized in-room safe as well. The location is at the east end of Waikiki as opposed to being centrally located. However, this was no problem as buses and the trolley stop virtually at the hotel door and can get you anywhere you want to go. Also, the hotel is a less than a 5-minute walk to the zoo, the beach, and a large, beautiful seaside park. The portion of Waikiki beach nearest the hotel has a protected area that would be great for children who might not be able to handle the surf, although that is available as well. Watching the surfers and body boarders was great fun. This is definitely a place we'd return to.

A stay action during Labor Day weekend. Perfect for families wanting to go to the Okinawan Festival! Nice people, great location, good breakfast variety and spacious rooms! I would definitely stay here again.

The price point was spot on and very reasonable in comparison to other hotels of the same likeliness. The décor was modern, clean line and yet very comfortable. The hallways were clean, open, lighted and smelled of clean linens. The room was perfect size for two people, carpet was clean and soft under your feet, no dust balls under the bed or on the side of the nightstand(my glasses fell on the floor) so I noticed, color choice in the room and the décor is beautiful and comfortable. After returning from a day at the beach, in the sun or shopping you want a nice cooled AC room and comfortable chairs to sit on and this had it. Would definitely return again and again.

This is a wonderful hotel with easy access to Waikiki beach, the zoo and Kapiolani Park. We've stayed here a number of times and enjoyed it every time we've visited. And the wonderful part of our stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki is our shih tzu is also a welcomed guest. We don't go anywhere without our dog!

Breakfast and wifi included. Charley's taxi used to go to and from port and cruise. Disappointed because items were left in room and not returned after checkout. Two blocks from beautiful Waikiki Beach.

Good Friendly Staff, willing to resolve the problem(s) promptly. Fresh breakfast. Clean rooms. Good location, close to beach. But long wait times for elevators. Some days not enough seating for breakfast. Overall it's good clean place.

Pros: great value, clean functional rooms, quick check-ins / check-outs, great adjoining convenience store in the lobby (Lawson's - Japanese chain) that has great edibles / drinks / etc/. good partnership with a fixed rate cab service to the airport of $29 (exclusive of gratuity), good surrounding eateries and stores (may require some walking), public parking space located ~40 meters from hotel ($20 p/day) Cons: only con is at the end of the strip so to get to certain eateries & stores may require some walking or driving.

Hotel staff were always happy and helpful, no request was ever a problem. Very kid friendly with only a short stroll to the best kids beach in Waikiki. Rooms were spotless and breakfast included made mornings easy. The pool is basic but the kids loved having a pool in the hotel so it was perfect.

You can not beat he price for the service and amenities. Good location, great staff, nice contemporary room. I found easy walking to great restaurants, shopping, and be sure to use the tour buses which stop in front of hotel as your main transportation. Only $20 gets you all over Honolulu. I would stay again, Dr. Darner

Really enjoyed our stay, the hotel was really clean and tidy and located in a good spot with access to buses, beaches and resturants Not far to the local surf breaks and jumping off the gazebo break wall will keep the kids entertained

Our stay was pretty nice except for the fact we couldn't adjust the temperature down past 68°. The staff was excellent and and the valet folks were incredibly friendly. The breakfast area left a little to be desired as it's located outside on the 3rd floor and during the rain it was difficult to eat out. Also, the food selection wasn't too good; it was included in the cost but we ended up eating elsewhere most days.

Great hotel with super friendly staff. If you forget something like a razor or toothpaste they are happy to supply it. Breakfast is included - you can eat healthy or not. Excellent value / central to shops and restaurants.
user_name:
Margaret R
Menlo Park, United States

review_body: We didn't have much time here (just 2 days) but the hotel was perfect. It was only a one block walk to the beach. I don't know that I would want to be on the beach. It can be noisier near it. Restaurants were also within walking distance. Easy to get around by foot. The staff was very helpful. I only gave them a very good for the location because I know that being right on the beach is important to some people.

Was thrilled to find a moderately-priced Waikiki hotel in a major chain that also offered complimentary breakfast. Loved that it was just one block to the beach and zoo, offered wifi, workout room, business center, convenience store, and many restaurants close by. Rooms were immaculate. Staff very helpful and gracious. We were so satisfied six months ago that we returned for a second stay in August. Only suggestion is that they replace the mattresses, which have lost their firmness.

Our upgraded room had plenty of space with an extra little sitting TV room. The view included city, mountain and partial ocean. The pool is small but was not crowded so it did not matter. The complimentary breakfast had just enough variety to make it delicious. Shopping and the beach are very close and within walking distance to the zoo. We also walked back from Diamond Head State Park. The stores and activities desk are convenient and I enjoyed the green apples in the lobby! All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. We were celebrating our anniversary and this was a wonderful place to stay.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 7 days and enjoyed our time there. The Hyatt Place is a bottom level hotel within the Hyatt range and we were interested to see what we would get.We had a specialty mountain view room after downgrading our initial booking from a specialty ocean view room. On further consideration we decided that as the view would be partially obstructed and as such was not worth the extra expense. We were very satisfied with our decision and very happy with the room allocated to us.We found our room to be spacious and very comfortable.Staff in particular were very friendly and very helpful.The complimentary breakfast was perfectly adequate, diverse, and plentiful if a little plain.Overall we were very happy with our decision to stay at the Hyatt Place and would stay there again.

I recently stayed in this hotel while getting my son moved into his college dorm. We received an upgraded room, the staff was friendly and helpful, the location is excellent. Due to an unfortunate accident, I was forced to extend my stay by a week. When I explained my situation to the person at the front desk, they made arrangements to keep me in the same room at a lower price, and even volunteered to sign me up for the Hyatt Rewards program. This small touch at a time when I was very stressed was greatly appreciated. Hats off to the staff here on how they handled my situation.

This hotel isn't fancy or flashy like others in the area but it isn't rundown either, it's perfect for couples or families who want a clean, moderately priced hotel near Waikiki, it serves free breakfast and wifi. We also got a good deal on priceline that is hard to beat for a hotel of this class. It is a short walk to the beach and there is an ABC store nearby (convenience store).

We stayed here for half of our time in Oahu because we wanted to experience both being right on the beach and also stay somewhere that's not right on the beach. The hotel is good value for money. We stayed in a King City view room and the room was quite spacious and we even got a small glimpse of the ocean from our room. Our room was on the 10th floor of the Diamond Head Tower. Overall, we are very happy with the room itself. There are three lifts servicing the Diamond Head Tower (instead of 2 for the Pali Tower). We didn't have to wait for the lifts at all even during the supposedly busy times. But you do have to wait a bit at peak times if you are staying in the Pali Tower. The gallery staff and the valet staff were very friendly and attentive. The housekeeping service wasn''t that great. One day they didn't refill the coffee pods so I rang to request and waited for a few hours in the room but that never showed up. The free breakfast was delicious and it wasn't too crowded at all. But we brought the breakfast up into our room a few days and ate on the lanai which was very nice too. A reason for this (other than to enjoy the lanai) was that there are about five steps if you are accessing the pool/breakfast area from the Diamond Head Tower. There is a wheelchair lift but you have to ask a staff member to use it as the lift needs a key to operate. I am not in a wheelchair but can't climb stairs and the look I got from staff when asked to use the lift made me reluctant to use it again. On our last day, we had breakfast by the pool but I used the Pali Tower lift to exit to avoid going up those steps and avoid having to ask a staff member to help, and then walk all the way back to the Diamond Head Tower to get back to our room. The laundry is also on the third floor inside the Pali Tower but you can access it from the Diamond Head Tower too. If you like to walk around the area surrounding the hotel and you have issues with steps, I would suggest reconsidering staying at this hotel. There are about 5 steps to get to the lobby from the street level (you can go around it by going up a fairly steep slope/driveway if slopes are no issue). Again there is a wheelchair lift attached to it but it was covered and doesn't look like it has been used any time recently. You also need a staff member to operate the lift and that was a put-off for me. The ability to text with our questions about the hotel was really great and the response was quick. The free wifi is really great and fast (better than HHV). So overall, it is a good place to stay but there is room for improvement and it is perhaps not the most suitable place for people who have similar mobility issues.

I use Hyatt whenever possible for business and pleasure as I have found their franchise to be the most solid and consistent worldwide. The Hyatt Place Waikiki did not disappoint. Only one night stay, but the property had everything I needed; good bed, clean and spacious room, solid wifi and courteous and professional staff. Another winner and great rates for Waikiki hotel.

Well my trip was overshadowed by the rudeness and poor service of the people that work at this hotel. Firstly after travelling for 18 hours, 2 members of staff took 15 minutes to find my reservation- even though I showed them my receipt, the date and the company I found them through. When they found it and one of them was allocating my sister and I a room - the other person whispered "why are you giving THEM THAT ROOM?". Regardless as to the reason- this is totally unacceptable and if I wasn't so tired from my travelling I would have asked her to say that out loud or try to be a bit professional. I paid $100 deposit which is normal and told that I would get it back automatically and it would be in my account the day that I check out.Upon my checkout 14 days later, the man on the desk told me I owed them $30 for using the valet service - I told him I owed them nothing, as I didn't use any valet service. This turned into an argument - until I told him that it is impossible for my sister and I to have used valet as neither of us can DRIVE. With that said he looked through the records and found that it was a mistake of someone writing our room number down with some other guests name. He told us that we would not have to pay as we did not use the service.I got home and found that my $100 had not been refunded, additionally I had been charged $30 for valet - even though I was told that I would not be charged. I was also charged an additional $50 at the end of my stay- I was confused. So I emailed the hotel and they said I would receive $100 in 3-5 working days. They said nothing of the other two charges. I emailed them another 4 times regarding the mystery $50 charge and the $30 valet charge and I heard nothing back from them. I didn't break anything - I'm very careful about that kind of thing. I understand that mistakes happen but why have an email address if you are going to ignore your customers? All they needed to do was apologise and explain what had happened and tell me when I would get my money back. I did not get $100 back after 5 days.I reviewed this hotel elsewhere and only then I got a response- apparently $50 charge is for incidental hold- if this is the case why have $100 at check in? I was told that the $100 was for incidental hold. So they have an incidental hold they tell you about and then take more money and don't tell you about it. They took the $50 12 days after I checked in. I got my money refunded 30 days later and not in 3-5 days like they said. All $180.They said they they would hate to permanently lose a customer and they would like a chance to redeem themselves- but why would I give them a chance to lie to me again and ignore me? This hotel has lost a customer FOREVER. I am travelling back to Waikiki again next week for another two weeks and I did not even consider Hyatt Place and will never, ever return there again. TERRIBLE SERVICE - THE WORST I HAVE EVER RECEIVED.

Overall the Hyatt Place was excellent value. Great service, location and breakfast and bar. Concierge was very knowledge- of the islands and provide us with information about local tours. This hotel is excellent for handicapped individuals(all areas were ADA accessible. Location is one block from the zoo and two blocks from the beach.
user_name:
Oliver Wendell S
honolulu, United States

review_body: We stayed here for our wedding in May, and absolutely loved it!! The staff were amazing, every said aloha, recommended restaurants, never had to wait long to been seen. They've also got access to things you may not be able to bring or have forgotten - in particular I borrowed a steamer for my dress and a sewing kit all free of charge. We booked on Black Friday and had a voucher code curtesy of one of the hotel websites. The room was clean and tidy with the maids working around all our wedding things. Had a great balcony as well. Safe and ironing board is all in the wardrobes as well as the ice maker being on every floor at the lifts. The beach is just in sight as the hotel is set a few hotels back. Just a short walk to all the shops in Waikiki, the zoo, and diamond head! Plus there's a little bike/moped hire shop around the corner. Breakfast is included. It's rather basic but everything you'd need. You eat outside on the roof where it can get a bit windy, or take it back to your room. The bar does have a happy hour too - Mai Tais and blue Hawaiians all the way!! I do believe longboard is also in the offer. There's a little abc store the next building along on your way to the beach.The only downside really was the parking - no self park. However, across from the hotel at the cross roads is the Waikiki banyan where you can pay to park and it's cheaper than the hyatts valet park, but you do have to go and get a new ticket every day on time.Wonderful stay, can't wait to come back next year!!!

We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The location, staff and accommodations are great! It is especially easy to depart the hotel by car and get on your way to other parts of Honolulu easily based on the way the hotel is situated. A very pleasant surprise for someone who usually stays out of Waikiki in the Diamond Head area - I'll certainly stay here on my next visit to O'ahu!

After 30 years I decided to attend my 40th year high school reunion. Drug another classmate along, time ended up being compressed and we were checked in easily and quickly, assisted once we were settled into our room several times without the feeling of imposition. The trip also included saying goodbye to a friend in the hospital so it was even more important that everything else went as seamlessly as possibly as it did with our hotel experience. We were a bit disappointed as we stood I front of that bar considering a drink however it seemed that it was not open yet and no one was behind it. That's all.

The hotel is great value. After a false start with our room, we were reallocated a better room without a problem. Diamond Head tower houses the smaller rooms so consider this when choosing your rooms and ask for higher floor if booking the ocean view rooms. For longer stays for two people or more I would strongly recoommend a room with 2 x queen beds. Hotel has everything you need really. Love the location and vibe of this hotel. Happy and friendly staff also.

The Hyatt Place in Waikiki is very clean and has a great location. Only a block from the beach. The hotel staff is excellent, parking is a issue, they have very limited self parking and they charge $15 a day for self parking and $25 a day for valet. You will most likely have to use valet so be prepared to pay the $25 a day.
user_name:
Joe C
Kailua Kona, United States

review_body: I stayed stayed at a nearby Courtyard and was disappointed with the size of the room and the noise level. So, I cancelled my remaining nights and looked for something quieter. Several reviewers complained about the slowness of the elevators...and during busy times, that's true. But the room was very nice, big and above all quiet. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Hyatt Place in Waikiki is nice gem in waikiki. Its newly renovated and the am breakfast bar was great. Sausage, eggs, pastry to miso soup and rice. It is closer to the zoo but thats fine. You can walk to beach in a couple of minutes and walk toward diamond head or into the heart of waikiki.

Loved the huge room, although it seemed to be well-used. The queen beds were excellent... for a hotel. I stay at dozens of hotels every year and HATE sleeping on poor/cheap beds. Hyatt Place Waikiki put some money into the beds they purchased and I appreciate it. Hot breakfast was great. Not fancy, but convenient and more than adequate. Hotel staff was excellent at during every encounter, and we stayed there for over 2 weeks, so there were many questions and issues we needed help with.

this hotel was excellent from the staff to the breakfast buffet. the location was perfect close to the beach and restaruants and not to mention all the stores you can shop at from jimmy choo, nieman marcus and many more stores
user_name:
Martha M
new york city, United States

review_body: We stayed one night in between island hopping. Check in/out was fast and efficient. Staff were very personable. The hotel was very clean, our room was large and had all the amenities needed, very close to Wakkii beach and high end shopping. I would recommend this hotel. Buffet breakfast was included on the outside rooftop, 3rd. floor.

The hotel is located steps away from Waikiki beach. The room is clean and spacious (by Waikiki standard). The staff is friendly and attentive. Breakfast is included in the fare, which is a huge convenience. Off-site self parking is available just across the street. We definitely would consider it when we visit Honolulu again.

I went to Honolulu, Hawaii in mid July (2015) for a soccer tournament for kids that were around 11 years old. The kids came from Bixby,Oklahoma (close to Tulsa, Oklahoma). I went with my daughter and her 3 kids plus one other girl to help her. The kids ranged from 6 to 11 years. We were in Honolulu for 8 days and overall had a great time. I had been to Honolulu on business 2 times previously and stayed at Aulani (a Disney hotel on the other side of the island).The pluses and minuses for Hyatt Place Waikki Beach for me are as follows: * PLUSES:  ** Location:  ***** Beaches: the hotel is a very short distance from the beach and has a lot of things to do: Swimming in areas that the waves don't come in too high because of concrete walls that reduce the force of the waves. In other areas there are pretty good waves and there are a lot of surfers. ***** Shopping: Excellent shopping on the road that goes along the beaches. Lots of excellent shops and your usual lower take home souvenirs. ***** Places to eat: There are a lot of great restaurants and the usual lower ones such as McDonalds, Starbucks, etc.  ** Hyatt staff: Excellent staff that are very friendly and helpful.   ** Hyatt Food: We ate breakfast at the Hyatt and for the most part it was excellent. We were on the go on all the days and ate lunch and supper at other places from the hotel. The hotel provides an excellent breakfast buffet that has a lot of choices. The only downside was long you stayed there because the food menu changes to the same food every other day. * MINUSES: ** Elevators: they only have two elevators (except for the ones in the back of the hotel for the special guests). These elevators are overwhelmed at times and long lines build up. You will get to you floor but it can be somewhat problematic. ** Parking: There is no self parking at the Hyatt unless you park on the street but that can be a problem since you would probably get a ticket. The hotel has a parking area but you must use the Hyatt staff to park the car and bring it back to you when you want your car. So it is not a big issue but you pay for the parking and also should tip the bellhops. All in all the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel is a very good place and the pluses are much better than the minuses.  HAVE A GREAT TIME.........
