Great place to stay, even if its overnight. The room is nice and very comfortable, slept soundly. The Sunday breakfast buffet is always good, not a big buffet, just in enough to get your day started. The food tray available in the room is a great help, we like eating in the room.

just spent the last 4 nights here and i must say from start (valet) to end (checking out), this hotel is quality for the price in waikiki. I felt like the hotel was always saying "yes" to whatever we needed without a glimpse of being bothered. I especially felt that the housekeepers were stealth. They were there if they thought you might need something and when i was out they came and cleaned the room. But i never felt like they were "there" if you get what i'm saying. Julie (housekeeper) was especially friendly and went beyond just saying "hi" to you. I felt like I had a personal housekeeper. That was a great feeling. It's not ON the beach but it's definitely worth the walk to it.

Firstly I'll start by saying how great this hotel is and I have stayed more than once. The only issue I have is the so called "ocean view" rooms. When we first checked in we were on level 6, the view from here was a joke considering you pay extra. I asked to be moved and was put on 10 however this was just as ordinary. If you are after a hotel with ocean views while sitting on the balcony don't stay here. An ocean view shouldn't require you to stand up and look a particular way. The Hilton Waikiki beach ocean view rooms are far superior.

Based on many favorable reviews, I had hoped for better, but Hyatt did nothing to resolve our problems (Staff did say "sorry" once, but after that long a wait, I don't think they appreciated how annoyed a patient can get)

This hotel is on the eastern end of the Waikiki stretch and close to lots of good restaurants and just a couple minutes walk from the beach. Our room was very clean. However the shower in our room was a bit odd. It feels like I'm showering in a closet. Also the shower doesn't have a faucet and the shower head is angled too high and isn't easy to manoeuvre for a shorter person to shower. The employees here are not friendly but not unfriendly either.

We stayed just one night at the Hyatt Place and had a good experience. Our room was on the top floor facing mauka (the mountains). Hotel was clean and nice and so was our room. Breakfast on the pool lanai was great as well. The hotel is situated just a block away from Waikiki Beach and Honolulu Zoo. It also has a Lawsons convenience store within which made getting drinks and snacks easy.

This hotel is a gem!! Great value for ur $$$. Nice room, friendly staff and a wonderful breakfast included. I would definitely recommend it. Breakfast food was good and area kept clean considering how many people rush thru each morning. Saved lots of time not to have to look for a restaurant each morning. And I didn't notice any "ugly" Americans at the breakfast bar as one review mentioned. Everyone was quite cordial.

Great service, plenty of space and comfort close to the beach. Easy access to everything in Waikiki. You just can't beat Hyatt.For in house breakfast lovers, there is a choice for every taste. Good decaf is hard to find. I thought theirs was top notch.

We enjoyed this Hyatt after returning from a stay in Maui. The staff were brilliant & the room was fine, although small overall. The location is fantastic and missing lots of the hustle and bustle of Wiakikki.

Having been to many different hotels in Waikiki, this is probably one of my favorites in the budget category. Location is great, steps away from a great strip on Waikiki. The rooms are comfortable and functional although admittedly not the best Hyatt Place. Even if you are there for work you will find adequate work space.Elevators can be slow and breakfast is definitely poorly organized. Most of the time, choices are empty and not being replenished fast enough and getting a table can prove challenging. But if you are patient you will at least get an acceptable free breakfast which is better than most other hotels in the area.Another big plus is the absence of a resort fee. Overall, this is my preferred hotel in the budget category and definitely would recommend.

It's clearly been recently renovated and the rooms are comfortable and spotless. We booked a beach view (and although there are other towers, we could see the water - no complaints). It's a 5-10 minute walk into the main Waikiki shopping strip and it's nicely tucked away towards the zoo and Diamond Head. Not as noisy as the main drag near Moana Surfrider. The room service food quality was much better than anticipated - a good selection and tasted fresh! WIFI was strong and the included breakfast was good (it is very popular/busy though!). First time staying at this hotel and we would come back.

This was a really nice hotel and I really like the free wifi, the big rooms, the cold A/C in room (NOT when you're checking in!) the free breakfast that had bacon, fruit, waffles, eggs, etc, and it really was just a couple minute walk to the beach and all the other cool stuff in Waikiki. The elevator takes FOREVER. It annoyed us many times during our stay. Also, the pool is very boring and plain. But, the ocean is just down the road...!

Recently stayed at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki and had a wonderful experience. The staff and facilities were superb. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of most of Waikiki's attractions, shopping, and dining.
user_name:
William D H
Ashaway, United States

review_body: Valet damaged the car on first night. Valet manager was nowhere to be found, although many messages for him to contact me were left. The hotel manager also did not contact me about the issue even after I left messages for him.

I was very pleased with our recent stay at this hotel from August 10th to 14th. While it is not on the beach, it is a quick and easy walk over. I would rather walk for a couple minutes and save money at a slightly off-beach hotel. The room was spacious enough. There wasn't much anything special from any other hotel room - besides the bidet that wouldn't work for us, but you don't spend much time in your room in Hawaii anyway. The beds were comfortable, and our lanai had a great view. We got an ocean view room and requested a high floor (got 18th out of 20 floors). If you want a view, request the high floors. There were a couple buildings obstructing it, but a great view nonetheless for a hotel not on the beach. Breakfast was good, but it was hard to find seating. The one big complaint was elevator wait times. There are two for the whole hotel. The hotel does acknowledge this with a letter stating the busy times for the elevator. During breakfast, you could find yourself waiting for at least 5 minutes. We tried to take the stairs from level 3 (where breakfast is) to the ground since we were late for a tour. Turns out the ground floor door is for fire only. We had to go back up and wait. I understand that for security purposes, as you need a key card to get to your floor, but it was an annoyance to take the elevator down 2 floors. There is a 24/7 bar, but no room service.Even with a few cons, it was still a great stay. The employees were all very helpful and friendly. I did not have one negative experience with the employees. The hotel is fresh and clean, and the service is wonderful. Plus, there's no resort fee and breakfast and WiFi are free. We have already decided to stay again for our next trip to Oahu.

We thoroughly enjoyed staying here. We moved to another hotel during our vacation and we enjoyed Hyatt the best. The location is pretty good to walk to the beach. the only drawback is that is it a long walk to middle of waikiki like near beach walk. Easy access to get out of waikiki near the zoo to hop on the H1.

love the upgraded design. clean. GREAT SKILLET BREAKFAST! The pool was tiny but the beach is very very close. the bar is apparently open until 4am. the design in the lobby was nice. our room was very comfortable. had a great time.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki beach in June - a very pleasant experience. The staff at the reception was able to offer early check-in at 10am and we stayed in a room with great views over the beach. Free Wi-fi throughout, breakfast was average but the location was super - a few minutes walk to the beach and zoo (which was such a ripoff). The hotel is also within walking distance to restaurants including some very nice Japanese ones. Great value for money.

I can't believe some of the reviews for this,the poorest Hyatt I have ever stayed in,anywhere across the world. The hotel is not seafront and our ocean view was between buildings and over grotty rooftops. The receptionist was delightful. The room was adequate for an overnight stay. But the bar is not appealing. The pool is tiny. The worst part is the breakfast. To say it is busy and devoid of atmosphere would be an understatement. Absolutely nothing is served,not even coffee. You have to clean up your own plates as birds are hovering everywhere. The range of quality breakfast dishes is dreadful and you queue and jostle for everything. There are families galore and this is clearly the group for which the hotel is geared,not couples. I was glad to get out after one night and head to an island resort that would provide greater quality. This place is basic,entry level Hyatt .

Good hotel in good location. We were on the "penthouse" floor which is just the top floor. Right near the lift motors which took a few days to get used to. Very busy howl with only 2 lifts so at peak times was a long wait at times for a list. Of course on the top floor there is no option to use stairs. The view was great. Breakfast included was good but very busy.

Hyatt Place upholds its dependability at Waikiki. Great stay. Clean and so very spacious (Pali Tower). Fantastic access to beach. Next door to Honolulu zoo. Minutes from both trendy chain restaurants and oh so delicious local dives. Tour buses pick up right outside.Good breakfast with eggs, breakfast meats, fresh pineapple mixed wth honey dew and cantaloupe, bagels, sweet rolls, cereal, pancakes or waffles, all sorts of juices, milk and ice water, and even traditional Japanese food that I enjoyed. Love it the they have Tabasco sauce for my eggs!! They serve Seattles Best coffee 3 & 4...great way to start each day. Hawaii is very expensive so a nice "free" spread each morning such as this is a welcome addition to the trip.Very nice workout room with a full set of dumbells, in addition to elypticals, recumbent bikes, treadmills. It is more spacious than most Hyatt Places....and it overlooks the pool. Earplugs, workout towels, yoga mats provided. Everything I need.Loved having the laundry room available. Again clean, stocked detergent machine, etc.No other hotel compares in my mind and I've been a gold member with Westin, Marriott, And Hilton.Hyatt Place consistently gets it right, and the Waikiki facility is yet another asset to this company.

We only stayed for one night and upon arrival after 2 flights, being awake from 3am the night before and a 5 hour time difference we were greeted with a warm welcome and a smile! The front desk did everything possible to get us a room upon arrival prior to the the check in time! The front lobby was welcoming and comfortable Angeline even made sure my 8 year old could connect to the WiFi while waiting for the room. The room was clean and comfortable, the only complaint is the pillows are way to soft and I hope in the future all Hyatt Place's will offer a firmer pillow or an option to get one. The breakfast is well stocked and well run!! We were very impressed and did make mention that as busy as it was, it was the best run breakfast we have ever seen especially since the hotel was at capacity! We want to thank Angeline, Chris O and Josay who we later found out is the AGM not to mention a sharp dresser for a great stay and being such a great staff! We hope to visit again in the future!!

I stayed for 4 nights in July 2015 with my family (2 kids). I was totally satisfied this hotel. We enjoyed the breakfast including rice and miso soup. Staff was kind. Location is very good to access Waikiki beach. There is no resort fee. We parked our car at the parking lot of Banyan ($20 cash/day). Only one problem was that the room is little bit noisy. Many buses stop near the hotel. It is convenient if you do not rent a car. However, the bus noise is loud in the room.

Waikiki crowds, not relaxing at all. The morning breakfast was severely crowded and unpleasant. I would recommend spending the extra dollars ad staying at the Hyatt Resort and Spa. It is worth the extra money to reduce the crowding. It was really just a meat market. Nothing relaxing about this property, just a bed to sleep in. Room was very clean, elevators slow and crowded.
user_name:
Ray O
Coto de Caza, United States

review_body: One of the only pet-friendly hotels on Oahu. Also, one of the most affordable. Our room was clean and comfortable: had a modern feel. Also, included a balcony, though ours looked out over the city.There's no room service, but you can call down to the 24-hour restaurant and they'll make food for you, but you have to pick it up.Not a beach front hotel, which accounts for its lower cost. I'd definitely stay here again.

Could not have been happier.Great location.Great staff.Very clean.Room was great.Room was clean.Room had great decor.Room had great air conditioning.Free breakfast food was good.Free breakfast had a good selection.Free breakfast was a bit crowded.Room $273.00Tax $ 25.25Tax $ 12.86Total $311.11 (one night - ouch)

The accommodations were perfect for a family of 5 with teenagers. The proximity to the beach and park were great. My teenage children were very satisfied with the breakfast selections offered and I loved the coffee. View from the room was blah, but we were never in the room anyway.

I'm so glad I chose this hotel. The location was perfect, right across from the beach and with a great view from our King Ocean View room. It was also a convenient based for exploring the rest of Oahu. The room was not huge but plenty big enough for two, with a comfortable king size bed, chair, ottoman, desk and desk chair. The hotel is modern and the public areas, halls and rooms are nicely decorated and well-maintained. The staff, from front desk to housekeeping to bartender to concierge, were friendly and helpful. Others have mentioned issues with the elevators, but we never waited more than about a minute for an elevator. The free breakfast buffet was quite nice, and I liked the outdoor rooftop seating for breakfast. We always were able to get a seat. Overall my husband and I were very pleased with our stay at the Hyatt Place.

I traveled to this hotel for work, with a little fun thrown in. The hotel has an open air lobby and the hotel clerks are friendly and helpful. The hotel is boutique style with a little more than you would think. There is a bar, counter style restaurant. Various spots for lounging, pool, and a great hot breakfast, with different offerings everyday. The rooms are good size and modern. I repeat the clerks, maids, and the rest of the staff, are very friendly and helpful. 1 block frim waikiki beach and within walking distance to lots of bars, restaurants and shipping. My favorite spot to stay, for a food price.

I stayed here twice and will stay again if I return to Oahu. It is about two and a half blocks from the beach which makes it a quieter hotel. There is a store on the first floor where you can pick up snacks, drinks other things you may need and you don't pay hotel prices since it is privately operated. The free breakfast isn't the same everyday and it is an outside buffet where you can enjoy the morning breeze.
user_name:
Mary K
San Antonio, United States

review_body: Recently stayed at the hotel and it was very nice. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Included wi-fi and a breakfast buffet in the price. Short walk to shopping and beach. Good location if you don't need to stay right on the beach. Staff was excellent.

Nice, basic hotel just off Waikiki. The staff was wonderful. They went out of their way to accommodate us. The room was fine -- clean, but pretty basic, with a tiny bathroom. The beds were a little soft for my taste. But the location was wonderful -- a five minute walk to the beach -- and the hotel was a good value for the money.

The valet took to long. 25 minutes to get the car is too long. The staff was very friendly. The only 2 elevators took about 15 minutest, this is not during busy parts of the day. The breakfast had a nice variety that changed each day. The room was good sized but the bathroom needs updating. Also the long hair found on the bathtub and floor was dissapointing for being a Hyatt. It was great to have a mini fridge, which was needed to store medication and few cold sodas and water. We have many families that live on Oahu, the purpose of our visit was to see them. But after leaving Kauai to come there was a shock to my kids. They left paradise in Kauai and felt like Honolulu was being at home in OC, CA. My only big complaint is the overpriced of valet and the long waits to our car. But there's not a big enough area for guests to arrive in cars and valet bringing cars to those waiting. Thank you for having a wonderful staff, they made a huge difference.

This hotel is old and not renovated at all. The room have carpet everywhere and it was not very clean.... The only good thing is: the room are big. The pool is small and again very old and cheap. The breakfast are included but it was not good so we ended up going to the restaurant. The hotels in Honolulu are cheap and super expensive. :-(

After much debate over a number of well rated TripAdvisor.com hotels, I chose the Hyatt Place Waikiki based on its combination of many positive factors. I was not disappointed!From the moment I walked in, Chris from the checkin staff greeted me very quickly and despite it being only 2 pm, offered me an early check-in with no problems. She showed me around the lobby and explained the free breakfast and other amenities. The room turned out to be just what I had hoped for - a "partial ocean view" that was actually pretty awesome. I could see the ocean very clearly and had a nice balcony to enjoy the morning and evening sun. (See attached picture)The room, while a bit small, was very well laid out and I found the AC to work quite well (a new wall mounted Fujitsu system). The room was quiet and the bed incredibly comfortable. I also liked that the room had a small refrigerator and I was able to get water and soda at the local store and keep them in my room. The free Wifi worked well and was very fast actually.Finally, the daily included breakfast was actually quite comprehensive. Both days I stayed, there were eggs, sausage and plenty of other options like waffles, pastries and fresh fruit. In fact, the fresh Pineapple was just as I would hope in Hawaii - very fresh and good!So all-in-all a great stay and I was very pleased with my choice.
user_name:
Chris20874
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki was pleasant. The only negative was the small room for the big price. Hotel was clean and the staff was very attentive. Location to Waikiki was great and within walking distance to everything.

The location is very good, the staff are all very professional and the room is clean. We stayed here for 6 nights, the housekeeping staff took care of room on daily basis and always smiling. The front desk staff are always friendly. We requested for an Ocean View room, but due to the height of the floor (9th), that we only get partial ocean view, which is the only dissatisfaction that we have. Overall, I will stay in this hotel again if I have the chance and will certainly recommend to friends.
user_name:
John R
St. Louis, United States

review_body: I chose this hotel because it offered free Wi-Fi and breakfast. The breakfast had a good variety. Their rugalach was as good as any bakery! They also had some Japanese breakfast items. The kids liked having free Wi-Fi for the short time we were in the room. The room was spacious. Location was good.
user_name:
Isabelle S
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Friendly staff, even when busy. Free Internet, free breakfast buffet. Rooms were modern and housekeeping efficient. Iron, blowdryer, roomy safe in room. Nice fitness center with big screen TVs to watch. TV in room had plenty of jacks for plugging in laptops, etc. Parking fees are around $28/night; the nearby Waikiki Banyan Hotel is open to public at $20/night. Try to get a room 5th floor or above for the best views.

Just a block from the Beach. Free breakfast. Excellent facilities and service. Was working at Tripler and was 20min without traffice, but 30+ with traffic. Staff was excellent, was very happy with my time at Hyatt.

The Hyatt Place hotel is a great place to stay in Waikiki. It's conveniently located, just off the main street, so it's not as noisy or crowded. The room is small but adequately furnished with a great bed. We had a partial ocean view. We really appreciated the security at the hotel and the staff were very helpful. Breakfast is included and included a variety of foods with the main dish changing a bit each day. The fresh fruit was wonderful! It's a definite plus to have breakfast at the hotel as the breakfast places had long lines each morning. The price is very fair and includes a lot of amenities. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it! The wi-fi was very fast and free although not secured.

My family of 5 stayed 1 week at this hotel about 2 weeks ago and I must say we where pleasantly surprised with the size of our room very spacious. 15th floor - 2 queen beds specialty ocean view w/sofa bed, (didn't use the sofa bed, so not sure comfort level to sleep on). We had a nice ocean view, seen thru a panoramic size window, partially obstructed by another hotel. Was hoping for a balcony with the view but it was ok. Beds & pillows where soft and comfy, nice balcony with 2 chairs, bathroom is a shower/tub standard size, vanity is outside of the actual toilet/shower area which was nice for getting makeup ready. Hotel is just one block from the beach no more than 10 mins walking at the pace of a 4yr old. Shops and plenty of restaurants are within walking distance. If renting a car (which in my opinion it's not really nessecary in Waikiki, everything is within walking or a quick cab or bus trip away) parking is $30 a day yikes! we had a 1 day car rental to explore North Shore and circle the island at our pace. Free breakfast buffet, again pleasantly surprised the selection of hot items are different everyday and tasty. There was also an everyday nice selection of pastries, cereals, fruits, breads etc. Free WiFi was great no dropped signal. Now this was not an issue for my family at all, but if you are a swim or look cute by the pool instead of the beautiful beach kind of person, you will be disappointed it is a tiny pool and very basic. The other issue which we only had an issue with 2x during our 7 night stay was elevators, with a no vacancy hotel in the middle of summer and 19 or 20 floors filled with rooms yeah you might have to wait a bit and I think that's OK, we where on Hawaiian time! "Shaka" and Mahalo!

Great location. Stayed here with my family. Very close to the beach. Lots of relatively inexpensive places close by along Kuhio Ave. Our favorite was the am skillet breakfast and free wi-fi. Breakfast is on the 3rd floor and gets changed up a bit each day. So far we have had french toast and sausage, waffles and breakfast sandwich, oatmeal, and fresh fruits/yogurt, pastries. Our deluxe room was very comfortable and roomy. Valet was very friendly -- but they always seem quite busy. Their swimming pool though was quite small. Very convenient.

Front office staff was very welcoming and helpful, although very busy, I appreciated the undivided attention that was given to me at both check in and upon departure. Room was very clean and bedding was super comfy. It was a spur of the moment weekender, but the prices were very good!

What I loved about this hotel was its location. Its just one block from the beach. Also, I liked that the lobby was not as busy as the other hotels that had retail everywhere as soon as you entered. I would recommend this hotel for leisure or business. The free breakfast is nice too.

It's a good hotel off the beach but very hectic lobby and parking. Breakfast variety lacking. Noisy pool area late at night and very hot lobby area. No room service and late night food offerings not great.

Excellent locations for those who are looking for a proximity to waikiki beach. Service is good. 24/7. Supermarket at the lobby side really convenient. really small pool, Ask for partial see view room

It was a good experience.Morning buffet was very good Could use a Jacuzzi. rooms were comfortable. the fact that it was animal friendly was a great plus. staff was very friendly,helpful,caring, and joyful

A great hotel for those who don't want to pay big bucks for usually worthless amenities. The room was spacious, up to date and attractive. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate. Personnel awesome.
user_name:
Lynda A
Georgetown, TX, United States

review_body: Had a stay-cation at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. There was a high surf warning, so it was perfect for boogie boarding. The waves were 8-12 feet, so it was for the experienced surfers and boogie boarders. The room came with a King size bed and ocean view. Will plan to stay again soon. Free breakfast near the pool is great.

We had a perfect stay at the Hyatt Place. The staff was excellent and extremly accommodating to our family. Jade at the front desk was the best, she responded to our text messages quickly and provided great service, extra pillows, blankets etc..to allow my children to sleep on the floor (the hotel gives you a text # to the front desk) We text'd while out on the town and received great recommendations and info. Our room was clean, comfortable and as described. Breakfast buffet had a good variety of hot and cold items to start our day. We arrived late and left early and again the staff was superb in holding our luggage while we toured on our last day after checking out. We like Waikiki and will stay again. Thank you Jade and Hyatt Place for making our vacation no ka oi.

I stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki when I go to Honolulu (twice a year). The hotel is just a few blocks from the ocean. Breakfast and Internet is included, however, the breakfast is somewhat limited in the variety. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The biggest down side is the elevators...SLOW. Reading through the various reviews of this hotel, many complain about the price of parking. However, that is the case for the most of the hotels in the area, so, plan ahead if you rent a car.
user_name:
Tracy W
Rohnert Park, United States

review_body: We were welcomed by friendly and efficient hotel staff; our room was comfortable and spacious enough for a family + luggage; everything was clean and in good condition. We enjoyed our stay very much! The pool area would benefit from adding a hot tub, but the pool itself was nice.

I looked at different hotels in the area, and finally I booked at this hotel. After 20 hrs trip, we were greeted by Christopher. The check in took like 5 min, and we didn't have to wait. I was upgraded to Ocean view, but I am glad I didn't pay for it since you see it through the buildings. I was concerned about the elevator problems that I read. We stayed at the Diamond tower, and It wasn't any wait. I heard the Ocean Tower had serious waiting time, and that is because there are only two elevators.The room was very clean, no bath tub. The WiFi, the breakfast and beach towels were complementary. The breakfast can save you good money since food in Hawaii is pretty pricey. The bus stop is just across the street in Kuhio Ave (2.50 adult and $1.25 children) The only problem with the bus is that it can't take 1 1/2 just to go to the airport. They have laundry facilities in the 3rd floor on the Ocean tower just beside the gym; $3 a load and you can use your credit card if you don't have quarters. I would recommend this hotel since the Marriott across the street doesn't have front view either, at least the tower in Kuhio Ave, and they have to pay resort fee $30 per day, and WiFi $15 per day.Finally, I had a night flight, and I didn't know what to do with my suitcases. They held it for me, after I check out. free of charge.

Hotel is in a convenient location in Waikiki but the main tower has 20 floors and only two elevators, one of which was not working most of the time during our eight day stay. 15 minutes on average was the wait time to get on an elevator to go from the lobby up to the floor our room was on.
user_name:
Terry M
Salt Lake City, United States

review_body: Room request at booking not met in spite of being Gold Passport. First night placed in possibly one of the noisiest rooms in the building. Resolved the following day. Large teenage sports groups coming and going who were unsupervised. We ended up trapped in an elevator for thirty minutes with 14 of them after they caused the elevator to jam between floors by jumping up and down. The fire service was called to extract us from between floors. No acknowledgement from the management that we were put in this situation. The hotel does offer good value for money. Our ocean front room was spacious and clean. Our housekeeper was a delight. Would we stay here again - I don't know. Maybe pay the extra and go to the Hyatt.

I recently spent two weeks at the Hyatt Place in Wakiki while on a business trip in the area. The room was clean / fresh/ well maintained. The staff was all very friendly quick to take care of my needs. A big selling point for me was the breakfast @ the pool Lanai which prevented me from having to look for breakfast on the way to work each day (A big help). Also, the hotel is easy walking distance from the beach and lots of places to dine for the off hours/ weekends. I would recommend this place.
user_name:
Jeffrey D S
Waldorf, United States

review_body: Staying in Honolulu can be challenging. Everything is expensive! The Hyatt was reasonably priced and included a decent breakfast buffet. Parking is expensive at $30 a day but chances are you do not even need a car if you plan to stay in the area. The rooms are very clean and have balconies. Excellent internet too. Close to (but not on) the beach, the zoo and Diamond Head.

Excellent location, superior room with 2 queens and sofa bed was comfortable for 3 people. Beds were very comfortable. Staff addressed all needs quickly. Pool isn't very big, but most people seem to go to Waikiki Beach - only 1 block away. Hotels gives beach towels.

was there in December 2013, never again during that month. Breakfast buffet was cold, area not protected well from wind and rain, staff was pleasant and assistant GM was accommodating. We have been going to the Hyatt in Waikiki since 2008 and stayed mostly at the Hyatt Regency but wanted to see how the Hyatt Place was, mistake on my part because the Hyatt Regency did a tremendous turn around for the better. On our next trip in 2016, you can bet the Hyatt Regency will be the place to go.

If you want a great place to stay, just not very close to the beach, this hotel is perfect, and very nice! Staff was great, room was nice and fairly spacious and recently redone. Bed was excellent and everything was clean.

We stayed here one night on the front end of a trip that included a cruise out of Honolulu. We had to move the second night to a full service hotel that was associated with the cruise line program. We wished we could stay at the Hyatt Place longer. - Spacious,clean Room- Friendly staff- Breakfast included, the quality was very good. The pool here is very small, but you are just a short walk from the beaches of Waikiki. The hotel directed me to Charley's Taxi from the airport and for a fixed rate of 29$ they transported our family of 5. I contacted them the day prior and the driver was waiting for us when we emerged from baggage claim. This hotel went above and beyond our expectations. As I said, we were sorry to leave!

Great stay, great experience. The staff was great,the locale exceptional, and the overall experience unbelievable! The rooms are clean and well kept. The room staf highly friendly and courteous. The front desk staff was knowledgeable and courteous. Breakfast included with room was more than expected and very tasty and varied by day.
user_name:
Joseph R M
Honolulu, United States

review_body: Never staying here again. As a platinum member of the Hyatt Gold Passport program, this hotel has left a very bad image of the Hyatt brand. The many grievances started with the 15 minute wait to check in. The guy was efficient and friendly, however have incorrect information of the "happy hour" times and sadly we missed out on the "cheap" alcohol. The next issue was with room service; we ordered a hamburger with chips and the hamburger came with potato chips, not fries!! I have never experienced receiving potato chips with ANY meal before. This was quite disappointing, especially for the exorbitant price of the burger. Thirdly, the complimentary breakfast was very dismal and had only ONE hot option (bacon) and there were no bowls to be seen anywhere for cereal, so we were advised by the staff to use drinking glasses. Again another disappointing element of this stay. Fourthly, and perhaps the WORST aspect of this stay was the valet parking experience. Not only is the price INSANSE at $30 per night, but we waited 34 minutes in the lobby for the car to actually arrive. Yes, 34 minutes, we timed it as we saw the long queue of people waiting. This is absolutely ridiculous for an upmarket hotel chain. Once the car arrived we then proceeded to wait a further 9 minutes behind other cars with no one in them as both lanes of the hotel exit were blocked with cars. All up we wasted 43 minutes collecting the car. The staff doing this service looked stressed, and I cannot fault them at all. They did refund one nights valet parking fee. On a side note, we booked the 'Deluxe Ocean View Room' and it was anything BUT a deluxe room. The view had a slight view of the ocean in between buildings, but it wasn't that great. My advice is to save your money and get a cheaper room as the view is definitely not worth the premium price!! All up, this was a terrible experience and I would advise you all to not stay at this hotel in the future.

My stay at this hotel (4 nights) was very good. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The only negative was the room air conditioner did not keep the temperature as cool as I would have liked. The unit worked but the air it supplied should have been cooler.
user_name:
Douglas D
Portsmouth, VA, United States

review_body: Firstly, the only parking available is valet at $30 per night, and the parking valets didn't even bother to help retrieve the 5 large bags of luggage. Secondly, we ordered burgers and chips through room service. Turns out they are kettle type 'crisps' potato chips, not the hot kind as you usually get with a burger, all for the princely sum of $14 each. Using burger king prices (equivalent burger in size/flavour - not an insult) and local potato chip wholesale prices it should have cost about $7.90 each, meaning they over charged by 50%. I know hotel room service is usually over priced, but after making us walk down to the lobby to pick up the food I am extremely dissapointed. Can't wait to leave this money hole.

while Hyatt Place is a budget choice rather than a Hyatt Regency or a resort, it is a very pleasant place to stay in Waikiki. Our room was fairly spacious and nicely appointed. The bed was very good with comfortable pillows, and it was cool and quiet. There was a small balcony. The desk/work area was functional. Wifi was free and worked well. The pool was average but my grandson enjoyed it. The staff was helpful and efficient. It is well located, close to the each and the. zoo.

A taxi to hotel from airport is expensive be prepared. 40$ or more .The hotel is 1 block from beach a tourist hot spot. There is sandy white beaches, blue ocean and lots of shopping for everyone. The staff at hotel are friendly and professional. The room I had was a double bed room. It was larger than I thought it would be .The fixtures and amenities were newer. The pool area kind of small but there is beach 1 block from hotel.Nice people nice hotel nice trip.

Great Rooms Close to the Beach Close to beachfront restaurants I would recommend this hotel to vacationers and business elites alike. First time staying with Hyatt and will become loyal to the brand and hotels in all future travel.
user_name:
Mark J A
Honolulu, United States

review_body: Good: Hotel was clean and staff was pleasant and friendly. The valets worked quickly and the front staff person that checked us in gave us a small tour of the lobby. It is in a great area about two blocks to from the beach and a major street with restaurants/shops. Pets are allowed which is a plus. They have a free continental breakfast from 6:30-9:30. I haven't had the chance to try it yet due to work but hopefully tomorrow prior to flying out. Negative: I got a room with a king size bed and it was smaller than I'm used to but it's probably standard for Hawaii. The pool is very small so it's not much room for a big group of people to swim. You cannot bring drinks up to the pool area. You cannot bring drinks from the bar to your room from the bar unless it is a bottle of wine. That is a first for me. The entrance to the hotel is tight for cars and directly off the street. The balcony is extremely small so no room to sit out there even though it has furniture. The shower is a stall not a tub shower. The first day the water was only warm so we had to call maintenance and they turned up the temperature. I was on official business so it was paid for. I would consider it again if my business paid for it but not worth the money to pay out of pocket.

I love this place if the price is right. I wouldn't pay more than $200/nt to be sure, but the I am have stayed here 3 times and have always been comfortable. The tower in the back away from the breakfast has a little nicer bathroom, but the rooms are smaller and views are worse. Depends on what you prefer. The tower with the breakfast can have spectacular views of Diamond Head from the lanai. The best part is the size and comfort of the rooms. They are new, well sized, and modern, and seems like they are taking good care of them. The only major problem with this place is the elevator speed in the tower where the breakfast is. It can take seriously forever, and leave you stranded if you are on a high floor. They need to re-do the elevator situation. The breakfast itself is also fairly week, but it's a standard hyatt place breakfast. They used to have Starbucks but changed to Seattle's best. Coffee was not very good now. Place gets very busy sometimes is a problem. The pool is not really a usable pool, it is very tiny.

Very good value. Very clean and tidy hotel and daily room service was very professionally done. Buffet breakfast was amazing with a huge selection of good quality food. Great location in the heart of Waikiki. Short walk to beach and main strip.

This hotel is absolutely fantastic! The staff is friendly, the hotel is clean, the breakfast buffet is plentiful! They allow you to text them with questions which is convenient. This is the first time my husband hasn't had an allergic reaction from a hotel in Waikiki. We will only be staying at THIS hotel when we go back.

Just got back from a one week vacation. Excellent place to stay. Two short blocks to the beach. Close to stores, all kinds of restaurants (inexpensive to expensive). The concierges (Cameron and Chris) were fantastic for getting us trips to luaus and Pearl Harbor. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet had a nice selection of food to choose from. We will definitely stay here again!

Every dollar spent at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was well worth it.My family and I stayed at this hotel for seven days. We arrived early and waited 2 hours to get our room, and by then the room was not ready. To compensate for our waiting (even if we are the ones who arrived early)and also because we had a small child, we were given a room upgrade.Staff were exceptionally friendly and professional. They had a big smile to welcome and serve you, that no matter how tired you are, it keeps you sane.Our child was given a welcome gift, small bucket and spades, which was well appreciated not only by our child but also the parents.Check in was quite swift. The room was VERY spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was well stocked.Room was cleaned on a daily basis, and much attention was given to the little details as well. There is a balcony with the room with a partial view of the beach, and waking up to this every morning was just superb. We also had free high speed Wifi, and the television was modern and could be connected to a usb drive.Compared to most if the other hotels in the area, there was no resort fee and breakfast was included with the room rate. Breakfast comprised of toast, eggs, waffles, fruit, and cereals and condiments. Some people may find breakfast limited but it is important to note that there is no charge for this breakfast.In terms of location, it is located a few minutes walk to Waikiki Beach. It is also walking distance to shopping areas and restaurants. It is also close to the zoo.There is also a grocery store 10 to 15 mins walk (Food Pantry, 2370 Kuhio Ave), they have meal options that are more affordable (e.g. roast chicken, fried noodles, etc).If you want to get on the pink line, it does stop at Aston Waikiki beach hotel (opposite Waikiki beach) just a short walk from Hyatt Place.In the event that you need additional help, as in our case we needed to find an emergency dentist, the staff was at hand to assist find one and also provide some advice.Check out at night time can be a bit slow, so you should come down earlier if you are travelling by shuttle or organized transportation to the airport.Would I stay there again?YES, I would, there is not doubt.

The rooms are very nice, large and modern. The walk in shower, which I love, had the best water pressure of any hotel that I've ever stayed in. Nice beds, great air conditioning, and very comfortable room for a 5 night stay. Great service from the staff. I have seen a number of complaints about slow elevators, but the issue is really not that bad. And the hotel leaves you a letter in the room with advice about high traffic times on them. The breakfast is okay, just average, but a good selection.

Noce place to stay in honolulu cole to everything and the room are real noce spacious clean the breakfast is a buffet wouah ! Worth it ! I found a good deal on internet to stay there i will go back real soon.Best place to stay close to everything attractions beach free wifi with free access computers in a nice place view from my room was perfect.
Great hotel!Pros: Close to the beachAmazing breakfastComfortable bedsNice sized roomCleanGreat cleaning staffClose to tram linesUse of beach towelsCon:Front desk staff not friendly or helpful

The Hotel is only 1 block to the Wikiki beach, so very convienent and made trips to the sand easy. The parking a was a bit expensive. Overall it is a nice place to stay. We would consider staying here again when we return to Oahu.

My family and I came in on July 10, 2015 at about 11am and weren't supposed to check in until 3pm. I was very tired and needed to rest from our flight and the Front Desk team members were very courteous and friendly. They let us check in early so we went upstairs to get situated. The Valet team were very friendly also and they took care of us. They also explained that there were cheaper options for parking across the street as the hotel charged $30 a night but I didn't bother. I liked the ease of waiting while they hustled through all the traffic. They were very speedy and professional. The WiFi was free and it was great because I could hookup my daughter's Kindle and she could watch her shows. The complimentary breakfast was 'ono. I thought it was going to be only fruits and toast but I was wrong. There were eggs, sausage, waffles, rice and even Miso Soup!! I like it..I had a great time and my family did too...I will definitely go back...

We had a great stay here during our move from Hawaii back to the mainland. We stayed 4 days and were able to bring our dog and cat, if your traveling with pets you know how hard that is to find. Our 7 year old enjoyed the pool and we all enjoyed the free breakfast. My husband and I used the fitness center several times, it has several cardio machines and free weights. Short walk to the beach and restaurants. Very happy with our stay.

We stated at the Hyatt Place (Waikiki) for 2 days before we started our cruise trip. The location of the hotel is awesome, a block walk to the beach and 15/20 mins walk to the shopping mall and restaurants. There is a Subway at the intersection where we grabbed our quick lunches. The room was neat and clean. Wifi was fast. My daughter used to log into the computers in the business center to watch Minnie Mouse on Youtube. They have a great excursion assistance desk in the concierge. The best hot breakfast buffet I have had so far among all the hotels I have stayed. Lots of choices. Thank you Hyatt Place for giving us a good experience while in the Waikiki area. P.S. I would not go with anybody except Charley's Taxi. They offer good service, quick turn around time and $29 flat rate to and fro from airport as well as $17 flat rate to Pier 2 Harbor. We did not have a good experience with other companies.
user_name:
Bhakti P
North Andover, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for one week. This hotel is ideally situated and the staff are welcoming along with the independent concierge. We were able to book everything we wanted to do at the hotel. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend this to anyone.

My husband and I spent 4 nights in our room with two teenage daughters and it was roomy enough. They all loved the breakfast and the convenient location, right in the middle of hikes, surfing and Honolulu fun.

The staff were wonderful, friendly and hard working. After 8 nights at this hotel, we felt like this was our second home. We choose this hotel for the 2nd time in Hawaii because the 1st experience was great. We stayed from July 1 - 9 and left super satisfied and happy that we choose this hotel again. Some of the staff that I interacted with were great. Chris, Troy or Trevor and Annabelle were very nice. Love the bar staff for making the yummy Mai Tai and Blue Hawaiian. The valet guys were so helpful when giving us directions to places. On to the rooms.... Our room was spacious and house keeping did a great job cleaning our room every day. This is my 2 cents about elevator.... I traveled with a teenager and young daughters and we stayed at the 17 floor. The elevator did not cause any problems to our vacation. Just like traffic lights, you have to be patient. Yes, the wait time is a little longer during high traffic time like morning breakfast and check out time but wait time throughout the day was not bad at all. If you are in hurry, then take the stairs. We heard a lady complaining that she waited for the elevator for 15 minutes. She was waiting from the 5th floor to get off at the 3rd floor. She could have just taken the stairs..... We love the convenience of the complimentary beach towels and the complimentary breakfast. We could have chosen a timeshare, condos or the other resorts next door but we choose this hotel because it was perfect for our family. The price was reasonable, the service was great and location was perfect.

The hotel is conveniently located in Waikiki and only minutes from the beach. The staff are extremely helpful and very knowledge about tours and getting around Honolulu. The free wifi was super fast and reliable. The pool and gym facilities are excellent.

We stayed at the Ohana East Waikiki Beach first and on return stayed at Hyatt Place. It was disappointing for the money you paid. POSITIVESRoom was comfortable but very noisyThey had a texting system which was very efficient - should you need anything you txt requirements and things are delivered. NEGATIVESPriceySelf help hotel - no one helps with luggage etcOnly a pair of lifts to service the hotel. You would wait for long long periods of time to use it.Staff were curt to the point. Check in staff were very good. I wouldn't stay there again.

Great hotel. Two blocks from the beach. Complimentary breakfast. Modern, quiet rooms. Knocked off one star because of elevators -- We would typically have to wait 3-5 minutes. Parking is also touch (you're right down on Waikiki). Valet is really the only option.

Twice we have stayed here (New Year 2014/15) and this past week (Independence Day).The staff are most friendly, the location central to attractions such as the Waikiki Beach, shops, restaurants, the Zoo, public transport such as taxis or buses are easy to locate and use.

Stayed at Hyatt Place in Pittsburgh before going here so had an idea of what we were in for. Not a 5 star swanky place but has everything you need from a good sized room and bed, Wifi, good breakfast selection and great location. Would definitely recommend.

This hotel is literally a 2 minute walk to the beach in Waikiki. It is much less expensive than the Hyatt Regency and other similar hotels in the area. If you want a fancy lobby and expensive shops with snooty people, you should stay somewhere else. No frills here, but very nice and comfortable rooms,free hot breakfast and very accommodating staff with reasonably priced rooms.

We stayed in room 1434, ocean view with balcony. The room is very large, fridge, wii-fii, breakfast, super comfy beds, and buses come right to hotel door! Parking was never available but lot right across street was easy. If you want the most for your money, this is your place! It's two blocks from the beach, easy walking, quiet, laundry, small pool, towels to borrow, convenience store on site and very clean. Huge sno cones at convenience store you will find no where else on the beach! Only two elevators for 19 floors but if you plan accordingly, it is no biggee! Compare other hotels for a little cheaper and you will find no breakfast, small outdated rooms, and unclean conditions. This hotel has super staff, it's kept up well and very clean. Unless you want to stay right on the beach, this is your next stop! We loved it!

The stay was very comfortable, especially when able to entertain one evening due to the large room with a L shaped sofa. The view was of the back end of Diamond Head, none of the ocean. The staff were very professional, friendly, and did not make you wait for service. Overall recommend it to others.
user_name:
Karen Lou G
honolulu, United States

review_body: I was looking for a good hotel and a affordable price. So I found the Hyatt Place. The location is great, but its a simple hotel- breakfast is included but not many options in there, room is clean a new but very small, pool is very simple. Breakfast area and time is always busy and crowed. You have to ask for body lotion and cotton swabs at the front desk. So it has an economy feeling, not a Hyatt feeling. But, you get what you pay for. Its good for sleeping and saving some bucks. The front desk staff is nice, it was one of our honeymoons and they gave us a wine bottle and a card- so nice of you, guys! Thank you!!So I'll recommend for those that are looking for a clean and convenient place, but not fancy or resort atmosphere.

This was an exceptional value for Waikiki if you're looking for space and bedding for a family or group. 2 Queens + sofa bed makes a single room workable for families with older/larger kids (we were 3 adults + 12 yr old) Free in room internet and breakfast included; hot food, good coffee. This hotel does not have scenic views of the ocean, it is not an ocean front hotel, but it's just a short walk to the beach. Pool is small and plain. Rooms seem recently refurbished, updated. This property does not have as many late night wild and drunk young adults as some of the other Kuhio Ave hotels we've stayed at, a definite plus!

Staff was courteous and the room was clean and comfy. Internet service was spotty, elevators wait time was high and the pool was dirty. We took the city tour, did not like it at all. We were a group of 7 and the guide would not even stop to let us take pictures at scenic points.

We stayed here last minute after staying at the Sheraton for one night. The Sheraton was undergoing some renovations, booked solid and had no other accommodations for us. We then booked a couple rooms at the Hyatt place and absolutely loved it. Although it was a small hike to the shopping and markets, it was only a block from the beach and away from chaos. We loved the staff that accommodated us with a larger room when we were crammed into one of their smaller suites. Because this was not originally built as a Hyatt place, some rooms were smaller, however had the same accommodations. Parking is available at the front of the lobby but its not the hotel's valet and is the normal $25-$30 per day. Or you can park kitty corner from there at a self park garage for $10-$12 per day. All in all the rooms were very clean wit nice clean showers! Microwave ovens and fridge are also in the room! Much better than a 4 or 5 star where we would pay double and just get the normal deluxe room!

We had a great time in our 7 days stay in Oahu. Great place, great hotel and great people! If we have a chance to get back we will stay in Hyatt Place again...Hotel is very clean, staff very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast is very good! Location is perfect, not too crowded because it is not in the main road.
user_name:
Arlene D
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: My family and I stayed here in a room with a view of Diamond Head on a mid-level floor...the last week of Feb 2015. (OK, I've been busy, but I promised myself I would write this review!) We had one comfortable bed, and one bed - the one by the window - that gave all of us aches the next morningI I really enjoyed staying here, despite the CONS: 1. really busy - large groups tend to book here, e.g., tourist groups, school sports teams,etc. - it can get loud, chaotic; we asked for a quiet area of the hotel, got a room at the end of the hall, but was next to a suite which had lots of people staying in it so tended to be loud; 2. elevators can be quite slow when crowds of people are staying there; 3. no free parking and no lots nearby to park at cheaper rates - the day we got there, the hotel's self parking lot was full, so we were forced to use valet parking - the good thing was that the hotel did not charge us for valet - still, self parking costs $18/day!PROS: 1.) The hotel is located on the east side of the Waikiki strip, which I liked because we were away from the busy activity but close enough to walk to lots of restaurants, shops, etc. Also a short walk away from the Honolulu Zoo. Really good complimentary breakfast - includes hot items like (slow-cooked) oatmeal, some variation of scrambled eggs every day, and Asian breakfast dishes; also served were cut fruit, cereal, pastries, milk, juice. I recommend bringing your tray from your room to the breakfast buffet so you can bring everything back to your room - the dining area is outside by the pool, and it can get really really windy!! We didn't use the pool, by the way, so no comment, except it is modest in size. 2.) Nice beach - easy walk from hotel! This area of the beach is great for small kids because there is a wall buffer that minimizes the waves and keeps the waters gentle - my daughter loved being in the water! AND the hotel gave out complimentary beach toys - score for my daughter! 3.) All nice, helpful staff - thanks to Terence, Ted, and Troy!! I loved the courtesy and excellent service they all provided - so rare to find these days! I would come back, for sure.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place on Waikiki Beach for two nights before leaving on a cruise from Honolulu Harbor. The hotel is updated, clean, and the beds are comfortable. It is a block from the beach and close to restaurants and shops. The service at the front desk and valet stand was excellent. The breakfast was included, but the first day it was very Polynesian, offering rice and poached eggs on an english muffin. All we wanted was eggs and bacon, but that was not offered. The second morning, we got our breakfast elsewhere, only to find out later that eggs and bacon were offered that day. I guess it changes from day to day. They have a nice gym, although they keep it a tad warm. The pool is small and lacks any kind of ambiance to indicate you are in Hawaii. We were supposed to have a mountain view room. Technically, that was true, although we had to look between two very run down buildings to see a glimpse of a mountain. I normally spend a lot of time on the balcony, but not this time. It was not a pleasant view at all. Bottom line, the Hyatt Place is good as a place to sleep, but if you are looking for a Hawaiian experience, it's a little lacking.

A friend and I went to Honolulu for a week to visit another friend on our first trip to Hawaii. We picked this hotel because of it's location close to the beach, free breakfast, and brand new rooms. This hotel had recently converted to a Hyatt Place and underwent a complete renovation. The lobby has a very warm, modern feel and is completely open to the outdoors so you always felt the nice warm breezes of Oahu. Our room was beautiful, good sized for the two of us and all our luggage, and had a balcony that had a view of the ocean (although the hotel is two blocks from the beach). The included daily breakfast is served outside by the pool and has a great selection of hot and cold breakfast items with pastries and juices. The hotel is located at one end of Waikiki beach across from the zoo. The location was great for us as we walked to many restaurants, bars, and the beach during our week-long visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Honolulu.

I've been to Hawaii probably more times than I'd like to admit.... it's my happy place. Usually I stay in smaller lower to mid-priced properties. But since my sister and her family were with me this time, we decided to stay somewhere family friendly and easy. Enter Hyatt Place Waikiki...we stayed one night pre- and post- cruise and each time the front desk were genuinely helpful and went out of their way to make it a great experience, even knowing we were there for such a short time! I've been to Hawaii when the Aloha spirit was super strong back in the day... and I've been when unfortunately, it's died down quite a bit in more recent years, to the point I really never thought I'd experience that again at a hotel in Waikiki...BUT Hyatt Place gives me hope again that that same spirit of love and care for others is not dead in the hotel industry! I appreciated so much their level of service and help in getting us checked-in to a room right away, especially since we had so little time there. Mahalo to all the front desk who were so helpful and friendly and genuinely cared about our experience...even the little things like helping us to microwave a manapua for a hungry 7yr old. They actually made us feel welcomed and a true guest to their property. Breakfast was good, location was awesome just a few blocks from the walled section of the beach (safe for kids), beds were comfortable, and rooms generally clean. They made our short stay in Waikiki so much easier and comfortable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat cuz I know I can find that true Aloha spirit that I have missed for so long in the hospitality industry when I visit Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach! And so long as they keep doing what they are doing, I will be back...

Service was okay, but The hotel needs rot be remodeled. Also it's a bit of a walk to the beach from this property ..the beach is public and the hotel does not offer lounge chair services for the guests..was not impressed at all.

Not to close to the beach, not to far from the beach, not to close to the bars and restaurants, not to far from the bars and restaurants...... very clean room, nice and professional staff.... stayed here while on business...... by Wednesday the bartender knew me and was pouring my cool beverage when they saw me coming through the lobby...... what can I say...I will be back

We stayed one night prior to our cruise. We found the hotel a bit further from the beach than we liked but still reasonably close. It was within walking distance to many shops, restaurants, the zoo, park, beach, etc. It was clean, our room was huge and had a balcony with a sliver of ocean view but we knew what to expect as it was well represented in pictures on the Hyatt website. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. They arranged transportation for us and stored our luggage after we checked out. The breakfast buffet was good but beware of birds trying to steal food from your plate! Overall we enjoyed our stay and had no complaints. If you're on a budget this is an excellent choice.

Great place to stay!!! The staff was awesome!! Great room , easy walk to beach. Conceirge got us a great rate on a car and booked us a luau. Only complaint was breakfast buffet was on a roof area and it rained and it wasn't covered. Since they have frequent quick showers they really should have it inside. Will definitely stay again

Short 3 night stay. Overall a pleasant place to stay for 3 nights with our family of 4. It's a block or so from Waikiki beach so you expect the high price. Parking is about $18 per day. Good variety of choices for breakfast. Pool is not heated and kind of small so the kids were disappointed in that. They love to to swim in the evening but to chilly for them. It's nice and warm in the afternoon for swimming but we were out most afternoons.They have a small coin/credit card laundry room for guests to use so that was nice. The room was nice, clean and comfortable which we all can appreciate.The only reasons I personally wouldn't stay here is the pool size for my kids and a bit pricey for our family. Great hotel overall.

I booked a Deluxe Ocean View room to ensure getting an ocean facing room. When I checked into the room, the ocean view could only be seen on the lanai.I asked the front desk receptionist about this not being a “Deluxe Ocean View Room” and she said that it’s considered a deluxe room and you can see the ocean from the lanai. I thought this was very misleading. Fortunately, they changed my room to an ocean facing room and it was much better even though the view is between two buildings. The elevator is extremely slow but I was told in another wing it’s much faster. The buffet consisted of hoards of people vying for subpar food. At least there was some fruit. The location is very good but be prepared for a hotel with massive crowds which might not be your idea of a relaxing experience. If you want a good location and price, then this is a good choice.

My company selected this hotel as the least expensive for the two nights needed. Property is old, but very well maintained, updated, clean and super service oriented. From the time we arrived I felt taken care of. Valets gave me my parking options, off loaded my luggage and took care of my car. Concierge greeted me, found me an upgraded room with two beds (reservation was for 1 King), and enrolled me in their Gold Program. Porter took me to the room with my luggage. Every time I approached the desk, I was treated as if they knew me well. Beds were very comfortable, breakfast was well prepared and ample with lots of choices.

This hotel was close enough to swim at Waikiki Beach, but far enough away from the noise. The breakfast buffet is a real plus for a business traveler. I spent two weeks at this hotel for business, and found the front desk and valet service to be excellent. Because it is in the center of Waikiki, expect to pay for parking.

The hotel is very nice, nearby with the beautiful beach. We can enjoy the wonderful free breakfast, including different styles of food, such as western food, Asian food (rice, soup, etc.), refresh fruits. The room is very clean, just at your home.
user_name:
Chengnian W
San Francisco, United States

review_body: This is a great place to stay. The staff is super friendly and the rooms and very comfortable. I stayed on the 12th floor which over looks the ocean. Views were great. Breakfast is served at 6:30 and it was better than most hotels that I have eaten at. The beach is just a short walk away. I would stay here again.

Loved the proximity to the beach. The staff was very courteous and friendly. I have stayed in lots of other hotels in the area and the furnishings have had a tendency to be old and outdated. The Hyatt is more up to date. I also got it at a great rate.

The staff is so kind and welcoming, they have lots of good recommendations. The front office staff to housecleaning, everyone is always so helpful. I truly feel the spirit of aloha when I to Hyatt Place Waikiki! The staff is always wanting to help you the most they can. I always try to stay here when I go to Hawaii! Thank you Hyatt Waikiki!

This property is a little set back from the main drag but still a great location, clean, friendly and a great price. We have been here a number of times already, have not stayed more than a couple days but I think it would make a great place for at least a week, one day we will do an extended stay
user_name:
Saskia F
Santa Clara, United States

review_body: Great hotel overall. The rooms are spacious with excellent comfy beds and the hotel is in a convenient location. Trolley bus stops next door and hotel is one block back from beach. Wifi included. Would definitely choose this hotel again.

Very nice room with a view and extra space. In route with our adult daughter needed a room for two nights. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. Great location, short walk to the beach, restaurants, and shopping! Right in the middle of the city but with a beautiful park close by.

Hyatt Place Waikiki is an exceptional mid range property located on the eastern end close to the park. The public areas were functional, nicely decorated, and well maintained. Our Deluxe room was spacious and comfy and the ocean view was pretty good considering the property does not front the beach. All of the personnel that we encountered were professional, friendly, and polite. The complimentary breakfast was above average and constantly replenished. During our stay, the hotel was very busy with a hodgepodge of guests, including families, tour groups, youth organizations, etc. so the lobby could be a bit crowded at times. As for other reviewer comments about the slow elevators... Well, we stayed on the 18th floor and the elevators are actually high speed, smooth, and quiet, but if the hotel was busy, you might have to wait a few minutes and then expect a few stops on other floors along the way. My goodness, you are in Hawaii. What's your hurry? Overall, the Hyatt Place Waikiki met our expectations and we were very satisfied.

Overpriced for the noise is renders. Cheaper to sleep on the beach than have the constant sound of housekeeping staff slamming doors inside the hotel - and delivery trucks honking/backing up outside. Furthermore, the lack of central air in favor of puny window unit air conditioners that don't properly cool warm rooms is disappointing.

Hyatt Place hotels are known for their nice rooms, Breakfast, a straight forwardness of their parking. Pros: Hotel staff, hotel room Cons: Self Parking was not self parking! The breakfast was the worst that I have had a a Hyatt Place property.

Hotel feels new and fresh. Great location, close to the better beaches in Waikiki. Still close to the action, but out of the really crowded area. Since it's not a mega hotel, the elevator waits aren't too long, and the valets are quick to get your car. Great bed, good desk set up if you're on business. Breakfast was included, and better than most hotel freebies. Friendly staff.

My 78 and 76 year old parents came from China to visit Pearl Harbor and we had a great experience at hotel from early check in to late check out to flat rate taxi rate and free breakfast.... the staff is super welcoming and considerate to our needs. I forgot my iPhone charger at the room after we left and the staff chased us all the way to the front desk and returned to us before we left for airport!

I must say initially I felt claustrophobic in our room (king size bed) as it was very, very tight. Barely enough room to navigate the room without bumping into my partner or furniture. Fortunately we asked to be moved to a room with two double beds and were moved to a physically challenged room which more than doubled the space we had. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very clean and new. I would say that the location is not central but within walking distance of many attractions along the Waikiki strip. Definitely up to Hyatt standards and recommended.

Somewhat pricey, for our budget, but the Ocean-View Room and very warm, friendly and helpful staff made for a great experience. Minor complaint: the coffee at breakfast was under-par -- sour or, over-roasted.
user_name:
Tushar D
La Crosse, United States

review_body: Stayed here for a week, 2 years ago with the family and have finally gotten around to writing a review. Pros- proximity to the beach and restaurants2. Bus stop and ABC market just outside3. Beach towels 4. One of the best complimentary breakfasts I've seen with American and Japanese selections and fresh local fruits5. Classes, arts and crafts6. Great concierge desk where we can book excursions. We booked a day at the Polynesian Cultural center. Great for little ones but older kids might get bored. 7. Had a partial view of Diamond Head (and partial view of hotel next door which wasn't that great but oh well)8. Sofa bed convertible. 9. The rate was justified. Cons- the pool was small but no one really used it2. The fire alarm rang near midnight one night and everyone had to evacuate via the stairs. You can imagine the congestion. Everyone was very calm though. One elderly lady became so exhausted (we were in the 14 or 17 floor) that she began hyperventilating. Had their been an actual fire, I don't think we would have made it. Perhaps the hotel needs to look at reforming their evacuation plans. Overall it was a great stay. Have recommended this hotel to others and would definitely stay there again.

Brand new hotel located behind the Marriott toward the end of Waikiki. The hotel is much nicer than the Hyatt regency. The rooms are large and in perfect condition.The breakfast can be crowded and the pool could be bigger. But this is Hawaii everybody is at the beach. Plenty of restaurants and bars aroundEnjoy your vacations

My husband and I stayed here for his business trip and then a few days extra for fun. This hotel is very pleasing with classy decor. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful - they stood out among the many hotels we've used over the years. The hotel room (1940, a corner room) had plenty of space and comfortable beds. The shower had plenty (almost too much) water pressure. The housekeeping staff was thorough and quite friendly. The hotel itself is two blocks' walk from Waikiki Beach, which was really nice. Also walking distance to many shops and restaurants. There is almost always something happening in the evenings at the nearby parks. (Be sure to hit up the local farmers' market on the ground floor at the Hyatt Waikiki, five minutes' walk. Excellent fresh veggies and fruit, as well as local bakeries, crafts, etc. - definitely worth a visit!). Hyatt Place is just far enough from the craziness of the high-end shopping at Waikiki to be relaxing. The complementary breakfast included a nice selection of hot egg dishes, fresh fruit, sausage/bacon, yogurt, pastries, pancakes, etc., as well as miso soup and kimchi, all of which is fresh and tasty (the staff do a good job of keeping it full). Overall, we can't think of anything we would change. If we find ourselves in Honolulu again, we will be back.

This was the first time I stayed at a Hyatt Place and I have to say it was a very pleasant experience. The room was very large and the beds very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location was great in Waikiki, close to the beach and the zoo. The breakfast buffet was a plus especially that it was included as well as WiFi being included. I would recommend the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach and will probably stay at other Hyatt Place properties.
user_name:
Michelle Z
Santa Cruz, United States

review_body: Stayed here for first 2 nights of Hawaiian vacation before heading to Maui. This is definitely not a resort, but it is a nice hotel and only a quick 2 block walk to the beach. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was really great. One of the best free hotel breakfasts we've ever experienced. Parking garage right across the street. Can walk everywhere from this hotel. Very convenient location.

Very friendly hotel staff, very clean, and affordable accommodations! The walk to Waikiki Beach was very pleasant and not far at all (only two blocks). The breakfast skillet offered in the mornings is pretty good, however they don't have any gluten-free options if you have Celiac disease or allergic to gluten. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

The hotel is located at the east end of the Waikiki strip, and arriving after dark it seemed a bit seedy, but was actually fine. I stayed in a deluxe king room, high floor. The room was spotless, large, well appointed with a refrigerator, lanai and desk area. The housekeeper Josephine was very friendly and tolerant of my late departures in the morning. I didn't use any of the hotel facilities other than the room, but the elevators were a bit slow at times (and the hotel even put a letter in my room advising me of that). My only advice for rooms would be to try and get a high floor, as there is a fair amount of street noise, but I don't think it is worth going for a view as it seems unlikely there would be one with the surrounding high rises. I got a decent rate at fairly the last minute and no resort fees (which I loathe to pay for services I never use). Staff is friendly and universally helpful. Fast, free wifi. I normally stay at Starwood properties but would easily stay here again.

good place to stay at Waikiki beach for family although it is not a beach front hotel, no resort fee, continental breakfast included, friendly and resourceful staffs, and a staff told me where the public parking is for my late arrival. You can pick beach towers to go snorkeling, Waikiki beach, even north beach.

First night was not great, firstly when we arrived they had us in a twin room instead of a king room, this was sorted out quickly without us needing to go upstairs, but when we were given a room, someone else was already in there, luckily our swipe card did not work, but this was very embarrasing when she came to the door, this was after 11pm at nightStaff were highly embarrased, and shifted us to another room, in another area, much cheaper room, no view close to the noisy breakfast area. Shifted the next day to the room that we had booked and paid for,Other issue was the lifts, these were terribly slow, and broke down on one of the days, we were on the 14th floor and had to walk up the stairs when we wanted to get back to our room. Not great at all.Small swimming pool beside the breakfast area, Apart from that, the location was very good, the rooms comfortable

Stood here for the very first time with the family. Only a 3 minute walk to the beach so the location was excellent. You save alot of money staying here for the simple fact that it's not beach front property. Staff was excellent, very friendly. Received a complimentary room upgrade which was totally unexpected.Clean,large rooms. Free breakfast every morning, which was very good as well. Only draw backs are the elevators are very slow(there are only 2) so u may find yourself waiting a while at times. Also parking can be pretty pricey($30 each day to valet and $25 to self park). Overall it was well worth every penny. Definitely would stay there again.

I booked another hotel in Waikiki for our 4 night stay. I wanted somewhere nice but it didn't have to have the best views, pool bar, etc, I just wanted it to be nice without a huge pricetag. The other hotel was awful. With a base rate of $268, it was extremely old and tired and with no atmosphere but worst of all - smoke. I don't know exactly where it was, whether it was hidden in the old air con units or whatever but it was bad and I had a near asthma attack on our first night.Thankfully the Hyatt Place took us in and from then on our stay in Waikiki was perfect. I do not have enough kind words for this hotel, everything is spot on. Great staff, the room was fabulous; clean and spacious and the included breakfast was surprisingly great. I have seen others on Tripadvisor mention the pigeons on the breakfast terrace - do not let this deter you. There are no more pigeons here than any other outside dining space in Waikiki. Do not hesitate to book the Hyatt Place!

I left my Tiffany silver earrings in my hotel room and contacted the hotel on the same day I checked out. There was no follow up e-mail or phone call for 2 days, so I called them back to follow up. The person I spoke on the phone said she will e-mail the house keeper , but she didn't even asked which room I stayed in. It was very obvious that the hotel doesn't take this kind of claim seriously. My family had stayed at many Hyatt hotels in a few different countries and were always treated well except this hotel in Waikiki.

I stayed here last week with my husband who is a Hyatt Gold Passport member. We booked the room less than a week before our trip and got a great rate on an ocean view room with a king size bed.Check in was seamless, although an early check in was not possible for our desired room, because the prior occupants of our room had a late check out (good for them). We were offered an early check in a lower category room at no extra cost but it was highly suggested we wait for the room we booked because of its view and we were very glad that we waited. A free late checkout was also offered to us because we couldn't check in early, but we declined it.The room itself was modern, clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the room and the view was a plus. It appeared to be the best room in the hotel - Room 1833.Breakfast is free and there is a wide variety of items. All in all, we loved our visit here and would stay again in a heartbeat.

This is an above average, well kept, convenient hotel for lodging in Waikiki. Our room was very clean and did have a nice view of the ocean as stated in the room description.
