We were very satisfied with the quality and comfort of the entire room and would definitely stay here again. Breakfast is free and there is something for every palate. The staff was friendly and helpful. Quick valet. Highly recommend for a quiet, enjoyable stay.

A decent hotel from perspective of cleanliness and location. Facilities such as gym, pool, breakfast and Internet quite basic. Hence very suitable for vacation where one wishes to enjoy Waikiki. Not as suitable for business stopover.

If you are looking for a high priced hotel on the beach, that will charge you a resort fee, charge for wifi and charge for breakfast don't stay here. On the other hand, if you are like us, and came to town to be a tourist, someone who enjoys a hearty free breakfast, free wifi and a convenient location this is the place for you. Well sized rooms, a staff that caters to your needs and a block from Wakiki. With the money you save, have a sunset drink at one of the beach side hotels.

The staff were very courteous and helpful. the open lobby was evocative like many of the Honolulu hotels. The rooms are a bit dated but certainly comfortable in every extent. They had a 3rd party reservations desk for inter island travel and day excursions. i enjoyed the quiet and the easy walk to the beach. Was a wonderful experience and the breakfast that was included is very good even my Hyatt Place standards.
user_name:
Spearfish101
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The staff made our visit very enjoyable. From front desk to food service to housekeeping, everyone was so friendly and most accommodating. We practically had the pool & fitness area to ourselves each day. Perhaps it was because it was early june but still a wonderful benefit. Location is very convenient to Waikiki, Zoo, and all major attractions. It's a very clean hotel and the complimentary buffet breakfast was tremendous!

I stayed 3 nights at Hyatt Place the beginning of June 2015.It is wonderfully situated being one short block away from the main hustle, bustle and noise of Waikiki Beach. It is also walking distance to many shops, beaches, eateries etc. Outside are bus stops to get you all around the Island. I took a $2.50 bus to Pearl Harbour as well as a different bus to Diamond Head. The hotel itself is average. Reasonably quite (I was on the second highest floor), clean, comfy beds and pillows as well as a very useful breakfast skillet, pool and gym (see pictures). However I have food intolerances and this is the first hotel under the Hyatt chain around the world that haven’t been able to accommodate, even just a little bit – no gluten free bread. The cleaning staff were very friendly in their nature and how they spoke to me in the hallways, however I didn’t receive the same friendly vibe with other staff members, in actual fact I would err on the side of them being rude. At the breakfast buffet, for example, when I was wanting to walk through to find a seat, a staff member would push in front of me with their breakfast trolley (collecting dirty dishes or placing clean one out or updating the food at the buffet) instead of allowing myself or others through first and there wasn’t even any acknowledgement or thanks for me standing back and waiting for the staff member (this happened on more than one occasion with different staff members). Also I would recommend if you are deciding to use Hyatt Place as a hotel to stay at ensure that you don’t arrive before 3pm. Due to my flight arriving into Honolulu in the morning and myself getting to the hotel about 10am I was left sitting on a couch in the hot reception area until 3pm. Again there was no acknowledgement of me after I had spoken to staff of my arrival and I had told the hotel prior to my arrival that I would be early. Another factor would be to ask to be away from the lifts/elevators as they constantly beep and I was lucky enough to be down the corridor but I only had to walk closer to the elevators to hear there beep as the reach every level. Also there was no information given to me on the layout of the hotel or a map of the area.Despite all of this it was a good place to stay for what I needed and for the type of hotel it is and there were certainly very happy families around the hotel. You may be able to find a better deal at another nearby and better hotel if you are travelling as a couple or single or try and get a lower bargain deal rather than paying full price.

we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, people were cheerful and courteous, our room was always clean...it was only the breakfast buffet that made me unhappy because of the same variety of food for our whole week of stay, that was tiring...

This hotel is pretty much is a place to rest your head and I mean that literally. There are a few good things...free wifi, no resort fee and free breakfast. Not many hotels will offer those options which are a PLUS! The not so good thing was the pool and gym. The pool is very small, no lounge or bar. No room to sunbathe, which is a problem for me...I like the beach but I would like at least one day not to have sand everywhere. So, I had to call around to other hotels to rent a cabana for the day...no other hotels would allow cabana rental to outside guests until I called the Hyatt Regency which is down the street, I thought because it was the Hyatt family it would be no problem, well they gave me a hard time, I had to basically beg to make it happen. I got at least one day without sand...LOL! The gym is very small...not enough equipment for the size of hotel and the number of guest. So, I decided to run outside instead, which isn’t bad but I would have enjoyed the air condition. The rooms were small but very clean and comfy, I like bigger rooms but for the price for this hotel, I thought it was adequate. Make sure you request a high floor, better view, if not you will be looking into someone's apartment. If you are looking for somewhere clean, free wifi, no resort fees and free breakfast…this is the place!

Good value for money Hotel, 1min walk to Waikiki Beach, Trolley Bus Pickup at Street Level, spacious rooms with some with views of Beach/Diamond Head or Hill. Included Breakfast (just the basics) but was always a good way to start the day, also has a Pool and Gym area (basic) Great for those looking for a better than budget Hotel that's close to the main sights of Waikiki.

I really enjoyed the three night stay in this hotel. The hotel was simply beautiful and the location was 2 minutes from the beach! The breakfast was average,however I would recommend this hotel for families looking a good saving in Hawaii.

The room was clean, roomy and comfortable. Breakfast had a great selection. Had a great stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Nick, Tiffany and Christopher from the Gallery Bar were terrific. Wilma, the lady who looked after the 12th floor was fantastic and kept our room spotless! Would stay there again. Close to everything!

We went to visit our new granddaughter Addy, and used our Hyatt Gold Passport points to stay here during part of our trip.We like Hyatt Place for its consistent quality, and the fact that we know what we will find even on our first visit... because one Hyatt Place is very much like another. With the exception of different smiling staff faces greeting you when you walk in the door, its almost cookie cutter, in a good way! You know what the room layout will be, you know what's on the breakfast buffet (included with your room !!), and the quality you get for the money (or points if you are using GP points) is an excellent value!But none of our Hyatt Place experiences prepared us for Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach! Instead of the usual 3 to 5 floors, this hotel had more than 20 floors I think. As Platinum GP members we got a top floor room with ocean views. Totally unexpected as was the open air lobby! We were one block from Waikiki beach, and all of the shops and restaurants were within walking distance, as well as lovely beach front parks. Although we could walk anywhere we liked, we also had a car to get around the island and were able to park it at the hotel for a reasonable fee. I would highly recommend this hotel to Waikiki Beach visitors! A surprise for Hyatt Place regulars and an excellent value!

Just a short walk from Waikiki Beach is the Hyatt Place Beach hotel which offers outstanding value for the area. Few hotels in downtown Honolulu offer two queen beds, like this hotel, which was great as we were travelling with a friend. The hotel offers an outstanding full breakfast which is included in the hotel rate. Both hot and cold items are efficiently replenished by staff.The breakfast area is right by the pool but it is extremely busy so go early or late. Peak times are 7:30/8:00 am. Our room was very comfortable with a sofa and large TV. In bustling Honolulu it was a quiet place to relax. The hotel staff are efficient and helpful. The rate was considerably less expensive than hotels on the beach, the room was bigger and with the full breakfast the value was better. And just one block away with an ABC Store right out your door, this will my Honolulu home when I visit again.

My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights recently with our 10 year old daughter. This hotel was much cheaper than some of the bigger hotels and seemed to have a good location not far from the beach and it also included a free breakfast. The walk to the beach is only about 3-4 minutes and there are plenty of great eating options near the hotel. The staff is very helpful and they have an activities desk right in the lobby.A couple of pointers. Do not waste your money on paying for a ocean view. You can only see parts of the ocean unless you are on the top floor. There are too many buildings in the way. Also, get to breakfast early if you want a seat and don't want to wait in line for 20 minutes. The breakfast is very good and changes daily, but it gets crazy crowded in there. The pool here is very small and not very useful.Overall I would probably stay here again unless a nicer hotel on the beach had a good rate.

Stayed for 1 night after a cruise trip. The hotel is within a very short walking distance from the beach. The mattress for the king bed in our room was starting to show its age. Deadbolt for the door wouldn't work (Room 215).

We stayed here for one night. We were unable to check in early (got there about 1pm), but able to check in at 3. We asked for an ocean view king room and they were out of king rooms, so asked if 2 queens would be ok. I was kinda bothered at first considering we had booked it months in advance and there was only 2 of us, but agreed to it....and I'm glad we did! Such a HUGE room and plenty of space to lay out our suitcases, swimsuits, etc. We got our ocean view between two buildings and it was beautiful. An ABC store was only a block away, to pick up water and beach mats, and the beach is another block further. Absolutely a great deal, as most of the hotels right on Waikiki Beach were almost $100 min. more for a night. They also serve free breakfast in the morning. We got there right at 6:30am when it opened and it was a mad house! Still able to get food easily, but it's definitely their busy time. Food isn't too bad and had variety. We went on a tour that actually didn't get us back to the hotel until 12:30pm. We called the night before to make sure it would be ok to get a later check out and they were totally fine with it. We checked out about 1pm with no issues or addl charges. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for a wedding.Of course as every wedding the bride had a few things she forgot to grab. The staff was amazing in helping us get everything together. The staff was amazing and the place was so clean and comfortable. We will stay here again!

Very nice place and the location is excellent! I would recommend this hotel to a friend! friendly staff and the food was very good! Complementary breakfast that makes for a good start to the day! Bed was very comfortable and the room was clean I had a ocean view that made a big difference.
user_name:
Jeffrey Blake H
Philadelphia, United States

review_body: This was a great stay. We booked Ocean view and had a great view. The room was neat and clean and the breakfast was more than expected. Located just a block or so from the beach, it was easy to walk to the beach. A little far down the coast for the best beach, but a short walk remedied that.

Staying at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is definitely a place to remember. The hotel is clean, friendly Staff with breakfast included… can't beat that. We had a magnificent view enjoying the Diamond Head! To top it off, it is very convenient to shopping stores and restaurants. But my favorite part staying at this hotel is walking distance going to the beach. This is definitely a thumbs up and will surely recommend for every tourist that stay n Honolulu!

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt from May 18-27. The staff were friendly and checking in was quick. The hotel is modern with a bar area ( your drinks cannot leave the bar area ) and a convenience type store and is only 3 minutes walk to Waikiki Beach and within walking distance to all the good restaurants and shops. In addition there is a excursion desk with staff that were very helpful in planning activities. Our room was larger then I expected, which was great and the bed very comfortable. They offer a free breakfast which was pretty good with a nice variety to choose from.The only complaint I have was the street noise. From 6:30 am to 10:00 pm there is a constant parade of tour buses and taxies, sleeping in past 6:30 am is impossible. To be fair to the Hyatt, we spoke to other visitors staying in different hotels in the area and they all had the same problem. Overall for the price, location and service we would recommend the Hyatt to anyone travelling to Waikiki.

I'm from Oahu and recently stated here for 2 nights. The location of the hotel is great it's walking distance to many restaurants and the beach. We took advantage of their free breakfasts they serve till 10am on weekends. To access it youll need ypur room card to get to yhe 3rd floor. I thought it was pretty good for free. They had bacon, pancakes, scrambled eggs, cereals, juices, coffee, oatmeal station, yogurt fresh fruits cottage cheese, granola, bagels, muffins, toasts,pastries, miso soup, kim chee, tofu and seaweed for the Asian guests. It was not a run down thing and many guests took advantage of it. Outside it would have easily been a 15$ breakfast. The original room I had was a standard city facing king, I felt it was a little small for us and when I called the front desk they were able to find me an upgraded room that was much larger and had a big balcony. There's a small area in this room that has a separate TV and pull out queen sofa. This would be ideal if I had my kids traveling with me. Here are my pros and cons of the hotel..Pro: very comfortable bed and clean roomsFront desk and valet were excellent. Valet was high at 30$ a night, self parking for 25$ but limited stallsNo resort fee and free wifiThey had in room demand movies for 17.99$Free breakfastsLocation is awesomeIn room safe and mini fridgeFree coffee and tea BUT water is 3.50$ so bring your own24/7 room service availability convenient when you want to stay in.Safety you will need your room key to access the elevatorsGreat pressure in the showerStarbucks and a bar in the lobbyCons- not many bad things to say. Just minor things like the lack of that little lotion bottle that usually comes with the shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom. And the size of the original room I had was pretty small. Overall from a local perspective i would definitely stay here again!

Overall excellent, except breakfast and check in times! It's a very great location to the beach and all the attractions, hotel's staffs are very friendly and helpful. It's a walking distance to all the shops and cafes, and rooms they're very clean and comfortable.

Loved the accommodation! Felt like a home away from home! Hotel location is great, just down the road from the beach, and close to bus stops if you want a trolley bus or need a bus to catch downtown. Very clean, staff very helpful and friendly. Great views of the ocean. We had a corner room that had ocean and mountain views, was lovely. We were travelling with a 2yr old, crib bit small for him but he loved having a queen size bed to himself, so ask for a twin room if travelling with kids, as it's a large size room! . Am skillet is wonderful, lots of variety and kept us going for most of the day :) Hard to find places that include this type of brekky in the cost of your stay. Enjoy your travels if your lucky enough to be heading over!!

Free breakfast, clean modern , 5 min walk Waikki beach. Hotel was pretty modern and I had sea view from my room. Wifi everywhere. Parking facilities available if you rent own car. Hotel staff pretty good however tour operator just wanted sell tour rather give information about what to do where to go etc

This is a nice hotel to stay in while in Waikiki beach. It's not a 5 star, but you're not paying for that either. It's convenient to walk pretty much everywhere you'd like. It's a quick few minutes to shopping, renting moped or bicycle or grab a trolley. The staff are helpful, friendly and your room is keep tidy and clean. Breakfast every morning is a great feature and much appreciated at the pool deck. Small balcony, but we're here for the beach - not to sit on the balcony!!

We booked a room with an ocean view room and got "upgraded" to a mountain-view room which was on the 6th floor and had a view of part (maybe a couple of inches) of the mountains through the decrepit buildings on either side. Never mind that it was our honeymoon and we asked for a nicer room...."we're full...sorry!". The room was smaller than our bedroom at home (and that's saying something) and my knees almost touched the shower door when sitting on the toilet. Location is handy to Waikiki beach so if you don't care about the room size and the view, this is the place for you! The only saving grace is that the staff gave us a cheap bottle of wine to make up for the crappy room. We thought it might be worth the price because of the breakfast that is included....you are better off eating at McDonalds.

People at the front desk greet you with plenty of aloha and make the process quick. The rooms have a luxurious look and feel with comfortable linens. The entertainment on the TV along with premium channels will keep you well entertained during your relaxing moments in your room. The wifi in the room and the business center (located in the lobby) is fast and easy to connect to get some work done or simply surf the web. The morning skillet breakfast offered from 6:30am-9:30am during the week and weekends until 10am will provide you with a variety of choices to start your day. The outdoor seating area has plenty of tables under umbrellas that enhances the experience. Overall, it is a wonderful and comfortable place to stay on your getaway to the beautiful island of Oahu. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. You won't be disappointed!
user_name:
Armando L
Garden Grove, CA, United States

review_body: Convenient location; tours left from hotel across street; walking distance to Waikiki Beach and shopping/restaurants. Although not fronting Waikiki Beach, the cost per night was not equal to beach front either. We would definitely stay there again.

Nice rooms. Good location. I would give it 5 stars if it had a restaurant. Unfortunately, it only has a snack bar with sandwiches and salads.For the price, it was worth it. Great ABC store 1/2 block away

This is a more affordable way to experience Waikiki. It is away from the busy environment of the beach making it a more quiet and enjoyable place to stay. The walk to the beach from here though is really easy and it is also close to shops and restaurants. The rooms are relatively new but we did have some issues with the water pressure in the shower (the only con of the stay). Other than that the staff were fantastic and we would stay again.

I can tell you that I was very pleasantly surprised at the level of service one gets at this hotel. One gentleman in particular, Roy, even helped us get to church on Sunday and provided us with the information we needed to get what we needed done at each turn. The hotel, unlike most of the older hotels in this town, is clean and tidy and the beds are really comfortable. The breakfast is more than adequate and about the only thing they lacked in offerings as some papaya. There are even a few offerings for the Asian community like kimchee at breakfast. When we checked out they were able and graciously hold our bags for us since our flight was not till 8:45pm. I highly recommend this hotel and would come back here in a heartbeat. It is only a block from the beach.

My trip to Waikiki was a last minute decision. I went alone and wanted a moderately priced hotel where I felt safe. The location was great. I was able to walk everywhere I wanted to go. One block to the beach and one block to the bus stop. There was free WIFI and free breakfast. There was a small fridge and an ABC store was right next door. The mattress, bedding and pillows were wonderful. The room was modern and clean with nice fixtures. No bathtub only a shower. Because I was traveling alone, I was pleased that the elevators could only be activated with my key card. I splurged on a room with an "ocean view". The balcony room with an ocean view was an exageration. Yes there was a view...a small smidgen of ocean between two tall hotels in front of me. The balcony was so small that I had to move the chair to one side just to step out on it. But other than that it was a good experience. The employees were helpful and friendly. I would stay here again.

My husband and I chose Hyatt Place for our recent honeymoon in Hawaii. The rooms were modern and clean, the location to the beach was fantastic and the complimentary wifi in the room was the tipping point. The staff were all incredibly helpful and we booked an number of tours through their inhouse Travel Expert who was so knowledgable and answered our every question. Our stay at the Hyatt could not have been better, it was the perfect honeymoon.

We were very happy with our stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Our room was updated and clean. We stayed with our 3 teenagers and the room was a nice size for the 5 of us. The breakfast was great for our family. The hotel was located about a block off Waikiki so it was convenient to many activities. We stayed for a week and would definitely stay here again.

We were really impressed with the staff. They made our stay there memorable. The front desk was very attentive and helpful. When they found out we were there for our son's wedding they even had something special sent up to our room. We certainly didn't expect that! What a nice touch to help us start with our celebration. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable, no complaints. The breakfast that was included was actually not bad. We found something to eat everyday and enjoyed the coffee. The pool was small but beautiful exciting Waikiki beach was only one block away. The only room for improvement would be the Happy Hour it was a bit disappointing.

Stayed here for one night with my family of 4 before we moved on to a timeshare for the rest of the week. I was very pleasantly surprised with the size of the room! We had two beds and a sofa bed. Smart layout of the room. The TV pivoted to face the side with the beds or the side with the sitting area. Beds were quite comfortable. Breakfast and wifi are included in room rate, but parking was an additional fee. Breakfast was what you would expect, with some nice hot options available. Seating is outside near the pool area, and there were plenty of tables with umbrellas to provide shade while eating. There were lots of birds trying to get their meal, too, but employees did their best to shoo them away. There are signs not to leave your food unattended or feed the birds...for good reason!Did not go in the pool, but it is very basic and small. Hotel is a couple of short blocks away to the beach. Even though it's not right on the beach, we could see the ocean from the balcony in our room.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Hyatt Place from 5/13/2015 through 5/21/2015. We had a mountainside King-size room. Very comfortable bed. View was beautiful. Room was adequately sized and very well maintained and cleaned througout our stay. While there has been a lot of mentions of rooms being noisy (street noise), I didn't find the noise levels objectionable on the 11th floor. Earplugs for sleeping were provided, which seemed a strange touch. But I never had to use them. An easy walk to the beach and many restaurants. Breakfast included in the room rate was quite good compared to the usual continental breakfast served at most hotels. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I did not encounter any rude or non-professional staff members. I suspect (based on our experience) that if others have, it was an anomoly. I strongly suggest using the valet service if using a car for your stay. Very courteous and prompt. The slight marginal cost above self-parking fees is well worth it. Even with tipping. The pool looked very nice. But there was this huge ocean a short walk away. Never got in the pool.

Very classy hotel. Great staff. I have always been somewhat skeptical of hotels in this area of Waikiki but found the area to be very safe. As a woman traveling alone, I felt very comfortable walking to and from my hotel in the evening. Two blocks from the beach. Great restaurants within walking distance. Great free breakfast by the pool in the morning to start your day. All-in-all...a great vacation hotel for singles or families.

I just got back from a last minute trip to hawaii, while there I bounced between 3 hotels, 2nights each, because why not. so this was hotel number 2. Overall this hotel was great. the rooms were nice and big and clean. ( nowhere near as big as the standard Hyatt Place, just as an fyi) So a couple of annoyances, valet was sooooo understaffed at check in ( and 3 other times) so over crowded we couldn't even pull in, we had to park the car on the street when they could tell we were agitated with the 20 minute plus wait. Next came check in, all seemed good, got up to room, city view. I had already prepaid through their website for an ocean view room. I called down and they tried to convince me they gave me an upgraded room which was better than the ocean view room I had paid for I explained I will take my chances with the downgrade, I wanted to see the ocean. They said they'd get right back to me, 15 minutes later I call down again, and they say, oh ya we have a room for you come back down. no offer to help move us or anything. So Shlub back down to the front desk, get the new keys, go to new room. oceanview, with balcony, and overall a good room. Pros:Rooms were cleanRooms were spacious and what you'd expect from a hyattgreat location, on the far end of Waikiki beach, right by the zoo. staff was great, especially valet guys, especially with being so overworked.Cons: -tried to pass off a city view room as an "upgrade" on a room I had paid for already, direct from them! -Poor Valet guys are understaffed, they needed some help. One last thing, the gift shop in the back part of the lobby has the cheapest water, sodas and gatorades pretty much anywhere in that area. Would I stay here again, yes probably. but there was nothing about it that made me dying to come back, but no reason why I wouldn't go.

This little hotel is one block from Waikiki Beach and all the stores you'll ever want to see or go to. I did not rent a car and found this location to very good for walking to your favorite restaurant or beach. I play golf and the hotel made all the arrangements, all I did was show up and play. If you like to do your own thing this is the place. They have a free breakfast, gym and a pool. Nice little bar and free internet. Very clean and everyone here wants to help you have a good time. Two minute walk to the beach, The Tiki bar and the rest of Waikiki Beauty. Enjoy I did. MJG

Nice, friendly, clean and comfortable stay. While there is not much of a view, the rooms were spacious, and the walk to the beach was about 2 blocks. Breakfast was enjoyable with open seating near the pool, but beware of wind and birds.

I've stayed in Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach this may. Complementary breakfast is a huge plus, our room was on 19th floor, create view!!! room is remodeled and fresh, , great service, close to the beach. Excellent!!!

We stayed at thThe Hyatt Place for a week. Our stay could not have been any better! Our room was very well appointed and very clean. Check-in was a breeze. Located 5 minutes walk to the beach, restuarants and shops.

Only spent one night at this hotel and had a view looking at an alley and run down apartments. Looking at the pictures there are some nice views from some of the rooms, but some have views you would expect from a motel. My advice when booking make sure you request a room on the upper level.

Good location staff was good ,morning buffet was not one of the best was o.k,No hot tub swimming pool is too small,havent seen any one using the pool . Overall not a bad place to stay for the price. beach is couple of mins away.

How do you think a group of 27 came to a hotel was treated? GREAT. Two couples arrived on Saturday May 2, 2015 then the balance of 25 came in on Sunday. We were greeted like we have been there before ,asked how our flights were. All the employees were friendly, polite, and told us whatever we needed just ask. The rooms were spacious, clean, breakfast included, free WI-FI. With being such a large group we were given suggestions to places to visit, eat and they also make a reservation for us. I give this hotel a AAA plus. Will suggestion to anyone that needs a hotel in Honolulu. Having breakfast outside was great along with the food

Parking is at a premium in Waikiki and is especially so at this hotel. I opted for self parking and occasionally found that a lot of the spaces were full of valet so it seems they may oversell parking. I would recommend that if you stay here you should opt for valet to skip the hassle of finding a spot and dealing with the nearby one way road. If you are traveling for pleasure and are going to spend a lot of time in Waikiki I would recommend a different hotel for location reasons unless you enjoy walking. Otherwise this hotel is excellent and the included breakfast is quite good.

Staff was very friendly and hotel was clean. Would recommend this hotel. They were very accommodating to our needs. This hotel was in a great location and central to the area. Restaurants are nearby and also many stores to do your shopping.
user_name:
Karen G
Buffalo, New York, United States

review_body: We were pleasantly greeted, despite being early for check-in and were directed to our room promptly. The staff is friendly and professional. The location is close to places we wanted to visit and the concierge gave us simple directions.
user_name:
Brian P
West Warwick, United States

review_body: We have stayed at three other Hotels within Waikiki over the past five years (including the Sheraton), and found this Hotel to be the best yet. The reasons for this include; - great concierge service (booking of activities was easy and friendly). - Trolley stop about 10 meters down the road. - ABC store only 5 meters down the road. - Within an easy walk to any part of Waikiki. - Friendly and accommodating staff. - Complimentary WIFI & breakfast. - A coin laundry (which we used twice and worked very well). - No resort fee. - Our room was spacious, clean and quiet (we stayed on the 3rd floor). - We made use of their agreement with the local taxi company for transportation to the airport (Cost $29 and was on time). It cost us $50 to get to the Hotel, when we arrived (if only we had known about their agreement earlier).

I had to "beg" for Room Service days 1 and 2. You claim you are a green hotel, but you are willing to replace towels. (That is what uses electricity!) You have to beg for it. Then on check out at 8:30 am, I get an obnoxious knock at the door saying they wanted to do room service. I said I will be out in 35 minutes. I of course had 3 1/2 hours more of entitlement to the room. The breakfast was poor. The skillets were marketed that you could get food made to order. No such thing. The food tasted poorly. The breakfast is outdoor on the 3rd floor. It was extremely windy. Food was literally blowing off of people's tables into the pool. The pool is very very small. I mean tiny. There was no Jacuzzi. I was not impressed. Poor quality for an expensive hotel. Parking was inconvenient and expensive.

Location: 4*It is near end of the Waikiki strip and not right across from the beach . But it's a city block away. 5 minutes walking tops. Room: 3*+The room was clean and relatively spacious. +Bed was comfortable. -Bathroom was a little tight. -We had just stayed at Hyatt Regency DFW they had a nice set of essentials waiting for us, NOT the case hear. We would have had to call for them, but I didn't want to have to wait for them. They say they will leave it at the door but it wasn't the case at another Hyatt. -The bathroom fan was continously on, I think it had a faulty switch. (there was a switch on the wall that didn't work)Breakfast: 3*Continental breakfast plus a few "skillet" items Getting there was a little confusing. There is a sign on a desk in front of the elevators, but the people waiting blocked it. The door you have to go through seems like an emergency exit door. -Breakfast ends at 9:30, but they started picking up 5-10 min early. They left out a few items while people finished. So be there at least 9:15Facility: 2*Although it's nice overall it had a few shortcomings. -Keyboards at the computer center where dirty. They had grime on them-The concierge never picked up the phone. By the time I had changed and was able to go to the tour desk, we missed a luau that left earlier that afternoon.-Elevator is slow. Only two to service 20 floors on our side.-when we left my wife had to use the washroom on the ground floor. It was out of service. She would have had to go to the 2nd floor to find one in service, but we had our taxi waiting so she had to hold it. -No water served (or at least in plain sight) on the ground floor.+ They have a pre-set price on taxis to/from airport. At $29, you can save $20+ per trip. Make sure to request a non smoking taxi the first one had a strong cigarette smoke smell. Service 3*Nothing good nor bad to report. OverallWhile it may seem like i listed many negatives (i would like to think they will correct some and the rest are isolated incidents) it's location and reasonable price makes this hotel a good choice when staying in Waikiki.

We were recommended this hotel and it didn't disappoint. We got to the hotel at 8.30am and did not expect our room to be ready but was advised that it was..perfect. The kids wanted a swim so we went to the pool not realising that it was not open till 10am due to it being in the breakfast area. Yuko in the breakfast area was so friendly and advised us of this but as breakfast was nearly finished and there were only a few people left we were able to stay. The hotel room was one of the largest that I have stayed in we had room 840. It was very clean and had all the amenities that you require. All the house keeping staff were very friendly as were the front desk. Dealt with the Expedia desk on a few occasions and found Cameron to be wonderful to deal with but Chris was not so approachable and avoided the desk on these days unfortunately. During our stay I celebrated my birthday/anniversary and Mother's Day. Yuko wished me the best for Mother's Day when my husband informed her of the other dates as well. Later that day we had a delivery of goodies organised by her with a lovely card. This was very thoughtful. The kids were also given their own set of beach toys by the hotel and also drawing books. It is these little things which will bring me back to this hotel. Location is fantastic for the beach and trolley/the bus. Will be back for sure to this paradise. Hyatt place should be very proud of their staff and hotel.
user_location: Dolans Bay, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Heidi2229
Dolans Bay, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I worked on our dream trip for a year, I booked everything and researched extensively on hotels from a 2 to 3 star rating. I already had a hotel booked when I came across the Hyatt Place. It was a short walk to the beach, the price included a hot breakfast which saved us money spent on breakfast each day. It was very very clean and nicely decorated and modern. It had a very fresh appeal. The best part which I didn't expect was how comfy the bed was.A huge plus in our book. We had an ocean view room and the view was just ok but considering the price and the fact we didn't stay in the room a whole lot the view was perfect of the ocean. The free Wifi in our room worked great, no issues. Management also took the time to send up a bottle of wine in celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary which I thought was really nice. It was a wonderful stay and I'm so glad I made the right choice for our stay.

This hotel is fabulous is you're looking for affordable, yet luxurious lodging at Waikiki. It's not right on the beach, but it's a very short 2 blocks away. The rooms are large, impeccably clean, and modern with lots of storage space and drawers to put your clothes and belonging. The beds and pillows were so soft and comfortable The complimentary breakfast was fantastic...the best we'd ever had at a hotel. And the service is great. Everyone was very friendly and very helpful. The hotel's self parking garage ($25/night) was full when we visited, with their only parking option being valet ($30/night+tips). BUT there is a large parking garage directly kiddy corner from this hotel where you can park for $20/night, which we used and was perfect for us...saved us a few $$ and was super convenient.

My family and I really enjoyed staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. The room comfortably fit the five of us, and their service was great. We enjoyed the close proximity to the beach and many good restaurants. The free breakfast was a nice perk. We definitely recommend staying there.

I was very dissatisfied with the ocean view room I received, which was viewing only a sliver of ocean amongst many high-rise buildings. The next morning I called and was lucky to talk to front desk staff member, Angeline, worked to find me a better room; she was successful and it made my stay perfect versus my never returning to Hyatt Place Honolulu and writing a negative review. The hotel is a in great location and the breakfast is very good. Thermostat was locked at 68 degrees though, which is too warm for sleeping at night.

I enjoyed our stay here. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms spacious. We had booked two king rooms (my parents in one and us - family of three in the other). The check-in girl, whose name escapes me, offered to change us to a large double queen room in a few days time. We accepted and swapped rooms without any stress. None of us were keen on the breakfast or the area it is served in (too windy) but it is perfectly fine for coffee, toast and cereal. Our room(s) were on the 12th floor and super quiet. We had a good view as well. Valet attendant was very friendly and prompt even when run off his feet. Overall this is a a good option if you are watching your pennies but want a comfortable bed in a clean and functional hotel. Oh and the free wifi was a great bonus too!

This turned out to be a great experience. From right at check-in I knew I had chosen the right place. I had never been escorted to the elevator after check-in before but it happened here. Very impressive. The room was great and was very clean the whole time I was there. The balcony was a bit small but it worked. The wi-fi was great and there was a small frig and coffee maker in the room. There was plenty of drawer and closet space.My only negative was the car valet service. Seemed like very often the cars in the driveway were backed up all the way to the street. When I checked out the valet had to leave my car in the street since the driveway was full and there was no one to move cars. More help is certainly needed in this area.The place is only 1 1/2 blocks from a nice beach and there's several nice restaurants close by along with the ABC stores. I felt the cost of this place was well worth the money.

This was a lovely stay in Honolulu. Super close walk to the beach and loved having breakfast included in the morning. The room was so spacious and comfortable. The hotel was all around clean, colourful, warm and relaxing.

Love this place. All of the staff is great. They know their job, do it well and are very friendly. Housekeeping was great. Internet was great, I could even Skype. Breakfast was great. The staff kept things stocked and the tables clean. The only negative I have is the car valet. Not enough of them. It seemed like the driveway was always backed up out to the street. The hotel is only 1 1/2 blocks from the beach and there are many bars and restaurants close.

We enjoyed the atmosphere and location of the hotel. It was a short walk to the beach and it was in the center of beach front activities. We has an excellent breakfast buffet. I would recommend this hotel as a Hawaiian vacation hub. The staff was very friendly and accomodating.

I had certain expectations of this hotel because it was a Hyatt. While I thought the location was great, just one block back from Waikiki Beach, it was the little things that let me down. The other positive was the size of the room, it was huge and very comfortable (2 queen size beds and a sofa) and the view of the beach was wonderful. The beds were also very comfortable. Now the cons: loud airconditioning (the techician did come up and adjusted the temperature but advised us to keep the fan low to keep the noise down); housekeeping was very disappointing - four days there were dark hairs in the bath after the daily service; the mirror in the entry was never cleaned; there was no shower cap or body lotion provided. I was told later that I could have rung down for both these items, however, when you are naked or in your underwear, the last thing you want to do is ring reception and then wait 20 minutes for these items to be delivered. Both should have been available in the room already. There was also an issue with the bed pillows never being put back on the bed or the replacement glasses/mugs being put back in the cabinet. I expect to walk into the room at the end of the day to a room that is set up like it was the first day. The service was very disappointing for a Hyatt. The other issue was the free breakfast. And yes I know I shouldn't complain, it was free, but there were issues. Firstly it was on the pool deck. Too bad if you wanted a quiet early morning swim - there were 100s of spectators watching you. There other issue was the wind which caused you to bolt down everything otherwise it was blown away. As a consequence the floor was littered with butter and jam containers and lots of napkins. Definitely a tripping hazard. The other issue was the birds - flying everywhere, trying to get to the food. Not very hygienic and not pleasant as they swooped around your face. I have raised all these matters with hotel management who have been very positive in their response which I appreciate. I don't complain frivilously but there were obviously issues at this hotel that I just would not expect from a Hyatt. My booking was partly based on the experience that I expected from the brand. I hope the next time I visit (and I'd be happy to stay there again) I hope to see some changes made especially to housekeeping.

My wife and I traveled to Hawaii to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. We reviewed several hotels online before selecting Hyatt Place. Upon arrival, we told Hedi the purpose of our visit and she immediately provided an upgrade to our room. The entire staff was extremely helpful and courteous. We would definitely seek out more Hyatt chain.

If you're going to Waikiki, your aim is not to hang out in the hotel (or at least it shouldn't be.) You need a hotel with friendly, helpful staff, comfortable beds, and clean, well appointed rooms. The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach checks all of these boxes.The rooms themselves exceeded our expectations. They were very large - we were travelling with a family of five and never felt like we were on top of one another. And I loved the fact that they realize that stuffing the room's fridge with ridiculously priced food and beverages that no-one will ever buy doesn't serve either their or their guests' purposes. Having an empty fridge was a wonderful addition.The no-charge breakfast buffet was great. I was a little surprised by the hours, but it ends up the busiest time is between about 6:30 and 7:00. I put that down to the guests still on mainland time.Overall, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Unless you absolutely must have a totally open view of the beach, I heartily recommend this hotel.

Hotel was excellent, good location, good breakfast, birds are only a minor problem, as is rain when at breakfast as this option is outside, room and bed were very comfortable, but the pillows on the bed were useless. Great hotel option at a good price.

My husband and I booked a room at the Hyatt Place as a stop over after our honeymoon. Overall it was a fantastic stay. The hotel itself is located at the Diamond Head side of Waikiki and provides great access to shopping and resturants. It's only a short walk to the 'action' in Waikiki. We arrived quite late and tired after a delayed flight, the check in staff couldn't have been more accommodating providing us with a room on a higher floor for an extra quiet sleep. I would definitely request a room on a high floor of possible as the noise and traffic from the street may keep some awake- however it's like that in Waikiki no matter where you stay we've found. The room itself was generous in size and had all the classic ammenities you need. It was an older hotel renovated, but really clean with new furnishings. As part of the room rate there is free wifi and breakfast which is an added bonus. I would definitely recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki for a more basic, but trendy place to stay for a few days.

Stayed here Feb.2014 for 2 weeks. Wonderful location, short walk to beach. Room was beautiful, lots of room. We had 2 queen beds, couch, coffee table, ottoman. "Free" breakfast was very good, lots of choices. You can breakfast on the pool deck, or take back to your room, tray supplied in room. Pool area hardly used, so we had it to ourselves most of the time. Lots of places to tan or sit in shade. Staff very helpful. Will stay here again.

I came across this hotel on Expedia. I thought I would follow up on TripAdvisor as the deal was much cheaper compared to other hotels in Waikiki. After reading some of the reviews we decided to go ahead with the booking. The hotel is in a brilliant location less than a 5 minute walk away from the main beach promenade where there are plenty of wonderful restaurants and shops. The room rate includes complimentary breakfast and wifi. Breakfast has a couple of hot options and the rest is continental. Wifi is really quick and convenient for when you are travelling. The hotel has a bar, gym, pool, self service laundry, breakfast area and tour desk. Public areas of the hotel are modern and really well appointed such as the lobby. We booked a standard ocean view room as we got such a great rate. The room was well appointed, super clean and surprisingly much more modern than we thought after seeing photos of other hotels in Waikiki. Air con was great and the TV had a great selection of channels. The bed was amazing I had the best sleep in months! The staff are the most professional and friendly team that I have ever come across. Terrence who checked us in called within minutes of us arriving in our room to make sure we were happy with what we were getting. I worked in hotels for over 8 years and never received service like this. Don't be discouraged by some of the negative reviews you see on here. The pool is small but you come to Hawaii for the beach which is 5 minutes away. The birds at breakfast only come from people who do not clean up after themselves, there is even signage to say don't feed the birds or leave food behind. There are no problems with the lifts I never had to wait longer than a minute. Will happily recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely return with my family again!

We chose this hotel for its great reviews and location to the eastern side of the island (Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay, Waikiki Breach) It also offers an excellent breakfast in its outdoor kitchen. What a way to experience Oahu

Recently tried Hyatt Place Waikiki for a week long stay. I wanted near the beach and this was literally less than a block away. Overall the BEST part of stay was the amazing customer service! Staff is amazing! The room was simple and efficient, no frills but everything you want and need, refrigerator, coffee maker, small balcony, comfortable furniture.
user_name:
Kate E
Las Vegas, United States

review_body: From the moment I first walked up to the front desk the staff were always helpful during my stay. The front desk writes your suite # and also the free WiFi password on your room key envelope. The free WiFi is pretty fast (25MBish), as a side note. There is no Resort Fee with this hotel which is a huge Plus, I upgraded my room instead with the money. My balcony view of Diamond Head and the ocean was nice. Although I'd assume all the ocean view rooms will be looking in between other buildings to the water. Room was very clean, especially the bathroom. The cleaning staff I saw on the 18th floor were always very nice. One of them already knew when I was leaving and wished me a good flight! One of the reasons I chose this hotel over others was the included breakfast as part of your stay. By the fourth day of breakfast sandwiches in a row, I had already predicted the next mornings first meal when the chef surprised us on Friday with bacon, scrambled eggs, and pancakes. It was like light had started shining through the sky. Please stop the madness and mix up breakfast a little! The gym was overall Very Good. Lots of free weight variety. Nice modern looking machines from Good Life Fitness, also fresh towels and a cold water (and cups) station. Bathroom on site if you want to wash your hands after using the equipment. Pool area was pretty clean. There are towel cupboards on site which were always stocked. Lots of lawn-chairs and chairs surrounding the pool, which is 1.5m at the deep end. The pool connects with the Gym area. Self-serve laundry machines are on site if you need them. There were only 1 or 2 however so don't leave your laundry until the last minute! To do a full cycle of laundry will cost you about $9 USD, unless you bring your own detergent, which would reduce it to $6. I believe you can swipe your room key to pay the fee. Location of this hotel was about 1 block from Waikiki beach. ABC stores are everywhere including just outside the street a few doors down.

The hotel was in a great location with restaurants close by that were reasonably price and a short walk to Waikiki. There was public transportation available. It was close to the zoo and park along with Diamond Head. The staff was excellent.

I stayed here for about a month. Pros: More spacious rooms, valet customer service, convenience, breakfast, internet, couch w/sofa sleeper, location not too far from beach Cons: Room was dirty under beds (dusty) and patio area was not cleaned, breakfast selection, washer/dryer not great, not enough amenities, pool small and no hot tub, customer service of front reception area staff not very good/kinda fake, have to use the key for elevators (each person to go up) - very inconvenient and annoying. Average, but not great for cost.

We are totally satisfied with the service that was provided to us.Staff are very friendly, rooms are clean and quiet. It's very close to the beach and all stores it's just a few minutes walk. Everything is so accessible. I will definitely recommend this place and will surely comeback and stay again here. It's an excellent and awesome experience. Thank you for great service. Especial thanks to Heidiliza (front desk) and Adelma ( room attendant) they're awesome 

I love this hotel - great location and staff, clean, spacious rooms, ample breakfast, good WiFi. Comparatively quiet block for Waikiki. I am a frequent business traveler. I stayed here for business in October 2014, April 2015, and will return in May. This is my ONLY choice for a Honolulu hotel. I look forward to returning.

Hubby and I spent a couple of nights at this hotel and we both enjoyed it. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the beach and centrally located. The reception area was a bit of a surprise and quite busy when we checked in but the reception staff were very friendly and accommodated our request for a higher floor straight away. Our room was very nice and seems to have been recently updated. There was a large TV in the room, an iron and a hot water percolator, which was handy. The free wifi was a nice addition to what was included in the package and so was the free breakfast. The breakfast menu varied on the two days that we were there and the food was good. Lots of types of tea, coffee, hot food, breads, and the nicest thing: miso soup. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. The standard rooms of this hotel do not have extras like bathrobes and slippers, but for the price, it is lovely and I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other travellers.

I wasn't sure what a Hyatt Place at Waikiki Beach would be like. I always associate this hotel branch with suburban and airport locations. But this location can be great for budget travelers. That that it's a budget hotel by any means, but it's just a great value. First, while this is a very nice hotel with a pool, it is NOT a resort. So if you need in hotel choice of restaurants, several pool options, etc, pick a different hotel. But it also doesn't have any of those annoying "Resort Fees" that so many of the other Waikiki hotels charge. So the rate you booked, is the rate you pay. Also, it includes the standard Hyatt Place breakfast buffet. While not fancy, it is a full breakfast (not just bread products and coffee), which adds a ton of value as well.The location is great, while not right on the beach, it is only a block away and I did still have an ocean view from my room on the 17th floor. And there are tons of shopping and dining options within a couple of blocks.The standard Hyatt Place rooms are huge, so you and your family get a lot more room to spread out. And they are very modern and clean. With desk area, huge sectional sofa and mini fridge. The large flat screen TV has tons of channels and the free Wifi was very fast and reliable. They have more power outlets in the room than you will know what to do with (including 4 total outlets above the nightstands on either side of the bed, YAY!). The split bathroom is modern, clean and functional, with the vanity separate from the shower and toilet.If you do need to park a car, valet is the only option and it's $30/day (plus tips). But if you just want to explore the Waikiki Beach area, you really don't need a car at all. There is so much to do within walking distance.Overall, if you are looking for a luxury beach resort, this is not the place for you. However, if you want a large modern room right off the beach, this is a fantastic hotel and I would recommend it to anyone.

Enjoyed a 2 night stay in this hotel, the location was walking distance to everything, restaurants, beach, shops. The buses that went to the shopping centre stopped right by the hotel. Tour desk was excellent. Reception Staff were pleasant and efficient. Breakfast wasn't the best could be more choice and since most tours start early in the morning it could have started earlier. would stay there again and recommend this to family/friends/couples

We stayed here for three nights recently. I must say that overall our experience was excellent and it suited our needs down to the ground. The big thing to note is this is not a "resort" hotel like the Hilton or the other Hyatt with large open complexes and large pools and drinks by the poolside. If you want that experience this isn't the hotel for you. HOWEVER if you likea) a breakfast included in the base accommodation rateb) no resort fees - wife included in the rate then this is for you.The staff were all very friendly and did their utmost to help with our requests and you are definitely made to feel at home. The room was wide and spacious and we got a free upgrade which was very well received however a few small gripes- The bathtub wasn't clean - it had some hairs in the bathtub so the wife had to rinse it out before she used it. - The rubber door stopper in the door frame came loose towards the end of our stay. - A large immoveable dispenser of cheap'ish body soap to complement to toiletries wouldn't go astray - there wasn't enough shower gel to go around!.- The air conditioner got a little noisy at times ?Other than that the room was clean and tidy and well presented and we had a good sleep - it was well away from traffic noise. Being on an upper floor definitely does help. The breakfast works very well on the third floor and was the reason why we chose this property. It's not a "huge" selection but fruit, cereal, yoguhart, fruit juice, bread basket selection and some hot items works VERY well. I never felt hungry in a morning. Job well done there!. The bird problems were also not really noticeable apart from one day but even though they were an amusement more than an annoyance. I would definitely stay here again on my return trip to Hawaii.

Pleasesant atmosphere, good food, people are friendly and caring, shops are full of wonderful gift ideas. Can't wait to visit again! The trips that were set up for me were wonderful and I'll use them again when I return.
user_name:
Carmen Dolores L
Cherry Hill, United States

review_body: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Hotel as we were Hosting a large Family Wedding. We chose this Hotel based on price and value, free wife and also the other Trip Advisor Reviews that noted how clean and fresh the rooms were. That is an important aspect for me and I really wish reiterate those other Guests Reviews, that the Rooms were so fresh and clean- we were delighted with the quality of the sheets and towels, and also the Bed. It was really lovely and made a big difference to our stay. Thank you Hyatt Place for a lovely stay.

This is the second time we stayed in this hotel. We returned because the place is clean, the breakfast is good and reasonable and the staff are all so helpful and happy. What was difficult was parking and that the breakfast is served in another building.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for one night the other week prior to a family get together on the North Shore. The hotel was fine for the price considering the area. The room was clean and comfortable and the free breakfast saved us from looking for an eatery in the early morning. The venue is close to the beach and just right for taking the little ones down for a quick swim.Unfortunately, my son in law was told that self parking was not available for his rental vehicle and that he would have to use the valet parking. Using the valet "service" resulted in a large dent and big scrape being inflicted on the front passenger corner of the rental. We were told by staff this was the second such incident that day, which should send up a red flag to the hotel management, but apparently not. My son in law got an accident report and requested that, at the very least, the cost of the valet parking be removed from his bill but was refused as "the parking is run by another company". If you don't want to have to deal with this kind of problem and huge expense, which will ruin your vacation, whatever you do, self park.

This was my second time staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki and definitely not my last. My experience this time around was just like the one back in 2012. The hotel employees definitely put you - the guest - FIRST and this is important.
user_name:
Stephen W
San Diego, United States

review_body: Good value for being in Waikiki. Staff here was really friendly and helpful. Hotel is close to the beach, Honolulu zoo, Waikiki Aquarium, and bus stop. Stayed here three nights before going on an Hawaii cruise, then stayed again for four more nights after the cruise. I had requested an early check-in for the second stay, they said they would try but no guarantee since it depended on availability. We got to the hotel around 10 a.m. and we were able to check-in. (Hooray, since we needed the rest and need to do some laundry.) The only draw back to this place is where they serve breakfast. It's on the third floor, outside deck. There are pigeons that are looking to eat your food. They did have warning signs on the table. Breakfast was good, except for the pigeons, so someone has to be at the table to keep them away. There aren't many hotels that offer a breakfast included with your room price. Note there is no resort fee either.

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel in March for 5 nights. Check in was very quick and easy. we were on the 11th floor facing Waikiki Beach. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the beach. From our room we had a view of the ocean and Waikiki Beach area, but due to the hotel being a few blocks back there are some taller hotels and buildings around that block most of the view, not a big deal for us though. The balcony would be the only downfall I think to this room, very small, there was a small side table and two chairs but the size of it was around 2ft by 5ft. Very little noise from our room as well. The room was smaller then what we are used to in a Hyatt Place but we expected coming in that the room would be smaller, again no big deal. Big shower, plenty of towels, very very comfy bed. The free breakfast wasn't bad for free breakfast, very very busy at times with minimal seating, the two times we had breakfast at the hotel we took it to our room. Valet was $30 a night(24hr) and I thought we worth it. A nearby hotel we were told may have $20 a night parking, but the convenience of having our car quick was worth the extra to park at the hotel, valet guys were extremely fast and nice. Overall we had a great trip staying at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a very nice hotel that is cheaper then most in the area for what you get. Staff was A++++++ the entire time, very helpful and friendly. Free wifi, free breakfast, free beach towels.

I have nothing except great things to say about hyatt place. The staff were amazing!! Close to the beach and far enough away from the busy strip. We were on the 18th floor and the views were great. The room was a decent size with a pull out sofa bed. Breakfast was very good and there was a lot to choose from. I would definitely stay here again. The folks at the Expedia desk were great in helping us book our outdoor activities as well. The staff went over and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and happy. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay.

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was clean safe and close to the freeway, excellent for business travelers offering a quick back route to the H1. I would not recommend getting a room near the elevator or too high of a floor as the elevators are quite busy. Great beach access to a fun barricaded beach offering a pleasant beach with no rocks or waves. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers, a bit small for a family.

This was our first time near Waikiki beach. The hotel was set back about 2 blocks from the beach but the walk was pleasant and quick. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel had a beautiful open lobby. The rooms were nice, about what you'd expect. The breakfast options are excellent although it's generally windy and a bit chilly during those hours. The only downside for us was that there was no actual dining facility, although you can get lunch or dinner food 24/7 and it was delicious. There are many dinner options within walking distance. They also have someone there most of the day who can help set up tours and give information about all the activities in the area. He was very knowledgable and helpful even with the local bus lines. I would recommend this hotel.

Good position,good value,friendly staff,nice to be away from the hustle bustle of the ocean front,which gives you a quiet relaxed holiday.The tour desk Cameron was a pleasure to deal with and went beyond what you would expect from other event organisers

This hotel great value for money.Good walking distance to everything, Very good hotel with generous clean rooms. Though another elevator would be great and improved breakfast. Would stay here again :)

Stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach from 4/14/15-4/19/15.Great location!3-5 minutes walk to the beach, close to restaurants and shops, bus/trolley stops just outside of the hotel.Amenities: No Resort Fee! Free Wifi anywhere in the hotel premises, free breakfast (great way to start the morning and save money). Daily room cleaning. Beach towels available to borrow.Hotel Staff:Friendly, helpful, and accommodating.****Hyatt Place at the Waikiki Beach will be our #1 choice the next we visit the island of Oahu.

We found the hotel suited our needs most adequately for facilities and location. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. The room was spacious and comfortable including Hyatt bed, 3-seater sofa and free wi fi,We had a good view (high floor). We were impressed with the daily cleanliness of our room. We found the breakfast included in the room rate was more than adequate for our needs. Also the food and coffee at 24/7 Gallery was excellent as was the service.

The hotel staff at the hotel were very kind. It's only a block from the beach, I liked the area as well. It wasn't as busy as most hotels that are on the beach at night. I traveled with my young children, the hotel was patient with us. I would stay there again in the future.

A few short blocks off the beach saves some money, & this is a great hotel! Internet does not cost extra, and breakfast is much better than average. My room had a separate TV watching/sitting room, which, while I didn't use it, was a nice touch. I would highly recommend!
user_name:
Matthew S
New Orleans, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed here Saturday, April 11, 2015 - Tuesday, April 14, 2015 while on vacation. There are hardly any hotels that are right on Waikiki Beach. This hotel is about 2 blocks from the beach. It is literally a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. If you are not feeling the beach, then head to the great shopping that is just down the road. You will find many high stores like Tory Burch, Coach, Ralph Lauren, Louis Vuitton and more. There are also great restaurants located near the hotel that are with in walking distance. We did not have a rental car so we walked everywhere we went, even from our hotel to Diamond Head and back! Many of our walks were when it was dark and we felt completely safe. Ok, now about the hotel itself! This is an awesome resort with a great staff. Breakfast is served every morning at 6:30am. There are good selections for breakfast. Rice, miso soup and different Asian toppings were served at breakfast also. Fresh fruit was there daily! Breakfast is served on the 3rd floor and most seats are outside. Birds will fly down and peck at your food if you leave the table with food on it. Our room was on the 12th floor. There are 2 towers and the tower we were in has smaller rooms than the other tower. We did not mind this because we had a great view and were not in it very long each day. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. Free WiFi is provided by the resort. My only downside to this hotel is the pool. It is located on the 3rd floor and not very big. However, we were there for the beach and not the pool. The workout facility is on this floor too. There are plenty of treadmills, bikes, elliptical's & dumbbells to get a great work out in. Gym towels were provided and so was water. There were 2 TV's that you could watch. On some of the machines they had individual tv's. We never went to the lobby bar but there is one that looked like it had good liquor and beer choices. One service they provide that we used was a local expert there for any questions. We went to her for several questions and was very helpful about telling us where to each, visit, etc. All in all this is an awesome hotel. It is an ideal location, clean and great staff! The staff was very warm with their greeting and texted us to check on our room when we arrived. This is your hotel for Waikiki Beach! When we return to Waikiki we will definitely stay here. Aloha!

I've stayed here for both business and pleasure and find it to be an excellent hotel. It's got a great open lobby, helpful staff, free delicious breakfast, nice rooms, and good location near the beach. I'd stay here every time in Waikiki. Just note that there's $25 self parking (first come first serve) and $30 valet parking.

The hardware and software were just perfect, and if you consider the price, I think the cost performance is brilliant! Though I arrived in the morning, The staff was very kind that let me check-in to a vacant room which really helped me start off Hawaiian holidays. I would definitely recommend anyone considering this hotel.

Stayed there in April 2015 with 83 other folks on a band trip. Spacious rooms and recently updated, very modern. Breakfast was included and very good with a nice variety. Bed was super comfortable. Staff was very nice and always helpful. ABC store nearby and Lawson's Station right off the lobby. The only downside was the elevators are somewhat slow. Definitely recommend!

The hotel was very quiet and clean; the beds were comfortable and the staff was amazing! Only issue is the birds at the breakfast buffet was to much to contend with. Other than that my friends and I all agreed we would stay again.

Hyatt is a pretty trusted and this one delivered. Here are the reasons why:Location:Unlike Hyatt Waikiki, this one is not overlooking the beach. But, the 2-5 minutes walk to the beach is pretty awesome. As I was traveling with family, the night's sleep away from the crowd is preferred. Hotel Amenities:NO resort fees and this is an absolute must for me. If I am paying to stay at a hotel, I should not be forced to pay for the Amenities for additional price.A. Breakfast buffet:Quality food, hot meal from the oven, and the roof-top open air dining next to the pool was awesome. B. Onsite activity desk that are genuinely courteous and knowledgeable and gave me good advice knowing my situation with an infant. C. Front desk staff were great. "I need a beach towel", "Here you go". It was great that I did not have to trade a card to get a towel. I loved the level of trust. Friendly staff: Staff went above and beyond to make the stay great. Knowing that we have an infant, they honored our request for the king bed.Parking:Valet parking was a good option. However, I feel there are rooms for improvement. It was a sort of salesman type persuasion to choose valet parking over self parking. This was probably my one gripe about the hotel.

The location of this Hyatt is wonderful! Close to the beach and many places to eat and shop, yet no street noise in our 2nd floor room! Beds were comfy and we were upgraded to a larger room with a sitting area. Big room!

Love the hotel and great place to stay would do it again great staff and clean rooms . I just I had more time to stay long here they were great all around great place . I cant any more about are stay will be back some day .. Stay here you will be happy .

We arrived early and the hotel staff was able to check us into our room, no waiting, We really appreciated this. We received a room with a great ocean view. We used the balcony day and night and watched the city wake up and see it's night life. The hotel has a great location, two blocks to Waikiki beach, two blocks to Kapiolani Park/Honolulu Zoo, city bus stop at the corner, ABC store a block away, Starbucks and McDonalds is close (if you must). Being close to the park is great for morning walks/runs along the beach and the park. Many people out doing the same, so it is safe. Hotel offers a good continental hot breakfast, has pool and fitness room, offers towels for the beach, business center has enough computers. Hotel offers both valet and paid parking. We rented a car for half of our stay and opted for street parking. Will return on next trip.

This hotel is well maintained, updated and friendly. We also found the price to be very reasonable. Our room was comfortable and had lots of space. We could walk to nearby restaurants and stores. Breakfast was yummy and served out-of-doors. Highly recommended!!!

Hyatt place was more than I was expecting. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and filling and free. When everything in Hawaii is very expensive that is a plus. Our room was very nice It was only a short walk to the beach and many restaurants and attractions. I would definitely stay there again!

This hotel is in a great location. Waikiki Beach, Diamond Head, and The Honolulu Zoo are a quick (under 5 minutes) walk away. The complimentary breakfast had the best selections I'd ever had. The service was great, everyone was friendly. The pool is small but the beach is right around the corner!

We've stayed at this property many times and they never disappoint. Close to the beach and the rooms accommodate a family of five with the double queen beds and a sleeper sofa. My only issue with this property is that the breakfast selection has been the exact same evertime we've visited this property but otherwise we would highly recommend the Hyatt Place.

Booked 2 adults +1 kid, so Hyatt offered a king bed witha rollover bed, however the rollover bed is so small that is not even for an small kid. Restaurant/buffet ok, however the place is really bad as is an open space, so wind is blowing during the morning making it a really bad experience.

Great breakfast...every day hot selection changes plus standard continental breakfast. Hotel is clean and staff appreciates their guests. Stayed on 10 th floor full ocean view room however the ocean view was between hotels. Pool area is small and with zero activity from hotel Small bar located near lobby.

This is a great place to stay in Waikiki. The room was spacious. Our 9 year old is an early riser. He would wake up before the rest of us and enjoy his reading on the other side of the partition without disturbing us. The room service staff were very friendly. We didn't use the pool as the beach is a block away. We will definitely stay here again.

Staff are always smiling and helpful. A really nice place to stay, close to the beach and affordable. Our housekeeper kept our room clean even on our last day when we had late checkout she made the bed and changed all the towels. Breakfast was good and a lot of variety for picky eaters. Every morning had something different. Internet worked excellent in all areas of the hotel. They went out of their way to help us and made a reservation at a local restaurant on their own cell phone.

We had a queen room with ocean views. Could not be happier. Cool air conditioning, spotlessly clean and breakfast included. Although not beach front it is only one minute walk to beach. The Bus is only across the road so very convenient position.Staff are very friendly and polite. Would highly recommend to anyone for a safe and quiet stay.Motel was full but all ran well. No noise and a pleasant night sleep. They also arranged for taxi to airport. Charley's Taxi for only $29 to airport. Very professional.I will be using them again on my return.

Great location - walking distance from the beach, nice rooms and great breakfast! . Hotel was super clean and breakfast had a good variety. Stayed at the deluxe ocean room and room was huge with amazing view. Highly recommend this hotel for all type of travelers

Enjoyed our stay. Very clean and staff was freindly. Did not receive the correct room when first arrived, but they made it right with us. The location is very close to the beach, stores and restaurants. Can walk to all! Would stay again!

Parking at the hotel is pricey and pretty non existent. The hotel lot is very small and the hotel blocked one of only two handicap spots with hotel carts nightly. The Hotel common areas, rooms, and other facilities were very nice though and the staff was friendly.
user_name:
Robert J C
Oak Harbor, United States

review_body: Our family of four enjoyed our stay here. The breakfast buffet and the pool made the stay even more enjoyable. The room was good, if a bit small, but that is to be expected at most hotels, and when you have 4 people staying in one place.

Booked a high floor with sea views but was disappointed with the view and the size of the room. I should have taken the upgrade to queen room with no view.Breakfast was a bit of a bun fight with no tables on arrival and the hot breakfast was adequate but nothing more.Pool was small but functional but lacked more sun loungers.So in summary if you can get it at a good price, we paid £525 for 4 nights and I guess we got what we paid for!

The staff are fantastic and friendly and the location is great - just a short walk to beach and shopping. Terrific value for money. Shame the pool area is small - but that is OK as you can just go to the beach instead.

Great location.100 meters from wakiki beach.Room was clean at our arrival but daily housekeeping was average. The room had all the basic requirementsBreakfast was extremely basic and disappointing.Swimming pool is like a bathtub.And just know that the elevators are VERY slow...........:-)Price versus quality is good. Recommended to discover honolulu and the rest of the island.
user_name:
Jean-michel B
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We stayed here one night before a cruise. Very comfy, great location 2 blocks from beach, and a great breakfast too! The concierge was helpful, the breakfast was fantastic, and they even arranged a taxi to our ship at a dicounted rate.

I have been to Oahu five times and this hotel's value and location can't be beat! I cannot stand a hotel that over-charges because it has a restaurant that serves a mediocre dinner, this is not the case with Hyatt Place, they offer breakfast, but not lunch or dinner. You can get take-out sandwiches and salads from their market place. It does not charge a resort fee for things that should be included. Wifi, workout room, pool towels, and breakfast was included in the nightly rate. The breakfast had several basic hot choices that varied daily, like pre-prepped eggs, waffles, french toast, and always offered cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, bread, bagels, jam and peanut butter, as well as, Miso soup and kimchi, coffee, tea, and juice.
