I eat wheat-free and was able to do so and still have a hearty breakfast. I had the Diamond Head view room, with a King bed and lanai. The room was small, but it was more important for my room to be updated and clean, and it was! It was also very quiet. I would make sure you are not in a room at the front of the hotel if you're looking for quiet and are a late riser. In Waikiki, the streets are narrow and often packed with early morning tour buses. Elevators were very quick.Great bar for Happy hour. A tour desk is available if you need it. The beach is one block away.I stayed 5 days and had a rental car from the airport. It is very difficult to park a car in Waikiki and I had to park across the street, as the hotel parking was sold-out. The parking, across the street was cheaper and I felt very safe. We did travel around the island, but a car was unnecessary for longer than 2-3 days. There is plenty to do in Waikiki.The hotel was full, as it was Spring Break, but it seemed to run very smoothly and we enjoyed ourselves. I will definitely return.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki offers true value in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach. Although not located right on the beach, it is only two blocks away and the hotel makes up for this with a full (hot) complimentary breakfast in the morning that will easily hold you until dinner. My room was comfortable and as we were travelling with a friend we appreciated that this was the only hotel we could find that offered two queen beds. Most hotels downtown don't do this. The room was very large. The value is excellent considering the location and the breakfast.

The hotel and staff were terrific! The room was clean and updated and the gym had the latest equipment. I have stayed here before and if I get back to Honolulu again the Hyatt Place will be my hotel. Thanks for an amazing stay!

Just got back from a nice Spring Break trip with the family. We had three kids (8, 7, and 5) and it was perfect for us. Our room had 2 beds plus a pull out couch, ocean view, refrigerator, balcony and plenty of space. We took Charley's taxi from the airport ($29 flat rate) and the kids were given free sand toys upon arrival at the hotel. I only wish I knew that they had beach towels. I would have kept ours at home. The free hot breakfast was great and free wifi was wonderful for down time in the room. A short walk to the beach and convenient ABC store next to the hotel. The bus picks up/drops off right across the street from the hotel. The staff was great in helping us navigate our way to Diamondhead and then Pearl Harbor one day. Free lei making on Friday nights in the lobby was great for the family. Everyone enjoyed that too. The location of this hotel and all the amenities makes it a great choice. The kids said it was perfect and we agreed. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Thanks so much for making our spring break wonderful!!

The Hotel is genuine 4 star and at the right end of Waikiki Beach so far our family was concerned and is only a 10 minute walk to the very ritzy end of the strip, where identical accommodation is 50% more expensive. Hotel was very clean, staff were great, tour guide advice was brilliant and the shuttle services were excellent

This hotel in Waikiki, near the zoo is very well maintained, with very accomdating staff. It was pleasant, clean and very well run, I highly recommend it. After an exhausting day at work, I melted into the bed-super comfortable.

Can't go wrong with the value at Hyatt Place. Great room, great price. Very friendly staff in all areas. Convenient location couple blocks from the beach and within walking distance of shopping. Free breakfast worth eating. And a bidet in our bathroom.

When I arrived to the hotel for my stay, I was immediately greeted by the staff, which was very welcoming and hospitable. The check-in process was very quick. They also remembered my preferences of having a high floor room and the size of the bed I wanted. When I first entered my room, I noticed the cleanliness and organization of the place. The high-floor, ocean-view was breath-taking, showcasing Waikiki Beach. This place is beautiful. i cannot wait to go back.

This was not a favorite hotel of ours by far!! Repeating issues with the elevator and staff was either super friendly and helpful or the opposite with attitude and unwilling to help. It's one of the more inexpensive hotels, so the price lacks in service and convinience of the hotel overall. Safe, clean and okay location-very short walk to Waikiki and close to downtown restaurants/shops.

My Aunt and I stayed here for 10 nights in October 2014 on a spur of the moment trip to Oahu. We had 2 Queen Deluxe Ocean View on the 18th floor and the room couldn't have been better. It had an L shaped sofa with a bed and a huge ottoman in front of that. Trust me with all the shopping we did we never wanted for more space. The bathroom was more than sufficient and the toilet OH the toilet had the Toto cleaning seat. OMG how wonderful was that. I really don't get the negative reviews about this hotel. The hotel is not ocean front but we had a wonderful view front ways and looking down the beach. We could see surfers, boats and swimmers. Wonderful. The beach is less than a 2 minute walk and the beach isn't that crowded where you would cross the street. There is a trolley stop to the left of the hotel. We are planning another trip in September and are staying here 14 nights this time. Same room except we are taking the husbands this time. Umm. Stay here and rest assured you won't be disappointed. Stay here, take the trolley where ever you want to go, buy a chair and umbrella from the ABC store and pay it forward when you go home. Give it to someone at the beach on your last day. We did that in October and I plan on doing it again when I leave in September. It is appreciated and hopefully that person will do the same.

The negative reviews are nit-picking about minor items. Those of you striving for perfection in a hotel are bound to be disappointed anywhere you go. No, this hotel is not on the beach, but they don't charge you like the ones that are. It's only about a block off the beach and very close to shopping and restaurants - great location. It's clean, recently renovated, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and the service was great ... beautiful hotel. Very nice place, good value. I'd stay here again if returning.

Hotel is average, my husband got stuck in the elevator and we were promised 2 free nights, it's been 4 months and nothing has happened, the hotel manager is a lier and I will never stay at another Hyatt hotel.

We stayed 7 days and were very pleased with this hotel. Very close to the beach, clean rooms, comfy beds & excellent staff. We had issues with the toilet the first night we arrived & someone was sent up right away & fixed it. Another bonus that just sent it over the top - our flight was not until 10:00 pm. The staff held our bags & allowed us to shower in a room before we left.My only critique would be the breakfast...it was okay, nothing great. The breakfast sandwiches look nothing like the picture on the website. They were bland & didn't even have a muffin top. Also, I saw the staff squeezing the eggs out of a plastic bag so they aren't even made fresh. Sitting outside was nice, except for the birds that keep trying to eat your food. It wasn't nice eating outside when it is raining or very windy either. I know the staff will say you can bring it up to your room...but we are a family of 5 & trying to carry it up to the room on a little tray would have been impossible. Plus there are no tables in the room to eat.Despite this, we were very happy with our stay & would definitely recommend it. The staff is very courteous & helpful when you have questions or need anything.

Excellent location , near Waikiki beach but a little bit away from road.Our room was with mountains view, with 2 king size beds and nice staff inside . Every day cleaning and new towels- a lot of pigeons on the breakfast was a big minus

We stayed here for 6 nights and it was a pleasant stay. The room was clean, comfortable and there's even a view to the ocean (sort of). It's not a 5 star Hyatt so I was a bit disappointed with the price we paid for this 3 star hotel. But the customer service was unreal!!!! Such great customer service! Breakfast was not bad, sufficient! I actually like the location, yes it's not quite the central beach, but it's only 5 min max walking to the ocean and all the shops. In fact I like it no so busy the minute I step out of the hotel. And all the bus line stops around the hotel which is great! We booked some of the tours with the hotel tour booking guy and he was totally fantastic! Gave us plenty of good ideas and make the most of the tour! The free wifi is great! Overall I can't fault this hotel except the price was a bit more for a 3 star place.

We stayed here for 6 nights and were very pleased with the service. Our room was cleaned daily and staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was more than adequate, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, some hot selections (No variety in eggs though-only scrambled) toast and pastry. You need to be there by 8 am as things started to run out. The hotel was busy with large groups for the Sprng vacation. The hotel is a two minute walk to the beach and the main road. It is in a clean, quiet and safe position. It is also handy to bus stops. The Pink line bus stop (takes you to Ala Moana shopping centre) is handy. Cost only $2. I would recommend this hotel. WiFi was very good. If you want to book tours, I would not do it at they hotel, they are more expensive then if you book through the people selling out one the streets.

Amazing experience! The staff is friendly and very helpful! Absolutely the best vacation hotel in Honolulu!!! I have enjoyed every minute of it! Clean rooms even better that the pictures online! Also in a great location!!

The hotel is nice. The lobby is very airy. The room was very clean and comfortable. Although we stayed on the 12th floor it was very noisy (street noise). Breakfast was a disappointment in terms of variety, setting. Constantly over crowded. Luckily one can take the breakfast to the room. NB: bring the tray from your room. They don't have any trays at the breakfast area. Beware of stairs on your way to the elevator :) Beware of pigeons: they are on the look out for your food! The pool is very small. Lots of restaurants in the area eased the pain. Way to expensive for the service they offer.

The hotel is amazing, there is lots to offer inside the hotel. Close to everything. It is in a very busy are so there is lot of traffic. Both road and foot traffic. The pool is nice and quiet and staff are great at taking care of you. Crossing the road to the beach, is extremely busy. People sitting right on top of each other. You can find quieter place further down the beach. The beach front view is incredible, waking the many eager surfers. Lots of shopping and restaurants in the area. Easy access to public transportation to explore. Not sure I would visit this area again due to the business. If I did I sure would like to stay at this hotel again.

My husband and I stayed for 6 days and 5 nights at this hotel. We enjoyed every second of it! The location is great, just a very short walk to the beach, and within walking distance to so many shops and restaurants. The staff was super friendly and the hotel was very clean! We had an ocean view from the 10th floor, and while there were other buildings, we could still see palm trees and beach, it was perfect for me! Breakfast was delicious and set up nicely. We loved having our coffee and breakfast outside every morning. We would definitely stay there again!

I had to book a week out due to a work situation and was pleased that the Hyatt Place was not booked. As you may see I have stayed here on a few other trips and really like the place. I wanted to review again as there was a situation that occurred that would test any hotel to maintain a high level of service. I flew in on Monday and landed around noon. I headed to the office and worked a half day. When I checked in around 6:00 p.m. I was thanked for my loyalty (platinum level Hyatt) and then told that power would be out that evening from 9:00 p.m. until 5:00 a.m. The staff apologized and said that it was a last minute transformer repair issue and there was nothing they could do. I asked what that would exactly mean. I was told that the only power available would run elevators and room keys (electronic locks). Usually, this wouldn't really bother me but I actually was planning on leaving for work at 5:00 a.m. as I had to prepare for a big meeting. I asked if it would affect hot water and they said "unfortunately yes, we do have a battery powered lantern you can use though". I'm not sure if they had one for all guests, but they gave me one. They apologized again and I said it would be no problem, but expected some compensation. I negotiated for a good deal of points, as I am a platinum member and do this regularly. I charged my cell that afternoon and true to their word, power went out at 9:00 p.m. My cell alarm went off at 4:15 a.m. and power came on around 4:30 a.m. I did have a cold shower but it was kind of refreshing due to the lack of air conditioning all night. I feel the staff did a good job with a situation that is tough. I confirmed that it was a last minute power outage scheduled by the city as our company had employees assisting with equipment shut down and restart on the facility. The rest of the trip went well. My room wasn't as high up as usual but I did book a week out, so I understood. The only complaint was the lack of coffee early Tuesday morning due to the blackout, but that was understandable. As usual the staff and valet were excellent and I will continue to alternate stays there and the sister property down the street.

Hyatt Place Waikiki BeachI enjoyed my stay here. It is close to the beach, shopping and restaurants, all within 5 mins.Carpet and furniture's are little dated, it didn't bother me since I didn't spend that much time inside the room, everything else was fine. It is great for single travelers.It also offered buffet breakfast with the room. I travel a lot and not easily pleased, I had a pleasant stay here.

I have stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach several times, and each stay has been relaxing and thoroughly enjoyable. All the staff are helpful and friendly. They make staying in Waikiki easy. In my experience, they go out of their way to take care of you. If issues arise, they resolve them pronto. The hotel is just a quiet two blocks from those fabulous Waikiki ocean views, literally a couple minutes from beach, ocean, shopping and whatever else you want. Concierge service is excellent: they can connect you with any event or tour. The Hyatt also serves a pretty dang tasty FREE breakfast everyday, on its outdoor patio by the pool. The bar serves excellent food and drinks, and Tiffany and gang will provide wine tastings and great conversation. Go enjoy yourself at the Hyatt. It's my Waikiki home away from home!

Room service is food you would expect to find at a gas station. The free breakfast was like UN aid truck in a African village. Service was poor at every interaction. The AC was loud and made it hard to sleep.The room was clean though.

Hotel is modern. It is not too big, Has a good breakfast. Located two blocks from main avenue, near restaurants, shops and bus stops, three blocks from the beach. Clean, nice docorated rooms. Great service.

Our college basketball team stayed at this hotel for several nights. The rooms were good size and the best mattresses in all of Waikiki. Breakfast is included in the rate. The menu changed each day and was very good considering how busy they were. Only complaint was they ran out of forks each day so one has to eat with a spoon. This hotel is located one block from the beach and the zoo with plenty of food options available in the area.The staff is excellent to meet your every need. Parking is extra, but no resort fee which is a big ripoff at other hotels.

There is nothing wrong with this hotel - but then there really isn't anything great about it either. There were no highlights and really no "low-lights". If you need a clean, comfortable hotel with good service at a reasonable price it's a winner. I had five nights here and while the staff were excellent, the overall feel the hotel was just a bit awkward. The rooms were a fair size, very clean but the air conditioning units couldn't keep the room cool and the hotel has a modernized but old feel to it. There is a complimentary morning breakfast but the "bacon" was so thin you could see through it and the eggs were either powdered or had been sitting for a longtime. The gym was excellent and well equipped and ideal for anyone who wants a meaningful workout as part of their stay. Unfortunately the hotel has a beautiful deck area that is dominated by plastic breakfast tables which could otherwise include a nice outside sitting and bar area. The pool is in the same area and unfortunately it's utilitarian in design and feel (it could be at a Motel 6 on the I5) and the surrounding patio area is missing anything that brings a tropic feel to the space. Again, a pleasant enough hotel and one that's probably ideal for people who don't want to spend a great deal of time at the hotel as it's functional, clean but not really a contributor to great holiday memories.

We stayed in Diamond Tower. The location is perfect: close to the Dimond head, Zoo and Aquarium. The hotel is in two-minute walk from a wonderful beach (sandy bottom, no rocks). Good restaurants in five-minute walk ("Duke"; Steakhouse + Japanese cuisine in the building of the hotel "Mariott". Very good accomodation. Beach towels in any quantity in any time. Friendly staff. Tea and coffee are available in the lobby during breakfast time. Own laundry.The beakfast was lean.

On a recent return trip from Molokai, Hawaii, we decided to stay overnight for one night in Waikiki. We chose Hyatt Place because of price and location. We had never been there before, so didn't know what to expect, and were very pleasantly surprised. Following a recent remodel, the room was wonderful. Everything was very modern....comfortable new beds, wide screen TV, nice furniture, updated bathroom (though a little small) and nice balcony furniture. There were two lanais, one off the main living area and one off the bedroom.....both with peek-a-boo views of the ocean. The view was actually quite nice for being a block off the beach. As far as convenience goes, it was great! Only a short walk to restaurants, bars, shops and the beach. The pool is pretty small, but it wasn't crowded....and it was in the sun, which isn't always the case with facilities located in the heart of town. There was a breakfast buffet included, served on the pool deck, that was pretty nice....though extremely crowded! I actually felt bad for the employees trying to keep up with refilling and cleaning.The staff was wonderful and we would definitely stay here again if we were ever to return to the area!

Stayed here for 7 days and were extremely satisfied. The rooms are large and comfortable, the breakfast is included and very good variety and good taste. It is within walking distance of several beaches, shops and restaurants.

We were due to stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki in mid Feb but my wife suffered a serious eye injury 3 days prior to setting off on our trip which required major surgery...when we made the accommodation booking we didnt realise that it was a no refund booking...However we contacted the hotel stating the reason for the late notice cancellation and on the production of a Medical Certificate Hyatt Place reservation staff gave us a full refund of the accommodation booking for which we are most greatfull...Just another reason the recommend Hyatt Place Waikiki as a good place to stay at (if unlike us you can actually get there)
user_location: Kings Langley, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Chris W
Kings Langley, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The hotel staff is what makes this hotel stand out above all the rest. In particular the bartenders Tiffanfy and Nick. Tiffany gave us great tips on how to make the most of our trip, the best places to shop and to eat. Personally I have never stayed at a hotel with such a friendly customer service orientated staff. The hotel itself is ok. Very clean. But the rooms are very small and you can hear everything that goes in outside and in he room beside you. It's a very very busy hotel and location and part of hawaii in general. Free breakfast that offers a variety of foods and great happy hour.

The rooms at this Hyatt Place are smaller than others in the chain but still a good size for Waikiki. I liked how close of a walk the rooms are to the lobby and that there was no additional resort fee. We paid extra for a mountain view with a balcony. The view wasn't amazing but it was nice having a balcony. The free breakfast was good and there's a Starbucks in the lobby.

You can't beat the value. Walking distance to everything. Friendly staff and wonderful free breakfast! I felt safe knowing you needed a key card to access the elevator and the stairs. The valet to park was $30 a night a very quick service. The happy hour was 4-6 nightly and had generously strong drinks! The beds were so comfortable!!! Best beds in a hotel, hands down.

The hotel sat a couple blocks off the beach. It was a beautiful hotel with a nice open air lobby. Staff was very friendly and accommodating! On my first night there we asked one of the staff members for a dinner recommendation and instead of pointing us in the direction of one of the many busy restaurants on the main strip in Waikiki she directed us to a local place with AMAZING local Hawaiian food. Her choice was SPOT on to what we were looking for. The breakfast was pretty delish for a complimentary breakfast, good choice of hot foods, fruit, and typical breakfast items (breads, cereal, yogurt). There was always plenty of food and the choices for the hot foods changed daily.Hotel was clean and upscale. Rooms were tidy, modern, and spacious. I was here for business and pleasure. I stayed here one night in the beginning of my trip, moved to another hotel and then returned for the pleasure part of my trip. Both of the rooms had a GREAT view, the first night it was of Diamond Head and the second portion had a view of the ocean. Even being a little over a block back, it was still a nice view.

We were a bit dubious about this hotel after reading other reviews on trip advisor but it is great. Spotlessly clean Clean sheets and towels every day. The staff couldn't be more helpful and friendly. It is 5 mins tops walk to beach. Buses to everywhere yards away and right in the heart of Waikiki. We can't fault it and the bed is to die for. The comfiest bed we have ever slept in.

Surprised that breakfast was more than a continental breakfast. Food was ok. Very noisy. Seemed to be a wind tunnel outside our room and had to sleep with ear plugs.Guest seemed to be part of big groups. College students on spring break and basketball players for a tournament. It is a good value.

The Hyatt Place is on okay hotel. The rooms are well appointed and staff are nice and accommodating. For a Hyatt, though, I was really expecting a lot more. Plus, I felt nickel'ed & dime'd for just about everything. For instance, I actually forgot my toothbrush, but thought no problem. Well, it wasn't a problem except it cost me .50 cents to get a disposable at the front desk.I normally stay the Hyatt Regency up the street, but couldn't do to lack of rooms. I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying at the Hyatt Place, but for around the same money and a MUCH better location I would suggest the Regency a couple of blocks away. Plus, I don't feel there were any perks to being a Hyatt Diamond status...room upgrade, late checkout or anything, actually.

When we first arrived we drove around the building three times looking for self parking. I pulled into what looked to be a parking garage but negative, the arm refused to go up. I then had to back out on a busy road up hill. Not great when you don't know the area. I drove to another spot the arm refused to go up there as well. Then we called the hotel and they said we needed to find out if self parking was available. It turns out there are only 10-20 self parking spots total at this hotel. What a nightmare. I am extremely frustrated. The hotel room it self is clean and the bed is nice. The room however is very small. We stayed at the volcano room and it was bigger than this place. The view of the ocean is nice when you can get past the hostel that's in front of you.

Staff was VERY interested in keeping us comfortable. Great local food suggestions. Valet parking is a must due to very little space - but the valet was quick and courteous with unlimited ins and outs. Nice little bar in the lobby.

Just spent 2 nites at the Hyatt Place and wish we had stayed longer. Felt very safe and cozy. The personnel there we very sincere and friendly. Close to the beach, zoo and restaurants. Didn't have to use our car at all.

We stayed at Hyatt Place for 3 nights. Location is good, rooms are modern and clean, staff are very friendly.We had requested a high floor and as early check in as possible when booking as I am pregnant and we would be flying in on a 10 hour red eye flight from Australia. When we arrived our room was not available. We were assisted by a lovely lady (Anne-Marie I think?) and she did try to assist us by offering us a room on the 2nd floor with no view that was available straight away. We initially said yes, but on seeing the room we changed our mind as the front door did not lock, and the sliding door to the balcony didn't close properly or lock so we didn't feel safe leaving our things there. We took the keys back and were given our room on the 18th floor at about noon (check in is usually 3pm). We would definitely recommend a high floor; the street is still quite noisy even that high up but if you're a light sleeper you might have trouble anyway as the air conditioning system is super loud.The breakfast wasn't amazing but it's free! We paid for a breakfast nearby that was on par at best, so you might as well just eat the free fruit and bagels and save your money for nicer lunches and dinners. The beds are very very soft, not to our taste but some will love it I'm sure. Overall it was pretty much what we expected, i think we'd stay again if we're in the area for a few nights.

I stayed here for a week in February. The location is perfect - 2 short blocks to the beach. The outstanding feature of this hotel is the aloha feeling from the staff. The open air lobby was relaxing to take a break. The bus stop is across the street. If you have a medicare card the fare is $1.00. I had a mountain view room. The lanai was pleasant to sit out on. At night you could see the stars and the lights from the houses in the hills. One night it had rained and you could sit there and listen to the cars drive by on the wet street.The room was very quiet and the bed was so comfortable, The room was on the small side for a king size bed, however. The breakfast was OK; always crowded during the times I was there. The pool is on the same floor; it is basically just your standard motel pool surrounded by concrete.I used the tour desk and found the staff helpful. There was a convenience type store and also a gift/souvenir store. I tried some of the food from their "pantry". The soups were good. Salads, sandwiches and cheesecake looked good, too. Housekeeping was typically mid afternoon. On Friday afternoon they have lei making. This was a highlight Everyone made a very full orchid lei. The location was convenient to shopping and restaurants.

You can't beat this location. We chose this hotel because it was on the outskirts of Waikiki, easy to get to without having to through the Waikiki traffic itself. It's obviously an older hotel. The rooms are larger and have been updated, but something about the layout still says it's an older hotel. But no complaints. It was clean, very spacious. The staff were amazing to deal with. Very friendly, very welcoming, extremely helpful. The concierge helped us book a few very last minute activities, and the fact that they were so accommodating is always a huge bonus in my books.The reason I would rate this hotel average instead of higher is because they were painting outside while we stayed there and our room, despite being on the 12th floor, smelled of paint solvent. I understand that there isn't much that can be done about this, but it was a bit nauseating after a while. Having said that, if we're ever in the area, I would not hesitate to stay here again, although next time I will check to see what maintenance projects they have planned first.

one of the BEST hotels in waikiki! fabulous price for great customer service.. front desk staff was AMAZING! they were all so friendly and really quick to check guests in and out of hotel.the inside of the hotel is very modern and spacious. there is a business center, a starbucks looking cafe, and a relaxing lobby to just lounge around. they also have a tourist center to book tours and trips on the island which is very convenient! :) oh, and they have complimentary breakfast though we slept through it...we stayed on the 6th floor. it was surprisingly VERY QUIET which was so great because the hotel was right in waikiki and next to the road and shopping. our housekeeper JULIE was fabulous and so friendly!! she introduced herself to us as we passed by and she made sure that we were doing okay. our room was quite small but it had everything that we needed:-mini fridge-huge flat screen tv-huge king sized bed-mini sofa to relax-desk-iron+board, 2 luggage racksthe room was so clean and nice. we did a bed bug inspection and none to be found. also did not notice any other bugs at all in the room. i would definitely stay here again! for your moneys' worth, you get great location to the beach, the honolulu zoo, to restaurants (try RAINBOW DRIVE-IN and LEONARD'S MALASADAS). you also get complimentary breakfast (one less thing you have to pay for during your trip). not to mention you get an amazing hotel staff!! you would not regret this hotel.

We were surprised at the size of our room because is comes with a "sofa bed," but that piece of furniture was more the size of a chair because a sofa would not fit into the room. We had a balcony with a view of some tall buildings with sections of the ocean beyond. Sunsets were lovely, and the breakfast, though good, became monotonous after the first two days.

I am a cancer patient and depended on this hotel for it's Ohana program so I could continue my medical care at Queens and Straub hospitals. Unfortunately I was blindsided and never told that when it was taken over by Hyatt it would no longer honor the Ocean Resort Ohana Program. Someone should have notified the Ohana members so we would be able to try to find other accomodations. Cancer is stressful enough, but to have my life turned upside down because I can't find accomodations is really awful.I realize that change in ownership means that the new owner can set their own policies, but when I contacted the Hyatt Place and asked about the old program I was made to feel like I was a piece of trash.I have since had to remove myself from cancer research programs there because I can't find accomodations.

The hotel is two blocks from Waikiki beach and some shopping. The pluses are an affordable price, great staff and an outstanding complimentary breakfast (one of the best). We've had better Hyatt Place rooms in terms of size and decor, but the bed was very comfortable and the room was fine overall. We had no view, but some rooms do face Diamondhead. Staff was quick to offer dinner possibilities and make reservations--or take care of any of our needs.

Hotel staff - very friendly and helpfulHotel - Always clean and tidyRoom - Comfortable beds, decent viewBreakfast - Plentiful and yummyLocation - Great!We visited Waikiki in very late Aug/Early Sept 2014. Perfect time of year, weather was spot on every day. We arrived at the hotel about 6 hours before checkin was allowed, due to the time our flight got in form Sydney, Aus. Hotel staff were more than happy to let us change into new clothes and leave our bags with them until our room was ready. Ended up being ready about hour/hour and a half earlier so were able to enter our room earlier. All our bookings/tours the hotel staff knew how to assist us the best way possible. Location was probably deemed as the southern end of Waikiki which worked out perfect for us as it was closer to Diamond Head trail, but also close to the beach and restaurants. I only have positives things today about the hotel, we would stay here again and have recommended it to friends if they ever decide to travel to Hawaii.

My husband and I stayed for 11 nights in early Feb. After much research we settled on Hyatt Place as we didn't want to spend a lot of money on accomodation and we wanted somewhere a little of the main path. Location was good only a short stroll to the bus point to get the trolley and close to ABC store ( what isn't) the beach and the stroll into the centre of Waikiki became a enjoyed activity. The room was small especially for a longish stay. Paid extra for a better view but didn't look at anything except the hotel blocks around us. The bed was comfortable and showers standard. The breakfast was pretty poor, very very limited with food and seating and can get very windy. There is 90% outdoor seating so if it rains, well, you'll just miss out. Coffee machine in the room was a shocker! Please, just put a standard kettle in the room. To be honest the rom was cheap compared to most and I do believe you get what you pay for. We will stay elsewhere next time.

We spent 3 nights at this property early February. Despite a large group of teenagers, the hotel was quiet and very well maintained. We got upgraded to a jr suite type of foo. Which was very spacious and offered an adjacent small TV room. The refrigerator was very convenient to keep drinks cold. Included breakfast was adequate with nice Tazo tea brand, different selections of eggs or omelette each morning. Location was good although more toward Diamond Head but an easy walk to the central part of Waikiki. Plenty of convenience stores close by as well as restaurants, shuttle stop and city buses. The lobby restaurant was perfect for a quick meal. They also offered lei making classes and wine tasting at the bar.

We travel to HI every year for the Pro Bowl. We've stayed at this hotel every year for the last 7 years. We've seen it through the current remodel. Most of the people that were there 7 years ago are currently still there and treat you like family. I suggest parking caddy corner across the street at the weekly rate or $15 for 24 hours. Also they have a very good breakfast to start your day and don't waste your time planning your day trips as they have people that will take care of that and will get you the best available price. We will be back next year as the Pro Bowl returns to HI

Hotel is in a convenient location, short walk to the beach. Parking available across the road for a reasonable price. Was apparently upgraded upon check in when I requested a higher room to limit street noise, but the room was not what I pictured, it was different from the photos available online. It was still a clean room, just not the quality displayed in the pictures online. Thought it was strange that there was carpet in the bathroom area where the basin and mirror is. Water pressure/heat was not great. Air con was noisy but street noise was at a minimum as we were on a higher floor. The complimentary breakfast was awful but that is not a big deal as there are many food retailers close to the hotel. Not an amazing hotel but good value based on location and price compared to other hotels in Waikiki.

I stumbled into this hotel (literally) at about 9pm on Jan. 29th. I had no reservations anywhere, had gotten lost and was just a bit desperate. I went to the front desk to ask about rooms and was helped by Christian, who was so kind and so helpful. The lobby was filled with what appeared to be high school or college-age girls, having a high time. I told Christian I needed peace and quiet and he put me in a tower completely away from the partying. I had 2 nights there in blissful peace and quiet (the only 2 nights, as it turns out in my entire 2-week stay in Hawaii). The room was a bit small, but it was clean and had a small view of Waikiki. The complimentary breakfast was fun because it also incorporated items from Japanese cuisine. The 6th floor pool was quiet and peaceful, and I had it to myself most of the time.This is a very conveniently located hotel, a terrific value for the area and the people I encountered couldn't have been nicer.Highly recommend.

My husband and I just had 9 nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki, and we were very happy. The location is great, an easy walk to the beach, shops, restaurants, the Zoo and the Aquarium, plus a stop for The Bus just across the street. The staff were almost all lovely (one bar man could have worked on his pleasantries) and helpful. A few (what I consider) bonuses that they don't tell you about are (1) an onsite guest laundry (2) beach towels to borrow so you don't have to weigh your luggage down bringing your own and (3) rooms available for showers etc for those who have checked out but who aren't leaving til later in the day. Much appreciated! The free wifi, free breakfast and lack of resort fees made this hotel particularly good value for money. I would recommend this establishment to others and would happily stay there again.

We wanted more from a Hyatt- which we often enjoy. This hotel was more like a European pension or Best Western. The room was standard, despite being told it was "upgraded." But it was large and had a nice sofa. The beds were comfortable, something for which I've come to rely on in a Hyatt. We were given earplugs, which were necessary as sirens blared periodically.Regarding breakfast, the manager should be made to eat the eggs every day until the quality is acceptable. Everything else at breakfast seemed to come out of an astronaut's survival kit. At least you can count on the Miso soup and kimchi. As for the breakfast seating (on the pool deck), it's been extremely windy and there is no indoor seating. I wanted to have a relaxing breakfast but unfortunately felt like I was in a wind tunnel. When my husband lifted his elbows from the table it threatened to topple. The table top wasn't attached to the base securely, either, and we had to hold it down for fear that it would fly away, too. The hotel staff was pleasant though. I recommend the Hawaiian Prince or the Sheraton Princess.

We searched several hotels in the beach area and decided early on that the $1,000/night Oceanside resorts were not in the plan - even for our 48th anniversary. We have stayed in many Hyatt Place hotels and found them to be the best value for quality as compared to Holiday Inn Express, Hampton, etc. it's a step above - especially for breakfast opportunities (if you don't mind the pigeons when you eat outside). And we like a walk-in-shower. But the rooms are basic. We requested in advance the ocean view and were given a room on the 16th floor. You don't have a 180-degree view of the ocean without obstruction - two hotels cut out a piece of the view. Expected when you're paying $300/night in prime time. I don't like having to pay $25/night to park the Harley I rented for 4 days - but that's in line with others. And you'll pay $30 for a cab getting to and from the airport. The location is great in my opinion. Right near the Harley rental. And Diamondhead Park and the zoo are right nearby. So are a ton of restaurants and good 'ol ABC variety stores for water and snacks for the room. The walk to Waikiki Beach Park is a block. The service from front desk to room service was great. Tory was the guy assigned on our text message service and he took great care of us. Just text the assigned number. Hey we may come back for our 50th!PS: Hy's Steakhouse is also nearby if you're up for the price.

Very solid hotel for the guests that they are trying to target. Friendly service, nice, clean bright rooms, free wifi, free breakfast, located close to the beach (about 2 blocks walk).I booked this hotel for two separate stays and I have stayed at two towers and they were both nice stays. My first stay was at the tower facing the diamond head, on the corner and the building does feel a bit different unlike the usual Hyatt Place layout. This one has a tub / shower combination and lots rooms include a small living room. Another room was located on the tower adjacent to the check in desks, which feels newer with the studio-like setting, and it comes with the washlet but the bathroom were VERY small. Not even a room for tissue holder. (Sinks are outside the bathroom). AC units are different too. One of the AC was those wall mount units that leaked water and went directly on top of my shirt and another one was the one we commonly seem at modern hotels.The breakfasts were enough but unremarkable. There are a small pool on the lounge level too but everyone seems to go to beach to enjoy more. Washer/dryer available as well as a small gym. Friendly staffs, Lawson (convenience store) on site too. Overall, very nice property without resort fee. I will definitely return when the price is right.

The Hyatt Place is ideally located a short walk from the beach. It is centrally located to everything. I can't say enough how friendly the staff is. EVERYONE went out of their way to make me feel welcomed. I mean everyone - from the Housekeeper to the Front Desk to the person clearing plates at the breakfast. What an outstanding place! I unfortunately only got to stay 5 nights for a little get away from California, but, the memories I have from this hotel will live on for years and will be expanded upon because I will be back as soon as I can. You don't find places as special as this just anywhere.Mahalo Nui Loa Hyatt Place Waikiki and Staff!

Absolutely no regrets with our decision. We stayed here for 10 nights in January and February. Great location, affordable price and the complimentary hot breakfast were a few of the reasons we booked this hotel. No matter what time of day, the staff were always helpful and friendly. On arrival we were quite excited to be upgraded to a deluxe room at no extra cost. The room was a perfect size for myself and 2 adult daughters and the view of Diamond Head from our balconies were amazing. We were close to the main strip with many great dining options, a great stretch of beach, the Zoo and Diamond Head. If we needed to use the trolley or bus, the pickup was right in front of the hotel. Having fresh clean towels to use on the beach every day was very convenient and the use of a hospitality suite when we needed to freshen up before our late night departure was perfect. Holding our luggage in a locked room while we enjoyed our last day on the beach was also very helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel. It may not have been as fancy as some more expensive resorts up the strip but it was everything we needed. Clean, modern and outstanding service. We didn't come to Hawaii to hang out in our hotel, we came to explore. Knowing we had a clean, spacious room with extremely comfortable beds to return to every night and super friendly staff to assist us, is why we will definitely return.

Just a short walk from Waikiki beach which is a bonus as you are away from the noisy crowd that hog the walkways along the beach. The rooms are well appointed, though a tad small. Everything is within reach from the hotel, including a big convenience store next to it and just further along the road is the stop for the trolleys that can take you all over Honolulu. The hotel serves a decent complimentary breakfast.

This is a fine city hotel, but don't expect a resort. The beach is a couple of blocks away, and our ocean-view room only showed the ocean through a small, high square window or from the lanai (see "Nothing like the pictures"'s review). The pool is small, rectangular, and uninspiring. That said, the lobby and the room were wonderful, large, and attractive. The reception, cleaning staff, and bartender were friendly. The included outdoor self-serve breakfast buffet was good or better than expected (your expectations may vary), with the standard cereals, breads and pastries, fruit, and yogurt, along with a daily hot (apparently pre-made, packaged) item. It's close to a variety of restaurants and the zoo. They have valet parking, limited self-parking, and to save more, there's a public garage kitty-corner to the hotel. It's a great place to stay if you don't need the amenities and cost of a resort.

I stayed here recently and was very happy with the hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was perfect because it was just a block from the main strip. Far enough from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach but close enough that you can easily walk to anywhere. There was a trolley (the pink line) that stops right by the hotel that takes you to Ala Moana Centre. The pool is small but the fitness centre was a good size and had a good selection of cardio equipment. The included breakfast buffet had a decent selection of breakfast food and the hot food was changed daily. The room was comfortable and quiet. I would absolutely stay here again!

I can only say that" This Hotel is great place to stay because of hospitality, service, cleanness and for the breakfast they serve. This hotel is located block away from a beach, restaurants, and shopping place. The staff from valet parking through Assistant General Manager were great they didn't gave us a chance to think that we are away from home, they were polite and always ready to serve you with big smile on the face. The only one thing We didn't like they don't serve Complimentary bottle water in room, like some of Hyatt Hotels they do.If I get another chance to visit Waikiki this Hotel will be my place to stay.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is a pleasant stop in the middle of busy downtown Honolulu. Our double queen ocean view room was affordable and comfortable, and nicely appointed with a great view of Waikiki beach from the balcony. Public areas are inviting and well laid out with interesting local accent touches. We enjoyed the bountiful "Skillet Kitchen" complimentary breakfast, with a nice array of items in a semi-outdoor location on 3rd floor.Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, with a great deal of information about the area attractions. Several computer stations in the business lounge.As is typical of this area of Honolulu parking is at a premium and difficult to find. As mentioned in other reviews, the pool is small and in a shaded area.The only problem was that the room air conditioning system was a bit noisy.

Reserved a king bed with an ocean view. It was nothing like the pictures. They gave me a room with 2 queens and a limited ocean view through a tiny square window that you couldn't even see if you were on the beds (see windows to the left in the picture). The rooms next to us had an ocean view from their balcony/sliding doors - just like the room pictures on their website.When I checked in, I complained about not getting the king I reserved. They said there were no longer any ocean view rooms with kings available, so I could only downgrade the "view" to get a king, but I wouldn't get any money back for the difference if I did.Another annoyance was the bidet that would randomly make this very loud squealing sound and woke me up at 3:00 in the morning.

Given that nothing is cheap in Waikiki this place is reasonable and typical of Hyatt Places though the rooms are a bit smaller. My guess is this is a conversion from an older hotel. The location is three short blocks to the beach and the main drag. Refrig and free wifi are great. Beds comfy. Lynn at registration was exceptionally helpful and the whole staff friendly. The free breakfast was also a nice plus and decent. One note if you are thinking of walking to Diamond Head from the hotel and then hiking. Pay $12 for a taxi and then do your climb. You'll save 2.5 miles of a walk to the entrance gate. Walk back to the hotel is downhill if you have the energy after hiking DH.

This is an example of Hyatt trying to copy what Marriott have done in reducing prices and cutting out some frills but in this case it is done badly. First I have to say I had no problem with the room it was very comfortable and large enough although the bathroom was so small you had to sit on the toilet to enable you to have enough room to close the door. The room and linens were lovely and clean and well presented. After arriving in Waikiki and making an informed comparasion of hotels I can say that this hotel at $300/night is well overpriced and you should look else where for better value. The breakfast is not worth paying for (some of the food was unrecognisable) and the resort fee didnt cover parking which is $30/day. The pool area is not at all attractive and needs upgrading. I have never stayed at a hotel that served your morning tea/coffee in paper cups and then you have to clear the table as you leave. At the time of writing this the Sheraton right on the beach had much better deals and the resort fee included parking!

Breakfast a big disappointment served outside , with not much of a selection ,with the hot food swimming pool small and most of the time in the shade otherwise nice hotel big rooms friendly staff and free wifi

We choose Hyatt Place because it looked like a quality property but at a reasonable price.We were really pleased with our choice. It was modern, clean and had everything that we needed for a great stay. Free WiFi was great. The room was very spacious, so we had plenty of room for all of our shopping. As a family of five, the big room was great. The queen beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept on, although the pullout couch bed was not the best. We stayed high up in the building to avoid the street noise. There was still some street noise but it was not a problem. Breakfast was good and the birds were a bit of a pain at times, but no drama really. Only a short walk to the beach. An excellent location considering the price. I would be happy to recommend this property. However if you want an exclusive property in the exclusive area this is not for you. If you want an intermediate property at a good price, then this will suit. January was a great time of the year to visit as it was hot enough to swim, but not too hot for sight seeing.

We were very pleased with our choice of this hotel. The location is great...quick walk to the beach and and lots of Waikiki sites. Everyone here is very friendly, and we would recommend it to others.As for the parking, we opted to park in the ramp that is kitty-corner from the hotel at $15 per day, rather than the $25-30 charged by the hotel. And, we got in and out of there just as quickly, and felt safe. Our balcony view was spectacular...sunset was just gorgeous right in front of us. We were on the 14th floor, and really appreciated the view.Good hotel choice in Waikiki!

We stayed here as a family of 5 with 3 teenage children . The room was a great size & nice & clean . Breakfast was crowded at certain times but we always seemed to get a table , there was a good variety of food . The kids used the pool a couple of times & it was not crowded but we usually just went to the beach. The staff were always friendly & helpful with recommending places to eat etc . We wouldn't hesitate to stay again . Only downside is that the lifts were sometimes slow , we weren't in a hurry though .

Our room was excellent large with ocean views great bed.One day we returned to our room after sightseeing to find that my tablet which had been charging had been accessed my Google history was showing some random site that I know we never accessed, no one to blame except housekeeping very disappointing. The elevators were extremely slow apart from these two incidents a very nice hotel great location with excellent breakfast included.Yes I would stay again but be more careful with my personal belongings!

Hyatt Place hotels typically have minimalist decor and spare, yet comfortable, rooms. This Waikiki location is no exception. Still, being 3 blocks from the beach just can't be beat. There were some minor oddities with the room: the phone that doesn't function, the TV that seemed to take 2 minutes to turn off, and birds swooping in on you while your eating breakfast. Ok, perhaps the last one is a little charming.

After staying at this excellent location I am dismayed at the negative reviews. Maybe I'm just too easily pleased, but I suspect it's more because I am not so full of myself. I have stayed at hotel and motel properties on the U.S. mainland ranging from 1 star up to 5 star. Bottom line is you get what you pay for. You want a huge room with lots of space on the beach in Hawaii? Fine go stay at one of the big name resorts and pay several hundred dollars PER NIGHT. This is a quality property. It is well managed and well cared for in order to carry the Hyatt badge. Our room was on the top floor. I had requested an Ocean view room and that's what I got. King bed and a balcony. About a block and a half off the Waikiki beach. The property comes with a free hot breakfast. We utilized the valet parking for our rental car and were very satisfied with Paolo and the other boys. The property sits opposite a Marriott property where ALL the tour buses pick up at. A plethora of shops are within the property itself. Souvenir, clothing and a nifty little convenience store. The property has it's own travel service in the lobby. The hotel is "accessible" too. There is a wheelchair lift into the lobby area and a lift next to the pool. The rooms are NOT big, I agree, but were big enough to sleep and shower in. The maintenance department was VERY responsive to our needs. We were in the property from December 26th through January 1st. Very please with the location, the personnel, the service and the price.

This hotel is fairly well located for Waikiki. Beds are comfortable. The rooms are Ok but expensive for what you get. Then again so is Waikiki generally....The breakfast is like a low budget cafeteria. Paper cups, plastic dishes and food.

I stayed here for three nights. A combination of business and pleasure. When I arrived I was promptly greeted by Joshua (who was awesome) and got checked in. When I arrived in my room, it was already occupied :( Went back to the check in station and Joshua found me another room and accompanied me to the new room to make sure it was clean and up to standards. The room was clean and ready to go.The hotel was clean, but I felt that it was a little dated and frayed around the edges. The bathtub surround was chipped and the tub stained and stains on the main carpet. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were very nice in my room. My room was more of a mini suite, with a separate sitting room for the TV and couch. I had a nice wrap-around balcony and a view of Diamond Head. I was a little surprised that the Hotel did not have water in the lobby. I have stayed at another much cheaper (but overall better value) and they even had iced water in the lobby. This hotel did have a free breakfast included. The breakfast was average. The standard fruit, cereal, yogurt, and bread fare with the added prepared specialty english muffin with egg and other toppings. Also there was a miso and rice station as well.This property was close to the beach which was nice and close to the Zoo and Aquarium. The food provided as catering for our event was by far some of the worst food I have ever had. Everything was brown and unappetizing and greasy. I hope that the food in the cafe was a better quality.Overall I would give this a 3+ rating. A solid good choice if you can secure a less than full price rate. This is not a property I would stay at again, nor would have chosen if it was not previously chosen by the conference I was attending.

Stayed here for a meeting and then took a few extra days to enjoy the beach and the island. The room was reasonable priced for only being a couple minutes from the beach. No restaurant on the premises but many in the immediate area. Rooms are nice but not exceptional. The staff always has a smile for you. The AC in the room we had was very loud.

We had an enjoyable stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Rooms were clean and spacious. Staff at check-in, Chiamar and check-out, Ihab were extremely courteous and helpful. The free breakfast was awesome and location convenient. Definitely plan to stay there again!

We booked the hyatt place as it could fit our family of 5 in one room. But it gave us much more than just the space. The rooms were clean and modern. Staff were very friendly. The breakfast was a bonus . And even though it was about a 10 minute walk from the main "hub" there were still heaps of restaurants and shops just a few minutes away. We actually enjoyed the walk back to the hotel after dinner . Also the beach just a couple of minutes walk down the street was much less crowded than the main part of waikiki beach.

I am generally not a fan of Hyatt Places, as I prefer the more full-service and higher-end brands of the Hyatt chain; however, this hotel is an exception, as I was pleasantly surprised at how great this property is, given value for money for Waikiki. The hotel is situated towards one end of the main strip in Waikiki, about 3 blocks away from the beach. It is basically down the block from the Marriott, which makes it rather convenient. The rooms are comfortable, but it is a much more basic hotel than others in Waikiki. The bed is comfortable, but it is a bit of a tight room. There is a small pool, which as others have noted, is a joke, but frankly, you don't go to Honolulu for a pool. Breakfast is served on the third floor, although it does feel like a bit of a "free for all" and the quality of the food is not that great. There is a small cafe area in the lobby (similar to other Hyatt Places) and some concierge services including an Expedia Local Extra booth. The elevators are a bit slow, but a great property for around $200.
user_name:
awc4
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice looking hotel inside. I felt I was getting my money's worth. Located about 2 blocks from the beach and local restaurants. Nothing wrong with staying here. Decent-looking rooms and nicer hotel interior.

This hotel is amazing! Free wifi, great buffet breakfast included on a lovely rooftop balcony and a phenomenal location a stone's throw from the beach. What more could you ask for?Rooms are clean, a tad small but who spends any time in the room anyway while in Waikiki? If you are a seafood lover, I highly recommend eating dinner or lunch at Tiki's bar & grill just next door at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel. Their seafood is so fresh, it's unbelievable. The Hyatt place also provides beach towels that you can exchange any time of day. It's worth it to do valet parking because if you opt to do self-parking, they can't guarantee you will find a parking spot at all times of day - it's limited. They have a great happy hour in the lobby too.Overall, had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki!

I stayed here for a week with my family. We had two rooms next door to each other. We were very pleased with our rooms. They were deluxe which meant that we had just a bit more room within which to move. We were fortunate to have views of the beach and by views I mean I could see the water from between buildings.The Expedia guide was a fantastic help. He really helped us get the most out of our week stay in Waikiki.Negatives - The pool - it was a complete and utter joke! Having said that who needs a pool when Waikiki beach is just down the street.Breakfast - the only complementary thing I can say about the complementary breakfast is don't go to it. I have seen better behaved children eating free food. The elevators - because this hotel was originally designed as condos the lifts can be very slow especially during peak times.Overall, a nice place to stay with a central location.

We stayed here for 10 nights on business. Hotel is very clean and up-to-date. Very polite and friendly staff at the desk, at the bar, and at the Valet. Very short walk to most of what you want to do in/around Waikiki. Breakfast is included, which is easily worth $9 - $12 per day. Pool area is nice, but the pool is quite small; better to take the 3 minute walk to the beach.

This is a really good hotel. Be aware of the fact that there are two Hyatt hotels in Waikiki: the more upscale Hyatt Regency and this one. Service was perfect. Staff was very helpful and able to accommodate all our requests. Good, free WiFi connection in guest rooms. Very good buffet breakfast included in room price (not common in Hawai'i). We stayed here two nights and loved it. Rooms are clean & modern. The pool is a rather small hotel-pool, but ok for small children to play after having been to the beach. The hotel itself is located about 2 blocks from the beach, easy walking distance. Will definitely return and highly recommend this hotel as a solid option at a moderate price (by Waikiki standards).

The transformation is amazing! We had stayed in this hotel 7 years ago and chose the same location (now under Hyatt) again because we loved it the first time. The renovation has made it unrecognizably fancy; it's much more efficient, refined, comfortable, and beautiful. We had a standard city view room but the balconies are placed in such a way that can get a glimpse of Diamond Head as well as the beach if you're on the 7th floor or higher (though, I guess it'll depend on which tower your room is). Here are the positives:1. Spacious rooms with new furniture, a little fridge, and coffee-maker inside.2. Bathroom was also spacious and with shower (yay!)3. Breakfast is included (buffet type of breakfast) and they do offer a great variety of food and drinks.4. The hotel is very conveniently located--close to the beach (just a block away), close to casual restaurants, close to downtown (about a 15-min. walk), close to bus stops (in case you decide to travel around the island using public transportation), close to a couple of fast food places (in case you need a snack).5. Staff works hard to make your stay nice and we appreciated the kindness.6. Bus 22 stops down the street and it can take you to Hanauma Bay. it's a must to go there and spend a day snorkeling).7. Lot's of night life around.8. The beach can get crowded (dependent on the season, I guess) but you can always walk about 2.5 miles north and find more secluded beaches.9. Internet IN the room (yay!).I can go on and on but I hope that gives you the picture. My ONLY negative and recommendation to the hotel is to have the bottled water they provide in the room free of charge. It felt ridiculous that in a high end hotel (not inexpensive), 2 small bottles of purified water will cost 3.50 each.We stayed there at the beginning of January and the temp was between 74 and 83F--not bad at all!All in all, we loved our stay in the hotel and Waikiki! Thanks!

Just spent a week at this hotel with family . What a fantastic stay . Staff were amazing and helpful . Hotel is situated towards the Dismond head area of Waikiki. Close to the beach (less than 1 block) ABC store meters from the front door, bus stop across the road where all tour buses pick you up. Felt completely safe and sound here with young family members . Rooms are very clean and spacious . Breakfast is included in the room rate and was always hot and well maintained when we ate. Staff always around and refilling everything . Excellent gym on the same floor and swimming pool. Any negative review on this hotel is not justified . Staff do everything to assist your stay. Will be back in a few months with my wife .. Well done Hyatt Place

Great hotel. Breakfast is included which is a real plus while visiting Hawaii. Cost saver! The only drawback was the wait sometimes for the elevators. Great big rooms. Provided towels for the beach. Pool was on the small side, but why would you be in the pool when Waikiki Beach is 2 blocks away. The main shopping area is a short walk away. The zoo is only a block away. Would recommend and stay here again!

Everything was average. Location did not provide much of a view except the low cost apartments across the way. Room was clean with average space. Bathroom was small and a little dark. Lobby was nice but not very interesting. Staff were very nice. Pool was in the shade and a little too chilly to swim. Breakfast was crowded and bland. The whole stay felt a bit cramped and overpriced. Generally Waikiki Beach has that look and feel. So it was a decent place for an overnight but not for a vacation.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach during Christmas to New Year 2014. Here are some comments starting with the negative. Understandable dynamic (high) pricing for this period of time but considering the terrible experience, we felt ripped off. 2 elevators for the entire tower, seriously? We ended up waiting a very long time for elevators. In many cases the elevators were full when they did arrive. These are also quite small elevators and when filled with a stroller makes for more inconvenience and annoyed passengers. At one point, I called down to ask if the elevator had broken, the response was that it was working just fine (but in fact had broken) and the operator suggested I take the stairs. Thus, we ended up taking the stairs regularly carrying an infant, stroller and bags. Valet was challenging with a short driveway and apparently far away parking thus car retrieval took some time. The property was quite far from the beach. Breakfast area was over capacity so we ended up standing (noting infant) and fighting with birds. End with the positive. Customer service was great. They went out of the way to compensate for the terrible facilities.

We booked this as it was the most reasonable 4star rated hotel on hotels.com with free wifi when we were looking. We stayed 2 nights on the front end of a 2 week multi island trip and we knew we wouldn't be spending a lot of time in our room. The hotel was clean, the staff attentive, the breakfast a nice surprise... My only real negative is that had I known our balcony would look straight into a sad gross hostel/apartment/tenement looking building feet away I likely would have paid an extra couple of bucks to get a room on a higher floor. Besides the awful view (we were in the tower toward the back on floor M) there were always people out smoking in their balconies so we couldn't have the door open at all. There are probably only a handful of rooms in the hotel with this crappy problem.

Great value, And great views... Really was a great hotel all round. The breakfast was also 5 star, And changed almost daily. Within walking distance to Diamond Head, I think about 1/2 hour easy walk. Beach was literally a 5 minute walk, and was just perfect! We stayed on the 14 th floor... Well actually 13 th but they won't state it as that.. Must be bad luck? About a 10 min walk to central shopping district.

We had two nights at Hyatt. We booked a two bed room, which was not first ready when checking in. We had to ask for it and finally got it. Beds were ok but for a longer stay too soft.Room to the street was loud in the morning hours.Breakfast offer on the 3rd floor rooftop was ok. But lots of birds and doves which made the place dirty and less nice. Breakfast only available until 10am. I would have expected a bit more from a Hyatt hotel. One morning we had breakfast at the bar which was so expensive compared to other places and not that good.

We enjoyed a week celebrating New Year here at Hyatt Place. Quiet yet close to the main action along Waikiki Beach. Close to good food venues such as Il Lupino, Cheeseburger in Paradise, Wolfgangs Steakhouse, Beijing Chinese restaurant and Moana Surfrider beach bar.

We stayed at this property for 6 days in December before heading off to another island. This property is close to Waikiki Beach, walking distance to many shops and food options. The breakfast in the morning is a great start to my day and best of all was free. Beware of the birds, they'll eat what's on the plate if you walk away. You'll see staff shooing them away. Don't feed the birds, just makes things worse. The pool is small and on the 3rd floor (I think), I didn't use it since the ocean was nearby. Towels are provided near the pool. Also, another thing which was free, Wi-fi connectivity. The speeds were great at this hotel, I was averaging 10 mbps upload and downloading. Great to keep in contact with family, watching videos off YouTube and such. Wi-fi throughout the hotel was good.I parked at a nearby garage a couple blocks away and saved some money, but there are options to park at the hotel, however it's valet only. We were initially in the tower that had 2 elevators, but moved to the other tower (Diamond Head), which has more elevators and found it faster to get to the room and back down. Also, it was quieter from noise outside of the hotel.

Stayed in Hyatt Place in sept 2014 on my way back from main land USA - Good hotel, has an two ABC stores very close, and about 5-7 min walk to the beach.Good breakfast, but beware of the birds, they over take the place - Small Pool, - we didn't use it as every time we went down - with a couple of people in it - it looks crowded, NO spaGreat Room in the tower closer to the beach, and we had a sea viewWould recommend

Be sure to request an ocean view room; it is worth the extra cost; room price includes breakfast buffet which is outstanding and saves money on meals; there is some street noise but it is tolerable as you sit on the lanai

This hotel was very good overall. The only problem I had with this hotel was the slow elevators. Other than that it was very good. Although I chose a "street view" I still got partial view of the ocean. The rooms were very spacious and clean. My family of four lived very comfortably. If you're deciding to choose between Hyatt Place and the Marriott, I suggest Hyatt. Every room has a balcony and so does the Marriott. If you look from your balcony, you can tell the rooms are very small and tight fitted. I suggest everyone to choose the package with breakfast because trust me, that was save you lots of money when traveling in Hawaii. There was a wide selection from rice, kimchi, and miso soup to eggs, bacon, and bagels. Although everyday changes, most of the breakfast selection is the same. Because Hawaii is known for being expensive, don't just find any restaurant, because trust me, it is so pricy. There are a lot of burger places near, but if you are looking for a variety to choose from, I suggest you walk to the mall. It's not a long walk from the hotel. It's about 8 minutes away. Inside the food court, there's a lot of great foods to choose from. As of location, it's pretty decent. The walk to the beach took no longer than five minutes. Although the beach is "right there", I suggest you walk a little bit further away because the beach that is right in front of you has rocks at the bottom and not sand. Also, if you plan on doing tours, the walk from the hotel to the bus pickup is also no longer than a five minute walk. Overall, the service was great and everyone was friendly. I suggest you choose the Hyatt Place.

Stayed 10 nights and could not ask for anything more. Hotel was clean, beds were comfy, close to the beach, quiet and the breakfast saved us a lot of money and was good! Jessica at the bar was a little angel and every one of the hotel staff spoke to you everytime you passed! They even let us use a hospitality room after we checked out later in the day to get cleaned up before our late flight. Truly a wonderful stay! Can't wait to go back!

If you're looking for spacious rooms at a good price, you're looking at the right place. Sure, it may not give you the Hawaiian flavor that you might expect from a hotel overlooking Waikiki Beach. But, it is a very comfortable place to stay at. The rooms are very large and can accommodate a larger family comfortably. The bathroom is large with a separate vanity. Most importantly, the hotel is well located. There are many good restaurants within walking distance and Waikiki Beach is a few minutes away by foot. Parking is very limited and not free, but that is expected in a city. I did not get the chance to eat the breakfast or use the pool, but it is a plus to have it included. Free internet is always a plus too. All in all, if you have a large family and/or want to have a more comfortable stay, this is the place for you if you do not mind staying in a hotel that does not have the Hawaiian flavor.

We stayed here one night when we got to Honolulu. Staff were all very friendly and concierge apologized for keeping us waiting which we were not bothered about. Our room was very nice and a very comfy bed. It came with free wifi and a free buffet breakfast. Breakfast was lots of variety. Breakfast is served near the pool and can be very busy the later you go. We paid 30.00 for valet parking which seems to be average around Honolulu. We would definately stay here again.

This has to be the best value in Waikiki. My wife and I stayed here 5 nights using Hyatt Gold Passport points and we couldn't have been more pleased. Every staff member we came in contact with was friendly, the rooms were quiet, clean and immaculately maintained, bed was super comfy, wi-fi and breakfast was free and there are no resort fees, which is the real value. Don't know what more you could ask for just a block away from Waikiki Beach. Even if you stay at the Hyatt Regency you still have to cross the street. It's not like you can walk out the door and your feet are in the sand. So, what's a few more steps for that same experience?I am a Hyatt Platinum member and we have been regulars to Waikiki at Christmastime for 15 years running and usually stayed at the Hyatt Regency, which was nice but there was always a long wait for check-in, Regency Club access could be hit-or-miss depending on occupancy and the check-in clerk and the elevators always took forever and a day because the hotel was packed. There were none of those worries here. This hotel is significantly less price wise, whether paying cash or using points, and truly a diamond in the rough. It is definitely our new hotel in Waikiki. No more Regency for me!
user_name:
romadaro
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. It offers breakfast in the morning which is very convenient if you are traveling with kids. The pool is nothing to rave about, but who would want to be in the pool when the ocean is just a block or 2 away. The bus stop is located right outside the hotel, so if you don't have a car, public transportation is very accessible. The only reason for giving 3 stars instead of 4 stars is the room we got. The room was hardly an ocean view room, even when we had booked one. On top of it, some members of front desk called the same room as 'city view' while others called it 'ocean view'. Obviously something looked fishy there and we probably didn't get what we paid for. But we still had wonderful vacation & most of the staff at this place was very helpful and accomodating.

We definitely recommend this place. It has wonderful location.As a reference, deluxe rooms are much better than the regular ones. The price difference is not huge, yet the room difference is a lot. Higher floors will guarantee better view.

This is a reasonable choice of a hotel. It is not super luxurious but still nice. The rooms are clean and typical Hyatt high standard. The location is very convenient and yet still in a quiet part of town. The hotel is definitely a step up from the many 3 star hotels in Honolulu but lacks the luxury of the high end beach side hotels. The free breakfast was okay but still a little dissapointing

We just came back from a 6-nights stay at this hotel. We would definitely recommend this place, here are the reasons:Pros: location: The hotel is about a 3 to 5 minutes easy walk to the beach at the corner of Kuhio and Paoakalani. Almost all the hotels except for a few are not directly on the beach. Kuhio beach is blocked off by a wall, the water is very calm. It is located at the end of Waikiki near Diamond head, still within easy walking distance to most of the shops and restaurants. The hotel directly across from a bus stop where you can take buses to Ala Moana shopping center, Pearl harbor and downtown. Free breakfast: It has one of the best free breakfast offered by a hotel in the US! There are hot items such as half breakfast sandwich or break meat(sausages or bacon) and eggs; and one of the followings: pancakes, waffles or french toast. There are also cereals, yogurt and fresh fruit as well as a couple breakfast pastries. To cater for the Asian tourists, they always have miso-soup, rice, kimchees and tofu as well. They also offer several fruit juices, coffee and hot water for tea, One of the reasons we booked this hotel was for the free breakfast and we were very satisfied with the quality of the breakfast. While some reviewers complain that there are no too many items to choose from, I disagree. Many hotels in Asia offer a very extensive free breakfast, it is not the case in the U.S. This hotel definitely has one of the best free breakfast in the country if not the best. If you are traveling with a family of four, you can save $50 every day just on the breakfast. Some reviewers have mentioned that the seating area of the restaurant is not big enough, I also disagree, we always find seats. The hotel staffs do a good job cleaning quickly. You can also use a tray in the room to take the breakfast to the room. Free coffee is available in the lobby in the morning. Free Wi-Fi: it is easy to connect to the internet while you are in the room. That also saves you a lot of money. There are 10 or 15 computers available in the lobby if you do not have your own computer. Room: The room we had was big with a separate sitting area. There are two TV's, one in the main area and the other is in a separate sitting area. There is also a couch. Our room is on the fifth room with a wrap around balcony. While there's not much view, we are also far away from any other buildings near by giving us total privacy. We put our wet snorkeling gears and wet bathing suits in the balcony, they are usually dried by the time we are back from dinner. We never had to use A/C once while we were there. We left the sliding door open, the wind we had at night was enough to keep it cool. You can hear some traffic noise, so do ask for a room in the higher floors. Convenience stores: There are two stores, Lawson which is on site and the ABC store that are 2 minutes away. They open till midnight. They have everything you need, tooth paste, lotion, snacks, sandwiches, sushi, drinking water, soda, beer, sandals, beach towel, beach mats, buoys, snorkeling gears, swimming goggles, souvenirs...etc. The ABC stores are everywhere throughout Waikiki, you can never be more than 10 minutes from an ABC store when you are in Waikiki.
