There's only one super market in Waikiki, it's called Food Pantry. It is located on Kuhio near Seaside, about 10 to 15 minutes walking distance from the hotel. The ABC store is also the place to buy the 4-day bus pass ( $30). Staffs: The hotel staffs are very friend and efficient.Tourist desks: They have two desks, one for English speaking customers and the other is for Korean and Japanese (?) customers. Cons: Swimming pool: It is very small. If you plan on lounging by the pool all day long, this is not the hotel for you.Tours: The staff at the tour desk recommends some island tours that are much more expensive than the ones you can find online. Do your research, before making your decision. You can also take a bus to many places, depending on how much time you have, you may want to consider this option. Overall, this is a very good hotel. We chose this hotel for its free breakfast, free WiFi and its location away from the crowd. We are happy with our stay here and we would recommend this place to anyone.

Only 3 blocks to beach this cuts down on cost. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast bar included that is very nice and included some hot breakfast items. Rooms are nice and comfortable and have lots of room with a sofa. Lobby has free internet with printing. ABC store 1 block down and lots of places to eat in all price ranges very close by.

I like a 4 star/4 diamond property as much as the next guy, but when i'm traveling for pleasure i'm a bit more conscious of price and let's face it when you are on vacation, all you really need is a clean/safe space to sleep & a shower. The Hyatt Place has both. The room and bed was quite comfortable. And the location can't be beat. and the view of diamond head was so beautiful. I wish i could give this 3.5 instead of a 3 or a 4 as there were a few concerns:-the smell is the lobby is quite weird. Moldy water is the only thing i can equate it to-the air conditioner in the room is quite loud-the complimentary breakfast is substantial, but the buffet food got cold quick and there is not great seating.

The hotel was nice enough as were the people working there especially the valet guys however it was balanced out by a few issues.The hotel is really noisy, inside the hotel and the area outside. Inside the hotel you will get doors slamming, people talking, etc. If you have a screaming child, I feel for you... Outside felt like constant traffic and sirens and this was on the 12th floor. The pool was out when we went and access to the other Hyatt given however the beach is 2 minutes away so wasn't that bad. Would have like the option of a swim in a pool though as not that keen on the sea.. The shop was stocked well albeit a little expensive however it still had a great choice. The room was kept clean and the cleaner was a fantastic women who was so friendly. She even held back one day until we left our room (jet lag) around 4pm. The free breakfast was a nice option as nearly everywhere in Waikiki is expensive. The options are basic however it is enough to get you by. The lift is a nightmare and we often walked it took that long. Most of the guests exchanged that awkward look that said is this actually every going to come? The location of the hotel was really good. Not on the beach but crawling distance and plenty of attractions close by from shopping to the Zoo. The parking was a bit of a nightmare. It was limited and very expensive. TBH we probably didn't even need the car however it was a nice option at night. We did request an early check in however didn't get into our rooms until 15:15 so be careful if you are expecting a room on early arrival....

Stayed for the week. Staff was so friendly. Looked after us so well, very and so polite. The room was good to go, and the breakfast each morning was all ways so filling and delightful. Grate location for our pick ups for our activities. Would stay there again and a again

We stayed here for the weekend for the Honolulu Marathon due to the location of the finish line. I do have to say the check out time was a bit of a hassle of 11 am. Most do not complete the marathon until 10 am. The staff was polite, breakfast was good with plenty of food. We got a king size bed and the couch turns into a bed. The room was clean. How ever it has a mildew smell that was ever present especially when turning on the AC. If a person has any kind allergies or can not bare the smell this is not a place to stay. It was hard to get over the mildew smell.

I've never written a review, but couldn't resist after this stay. I had a fantastic time at this hotel for 5 nights. Every staff member I encountered was incredibly friendly, attentive, and helpful. There was always staff everywhere, which was great. Complimentary wifi and breakfast was an excellent bonus, as well as 24/7 dining (pick-up in lobby or room service). Room was modern, clean, etc. and just a block away from Waikiki! Definitely recommend.
user_name:
TravelerNYC55
New York City, New York

review_body: I highly recommend Hyatt Place bec of its staff's great customer service. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast-fresh juices, fruits & hot meals! The rooms were spacious w/ our living room & veranda! It was Awesome!

We had a great experience at the Hyatt. Everything was super clean and modern. The rooms were spacious, and our maid service was fantastic. The hotel had daily events including art shows and free lei making. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful, with a wide variety of items that changed daily. All of the Hyatt staff was gracious for our entire visit. Our kids were given complimentary beach toys upon arrival. We will be back!

Check-in was fast and Christopher was very informative regarding the amenities offered at this property.I was upgraded (without asking) even though I booked with points. One of the consistent issues that I have with the Hyatt Place rooms are that they are normally not well lit. The room I had on the 16th floor was very spacious and well lit with a balcony too. Hyatt Place offers 24/7 options for food but normally you have to always go down to the lobby and pick it up. This property offers room service for only an additional $3 surcharge which is great. The bistro menu is basically the same as other Hyatt Places with a few local type offerings.Breakfast is included and is served in the outside pool area on the 3rd floor. The offerings were the same as most other Hyatt Places – Egg Sandwich (open-faced), assorted cereals and breads, juice coffee, etc. The staff is phenomenal, I usually take soy milk in my coffee and Sonia was prompt in filling this request even though there were a lot of breakfast patrons. Also because there is a large Asian tourist population, soups are also offered at breakfast. The only issue I had with the breakfast space is with the number of birds that are present since it is outside. There is plenty of seating with signs not to feed the birds but I’m not sure how many people adhere to that advice.Checkout was fast and no surprises on my bill. I would definitely return to the Hyatt Place Waikiki.

This was supposed to be a stopover hotel for us in Honolulu before we proceeded to Maui for our vacation. The biggest draw for us was that it was very close to the Waikiki beach and the Kalakaua road, the famed shopping street in Waikiki. The room's price was perfect and it included complimentary breakfast for the guests. However, the overnight parking fee was extremely high. We had rented a car for 2 days and each day, we returned the car in the evening to the rental agency. There are excellent restaurants, 5 minutes by walk from this hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is visiting Waikiki.

I really enjoyed my stay at Hyatt place. The hotel was were clean and just walking distance from wakiki beach. Great location! I had a room with a view from the balcony and it was an amazing view of the ocean! Would definitely stay here again!

Great hotel to stay at, just a block or so from a great beach. Right by the zoo and park. Walk to all shops and lots of places to eat. Not a resort style pool but good enough to cool off if you need it. Great free breakfast. Lots of fresh pineapple, an egg dish, and either french toast or waffles. Plus good oatmeal, cereal, all sorts of bread for toast and some pastries. Coffee was even good. Rooms were good size with a nice seating area and the beds were comfortable. All in all great place to stay.

Just stayed one night on our way back to the mainland. I'm not a fan of Honolulu but this is a nice hotel. God location, has a little bar/ cafe in the hotel itself. Every staff member we cam in contact with was knowledgable, friendly and professional. The room was Big with a comfortable sectional couch and the bed . Oh my was it comfortable. There is nothing they could do better here, Great job ! We would stay here again.

Very friendly service at the front desk check in. Not only at the check in but on a daily basis.The room was huge & had a great view. Comfortable bed. Easy access to the beach & short walk to the Tiki bar.Inexpensive convenient store within a 2min walk.The main downside is the pool, as its small & uninviting. This is where the breakfast is served too... Ok breakfast but it was a wind tunnel with birds trying to get the scraps.

Closed to everything, had a wonderful room-1534, view of the beach. Staff was outstanding and loved the breakfast, lots of choices. Would stay there again in a heart beat. Pool is a little small, and does not get a lot of sun, but who cares when the beach is a block away.

My wife and I (plus our 21 month old) stayed here for 14 nights around Thanksgiving. We decided to stay here as we had stayed here 2 years ago. The hotel was reasonably priced and included the free skillet breakfast. We have also stayed in the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa several times, the Hyatt Place is not as luxurious, but is adequate. The staff are accommodating and try to correct any problems quickly. Housekeeping staff were lovely and interacted with our son. The only complaint about this hotel is that the glass sliding doors to the balcony to not close well; during our stay there were strong trade winds and this meant that there was lots of wind noise (kept me awake several nights). We had a large room on the 14th floor (top) with a separate setting room with TV, the bathroom contained a bathtub (great for our son) and the view from the balcony showed the mountains and also the ocean. This hotel is not located on the water front, but is only a 2 minute walk to the beach; however the hotel is not on the main dinning area of Waikiki, but is only a 10-15 minute walk.Overall this hotel is pleasant.

Stayed in the Hyatt Place because my parent had their dog. We normally Stay at the Hilton just one block down. The Hyatt is very nice, the rooms were very clean and modern. The larger king rooms are well worth the money. The breakfast buffet is very nice with both warm and cold items, well stocked, and clean. Eating on the outside patio is a great way to start the day. A tray is provided so you can safely transport your breakfast goodies back to your room. The hotel is nicely situated just a couple blocks from the beach, shops, and restaurants. The Zoo is also just a few minute walk away. MACs 24x7 in the Hilton is just a few blocks away. WifI and pool are adequate, beware, there is NO hot tub. The only reason five stars are not given is that the the bell hops do double duty as front desk. When we arrive there was a line of seven cars in the very small front portico. No one was at the front desk because they were parking cars. The wait was a little longer than you would expect. The staff that was there was always moving, friendly, courteous and professional. Overall a great place to say, especially if you have a pet!

Background: I traveled with family to Oahu for a sporting event. My husband and I had previously stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort seven years ago, but as the latest reviews were somewhat negative, we decided to research another hotel. We found a great rate and many positive reviews for the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach.Booking/Check-in: A relative made our room reservation via BookIt.com. We had originally reserved a Mountain View room with two queen beds. Upon checking- in, we were upgraded to a larger room (same view) that also included a sofa bed. We arrived after check-in (3 pm) and our room was ready.The Hotel: The hotel is located two blocks from Waikiki Beach near Diamond Head. Hotel highlights included a 24-hour fitness center, an outdoor pool, complimentary Wi-Fi and complimentary breakfast. Our guest room was modern, clean and very spacious. Room highlights included two comfortable queen beds, a large flat-screen TV, a mini-fridge and two small balconies. Finally, the hotel had no resort fee and offered valet parking for $30 per night.Amenities: The fitness center was a good size for this hotel and never crowded. The pool was on the small side with no view. Fresh pool/beach towels were available (free of charge) at the pool. We only used the pool once, but had it to ourselves. Breakfast offered a selection of hot items (that changed daily) as well as a selection of fruit, cereals, breads, pastries, etc. Tea, coffee, milk and various juices were also available. Breakfast was served outside by the pool. I noticed if you left your food unattended, the birds would take advantage. (There were signs not to feed the birds.)Overall: We were happy with our stay at this hotel. It was clean and modern, the staff was friendly and it was a great value (especially compared to neighboring hotels.) I would recommend this hotel to family and friends.Note: There is an ABC Store next to hotel, a great place to buy drinks, snacks and souvenirs.

My husband and I (in our late 20s) stayed here in late November for 1 night and were pleasantly impressed with this hotel. It's clean, updated and nicely decorated, although the rooms are a little on the small side. Free breakfast, WiFi and a short 5-min stroll to Waikiki beach are great bonuses offered by this hotel. We would stay here again!

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights around Labor Day weekend for the Waikiki Rough Water Swim ocean race. I made my choice based on the short walk to the race start, the reasonable price, and the good reviews. The hotel was definitely very decent though not a glitzy luxury resort. The staff and housekeeping team were friendly and helpful. Our room, though on the small side, had everything we needed. And, being on the top floor (14th) corner, we had a small bit of an ocean view from the balcony. Meanwhile, you may or may not like the location. We had no trouble with its being away from the high-end retail stores and the 2-block walk to the beach. However, we were not so impressed with the number of homeless cruising this stretch of Waikiki, though it was not the hotel's fault. Breakfast buffet was excellent. We were usually the first bunch to eat when they opened. The choices and the quality of the food were the best that I had seen in free hotel breakfasts. We actually returned for a quick "second breakfast" on two occasions after swimming / hiking. The one mild discomfort was about the air conditioner. It was an individual unit for the room, with one vent pointing straight at the head of the bed. Perhaps the hotel staff could figure some mechanism to better distribute the cooling air.

I stayed here for 5 nights. It was nice to have a bigger room since I was here so long. The hotel provides a nice breakfast better than the normal free breakfast you find at the chain hotels. Friendly service and very clean. The pool is very small but the beach is about 2 blocks away. I love the beach that is closest to the hotel.It is totally protected by a break wall. It is more like a gigantic pool. It is perfect for young children and adults who want to float around and not worry about being swept to the sea. There are numerous restaurants around the area. I highly recommended this hotel.

1. Avoid third floor rooms... Very noisy due to fitness, laundry, pool and breakfast service off of this floor. 2. If you have children, get a bathroom with a tub, not just a shower. 3. Get to the breakfast, served around the pool early (6:30-8:00) so you can get a table and not have to sit on a lounger. 4. If you are a senior with a Medicare card, use it with a photo ID to travel on the buses for $1 with 2 transfer possibilities. Go to Longs/CVS and next door Safeway for better assortment and cheaper everything than Lawson and ABC stores in Waikiki. (off Beretania on Fort Street). 5. There are really no ocean views from this 19-floor hotel, just a 'slot' view from some of the rooms, off their balconies. So, don't worry about the lack of ocean views... There really aren't any!Pluses: typically Hyatt comfortable beds, new and nice furnishings, we'll-trained staff, a variety of breakfast choices (hot to cold to kim chee!) help save $. Beach two blocks away. City buses off Kuhio just to the side of the hotel. Convenience store downstairs or two doors away.

This was a great hotel. We went for our honeymoon and it was great. The staff was very nice and personable. The valet attebdant were very helpful with directions and very nice. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were very clean spacious. We will definitely be back.
user_name:
Kelly H
Medford, Oregon, United States

review_body: The staff in all areas were extremely friendly and seemed genuinely concerned about me and my family having a good time. The room price includes breakfast which is elaborate and adds to the value of the experience. They have good security measures in place and an overall well-run operation

Stayed here for 3 nights and liked it so we booked another 4 nights. We did have a hiccup with being charged twice but they sorted it out. Lots to like about the Hyatt place. Firstly the staff are brilliant. Always smiling and nothing is to much trouble. Secondly the beds we loved. Very good quality and comfortable. Third is location. Not on the beach but close enough and we liked being on the edge away from the hustle bustle. As far as I know this is one of the only places that includes breakfast in the booking price.

We stayed there for couple nights and everything was wonderful. A budget hotel but everything looks nice and clean. Staff always greet you with smile and willing to help. A good bargain with a nice sea view, spacious room, most toiletries included or can be requested for free. Location is decent, couples mins walk to the beach. Best experience is the business center you can have access internet anytime and printing is free, definitely save lots of hassles for last minute coupons. If you plan to go to the outlet, the hotel is great location as you can just buy the tickets at travel center down the lobby and wait just outside the hotel for pickups. Overall stay is out of my expectations, services are outstanding but don't expect too much for the breakfast (just average food quality) and be sure to check if the self-parking available. During my time there only valet parking available so that I have to find a self-parking lot nearby that not quite convenient.

We stayed 2 nights at this newly renovated hotel two blocks from the south end of Waikiki beach. The hotel decor is chic with a relaxed vibe, and despite its location our room was very quiet which we really appreciated. The service from all the staff was amazing, from the minute we checked in till our very last day when we were given a hospitality room to freshen up before our late departure.The minor downsides of this hotel would be the small rooms (we were a Mountain view room in the Diamond tower, I believe the Pali tower has larger rooms, at a higher cost) and the cold, tiny swimming pool, but we weren't there for the pool so it didn't affect us in any way at all. For what we paid the value is simply unbeatable - good location, modern and cosy room, free buffet breakfast, free wifi, no resort fee, and above all, the fantastic service from the staff. Parking was on the expensive side ($30) but you can park diagonally across the road at the Aston Banyan (enter on Kuhio Street and pay the security guy when entering) for half that price, as recommended by other Tripadvisor reviews (thanks for the tip!). Would return!

This is a wonderful hotel and very close to Waikiki beach. The staff is wonderful, friendly and helpful. My only negative comment would be the birds at breakfast. Do not leave your food unattended, it will be gone when you come back. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

We pulled in to the valet space an hour before check-in. The very friendly and helpful gardener welcomed us and said the valet was parking a car and would be right back. This was the experience we had with everyone from the hotel -- front desk, valet, housekeeping, restaurant staff -- smiling, helpful, friendly -- it's nice to be in a place where the workers really seem to enjoy being at work-- and enjoy being with their guests. The room was small but well designed and furnished - not cramped at all. Furnishings and fixtures were new, clean, attractive and wifi was strong. Breakfast (free is my favorite) had a little of everything - eggs, bacon, pancakes, hot cereal, yogurt, granola, pastries, a variety of juices, coffee, tea and staff members chasing the birds away from the tables. The beach is a minute away. Hardcore Waikiki also a short walk away. Our room was 5th floor mountain view -- can't really see much but the hotel is on the quiet side of Waikiki and there was very little noticeable street noise.

Me and my husband went to Honolulu once a year since 2012. Everytime we stayed in Hyatt Place for a week. The room is simple and clean. For the price of the room includ the breakfast buffet was great. Love this hotel. Will stay here again.Highly recommend.

Great destination, but quite crowded. This hotel is located near the Diamond Head end of the beach and away from the shopping mall mobs. Rate is good by comparison to competition.Hotel offers free in room Wifi and full hot food breakfast buffet. Staff was pleasant and helpful.Dining is a problem, no onsite restaurant , Marriott and Aston both right next door do have options. Eating in Waikiki is generally a problem.... many, many very large hotels and most don't want to be involved in the business of serving food. Budget more than you normally would for eating out... I would estimate 50% more than usual vacation destination.

Hi, We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks and loved it! The staff were so friendly and also so helpful ESP at 3am in the morning when your hungry you can easily order from the 24/7 restaurants in the lobby. WIFI is awesome very fast and no lost signals! Must admit the breaky wasn't that great but it's still good enough. With the usual juices , breakfast breads etc. This hotel is so close to the local ABC STOre WHICH IS SO HANDY! Close to the local bus that takes you to ala Moana shopping centre (pink line) only costs $2 pp just watch out for the tree branches when riding rooftop. Close to the beach just minute walk literally. You can organise shuttles to the shopping outlets or tours anywhere through the hotel, they are very fast and efficient. The Polynesian culture centre bus pick up is just across the road from the hotel which was handy. Clubs and pubs are walking distance. Even though your not ocean view you can easy just walk down to the beach and watch sunrise or sunset. The hotel room is the best! The beds are so soft and also the pillows are also soft which makes you night so peaceful! I loved it! Showers are good and also bathroom. The room service is always helpful and will assist in any way! In the future I will be staying here every time I come to hawaii! Trust me you get what you pay for at this hotel! NatalieSydney, Australia

Many Waikiki hotels are super expensive, but this hotel is good value for under $200 Aud per night including breakfast . There was a warm welcome from the staff , an upper floor with an ocean view , new decor and a typical hyatt heavenly bed. The downside was a very dated pool area and breakfast was basic. This was compensated for by a family friendly atmosphere. The Waikiki beach area, only minutes walk away was lovely and not crowded. It's also next door to the Kapilani park and Hawaii Zoo .

This is a bit off the beach (two long blocks), but that means two minutes more in the confines of Waikiki (and less $$). While it is an older hotel, it is well appointed and the rooms are fairly up-to-date. That said, it isn't a top-tier resort like some of the other places (e.g., Hilton Hawaiian Village, Marriott Waikiki and so on). It is a good place for those who want to enjoy Waikiki outside and use their room as a place to rest.We didn't use the pool/ fitness room, but the free breakfast was quite nice and the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Given the value, we really enjoyed the stay/ location and so on. But the big demerit: the elevators, especially in the Pali tower were just over-matched. It was easier to take the stairs ten floors than wait for the glacial progress of the lifts. Quite a shame given all the other nice points of the hotel. But stairs are good for the legs and so on, no?

Myself and my partner stayed here for 5 nights in September 2014 as he had a conference across the road at the Marriott. We really enjoyed the hotel as a base to explore Waikiki. We were initially put in a room on the 2nd floor on the street side above the Lawson convenience store as this was all they had. We asked to be moved as soon as possible due to the noise on the main road. The next day we were moved to a room on the 6th floor on the same street side. The noise level was much better, but was still slightly noticeable.Overall, both rooms were spacious, modern, and clean. Our king-sized bed was very big and very comfortable. I felt the bathroom shower could have done with some modernisation but this was a minor gripe (it was too close to the toilet). Wifi was included in the room which was a big plus.Breakfast was also included. Guests were able to take the tray from their room and use this to take breakfast back to the room. I did this each day as the breakfast space was very busy and not that large. It was also outside in the heat which was quite unbearable even under the shade.The location was great being a short walk to the beach (less than 5 minutes). The hotel had a Lawson convenience store in the building and there was an ABC store 2 minutes walk away. There were also plenty of restaurants nearby.Overall this was a good hotel for a good price. Whilst it lacked the wow factor of our stay in the Hilton Waikiki at the end of our stay (with view of the beach), we still had a nice time here and would recommend it as a good middle range hotel.

The old adage "you get what you pay for" comes to mind. We booked this hotel many months ago for a vacation in late October. The price was competitive and the reviews were mostly positive. We stayed 9 nights and overall, the stay was pleasant. Check-in was a breeze, the staff make you feel welcome and are always kind. They were more than accommodating for any issue. Some reviewers mention spacious rooms. Ours wasn't. We stayed in the east tower. If you want to see the ocean, you have to be above the 10th floor. Elevators are slow. Our room was very clean and the staff did an excellent job with maid-service. Our room was very dated, with popcorn ceiling in the bedroom area. The entry and the bathroom areas have been updated although there is only one switch for the vanity / sink area and the shower / toilet room. This can be annoying for the partner trying to sleep if you need light in the shower / toilet area only.Breakfast is very average. Hot foods are warm. I saw about 7 different ways to prepare an egg sandwich. They always served some form of meat product. It is a zoo and feeding frenzy around 7:30 - 9:00 am. Come early for a good seat and if it's raining, opt for breakfast somewhere else. The birds are annoying, but that's the price you pay for outside dining.We had a great view from our room on the 14th floor. Yes the Aston and Marriott block some of the view, but there was enough water to make you feel tranquil while sipping coffee on the lanai. By the way, Their coffee was great!!! No need to run to Starbucks or Seattle's Best ( both a couple blocks away). Just wish they had real cream for my wife's coffee.

Great size rooms, very comfortable bed. Location was right at one end of main strip but walking distance to most things. Free breakfast was just awful. We tried it one morning and left as aside from fighting for a seat because it was so small and busy the food was terrible

This hotel is located on the noisiest corner of the area. The street on which this hotel is located is the one ALL tour buses,trolleys, etc travel down to turn around and go back through the loop of the Waikiki Beach tourist area. The other street is another major through-a-fare where large vehicle travel. The hotel even routinely supplies EARPLUGS in the rooms. The rooms are nice but the one we stayed had a loud, noisy, clattering air conditioner and the same for the bathroom fan that would not turn off. Bring DOGS but pay an EXTRA $75 per day and non-refundable cleaning deposit.

Spent 8 days at the Hyatt Place for our 40th Anniversary every expectation was met. Clean, modern good sized rooms, friendly, helpful staff. Large breakfast deck with varied freshly prepared items each morning. Easy access to both city bus lines & tour bus stops. Beach about 400' away. No down side here. Very happy with our choice to stay here.

This trip was a combination of business and vacation. I picked the hotel because of its value - significantly less per night than most - no resort fee, free wifi, free breakfast and location. It was an easy drive from the hotel to my customer so for me the location was fine. My husband, who came with me, felt it was too far from all the action. The beach was a two minute walk but the hotel is at the far end of Waikiki. Wifi was great. Breakfast was good. Parking was expensive. Rooms are tiny but very clean. The only negative was that they came in to clean the room anytime between 10am and 4pm. No two days were the same. My husband would leave the room at 10am and often come back after 2pm and find they hadn't cleaned yet. And other days they were knocking at 10am to come in and clean. Very annoying. I'd return for a business trip but maybe not vacation.

We recommend this hotel. Great place for getting tour buses and local transportation. Friendly staff always looking to help, convenient location one block from shopping, beach and zoo also great restaurants

We just stayed here for a week. I picked the hotel because it had free wifi and didn't have any surcharges as some of the hotels in waikiki do. The hotel is located about a 2 minute walk away from Waikiki beach and is close to Kapiolani Park and the zoo. It consists of two towers which are connected by a common area which contains the main lobby, lounge areas, business center, a cafe and and bar. The hotel appears to have been recently renovated since every is fresh and clean. The Japanese convenience store Lawson station is great because it has a great selection drinks, snacks and sushi/sashimi and a really great price. We ended up getting some water and sod to keep in our mini bar since hotel actually charges $3.50 if you drink the bottled water they provide. The room I felt was bit on the smaller side however it was well laid out with a small balcony. The free breakfast was more than adequate with a good selection of cereals, waffles and muffins and juices, served in a really wonderful outdoor patio. We had a chance to chat with Yuko who is one of the workers there and she was so wonderful.

We recently stayed 3 nights at Hyatt Place after spending almost 2 weeks at resorts at 2 other islands.I had booked the deluxe ocean view room on a high floor, which the hotel confirmed was the best room category. HotelClub had a special deal, so this room was at a very good price. We did get on level 9 in an ocean view in the 1st tower (not sure of the tower name) however the view was enjoyed from a small window over the desk, you would need to stand t the desk to actually see the view. Needless to say it was not what I expected for what was supposedly the best category of room. Went back to reception to advise that the room wasn't what I expected & they did move us to the Diamond Head Tower in a room with a decent ocean view. Why they put us in the other room in the 1st place when the other room was available annoyed me a little, but I was happy with the next room that we moved to. The room was a good size, with a small lounge area. The staff were very good & friendly. The included breakfast was decent, we only need toast, cereal, coffee & juice. There were a few hot options as well - eggs, sausages etc. the hot options seemed to change daily when we were there. We had to leave very early for our return flight, so we were able to pack some breakfast items & get some coffee to go & eat on the way to the airport.We had no issues with the speed of the included wifi, there are also computers in the lobby with printing so handy for online check-in.The pool is very small & didn't look like it would get a lot of sun. The beach less than 5 mins walk is great, it is sheltered from waves so very family friendly. Reception provide towels to take to the beach. The rooms have small fridges so good for drinks & snacks. There is the standard ABC store on the corner & also a few stores in the lobby area. We had a car for 1 night & the parking was full, however we were directed to Banyan Tree directly across the road which ended up being cheaper at $15 with in/out priviliges, whereas the hotel charges $25.We were very happy with Hyatt Place and would stay again without hesitation. It is a good hotel and very good value for $ considering it includes wifi & breakfast & it does not charge the ridiculous resort fee that seems to be the norm in Hawaii.

We are frequent visitors to Hawaii. In the past we have stayed at same hotel many times.It was bought out and last year we had some unresolved issues and decided to try Hyatt Place.It is 2 blocks from the beach and reasonably priced. It also included an ample breakfast.During the stay we encountered a problem and was immediately taken care of by the management and staff. We found the stay enjoyable and would definitely return.

If you've ever stayed in a Hyatt Place hotel you'll know what to expect at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Like all Hyatt Place hotels, this one has comfortable beds, a nice desk, free WiFi in the room, free breakfast buffet, and some in-room amenities you don't always get in Waikiki hotels without paying extra for, like a mini-fridge. The location is very convenient -- a short walk from Kalakaua Ave., which is the main drag in Waikiki. There is an ABC store a half block away that has most of what you'd need in terms of supplies -- some groceries, soda/pop, beer, souvenirs, milk & cream, etc., which makes the in-room fridge a great feature.Both valet & self-parking are available at rates that might seem steep but are competitive for Waikiki. The staff is very warm and welcoming, and helpful if you have any special needs.There is a fitness center that's small but very well-equipped and available 24/7. There is also a small pool, but be advised that this is not really a resort hotel, so you'll want to set your expectations accordingly.I've stayed there twice and will absolutely stay there again. I now consider this hotel my "go to" place to stay in Waikiki when I need to go there for business. It would not be my first choice for a romantic resort getaway -- I'd go to something like the Hilton Hawaiian Village for that -- but if you're looking for relatively economical accommodations in paradise, this is a great choice.

First impressions were unfortunately a bit disappointing the check in process was not smooth and when we got to our room we thought it was a bit small. However it was late at night and after a good nights sleep in a very comfy bed we discovered the rest of the hotel. Breakfast is free and is pretty good, lots to choose from and a good selection of cereals, toast, pastries and hot food that changes daily. It is served on the 3rd floor next to the pool and I loved sitting outside for breakfast although there is a small covered area if preferred. There is also free wifi throughout the hotel. There are standard amenities in your hotel room including a decent hair dryer and the hotel has many more available through reception if you forget anything, most free some for a very small fee. I thought the rooms were a tad small because there isn't really anywhere we could ut our suitcases but I loved the balcony. We were upgraded from a city view room to a mountain view room on the 5th floor but as we couldn't really see the mountain I wouldnt bother upgrading. Other than the girl who checked us in we found the staff to be very friendly and their service was fantastic especially Ted the bell hop and the housekeeping staff. There is also a pool and a guest laundry both located on the first floor if you wish to use them :)As for the location it is only 2 blocks to the beach which was brilliant. We went to the beach atleast once a day. There is a bus stop right outside and pickups for most tours across the road. We didn't have access to a vehicle but we found the public transport very handy. Its only a short walk to many great restaurants and shopping. We stayed here 6 nights and on leaving it was no problem for the hotel to look after our bags (our flight wasn't till 10pm) and we were also offered the use of a hospitality room which was unexpected and made a huge difference :). Due to a hiccup with our flights we found ourselves staying in Hawaii an extra 2 nights so we decided since we had enjoyed our first stay to return to the Hyatt Place where it was not at all a problem to book in for another two nights. Would definitely return again :)

My wife and I had a stopover in Waikiki on the way home back to Australia therefore didn't want to spend too much on just one night's accommodation (especially when we'd be spending the day on the beach). So when we stumbled upon this place, we booked it immediately. It was really cheap considering the quality of the hotel, the great staff services, amenities and location (3 minute walk to the beach). A big bonus was complimentary breakfast which worked well for us as we had to leave early the next morning and they commenced serving hot and cold breakfast from 6.30 am. Not a the most variety we've encountered but it was fresh and tasty (we had eggs, toast, sausages and waffles). There's options there also for cereal, fruit and yogurt lovers.We would definitely stay here again.

Hyatt Place Waikiki is a great hotel with a very reasonable prices. The free breakfasts are superb. It's a block away to the best beach in Waikiki. The staff are outstanding and professional. What's not to like?
user_name:
Paul S
Homosassa, Florida, United States

review_body: From the moment we arrived we really felt at home the front desk team were very accommodating and friendly. The offerings were lavish. Close to ocean. Hawaii is truly a beautiful place and we enjoyed every meal and outting recommended by the staff.

We stayed at this hotel in August 2014. The location of the hotel is a little far from the shopping areas and night life on Kalakaua Ave and Waikiki Beach. However if you have a rental car and only want to go to the beach then it's fine. Amenities included were a good bargain, free wifi and free breakfast. The room itself was a good size. We booked ocean view but with the tall buildings nearby blocking most of the view I feel this was not worth it. We had no problems with wait times for the elevators as some other reviewers complained about. We also felt that the pigeons at the breakfast area were annoying but so long as you did not leave your food unattended it was fine. The food was good and it really helped to be able to start the day on a full stomach. Overall it was a good stay and I would recommend this hotel.

This is a great new, no frills hotel (in the style of Hyatt Place) just a block away from the beach BUT a fair distance (about a half mile) from any of the restaurants, shopping and hotels along the beach.The staff is incredibly friendly, rooms are large (with mini fridges) and clean with comfortable beds and large showers.The cons all come under the heading of "this is not a resort." The pool is small and kinda crappy, the decor is bland "could be anywhere" and there really are no services.NONE of these impacted our stay. This is an amazingly priced hotel that served as a place to sleep in between excursions. we spent a couple nights at the Royal Hawaiian for complete pampering and relaxation (at more than triple the cost).So, if you are exploring the island -- which you should -- and just want a place to hang your hat, the Hyatt Place is a real bargain.

From the moment of check in, where I was asked if I was celebrating anything..... to a beautiful room..... with first class amenities, a great bed and a work space, I loved it. I will definitely return to this property!

We were moved from the Hyatt Regency Waikiki (see review) to the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. This hotel was quite different from the other Hyatt Place’s we have stayed at. For one it’s a high rise. Our room was large and appeared to be remodeled. Very large and may be considered a step above a regular room. The view was another matter. The line from a song came to mind, “they tore down paradise and put up a parking lot” In front of us was three high rises, below was a private bungalow with clothes hanging on a line. Strange to see this smack in the center of all these high rise hotels. In fact to be perfectly honest, each high rise blocked the next from any chance of a view. Forget the water. We went for breakfast the next morning only to be shocked at the area they put this in. The pool is the size of a backyard pool for a family of 6. The food area appears to be stuck on a roof with private apartment buildings surrounding the area. Our view was of the adjoing balcony’s, that had stacks of storage boxes, trash and clothes lines. What a letdown for a Hyatt. I know they can’t do anything about the private apartments but they should find another area to have their breakfast service. That evening we choose to just eat in the Hotel and sat down at the bar. The bartender poured a taster of the house wine. I tasted it, sat the glass down and stated it was fine. She pulled the unfinished glass and poured it out. The service just went downhill from there. We did get our food, and I ordered a second glass of wine since she was there. She poured a fresh glass then grabbed my un finished one. We told her to put it down, I explained to her she should ask if the customer was finished before removing their glass. She said no one has ever complained and that’s the way it was done. After not seeing anyone to help us customers got up and left. Some still owed for their meals and stated they would pay at the desk. When the male helper returned he apologized stating he was valeting cars. So I gather from that they have no permanent help in the restaurant/bar area. This might work at the other Hyatt Places, but this one is far too big to manage it like they are. The hotel manage did attempt to contact us. We tried to meet with him at the desk. None of this happened. So hopefully they will straighten this out with their staff. Would I visit this hotel again? Not by choice. This was a business trip.

We were able to score really good and cheap flight and hotel for hawaii. The hyatt is usually a good name so we went with it and we were not disappointed!!! The staff are friendly and helpful! The hotel itself is like a resort, very clean and spacious! Had such an amazing time. No complaints whatsoever. Free breakfast and wifi made it even better!! Would recommend to anyone who was planning on going to waikiki as the beach and shopping are so close by! Just AMAZING!

Im on the 19th floor in a double queen delux room.This is a great value hotel as its a five minute walk to the beach and you get free Wifi which can be costly on holidays. There are many positives and fewer negatives however I dont suggest booking the top room unless of course your booking the penthouse as it seemed everyone was being upgraded due to a 'celebration holiday' I do regret paying for the top category, after all your not spending too much time in the room. DO ask for a floor above 10 if your not big on street noise. btw this goes for anywhere in Waikiki not just here. Here are my pros and cons below:Pro's: staff are nice and friendly, very polite and helpful. Free wifi as mentioned.Lobby is clean and tidy.Beach is a five minute walk if that.Rooms are large, clean and modern considering they are not suites they have more space than many. All rooms come with a fold out sofa too, although we didnt use it, my 2 yo loved having it out with his toys cars during the day. The TV was big, bathroom clean and well equipped and the full length skinny mirror was a bonus.Tour desk (Expedia) are helpful and honest.Lots of towls and face washers, soaps etc were left every morning at our service. The maids weteClean and reasonably priced cafe/ bar downstairs.Free coffee in the morning between 6.30 and 9.30amLobby is a pretty place to sit and people watch waiting for your friends.Air con in room is great but the Fan is loud, I actually love the white noise to go to sleep.Cons:Stinky sushi outlet/ convenient store 'Lawsons' downstairs in the lobby, the smell after a few days makes you feel sick.No robes in roomThe pool is not worth mentioning unless you want to literally dip before going out and shuts at 10pmNo bar at pool level.Breakfast is plain rank, everything to eat is just yucky! Stale cereal, fatty egg patties, greasy cheese, soggy fruit, sweet breads and sugary pastries. If you are at all health conscientious do not even bother looking, and don't even think of finding anything carb free. (Juice is fine, apple, tomato and oj)The lift beeps loudly on every floor, so annoying staying on the 19th floor!Birds everywhere and all over your table on 3rd level during coffee/ breakfast timeYes a few cons in my opinion however I would stay here again, just in a cheaper room. For the staff and cleanleness and size of room plus having free wifi is still great value. Xx

Approximately 1 block from a great little beach at the end of Waikiki. The beach has a breakwater which was needed during a strong tropical storm. Slow elevators in our wing. Poor response by staff during two false alarm emergency evacuations. Clientele backed up in stairwells, with no staging areas allotted at the bottom. Great breakfast options. Close to Diamond Head. Large rooms so able to have 3 sharing comfortably. Comfortable beds, decent view, free wifi.

We stayed for a couple of nights before leaving for Kauai. Its five of us so we reserved a room with partial ocean view, 2 queen beds and one sofa bed. It did suffice and the view was actually very nice. I liked that the internet worked fine, no trying to connect again and again because of weak signal. I had read that in some parts of the building the rooms are very small but fortunately this wasn't the case. Some amenities were lacking such as a shower cap, sewing kit. We got shampoo, conditioner and soap just once. Also the room had only one trash can. For extra blankets you need to ask the front desk as there are none in the room. Apart from this it was clean, I saw no mildew or such.Waikiki is very noisy so even though the windows are well sealed you will hear some noise from the streets, but nothing major. You also get the complementary breakfast which has some decent items in it.What stands out about this place is that its close to the beach (a couple of minutes walk) and the friendliness of staff. A lot of people and tour parties are coming and going from the Hyatt and yet personnel is always nice and ready to help.This is a good hotel for a middle ground budget. I would recommend not ordering food there if you are on a budget. Waikiki is already expensive enough.
user_name:
kirk441
San Pedro Garza Garcia, Mexico

review_body: We have just returned from our eleventh visit to Honolulu and our first 12 night stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. We would highly recommend this hotel.While not directly on the beach it is a very easy walking distance making the value tremendous as compared to the beachfront properties. With the higher cost of airline travel, the higher per night lodging cost and the mandatory resort fees at most hotels this is a great value. We booked through the Hyatt Hotel travel partner that resulted in a great price, by Hawaii standards, for the room and airfare.Our deluxe ocean view room was large with a nice seating area consisting of a sofa bed, chair and ottoman/coffee table adjoining the sleeping area. The bathroom was nicely appointed and the entire room was kept very clean by the housekeeping staff. Wear and tear for a high volume Waikiki property is showing in the rooms but I feel confident that management will maintain high standards.Anyone who has been to Waikiki and eaten alfresco knows that birds can be an annoyance but the staff was very good at keeping them away at breakfast. So long as you do not feed them and you do not leave your food unattended you will not have a problem.Free breakfast that is not part of a package price at a Waikiki hotel is unheard of and the Hyatt Place does it more than right. The food was fresh, always stocked, a variety of items for most anyone’s taste, the area was kept clean and it was good. Guest that complain about breakfast should realize that most properties in the area would change $20 per person for breakfast and this is free.While everyone was friendly throughout the property (the front end staff pretty much ignored guest when not directly dealing with them), special recognition is given to the housekeeping and maintenance staff for always going out of their way to be extremely friendly. In our case Wilma, who attended to our 12th floor room during most of our stay, was extraordinary. Wilma introduced herself on our first morning, constantly acknowledged us in the hallway and left a personal note on our last day thanking us for our visit and welcoming our return in the future. Wilma is certainly a great ambassador for this hotel and deserves recognition for providing exceptional service and asking for our return business.Hyatt Place is a moderately priced limited service brand that in this case provided exactly what we were looking for and more. They exceeded our expectations. If you are looking for a resort hotel with high end amenities, then this would not be a property well suited for you. If, however, you are looking for a great value, large rooms, friendly staff, free Wi-Fi that works well and free daily breakfast that is near everything for half the price of the high end hotels then you will not be disappointed.

Upon check in we were greeted by Anaeline,asked if we were celebrating anything. We replied our 40th anniversary We got back and there was a bottle of wine with their compliments!!!!!!.Every single staff member we came across was so helpful and smilling,Our room was very nice, with beds to die for!!!!Our hats off to Jarron,Cole,Joey,Lynn,Anaeline and Ihab.You all are rock stars and made our stay wonderful. It really shows how much you all like your jobs. Alohas to all!!!!Much Mahalo,LKP

The staff at the Waikiki Hyatt Place were exceptional I couldn't be more pleased w/the service we received from the time we arrived to the time we departed. The room(s) were clean and well appointed and had a killer view(s) (Diamond Head and/or Deluxe Ocean Room). In addition, the location was great (off the beaten path) and many of the tours buses pick up either in front of the hotel or a short 2 block walk (the last pick-up/drop off). I highly recommend this property for what you get for the price you pay...

The Hyatt Place Waikiki was more than I expected. Since it was my first time there the front desk assistant gave me a quick tour of the lobby area and provided me with information such as restaurants near the property and Hyatt amenities. The room was was clean and smelled clean, huge kudos! Wolfgang Puck's was just down the street and Starbucks is around the corner. Since your in one end of the Waikiki strip you can hit every shop on one end and hit the other shops on your way back. I would definitely consider staying here again.

We go to Oahu often and have stayed all over Waikiki. The Hyatt Place Waikiki is hard to beat for price and location. Less than 2 blocks to the beach (closer to the water than many of the rooms at the Marriott next door). Excellent service, clean rooms and no resort fees. Breakfast is included and is very well done. Location is convenient to shopping, restaurants, Zoo/park and beach.Would stay here again in a heart beat!

Great location, nice and clean property. Room was great. Breakfast was a bonus! We parked across the street for $15 a night, much less expensive. The staff was very, very pleasant, accommodating and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

We chose this hotel as a package deal on Priceline. It was very reasonably priced with the free breakfast package and no hotel surcharge like some other hotels. The free in-room WIFI was also a big plus. This hotel is situated towards the end of Waikiki beach area but walking distance to the Zoo and the Aquarium. The staff are friendly and really try to please. They provide beach towels for those who like going to the beach which is half a block away. Food and shopping are close by. They have a bar and food in the lobby with happy hours every day. A concierge is available to help book excursions. We booked 5 with him and were very pleased with his recommendations and the quality of the tour companies.Our standard room had a king sized bed and plenty of room. The in-room safe was huge and had room for my 17" laptop and my wife's purse. There was a desk and a 48" flat panel TV. The shower and toilet were in a separate room from the vanity. The room staff made the room up every day and kept the room clean with fresh towels and sheets.The free breakfast had lots of selections with a different egg selection every day. One day they even had eggs Benedict! They changed the selection of waffles, French toast and pancakes (one per day) and rotated bacon and sausage. There was fruit, cereal, bagels, toast, oatmeal and a selection of juices and milk. You either sit outside in a reserved area or take the food back to your room with a supplied tray. There are no aggressive birds like I've read in other reviews. Some small birds do fly into this area but they mostly pick up crumbs from the ground. It did not seem to bother other travelers who are in the outside area.I would stay here again without hesitation.

We got early checkin opted for upgraded room instead of ocean view...thiscwas our last stop after 6 nights of a great view at other hotels.......it is confusing where to go if u are a first timer in waikiki like us. They did have self park which was 5 cheaper but very limited spots. They were quick and polite...lobby is nice. Our room was clean and u can tell its an older hotel but renovated and clean....bathroom ..bathroom was upscale and renovated also. We were on 18h floor and could see city only. One block walk to beach...we only stayed 1 night and i was happy with room and service...all waikiki is crowded, stacked on top of each other..the street...kuhio is one from beach...a little scarier after dark...we stuck to walking by the main street closer to beach. Pool is small no hot tub...we didnt use it! Oh exercise room is nice too! Breakfast was typical buffet... all u can eat and after paying high prices for a week for any food this was the highlight...free food!! Clean and well stocked. Main downfall was 18th floor had a wind problem...u could hear wind whistling all night. ..not quietly. ..actually sounded like a pearl harbor air raid siren...no joke...thats what my son thought it was at first...kids slept fine...beds were comfy and clean...just too noisy! !

Hotel is just off the main Waikiki Beach walk. Rooms are awesome for extended stay or those that require room. Rooms have that feeling of home with beds separated from the living room area. Had the best-ever check-in service by Kimberly! From the onset, she was kind, professional, and extremely helpful in getting me situated with my room. Truly impressive. A definite hotel to return too!

Good location in the quiet end of Waikiki, still pretty close to the beach, comfortable bed, attractive modern decor in the room. Beach towels available at reception, which was very convenient. Very pleased overall.Had to email staff twice before arrival about the reservation and they got back to me both times with a good response.

Just returned from an 8 days 7 nights family vacation to Oahu Hawaii. 2 adults 3 kids and upon check in at the Hyatt, we were given an upgrade to a deluxe room. Can't beat that! Could be because I'm a Hyatt Gold Member but I've read other reviews of travelers who were also given an upgrade at check in as well. Whatever the reason it was great! The hotel is not directly across the Waikiki beach which is nice because that section gets so busy with tourists and traffic. It is hidden in the back and about 3 blocks from the beach but still within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants on the main Waikiki strip. The room was very spacious and clean and the queen size beds and pillows were very comfortable, even the pull out bed that my 6 year old got all to himself. As a mom traveling with children I am very picky about where we stay. My husband is also very choosy about the brand of hotels we stay at. This one did not disappoint us! It is very cleaned and well maintained. The staff are very nice and friendly and are eager to assist. There are times when they are swamped and the wait may take a while but that's a given. They have a business to run so do expect slow service at some point if they are busy. Same goes with the elevators. Several times we've had to wait for the elevators a little bit longer than the 1-2 minutes wait but never longer than 5 minutes. It wasn't a very long wait. Yes it's longer in the mornings when everyone is trying to get to breakfast on the 3rd floor. That's expected! The complimentary daily breakfast was a plus for us because it saved us money and time from having to rush out in the mornings to get breakfast. We were able to take breakfast back to our room (with the in room tray that we didn't know to take down with us the first morning but we learned quickly:-) The kids were able to eat and relax in the comfort of our room. The variety of items during breakfast was great. Hot items such as eggs, beacons, sausages, pancakes, waffles, french toasts and croissant sandwiches (need I say more?) were alternated every other day. There was plentiful of hot items every day. An array of oatmeal, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruits, muffins, bagels, toasts... there was plenty to choose from. For those reviewers who complained about the lack of breakfast items, we sure didn't see it. For being a complimentary breakfast,which is very hard to find at hotels in Hawaii, there was an abundance of food to choose from. If you are expecting gourmet breakfast food, then this is not for you. Expect more of a Denny's or Ihop type of breakfast. And we did not see any pigeon issues on the few days we ate onsite. Food on the island can get very pricey even with the "cheap eats" so having daily breakfast was a huge plus for us. The pool is small as with many hotels on the island (and we have been to Hawaii many times) but you don't come to Hawaii for the pools when there are miles and miles of beaches to explore. We went to the pool one time and everyday we were at the beach (Lanakai and Kailua were our top picks). The hotel offers sand toys for kids so you don't have to pack any or purchase them. Wish we had known to ask because we bought some the first day at the ABC store down the street. The free flower lei making on Fridays was a major hit for us. It was such a fun activity and the kids loved making their own flower leis. Overall we had a fantastic stay here and would return in the future!

For a first time trip to Honolulu, this hotel was a perfect choice! I stayed with my mom and we truly had an unforgettable experience. The room was spacious enough to where we both easily moved around and the amenities in which I partook, while not plentiful, are typical of what you'd see in a five star hotel, but at half the price. The view of the ocean is obstructed, however you are a five minute walk from the beach so walk to the beach for an uninterrupted view! From previous reviews, I was apprehensive about the elevators, but they ran smooth as butter. My mom and I never waited more than a minute or two for them. Yes there are birds at breakfast, however you are provided with trays to take food back to your room -- and newsflash, the breakfast is free so some of the entitled attitudes I've gleaned from other reviews shouldn't be taken so seriously. I love, love love the fact you can book excursions through the Expedia Desk. Chris Barzman was a great help and assisted me almost a year before my planned stay! That is exceptional service. With the excursions, you may pay a bit more, but had I not had help, there might have been something I missed. The rest of the staff, including Ciamar and Angeline were so sweet. If you want to have an awesome time and are looking for a comfortable place with great service and a reasonable price, then the Hyatt Place Waikiki is the best option for you!

Stayed 11 nights in September as a family of 4 with 2 teenagers and stayed in a Deluxe Ocean view Queen / Queen room with sofa bed on the 17th floor. Great view of the ocean if not between a couple of buildings and room was a large size with plenty of room for all our stuff. Being on 17th floor, the room was quiet and aircon worked really well which was great in the hot weather that we experienced whilst in Waikiki. Breakfast buffet was great every morning - yes there were birds but nothing that would deter you from having breakfast - appreciated the included breakfast as it filled up our teenagers before we started each day! My husband wasn't fond of the breakfast coffee but he would order coffee down in the foyer from the restaurant / bar before we headed out everyday. Lifts could be slow in peak times but didn't really bother us. Laundry facilities were great which we used a couple of times over our 11 nights.Beach towels available from front desk every time we went to the beach which was great and rooms cleaned daily by lovely cleaning staff.If we returned to Waikiki we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.........Mahalo!!

This property is in a perfect location, just a block from the beach, near the south end of Waikiki.The rooms are compact but modern will all conveniences; Wi-Fi is provided free to guests. The staff is excellent, most friendly and helpful. The breakfast is fine, very busy of course, but the quality of food offered is very good. There is also a very convenient bus stop right across the street; the city bus service in Honolulu is very good and user-friendly. The hotel staff can get you started and if you tell the driver where you are going, they will help you to the correct stops. All-in-all a very pleasant experience.

Upgraded to a huge room with sofas very comfy bed and ocean glimpses. Very strange "bathroom" there was a wash basin situated down small corridor and a door into toilet that was opposite shower, like a small cubicle, horrid and not suitable for a family. Breakfast was like a freeway stop with coffee in paper cups, not at all pleasant. Sofas in lobby were very grubby. The location was excellent just a short walk to beach, the staff were also very helpful but I'm afraid there was no atmosphere and a very forgettable experience

We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The room was very spacious, quite and comfortable with the most comfortable bed we have had in a hotel in a long time. The location is great, only 5 mins from the beach, 10 mins from the main restaurant area, with bus/trolley stops right outside. The staff were all friendly and after a 6 week trip through Alaska, Canada and Hawaii the receptionist who checked us out was one of only a couple who bothered to ask "how was your stay?". The breakfast was great, with something for everyone. The coffee was lovely and the food we ate (fruit, pastries and savoury of the day) were all very fresh and tasty and the staff did a great job of keeping the birds away. How people could complain about this is beyond me, especially seeing as it's complinentary in what is a very expensive resort area. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this hotel.

As a Place to put you head down for the night you'll not have any reasons, I think, not to like this hotel. Our room was spacious, very clean, quiet, comfortable bed, but if you like darkness while sleeping ineffective curtains. The staff were more than helpful the odd time we had need to seek their help. Located at the far end of Waikiki, not far from the Zoo, so it's a hike, for some, if you want to get into the hub if things, but enough restaurants and shops (high end and budget) near-by to pass the time should you need to. Numerous PC's with printing available and with free WiFi throughout keeping in touch with the outside world is at your finger tips, not that you would want to being only a minutes walk from the beach and all that it has to offer. So forget the tech and go explore as the staff are only too happy to point you in the right direction. OK the breakfast options are limited for some, you may tire of it after a few days but it is more than enough to get you started, and besides it's not that type of hotel to have a sleep in and have a lazy day by the pool. Get the fuel in and then get out and about, after-all you're in Hawaii and it is a long way from anywhere so make the most of it, we did.

Stayed for 8 nights with 3 adults in one room. The room was clean and the location was walking distance to the beach and great shopping/restaurants. The breakfast was wonderful too. Most importantly was the kind and accommodating staff! They were great! I would recommend this hotel and would certainly go there again!
user_name:
Cathy T
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: Great hotel with great food at the lounge/bar lobby area. Negatives - Breakfast was just ok (lots of birds to contend with as the outside area is open). Pool area really had no wow factor at all and adjoined breakfast area. Room was small but very comfortable with great ac and a good sized balcony (view of mountains was just ok).Location is excellent with just a short 1 minute stroll to a great beach, shops, restaurants.

Stayed for 11 nights with 5 of us in one room. Good location, great staff and facilities fine for the price. Breakfast was sufficient for us, the kids loved the variety and the novelty of pancakes,waffles and bacon for breakfast. Lifts were ok on our building, its a numbers thing really, if everyone decides to go to breakfast at the same time, delays will happen, but hey, you're on holidays anyway. Happy hour and food all good, Nick the barman friendly. Pity about the pool being closed (offer to use other pool should have been in the letter). Expedia desk staff very helpful. Pull out bed wasn't exactly cosy ( a little squeaky) and was just adequate for our 6 ft long 14 year old. Great value and stay for us. Would have enjoyed a better cable TV experience but still ok. Wifi was a bonus for our devices.Great experience for our first overseas holiday!

Stayed at the Hyatt Place for 6 nights with 3 teenage children. Location is good - seemed to be a quieter part of the main town area. Short stroll to beach and park area overlooking the beach. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was simple but being included in room price for fabulous. Our only sad point was the pool was closed for scheduled maintenance - we were told until check-in and was due to be out of use for our entire stay - thankfully it was finished early and back in use for the last few days. Would suggest asking reception to book a taxi/cab to travel anywhere - very efficient and cheap. Facilities were good too - laundry with washers and dryers was very much appreciated for extended stay. Would recommend Hyatt Place and would stay again.

What a great place and location. The staff was so informative and friendly. The front desk clerk Annabelle was terrific. What a great smile and wonderful personality she has. What an asset! The hotel was updated and very clean. We did upgrade to an ocean view but they are all fine. Would stay there again. The breakfast was great and what a variety to choose from.

My wife and I stayed in this hotel for almost a week, the bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean, all the mods and cons, the breakfast was very good lots to choose from, hot or cold, but if your fussy and like a cooked breakfast just the way you wand there are plenty of café's and restaurants near bye, I quite liked the large amount of choice they had.The location was perfect for tours as all the bus and trolleys start right out the front of the building, if you want to go to town its just $2 by trolley (bus). very convenient and reasonable, We would definitely stay here again

Currently spending 7 nights at this hotel and have a nice room on level 15 with views of Diamond head and a limited view of the ocean.Breakfast is provided but is mainly high carb fair which I try and avoid. Its a shame there isn't more fresh fruit available although they do provide apples in the lobby. There does need to be more seating in the breakfast area.Gym is standard hotel gym and fine for a quick workout.Location is good and only a short stroll to the main shopping area. The hotel is not on the beach but if the beach is your thing then its only a 5 minute walk away.Wifi is free and has been reliable.Main issues I have had are:Lifts are dreadfully slow and I've sometimes waited 5 minutes at busy times. I'm not sure the hotel can do anything about this.When I checked in I was told the pool is being renovated but the sister hotels pool could be used. The problem is the sister hotel is 3 blocks away and its annoying having to plan around going to the pool rather than just wandering down to it when you feel like it. I'm annoyed the Hyatt didn't inform me of this before I checked in because I would have likely changed my booking to another hotel. The sister pool is also very noisy with construction work going on at the hotel so no much chance for peace and quiet. As I said the beach isn't far away but I'm not a beach person.

We stayed at Hyatt place and we're pleased with everything. Staff are friendly, rooms are spacious and clean. It suited exactly what we needed. A place to sleep that's comfortable and close to everything in Waikiki. It's super close to the beach but if you want a hotel on the beach then this isn't for you. They have happy hour from 4-6 pm and have wine tasting on Wednesday. Breakfast is included which is eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, toast/bagels/English muffins and fruit. They have coffee and juices. ProsLocationServiceRoomsBreakfast includedConsPool is average and was closed for construction during our stay. The bright side was that you were able to use the facilities at the grand Hyatt down the road which had better facilities.
user_name:
pink7oreo
New York City, New York

review_body: We were pleased with our stay at Hyatt Place, the room was quite large and offered some ocean views. It was a short stroll to the beach and nearby restaurants, it was all we expected.The bar area was great for pre-dinner drinks and the included breakfast was adequate, Free wifi was good.As others have mentioned if you want beachfront stay elsewhere but you will pay a lot more.

We stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki for a week on our honeymoon. Love the fact that the hotel is within walking distance to the beach, close to the shops and restaurants, and that most tours pick up / drop off are either in front of the hotel or close by. Our booking included breakfast which was an added bonus. Everyone we dealt with were so friendly and helpful. It was our first visit to Hawaii and we couldn't be more impressed!! We will definitely come back, maybe next year for our 1st anniversary

We stayed at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki for two nights at the start of our two weeks on Oahu. Our stay didn't get off to a great start at check in when a young boy ducked in front of us and asked for a room key as he'd lost his and couldn't get access to his room. This was after midnight (not sure what this boy was doing out on his own at that hour!) and it took the desk clerk at least ten minutes to sort this issue out. In this time, nobody acknowledged us - no eye contact, no apology. We just stood there feeling very tired as our flight had been delayed from New Zealand and we just wanted to get to our room.Finally some other desk clerk came up to us, asked if we'd been looked after - we said No! She checked us in promptly but again no apology. This is so unlike Hawaii and we were quite shocked. After the bad start - everything else was great. The room was spacious, newly renovated and comfortable in every way. The bathroom was good, the bed comfortable and air conditioning worked quietly and efficently. The "ocean view" was a joke, but I expected that from the location back from the beach. Free wifi worked well - was speedy and easy to connect to.The free breakfast was adequate but I certainly wouldn't rave about it. It changes each day and it's just lucky if you get something that you like, especially in the hot section. The pool is a wind tunnel, but for us this wasn't a problem as the beach is a block away.We considered the Hyatt Place to be good, solid value for money in a good location.

We booked and paid top dollar for this " Hyatt" Hotel in short we could have stayed at a true 4 star hotel for equal or better price . rooms dated ,not to the spec and decor as depicted on site . when we complained about this we were reluctantly moved to another room but well short of what we paid for , staff were just going through the motions stay elsewhere !

In Waikiki you have the option to pay normal or double. Normal for this place, double for first row hotels, but sharing the same beach and having the same small pools. So... Nice rooms, spacious and confortable, Hyatt style. Great balcony with nice views - if you choose the ocean ones. Good service, kind staff. Very clean, beach towels to borrow, nice but small pool and free wifi. Breakfast is included, eggs, pastry, Japanese food, bagels and cream cheese. Enough... Downstairs is also a Lawson convenience store but is pricey. Try other options around or the small cafe offering Starbucks and sandwiches. The only costly is the valet parking, 30$ per day. Parking is small so valet has priority. Or you can find parking outside yourself. Lots of restaurants nereby and walk to the great beach for 3 minutes. Great place...

Spent three nights at this hotel. We had a fab stay. On the tenth floor with a sea view the room was clean and the bed and the bed linen was extremely good. The buffet breakfast was lovely with plenty of choice, even porridge, there had to be something you liked for everyone. The fresh pineapple was delicious. Nick was great behind the bar and Chris organised some great trips for us. Thanks to Jarren at the front desk for all his help. Friendly staff. Would definitely recommend the Hyatt Place. Hope to return one day and stay longer.

We stayed here for 2 weeks at the of September 2014 and got a great deal. There is nothing bad to say about this place, just stay there. Have a cold Kona Longboard at the bar during happy hour and talk to Nick about rugby. Thanks Nick for been a great been a great dude.

we were very impressed with the staff and facilities ...they were very friendly and courteous people and that continental breakfast has the be experienced to be believed esp the fresh pineapple i could have eaten buckets of it...the concierge "Chris" was able to help us with all aspects of our stay and was responcible for the experience of a lifetime being a helicopter ride over the island of Oahu ...he also guided us perfectly to the shopping centres and food outlets that met our many needs...Overall a stay at this hotel cannot be faulted in my view...and...indeed we have booked to return in Feb 2015 for a further stay...This hotel would figure highly on any list I put together to recommend people to stay at...
user_location: Kings Langley, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Chris W
Kings Langley, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: This is a wonderful hotel in a good location. The room was large with a view of Diamond Head from our balcony. The rate includes a good breakfast buffet - loved the fresh pineapple every day in addition to hot and cold other breakfast options. Most of the tour buses pick up right across the street. The beach is only 2 blocks away. Many good restaurants within walking distance. Staff was friendly and helpful.

We loved this hotel! We only stayed one night because of our itinerary but we had an excellent experience. Check-in was fast and very friendly. The bell desk was extremely helpful telling us that we could park at the public facility just diagonally from the hotel since the self-parking option was full at the hotel. This parking is 15$ with in and out privileges. The room was really nice, spacious and very clean. As a frequent business traveller, I have certain particularities about hotels and this room did not trigger any of them. I don't think you will get any breathtaking views from this hotel because it is about a block from the beach surrounded by other tall buildings, but we did have a great view of Diamond Head and the sea from our room. Breakfast (included) is surprisingly really good and extensive. Their little pastries are so fresh and buttery! Yes, there are birds, but what can you do? The Wi-Fi was at an excellent speed as well. The gym is well stocked and will allow you to keep up with your gym routine. There is a convenience store that sells Asian food too in the same building, along with other souvenirs as well as an ABC store just down the street. In fact, those stores are everywhere! This is not a resort and I think that is part of its charm. It is a tall, but smallish hotel with a focus on excellent customer service and we were so glad to have stayed here, even for 1 night.

Hotel has pretty decent location to Waikiki Beach. Rooms good but not perfect, our sliding door to porch was broken but porch looked over parking lot and old apartments anyway....no view when we were told we had one. Fold out bed had a bit of odor to it! Front desk was only average, they wouldn't mail a post card for us!!! Bell staff was great though, quick to respond and correct directions. Breakfast buffet was very average and too crowded, foreign tourists pushing and shoving everywhere!
user_name:
Stoney F
