Palo Alto, California, United States

review_body: The perfect location a few minutes walk from the beach. Very clean hotel with a nice open, airy lobby area. The room was a comfortable size, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very extensive and better than I expected. People are complaining about the birds in other reviews, quite frankly I don't get it. Yes !!! there are birds. Lots of them !! You are sitting outside. They are perched above waiting for people to get up and leave their plate so they can swoop down and have a feast. The hotel has put deterents out there but there are just far too many birds out there. If you have an issue with nature then I'd say eat in your room. They provide a wood tray in your room specifically for those that would like pick up breakfast from the buffet and go back to their room. It does get very crowded outside, so it's nice to have the option. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and it exceeded the expectations that I had . I will definitely stay here again when in Waikiki.

We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The front desk staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. We were in a deluxe mountain view room; we faced Diamond Head and also had a partial ocean view. We were on the 17th floor and the room was totally quiet, but I imagine city noise could be an issue on lower floors. The deluxe room was very spacious, modern, clean and comfortable. We appreciated the mini-fridge and large HDTV, and the free wireless internet was reliable and fast. The included free breakfast was quite good, with several hot items, fresh fruit, juice, cereal, and tasty pastries. The staff did a great job keeping it stocked. There are only two elevators for the deluxe tower, but we didn't have any issues with waits. The location is very good--you're just a short walk to Kuhio Beach Park, one of the better places to swim on Waikiki Beach. It's about a 10 minute walk to the largest collection of shops and restaurants in Waikiki. We really appreciated that the Hyatt Place doesn't charge a resort fee--one of the few in Waikiki not to. When you consider that and the included breakfast, it's a better value that many hotels that initially seem to have lower rates. As long as you're not looking for an oceanfront property with uninterrupted views of the water, the Hyatt Place is an outstanding choice, offering great value, location, and comfort. We would absolutely return.

Stayed here 3 times this trip, fantastic value. Service exceptional, wifi unbelievably good. Rooms are huge for a family and views gorgeous. Doesn't matter at all that you are a block back from the beach, takes 2 minutes to walk there. Don't need to be on the beach to still feel like you are amongst it all. Would recommend to all to stay here!! My only gripe is the carpet was dirty in all our rooms - like filthy soles of your feet dirty and the pigeons that hang out on the umbrellas at breakfast are a bit grotty. Pigeons are really not the hotels fault as they try and try to get rid of them but it still is yuck.

First of all, location is Perfect. It's only 5min away from the waikiki beach and close to all-day parking spot.Second, all the staffs are friendly and great. On my checking in, the front desk clerk upgraded my room and gave me a short tour of the hotel.Last but not least, event board and having breakfast in the room was useful.One thing I think should been taken care of is their elevater. It was out of order for couple of busiest hours due to overweight of the capacity. It wouldn't happen if the elevater facility were enough.

I went here last week for 5 days with my sisters. When we arrived they upgraded us at no charge to a room with two queen beds and pull out couch. The person at the front desk then showed us to the elevators while explaining all the amenities to us. Really top notch. We were on the 2nd floor which I would get again since the elevators are slow so we just walked up to our room all to the time. We loved our room and the pillows are so comfy I'm buying some! The bathroom is small but at least the toilet was separate from the sink. Worked for us! They have breakfast everyday included with Starbucks coffee. It really started our day off right. The pool is small but who goes in the pool in Hawaii?!? It is a two minute walk to the beach and restaurants/stores. There is an ABC store next door which has everything you could possibly want including liquor/food/rafts. I highly suggest buying a $2.99 raft and for an extra .60 they blow it up for you and get a snorkel kit for $6.99. If you leave the hotel and walk to the beach walk left until you get to the beach cafe. There is great snorkeling that people don't know about right there!! I also did the lei making class which was fun but get there early! They have wine/cheese tasting in the bar. You can rent bikes and scooters around the corner. I would also highly suggest renting a car for a day to your the island and check out turtle island. It is worth it! It was an amazing stay and couldn't have asked for better for the price!! We will be back next year for sure!!

I stayed at this hotel twice on a 2 week trip to Hawaii. The first time was for 4 nights and then I returned 10 days later for my last night in Hawaii after visiting Kauai, Maui and the Big Island. Had a king room with an ocean view the first time and an upgraded king with a city view the second time. Their regular room is fine but if you really want to have a lot of room . . . . about 25% larger . . . . . the upgrade is a bargain. Both rooms came with FREE wi-fi and a refrigerator too. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the service couldn't have been better. It a short block to the beach and only a half block to an ABC Store (like a 7-11) where you can get everything from liquor to a salad 24 hours a day. Another plus is that it is across the street from a Marriott where all of the tour companies pickup their clients. You can just walk across the street and jump on your bus for a booked tour. There is a tour desk in the lobby of the hotel with helpful service. We got back late one night and tried the individual pizzas that you can order in the lobby. They were great. The FREE breakfast buffet on the third floor roof deck is very good too. They had a change of offerings each day. Tip : If you need a cab, they have an agreement with Charlie's Taxi, 808-233-3333, for a $29.00 set price to or from the hotel and the airport.

The good stuff-Very close to the beach. And if you have a car and want to get out of Waikiki for a while, Kapahulu Ave to the H1 freeway is a block away. There are also bus stops on either side of Kuhio right across the street. Close to and great views of Diamond Head.The rooms are clean and were updated a couple of years ago. The WiFi works well for a hotel. WiFi is free by the way. The included breakfast was of good quality and variety. The coffee could be better though.There is a convenience store just off the lobby of the hotel and an ABC Store (better selection) on the next block. Quiet bar & lounge in the lobby.The not-so-good stuff-The birds in the breakfast area. Others have mentioned this and they are a bit a nuisance. The hotel has clearly tried to deal with the issue but it doesn't appear they're having much luck. I would suggest getting a cat. Guests can use the tray in their room to collect breakfast and take it back to the room if they want. I'm used to Hyatt's having very comfortable beds and fortunately my room had 2 queen beds because one of them wasn't comfortable. The air conditioner didn't cool the room very well. And there was a partial divider (probably to hide the a/c unit) that basically cut off half the room from the a/c. They could really use a fan or ceiling fan to move the cool air around. Note- this is an ocean view room on the 14th floor.Minor gripes-The popcorn ceiling in the room... makes the remodel seem pretty low budget. The paint job wasn't very good either. There were also numbers written on the tiles in the shower probably from when they were cut. Makes me wonder how thoroughly the showers are cleaned. Housekeeping did a nice job but a couple of times I went back to my room around 3PM and it wasn't ready.The pool is small and best for small kids that may not like the ocean. Just wait until the breakfast crowd clears out after 10am. While I didn't have any bad encounters with the staff, there isn't much aloha here. Stuff to know-Self parking $25/night (limited spaces), Valet $30. Less expensive parking available at the adjacent Waikiki Banyan Free WiFiFree BreakfastNo resort changeHotel has 2 towers (2 old hotels combined into the Hyatt Place)- Pali w/ 2 elevators and more floors (19 I think) & Diamond Head w/ 3 elevators and 14 floors (ok, 13 really) I was in the Diamond Head tower and didn't have any long waits for an elevator like some have mentioned.
user_name:
Chris H
Brentwood, California, United States

review_body: We have stayed in several Hyatt Place locations, and always been impressed. This once looks to have seen a bit more use, but was very well kept and clean. The staff was awesome. My husband discovered his ID was missing when we were out on an excusion, and a quick call to tje hotel had the housekeeping supervisor scouring the room for it. She immediately sent a text when the search was complete.

Loved this hotel - comfortable beds and pillows, balconies, generous sized shower with good pressure shower nozzle, delicious breakfasts, the reception staff could not do enough for youand the best part is there is no traffic noise. Would definitely stay here again.

This place was exactly how I had imagined it. I arrived around 6pm for an eight night stay and was greeted right away by Christopher, who was very nice and very helpful. Throughout my stay the staff was always friendly and attentive. The place looked nice and homey. Free wifi and breakfast with rooms.I was given room 911 with a partial ocean view, king sized standard. The hotel is not oceanfront but you could see a little bit of the ocean from my room. The room was small but not that small as others have said. I thought it was roomy enough and extremely comfortable. I was a solo traveler though too. Everything in the room was good quality. My location was extremely quiet. The only thing I did hear was at times sirens from the street at times. I never heard my neighbors and I never heard a bunch of traffic. It has it's own temperature control, a small balcony which was nice to lay my wet swimming gear out to dry daily. The bathroom was nice with a glass shower and toilet in one area and the sink located near the bathroom but not in the shower area. I liked this set up. Free safe that I used daily. Came with just soap, shampoo and conditioner. No lotion. The products were good quality and replenished daily by housekeeping. Housekeeping was nice. They normally wouldn't get to my room until around 2 or 3pm in the afternoon. I think they work the checked out rooms first that's why it was so late. They did a good job. It would have been nice to have it done by noon because that's when I would normally come back to my hotel to rest. I eventually just had them do the room up every other day since I would get kind of tired in the afternoon and wanted to rest sometimes. Hawaii is hot in August and it wears you out. The TV channels were limited and I had a hard time finding things to watch during my down time. That could definitely be improved. I've heard from other reviews that the elevators were slow but I did not experience this so I must have been in the tower with the fast elevators. You need your room card to use the elevators and mine sometimes did not work. Breakfast was the same every day with two rotating hot items. It was just okay. The one thing I liked the best about the breakfast was really the fresh fruit. Other than that it was not spectacular but it wasn't horrible either. I got up every morning to eat it because it was included, it does the job. Cereal, rice, kim shee, miso soup, cottage cheese, toast, some pastries, mini donuts, bagels, two kinds of yogurt, fresh pineapple or pineapple mixed with some melons were provided. The hot items that were rotated were scrabbled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, and a little biscuit topped with eggs on it. Drinks would include tomato, apple, orange juice and milk.I would sometimes bring extra fruit and put it in my small refrigerator for a later snack:)I did see the birds going after food a few times I went down when other people would leave their plates to go get something. The birds were aggressive and would fly over you. That was kind of gross. The last couple days I would take the tray the Hyatt provides from my room and just bring it to my room. I don't like birds.Beach towels were provided at the front but you had to check them out and then return them by given your room number you could take as many as you wanted. Some were provided near the pool as well. The pool was small and located near the breakfast area on floor three. I had wanted to use the pool but for some reason it was shutdown the two days I went to go use it. I never saw the gym area so I can't comment on that.There was a concierge on the main level if you wanted to book any fun activities. I never spoke to them but they were there everyday for most of the day. There was also, a small snack shop located near the front area by the elevators and a little store near the back elevators by concierge. The lobby area has a TV and some nice comfortable chairs, there is a small restaurant type bar that serves food and drinks. And I think there was a daily happy hour I never took advantage off.The beach was about a three minute walk and a protective walled area in the ocean so you could do some late night swimming and not worry about sharks. ABC store was a minute walk, literally. The pink trolley conveniently had a stop right in front of the ABC store, and the bus stops were also conveniently located right in front of the hotel on Kuhlio. Really nice. I used them both.This location had some wonderful food options. Just down the street about a 10 minute walk was Rainbow drive inn. Teddy's Burgers was two blocks away as was Wolf Gang Puck Express and Mee's BBQ was about three blocks away. The location was kind of far from all the action especially in the hot sun.I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to someone. I did think the location was a little too far from the places I normally like to go but that's not the hotels fault. This hotel is really nice and I think it's a safe place to stay. I got this deal off hotwire but I really wished I would have just booked direct. Hyatt offers a price guarantee on their website so if you are thinking about staying there do your price research.All and all I would stay here again if the price was right. I was not a perfect stay but I don't have a lot to complain about either. Check out was a breeze and they held my luggage for me because I had a late flight. Overall nice stay. The place was clean.

"We had a marvelous stay in Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach Hotel, We've been to a different Hyatt Place but I think this is one of the best and bigger Hyatt Place. Wonderful interiors, very good service and some excellent dining around the area and specially it's only couple blocks away from the beach.... yey!!!, must recommend this hotel Very reasonably priced, free WIFI, and also free breakfast. It's worth it coming to Hawaii and what else can you complain for; its hard to find a hotel that has free breakfast. Breakfast employee and the food are awesome - Housekeeping clean the room very well... and lastly - saved the BEST for last the Front of the House (always say Aloha, How's your day!, Hi, Mahalo, Have a great one, :) it makes your day/night so wonderful) Christopher, Ciamar, and specially to Hidelisa that help us a lot and recommend us the best things to do in Honolulu. The only bad things that happened is.... Long story short: when I asked them to make me a drink in the morning - (Terance & Troy was at the bar at that time) they said they, "No can't make it" and I asked, Do you have Champagne and Orange Juice and they said Yes but we're not allowed to make Mimosa... so anyway I just went to the beach and get some Mimosa from other Bar. Beside that - We enjoy very much!!!

Nice modern rooms. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I just checked out a few days ago and i dont regret one bit staying at this hotel. Everyonee was so friendly and helpful. Especailly Ciamar who always had a smile on who helped me checked in when I arrived and also signed me up for the gold passport program which I think is great. The bartender Cole was awesome too. He kept me entertained while I sat at the bar for a few drinks after work. He knows how to make drinks very well. Happy hour is awesome and I must say that they make the best mai tai's. Everyone always greeted me whenever i walked in the hotel after work. It felt really nice. Upon check out i had to rush to get my car at the banyan and I didnt wanna bring all my stuff. Christopher held my bags and waited for me to drive my car up the ramp then helped me load my stuff in. Very nice and helpful bell man! Free breakfast is a huge plus especially since breakfast in waikiki is so expensive. Overall the hotel and staff were all great. But the staffs who I wont forget is Ciamar, Cole and Christopher. Hope to see them there on my next visit this December!

I had to start my title with the best news. If you are traveling with older kids and need to share a bed with them, then you know what a plus having queen size beds (not double) are. Thank you for Hyatt Place, for a good nights sleep!When we booked our stay here, it was in order to move my daughter into college so being off the beach wasn't a big deal. I would still trade queen size beds for a 2 minute walk to the beach any day!I was pleased with the breakfast in the morning. It wasn't too crazy busy to us, we stayed near the end of August. Good food, and nice to have one less thing to worry about. The rooms were cool and comfortable, the mini fridge in the room is always a plus! If I came back to Waikiki Beach, I would stay here again for sure.

Rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast is free and isn't terrible, but a challenge keeping the birds off of your table and out of your food.:) Lobby is cozy. Valet is $30 a day and a surprise when you check out because they do not advise you of the cost. My best advice would be to request a high floor as it is quite noisy. Most "Ocean View" rooms have obstructed views of the ocean so if you're on a budget opt out of the l upgrade and save your money. Oh and the little store next to the elevator has FANTASTIC sushi!

This hotel is about 2 mins walking to the beach. Customer service is very attentive. .we had no problem checking in. Breakfast is free and it's continental ..don't expect much but will get you thru the morning. We had a penthouse room ocean view it's very roomy and clean. .no problem whatsoever. The negative (air conditioning is a bit loud) and it's right above our bed blowing away.Other then that..the price is right and the location is superb. We will be back.

Had a good experience over a week long stay. Breakfast was simple, but when traveling as a family we always vey much appreciate having breakfast included from perspective of both ease and value. 16th floor room in the Pali tower provided excellent vistas of diamond head and partial ocean view - worth requesting. Pool is small and not much of a draw compared to more 'resort' type properties. If I had to find fault in something, as other reviewers have noted the elevators are slow - especially in the AM breakfast rush. But you may as well, slow down and run on Hawaiian time while you're here.

I am a big Hyatt fan and typically I stay at the Hyatt Regency three blocks over in Honolulu. However, due to price gouging because it was a holiday weekend at the HR Honolulu, I elected to stay at the Hyatt Place instead. I gave it average ratings and if you are on a budget it is a good option for Waikiki as there are so many beat up run down hotels on the strip. Very few justify the prices charged on the beach so if you do not mind two blocks back and you can get a good price go for it. Here are my pros and cons:Pros:decent pricing compared to other similar hotels but shop around as this hotel goes up or down based on occupancy. They have a Hyatt bonus program for this property right now so that helps. With the 20% Diamond discount our room was around $154 a night and they do not charge the rip off resort fee so many do in Waikiki. The room was a good size and they did a decent job of remodeling the rooms from its former owners. The bed was comfortable and the move about area good. The shower/toilet worked fine and the towels were a good size. Beach towels you get downstairs for the beach. Because it is a Hyatt Place they provide free breakfast on the 3rd floor and it is typical "motel breakfast included" food. There is a bar and starbucks machine on the lobby level for those who want real coffee or a bar drink. The lobby area is well laid out and comfortable to hang out as I am doing now.The internet service works fine in both room and lobby.Staff really try hard to be friendly and helpful. It is very obvious that the management puts great stress on that point and thank you it is appreciated. (not the phony marketing campaign called the aloha spirit....barf)Cons:Very few rooms with any kind of view except the building next door. Being a diamond member I only got the category paid for. No upgrade but the hotel was packed for sure. We had a tiny partial view of Diamond Head.The pool really sucks. Small and not inviting. It is joined by the area set up for the free breakfast.The free breakfast was generally disgusting. Coffee was not starbucks and weak. The eggs were right out of the wholesale milk carton that so many places now use to make scrambled eggs. To me it is tough and tasteless. The bacon or sausage was microwaved and devoid of flavor. Fruit tended to be overripe and the breads mini mart quality. Cereal was fine with some standard yoghurt. All in all typical of low end motels which offer a free breakfast. You get what you pay for.Parking is a mess on the beach and the hotel charges $25 for self parking (even though their sign says $18) and $30 for valet. The hotel needs to provide a map with notes explaining where to park. The streets are one way and after driving around twice we finally saw a sign self parking but as we entered a car came roaring down the ramp. So the entry and exit are the same for self parking and no way to determine who should give the right of way. If you can get a spot at the zoo parking two blocks away it is much cheaper than the hotel. All hotels in Waikiki charge highway robbery prices to park. AC did work but it was loud and we felt you needed to have the fan on high to keep the room cool. If we opened the sliding glass door it was way too noisy and hot. Maybe in the winter months?

We stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach from 8/25 - 8/28. We chose a Hyatt property because we wanted to maintain our Platinum membership with Hyatt. Moreover, Hyatt Place was less expensive than Hyatt Regency. We also knew we would be hanging out at the beach more often than in the hotel, thus we proceeded with this reservation. Front desk service was good - as we'd expect from Hyatt. Yet, the housekeeping service was deplorable. For 3 consecutive stays, we found out that our room was not cleaned even after we left our room for more than 5 hrs. The housekeeping lady came by when we were in the room after we had been out twice for several hours. We asked her to come back in 10 minutes so that we could get ready to go out and let her clean. She pulled a face and snarled "I will try to clean the room!" . We understand that being a housekeeper is not a high paying job so, we left $5 bill on the table for her. Later on after our room was serviced, we found out that nothing was tidied up except the bed linen and towels. The $5 was gone, of course! Will we stay at Hyatt Place Waikiki in the future ? No ! Our experience here was really not the Hyatt experience that we would expect.

I usually stay at the Hyatt Regency but had to stay here when they filled up. I'm glad I did and will stay here more often. This is a more price friendly option and you get about as much. You won't get a view room and are not right across the street from the beach, but you are a few minute walking distance from the main strip. Also, the rooms are great, spacious and comfortable. The staff is great and very friendly. You are basically in the same area as the Regency and have all the same options at nearly half the price. I didn't get to the pool this trip.

My stay last week at the Waikiki Hyatt Place was excellent. I am actually an employee of another well-known chain but was unable to get my discount. So it was my 1st stay in over 15 years at a different chain. We were upgraded to a deluxe room with a view of Diamond Head. Chris, Chamar & Anabelle at the front desk were amazing, especially Chris, who called me by name from the first day & always had a friendly smile & cheerful attitude. We LOVED the breakfast (so many selections & and variety each day), the size of our room and the proximity to restaurants, the beach & shopping. Cameron at the tour desk was also so helpful. Housekeeping did a great job, especially since we were moving my daughter to the university (lots of stuff). We used the business center & had snacks from the restaurant. I especially appreciated the fact that there wasn't a resort fee. It was also quiet- I never heard guests in the hallway. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this property again!

We're Hyatt Platinum members and stayed at plenty of Hyatts throughout the world. This Hyatt Place is wonderful for a Hyatt stay. Typical Hyatt standards and taste in the room/lobby/service. The hotel is located within a 5 minutes walk to the Waikiki beach and the main Waikiki walkway. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. I recommend the Italian restaurant located in the Sheraton across the street. The hotel offered a free breakfast that was above average. Valet parking only ($$$$). There's a public garage a couple blocks away. The Hyatt Regency has better views and it's right on the main Waikiki strip, but it can also be almost 2X as much than this Hyatt. If you're the type that you won't be at the hotel much (visiting the beach, Pearl Harbour, etc...), the room is perfect, and the location is great. Save your money and stay here instead. Hit thumbs up if helpful :)

Travelled to Oahu in August 14 with virgin holidays. The Hotel seemed to be in a good location near to the beach and the free breakfast offering seemed to make the property a good deal. This is only true if you have no aversion to sharing your breakfast with 20 to 30 pigeons who are happy to eat from your plates whether or not you are eating from it. Take my advice, book another property. I raised this with the hotel but they were uninterested. Very poor hygiene!!!

I have stayed at a few Hyatt place locations, this does not represent the brand. Rooms are really small. If you have little kids it may work for you. On the positive side the location is great and the daily breakfast is good. If we had been there a week I would have been bored with the food and gotten a divorce from my family!It felt like a slightly refreshed hotel that Hyatt Place branded. They can do better

Only spent 1 night at Hyatt Place Waikiki (family 4 with 2 kids 9 & 13 yrs). Rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed. Staff really helpful and friendly - even the morning of the Hurricane when breakfast was full to capacity, with nearly everything in Waikiki closed and gail force winds blowing. Hotel is a couple of blocks back from the beach, in a quiet location. Would definitely stay again.

This was our second stay to what I think is a well located hotel in Waikiki. However checkin has been a nightmare on both occasions. Each time we have arrived we have had to walk the streets to fill in several hours until our room was ready - OK- I can handle that. However each time on our return ready to book in the ocean view room we have paid for 2 adults with 2 queen beds ( and confirmed by email 2 days before arrival) has not been available. We were given a dark "king" bed room and as a passing comment told is we need help with the fold out let them know. Only after complaining ( which is degrading to all parties who happen to be in reception listening) was the room type which we booked available in 4 days time ( half way through our stay). After fronting back to the reception yet again waving the confirmation email ( which they claimed they didn't know who sent) were we able to get a room with two beds for 1 night and the type we actually booked for the rest. As this has happened twice I am starting to think they just take bookings regardless of availability then hope people are so tired from their flight they will accept any room. Breakfast is included which is a bonus however most items are sugary. I feel extremely sorry for the staff as it is constantly windy so they are always having to fish out items blown into the pool and shooing away birds stealing food. A little renovation or innovation to this area would make this experience more pleasant for all concerned. The rooms are a good size and clean however after this time I would think twice before I booked here again.

We went to Hawaii with my daughters marching band. It was a trip of a life time. For the total trip price we were not expecting too much in the way of the hotel. We were so pleasantly surprised. For one thing our group had 175 people. The hotel got us checked in with no problem. The hotel lobby was large enough for us to meet as a group. It was also open air with large fans. It made you want to sit and relax. There are several small shops to get drinks, snacks, gifts and common necessities. The rooms were clean and updated a few years ago and are very tastefully decorated. The employees were supper friendly and helpful and will even take pictures with you. The ONLY thing negative is the elevator. Here in the south would say they are slow as molasses! Be prepared to walk the stairs or wait at least 10 minutes for the elevator. Remember I said it was an open air lobby? Don't forget your room key because you have to have it to use the elevator, this is for safety reasons . There is a pretty nice breakfast provided every morning. Generally the meat is the only thing that changes. Of coarse there is always pineapple. There is also asian menu items provided. The breakfast is served outside on the patio by the pool. It was wonderful to be eating pineapple in Hawaii outside! There may not always be a place to sit but they have trays so you can take your breakfast back to your room. The hotel is not on the beach but it is a very short walk...a block. There are several restaurants nearby. Tiki's, Lulu's, Wolf Gang Puck express, and Starbucks are in short walking distance. There are many more for little bit longer distance walking. Cheeseburger in Paradise, Dukes, Hard Rock and jimmy Buffett's etc. There is an aquarium and zoo near by also. OH the beach! The hotel is close to surf board and paddle board rentals. You must take a catamaran ride. There is so much to do and you can walk to most of it right from the hotel.
user_location: Rock Hill, South Carolina, United States
user_name:
Chell1971
Rock Hill, South Carolina, United States

review_body: Smaller sized rooms, yes, but great value! Super close to the beach, Waikiki strip, ABC stores, restaurants, bus lines, the zoo, moped rentals (which are fantastic btw). Not much that wasn't in the hotel or a quick walk away. The gentleman that checked us in was great! We had a complicated set of reservations since it was booked using rewards points and regular payment. We ate at the gallery the first day we arrived and the food was great, pricey of course because you're in a hotel (#1) and in Hawaii (#2). That also contributes to the size of the rooms since space is so limited on the island, not sure why people coming about things that are out of one's control.We don't like using housekeeping services so I can't comment on that but the one day we did need to stock up on everything, the housekeeper was extremely friendly and organzied.The pool was fine, small yes but again that goes with space limitation. It was clean and the area was well kept. Breakfast should not be anything one complains about. They have a variety of items daily and always well stocked along with friendly staff that have to clean up after adults who think they have maids!! There are birds present obviously because it is outside but if you don't drop your food or feed them they won't bother you, even if you do they only want the food (NOT YOU!) They have had the best selection I've seen for complimentary breakfast, another reason to not complain.Our stay was fabulous and it upsets me to know that people are so meticulous and harsh in their reviews as if they are staying at a resort. Thank you for the great service, clean room, and wonderful honeymoon. Mahalo.

Nice big rooms, very clean, front desk staff answer your questions but not overly personable.Nice beach at top of street...bit of a walk from main street. Stayed at two other hotels in Waikiki and this had the second best room. Probably would stay again or maybe somewhere in the centre of town.

I stayed just one night in this hotel as a stop over. The room size was fantastic, and the rooms were clean and nice. A little corporate, but overall great. Other reviewers complained about the speed and availability of elevators, but this was not a problem for me for such a short stay . I could see how it might get frustrating for longer stay/ or if travelling with children etc. Staff very pleasant. Location great.
user_name:
Kelly F
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We stayed here twice over the last two weeks and really enjoyed it.The first time we were up on the 18th floor with a view of the ocean. Not being beachfront, there are a couple of buildings that partially obstruct the view, but we could see more than enough to get the Hawaiian 'vibe' going. The other advantage is that you can see down to the area where breakfast is served, cunningly timing things to go down when it is least busy. The second time we were on the city side with not much of a view, though a cheaper rate. Both of the rooms were big, clean and the bed very comfortable. Breakfast was included in the cost and was pretty good. Other have mentioned the pigeons and they can be pretty full-on. Don't leave food on the table unguarded. The Hotel has tried putting shiny things around to deter them, but they do not seemed bothered. Short of a golf club being issued to everyone, I'm not sure of an easy solution. One of the staff (I think his name was Fred, apologies if incorrect) was a crack shot with a squirt bottle and there did not seem to be a problem when he was on patrol.The staff were friendly and helpful with suggestions. Free and reliable WiFi was cool.The location is excellent with the beach a few minutes walk away. The nearest section of beach also has a breakwater so pretty good for kids. Two of the Waikiki Trolley lines stop just up the road and I understand that one of the shuttles to Waikele stops outside.

I had Stayed in this hotel 2 years ago, i Think close to the opening and had a fantastic staying: booked city view room and got upgraded to ocean view room very large, without asking as a loyal GOLD passaport MEMBER. This time I Stayed 5 nights in august, booked an ocean view room and Was given a very small room on another tower. 2 people and the bags could Berely stay. Luckily we Stayed all day around but 250 dollars plus taxes is too much Even for waikiki for such a poor room. Hotel Was not full, Maybe because of hurricane, which didn't arrive. Breakfast a mess, Lot of people around in search of food, newspaper was received in the room one day yes another not. Dirty glasses in the room were never replaced. Stay away unless on discount price. No recognition for loyal clients. The best Was park valet: especially Paolo Was full of enthusiasm and Happy to serve. Maybe he should be the next general manager at hyatt....

I stayed here for a couple of nights for business. This hotel was great and in a convenient location. A short walk to Waikiki beach and restaurants around the area. Breakfast was really good and the staff was more then helpful. I ate every morning at the complementary breakfast located on the third floor. A good selection of breakfast items compared to other complimentary hotel's breakfast. The rooms were very well designed and the king size bed was one of the most comfortable beds i have slept in. The A/c goes down to 64 and keeps the room nice and cold all night. I went down to the bar every night to relax and have a couple beers. The bartender was very nice and extremely helpful. I was a bartender before and really enjoyed the service i received from Tiffany hashimoto. I think i spelled her last name correctly. :) She recommended a great aca'i bowl place to try out. We have a few acai places on the big island so this was great recommendation! Thanks a lot for everyone's hard work and great service. It's always nice visiting another island and meeting happy, helpful and wonderful people. Thanks again and i will be back soon!

GREAT newly re-developed value hotel 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Brand new everything. Old hotel closed for a year and completely new interior. ALL AREAS. Room was beautiful, had 2 balconies with view of Beach (pay extra for the side of the hotel with the view as its not that much more). Room was HALF the cost of the Westin and nicer. Being a Hyatt Place Breakfast was included. Its a giant Buffett breakfast outside by the TINY pool. This is an OLD building made pretty and new inside. BUT, this is NOT a pool hotel at all. Why pay for it with Waikiki Beach 2 walkable blocks. ABC store (like a 7-11) superstore next door for all your drink and snack needs, or souvenirs. Rent an umbrella and lounge’s or chairs on the beach for about $20 a day per person. MUCH better than just a mat or towel. DO bring beach towels from the hotel. Get them at the pool or front desk. Visit TIKI’s bar and restaurant on the beach corner (fantastic!) in the ASTON Waikiki Beach Hotel. Sit on the deck with a direct-on view of the beach, water, and waves for reasonable prices and good food. Main Waikiki bus line is across the street from the hotel and will take you anywhere in Honolulu for a few bucks. Tour bus lines, like GrayLine Tours, Hop-on-hop-off busses, and Polynesian Cultural Center busses are directly across the street from the hotel too. GREAT location. Cant wait to return next summer!

Was booked in this 2yr old hotel for business, and was impressed by the very friendly and helpful employees, upscale lobby area, and beautiful rooms with all of the ammenities you deserve. They have complimentary wifi in all rooms and lobby area, and free breakfast from 630a. I love the proximity to the beach and other eating places nearby such as Teddy's Bigger Burgers, Subway, Jamba Juice, and Starbucks. With two convenience stores in hotel, and one two buildings over, makes it easy to get things you forget.

My husband and I stayed here for 10 days in July. We felt like it was an excellent value for Waikiki, quick walk to the beach, breakfast with a nice selection of food, convenient and in walking distance to restaurants and other attractions of but in a quieter area of Waikiki. The staff was friendly and attentive, bed was comfortable. Lobby was attractive and we liked the apples available there each day. Transportation to other areas was convenient by bus or taxi from this hotel. We have relatives in Honolulu and would definitely stay at this hotel again on family visits. Only one negative: the area where the food was served was immaculately clean and tables for eating were wiped and kept clean. The floor in the eating area needs a good scrubbing! We had no trouble with elevators. Others need to relax about the pigeons, it is an outdoor eating area!

We visit with friends and family many times a year. We always love the Hyatt Place. True pigeon problems do exist and one tower has slow elevators. However, No such thing as rude staff anywhere. Everyone had their best Aloha. In fact, we saw the customers being rude to the check in staff because they did not read their reservation correctly and take it out on them cause they had a bad trip in. Kudos to the front desk staffs for staying calm. The one family who we over heard apparently did not indicate they had a family of 4 adults . only picked a king bed category. We could see the clerk was working hard the help this family. We have seen this many times when we come back to this hotel over and over again. Please be careful when making reservations read carefully so we the people in back will not have to wait longer. Hyatt place is our second home for our family and friends. They have more Aloha than you will ever know. We have seen this. If you had a bad day or things don't go right....ASK NICELY for help and be understanding. Why if you were in their shoe? They will do their job best as they can. Anyway, We will be back again and again because they are truly the best Aloha staff. P.s. save your money and just get the room. Never mind about the view. Go out and enjoy the island .the beds are already comfy and you have s place to rest and shower....go out to the beach,hike diamond head,snorkel hanauma, go walk the beach,see the zoo and aquarium,buy a luau package,surf,swim,dive. Why waste you time in a room! There is so much to see,eat,learn about Hawaii. A bed is a bed! Share the Hawaiian experience not your negativity for the little stuff. like they taught our family LIVE ALOHA!!!! Thanks to the Hyatt place staff we are learning this every time we come back to Hawaii. Hope this helps people reviewing this...you will be pleasantly surprised. No one is rude or negative in Hawaii they live with ALOHA. God Bless all readers.

We stayed here as a couple last week. Our requirement was an ocean view room, with breakfast and wifi. Check in was smooth and within minutes. Ocean view is pretty good, though a couple of tall hotels block the view a wee bit. Room is not very large, and one can struggle to find place for more than 2 bags. Overall, all amenities were good and wifi was working well in the hotel room and lobby. There is a convenience store with local souvenirs attached to the hotel, so drinks, macadamia nuts, slippers etc can be bought anytime. Hotel breakfast is not exhaustive as in a 5 star but is a complete one with fruit, juices, breads, bagels, and one type of egg preparation that changes every day. Starbucks coffee rounds it off rather well, with a tray provided in the rooms to allow you the option of taking your meal to the room. Ice is available from machines in each floor. Service was very good, a jammed lock call was attended to within minutes, and cab request for airport transfer at an odd hour also on the dot. Location is very good, at the quieter end of Waikiki across the zoo. Buses are available around the corner in front of Aston Waikiki (pink line) for a 2 dollar ticket to ala Moana shopping centre. Teddies burgers around the other corner as a good burger option. Will stay again.

I stayed at this hotel for just under a week, in May. There was a little bit of runaround with my room as I had decided to stay an extra night, so had made two separate bookings. Once that was sorted out I was very happy. My room was huge, the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever had and I had a decent view through other buildings of the ocean. There were several bonuses such as the included breakfast (the only downside is the aggressive pigeons at the outdoor eating area), the free wifi and there being no dodgy 'resort fee'. The concierge was also very helpful. A very pleasant stay and I would happily stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel for a week and a half and loved everything about it!This hotel may not be beachfront, but it has a convenient location only a block away from the Waikiki boardwalk and also has an ABC store nearby. In addition, there's a Lawson's Station corner store right next to the hotel lobby, with a great variety of food for a quick meal. Everyone working in the hotel is friendly and listened to our needs. The staff at the front desk were very helpful, recommending restaurants, giving directions, and handing out brochures to us. Our rooms were on the higher floors (main tower) and were all very spacious, comfortable, and well-accomadated. Housekeeping was very consistent and thorough. The hotel doesn't have many amenities, and its pool is extremely small, but its free breakfast is wonderful. There's not a large variety of options and the choices aren't guranteed to change daily, but what is offered is more than enough to satisfy a family's tastes.This hotel is not a luxury hotel or upscale resort, but it has very accomadating staff, clean, bright rooms, a comfortable lobby, and great location. Tips-the hotel elevators (at least in the main tower) are slow, but not as terrible as we expected. In fact, when there's not a lot of people, the elevator can be quite fast. Also, the breakfast buffet won't be as crowded earlier in the morning.

I stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach in September, 2013, and thought my room was fabulous. It was a huge room! It has 2 king bed, couch, and love seat. A complimentary daily breakfast was included. The staff was extremely kind and courteous. Nice location and very clean.

We spent a few nights here on a stopover on the way to Maui. They have a few different size rooms which was odd to me for a Hyatt Place. The room we got was very small and cramped, and I could barely fit between the bed and the dresser. The hotel was clean and offered free breakfast which was nice. Valet parking can be expensive so we parked in the garage across the street which saved us a bit of cash and was still very convenient.

I was NOT expecting much from a Hyatt Place especially in Waikiki but this place way exceeded my expectations. Overall friendly and good location to get in and out of Waikiki. It is next to the Zoo so if you know your way around there, you can get our of town OR if you want the night life, it is walking distance.The front desk was a bit swamped and it slowed service a bit but they made things "right." I called and they said my room was ready, but when I got there, they had the wrong room, but we were allowed to check in to that room, took a shower, then when when we were at dinner, they moved our bags to the right room! More service than I expected. The room as nice too...Two queens and a pull out. Not great view, but that was not what I was expecting. There are nice views to be had on the east/zoo side. The towels were plush and beds crisp and comfortable. The breakfast was awesome..Japanese and western style. The breakfast was so good, that it forced me to use the workout room, which was nice too.Not great amenities in the hotel, but good short walking access to all you would need.I WOULD stay there again. Not a luxury hotel, but when in Hawaii, I am running around.
user_name:
Tommy D
Long Beach, California, United States

review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach in March, 2013, and thought my room was fabulous. It was a huge room! It has a king bed, couch, and love seat. My room would have easily accommodated four adults with no crowding. A complimentary daily breakfast was included. The staff was extremely kind and courteous. I usually prefer staying right on the beach, but the price was so good here, the view from the side sufficed. The beach is a short walk with wonderful breezes. (If you have a good haircut, you will never need to dry your hair, and it will fall into place perfectly!) We have stayed at other wonderful hotels in the area, but this is the one I will chose to stay at again.

As a business traveler, I needed relatively low cost accommodations that had lots of amenities. Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was better than expected. The hotel itself is in close proximity to pretty much everything.I had a room where you could see the ocean off in the distance, the hotel itself is an easy few blocks from the beach. Heating/Cooling worked great and the room had a small balcony. Overall, it was roomy and comfortable and I could not hear noise from the other rooms.Breakfast is free (Yeah!) and there is plenty to eat. Yes, it does get busy at the buffet line but you’ll still get plenty to eat. ABC stores, there is one on every corner in Waikiki but this one has one right around the corner that’s open late. Parking - Valet is a $30 a night. Typically, I hate paying for parking but everyone charges for it in Waikiki and with the area being really crowded, it kind of makes a valet a necessity. This being said, I didn't tip the valets once and still received phenomenal service. They’re a great bunch of guys and really hardworking too. The only caveat is if you are headed out in the morning, there may be several folks waiting for their car.If I come back to Waikiki, this will be my first choice.

Location a bit down the Waikiki strip. Room was typical Hyatt Place, very roomy. Free breakfast was excellent, good variety and nice pool outdoor location. Friendly helpful staff. Activities desk person had good knowledge of Honolulu and book exactly what I wanted.

Checking in was quite the circus since a high school band (like 200 + people in the lobby) had also just arrived. But the receptionist got us into a great room and I found this to probably be one of the CLEANEST hotels I have ever stayed at, and I am REALLY picky. The linens were so soft and fresh, the room was a great size. Ours came with continental breakfast, which also was decent. Nick the bartender was especially helpful because we were running late for an outing and I wanted to fill up my Nalgene before going out (with tap water and ice from the ice machine) but had forgotten and didn't really want to trudge upstairs to do so since I had already had the valet go get my car. Nick was super nice and filled up both my Nalgene bottles from the bar. Super nice. Great hotel. Awesome staff. Thanks!

I would have given this hotel 5 stars if it has been on the beach! Although redecorated 2 years ago, the rooms look like they were redone last week. The decor is very nice and the rooms are beautiful. The room we had, an upgraded queen room (1408), was very large with the bed area separated from the wrap around sofa area by a narrow divider. The carpet looked brand new, the bed linens were crisp and white, and the bath towels were large and thick. The bath featured a very large, thick glass walk-in shower with the shower/toilet room separated by a door from the very pretty sink area. The only negative was that the sink area opened into the bedroom (no door) and one light switch turned on the sink area and shower/toilet area lights. So, if anyone turned on the light switch to use the toilet during the night, the bedroom lighted up. A large safe in the closet was appreciated. The hotel staff from curb to reception to housekeeping was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included. It was probably the best complementary breakfast I've had in a hotel with delicious fresh squeezed orange juice and numerous hot and cold breakfast items all well cooked and presented, and served in a beautiful setting on the open air swim pool deck of the hotel. The free Wi-Fi in our room was fast, and computers were available (free) in the lobby for printing boarding passes.

My husband & I were booked here as part of a large group of athletes & family members returning from an international track meet in Australia, and we stayed two nights. Our room on floor 14 of 18 was very spacious and comfortable, but I am not attaching a picture because it overlooked the side alley, which was very noisy most of the time. Since this was a layover stay, however, it was adequate for our purposes.Waikiki Beach is a 2 or 3-block walk, which wasn't too bad. The room was not serviced by the housekeeping staff during our one full day there, so we had to get creative with drying our towels for reuse. Since this stay was part of a larger trip, and I didn't receive an itemized breakdown of everything, I cannot comment upon the value of this hotel, though I do know that one of the other members of our group chose to extend her stay, and they charged her only $60 for the extra night. I have no idea how this compares to the regular rack rate.The one oddity of the room is that the entry area and bathroom/vanity lights are all controlled by a master rocker switch next to the front door -- the up position on the switch is labeled "Aloha." It took a few minutes to figure out to set that switch to "Aloha" before any of the other lights would come on!

I wouldn't go back to this hotel for the price we paid. My family was unimpressed with their customer services. One of the worst things happened at this hotel was that at the free breakfast, an employee who was in charge of clearing the tables, kept spraying pigeons using his cleaning spray bottle 6-8 feet away. He kept missing the pigeons but managed to spray the mist of cleaning liquid all over the dining space. It was one of the most terrible dining experience we had at any hotels. Because we are family of four, we needed one more set of shampoo and conditioner tubes, I requested them. Our request was never heard.Valet personals were kind but overwhelmed time to time. It was slow. One time, bunch of guests and we had to wait about 30-40 min to get our cars.We are from Hawaii and often have to visit Oahu. There are better valued hotels with better customer services out there. I wouldn't recommended it.

My family of four (2 adults and 2 small kids aged 5 and 9) stayed at the Hyatt Place July 8-15th. Upon arriving, we unloaded the taxi with 3 big luggages and 3 small ones, no one came to offer any help, which is fine , we managed. Check in was quick. Stayed on the 16th floor. Got the room we wanted, corner ocean view. Room was modern, spacious, clean. Beds and pillows were comfy, almost too soft at times. Free breakfast with limited options however, enough options for each of us to choose from, incl hot items which changes daily. Free wifi which was pretty good, not slow at all. Small gym but decent. The hotel was 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach, 5 minute walk. The Honolulu Zoo is also a short 7 minute walk. Elevators were extremely slow at times, you can end up waiting 5-10 mins for one. Pool was tiny, however, the kids liked it and only used once or twice. Mostly we went to the beach. Housekeeping was friendly and did a good job. On Fridays, they also had a free lei making in the lobby/gallery and my daughter and I absolutely loved it! Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for value and a nice hotel.

Firstly, I understand that when check in time says three that I shouldn't expect to check in any earlier - however I had repeatedly made myself known to reception and was waiting in the lobby with a small child so was surprised when finally, at three o'clock, the very unfriendly, Lynne, told me that since I was the last to check in for my room type which had been oversold she was going to downgrade me and give me the difference in money back. I'm sorry, last to check in? I'd been there since 9am! She didn't even ask! Of course I told Lynne that downgrading me would not do - I come from a city, I came to Hawaii to get an ocean view, not city view, which is what I had booked and paid for months ago. She was not friendly or helpful but appeared to downgrade the last poor people who had not checked in. The room was spacious and nice. Good view - worth arguing for. Pool is a disaster, no shade and in a total wind tunnel. Didn't even bother to venture to breakfast there. Housekeeping didn't vacuum once, sometimes didn't even appear until the late afternoon. Usually did a poor job, no clean glasses etc. Waiting on the lifts was a complete joke, sometimes it'd be 15 minutes! Who's got that kinda time? Waiting for a drink at the bar in the lobby was just as bad - doesn't matter if you want a wine or a cup of tea, they'll pretend not to see you but are the thirstiest on the island for a tip. The hotel is really quite a walk from the main strip. Wouldn't recommend it.

The week in July 2014 that I arrived for business, all of the major hotels were either fully booked or very high priced. This was the first Hyatt Place that I have visited. I booked a standard room and received a mountain view (14th floor) in the east tower. The room was clean with a king sized bed and adequately sized. It had a stand-up shower (no tub) which worked fine for me. The internet was good but the balcony was small. The breakfast was good but these is a feeding frenzy when it opens at 630 AM. Parking is a problem (hard to get to, small slots, and fills up) at this hotel. The location is less than two blocks from the beach where restaurants and shops are. This hotels supported a few tours and a sports convention - this can effect room in the lobby, hotel access (bus parking) and breakfast dining space.

If the major resorts are booked up (or even if they are not), the Hyatt Place is a good hotel stay close to the beach but without many of the resort-type amenities. The lobby is very attractive and clean. The hallways are pleasant and smell fresh. The rooms are more than adequate with very large TVs, comfortable beds, nice bathrooms, and a luxurious shower. The room appears trendy and modern. The staff was always incredibly helpful and friendly. The gym is small and limited. The pool area is small. The complimentary breakfast was good but limited. I'd stay here again and recommend the hotel to others. The rooms were clean, but the shower could have used an extra scrubbing. Valet parking staff was very courteous, professional, and speedy. The hotel could have used an extra staff member or two for the valet service during the busy hours.
user_name:
dnpinva
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great hotel. I have a king size room with ocean view. Check in was quick, friendly staff, clean room. Good breakfast variety. The down site is the pool is too small, but who care since you probably will not use it anyway. The ocean is more fun. They provide you with the beach towell at the front desk. The hotel is about a few hundred feet from the beach, plenty activities in the area, plenty shooping place to go. Valet parking cost $30, very proffesional. The other down side is elevator a little slow. The hotel has a grocery store in the lobby area that open until 1 AM.

We just returned from a week at the Hyatt Place with our two children, aged 6 and 8. We loved our huge room, with plenty of space for luggage, and for each person to have their own corner to rest or read. Very convenient to have the toilet separated from the sink, and nice partial view of the ocean from our ocean-view room on the 17th floor (another hotel blocked part of it).The free breakfast is a godsend for hungry kids who don't want to wait for food. We liked that it started at 6:30 AM for our jet-lagged kids who were up at 5 AM. Maybe not all the food is to everyone's taste, but there are a lot of choices. My son really liked the miso soup and rice option, as well as the usual cereal, toast, and hot choices. Coffee was really good.The pool is small and a little boring, but for little kids, it's the perfect size for a before-bed dip, and it seemed to be very popular with the under-10 set. The workout room is roomy - you don't feel like you're on top of other people like so many workout rooms in hotels. The laundry takes visa cards - no fiddling with a roll of coins to do laundry!Housekeeping was efficient and good. Front desk staff was very helpful giving out bus directions, beach towels, and ordering cabs. Free apples in the lobby, and kids get free sand toys. Fun lei-making on Friday afternoons. A quick two-block walk to a beach with a breaker, so little kids can play without fear of getting knocked over by big waves.Use Charlie's taxi service to and from the airport - very efficient. If you book ahead and let them know when you're landing, they'll be waiting for you outside baggage claim.

Front desk staffs are patient, but very inefficient. Valet parking folks are professional. On the other hand, elevator wait is 10-15 min long. Breakfast is free and interesting. Overall experience is just fine.

one very good thing is free breakfast. rooms are ok not bad not great and it is really close to beach and shopping area.one thing would have prefered is that if they had resturant on location they have bar in the lobby but do not allow to take drinks to your room.

Hyatt place is about three blocks off the beach at the eastern end of Waikiki beach, and I loved that! City bus is right there that can take you all over....and the valet were super helpful with this first time visitor to Hawaii! Breakfast being included was great.....hot food every morning, with a variety of cereals; everyday fresh pineapple, oatmeal, bagels, yogurt and juices. Great place to stay!

Now this is a BIG PLACE. Two towers about 20 stories high. They offer breakfast every morning like many of the Hyatt places do but they manage it well. I am an early riser (there at 6:30 am when they start) and my friend who I traveled with runs to breakfast at the last minute every day. The same offering and quality were available for us both. The food choice was pretty good, no made to order omelets but they did have scrambled eggs or some other egg omelet thing with bacon or sausage every other day with their daily offerings of fresh fruit, juices, coffee, Danish, oatmeal, cereal, pickled cucumber, white rice and kimchi. The rooms were all refurbished although be forewarned that the lowest class of rooms with the city view are really small with a fabulous shower but small. The other classes of rooms are large with the tub shower combo. We stayed in the city view for half our stay then moved to the larger rooms for the remainder. The elevators in the main tower are slow and there is only two of them. The second tower has three elevators and I like that tower better. Both have access to the third floor food area. BIG PLUSES: washing machine on the premises, lei making class on the premises. Right across the street from Marriot where everyone picks up for tours if they don’t come directly to your hotel which many do, close to the beach( Location, location, location), block and a half away, great concierge people, and housing keeping is polite and thorough. Small minuses: the front desks people could be nicer although they were efficient. They made you feel like you were bothering them. The food area was small for so many people but it worked as you could take your food back to your room with the trays they provided for you in your room.

we stay at hyatt place in waikiki last month for a week. it's close to everything : beach, restaurants, shopping area, bus stops, etc. our room is nice, big and has partly mountain view, not bad consider the price (most rooms are $200). free breakfast is a big plus, when you in hawaii you don't want to spend too much $/time in the morning meal, just feed yourself and head to the ocean! The only downside is the bathroom is too small, only fit for one person , and the toilet is in the bathroom, you can image the awkward.

We staid for a stopover, and had spent a couple of days at the Hilton before. The Hyatt offers good value, rooms are rather large, staff is super friendly. It's not really at the beach, and one needs to be lucky to see the ocean, but it's a good place to start from and there is plenty of beach on o'hau anyway. It's probably not the right place if you look for a resort style hotel, but if you are about to go around, that's a good choice.

LOCATION:This hotel is towards the end of Waikiki, nearer the zoo and park districts. It is still in the main downtown area, about 5 minutes walk from the beach, and 10+ minutes walk from the shopping areas. The area is level, so an easy walk. There are bus stops along the street, on the other side, so it is quite convenient, although not in the centre. If coming by car, there is a small driveway to briefly stop, and on-site parking is available for around $20/night.FRONT OF HOUSE SERVICE:The staff at the hotel were moderately helpful, assisting when asked with specific questions, but not helping beyond what was requested. For example, on check-in there were no rooms available at the time. Although we waited in front, nobody checked or advised expected waiting times, and we had to keep checking. Similarly, we had a more serious issue later on, but there was no concern or interest shown; it was a case of not being involved or assisting. As staff are dealing with tourists in a foreign city unfamiliar with local contacts and procedures, a better standard of service would be expected. ROOMS:There is a small variety of rooms. Our room was spacious, with two double beds. The rooom also had desk and chair, and sofa, a wardrobe, luggage stand, iron and board, and mini-fridge, with an LCD tv. Unfortunately, there is a very limited range of channels, with just the US networks, plus a Japanese channel. For such an international destination, it is a pity there no channels from elsewhere such as Europe or Australia, so news was narrowly focussed. All furnishings were in excellent condition. The bathroom had a shower over bath and toilet, and hair dryer, mirror and basin outside. All were in good condition and presentation. The shower head was an adequate height. Toiletries were private brand, supplied in individual packaging.The lifts are regularly mentioned in reviews. There are only two lifts to serve so many floors in the tower, so a wait is common, except at off-peak times. They're not the fastest lifts either.AMENITIES:A large lounge area is at the foyer, open to the street, which was a convenient waiting area if waiting before or after check-in. Wifi/internet access is included, with 4 public terminals and a printer near check-in. A pool and simple gym, and laundry machines are located upstairs. There is also a shop attached which sells convenience supplies, and some other shops and a cafe on the ground entry floor of the hotel.DINING: A breakfast buffet is included. There is an area seating about 50 people outside near the pool, with pigeons watching and waiting for unattended food and plates. The range of food is not great, but gives you a few choices. Each day, there is a hot option e.g. eggs, with cereal, preserved fruit, yoghurt, and a sweet bakery item. Bread, jam, Tea, coffee and juice are also available. OVERALL:A nice place to stay, which is also convenient. The hotel is well presented and maintained. Overall, I would rate it as pleasant, with everything you need. For a 4-star property though, I was disappointed in the service provided, that they didn't show interest and try to help when the opportunity presented.

We recently stayed for 6nights in a Ocean View room.Our room was in the Diamond Head Tower on 12th floor.The view was amazing!We had a King size bed and a single sofa bed.Not an overly big room but big enough for us.There were 3 lifts in this tower. We never had to wait more that a minute or two for a lift.The decor was very nice - modern and clean.We enjoyed the breakfast which was included in the room rate.We never ate in the breakfast area - we preferred to eat in our room.Even though it was a very busy time when we were there we could have got a table in the breakfast area. Others have mentioned the amount of birds in the breakfast area - I didn't think they were a huge problem - we saw a few but not a flock.We used the pool a few times - its not big but good enough to get wet in.There were a few other people there but not lots. (People tend to be out and about in Waikiki)Loved the foyer area - very spacious with a nice modern decor.We had access to the computers in the foyer area - liked that.This was our 1st time at this hotel.Would definitely stay again (if the rate was right).

Stayed a week here the first of April..... Awesome hotel.... Great maid service... And much attention from the front desk. The breakfast on the lanai was always varied and awesome. Plus only a block and a half from Waikiki Beach.

I read reviews for six months and was fully prepared! We got An 11th floor partial ocean view room. There was enough room for the five of us. The beds were soft, but comfortable. Had we been on the 12th it would have been a full ocean view. All rooms have a balcony. The hotel has 2 buildings. Coffee is available everyday in the lobby as well as on the 3rd floor daily breakfast. Breakfast saved us a minimum of $50 a day. Fresh fruit consists of a pineapple, melon and cantaloupe mix. They have granola, four cereals, skim and 2% milk, yogurt, three pastries per day (apple one was best), bagels, two types of bread and English muffins, and a rotation of hot breakfast items (French toast, pancakes, waffles, sausage, bacon, eggs and a few omelet type selections).Coffee is a Starbucks Italian Office blend. It is very strong, but good! They also have ice water and juices. Finally, they serve white rice with miso soup and three items that go with it. Take the Bus to various areas that are within 5 miles. Rent a car if you go out to Dole, Sea Life Park or the Northshore as the stop and go gets old. Main stop is on Kuhio Drive right behind Lawson's at the hotel. Take the 42 as it is a more direct route to many places. Check their website. Staff was great! Room was cleaned daily. Hotel is great for families on a budget. We booked through hotels.com. I liked the fact it was somewhat off the main strip. You actually swim on Kuhio Beach which is far less crowded. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

We just got back from Waikiki last week. Our first time in Honolulu. We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 8 nights and it was great. The hotel has a pool which we used only once as it is quite small and the beach is only a couple of minutes away. The gym is adequate equipped and I used it almost every day to wind down before going out for dinner. The room is big enough for two people and it was fairly clean (had some long hair in the bathroom and on a towel which weren't ours). There is no restaurant in the hotel which was probably the only thing I need to critique but you could buy small things like salads and sandwiches. Restaurants were all in walking distance and beach just 5min walk. The staff was great, especially Chris and Cameron from the tour desk (thanks guys for all your well informed tips! helped us a lot). As well as everyone else was very friendly! The breakfast buffet was good, definitely something for everyone. Would definitely come back if we go to Honolulu again.Thanks again for a great service!

My husband and I stayed here two nights prior to taking the Pride of America cruise the end of May. We found the location really convenient to restaurants and a short walk to Waikiki Beach. The room, bath and balcony are small but adequate and very clean. The breakfast each morning was wonderful. We would stay here again.

Just returned from Hyatt Place after staying 6 nights and my family and I couldn't be more pleased with our stay. We paid a tad extra for the ocean view deluxe room & we loved the view, the extra space & the overall contemporary feel.. Everyone we encountered was friendly especially Jade who helped us and Paolo with driving directions. Dont listen to anyone who complains about breakfast, it is free here and the selection is more you can ask for. My kids loved the donuts, yogurt and waffles. Birds do come around but nothing to complain about because you are eating outside poolside. There is a nice gym to workout and we even did a load of laundry to clean our sandy clothes. Thanks Hyatt for making our stay wonderful!

We stayed here two weeks ago...traveling with my parents and another couple. We stayed at Hyatt Place for just three nights. Oahu was the first stop in our three island tour. Excellent value, very close to the beach and beach walk. Pretty, modern rooms. No goofy "service/amenities" fee added on like most of the properties in Honolulu. Why hotels insist on charging a fee for wi-fi and work-out facilities is beyond me. So, thank you, Hyatt Place! Friendly staff, nice little bar, free breakfast. Pool is very small, not of importance to us. We didn't use the workout facility...climbing the stairs to our room was enough of a workout! We ate at Tikis Bar and Grill at the Aston Waikiki on the night we arrived after traveling...a perfect location for a fun and festive night. Outdoor seating on the patio overlooking the ocean. A short, two block walk from the Hyatt...just head towards the ocean. Good food and drinks. Casual.We also ate at The Beach Bar at the Mona...open air seating right on the beach. Beautiful surroundings, excellent food and drinks, low-key live music...festive but not so loud that we couldn't enjoy our meal and conversation. My husband and I also ate at the Hula Grill at the Outrigger. Excellent food and second story patio dining with lovely view of the beach. Marvelous service. I would not hesitate recommending the Hyatt if one is looking for value, great rooms, beautiful lobby, and great staff. The concierge we worked with was friendly and helpful...the tour service we booked through them to see Pearl Harbor memorials not so much. The driver/tour guide of our hapless little group was so inept that in the end, laughing together about the five hour tour was one of the highlights of our trip! (Right, family?) I wish I had researched tour groups thoroughly myself and booked it independently, as Pearl Harbor is far too important to not have a knowledgable and competent guide to learn from...although we greatly enjoyed the memorials we visited.Happy researching, and enjoy your trip! The Hawaii Revealed series is a terrific resource to use to plan your trip.

My family and I stayed at Hyatt Place Waikiki and found it to be quite clean, safe and convenient. Approximately five minutes walk from the beach. Hotel is located away from the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki stretch. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was good, fresh fruits and mixed selection of items everyday. Ocean view rooms are so worth it you can take your breakfast to the balcony. Would definitely stay here again.Mahalo to the staff of Hyatt Place!

This is generally what you expect from a Hyatt Place, which is a tier lower then the regency. But IMHO they don't lose much of the service, it's just not as stuffy. younger crowd or those who don't plan on spending much time in the room. It's literally a 3 min walk from the beach. Has a pool, decent (but not amazing) breakfast, good and very clean gym with lots of treadmills, bikes and elliptical machines. Bar is open late. Music at the bar on the weekends. Pros:Staff and service were excellent. Went out of their way on every occasion. Like I mentioned - blocks from the beachRooms are very big. Cons:Elevators take FOREVER. Easier to take steps but sucks if you're on a high floor (unless you want to use it as your work out)Breakfast is a bit of a battle zone as everyone is there to suck down the grub and get to the beachParking - we didn't rent a car overnight (that's the key, just rent a car for the day and bring it back to the rental agency at night. Then rent it again in the AM to save on parking). Parking at the hyatt was $24.Overall I'd say stay there. Esp. if you have points.

I think we were in the older part of the hotel. It was formerly called something else, so its not set up like a normal Hyatt Place in the tower we were in. Maybe the other tower was, Im not sure. In the older tower that we were in, it smelled a little musty, but the service was still great, breakfast was good & changed each day. We could still look out our balcony & see the ocean & a portion of Diamondhead.

I had a very large room that was clean and comfortable if not particularly stylish. I like the hotels location, very near the beach and strip, but slightly removed from the action—easy to walk everywhere. This hotel struck me as being extremely good value and a great night's sleep.
user_name:
Gandaratravels
New York City, New York

review_body: I had read negative reviews about this hotel but was pleasantly surprised. The room was nice, clean and spacious. We didn't wait for elevators but I don't know if this is a busy time if year or not. The free Bree breakfast was great. A big selection and fresh every day. The wind was a bit if a problem hen you were eating breakfast, but a tray was provided to take breakfast to your room. All in all a great hotel. Would stay here again

This was a stay-cation and specifically booked this hotel for the fire pit and breakfast. I had room 710 on diamond head tower. The room was small and not like the photo which showed a pullout sofa. Our room just had a one sitter. The bed was great! Hair dryer and iron in room with mini fridge. One cup coffee maker and in room tray was a plus. My first night went to the fire pit at night to find ... It's not on! Oh snap! The feature I was looking for and it's not turned on! Please advertise on the website when it's on ... I felt a big letdown. So my second gripe was the minuscule balcony ... Two chairs facing each other with a table. The view was nice of Leahi but the air unit was behind one chair making it very uncomfortably hot. As for breakfast, it was okay. Egg croissant and French toast. Hot and cold cereals. Variety of breads and juices. We only drank juice.I felt the complimentary coffee should be put out earlier in the lobby and at night when guest returns. We weren't able to use this service. The exercise room was nicely equipped. We paid an extra $50 per day vs another budget hotel during a stay in May.

A lot of reviews accurate - elevator wait, some sign of age, rooms that are close to each other are really not quiet, and a room within close proximity from what I had (12th floor, Deluxe Mtn. View) gets loud with the in & out of other guests. Parking is another thing, only 20, or so self-park spots (more on that later though). Although, the hotel did it's best to fulfill my "Quiet room" preference. They did all they can, that's the thing. Those cons didn't outweigh benefits. Very helpful staff upon check in. - literally a slew of 20+ people from a van that offloaded just in front of me but front desk (or, Gallery Host, as they refer to themselves) quickly took next person and expedited my check in. I know why they're referred to Gallery Host because after check in, they show you around, well, the Gallery. The lobby, as most people say, is beautiful. Open air, tropical setting, public computers. Very nice. That's what I mean, elevator wait (c'mon, you're in Hawaii), age of hotel (very clean and updated rooms, what'd you expect for older part of island overrun by tourists all the time), etc. Especially accommodating was the overnight staff. I mean, I had a specific request for a specific time frame and they pulled through - Matt (Gallery Host) and Mark De Guzman (parking attendant), you know what you did! Awesome.
