I mean parking was either self-park (not usually available) and public parking up until midnight each night for fee as well. But, Mark, he'll take care of you. Trust me, he did for me. All in all, breakfast included, nice location, updated rooms (I mean, walk-in glass door, shower). Great stay!

We stayed at the Hyatt Place on Waikiki Beach for 3 nights. The location is great. It's easy to get to with a car and the hotel is along Waikiki Beach so there are plenty of restaurants, shopping and things to do nearby. There were 2 downsides to the hotel during our stay. In the evenings, one of the two elevators was not working. So, there was a long line for the elevator at night (not something you want to have to deal with after a day out in the sun). The second hiccup was parking. When we arrived, the hotel ran out of self parking so we had to pay extra for valet parking. There is a charge for self parking, but valet is more. Other than those 2 minor complaints, the hotel was great overall. Breakfast is included with the stay and they had a decent selection (eggs, meat, cereal, etc.). We enjoyed our stay and would return in the future.

This hotel is good if you have been to Hawaii many times and you are just looking for a place to crash. I would not necessarily stay here if it was my first-time as I would want it to be special. The hotel is very clean and the staff is excellent. It has a nice gym with free breakfast. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants and entertainment. Overall no complaints.

We stayed here in April as a family of 4. The location was great. It is easy walking distance to the quiet end of Waikiki and the kids beaches. We had a room on the 14th floor which was beautifully quiet and had a nice enough view to Diamond Head if you craned your neck a little! The staff were wonderfully polite and helpful as were the guys working the valet. The room was spacious and clean. Breakfast was served daily and was more than enough to get us going for the day - and we really appreciated the opportunity to take a coffee away too!

Good location. Value for money, great no taxes and free breakfast. Breakfast got very boring after 10 days but we are not complaining it saved us lots of money which we spent elsewhere! Local buses take you everywhere for $2 so you don't need a car. Comfortable bed and air conditioning. Fantastic to have free Wifi. We would be happy to return.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights for the first leg of our 2 week Hawaiian vacation. The hotel is very close to the beaches and I was very happy with how modern and spacious the room we had was. The hotel was completley up to par and we have no complaints. The breakfast was ok - the frist day there was this strange omelette thing - but other than that it's fine - don't go in expecting a gormet breakfast - if you just want something to eat before starting the day it's perfect. We are from a large city to Waikiki tired on us quickly - but the beaches are lovely and if you like shopping you're in for a treat. Maybe the only negative would be the wifi - weak at best.

When we arrived at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach, the receptionist was very nice and told us that we had an upgraded room. We had booked a city view room for 10 nights but, we got a bigger room with a separate living room. The room was very clean, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. We did not go outside as our view was an ugly apartment building. The complimentary breakfast was amazing and the birds did not bother us at all. The free Wi-Fi was great to have. The staff were very pleasant and friendly. Only a block to the beach and the main strip. Very easy to take the public transportation across the street to go to the shopping mall, diamond head, etc. About one block walk to the zoo. The Hyatt Place is very well located. We really enjoyed our stay and we highly recommend the Hyatt Place.Louise C.

Stayed in a "mountain view room" but had to look through the other high rises hotels to see them. There were a few things that I liked, no resort fee, 24/7 access to their gallery menu, beach or swimming pool towels, free Wi-Fi and complimentary breakfast. In regards to parking, you can pay $20 a day for self-park or $30 for valet but we went a completely different route. A block a way from the hotel is the street parking and from 6pm - 7am its free! If you are planning on spending the day by the hotel you can move the car into the zoo's parking lot and pay $11 to keep there until 6pm then move it back to the street. This worked out for us because we took a day trip 2 out of 3 days we were there. Instead of spending $60 on parking we only spent $20 for the entire time. Another suggestion is if you are planning on spending more than 2 days on the beach I would suggest buying a beach umbrella from the ABC store ($18) instead of renting one for $20 a day from the stands on the beach.

This is my 2nd stay (1st stay was in October 2013) at Hyatt Place Waikiki. 7 months later, I was once again pleased with my stay. Not much has changed from my first visit to this Hyatt Property. I chose this Waikiki hotel for these reasons - free wifi, no resort fee, being a Hyatt (reliable), complimentary breakfast, friendly staff, good housekeeping / clean. It is very easy to get around Waikiki, so this location is alright to get to and not a hassle. In my opinion as I walked around, this is the best hotel being away from the beach/water facing hotels. I will be back yet again in the future. Mahalo.

The room was large clean and well maintained. the included hot breakfast was good but the birds were a bit aggressive (outside by the pool eating). If you want a view, try for an upper floor. Our room had a beautiful up-close view of the rundown apartments next door. Then there was parking. What a pain that was. Tried to check in at 11:00 am and was told that our room was not ready and to come back at 3:00 pm. Came back at 3:00 pm and was told there was not remaining self-park (very small lot at a meager $20 per day). told that we could use a parking structure in the next block or pay $30 for valet parking.

This hotel was beautiful even though it might be 30 years old. It has been renovated and they have a lovely patio area where the breakfast is included.It is only a few steps to the beach and your local ABC store!I stayed her in April 2014 and it was great!

A comfortable and clean hotel with all the amenities expected of a modern hotel. Good value for money as well with complimentary breakfast, WiFi and beach towels! Also conveniently located within 2 mins walk from Waikiki beach. The staff were also very friendly and always smiling. One small tip the breakfast area can get quite busy after 8.30am so if you want a relaxed breakfast better get down early. Overall a good hotel and excellent value for money for the location

Beginning with the welcome and tour of the facilities all the way to the excellent front desk check-out, the impeccable housekeeping and cleanliness and the great choices for breakfast, this is an excellent value in Waikiki. It is not a resort and activities are limited but also the price reflects that difference. There is no added resort fees (for things I will not use) and you get free wi-fi, free breakfast, there is a small gym and pool and you get fresh towels to take to the beach. For an extra $20 or so I had a room with a separate seating area with lots of outlets to plug all my electrical/electronic stuff (very hard to find in the older hotels). The lobby is large, outdoor/indoor and lots of space with good wi-fi connectivity to work or hang out. You can get fresh coffee and snacks 24/7 and there is also a bar available (reasonable prices)I am (was) a big fan of Hilton but slowly but surely are moving to the Hyatt family and Hyatt Place is a great brand within the family.

Clean, helpful, all you look for in a hotel. Breakfast area is a bit eeerrr, other than that, a fantastic experience. We had no problems with the lift as others had complained about. ......."..........

We found this hotel to be quiet, convenient and excellent value for money. While the rooms may be a bit on the small side, they are comfortable and supply all necessary amenities. The room rate also includes a free buffet breakfast that was more than adequate and free wifi. The Hyatt beds are second to none so there's no problems getting a good nights rest after a busy day exploring beautiful Waikiki and surrounds. This hotel, while not directly on the beach front, is a very short walk to the beach which is never too crowded. It is also close walking distance to the shopping strip along the main beach road and great restaurants and has all the tour buses and shopping transfer shuttles stopping right outside. All in all a perfect hotel for those who aren't fussed about not being right in the middle of the strip. Enjoy your stay, we did.
user_name:
Karen P
Gerrards Cross, United Kingdom

review_body: Our stay was great. The room was large, clean, and easily fit our family of 4. The free breakfast and free wifi were an excellent addition to the stay. Short walk to the beach. Would definitely recommend!

New hotel with great rooms - can choose, beach, city or mountain view rooms. Great housekeeper, cleaned very well. Front desk staff need more employees, service was slow at front desk and bar. Main lobby was not air conditioned - very muggy. Overall, good experience, 2 minute walk to the beach and strip. Very conveniently located.

Great Location and Fantastic Customer Service. My husband and I were allowed to check in early and staff were very accommodating and extremely helpful. The location to the beach, nightlife and zoo were wonderful. I cannot say enough about the excellent breakfast buffet in the morning and again the fanstastic staff that go the extra mile. Well done Hyatt, Thank you.

Great value hotel with very nice rooms close to the beach. Breakfast is included and has a reasonable selection although some of the food is pretty poor quality. Overall I recommend highly for those not wanting to pay the higher cost of the beachfront hotels

The Hyatt place will be one of my favorites when traveling to Hawaii. First of all, the staff is professional and positive. The rooms are extremely spacious and the view is not great, but also not bad. The local is one block away from Waikiki beach.

My husband and I, in our mid 30's and early 40's, traveled to Oahu and stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. It was a fantastic experience and we wish to share it. This hotel is convenient just a block away from Waikiki Beach. There are ample shopping and restaurants around - ABC Store and Lawson Station just right downstairs. It is a 5 minute drive to the aquarium and zoo. 15 minutes drive fro Diamond Head. Upon check in, we were told their parking garage was full ($20/day) but we can park across the street at the Waikiki Banyan for $15/day. The check in process was painless and the staff was friendly. The room we booked was a king size room that is tiny but modern and clean. Early on, we realized that the free WiFi in the room was not working. We notified the front desk twice but they couldn't find a problem. Lynn from the front desk was nice enough to offer us another room, a free upgrade, to a room that was much more spacious. The continental breakfast was satisfying with selections such as eggs, bacon, sausages, bagels, pastries, fruits, cereals, coffee, tea, juices, etc. The selection varied each day. This saved us a lot of money from having to buy breakfast each day. Watch for the birds who will attack your food if you leave it unattended. The only downside to this hotel is the small pool. Wished they had something bigger as we usually enjoy being at the pool more than the beach.Overall experience was a fantastic one. This hotel is towards the east of Waikiki. Very centralized. But if you want to stay near all of the glamorous shops on Kalakaua Ave, then you might want to stay further west.
user_name:
one1luv629
New York City, New York

review_body: I stay in Hyatt hotels very often and have stayed in many Hyatt Place properties. In comparing the Waikiki Hyatt Place to others, several things stick out. First, the location. Hyatt Place hotels tend to be in suburban areas or near airports, away from city centers. This Hyatt Place is a quick walk from the beach and close to all the action at Waikiki. I really liked the location, which I would compare to staying a block off the Las Vegas strip. It's close enough to all the action, but you can't hear the craziness from your room. Hyatt Places also tend to be small, low-rise hotels. This one is 20 floors, affording some great views up top.Like all Hyatt Place hotels, breakfast and internet are included. I appreciated that they made the effort to provide a traditional American breakfast as well as Asian breakfast options. Breakfast was okay, on par with other Hyatt Places. Internet ran well, but it required me to re-enter the hotel-provided username and password any time my computer went to sleep.My biggest gripe at the Hyatt Place Waikiki are the elevators! There are TWO elevators for the 20-floor tower. Just two, and they're just as slow as an elevator you'd find in a five-storey building. This is a huge oversight! We were on the 15th floor and would take 3-5 minutes to get down to the lobby on packed elevators every time. The Hyatt Place brand isn't used to building towers like this, clearly evidenced by the lack of sufficient elevator infrastructure.Parking was another gripe. There are only a few spots in this large hotel reserved for overnight guest parking, the rest is set aside for hourly parking for the general public and Valet parking. I've never been to a hotel where registered guests did not have priority over hourly parkers. Because self parking was full, we were sent across the street to the Banyan to park, where parking is $15 per night in cash only. Waiting for our elevator, getting down to the ground floor, across the street, up to our car and out the garage was a 15-minute ordeal. It was either that or wait for a Valet to bring our car out.Bottom line, Hyatt Place should stick to what they do best, airport and suburban hotels. Too many growing pains are evident at the Waikiki Hyatt Place.

The staff at Hyatt Place is very solicitous and helpful as well as kind. The location is great for walking anywhere in Waikiki. The beach is just down the street if that's your thing. A nice perk is having free wifi throughout the hotel and even those the free breakfast is a total zoo it has what you may need to start your day. The room is was in was very spacious with a sitting area and all and a nice balcony overlooking the beach. The beds are very comfortable as well. A rather nice feature is the text service. Anything you need you text a central number and it's taken care of immediately. Very handy. If you're looking for a good value in a central location then the Hyatt Place should be on your list.

This Hotel itself is nice as it provides the free internet, breakfast esp their pineapples. The size of the room is very tiny, However bathroom are modern and nice. it has a small balcony too. Would love to return this hotel when going back to Waikiki Area.
user_name:
Jetsetter_B777-300
New York City, New York

review_body: checked in sunday, for a one day staycation, my son actually had a final so he did not want the morning traffic to go to school in manoa. so chose this hyatt for the points plus cash since we are hyatt platinum members. although this is a category three hotel the hotel in itself was beautiful and clean, also quite new, the lobby was nice and check in also impressive. our hyatt associate Christopher was very imformative, helpful, and seemed to really enjoy his job. we got the feeling that everyone there enjoyed being a hyatt employee. the breakfast was good and generous, cant complain how many hotels give free breakfast, also there was a wide variety of juices. Christopher new that my son had to study so he gave us a room in a more quiet area, but we could still see diamond head and the beach. the room was large clean and nice amenities, same as in the park hyatt in new york, but this room was larger with a full size sofa and king bed, for the kamaainas that live out in the country, if you need to to something to do in town, this hotel would be a nice place to treat yourself. The prices are reasonable and they do give kamaaina rates. would definetly recommend this place to locals as well as visitors.

We chose this hotel because breakfast was included in the room rate. If you like plastic cups & bussing your own table & substandard food this is the breakfast for you. We ended up eating at nearby restaurants after the first morning. With the exception of the food this is a very good hotel. Good location - avoid city view rooms, ours looked into the next building. Best thing - awesome beds & happy hour at Tiki Bar & Restaurant just down the street towards the beach.

Just five minutes walk to the beach and zoo. Fee includes breakfast which has a limited selection but good enough. There are a couple of stores around even during late nights. Bus stop on the corner and most tour buses can stop out front of the hotel. All in all, this hotel gives you value for money and I would go here versus other unreasonably priced hotel around it.

I am really glad I found this hotel for our Hawaiian vacation. My boyfriend and I were just looking for a nice room to book while in Waikiki because we knew we weren't spending much time in the hotel... since there are so many trails and beaches for us to visit. So, we didn't have the need to spend tons of money on a resort. But I really needed a nice, clean and updated hotel! I try not to just hotels by the pictures, but I do! A lot of the hotels in our price ranges were very old-looking. I was very happy when I stumbled upon Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. It looked very clean and modern and reasonably priced!We stayed for 9 nights and it was affordable to us. The big pros for this hotel was the price, free breakfast and NO RESORT FEES!!! I couldn't believe how other places had resort fees that made their price jump so much! So I was excited to find this hotel did not have resort fees!!! The walk to the beach is only 2 short blocks. And the rooms are nice, clean and spacious. The beds are very soft and comfortable. Out of all the hotels/resorts I've stayed in, this is my 2nd favorite bed! The bathroom is also very clean. Old and dirty bathrooms always give me the heebie jeebies and would need flip flops to take a shower in, but these were great! Sure, there's no bathtub, but why would you even need one in Hawaii?? The tv is large and there is a mini fridge. We had a small balcony, but it didn't matter to us. The room was nice and clean and that's all that matters.Breakfast was good... we didn't get to go every day but when I did I was always able to grab food to bring to our room. There was always enough food and it wasn't so crowded. There is a 24-hour fitness gym... the free weights only went up to 50lbs dumbbell if it matters. I'm a tiny girl so it was good enough for me!There is also free wifi. If you need to use the computer and print out vouchers for your day trips and such, you are able to do so in the lobby!There is only one con that could not be helped since every hotel probably charges for it... the parking! it was $30 per night if we did valet parking. There is self paring but it's first come, first served. If you are always out because of activities, then you have to resort to valet. FYI, they start charging if you keep your car there after midnight. Before midnight, we were told you weren't charged. At first, it was hard to get a straight answer about parking cost but eventually a nice valet named Pablo? informed us. We found a way about our parking dilemma after 2 nights of parking there... we parked ~2 blocks away at the 24-hour parking for Honolulu Zoo. $1/hour! The pool wasn't anything special in the hotel. It looked small... but I rarely saw anyone in it because why would you need to use the pool when the gorgeous beach is right there! All in all, I would definitely stay here again! We can't wait to go back to Hawaii!!!

Stayed at the Hyatt Place for 6 nights at the end of April for the remainder of our honeymoon. Having stayed in Waikiki before(at the Holiday Inn) we knew that the Hyatt was towards the end of the strip and that we would have to walk to get into the "action." That side of it didn't bother us much except at the end of the day when we really felt that extra block to walk. However, because of the location it is very quiet. Another positive was that it was only a 2 minute walk to the beach. We liked how clean the room was and how new it felt. The room felt very small. It was simply the bed, a chair and the tv and desk. We had to put one suitcase on the desk and the other on the floor in front of the chair which meant the doorway to the balcony was blocked. There was very little room to move around. The free breakfast was an added bonus with the usual continential breakfast available and a rotation of differnt types of hot food every few days. The negative for us was that for our final day and a half, we had no wifi connection. Apparently a part had broken and there was no internet from the 7th floor up. That was annoying as there was no sign informing people of this. Also on our last night, a water main burst on the street so the hotel had no water. The next morning they provided a free bottle of water to guests however we were flying back to Australia that day so it didn't really help us with wanting a shower before our 10 hour flight home. While the hotel was lovely, if we were to return to Waikiki we would stay in a more central location.

Stayed here with my wife for three nights in May. This hotel is a great value compared to adjacent hotels and the walk to Waikiki beach is a short two blocks. The rooms are clean and nice. The breakfast had good variety and tasted great. Be aware that the breakfast area will be crowded, especially on a weekend. The customer service was very accommodating and helpful. I recommend requesting a room on a higher floor to get above the street noise. Partial ocean views are available, even being a few blocks from the beach. I would definitely stay here again.

I have three rooms at the hotel for 4/23-4/30/14. This hotel beats my expectation in many ways, the rooms are very new, comfortable and clean, location is great in central Waikiki and the hotel offers free breakfast buffet and WIFI. The hotel is very new like two years old, unlike the other hotels in Waikiki, good hotel but OLD inside. Service is great. My family had a great time there and we miss the breakfast buffet, there are lots of selection and fresh cut fruits. Would definitely go back to this hotel again and recommend it to anyone! I have been to Hawaii 14 times and I finally found the hotel that I truly like!

We stayed here for one night after our cruise. We arrived at the hotel in the morning and were able to check in immediately. The room we were in was a corner room so the balcony was big. The room was spacious and clean and equipped with a large flat screen TV and mini fridge. The sofa is also a pullout bed but we did not use it.The location of the hotel was excellent because it was only 5 minutes away from the beach by walking. There were plenty of shops and restaurants within a 15-minute walking distance.The breakfast came with the room and we had breakfast before heading to the airport. The food was average. Beware of birds in the breakfast area. They would come eat your food if unattended.It was a good stay overall and would consider staying here again if we could get a good rate.
user_name:
SandiTravels12
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent 4 nights here from April 22nd to 26th, 2014. Good things:- Free breakfast with plenty of selection. That is a nice touch considering in Waikiki meals can be pricey. Fruits, pastries, hot and cold cereal, bacon and eggs etc etc. It was very busy as to be expected, but we felt it was run quite efficiently and the food didn't run empty.- Rooms were nice and clean as was the rest of the hotel. - Comfortable beds- Good location. We didn't find it too noisy (Waikiki can be very loud) because we were facing a side street. The hotel was just a couple of minutes walk to the beach. Most of the beach front hotels are very pricey compared to being a block or two away.- Free wi-fi (the other hotel we stayed at in Waikiki charged $10.00 per day)OK things:- Front desk staff were just ok. Not overly friendly, but not rude. Just doing their job...nothing more, nothing less. The bar staff were a little more in tune with customer service I think. They have a happy hour in the afternoon and make good tropical drinks.Things we didn't like:- If you want a decent size balcony with a view, you may want to give this place a miss. We were on the 5th floor (I asked for the highest floor possible and that was it - hotel was apparently very full). The balcony was so small that you couldn't even face forward in your chair. You had to sit sideways because it was only about 2 feet deep and maybe 8 feet long. We gazed over a rather ugly apartment building. Needless to stay, we didn't spend any time on it. Maybe you get a bigger balcony with a room upgrade??- The room was tiny.You get what you pay for. Overall no big complaints about this property. We were satisfied. We paid about $170.00 per night here. We stayed at another nearby Hilton property when we returned to Waikiki after the cruise we took. The Hilton was about $50.00 more per night and you paid for wifi and no breakfast included. It was worth paying the extra though to have a larger balcony with a fabulous view from the 30th floor, not to mention a much larger room.

Soild value with free (and good) breakfast buffet. Free wi-fi. No charge for toll free numbers. Clean. Mini-fridge. Large TV. No DVD. Short 2 blocks walk to calm protected beach. Ask for a room that looks down on a side street NOT a main street which are noisy. Short ride to Diamond head - do it - $7 to park then 2 hour or so round trip hike to the top with fantastic views - take lunch (from breakfast buffet). Don't do it if you have probs with your legs. Includes a tunnel and lots of steps near the top.

Staying one block away from the main strip will knock the resort fee from your bill. The informed traveler who books a non-refundable, 21 day advance reservation, will find that the price will be 20% lower than comparable like the Hyatt Regency, or the Marriott Resort, right across the street.While the numbers are by no means a bargain, they do provide great comfort given the generous amenities, like breakfast and free Wi-fi. The location is just perfect: you are close enough to the beach, but tucked away so as not to be too bothered by the noise.The staff is professional and extremely friendly. The style is bed and breakfast boutique instead of corporate procedural. Service is timely and efficient. Housekeeping replenished all the needed accessories.Upgraded suite had a view of Diamondhead. Room was spacious and uncluttered. Mini-living room couch and table is separated from the bed area by a tinted glass partition. The refrigerator was working fine.The desk is large enough for a computer and paperwork to spare. Strategic electrical plugs are built into the lampshade. Free Wi-fi is right for basic surfing needs. It had an average download speed of 150kb/sec and maxing out at 175kb/sec. A 2-tiered option for a faster download could be a good paying menu choice.Layout is well-thought out. More LED lighting could increase the hipness quotient.It was overall a very satisfying stay.

We stayed for 4 nights at the end of January 2014 and were initially disappointed that we were put in a small bedroom with only one bed, when we had specifically booked a room with 2 queen beds. The reception staff were unable to move us and seemed to have no record of the beds we had requested. Not a great start - but seems to be a consistent theme when booking using booking.com. However, apart from the room, we thought the location was great for the price, and the hotel was clean and well maintained. We also liked the breakfast, even though it could be a little windy in some of the seats. I am sure there there are better hotels right on the beach, but for the price this is a great place to stay for the convenience of a short walk to Waikiki beach which was just amazing!

This hotel is kept very clean, and the staff was very helpful. Did not like having to pay the $28 for valet parking as the other parking was full, EVERY TIME. The breakfast was quite good although I would like to see more hot choices.

This was a great hotel!.Informed at check in that we were upgraded to mountain view room. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds and it was over the top!. Had a sitting area with sofa bed that was separarted from the beds by a partition. Gave extra room for my grandson to play. The beds were super comfortable. No resort fee, which most hotels in the area charge. Breakfast was great but after th 4th day the menu repeats.Room was always clean upon our return. The staff was great. Responded quickly to our requests. No need to call front desk for stuff. just text and they respond quickly!! LOVED this option! Pool is small but the beach is 5 minute walk away. If you have children this area for the beach is great as there is a break there,so it's a little safer.Had some activities for kids like making leis for free! We did not rent a car since it was our first time there and we were fine. The hotel has an agreement with Charlies Taxi for $29 flat rate fee to/from airport. Across the street at the Marriot you can catch shuttles to just about any attraction you may book and the bus pick up is nearby also.5 minute walk to zoo. Shopping and eateries nearby. Away from noisy night life but easy walk to that area. Yes, there are homeless prople laying around on sidewalk, which was surprising but they didn't seem to bother the visitors.This was a GREAT location for our stay and I would stay again!

Overall great experience. Hotel was clean. Staff was friendly. Only 5 minute walk to the beach. Great beach area for small children (there is a breaker in the ocean so no waves). My 2 year old had a great time. Very close walking distance to many shops and restaurants. The breakfast was average considering it's free but that was ok with me considering I didn't want to fill up on breakfast food when I would be eating out for lunch and dinner. The hot food was different every morning. Fresh fruit, yogurt, variety of breads and cereals, and juice. No resort fee.The only cons were the elevator machinery was loud and could be heard from our room and the self-park garage was full so we had to valet park which was pricey.I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Id like to know the room type when others were commenting on rooms being large as, I stayed in a studio and it was incredibly small! The breakfast was poor quality and not much variety. The 24/7 menu needs more options. The location is good. Close to the beach and walking distance to most amenities however there are a lot of homeless people on this section of Waikiki. Next time I stay in Honolulu I would choose a condo rental instead. Some staff are great and others task orientated instead of customer driven. Not my favorite place.

This hotel exceeded our expectations. Room was clean and very comfortable. The staff was fantastic - Friendly and very helpful. Couldn't ask for more.When we heard "free" breakfast, we expected the usual coffe , juice, and pasteries. What a surprise! A hot breakfast buffet with all the extras.The lobby and grounds were immaculate.A short 2 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and all the shops and restaurants along the beach.Can't say enough good about our stay - would certainly stay there again!!

Just got back yesterday and can't say enough great things about the hotel. Amazing breakfast, yep it was windy so we took it up to our room. Our room was huge, we were upgraded, which surprised us as we booked on Expedia and didn't think it would happen. Amazing view, comfortable beds, free WIFI, all round incredible stay. Will be back again for sure.

Pros: Huge room with plenty of bedding, lovely balcony, free wi-fi, generous with towels for beach and pool use, short walk to beach and main Waikiki strip. Cons: Repetitive breakfast with almost zero variation, only 2 lifts servicing entire building, tight and limited parking space, staff was not friendly.

First of 3 minute walk to one of the most famous beaches in the world! Waikiki always sunny and beautiful for all! Hyatt place is not over the top luxury but it has Quality, location and top notch service and a nice breakfast included! Birds to visit in the morning at the pool area where breakfast is served but any out side area has birds and I was the for 5 days and never had a problem! Fresh fruits juices and great daily variety family's will be happy to have this in the morning.The pool is not much but you don't need a pool there.If you are looking for Resort style with water slides and games then Hyatt place isn't for you. But if you want a place to stay and play its awesome choice! They have great happy hour nightly and Tikis is across the way with nightly music! Aloha

First stop on our honeymoon. Will not return for any future anniversaries that is for sure. Upon our arrival we were "upgraded" from my king bed room, to a two-bed room. Just what I always wanted for my honeymoon. From there things only improved, there was maintenance work being performed our first night there, this lead to my wife not being able to sleep (after flying in from Connecticut) and left us with no power in the room that night/morning. They did swap our room out pretty quickly that morning. That afternoon the new floor they moved us to ended up having a sprinkler malfunction or pipe burst, that lead to a flooded hallway and walking through sludge. Not to mention the cleanup crews that were then needed on the hall the next two days.Oh and as far as parking goes, its pretty much a lose lose situation. They have about 10 spots for self park. Be prepared to feel like Austin Powers. They do offer a valet service for $10 more a night. Be weary of them too, my car was returned with the front passenger corner panel damaged. $600 in damages. I was told sorry and not to worry their insurance company would take care of it. Well here I am 50 days later and their insurance company is still trying to deny it for a different reason every time they are proven wrong with facts.I was told from the front desk they would credit me points for future stays and I have heard nothing. I have placed a call to hotel management and will update this review when I hear back.

A place to stay. That's about all.The location was good if you want to be in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The room was comfortable. The breakfast was adequate, but the whole experience lacked the aloha we had hoped for. Stay here if you want nightlife and to ne be amomg the hoards of people. But avoid if you are looking for a slice of paradise.

This hotel was remodeled fairly recently to become a Hyatt Place - so it all seems very fresh and clean. Bed was very soft and rooms in the high tower are a bit larger than normal. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly, including Jade at check-in. Location is great - close to all the action, but a bit away from the really noisy area where some other hotels are located. Breakfast is good - others seem to complain about crowding, but the hotel does provide a tray in the room so you can bring it back to your room and eat on your own rooms balcony. Only downside was my neighbors door seemed to constantly be opening and closing -- not the hotel's fault - but you may want to stay away from XX31/XX32 in the tower since they share one entry area - unless you need two rooms together.Great hotel for business trips with good free wi-fi and easy access location-wise, but you will be sharing with families visiting on vacation.

My freind and I sent 1 night in Waikiki and satyed at the Hyatt Place. It was great. I have stayed in several Hyat Places and they are all nice hotels. The customer service is always friendly and accomidating. The rooms are spacious and nice. The breakfast in the AM is great lots to choose from. Great place to stay

As mentioned by many previously, we found the hotel staff to be excellent, the location is very good, and the rooms clean and well maintained. We also enjoyed the wine tasting one Wednesday evening. The breakfast was more than acceptable with lots of choices. Yes, the pool deck is a little breezy in the mornings (as mentioned by others), but this is Hawaii! The breeze is lovely.We checked quite a few hotels and reviews before settling on the Hyatt Place. We are happy with our choice and would definitely stay here again.

This has been a lovely stay at the Hyatt in Waikiki it is close to the beach shops restaurants and buses. The hotel is clean and room was nice and bed very comfy and had a great view of Diamond Heads. The breakfast had a great choice of food and drinks just a little windy sometimes as it is by the pool area but you can take a tray of food to your room if you want. The staff were very friendly and happy to help any time we had any questions. Would stay in a Hyatt again if this is the service you get.

This hotel is in a great position just back off the beach front with very helpful staff. The price to stay here was very reasonable the rooms very clean and fully equipped with hair drier, iron board & iron, safe box & tv, the beds are comfortable & the rooms are quit. Overall a very good hotel. SteveEngland.

We stayed a couple of nights at this hotel and we were very pleased! The room was very spacious, clean and service was excellent! The hotel bartender had several good suggestions in regards to dinner and really made you feel welcome. There were plenty of good places to eat and shop in walking distance. They even held our luggage for free after our check out because we had a late flight.The free breakfast was good and had several options.

We stayed here for 8 nights in mid March. We booked it thru HOTWIRE. You will save about $20 per night when you book on HOTWIRE off the lowest hotel rate we found. If you want to book on HOTWIRE, pick diamond head location and it has 95% satisfaction rating with breakfast. Booking on HOTWIRE, you will get the less desireable rooms. We ended up on the 3rd floor next to the pool and breakfast area. It had no view and surprisingly quiet. Breakfast was good, hot, and healthy. You get your normal breakfast items plus rice, kimchi, and miso soup. The gym was good size with lots of cardio equipment and barbells as the only weights. The pool is tiny, but you are so close to the beach. You are able to take the pool towels to the beach. The location is very good as you are near the south end of the beach where it is less busy. Excellent sushi resteraunt across the street in the Mariott where it is 50% off sushi between 5:30-6pm on Mondays. Also, fresh udon resteraunt is about 10-15min walk - min 20min line up to get in, but it is cheap and good. The line moves quick and it is worth the wait. If you want to hike to diamond head, it about 7 miles from the hotel. $25 ride to the airport using johnnycabhi.com - realable with pickup and return. Can't wait for our next trip here.

We stayed here from March 18 - March 21. This hotel is a great location, we took advantage of the taxi service from their web page, Charlie's Taxi offers a flat rate from the airport for $29. Good deal and that way you don't have to stop at everyone else's hotel before you get to yours. This hotel is one block from zoo and maybe two blocks to the Duke on Waikiki Beach. We had a room with an ocean view and diamond head view on the 11th floor, but I don't know if I'd pay for that next time, as you are barely in your room and also the hotels below are pretty dumpy looking. The rooms/hotel is beautifully renovated. Breakfast was included in our stay and it was excellent. Huge selection of stuff to choose from and you could take it to your room to eat if you'd like. We did as we found a lot of people in the breakfast line rude and pushy.....you'd think that someone had said this is all the food we have left, so get it now or you'll have none.....not quite sure why people were like that but they were. The pool area is small but not as small as I was expecting from reading other reviews. My daughter was the only one in it a few times. It has lots of lounge chairs around it, so I was always able to sit while she swam. The hotel also has two little gift/snack shops in the basement which were very reasonably priced for their snacks and souvenirs. There is also an ABC store just one block over. Would stay here again.

This is a new hotel by hyatt and I give it a try. As a platinum member, the hotel upgraded me to penthouse. Room are spacious with double bed, desk and sitting sofa . Bathroom are just regular , nothing fancy. Overall clean and decent. Check in was pleasant , friendly Front desk. The only problem I had with the hotel is the service of housekeeping . Requested for a shaver cream , take 3 calls and 55mins to delivered which is totally unacceptable .Other than that, everything is great . Walking distance to beach, Starbucks next block and tips!!!!! Hotel lobby convenient store, prices are less than ABC store. So check the prices and check the hotel store.

I stayed here March 18-25,2014. Most of the reviews I had read prior to booking are very accurate. The hotel is freshly renovated, modern and clean. The staff is exceptionally friendly and professional. We travel a lot and encountered some of the friendliest and most helpful staff. Special mention to Troy, Jing jing and the tall fellow with grey hair who was concierge for a night. You gave us excellent advice! We loved the free hot breakfast and free wifi and these two features alone would be why I would be likely to stay here when I return. There is no resort fee, which is excellent. There is reasonable parking nearby. When we arrived the regular parking, which I had noted was cheaper than other places, was full and only expensive valet parking was left. We drove across the street and parked for a reasonable weekly rate. This worked fine. Check in was very quick and painless. We were told we were "upgraded" from a mountain view to a city view room. Can that ever be considered an upgrade? I questioned this and was told the room was bigger but I seen other rooms the maid was cleaning and this was not the case. However, our lower room made it very accessible to breakfast, lobby and work out room so we were content, especially since the elevators could be slow at peak times. The hotel is very close to the beach and conveniently located next to an abc store. As a gold passport member there are extra perks that are worth it. We especially appreciated a hospitality room at the end of our last day at the beach to shower before our 10 pm flight. I was extremely pleased with this hotel. Mahalo for making our trip so great!

Just back from an eight night stay at the Hyatt Place. The location is convenient to just about everything that you will need. Less than five minutes walk to the beach. The hotel will provide you with towels for the beach at no extra charge. We were in room 1532 with a spectacular view of the beach. For those that have complained about the breakfast, not sure what your issue was but the selection is outstanding. The only complaint would be that some of the hotel guests could be a little more considerate of others that have not yet eaten their breakfast and not load your plate up four and five times. All in all this is a wonderful hotel and the staff are very nice especially the lady at check out yesterday who put me at ease after I had to report that I had spilt an entire cup of coffee on the carpet in our room as we were leaving. The aloha spirit is alive with this hotel and its' employees.

My husband and I stayed at Hyatt Place in February. From the time we arrived until the time we left we found the staff amazing. They were helpful and friendly and bent over backwards to help us upon any request. Our room was clean and big and very comfortable. We were on the 7th floor and overlooked the pool area but that was fine with us as we didnt spend alot of time in our room really only at night as we were out and about the rest of the time. It was quiet and no problem or noises from other guests. The breakfasts were not the best we have had but you could find something yummy to eat and the service was great. The birds were a bit annoying but the staff did all they could to keep them away. The Hotel was very clean and had great amenities. A short walk down the block sees you at the beach and restaurants and shops.

I recommend this hotel. We stayed in a room with an ocean view at a price other hotels charge for a mountain or city view. The room was a good size, had a big comfortable bed, with quiet AC, and we hardly heard our hotel neighbors. There is noise from the neighborhood (i.e. trucks backing up, construction, drunk people yelling) but it did not interfere with my sleep and I am a light sleeper. Every morning there is a good complimentary breakfast served on the pool deck. Eggs, waffles, French toast, bacon, oatmeal, bagels, toast, cereal, juice, milk, etc. The layout of the buffet isn't great which makes it crowded. I recommend you bring your tray from room to the buffet to help get your food. The hotel is renovated nicely and is very close to the beach and zoo. Tour operators pick you up / drop you off in front of the hotel or half a block down. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel concierge helped us book a tour and a luau and his advice was great.I had a great stay for seven nights.

This was our first time staying at this hotel and it more than exceeded our expectations! When we checked in the front desk agent notified us that we have been upgraded to a Ocean View Deluxe Queen/Queen, which meant we were higher above the building before us so that we would be able to see Waikiki Beach. Once we got into the room we were stoked because there was so much room for the kids to stretch out and be in their own corners and not bother one another. The best part about the whole stay was that there was free HOT breakfast daily, which saved us time and money. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and have been recommending it all weekend to the other soccer parents for the next tournament. Oh and if hotel management is reading this, we had the best chambermaid (J. Bautista) give her a raise! :)

If you don't care about pool and breakfast, I totally recommend this Hyatt than Hyatt Regency Waikiki. Hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. The room is also comfortable. And the location is close to bus stop and Waikiki beach. You enjoy staying Hawaii.

Our family of three stayed here for 1 week in March 2014. Hotel has a great location (5 min walk to beach and restaurants). The staff was always friendly. Room was very clean with stylish furnishings. Beds were really comfy and I loved the pillows. Pool was clean and quiet (we often were the only ones in it). Front desk was helpful (arranged and negotiated $29 fare for airport drop-off). Room has a big screen TV with great channel selection (loved having HBO). This was our third time to Waikiki and was our favorite hotel. We will absolutely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

We arrived in Oahu late Saturday afternoon. I think the drive to the hotel was about 45 minutes. We were pleased to have valet parking and friendly staff greet us. The room was very nice with an ocean view that I wasn't expecting. We took a walk on the beach which was very close, had a nice informal dinner in the restaurant adjacent to the lobby (kitchen is open 24 hrs I believe) and off to Pearl Harbor early the next morning. They got the car quickly and we were at PH 30 minutes later. They have free breakfast but we left a little too early. We were perfectly happy with this hotel.

We just came back from a 7 days stay in this hotel. Excellent location, two blocks away from the beach, shopping and good restaurants are also in walking distance. We requested an ocean view room, got it on the 12th floor, which is the second highest floor. Our room had beautiful south and east ocean views. (Any lower floor location may be obstructed by buildings in the front). Staff of the hotel are super friendly and helpful. Breakfast is plentiful, lots of different choices every day, hot food as well as cold. Our room was beautiful, very clean. Maid did room as soon as we left in the morning. Things we were not impressed with were the very high daily parking fees. We found a parking garage a few minutes away across the street for a more reasonable rate. Also there is a lot of very early morning noise from Hotel deliveries etc. All in all we highly recommend this hotel.

Had a very nice room with ocean view as received an upgrade. The air conditioner was very noisy and if it wasn't that we were knocked out by an 11 hour flight from New York City I think it would have made sleep difficult. The room itself was really nice great colour scheme and very well designed. The staff were helpful and efficient and could not be faulted. The breakfast was extremely average and was a disappointment. Very well maintained property though.

The Hyatt Place in Waikiki was chosen as our hotel while we were staying on Oahu (followed up by the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel on Maui). It looks just like any of the high rise hotels in Waikiki, but what makes it super special is its location. You walk literally ONE BLOCK until you get the to beachfront, and what could be better, since the price for the Hyatt Place is very reasonable compared to a lot of the other Waikiki hotels. Very friendly staff, spacious and beautiful rooms greeted us on arrival, and got to know us, which made our day, since they must have quite a lot of guests walking through the lobby each day! Breakfast is fun- outside, so meet some of the African Zebra doves (we called them tiny doves- so cute) and right next to the pool. The pool is quite small, but high up so you have a fantastic view of the beautiful Oahu sky. Definitely worth booking a room here on your next trip to Honolulu.

This was our second visit to Hyatt Place having stayed 12 months earlier on our honeymoon and I have to say that I enjoyed it even more this time around. We booked the Hyatt at the last minute when transiting through Honolulu.The hotel were very accommodating and booked us in quickly and easily. Despite us arriving at the hotel early due to our early flight the hotel not only let us drop off our bags but allowed us to check in early to our room, something that was greatly appreciated.The room was very large and nice and modern, wifi and breakfast were also included and the Hyatt is great value, probably the best value in Waikiki considering what it offers. Its slightly back from the beach but you are also not paying the huge beach front premiums. Breakfast is included and the hotel setting is nice as well. There is a gym and pool on site as well which is a nice touch.Honestly, I would highly recommend the Hyatt if your on a bit of a budget.

I liked this hotel, loved the breakfast. Location was just a few blocks from the beach and easy for me to drive to the offices I needed to be at. Walked to the beach several times, the hotel gives you a towel as well. Also liked the tour desk in the hotel loby, took advantage of a few tours. was really great!

We hailed a cab at the airport and asked to be taken to the Hyatt Waikiki. Upon arrival at hotel we discovered that we had actually booked the Hyatt Place, so off we went a few blocks away. We were welcomed with open arms at the hotel, which is much like a Marritott Courtyard. The hotel has been recently purchased and was fully renovated. The room was fresh feeling and very modern, with nice linens and fluffy towels. The staff was great and the amenities very good. There is a Starbucks,bar and food options, all available 24 hrs a day. The front staff mans the previous, so there can be a wait for the food. There is a complimentary buffet breakfast and unlike some other hotels the main hot choices are changed daily. The 2 minute walk to the beach was nothing and the beach area was great, with nice sand and a wide beach compared to some other parts of the island. The hotel provided towels for the pool and or beach and trusted us to return them. We found the concierge to be most helpful and willing to assist in any manner required. There are two small gift shops in the hotel and they provided nearly everything one might need during the stay.I would stay there again and felt it was a much less stressful hotel than the big and bustling Hyatt.

We booked this hotel after 2 terrible hotels. We were so relieved when we arrived. The lobby is absolutely beautiful, and the reception from all hotel staff is so welcoming. The lobby area is open and modern. The room is so open and spacious, with a great sitting room off the bedroom. Lots of counter space by the beautiful and modern sink. After being so disappointed with the other hotels, this was a breath of fresh air! Half a block to Waikiki beach, and 3 minutes to the Zoo. 3 great little shops on the main level, and an ABC a few steps away. I can't say enough about the staff. Every single one was so friendly and helpful! Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it!

We enjoyed our stay on Oahu for 6 nights. This hotel was located in Waikiki and we were able to walk to many restaurants and activities. We used Charley's Taxi service for the places that were a little farther away. The hotel breakfast was ok, we ate it most mornings but toward the end of our stay, we ate out because we were tired of the same things. The staff was always very helpful and we loved the ability to text requests to them, although at times, the response was slower than we would have liked. There was only one set of elevators for 20 floors and this caused a delay many times. It was nice to have fresh clean towels for the beach or pool when we needed. Wish they would have had chairs or mats available as well. The room was clean and good sized. We liked the pull out sofa as well as the two beds. Upgrade to Penthouse level was great and our view from the corner room was fantastic! We could see Diamond Head and the beach.

We had a very nice stay at this hotel during our 3 days on Oahu. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet in the morning was delicious with enough variety each day and the outside patio where we ate breakfast was very nice. You also have the nice option of bringing breakfast up to your room instead. We were closer to the ocean/beaches and some excellent restaurants/shopping than we originally thought--these were only a 5 minute walk away. This hotel is across the street from the Waikiki Banyan parking lot where you can park for 15 dollars per day with in and out privileges. We had a partial ocean view room on the 11th floor and the views were more beautiful than I thought they were going to be. We asked for a quieter floor in advance and the hotel accommodated. We had a late plane to catch and the hotel securely held our luggage during the day while we enjoyed some exploring of Diamond Head which is only 5 minutes away. I thought this stay was great value for the money and we will stay here again when we return to Oahu.
user_name:
Bonnie C
Bradford West Gwillimbury, Canada

review_body: I recently stayed in this hotel with 90 high school students, and the staff didn't bat an eye. Willing to help with any question or need, the staff here was one of the friendliest I have come across in a while.The rooms are modern, in good shape, and clean. There is also a breakfast included that changes from day to day so you don't get board of it. There is always fresh fruit on offer both at breakfast and in the lobby (green apples). The pool leaves a little to be desired, but you are in Hawaii, go swim at the beach!The location of Hyatt Place at the end of "the strip" makes it a good place to stay. You will be close to everything, but not right in the middle of all of the noisy action. Jump in a cab for a short ride to Diamond Head for a hike, or take the city bus out to Hanauma Bay for some snorkeling.Good for kids as well as adults, I would stay here again anytime.

This was our first visit but I'm pretty sure it won't be our last. The hotel is spotless, the staff dedicated to making sure you are comfortable, and you needs taken care of. Our room had an ocean view so we were greeted by the sun every morning, and relaxed to a sunset. Our view was also center stage for a fireworks display on the ocean the last night we stayed it was a perfect ending to our visit. The only thing that was uncomfortable was the breakfast included with the room. The buffet itself is well done, but turns in to a feeding frenzy when unattended kids or entitled adult take over. I'm not sure what of if Hyatt can do much about this, but I felt I should at least mention it.

Great location. Clean modern rooms. Fast check in less than 5 minutes. Comp hot and cold breakfast...very nice touch. Free use of a room to shower and freshen up before our red eye flight after a day at the beach. Pool is very small but we didn't use it at all due to the location to the beach. Will def stay here again.

My Husband & I stayed at the Hyatt Place & overall were satisfied w/ our room & service. I didn't enjoy the breakfast b/c of the selections that were offered & the food was luke-warm but overall we were satisfied w/ our stay. The beds were comfortable & the hotel was quiet, despite it being a very busy hotel.

This is a new hotel, renovated with new furnishings and beds. Rebranded Hyatt Place -- an interesting choice given that most Hyatt Place are smaller properties but this is a high rise with two towers -- easily one of the largest hotels in the Hyatt Place chain. In fact, this hotel seems like a favorite of tour groups. Not really a convention hotel as there is limited meeting rooms.The hotel is not quite ON the beach -- but just a few blocks away. It is right across from the "bus/service" entrance to the huge Marriott Waikiki so rooms facing the Marriott will be noisy from tour buses and delivery trucks. The Diamond Tower would be quieter. As others have noted, although the hotel is not in the main Waikiki Strip, it is very close and convenient.Hotel has all the standard Hyatt Place amenities with some twists:- A.M. Skillet (free breakfast) has heated-in-the-oven type eggs/bacon/waffle combinations (not quite your full american breakfast but standard Hyatt Place fare). But it also has fresh pineapples and rice/miso offering.- Toiletries are your standard Hyatt Place offering, except that body lotion is "on demand" only and not in the rooms. So if you need moisturizer, be sure to ask for it at the front desk.- Watch your food during breakfast to avoid birds taking off with a bite. Trays in the room are provided so bringing food back to your room is allowed -- and even encouraged.- Some rooms have a full sofa-bed available.-- Keys are now the RFID kind. No demagnetization of keys and you need to have your key when using the elevator.- Lobby is "open air" as is traditional in many Hawaii hotels. Lots of space to stretch out. There's a tour operator right in the lobby, not something you find in many Hyatt Places.- There's wine tasting offered one afternoon. But a little pricey $18 for 6 pours if I remember correctly.- Very limited parking. So don't plan on renting a car if staying at the hotel. But it's walking distance to Waikiki and we had city (TheBus) transit service right in front of the hotel that took us to the tourist places (Ala Moana Shopping Center, Downtown Honolulu, HNL airport, DiamonHead, Pearl Harbor, etc). All in all, a very pleasant stay. Not a resort, but a clean, tourist level hotel convenient to major sights.

Service was good. the food was excellent. Nice view, full of green.Floor was clean and speck.The drinks were added with nice toppings to munch. general eco friendly. Neat shower, with clean toillet. Good view

Good quality hotel in the eastern Waikiki area for those who dont need a pampered vacation experience and only use the hotel as a place to sleep at night. Check-in was a breeze and the room is clean, functional, and large enough for two people and two large suitcases. We were placed on the "Penthouse" floor (all the way at the top) which gave us great views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Everything worked fine and the bathroom had plenty of hot water and a nice walk-in shower (no tub). The location is excellent: within 1000ft from the beach and outside of the extremely crowded areas of Waiki but still very close to the shops and boutiques. The hotel offers $18/day parking, but another great option is the lot at the zoo within 50 feet of the hotel. You can pay $1/hour here and end up cheaper if you only pay to park the car at night. There are even some free spots nearby if you can park after 9pm and move the car before 7am. Plenty of restaurants and there is an ABC Store (convenience store) right next door to get anything you forgot. Three small issues I would like to point out:1). When we were in Oahu it was windier than usual, but you can clearly hear the wind howling on the top floor of the hotel. It's not obnoxiously loud but it is definitely there. It didnt keep us awake but a very light sleeper may have trouble. 2). There are only two elevators for 20 floors worth of rooms so you can imagine the wait can get pretty long as elevators can either be full or take forever to get to your floor. My wife and I actually walked down the stairs from the 20th floor because of an extremely long wait, one morning. 3). The breakfast order is outdoors; great if you want to enjoy the beautiful weather but tough when you want to enjoy breakfast in peace without chasing birds away. One of them almost pooped squarely on my wife's head. I understand that the risks with an open-air dining spot but a simple net over the area would keep the birds out without spoiling the open-air feel. Overall a very good stay and a hotel that I would use again the next time we come back. You cant beat the value, location, and modern rooms.

This is a great hotel, and a great priceI had a high floor and ocean viewPros-Big room, Baday ( which was interested and different) ,- short walk to the beach,nice balcony to sit on -fridge (big) -nice but small gym-Cam at the expedia desk is super helpful- good mai-tais at lobby bar and nice siting area if the bar is full or you just want to sit in nicer chairs-Breakfast was good an had lots of variety/ had a variety on tea and coffee ( I'm a big tea drinking so I loved that they had variety and not the basic black).. and you could take it in to go cups-coffee and tea area in lobby nice and quick for morning when going on excursions Cons-Small pool (never used it)- no hot tub ( some nights were a little chilly ( Cant complain to much about the cold.. a lot nicer then buffalo but I really wanted to go in the hot tub so I was disappointed that there was none)-breakfast and coffee/tea station opened at 6:30 and most of our excursions left at 6:30 or earlierour solution.. had stuff in our room for the mornings we left early Wish the coffee tea station was open earlier for when having to leave earlier... there is a starbucks right by it in the hotel, but you have to pay for it and who wants to pay $4 or $5 for the same coffee or tea thats including in your hotel for free.overall nice hotel, wasn't in there much, nice beach, excursions are great ( although be prepared for them to pick you up late, as they go around to multiply hotel to get people timing can be offRecommend Dukes Restaurant on the (went multiply times, beet salad and veggie burger were both delicious.Must get the Honolulu cookies so good!excursions-rent a car drive around the island (convertible is what I recommend.. worth it!)-Pineapple maze was fun ( did this the day we drive around the Island)-Swim with the dolphines-luau was awesome ( I recommend Paradise cove) -Disney resorts beaches are super nice ( close to the luau, went there before the luau.. and we go into the resort which was nice and unexpected)-Mai Tai sun set cruise is nice, fun and beautiful-Do Diamond head for a easy hike -acai bowl is so good
user_name:
Alexandria_s225
Buffalo, New York, United States

review_body: The Hyatt place is a good city hotel within walking distance to all the restaurants on Waikiki beach. However with this comes also the street noise of Honolulu. The rooms are spacious and comfy. The breakfast buffet is ok but the seating is limited and be aware of the birds which will eat from your plate if you are not careful. Self parking for $18.00/ night is fair.

We spent two weeks at the Hyatt and found the accommodations to be first rate. From the time we checked in to our departure, the staff went out of their way to help us. We especially appreciated Troy's help and recommendations for dining and booking us tables. The housecleaning staff did a great job in keeping the room neat and stocked with toiletries. The location of the hotel is ideal as it is not in the middle of the beach strip so is quieter than many hotels yet provides quick access to the beach. The only drawbacks were the small sized pool and soft mattresses. For anyone with a back problem this could present a problem.

Reward travels rock my socks!! Free room, Ocean view upgrade ~ Thanks Hyatt Rewards!!! I like Hyatt!! And their hotels. Last year, I got to stay at their category 6 hotels aka Park Hyatt Tokyo for freee. Too bad they don't have yelp Tokyo. Else I'd be all over that page for 10 stars. Hotels~ always elegant, mordern and upscale ish without being too swanky flashy. Rooms are nice. The bed-I loveee a good bed and Hyatt always have that plushy, fluffy, comfy beds. Their amenities are pretty darn good too.Pros: location, free upgrade, ocean view room and my awesome bed!Cons: breakfast bar & the pool. Both are quite small but considering how this is right in the middle of tourist zone/shopping/wakiki beach walk. I hate this area but I love my stay here. And I get to text them about my requests from room. The room keys are much easier, you put the card against the bolt and it opens. I also love the room service via text.Over all, you can't go wrong with Hyatttt! Maybe I;ll try out their pool next.

My family and I stayed in two rooms at this hotel in January 2014. The location is outside of the busy part of Waikiki and a short walk out to the beach. The rooms were spacious and clean. There was free wifi. The breakfasts had many options available and we often brought our food back to the rooms on the trays. The only problem we had was that two members of our group got stuck in the elevator after breakfast! We were very concerned because we did not know how long they would be stuck in there. The hotel staff kept us informed of what was going on and they were able to get out after about 30 minutes. This was not too bad, although the hotel said they would follow up with us afterwards, they did not call us until we had already checked out and left the island. Other than this, our stay at this hotel was really good and I would return if I got a good deal.

Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach we chose as the third hotel on the ten-day vacation in Honolulu. The location is good, five minutes' walk from the coast. Maybe it's a distraction close to the main road where traffic is quite loud, so I recommend choosing rooms face away from the road, perhaps to the sea. Rooms on the lower floors are less expensive (due to the aforementioned noise), on the higher floors the rooms are larger and more expensive. We have a room in the 4 floor, the noise was heard quite a bit, so it was not possible to sleep with the window open. A small swimming pool is on the third floor, next to him in the morning serves a very good and rich breakfast. but there is a little space, so it is necessary to wait for the free table. The hotel also offers self-service laundry, a travel agency, shops, as well as arrange for transportation to the airport, with a fixed price of 29 dollars. If the price is good, very recommendable hotel.

For the most part, all the other reviews are on point. This was my first trip to Honolulu and I was pleased with my stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki and would recommend it for those who want to stretch their dollars and don't mind a three minute walk to the beach and a 15 min walk to the shopping center of Waikiki. My 14th floor view of Diamond Head was so, so because a building partially blocked, but I wasn't there for the view.Pros:Very Clean room, probably cleanest I've been in the past 12 months of a dozen or more hotels.Room size -very large, not sure if there is a difference in rooms but mine had two queens, and just a lot of empty space giving it an airy feel, plus a couch/sitting area and small balcony, good for drying towels and bathing suits.Excellent helpful, friendly staff - I left behind my phone charger, called the hotel the next day and the housekeeping manager David Smith, mailed it to me at my request (i paid a small postage fee, less expensive than replacing). Shaun and Blaine the valet parking guys were great.Front desk help great.Affordable rates, would have expected this hotel to be pricierFree WifiFree hot/cold breakfast buffet. Staff was always refilling and cleaning area and present. Included a miso soup with tofu, vegetables, etc for those wanting a Japanese breakfast option.Free coffee in lobby in morningLobby snack bar.No restaurant - but 24/7 food menu available including entrees and more to bring to your room (I did not try this service)A 24/7 restaurant called Mac/24 is around the corner in the Hilton. Other restaurants are toward the beach two very short blocks away.A Lawson convenience store in lobby was opened til 1 am.and prices were cheaper than the ubiquitous ABC convenience stores everywhere else. Even the sushi in Lawson was good.Taxi Flat rate of $29 to airport.Knowledgeable, friendly concierge/tour guides in lobby to help with local attractions and tours and such.Small pool, I did see people using it.Gym - did not useCons - (not specific to the hotel, rather the location)Location- I would have liked to have been a little closer to the heart of the shopping in Waikiki where the Sheraton, Royal Hawaiian and Surfrider are - it's about a 15 min leisurely walk on the boulevard that runs along the ocean. But the savings at this hotel were worth the walk.Beach - the beach just down the street wasn't geat- there's a retaining wall of some sort to keep the waves out, just feels weird, but if you head straight down to the ocean and make a left, and head north just a block or two, the beach is nicer and you can rent a lounge chair for cheap- $5 an hour or $20 for the day. The better beaches are outside of Honolulu. Neutral -Birds - let me address this as I've seen it in many reviews. The breakfast buffet is served in a covered area. It was incredibly clean, always staffed and I ate there 4 mornings and no birds were in the food area. You can take the food back to your room or eat in the outdoor patio. Yes, there are birds who want to eat your crumbs. Honolulu is a major cityYou can't keep the birds out unless you enclose the common areas - but this is the pool area, so it's not going to be enclosed. I was not grossed out or bothered by the birds and I've got high standards. So if a dozen or so pigeons are going to bother you, then don't use the free breakfast.Bed - I had a good night's sleep, but the edge of my bed was weird, the mattress felt like a foam mattress at the end. Basically couldn't sit on the edge of the bed, but with the couch and desk chair, I didn't need to. But I did sleep well which is why this is a neutral issue.Zoo- around the corner from it if you are into this sort of thing.I didn't use the public transportation but I saw city buses and tour buses and trolleys all the time.

I love this hotel, because- The cost is from 75% to 50%, compared to on-the-beach hotels of Waikiki- The serevice is of the Hyatt- It has casual atmosphere and the lobby is quiet- The room is clean and the bed is good for sleep- Breasfasts are free- It has an athletic gym and a coin laundry which accepts credit cards! (you don't have to bring many quarters!)- It is convenient, because -- at the 1st floor, there is a Japanese famous CVS "Lawson" -- a pick-up and dropping point of inland tours is located Marriott Waikiki, just in front of this hotel -- Honolulu zoo is near from this hotel- You don't have to pay the "resort charge", which some hotels charge for the Internet, telephone, or some other services- A stop of "The bus", Honolulu's public bus, is very near from this hotel- The hotel can call a "flat rate TAXI", which costs only 29 USD(not including tips) to the Honolulu AirportBut on the other hand,- This is not a "luxury hotel"- You have to walk more than 5 minutes to reach the Waikiki beach- You have to walk more than 10 minutes to reach the center of Waikiki, such as Moana Surfrider, Royal Hawaiian Center, or Waikiki Beach Walk- Because the place for brakfast is very small, you have to wait for a moment to find your seat especially when raining (many seats have no roof and parrasols)- This hotel doesn't have bed guards for your babies (but has baby cots), even though the Hyatt customer center says "yes"- The lanai is very small (but has small chairs and a table)- Even though your room is a "ocean view", you have to see some buildings located between you and the ocean

This was my fourth visit to Honolulu (each time just a day or two on my way home from another island) and happily the first place I've stayed at that I would definitely return and stay again. I had an Ocean View room on the 17th floor. Yes, there are two buildings between Hyatt Place and Beach, but if you are up on a high floor the view is quite beautiful. Best of all, while I've given up on any place in Honolulu being what I'd consider fully quiet, this was relatively quiet and with earplugs or closed door to lanai slept beautifully. Comfortable bed, refrigerator and coffeemaker in room. I loved the location. At east end of Waikiki can still easily walk to central parts, just two blocks from Zoo, beach, Kapiolani Park. Easy walk to aquarium, Kaimana Beach (which is a little less crowded and nicer than main Waikiki Beaches). Breakfast surprised me - I can't normally eat American style breakfasts at hotels, but this included Japanese style as well as American and I was able to have miso soup, rice, pickles and tofu. (FYI, they also had eggs, waffles, oatmeal, and other items). I think what impressed me most was the service. While by Waikiki standards this is a moderate priced hotel, service was excellent. From walking in to checking out staff was friendly and helpful. They had a computer center where I was able to print out my boarding pass which was another plus. Finally, if you are a Hyatt Gold or Platinum member, you can use points to get free nights or reduce cost. I would have stayed here anyway, but that was a really nice added bonus.

Hyatt Place Waikiki is an awesome hotel because it is so close to the beach. The location is great because it is in the heart of the busy district of Waikiki, and is in close proximity to world class restaurants, other hotels, and shops. This hotel offers views of Diamond Head, the beach, or the busy streets of Waikiki. I RECOMMEND THE VIEW OF DIAMOND HEAD. These rooms are quiet, and peaceful because every morning you wake up to the view of Diamond Head. This hotel has a small workout room, and a pool. NO HOT TUB, bummer:(

I found this hotel very nosey and it had no security to prevent anyone from coming onto the second floor where my room was located, Imagine my surprize to come back at 4 pm and finding a maids wedge in the door but no maid to be seen or found on the floor, When I did find someone they said they would investigate but heard nothing. The hotel had a good breakfast buffet but is lacking a restaurant for lunch or dinner. All in all I don't think the hotel is up to the Hyatt standards.

Stayed here for a couple of days to get a bit of time in the hustle of Waikiki and get over the trip. Super location and friendly staff. The included breakfast was great but get there early and watch out for hungry (Not angry) birds. The location of this Hyatt is just perfect. A short walk to the Beach and the busy shopping area of Waikiki.

The hotel is really a nice treat right in the heart of Waikiki. While I have stayed at numerous hotels on Oahu over the years, this place is amazing for service. The staff at this hotel do a nice job taking care of guests.The room we were in was on the small side, but very nice. I would stay here again.

Good location easy to walk to Waikiki beach and shopping strip. All staff were nice and helpful. Breakfast was of average if not poor standard, and I couldn't believe all the birds feeding off the clean up trays. Yuck! Rooms were average, crappy balconies but nice modern bathrooms! Good wifi included. ALSO.. on the top penthouse level which anyone can access, there is a balcony to the right after exiting the elevator, makes for awesome photos! Wouldn't stay again as there are much better hotels closer to the action for the same price.

We spent two nights at this wonderful hotel before our recent cruise. Beautiful room, very helpful and friendly staff. Great location just an easy walk to Waikiki beach, the Honolulu zoo, restaurants and shopping. The included breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious. The hotel even mailed some forgotten items to our home in Florida. I would book there again and highly recommend it to everyone.

I emailed the hotel prior to arriving to check they would store luggage as we had an early arrival of around 8 A.M. and check in was 3. The reply back a few days later was no problem. Bags were stored tied together with other bags by a cable cord in the lobby. When we were able to check in we were given a single bed room when I had booked two beds in the room, (and was told this was an upgrade on my booking) so went back down to ask for my original room as I needed two beds, not one. The girl behind the desk said this wasn't possible and that it is a request, not an actual booking that can't be honored on my room type, apparently, even though they advertise city view rooms with two queen beds on their own website for booking. She suggested we sleep on the pull out sofa - not what I'm paying good money for and when I booked the room over 6 months prior. After making us wait over half an hour, and being told we would have to move rooms later in the week from a one bed to a two bed, eventually the situation was rectified and we were in fact given a two bed room like I'd booked (so turns out they existed after all). Room was huge but on the second floor so was not subject to the key activation security for the elevators, which only works for levels 3 and above.
