However, I think we were punished for asking for the two bed room we had booked for as our room backed onto the elevator shaft (not too much noise from that, thankfully), and also the driveway by Kuhio Ave where traffic was super loud all night long and we were woken around 6 A.M. each morning by the delightful noise of the dumpster truck arriving to empty the dumpster in the driveway one floor down from our bedroom window. Noise was terrible - I have stayed in hotels by the airport and hotels on Broadway in NYC and never heard a sound so they really do need to soundproof these rooms.Breakfast was good with a hot food selection on a two day rotation basis. However as it is outdoors by the pool birds are absolutely everywhere, which is not good as I have a huge bird phobia! Location is good with a block walk to the south end of Waikiki Beach and close to the bus stop and an ABC Store. A tip for the hotel, as I prefer to book direct through the hotel website where possible/feasible - make your prices on your own website more competitive to third party sites and people will be more likely to book direct with the hotel - first time in a long time I've used a third party site as the hotel site's prices were astronomically high comparatively.

The tower we were in overlooked the canal area and you could see Diamond head from the lanai.Stayed for 10 nights and never got sick of the breakfast as different choices daily. The breakfast would keep us going all day with just a snack needed till diner. We would go to breakfast before 7am and the birds don't bug you at that time.Our room had 2 queens and a lounge area with 4 seats.Best shower/bathroom I have used in a hotel, the room never got steamy or have condensation in it.Close to the beach, we hired surf boards across the road in the Marriott Hotel.Close to shops and restaurants.Even with the lanai door open at night we would sleep really well, the car sounds and other noises would not disturb us.Very nice area, safe to walk around there at night without worrying.Always clean, nice foyer and towels for the beach.You need your room key to access the floors in the lift, so very safe hotel.

Stayed here in October for a night before going to our rental home in Kailua. Was given a great room that was very clean and had a nice view of Princess Kapiolani park and Diamond Head.Very friendly staff and nice free breakfast buffet. Good location at the end of the Honolulu beach, a block or 2 in however. Will definitely visit again if the price is right and I want to stay in busy Honolulu. Sorry I just prefer the quieter more authentic parts of Hawaii.

The room was spacious with 2 queen beds, work desk and a couch. It It was perfect for our family and the kids loved the hotel room. It is an easy walk to the beach, restaurants, shops and the zoo. The breakfast that was included in the stay had a variety of food options - eggs, protein, pastries, yogurt, juice and even pickles veggies w/rice! We did not experience the bird problems others were complaining about. It is next to the pool and is partially outside. It opens up around 6:30 am. Self parking $18.

Only a one night stop over on our way home.....after 4 weeks of hotels room, I loved this room. Everything was new and the room was huge, beds and pillows were great. Air con was quite, breakfast was really great with a good variety of food, which you can take back to your room if you wish as a breakfast tray is provided in your room. Hotel is down the Zoo end of Waikiki, but nothing is too far away in Waikiki to walk too. Plan to visit again.

We stayed 2 nights before heading to the Andaz in Maui. Glad we started our trip here instead of ending it. Mostly because Waikiki is just so crowded (expected) and full of loitering and drugged hobos (not expected) begging for weed money. Plus the Andaz in Maui is awesome. Back to the hotel... only 4 stars because the pool isn't worth getting into since its so small and no hot tub. However everything else about it was just what we needed... free breakfast that has lots of options and slightly changes each day (watch out for birds), close proximity to beach and main Waikiki restaurants, complimentary ocean view room upgrade, nice updated rooms and nice tv.At only 12000 hyatt points, I would definitely look to stay here first IF we go back to Waikiki in the future.
user_name:
Dan B
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Wow where do I begin! The staff was so friendly, helpful and genuine everyone from the front desk to our awesome housekeeper. Our room was beautiful and recently remodeled we loved the layout with the sofa sitting area. I have to comment on how quiet the hotel was; we never heard any noise from others on our floor. We had a gorgeous view of the ocean from the eleventh floor. The breakfast in the morning was terrific and the choices and options changed daily. This was our first time coming to Oahu and because the experience was so great we will definitely be coming back next year and we will be staying at the Hyatt Place!!

There is NO RESORT FEE and that in and off itself makes this a place that should be rewarded with a great review. I'm sick and tired of hidden resort fees for stuff you should be getting as part of your hotel stay.The Hyatt Place was a surprise. I wasn't expecting all that much, but it was far and away a nice surprise. We loved the location as it was close to everything. The valet crew was on top of it totally. The front desk staff was always so kind. The morning breakfast was better than most hotels that offer complimentary food. There was plenty of fresh fruit and oatmeal. Sitting around the outside fire is a nice way to start the morning.We were on the 9th floor and our room was huge. I was surprised that this place had such a large bedroom.

Not a lot of sleep in this hotel which needs a good renovation. Our room was located in the Diamond Tower over the lobby and on a street. We heard loud street noise all night long, motorcycles, etc. We room decor needs updating as well as the baths which are probably from the 70's. I don't plan on staying here again until after the renovation.

Me and my husband stayed here for our honeymoon (delayed by 13 years lol) and also celebrating our joint 40th birthdays. We got a free upgrade to a deluxe ocean view (booked a regular ocean view) without asking. The room was on the 11th floor, which was not high enough to see the ocean without other buildings blocking it, so I would say it was more of a partial ocean view. The room itself was spacious and very clean. Bed was comfortable. Rooms cleaned daily but they left our food tray behind one day.Hotel is very close to beach - probably a 5 minute walk. Located close to the zoo/aquarium. We walked down the strip (amazing shopping, we couldn't believe it!). Tour buses often parked across the street at the Marriott. Be careful when booking tours as they confused us with the Hyatt Regency and one tour didn't pick us up because of it, others made us go to the Mariott. So somewhat of an inconvenient location for the tours but just make sure you double and triple check when booking.The concierge desk is not visible when you walk in so be sure to ask.Breakfast was ok - they don't provide trays, you must remember to bring your tray from your room. Coffee is quite strong - selection ok regarding food, pretty typical. Big money saver.Pool is a small rectangle. Not great but I recommend spending your time at the beach anyway. Wouldn't have been a deal breaker unless we brought our kids.Cafe around the corner from the front desk offers some Starbucks items but we never got served - stood there without being acknowledged so we went elsewhere. Not the hotel's fault though.On our last day we had an early check out but a late flight. They will hold your luggage and give you a courtesy room to shower in but you must book in advance to get the time you want and you only get 30 min.We opted to pay a day rate and we were moved to a room in the other tower, it was way smaller (not a deluxe) and just had a shower. It would have been ok for a couple but that's it.All in all I would say that this hotel is better for couples or people with older kids. It's clean, economical, friendly staff, and it smells heavenly! It is a no-frills place, so if you are looking for fancy resort style, this isn't for you. However, Hawaii is expensive so I would say save your money, stay here, and spend what you saved on the tours.Thanks for a great stay and memorable vacation. We will recommend to others for sure!

We were in a deluxe city view room on the 4th floor that was spacious with a king size bed, couch, and a small balcony overlooking the very busy Kuhio St. The negatives of the room were the extremely small bathroom and the street noise. The complementary breakfast was OK and typical of many chain hotels such as Holiday Inn Express or Marriott Fairfield Inns. The coffee is Starbucks and outstanding. If you don't think the breakfast is adequate they will not MAKE you eat it and you are free to go anywhere else. The breakfast crew does a nice job handling the morning crowd. The pigeons in the breakfast area are not as bad as I was led to believe by other reviews. It is not exactly a scene from Alfred Hitchcock'sMovie "The Birds". However don't leave your food unattended for very long. It is a short walk to the beach and many restaurants.The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. One piece of advice is to let the hotel get your cab to the airport for $29 and save some money. Overall it was a nice stay.

We had an enforced stop over due to flying Hawaiian Airlines from San Diego to NZ, and after much searching chose here, and am so glad we did.The hotel is stunning! The rooms are clean and well laid out, the beds were really comfy, and the shower powerful, even on the 11th floor. Breakfast is fruit, cereal, pastries, yogurt, oatmeal, cooked items, and ramen - everything catered for! The coffee is also good and strong, and they have take out cups so you can grab your coffee and go. En route, we saw some of the other hotels I had looked at, and am SO glad we chose the Hyatt Place! This is also easy walking distance to the quieter end of the beach - so you can actually walk along the pavement without being hassled by people trying to get you to have your nails done or shoot firearms. The beach was also quieter - a real no brainer to swim there!The staff are all lovely. Davi - who checked us in - was particularly helpful, and gave us a good recommendation for dinner too!Overall a fantastic night's stay. Will certainly stay here again if there is a next time!

Loved this Hotel! I had researched lots of Waikiki hotels for the perfect holiday. We were travelling with 3 teenagers/young adults. We stayed for 10 days over Xmas. Hyatt Park fulfilled my requirements which included large rooms (opt for Deluxe Queen with cozy corner), free wi-fi, free breakfast, ocean views, no resort fee, car parking, within easy walking distance to beach and shops, welcoming staff etc. The Deluxe Queen room was large (50sqm) and adequate for 4 people. We also booked the Deluxe King next door which was perfect also.We arrived early (8am) after a long flight. Our room was immediately available and we were offered breakfast also. I had asked for a room in the Diamond a Tower, highest floor with ocean views and the room was perfect. A huge thanks to Monique who assisted me via email prior to arrival. The Hyatt is recently newly renovated. Staff are excellent. Nothing was too much trouble. Free breakfast was a bonus and we sometimes used the trays provided and took it back to the room. I had read the lifts were slow but as we were in the Diamond Tower we never had to wait more than a minute. The room on Floor 14 was very quiet, really comfy beds, excellent wifi, TV and amenities. We never noticed any undue noise from the street. The hotel is at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki and only minutes from the shops. We enjoyed the nightly walks up and down the strip each evening. We rented a car and were lucky to get a car park for our stay. Pool was small but as the location to the beach was only a short 5 min walk it was not important. The gym and laundry facilities were adequate for our needs. We ate out each evening and never had to walk more than 10-15 mins to a restaurant. The majority of good shops and restaurants are about a 10minute walk which is great for exercise after a meal!We booked a couple of tours through hotel, thank you Chris (Expedia) who organised the Xmas Day helicopter flight at short notice even after being told there was nothing available. Great location for tour pickups right at the front door and on the bus routes. The hotel happily organised a late checkout and a convenience room to use later in the day as we had a midnight flight. Perfect!!Overall if you require a smaller, boutique, friendlier, newer hotel I would highly recommend this hotel. This is not really a hotel for small children (ie kids clubs, resort activities) or if you plan to spend endless hours at the hotel. It is however perfect for couples, older families or business travellers who require comfort with no hassles or intend to be out exploring each day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would not hesitate in staying here again.

Stayed at Hyatt place for ten days in November. The checkin was painless and welcoming staff. We checked in late and had inform the hotel about our late flight.After checkin there seems to be minimal staff to help load in trolley so I did it myself with a half asleep child and a hubby who tries to find parking.As I cart the 4 luggage that we have I didn't realize that there's two wing and ended up in the wrong one. All the way to the high floor I called reception and they told me that my room was the other building. Was not excited to roll this cartful of luggage and push. I passed thru the reception and 2 staff saw me and didn't even acknowledged to help. :( finally I got to our roomIt was small than what I'm used to and we requested a King size bed. With a sofa three feet away from the bed so there's much room to really. The balcony has ample space and a partial ofOf Waikiki beach. Cleanliness of the room I question. Few times I had to pick up a piece of paper or a crumb from the night before. And I don't think theyVacuum the rooms on a daily basis. That really erks me because we are on the beach all day and sand is bound to collect so not happy about the carpet how it's not being cleaned.The daily breakfast was plenty and busy but you can always find a seat. Just make sure you don't leave your food unattended . This was a daily morning entertainment when people don't realize those birds are so notorious! They want your food! The cleaning staff and kitchen crew for breakfast are pleasant :)The cafe by the reception tho was a different story. We had a late snack night and a waiter seemed like he didn't wanna be there a simple mushroom soup order and milk for the lil guy. Waiter didn't make eye contact and just not engaging. So we never went back and decided to not eat there anytime :(Really nothing of a WOW factor just a stay :)

We loved the location of the hotel, of course we don't mind walking that is major part of any vacation experience. It was about 2-3 short blocks to the beach and a block from the ABC store. We didn't have any problem with noise but we didn't face he street. The staff was very accommodating and we set up many of our expeditions with Expedia expert near the lobby. Most tour companies would pick you up at the curb or on the other side of the street. We made leis down in the lobby which was a wonderful experience and it felt like genuinely Hawaiian experience, many other people joined in with us after they saw how much fun we were having. The young man down at the bar named Nick was very friendly and explained to us how to get to several locations we asked about. The rooms were nice and more than what I expected when room is a commodity there. The free breakfast gave plenty of options and of course the pineapple was out of this world I ate it everyday we were there and have tried it since hoping to have such a beatific reminder of our time there, with no luck. We stayed in November 2013 for 8 nights. Since leaving I thought about nothing but returning to Hawaii and I would stay at Hyatt Place. I recommended this hotel to friends that were going the following month and they stayed there a week as well. Thank you for your hospitality and we ( my boyfriend, aunt and mom) will be back as soon as possible!!!

My husband and I stayed there 7 nights and were very happy with the overall experience. The rooms are very small, but the shower is huge and the bed was big and comfortable. Staff were very helpful and kind, rooms were clean and fresh, location was fantastic. Your only a couple of blocks from the beach and tons of restaurants and entertainment. Breakfast was AMAZING. Plenty of protein and fresh fruits to start the day healthy, or waffles and pastries if your wanting a treat. Be sure to bring your own bottled water though, they charge $3 for the ones stocked in the mini fridge. I left my very nice, expensive jacket in the closet, and only noticed when we arrived back home. When I called, they had found it and were happy to mail it back to me promptly, Very impressed. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Family of 5 with three teenagers we loved this hotel .. Managed to get us all in one room on the 19th floor with beach views - beautiful. We arrived at 7am after a very long flight and the desk staff made our room available by 9am it was brilliant. We loved the location right near the beach and walking distance to the shopping/ restaurants. Breakfast was fantastic we looked forward to this every day. The staff always had a smile and a friendly aloha ... Would we book again - absolutely !!!!

Booked on a last minute special through Hawaiian Air the night before, this hotel turned out to be a great stay.Located 2 blocks back from the beach it offers clean rooms and courteous service. Staff are friendly and accommodating. The hotel has a small pool and a laundry room ($3 each per wash/dry). The daily breakfast was fine, although a bit repetitive, offering hot and cold Western style food and Korean options. There is an in house Lawson store selling Japanese and western style foods/supplies and an ABC store selling everything 20 meters from the entrance. Although there is no room service available, hotel food can be ordered downstairs and is served either at the bar or in the lobby lounge area.We were offered late checkout on request free of charge, with the use of a hospitality room to freshen up/shower etc before heading out to the airport for the red-eye back to L.A. Would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I spent 8 days here. Hotel was very nice and staff was very nice in different situations. Breakfasts were amazing with plenty to choose from. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Wonderful location with a short walk to Waikiki beach.

My wife and our best friends spent 5 days on this lovely property and loved it. Kind hospitality and wonderful location stands out the most for this leg of our journey. 3 blocks away from Waikiki beach, walking distance to great shopping and restaurants. Daily hot breakfast and complimentary gym and wifi. We rent a car and visit other favorite places throughout the island, so being located near the freeway is a huge plus. The rooms were renovated and offer a clean, quiet, and modern option to sleep in while being around the action in Waikiki.

Usually stay at Kahala but on a short trip Waikiki is best so chose this hotel for the first time. Totaly remodeled from an existing long term hotel apartment complex, and an excellant transformation. Excellent check in, room was huge, no view on tiny lanai but who cares when one block to beach. 42 inch plasma tv, separate sink shower areas. Breakfast included just fair buffet but you are encouraged to bring everything to your room. Trays provided for ease. Pool is small but all the kids are at the beach so its quiet. Excellant gym right near the pool and 24/7 for the gym.. very professional staff and lots of security. Will definitely stay here and save $200 a night.

My family and I recently stayed 7 nights at this hotel, and were pretty impressed. We didn't have a good start - having booked an ocean view room, some 6 mths ago, we arrived to find our room sold. We had to settle for a "city view" room (ie carpark view) for 4 nights, until an ocean view room became available. Gil, the duty manager, agreed to reduce our room rate for the duration of our stay, by way of compensation. This helped to reduce our disappointment.Compared to other hotels we've stayed in, in Waikiki, the room rate was reasonable. Breakfast was included. The offerings were 'average', but sufficient. There were only two elevators servicing 20 floors, which was frustrating. Aside from this, we were pleased with the hotel, and would recommend it.

We spent 7 nights here. We arrived before 11am but got check-in immediately. Free breakfast buffet probably saved us $300. The downside is small pool and no spa, but Waikiki beach is just out there. Nice location to walk everywhere including Safeway, Rainbow Drive-in, Leonard's bakery, Zoo, Aquarium, beach park (you can do snorkeling there) and when we got so tired from walking, we just take the bus back to hotel, the bus stop is right across the hotel!

Hyatt Place (HP) is located 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. (Don't mix it up with Hyatt Regency which is across the street from the beach.) There are 2 buildings in Hyatt Place: Pali and Diamond. Other than location, I don't know what the difference is. Our room was awesome, complete with a little reading nook by the window which was perfect for watching the sunrise. There was free wifi, mini fridge, large screen TV, coffee maker and a mini balcony with chairs. The room was smallish but liveable for our 7-night stay. The room was refreshed daily (Lanie was so thorough!). Other amenities were available upon request (curling iron, baby chair, shaving kit, etc).The friendly staff were relatively quick with service. The lounge area was huge in the front. Off to the side was the 24/7 Galleria Cafe/Bar with another lounge area. Computers with internet/printer access are behind this area. Expedia reps comprised the Concierge desk. They work daily 0700-1800. Our rep was Chris B who was patient and explained things well. There were also foreign language reps, offered by a different company. There is a small pool and fitness centre.Breakfast was complimentary daily 0630-0930. We weren't expecting much. But we were surprised: there were 2 different daily hot portions (waffles and sausages or French toast and scrambled eggs) plus a section with miso soup (plus rice and kim chi). There was fresh fruit, breads, toast condiments, oatmeal (with condiments), yogurts, cereals, pastries, granola, juices and coffee. The hotel recommended coming early or bring your tray and eating in your room. Tables were constantly busy. (Watch out for the aggressive pigeons!)Overall, HP was worth the price especially if you get a deal. We didn't drive but just like any downtown touristy area, parking is expensive. The city bus service is pretty good. But look around for free trolleys. We found out you could book a free trolley from the neighbourly Aston hotel. The access to shopping is ridiculously easy. Check out the smaller independent shops (like Maki shop beside Subway on Kalakaua Avenue). Be prepared for the street sellers (only one wholesale tour salesman was supremely aggressive). I was surprised to see the high numbers of homeless individuals. But the mild weather attracts people who are not financially prepared to live in Hawai'i.

A belated review having stayed at Hyatt Place for two four night stints either side of a 7 day US mainland trip. Rooms were excellent, good size, spotlessly clean and well furnished. The buffet breakfast was also very good. Although essentially an eggs and bacon breakfast person the range on offer (which doesn't include them) was more than sufficient and appetising to fuel up for the day ahead. The staff were always friendly and ready to help where required. The free computer/internet access were particularly useful for bookings ahead etc. Although located only 100m or so back from the beach Paoakalani Avenue is right at the end of Kalakauana Avenue (just by the zoo) so at the end of a tiring day it can be quite a lengthy walk if you finish your evening at the other end.

We enjoyed our 10 day stay here in December. The staff are great and very helpful. The room was good, liked having WIFI in the room and the bed was so comfortable. The hot and cold breakfast in the morning was great. It was so nice not to have to go out and find a restaurant in the morning and if you are on a tour you are usually picked up early so we didn't have to rush.

This hotel has everything. the rooms are very clean an roomy for me anyway , I had a wonderful stay here , the staff gave me a worm welcome from the first day too the last, the breakfast buffet is great, pick your time to eat or there well be some waiting time, the bar was nice for a drink or two, the beach is just on the other side of the street , seen one of the rooms with the ocean view nice but high priced wish I had the money for this. I like to set in the room an look out at the view of Hawaii in the afternoon then go shopping in the evening then go out for a great glass of wine. you must try the trolley hop on hop off great to get to one place to the other or to just see Hawaii.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights and were upgraded to a corner suit. Nice clean hotel with friendly staff. The location is not as good as the other Hyatt, however it is nice and quite. The location is still within walking distance from all the shops and restaurants. The valet was good value. The breakfast buffet was limited, however as it is free you can't complain. The pool has no view and the sun can be obstructed by other tall building. Would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Wonderful, is the best description I can find for this hotel and its staff. From the first minute when we received such a warm and comprehensive reception from Kimberly, to the last minute when we sadly departed, everything and everyone contributed to an excellent stay. The hotel manager can be very proud of this team of exceptional people. If you are looking for a quiet place in Waikiki, away from the main buzz, but just a short walk to the park and the beach, this is the only location to consider. The modern, quiet, comfortable rooms, great WiFi, excellent buffet breakfast and the all-round service make for the perfect escape. It truly is an oasis in the city!

I am a Hyatt Gold Passport member and was very pleased with this hotel. I used the valet parking, something I usually hate. But in a big city you are not always in control. It took the valet just a couple minutes to get the car. Nice group of guys. The housekeeping staff was friendly and did a great job. The best deal in Honolulu must be the free breakfast. I looked for a tip jar and didn't see one. The staff keeps the eating area clean. The food was good and a great variety of juices, coffee, cereals and hot eggs and either bacon or sausage. Items change daily. Stayed on the18th floor. Elevator was fast, no long waits. Sat on the room balcony and enjoyed our wine. We had a "mountain view" which was fine. The hotel is in a big city, a block from the beach so don't expect great views from your room, but you aren't paying Ocean Vista prices either. We don't spend much time in the room. Easy walk to the beach and shopping.

We stayed at this hotel for four nights and it was a great experience. The service was excellent, the staff was always willing to help and make you feel at home. Loved the breakfast, room and location. There are better hotels in Hawaii but for the price, this is one of the best options in Oahu. I highly recommend this hotel for those looking for a great deal.

We stayed at the Hyatt for only one-night but during a visit to the island of Oahu that included a horrible stay at one property (the PK) and a first-class experience at another (Aulani). The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was a perfect blend of the two and where we would likely stay were we to return for a lengthier visit to Waikiki only.We were upgraded to a deluxe city view room, which we understand significantly increases the square footage. Even though the room was city view, we could see ocean from the lanai, which was a nice bonus. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. There was a little seating area, which was nice but the table was this tiny ottoman so not a good place for eating or drinking. The provided breakfast was not amazing but was not horrible. plenty of hot meats and pastries and usually some egg choice. If you care about your coffee, you will need to get it elsewhere.One tip: have a person in your party take the tray in your room down to the breakfast and stock up on goodies that can take you beyond breakfast.

For the price, I was expecting a bit more. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient. The location is good, and the free wi-fi and free breakfast are some of the good things about the hotel. What I was a bit disappointed about was the small size of our ocean view room, and that the air-conditioning only cooled so much. It was very hot when we stayed there, so we were sweating the entire time even with the air-conditioning set on the lowest temp we could get it. The free breakfast sounded nice, but beware as it's somewhat of a madhouse with screaming kids and families everywhere grabbing food like it's going to disappear.

We stayed at the Hyatt for the first week of November, with the intention of just chilling out for a week. We found the hotel perfect for this. To go through the things I would want to know: Location, two minute walk to the beach but off the main road. Our balcony did not have the best view (3rd floor) but we were on the same floor as the breakfast. The room was OK, nice bed, shower only, but roomy enough. As an FYI, if you sat on our balcony you needed to turn the aircon off as it pumped warm air onto the balcony (unless you want a heated balcony!). The buffet breakfast (included) was OK and had the added advantage that you could take it back to your room on the supplied trays. The staff were always welcoming and could not help enough. BTW, the hotel will supply beach towels FOC so no need to fill up you case with them. Simply take them in the morning and return at night so you always have fresh one's. So with the rooms, the staff and the extra's we found it good value and would return. If there is a downside, it would be the open bar area which is not that welcoming as it's on a main walk through, but with all the bars in Waikiki, it's not an issue!!

After looking at various hotel options in Waikiki, the Hyatt Place seemed to be the best value. Self-parking was $18 (a steal compared to other hotels at $25/night) with valet parking at $25.Our room on the 18th floor was very very clean -- everything looked quite new still and the carpet was clean enough for our infant to crawl around on. The views aren't much given all the hotel towers nearby but we didn't really care about that. The staff are super friendly and I felt like I was hanging out with friends!Another plus was the skillet breakfast. Tasty and just enough variety that we were still enjoying it 5 days later. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

After a lot of reviews and research we chose this hotel and felt lucky that we did so. The Hotel Staff was very friendly and hospitable. The Breakfast was excellent and the beach was just a few minutes away. I was lucky to get a self parking spot which can be reserved for the duration of your stay. Overall nice hotel with an excellent ambiance. The ABC stores are nearby just in case you need to buy some stuff. We had an ocean view balcony which was really nice.
user_name:
ASK_Dreamliner
New York City, New York

review_body: Started our 10 days in Hawaii with a quick 2 nights in Waikiki and tried the Hyatt Place. Hotel is a block off the Main Street that runs along the beach at the far end by the Honolulu Zoo. Staff was very friendly and the room fairly upgraded although you can definitely tell the rooms were once old with popcorn ceilings and old textured walls. They tried to scape down the ceilings and paint over the texture which does a somewhat good job of giving the room an updated look but you can definitely tell it was once an old style Waikiki hotel. Bed was very comfortable and the furniture updated. Our room had a very nice Lanai which wrapped around to see some of the Pacific through the buildings. The free breakfast offers a basic meal to get your day started and saves you lots of money as meals in Waikiki tend to be expensive. Pool was kind of a letdown as it's tiny and the fitness room also leaves a little to be desired but all in all a very reasonable place to stay in Waikiki. They also don't charge an annoying resort fee like almost every other hotel in Hawaii.

We flew into Honolulu at the beginning of a two week Hawaii holiday. When we come to Hawaii we usually stay at Waikiki for the first few days to get acclimatized before moving on to one of the other islands.This is our third trip to Hawaii and this time we picked the Hyatt Place Waikiki to stay for four nights. We arrived late due to plane problems and when we arrived at the hotel, even though we had booked an ocean view room, we found we were upgraded to a very nice suite with a view of Diamond Head and the ocean on the 18th floor. Check in was very easy and the desk staff were friendly and helpful. We found the room clean and well appointed. The room included a first class breakfast by the pool every morning. The only problem is it is outside by the pool and if it is stormy, you have very little seating under cover however, you can take your food to your room or to seating in the lobby no big deal. The only other minor problem we found was in the wing we were in, there were only two elevators. When it is busy, the wait for an elevator can be quite long. We found the Hyatt Place Waikiki was great value for the money relative to other hotels in Waikiki. The free breakfast and free Wifi was a definite plus.

This hotel is in a great location far enough away from the noise and yet close enough to the action in Waikiki. The rooms are spacious with a modern decor and very clean.Service is exelllent.Would highly recommend this hotel when staying in Waikiki.

Just spent a couple of day in Honolulu transiting from Australia to Canada; which meant flying during the night and landing at 08h00+. So arriving quite early around 09h30, the pleasant people of the Hyatt welcomed me warmly and made a room available right away.Room was excellent, King Size bed as requested, quiet and functionning Air Conditionning, good size flat panel TV, and a fridge. Excellent washroom with shower only but super for me. No noises came from the street; hence, a good night of sleeping. The hotel is within 4 mins walking to the beach; how can you beat this. They had valet parking or self-help... the actual parking is under the hotel and a door directly lead to the hotel; so don't bother using Valet parking.There is an office of Expedia (local folks) who found me an excellent catamaran cruise (3.5 hrs on board KoOlina)); the cruise picked me up at the hotel, super catamaran, great snorkeling at two different places seing huge turtle, 8 dolphins, loads of colorful fishes, and even a whale. Food was excellent and with good alcoolized drink too (2 provided free).The same Expedia guy checked for Luau and show.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 4 nights at the beginning of our Hawaii vacation. The room Was Very clean and recently updated. It was on the smaller size as far as rooms go, but it did have a full sized couch and dresser. The TV was on top of the Dresser which was on the left wall, not at the foot of the bed. I think if they had arranged the rooms differently, it would feel like a much better use of space. It was not laid out well. The bathroom was near the door, and not visible from the bed, so it gave the room a little larger feel. The sink was on the outside of the bathroom and had almost not space for toiletries. If you are more than one person, you have to put them under the sink. Again, a poor design and use of space. The bathroom had a walk in shower and commode. That room had no a/c but did have a small window that needed to be opened after each shower to let the steam out. There was a safe in the closet and a small frig in the bedroom. There was a coffee pot and coffee as well. There is a large tray in the room, best used for the complimentary breakfast on the rooftop. Breakfast was excellent and included a huge choice of foods to everyone's liking. Plenty of hot coffee, tea, cereals, pastries, eggs, potatoes, yogurt, fruits and juices. The staff keeps everything full and replaced. There was never anything missing. The birds are a problem and it requires a little team work to get your breakfast at the table without the pigeons attacking. The staff tries their best to keep them away as well. That is why the tray is necessary, so you can carry all your food at once and not have to leave it unattended on your table. I do think they could come up with a "green" solution to keep the pigeons away, like owls or fishing wire. I did not seem to notice this problem at any of the other outdoor areas we ate. Parking is expensive and that costs balances the "no resort fee". However, if you park across the street, it is a little cheaper.

This was my second stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki, having visited the exact same week in 2012. All staff members are very pleasant, helpful and accomodating. Great location, fresh-looking rooms and a more than adequate breakfast spread. Value, value, value is the name of the game here and it's a huge asset if you've done your research on other hotels in Waikiki. Many people complain about the birds at breakfast, but all open air restaurants in Hawaii have birds. Even the Four Seasons Maui has persistent birds at breakfast. Don't leave your food unattended and you'll be fine. The pool is small, so if you arrive expecting to see a flashy resort pool, you didn't do enough research. I was so pleased to see Nick behind the gallery bar again. He makes wonderful happy hour drinks, has a loyal following of guests and really is an excellent ambassador for the Hyatt Place. I will happily return here and will continue to recommed this hotel to others!

Located in a great spot right across the road from the beach. The buffet breakfast was amazing the quality of food and the selection was top notch. The service pool side was great. checking in and out was breeze.

Lots to like about this hotel just a 5 minute walk from Waikiki beach: big, very clean rooms that look brand new; super comfortable beds and blackout curtains (helps w/the jet lag); free and fast wifi; free and surprisingly tasty breakfast w/quality coffee; a very clean and uncrowded gym; helpful, pleasant staff; and a good location only a 5 minute walk from Waikiki beach. There is also a decent pool, but with the beach that close, you'd have to be kind of crazy to use it. Getting all of this at the prices we were paying was a GREAT value compared to other places in Waikiki beach - can't emphasize that enough.Only (nitpicking) negatives are the lack of on-site parking (which, to be fair, is something you'd probably encounter at a bunch of hotels in the area; there is a large, separate parking garage a half block away that you can also use) and the pigeons that hover nearby at breakfast (which, to be fair, is probably the fault of people who don't bus their trays and instead leave partially eaten food out, which the pigeons pounce on). If I could give half stars, I would probably give this a 4.5. Overall, this is a very good hotel and you will not be disappointed if you stay here.
user_name:
rferris33
New York City, New York

review_body: We were very pleased with Hyatt Place Waikiki. The rooms have been updated and comfortable, decent wifi... They have a Free Breakfast. It is a decent spread. This is a big plus especially when you are travelling with kids. Only downside are the birds. Not sure why the hotel hasn't done something about this. Do not leave your plate unattended. They can get pretty aggressive.The location is very good. It is close to everything and in a way better that you are not right in the middle of the hotel strip. You can park in the garage across the street for $15 day.If you keep your expectations realistic, this is good hotel.

Newly renovated, this is a great addition to the Hyatt chain. From the time of check-in through to the end of our 8 night stay, the staff in all areas were fantastic and always on hand to assist - In particular Troy and Danielle at the Reception area. One of the perks of staying at a smaller property compared to some of the larger hotels at Waikiki is that you are a person and not a number - the staff soon knew our names and coffee orders, always greeting us with a friendly welcome as we walked through the lobby. Our deluxe room on the 18th floor was huge, modern fittings and decor and had direct ocean views and partial views of Diamond Head. The free breakfast included in the rate offers a great selection of continental items with changing hot items daily - set amongst the pool area on level 3 it is comfortable however there are birds which can annoy some people. Situated one block back from the beach, the hotel is approximately 10 minutes walk from the main strip of hotels and shops, central enough without being in the midst of the busy area. There was some traffic noise mainly from the hotel across the road having a bus pick up point located there but nothing too major to disturb sleep. WiFi was inclusive - fast in speed and strong in signal. The Expedia Concierge (Cameron) was extremely efficient and friendly and has a broad range of contacts - he was able to book us a particular rental car we wanted when our friends staying at a competing hotel were unable to do so using their hotel concierge. It was a fantastic stay - we will be sure to return in the future

I was really impressed with my stay in the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. Everything was great if not perfect. My young family (2 adults with 2 kids) spent 12 beautiful nights during November 2013. The hotel & the room exceeded my expectation. Staff in the hotel were decent, welcoming & polite. Special thanks to Kimberly who allowed us to early check in as our flight arrived very early in the morning and the kids & us were tired. There was a room available, and she thankfully provided it to us.Breakfast was a big advantage, specially when you have kids, considering that food price is not cheap in Hawaii. We really like the offered hot food & the fresh fruits, plenty of food, they are very generous. But the birds were annoying though.WiFi access was easy in the room & the whole hotel, signal & speed was strong & satisfactory.Our room (Deluxe room) in level 19 was very spacious (biggest hotel room I've ever seen), modern furniture in a very good condition, clean, big TV screen, overlooking Diamond Head & partial ocean view. Our booking was supposed to be ocean view room, and when I spoke to reception they confirmed it's an ocean view room & one of the best rooms in the hotel. I was not convinced by the response, but I did not request a room change as I liked the room given to us, I was just making sure that we were not given wrong room.The hotel during our stay was pretty much 100% full, but we did not feel that issue about slow lifts or so, probably little busy during breakfast time but that was not an issue to us.Gym is well equipped with new & modern equipments.The hotel is about 10-15 min walk to the heart of Waikiki, but I see this as an advantage, so it's away from city noise, however street traffic itself can still be very noisy. I was lucky to be in level 19.The hotel was 4 min walk to the beach.We enjoyed our stay to the most in this hotel, we'll definitely come again & we'll recommend it to all our friends.

I've stayed at this hotel several times and each stay has been consistent with the rest. The best experience a hotel can offer you is an uneventful one. No one wants memories of hassles, frustrations, or bad service. Luckily this hotel offers none of those. The staff are very helpful. They are fair and accommodating where they can. This hotel is in a great location and is one of the newer properties on the island. It's also one of the few hotels on the island that has contemporary styled rooms. Internet is stable. Hot water is abundant. Beds are comfortable. You really can't go wrong with this hotel. It's less than a block from the beach. It's next to the zoo which gives you good views of Diamond Head plus the beach. It's an easy stroll down the beach to a multitude of restaurants. My only con for this property, which is really a con for almost every property in Waikiki, is parking. This property only has about 18 self-park parking spaces. They do also offer valet but they have even less. So make sure you confirm that they actually have a space for you. This property uses a third party vendor to manage parking. They dress in the same shirts as the hotel but they operate completely separate and there is little communication between the two. So even though you've purchased parking as part of your room rate, doesn't mean you will actually have a parking space. This has happened to me more than once. Therefore always a good idea to confirm with the hotel they actually have room for your car when booking a rate that includes parking. Otherwise you could be left in the cold. Parking in Waikiki is a pain. There are very limited parking spaces on the island in general. The closest public parking to hotel is the zoo parking lot. It's meter parking, but you can use a credit card. You just have to keep feeding it. These meters don't have an off period. So you're billed 24/7. It's approximately a $1.00 an hour which is the going rate in Waikiki in general. If you have to park there it's approximately $24.00 a day versus approximately $15.00 a day at the hotel.

We knew we had made the right choice the minute we set foot on the property. It is beautiful and open, very tastefully decorated. The staff are so friendly and informative. The rooms are large for 3 adults, but there is also a sofa bed and chair that makes a bed. I understand its a newly acquired hotal for Hyatt and has been completely remodeled. There are shops downstairs, bar and food area where you can sit on the open lanai. There are 4 computers and a printer downstairs for use, which is great to print out boarding passes. The free breakfast is fantastic with something different everyday. You can get eggs, sausages, breakfast sandwiches, fruits, yogurts, cereals, several bread choices. They even have an Asian breakfast section with rice, miso, kimchee etc. Unlike most breakfast where your choices are cereal, toast and muffins. This accommodation really helps stretch your travel budget. The only flaw to the breakfast would be the location which is out by the pool. The birds can be annoying and the second you leave to get something, they swoop in and starting eating your food. I would think someone would've thought to put a net or screening up . They also have an onsite Expedia Concierge. That is a fantastic bonus for us, the new travelers. This is our first time in a Hyatt hotel and will definitely try them again..

Hyatt Place is definitely the hidden jewel in Waikiki. How do I love thee, let me count the ways. First, the breakfast buffet is simply the best that I have ever seen inside US and it’s completely complimentary. The hot items changed daily while the fresh fruit and other staples are available in abundance every day. The room is modern and stylish but the best thing is the large LG flatscreen TV. The TV is enormous, at least 50 if not 55 inches – the largest that I have ever encountered in any hotel. It was fabulous to watch the World Series on a large screen TV after work. Additionally, Hyatt is merely 2 blocks from the Waikiki beach that is literally lined with restaurants and shops as far as you can walk. There are more restaurants in walking distance than you can shake a bat at and the biggest problem I had every night was deciding where to dine. Another good location perk is that Waikiki is close to Hanauma Bay so it’s an easy 30 minute drive east on H1 to the best snorkeling beach on the island.The only issue is with parking. There is no free parking anywhere in Waikiki near the beach. Hyatt offers valet parking however there are limited number of self parking spaces that you can request if any become available. All of the valets are friendly and helpful as well as the front desk clerks. Any visit to Hawaii will be wonderful but Hyatt added class and a level of comfort that far exceeded my expectation.

My family and I stayed here for 4 nights. It was great accommodations for two adults and two kids under 5. Our favorite aspect of the hotel was the free hot breakfasts provided. Though simple fare, it satisfied hungry tummies and saved us money. They had hot breakfast sandwiches, cereals, yogurts, pastries, oatmeal, granola, fresh cut fruit, coffees, teas, and juices. They also have kimchi, steamed white rice, pickled veggies, and miso soup if you prefer a more asian-style breakfast. They alternate days cooking waffles, pancakes, or french toast (the best out of the 3) as another option to the breakfast sandwich. I'm not a big coffee person, but they do have Starbucks downstairs operated by the hotel staff. You can bring down the tray provided in each hotel room to bring back breakfast if you want to eat in privacy. The breakfast buffet is served outside near the pool and birds are a problem. Don't leave your table unattended with food, else you'll find your breakfast missing when you're going to grab your oj. Our room was spacious enough. Our balcony had a slight view of Diamond Head. There was a queen bed and a sofa with a pull-out bed. There's free wifi. Upon arrival, we were greeted very warmly by the staff and they gave the kids their own small sand bucket with toys to use as they pleased. It was great. They also had a small fridge (bigger than a mini-fridge) that was adequate to stock up 12 beer bottles, a few cans of soda, water, and snacks. On Friday afternoons they offer a lei-making class. In terms of location, though only a block away from the beach, if you want to go to Duke's or International Marketplace, the walk can be anywhere from 15-20 minutes. Bring a stroller if you have kids. Want a workout? If you're feeling a bit adventurous, take a long walk down Kapahulu Ave. to reach Leonard's for malasadas, Safeway, ONO seafood (where they have great fresh poke bowls), and plenty of other food places. Diamond Head and the Zoo are next door. Hanuama Bay is 10-15 minute drive away. The nearest ABC store is a two-minute walk and the hotel has it's own little mini-mart. Hotel parking is minimal (maybe 20 spaces?) and costly. We did have a car and never had an issue finding a space no matter how many times we went in and out (it's low tourist season, though). We would definitely come back here and recommend this to family and friends. Each day we were able to load up on breakfast that lasted us to past lunchtime, and it was one less meal to pay for and worry about. I truly appreciate that the staff were extremely kind and welcoming. It made our stay more enjoyable. They greeted our kids so kindly each time and happy kids make for a good vacation.

My husband and I booked our honeymoon at the Hyatt 9 months in advance and when we checked in they only had two double beds available and we only got our room switched half way through are trip. The lines for breakfast for extremely long. The beach was right across the street which was okay and the food at the hotel was very good. If I wasn't on my honeymoon I wouldn't of minded as much with the beds but I felt the Hyatt didn't do or try to accommodate us at all.

Clean hotels, friendly and helpful staff, and concierge service. Breakfast was included, with good quality bread, juices, pastries, but poor quality of dairy products (milk was cold, but yogurts and cheese were warm and not adequately iced/cooled for the warm weather so be careful when consuming these products) and fruits (only pineapple and melon were available and sometimes small flees flying around so one needs to wait until they bring out fresh fruit before digging in). Birds on the deck were a real nuisance, so watch where you sit. Poor selection for vegetarians or those on a gluten free diet. Otherwise, the tea, coffee, juices, and breads were a convenience if you don't want to go out and spend money on breakfast. Close proximity to the beach and shops which was helpful, and a lot of tour companies pick up from either the Hyatt or the Marriott across the street. The rooms were small and not a great view (we had a 14 floor ocean view but not great as building are blocking the view). Make sure you take air spray for the bathroom as the fans are non-existent, so it smells the room - if you catch my drift. The AC conditioner was good and you could vary the temperature so the room would not get too hot or cold. Main thing was that they were cleaned well and fresh sheets and towels were available every day. About a 3 star quality, but overall good for a reasonable budget trip which was what we wanted. If you want more luxury, try the Sheraton on Royal Hawaiin which are the best from what we could see, although I'm sure there were others.

We liked the Hyatt Place except for the breakfast and the roof top area which was like a wind tunnel. We stayed for 6 nights in a nice spacious room with obstructed view of the beach but it didn't bother us too much. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The free Wifi tested our patience so we gave up on it. In our opinion the only thing that let the hotel down was the breakfast and where it was served.

Stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights towards the end of our trip. I am a Hyatt member, so I was upgraded to a larger city deluxe room upon arrival - decent size for me, hubby and our toddler. However, the view was rather horrendous - just a site of rundown apartment buildings next door. The location is okay but there is a bit of a walk to the center of Waikiki but very close to the Honolulu Zoo. However, my issue with the hotel are the elevators. I am not sure if this is an old converted apartment building or what, but the elevators are extremely slow - I waited 10 minutes one time: not easy when you have a toddler. And the breakfast was sub-par, don't book this hotel because of the complimentary breakfast - it's only a handful of items and it's barely edible.

We booked this hotel for one night before we had to catch an early morning flight home from Honolulu. I was afraid the room would be really small because the price was reasonable for Waikiki. I was SO wrong! We had a beautiful, large room with two beds and a sleeper sofa on an upper floor. It even had a view of the beach and ocean. This hotel is top-notch - modern, clean furnishings and all the amenities you could want. The staff members are very friendly and helpful. This hotel serves a breakfast buffet on the pool deck each morning. It is VERY crowded, but they offer a large selection, and there is quite a bit of seating. The pool itself is quite small, but who needs it when the beach is 2 blocks away? We couldn't have been happier and will probably pick this hotel again next time we are in Waikiki (over our usual suite-hotel!)

We've been going to Waikiki a lot in the last few years and after staying at the Aston Waikiki beach 4 or 5 times in a row and not being too happy with it (it's on the same street), we decided to try something different.I'll be comparing the Aston and the Hyatt Place in this review. If you don't feel like reading my whole review and see which hotel I would recommend, here it is!Without hesitation, I would say, stay at the Hyatt Place!!!The only three things that were better at the Aston were the great balcony views, the proximity of the ocean and the fact that you can borrow beach chairs.We booked 4 nights on Expedia and had a good deal at $170/night. The good news is that the Hyatt Place doesn't charge a resort fee (like the Aston and the hotel Renew next door). The resort fees have unfortunately been spreading like a virus in Hawaii.The check in was really nice. We had a few simple requests: a quiet high floor room, not to be next to an ice machine, a pop machine or near an elevator.Unfortunately, one wish could not be granted. We were offered a room on the 2nd floor.From now on, I have to admit that Lynn at the desk was such a pleasure to deal with. She tried everything she could to please us and to make it work.The hotel seemed to be full that day and she tried to look into the next day to see if we could move to a higher floor. She was successful and we were set to move to the new room the next day.In the meantime, we moved into the room on the 2nd floor and thanks to Lynn, she put us in a corner unit. (they seem to be much bigger rooms)Honestly, we were pleasantly surprised with the room: the quality of the furniture, the cool design bathroom, the extra small living-room with another big flat screen TV, the large comfortable king size bed and the extra big wrap around lanai.Even though the room was great on the 2nd floor, it felt claustrophobic with the apartment building right across from it.I would definitely recommend to make sure to ask to be at least on the 4th of 5th floor.We were a bit familiar with the hotel. In fact, we had previously stayed in the hotel when it was called the Ocean Resort hotel a long time ago.I can tell you that they have done an amazing job with the hotel. The former place was a dump. But now, we love it. After staying at the Aston 4 or 5 times in a row, it was a breath of fresh air to see a great new and current hotel like the Hyatt Place. No moldy bathroom and no holes in the curtains. Just a fresh cool designed hotel in 2013. (I realize I'm not being very nice to Aston)...The noise. Honestly, I was expecting so much more noise (and we are light sleepers), especially on the 2nd floor. But it wasn't a problem at all for us. The breakfast. We tried the breakfast on the first morning. We didn't like the experience. It was a bit similar to the way the Aston functions and frankly, it was not our thing.The food was average and it was too much of a hassle with too many people. We preferred going to the Starbucks at the corner of Kalakaua and Kapahulu.After reading so many reviews, we were not surprised or upset about the breakfast situation.The location. We are very familiar with Oahu and we love this location. It's a bit outside of the madness but close enough if you want to go in there.It's also close to Kapiolani park and Queensurf beach which is a bit more quiet to other Waikiki beaches. As a tip, I would recommend to walk to Queensurf if you want to take great pictures of Waikiki, especially at sunset.As mentioned before by previous reviews, there are homeless people in the neighborhood.The parking. We've used the Waikiki Banyan parking which is is only a couple of minutes away for the Hyatt Place on Kuhio Avenue. It's 15$/day or 80$/week as October 2013. Their prices have been going up but are still the best in the neighborhood.The views. The Hyatt place is surrounded by very tall buildings and chances are that you won't have much of a view on lower floors (possibly on higher floors too).In conclusion, after trying out the Hyatt Place, there is no way that we would return to the Aston Waikiki beach hotel.The Hyatt Place beats it in every categories.I'd like to thank Lynn again at the reception for making our stay so much more comfortable and pleasant. If you realize that she's checking you in, you will know that you are well taken care of.

Stayed for 5 nights, with 30% discount. Friendly & helpful staff. Comfy beds & nice big rooms with city view, actually a view of marriott accross the street. A bit noisy early in the morning (bus stop across the street at Marriott Hotel) as our room was just on the 2nd floor. Requested for a room on a higher floor, however none was available. Hotel with complimentary breakfast buffet, would have appreciated a little more choices & change in menu. Lots of birds (pigeons) flying all over the place picking on leftovers at the table during breakfast time (open space on the 3rd floor) which could be annoying at times & not so sanitary. Small kiddie pool on the 3rd floor beside the breakfast area. Hotel is just a short walk (few minutes) to the beach, lots of restaurants & shopping nearby. With Expedia concierge inside the hotel. Overall stay was quite good.

Before I booked our hotel in Waikiki I did a lot of research and this Hyatt didn't disappoint. We arrived at 12 noon and our room was ready, Expedia booking was for 1 king bed and we wanted 2 queens instead. Terrence was very helpful and within minutes switched our rooms. The deluxe room was spacious which is a big plus for families. The bathroom is quite small but again nothing to complain about as long as it is clean. Valet was $28 a day, comparable to what most hotels offer. If you wanted to park it yourself you can do so across the street at Banyan but since we have 2 kids on tow we chose to use their valet service. They gave out complimentary beach toys for the kids which comprised of a bucket, 2 shovels and 2 molds. Our kids were excited, small details like this is a big plus for us. Again you don't have to worry about beach towels as they provide it. They are not the big beach ones you might prefer but we go to the beach everyday so having fresh towels everyday was nice. They have free wifi and the speed was quite good. They also have several computers at the lobby free of charge and you can also print stuff free of charge, that again is a good thing as I travel a lot and this is the first hotel who didn't charge me anything for printing boarding passes and confirmation emails. Breakfast is adequate, not the best but it takes out the guess work on where to eat. The location is perfect for us as we love that we are on the calmer side of Waikiki beach. We walked along the beach and yes there are beach front hotels but they are also quite busy and loud. For families traveling with kids this is a good spot so kids are not exposed to the loud party ambiance of the other hotels along the beach. If you are single and would like to party, this is not a good place for you as it is a long walk from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach. My husband and I both agreed we got our money's worth here. Great staff, Annabelle and Terrence were very helpful and they know the term "service with a smile". We highly recommend staying here.

We stayed several nights here in October 2013. The hotel is centrally located near shopping, Waikiki beach, and lots of restaurants. -Our room was clean, comfortable, and had plenty of space for the two of us-The staff was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable, even giving us directions to "off the map" type places that we really liked -The "breakfast included" option was great for us and the food was very goodA note on parking: it's a true premium in the entire area, not just this hotel. We were lucky to sang one of the 15 or so spaces by going down to the desk as soon as we got up the morning after our arrival since no self-parking was available when we arrived the night before. Yep, that's right, 15 spaces available in self-park for a hotel with over 8 floors!

I stayed here twice in between island hops, so I'll review both visits in one. The hotel was not bad, all the staff were friendly, and our rooms were upgraded, for free, both times. The rooms were large, but the bathrooms were quite small, and the sink area poorly lit. Both rooms were noisy, even one which overlooked a side street rather than the main road. The second room had not been cleaned very well in the bathroom - I cleaned up two stains myself that the housekeeper had missed.The location was convenient for the beach, shops and restaurants.The breakfast buffet was chaos. A notice in the room suggested that you take a tray down and bring food back to your room, as it was likely to be busy. The breakfast room was small for the number of guests, and had very few places to sit. We did indeed take food back to the room, but it was still hectic just trying to fill our plates. I also found it bizarre that you had to cross the outside pool area in order to reach breakfast (at least, you did if you were staying on one side of the hotel) - walking on wet tiles with a loaded tray is not a lot of fun.The fridge in the second room was not working properly and the maintenance man did arrive promptly to fix it. However it still didn't work after that, and we had put milk in there, which went 'off' as it had not been kept cold. I reported it again to reception - they said they would replace both the fridge and our milk. In the event, they only replaced the fridge.We had prepaid for our rooms months ahead of time, and did not use room service, the phone, or any other hotel service, so when we checked out, the receptionist confirmed there was nothing to pay. However, a charge of $3.50 later appeared on our credit card bill. We are guessing here, but we think this was the price of a bottle of water offered for sale in the room. Now, it might be a genuine mistake - the housekeeper may have noted it against the wrong room number. It's a small amount but I don't see why I should pay for something I didn't have. I emailed the manager of the hotel about it. At time of writing this review, I have been waiting three weeks for even an acknowledgement of my email, let alone a proper response to my query. Very poor customer service.

A great hotel if you have a discount. Can't really compare it to any other hotels out here. That being said I came out solo for business for the first two days. My review might be different if I came with my family. Don't expect a great pool or a nice place to eat breakfast, some days you get a company of birds trying to share your meal. The food was good, each day they had something new. Regarding the I did not mind because I preffer the beaches around the island, if I wanted a nice pool I wouldnt need to be in hawaii for that. It's all about the beaches!

The hotel's web site has some pretty amazing pictures and the marketing is superb. What a shame the photographers have used tricks to make proportions appear larger than reality! As Europeans, we are used to small hotel rooms, so didn't take much notice of previous reviews! What a pity......The Brickbats:Having stayed at the Aqua Palm Waikiki five years ago, we chose the Hyatt Place at £300 more for five nights because wi-fi availability means we don't have to lug a heavy laptop around with us and mess about with plugging in LAN cables. Having paid so much more for the hotel, and having seen the wonderful picture gallery, we had set ourselves up for disappointment:1. The "King Bed" Room was pitifully small with hardly any drawer space to keep anything. A large safe occupied a corner of the wardrobe which restricted the useable hanging space. The sink area had a very small surround to keep toiletries and there was no spare space at all in the separate toilet/shower cubicle. To store our suitcases which we kept tripping over, I pulled the single seat sofa away from the wall to create a space behind. The room was okay for a one or two night stop, but for a short holiday was unbelievably cramped - even by our European standards.2. Breakfast is okay-ish, but nothing special, and is served adjacent to the swimming pool area - a veritable wind tunnel. The coffee is, however, terribly, terribly bitter and quite undrinkable. (Allegedly, the coffee is Starbucks Napoli) and we ended up buying "Kona" instant coffee from the ABS store and brewing up in our room. Whilst I would agree that breakfast can be a "zoo", that is going to be the case wherever "free" brekkie is included - get there early, then you won't have to jockey for position! 3. Whilst on the subject of the swimming pool and surrounding loungers - the pool and adjacent area is tiny! Everything in this hotel is tiny! In fact, it's almost as if the hotel has done the bare minimum to achieve its 3 star rating, working towards 4! 4. It took three days for us to discover the "water scam". When the room is cleaned, two bottles of water are placed next to the TV. A card on them reads "Welcome" "We want you to enjoy this water.......blah...blah". If you read further, you will see that it costs $3.50 per bottle - a 700% markup on the price being charged at the ABC Store! Reception did credit one day's worth of water to our bill, but being taken for a ride is never pleasant and I'm afraid that for the sake of making a fast buck, I would be reluctant to ever return to ANY Hyatt owned property!5. The Property Location at the Diamond Head end is okay. However, we found the Aqua Palms better as one didn't have to negotiate clusters of smokers outside each Hotel entrance as we walked to the beach. The road with the Hyatt Place has quite a few hotels and tourist bus pick up points, and each one perpetually has a group of smokers blocking the pavement. This, I suppose, is the flip side of hotels banning smoking inside the buildings and doing away with smoking rooms. The Positives:1. The Staff were wonderful and seemed genuinely eager to ensure we had a good holiday.2. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Towels to take to the beach were thoughtfully provided, for the asking. (You only have to ask the pool staff and they will sign them out).3. Late check out was arranged for $100. Even though our room was required for an incoming guest, the receptionist worked her magic with the computer to juggle bookings around so that we could remain in our room until 4.30pm for our evening flight.On balance, then, the holiday was enjoyable because of the staff and because it is Hawaii, after all! If we return, it certainly won't be to Hyatt - unless they replace their marketing director!

Arrived early morning 10 am and was given room access immediately. Friendly staff greeted with offer of a brief tour of the hotel facilities while they took my luggage to the room. Excellent room size. 2 Queens with corner couch and table and small porch with beach view. We were on the 11th floor and elevator access times were good. Very conveniently located. Only 2 min walk to the beach. Bus 8, 19 & 20 stop opposite and take you to Ala Moana shopping Centre for retail therapy. Free WiFi and free breakfast make this hotel a no brainer. At only $250 per night it represents good value. I for one will be staying here again and give my highest recommendation to anyone who wants a comfortable Hyatt experience at a price that leaves plenty over for wining, dining and touring.

We love Hyatt hotels. We usually stay at the Regency Resort, but decided to stay at this newly renovated Hyatt Place since we could save a bundle of money.This is a hotel not a resort. It's important to understand that you won't have a resort fee here which can add up to over $150 for the week at most resorts. That saved us a bundle. Waikiki has a lot to offer as far as food, spas and beach access within a short walk( 2-10minutes) that we didn't feel we missed anything by opting to stay at this hotel over a huge resort. The Room:The room was very clean and new! No mold or beat up furniture. The bed was super comfortable and the pillows were perfect just like our favorite Hyatt Regency Resorts. Our room was on the small side, but perfect for a couple and we don't stay in the room for much other than sleeping anyway. There is no bathtub, only a shower which worked fine for us. We got the City View room which ended up being a very obstructed ocean view. The decor and room styling is very modern, but warm and comfy. The patio faced an apartment which would have been a problem if we could use the balcony and chairs, but it was so noisy when we opened the doors. This is not just this hotel so I don't see it as a negative. Waikiki is a loud place and you can't really escape it! I've stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Waikiki and it was the same thing. The Service:The room was always cleaned and clean towels were replenished. The front desk is friendly and welcoming and happy to serve you in any way possible. The bar was surprisingly well used and although we didn't have a drink, people seemed to be enjoying them self and conversation with the bartender. Free Breakfast:My husband and I thought it was good. It wasn't an outstanding 5 star breakfast, but it was really tasty and they had some good options including yogurt, fruit, pastries, cereal, miso soup, rice, bagels, English muffins and two different hot options each day. The photos on their website of the breakfast sandwich don't do them justice, they taste amazing!!! It's a free breakfast, your wallet will enjoy this in Waikiki! It's also easy to just get your day started and get going especially when you have a tour and can't wait at a restaurant. Overall It was well worth having!! Location:The only reason I give it a 4 star. It's a nice stroll down to the beach which is a 2 minute walk. It's a calm swimmable spot. Very nice. However, it's kind of a long walk to the main shopping and popular dinner spots. It isn't an ocean front resort and doesn't claim to be, but after a few days we felt the walk began to get a little tiring. Wouldn't make or break a stay, but something to consider. There is a parking garage with in and out rights caddy corner from this hotel. It's $80 for the week. Hyatt parking can fill up so it's a good option. There is an ABC store a block down, a board rental spot across the street in the Marriot and a nice place for dinner at the end of the block overlooking the beach. Other details: We only had to wait for the elevator once or twice, but never more than a 2 minute wait. Not a problem at all. Free wi-fi was fast and there is a convenient wi-fi station where you can use the computers and printer so you don't have to bring your own. Pool was small, but not a lot of people use it so you may have it to yourself. it's super clean and they have chairs and towels. You can take the towels down to the beach as well. Overall, it's a great hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel especially to those who travel on a budget, but like the same quality of service, comfort and cleanliness that you would get at a larger resort. Good job Hyatt Place for living up to Hyatt Regency Resort standards!

arrived very early after long flight 10am check in was easy and upgraded to better room deluxe king ocean view as platinum member room good view and huge clean room room comes with free wifi and breakfast all good I haven't had a bad Hyatt experience yet

It's a nice hotel, very close to everything, walking distance to the International Market. The only negative thing is during breakfast it was like a zoo. Too many people in the breakfast lounge area. But, overall not bad. There is a laundry room which is very convenient to have. And there are trolleys a few steps away from the hotel that takes you to the Ala Moana mall.

I would stay again if the price was right (sub $250 per night). The clean, pretty recently remodeled rooms are what makes this place worthwhile. I actually think the location is pretty good as well, but may be too far away for some people's needs.The elevators are way too slow in the tower closest to the front desk. Try to stay in the other one. You could do a lot worse in Honolulu at this price. Just don't expect a resort, because that it is not.
user_name:
Mio T
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for one night on business. Easy walk to the beach. Plenty to do. Lots is shopping options with in walking distance. Rooms were good. Lobby is open air, and very nice. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. Was a little pricey, but everything in Hawaii is.

We normally stay at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach, but decided to try the Hyatt Place as it was cheaper. We also picked it for its free breakfast and free wi-fi. The holel is located 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beach, but we did manage to get an peek-a-boo ocean view. The rooms are small, but cozy. The balcony is very small and not very usable. The a/c didn't cool the room as it couldn't keep up with the sun from the southern exposure. The employees were nice and the food at the free breakfast was fresh and plentiful. The hotel only has 6 self-parking spots which fill up by noon, so we were forced to pay extra to use valet parking. After bringing this to the attention of the manager, the manager only charged us the self-parking cost. (I have Diamond status with Hyatt, so I don't know if the manager would have been as accomodating without this.) If you don't have a car and don't mind not being right on the beach, the Hyatt Place is an nice hotel. But if you have a car and want a clear view of the ocean and Waikiki Beach, I recommend the Hyatt Regency Waikiki instead. I will return to the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach on my next stay to Hawaii.

At $329 per night out family of 5 was able to stay in a single room. The hotel functioned very well for our needs. It is not a resort. It is a city hotel. There is a small pool. The beach is a 2 block walk. There are good restaurants near by though we typically ventured farther out for meals. It was very clean. Rooms were up to date and nice. Elevators were slow. Valet service was excellent. The public spaces are minimal. There is a nice outdoor dining area for morning breakfast and the food is excellent. But it is crowded and it was a bit of a pain to get a table. There is a nice little convenience store attached with food, drinks, beach items etc. I will mention without judgment that this hotel caters to Asian travelers and I believe well over half of the guests were from Japan. I noticed that there were special items at breakfast, Japanese speaking staff, and the store carried many items intended for Asian clients. Overall I would recommend this hotel. We did our beach resort on Maui during this trip and certainly enjoyed it much more. But Hyatt Place Waikiki met our needs for a conveniently located reasonably priced base for our Oahu adventures.

This is my 3rd time visiting Honolulu. My previous stay was at the Hyatt Regency on Waikiki, which is about a 10 minutes walk from Hyatt Place. Hyatt Place attracted me for 2 main reasons -no resert fee with free WIFI throughout the hotel and free breakfast everyday! The front desk employees were nice and accomodating. I did have a housekeeping problem and once it was brought to their attention, it was fixed. I stayed for 6 nights and the hotel did their best to change the main attraction of food each day. If you don't want to eat breakfast at Hyatt Place, just take a coffee/tea to-go and there are other places to eat close by; I found the convenience of the breakfast a highlight so I didn't have to worry about food first thing in the morning but to enjoy my lunch and dinner out of the hotel.
