Tip - sit under the covered part of the breakfast area. They have an excellent map and very easy to follow. The pink trolley which takes you to Ala Moana Shopping Centre can be caught one block down ($2) and the public bus can be caught a few steps in front of the hotel ($2.50). There is an ABC store half a block from the hotel where you can buy water and alcohol to stock up the fridge in the hotel. Overall, I am pleased with the Hyatt Place and yes, we did get an amazing room on the 18th floor which was spacious and made our vacation comfortable. Mahalo!

If you don't mind Waikiki (definitely not for me), I have to say that location was great. However, service was average. Some of the receptionists were nice, but others were quite arrogant. Room service were knocking at our door at 8.30 in the morning!! Definitely not happy about that as they were about to open the door and I was half naked. Breakfast was average, very busy and there were pigeons all over the breakfast area. Extremely annoying. But the size of the room was good and it was clean. However, the hotel looks dated and not worth what we paid for it.

This hotel was much cheaper than the hotels on the beach front. But considering it was only a couple of minutes walk to the beach, it was amazing value! We arrived at about 10 am in the morning, thoroughly jet lagged and the staff let us up to our room early. We had a room with 2 queen beds and an ocean view. The room was a great size. The free breakfast was great and you could bring a tray up to the room. Don't waste your money on a beach front hotel, stay off the strip, it's worth it!

This place overall was a great place to stay if you are going to Waikiki. It's about 3 minutes walk to the beach. It's close to the zoo. ABC stores are right outside of the hotel. Clean room, friendly staff, and good breakfast. I would come back next time.

We stayed in Hyatt Place for 4 days in september.This is a very nice hotel at a decent price compared to other Waikiki properties.The room was clean,quite spacious with an average view though.Breakfast was good but birds were definitely a problem.The hotel staff was very helpful..we were upgraded to a bigger room (of the same category though) when we requested them for another room.The vallet guys are very helpful too..They gave us really good tips about the attractions and other stuffs.Internet was pretty decent..Its a bonus to have wifi in room w/o any resort fee while other hotels charge 25-30 bucks for these amenities.I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a comfortable stay with all facilities w/o breaking their banks.

The location of this hotel is a 4 minute walk to the beach. Hotel is a built up hotel, with no character or luxury. Breakfast was minimal, and the pigeons were everywhere!we ended up just taking it back to our room/or not going at all due to this!Wasn't the nice surroundings and what you would expect when you are in Hawaii.Hotel ammenities were basic, they advertise a pool, its literally the size of a bath!Only saw one person in it during our stay. Bar and restaraunt in the hotel were basic, and nobody ever seems to be eating/drinking there. No atmostphere in this hotel. Our room was basic, and didn't have a particularly nice view, it looked into other apartments/hotel directly, so no privacy!

We just got back from 11 nights at Hyatt Place 23/9 to 4/10. This is a nicely renovated hotel. Cannot fault the staff from Tour desk to Concierge.The happy hour Mai Tai's were powerful but hey, we were not driving anywhere.We had a king sea view room and whilst some of the view was obstructed this was to be expected a street back from beach. Breakfast included was a real bonus. Gym sufficiently equipped to do some cardio before the diamond head walk. Beds nice and comfortable, rooms featured large tv, good bathrooms with separate sink area and we loved the balcony.The only negative was the pidgeons at breakfast. We worked it out to clean up in the trays provided straight after eating and don't walk away leaving table unattended ( saw the same Asian people have food gobbled twice after not learning the first time)Despite this I rate this hotel highly and it was perfect for us as a number of family members were staying there.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Deluxe ocean view room was roomy for 4 adults and 3 kids. The free Breakfast buffet was a great bonus and different each day. Our 2 yr old enjoyed eggs and rice each morning finishing off with fresh pineapples. Close walk to Kuhio beach and shopping. Staff was great and kept overall hotel clean. Was a couple times I saw one of the staff cleaning in the elevator. Pool is small but who cares. My family enjoyed the beaches. We're in HI, live it up! Oahu is our fav island and will come back to Hyatt again. Mahalo Hyatt Waikiki!

Our final week and it was all about relaxing and soaking up the sun!There is nothing that we could really fault about this hotel other than the size of the swimming pool BUT, the beach is what were after and it was just at the end of the road and all along the main road!All in all - we were really happy with our stay here. We would stay here again but for our 2nd visit we wouldn't mind trying another hotel with similar price range to compare!!Location - the hotel is at the end of the main strip (Kalakaua St/Ave - may have spelt that wrong!) but it is only a short easy walk to it all (eg. where the International Market is located). If you join any tours, the pick up is usually at the Aston Waikiki hotel which is a 2 min walk to the corner of the street. There are ABC Stores everywhere! So purchasing snacks/water etc etc is easily accessible.The room/hotel - average size room (we had a queen bed) but it was clean and tidy! The bathroom had the standalone shower (not a shower head over the bathtub) which is definitely preferred. Good to return to each time after the beach or a day out from shopping! The hotel provides complimentary breakfast which was pretty good and serving starbucks brewed coffee!!WIFI internet - excellent. No connection issues and speed was not an issue also.Service - excellent! All very friendly staff and willing to help. The Expedia Concierge desk staff are also lovely to speak with and provides good recommendations. Some tips:* don't swim at the beach that is right at the end of the hotel street. It has like a safety wall that maybe seperate swimmers and surfers. We were stung by jelly fish in this area and thought maybe perhaps they come in with the waves but cant get back out because of this wall!!* swim bit further down where there is no wall! in front of Grand Hyatt was nice!* the Expedia Concierge recommended the luau at Paradise Cove - excellent choice! * if you want to do some snorkeling, the Expedia Concierge recommended the EO Waienea Tou - a day out in a catamaran which takes you out to sea to snorkel and see dolphins and turtles. This was tour was amazing! It is also a family operated business which makes it more personal and a great experience. * eat at The Cheesecake Factory - food is nice and their cakes are delicious!* don't be fooled by the queues outside Eggs n Things! We only tried their main meals and was disappointed so did not return to try their crepes/pancakes!

The hotel was great but its honestly what you make it. I am really big on the outside area such as the beach & pool. But I was dissapointed witht the pool its super small!But the food at the bar was amazing and so was the service, I wouldnt recomend for a long stay vacation but definetly stop by and check it out

Stayed here in September 2013 for 4nights/5days. The hotel was perfect! From the friendly Aloha to the check in process, it was all done with a genuine smile. I paid for a City View base room and was pleasantly surprised when the guest check in liaison, Kimberly, upgraded us to the Penthouse level with a deluxe room! This was on the 20th Floor and had views of the city plus the mountains, it was breathtaking.The room was quite spacious with 2 queen beds and a lounge area. There was even a balcony that had two chairs and a small table. The room was very clean and very modern with a luxe feel to it. Most Waikiki area hotels say they're on the beach, but they are actually across the road. The Hyatt Place is literally 2 minutes walk to Waikiki Beach. You can see the beach from the entrance to the hotel. They even give you beach towels which was and added bonus! There is a free continental breakfast everyday on the 3rd Floor along with the hotel's pool. The pool was simple and small but who needs a pool when you're a splash away from the beautiful Pacific! Other reviews complained about the breakfast and the pigeons. The breakfast area is an open are to the outdoors hence birds are about. Once you stay with your food, the birds don't bother you, however if you walk away for a second, say byebye to whatever you had on your plate! Breakfast was filling, ranged from french toast, to eggs and bacon. There is a selection of breads and bagels along with cereals and also 2 types of pastries. The nice thing about this hotel is that there is a tray in your room that you can bring down, should you wish to take your breakfast back to your room. I've not stayed at any other hotel that offers this. There is also a Gallery Menu in the lobby area which serves up a variety of food items at reasonable costs. Happy hour is also on daily from 4-6PM. Oh, and there is a 24HR fitness center (very nice and spacious) and a guest laundry (3 washers / 3 dryers). The laundry takes coins and credit cards. $3.00 per wash, $3.00 per dry and $1.50 for detergent.The rooms do come with bottled water at a cost of $3.50 each, but 1 minute away from the hotel is a convenience store, ABC Stores, with bottled water at 99cents. Along with great souvenirs, snacks, drinks, food, medicine, actually anything that you will want or need and at great prices too!The hotel is actually centrally located, you can walk to the Honolulu Zoo ($14 entry), small but nice, and all restaurants and shopping is right around the area. There is also an Expedia agent at this hotel where you can book tours etc.All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for location, price, amenities and great, warm, friendly service!

Stayed one night before taking the cruize around islands. Room was very large and well appointed. Breakfast was a full breakfast not just continental, outside on the terrace. A little problem with pigeons but hey you are in a big city. The staff was very attentive and polite and held our bags before we got in our room and the next day before we left. Cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Great stay.

Its just such a zoo. The pool deck is a wind tunnel and breakfast - served there each morning - is a zoo. On the upside the guest laundry takes credit card so you don't need change. I loved that! Great location near the beach and main drag, but that's also a negative as Honolulu is so crowded and the traffic and trams all come right passed the door.

Had an ocean view king room that HAD a view of Waikiki but our room was VERY small, bothered my husband more than me, only a shower in the bathroom, no tub, which made leg shaving difficult!! They did offer to upgrade us to a larger room at no cost but it wouldn't have been an ocean view, we decided to stay where we were! All the employees were extremely nice and friendly, including the lady in the gift shop who "persuaded" my husband that I needed the earrings to go with my new necklace! The location was great, not right on the beach but close enough!

We stayed in the Pali wing and found it well located but a little noisy because we were low down and close to the street entrance and the noise of buses and traffic was present. The service was good and staff offered advice on a seafood restaurant that we found excellent. Thank you.

We have just returned from a 10 day stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach hotel and we couldn't be more impressed! From the moment that we arrived, the staff were so helpful. We had made 3 specific requests prior to arriving and all of our requests were accommodated. We arrived at around 11.00am and were able to access our two rooms immediately which was most appreciated after the long flight from Australia. The rooms were clean and spacious and the inter-connecting rooms were a hit. The kids were very happy with the hi-speed wi-fi and the breakfast choices offered. Don't be put off by some of the negative comments on Trip Advisor, we never waited more than a few minutes for the lifts and the birds in the breakfast area were never a problem. All in all, this hotel represents great value for money and we were very happy with our choice.

arrived atthe hotel a few hours early . room not ready so we waited in the foyer .rooms were nice, good showers and lifts were fast to arrive.hotel is well placed 1 block form the beach, but is no shining star in the Hyatt chain. more like a 3 star .breakfast was so terrible that we ate elsewher after the first 2 days there. better hotel would be teh Hyatt Waikiki.

This is a very good value for money hotel, excellently located within very short walking distance of Waikiki Beach. Service is friendly, attentive and helpful. Everything necessary for a comfortable relaxing vacation stay is available. In truth though, who goes to Hawaii to spend a lot of time in the hotel, unless it is specifically a beach side resort (which Hyatt Place isn't). We reserved two rooms through Expedia, one of which was to have two separate beds. Upon arrival we found that the two bed room was actually one bed and a sofa bed. This was an inauspicious start to our vacation and only after some discussion were we offered a two bed room at an additional charge. In our opinion, the hotel should have honored our explicit reservation and found a solution without additional charge. Somebody forgot that saying about "the customer is always right". The rooms themselves were very comfortable with all necessary amenities. We didn't find the beds hard, on the contrary, we found them to be very good and somewhat on the soft side. Nor did we hear any outside noise. In the smaller room there was a rather unpleasant odor that seemed to stem from improper cleaning. It seemed dissipated after we opened the window (or perhaps we got used to it).The hotel rate included breakfast and this was nothing to write home about. Not that there wasn't enough to eat or it lacked variety, but the culinary standard was low (including what seemed to us to be powdered eggs). We've had much better breakfasts in lower class hotels elsewhere. Perhaps it's all part of the culinary wasteland that is Honolulu. One reviewer mentioned being rained out at breakfast, since most of the tables are on an open terrace. This happened to us too and is not a great way to start the day. The same terrace houses a small swimming pool in a relatively uninviting environment. Go to the beach!The hotel offers parking at $18 a day (or more expensive valet parking). It's cheaper to park across the street at a nearby hotel for $15.All in all, the hotel lived up to our expectations and we enjoyed the stay. Due to its location and value for money we are happy to recommend it to others. We just wish they would put some more thought into the breakfast.

The Hyatt Place is located near everything, including a short walk to shops and an Apple store. It is located on a bus stop that can take you almost anywhere. Check in was not only easy, but they let us in our room early, which was a bonus after a very long flight. The room is a very comfortable size. The bed is really comfortable. We had a dresser, with an empty refrig that was already on cold, a sofa and a separate area with a desk and little coffee maker. We also had a balcony overlooking the ocean. Since this property isn't waterfront, the view was obscured, but still amazing. We saw a magnificent rainbow the first morning we were there over the ocean. The hotel provides a pool, gym and a complimentary hot breakfast. You can bring the tray from your room if you want to bring breakfast back to your room. Don't miss the pineapple! I would definitely come back here again. There are ABC stores everywhere in Honolulu, basically a well stocked convenience store. There is one two minutes from the front of the hotel. I went there for bottled water and anything else. The items were reasonably priced considering the location.

We used this hotel for two visits whilst we island hopped and on both occasions our room was upgraded.There are a few problems with this place but nothing serious. No matter what floor you are on the noise level from outside is quite considerable even with all doors and windows closed and the AC on. This is not the first Hyatt I have experienced this in it must be something about their construction. The AC whilst mainly quiet suddenly sounds like it builds up a head of steam and spouts out a 30 second loud wailing sound. This happened in both rooms so it must be general.Our second room also had a small layer of slime around the bath and sink areas nothing serious but noticeable.Ok that's with the negatives now the positives.Both rooms offered were large with two queen beds which were comfortable. They are well equipped with a fridge, ours did not work one day and was replaced, coffee machine, television, balcony, safe and free WiFi. The staff were very friendly and offered a good service especially when said fridge broke down.Whilst not on Waikiki beach it is only five minutes walk away and as are the shops and restaurants. The breakfast offered has a great choice and is served on the third floor outside around the pool. This is ok but when it rains under cover seating is limited. You can take the breakfast back to your room if you wish.Also make note that the elevators in the hotel are in constant use so give yourself a little extra time if you are in a hurry to get from your room to the lobby and out.As far as an inner city hotel goes this is one we would still consider on a future visit to Honolulu as it measures up to most chains and gives good value for the price paid.

Stayed for 5 nights before a cruise and 2 nights afterwards. Hotel is very modern but the first room we had was tiny and the bed far too hard. Had a mountain view. Breakfast is ok with lots of choice until it rains and then there is nowhere to sit without getting soaked :( Pool is small but ok and was a bonus to be able to use the hotel's laundry. Staff very helpful. Location is ok and the bar food is great and very reasonable.After the cruise they upgraded us to a King Suite I think they called it on the Mezzanine floor which was huge!!! The bed was enormous and it was nice to have a separate sitting area too - wish we had this room first as I was seriously thinking of cancelling our booking post cruise.Overall a decent hotel

Hyatt Place is a newly renovated hotel a block from Waikiki Beach. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are nicely appointed, extremely clean and safe, but on the small side. A standard room with King bed, was large enough for two people, but not for more than two. We had a mountain side view room, but wish we had not paid extra for the view, as we were not in our room all that much. DO NOT pay extra for a view, at Hyatt Place. It's not worth the extra bucks.Self-Parking was an issue (always full), so we relented and paid the extra for valet parking. The valet staff was more helpful than the concierge, as far as driving directions and things to see. Other reviewers have complained about the $28 valet parking fee. This is in line with ALL major city hotels. (San Francisco charges $50+ a night for self-parking, so quit complaining!)The valets were especially helpful when it came to directions and things to see. They were actually more helpful than the concierge.Concierge--there was only 1 and they were always busy. He was not especially helpful. A hotel this large and this busy, should have more than 1 concierge on staff.FREE breakfast is a huge plus, as there are not many eating establishments nearby.Many reviewers have commented on the pigeons in the outside dining area. Yes, there were pigeons, but they were not on tables, the buffet line, or trying to steal food. The manager was vigilant about squirting water on them, to keep them out of the eating area. What folks seem to forget....THIS HOTEL IS IN A BIG CITY, there will be pigeons if you are sitting outside! There are places to eat inside the lobby. The hotel provides trays in each room--if the pigeons bother you, take your food to your room and eat. There weren't many restaurants within a short walk from the hotel, other than those located in hotels, or chain restaurants. This was a little disappointing, as you'd think there would be more options for eating out at night. We were usually too tired by evening, to fight Honolulu traffic to eat out. The Tiki Bar and grill, at the Aston was an okay option. The beachside tables were great. The food about average. If we ever return to Oahu, we would probably choose to stay out of the congested downtown/Waikiki Beach area. Honolulu traffic is worse than Washington, D.C. beltway traffic or Atlanta during rush hour! Keep that in mind, if you need to be at the airport, Pearl Harbor, or anywhere else at a specific time, during the week. Leave extra time for getting to the airport!Overall, the Hyatt Place is extremely clean, exceptionally safe (you cannot use the elevator without your key) and good location. It's a great choice, if wanting to stay near Waikiki Beach.Keep in mind, the rooms are small. If you're bringing a family, opt for a deluxe room or two rooms. There is no bath tub, only a shower. This was fine for us, but families with small children might want a tub. I would probably choose to stay elsewhere, if I return to Oahu. But, for a first time visit, the Hyatt Place was a good choice.Great place for couples to stay, near Waikiki Beach.

We stayed at the hyatt place in honolulu the last night of our Hawaii trip. The location was perfect, just a short walk to "the Wall" (best place for bodyboarding in waikiki) and the strip area. The hotel is also very close to Diamondhead and the farmers market at the local community college, which is open on Saturday. If you dont have to be on the beach, there isnt a better hotel for the money than the Hyatt Place Waikiki.

We were excited to book a stay at this hotel based on it's high Trip Advisor rating. While i have no real complaints about the hotel, it was clean, quiet, freshly remodeled, and a nice 2 minute walk to the beach.. there was nothing spectacular about it. I wouldn't stay there again, but only because I have stayed elsewhere on the island and have been much happier with the experience. Here are the things we liked/disliked about this hotel.1. Breakfast - This was the only reason to stay at this hotel. Nowhere in Waikiki (that I am aware of) offers a free breakfast. Breakfast varies daily and is wonderful and clean for a hotel breakfast. I have read some reviews about the birds being a bother, but if you've ever eaten anywhere in HI, you'll know it's not just this hotel. It is a beautiful place to start the day and with the cost of island food, a nice break. If you're looking to save a few bucks on your food cost - this is a good option.2. Location - About 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. We paid to upgrade to a Diamond Head view - NOT worth it.. all we saw was the back of the mountain and wasn't anything compared to the view we had when we stayed at the Marriott across the street. It is a nice area of Waikiki though because it is not as loud and busy as the main strip - which is one of the reasons we picked this hotel in the first place.3. Room Size - SMALL rooms (even the "upgraded" room we had). They are clean an nicely decorated, but beyond that, nothing to write home about. Beds were very comfortable.4. Shower/Bathroom Lights/Fan - There is no bath tub, only a shower. Not a problem, but something worth noting. Also, the lights for the bathroom and the vanity area are on the same switch, so if you need to use the restroom in the middle of the night, be sure you can do it in the dark or you will wake everyone in the room.5. Staff - we never had much interaction with the staff beyond the concierge. The young man was not only not very helpful, but acted like we were bothering him. We were trying to obtain tickets to the Arizona Memorial and he was no help at all. He not only told us that if we got there early (5am) we had only about a 5% chance of getting tickets, but he wouldn't even look for $80 tour tickets for us. So, if this is something you plan on doing while you are there, make sure you book your tickets in advance. We were disappointed that we missed it because we didn't know you needed tickets years in advance. 6. Parking - Outrageous at $28/day. They say they have "self parking" for $15 a day, but they said to get those spots you need to park around 11 am/Checkout. Which, is pretty much when you will be using the car, so it makes it a useless prospect. Park across the street at the Banyan Waikiki parking garage for $15/day and they will give you a discount if you pay for the whole week. Kind of a lot of walking back and forth every time you need your car (and a roundabout way to have to get the car out and back to the hotel) but worth it to avoid the price of their valet. 7. Etc. - They offer no sort of snorkel rental or any sort of check out service, so be prepared to be buying everything you need, unlike some of the other hotels... this can add up fast. In conclusion, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay and save a few dollars on breakfast, this is a great spot. If you are used to a resort experience - or looking for a resort island/beach experience, look elsewhere.

Stayed six nights here with family in August. Very good breakfast every morning starting at 6:30 a.m., in spite of pidgeons that other reviews warned about. We had a city view deluxe room on the top PH floor that was spacious. Wifi worked well. Staff especially Angeline was very helpful in giving tips for local restaurants, transportation etc. We hiked Diamond Head one morning and walked all the way back to the hotel. One thing that might help is to be advised that they cannot guarantee locking up your luggage in secure area. We checked out noon and took taxi at 4:30 p.m. Fortunately, they took it and put it in secure space, but I guess they will not guarantee that is possible with lots of guests checking out. Even with our expressed concern about laptops, ipads, etc. they would not lock it up for you, instead hotel will tie up with cable lock and leave in lobby area. Also, take Charley's taxi they have fixed rates to certain destinations, like airport. For $29 to airport one way for four people was great! Sat at the bar for happy hour discounted drinks. Had lunch there, would not recommend, since it is the same fare as the breakfast.

Stayed here when we visited Waikiki in April.Rooms were nice and the service was good. Staff were friendly and very helpful.I had to ask for fresh pineapples that had not touched the melons as we had an allergy to melons. The staff, especially one girl by the name of Monique was awesome in accomodating our request. She recognized us every morning when we came down for the free breakfast and asked us when we would like the pineapples.Only thing is that you have to be careful about the pigeons. There are plenty of warning signs about not leaving your food unattended but people still did that and the pigeons are quick to go after your food. Parking at any of the hotels in Waikiki is pretty expensive but we made other arrangements close by. We found parking at the Waikiki Banyan apartments only 1/2 a block away on Kuhio for around $15 per 24hr period. I can't remember the exact amount, I just remembered that is was much cheaper than the $25 per day parking at most of the hotels in Waikiki.

Was undecided between hotel renew and Hyatt place for our 2nd visit to Honolulu but ended up choosing Hyatt place. Value for money it is awesome, very clean, had easy access to washing facilities and the rooms were freshly refurbished and presented beautifully. The pool was small and basic but seriously your in Hawaii so you don't really care for the pool, the gym was a but of a let down with not much to offer there at all but it wasn't a deal breaker. The breakfast was probably the one let down of the experience. I had set he bar pretty high for the buffet style breakfast and was well disappointed, the food was all starchy and the coffee was pretty average also. The staff who do bookings are great though and suggested some awesome activities for us to do which helped make our trip. It's sounds negative but the place is pretty good!

My partner and I spent a week in Waikiki and had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt Place. First off, the staff and customer service was amazing. Our room wasn't available upon arrival, but they were able to place us in a temporary room to wind down, freshen up and relax after the long flight. After our room was available, they immediately sent someone up to give us our new keys and assist us with our bags! We decided to extend our stay one extra day and the management worked well with us, arranging it so we wouldn't have to switch rooms (even though they were nearly sold out!!!) Thank you Emery! :) We had the Ocean View King Room which was VERY spacious and had a great view of the Beach! The bed was very comfortable, the room itself was clean and cozy. Location was great, right next door to the ABC shop and there was a store inside the hotel. A block away from Waikiki beach and the main strip of Kalakalua :) The hotel also offers a full breakfast buffet every morning! For the value - this place has it all! Would definitely stay again!

We stayed at the Hyatt for three nights at the beginning of September. We arrived around 1:30 and talked to the valet guys. They gave us the last self parking pass and told us where to find the parking garage. Self parking is $18 per night. We parked in the garage and attempted to check-in. We were told our room wasn't ready yet (no problem), so we headed to the beach, which is only two very short blocks away, and grabbed lunch and did a little browsing. By the time we returned (around 3:15) our room was ready. Our room was on the 14th floor with a partial mountain view. I read several reviews and checked out several photos prior to booking, so I knew the room would be on the small side and the mountain views would be partially obstructed by other hotels. Again, not a problem. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and road noise not an issue. Several people have commented in their reviews that the pigeons are bad in the breakfast area and that the elevators are slow. I didn't find the pigeons to be as bad as everyone said. They just walked around. I didn't see any fly up on to tables or pick food off of people's plates. As far as the elevators, one time we may have waited four or five minutes around breakfast time, but the rest of the time we waited for a minute or two.Self parking worked out well too. We got back to the hotel late one night and all the spots were full. My wife talked to one of the valet parking attendants while I waited in the parking garage and they walked with her back to the garage to show us what other spots were available for us to park in. Essentially they opened up their handicap and one reserved spot for anyone to park in. Other than that, we had no problems parking any other times. What more can I say? The free hot breakfast was great each morning and the staff was friendly.
user_name:
Daniel R
Round Rock, Texas, United States

review_body: We arrived at the Hyatt Place on a early flight from Australia and were lucky enough to have our room ready and able to check in at no additional cost. The front desk was very helpful and showed us around the lobby and gave us the information on breakfast and wifi etc for the hotel.We stayed on the 15th Floor (1535) in Deluxe, Ocean View room with 2 Queen Beds which was great. The room was very spacious with plenty of room for the three of us staying in the room. There was a drainage problem in the shower/bath on the first morning but was fixed quickly after speaking with reception. The beds were comfortable and everything worked. Overall we were very happy with the room we stayed in.The hotel is a short walk from the water and Waikiki beach. There is convenience store attached to the hotel and an ABC store very close for all your needs. The breakfast in the hotel was ok, good enough to get some food in before heading out to the beach. For the price we paid, the Hyatt Place is a great option for anyone coming to Waikiki and not wanting to break the budget on their hotel.

We arrived at The Hyatt Place, Waikiki Beach on the second leg of our U.S tour.Upon arrival, the hotel foyer is spacious and clean with a modern contemporary design. There's plenty of seating to the front and side of the lobby area, plus a bar, a business centre and gift shop to the side and rear of the hotel respectively.At the reception desk you are greeted with a friendly Aloha and checking in was professional, quick and efficient.Our room was a deluxe ocean view which was on the 20th floor. The room comprised of a bathroom with a sink and walk in shower, plenty of clean towels and a hairdryer. A sofa in the lounge area (which doubles as a sofa bed), a coffee table; a study desk to the rear of the room and a massive king size bed with a dressing table and large LCD TV to the side. The room also has an ironing board, iron, safe and a refrigerator in the room for you to use.The ocean view from our room was amazing but I would ask for a room on a higher floor as the view might not be as good on a lower level floor.The hotels complimentary free WIFI was ok and a signal could be found in the room but it wasn’t the quickest, but definitely not the slowest either.Each morning between 6.30-9.30am there is a free buffer breakfast served on the 3rd floor by the pool area. The breakfast consists of cereals, bagels, muffins, fruit, toast, juices, tea and coffee, continental breakfast and scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages (varies each day). The breakfast is unlimited, tasty and filling which sets you up for the day ahead.Each Day our room was cleaned to a high standard by the cleaners, ready for our return.The hotel staff was very helpful, professional and courteous at all times. There is also an Expedia Agent onsite (Cameron) with whom you can book all your tours and tickets from. TIP (If you plan on booking a trip to big island make sure you pay the $10 extra each and fly Hawaiian Airlines and do NOT book with GO AIRLINES! THEY ARE VERY UNRELIABLE) but he will tell you this anyway.The hotel is ideally situated one block from Waikiki beach and the promenade. There is an ABC store next to the hotel which sells most things and open till 0030hrs.Don't bother taking beach towels with you as the hotel will let you take theirs to the beach or pool on confirmation of your room number.Talking of the pool, it isn’t the biggest. The pool is 3ft deep at the shallow end and 1.5m at the deep end and is roughly 15ft wide by 45ft long (approx).On the third floor there is also a laundry room with washing machines and tumble dryers (not free to use), there is also a small gymnasium next to the pool area (which is free to use).We did not drink at the bar but they did do a happy hour daily between 1600-1800hrs where draft beers are $3.50 and Mai Tai's are $5.If you are bored of the sun and beach the hotel does have activities throughout the day for you to try if you wish.The only negatives that I could find with the hotel were:-The birds! During breakfast time they will swoop down and eat any food left lying around either on the floor or the tables, but you get used to it after a couple of days. Just make sure someone is sitting at the table and they won’t bother you. This problem however isn't really the hotels fault and the staff do try to move the birds on during the breakfast period.There are two lift in the hotel which can be slow during busy periods i.e. breakfast and late evening. My advice is to get on the lift whether it’s going up or down then select your floor once you’re on it otherwise you will be waiting a while.On the whole the pros far outweigh the cons and The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is definitely value for your money. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

nice hotel without pretentions .Very pleasant and helpful front desk staff.Good location close to the beach the rooms are nice and spacious we were given two queen sizes beds and I really appreciate the koerig coffee machine the breakfast buffet it's nice in the morning as they serve it outside on the patio with a good varieties of American and Asian foods.The only thing is they charge you 25 $for valet parking but across the street is only 10$

We stayed at this hotel at the end of August 2013 for 6 nights. We LOVED our time at the hotel. The lobby is beautiful, spacious and lots of comfy seating was available for the guests to wait for their tour operators, spend time during their happy hour, and just catch up. The staff were so welcoming and nice ALL THE TIME! The rooms had everything you needed, even a small balcony (although, we never actually sat out there other than to dry our swim suits and towels). We had a city view on the 5th floor, and the street noise was very minimal - non existent. Very impressed. The beach was one block away, literally a 5 minute walk. Which in turn was on the same street as all of the shopping. Breakfast was so great every morning. I would consider it a breakfast buffet vs. continental breakfast. They also took into consideration that there is a large number of Asian guests and offered: rice, miso soup, kimchi, tofu and sweet pickles. We chose this hotel because of its boutique style, proximity to the beach, breakfast and WIFI. All of those did not disappoint. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who asked. Note: we brought our own beach towels, but the hotel offers it to their guests.

I loved staying at this hotel! The rooms were newly renovated, everything was clean, HD TV in the bedroom, spacious living room. Bathroom was small but that's ok. It's right behind the Marriott Waikiki hotel and only a 5 minute walk to the Waikiki beach, very convenient location. My favorite thing about this place? AWESOME breakfast (and it's free!). Scrambled eggs, sausages, belgian waffles, bacon, oatmeal, fruit, even miso soup - you name it, they've got it and the menu changes daily. You can even use the tray provided to bring breakfast back to your room. Overall, great experience...the breakfast alone was worth it! (oh yeah, wifi is included too)
user_name:
TravelR0ckStar
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here in August 2013. The hotel is well located one block from the beach, a little further from the main shopping strip. It has an attractive foyer and the rooms are nice. Free wifi is also great. The only negatives were slow lifts and a noisy room (the glass door did little to reduce the wind and street noise). Overall, great value for the money. Bring earplugs maybe.

We stayed here twice over a 10 day period. When we first arrived we given a room on the 9th floor however the pullout sofa was ridiculously small and narrow. After going to reception we were helped by Lynn, who changed rooms for us into a larger room with a double pullout sofa. All we had to do was pack our bags and everything was moved for us. Before we left on our trip to Maui, we once again spoke to Lynn, who ensured that we would get a room with double pullout sofa. On checking in we given a room with 2 queens and a double pullout sofa. The front desk were professional and helpful the entire time of our stay. They are to be highly commended. Even though this hotel is not on the beach, it is very close. It is also far enough away from the main road of Waikiki and noisy crowds but close enough that all the action is around the corner. The one negative is that the outdoor breakfast area is always windy and inundated with pigeons. The quality and quantity of the breakfast items is good. However as there is no one to allocate tables, you are often left hovering around with plates of food and nowhere to sit. On our next trip to Hawaii we would consider staying here again.

Thought the hotel was nice. We stayed from June 25 to July 5, 2013. Service was very good. cleaning staff was very good. Breakfast served outside rain or shine. Pigeons were a problem some days. Only two elevators so you could wait awhile sometimes to get to your room. We all felt hotel was a great value including the breakfast especially when the alternative could be a $10.00 breakfast in Waikiki. the view was ok since we were on the 3rd floor and there are apartments across the street. Saw a teen girl try to rob the washing machine at the apts until she looked up and saw us staring at her.close to beach and a nice beach at that. better than walking down to the heart of Waikiki. There is parking but you have to get lucky they only have a few spots for the hotel guests, then you park across the street. The room also has a lot of outlets for phones, dryers etc. Room safe and blowdryer in the room too.

Stayed at the Hyatt Place for a night in July 2013 for our anniversary. it was my first stay at this particular hotel and nowhere near the quality of the Hyatt Regency and Spa. The room was pretty big w/ a king size bed and partial view of the ocean. We overlooked some apartments, so it was a little noisy but bearable. The free breakfast was okay, just don't expect anything special. it is served near the pool area, where it was really windy and sunny. If you didn't hold on to your plates, cups or napkins, it went flying. The hotel is clean and very central to Waikiki Beach.I would stay there again, given if the price was right.

Having breakfast ready in the morning make it easier for us to start the day. Close to the beach and shops and restaurant. The only down side is they rent their parking for 25 /day while across the street is way cheaper. So we choose to park across but have to endure crossing the streets. Why don't they make it easier for their guest.

Stayed a week at the Hyatt Place. Check-in was smooth - the lady at the counter was friendly and helpful - pointed out the hotel amenities as well as provided info on surrounding attractions.Booked a deluxe city view and was upgraded to deluxe mountain view w/o charge. The room was spacious, more than enough space for our family of four. Two clean double beds, and a pull-out sofabed as well.The included breakfast was also a welcome bonus - they tried to change the hot items every day, and refilled the portions quickly so that everyone could have their fill. Also lots of fruit juices, milk, coffee, cereal, yogurt, fruits, pastries. Particularly liked the fact that wireless internet and breakfast are included in the (what IMO is a reasonable) room price - most Waikiki hotels charge extra for them

My husband & I stayed here in June, 2013 for 3 nights before departing on a 7-night cruise of the Hawaiian islands...& I can't say enough about how pleased we were. We loved the location--more toward the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, yet just a block and a half walk to the beach. Our plan from the beginning of our trip was to hike Diamond Head the first morning (knowing we would awake early!) & we were situated in the perfect locale to also even just walk to the base of Diamond Head (about 30 minutes) before embarking on the climb. We also really enjoyed several restaurants within walking distance on Kapahulu Ave just a half block behind the hotel. Uncle Bo's was recommended by the sweet gal @ the hotel who checked us in, & it was the perfect spot for our first meal in Hawaii. A taxi driver also recommended Waiola Shave Ice as the best on the island--we sampled shave ice on all 4 islands & still felt this was the best we had! And you are not too far from Leonard's-where you must sample the Malasadas. Back to the hotel--we thought the free breakfast was just enough. Although the fruit was the same every day (pineapple with a bit of cantaloupe) it was sweet & delicious. The oatmeal was a bit watery-but still fine. They changed up the hot items each day, which was nice--& my husband really enjoyed their coffee. Yes, it is a bit crowded & since it's not laid out in a linear fashion, you are always dodging people darting to & from the different counters. But there was never really a wait for anything & it just took a small amount of patience to not be bothered by the crowd. We LOVED the beautiful outdoor terrace where we ate each day. We always found a clean table under an umbrella--& yes, there were pigeons, but as long as you didn't leave your food unattended, they didn't bother you. We loved the beautiful open air lobby. Our room was surprisingly large--it was a corner room on the 11th floor & the balcony wrapped around the corner of the building so we could see both the Diamond Head view & the ocean view (both partially obstructed by other buildings...but still enjoyable). There was some street noise, even on the 11th floor, but we found it did quiet down after about 11pm & actually didn't keep up awake. The staff were very kind, friendly & accommodating. They recommended Charley's taxi for our ride from the airport & to the cruise terminal as Charley's offers a flat rate--very much appreciated this tip. We didn't use the pool, but it looked clean, although small, probably perfect for those with children. Overall--we were extremely pleased with this hotel & wouldn't hesitate to stay there again and/or to recommend it to others. Great job Hyatt!!!

We stayed at this hotel from Aug 7 - 13, 2013. One block from the beach. Very nice staff and good breakfast buffet, nice and spacious rooms and nice gym. Hotel is great. Great value. Cons: only 2 elevators so takes time to get up and down during peak hours; breakfast served outside and it gets windy; parking on site was always sold out.Tips: self parking across the street.

I chose this hotel based on others' reviews and it was a good choice. Great location: 2 easy blocks to the beach (wonderful beach area) & the best breakfast buffet. The room was very basic but it fit the 5 of us and that was important. Noisy though, right near truck deliveries it seemed to me.Since parking was so expensive we really shouldn't have paid for a car rental in advance. There were plenty of options for sightseeing like tours and even public transportation right outside hotel.I'd give it 4 or 4.5 stars.

My family and I recently stayed for 2 weeks at Hyatt Place ...our second stay within a year.This is a lovely place to stay ..very clean rooms and welcoming staff. My balcony door was offit's runner when I arrived but hotel maintenance fixed it within minutes for me.Yes..there may be delays with the lifts as others have said...but really...we are on holidays..not in a rush.There are birds around the breakfast area..but..no big deal..just birds ..like seagulls at the beach.The breakfasts are quite adequate but plenty of places to eat in and around the area ifyou get bored with the variety.I recommend the sea views rooms..you can get some road noise on the other side. We will be back and I have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel.

I stayed at the Hyatt Place from 6/24/13 to 7/3/13 and have been debating on whether I should give this hotel one or two stars...When we arrived to the hotel around noon, front desk staff checked us in right away - that was great as their website information indicated 2:00 pm check-in. We were given room 1139 and I ended up with bug bites on the very first night. I had never had bug bites before and was a little confused the next morning, thought those were hives from seafood I ate the night before. The next day, those itchy red dots still there, I decided to ask the maid to change the bed sheets and still I got more bug bites. Went down to the front desk, showed them the bug bites and they decided to change my room to 1239, one floor up. Hurry up back to the room, packed and moved one floor up only to find out the very next morning the new room has a leaky AC unit that completely soaked the carpet around it. These room ACs shut off when the windows are open, thus we did not know about the leak after we closed the window and let the AC activated at night. Another trip down the the front desk, and again, we were told they could move us to a different room. At this point, I was tired from packing and moving and unpacking, I decided to stay at the leaking AC room and not using the AC for the remainder of my stay. I was utterly disappointed at the way the Hyatt Place handled the situation - I came and stayed in Waikiki to relax, not to pack/unpack/and pack again and got bitten by bugs inside room 1139. Maid service was also a little sketchy as they did not wipe bathroom counter or dust the furniture. One positive thing I should mention about this place is its breakfast. The Hyatt Place provides decent breakfast for guests; this alone almost gave them a second star...almost.

We recently spent a week at the Hyatt Place. Our room was very nice, clean and well appointed with a great bathroom. Were slightly disappointed in the 'ocean view' as there was a building in front that didn't allow for an uninterrupted view. Apart from that we only have a couple of small complaints that didn't detract from our stay. There was no tour information on display for people to look at. You had to ask at the tour desk which was always busy. So, all our bookings were done elsewhere. The other thing was the great number of unhealthy looking pigeons that frequented the outdoor breakfast area.However, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. It was conveniently located, close to the beach and a great range of dining options.

I am so glad we decided to stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. We arrived early in the evening after a 12 hour flight and over an hour wait for the car. The hotel was easy to find. We were given two options for parking. The first was valet and the other was to park diagonally from the hotel. We were told there was self parking at the hotel but it was full. We parked across the street for all but one night. We used the valet parking one night. The attendant that night was friendly and took the car right away. The next morning our car was brought to us right away. Upon check-in we were greeted by Terrance (I hope the spelling of his name is correct.). He was very nice, professional and made the whole process easy after a long day. After checking us in he showed us all around the lobby, the small restaurant, computers, how to get to our room and other things available in the hotel.We were so surprised to find out that we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room. The room was large and very nice. The bathroom was large and had a walk in shower. The sink was just outside the bathroom. In the next part of the room there was a couch, chair and small table. There was also a large desk with plenty of plugs to use for our electronics. The refrigerator was nice to have in the room. Unfortunately, it froze everything we put in it. We had two queen beds that were very comfortable. The pillows were also comfortable. The TV was large and pivoted around so you could watch it no matter where you were in the room. The room was very clean and housekeeping was friendly. The WIFI always worked, was easy to connect to and was free.The hotel offered a free breakfast in the morning. It was one of the nicest we have been to. Each morning there was a different breakfast sandwich offered. The sandwiches were yummy. They also had French toast, waffles, cereal, toast, muffins, bagels, juices, coffee, yogurt and milk. They also had an Asian section at breakfast. The breakfast was held outside by the pool. There were a lot of birds around that people were annoyed with but I got a laugh at the them and enjoyed watching them.The pool was small but looked nice. We didn't go in. I read a lot of complaints about the elevators. We never had to wait for an elevator. The hotel was within walking distance to the beach and zoo. It was located away from the busier part of town and we had to trouble walking to shopping areas. There was also an ABC Store close to the hotel.This was our favorite hotel on our Hawaiian vacation. I wish we could have taken it to the other islands we visited.
user_name:
Rockyny270
New York City, New York

review_body: On our way to Asia, in order to break up the journey and get some rest, we stopped at this hotel in both directions. We found it expensive, a little bit out of the way of the popular attractions, and with problems. The rooms are adequate in size and have comfortable beds; however, the air conditioning from the hallways gets sucked into the rooms and creates a loud whooshing sound. We had to place a towel at the bottom of the door in order to get some sleep. The balconies are puny, not at all inviting for sitting. As to breakfast, it's complimentary, but served in an outside area by the pool where one is buffeted by the trade winds. Furthermore, in the event of rain, there is no shelter or alternative location.

Once you begin staying in hotels more frequently you realize you can become unfairly critical of all the flaws that exist. This last trip to Oahu was number five for me. All stays have been in the Waikiki area. This hotel is on the far end of the Waikiki stretch. The trendier part of Waikiki is located more towards the opposite end. Those with mobility issues who like to shop the higher end stores would probably prefer a hotel in the Lewers Street area. The beach is only a few blocks away but honestly almost all hotels in this area can boast the same claim. Both the zoo and the aquarium are close by which is a plus for those with small children. Not all the rooms are the same size. Our room was a deluxe king with mountain view. The bed was comfortable. The room was large and included a sleep sofa. The decor was modern and seemed fairly new. Our stay was a month long and we never felt cramped or that the walls were closing in on us. The housekeeping staff was mostly pleasant with one lady in particular anticipating our needs before we had to ask for anything. Her unexpected kindness made our stay quite pleasant. There is a mini refrigerator in the room but no microwave. Wifi is free and easy to connect to. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the pool. Diamond Head was a wonderful sight to look out to but we could also see into some of the rooms in the other tower of the hotel. People really need to keep their curtains drawn at times! The sink was located outside of the small bathroom. This is not a location I prefer. The shower was large and clean with sliding glass doors. On the third floor is a laundry room, gym and access to the outdoor pool and sundeck. The gym is well equipped including providing headsets and extra towels. It is modern and roomy. The only issue I had with the gym is that guests from the other tower often use it as a route to the laundry area and the lobby instead of using the door closer to the elevators. This might not sound like a major issue but it is a distraction when one is working out and wants a little privacy. The sundeck features a gas fireplace which is lit each evening. It provides a nice quiet place to relax in. My husband and I brought our evening meal back to the hotel a few times and dined on this deck. Solitude is nice but piped in music might add a bit to the atmosphere. The pool area is small as is the pool itself. There are about eight lounge chairs located around it and it can get crowded during the day. Towels are kept in a cabinet and are plentiful! This pool area and sundeck transform into the breakfast area for the hotel's offered free breakfast skillet meal each morning. A tray is provided in the room so that one can bring the meal back to their room. Which leads us to the negatives. If your stay is brief than the breakfast is more than adequate. For longer stays the menu is monotonous. The daily breakfast sandwich rotates between two or three choices for most of the week with an occasional skillet of scrambled eggs and bacon added. There is hot and cold cereal. The same kind each day. Both plain (might be vanilla) and strawberry yogurt are served as well as a fruit bowl of pineapple or melon. Bagels and bread for toasting are also provided. A small selection of breakfast pastry alternates each day. The negative side is that the breakfast area is very crowded. It appears that the staff can not keep up with the demand for clean dishes. Many mornings I had to hunt for a bowl for my yogurt or a plate and would come up empty. Finding a table is sometimes very difficult which is why they provide a room tray. The problem with using the room tray relates to another issue, the elevators. The tray is a bit cumbersome especially if it is holding several breakfast items. The wait for the elevator can be lengthy so holding the tray is a bit of a challenge. Getting on a crowded elevator worsens the problem. Add that to the fact that one must swipe their card on the elevator reader to access their floor...well it gets tricky to say the least. The elevators are slow........very slow. The hotel utilizes them to hoist supplies up to the housekeeping closets which often leaves only one in service when demand spikes. Demand spikes often. The elevators are average to small in size. Even during the least busy times of day I had to wait ten or more minutes for the elevator to arrive. Breakfast time was often far longer. Our room was on the 12th floor and for the majority of our stay I took the stairs down. Down is not an issue as the stair door exits right outside the hotel. Going up one must take the elevator to the third floor where the stairs are easily accessed. Several times, when the line was exceptionally long a staff member would direct guests to the stairway that was normally off limit to anyone who was not staff. While the wait may not seem long over the course of a month the wait time would have taken at least a day off our stay. The stairwells are not air-conditioned making the climb up a bit strenuous.

My boyfriend stayed at this hotel for a week during our stay in Honolulu.We were not impressed with this hotel at all. We arrived from our flight from Las vegas and drove straight the hotel. On arrival ( 12 noon ) we were told we could not check in until 3pm, this was fine so we took a walk along the beach and ate some food and had a few Mia tai's!When we came back at 3pm and moved our suitcases to our room.Now our room smelled so fricking bad, it smelt like a gym room! We turned off the air-con and left the door open to air out the smell. We decided to go back out and hopefully the smell would be eliminated by the time we got back.We came back to the hotel about 8pm, the room still smelled very bad so we called down to reception and advised them of this bad smell. We were moved 3 rooms down where there was no smell! Once in the room we noticed the air con was not working, again we had to call downstairs and the maintenance man came and changed the batteries in the wall.Breakfast - The breakfast is open plan next to the pool, you have a small choice of breakfast which also caters for the Japanese. My partner only had breakfast on the first morning as we were so put off!! There was a section of pastries , one of the pasties had a bird feather stuck to it, I am guessing this was from one of the hundreds of pidgins that walk around the outdoors eating area and hop onto the tables while you eat!!! Very unhygienic !When you have finished with your dirty plates and cups, there is a station in the middle of the eating area where you leave them, again.. unhygienic as the pidgins just sit and wait for people to leave their leftovers on the plates in this area!The hotel is situated within one block of the beach, the hotel also has an ABC store next door which is great as water in the hotel was expensive!

My husband and I recently stayed at Hyatt Place for 6 nights following a cruise of the Hawaiian Islands. We were very lucky to be upgraded to an Ocean view room on the 10th floor. The room was great, the bed excellent. We were very happy with the position of the Hotel and the staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast, however the pigeons were a problem to some people. We did not have an issue with the pigeons as we did not leave food on the table unattended. Some people made the mistake of placing their plate of food on the table and then leaving it unattended to get a coffee. We did not have issues with the elevators, I recall there were three and we did not wait long at all for them. My husband has an injury and relied on the elevators at all times.

Great location, minutes from Waikiki beach. The staff were very helpful and friendly, gave us quite a few tips about where to go. Hotel room are large and comfortable. Downside is there were only 2 elevators which were slow and always crowded. Breakfast poor. Other than that a great base for Oahu.

There are 19 floors and two elevators we were on the eighteenth floor and it took a really long time to get on the elevator. On check out day something was up and it took about 20-30 minutes for us to get out of the Hotel. We returned the rental car a bit late and the rental car place Paradise Rentals did not care and charged me for a whole day over being 45 min. late.Not to mention I could not sleep because the elevator is so loud we could hear it going upand down all night. Street noise is loud even that high up. Breakfast was disappointing as well,very bland food and I don't care for spices much so bland may be an understatement. It was raining and the eating area is outside, if you want to take it to your room, again you have to wait for the slowest elevator ever, several guest were complaining about the elevators made for lots of grumpy people on the slow ride up to the 18th floor. It is on the wrong end of Waikiki which was not a huge deal for us we like to walk but the kids were not so excited. You will be the last to be picked up and dropped off if you do take any tours. On a positive note the hotel was clean and staff was friendly. Maid was a bit annoying kept asking when we would be out of the room every time she saw us in the hall going to breakfast. They do have 24hr food and ATM and a little store in the Hotel which was convenient. All in All we won't be staying there again the elevator issue's are a deal killer for sure...

We were impressed with the size of the room and how clean everything was. The beds were very comfortable, as were the pillows. The 2 elevators were somewhat slow, but lots to see while you were waiting for them. Breakfast was complimentary and varied - the daily fresh pineapple was WONDERFUL! One caveat about our particular room -- looking out the window/balcony you were viewing an alley with apartments, noisy in the mornings because of the garbage and delivery trucks. But after a few days it didn't seem to bother/wake us up anymore. :-)

we stayed with our kids and had a great time. They provided us with activity books and sand toys since we arrived a bit early and our room wasn't ready. near beaches and shopping, the ocean view room was beautiful and breakfast looked unbelievable.
user_name:
BatyaYIF
New York City, New York

review_body: I have just returned to New Zealand after spending nearly 3 weeks at this hotel. I left a shirt in my room after checking out and within 10 days my shirt was sent to me, by courier, at no cost.This is what I call quality service . Will done Hyatt Place. I will return and will ensure I let other travellers know the quality of you business and service. Very happy customer. Martin Dobson

Two of us stayed here during peak tourist season, the month of August, when the hotel was FULL of adults and children. The hotel was chosen for its location and price. We liked the location, at the edge of Waikiki, a block from the Honolulu zoo, a block from the beach, close to restaurants and shops, and convenient to public transportation,The Bus, and the trolley. Compared to other hotels in the same category, one tier down from a luxurious resort, the price was reasonable, especially with a complimentary breakfast buffet that had a large selection of hot and cold foods, and free WiFi in the room. All of the staff members, front desk reception, maintenance, valets, and housekeeping were very friendly, helpful, and approachable. The room and its balcony were small, but acceptable. Over night parking cost $28. The air-conditioning unit turned off whenever the balcony door was opened. That was to prevent wasting electricity. We would recommend this hotel to other travelers and would return.

The Hyatt Place is centrally located in Wakiki. You can walk on Ala Moana Blvd to do all shoppings, and 1 block from Wakiki Beach. We were there for 7 nights fo a family get-together and had several rooms. No resort fee, unlike other hotels in the area. In room 838, the room was layout spacious, but the bathroom, tub/toilet area is rather small, hardly any space to step out. The sink is on the outside of the room. However, in room 840, the bathroom size is larger and a better layout. Rooms were modern, clean. Breakfast is complimentary with hot food; eggs, egg/turkey/cheese muffins, bacons, etc.. As well as cold cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, juice, Starbuck coffee/Tazo tea. We saved both time and money for breakfast. Self- parking in hotel is nil- only 5 spots or you have to valet for $28/day. For $17/day or $80/week you can park across the street at Banyan hotel. One miss : only 2 elevators and during breakfast time, it's a extremely slow wait. Overall, Hyatt Place is a great hotel to stay while in Wakiki.

I loved my room, the view was amazing! The breakfast was delicious and the staff was very friendly. The Hotel has the perfect location and the rates are very fair. They have great Pina Coladas pool side.

I haven't been to Honolulu in a while. Many years ago. I do spend quite a bit of time on vacations on the other islands, especially Maui and Kauai but I never have been too fond of Honolulu. My wife and I were on our way to Bora Bora and decided to break up the trip a bit and overnight 2 nights in Honolulu. We used some points we had (I'm a Platinum Hyatt) member and stayed here for 2 nights. The staff is very friendly. No complaints there. The rooms are nice enough. We got upgraded to a bigger room and they also allowed me to check out later at 2 PM due to my Platinum status which was nice as our flight to Tahiti didn't leave until later in the afternoon.The location is good as you're literally 1.5 blocks down from the beach so it's super convenient. The hotel will give you beach towels to use. You just have to go down to the front desk to get them. They have umbrellas if it rains (it started raining on our last day as we were leaving to have our final lunch). The rooms itself are comfortable. Nothing really to write home about for that price but beds were comfortable. The only probably we had in the room was that some of the rooms are in a small corridor next to one another and people get confused on the room # and so we'd get people mistaking for our room. Not a big deal during the day when we aren't there. Kind of a big deal when it's 3 AM and you hear someone at your door. LOL.Our room came with free wi-fi which is nice in this day and age of every hotel charging for it. Also, the hotel came with a daily breakfast on the 3rd floor. However, it was VERY crowded and the food wasn't anything to write home about. In fact, after the first day, I got sick from something that I ate. I got a case of some Traveler's Diarrhea from something I ate there. So be careful here.The most frustrating thing about this place is the hotel is SUPER SUPER SUPER slow. We'd sometimes wait as long as 10 minutes to get on the elevator. A few times we decided to walk and keep in mind we were on the 10th floor. I'm not sure what is going on with those elevators but they were always always super slow. I think they need to be looked at.All in all this is a decent hotel in a really good location and friendly staff. Would I stay here again? Probably only if I was using frequent stay points. In fact, we fly back through Honolulu at the end of our Bora Bora trip for 1 night and although we have some points to stay here again we will pay to stay at the Sheraton.But if you're not going to be in your room much, want to be in a great location and have points to use, this could be a good option.FYI - a taxi from here to the airport was about $45 dollars. We took a taxi here and also one back to the airport.

The location of this hotel was excellent. My family of 5, which included a senior and a small child, couldn't have been happier with the short walk to the sites of Waikiki. The beach is just a couple of blocks away, the hotel is surrounded by restaurants and shops, and the zoo is a short walk. It was also a convenient stop for tours, which we used for an amazing luau. Two negatives: the street noise from my 3rd floor city view room was unbelievably loud, like the bed was in an intersection. Acoustic drapes may help. Also, the pigeons seem to run a muck in the breakfast area, comfortably grazing at the pile of used dishes (kinda gross). Still, the room and lobby area was clean, comfortable, and attractive. The service was also good, especially Terrence at the front desk and the concierge. I recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Tropic0fCancer
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The location of this hotel is at the wrong end of Waikiki so you tend to be the last picked up and dropped off by most tours. You also have to walk far to most shops. The location can't be helped so just be aware of this.The room was clean and tidy, the staff friendly.The biggest disappointment was the breakfast. The area is way too small and crowded for getting food. The seating is mostly outside in the area which is very windy - the hotel should consider ways to protect this area from the wind. There are not enough seats and we had to almost fight for a seat. The breakfast food was poor - it seemed like the eggs were powdered, for fruit there was only a melon and pineapple fruit salad and the coffee was tasteless. To top it off, you have to dispose of your leftovers like you are at McDonalds. The only good part was being able to take your breakfast back to your room, but getting back to your room means the your food gets cold. This leads me to the next issue: there are not enough lifts. We waited up to 4-5 mins for a lift at times.We have stayed in way better hotels for much less. I would class this hotel as only 3 star.

I reserved this on A booking website rather than all of the other hotels with better am entires, views and restaurants for the suite style rooms with the ample area for lounging on the couch. I made this reservation for a room with two beds and paid for the reservation in advance. When I arrived at the hotel they assigned me to a king bed room with no sofa that was TINY. I called back and asked to switch and was assigned a room on the third ( noisy) floor with only a king bed and sofa. No sight of 2 beds like I reserved online and what I spoke to the reservation assistant about 5 weeks prior to coming to this establishment, which was said to be noted. This place is only looking for money and does not care about your needs or what you paid for. I cannot say I will ever come back to this noisey and jam packed hotel ever again. I am very disappointed in the hyatt brand. I will make sure to recommend the marriott next door to family and friends as this is a regular destination.

This hotel is very modern, the rooms were adequately sized, neat and clean. Plenty of space for my family of 4. Lobby was very nice and the bar/food service was very good for a later night meal. The location was good for a walk to the beach and then out in the evening for a meal. The traffic in the area does create some noise at the intersection. Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach was worth a stay.

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki during the last week of July. We chose this hotel based on price, location and presentation of the hotel on it's website.We found that this hotel fit our needs very well. It was good value for the rate that we paid. Our check-in at 10:00 pm was quick. Allyson was pleasant, fast and efficient. Check out was equally easy and they stored our luggage on our check out date as we had a late flight. A guest key card is required to access the elevator which provides some security.We stayed in Room 1216, a Hyatt grand bed: Diamond Head Mountain View. There are 2 towers but I don't know what each of them were called. We stayed in the tower whose elevators were further away from the front desk.Pros:-The room is clean, modern with nice decor. Bed was comfortable and king sized- 42 inch TV with a good selection of channels and option for pay for view-Free reliable wifi throughout the hotel. I saw but didn't use the business center which had 4 or 6 computer stations.-Housekeeping was very good. Room was usually cleaned by early afternoon when we usually came back to the hotel.-Location was great. 2 blks from the beach, within walking distance of the heart of Waikiki. We enjoy walking and we were able to walk to Ala Moana Shopping center, Diamond Head and everywhere in between including the Honolulu Zoo and Kapiolani Park-TheBus stop is across the street from the hotel. TheBus was reliable and only costs $2.50 per trip. Always ask for a transfer which is usually good for at least 2 hours and use it to make stops or make your way back to your hotel.-Breakfast was fantastic. Healthy options. It was more than a continental breakfast with hot breakfasts. Choices include cold cereals, hot oatmeal, dried cranberries and raisans to add to your oatmeal, eggs, sausages, bacon, toasts, bagels, danishes, pancakes, french toast, yogurt and even miso soup, rice and kimchi. Tea, coffee, juices. Lots and lots to choose from. After we sit down for breakfast we would take a bowl of fruit, plate of danishes and a couple cups of juice with us and store it in the hotel room fridge for an afternoon snack. The area where breakfast is served is located around the pool and an outdoor patio. It is very windy during breakfast. I would suggest sitting close to the building, put your utensils on your napkins to keep them from blowing away and simply enjoy. However, we did see many people bring their trays from their room and took their breakfast with them. We usually had breakfast at 6:30 to 7:00 am and it is already quite busy. We always found a table because people are always moving. Watch out for the birds. There are signs everywhere that say DO NOT FEED BIRDS. They are aggressive birds so do not leave your food on the table. On more than one occasion we saw birds swoop down on a plate of food left on the table. -We didn't use the gym but we did go in to check it out. They have lifecycle machines which I am familiar with as I use them at my own gym. There were 3 or 4 treadmills, 2 or 3 elliptical machines, a couple of recumbent bikes, free weights, towels, a water cooler and scale. I was impressed and would have used the if I wasn't too busy walking.-we also did not use the pool but it was located by the gymCons:-we faced Kuhio street and the road noise could be heard quite clearly. I think in part it was due to single pane glass. The sound of the buses and the scooter were the most annoying noises rising up.-There was a gap between the door and window where the insulation is lacking. When the wind is blowing it sounds like you're in the middle of a wind tunnel. I think this would be an easy fix that the hotel should consider-No bathtub (just a preference thing)I hope my first ever review will benefit someone. I never thought anyone would be interested in my opinion but I know I rely on Tripadvisor reviews to plan out my trip regardless of how much or little info is given. Positive and negative reviews. More information provides knowledge and allows all to form their own opinions.

Enjoyed our stay. Staff very friendly & helpful. Hotel clean & location close to beach & good public transport. Booked room with 2 beds but on arrival only room with I bed & uncomfortable pull-out available! Disappointing after 23 hours travelling!Not great value for money but maybe your paying for location!

We enjoyed our stay here. It is not a five star as it has no restaurant on site. The beach is a very short walk and very handy to have the ABC store next door to buy supplies that you can put in the mini fridge in your room. We rented a car and drove somewhere each day which I highly recommend. Nick was such a great bartender and shared his knowledge of the island with us which we really appreciated! All of the staff was so helpful and showed enthusiasm to make our stay so delightful. I would recommend this hotel if you want a clean place to stay that is in a very desirable location.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki and picked the hotel based on TA reviews, location and room amenities. The location and the rooms lived up to expectations. The hotel is a couple short blocks to the ocean and Waikiki Beach. Our Ocean view room had a nice view of the surf and sand, was extraordinarily large and spacious, clean and had two very comfortable queen size beds - a rarity in the Waikiki area. I really wanted to love this hotel , BUT I WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN BECAUSE OF THE INCOMPETENT AND/OR POORLY TRAINED STAFF.Just to set the record straight, I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and while I care greatly about room cleanliness, comfort and conveniences, I really do not care a lot about hotel staff services as long as they meet basic needs. Here are some basic needs we had at the Hyatt Place that the staff and management failed miserably at:1. Our room was on the 17th floor with a great view, but also with an absolute need for reliable and regular elevator service. The tower we were in was served by two elevators. For the first day or two of our stay both elevators were in service and wait times were pretty average (1 - 3 minutes or so.) Starting on day three, the wait times increased tremendously (5-10 minutes) and lines formed at the elevator doors. After experiencing this a few times it was apparent that only one elevator was in service. The line for the elevator is immediately adjacent to the front desk, yet when I called the front desk to inquire whether there was an elevator out of service, the front desk staff said she had no knowledge there was any problem with the elevators at all. I explained the long wait times and what I had observed with only one elevator opening and closing on the first floor for several trips in a row and the other elevator not appearing even once. She said she would check into it. I guess she thought nothing of the mob of people standing next to the front desk waiting for an elevator and she certainly thought even less about my complaint as she never called back. After a couple days, both elevators were back in service and wait times were reasonable again. It seemed odd that the front desk would have no knowledge of an elevator problem, but it was to me the poorest of service not to try to communicate the problem to guests and let guests know that the problem was being handled.2.
