On site parking is provided at a not so nominal charge of $28 per day for valet parking. There is also self-parking for $15 per day, but upon arrival, we were told it was full. We love to explore while on vacation and thus having a car parked at our hotel is to us almost a necessity. So, I was okay with paying $28 a day for valet parking. Now when I think of valet parkinng, I imagine a system that involves me driving up to the enterance of the hotel and having a valet staff member meet me and take my cara to park without mush delay. When I need my car, I either call valet services or simply show up and a valet staff member scurries off to retrieve my vehicle in a few short minutes. Does this sound about right? It is not what you will experience at the Hyatt Place Hotel. Almost every time we arrived at the hotel to park our car, there was no valet staff in sight and obviously no one managing or supervising the operation. After waiting anywhere from 5 - 10 minutes, a staff member appeared and took possession of my car so I was then free to go about the rest of my day. Getting my car out was even a more absurd process. If you call down to get your car, expect to wait 15 to 20 minutes at times that are not busy and 30 minutes or more when it is busy. If you simply show up at the valet desk with your ticket, the process takes even longer some how! The valet staff appears to be understaffed and overowrked, not properly trained and clearly not managed or supervised. How tough would it be to get a valet parking maager to run the operation? Moreover, valet parking is right in plain sight of the front desk, yet complaints to the front desk by customers that I observed walking over to complain (and I was not amongst them) appeared to fall on deaf ears.3. We are a very on line family and wifi is a must have. Thus free wifi throughout a hotel is great as was the case at Hyatt Place until the hotel chaged to password for access (which they do every Moday apparently) and the hotel failed to let it guests know of this change. Okay I did get the new password after I realized the current one I was given only two days before had stopped working, but a well run and managed hotel would have either advised guests at checkin to call for the new wifi number on Mondays or simply would have given guests like us who were staying on for a bit both week's access codes or provided them when they changed. This one sounds pretty petty doesn't it? But it is indicative of a systemic problem at this hotel of poor management.Several times during my stay I questioned whether there was even any management staff at this hotel. I think that really says it all. There were other srevice issues, and I truly believe that with good management and training, this could be a terrific hotel. Right now because of a poorly trained or poorly motivated staff and the complete absence of management, I could not recommend a stay here.

Booked a trip for one week at this hotel back in July and had to voice my opinion.Pluses:The hotel has had a very good refurbishment and is very clean and modern. The staff was friendly and helpful. You are only a short block away from Kuhio beach which is has breakers to shelter the waters making it much gentler for kids. This also explains why the hotel pool is tiny.Free breakfast was very helpful to us as it took care of the "Where and what to eat?" question for us. The breakfast area can get very windy and crowded in the morning and pigeons are always on the lookout for a meal if you leave your plate unguarded.The free wifi was very strong and we never had a problem logging on. The lobby also had computers with free internetMinuses:The room (1411) on the top floor of the Diamond Tower was too small for two adults and a toddler. I thought that there would be a sofa bed and there wasn't. There was little place to store things and the bathroom had little counter space. The bathroom also only had a shower which is very difficult for bathing a child. Again that was not in the room description. For this reason alone I would not stay here again with my family.Do not bother trying to park at this hotel. Every night we were told that the lot was full and had to park at the Banyan lot which is kitty corner to the hotel. If I'd known that was going to be the case I could have paid $80 for a whole week.I wish this hotel had a room for guests to freshen up after checkout. We had a late flight out and had no way to clean ourselves up before we left.

I would definitely recommend the Hyatt Place Wakikki!!! Great customer service, clean rooms, great breakfast, and free wifi. The staff went out of their way to take care of us. Everyone was very friendly.

We found this to be a very good choice in Waikiki, good location, excellent breakfast. The pool was small but you go Waikiki for the beach! We got a free upgrade which was a pleasant surprise. Staff are friendly and quick to respond to any requests for extra towels etc. Only downside was we had arranged for an early check-in but when we arrived our room was not ready until almost standard check-in time. Breakfast is served in an outdoor area so you're competing with the birds but the staff do a great job trying to deter them.

Location, newly renovated room, free breakfast, wifi, quiet, safe,friendly and reasonable (within Waikiki standard). No, it's not 5 star but I give it a sold 4 star. Will be back and will recommend to my friends.

I enjoyed my time here. The continental breakfast was really good and we were very close to the beach. The only thing I didn't like was that the pool was too small. I also enjoyed the five dollar Mai Tai happy hour.

We had a room on the 19th floor with beach view. Great view. Short distance to the beach.Only annoying thing was all the birds/pigeons that jumped on to your plate as soon as you turned you back to during breakfast.Great value for money on Waikiki beach.

It is a good hotel, but nothing really fancy, the breakfast was good not great, it was really crowded! If you want a fancy vacation, it is not the place. The fact it is not right on the beach made it so difficult to swim, to enjoy the restaurants on the beach!

We are currently staying here and are seriously thinking of cutting our vacation short. We first of all requested 2 queen beds and ended up with 1 queen and a hide a bed with a uncomfortable bar in the middle. They are unable to move us because "they don't have any. The room has no hotel room information in it ex: tv channels, pool location etc. air conditioning doesn't work well, fridge doesn't get cold and pool is super small. I feel most sorry for my daughters and even they just want to go home.

I've stayed at a Hyatt Place in many different cities including San Antonio and Las Vegas. Now add Waikiki to that list. This hotel brand remains consistent in delivering great service and great accommodations. The hotel staff was courteous, knowledgeable and professional. The room is modernly appointed and decorated. Everything in the room functioned well, as they should, from high speed wi-fi to good water pressure in the shower. I liked the location of the hotel. It is just a few blocks from the beach. And going in the other direction, you get away from the tourist center and experience more of local flavor, which I say is the better way to experience Oahu. I loved their breakfast because it was truly a breakfast from an array of cold and hot selections. The breakfast alone is enough to make me come back. Now onto my two big criteria, cleanliness and sleep quality. This hotel passes on both with high marks. Hyatt Place - I'm certain you'll continue the quality that separates your from your peer hotels.

Our family vacation took us to Oahu this year and we enjoyed our stay. We came with a group of 15 and enjoyed the many meeting areas the hotel had to offer. Some of our group had problems with the ac's in their rooms, but they said a call to the front desk had fixed them, and in one case a room change. Breakfast was wonderful, different each morning, and had plenty of options with juices, cereals, waffles, french toast, ect. We were within walking distance of many shops, the beach, and the international market. One morning we hiked from the hotel to Diamond Head about 2.5 miles. My only complaint about our entire stay would be the birds in their breakfast area which is outdoors next to the pool. I kept waiting for them to leave droppings in my food while trying to enjoy breakfast. Other than that we greatly enjoyed our stay and are planning on enjoying another Hyatt Place in FL before our cruise in August.

This Hyatt Place was the perfect place for my family stay in Honolulu for 3 nights before our cruise. We were not looking for a hotel to spend our entire week vacation at in Hononlu, just a smaller place to spend 3 nights while we toured Pearl Harbor and the Polynisian Cultural Center, so the price was better than a fancier resort hotel.  The hotel had a bar and Starbucks coffee in lobby. There is a complimentary breakfast bar and small convenience store in the lobby. The rooms are clean and updated. We obvserved that local tour operators pick you up at this hotel or ar the Marriott acorss the street, so we did not rent a car. The hotel is located one block form a public beach. We attempted to walk to Diamond Head state park, but found it was over two miles away and never got there.

Booked a room with an ocean view but found ourselves on 9th floor looking into an old apartment building with a tiny view of the ocean at one end of balcony. Room was also very small for 3 of us. I spoke with front desk who were very helpful and showed us another 2 rooms one of which was an upgraded (larger room with better views) on 19th floor. We ended up taking this one. The hotel did not charge us any extra, they were very good about it. The breakfast was ok, cereal, toast, fruit etc. Served outside near pool and yes birds are an issue if you leave your table unattended but didn't bother us. Didn't much like the breakfast buns with egg etc. On the weekend scrambled eggs and sausages which was good. Location was good being a block back from the lagoon beach at Diamond Head end. If you are more of a pool person then pool facility would probably not appeal as very small but didn't bother us as we preferred the beach. Staff all very helpful. We'd stay there again.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach on the last night of our vacation.I am Platinum member and I used my Hyatt points to reserve two rooms for our large family.Check in was quick and easy and we got the rooms we wanted with the beds we asked for—2 double queenbeds in each room. The rooms were adjoining so we could enjoy our family time.Both rooms had balconies with a wonderful partial view of the ocean and other towering hotels nearby. The flat screen TVs in the rooms were huge!! And filled with true HD programming. My parents enjoyed watching musical concerts on them.The bath is big and comes with slip-guard mat; big help with seniors in our group. There is also a retractable clothing line for drying swim suits in the tub. I saw an iron and ironing board, too. Coffee maker provided. There is a mini fridge for your convenience. And it WAS convenient for our leftovers and bottles of water.The hotel also provides free Internet access in the lobby on one of their complimentary terminals just past the bar. I did not try in-room access.Valet parks your vehicle for a daily fee $$. I believe you have to pay each time you drive out. But walking to the beach is easy—only 2 blocks away. A lot of shops and restaurants to see and try including sushi, Chinese, Thai to name a few.We hope to be back soon!

The hotel is only approximately 3 mins walk to the beach but about 15 mins walk to the main drag of Waikiki. The hotel room is small but tolerable. We had a huge balcony but did not have much of a view. Room is clean and the bed is comfortable.Bathroom and the shower is too small and almost feel claustrophobic. Horrible breakfast. Went up hoping it will get better everyday but they did not even have cereals. Or any hot food. Staff at the front desk are not very helpful.All in all, it's ok for its price.

As the title says a great hotel with breakfast nuts that's about it swimming pool is to small in room dining not advised but easy and cheap Hotel is close to an ABC shop but again what place in Honolulu is. Issues Birds at Breakfast be aware can take the food back to the room but suggest your down stairs early Hotel needs to install thin wire above the umbrellas to stop the bird stealing food. We found a few German cockroaches in our room but again this is something to expect in Hawaiian Hotels close to the beach the zoo and a few blocks to the Cheese cake factory a must for dinner but get there early to avoid the long wait

We are always fan of Hyatt brand... Even though we are enrolled in honor programs of various brands (Hilton, SPG, etc.) and have never got disappointed with Hyatt! Keep in mind this is Hyatt Place... Not Hyatt Regency or Grad Hyatt... So it is not on the same class!We first stayed at this place in 2011 for the new year! We were a bit skeptical because it is Hyatt Place... We did not get disappointed then and were not disappointed now! There are many great things about this place!1. It is clean and quite modern! The place are well maintained since it has first opened... Now completed!2. The location is convenient, close to the beach, Waikiki aquqrium, zoo, etc. but because it is not right on the main strip so it is much more quiet! 3. Wifi is free. Computer access is free to all guests! (You won't get free wifi or computer access any where in Waikiki!)4. Breakfast is included and quite decent!5. The gym is opened 24-hour!6. The room is nice and clean! Yes, some are tighter than other.. Yes, bathroom is tight... But so are other hotels in Waikiki beach (we have stayed at the Marriott resort, Hilton Village, the Modern, etc.)7. The staff here is excellent! We left our iPhone in our room.... We called the hotel and spoke to Jerry, one of the concierge... And he personally went to our room and found our phone...!)You denifitely get the Big Bang for your big here and will not be disappointd as long as keep your mind open that you stay at the Hyatt Place... Not resort and spa! I can't find anything negative here!After all, you are on vacation in the most beautiful and friendly place on earth!

Hyatt Place Waikiki is in a phenomenal location! If you're just staying for a couple of nights like we did, it's fine. I wouldn't recommend for long stays for the following reasons:- Concierge was incredibly difficult to get a hold of before our trip (to book various excursions)- A/C in room was loud every night and only cooled half of the room- Room and bathroom were quite small, though bed was comfortable

As first sight the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is a really nice family hotel.The staff were very friendly and helpful.My partner and I stayed at the king sea view room (level 15) in June 13, our room had a good size for both of us, the bathroom and room's furniture looked quite new and funky; the bed was really comfy.I heard that is better to stay at a high level (if you can pay the difference) in order to get a quieter stay, as some rooms on level 3 to 6, face the pool side where breakfast and food are served. The hotel has a good price because it does not have many fancy services. For instance, there is no menu for room services; or minibar. At the hotel there is only two small lifts to take you to your room so in pick times you may need to wait a little bit longer to get in ;) The hotel provides you with a complimentary hot/cold breakfast at the pool (level 3), the breakfast it's basic and somehow it makes you feel at the school canteen, however the pastries offered are very nice.The location is really good, it's opposite to the Marriott and just a 5 min walking distance to Waikiki beach.In summary, I got a really positive experience and I will not hesitate to choose it again, although it's not a place for romantic getaways it's definitely a really nice clean modern hotel, located in a good spot in Waikiki.

Last year we stayed here for five days. I can't believed the room we stayed in was very small for family of four. We did not get upgraded for a bigger room because it was fully booked. Now this coming July 1, 2013 we are coming back and we booked our trip reservation to Expedia. Now, a week before we go, I decided to call just to make sure we have 2 Queen beds when we arrived for check in on July 1,2013. The customer service at front desk said that we only have the regular room assigned for us..and that 2 Queen beds are just aREQUEST not a GUARaANTEED . They informed us to call Expedia. I explained to the customer service of Expedia about the situation and they called the place. Customer Service spoke to Jane, Reservation Manager and said she will try to accommodate us with our request. I'm really hoping Jane will give us a better place to stay because we will be there for 1 week. We are giving this place a second chance.

Okay, first let me say that I am a huge fan of Hyatts. I find Hyatt's customer service to always be top notch and the customer service at the Hyatt Place lived up to my expectations. I stay in them as often as I can. I saved up enough points to qualify for a free stay here so I figured why not. Here's why not:This hotel seems to be an old Holiday Inn or something similar with a Hyatt sign slapped on the front. The rooms, while "updated" still feel more motel-ish than hotel-ish. The walls and windows are paper thin and the noise level in the room was pretty high. We could hear everyone in the hallways as well as street noise below. Granted, there were a ton of young people staying there when I was there. The AC and refrigerator made loud noises too. All of this prevented us from getting a good night's sleep, which is extremely important to me when travelling. I will say that the bed was very comfortable. I am also a platinum passport member and I did not receive any options to upgrade. The free breakfast was awful. Cold "egg" sandwiches were gross. I guess if you just want cereal or something quick, it's a nice convenient option. Even my teenage boy who is always hungry passed on the breakfast after the first day. The coffee was good and they did have to go cups. The fruit was good also. The breakfast eating area by the pool was pretty dismal too. There was nothing nice about it at all. The pool itself was tiny and not somewhere I would want to lounge. The location, while only a couple of blocks away from the main strip and the beach, felt just a little seedy to me. Honestly, for about $100 more a night, you can stay at the Regency and be treated like royalty. Which is what we opted to do after two nights...

From the moment I parked my car in front of hotel to the moment I checked-out, all was amazing.Arrived friday at 3:00pm and the driver from the valet service came and talked to me, asking me if I wanted the valet service, and offered me the self-parking service (USD 15,00/day vs. USD 28,00/day). Once I said self-parking was ok, the guy promptly gave a folder with a map explaining how to reach the garage (which is in the very same building of the hotel, but considering the traffic one has to drive around the block to reach).After parked, I checked-in. It was soooooooo easy, fast and the guys were always smiling. Got my ocean viwe room at 14th floor, with an amazing view. Wifi worked properly in every corner of my room.Bed was comfortable, shower had a great water pressure. Toiletries were good. Towels were great, big and seemed to be new.About breakfast: they had the very same options you will find in every Hyatt Place in US. Some pancakes, some breads, pastries, butter, cream-cheese, orange juice, yogurt... The only problem is that it is really windy there! How to make it better: there's a tray in everyroom. Take this tray down to breakfast area, pick up all the food and drinks you want, and move back to your room. If you have an ocean view room, it's even better up there than downstairs... And don't worry, it's not "forbidden" to do that... they even encourage guests for it...The beach: about 100m from the hotel, you can find some white sand, calm, blue and warm sea. And they even offer you some beach towels (ask for them at the front desk).Don't forget to stop by any ABC store (there's one just beside the hotel) to buy some food and drinks. At Hyatt they have some for guests to buy it, but it's much more expensive than outside.For sure, recomended!

Great place for a week! Enjoy the place and the service. Quality price 100%! Not really like the deco in the room but it was overall ok.Will come back again because bf really liked it : clean, quiet, nice location. :-)
user_name:
Kim D
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice hotel for a couple nights ... We got upgraded to a higher floor with a bigger room because ours wasn't ready! Good start! We had a sofa and coffe table so it was like a suite. Breakfast was pretty good and FREE! Hope you like the birds at the roof top dinning area though cause they liked us. I thought it was fun... So close and yet so reasonable for the neighborhood. Very nice swimming beach was nearby...protected by man made sea wall.. Nice park right there also near zoo, aquarium, diamond head!Not too bad for just a tad bit over a Benjamin. But we got a deal of course:)

Its not the Hyatt Regency...but its ok... I am a Gold passport holder and got upgraded to a mountain view. Its well worth it anyway, its much more quite.it is at the DIAMOND HEAD end, which in my opinion is better. The rooms are small but nice. The pool is tiny and as mentioned next to where you eat breakfeast. It is free so dont expect too much. Its always windy by the pool so, not pleasant.The staff are wonderfulHawaii needs a total renovation, starting from the airport, unless you are spending heaps on accomodation, everything is stuck in thd 70's.i have been here heaps of time, you either love it or hate it.

Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, super clean, huge rooms and wanderful decoration. Very close to waikiki beach, fast foods, Excelent breakfast.definitely the best option near tourist areas, shops and tours well accessible.

Stayed in the Hyatt Place as part of a family trip. On arrival we were too early for check in (understandable) but left our luggage and returned after lunch. It then emerged that there had been confusion with our booking, and only 2 of the 4 rooms had been booked. Staff sorted this after a while and apologised for the mix up with 'complimentary breakfast added to the duration of your stay'. Upon entering the room, we found that the breakfast is complimentary for ALL guests so we hadn't actually been compensated at all. The staff at check in, although polite, werent all that informative. We hadnt understood that there were 2 towers to the hotel, so lugged our cases all the way up to the right floor in the wrong building to figure out we weren't in the right place. Back down we go! The hotel is right next to waikiki beach, so great for beach fans. I was extremely disappointed in the pool area here. I prefer to spend the day away from the beach in order to get some shade if needed. Tiny tiny pool, not what I'd expect from a 4 star hotel, so unfortunately spent a lot of time in my room reading with nowhere else to do it. If there is anything about this hotel I feel NEEDS improving is the breakfast area. There are pigeons EVERYWHERE around the seating area. Small amount of tables, so it is recommended that you bring a tray from your room to collect breakfast and then return to eat there. We did this every morning we ate there, as I do not enjoy pigeons landing beside me on the tables and chairs. I really feel there should be a net or some sort of preventative measure taken against them if that's where the Hyatt has allocated for their guests to eat.

This was my second stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The first time I was so happy with it I just booked it again without even looking at other places. This time I was still happy but there were a few things that weren't ideal so while I definitely wouldn't rule out staying there again I'd probably look around first.Last time we were in the Diamond Head tower. This time we were in the Pali tower and I think that might've made all the difference. The rooms (our party had two) were just as nice and big but were really noisy. The air conditioners in both rooms sounded like freight trains. I live in the inner city and have never thought of myself as noise sensitive but this really bothered me. I asked reception about it and was told that all the rooms in Pali had that problem. If it's a known issue effecting the whole building, why would it not be fixed? They did kindly offer to move me to the other building but the other problem with Pali is that there are only 2 elevators so you often have to wait for ages - so to get to the other room if I moved would've meant going down in the Diamond Head elevator and back up in the Pali one. So I stayed put and after a couple of nights of trying to get used to the air con noise I just turned it off at night. Also, and this isn't huge because we weren't in the room watching tv much but I'm sure there were better channels on our last trip - seemed like most of the channels now were 24/7 infomercials.Something that drove me insane and I would've thought could be easily fixed was door slamming - this was constant late at night and early in the morning. Unless people carefully closed the doors - and seems no one does - they slammed so loudly that all the furniture in the rooms would shudder. They have closing mechanisms that probably just need to be adjusted.The other problem that really impacted our trip - and not sure what the hotel could do about it - was that there was a school band group staying at the same time as us who were really noisy in the halls, stairs, etc. The night they checked in there was a fire alarm in the middle of the night and the whole building was evacuated onto the street. It wasn't fun being woken to a loud alarm and having to walk down hundreds of stairs and then back up them afterwards (would've taken an hour for everyone to get elevators) when it was determined that someone had triggered the false alarm but I REALLY felt bad for all the elderly people and people with babies and small children.On the good side, all the staff were nice, rooms are very nice and big, breakfast is good - we were there for 10 days and went at all different times and it was never too crowded or low on supplies.

First time I stayed here and must admit I was a little concerned. Been ripped off on Oahu in the past. My wife and I stayed here from May 19-29 2013. When we arrived the front desk was very friendly and welcomed us to their hotel. The lady at the front desk Fi? Not sure if I am spelling her name correctly was very pleasant. The first room we got was very nice, however the view was horrible. My wife and I spend a lot of time setting on the Lani just relaxing and the view from this room was right into someone's private residence. The front desk immediately upgraded our room with a much better view. Chris who also works at the hotel was kind enough to show us some other rooms to help us make a better decision on where we will stay next visit. I have seen some complaints on the breakfast that was being served at the hotel. I must say that the FREE breakfast was great! When you consider what it would cost from breakfast at McDonalds on Oahu this saved a considerable amount of money. And the breakfast was GOOD! Watching the hotel employee's working their butt's off to make sure everything was fresh and re-filled when ever it got low was very impressive. All in all we had a great stay and have already recommended the hotel to friends who are planning their trip to Oahu.

We were in Waikiki for 9 days and stayed one night in this hotel due to our flight back. I already know we will have a bad stay when we checked- in, she wasn't very helpful and friendly. Asked her if we could check out late because our flight is not till 9 pm the next day. Katherine immediately said no they are fully booked, I know they are not because I booked this hotel the night before and they had the room for us. I asked her if I can shower somewhere after I can go to the beach and said no right away, she said we have a bathroom where you can change. Checked in our tiny small room, didn't have space for any of our luggage and a carry on. Tiny bathroom, but a nice shower. Bed is ok too soft for my taste with a heavy comforter. Big flat screen TV but hardly have any channels. I asked her for a higher floor and got 7th floor facing a wall and a pool view. The swimming pool is a joke very tiny with about 5 lounge chairs, but we didn't use it, went to the beach but my husband stayed in the room. The beach is about 3 blocks away. When I came back from the beach I went to the front desk, got a different girl. I told her our situation and told her I'm willing to pay an extra charge and she said no also but she offered a hospitality room where I can shower, from 3 till 3:30. To make my story short, next day we checked out at noon. They put away our suitcases where you can see it, our shuttle to the airport doesn't get there until 6:30 pm so we have 6 hour wait. I went to the beach and my husband decided to stay and lounge at the hotel where a lot of people are sitting around talking. Came back from the beach at 2 pm, my husband talking to a man and his wife taking a nap on the chair. My time comes up for hospitality room and took a shower, I get back my husband is not there look around didn't see him. I asked the guy he was talking to and he said his in a police car being arrested, didn't see my husband and I asked the police where he is at and he said he almost got arrested and the man from the hotel said he got kicked and saw my husband with our luggages a block away crying, mad and confused. My husband told me he took a nap lying on the chair while I was gone taking a shower and a man woke him up from his nap asking if he's staying in the hotel and asked him what room did he stay. My husband couldn't think what room we were in, he got waken up by this man harassing my husband and called the police on him! For what? We stayed there waiting for the shuttle, it was only about 3:30, our shuttle doesn't come until 6:30. Now we're standing in front of another hotel with our luggages nowhere to sit and my husband very upset and still crying and yelling at the stupid manager. You can see this manager should not work for any hotel because he has no customer service and no hospitality. He didn't kick out the rest of the people in there lounging and taking a nap. He discriminated and harassed my husband because he's black!! I will never stay in this hotel again, thank goodness it's only one day. By the way the free breakfast is ok, nothing to brag about. Hawaii is supposed to be friendly people but we got rude manager that doesn't know how to deal with the situation we were in, I didn't get his name.

I received a great rate on Orbitz for this hotel and was a bit skeptical because of the price. This hotel far exceeded every expectation and I was completely and utterly pleased for all six nights that we spent here. I have arrived at 11am from Melbourne and they immediately checked me into an available king size room (that I requested) and Kimberly at the front desk was an absolute gem. I also had a few packages of stuff that I had ordered online and they had it there waiting for me - and no charge for collecting these boxes (other hotels that I have stayed at normally would charge a minimal fee for post). My only wish is that they provide soy milk at the complimentary breakfast but this was hardly an issue (as they told me when I called up in advance that this was not provided), so I came prepared with some and stored it in my room refrigerator. I found the breakfast to be full of choices and great for a free meal. Overall this hotel provided an excellent experience and I could not rave more about it. A top notch time. Thank you, Hyatt Place!

My girlfriend and I go to the south about once a year. After trying most of the Caribbean, we thought we'd give Hawaii a try. We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki and overall, we enjoyed our stay. I'll break my review into the pros and cons.Pros:- Hotel is clean and renovated. As you can see in my pictures, everything is more than fine. Given that a lot of hotels in Waikiki looks like they haven't changed since the 70s, you can truly appreciate this place. Room was also spacious enough despite being on the 3rd floor (reading reviews, it seems a lot of lower floors rooms are small, but it wasn't the case here).- Location. While not centrally located in Waikiki (it is at the end of the beach), it has the advantage of being quiter than other hotels. It's only a 50-10 minutes walk to go to the heart of Waikiki to do some shopping or find a lot of restaurants. Walk 2 minutes and you have the nice beach, with no waves thanks to the man-made wall. The zoo is right next and you should visit it!- Breakfast is included and they allow you to bring food back to your room. I read a lot of negative reviews about the breakfast but I was very satisfied with it. Sure the selection isn't huge (don't expect a cook to make you an omelette in front of you), but I could always find something to eat. Our room was on the 3rd floor, literally 20 meters from the breakfast place. So we could wake up, take the tray (provided in the room) and go pick up some food and come back to the room. Really convenient. We always took more pineapple that we stored for later in the little fridge.- Huge HD TV and good wifi. While having a big TV isn't essential when you're in Hawaii, it was still nice to have such a big screen with so many channels (including HBO). Wifi was also a nice surprise as it was not only provided, but fast! Some hotels provide a really slow wifi. Not the case here and you can enjoy netflix in HD on your tablet without any problem for instance.Cons:- Some of the services don't work. For instance, there is supposed to be complementary remote printing. I tried many times (to print my boarding passes) but it never worked. When I asked for help, nobody knew. Ultimately, I had to e-mail my pdf to the girl at the front desk and she printed it herself. While nice, it'd be better if the printing had worked right away.- The concierge/excursion guy doesn't provide 100% accurate advice. Specifically, he told us that there was no way we could get tickets for Pearl Harbor without taking a tour. We believed him, especially given that the online site did show the tickets were sold out. But when coming back, we talked to other people and they told us that you could simply take a cheap shuttle and buy tickets over there. You had to be there early, but still. Given that this guy is from the hotel directly, you'd expect better advice.- The bathroom is split in two, with the toilet/shower in a small room, while the vanity is out of this room, without a door to separate it from the main room. This isn't very practical and we'd have preferred if there was a door.Overall, we both appreciated this hotel. It was a good value for the price with only minor complaints. We totally recommend this place.
user_name:
Bryan B
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: My wife and I just returned from a one-night stay here. I emailed them ahead of time and told them it was our anniversary. We were promised an upgraded room on a high floor, but instead got the 8th floor with no view. Room was nice enough, but the shower/toilet room was showing some wear. Clearly this hotel is a madeover Day's Inn or something similar.Also, the door to the lanai offered no sound protection at all. Woke up at 4am to dumpster trucks. Hardly a way to start a vacation after a 6 hour time change.I wouldn't stay here again. But maybe I'm a little jaded because after we left Oahu we stayed at the Four Seasons Hualalai for 5 nights...

Our positive experience with the hotel started when I spoke to Stephanie in the reservations department. Stephanie provided me with valuable information about my upcoming stay. Our visit was a very important family gathering and Stephanie went above and beyond to make it truly memorable, she is an outstanding example of a true customer service oriented professional. When we checked in we met Angeline, she was all smiles and kindness, she explained the room key instructions (very good security features), she gave me information about the breakfast hours, etc. Angeline is another outstanding employee of the Hyatt Place Waikiki. The woman that cleaned our room was courteous, friendly, she also gave me tips about places to see on the Island. I spoke to her nearly every day and she was always very nice.We enjoyed fruit, yogurt and granola for breakfast every morning, no complaints about the breakfast.Overall, our visit was outstanding and I have to give credit to Stephanie and Angeline for making it a positive experience!

Just a two night stopover en route to the mainland from New Zealand. Friendly staff obliged me with early check in and late check out - but mind you the Honolulu check in time of 3 pm and check out time of 11 am are hardly generous. The room was spacious and modern and the king size bed very comfortable. Location is excellent - just a short walk to the beach but not right on the beach with all the crowds and traffic noise. 4th floor room had no view but that did not worry me. But why does a hotel staff member have to go into the side street with a noisy leaf blower at 6:45 every morning and wake everyone it. It just seems crazy - please Hyatt reschedule this fearful noise to 9 am.Otherwise a very good stay. I recommend this hotel.

The hotel is nicely located on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, and that's good thing because you don't have to deal with the traffic and the crowds in the middle of the strip. My room was on one of the higher floors, and facing the mountains. The view was mostly of the neighboring buildings, but (as many visitors forget) Waikiki is an urban environment, and you are in the midst of many other buildings. The room was actually quite quiet considering you're in the city, and sitting on the small balcony was pleasant in the morning. The room was nicely furnished, well kept and included all the usual amenities - coffee maker, safe, ironing board and iron. The free Wifi - standard at Hyatt Place - is always welcome (Why doesn't Hyatt adopt that across their system?) The freed breakfast in the morning is also a nice addition, the only drawback is that everyone in the hotel thinks the same thing so it's pretty crowded. This isn't a glitzy beach resort which is a good thing. Instead of never leaving the hotel pool - get out and see Hawaii! If you're driving in from the airport - the hotel is easily accessed from the Kapahulu Avenue side of Waikiki. Parking was a VERY reasonable $15.

Before booking the hotel, I searched several hotels in the same class and star ratings. And most of the reviews on this hotel was very consistent and most were positive. So we went ahead and booked this hotel and I'm so glad that we did. It was priced well for the location especially for the free breakfast. After staying here, I can finally provide my take on this hotel.Pros:- conveniently located next to the shopping districts and walking distance to all the main attractions- ABC store is right next door- hotel is a short block or two at the end of the main shopping areas so you're not in the middle of all the crowds- lobby was small but very impressive and modern deco- room we stayed in was a deluxe room and it was much bigger than I expected. there was a lot of room and can accommodate a family of four very comfortably- room was clean and it came with free toothpaste- free daily breakfast- mine fridge is always a plus- big entry way when entering the roomCons: - AC in the room can get noisy each time it starts up. We had ours on automatic. - you can hear some of the street noises- check-in driveway is small- hotel parking is $15/dayOverall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to save $$ and still stay at a decent, comfortable hotel. It's perfect for families especially for the free breakfast. If you want to stay at a good hotel and don't need the resort experience, this is the place. I would come book this place again the next time I come to Waikiki area.

This hotel has a professional and friendly staff. The room on the 19th floor was very spacious and with my two kids my stay was very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was great with varying options. The hotel is just one block from Kalakaua Ave and with a short walk you are in Waikiki beach. The parking in the hotel is only valet ($28) but you can park in the cheaper self-parking just crossing the street at Waikiki Banyan Hotel.

Room was comfortable size with a king size bed. The location was quiet and a quick walk to beach. The breakfast buffet was always plentiful and different selections every morning. The staff was outstanding meeting every need.

I enjoyed my stay at the newly renovated Hyatt. The rooms were very spacious, nice and clean. Very close to the main strip/beach. My room was on the 10th floor and the view wasn't perfect but it was considered an ocean view. You could see the ocean by looking over the balcony of the apartments next to the hotel. I would request a room on the 14th Fl or higher. I didn't like that there was no microwaves throughout the entire hotel, we had to take food down to the bar area to be re-heated. The staff, was very friendly and helpful. I would certainly stay here again for the price and location.

It has been a long time since I felt a hotel wanted to win my business but this place did. I had never stayed at a Hyatt before. I signed up for their card and made the reservations. Just before we arrived i notice the price had dropped. No problem they changed the rate. When we checked in about 4 employees came to help. I told the front desk I had never been at a Hyatt and we paid for an upgraded room so she upgraded us again. We were on a top floor with a great view of the mountains and the room was huge. Every time we had a question or a need - somebody was there to help. Free breakfast was big enough where most days we did not eat lunch. Between the breakfast and skipping a few lunches - that was a great money saver. They also Expedia personal in the lobby to help plan things to do. They were great also. They never pushed you into anything and were willing to make last minute phone calls to get things to work out. The only thing i would say in the hotel is a little far from the upscale shopping and eating places. Also it is near the protected beaches (great for families) verses the "IN" beaches near the high end stuff.Bottom line is they won my business. I hope all Hyatt are this good.

Hyatt Place Waikiki would be a good hotel in many cities, but for this area it lags the competition on many points. The hotel is 3 blocks from the beach and 1/2 mile from what would be the heart of Waikiki Beach. Many of the rooms overlook Kuhio avenue, and after the first night I asked to be switched to get away from the constant truck and bus traffic. The pool is very small and not what you would imagine in a resort. Breakfast is only slightly above continental. Parking garage and hotel entrance are on either side of the hotel, so expect significant waits to retrieve your car from the valet only parking garage. Staff was excellent and hotel is very clean, but understand that you're giving up a number of issues to many of the other Waikiki properties.

We stayed here 4 nights in May 2013. The hotel was in good condition, everything was clean and the furniture looked newer. Our room (king city view) was very small, however it had a reasonably sized balcony and a huge tv. The breakfast included in the price was very good and changed daily. The walk to the beach was short and the hotel provided beach towels. The bar/restaurant had good food and drinks at reasonable prices. The only downside is the parking situation. Onsite parking is valet only and is priced high. There is a garage around the corner that offers self parking for about half the price, but it does fill up quickly. Street parking is available, but hard to come by. Overall, I do recommend this hotel.

This hotel is situated one block from the beach and right down the end near the Honolulu Zoo.I am used to staying in a more central location but it's not too bad.The hotel is decked out quite nicely with an open air foyer and casual sitting/eating area. There is a very small pool ( like a lot of waikiki hotels) so really you would want to head to the beach.I had booked a king oceanview room and upon arrival was upgraded to a deluxe king o/v. There wasn't much of a view but that was to be expected. The room was excellent though. A really good size with a small study area and lounge and was well equipped and pleasantly fitted out.The complimentary breakfast is a good inclusion and for me who was happy with a bit of fruit and some oats it was sufficient but if you like a full spread or a nice hot breakfast you may need to go out but they do supply toast tea/coffee and one type of breakfast hot sandwich.I felt like the hotel just didn't grab me really. It was a nice room to come back to but that was about it, but really when I consider it most Waikiki hotels are just that. For the price it was a very nice room and with the breakfast and wi-fi included it's a pretty good deal.Also if you are heading off to Ala Moana for a bit of shopping there is a bus stop about 100 metres down the road to catch the free shuttle.

We loved the continental breakfast, hotel room was very nice with double beds and a couch. Kids got a kick out of the toilet that cleans and drys you off, although restroom was kind of small. The view of the beach was great and the staff was pleasant. I plan to return next year.

My Father in Law did a lot of research before picking this location for the family vacation and I must say it was an excellent choice. You get a lot of bang for the buck here with a free breakfast, big rooms, and some pretty nice views on the upper floors even though you're not on the beach. Service is friendly and helpful. Everything is clean. Beds are comfortable and you can get connecting rooms almost in a suite like arrangement where you have one door that opens into two separate rooms that have their own doors that require separate keys, but its a really nice arrangement that sets up well for putting the kids in one room and parents in the other. Breakfast food quality is just avg at best, but they do have Starbucks coffee. Birds are an issue at any outside location in Hawaii. The location is within walking distance of several eating places and very easy stroll to the beach. This is not plush, but for the price, you will be pressed to find better in this area.

The rooms though small are very efficient with a large bathroom and with nice amenities the 42" tv looks huge ib the room and is larger than most 4 or 5 stars properties location is perfect just two blocks to waikiki breakfast is enough to get your day started right on a t the 3.5 stars excelent choice for your money
user_name:
dreyes1047
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for a week with a group of friends and couldn't have been happier with the experience.Hyatt Place is not at the luxury end of the scale but it's good quality with nicely appointed rooms.If you're booking an ocean view room make sure they give you're on floor 15 or above, between 12 and 15 you'll see the ocean but you'll also see neighboring buildings which aren't too attractive. Wifi is free, breakfast is also free and while the range was perhaps a little limited it was tasty and a good start to the day.Location is perhaps most important and Hyatt Place gets top marks for that, just a block back from the beach and main entertainment area and right on Kuhio Ave which is one of the main transport arteries.

My husband and I spent 4 nights here in mid-May and would highly recommend this hotel for a stay on Waikiki Beach. The hotel is a short, safe two block walk from the beach and all the shopping and restaurants Waikiki has to offer. We called a month before our stay to request a higher floor away from the elevator as suggested on other reviews and received a room on the top floor (PH on the elevator) in the corner as we requested. The rooms were recently updated with a very nice, clean feel to them. The only downfall of this hotel is the street noise which could still be heard from the top floor and the limited views being two blocks from the ocean. We still had a nice view of Diamondhead from the lanai (balcony) and I would not dismiss the hotel because of either of these things.Every staff member we came across was incredibly friendly and welcoming. There is a happy hour at the bar every night from 5-7 which we enjoyed a $5 Mojito from in the open air lobby. The pool area looked nice although never in use since the beach is so close. Beach/pool towels are available in the pool area so you don't have to bring them along. My husband (and I) loved the breakfast which included breakfast sandwiches, some sort of pancake/waffle/french toast, bagels & toast, pastries, yogurt with fixings, oatmeal with fixing, fresh fruit and Asian breakfast soup options every morning. We also took some snacks back to the room a few times which they didn't appear to mind at all. Staff members offered great advice whenever asked and even suggested the Banyan hotel across the street for the cheapest self park which we used for one day. The other days we simply parked a few blocks away on the street across from the park and zoo for free. Parking is limited here but we got lucky and saved some money which we're all for. All in all this is an up-to-date hotel perfect for those trying to make the Hawaii experience a bit more affordable with complimentary breakfast, wifi, in-room safe and more affordable parking options. This would also be a great option for families. Compliments to they Hyatt Place staff!

We spent a week here and can honestly say everything was perfect. The location is great; about 2 short blocks from Waikiki Beach and restaurants and shops, and about 1 short block from the Trolley pickup. The hotel has recently been acquired by Hyatt Place and they have done a great job remodeling it. The rooms and bathrooms are great and so clean! The beds are very comfortable and you also get a balcony. The complimentary breakfast included is really good. They have waffles, french toast, yogurt, fruit, coffee, juices, bread, bagels, cereals, and hot breakfast sandwiches. You can either eat there on the pool deck or take it back to your room with the tray they provide in your room. No complaint regarding anything in our stay. Great hotel, location, service and value. Highly recommended!

Have just returned from 7 night stay here. The hotel is a very close walk to the beach, we had an ocean view room on the 9th floor which was great (there are hotels in front as this hotel is two blocks from the beach, but we could see the sea, beach, boats ans surfers and this is reflected in the good rates offered). It is exceptionally clean, the breakfast is perfectly fine. Good size bathroom, very comfy bed and huge TV, and free wifi in room. The lanai is tiny but at least you can have the door open and sit outside. The staff are all very friendly, professional and helpful, from the lobby staff, breakfast staff, expedia concierges (where we booked a number of trips) to the cleaning ladies. We didn't fly out til evening and they allowed us to store our luggage and have a courtesy room later in the day to freshen up in which was really appreciated. Would stay here again anytime. Thanks and Mahalo from Kelvin and Penny, New Zealand

I spent weeks and weeks amalyzing several options and this one was a solid, safe choice. My boyfriend and I stayed three nights and loved it. Room was very clean and updated with lot of touches like pull out clothes line in the shower, fridge, safe, hair dryer, etc. They also have several things you can borrow like flat irons and baby things. We thought the breakfast was excellent with coffee, toast, cereal, waffles, oatmeal, fruit, pastries, sandwiches and even Asian options. This saved us alot of money and time! Birds were not nearly as bad as i feared from other reviews. No resort fee and free wifi. Parking $15 per day. Elevators require room keys which adds security. Service was great. A sweetheart Allyson checked us in and was especially warm and welcoming and had us laughing after a long flight. Another staff member Christopher we met on the elevator was kind and chatted with us about the local surfing. At breakfast their was a wonderful hostess Maile who was always bustling around and talked to us each morning. We considered her a friend by the time we left. I wish we could have thanked her and all of the staff!! You might find a better screaming deal but if you don't want any risk on your hawaiian vacation this is a very solid value. On Vegas take a gamble, hawaii is too precious to risk to a lower end hotel.

We have just spent 1 week at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. We stayed in a huge room on the 16th floor which had wonderful views from a nice little balcony of the beach and city which was also great to see.The room was very clean and the beds were so comfy. The staff were very pleasant and always there to help. The breakfast was a nice way to start the day especially when we had tours booked early. Also, the free wi-fi was a bonus. Would highly reccommend the Hyatt Place as it was in walking distance to everything. As Waikiki is very noisy it was just back enough from the main drag that when we closed the windows and curtains at night time it just about blocked all the noise out. Thanks to all the staff - we had a lovely time staying with Hyatt Place.

Hyatt Place was an excellent choice. Very close to the beach (less than 5 min), bus station next to the hotel, complimentary breakfast and WiFi, newly renovated and spacious rooms, excellent value for money. The only downside was that parking was a little pricey, so we decided to not rent a car for the 7 days stay in Waikiki. We used the bus to travel to the airport and to Pearl Harbour. Following the advice from another reviewer from Trip Advisor, we rented a car for one day (pick up in the morning and return late night). To see the rest of the island was definitely worth it!

My wife and I celebrated our babymoon in Oahu (first time in Hawaii), and wanted a place close enough to all the action, yet nestled somewhere more remote so we could relax by day's end. Hyatt Place was just that. 5 min walk to the beach, and another 5 mins to the heart of Kalakaua Ave, it was situated perfectly. For those who don't mind longer treks (25 mins), Leonard's, Ono Hawaiian Foods, and Rainbow Drive are nearby as well. Above all, the staff, esp. Kehaulani were just spectacular - and made my wife and I feel like stars!

We stayed here for four nights in late February.We visit Hawaii every year and have usually stayed at Hyatt Regency but got a fabulous deal here so decided to give it a chance....and we were glad we did.We were upgraded to a large room on the top floor with views to the mountains. It had a wrap around lanai which gave great views.The room was very nice and very clean.Breakfast wasn't that great.Everyone mentions the birds and they are definitely a problem. But I feel the hot items are a waste of the hotels $$$. They just get thrown in the trash.But the cereal/fruit/coffee/pastries/juice are good.All the staff we interacted with were professional and helpful.One tip - the front desk staff organised our taxi to the airport for a good price. From memory, it was $31.We will definitely stay here again!

We enjoyed our week at this hotel and received a complementary upgrade to a mountain view on a higher floor - Necessary because of the street noise. Our room was very clean, our housekeepers did an awesome job refreshing our rooms. The staff is always so helpful with our needs whether directions, notions and almost everything one could ask.While the eggs seemed 'pre-frozen' the daily breakfast afforded us broad entertainment as well. It seems one has to know not to leave one's breakfast unattended. The local bird menagerie, ever vigilant to unattended treats, perches above. As an architect, I saw the potential for some decorative marine netting with grommets for ease of installation. A very reasonable and decorative solution to the winged predators ... preferable to the chemicals sprayed around the food to deter the birds. Back to the food, great selection ... American egg sandwich varies day to day, fruits, yogurts, cereals, toasts, Asian options include Miso soup, Kimchee et al. All in all, a great way to start the day en route udon noodle place, taco kabana or Matsumoto shaved ice and the shrimp truck on the north shore.Heads-up to the travelers: this hotel only has valet parking. Luckily, heeding a Trip Advisor's review and the hotel's valet staff, we parked diagonally across the street at the Ashton Waikiki Banyan, which was $15/night. (Also available for $80/week). This came with all in & out privileges...for those runs to the Safeway 6 blocks north...as amazing as the Hyatt Place and a real find.

We have just returned from 3 days in Hawaii, as the tail end of an 18 night cruise from Sydney.The Hotel is well placed (about 2 streets from the actual beach) and well serviced by bus and trolley stops. The rooms themselves are excellent, well at the high end of the scale. The bed was comfortable and king size. Their is no mini bar (not needed by us) and the shower was good (even if missing the bits to stop the water leaking out of the door !) There is a pool on the 3rd floor, that also serves as the breakfast area. Wifi is free and available throughout the building (letting us catch up after 18 days at sea).However....The staff seem very unhappy and completely non customer interactive. We had very little conversation that was not related directly to work. The Bar / food area took 20 minutes to provide a basic burger (that seemed to be made on 2 week old bread) and followed the first meal by 10 minutes....Breakfast had to be shared with pidgeons, who seem to infest the dining area. You need to have breakfast with two poeple, one to fend them off while the other eats - if you can eat the dried up offerings. The daily waffles and other bread based options were in-edible. The fruit was nearly all pineapple (you had to be up early to find the few pieces of watermelon or other items). Coffee was the best option.Apart from eating and drinking, this hotel is a very pleasant stay (lol).

There are many possitive things: nice, clean and spacy room, comfortable bed, nice balcony, friendly and helpful staff, good location. But as this is Hyatt there should not be negatives like very poor and boring breakfast (always same, not tasty at all, no vegetable, ham, eggs), not very representative outside breakfast zone with annying doves eating from your plate and even more annoying wind :-(, no proper swimming pool, no shower just bath with plastic curtain in our room. Overall feeling: not too bad, but based on our previous Hyatt experience I expected much more.

We've just returned from our first trip to Hawaii where we stayed the first two nights on Oahu. With three kids in tow, and as fans of Hyatt properties, this location didn't let us down. The hotel is just a block from the beach, and the room overlooked Diamond Head, so it was a good spot. The staff was very kind upon checkin, even offering little welcome packages to our kids. The entire place was very clean. The room was ample size for a family of 5 or even 6. The breakfast each morning was great -- even the Miso soup (an oriental breakfast favorite) was enjoyed by my husband and son. We ventured out with our rental to drive the island and visit Pearl Harbor. Lots of great places to see on the island and lunch from Macky's Shrimp Truck in Haleiwa on the famed North Shore was the best! If ever we find ourself back in Waikiki, we'd be pleased to stay at this location, again.

The Hyatt is beautifully kept and the best part it is in the center across the street from one of the best beaches in the world. You only have to walk a 100 feet and your toes are in the sand. The hotel has plenty to offer as far as amenities, great service staff and views of the strip, beaches, and mountains if you choose.You can workout, swim, window shop or just order up that refreshing cocktail and sit and watch all the beautiful tourist and locals stroll by, all this with the water and sand and fresh air smell in front of you. Great setting, and location for shopping, surrounded by the of the islands best shops and restaurants....great place to spend a weekend, week or stop over, you will always enjoy this find grand lady.

Hyatt Place is the place to stay when you are serious about seeing the rest of Hawaii. Located down the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, it is one block from the beach and close to bars, restaurants and public transport. The rooms are clean with modern furniture, comfy beds, large flat screeen tvs, they have a free buffet breakfast with good options to start the day and free wifi and computers to use in their lobbies. There is also an Expedia tour desk to book your daily excursions which is very helpful. This is not the place to stay on honeymoon or a luxury getaway, their pool is tiny - you will not use it. Hawaii is awesome, do not stay in your hotel room and do not spend all your time in Waikiki. This hotel is perfect for someone wanting a clean, nice room with free breakfast (which is hard to find in hawaii) to use as their home base as they travel around the beautiful island of Oahu.

This is a really well done hotel. It is only a block off the beach and close to the action of down town Honolulu. The rooms are very well done and the public rooms are well maintained. It is not a full service hotel but it does have the service you need. You can get a drink at happy hour and light food through out the day. Free breakfast is always a bonus but it does get crowded and windy. The staff were very kind and helpful. This is a great bargin given the going rate for other hotels in the area. I enjoyed this more than our stay at Turtle Bay.

We stayed for a week at this hotel for our trip to Oahu. We received a complementary upgrade to a mountain view which was really sweet. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is very clean, our housekeepers Leonida and Mirla did such an awesome job refreshing our rooms every day. The staff is always so helpful with our needs. The daily breakfast is also a good deal. The distance to Waikiki Beach is really great, and there are so many nearby restaurants and stores around.Now this is just a heads-up to the travelers: this hotel only has valet parking. We rented a car throughout this trip and my husband and I both think that might have been a mistake. PARKING is the number one issue when visiting this place. Luckily, heeding a fellow Tripadvisor's review and the hotel's valet staff, we ended up parking across the street at the Waikiki Banyan, which was $12/night. (Also available for $72/week, but we realized this after they increased the nightly rate to $15/night). So, it was really a crazy dilemma between $28valet at the hotel that we're staying at vs. $15 across the street, self-park. We spent $130 for parking alone. That was my only trouble with this hotel. If you are renting a car, be prepared to pay for this.Waikiki beach is a beautiful beach, but coming from a tropical country, I think it is average. The number of homeless people along the stretch of the beach and the streets is what's disturbing. But going back to the hotel, I would recommend this to a friend.

Nice location with quick access to the beach. The first room we were put into was so unbelievably small for three people. It had one bed with a small pull out "bed". the pull out was 1/2 the size of a twin bed, and that filled up the room, with no walking space between the bed and the pull-out. When I asked to be moved I was made to pay $100.00 for an upgrade. This did not start my vacation out well. After the move we were somewhat satisfied. Breakfast was generally good. I really liked that it was included.

There is nothing not to like about Hyatt Place. The location is fantastic (a two-minute walk to the beach, a slew of restaurants and world-class shopping). The rooms are a nice size, crisply furnished and very comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful, and I thought the breakfast buffet - which I try to avoid in most hotels - was very good. By which I mean the pastries seemed to come from a bakery that cares, the Kona coffee was hot and delicious and the bacon-and-egg-on-a-bun thingie was fab. And, of course, the place was immaculate and the Wifi was "free." That said, the view wasn't much and it's not a hotel that will wow you with doric columns, wave-pools and a four-story atrium. It's just really nice.

I've been to Honolulu several times over the past 2 years for business and have stayed at the Hyatt Place for several of those visits. This time was a bit disappointing, especially since I was finally able to bring my wife with me.The staff seemed just a bit less attentive than previous trips - when we arrived to check in, there were two front desk staff chatting casually with a guest while we stood there awkwardly for several minutes waiting. Once we got to our room, I was a bit dismayed to see that we were given a rather small room - not the larger suite I was given on previous trips and booked for this trip. I was told this was an "upgrade" since I could see a sliver of mountain from the window. I would have traded view for space in this case. I called down pretty much every morning and was told that they weren't sure what they had available, or they weren't sure, or they didn't have anything.Breakfast was the standard Hyatt Place menu - some sort of breakfast sandwich that rotated every morning, along with fresh fruit (why does the pineapple just plain taste better in Hawaii?), yogurt, and assorted pastries/carbs. The coffee was actually very good and I always took a cup to go.Be warned ahead of time - especially if you've never been to Waikiki - it's a magnet for Japanese and other asian tourists. This is not necessarily a bad thing - I think it's great for the local economy. They do, however, come with a different set of rules and etiquette, particularly when it comes to anything where a bit of order might be expected. Lines are non-existent and people tend to either swarm, walk in front of you if they want something, or otherwise not pay attention to where they're going. Again, not "bad" - just different, and if you're someone who's used to order, this might throw you off some. With that in mind, it can make breakfast an interesting, free for all dining experience. The menu does tend to get a little old after a few days, but it's free, convenient, and if you're really tired of it, there are lots of other places in the area to walk to.I prefer this property because it's down on the end of "the strip", so it's a little less hectic than the properties smack in the middle. The Sans Souci beach is not too far, and from what I read, one the locals prefer. It's actually nice to be on one end of the strip because you can just walk down one way and back, making a clean loop.As with all other hotels in the area, the driveway is way too small for the amount of vehicle traffic that comes through. That can make getting a car in/out with the valet service a bit of a challenge at times. The valet staff also seemed hit or miss - hustling at times, disappearing at times.Another neat thing is that there's a pretty good bike/scooter rental right next door - my wife took a scooter one day while I was at work and promptly claimed that it was one of the top three days of her life - they were very friendly, polite, and took the time to cover all contingencies.Overall, it was fine for what we needed - a bed, shower, and free breakfast to boot. It was just a little "off" from my previous visits, and I found that a little disappointing.

I couldn't say enough good things about this hotel!From the time that I booked my reservation until check-out, I was very impressed by the service and the quality of the hotel. I came here on a girls trip, with my mom, best friend, and her mom and all four of us really enjoyed our time at Hyatt Place Waikiki. We booked deluxe rooms and the staff were able to accommodate our request for connecting rooms. These rooms were very large, tastefully decorated, and the housekeeping for a "select service" hotel was spot-on. We enjoyed breakfast every morning, which tasted great and was also a nice way to start off our mornings. The staff here are equally as important to mention--everyone from reservations, valet, reception, housekeeping, bartenders, and cooks were extremely nice and seemed to be having a good time. We called down a couple times to request things and the staff were always friendly and eager to help. Special mention to the person that checked us out, he was one of the nicest people that I have encountered in my travels! I only wish he was wearing a name tag so I could have mentioned him here!One thing I will say, is if you are deciding between here and one of the Waikiki resorts... I have stayed at the Hilton Waikoloa Village, and I didn't miss the pool scene whatsoever--after all we were in Hawaii and enjoying the beaches! Another thing to mention is that this hotel is not on the beach, but we thoroughly enjoyed our walk down to the thick of Waikiki every morning! Maybe it's a 10 minute walk, but it's definitely not a site for sore eyes. There is also a $12 parking lot across from the hotel (with in and out privileges)--really you can't beat this place!

Although the hotel employees were very helpful, the stay was unpleasant because the mattress sagged, the pillows gave no support, a light near the wall-mounted air conditioning unit flashed randomly throughout the night, and an alarm clock went off early in the morning blaring loud music. Room was advertised as "ocean view" but other buildings mostly blocked the view. Breakfast was mediocre.

We stayed at Hyatt Place for 6 nights in April 2013. Reading all the reviews here and looking at the pictures, I obviously had my expectations too high. I read the hotel was renovated in 2012 and I was disappointed - the hotel just didn't looked renovated at all to me. It just looked old inside - the walls,the carpets, the furniture, the bathroom, the bath room accessories - everything looked cheap... and our room was sOther than that, I had no complaints, everything was great - the staff was so polite and friendly, there was free breakfast and the pool area was large enough. Location was perfect. I would recommend this hotel and we left content with our choice.

We stayed a week at this Hotel at the far end of Waikiki Beach where it is quieter but has less in the way of restaurants and cafe's. The hotel itself is what you would expect for a Hyatt in a busy holiday location, the room was large enough, clean and tidy. Our only disappointment was that the bathroom was on the small side with only the toilet and shower behind a door, after using the toilet you had to come out to wash in the vanity. Not the ideal setup. Staff were fine and we enjoyed our stay. The bus stop was within a 2 minute walk, very handy. We did find the hotels in Hawaii on the expensive side. As for the free breakfast we only used this once and that was on the first morning. It was a buffet and the "hot" food looked and tasted like plastic. However, we found a hotel with a great breakfast within a 5 minute walk, eggs any style, bacon and hash browns much more to our taste, but of course at $12 a head. Our holiday was great, relaxing and the weather was good all week, no rain.

Stayed at the Hyatt Place for 7 days with husband and 3 year old and it was fantastic. Just a 2 mins walk to Kuhio beach (perfect calm water for kids) made it a great location. Smaller boutique-type hotel that offered complimentary warm breakfast each morning (eggs, waffles, french toast, bagels, yogurt, cereals, pastries, fruit, etc) was convenient and very good. Rooms were clean and modern and beds were super comfy. All the staff we encountered were friendly! Thanks to Lucy for the upgrade upon arrival and Allison for allowing a later checkout on a ridiculously busy day for the hotel. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends and family. Price was also great!

We recently returned from our trip to Oahu where we stayed at Hyatt Place in Waikiki. We took our twin 10-year-olds with us. We found Hyatt Place to be a wonderful place to stay. 1. Room was clean and modern and the bed was very comfortable! We all slept great.2. The location was convenient and only 2 min walk to the beach. Very close!3. Breakfast was great for being free and included breakfast sandwiches (bacon, cheese, eggs) as well as fruit, cereal, oatmeal, pancakes/waffles, pastries, juice, milk and miso, tofu, rice and kimchi.4. Beach towels were available at the front desk and we made use of this.5. Wifi was free and pretty fast for a hotel.6. Parking across the street was $12 so not bad for the area.7. Lots of dining options nearby--try Wolfgang Puck Express for a quick, tasty, and inexpensive meal. Lots of good choices for kids there. Its only a 3 min walk away--located at a hotel nextdoor. There is also Lulus (great fish), Subway, and bunch of other eating choices.You can't beat this place for the price!

Excellent location, 2blocks from Waikiki beach. We had 4 adults in our room and had plenty of room with 2 beds and pull out sofa. Rooms were clean and each had a small balcony. Served a nice breakfast at the pool side each day. Staff was very nice. Small pool but didn't matter as we enjoy the ocean. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance and bus stop right on the corner from hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Wonderful, but smaller hotel room with a great bed and only a block away from the beach. Pleasantly surprised how great the breakfast really was...Every morning we were able to eat a large bowl of fresh Hawaiian pineapple along with our eggs and some of the best coffee. They serve starbucks products which is a plus. Only down side was that we were on a low floor and the view outside our room was that of a ruin down apt complex, and the fact that the pool is smaller than the one in my own back yard, but that didn't stop me from loving this hotel with it's very attentive staff...we are planning on returning...

If you've been reading up on this hotel, you've read mostly good reviews. We stayed here for a week in April 2013, and here's the good and the bad:Good Stuff:Great location - quick access to the beach and good restaurantsCheap parking - garage across the street ($12/day or $70/week) Resorts charge around $27/day so this is a definite plus.Modern - love the sleek and updated look and everything was clean.Free breakfast - this is definitely a plus and very convenient so I'm giving it a thumbs up, but it does need some tweaking. We ate french toast at the airport our last day in Hawaii and we all thought that was the best breakfast we had on vacation (if that gives you any indicator as to taste of the free breakfast buffet.)Beds - comfortable and not too soft or firm, good quality sheets, down pillows.Free Wifi - glad it's free but it's also quite slow. We used our hotspot most of the time instead.No Resort Fee - good grief why do hotels even have this charge? Thank you Hyatt Place for not squeezing more money out of your patrons.Beach Towels - just pick them up at the front desk, super convenient not to have to pack them.Beach Toys for Kids - they give you a complimentary beach pail set when you check in. Nice!Showers - love that you can change the spray on shower handle, good pressure and water was nice and hot! Plus there is a clothes line you can pull out/retract to hang swimsuits on to dry. Thank you! Mini Fridge - left empty so you can use it for whatever. We filled it with Diet Coke and water bottles purchased from Safeway up the road.ADA Compliant room - don't know why we got this room as we aren't in need of this, ended up being a perk as it is bigger than a standard room and the bathroom is larger too.Balcony - didn't expect a balcony at all, so this was nice even though we didn't really use it.Laundry Facilities - So convenient, especially if you have kids! $1.50 for tide, $3 to wash, $3 to dry.Exercise Room - conveniently located next to laundry room, so worked out while waiting for laundry to finish. They need to crank the ac in there as it got a little warm while working out.Teddy's Bigger Burger - right around the corner. Ate here 3 times it is that good - put cheese on your fries cuz you're on vacation!Bad Stuff:Noisy - they seriously need to upgrade to noise canceling windows as the street noise is nuts! Every night we were wakened by blaring sirens, and there was constant idling noise from diesel engines (tour busses, etc.) Hotel was fully booked so we couldn't change rooms to a quieter side of the hotel. I doubt it would be that much quieter though as Waikiki is full of activity at all hours.Incredibly Slow Elevators - we often opted to take the stairs as we were on the 4th floor. Everybody waiting for the elevators complained about this, including employees.Noise from stair well - our room was right next to stair well and we joked that it sounded like a heard of elephants as people opted to use stairwell due to slow elevators.Bathroom Vent - ours didn't work even though a maintenance guy said it was working (he pointed a flashlight to show that the fan was spinning - but there was absolutely no air flow or whirring noise and meant that our bathroom stayed warm and humid.)The good definitely outweighs the bad, and it's always better to know what to expect if you are considering this hotel for your vacation. In all I feel the hotel was a great value compared to staying at a resort hotel in Waikiki. Hyatt Place Waikiki, if you are reading this . . . you are almost a 10! Consider looking into something to help with noise and elevator issues as those are your weakest points.

We arrived on 4/18 and will depart 4/25, so we are here now. Nice hotel, not too far from the beach. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. Room is small, but I guess that is expected, real estate is precious here. My biggest complaint is the balcony, it is so small, you cannot turn your chair and face the ocean. Today I noticed every other floor has a larger balcony, I got the small. Wish this would have been explained at check in. My second complaint is the ocean view I paid extra for. Yes, there is an ocean view, but they do not tell you the view is partially blocked by the two hotels in front of you. Not my idea of a true ocean view I paid extra for. Breakfast is included which is nice. Would I recommend the Hyatt Place, yes, but I would argue the two negative points I listed.

We had booked a basic room so view was towards the mountain.Room was small but we had everything we needed.Hotel was located about 200 meters from the beach.
