Breakfast was included and there was enough to choose from.It was very crouwded at breakfast time.There is a very small pool but we never used it.Hotel is very well located , clean and friendly staff.Personnaly i would not pay for a room with a view because the hotel is located between other high rise buildings.

We stayed here for fifteen nights. Our first room was very big but on the road side, which was very noisy, we asked to be moved to face the beach and with the wall on the road side it was a lot quieter. The staff are very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was good with a variety to suit varied tastes, the pigeons thought so as well, so don't leave your breakfast unattended.lol. There is a tray in your room so you can get your breakfast and take it back to your room and eat. Location is exellent, a block from the beach, trolley stop on one corner and bus stop on the other, if you book a tour chances are the pick up is from the Marriott which is across the road or the Aston Waikiki which is to the left on the next block. The only downside is the lifts are terribly slow and the firestairs are metal not concrete so people using the stairs can be quite noisy. Our second week was spring break so the kids running from floor to floor up and down the stairs was annoying. Free wi fi was a bonus and taking my ipad was great and cheap way to stay in touch with home. The beds are soooooo comfortable.. We will defintely stay here again.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this location for 5 days 4 nights. We got this hotel for a great price through priceline. First time we arrived, we were able to check in a little early but to our surprise the room we were given had a weird musty smell to it. I noticed a HUGE blood stain on the carpet next to the bathroom and we immediately went down to the front desk to request another room. I'm not sure WHY there was blood on the carpet but there was no way I was going to stay in a room that smelled and was tainted. The front desk apologized (and I knew she was embarrassed about this) and gave us a new room. Throughout our stay, I noticed small little bugs in the bathroom that were crawling around. My boyfriend said "it's probably the island life." I'm not sure if it really is normal or not, but for me it was unacceptable. Luckily, we were leaving in 2 days so I did not make a big deal out of it.Daily breakfast was good. It is the same stuff over and over but hey it's FREE! They do change up the breakfast sandwiches everyday though.Parking can be expensive, but we parked across the street for $12 a day which is a STEAL!You can borrow free beach towels from the hotel so save some space and don't pack your own.Location is the best thing about this hotel. Right next to Waikiki strip and you can have access to everything!Staff is very friendly and helpful :)

This winter, I spent two weeks at this property. As a frequent Honolulu visitor, I have enjoyed many hotels there, but I would say this was my favorite. The staff is great. Very friendly and helpful. Being I was there for 14 days, many came to recognize me. Josephine, the housekeeper on my floor was a great plus to my visit. She tried to learn my schedule and clean while I was out. She was very friendly. I developed a fever one night and the next day, she made it a point of changing my linens. Reading some of the reviews before I visited, I was concerned about the room size, but mine was great. Very spacious and well designed. The bathroom itself is just a shower and toilet and rather small, but there is a nice vanity outside that makes up for it. The bed and sofa were very comfortable and there is a good sized desk and workspace. The breakfast was a great benefit. Very plentiful and the hot items seem to change frequently during my stay. The outdoor space was lovely, but just don't feed the birds.The hotel also had a very comfortable lobby; a four station complimentary computer station; a gift shop; a tour desk; a well equipped gym; a smaller pool (why use when I could take a short walk to the beach!); a coin-operated laundry and a sundeck. My favorite amenity was the lobby cafe. You could order food from their cafe menu 24/7 (sandwiches, soups, salads, deserts, etc), as well as a full size bar (never used). The staff there was great and I had some great meals. The location of the hotel was strong. Very close to the beach and near the Zoo and Diamond Head. My balcony gave me a nice view of the latter. The only downside I encountered was the elevator service. There were only two elevators in my 20+ floor tower. During breakfast or at peek times, you could wait a long time for the cars to come. Also, being that the housekeeping and maintenance staff are use these same two elevators, it created many traffic jams. Other than that, I would highly recommend this location. In fact, I have already booked my room for my next trip to Honolulu.

Had 4 nights here at the start of our trip. Staff were very helpful. Travelled with my husband and our 2 children, sharing a double room. Room size is good and we didn't feel too cramped. The hotel provided a fold out bed without having to be asked. Breakfast is very good, considering it is included in the price. Free Wifi everywhere is great. Fitness centre is also very good. Pool area is very small, but you are literally a 5 minute walk to the beach. I would definitely recommend staying in this hotel to anyone. Good value for money.

We had an ocean view room on the 15th floor. This great room was very large with two very comfortable queen beds. The staff was superb- everyone was so friendly, courteous and helpful! The location was perfect for us- less than two blocks to the beach, walking distance to most of the downtown attractions, and right by the bus stops for quick and easy transportation. The free wireless and breakfasts were an added plus.We had a great experience and would recommend this facility to anyone going to Honolulu.
user_name:
Deborah W
Simpsonville, South Carolina, United States

review_body: Excellent location, convenient to the beach, stores, and restaurants. Rates include breakfast (very good), internet, and beach towels. This is what you would expect for Hyatt in Waikiki. I was on the 7th floor, next to the elevator, and you could not hear the elevators. Nice, quiet, calm, good security.It's about a block from the beach. Caution: Hyatt has another place in Waikiki, about 3 blocks away, and you might end up there. Make sure you put 175 Paoakalani Ave into your GPS. Another way you can tell is the other place has check in on the 2nd floor.

We stayed here during July of 2012 and forgot to review the hotel. Our stay here was so nice and enjoyable that I felt the need to post our review. We have stayed in other very nice and expensive hotels on Waikiki beach in the past, but have to say that this place was just as good, if not better. Our room was clean, modern, and upscale with plenty of space for our family. The fitness room was also clean and up to date with nice equipment. An added bonus is the tasty complimentary breakfast which serves both hot and cold foods. If you like the hustle and bustle of the marketplace and the strip, but don't want to sleep around it, you should consider this hotel. It is short walking distance from Prince Kuhio beach and is a longer walk or short bus ride to the marketplace. We will definitely be staying here the next time we are in the Waikiki area.

Excellant location 1 block from ocean. We had partial ocean views. Modern rooms in an upscale hotel. Great service from very freindly staff. Rates incude breakfast, free internet and beach towels. Wakiki has many high rises and beautiful beaches. Take bus that circles Oahu that stops nearby the hotel. Uncle Bo's is good reataurant within 2 blocks.

I just returned from a 12 night stay at this fabulous hotel. We were put into a room on the 17th floor, Pali tower with mountain view (free upgrade) with two queen size beds. Beds, oh they are heavenly. Very nice and spacy rooms with huge flat screen TV, fridge, coffee machine, big safe box. Wi Fi worked perfectly both in room and lobby area. Kind and courteous staff with nothing but smile on their faces. Bathrooms equipped with hair dryer (manual not the weak wall version), shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste (Aquafresh), soaps and tons of towels. Upon request they will provide a number of items to guests (car starter cables, razors, little sewing kit, body lotion, universal phone charger and list goes on). Breakfast is fairly repetitious but you can always find something good to eat. Nice selection of juices, coffee (Starbucks) and Tazo teas. Fresh pineapple, melon and cantaloupe are to die for. Fresh towels at the reception any time of day and you can take as many as you want. For those that don't want to carry boogie boards, a convenience store located in the lobby of hotel rents them for $3 per day. The same store also had better prices on souvenirs and pops than ABC stores located on every corner of Waikiki. Four free internet stations at the lobby of the hotel. 24 hour gym (nicelly equipped) and 3 washer and dryers on the 3rd floor ($3 per load).Only steps away from a family friendly beach with calm waters. Next to this beach is a beach where you can ride your boogie boards on fabulous waves.One minor thing is that there are only 2 elevator for 20 flooors and these elevators are also used by cleaning and service staff so sometimes waits can be a bit annoying.Way to go Hyatt. This hotel will make your chain proud.

I did a lot of research for this trip trying to find a place for me and my husband, my college age daughter and my pre-teen nephew. I am also in the travel service industry. I've stayed in 5-6 different hotels during our recent Hawaii trips. This was the best!We didn't want to get two rooms, wanted a decent view, wanted to be close to the beach and wanted separate beds for the kids. I researched on Trip Advisor, Yelp, etc., but ended up booking directly with the hotel for the best price which turned out to be with AAA. We got a Deluxe Ocean Queen. It had 2 queen beds and a full pull out sofa bed.The rooms were newly renovated and nice. There was a small refrigerator for snacks, water and soda. Wireless Internet is free! No annoying resort fee either. Staff was super, super friendly. Complimentary breakfast bar 6:30-9:30am daily. It consisted of breakfast sandwiches, waffles/pancakes, fresh fruit (usually a mix of pineapple and melon), yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, cottage cheese, granola, toast, bagels, orange juice, milk, apple juice, tomato juice, water, coffee and tea. Can get really busy depending on when you go. There is a wood tray in each room that some families brought down to take food back to their rooms.There are free computers for use in the lobby. Printing is also free if you need to print out boarding passes or tickets purchased online. Beach and pool towels down in a cabinet by the pool. No hassle, just grabbed as many as we needed.Lobby is totally open, but you need a room key to get up to the rooms. Safes are in each room as well. Felt very secure.Only downside is valet parking at $28/day. This is pretty normal for Waikiki though. The valet guys are super nice and earn their money. There is self parking diagonally across the street for $17-18, at the Banyan, but is very crowded and hard to park in. We ended up parking at the Hyatt. Like I said, this was the ONLY downside.This is a great place for families, especially if you don't fit into the 2-queen hotel room model.

We stayed here at the start of our three week Hawaii trip. We had pre-booked two nights for when we arrived in Hawaii. After an overnight flight it was great to be able to check in at 10am to refresh and have a short rest! It's so close to everything you need in Honolulu - the rooms were fairly quiet (the quietest we experienced out of the 11 hotels we stayed at in Hawaii!!), the breakfast was terrific, loved the gym - this place is the whole package!Our only complaint is that when we wanted to extend our stay because we were loving it so much, the price per night suddenly doubled. And it was out of our budget. We wished we'd just booked a longer period online before we arrived!I have already recommended this hotel to my parents and my best friend for upcoming trips to Hawaii - and if I went to Honolulu again I would happily stay here!

We had booked at the Hyatt Regency, however got transferred to Hyatt Place for 2 nights due to over booking.Couple of points to note (different to all the other positive feedback which I agree with):- Rooms are nice and modern. We had our room on the 10th floor. Note that the rooms are a bit smaller, which prevented us from leaving our two suitcases open, however it isn't a major issue.- At the 'end' of the Waikiki strip of shops and hotel. May be an issue if you're walking.- 'Pink Trolley' stop about a block away.- Bus stops right outside (on the main road).- Nice size bed, however we found the pillows 'too' soft.
user_name:
Akshay C
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We loved this hotel, its location, the VERY good price, which made us love it even more! I totally agree with all that the travel agent review just below says : we were on the 14th floor and room was totally updated (i loved the big shower). We saved money here, that we were able to spend "eating out", and we also probably saved at least $25 / per day just from having the complimentary breakfast almost each morning. We would definitely stay here again... location, location, location ! Just a one block walk down to beach, and we didn't feel we were in the "concrete hotel jungle" .

Newer hotel, close to airport, close to many attractions, nice amenities. Friendly greeting, friendly helpful staff (at the front desk there is one girl originally from Orange County California, I forget her name, she was very very helpful and friendly), great service overall. Beach toys are given to children at check-in. There is a small pool onsite but you're there to go visit the beach which is only a short 5 minute walk to Kuhio Beach. The hotel provides beach towels and you may borrow, water wings, and water noodles for the kids. The hotel is close to "The Wall" an area on the beach where waves are blocked off so the water is shallow and clear, no higher than approximately 6ft. Great area for kids, bring food to feed the fish.Free breakfast every morning, bring your wooden tray from your room to carry all the dishes. An assortment of danish, rolls, an egg muffin dish (changes daily), juices, teas, coffee, toast, cereal, fruit, yogurt, miso soup and rice. There is a 24/7 cafe in the lobby for sandwiches, pizza, desserts, but the cost is high. Happy hour at 5:00 p.m.There are many restaurants within a 5 minute walk, Tikis (great taro biscuits), Wolfgang Puck Express, Subway, Coldstone and Starbucks and many many other restaurants down Kalakaua Avenue including Cheeseburger Paradise. Not to mention the ABC stores practically every 10ft. You can buy anything from ice cream to beach mats. This is not a resort hotel, you will have to plan your own activities. Expedia agents are located in the lobby everyday to assist with tours and luaus. Do your homework, have an idea of what you're looking for and the cost before speaking to an agent. Many of the tour companies include transportation such as Discover Hawaii Tours. If you rent a car, you have the option of valet parking $28 per day or self parking across the street at $12 per day. Free Luaus on the beach across from Hyatt Regency on Kalakaua Avenue and at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. There is a hop on/hop off double-decker bus that will take you around the city for a 1 day pass.The hotel staff has info. Great view of Diamond Head and close to farmers markets and swap meets for unique souvenirs. Around the corner from the Honolulu Zoo and near-by the aquarium and golf course. Less than 60 minute drive to the Dole Plantation, Waimea Valley and the North Shore. Pearl Harbor is 20 minutes away. Only 10 minutes from the Ala Moana shopping center. Great Place to stay!

we got the rooms for a quite acceptable pricethe problem, we were located close from the elevators and I heard the machinery (I'm quite sensitive to noises) all the time, a bit annoying.but there were very good points. The 1st was the staff, very friendly and helpful! The swimming pool as well as the location.The breakfast was good but don't expect the real Continental one. The choice was limited.A very good point: we got a courtesy room after check-out for free to take a shower and change our clothes (just before taking our flight) and that's priceless! thanks to the staff for that!

I am a travel agent and was in Waikiki to review hotels. SO glad I chose to stay at the Hyatt place. I found them superior to most of hotels in town including those with much higher ratings. Most of the hotels in Waikiki were built in the 60s and 70s...and they look tired and worn.The Hyatt Place Waikiki is fresh and newly remodeled. It is about 2 blocks walk to the beach. Rooms above the 12th floor on the ocean side do get ocean views. I stayed on the 17th floor city side and yes, there is a good deal of city noise. If you are sensitive then ask for a higher floor.As one contributor mentioned, the Hyatt Place is more of a city hotel. It is NOT a resort with options like room service, a resort style pool for features like a kids club. Out of all the "resorts" in Waikiki there are only 7 that sit directly on the beach. Several of the larger resort style hotels, including the Hyatt Regency sit across the street from Waikiki and also offers a small roof style pool. Most travelers visit Waikiki for some time on the beach and to do sight seeing around the island of Oahu. For this purpose, the Hyatt Place is perfect. Daily breakfast is free here and very good...an egg dish, waffles, french toast, fruit, yogurt, miso soup. Bring along the wooden tray from your room to ease with the buffet. You can also grab bread, peanut butter and jelly for sandwiches for later if you are so inclined. They even had a full selection of my favorite tazo teas. The hyatt place is right next to an ABC store. These are mini marts found all over Waikiki that offer quick food shopping, snacks, soda, water etc. The Hyatt place also has a snack/bar area right in their lobby for a fast meal/drink. You are also steps away from Tiki's (restaurant at the Aston Waikiki Beach with the BEST coconut shrimp I've even had!). There is a wolfgang puck,s fast serve, subway & cold stone Ice cream right there too.The Hyatt Place also offers free WiFi in all their guest rooms. Many of the higher priced hotels charge about $15/day for guest room WiFi. The higher price came with connection problems that I never encountered at the Hyatt.Most of all the STAFF at the Hyatt Place are AWESOME. They show genuine care and concern for the needs of their guests. My flight didn't leave for home until 8pm. when I asked how much it would be for a late check out they graciously extended me to a 3pm check out without any charge. (and they didn't know I was a travel agent!) If you ask for directions, they give you a map, offer suggestions on public transit and even restaurant options without being prompted. Even housekeeping will always stop and greet you with an aloha and a warm smile. I will definitely recommend the Hyatt Place to my clients.

One can never be too sure as to where to stay in Waikiki. There are just so many choices!! But the Hyatt place, is just one street behind the beach.I recommend you ask for a high floor with an ocean view, then you could not be in a better place.Hotel is modern, with good service. Staff are welcoming and polite. As souls expert from a Hyatt.

Hyatt place is the place for you if you want to stay on or close to Waikiki beach and are on a budget.Its location is quite good although its placed a block or two back from the beach so you wont be staying "on the beach" but you are fairly close to it. There is a bit of a walk down to the shops and beachfront but you are saving a fair bit of money when compared to other hotels that are on the water. The rooms are small and fairly dated and the ocean view room is quite misleading. Our ocean view had a tiny sliver of water available....from the balcony....around the corner. So dont expect to wake up to views of the waves crashing onto Waikiki.The pool is very basic and there is a gym on site with some equipment available. Breakfast is nice enough although it is the exact same thing nearly day after day. Wifi is available but unreliable and the only parking available is off site and is at an added cost.That said we were very happy with our location and the cost and the front desk staff were always available to help out or loan us a travel adapter as required! Essentially, if you want to stay at Waikiki beach at a cheaper price than the big ocean front resorts then Hyatt Place will fit the bill for you.

Great hotel with above average complimentary breakfast including steel cut oatmeal. If you really want an Ocean View ask to be above the 12th floor. Rooms are well equipped. Even the valet attendant offered a better parking deal across the street.

I would like to clarify that the Hyatt Place was wonderful, but this is a hotel and not a beach "resort". You have to walk 1.5 blocks to beach and the pool is pitiful. However, if you know this ahead of time and it's OK with you then Hyatt Place is a great hotel. That being said, the hotel is modern, new renovation. Our room was huge but the bartender said half are HUGE and half are TINY so make sure you inquire before booking or upon check-in if you need a large room. That bartender was excellent, friendly and fun to talk with every evening from 5-6pm during happy hour ($5 mai tai can't be beat!). The free breakfast was convenient, lots of options and good quality food. Something for everyone. Valet parking a little high at $28 per night. The hotel is right in the middle of the action of Waikiki beach. Really nice location and I would recommend this hotel if you don't need to be "beachfront".

Stayed here 5 nights with my daughter while house hunting on Oahu. Perfect location for walking to the Hilton Hawaiian Village on one end of Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head, the Zoo and Aquarium on the other end. No need for a car, but if you do bring one, park across the street at the Aston Waikiki Banyon Hotel garage for only $12.00 a day with in and out privileges (half the price of the hotel's valet service). We had the Deluxe City View room with 2 queen beds. It was huge! Had a nice sitting area with an additional pull out bed. Very clean and modern. Beds and pillows were comfy. Nice toiletries (toothpaste, lotion, razor, shampoos,etc). Only downside to the room was the traffic noise. We were on the 4th floor facing Kuhio Ave. which has lots of bus and truck traffic. Almost always too noisy to sit on the lanai and very noisy while trying to sleep. We also had a view of a homeless man who nightly made his bed directly across from our room - not sure if this room qualifies for the 'Deluxe City View' rating....Breakfast was very filling - only had to buy dinner - never needed lunch! Only problem was the birds! Guests need to be told not to leave food unattended or there should be signs warning people of birds attacking food! A better solution would be to net or screen in the 3rd floor outside breakfast area. Staff was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. Overall nice stay.

My family of five stayed here during Spring Break and we had an awesome time. The rooms were large enough to accomodate us. The sofa turned into a bed. We had two queen beds with partial view of the ocean. I say partial only because there were buildings obstructing the view. Bathroom was modern and clean. In-room safe for our valuables. Free breakfast and wi-fi. Breakfast could use a little variety though. Service was pretty efficient. Waikiki beach is a 5-minute walk and close to restaurants and shopping. You have a choice of whatever takes your fancy. Transportation is easy. Ride on the trolleys for a quicker ride to points of interest. The Bus is cheaper $2.50 adults, $1.25 kids but is slower with frequent stops. If you're going sight seeing book a trip at the hotel lobby where they have Expedia local experts who will arrange everything for you. Pearl Harbor tour arranged thru them with the $55 Day Pass takes you to every site. They also arranged a tour of the North Shore and the island with Hawaii Turtle Tours. We had a blast with Eric our guide who showed us around. Plan for a whole day. Fumi's shrimp shack was delicious! Stop by the Old Sugar Mill and taste their Waialua coffee. Secret beaches and snorkeling. Thanks Hyatt Place and Hawaii Turtle Tours for making our vacation a great one.

We booked this hotel because it was newly renovated and that is always a plus when searching for a place to stay for 3 days. This room was spotless and well appointed but was it ever small!There was not an inch to spare in the room or the very narrow balcony. I wish now that I had gone to the management and discussed the difference between the posted photographs and the actual room! Next time.The free WiFi was very nice, the breakfast was quite adequate, the valets were quick in retrieving our car and the proximity to "the stroll" was fine

Found this hotel because my 3 day stay ended up on a bad note with the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Wanted to extend our vacation one more day and did NOT want to go back to the other hotel. Spoke to the front desk and to our surprise its a Great hotel! Walking in to the lobby it smell great! Nice touch! The staff was friendly with the people in front of us for check in and with us too. At check in we were notify we got our room upgraded to Ocean View. Keep in mind this Hotel is block away from the beach. CLEAN! CLEAN! CLEAN! Nice elevators and secure. Complimentary wifi for your stay, access to computer and printer, activity and tour booking center, 2 mini store inside the hotel (no need to walk to the ABC Store), bar and deli open 24/7, clean pool, free warm breakfast and room very clean and modern. Breakfast includes, cereal, breakfast sandwich, French toast, oat meal, 4 kind of slice bread and a toaster, fruits, rice and other kind of food to cater to the oriental crowd, few type of juices, actual plates and utensil, other food I might have fail to mention too. Plenty of seating area in the pool for breakfast! If you like to eat in the room just bring your food tray that's in the room to take the food to your room. The room was quiet and beautiful. The bed were comfortable and AC was good. The bathroom was nice and the look on the sink is so slick! Balcony is small but with chairs and small tables. The flat screen was great and it had Direct TV and there was a lot of options to watch on tv if you need to. Complementary toothpaste! Mini fridge and nice ice bucket. There is complementary Wall Street Journal newspaper at your door. Phones on every elevator waiting area to call front desk. Ice machine is at every other floor if you need ice. Over all I will be looking forward staying here again. The hotel had no extra charges or hidden fees like other hotels (Aston Waikiki Hotel). Staff is amazing and friendly! Smells good everywhere and it's clean. It's a little gem in Waikiki! Can't wait to come back! Props to all staff & management for a great job! No complain... Well actually that I wish I had stay here from the begining!

Our family of 5 stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in march 2013. We selected this hotel based off the positive reviews we read here on tripadvisor. The rooms are large, nicely appointed and very modern. The free breakfast is EXTREMELY helpful and really quite good, well above average. My only negatives are 1. The pigeons at the breakfast area need to be dealt with. As funny as it is to watch the newbies have their food pounced on the second they walk away ... It's annoying to have to be on "watch" your entire meal. 2. The pool area needs some love ... Some plants, decor, something ... It's just concrete. Yes the beach is only a block away, but sometimes it's nice to hang by a hotel pool.Overall I highly recommend staying at this hotel, we have previously stayed at the Prince, Hyatt and Sheraton in Waikiki and this hotel offers the best value overall.

We just got back from staying at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for almost 2 weeks. The hotel was located close to Waikiki beach, but a bit further away from the main hustle and bustle of the Waikiki strip. The hotel was new and modern, and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The complimentary buffet breakfast was one of the best features of the hotel. There was a large variety of hot and cold foods, as well as juices, and Starbucks affiliated coffee and tea. It was convenient for days we wanted to eat at the hotel, or pick up something and take off for the day. Only complaint was for about half the time we were staying there, every time we came back to our hotel after it had been cleaned there was a distinct odor that was not very pleasant. I believe it was the smell of a damp and dirty cloth that had been used to wipe and clean our room. As much as the room looked clean, the smell was very off putting, and we had to open our lanai door and spray as much body spray as we could to try to eliminate the smell. Please make sure house keeping uses clean and non-smelly cloths to clean the rooms. Other than that we loved the hotel and would definitely come back.

We are lifetime Diamond Hyatt members who have stayed at both Hyatt properties. All tolled we've logged in 65 visits to the Hyatt Regency Waikiki and just tried the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach for the first time. The Hyatt Place is a winner in our book. Hospitality is a top priority as are the fantastic staff, great and spacious, newly renovated guest rooms and lovely appointed common areas. No name tags here as employees are encouraged to introduce themselves to guests and interact with them by name. Genuine smiles abound whether the employees think they are being watched or not. No glum faces here. Two books away from the beach, across the street from The Bus stop.Friendly, courteous and quick to respond to guest needs. Hawaiian music fills the air, beautiful tasteful Hawaiian decor, true Hawaiian hospitality at its finest...they way the Hyatt Regency Waikiki once used to be years ago when repeat guests were cherished. Good selection for included breakfasts and happy hour deals. Kudos to General Manager Bonnie Kiyabu who has put together a great crew of employees who exceed all expectations. Hyatt corporate would do well to realize that local Hawaiians are quite capable of managing their properties in Hawaii. A few more locals in the executive offices of Hyatt properties in Hawaii would be a welcome change and frankly is long overdue. Well done Ms. Kiyabu and everybody at he Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. We'll be back or sure.In the meanwhile we'll return to the Hyatt Place and recommend it highly to all.
user_name:
dave and rocky b
encino, california

review_body: In the interest of discloure, we booked this room using points so I can't speak to the price/value compared to other places. But I was so glad we chose this property, it turned out to be a great fit for us. About 2 blocks from the beach it was close to tons of shops & restaurants and was incredibly convenient. And the room was huge! Lots of space, a big bathroom, in-room safe, and a balcony overlooking the ocean which was nice. Partial view since there is a huge building between the hotel and the beach but it was still nice to see water.The staff was excellent, very helpful and attentive. Limited beach amenities (towels only) - chairs would have been nice. Breakfast was very crowded each morning but there was a nice selection of hot & cold items. I was a little surprised that there weren't any "grab and go" options (whole fruit, yogurt cups) especially given the crowds but we made do. We didn't end up going to the bar or making use of the other amenities on the property but everything was nice and updated.All in all, a nice choice. We would definitely stay there again.

Have just enjoyed eight nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki and everything was, as you would expect from this Brand - pretty good. Big TV, comfy bed, WiFi included, bar frig and breakfast daily all in the basic price. My only complaint was the size of the standard Mountain View Room that I had booked. By any measure it was on the small side of a standard hotel room (certainly the one they gave me was) and was not in any way the same as the photo's shown on their own web site. A quick talk to the girls at Reception and we were duly upgraded to a Deluxe room which looked more like the photo of the standard one - anyway, I was now happy.The location is at the southern end of the famous Waikiki strip and a leisurely 5-10 minute walk to numerous restaruants, bars etc.Breakfast can be a bit hectic at peak times and they continually run out of plates, cutlery etc but the staff do a good job topping it up as quick as they can. The Breakfast area is basically outdoors and can be a bit windy - I'm not sure where you go if it rains?I rented a car from the airport and my concern was where to park it. Valet parking was available at the hotel for $28 per night, but as I tend to come and go all the time I am loath to use it. Right cross the street is the Banyan Hotel and you can self park there - I paid $72 for 7 days with unlimited in and outs - a bargain! Where else can you park for basically $10 a day? Would I use the Hyatt Place Waikiki again? - absolutely.

Thank you for making our honeymoon unforgettable .Rooms were clean and spacious.Staff was friendly and accommodating.We have traveled the world and will return back to this little piece of heaven. Breakfast was awesome and they accommodated to all guests ex. Miso soup.We will share our experience with our colleagues.Thank you for keeping up the Hyatt Platinum reputation !!!

Great service. From the minute we walked in we were welcomed. Desk staff escorted us to the elevator and room. Location is central and easy walk to everything. Rooms were clean and updated. Staff was great at storing our luggage pre-cruise departure and arranged a shared cab with a couple we ended up spending the entire cruise with.

The hotel offered all amenities. It was well located in Waikiki - very central and close to the beach. The front desk staff were terrific - very hospitable and informative. The room was large and fully equipped. Breakfast was included on an outdoor patio. We found access to the area a little complicated - not well marked and it was not as tidy as it could be. They need more staff to clean up after quests. Also there was no doorman to assist with taxi etc. Other than that the hotel more met all our requirements.

My husband and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon in December. We stayed for a week and enjoyed every aspect of the trip.The hotel staff was very friendly and we checked in quickly. Our room was spacious and exactly what we booked. We had an ocean view from our balcony. The hotel has recently been renovated and was very clean. The hotel include a Kitchen Skillet which served complimentary breakfast on the pool deck every morning. After a week the menu started to repeat itself, but we did not mind because it was included in the price of the room and was very delicious. (BEST pineapple I have ever eaten!)The location of the hotel was absolutely amazing. It was a 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. There are lots of restaurants in the area that have amazing food. Anything you can possibly need can be found in the ABC stores on every corner. I liked that the hotel was not directly on the beach because there were fewer guest hanging around the lobby and front of the hotel. Also very close to Diamond Head, Zoo, Aquarium, Shopping, and entertainment. We utilized the in house travel assistance to book activities. I think they worked for Expedia. We were able to book a trip for a luau, Pearl Harbor, and get maps of area restaurants and bars. The hotel also gave free wifi. Between the complimentary breakfast and wifi this hotel beat alot of others hands down. Most other area hotels charge for Wifi or breakfast is not included. When traveling that far you want to feel safe and have a clean place to rest your head. This definitely fits the bill!

The Hyatt Place is a very pleasant Waikiki hotel to stay in that feels like a boutique property, although it is fairly large. Plan on extra time for checking in as it took me 20 minutes. I stayed there for business and found it to be very beautiful, trendy and hip in overall decor. The rooms were comfortable/spacious with WI-FI and large desk/bright with sunlight. The in-room decor followed the "island-modern" theme of the public spaces and I loved that there was no yucky bedspread (always take them off as generally hotels infrequently wash them). Bed was extremely comfy. Housekeeping was scrupulous and there was a mini fridge. Complimentary breakfast is served on the roof-top terrace - very nice but crowded so plan accordingly. While the property is not beachfront - Waikiki beach is less than 5 minute walk. I was pleasantly surprised that the room was very quiet in spite of its location. You are minutes walking distance to Kapiolani Park (great place where locals jog, picnic and enjoy concerts/fairs and the zoo) and Kapahulu Avenue where locals shop/dine. As a woman traveling alone for business, I was not too happy about my car parked across the street in another parking garage. While there is valet service, I had to go in and out of the hotel frequently so self-parked for efficiency sake. There is "competition" for parking later at night - so that was a bummer.... not a fan of walking through areas that are not well lit. I would stay at the hotel again.

First I need to start off by saying that all previous trip advisors about this hotel. I had no surprises upon arrival. Our trip ended up consisting of three couples. We were expediently given our rooms and an explanation of hotel layout. All the Gallery Hosts were great. Special shout out to Angeline Nguyen. However we just loved Christopher K, the houseman. He was SUPER helpful in all our needs, from chicken wings to the best bang for your buck in transportation. Yes breakast had little variation each morning but it was good, area was clean and the staff were very helpful, even running the birds away. Happy hour is from 5:00 to 7:00 and is limited to the same $5 drink each night but again, the ABC store is next door so you can make the change to whatever you like. Did not use the concerierge for events as I booked in advance but they were on duty regularly. Lobby is clean and we did our evening countdown socializing there. Free fresh green apples are daily provided in lobby. Yes, on high wind days you can hear it howling through the hotel, once you know what's going on, no big deal. I had my room straightened up daily and received fresh towels. If you put the card on your bed the sheets will be changed, otherwise it will be every 3 days. So put the card on the bed. We stayed in rooms 910 and 816 which were nice views. Room 915 had an ocean view between two buildings, but it was an ocean view. Our stay has been great. We leave today and have to store luggage due to late flight. I will see how that turns out. I would definitely stay again. Oh and best of all. I left my camera at the computer, Christopher willingly started to check the hotel videos to see if they could help. Thankfully it was turned in. Thanks Hyatt Place and to the person that turned in my camera. All my trip was on the camera, it would have ruined my trip,

We stayed here for 8 days and had a great time. The staff were all very good.Happy to help with everything. Two blocks from the beach. Wifi works great. We got a deluxe diamond mountain view, dont know how it could differ from a normal diamond view room. Breaky daily was good. Sadly no straight up bacon and eggs but lots of different egg bacon muffin type things. Fruit selection was a bit plain. Yoghurt was nice. Washing machines and dryers on the third floor next to the gym. Bar staff were very good. Computers and printing on the ground floor with easy access and multiple terminals to use. Beach towels available from front desk.There must be a hospital close by as you could here ambulances go by very often. A bit loud but nothing to stop you staying here. Bus stop down the road is a great help.When we come back we will stay here again. Close to Tikis and Wolfgang Puck express which we visited a few times. They are great.

First off there are no ocean view rooms, they are partial ocean view rooms from two blocks away. See picture and or map and compare with any hotel on the beach near Waikiki or across from Waikiki on Kalakaua Ave.Free Wi-Fi is available and bring your computer because you will need it to get a programming guide for the TV but at a fee.Get the Deluxe room, the standard they first gave us was so small you could not walk around the King sized bed if the luggage was on the floor. Do not plan to stay too long in standard room, they closet space is limited and the dresser provides three drawers, period. No drawers in the night stands. No shelves or drawers near the sink.The lanai is worthless. It is occupied by two chairs facing each other, a table, and the AC compressor. We removed the table to sit in the chair, but couldn’t turn the chair to face away from the building. Twelve days and we never used it again.The pool is 30 feet long and maybe 20 feet wide. It is on the shady side of the building on the third floor. It seems the surrounding buildings create a wind tunnel and is always windy blowing hats, books, and towels into the pool. Total number in the pool was maybe ten during our entire stay.The pool area is also where you eat you free breakfast; outdoors hopefully under an available umbrella, sharing the space with the pigeons. Entertainment for breakfast is to watch the newbies place their food on the table and walk away maybe for a cup of coffee. The pigeons swarm down in mass and leave just the clean plate when the visitor returns. They provide a tray to bring food to you room for when it rains.The bar is on the side of an aisle use to access the two shops and the elevator. Nine stools and high table for a few more on the right side, this is not my favorite layout for drinks. We walked two blocks two beach and frequented very nice second floor bar with music overlooking Waikiki. The beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was good but it doesn’t change much. The exercise area has lots of treadmills and other aerobic machines, TV, and I pod hook ups. They even supply headphones. Good laundry 3 washers and dryers that take credit cards.The best part was the people who work there. Helpful, courteous, promises were kept and promptly executed. On the way out I thanked them for there efficiency and help during the stay. I added I hope corporate is taking care of them.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place tor 9 nights in a king room with ocean views, being club members I think the king bed is part of the arrangement and on check in we were allocated a room on the 12th floor. We arrived at 0900hrs and check in was smooth and did not seem to take too much time, we had requested an early check in when booking. .The room was a nice room, the view from a very petite balcony was of the ocean thru several other high rise and it was nice too. The room was a good size, plenty of storage and a comfortable bed with good clean fresh linen. The bar fridge is empty, this is great as you can actually use it for your own things, there is a coffee maker and daily provisions for two coffees. The bathroom is good with the basin separated from the shower and toilet, although the water pressure from the shower head is dismal it is a very functional space.The breakfast included in the room charge, what can I say that others haven't. ....take your room tray, collect your breakfast and go back to your room! We ate down there once, is was very windy and not an enjoyable experience and we got a good table. The food is one step up from a fast food breakfast, is is very simple and not of the Hyatt standard we have been use to. The space is too small for the amount of clients and is an uncomfortable experience. But once you get your breakfast back up to your room, it is pleasant enough and does the job.The other amenities provided, wi-fi, computer terminals and laundry are all very good. The bar and cafe food offered were also good and all seemed to be enjoyed by all.We found the location to be very good, a short walk to the beach, many restaurants close to hand and just out of the really ritzy bit that there are even some good finds. It is still a very busy area with loads of traffic and people.

Wife, two boys 15 and 11 and myself stayed for 6 nights. Staff was outstanding and welcoming. Rooms were clean and spacious, staff went beyond to make stay comfortable. My son broke his phone charger and a desk clerk lent him his own charger for the week...great breakfast..3 min walk to beach and clean towls everyday. Terrance, Annabelle and Christina went above and beyond..Mahalo from Buffalo, N.Y.

We spent for 4 nights at Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Our room was #1216 mountain view on 12th floor that was very nice. Though was a bit cramped, clean, quiet at night, comfortable bed and had a nice view of mountains.A few blocks from Waikiki beach and the bus and trolley stop are right out of hotel. We had a walk to kaimana beach; it was less than 10 minutes. Complimentary breakfast was ok, Wi-Fi was included in the price. Laundry facilities were on 4th floor in Pali tower.All staff were quite helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel if you stay northeast side of Waikiki.

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here in January 2013! We thought the location was excellent on the Diamond Head/Zoo side of Waikiki with a short and lovely walk to the beach. Across the street is the Marriott with the Kai Sallas Pro Surf School (also highly recommended) and cheap(er) parking is available at the Banyan (very short walk to the hotel entrance).Breakfast was great every morning... I recommend grabbing the tray from your room and bringing the food back to avoid the crowded tables! All the staff were very kind and professional during our stay and we would definitely consider staying here again.

We stayed 10 nights with our 19 & 22 year old. The Hyatt Place is well located for beach, Waikiki shops, restuarants, trolley and the bus. I did become the Ugly Australian when told our booked rooms were not available for a couple of days but the staff were very professional and sorted it to the best of their ability and no- one can asked more than that. We ended up with one room on level 17 and the other on the pent house level. This was fine for us. The view from level 17 was actually framed in the bathroom mirror which was a nice effect.The rooms were very spacious - with plenty of space for all those shopping bags! It's noisy to leave the door open but that's Waikiki generally - sirens all day and night. All staff were really friendly and helpful - nothing was a problem. Breakfast was included which was an added bonus but it is on the sugary side. Plain cheerios would make a good cereal option.The deck is very windy and the birds will steal your food if you leave it unattended so it was certainly entertaining each morning.The lifts are very slow at peak times so do allow for this is you are being picked up at a certain time but we were there for a holiday so what's a few minutes longer.Wi fi was a good feature for the younger members of our family. We have all decided we would definitely stay here again

We purchased a room here along with two other couples. An additional friend of ours decided to join us, but couldn't afford to pay for their own room. They upgraded one couple to a suite with no additional charge. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Staff was super friendly. Continental breakfast was a major plus. We were traveling in a group of about 30, and other friends stayed at different hotels. We were the only ones to have breakfast included! Location was great for wandering, and availability to get off the strip. Zoo is close. Rooms have a lanai, and a drying line in the shower. Only downfall was the wind howling around the building. It was pretty loud and periodically woke us up on our last night. Bed and shower were more than satisfactory.

The minute we arrived we felt welcome and comfortable. The Hotel front staff were extremely nice to meet. The one staff member (Ean) in particular at the time of my arrival was a delight. He and his fellow employees were very helpful and made us feel very welcome (honest). The room my wife and I had was excellent , the bed was comfortable and had everything that you would want and expect. They offer a nice buffet breakfast every morning and the staff preparing and displaying , cleaning were inviting and friendly. We stayed for 2 weeks and they (staffers) greeted us with kindness every single day. I have travelled several times over the years to Paris , Mexico , Maui to name a few and I found this hotel offered the best stay my wife and I have ever had. If you ever travel to Honolulu I highly recommend this hotel !

Visiting Hawaii for a week and wanted to have more $$$s for shopping v a 5 star hotel. Hyatt Place was a great compromise! Located a few minutes walk from the beach front, moments from the Zoo and within walking distance of shops etc., we were pleased with the location. Rooms were clean and a very good size. We were on the 14th floor with partial ocean view...leaving the door open at night for fresh air proved noisy so wonder what being on the main road in another hotel would be? Only "ordinary" bit for us (20 and 50 mother/daughter) was the breakfast area. Located on the 3rd floor, beside a smallish but neat pool, it was incredibly windy and exposed (nice on a warm day). Think the hotel could add some wind breaks and definitely plants etc., there to make the ambience better. Staff super friendly and all-in-all very happy with the outcome (20 yo loved the free wi-fi for staying in touch with Australian friends). Thanks Hyatt Place! PS: Expedia travel agents to assist with excursions etc., located on the ground floor and also very helpful. The hotel peaks to 3.5 stars and I'd give it 7/10 for a non-5-star-not-on-the-beach hotel.

Beautiful room with great view of the surrounding mountains. A few blocks from Waikiki Beach.Staff was extremely friendly. Front desk staff gave us a personal tour of the ground floor (lobby) upon our arrival. Would definitely stay there again. Just off te beach enough for a quite relaxing and wonderful experience.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for 5 nights Jan 31 - Feb 6, 2013 and here is my review.Hotel - Spacious, clean, hallways are newly carpeted, fresh and open, 3 elevators so waiting time is minimal, has convenient 4 internet computers and printer in lobby, a small pool, but the best part is the free hot breakfasts in the morning.Room - We stayed in a 2x queen city-view room which has a mini-fridge 2 queen-sized beds with excellent soft down pillows and good mattress. Does not come with a tub but has a very large glass shower that is convenient to shower the kids after a day at the beach. There is an in-room safe to keep valuables. Very clean room and quiet. Our friends had an Ocean view room which have a full tub and separate room with t.v.Breakfast - Serves 2 stations of egg/ham muffin sandwich (type of bun and cheese change every day, waffle, pancake, french toast (changes every day - one of the 3), fruit salad only has pineapple and cantaloupe, pastries, yogurt, toast, miso soup, cereal, toast, bagels, apple, orange juice and milk, and other assorted breakfast items. It is located on the 3rd floor by the pool but is very windy. The best place to sit is undercover near the buffet or along the side wall of the building on the right. Beware the pigeons and birds are everywhere as they lurk around the tables or swoop down and each the food on the tables if left unattended.Location - It is only 1 block away from Waikiki beach, is very quiet, clean and staff are very friendly and helpful. About a 15 minute walk to International Marketplace. Safeway is only 10 minutes away, costs $2.50 for Bus #13 to get there. (keep the transfer so you can ride back to the hotel free). There is an ABC store every block to buy food or souvenirs but is expensive. Starbucks is just a block away as well. McDonalds is 3 blocks away along the beach. Very close to the zoo as well.Hotel arranges taxis 10 minutes before your departure to the airport for a flat fee of $29.00I would definitely recommend this hotel because of location, free hot breakfast, excellent beds and pillows, quiet, and 1 block from the beach and buses.

Every aspect of the hotel seemed new and cool. The elevators were slow and the breakfast was cookie cutter buffet. The room and lobby were very modern and well thought out. We very much enjoyed our stay here at the Hyatt Waikiki. It's not far from the beach (although I recommend walking further west the beach directly in front is a bit brackish). The zoo and tons of restaurants are near by.

Room is clean. Location is perfect. Bed is comfortable. Breakfast is OK. The only downside is no complimentary parking, it's $28 per day. Very modern and the staff are very welcoming. Love the aroma as soon as you exit the elevators. Walking distance to convenience store, coffee shops, Subway sandwiches, McDonalds and yogurt shops. Bus stop is walking distance, less than a block. Waikiki Beach is a 2-minute walk and Honolulu Zoo is one block away. Will definitely stay here again, just have to look for parking on Paokalani / Ala Wai Blvd.

I was looking for a nice hotel at a reasonable price in Waikiki and decided to give the Hyatt Place a try, and I'm glad I did.The hotel has obviously recently undergone a remodel, with the public areas being very clean and modern in styling. Check-in went very quickly and my room preferences were honored resulting in a nice high floor room with an ocean/beach view.One of the best things about this hotel, especially given the area, was its complementary breakfast each morning. The breakfast offering varied somewhat each day, with the hot offering typically being an egg sandwich of some type, usually on a English Muffin. The usual breakfast offerings of bagels, breads to make toast and cereals were also provided, along with juices and milk. Somewhat uniquely (perhaps not for Hawaii) they also offered rice and kimchi each morning. It was never difficult to find a seat, tables were bussed very quickly and in general it was a very pleasant experience.The room itself was perhaps a bit cramped, but the beds were comfortable with good climate controls, a flat screen HDTV with HD channels and a refrigerator for cooling your own beverages and snacks. The bathroom was lovely, but the shower was severely lacking in water delivery and pressure (do "water saving" shower heads actually save water when it takes you three times as long to shower because it takes five minutes just to rinse the shampoo out of your hair?)All in all, the hotel's location (two blocks from the beach, and one from one of Waikiki's ubiquitous ABC convenience stores, and about ten minutes' walk from the heart of the Kalakaua Avenue retail strip or the Honolulu Zoo), comfort and value make me confident that I'll return; why pay an extra $200 per night just to be on the beach?My one piece of advice is to avoid the hotel's rather pricy ($28/day with in/out privileges) valet parking and self-park at the Waikiki Banyan hotel garage located diagonally across the street to the north for only $12/day with full in-out privileges.

This is the perfect hotel to stay at in Waikiki. The location is excellent, with less than a 3 minute to walk to the beach yet just far enough from the busy hustle of Waikiki. The hotel is not too big and not too small. All the staff are friendly, attentive, and helpful. The room was spotless and comfortable. I can see how some may get bored with the daily breakfast, but it still beats having to pay the big bucks for a breakfast somewhere else that probably wouldn't be as good. As for the noise factor--I am very sensitive to noise, and I know it's difficult to avoid noise if you want to stay in bustling Waikiki. At this property, the everyday city noise was noticeable but not disruptive. At night it would quiet down, and the streets next to the hotel are much quieter than the main streets going through Waikiki. TA reviewers have also been commenting on the "wind tunnel" effect that occurs throughout the halls of the hotel and then passes under the door to the room. It's a simple fix to lay a towel down along the door and you will not hear the wind at all. It was a great place to come back to after a long day at the beach. I would absolutely stay here again.

We only stayed here one night but enjoyed it. The location is great...a block from Waikiki. The staff is warm and friendly...especially the front desk and valet guys--they sent us in the right direction every time! Rarely do we feel at home so quickly, but we did...and we only stayed one night. We arrived early, and they had our room all ready for us weary travelers. We found a good, relatively inexpensive place for dinner...you can walk to restaurants, shops, fast food, etc. Yes, the rooms are small but still very comfortable. We were on the top floor and had a nice view of the corner of Diamondhead...and the rooftops of other hotels/condos. For the price, we were impressed. The hot breakfast was appreciated...especially in such an expensive city like Honolulu. I told my teenagers to eat up because that was the only free meal we had in our 2-week stay!I would highly recommend for a short stay. We moved to a larger hotel directly on the beach for the rest of our Honolulu stay, but we fondly remember the Hyatt Place.

Great breakfast included, Comfortable beds, Small pool, Near zoo, Friendly staffIn walking distance of the main attractions located in the Waikiki downtown areaVery impressive breakfast including pancakes and great coffeeAll in all a very good hotel!
user_name:
Bluelabelmalt
New York City, New York

review_body: Recently stayed two nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach and was generally pleased with the experience. The hotel is a great option for those who want to save a few bucks on a room and don't mind not being right on the beach. The property is about two blocks from Waikiki beach and less than a half mile from the busy Waikiki shopping district. The hotel offers free WiFi throughout the hotel and a great complimentary outdoor breakfast buffet in a beautiful outdoor setting. The pool is small as others have noted...not much larger than a backyard swimming pool to be honest. There is an exercise room that's accessible 24/7, though we didn't use it so no comment. Self-parking is available in a garage across the street for $12/day with in/out privileges (first come, first serve) or $28/day for valet. The only reason for 4-stars instead of 5 was the view. We bought a standard city-view room and were on a low floor; our view was basically into the apartment building next door, and not a very nice one at that. Outdoor noise was also easily heard at night.Overall, enjoyed the stay, would recommend and stay again.

Honestly we did not spend too much time at the hotel, besides that the room was recently renovated and spacious, and the great complimentary breakfast there are really not too many activities available in the hotel. The property is conveniently located in Waikiki, beach is only (2) blocks. Would come back.

Stayed here for 13 days in January. Really liked this hotel,very modern and clean and though the oceanview room is quite small, we still did not feel cramped. Nice lanai to sit out and enjoy the sunsets. Staff at the hotel very friendly and helpful. Only negative is the small pool, which does not get much sun, but who needs a pool when the beach is only 2 blocks away. Good breakfast but after the same things every day would have been nice for something different. Definitely recommend this hotel for good value and location.

Our family of four stayed at the Hyatt Place before and after our cruise and we really loved our stay! We would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was always so kind and helpful with everything from extra coffee for our room, beach towels each day, extra blankets, plus storing our luggage for us before we got on our cruise and until we had to leave for the airport. The beds were amazingly comfortable! The deluxe partial ocean view room that we had was so clean and roomy, loved the view as well. The breakfast was real good, Starbucks coffee an added bonus! This hotel was the perfect choice and our teenagers really liked it as well.

Stayed here for 5 nights in January. We got a room in the newer tower - room was kinda small but the balcony was larger than the ones in the tower across from us. TV was nice but who comes to Hawaii to watch TV?! Breakfast was free and hot - no complaints here! Big fan of the kimchi and rice. They also have coffee and tea service in the lobby every morning. Location was also really good - only two blocks from the beach and a short walk to the center of Waikiki. Oh and props to the beds - may be the best I've slept on.Would give 5 stars but on our first day we asked for extra hangers and never got them. And one day housekeeping took all our towels without replacing them! What up with that?!But overall, great value and a really good stay.

We spent three nights in an ocean King deluxe room. Nice room size. Very clean and friendly staff. But but....the noise from the street is loud with buses and trucks. We were on the 14th floor. So if you are not bothered by noise this is a nice place. Traffic noise is ok if it only were with the window ajar. But the doors to the balcony does notning for the noise.

Stayed for 5 nights, the hotel has a very convenient location for the price I paid. I will happily pay $50 less per night for additional 1 block (about 2-3 minute walk). Breakfast is decent but gets old after couple days. I would stay again as affordable alternative option

Stayed for 6 nights. 1 block to beach, ABC stores close by. Best yet, across the street from Waikiki banyan parking garage which was only $12 per day with in out privledges. Hotel was a great value clean and updated.

Top 3 Benefits of the Hyatt Place:1. Location to Waikiki Beach2. Free, hot breakfast3. Comfortable, clean roomsWe stayed at the Waikiki Hyatt Place from Jan. 12-16, 2013 and genuinely enjoyed our stay. The staff was wonderful - very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions for places to eat. We arrived about an hour before check-in, and since our room wasn't ready, the staff upgraded us to a corner room with a view of the beach for free! The rooms are smaller than the standard mainland hotels, but they were perfectly cozy and comfortable nonetheless. The bed - my god, the bed - was incredibly comfortable. I sank right in and slept like a baby every night. Our lanai was the perfect place to enjoy our daily hot breakfast (a rotating selection of breakfast sandwiches, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, french toast/waffles, cereal, miso soup, and coffee/tea) and watch the sun rise (and then set). Though, be warned: Waikiki is incredibly dense, and you'll be able to see into other hotel/apartment rooms (which means they can see you, too). If you see a naked old man like I did, it's your fault - I warned you. The pool is a bit on the small side (and not heated), but who cares when you're a 2-block, 5 min. walk to the beach? The bar does a nightly happy hour (Mai Tai's while we were there), but the prices were a bit confusing. The signs in the elevators advertise the drinks as $5.00, but the bartender charged us $5.50. There are TONS of other happy hour options within walking distance though, so check one of those out instead. We'd definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends and family. Last word of advice: Waikiki Beach is massively busy. If you rent a car, be adventurous and drive up to Kailua Beach. Not only is it MUCH quieter, but it's far more scenic and the drive up is INCREDIBLE. Tons of beaches and scenic lookout points along the way.

I stayed here as the price was right. My king bed room was small but efficient. The bed was too soft for our preference . The direct ocean was great. The breakfast was included in the price which was a deal. The host stand opened the bottles of wine we brought and cut our pineapple. I would suggest bringing ear plugs and down loading a white notice app on your phone to play at night as all of Wikiki is noisy. I would suggest that the management add a way guests can clean the exercise equipment as it is flu season! Also the housekeeping services are below average. Our housekeeper did not wipe down the sink and counter top on two occasions, she left dirty glassware in the room and never replaced the bed throw nor emptied out the ice container. I usually leave house keeping a tip but not this time.This is my first stay at a Hyatt Place. I would stay again knowing that it is not a resort but a nice safe place to stay at a reasonable price.

The Hyatt Place Waikiki Place is one of the more reasonably priced hotels and for what we paid, it was very good. The room itself (we got the deluxe room) was spacious with a nice seating area, nicely decorated with modern amenities. The vanity area is separate from the actual bath and toilet itself which was convenient allowing one of us to brush our teeth or to get ready while the other can use the washroom. Very limited counter space though. The bad: there's a lot of noise from the street. I believe our room faced a firestation near by and some bus stops so we could hear the sirens and the bus coming and going at night, even up on the 19th floor. Upon check-in, there was only 2 staff working and unfortunately for us a large tour group had just pulled in and the wait time for assistance was quite lengthy. This is a very busy (not to mention large) hotel and could use more elevators as the wait time for the only 2 elevators took forever. Parking in Waikiki is generally very expensive but we did park across the street in a parkade for $12/day which is much better than the $25/day valet offered at the hotel. The wifi was included with the room rate and pretty reliable, and the included breakfast was convenient, and decent, including a few hot items including hot breakfast sandwiches. Not fantastic, but good for a morning snack. Given the abundance of good eats on the Waikiki strip, we went out for breakfast more often than not. All in all a pleasant stay, would come back to stay for sure, assuming they don't drastically jack up their prices once they'be been around for a bit longer.

We got a really good deal for this place. The location was off the main strip but not too far from the shops and beach. Everything was walking distance from this hotel including all bus transportation. The staff was great & friendly. Breakfast was included everyday but it was the same breakfast every other day. We stayed for a week & by the 5th day, I was getting sick of it...I can only eat breakfast sandwich, french toast & waffles for so long but overall, I can't complain because it was free. Valet parking only, $28/day. If you didn't have a car, public transportation stops near their neighboring hotel (Aston Hotel)...the Hop On, Hop Off bus, Shuttles, Roberts Hawaii, etc stops at Aston Hotel which is approximately 500 feet or one block away from Hyatt.

The good: Close to beach, buss restaurants, shopping. Breakfast included in the price. Clean rooms. Nice staff and helping. The bad: Noise from the street is terrible in the morning  Same food for breakfast(frozen fruits and no meat)

Hyatt Place Waikiki was such a wonderfully inviting hotel. The open air lobby is beautiful- and our room was so spacious and clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is great- very close to the beach and some shops. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and informative. The hotel has a great business center with computers and printers ready for your use so that printing out boarding passes or whatever else you need is very easy. The breakfast they offer was absolutely wonderful. Lots of fresh fruit, warm breakfast sandwiches, and pastries as well as yogurt and cottage cheese. One of my favorite offerings was the kim chee and white rice with soy sauce. Not what you see on typical breakfast buffets- but very warm and comforting to try in the morning. Do not hesitate to stay here!
user_name:
wanderlustfamily17
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Once again, the Hyatt name did not disappoint. We stayed for one week in January 2013. We had an ocean view king room on the 12th floor. The room was great. We had a large balcony with two chairs and a little table. The bed was really comfortable, which, anyone who travels will know that the comfort of a bed can make or break a vacation. The room also had a large screen tv, and a comfortable couch. A full Breakfast was included in the price of the room. The food was excellent. If you don't mind the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, then I highly recommend this hotel.

Great location, and while the rooms are small and the pool is smaller, the ambiance of the hotel makes up for it. The breakfast is ok but if you happen to have a windy day, not the best location. I had a late flight out so the front desk accommodated me with the use of one of their rooms for 1/2 hour to freshen up before my flight. Nice touch at no cost. Definetly a return for me!!

Firstly I'd like to say that this is a genuine review. All too often I find reviews which vary so widely and are written such that it leads to believe the hotel staff wrote the review. I am member of the American Armed Forces with over 22 years active duty. I decided to visit Waikiki, Hawaii during my holiday leave period.Now onto my review. There is really only a few key things that make a hotel great. The first two are fairly straight forward and they are facility and location. The Hyatt Place Waikiki Hotel has both of those and then some. Only a short 2 - 4 minute walk to the waters edge of Waikiki beach location is about as good as it gets. The ocean view rooms have a near unobstructed view of the ocean. As for the facility, this is where I was very impressed. The rooms were modern and well stocked. Refrigerator, large 42" LED HD television equipped with what appears to be a new version of LodgeNet. I have never seen or used LodgeNet before but I am sold on it. New movies and a large selection of SatTV stations including three ESPN channels, CNN, FOX and many more well known stations. This system made the evenings I decided to stay in very pleasant. The rest of the room was stocked with what one would expect... coffee maker, complementary water, coffee mugs, tea ect. The only shortfall, and it is a very MINOR one is that that is almost not worth mentioning... there is no microwave in the room. There was an instance where I wanted to reheat a sandwich I purchased from a local steak and cheese shop, ended up eating it cold (Matters not because it was still delicious) The lobby was very nicely furnished with plenty of seating, and a café which was open 24/7. All menu items were available at any time day or night. Not to mention the food was pretty darn good. Also in the hotel lobby was a small bar if anyone wanted a nightcap or even a cold beer during the day. The one and very minor shortfall here is that it was not a fully stocked bar. So only basic mixed drinks and domestic beers were available. I am not much of a drinker so definitely no negative points here from me, just letting anyone who reads this how things are. The pool was small(ish) and pretty basic but there is plenty of sunbathing space and lounging chairs. Near the pool area is where the complementary breakfast is served (continental breakfast is available in the hotel lobby) Omelets, breakfast biscuits (which were amazing!), cerials, coffee, fresh fruits and all the trimmings... excellent breakfast I must say.Lastly the staff. Here is where most hotels in my opinion fall short. The staff here take their job seriously. Their upbeat attitudes, big welcoming smiles and eager to provide the best service I've seen at any hotel. Everyone from the first moment I set foot on the property, has been top notch. I would go into details to explain how they have made my stay so fantastic but the list would just go on and on. The entire staff at this hotel starting at the graveyard shift reception desk, to the maids who do a fantastic job keeping the rooms in order and stocked, to the cooks and hotel manager. Every single staff member I encountered seemed genuinely happy to be working at this hotel and it showed in their service.I mentioned I am a 22 year United States Military service member. Good people working for any organization is never as simple as "Finding" good people. A great staff is a product of great leadership and a great environment fostered by the hotel leadership. Although I was not able to meet and congratulate the hotel management for doing such a fantastic job I only hope they are able to see this message and receive my gratitude. You've made a loyal customer out of me. Keep up the great work!

This hotel offers the tourist everything they could need: clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, free wifi & free breakfast. Breakfast is great - not just standard continental items, but also things like cheese and ham toasties. They have a small pool, but most guests are down at the beach (borrow a towel for free from reception desk), which is just a block away Ask for a room with ocean views. We were on level 11 and faced the ocean, which was nice (but would be better if two beachfront hotels weren't in the way!).Walk to shopping, restaurants. Drink at Tiki bar, which is on the corner closest to beach, and if you have time and energy, I recommend doing the mountain walk to Diamond Head mountain - an old volcano with walking trail. 3 mile walk from hotel, so a 2 hour round trip. Views are worthwhile, I promise. Wifi quality in hotel is excellent. They also allowed us to check in early (at 10am), which after a 10 hour flight, we were very grateful for! Hotel also has concierge desk, with friendly guys who can help plan your activities. It's cheaper to book them from Hawaii (as opposed to through your travel agent at home), so I recommend leaving it to the guys here.

POOR DESIGN CONSTRUCTION: On the main floor, the hotel has areas open to the outside from the lobby floor through the hallways which, in windy conditions common to the rainy season, creates a wind tunnel. In my 2nd floor room, this created an unreal and bizarre amount of noise, varying from a low loud moan to a high-pitched scream that completely drowned out music and the television, even set to a high volume. As a heavy sleeper that rarely has difficulty resting, I could barely sleep. What little sleep brought unpleasant dreams incorporating the noise. Finally, early in the morning, I inquired at the front desk and was THEN told to put a towel at the base of the door. This did indeed reduce the wind vacuuming into the room, cutting out about 90% of the noise. Sadly, this came too late to be any help for me when I left exhausted for 2 days of flights. This seemed to be a common complaint (based on how the front desk responded to me) so why hasn't the hotel put in some kind of door seal or at the least advise guests beforehand?Otherwise, the hotel was decent, clean, with nicely appointed rooms, typical comfortable Hyatt beds, and polite staff.

I stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki for the New Year night. I was glad to be able to use my Hyatt points instead of paying the $430 per night rate, what would have been outrageous - even for Waikiki.The hotel was recently renovated. Rooms had all the expected amenities and were comfortable and well appointed. The breakfast was great, but closing the buffet at 9.30 am sharp was unusual for a hotel in a resort town and on a New Years holiday.Also make sure to take a tray from your room. No trays were provided at the breakfast buffet.The staff was friendly and went out of their way to assist.The pool was small but still larger than the pool at the more expensive and lot larger Hyatt Regency.The gym was basic, but clean.The location of the hotel is central and everything in Waikiki, including the main part of Waikiki Beach is only steps away .

Just spent 6 night over the christmas period at Hyatt Place. Family of four, in a clean room with two queen beds and lots of space, a desk and lounge sitting area, 42 in HD tv, with all the best channels. Lots of plugs to to charge cameras, cell phones, laptops. Clean bathroom with shower and super-quite flush toilet. The room comes with a large safe, big enough for a laptop bag. Free wifi throughout the hotel. The breakfast was excellent everyday, with lots of healthy food options. Enjoyed coming back to the hotel after the day's actvities. I would stay here again.

Overall it as an excellent stay... Our mountain view room had everything we needed and requested, large shower, huge comfortable bed and free wifi that worked well. Breakfast was perfectly edible and more than sufficient. Yes, it gets busy but we never missed out on a table and enjoyed our food every day. We were there for a wedding and had groups of friends staying in many different hotels. We were the only ones to get wifi, breakfast, balcony and great service so we chose well and we all paid similar prices. Every hotel we visited had a small swimming pool but in saying that, no one was ever using them either. Nothing to complain about at the Hyatt Place, they did a great job! Thanks!

We hail from Melbourne, Australia. Spending 2 weeks in Oahu, thought we'd experience 3 different hotels. After much research, we decided to give Hyatt Place a go. It was a really good decision.We were in the Diamond Towers, which has ocean views, 12th flr, with 2 queen beds. As we have a 16yr old daughter, the 2 queen beds were a neccesity for us, so everyone can relax on the bed after a long day tour.The bedroom is partitioned by a huge LCD TV/cabinet and you can turn the TV the other way round facing the other side, which is the lounge area. Lounge has a 3-seater sofa and single seater, with a computer table. Lots of storage space/cabinets. Free coffee/tea, however, mineral water is $3 per bottle. The shower space is adequate for a single person, however, the water flow is quite slow. Towels were really clean and sparkling white, which is very important for me, as I gauge the star of the hotel by the standard of the towels, and being a seasoned traveller all over the world, this is normally quite accurate.The other preference is perhaps they should separate the toilet from the shower, as the other family member cant use the toilet if someone else is showering.The sink space could be larger as well. Only valet parking available, $25per day. The pizza from room service, esp. Vegetarian & BBQ Chicken is the Best we have ever tasted! Must try!
