As my teenager was too tired, she fell asleep as soon as we checked in, after a long flight, and upon waking after 8hrs later, the BBQ Chicken was still delicious, without the need to warm it.Every staff in the Hotel very friendly, breakfast and free wifi also included! What else do you want in a regular hotel! Definitely worth what we paid for.

We spent four nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki this autumn. Terrific value. The rooms have a sitting area and tiny decks (facing decks on other hotels). The breakfast is just fine. The beach is nearby as are a number of nice restaurants. If you are looking for a reasonably priced, family-friendly hotel in Waikiki this is a good option.

Staying here with my wife and 13 & 15 year old kids. Two queen beds are very comfortable. Rooms are clean. Elevators are slow as everyone else says but if you're on floors 5 or lower the stairs are easy. The two big pluses for this place are its excellent breakfast and well equipped fitness room (5 ellipticals and 4 treadmills and free weights). The breakfast is like having endless free egg mcmuffins from mcd's everyday. The food area is windy but it is 73+F so I'm not complaining. We actually used the super-clean laundry room too, which was a nice surprise. Oh, and the hotel staff seem very friendly. Always quick to hand out beach towels for the day. I have no major complaints at all. Well, maybe the street noise is a little loud when we're still adjusting to the time zone but then again we are staying in a city so that can/should be expected.

We traveled to Oahu in June 2012. This hotel had just completed renovation in April so we were able to secure a very attractive rate for our room. We were very impressed with the staff and renovations throughout the hotel and our room. The room, although small was warm and inviting (you'll go home wishing your bedroom had a bed as comfortable The Hyatt Place.) The view wasn't great but we didn't pay for that so no love lost there. The free full breakfast was great... and did I say free? That's worth at least 20 dollars a day for two people in Oahu, can't beat that. However, the location of the breakfast area on the 3rd floor left a little to be desired. It was always very windy and therefore usually a mess during breakfast with juice and food scattered throughout which the wind blew while people were eating. Not unbearable. The location was good, very close to the Waikiki Beach, Kapiolani Park and Waikiki Zoo. There is also a public parking garage right on the corner opposite of the hotel where you can park for 10 dollars a day. 60 per week. This was awesome considering that parking is generally 20+ dollars a day in most parts of Waikiki. Overall, this hotel is a great value in a good location with convenient access to cheap parking. You'll be more than satisfied with your stay if you don't expect 5 star accommodations for 3.5 star pricing. We will happily stay at The Hyatt Place during our next trip to Waikiki.

ok the rooms and the bed were awesome, and the hotel staff are friendly and courteous. the problem we had here is the front desk workers. first off, they dont have a 'little maze' like the rest of the hotel check in's do, so its NOT first come, first serve. my husband being a local, complained to the mananger, when that didnt work, he complained to corporate, well they gave us a $50 dollar credit, that we could spend on whatever at the hotel-thanks for that. they had a promotion, that gave a free-continental breakfast, not bad food, the only down part is that its located on the 3rd floor and windy as hell. oh the elevators are a little weird, you have to use your room keys to access the floors, btw, the elevators will they're freak out moments and ultimately skip your floors.

My husband and I went back to Oahu for our first wedding anniversary and we really enjoyed this hotel. it was a very nice place! we paid for a standard city view room and we were upgraded to a ocean view after requesting a high floor. Breakfast was very decent and we were able to take it back to our room since its free BK. We stayed there for 7 days and each time there were different sandwiches and pastries. very yummy. Room was clean and neat. A couple of times we were left with no towels or tooth paste and shampoo so we had to call front desk which is not a big deal, they got to the room extremely fast. restaurants and shops are walking distance. only one block away from the beach.the hotel is newly renovated and they decor is pretty modern.the cool thing aboutthe pool is that it was from salt water and not chlorine. We had a very late flight after cheking out, so we asked if the hotel ha a guest room for us to refresh before catching our flight but they didnt so we couldnt enjoy the beach on our very last day, but they did keep our bags.overall, I would stay again

We were passing through Honolulu to and from a cruise and needed a place to overnight both directions, so we stayed here twice. Since this was not the ultimate destination, we did not need beach access or the other amenities you might look for on a longer stay. The Hyatt Place was very nice. It apparently was recently purchased by Hyatt and renovated. The hotel itself is old, as are many hotels in Waikiki. But it was fresh, clean and pretty well organized. They were having a post-renovation promotion (~$180), and we selected it based on this and Tripadvisor reviews. The breakfast was included and was good. There were a few hot items, but mostly fruits, pastries, cereals, and juices. Everything that we had was good. The hotel is about two blocks from the main drag along Waikiki beach and is walking distance to many attractions. The front desk staff was helpful, as was the tour desk. If the same promotional price were offered, I would stay here again.

This was my first time staying in the newly renovated Diamond Tower and, as expected, everything was great! Nice, clean room - modern and trendy. In-room wireless Internet is flawless with strong signal; I was staying on the 9th floor. This property is a 3-minute walk from Waikiki Beach. Staff is exceptional -- always outgoing, friendly and professional. Big props to Jarren, Annabelle and Lynn for exceptional customer service. Lone negative from this stay: the 16-ounce bottles of water in the room each carry a $3.50 price tag - way overpriced. Instead, buy bottles of water at any of the ABC Stores, where they are five-times as big and only 99 cents. Other positives of this property: the complimentary breakfast which offers much more than just an old muffin, and the bar. Great value, great property -- will be back and definitely recommend this hotel.

My husband and I just got back from celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary in Oahu. We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. The newly remodeled hotel was beautiful. Our room was perfect. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. Great location. Breakfast was also an added bonus. We will definitely recommend to others and stay there again in the future.

Nice hotel. My room was clean and comfortable, even with a sofa area. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was great, one block from the beach. Be advised that it is near the zoo and on the far end of the waikiki strip, but that didn't bother me. The Wolfgang Puck Express is right next door, with tasty and inexpensive food. Great value for the money.

Let me first preface with saying that I HATE staying in Wakiki. Took this trip to get my mileage for the year and had some hyatt points to burn so ended up staying at this hotel. It's actually in a really good spot (if you like wakiki) towards the end of the stip and right next to the honolulu zoo. Rooms were great...very good size, comfortable, clean and most importantly to me had a good selection of television channels :)Parking (as is everywhere in wakiki) is kind of a pain but not intolerable. Very reasonable parking garage just across the street for 12 bucks a day in and out as much as you like. Valet at hotel was 25 a day so I only used it for my last day to avoid lugging (no pun intended) my luggage to the car.I only had two negatives to bring up and both are mostly minor. First, the hotel elevators are insaneeeeeely slow. Spent a good amount of time waiting for an elevator. I was on the 10th but it might as well been 100th for the time I spent waiting. Secondly and a little more to be concerned about is the shower sliding glasses. My first day there I almost broke my fingers due to the way the handles operate. I mentioned it to the staff but thought you should be aware of it.Overall though, great place to stay if you're in the wakiki area. Oh...and they offer a free hot breakfast which helps cut the costs of eating downtown....that alone for a family is worth $50 or more a day.....

The attentive quality of the staff, the sophisticated modern decor of the room and its huge HDTV, the terrific bar menu available 24 hours, the bus stop a few yards away, the Fitness room with plenty of very good equipment, the calm organization, the good complimentary breakfast, the $5 mai tai's at Happy Hour, the free wi-fi throughout plus the free-access computers and printer in the lobby, and the free lei-making class all added up to a great stay and a really well-run hotel. And it's only a block from the beach and a block from the zoo.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to our Hawaii Cruise on NCL. Great value as you get free hot breakfast which was usually one item that was featured for the day-ex: biscuit breakfast sandwich and pancakes the next. Nice assortment of fresh fruit, cereals, toast etc. Did I mention it was FREE-so can't complain about it. The room also came with free WIFI. It was a couple blocks away from the beach but that was fine with us. The room was updated and clean which is very important to me. The staff were very friendly. We were able to leave our luggage with them as our cruise wasn't till later that evening. We decided we wanted to hang at the beach a little longer! We were on the 4th floor and did not find it too noisy. We're heavy sleepers anyways.

we stayed at this hotel for one night in Dec. 2012. Pros:The hotel is 2-3 blocks away from the Waikiki beach, which you can take a stroll over and enjoy swimming in the protected area in Waikiki beach. Great for families with small kids. The hotel also offers free breakfast: sausage & egg bagels, variety of juices and cereals, oatmeal and rice.The hotel is very clean and remodeled with modern furnishingsCons:Parking is 25 dollars per day. We had an incident with the valet where we called for getting our car. The front desk picked up the call and agreed to relay the message. We waited 30 minutes and haven’t seen our car. Finally talked to the Valet service. They were not aware of our request.We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. The room setting is configured like a studio. The sink is in the same area where the bed is without a closed door, which was not very good for families having early risers.The bathroom configuration is very crammed - you can barely squeeze in to use the toilet and bath tub.

This Hyatt exceeded all my expectations. It was our first trip to Honolulu and I couldn't have asked for a more welcoming hotel staff. Being Canadian and working in a hotel in Vancouver, I know a few things about great hospitality, but boy did the staff at the Hyatt blow me away. On top of that; the rooms were modern and spotless, the breakfast was delicious and the location was perfect. Great job!

The rooms are compact. That's not to say small. They are nice and adequate. We found them just right for our stay. Like the caption says, you won't spend much of your awake time in a hotel room when on Waikiki, so why spend extra? The staff was very courteous and helpful.

Have searched and visited many Waikiki hotels for a family of 6 and based on bedroom configurations, I recommend this hotel for a family of 5 or 6 as the best value. Whereas other hotels will require two rooms, this hotel you can do with one room saving hundreds of dollars. More details on this is found on the Hawaii newsletter at prasadandassociates.com This hotel also has an incredible self serve breakfast featuring bowls of fresh pineapples and great coffee! It is only a 2 block walk from the beaches of Waikiki - just perfect!

Stayed in hotel for 15 nights. Got room on 10th floor. Big LCD TV. Breakfast ok, didn't eat much. Birds at breakfast are problem, but they're problem everywhere in Waikiki.Staff friendly and very helpful. Nice small fitness. Loved complimentary wifi in the rooms.I would go back next time.

Great location, amazingly thoughtful service, a wonderful room...well, just go there. We stayed 4 nights in the Hyatt Place and absolutely loved it. The room had a nice ocean view (across the tops of a couple buildings, but still nice..), was spacious and well organized, and it was of course quite new. The staff were helpful, courteous and very friendly. You felt as if being welcomed into their home. I've been to Honolulu twice before, and this was my best hotel experience. Enjoy!

I have been to Honolulu twice this year. 1st time I stayed at the Hyatt Reg and the 2nd time I stayed at the Hyatt Place. Let me tell you, the front desk staff here are way better then at the Hyatt Reg. The rooms were more modern. Breakfast is included and so is the WIFI. Its a little walk from the beach. But still close and has a great view of Diamond Head. I will be back in March for sure. Great Job everyone!

We weren't sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor, but this Hyatt Place definitely exceeded our expectations. Great service, free WiFi, and a complimentary breakfast were just three of the highlights from our three-night stay. The hotel is located just two blocks from the beach, and our room was huge. Some reviewers have complained about the breakfast area because it's outside and the food attracts birds, which is true. However, it wasn't a major problem and we were able to enjoy our breakfast. There was also plenty of room to eat during our stay, although I can imagine that space could be an issue during busy periods.If you decide to self-park, you'll pay $12/day at a lot that's not associated with the hotel and located across the street. We did this the first two days and it worked fine. On the third day, the lot was full and we ended up using the hotel's valet service, which is $25/day. Ideally, the hotel would have it's own lot for self-parking, but it wasn't a big deal. When you're just two blocks from the beach, it's hard to complain about paying $25 to park.Overall, we were surprised the Hyatt Place wasn't ranked even higher in TripAdvisor's list of Waikiki hotels. The room rate can be a little high, but it's certainly competitive with other hotels in the area. We didn't experience a single problem mentioned in some of the reviews, and we would definitely stay there again.

I just wanted to leave feedback on how wonderful Hyatt's Australian reservation staff have been. They have done everything in their power to help me out and not only have the come up with the goods but their politeness and kindness has been a credit to both them and their organisation. In particular I would like to thank Stephen and his staff.I made a reservation through bookit.com about a month ago for the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Bookit.com took a deposit and the remainder was to be paid over 2 payments. Yesterday I got a call from my bank to say that the Australian Federal Police had contacted the bank to say that my credit card was among a number that had been skimmed (details of my credit card had been fraudulently obtained - no details given of where or when) and that they needed to cancel the card and reissue a new one with a new number.Over the last month I have tried numerous times to contact Bookit to give them a different credit card number and they never contacted me back. I had all but given up. However, with yesterday’s events, I didn’t have any choice – I have to change the credit card number but Bookit won’t accept that unless I either gave them my other credit card number over the phone (like I am going to do that given recent events!) or I cancelled the booking and rebooked at the current rate which is now $300 more expensive and there is was special discount that we got when we originally booked, meaning it will cost me another $4-500. The Hyatt's staff have been wonderful and have rebooked me directly with the hotel at a slightly lower rate than Bookit gave me. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they were unbelievably good to work with. They really understand customer service and if this experience is any indication of the service we’ll be getting in Hawaii, I can’t wait to go!On the downside,Bookit tried to tell me that they couldn't let me pay the rest by paypal because the Hyatt didn't take paypal. However, the Hyatt confirmed with me that bookit paid them directly with bookit's own credit card, so whether the Hyatt takes Payal or not is irrelevant. I pay bookit and bookit pays the Hyatt. Bookit clearly says they take paypal, so why can't I pay them by paypal? Yet another reason to never use bookit again.

We selected a package that included transporation. When we arrived to the hotel the staff were not knowledgeable of the package in our reservation. The morning breakfast was a plus and one of the reasons we stayed but it was almost the exact same thing for the five days of our stay. Out check out time was scheduled for 12:00 PM I requested late check out of 2:00 PM (I receive this benefit because I have a Hyatt credit card) and was told it was okay but at 12:30 PM the cleaning person arrived. I explained we have a late check out at 2:00 PM and the cleaning person said she was not aware so I called the main desk and explained the situation and was told we had till 2:00 PM to check out. Then at 1:00 PM a hotel employee came and said we had to leave the room because it was past our check out time then I had to explain the situation to him. They have a poor communication system and hotel staff do not seem keep a good record of customers requests..

I had a great 3-day stay at the Hyatt place. It`s great that the breakfast and wireless internet are both free! The hotel is two blocks from the beach, there is an ABC store nearby (it seems there are more ABC stores than hotels in Waikiki haha..) and public transport is available next to the hotel. The room is very spacious, clean and new. I had a balcony with morning sun. For an American hotel, it is great value for money! You can take the breakfast to your room, no problem. There is a fridge in the room to store your drinks. What could be improved, is the noise isolation of the room. Single glass windows do not keep the noise of the heavy Honolulu traffic out of the room. They dealt very well with an issue regarding my room (I discovered a bed bug on my first evening). Although I`m not scared of the insects like many people ;) I got a new room immediately.

I would actually give this hotel at 3.5 out of 5 (but i'm limited to whole numbers). Overall, i thought this hotel was OK. The furniture and everything around the hotel appears to be fairly new (one of the staff persons said it just became the Hyatt Place in Dec 2011?). Bed was comfortable and pillows were to my liking - not too soft. This is my 2nd visit to Waikiki so the hubs and i didn't do a ton of touristy stuff. There is a bus stop right at the corner, so it was easy to get around town with our 4 day bus pass (Diamond Head and Hanuma Bay was super easy to get to). The beach was 2 blocks away and the main shopping area was at most a 10 minute walk. We were first placed in a mountain view room on the 8th floor which had a separate sitting area (2 loveseats), i had unpacked all of our toiletries etc. and found some "issues" with the bedding so i called to ask for someone to bring up new sheets. They offered to send someone to replace the sheets or just move us to a new room. It was already late at night and after 12 hours of traveling i didn't want to deal with someone in the room so i opted for another room, which he told me was a little smaller (because apparently the room i got was one of the bigger ones) but on a higher floor (i was initially on the 8th fl). So the hubs got the new key card and we got the highest floor facing the "mountain" on the 14th floor - the room was SO SO much smaller. It was missing the entire seating area. It wasn't a big deal but for those that are looking for space, make sure you ask about this at check-in or when you do any switching of rooms. Anyway, again, it was late and for us this was just a place to sleep. We were on a higher floor, less bus/street noise (and we are from NYC so generally street noise does not bother us). The balcony was really small - all the other lanais that we've experience in Hawaii are probably 2x that size at least. But there was not much to look at, and we didn't spend much time out on the balcony. The free breakfast was OK, nothing to rave about, edible but certainly wouldn't pay extra for it - the coffee was probably the best thing that was available. Happy hour (it was only one type of drink that is specially priced) was ok, again nothing to rave about other than it being fairly inexpensive for an alcoholic drink. The sink (in both rooms) were outside the toilet and shower area - and in there was only a shower stall, no tub. For the price we paid, we thought it was acceptable for the Waikiki area. I don't think i would return though - other than the new furniture, close to public transportation, and, for the most part, clean appearance of the hotel, there is not much else going for it.

we had a great time at hyatt place, it was in a great location at waikiki beach - away from the shops and bigger hotels. only two blocks from the beach and a reasonably included breakfast. A close walk to ono's hawiian family restaurant. Nice lobby and tourist desk information. Self parking is available fore 12 dollars a night across the street.

We enjoyed staying here. We had stayed here a few years ago before the upgrade. The upgrade has made a phenomenal difference. The beds were extremely comfortable--they were heavenly to sleep on. The breakfast each morning was tasty and had considerable variety for a continental breakfast. The staff were very friendly and always eager to help. I appreciated the complimentary coffee I received from the front desk in the evening. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here 2 nights on the way out of the USA. It's at the eastern end of Waikiki off the main drag. It feels new and there is wifi included as well as breakfast. We had a random room upgrade (not sure what to) but it was very spacious with a sitting area. The front staff are professional and there is help if you need. It kind of suits my disposition. I can manage myself and don't need constant attention or service. The bathroom or what serves as a bathroom is the only disappointment. It's functional but the sink is out over carpet which is odd...It is a short walk to the main drag at the beach and we wandered up to and beyond the western and of the strip without much trouble at all.The breakfast is a get in, get out affair and is geared for touring. Overall good experience and would stay here again.

good hotel nice and clean staff very helpful and professional room and bathrooms a little on the small side I'm a single guy so was ok but for family or lady's might struggle with small bathroom free hot breakfast and wifi which was fast and reliable a good plus only one street back from beach easy walk bed super comfy small balcony with water views good value for the money defiantly stay again.

Stayed for 2 nights as a family of 4. Friendly, helpful staff provided quick check-in and valet services. Easy walk to Waikiki beach and kids enjoyed the lagoon section. Breakfast was good, and although busy, always had a good stock of items. Easy walk to the shops and restaurants of downtown Waikiki and a quick drive to Diamond Head. Room had a king bed and a pull-out for the kids. Good wi-if connection.

Travelling as a family of 5 it was difficult to find accom. The Hyatt Place was well priced, the rooms were in excellent condition. Location was ideal for a family. Close to most things or within walking distance. Zoo, Aquarium, International Market Place and most importantly Waikiki Beach. The room was serviced to the highest of standards on a daily basis.Breakfast was Free every day and part of the package and although not the most exciting of Breakfasts it was a great way to start the day.

Went there for two nights and had a awesome view of the ocean from the room balcony, had extra bed in a small sofa we didn't need but used. Breakfast was great had an assortment of foods from hot cold, bad side was there were only tables to eat outside... it rained when we were there, and pigeons... Over all nice place.

We were ready to book a trip to Las Vegas (our second choice of location - Hawaii being number one) when I received an email with an incredible offer for the Hyatt Place in Waikiki. The price brought the trip down into our range and we booked it. We certainly didn't regret that choice. We were debating between an ocean view and a city view room so I called the hotel directly to find out just how much of an "ocean view" those rooms had. The gentleman at the front desk was incredibly helpful and answered all my questions. He recommended asking for a high floor if we were opting for ocean view, so we did. When we arrived, they put us in room 1417 and it was amazing. We had a great view from our balcony. The breakfast every morning was perfect for us. Different breakfast sandwiches daily, cereals, toast, granola, pastries, juice and coffee. The staff were always happy to make us a "custom" version of the day's breakfast sandwich if we didn't like what they had on offer. The room had a breakfast tray in it so we could go down, get our food, and enjoy our breakfast up on our balcony watching the sunrise. It became a morning ritual that I miss now that we're home again! The room was clean and just a nice size for the two of us. Everything we wanted was within walking distance or a short trolley ride. We weren't smack in the middle of all the "action" (and noise and crowds) but could get to it easily when we chose to. The beach at the end of the road (one block away) was nowhere near as crowded as Waikiki Beach even though they're essentially the same place! We would definitely go back to this hotel on a return trip to Waikiki. The only hiccup we had was our luggage. Due to flight issues, our luggage arrived over 24 hrs after we did. We'd been told by the front desk that if it arrived after 10pm, they'd hold it down there for us for the morning (perfect!). Unfortunately, a well intentioned staff member called our room after 1am when the luggage arrived to inform us it was there and see if we needed it that night. It was unexpected and startled us awake. However, the fact that the only negative we had about the hotel was that says a lot for the quality of the people and location!

Hyatt should have spent as much money researching their purchase of this property as they did on their breakfest sandwiches. This property just doesn't match up with the hyatt portfolio, I understand that the Hyatt Place is a step down property but this building is beyond a step down, try 3 or 4 steps down. Unfortunately there isn't much hope. With the selection of hotels in waikiki at this price point, it would be best to pass on the hyatt place. Not really a kid favorite and boring for adults too. The pool is so uninviting and within the wind tunnel that even the kids pass on it. We ended up just walking accross the street to use their nieghbor's pool, and no spa/jacuzzi? The breakfest spread is fine but better hold on to your plate, if the wind doesn't blow it away the birds will. Just a real boring property. Thank the stars that the staff are first class, it's the only saving grace here

We were here for two nights. The view was amazing we could see Waikiki clear to Diamond head with no tall buildings in our way. The pool area to number of guests is gross to think about, however the beach is just across the street. Well located with walking distance to almost everything.

At the beginning of November, I enjoyed 6 nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. The one hiccup was right when I checked in. I had booked 6 nights directly on the Hyatt website in an ocean view room. When I arrived, I was informed my reservation was for 1 night in a city view room. Upon producing my confirmation which I printed out prior to leaving home, Allyson took care of the situation calmly and professionally, ensuring I was in a room that was satisfactory to me. I cringe to think what would have happened if the hotel was full. In the end I don't know exactly where the error occurred, but this is just a good reminder to always bring all your confirmations with you, no matter what it is you have purchased. I am SO pleased to report that everything else about my stay was wonderful!! The room was comfortable with pleasing decor, the location fantastic, and every staff member I encountered was friendly and quick to say Aloha. Breakfast was very nice, and after reading other reviews, I expected to make many trips back to my room with my food due to crowding or birds. This was never the case. Also, the towels available for the beach were much appreciated. Happy Hour from 5-7pm was a huge hit with everyone (a great deal too!) and I found it a great way to meet folks as I was traveling solo. A group of us even headed to dinner after meeting the same night at Happy Hour! My hats off to bartender Nick, who was not only humorous and engaging, but really took ownership of the bar to create a wonderful atmosphere for all the guests. He offered good, solid recommendations for food/activities and was always interested to find out about your day and your evening's plans. He definitely is an asset to the Hyatt Place. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach and would definitely stay here again or recommend it to my friends/family. It's a great value, without the resort fees!

We stayed at the Hyatt Place from Nov 3 to the 12th. Here is my take on the place.First, I emailed the hotel ahead of time to request a room with a bathtub as we have a 10 month old and she obviously requires baths, especially after a day at the sandy beach, I was informed by the person who replied that only deluxe rooms with 2 queen beds have bath tubs and we would have to upgrade to acquire one of these rooms. We decided to not go ahead with the upgrade as we already had an ocean view room, and I didn't wish to pay anymore. I instead booked an infant tub with an outside company from which I also rented a full size baby crib. When we got to the hotel on our arrival everyone was very nice and pleasant, I asked the agent (I THINK his name was Terrance?) if it was possible to get upgraded to a room with a tub, since we had an Ocean View Standard room, they upgraded us to a City View Deluxe room at no charge, so I figured it was a fair trade and shooed away any disappointment in loosing my ocean view. It was dark when we arrived so I couldn't really see the view in our room, but we were in the Pali Tower on the 11th floor, and the next morning when I went outside onto our balcony I was pleasantly surprised that while I didn't have a full unobstructed view of the Ocean, I could see it from our balcony. It was also VERY noisy from the street, luckily we were all so exhausted by the end of the night it didn't see to affect us much, however when there were sirens or loud motorbikes going by it sometimes woke up our baby whose crib was placed by the balcony door. The room was a fair size, the beds and pillows were comfortable and the sitting area with pull out couch and ottoman was nice as well. The television was on a swivel wall mount so we could watch it in bed or sit on the couch and watch TV, and my husband also liked that you could download an app on our ipad to control the TV from which was nice to figure out which channels were which and preview movies. The breakfast was nice, and FREE so Im not going to make a complaint about that because everything in Waikiki was so expensive this was a major money saver for us and we ate breakfast there every day. We got housekeeping every second day (by choice), the lady we had on our floor seemed to be the same one everyday and we really liked her she was super friendly! I will however say that I had to ASK for our tub to be cleaned after 3 services because it had not even been wiped down for our entire stay, and when I did ask her to clean it, I didn't feel it was done the greatest. When we arrived I wasn't all to impressed with the cleanliness appearance of it in the first place, and it had a tad bit of a mildew smell to it when you got into shower. The tile portion of the room which was in the doorway and throughout the sink and bathroom area also was obviously vacuumed but I doubt its seen a mop in months and I would not let my daughter crawl there. We had to request that our bedding be changed as it smelled of urine (no we did not pee the bed :)), and they did change it promptly, and when I called about our sink on the second day as it was not draining, someone came up immediately to fix it....unfortunately I saw what was clogging it, ugh. After that it worked perfectly the rest of our stay. The walk to the beach was super quick, I cant complain about location. We saw the same staff almost everyday for our entire stay, they were all super nice I wonder if they ever take time off??It was a bummer there is no restaurant on site, and we did try room service, wouldn't recommend it. Parking for our rental for one night was 25.00 and local calls from the room were $1.00 a piece. Overall, this hotel was nicely decorated, the staff were excellent, the rooms were modern and for the MOST part they were clean, If I was looking for a good rate on a decent hotel, I would choose the Hyatt Place again, but I think next time we will spring for a Condo.

The hotel is well situated although see view rooms means you can see little bits of it in between the gaps between other high rise hotels closer to the beach! The hotel and room was clean and comfortable generally but the breakfast is hyped up somewhat. It's okay but repetitive and as its buffet style, it's almost impossible to get hot food. It doesn't help that from 7.30 it's difficult to get a seat indoors (which is very limited to begin with) and that means you have to eat by the pool.That means the you have to sit and do battle with the birds who are well practiced at sneaking onto your food while you are distracted or fetching a refill - very amusing when you see it happen to someone else but less so when it happens to you! Some people are clearly scared by the birds so they have to resort to taking breakfast back to their room.The pool/breakfast area is mostly outside on the 3rd floor so it can be very windy and at this time of year, the hotel tower is in the way of the sun so it's not that warm. The pool itself is tiny, with extremely limited supply of sun beds so those factors together wit the wind don't make it an attractive option!A good hotel let down by the above (they ought to use the space in the lobby for breakfast too) and not worth the premium prices being charged.

We stayed at this hotel for four nights last week and were extremely happy with it. Paid a few bucks to upgrade, completely worth the more spacious room (King View with separate living area, views of Diamond Head and the ocean). Very clean, renovated/modern furnishings, breakfast was free, staff is friendly, everything was comfortable and easy. TV was a good size, free HBO. I was there with my hubby and 7 mo baby, so my opinion is based on family friendliness. The closest beach (two blocks) is great for families with little ones because it is less crowded and there’s a surf breaker, so the water is very calm, shallow, and warm. The adjacent beach, San Souci, is also fantastic and less touristy. The hotel provided us with a “crib” (which was really a generic brand pack n play) that was less than stellar – the mattress didn’t fit properly (about 3 inches too short!) and was lumpy. I stuffed the extra blanket under the crib sheet and used it for the baby to play in but didn’t let her sleep in it. However, I saw newer looking Graco pack n plays in the hallway, so maybe we got stuck with the last junky one. There is also a mini fridge in the room which was extremely helpful for storing milk for pumping mamas. My only complaints were the lack of a bathtub and the loud AC. Without a tub, I had to bathe my baby in the sink or in the standing shower. Not the end of the world but a tub would’ve been a lot easier. It could be a challenge for small children because the shower head is pretty high, or maybe there are rooms with tubs that I’m unaware of. Like other reviewers noted, the AC is loud and next to the bed. Slightly annoying, but would not deter me from staying here again. The pool is small and uninviting. We prefer the beach so it wasn’t an issue, but if you are looking for good pool/lounging time I would go elsewhere. Overall we were very happy with our stay and would definitely come back!

Love the location so far. View wasn't worth the extra money. Don't splurge for that. Bathroom is super tiny. Sink area is ok, but shower is very cramped and not the cleanest it could be. Disappointed no lotion provided. But they do provide toothpaste. I would LOVE a room service menu. I was looking forward to a massage, but will have to go elsewhere for that service as no spa here? But overall clean-ish, friendly, convenient.

Large, clean room with all you need. Seems the place was remodeled lately. All personel were very nice and helpfull. Breakfast good. We were on the 6th floor and the street noise was loud. It started about 6 am and got quieter at about midnight. We stayed for five days and as more people arrived the elevator wait got to be a bit long.

This is our first hotel on our Hawaii trip, my wife did the excellent job of searching and booking all the hotels, including this one.After a super long flight from Montreal we finally arrived at Waikiki! The staff at the reception are super friendly, we got to our room in speedy time.The room is clean, the bed is super comfy to crash a few hours in bed.The hotel is kind of at the end of Waikiki, and a few blocks from the beach, that did not bother us at all, Waikiki beach is not that big, you can walk round-trip easily.The hotel provided beach towel, that is a plus!!We enjoy the included breakfast buffet , not ultra fancy but you can find decent juices, nicely roast coffee, hot meal, nothing negative to say here, we got there every day around 8h and there is always seats available, worse case you can bring the food in the provide tray in your room back to the room, I guess we were visiting in October the low season so we don't have to beat the crow.Free wifi is also included in our price, that is nice, there are also PC desktop in the hall to if you did not bring your tablet or laptop you can always fall back to use them.Considering the proximity to Waikiki beach and how pricey are the hotels, I think this hotel has a good quality/price ratio !

Although this hotel seems to have all the mod cons - great location, clean and modern rooms- free wifi with our rate and a reasonable ocean view, the rooms were very small for a family. We had a king size room with an ocean view but once the cot was in the room there was hardly any space to sit or relax except the balcony which is impossible with a 7 year old and a 17month old !Breakfast was chaos with a stampede on the buffet- the (breakfast room) was a small open space which doubled as the terrace for the pool, the wind was gusting every morning and we had to hold onto our napkins and cutlery, the pidgeons were ever present, stealing food off plates that were left on an unattended table. Staff were friendly but we would not choose to stay here again.

We stayed here for a week. Breakfast was dull. Room was spacious, had everything we needed .. Customer service was nice. It was good to have it away from the crowds noises.. But overall very nice. The tourist guys were very handful. The room were pricey but I didn't mind it. The view could be better from the balcony.

The Hyatt Place is an average hotel in a nice location on the far side of the Waikiki strip. It's a clear step (or two) down from the area's well known standards (i.e. - the Haleukulani or Moana Surfrider) and located a bit far from the main action. It's within a few minutes of the beach and seems to target a college-age crowd. Guests staying here should not expect expect much more than a clean, quiet place to sleep.First, the good things: the hotel is new, clean, reasonably well located, very reasonably priced and the staff is courteous and very friendly. Guests will find very little to fault in these areas. The location is a bit far from the main part of the tourist strip but that also means it's a bit more quiet (and it's still only a few minutes on foot to everything else).If you're the kind of person who just wants a decent place to sleep - stop reading here because you'll be perfectly happy with this place. However, if you're someone who appreciates things a bit more on the high-end side and looks for attention to detail and luxury - there a few things you should be aware of:Although the lobby has a nice, open-air feeling to it - the standard rooms are tiny and lacking any kind of ambiance or detail at all. The bathrooms (which lack a separate toilet area) are equally cramped and there's little more that can be said about them other than they are brown.The staff is extremely friendly and helpful but seem to be limited in number especially in the evening and the concierge desk is sporadically manned it seems.The complimentary breakfast is a joke - some fruits and yogurt, the worst danish I've ever had and the only "main" was a greasy, egg-bacon-cheese sandwich. It was free (which is good since nobody would pay for this) but seating was limited and guests are semi-encouraged to take-away and eat in their rooms.Overall, this hotel does not have the desire or try to be the next luxury hotel in Waikiki. The atmosphere is somewhat akin to a youth hostel and that feeling is complimented by the fact that the average guest appears to be around college age (likely because this is also one of the cheaper properties in the area). This is in no way a bad thing necessarily but prospective guests who prefer the attention to detail found at finer hotels should look elsewhere.

Hotel is not directly located on Waikiki Beach. Be aware of that when you book a room with a view of the ocean. I personally do not think it has been worth the money.Breakfast was included in the room price, however; I thought it to be a bit of a bore. Everyday, you could only pick your fruit existing of pineapple and melon. Not enough variety!French toast and Belgian waffels didn't look remotely as the real French toast and waffels in Europe.Housekeeping only provided bars of soap and not any kind of shower gel or body lotion. That was strange!! I enquired about that. The lady who cleaned the room said that I had to ask about that at the front desk.There was also a tea facility in the room but when I asked the front desk about herbal tea instead of the breakfast tea which was present in the room they said the 'green' tea needed to be purchased and was not free. That really surprised me.A tip: Do no use the bottled water in the room. The hotel will charge you 3,50 dollars per bottle. That's way overpriced!! You can buy a bottle of water in the shop in the hotel and that only costs 0,85 cents per bottle

My Daughter and I spent 10 days in Hawaii at the end of September ,we were welcomed right from the moment we booked in ,Front desk Staff were very friendly, helpful and nothing was a trouble to them, we had a great room, spacious and quiet,the Housekeeping staff went out of their way to look after you,breakfast gre location was perfect to transport, beach and restaurants, our stay was great and be back again to stay, thanks for everything, Marilyn and Cindy (Australia)

Booked a two queen Diamond Head view room and was told we were 'upgraded' to a bit better view. Well, there's another tall building blocking part of Diamond Head, but we were at least on an upper floor and could enjoy a scenic view. The four computers downstairs are often occupied, so print your boarding passes if you see an empty computer. Some computers freeze, so restart them. The computer requires one start and end a session, so it cleans out the cache and history. The room was spacious, but the bathroom was very cozy. Since it's completely renovated, it was very clean, however we did find an open safety pin stuck into the carpet. Staff were friendly. Parked the car at the Aston Waikiki at the Banyan diagonally across the street from the Hyatt Place because they offer weekly parking with in and out privileges for $72 for 7 days or $12 per day. The Aston is actually both long-term permanent residents and a lot of vacation rental apartments, and the parking garage is open to anyone, not just those staying at the Aston. The Hyatt charges $25 per day plus remember the tip each time, and not to mention the long waits when a lot of people are waiting, so self-parking was a lot better this way. However, the garage is a little tight in some places, but all garages in Honolulu are likes this. Overall, the free breakfast was decent, but food ran out often. The outdoor breakfast area is windy and full of birds, so use the tray in your room! Bring the tray down and stock up on the food, then head to your room or, as we did, headed down one floor in the elevator and sat at the many tables in the lobby adjacent to the hotel bar/cafe and near the computer/biz center. It was always sparsely populated and we could enjoy breakfast without wind and birds (that freely pecked at unattended food), also one time someone's sunglasses fell from high up the hotel tower (prob. from the balcony's patio table) and down to the breakfast area. The price is fair, and while we could hear our neighbors sometimes, it was mostly quiet.

The hotel was in a good spot in a quiter area of Waikiki 1 block back from the beach, but was still walking distance to everything, trolley buses almost out the front.The room was smallish but very comfortable the room had a balcony which gave you a sense of more space and a big cupboard and lots of storage space meant you did not have big suitcases or shopping cluttering up the room, bathroom was modern and clean.Complimentary breakfast was decent, a couple of hot options and plenty of fresh fruit, it could get very busy with families but you were supplied a tray in your room and were invited to bring food to your room to eat if you wished.We needed to book an extra night on our arrival as well as chase up a tour company that didn't show up on time and the staff were more than happy to help. My only gripe was the hotel did not provide electrify point converters but you could purchase them in the gift shop $8. All in all a good stay, nothing special but very comfortable and good value for a last minute booking.

We stayed in several hotels in Oahu on our vacation last October 27-November 3, 2012. Although Hyatt Place is the only hotel we stayed on that is not by the beach my husband and I enjoyed it the most because it is close to everything and the staffs are very accomodating, everybody is just great! with free wifi and breakfast it is worth your money. Thanks Hyatt place for making our vacation a memorable one.
user_name:
Maria L
East Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: I think for a night or two this hotel is perfect but having booked this online through the hyatt website, I was a little upset they did not even recognise why we were there. When making the booking online it asked if there was a special reason for our stay. I put that it was the last 2 nights of our honeymoon trip to Hawaii. Having had a magical stay at the Hyatt in Maui, I really wanted to stay at the Hyatt in Honoloulou. I did not expect anything other than a "congratulations" or something. Why ask if there was a special reason? The plus side was the breakfast inc in the rate per night, shame about the birds but not the end of the world! Finally I would just like to say as long as you don't mind hearing every single door slam shut, then stay here!!

My family and i spent a week at Hyatt Place and we loved it! It has a very good location, 1 block from the beach, ABC store at the corner and bus stop is across the street. Has a friendly staff, room service is very good. The room is large ( city view), modern and clean. The valet parking service is good but expensive.The breakfast has many options and a japanese style is also included. Wi fi available, beach towels too.

We stayed at the Hyatt place for 7 nights. For the price, this hotel offers complimentary breakfast and wifi throughout the building. Although on the small side, the rooms are well presented and maintained. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on.First night we were there, the Tsunami warning had hit and we were not able to have dinner. The kitchen was closed the sad were in the process of emptying the cafe fridge. They would not even offer let us purchase the remaining food they were about to pack away despite complaining how hungry we were.The only complaint I would have about this hotel is that house keeping didn't replenish the toiletries on a daily basis (had to request from front desk daily despite from desk advising house keeping should replenish daily) and the location was central however a good 15 min walk to what i would consider the 'centre of Waikiki'Would definitely recommend this hotel

From the moment we arrived, the friendly staff and our beachside accomodations met our full expectations. We were there for Halloween night and the street along the beach filled up with amazingly creative costumes and continued in a friendly and controlled manner. Just added another dimension to a fabulous stay.

This was a nice enjoyable place to stay. A very good free breakfast. The room was a handicapped room and was nice except we did have some bad smells coming from the drain. Only two blocks from the beach. Quick drive to diamond head. Decent access to the interstate. The staff was very nice and helpful. Lots of foreign tourists. Not a problem though. A good stay.

My husband and I stayed four nights at the Hyatt Place before moving to the Hilton.Our stay at the Hyatt was great good position not too close to the centre ofWaikeke but walkable and best of all, quiet. Rooms are very well appointedvery clean the only thing I could fault is the size, a little on the small side.The staff at the hotel are just gorgeous they are attentive,polite & nothing isa problem.I can highly recommend this hotel if your happy not to have a large roomand let's face it most of us are out all day when on holidays.

What a lovely hotel this is, only a two minute walk to the beach, and ABC stores close by for your convenience. All the staff at the hotel were really nice, and it was lovely to be greeted by smiling faces at reception upon arrival. Check in was quick, our room was bright and clean, with a nice big shower. Free Wifi in your room, as well as computers in the lobby. Complimentary breakfast was really good, also a nice touch in the morning was the free coffee and tea trolley in the lobby, so when I had finished my walk I would grab a coffee and take it up to our room.We are hoping to visit Hawaii again next year, and will definitely be staying at the Hyatt Place, and recommending this hotel to our friends.

Stayed 5 nights and enjoyed every one. Good location on Kuhio one block from beach. Room was clean and hotel staff polite and efficient. Free breakfast a nice touch as it is served (weather permitting) poolside on the 3rd floor though I'd eat early (6:30 - 7:30) for best seating. Stayed on the top floor (20th) of the tower by the front desk and the noise was minimal. Small balcony nice to have as sandy shoes and towels fit well out there. Only complaint by wife was a lack of vanity or counter space in the bathroom. Well recommended...

My husband and I stayed in a King-bed room for 3 nights. The room size and layout is relatively average (maybe even on the small side) but there is a balcony, and plus, how much time will you actually spend in your room in hawaii aside for resting and sleeping?! Everything looked and felt clean and pristine. Bed is comfortable and supportive, decor feels modern and updated. All the staff we encountered--from front desk to bar to cleaning to restaurant--were friendly and helpful.The complimentary breakfast is great. Its buffet style, not a large selection but all the basics you need and everything is well made, delicious and filling. The spread is usually a hot brkfst sandwich of some sort, waffle or French toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, hot oatmeal, pastries and cereals, juices and coffee. Hotel location is great: one block walk to the beach, walkable to all restaurants and shopping on the Waikiki waterfront as well as the zoo, convenient store right next door, bus stop on the corner, 1-2miles walk to diamond head. The only thing you may miss out on is a 100% unobstructed view of the ocean since the hotel is one block in from the waterfront, but that didn't really bother me.I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
user_name:
msmaryw
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here at the beginning and end of our trip – once on the 4th floor & once on the 9th – rooms were exactly the same but the higher one had a glimpse of water.The rooms were much bigger than usual hotel rooms with a separate sitting area which was nice. The bar fridge was handy too. Everything was in excellent condition.Location is great – a few minutes walk to the beach & an ABC store and about 10 mins walk to where most of the restaurants & shops were.Free Wifi as well as computers in the lobby were very useful too. Breakfast was good – after other reviews we expected chaos but it really wasn’t bad at all – never had a problem getting a table. It wasn’t fancy but there was decent variety and it saved time & money.Staff were very helpful with information and organising transport.The main reason we chose Hyatt Place over other hotels was the price and I really think it was excellent value for money. If you're planning a holiday where you stay at the hotel the whole time and sit by the pool then this probably isn't the best place, but for our purposes – a nice room in a good location – it was perfect and I would stay there again.

We're here on our way back from other islands in the Pacific and couldn't be happier - everyone here is so helpful and kind, which really makes a difference here in Waikiki. Rooms are clean, spacious -- really great. Would def stay here again, and next time. Makes me a big fan of Hyatt Place. Whoever is in charge of staff here is doing a great job! The nabe is a little dodgy... but even still we'd return. it's a little off the beaten path - away from the busy shopping areas which we prefer.

At 426 rooms, the Hyatt place is a boutique sanctuary at the quiet end of Waikiki, down by the zoo and two short blocks from the beach. Compared to the neighboring Marriott with 1175 rooms and the 1239 room Hyatt Regency down the street, Hyatt place is a quiet sanctuary from the bustle of Waikiki. The hotel is a recent purchase by Hyatt, and was remodeled and updated. Hyatt retained many of the former staff, meaning the staff is helpful, professional and happy to be working under the Hyatt brand.The standard model for the larger hotels on Waikiki is to have shops on the first floors and common areas. The interiors of the Marriott and Hyatt Regency look more like shopping malls than hotels. While the Hyatt Place does not have restaurants, they are within easy walking distance. Instead of shops, the Hyatt Place has a modern contemporary common area with a 24-hour bar.Hyatt Place has two different towers. The Pali Tower is considered the deluxe tower due to the size of the rooms at 500 to 550 sq feet. The Diamond tower has standard room accommodations room size 220 to 250 sq ft. The penthouse floor is identical to all the other rooms in the Pali Tower, only difference is that the PH floor is the top floor. Insiders Tip: On your next visit, you can request to be on a higher floor. If you prefer ocean views, on the website you will need to confirm Deluxe King or Queen Ocean View, and request the penthouse floor. If you want to save money, get the smaller standard room; if you want more space, get a deluxe room. Our room had a sitting area and more plugs than I have ever seen in a hotel room. A skillet breakfast is included with the room. Fried egg is combined daily rotation of breads for an open-faced egg sandwich. Yogurts, fruit, granolas, cereal, miso soup and bagels with cream cheese are additional choices. Breakfast is from 6:30 to 9:30.The lobby area has a 24-hour bar and snack bar. In the back corner of the area is a gift shop with remarkably competitive prices. The water and juices there were less the neighboring ABC store! Would you rather pay $3.25 for a bottle of water in the room or $.85 in the gift shop?Insiders Tip: Park at the Aston Banyan diagonally across the street. You get in and out privileges and it is half the price of valet parking at the Hyatt Place. We had a deluxe city view room, which actually faced Diamond Head and had a partial ocean view. Our room had a small lanai (balcony), which we enjoyed in our down time. We were on Oahu for just a few days so we did not intend Hyatt Place to be a place of relaxation. If you want relaxation, head to Maui or Kauai. If you want mixing with lots of people, nightlife and high energy, Waikiki is the place for you!

Beware! Switch and bait!! This hotel has two towers. The rooms in the newer tower are small! Previous to this visit I had stayed 3 times in the first tower which was renovated two years ago. Upon arrival today, I was literally put in the smallest room in the hotel (they told me it was) which is in the most recently renovated tower. It was so small it is the only room in the hotel without a desk. I thought it was odd that they would put a single person staying 7 nights in a room with no desk. Meaning it would seem obvious to me that I was there on business. So they moved me to another small room but at least I have a desk. Oh, did I mention the air conditioner didn't work. So much for the loyalty program!! Time to find a new hotel!!!!

Just returned from a 4-night stay at the Hyatt Place. I found a great airfare to Honolulu and decided to spend a couple of days in Waikiki working remotely. I am a top tier member of the Marriott brand and mid tier member of Hilton and Hyatt brands. These brands are represented all over Waikiki but after comparing different hotels across the brands I chose the Hyatt Place because of the value I would get from my points. My two main needs were reliable free wifi and free calls to toll-free numbers for conference calls. I got both with Hyatt Place.As many others have mentioned, the hotel is a newer property with a bountiful continental breakfast. I used my points for a deluxe city room and received a room on the 18th floor with a partial view of Diamond Head. Plus I could see the sun rise every morning! I liked that a whole lot better than the partial "ocean view" I saw in some of the reviews here. Check-in was great because the person who checked me in offered to give me a tour of the first floor before I went up to my room. I don't think I've ever gotten that at any hotel I've been in! The room was pretty spacious with one of the biggest TVs I've seen in a hotel room. There were plenty of outlets which I really appreciated. It allowed me to work anywhere in the room. And the shower was great - there was always hot water with great water pressure. The only negative is that the balcony doors are not soundproofed at all. I could hear the traffic all day and night from the 18th floor. Even though the Hyatt Place is at the end of the strip, I could still hear trucks backing up in the middle of the night. Thankfully I'm not a light sleeper so I could sleep through it.Another desire I had was to save as much money as possible on the trip. The free breakfast helped a lot. I thought it had really good variety for a continental breakfast. Even with my statuses at the other brands, due to certain rules, I would not have gotten free breakfast at other hotels. Plus I saved myself from having to pay resort fees at the other hotels. I also saved money by taking the bus rather than renting a car or taking a taxi. The hotel is at the corner of a bus stop that serves many routes which is very convenient.

For the price this place is great! You're 1 block from the beach, rooms are clean and up to date, service is great and so awesome that you get a hot breakfast every morning. We paid extra for the ocean view room but after a few days we noticed that our bed was not really comfortable so we called to the gallery host and spoke to Thomas the manager. He was more than happy to switch us to another room which was not ocean view but mountain view/city view. Didn't matter cause the room had a better bed and it was sooo much bigger. Oh and we had a tub now and we had a whole wall with windows and a huge balcony! The tub was relaxing since I'm pregnant and all. The free breakfast was great! French toast, pancakes, egg and ham sandwiches, yogurt, hot oatmeal, bagels and toasts, fruits, starbucks coffee and orange juice, etc.... really saved us a lot of money. After the 6th day though we were kinda over it but hey we saved money for 6 days of breakfast! Overall, so happy that we went with Hyatt Place. I don't know why it has only 3 1/2 stars, maybe because it's not on the strip and it's not really a high end hotel but for the price this place is decent.

I stayed at the Hyatt Place with a friend last week - this was very luxurious compared to the 3-star hotels I've previously stayed at in Waikiki.We were very happy with our room in the Diamond Head tower: it was spacious with two comfortable queen beds, a large seating area with sofa and chair, a desk, fridge and coffee maker.Linens were comfortable and clean, room was very nicely decorated. We loved the two small balconies and our ocean view (we had only paid for a city view so this was luck).The breakfast was excellent too - so much variety! For me (a strict vegetarian), I had the fresh fruit (pineapple, canteloupe, and honeydew melon), and the oatmeal with sunflower seeds and nuts. My friend usually went for the egg/meat/biscuit offering as well as the danishes. There was yoghurt, toast, 4-5 different juices, coffee and Tazo teas as well. Staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful - everything from providing beach towels to calling a taxi for the airport (they have a special $29 rate), to storing bags after check out, to answering questions at the breakfast buffet.Bus stop was also right outside the hotel which was convenient for day trips.The only thing we were missing in the room was an additional mirror so that we could both get ready at the same time. I'd suggest they add one on the desk.

We stayed from 9/23/12-9/26/12. The hotel at that time was called something different like ocean resort. When we stayed the hotel was under construction but not once did it disturb us. The staff were very helpful. Our price,which was dirt cheap by the way,didn't come with breakfast which was fine because the beach was so close and filled with restaurants and shops. The beach was literally a one minute walk from the hotel. Great location!! The rooms were dated at the time but looking at the upgrades,the new renovations look amazing. I would definitely stay there again. Sorry for the late review hopes this helps.

This hotel has some very nice features and some flaws. Positive: spacious, newly renovated rooms, free breakfast, free wireless internet, very nice and helpful staff. Negative: single-pane windows, so the street noise can be bothersome. Also, the A/C is noisy (I had to turn it off to sleep).

Hyatt Place is a great place for large families. I went to Hawaii in August for a wedding with my Japanese friends. We rented three rooms for nine people. We saved a lot on breakfast. The rooms are spacious approximately 600sq feet. Everything looked new. We had two queen size bed and a full size sofa bed in each room. The TV 32 inch flat screen. The view was not the greatest my room was facing an apt type of building. I will stay at the Hyatt Place on my next trip to Waikiki. Love, love, love Hyatt Place!

Hyatt Place is a great place to stay. We had an extremely pleasant stay. The location was excellent, just short of the beach. There was public transportation at the end of the street. Great breakfast, Excellent service, wonderful staff. Don't have any negative points to say. The people of Hawaii are very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place.

We've just returned from 10 days at this hotel. Nice, modern, clean rooms with a spacious shower and they also had a large TV (not that you'll be watching much TV)! Decent complimentary breakfast, although it can get busy. However, you are provided with a tray so you can take your breakfast downstairs where there is plenty of seating.There is complimentary WiFi throughout the hotel, as well as computers to use in the lobby. There is also a printer for you to use free of charge. The hotel also provides towels for the beach that came in handy.We booked our trips through hawaiidiscount.com as they were a lot cheaper than the prices in the hotel. We also used go808 express for airport transfers, who were on time and provided some great local info.

We had a one night layover in Honolulu enroute to Kauai, and were heading out early the next morning, and the Hyatt Place filled the bill. We were upgraded to an ocean view on the 17th floor (we are gold passport members), which was great. The room was spacious enough and new, and we enjoyed a great sushi dinner at a nearby restaurant recommended by the person at check-in. It is in a block from the beach, and there are restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay there again if we had a stopover in the future. The included breakfast buffet was perfect - replenished frequently and enough choices - nice to be sitting outdoors, too.

We stayed in august in your hotel for two weeks, we decided on the hyatt with very little research ( i booked last minute), it was so cheap compared to what we would normally pay for are holiday's (my girlfriend normally books are holiday) but as we only ever use hotels as a place to sleep i thought it would be ok! well it was far better than ok, the hotel was modern/sleek and very well designed, the room was perfect love the bed/TV & free wifi ect, the breakfast was a nice bonus even after two weeks it was still nice (does get busy, so we would take it back to are room and have breakfast in bed).There is some downsides, the pool was to small (but who cares you have waikiki beach two minutes away and thats better than any hotel pool i ve ever seen). the gym was quite small as well but i used it every day and never had to wait for a machine. The food and drinks the hotel sells are to expensive.I ve travelled the world quite a lot and for value for money i would say the hyatt place is the best i ve stayed in.Thankyou for making our holiday so special & thankyou to all your staff who always had a smile and were happy to help with special praise the bald gentleman (sorry cant remember your name) who was on the front desk, i annoyed him everyday with questions where to go how to get there, is it worth going, and he always had the right answer.Cheers You will see us again!

Views of Waikkiki Beach from hotel room/balcony - WOW - made me feel good just looking out of the window! Good staff, all very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and we were glad of the air conditioning. The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice. Trips on offer at the hotel seemed pricey and we ended up booking things while we were there over the internet! Free wi-fi in the room which was a plus. Didn't eat any other meals in the hotel as there is so much on offer very close by. Plenty of shops/bars/restaurants in the vicinity without impacting negatively on the hotel. A good choice. Tip: pre-book a taxi from the Airport as the airport bus companies charge as much as a taxi! We found out too late.

We stayed two nights, and we were very happy with the room and the great service. We enjoyed the free breakfasts. I don't think a lot of the hotels provide this service. The location was good--just a couple of blocks to the beach.

From the moment we arrived, until the day we had to leave the service was absolutely fantastic. Jade checked us in and always seemed to be at the front desk when we needed anything. (Woman, you need to take a day off!) Although we stayed for 5 nights, we were not able to enjoy the breakfast provided by the hotel until the last morning because we left the hotel at 0600 every morning to go diving and the Hotel's breakfast service did not start until 0630. However, on our last day, we decided to "check out the breakfast" and were very pleased with what the Hyatt Place had to offer (fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, breakfast sandwiches, toast and a lot more). It was great!We stayed in the second tower which was completely renovated earlier this year (2012). We had a great large suite with a balcony on two sides of the building.We will definitely stay at the Hyatt Place on all future trips to Honolulu.

We stayed two nights here on our family vacation and were very impressed.Breakfast:They now offer a free breakfast buffet for all guests. It was better than some $15 breakfasts at other hotels. Eggs, cereal, pastries, rice, waffles, bagels, etc. very wide selection. It was casual. Grab your plate and also drop off your plate. We enjoyed it. Could have used a few more protein options, but we had no reason to complain.My wife enjoyed the free Starbucks coffee!Room:Nice. Clean. Great view of the ocean. Loved the fridge and in room safe. Balcony was pretty kid proof. We did not have to worry about our two year old squeezing through.Elevators:This was the only downside. In our section we had to wait and average of 1-3 minutes for an elevator. If you think about it, that's not much. It was worth the stay anyways.Location:Two blocks from Waikiki and a couple blocks from casual restaurants. If you walk straight North from the Hotel you'll encounter the little resturants that only cost $8 a plate.There was an ABC store next door with all the essentails including snacks and food items at a very reasonable cost.Customer Service:Top notch. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. Will defiantly stay there again if we ever make it back to Hawaii!

My daughter and I stayed 5 nights. The first couple nights were fine except we ordered pizza downstairs and the dough was raw. 4th day we found ants in our room and they were unsuccessful getting rid of them. We were moved to the newer diamond tower 6th floor and the ants were on the bed! Right away shuffled up to the 17th floor for 2 nights with no ants. Guess they can't climb that high. I feel there's no excuse for insects in that expensive of a hotel. For our inconvience we received a paltry $50 credit, from which was deducted anything we charged to the room. They wouldnt even let us stay in the room an extra few hours while we waited for our shuttle to the airport so we had to sit in the lobby all day because it was pouring rain. Never again will I stay even next door to a Hyatt hotel.

OK this was our frist trip ever!! The Breakfast in the morning is excellent (but same everyday) the breakfast sandwiches could use a little love on the flavor they were very bland. that being said. I want to get to the real meat of why I loved this place so much. AND WITHOUT A DOUBT the 5 STAR 5 DIAMOND award goes TOO!!! ,,,,,,,,,,,, (wait for it) ,,,,,,, THE VALETS!!!!!! these guys were nothing short of fantastic. I`ll get into the why`s in a moment. but first the who`s. Wayson A. Young (the ring leader) Steven Shintani, and Joey Kido these 3 guys made our whole trip. their professionalism was top spot, they were polite, funny and just all around awesome. Now for some more of the why`s ,, INFORMATION, these kiddo`s were a wealth of information for "Off the beaten Path" in where to go, where to eat, whats going on in town, whats the locals up to, where do the locals go and eat, what was touristy and keeping it real. WE were out to explore on a romantic getaway to a place we dreampt about and finally arrived. Now it was time to grab out scooters and head out to the Island roadways looking for what was suggested shown to us as red ink blots on a map that they circled and with complete faith in their smiles and thumbs up. so off we went. And MAN SPOT ON!!! from turtles surrounding us when others were scrambling like kids on an easter egg hunt. to quiet beaches and beautiful views when others were stepping all over each other. to The "Rainbow" Resturant Drive In Diner for some of the BEST teriyaki chicken and pork sandwhiches. We Love YOU GUYS!!!! thanks so much for making our First Hawaii trip AWESOME!!! when we come back next year we will be hunting you down where ever you are.
user_name:
Don W
Aloha, Oregon, United States

review_body: We hesitated going to the Renew hotel or the Hyatt place, both located on Paoakalani avenue. In the end, we decided to stay at the Hyatt place as it was our honeymoon and we trusted the Hyatt brand, but we expected more.Positive feedback :- well located, within short walking distance to the beach (3 minutes), which was not too crowded compared to other busier parts in Waikiki,- nice balcony which we enjoyed a lot- the breafast was included and there was quite some variety- the room was new and the bed was very comfortableAreas for improvement :- we paid extra to have a full ocean view room and even tough we were on the 11th floor, what we got was rather a partial ocean view with many buildings blocking our view, including Hotel Renew, which probably had a much better ocean view than Hyatt place- there needs to be a better way of scaring the pigeons away, as these aggressive birds disturbed us during breakfast everyday (including eating our food)- not enough breakfast seating + needs to have longer hours (closes at 9am...)- more personnel needed at the check in and information desk (we always had to wait)- improve beach amenities (umbrellas needed)- we got woken up twice for a false fire alarm at 6 am and the receptionist didn't even apologize when we called them to ask what was going onNext time, we will search for something else as we believe for this price, we should be able to get something better.
user_name:
A and G M
Paris, France

review_body: The room was clean and the shower was good but don't plan on staying in the room except to sleep. The balcony was so small it was filled up with two chairs and a table. Don't plan on meeting anyone there. No restaurant and water in a small bottle is $3.50 US. A short walk to the beach smells like urine the whole way there as the apartments let their dogs pee on the side of the street. Close to moped rentals and helpful staff.

I booked a five night stay (two rooms) in late September. The hotel is located about a block and a half from the beach. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very friendly front desk staff. Although we arrived a few hours before the actual check in time, we were allowed access to our rooms right away. We had originally been booked on one of the lower floors, but in reading the Trip Advisor recommendations by folks who had previously stayed there, I asked for a higher floor, which I learned has larger rooms with better views and which constitutes an upgrade. We were given the upgrades without a hitch. Our rooms were located on the 11th floor. The rooms were very spacious with two queen beds and a sitting area with a couch and a coffee table. The bathroom had a separate lavatory area with a separate shower and toilet. The room had a huge flat screen TV with lots of free movie channels. The room also had a lanai with two chairs. We had a partial view of Diamond Head and the beach. The room itself was modern and tastefully decorated, with wonderful, comfortable mattresses. The hotel has a small exercise room and an even smaller pool, but who needs these two things when the beach and other activities are steps away.The hotel provided a breakfast, which was great. Every morning there was a different breakfast sandwich, a variety of breakfast cereals, and either pancakes, waffles or french toast. There was fresh fruit which consisted of fresh pineapple and melon. Cottage cheese and yogurt were also available, as well as hot steel cut oatmeal with a large variety of toppings, including a selection of nuts, dried fruit and other toppings such as granola. There was even a section for the Japanese guests, with miso soup, steamed rice and various toppings for the rice. The beverages included a juice station included orange, pineapple, grapefuit, tomato and a V-8 type juice. Coffee and tea were also served. As you can tell, I was impressed. This was quite a savings for us, as restaurants on Oahu can be very expensive. The one negative thing about the location of the eating venue was that it is quite windy. We solved this by taking the trays provided in each of the rooms and taking our breakfast down to the ground floor where tables and chairs are also located. A coffee and tea bar are thoughtfully placed there as well. (A flyer left in our rooms had suggested this option.)There was some street noise (sidewalk repair was taking place), but it all settled down by the time we ready for bed.In all, our stay was very pleasant, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

This is a very nice, recently remodeled hotel near Waikiki Beach. While it does not have the panache the other hotels have, it is important to remember that this is a hotel that is geared towards business travelers for the most part. Yes, there are tourists that stay here (to include myself).Yes, there are business people that stay here (to include myself as well)But this is primarily geared towards business travelers, a la Holiday Inn Express.Don't get me wrong, they pull it off with ease, and you wouldn't know you are staying at a business travelers hotel. The staff is very accommodating, efficient, and very polite with all of the guests they encounter. While you aren't right on the beach, a nice two minute stroll will put you on the Waikiki sands. Shuttles stop constantly and bus stops are also nearby. No complaints and can't really recommend they change anything, because as stated earlier, they get it right!!Definitely plan on staying here again!!

Everything about our stay at Hyatt Place was excellent. From the friendly staff, to the newly remodeled room, to the breakfast buffet-- everything exceeded our expectations.
