Our room was exceptionally clean. I felt like I was the first person staying there. They use a mattress cover that zips around the mattress below the sheets, so this helped ease my bed-bug paranoia. The hotel is walking distance to the beach, but it is at the end of the "strip" of hotels so it's a little far from some of the shops. This didn't bother us because we came for the beach, not the shops, and if you have a rental car, this will not be a problem. We could hear street noise from our room on the 12th floor, but it's to be expected in a busy city like Waikiki (not a fault of the hotel). If you want a quiet vacation, don't go to Waikiki (go to Kauai or Maui). We absolutely loved the styling of the room and the hotel and would definitely go back or recommend our friends stay there.

(1) THE LOCATION could be a pros or cons depending on your goals. I personally didn't like Waikiki at all: it is the biggest tourist trap ever and I didn't feel that being close to this place was advantageous. The area is super noisy, busy, and crowded with tourists. Street noise is an issue even at 14th floor. If you are planning to explore the island by car then be prepared for spending lots of time in traffic on your way in and out downtown / Waikiki. (2) CAR PARKING. Valet ($25/day) is your only option. There is a cheaper public parking option right across the street but it is not 100% convenient if you are travelling with kids. (3) THE ROOM. The room was clean but INCREDIBLY SMALL. Just enough space for a bed and TV. The tiny patio is practically useless due to its size. Wasn't an issue for us since we only needed a place to sleep. Also, I paid for an "Ocean View King" room. However what I was able to see from the window (9th store) couldn't be classified even as a partial ocean view (completely behind other buildings). Moving to 14th floor (the highest available in one of the two towers) didn't help much. Long story short, don't expect any good ocean view from this property. Based on this property location (not water front), paying extra for view does not make any sense. (4) BREAKFAST. Complimentary breakfast was OK and really nice to have. Not too many hot items (very average sandwiches don't count). Watch out for birds (pigeons are always ready to help you with your breakfast). (5) FACILITIES. Gift shop downstairs was nice: local beer, cloths. Also, there is a printer available (no additional charge), convenient to print boarding passes for example.Bottom line: decent place to stay if you really want to be close to Waikiki, the land of highrise hotels and tourist buses.

Great location, only a short walk to the Beach walk, very tastefully renovated and decorated, rooms are on the small side( except the end/corner rooms) but the rate and added value makes up for that.Hotel is very clean and well maintained, but the 3rd floor pool is virtually unusable not only it's really a bird pond/kiddy pool, but it has no view and surrounded by too many breakfast tables & chairs (making morning swims impossible) it's also windy, but who wants a pool or a Spa when Nature has blessed these Island with that Beautiful Ocean outside?.... Pity that this hotel has no "real" restaurant, but there are excellent ones every where else in all major hotels. The Front Desk staff are all genuinely friendly, flexible and helpful if you get their attention to look up, as they're lost staring down at their computers.(Hyatt should place the monitors higher up as in most hotels).The Travel desk is always busy very too slow, there's always a line with an unfriendly clerk full of self importance, "talking down" on to Guests. Better use the friendly Travel desks of other main hotels like the Westin Moana Surfrider, you are not getting it for free, why put up with it?Great that Internet is free and 21st century has finally arrived to America, so to speak.So is an innovative sort of comp. basic B'fast Buffet with the essentials. I enjoyed this convenient new self-rooms service-concept too. Only problem is that it gets rather monotonous eating the same things every day if you're there for a long stay, always the eternal hot omelet sandwiches (Hey Hyatt: Make an effort, use your notorious "F&B imagination" a bit more and vary the fruit choices too as there are other fruits is Hawaii except Pineapples & Melons)The open sided Lobby is not where you want to hang around at all, too open and too "train stationish" with no welcoming atmosphere and high humidity, only good for waiting to get a room and leave immediately. The "lonely" bar's a boring place as if Hyatt didn't know what to do with that space in the corridor. Better to sit in the Lobby at the Marriott across the street with lots of comp. daily papers and very comfortable seats, or at the great Westin nearby with good F&B outlets.The beach right in front of this hotel has the "Wrong Crowd" and it's too neglected with a mix of dirty white sand & cigarette buts...( I see that no one of the desk staff has ever used that beach, in order not to recommend it...) Not as good as the lovely beaches near the Westin, with well maintained immaculate "yellow sands" and people who look more like real Hyatt Place guests!...Same poor note for the beach in front of Hyatt Regency; really down market.....Unless you are Japanese or speak it well, don't stay at the Hyatt Regency! In it's early days in the 70-80' it was a great hotel, now it shows it's age and feels like a little Tokyo ghetto....Not a healthy mix of Nationalities, I am glad they were full so I came to stay at the Hyatt Place which is new and less expensive. In a "Coconut shell": My advice is to stay here to sleep, use the Marriott or Westin Lobby Lounges and go to the Beach at the Westin / Royal vicinity.

I stayed at this hotel for a week and it was very nice, its located about a block from the beach but close to almost everything. The whole of Waikiki is within a 10-15min walk from this hotel or you can take a cab to the other end of Waikiki, it will run you about $12.00 if you dont want to walk back to the hotel after a night/day out. The room did feel a bit small but it was well maintained and clean. The staff is extremely nice and will do as much as they can to make sure you enjoy your stay. I would stay here again when I go back, very good hotel!

Just came back from a 7 night stay. Hotel is located at the very end which is perfect. Everything is in walking distance. Especially the beach! Traveled with my husband and 7month old daughter and didn't have any problems with walking to the beach with all our BEACH gear. Beach was calm which was perfect for baby's first time swimming. At night, we would walk around the area. Farthest we walked was to International Marketplace. Hotel room was on the sixth floor. Elevators are a bit slow. Our room was nice and clean. But, really small :( We booked hotel on orbitz and got a king size bed. Breakfast was really good on the first and second day. But we got tired of it afterwards. You eat outside which is really nice, but there are birds galore! We rented a car and chose to valet (only option) for $25. But learned that you can park across the street at Banyan hotel for $12/night or $72/for 7 days. Only downfall with parking garage is parking hard to find at night and the elevator isn't available after 6pm. Overall great hotel. Wonderful staff and perfect location. Only wished our room was bigger, but it turned out to be ok since we were always out anyway. Would definitely stay here again :)

This hotel is a very good option to stay close to Waikiki beach. Hotel is clean. They have very good breakfast. Hotel workers are friendly. Rooms are big enough and quite. I did not expose any bad experience in this hotel. Waikiki beach is walking distance away (1-2 min). There is a public parking next to the hotel $12 for 24 hours with in and out privileges. There are abc general stores everywhere. There is slight ocean view but don't expect more. Free Internet. Free breakfast. Clean hotel. I put the service avarage because it is ok service but average. If the deal is good, stay in this hotel.

Definitely this hotel is "like new". We were in a city view room, with some really good views of the ocean! Could even see navy ships going by! The hotel is very modern. Our room was small, but really what does one need a large room in Oahu for? No problems at all with elevators ever. Breakfast was wonderful - so much variety. Orange juice, tomato juice and apple juice everyday. All the coffee (Starbucks) that you can drink. A different breakfast sandwich everyday. French toast, pancakes and waffles (a rotation of one everyday). Steel cut oatmeal, fruit salad, yogurt, cereal, toast, bagels - what more could a person want? Very close to the beach. ABC stores everywhere. Different things in all the stores. We bought air mattresses and carried them back and forth to the beach and gave them away when we left.Wolfgang Puck Express close by with the best pizza's ever. Staff at hotel were extremely helpful. Billy at the Expedia desk was very friendly and helpful. Recommend the Discover Hawaii Circle Tour (ask for cousin Kevin). Wonderful time.Great taxi service - ask at the front desk for the $29.00 taxi to the airport - Charlie's Taxi - I wish we had met Garrett (the driver) on our way to the hotel instead of on our way home. He was friendly and knowledgeable! Would definitely stay at the Hyatt Place again and recommend to our friends.

Nice hotel friendly staff breakfast is a plus good location everything within short walking distance,beach a block away, zoo& lots of shopping trolleys and buses loved It will stay again lots to eat around hotel

It's about 2 blocks away from the beach and 1 block away from the ABC store. The location is away from the busy street of Honolulu, so it was quiet for us at night, which was perfect for us. The breakfast was awesome and more than what we had expected like other hotels we had been to. We paid extra to get upgraded to an ocean view, however all we got was a mountain view with a tiny partial ocean view where we had to squeeze and bend around the corner to see that ocean view. My husband was a bit upset about the view because we paid quite a lot extra to upgrade our room. Area for breakfast was windy, so it's not a good idea to wear skirt to get your breakfast. Staff was friendly. The parking was expensive so we didn't park there everynight unless we couldn't find a cheaper spot that day. There is a self-parking lot for half of the price just across the street.

Good value hotel in great location. Breakfast was really good. Thanks for a most enjoyable stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. After an early mix up with the room, we were given a lovely larger room. Only slight problem was that I found the air-conditioner quite noisy to sleep, but overall not a big problem.

Perfect location on one of the side streets in Waikiki. Just a 5 minute walk to the beach and the hustle and bustle. Close to everything. Breakfast skillet was great and was a nice start each morning in Hawaii.

Check-in was short and easy, Christopher was very nice. We were up-graded to an ocean view on the 8th floor. The view of the ocean was from between other tall buildings so not much of a true ocean view. The room itself was very clean but very small. Housekeeping seem to go with "Hawaiian Time" one day we left our room at 6:30am and didn't return until 4:30 that afternoon and our room had not been serviced yet. We left again shortly after and on our return later that night it was done. The next day we again left first thing in the morning and returned this time at 5, the housekeeper was at the room next door to us, but our room was done, probably just finished before we arrived. Breakfast was so so need a better variety of hot choices & more covered seating the birds were a pain to deal with. Nice to have free wi-fi. Short walk to the beach, public transportation close by.

Hyatt Place is located 2-mins away on the south side of Waikiki Beach. Very convenient for a short walk to the beach and main strip of where most hotels are. Mountain View room has a good view of the mountain side of Honolulu. The view is not entirely just mountain as there are other high rises in the area. The balcony door is not sound proof so you can hear buses running early in the morning. The room is not very big and may not fit big luggage. It is OK for accommodating two small hand-carry luggage. It has a shower stall but no bathtub. Shower and toilet are enclosed in a small area and there isn't much space to put clothes. Toiletries such as toothpaste, bath soap bar, shampoo and conditioner are provided but toothpaste may not get refilled. The tea bags in the room are also provided but also didn't get refilled. The room looks new and clean with modern decor. The entire hotel looks very new. Hotel provides great hot breakfast for guests which features different breakfast sandwiches, hot oatmeal, rice with japanese pickles, miso soup, cold cereal, pineapple, yogurt and different kinds of juices and milk. It is convenient to have breakfast available instead of having to look for restaurants like McDonalds everyday. This is a great hotel in new condition with good breakfast. Room rate is comparable to other higher ranking hotels like Hotel Renew but their breakfast is not as comprehensive as Hyatt Place.

We were in Pali tower and the rooms are big and clean. Diamond Head tower has smaller rooms. Street noise in some rooms but the AC worked well with the balcony door closed because of noise. Coffee is fresh in the lobby everyday at 6:15 am-a real bonus since breakfast doesn't start upstairs until 6:30. Lots of electrical outlets in room and comfy beds and pillows. Breakfast gets crowded around 7:30am and then the two elevators are crowded 9-9:30 am. There is a laundy room and you can use a credit or debit card to pay $2 for each load and dryer. Dryers are hot! Pool is small and chilly but okay. Lots of places to eat nearby and we used Charley's taxi instead of renting a car, a good decision since we didn't go too far this trip. Limited food to go area in lobby and a full bar. Hibiscus gift shop and store behind lobby had good prices for Hawaii. Great staff throughout!

We loved being so close to the beach, and Waikiki's night life. It also included breakfast which was great, and saved us some money. The staff was awesome, thanks Thomas for always taking care of us, and for your help.

My husband & I are visiting from maui on our anniversary. The only request I had was a clean room. Very impressed with cleanliness, consistentsy of friendly staff, breakfast! haven't been this satisfied in a holtel in a long time.

Rooms are OK at this hotel, parking is available opposite at $12 for 24hrs, but you need to excuse the continual noise through the thin walls of the lift pinging loudly at every single floor. However, the breakfast service and a good couple of stars below the standard of the rest of the premises. The eating area is entirely outside adjacent to the swimming pool, and has no roof whatsoever. The result being that, on a day such as today (9th Sept 2012), when the area is suffering from a stiff breeze, food goes flying everywhere, which the local birds then swoop down to steal - hygiene not being a consideration. I personally made 3 trips to the bread toasting machine before I managed to get food back to my table which was not blown away. According to staff, during the "windy" season, food is served downstairs in the lobby (itself open to the elements at one end) however, it's "not windy enough" at present I am told.The breakfast itself is of a poor selection compared to other USA hotels I have stayed at in the pasted - the only hot item offered each day being a muffin with a scrambled egg patty and a piece of ham in it - no choice, no variation so far in the three days we've been down. Also offered is a rotation of tepid pancakes or waffles,a selection of low grade cereal, and bread for toasting (as long as you can stop it blowing away). No butter is offered, only a vegan oil spread which makes the toast wet, and the same monotonous, sour pineapple and melon combo is rolled out each morning. I don't know if I will be entertaining this food for the rest of my stay, I might just go and buy breakfast elsewhere. A complaint was made to the front desk this morning but I expect, like many large operations, nothing will come of it.

Good stay for the money. Bed and room was comfortable. Was on the 3rd floor, avoid it if possible as it is the same level as the pool and breakfast. Best view was of powerlines and the balcony across the street, but only used the room for sleep so a not a factor.Was checked in by a very friendly member of staff and my apologies to her as her name escapes me at present. The Valet's were very efficient and good. - No self parking. Service overall - excellent and willing to go the extra mile.Included breakfast is basic and 100% self service including scrape the plate after you are finished, with only 1 staff member on the floor pulling her hair out keeping everything topped up. Often there was a wait to get a clean plate/bowl etc. Bed very comfortable in a quiet part of Waikiki but still fairly close to everything.

Purchased a "Hotel + Car" package on expedia.ca for $1049 for 7 nights.Everything about our stay at this hotel was excellent except for 2 things:1) The rooms are VERY VERY small. We had a city view/partial water view room on the 7th floor. I can honestly say it was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. I would highly only recommend 2 people per room (and make sure you like each other). Our bathroom was very small and only had a walk-in shower.. no bathtub.2) The pillows. For some reason all 4 of the pillows we initially had smelled like wet dog. On the second night the stench was unbearable, so we called to get 4 more pillows - suggesting they burn the 4 that we had. They promptly delivered 4 more pillows. 2 of the 4 'new' pillows we had, had the same stench. Nasty.The breakfast which is included is very nice... except for the crazy, pushy, rude asian's that run around the breakfast room as if it was their last meal. Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea was nice.The service is great - never had a bad experience.The location is great as well. 1 block from the beach!Would definitely stay here again.. great value for the money! Just bring your own pillows to your room, and make sure you get your breakfast in a hurry.

Smallest room I have ever stayed in anywhere, and we upgraded! Speaking of upgrade, the promised "ocean-view" was about 50 yards of beach and ocean between some pretty ugly buildings. This when we were only one floor from the top. The pool, for this large hotel, is a very simple, ugly, conrete square about 10'x20'. It wouldn't even be a "nice" or decent pool in a lower-middle class backyard in the suburbs. No hot tub at all plus no bathtub. Really wanted to soak my foot after getting a big cut on the coral. Plus, soaking is just relaxing, and that's what vacation is about, right? The provided breakfast was fairly good, but you had better plan on eating it in your tiny room because there is only covered seating for about 20 people. If it isn't blazing hot sitting in the direct sun and eating or pouring rain (one of which is almost guaranteed), there are dozens of birds walking (and popping) all over the tables and looking to raid your plate.Staff was good. Valet parking was fast and convenient.
user_name:
Randy B
Redmond, Oregon, United States

review_body: The hotel is newly renovated, has a view of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. The hotel is only two blocks away from Waikiki beach, shopping and dining. The City Bus service is just around the corner and the buses will take you mostly everywhere. An ABC store is located around the corner, which we used for stocking up on water, chips, souvenirs, and the price is reasonable. The hotel/room is very quite, clean, modern, spacious, and also has a safe in each room. The only thing that is missing is a "MICROWAVE", but if you need to heat up your food, you may ask front desk staff to heat up your food for you. The lobby is large and pleasant, friendly staff, and continental breakfast included. I would definately recommended this hotel. One last thing to note is that the maid forgot to clean our room for one night. They cleaned the room the next morning.

Stayed here for 6 nights and overall it was a pleasant stay.Check in was smooth and they even gave us a complimentary bottle of red wine for our wedding anniversary.They have an Expedia tour representative at the lobby who was really helpful. We arranged a few tours through him.The location of Hyatt Place is really good. It was close to the beach and all the shops. The ABC store and bus stops were just round the corner. Everything was conveniently located which we thought was the best thing about Hyatt Place.We had a Mountain View room which was pretty standard and nothing special. The complimentary breakfast was good and they even provide you a tray so you can bring breakfast back to your own room.The only negative point was the night before check out we discovered one of our phone chargers were missing. We had 2 chargers plugged in the sockets and only found 1 when we returned! We reported this to helpdesk and they did handle it professionally.Despite the mishap from house keeping we did enjoy ourselves and would recommend Hyatt Place to family and friends.

Hyatt Place is one block from the Waikiki beach. It is on the same block as the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel which sits across the street from Waikiki Beach and across from the Marriott Waikiki Beach Hotel which takes up the whole block. The hotel is newly renovated since the Hyatt chain took over the old Ocean Resort Hotel. This hotel competes against hotels like the Courtyard Marriott. The rooms are very clean, and modern. We are a family of five and booked two rooms. Both rooms were king beds but one room had a sofa bed which also acts as a sitting area when all of us got together for breakfast. The free breakfast was more than adequate and there is free wireless, beach towels and even live music on the weekends. Both rooms have a shower enclosure instead of a tub and a sink outside the toilet and shower. The staff were friendly and helpful. They stored our bags during the day after we checked out as our flight home was in the evening. Bus service is just around the corner and the buses we booked for the Polynesian Cultural Centre stopped at the Marriott across the street. The Zoo is a block away and if you are driving, there is easy access to the highway from this location. An ABC store was located 20 yards away which we used for stocking up on water, chips and souvenirs. Other affordable restaurants one to two blocks away include Subway, Burger King, MacDonalds and Eggs'N Things. Hyatt was three blocks away where a Budget rent-a-car was located and was convenient for day rentals so we could avoid paying the daily parking fee.

Stayed 1 week, first time visiting Oahu. From the moment we arrived all straff we encountered were friendly and service minded. The location was great, close to beach and walking distanse to shopping and dining. If you like running I recommend the kapiolani Park area and Diamond Head rd nearby. We used the Banyan parking garage (across the street) and paid $72 for 1 week. The breakfast was ok, with a decent selection. We usually ate early and had no problems with crowds or shortage of food. Really enjoyed the option of taking breakfast to the room. Room was on the small side, but was nicely decorated and with comfy bed.

The hotel is very close to the beach and has a view of the ocean. It's nearby the shopping and food street. The room (double beds) I lived in is very big and clean, and coz I booked the hotel through a travel agency, the price was very economic.

for first timers to HNL I thought this was good location, walking distance to most we picked up a car rental for couple of days to check out the dole plantation and visit the north side of the island. its across the street from the beach. surprised at the amount of homeless type near by. Pool was a bit on the smaller size seeing how big the hotel was. Staff was great rooms had great views and clean. did the tourist thing this time I don't think I would stay here again not because of the hotel but because of the tourist mecca this part of Honolulu.

We stayed 12 nights the prices for the room were very reasonable. Initially worried about the location on the map it seems farther away from everything, but for us it was awesome close to a nice quite beach, just on the edge of hectic Waikiki, close to Kapiolani park and we walked to Diamond Head and right on all necessary bus routes. Hotel is very quite, clean, nicely decorated/furnished and the king size bed was super comfy. We had an ocean facing view and we were on the 4th floor and could just see a little bit of the Ocean. Front desk staff suggested checking with us to see if later there would be a room on a higher floor, we did check one time, but really there was not much wrong with the 4th floor, so decided to just stay there.I think they do a great job with customer service, everyone is super friendly and the fact that breakfast and in room wifi are included and printing (for those google maps) is free too.Would highly recommend and would definitely stay again.

We spent two nights at the Hyatt Place Waikiki and enjoyed it. It is about two blocks from the beach in a central location. As others have posted, the free breakfast has lots of choices-more than what appears on the hotel website--with two kinds of egg sandwiches, one of which is open faced on a bagel thin, waffles or french toast, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal. There were also breakfast choices for Japanese guests. As a Hyatt diamond we were upgraded to a king ocean view--this meant we were on a high floor and could see the ocean through openings in the buildings in front of the hotel. Our room was small--it was not a problem for us as we had only carry-on luggage but if you are staying a longer time you may want to get confirmation of room size. There is a refrigerator in the room and a huge flatscreen tv--46 inches. The bed was very comfortable. Hotel staff was courteous and helpful, there were lots of restaurants and shopping in walking distance. If you use foursquare and have a linked American Express card for promotions, keep an eye out for these promotions (for example, spend $10 get a $5 statement credit) in the area when you use the linked American Express card. We found the hotel was one, Wolfgang Puck Express a block away and Jimmy Buffett's Margarittaville.

Stayed 4 nights. Upgraded to ocean view room. Clean, new, spacious, complimentary breakfast messy but useful. Clientele is easy but place is upscale. Very Good value for money? Online minus, noise from the street and it Was 11th floor...

Booking: I made my booking via American Airlines vacations which brought the rate in the $100/night range which is about right for this property...maybe a little more but definitely wouldnt pay the rate via the Hyatt site at about $190/night as there are better properties in that price range. Arrival: I took the bus fromt the airport as I was traveling all by myself this trip and very light which worked out ok given the price of $2.50. Usually I use a private taxi service in Honolulu but I had the time and decided to save the money. It took about 1hr 10min and the bus drops off right on the corner across from the Hyatt Place with no transfer needed. Check In: They guy that checked me in was very professional and thorough and gave all the info one would need without needing to ask. Room: I had room x19 in the Diamond Tower. It was a small room with a King bed but I didnt find it too small especially for one person. If it was me and my wife and we had a couple of big bags it would have gotten crowded for sure. The biggest let down for me was the small lanai...not very much space at all so if you want to sit out and enjoy the fresh air there isnt much space especially for one person. I am coming back this weekend and will try for a room in the other tower as I think they have bigger lanais. The room has plenty of power plugs which is a HUGE plus and the TV has plenty of connections in case you bring your own entertainment. I found the bed comfortable and slept good. The chair with ottoman is comfortable and actually looked liked it pulled out to a single bed. The shower had "OK" water pressure and there was no tub. I do not like the carpet in the sink area but the Hyatt Regency has the same setup and I think it is crazy but whatever. My room also looked directly into the Ewa hotel but you will have that with this location. In all, the room is good with the exception of the lanai and the size. Internet: It is included with your room at this property and it worked surprisingly good. Usually you get what you pay for with regards to internet but no issues here. I used wired in the room and the wifi and both worked fine. They provide a wifi code when you check in. Breakfast: I was only here a couple of days and I usually have breakfast at Lulu's up the street but did check it out one morning and it looked ok for the price but the place was a bit of a zoo and just headed on over to my usual location. The breakfast is located on the 3rd floor essentially using the pool area.Dining: They have the usual Hyatt Place menu for various cooked items (microwaved is my guess?). They also had a happy hour during the evening but I did not try it out to check out the prices. There was live entertainment on Friday till about 9PM. Here is a link that has a menu of food items. http://i.waikiki.place.hyatt.com/Pool Area: The pool was really useless. You could fit a few people in there at the most so I would just go to the big pool down the street.....the ocean. Location: Best location, no. Good location, yes. You are just a couple of minutes from the beach and just a few more minutes walk to the central waikiki beach area. This property is on Kuhio which is usually a negative for me but it is at the end of Kuhio so you a bit away from the more crowded and somewhat les desirable area of Kuhio (in my opinion). A big plus is this property is almost across the street from the Banyan parking which is about the cheapest place to park in Waikiki so you dont have to walk far to get your car if you drive.Service: Ok, this is not like other Hyatt Place properties as it is really closer to a full service property. They have people to help with bags, concierge etc. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and couldnt ask for more with regards to service. Conclusion: I think this is a very solid option in Waikiki and seems to be very well run and has a lot of benefits to staying here. I will be returning next weekend and will decide after that stay if I want to bring my family here for a longer stay later this year as I just am not sure the rooms are big enough for my in-laws. Having a friendly and helpful staff goes a long way though.

Thank you Hyatt place for a very pleasant stay...still currently in the property...Your staff displayed outstanding customer service skills , from the moment we checked in ( Annabelle and another very young looking asian guy) to the time our luggages were delivered to our room ( very nice friendly guy) , everything was to our satisfaction.. On top of that, we were so delighted to have been assigned the room on the 12th floor with ocean view ( diamond head tower with 3 elevators) -- the room has 47" TV, a ref, 2 queen beds, a sofa bed, 2 balconies , free coffee and tea, safe, free breakfast( now open until 10 am:)).. it was quiet--- cant feel any swaying of the building ...the location is very close to everything-- about I disagree with those complaining about breakfast-- this is buffet style though choices are limited but get real to what you pay for esp. in Hawaii:) ..We really have nothing much to complain about except maybe, make valet daily parking rate more affordable?

This hotel is located about a 3-minute walk to the beach and stores downtown. There is an ABC store next door for any emergency item you may need, too. It was a very clean hotel. Our room was a good size with a queen bed and a pull-out sofa. We had a small balcony that gave us a view of the ocean (although somewhat obstructed by other hotels - we could still see the ocean). The bathroom had the toilet and shower in one room and the sink was separate, which I liked. However, if you got up during the night to use the toilet, and you switched on the light, it lit both areas, which could disturb the other people sleeping since the sink area was somewhat "connected" to the sleeping area without a door to divide the two areas. The towels were removed daily and replaced with fresh, and as I said, it was very clean. The free breakfast was a bonus for us. Yes, it get crowded. You sometimes had to be patient and kind and wait your turn. We thought the menu items were fine. They offered 2 types of breakfast sandwiches, some type of waffe/french toast or pancake, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal with plenty of toppings, cold cereal, pastries, a variety of juices, milk, coffee, tea, rice and toppings. We were not disappointed in the breakfast at all. Several mornings, I used the large tray from our room to get breakfast for my husband, daughter and myself and I would take it back to the room. My husband and I enjoyed ours on the balcony and daughter was happy to eat hers in bed while watching TV...that was a real treat for her. We did have a problem talking to the concierge because of long waiting lines. However, by our third day, they had hired additional staff and added hours which helped tremendously! We rented a car for four of our 12 days there, and the cost to park (valet parking) was $10/day. We also decided to have a bite to eat late in the hotel one evening before going to our room. We had drinks, pizza and a sandwich from the bar area while we watch the Olympics on their big screen TV. The bartender was super nice and it was quite relaxing and comfortable. We also noticed they had entertainment there another evening, but were were out so we didn't have an opportunity to enjoy that. This is not a "luxury hotel." We didn't expect it to be. Our stay here was very pleasant.

The hotel is 2 blocks away from the beach, although if you have an "ocean view" room you will see a little slice of the ocean from your window. The room is a bit small but had everything we needed. The bed was especially comfortable and the a/c was efficient and very quiiet. There was a substantial floor safe, small refrigerator, ironing board/iron, fliashlight attached to the ironing board area and a hairdryer. The free breakfast was great with quite a selection that changed somewhat from day to day. Oatmeal, cold cereals, varous breads, pastries, yogurts, fruit, two egg sandwiches, waffles or french toast, etc. The breakfast area is outdoors near the pool (which is small, although I never saw anyone in it). It was comfortable in mid-August with a nice breeze and plenty of shade. The staff was very efficient and helpful. We had a problem with the safe and someone was there to assist us within 5 minutes. My husband's luggage was damaged by the airline and they helped us repair it enough to get it home safely. Parking is valet only at $25/day but diagonally across the street is a public parking garage that charges only $12/day and if you book it for a week you get 7 days for the price of 6. But it's cash only. Open 24/7. Lots of stores and shops and places to eat within walking distance.

Had an early morning flight out of Honolulu and needed a hotel coming back from Hilo. This was a great find for us.The double bed room had a great set-up. Spacious and very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. It wasn't "right" on the beach (short walk) but it was a nice hotel. I would definitely consider it again when we return to the islands. This is the second Hyatt Place we've stayed in and so far we haven't been disappointed.

We stayed here for about a week in August. I read the reviewed on TripAdvisor and among other sites and when we saw a sale for $150 a night, I booked it.Location:Only a few blocks away from the beach and you can walk to all the Waikiki shops rather quickly. It's at the end of the beach so it's not nearly as congested for traffic or people. Parking is also cheaper out here. We parked at the Ashton Banyan lot, which is kitty corner from the hotel. It was $12 a day with in/out privileges and $72 for a week. It was a great bargain. Other people I knew who stayed at a hotel more central had to pay around $30 a day. There are also numerous restaurants and dining areas nearby, although we didn't eat at any of them. There is an ABC store right next door if you need water and stuff like that, but we did a Costco run and got a case of 35 bottles for $6.Hotel Amenities:Room was a decent size with a safe (perfect for locking up passports and other valuables. I liked how the sink was on the outside of the toilet and showers. There was a balcony but we never used it. TV was rather large for the size of the room, and also swivels so you can adjust it. There are also plugs by the nightstand so we can plug in our phones and stuff. Free WiFi was nice, but I did notice it was flaky and I had to rejoin it often. It wasn't like that the first few days. The free breakfast was ok. I read reviews about it being a madhouse and people had trouble finding places to sit but I didn't find it that bad. Always found a table and the birds weren't a problem. They do have different items on different days. Some days there were pancakes and others there were waffles.Overall:The hotel was in a great location and I loved how there was cheap parking really close by. The staff at the hotel are really great and accommodating. I'd definitely stay here again in the future.

Love the Hyatt place location is great just a short walk to Waikiki beach. Abc stores restraunts, fast food so close. Just around the corner from what I consider very cheap parking for Waikik(12 dollars a day). We have stayed over 4 hotels in Waikiki and were not satisfied so decided to come back to the Hyatt place this time round and love it!!!

My husband, toddler and I stayed here one night in August 2012. It is a great hotel. We would definitely recommend it to friends and family. Positives: very friendly and helpful staff (even heating up food for my toddler), minute walk to Waikiki beach, room and bathroom immaculate, large and comfy bed, included breakfast delicious and large variety. Negatives: room quite small and no bath but not a big problem.

Had a 4 night stay at the Hyatt. Room was of average size with a smallish bathroom. No bath robes and no room service menu in the room. Hated the breakfast. After our first breakfast we did not return for another one. No eggs to order and everything served was pre made with far too many people for the amount of room they had. Location was good but would not return for another stay. Pool was less than average in size and location and freezing to boot.
user_name:
Linda B
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: We were quite pleased with the Hyatt. It was clean, spacious and fresh. We had a two queen ocean view on the 20th floor. It was a great view. The bath had an added bidet seat with a warmer. That's not something we typically look for, but I know it's important for some people.The included breakfast was better than most included breakfasts with a nice selection to choose from, but ordering off the menu in a good restaurant would be better. But, for something quick and cheap, this is the way to go. The breakfast is served outside next to the pool area. Lots of birds to keep you company and clean up after you, but this is typical in the tropics.The pool is a postage stamp, but I don't think people are staying here for the pool. Waikiki Beach is just a couple blocks away. It's a straight shot to the Honolulu Zoo as well.The staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to store out bags while we hung out in Honolulu waiting for our evening flight. The lounge bar and restaurant was pretty good and again, the staff was friendly. There was even some live music. This is a perfect place for a family that wants to be close to Waikiki and does not want to spend a fortune on a hotel.

We had the time of our lives at this Hyatt Place and we travel alot! We stayed at this propety 7 nights (July 27th-August 2nd). There were 5 of us. Two adults and 3 children. We were using our points for this stay. From the minute we walked in, we were treated like royalty. Our room was in the highest floor (2039) with an amazing view. The rooms were very clean and spacious. All of the staff members were more than woderful, from the front desk, to the house keeping leaving lots of towels and shampoo without us asking for them, to the bartenders, to the food attendants at the morning breakfast! The location of this property was perfect for us. Two very short blocks from the beach, walking distance from restaurants and shops. The complementary morning breakfast was very good and having 3 children this helped alot keeping cost lower for meals. We rented a car and maybe we got very lucky but found free overnight parking on the streets adjacent to the hotel, mainly around the zoo area every night. The self parking fee was just $12.00/night which we thought it was pretty resonable for being in Waikiki beach, but if you got there late at night, which we did every night, it was full, we only tried it the first night. Valet parking was $25.00/night. We cannot wait to stay here again! After we left this property, we stayed 2 nights at the Marriot Ko'Olina Beach Club resort which is a beyond beatiful resort, but we did not enjoy it nearly as much as we enyoyed this Hyatt property, and we kept asking ourselves the reason since anyone that has stayed at this Marriot property knows what a beautiful resort this is....but there were so many reasons... Please thank all of your staff for being so great! Thank you again for this wonderful stay!Paez Family

We had 3 nights here in a deluxe 2x queen room with ocean view. The room was large and we had a view out a window but not the balcony - I think there were rooms that did have views from their balconies - the location was ok, up near the zoo and easy walking into the centre of Waikiki. The breakfast and it's setting on the 3rd floor outside is very average. The pool is small and not appealing at all, so didn't use it, the beach was far better, but of course when in Honolulu you should use the beach rather than the pool! Overall it was just ok, I don't think it stands up to the quality of the Hyatt brand and would stay elsewhere next time.

My family stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay. There were 5 of us and had a room to accommodate all of us, which was really a great value. The hot breakfast was wonderful and we really enjoyed not having to figure out what to do for breakfast each day. Good location ... only a few blocks to the beach.

Very close to the beach, but not so close as to be noisy. The room was a little small (as was the bathroom), but clean. The ocean view was nice, even with some obstructions. The free breakfast was good, but at 9 a.m. the area was MUCH too crowded (as in, zero seats available), and the two mornings I was there it was pretty windy, too - watch out for flying napkins! I'd stay here again - but take my breakfast to my room!

The flight landed early in the morning at Honolulu airport and a short taxi ride to the hotel ($40) meant that we had quite a while before the 3pm check-in. Where could we put our luggage while we ducked down to the beach (it's 2 minutes down the road)? No drama. The Aloha spirit lives on at Hyatt Place and they could take our luggage in the back room and probably check us in early (by midday). Fantastic. The time difference from Sydney (4 hours) meant that a lunch time kip was just what the doctor ordered for a big night later on.The hotel is modern, beds are good, breakfast is good* (but a bit busy), staff are great.We would come back.*think egg and bacon rolls but on a scone, pineapple and cereal.

We stayed here for a week with family. Awesome place, only a short strolll to the beach, ABC store nearby ( and also a small giftshop and convenience store in the hotel ), free breakfast every morning and the rooms are fantastic, very luxurious, modern and clean! Staff members are very helpfull and friendly, we were very sad to leave!!!

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place for 10 days with my 18 and 15 year old sons. We originally booked a Mountain View Room with 2 Queen beds and a sofa pull out. On arrival I asked if we could have an Ocean View Room. The front desk staff member advised this was possible but it would be a King bed and much smaller sofa bed. We decided to risk it and checked in. Arriving in our room we realised it would be way too small, when I returned to the desk they were great about putting us back in the Mountain View room. That room turned out to be great. Two very comfortable Queen beds and a full sofa pullout. Two separate areas in the room plus two small balconies with a combination of city and mountain views. The pillows were too squishy for our liking but hardly a big problem.The free breakfast was fantastic every morning, although it would be great if it went longer than 9am on weekdays - most people staying in Waikiki are on holidays after all, however, when my sons didn't want to get up I just made use of the tray in the room and took them some breakfast.We got towels from reception every day to go to the beach and ordered room service for dinner a couple of nights which was priced VERY reasonably - you would pay a ridiculous amount in an Australian hotel. Free wifi also a great bonus.We used the gym which was well equipped and clean and yes the pool is small but who cares when you're a tiny walk from beautiful Waikiki beach. We booked a dolphin watch and snorkelling day trip through the Expedia consultant in the foyer that was a fantastic.The hotel is beautifully clean and nothing looks tired and worn out as in so many other hotels. It was also REALLY quiet, we were right around the corner from the elevators (in the tower which had 3 elevators) and yet heard very little noise and slept really well. I've stayed in many other hotels where you're kept awake by people coming and going all night. We had no problem with noise from the a/c either.Mahalo to all staff who were friendly and very helpful when we needed it. Great holiday!

Recently stayed at the Hyatt Place and I was impressed with everything and everyone. The rooms are a very generous size and the balconies are excellent for seeing the ocean from our ocean-view room. All staff helpful and friendly. 2 blocks from the beach.Highly recommend!!!!!!

We have just spent a week at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki and would highly recommend this hotel. First, the location is perfect - it's in the quieter part of Waikiki - one block to the beach and the zoo. There is an ABC store next door, excellent for stocking up on water, wine, etc.The breakfast is an excellent added bonus. I have read other reviews that complain about the breakfast - I'm not sure what people expect - but the breakfast was EXCELLENT. There are several choices, and the staff are constantly refilling and topping up supplies. The breakfast area is on the third floor patio, by the swimming pool, and yes, it gets busy, but we never had a problem finding a table. It also gets a bit windy - but its a welcome relief from the heat of the sun.We did have an small issue with our room upon arrival (we were a family of 3 and our room was only meant for 2) - however, the hotel staff made sure that we were moved the very next day to a City view room with a king bed and a double sofa bed. Thank you again to the staff who made this happen for us.Overall, we would not hesitate to recommend the Hyatt Place - the staff are friendly and helpful, the hotel is roomy and airy and the location is perfect.

We stayed here for three nights in July. We checked in late at around 10 PM. I had earlier called in about our late arrival. Check-in was smooth. They had advertised valet parking but the valet said that the parking is full but that parking is available at a nearby hotel. So we decided to park at this place and guess what, that was also full. So we drove around for about an hour and found nothing. Came back to the hotel and they suggested another hotel and luckily after about 1-2 hours after check-in we found a place to park. The valet 'assured' me that this is normal if you arrive late and besides it is cheaper to park elsewhere, so why should I trouble him at this late hour?The room on the 19th floor was very good with good maid service. No microwave in the room but there was a refrigerator and coffee machine. The breakfast was excellent with good kitchen/cleaning staff. There is a bar in the lobby but the grumpy bartender wants you to sit at the bar and drink even though there is a nice comfortable lounge nearby. There is a small place to buy food etc but you can easily buy everything you need at the ABC store one block away.All computers are normally occupied mostly by children. I tried to print my boarding passes but never got the chance until next day early morning. I was really excited and finally I printed the boarding passes. But unfortunately the printer had no ink. I asked the front desk and they sent someone with a new cartridge but it was for the wrong printer. So that did not work out.Except for these 'minor' issues the stay was good.

We are very happy that we chose the Hyatt Place Waikiki hotel for our vacation stay. Although the hotel is not beach front, it is only one block (2 to 3 minutes walk) from the waikiki beach. The free breakfast buffet saved us quite a bit of money for our family because a couple of coffee and a small container of fruit can run you ten dollars. Free Wifi and no resort fee!!!

Standard hotel, but although we booked a double room, (we were 4 traveling)_, the room we got on arrival had a king and a single pullout. They fixed this the next day with a lot of wrangling, put us in a double queen room, but as they were checking us into the second room, someone arrived and were in the same situation, too many people for a king+1. The check-in clerk admitted that "95% of their rooms" are king+1. This should be advertised somewhere on their website.

Our behalf of my family I am writing this review. THANK YOU TO ALL THE WONDERFUL STAFF at the Hyatt Place!! The SPIRIT OF ALOHA in every staff member made my family who came to visit from the state,very HAPPY. THEY FELL IN LOVE WITH HAWAII.....and the people! They are considering to retire here in Oahu.From checkin to check out the spirit of true ALOHA lives.They talked about the excellent breakfast buffet..its crowded for a reason! Room was brand New you can't get that....for the price with this kind of location! lobby open fresh air..peaceful.Overall they are now filled with ALOHA! and they wanted to say MAHALO for making their stay a wonderful memory.To the staff and management, especially to each staff. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts. YES MY FAMILY STOP TO SMELL THE ROSES AT THE HYATT PLACE. ALOHA TO ALL on behalf of my visiting family I thank you.

The lasting impression of the Hyatt Place hotel for me and my family is the friendly, helpful and very accommodating staff employed here. Everyone we encountered was eager to assist and generous with advice. Thomas, in particular, was gracious, diligent and expedient in effecting a room change for us when we had a problem with our first room. Ultimately, we loved the layout of our spacious room, furnished with 2 very comfortable beds and roomy sofa, as well as a lanai overlooking Kuhio Avenue. The sink and vanity are separate from the toilet/shower, which was convenient for our family. The flat screen tv was enjoyed by us all, and although we did not partake, there was also a small coffeemaker with coffee, as well as an assortment of teabags. The refrigerator and room safe were a good size.The breakfast included the following items each morning: 2 different hot sandwiches, either french toast, waffles or pancakes on a rotating basis, a variation of pastries, cinnamon rolls and/or mini muffins, granola, raisin bran and oat cereal, bagels, bread, strawberry and plain yogurt, oatmeal, fresh pineapple & melon, fruit puree, juices (tomato, apple, orange), milk (skim, 1%), starbucks coffee, various teabags, and a selection of Japanese food choices (rice, tofu, miso soup, etc.). It was adequate, but rather crowded at times. It was also windy most days, so a table by a wall or eating back at the room was more comfortable.The hotel's location was very convenient. Around the corner on Kuhio Avenue were bus stops, down the block towards the beach were trolley stops (in front of the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel) which we rode to and from the Ala Moana Shopping Center and Waikiki Beachwalk. There are many shopping and food establishments within easy reach. Just up the block from the Hyatt Place, half way to the beach, was an ABC store which we stopped at daily for water, snacks and souvenirs. Another minute farther, across Kalakaua Avenue, is beautiful Waikiki Beach. It was always busy there, but we never had trouble finding room to relax and enjoy the view.The hotel provides beach towels at the front desk, which we used for the beach as well as for snorkeling at Hanauma Bay. The hotel cafe was very convenient for a quick burger or snack when we were too tired to go out. The two gift shop have an excellent selection of souvenirs, surprisingly well priced!!!When it was time to leave, it was Thomas again who expediently checked us out, called us a cab, and bid us farewell. Overall, this hotel was an excellent choice for us. Its staff is superb. We would stay here again, and would recommend it without hesitation.

We booked the Deluxe City View room as we needed to accommodate 5 people. There were 2 queen bed and a sofa bed. The room is clean and larger than the typical motel, pillows are too soft to my taste. We stayed from 7/15/12 to 7/19. We booked late and paid the 21 day advance purchase rate of $254/night plus tax.You need to learn quickly to set the AC otherwise nights will be cold. Our room faces north and although we were on the 16th floor the only thing you will see are the massive 30 story towers between the Hyatt Place and the canal. Don't expect any view. Room and bathroom were clean. There was a flat screen TV with all the connectivity to connect your own device, i.e. iPad, portable DVD player, video game console. You will have to bring your own cable. This is typical for all Hyatt Place hotel.Free internet is provided.Breakfast was good although I expected some papaya, banana and apple but none were on the menu. We had english muffins with eggs/bacon or half bagel with egg/ham, yogurt, cottage cheese, cereal, pineapple chunks, cantaloupe, waffle, apple juice, oj, tomato juice, milk, real coffee, kim chee (yes), rice, toffu, danish pastries and I might have forgotten one several more items. Front desk staffs were very friendly as I frequently asked for hot water.We didn't use the pool, spa or gym.My complains are that there are only 2 elevators and sometimes you will have to wait. Also a family of 5-6 will have to wait to use the bathroom/shower. There is no microwave oven. If you have a baby/toddler, you will have to get hot water from the front desk and keep it in a thermos bottle. At home we use the microwave to boil water and sanitize baby's stuffs but here forget about sanitizing milk bottles, nipples, etc... If you rent a car, you can park at the canal (free) or on the street near the zoo (free from 6pm to 7am during week day). It's a very short walk. Very short walk to Waikiki beach too.Overall I like the hotel but next time I'll book somewhere else because I need a microwave oven.

The Hyatt Place is severely underrated. The staff is great, friendly and helpful. The front desk staff helped us with planning trips, bus routes and he best way to get around. The free buffet breakfast offers a wide variety of food and quick, courteous service. The location of the hotel is excellent with access to the beach and away from the crowded, bigger and possibly overpriced hotels. The lobby is clean, airy and relaxing. All staff are extremely helpful. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Room had 2 queen size very comfortable beds with living area with a couch and chair. Equipped with mini fridge, large flat screen t.v. Stay included a great free breakfast every morning. Great location close to beach, shopping, buses,bars & restaurants. Friendly helpful staff. Would return to this hotel again and recommend to others. One thing I didn't care for, was the small pool and no spa by the pool.
user_name:
Randy B
Bend, Oregon, United States

review_body: The front desk staff (Leilani checked us in) always accomodated the questions posed...very helpful bellmen holding bags after check out. Good breakfast for free...Yuko and the staff worked very diligently to keep the tables and floors clean and keep the traffic of people flowing. This property is well maintained with clean rooms and comfortable beds. Will not hesitate to recommend as well as re booking with this property. Well done!

Hyatt Place is a great place to stay. The free breakfasts were very helpful to keep us on budget and while the area around the pool is windy, we ate breakfast here every day. We had 2 types of hot sandwiches, pancakes or waffles, pineapple, bread, bagels and pastries, Starbucks coffee and juices. You also have the option of using the tray provided in your room and going up to your room with your breakfast. We were given an Ocean View room which was very kind and while we asked for 2 queen beds and got a king bed and pull out couch (not really an issue for us), we still think this is one of the best places to stay - and the MOST comfortable beds ever! Our housekeeper, Adela, was a joy to deal with as she was efficient, and helpful (she was great with information about Oahu). Front desk staff was very helpful as well. Beach towels can be obtained at the front desk and just across the front desk is a little basket full of apples if you need a snack. The front desk also has a bus schedule. The beach is less than a 2 min walk down the street and an ABC store is right next door. Wolfgang Puck is at the end of the street, across from the beach. The beach as you walk down the street is walled in so it is protected from the waves (and surfers) making it more enjoyable to swim. The waves can be seen coming over the top of the wall when the tide comes in. It was full when we arrived but luckily I’d arranged for a day room (you do have to pay for this) as we had a very late flight out and needed the room until 8pm as they do not have a courtesy room. I’d highly recommend this place for cleanliness and efficiency.

My mom and I stayed here for 8 nights during the first week of July, 2012.We had a basic room on the second floor with a wonderful and very comfortable queen size bed, and with a balcony which had no view, but the back of the hotel. That part didn't really matter to us because we didn't pay for an ocean view room.Once again, the bed was extremely comfortable. The room was a decent size and very clean. It was cleaned every day and fresh towels were available to us.The ladies at the front desk were nice and helpful. We had some problems with my mom's credit card and the issue was arranged within less than 24 hours by them. So we are grateful for their fast and positive handling of the situation.The bartender, Nick, and also the one in training at that point, Adam, were extremely nice, friendly, and helpful answering our basic questions about the island. They also made good Mai Tai drinks. Lucia, the housekeeper, was very nice and did a wonderful job cleaning our room.The hotel is 2 blocks away from the beach. It is 1 block away from an ABC store. It is really in a convenient location to everything.The buses stop right in front of the hotel, so if you want to adventure out on a city bus, how we did since we didn't have a rental car, you can do it in a fast and safe manner.The hotel overall is very clean and you can tell it was newly renovated.The breakfast area is on the third floor of the hotel. They start serving breakfast at 6:30am and I believe it goes until 9am. My mom and I were there usually around 7am. The place was always packed, regardless of the time we went to eat. They offer a variety of breakfast foods and they are always fresh. After a few days you do get sick of it, but I still believe that it is a cheaper option than paying 20 dollars for 1 person for a 3 egg omlette. So if you are picky than I suggest you find that place and spend your money. Unfortunately, the area for the breakfast is extremely windy, it is like a corridor between some tall buildings. If it rains than I suggest you take your food with you to the room. There are only a few places to sit under a roof, but those are taken very soon.The pool is very small and is on the same third floor. I've seen 1 person use it during our week long stay. Why would you even use it when the ocean is 2 blocks away?Ohh, and they have freshly brewed Starbucks coffee for breakfast every day which is liked by many of the American guests. Although I would like the hotel to brew the Kona coffee to support their own Hawaiian brand. The room, at nights, was a bit noisy because of the deliveries going on in the back and also from the people walking on the street. We didn't really mind that as we were exhausted from our days on the beach and on the island. I think this is a good hotel, very conveniently located to Kuhio, Sans Souci, and the Waikiki beach.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size and they allowed our family of 5 ( kids 6,8,10) to stay in one room which made it a very good price compared to many other local hotels. I usually don't like to have the whole family in one room but it worked well with big rooms and a frosted glass partition between beds and couch. My travel agent told me we would need two rooms but when I booked the room on booking.com they allowed us in one room - I ditched the agent at this point! We were in a deluxe room with 2 queens which was nicely decorated and very clean. The breakfast was really good, although the breakfast area/ pool a little tired ( sure didn't look as good as on the photos!). It was a little noisy but then the whole area probably is. A few blocks off the beach and 10 min walk into the main Waikiki area. Very family friendly - always handing the kids colouring things, buckets and spades, etc etc. my only dislike was the lifts- two lifts for about 18-19 floors meant walking was generally the best option even though we were on level 14. Seemed like good value compared to many others in the area

Was told we were upgraded at check in, but our room was so small - nothing like the photos! Just as small as our hotel room in NYC.. and that was tiny. Also not a fan of the bathroom layout.Service was great, free computers/ internet access was very handy. Would have loved to try the breakfast but we had a very early flight. Overall, was an adequate room for the one night.

after changing rooms on the 11th floor,as we wanted beach view but had to catch glimpses through the buildings in front we got a 'disabled' room on the 7th floor facing the mountans. Huge room with small lounge room with 2nd TV....great space and large bathroom,but no bath. Free breakfast is good, but only till 9am during the week,and we want to sleep in!Pool area on 3rd floor is extremely windy with very small pool,so a little disappointing,but the beach is very close as an alternative.Bed and pillows were great.

This hotel is located one block from the beach. The staff there are friendly and really helpful. The room was on the 12th floor and was a double. It was a large room, the beds were comfortable, the room tastefully decorated and it offered a view of the beach. It also offered free wifi. The bathroom was decently large as well and offered a nice amenity kit, including toothpaste. There is a complimentary breakfast for guest from 6:30am - 9:30am. The hotel lobby is nice, and the bar is reasonably priced and open at all hours. I believe this hotel is a bargain compared to other hotels in the area and does its best to help guest, including checking us in early even though we arrived at noon. The only downside is that even though we were on the 12th floor you can easily hear noise from the street including car alarms, horns, etc. Also there are only two elevator cars for our side of the hotel and they are not that quick so plan a few minutes for reaching the lobby from the rooms.
user_name:
Nathan E
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights before moving on to Kailua. Due to a flight delay of nearly 7 hours we didn't arrive until 1.30 AM (by which time we had been up for more than 20 hours) but check in went reasonably smoothly, although we didn't really appreciate being advised to turn up for breakfast as soon as possible after 6 AM as "sometimes its all gone after the first hour!" In the event we took our chances and went down for breakfast on the pool terrace at around 8.15 AM, and there was still plenty of food available for everyone although the selection is fairly limited and it was rather chaotic, with no tables immediately available and a strong breeze blowing. Breakfast finishes at 9 AM on Monday to Friday which seems absurdly early for vacationers (10 AM at weekends is more civilised) but apart from one day when the danish pastries had all gone, we had no problem in getting what we wanted, although after the first morning we chose to take it back to our room to eat rather than hang around for a table.The room itself (cheapest available) was rather small but clean, modern & tastefully decorated. We didn't really use the lanai as it was very narrow, faced other high-rise buildings across the sidestreet, and didn't get any sun. On arrival the fridge wasn't operating - we reported it on our first morning but when we returned to our room late in the day there was still no sign of life! This time they sent an engineer straight up and it turned out that it wasn't plugged in, although there was no way you would know this unless you had managed to wrestle it out of its fitted surround - not something a guest should be expected to attempt!Like most affordable options around Waikiki, the pool is very small and not really suitable for a swim, nor is the terrace particularly inviting for sunbathing (only 5 sunbeds out at breakfast although they might put out more later in the morning). You are, however, only a few minutes walk from Kuhio Beach Park with its large beach pool, and the front desk will provide you with fresh beach towels every day to take with you. We also tried out the Hilton lagoon area and the beach in front of the Pink Palace, but actually found that we preferred the beach right on our doorstep. Hiring beach-beds, umbrellas, etc. seemed uniformly expensive right across Waikiki, so if you can take along your own bathing accessories you should save yourself quite a bit of money.Whilst in the room we did quite frequently hear a noise that we originally thought was the wind howling, however, it would appear that is was actually linked to something mechanical (possibly a lift shaft or ice-making machine), although we never quite pinned down what the cause was - thankfully we never heard it too late in the day or overnight. Otherwise I would say that the hotel makes a comfortable and adequate base provided you are planning on eating out a lot (in-house catering options are very limited), and don't envisage spending too much of your day in the hotel itself. The free internet access proved very useful, and by-and-large the front desk staff were fairly helpful.Eating out in Waikiki actually proved to be more of a challenge than we had anticipated - this hotel is on the eastern periphery of town so you will generally need to head westwards for eating options. Most restaurants seem to be attached to hotels or located in shopping malls, and the few options that enjoyed sea-facing locations seemed exhorbitantly expensive. Nearly all the decent affordable options were big and busy, and at dinner involved waiting for a table for up to half an hour - the food itself was generally good but service was very in-your-face and you tended to feel that they were trying to move you on as soon as you'd put your cuttlery down so the next paying (and tipping!) customer could be wheeled in. Certainly the restaurants we visited didn't feel conducive to enjoying a leisurely drink after your meal. Self-catering in Waikiki might be problematical, too, as there seemed to be a dearth of conveniently located supermarkets, so you might well find yourself confined to the limited options provided by the ubiquitous ABC convenience stores (on virtually every corner and attached to virtually every hotel). If you want something a bit more relaxed and convivial then you might well be better off basing yourself in somewhere like Kailua, which seemed more convenient for self catering as well as having quieter restaurants. Public bus transport on the island is cheap and fairly regular, so it should be feasible to travel between Kailua / Honolulu / Waikiki without too much difficulty, although we never actually tried it. Undoubtedly the beaches and climate are Waikiki's prime draw, and if you want to do it on a relatively modest budget then I would say that the Hyatt Park represents a fairly decent option. If, however, you are looking for the "wow" factor then I would suggest you look elsewhere although the chances are you will need to have extremely deep pockets!

I chose this Hyatt property because of the free breakfast. I was surprised to find so much more. When I first stepped onto the property, I immediately noticed the friendliness of the staff. The reception desk was extremely accommodating when I asked them to secure 9 pieces of luggage for 7 hours prior to us checking in. This friendliness was further evident in the valet drivers, bellhops, and the staff operating the morning buffet. When my oldest child was sick for one day, the staff went the extra mile to make sure sheets were routinely changed throughout the day and that all our needs were met. The friendliness of this hotel is truly remarkable, a testimony to the hotel's senior management for establishing such a culture. Parking. Parking is challenging anywhere in Honolulu. This is our third trip to this island and we knew what to expect. Unlike other cities, the hotels in Honolulu do not have shuttle busses to pick up patrons at the airport and take them to the hotel. Instead, you must either take a taxi or rent a car. Taxis will cost from 30-40 dollars each way. If you choose to use a taxi to arrive at the property, you can use the Honolulu trolley, which has several lines to choose from, to explore the Waikiki/Honolulu area. However, I wouldn't visit Oahu without visiting the other parts of the island where I believe the true beauty lies. To explore the island you will have to hire a driver, join a tour bus, or rent a car. If you choose to rent a car, you have two options to park at the Hyatt Place. For $25 per day you can have the valet park your car, which I suggest. The other option is to use a public parking deck across the intersection from the property. This will cost half as much.Breakfast. Many people choose this Hyatt property because of the breakfast which is included in the daily rate. It is a good deal and was one of the main reasons I chose to stay at the property. The breakfast area is located on an open terrace on the third floor. It is somewhat odd entering the breakfast area. First you must pass through an external door which first looks as if you are entering a maintenance area. You then pass by the hotel's pool which is one of the smallest I have ever seen for a major hotel. The breakfast area is modern, clean, and is designed to handle lots of people. There is a large array of breakfast options. I stayed clear of the "breakfast sandwiches" which were not tempting to me at all. My kids did try them and they were not impressed with the quality. Don't worry though. The oatmeal options, fruit, and yogurt were outstanding and worth it all. One last thing about breakfast, the eating area is an open terrace located between the hotel's two large tower structures. As a result, there is a lot of wind moving through that area in the morning. Don't forget to wear a jacket or sweater to combat the wind.The Room. We easily fit our family of five in a room with two double beds. One child slept on the oversized sofa with no problem at all. The room was large, clean, and modern in design. Our room was located on the 14th floor on the street side. As a result, we could hear lots of road noise even with the patio door shut. This hotel is a good choice for families staying in the Honolulu area.
The Hyatt place @ Waikiki beach is one of the best good price very clean and the staff are the best

Stay-Monday, July 9, 2012. Used the Hyatt as a one night stopover on the way home from Kauai. Check-in staff worked to accommodate our request for ocean view/upper story room (12th floor, oceanish view...). Were unable to accommodate our early checkin request due to hotel at capacity. Checkin staff was very helpful. Since we couldn't checkin early, they checked our bags, parked the car (Valet=$25/day; self park offsite=$12/day USE THE VALET...) and got us into the pool area. Room was clean, open, and airy. Linens fresh, shower clean, etc. We did have a problem with a clogged drain in the sink (We had only used it to wash hands and put nothing down it) and then the drain started to leak under the sink. Maintenance quickly there, quickly fixed, at 9:30pm! When we brought in CPK food, desk lady grabbed us plates and forks to take to our room. I'd give the staff "6" if I could. Everyone was helpful, attentive and friendly. Very laid-back casual, chic atmosphere. This hotel is NOT on the beach, but close. Pool is small, sheltered and on the 3rd floor. We didn't try the breakfast since we left too early (5:45am) and breakfast didn't start until 6:30am. Elevators required your room key to unlock upper floors. Oh, my two teens liked the room, fwiw... :-)

We stayed at this hotel for a week as my partner was in Hawaii for work. The rooms were really big and we had a view of the water. The first night I was on the 14th floor, then got an ocean room on the 18th floor. The hotel was full when we are here which meant the elevators were painfully slow. The perks, great rooms, comfortable beds, breakfast was ok in the am but was too crowded, always clean and the location. The down side is the wait at elevators, the pool is small and on the 3rd floor where its very windy. I did not use the pool at all but went to the beach. We had a car and had to wait for the valet to bring it it us which sometimes took a long time due to traffic in the area. It was a very nice hotel though and we enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect walking distance to everything.

I just returned from a four-night stay at the Hyatt Place Waikiki and was very satisfied with this hotel. Most important to me, my room was spotless and there was no bedspread, everything you see and touch is freshly laundered. The comfort of the bed was also in the top three of hotel beds I've slept in (bettered only by business stays at Ritz-Carlton and St. Regis) - I wish I could have taken it home with me. I was in an ocean-view king that was on the small side, but very attractive. The entire hotel was attractive and well-kept.For me, the included breakfast was perfect - biscuit sandwiches (egg, bacon, cheese, etc.), waffles, pancakes, little pastries, toast, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit and more (including Japanese-style breakfast items). It was obvious that someone cared that the food was presented well and kept clean (again, a BIG deal for me, especially with buffets). Yes, the area got a bit hectic at times - lots of people going different directions. Tip: find a place to sit first (have someone hold the table). If you're solo like me, there's comfortable couch seating that works really well. Every Hyatt Place employee I encountered during my stay went out of his or her way to be nice and helpful (though I do think they were slightly understaffed, especially in housekeeping). For the reviewer who said there was no concierge, I can personally vouch for the fact that there was. I walked by his desk every time I came and went and he was there helping people - probably the hardest-working concierge I have ever seen. There are also computer workstations in the lobby where you can check-in for your flight, research excursions, even print free-of-charge, which was a nice surprise.I am a fan of this hotel and would recommend it to anyone! It might be a few extra steps to the beach (you'll be surprised to see how really close it is), and there's no room service, but it's a clean, pleasant, comfortable, attractive and reasonably-priced home base in Waikiki - the best I've stayed in yet.

Rooms were nice, big and clean. This is one of the few hotels in the area that have 2 queen beds in a room, which is why we chose it. We had a nice view of the ocean. Service was prompt when I requested extra towels. However, we were very dissapointed in the infrastructure of the hotel. Whoever designed this place didn't think it through. There are 2 elevators to serve 20 floors with many rooms on each. Always had to wait at least 5+ mins for an elevators. When the elevator did arrive, it was frequently full and we had to wait for another. We were so tired of waiting once, we took the stairs - 17 flights! Pool is tiny. Breakfast area is way too small to serve the number of people. We had to fight for a seat. There is no one clearing and washing tables. Dirty dishes that you had to bus yourself were stacked up and overflowing for the birds to fly down and pick through. Food was not kept well stocked so even when you did fight through the crowds there was nothing to grab. Very glad we were only here 1 night.

We were very particular in deciding upon a waikiki hotel for our family vacation. In reading other reviews of other hotels, I was apprehensive about being nickel-and-dimed during our stay, as it appeared from many reviews that was standard practice for hotels in the honolulu/waikiki area. However, at the end of our stay, we had absolutely no incidental charges on our bill. (NOTE that we did not use the hotel valet parking; we chose to self-park at a nearby garage with lower rates). Included in our stay were the following: beautiful room w/ small lanai with a partial ocean view (view was obscured by nearby buildings but was still a good view); free breakfast; free in-room safe; free in-room wifi; free in-room coffee; free newspaper; and free use of beach towels to take to the beach and return when done. Fresh beach towels every day = wonderful! My kids were given free Hyatt Place sand toys/buckets to use as well. :) Friday night there was live music in the lobby. There were NO resort fees.The room was gorgeous, clean, and had everything we needed. We had a spacious room with two queen beds. There was plenty of room.
