I liked how the bathroom vanity area was separate from the rest of the bathroom. There was also a nice sitting area in the room. We did not experience any issues or problems with noise, either from adjacent rooms or from the outside/street area.The open-air lobby areas were very pretty. This hotel is not directly on the beach but is about a 2-minute walk. The heart of the area, which appeared to be in front of the Royal Hawaiian/Outrigger/Moana Surfrider, was within walking distance as well. If you are hesitant to book this hotel due to location (as I was - I thought ity would be too far from the beach) - don't worry about it - it is a non-issue - everything is very close.The breakfast was a real money saver. Advertised prices for similar buffets in the area were around $20/pp. Food/restaurants in the area are very expensive and it was great to save the money by not worrying about breakfast. This was not the typical made-in-advance and left on the counter type of hotel breakfast. It had many everyday items that we enjoyed - steel-cut oats with berry sauce, nuts/seeds, all the fixings; freshly made breakfast sandwiches that were being made right on the spot and were on a daily rotation so they changed a little every day (also, these were not just egg-bread-bacon sandwiches; they had gouda, muenster, guacamole, spinach, tomatoes etc.) My daughter has a dairy allergy and I simply ordered hers w/o cheese everyday - this 'special order' request was always handled with a smile and promptly served up, although they were very busy, and I really appreciated that. There were also pancakes, waffles, various yogurts, juices, bagels etc. and HUGE heaping bowls of fresh pineapple - (delicious!!) We were so happy with the breakfast here. Yes, the pool area is a wind tunnel in the morning, as other reviewers have stated, but the benefit here outweighs that small inconvenience of that. Plus it was nice to eat breakfast outside every day.We only used the pool once during our vacation. Although it had been important to me to book a hotel with a pool, we were at the ocean for all of our swimming! The pool was open until 10pm and is lit at night, which my kids did enjoy the one time they swam. All in all, a great experience for us. We were very happy with this hotel. Everyone at this hotel was extremely helpful and genuinely friendly. I would definitely recommend the Hyatt Place.

I would like to strongly disagree with the person below who disparages the staff at the Hyatt.The management there should be commended for having some of the friendliest and most helpful employees we have ever encountered in our trips all over the globe!Angelina who works at the front desk was especially helpful on numerous occasions and (if anyone at Hyatt reads this) she should be strongly considered for a management position. They could not promote anyone who is more professional, knowledgeable or helpful.Mahalo nui loa for a fantastic stay!David and Frances MesserBig Island Rentalshttp://community-2.webtv.net/tideldave/doc

My wife & I stayed at this hotel on 12th & 13th June 2012. We travelled from Sydney, Australia.The hotel is very smartly appointed but is really like a "tarted up" motel. The service was very ordinary:1. No concierge or porter was available to assist us (The hotel doesn't employ any).2. The check in desk was small and understaffed for peak periods. When we checked in, our room wasn't available at 2:00pm. We had to pay for an upgrade to be moved to another room. 3. The cleaning staff was non-existent. We had to request that our room be serviced, and when it was, it was only done on the second day.4. No toiletries or other materials were supplied during our stay (only toilet paper).5. The "free" breakfast was a complete disaster. If you want to see UGLY AMERICANS go to a free breakfast at this hotel. The food was terrible, the quality and the service was appalling. It was a 'buffet style' but more like a 'bun fight'. People were scrambling over each other to get to the food as it was put out. The choice of food was minimal, some of which I could not actually identify as food. The cutlery & crockery was all totally misplaced and in illogical positions.The only good points about this hotel were:1. the rooms were clean and the air-con worked;2. it was only 1 1/2 blocks away from Waikiki beach.I would not recommend this hotel as it is GROSSLY OVERPRICED for the service level it offers.

The room were very clean and we appreciated the value we found in our room that slept our family of 6 for our couple of days on the strip. Short walk to beach and restaurants/shopping. Liked that elevators required your room key to activate made us feel abit more secure. Breakfast included in our room fees was a plus although after a few days food was all the same and you had to sometimes fight for a seat on the patio that was clean as many guests left their plates on the tables. Only negatives were make sure you know if your room is prepaid or not, booked online for special pricing and secured room with credit card however it was not charged until we arrived and that was an unexpected expense on our first day. Also, room was reserved for 6 but housekeeping kept leaving just 4 towels, alittle frustrating when you are the last to shower. The pool is not heated so don't expect to use it as it was freezing cold and if you head to the beach, make sure you have brought your own towels as the hotels are not allowed out of the hotel.

The service was good. Check-in was quick we were upgraded to the penthouse. It had two comfortable double beds. There was a balcony with two chairs and table. It looked to the hillside. The room was clean. We needed shampoo and extra towels and they were brought to us promptly. The bathroom was small. There wasn't anywhere to lay down clothes. The breakfast buffet had a good variety of items to choose from. Since it was at the end of the strip it was quieter and less hectic. Around the corner from the hotel was the Honolulu Zoo and a short drive to Diamond Head.

I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Our room was very nice and clean, had two queen beds, very comfortable bed and pillows, near the beach. There are 4 computers in the lobby which are also free to use. Breakfast is a bonus but I would suggest to have fried eggs, ham or bacon since they have white rice for breakfast. Love this hotel!

Took the family to Waikiki this week and decided to stay at the Hyatt Place partly because of the reviews from fellow trip advisor biyaheros. Checked in last night and making it our home for a week. We have a two queen bed with a pullout, room fits 5 people nicely, room is clean, good size with a mountain view. The beds are comfortable but not a big fan of the bathroom design though, where the sink is outside the washroom. Room also has soundproofing issues as you can hear the road noise so for people with sleeping problems, you might want to reconsider. Free wi-fi and breakfast but selection is limited. If you're staying at the hotel for more than a few days, you will definitely get tired of it, we had it this morning and already talking about going somewhere else for tomorrow. Staff here are friendly, the gentleman who checked us in is very welcoming and so is the housekeeping lady assigned to clean our room. Location is excellent though, not on the main strip but definitely not far from the beach, shopping, ABC convenience stores and restaurants. Took the cab from the airport to the hotel and it cost us about $34. Overall, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable, with some freebies and in a good location place to stay in Waikiki the Hyatt Place will fit the bill. I could recommend this place.

We upgraded to ocean view which you get to see a very little piece of the ocean since there are so many other hotels in the way. The room was nice, clean and average. The street that the hotel is on has many bus stops, its very busy. We sleep pretty heavy so the noise never woke us up. Free breakfast is great because its free breakfast. It does get seriously windy in the area where you eat. Pool is small but who needs the pool when the ocean is a block away! There is a abc store next door which is convienent. Free wifi and towels for the beach! We do wonder why the hotel serves starbucks coffee instead of Kona or some other hawaiian coffee...

We are staying here now. We have a nice clean room with a nice view. The staff has been wonderful. The food we ordered from room service was excellent! It's only a block from the beach. I will recommend this hotel to people I know.

Just returned from spending 7 nights in the Hyatt Place and had the most wonderful time. The rooms were big and as many people have commented on trip-advisor the beds are incredibly soft and comfortable.The location is just perfect for the short walk to Waikiki beach and shops, all the restaurants and night life to suit all tastes close by. The staff were so friendly and could not do enough for us, especially one member of staff called Lyn. The buffet breakfast had so much choice from cereal, fruit, egg/bacon rolls, yoghurts, juices toast etc., after 7 days any buffet becomes mundane as you know what to expect. There was always an abundant supply of free coffee in the room, reception and breakfast area. I had heard the breakfast area was outside and was shared with the local flock of birds, well it did not prove to be a problem for us, and you did have the option of taking a tray back to your room if you wanted to.I would definitely return to this hotel next time I stay in Waikiki and would certainly recommend it to friends and family, the cost, location and service were outstanding.Also thanks to the Manager who sorted a little problem out very promptly I believe his name was Tom.

I found this place at the last minute and it was just perfect.. It was newly renovated and totally clean.. The only problem was a part of the hotel was still under constraction so the noise can be a problem sometimes.. Almost at the end of Waikiki beach but has an abc store next door and trolley stop was 10 steps away..

We spent a week at this hotel in March, 2012 (myself, teenage son, teenage daughter) and found it to be excellent, especially as we got a terrific rate since the hotel was just renovated and opened under a new name/hotel line. I don't know what it previously had been, but I believe it was completely "re-done." The room was perfect for our needs! We had two double beds, plus the couch pulled out to a bed, which was handy since my teens are both nearly full-grown and this allowed us to not have to squeeze in and share. Mini-fridge in room was very helpful, as was the coffee maker. The morning breakfast was VERY wonderful! The fresh berry/fruit mix was incredibly yummy and, when added ontop of the yogurt, was so delish! They had a couple of different breakfast sandwiches each day that were also yummy, as well as a few other items to choose from. Free wifi was well used and love by all of us! business center downstairs worked well most of the time. staff were usually very friendly & helpful. I absolutely loved the lobby area, which is "open" and had a pretty waterfall wall and nice seating areas. They have the most wonderful aroma as you enter the hotel area! I commented to the desk staff that I loved it!!!! I was told it is specific to this hotel chain and I could look it up because you can purchase it---which I might do! It was heavely! Location of this hotel was fine for us, but it is quite a bit down on the one end of Waikiki, which some may not realize or appreciate. Since my kids are teens and we're all in good shape, we didn't mind the walking at all when we wanted to head to other areas and liked being just a block and a half (or two?) across from the beach. Location worked very well for us. If I had as good of a deal as before, I would NOT hesitate at all to stay at this hotel again.....it was perfect and made for a very memorable trip for my kids, who had never been to Hawaii before!

I loved this place. We made a reservation at the last moment when we decided to stay in Honolulu after being in the North Shore. The moment we walked into the lobby we felt a sense of calm. The lobby is open-air but it has a pleasant scent-nothing overwhelming just one of those touches that makes this place so nice. My husband didn't mention there were 4 of us when he called in the reservation :) but they could not have been kinder or more accommodating. In fact, everyone at this hotel is lovely. The young women at the front desk, and especially the lady who checked us in (wish I could remember her name), the bar tender who checked on us as we sat at a table near the bar and ordered appetizers for dinner late that first night--everyone was great. The room was so pretty, clean, nicely designed and just perfect. The only small complaint--and it really didn't matter in the scheme of things--was that the breakfast (which, again, was really nice--fresh fruit, oatmeal, breakfast sandwiches, miso and rice) was quite crowded.

I booked this hotel just a few days before my arrival to Honolulu. It was the only option, since all the other hotels in the price range I wanted were booked. So I opted for a cheaper option and was hesitant about my choice, but I have to say that after experiencing the hotel, I can only say: FORGET ALL THE OTHER HOTELS IN HONOLULU, STAY AT HYATT PLACE. The rooms are spacious and new. Breakfast is included, which is a good start of the day, but there are not a lot of options. Also, the breakfast area tends to get quite busy. The pool is very small, but I have never seen it being busy, maybe because people prefer the beach and ocean, which is very close. My room was a mountain view room and until midday I could sit on the balcony and sunbathe. However, Waikiki beach is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, so therefore it is a must to go out. Also, the city centre is very close to the hotel and there are a number of buses that take you around the city, which stop just outside the hotel. There is also an ABC store close to the hotel and eating areas. The staff is very pleasant and helpful and they take their time to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Check in and check out went very smooth.

Pros: The recent renovation is absolutely beautiful. The whole design is modern yet casual and comfortable (perfect for a Waikiki vacation) in addition to being impeccably clean. The beds are cozy and the air conditioner unit worked great. Complimentary breakfast and in-room Wi-Fi certainly add to the value, and the buffet offers a nice variety- breakfast sandwiches, waffles or french toast, oatmeal, toast, bagels, pastries, fruit, yogurt, granola, Japanese-style breakfast, and an assortment of coffee and teas were available daily. The staff were friendly and helpful, despite the busyness at the front desk. We appreciated that the hotel provided complimentary beach towels. There is also a reasonably priced 24-hour bakery/sandwich shop in the lobby, as well as a bar and computers guests can use.Cons: My husband and I were placed on the Mezzanine level, and our room was so small that we had to step over our suitcases to get to the bathroom. This issue could have been alleviated by scaling down some of the furniture (a large chair, ottoman, and a desk with office chair, plus a sizable dresser), but from the pictures that other travelers posted, it seems that our room was particularly tiny. Just something to be aware of when you book- inquire about square footage. While the customer service wasn't bad, it was obvious the hotel needs more employees. The front desk was always very gracious, but they were swamped with customers and there wasn't a separate concierge desk. Valet was extremely slow, which was a problem during busy hours when cars were lined up on the street, blocking traffic. Breakfast hours are limited from 6:30 - 9:00 a.m. on weekdays (10 a.m. on weekends). Finally, the pool is small and tucked away in a corner of the breakfast patio.Bottom Line: I would stay here again and endure relatively minor inconveniences if the price were right, as the most important elements- comfort, cleanliness, staff friendliness, and location- earn high marks. My advice is to shop around for a hotel with better efficiency and amenities, but if you're price-conscious and Hyatt Place fits the bill, I recommend trying it.

When we first arrived in Honolulu after an ~11-hour direct flight from JFK, we hopped in a metered taxi to Waikiki Beach (about 20-30 minutes away depending on traffic). Our taxi ride ended up costing $40 in the end, but we learned upon arrival that many hotels and car rental services in Waikiki offer a fixed-rate taxi service to and from Waikiki – HNL for $25-$29.We spent our first two nights in Waikiki at the new Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach, which opened roughly 6 months ago in December of 2011. The Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach is located just two short blocks away from the beach (literally a 2 minute walk), and there is an ABC Store adjacent to the hotel, which is great for stocking up on bottled water, snacks, wine (why pay $10+ a glass when you can buy two full bottles for $10?), sunscreens, etc.The average nightly room rate is about $294 during peak summer months, but I was able to book this property at a very good rate of $119 per night back in February using Hyatt’s best rate guarantee (related post). We enjoyed everything about this hotel; our room was incredibly spacious, new, and lively, and the staff was very friendly and helpful with local food recommendations.Another great thing about the hotel was the free in-room wifi, 24-hour fitness room access, and an impressive free breakfast spread. Breakfast begins at 6:30 am and consists of a variety of hot breakfast sandwiches, fresh fruit, fresh juices, an array of cereals/oatmeals, and even some Asian miso/rice/congee options. We knew breakfast at the hotel was going to be worthwhile when we saw a swarm of guests starting to line up as early as 6:10 am, and boy it was a madhouse by opening time.Another great thing that I just learned about Hyatt Places’ in general is that there is no early departure fee. This policy especially came in handy for us because we had to drastically shorten our Hawaii trip, and we would have lost our $119 rate if we had made any changes to the reservation online or over the phone prior to check in. Luckily we were able to inform the hotel at check in that we would be staying 2 nights instead of the 3 I originally reserved, and my $119 rate was secured.If you’re heading to Waikiki anytime soon, I highly recommend you consider the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach. Sure, the Hyatt Regency Waikiki is nearby and offers ocean views, but this little gem is less expensive, newer, and totally a wonderful place to stay right in the heart of Waikiki!The exterior of the Hyatt Place Waikiki BeachVery spacious and bright roomFun corner sitting areaLarge flat screen TVModern and simple work deskBalconyThe vanity sink is separate from the bathroom and shower, making it convenient for getting ready!Portico bath productsFor the complete review, including pictures, please visit my blog at: http://boardingarea.com/blogs/justanotherpointstraveler/2012/06/14/hotel-review-hyatt-place-waikiki-beach/

From the warm greeting on arrival, the room, the breakfast and the facilities overall it was a great experience. It is always nice to enter a room that matches up to the pictures and the marketing pitch, the 42 inch tv is certainly a bonus. The breakfast also matches up to the pitch and exceeds it. The only blemish in my stay that on the one day that my jet lag did not get me up in the middle of the night there was a false alarm at 6am forcing us out of our rooms. However, on the premise that safety is an imperative I have decided not to let this incident lower my rating as I am sure it's not a common occurence.On the whole Hyatt Place Waikiki beach rocks, especially considering the pricey accomodation on offer in Honolulu.

We (family of 3) stayed 3 nights during the first week of June, 2012. Great stay. We were told they accepted the bottom of the line free night gift certificate so I ordered three. When I got them, I called to make the reservations. The guy at the 1-800 number said this hotel did not accept them. He called the in house reservationist, who confirmed I was told they would accept the certificates. And low and behold, Hyatt stuck with their word. Our room had one king bed and a sofa bed. Seventeen year old son sleep on the sofa bed just fine. Which is a big deal when you know he's 6' 3" and 180 lbs. The room was big with plenty of room. Everyone was great; Jade was a diamond!
user_name:
beckyb208
League City, Texas, United States

review_body: Very clean, friendly front staff, great breakfast buffett, good location.

We searched a lot to find a good Hotel in Waikiki Beach at a reasonable price and the Hyatt is a good option.The situation is not perfect, because is in a corner of waikiki but in a short distance to the beach and to the main Waikiki area. If you are looking hotel in front of the beach with great views this is NOT your option.Breakfast is included and has enough choices to start the day with energy. Fruits (melon and pineapple) juices, toasts, some pastries, egg sandwichs, yogurt, waffles … The breakfast area is situated next to the swimming pool.The room is OK, with a good bed, nice bathroom (with shower), free wi-fi and a small balcony.

My girlfriend and I stayed here over our summer trip in Oahu. Loved the room! Loved the people and service! If we were to come back, we'd definitely choose this hotel. For its price, this hotel performed above my expectations. Only downsides, in my opinion, are breakfast and swimming pool. The breakfast options seemed plentiful, but the food wasn't spectacular. But... I don't believe you go to Hawaii to eat complimentary hotel food, which we only did for one morning because we were in a rush for an activity and needed to grab a quick bite. The swimming pool is miniscule, but likewise, you don't go to Hawaii to swim at a hotel pool, at least that's what I believe. Overall, this is the hotel to go with!!

Newly remodeled hotel. Rooms are on the small side, but have everything you could need. Beds are very comfortable (down pillows and duvets). Pool are is a little small--more motel style than resort style. Breakfast is great. You will save a lot of money not going out in Waikiki as this breakfast is more than sufficient and high quality. Parking is a bit expensive. No self parking on site. Location--very close to the ocean on the east end of Waikiki.

Clean, large, comfortable rooms, friendly staff and a fantastic daily breakfast. You cannot beat the value! The pool is small, but the beach is only about a block away. There is an ABC store close by for water and incidentals and also a Safeway about a mile away. We will definitely stay here again.

We had a great time staying at Hyatt in waikiki. The hotel is recently renovated.The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was nice and big and the beds extremely comfortable. Different variety for breakfast served outside. There's a pool as well but we spent our time at the beach and never used the hotel pool. Nicely located close to Kuhio avenue as well if you need public transportation in order to go to Hanauma bay, Diamond head, Ala moana center etc. We returned to Waikiki after a week in Maui and chose a different hotel, but regretted our choice and wished that we had booked Hyatt for the rest of our stay as well. Grab Charlies taxi to & from the airport with $ 29 flat rate:)

Clean big rooms.Most comfortable beds and pillows - king size.Views are amazing.Air conCable tvFree InternetLovely breakfast buffet - free daily.Great room staffFree apples and coffeeHuge tv!!Great location less than a block from beach, bars, bus, zoo.24 hour food!Nice big bathroom mirror and sink.All this for $151 a night between two people??? BARGAIN!!!This is my fifth trip to Waikiki and I've stayed here every time and it just keeps getting better.

I stayed at this hotel during the renovations to the wonderful new Hyatt in August of 2011 for 9 nights. I have to hope that it has improved as there was no pool, we had cock roaches, and a TV from the 80's.Beds and Furniture in the hallways so had to make our way around to get to our room.Construction also started at 7:30 AM and being from the east coast that totally was not good for the vacation.Had I known it was going to be a Hyatt I would have asked if I could have at least gotten points for my stay as that would have been a bonus.Some positives are:Close to the beach, which is amazing.The staff was always pleasant.

We stayed here for 5 nights in May. The rooms are spacious and modern with a very comfy bed.The staff are are very friendly and happy to help with anything. The free daily breakfast is a great added bonus. The pool is a bit small but with an amazing beach 1 block away it doesn't really matter. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we ever came back to Waikiki.

We chose this hotel because of the website feature of being able to select the number of beds you need. Our teenaged daughter has great difficulty sleeping on pull-out beds. As we checked in, we learned our room had been "upgraded" from mountain to ocean view for free, but we found that the upgrade came with a cost: tiny, tiny room, and only one bed plus a "mini" pullout. We knew from our lengthy wait checking in that the hotel was heavily booked, with large groups who were taking up staff time trying to get their rooms closer together. We had heard, "the hotel is full, there is no way to move rooms" about a dozen times. So we were quite upset to learn that our reservation had been changed to a less desirable room. It took a lot of talk and some time, but the staff finally did move us to a new "upgraded" deluxe room that had two beds. The room was fabulous. I only regret that we had to fight so hard to get the two beds for which we chose this hotel. Special thanks to "Jade" at the front desk for finally resolving the problem. Overall, this is a very nice hotel and we enjoyed staying here. The breakfast was good, with a large selection and -yay - protein dishes! Not just the sugar/carb fest that most hotels seem to offer. The staff was really nice. The room was well beyond our expectations once we settled the bed issue. Very clean, pleasant stay. The only really objectionable thing I must mention is that the lobby (which houses the bar and cafe as well) is an open-air construction and we were overwhelmed by loud street noise and a sewer smell.

I grew up in the islands, and were visiting family. We stayed for one Friday night using our Hyatt points during mother's day weekend, and got there around 9pm. We love, love this hotel.Room: large, flat screen TV, everything new, one king-sized bed, great bathroom, toiletry amenities, free bottled water, coffee. Private area for computer\desk work. We were on the 16th floor facing Kuhio.Amenities: free breakfast on the third floor. I had fruit slices, cottage cheese and eggs benedict, OJ and coffee. They also had pastries, other juices, eggs, waffles, rice and other things. Not the most choices, but it's breakfast. Free. In Waikiki.Gym is nicely appointed with several elipticals, treadmills, bikes and weights. Nice sized pool that we never got to use, though. Free wifi in room, and free wifi and printer at the lobby, and starbucks coffee some parts of the day. Parking is $25 I think, and is only valet; but the front desk told us to park at Waikiki Banyan across the street for $12 for a 24 hour period. Awesome. The lobby area is good. The location is great; on Kuhio side towards the end of Waikiki. Stores, restaurants, shops galore, as is the beach; are only a block or two away. The customer service is where they got me. The staff was wonderful. The people were friendly, helpful, and chatty. My husband is a friendly guy, and he felt like home talking to the front desk people. While at another hotel down the street that we used after this one, husband asked that guy a question; and all he got was a stare down as if husband had two heads. From the night crew to the day crew, from the valet/security guy to the cafe staff; everyone says hello whenever we pass by, they are knowledgable, and are always around. Class A all around.

I was in Honolulu on business and the Hyatt Place was available at a reasonable rate. It is about 3 blocks from Waikiki beach and is a convenient walk to restaurants and shops. The room was well appointed and was quite comfortable, but there isn't a full service restaurant in the hotel. Breakfast was included in my room rate, but the selections were pretty sparse. Rather than a full breakfast buffet, the fare seemed to include some egg and meat sandwiches, cereals, and not much more.The staff were quite friendly and helpful, although they were usually pretty busy. The hotel was more than adequate for my purposes and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

I stayed here for 3 nights in a large room with mountain views. Everything about the room was of good quality. We had a small balcony and a large sofa as well as two queen beds, which were incredibly comfy.The breakfast options were varied and it was nice to be able to sit outside although it was quite windy. The hotel is very close to the beach, just one block away, so it's in a perfect spot. Although the work on Waikiki beach wasn't finished while I was there it wasn't a problem, I just walked up a little further. I understand that it is now finished however. When I returned to the hotel the night before flying home for one night we were placed in a room which wasn't as nice as the original room. It was certainly smaller (although still perfectly adequate) and it was on the second floor so it was a bit more noisy (street noise) but having said that I have a lot of trouble sleeping and didn't find it to be problem. There was also work going on at that side of the hotel and when we encountered very loud drilling we did ask to be moved and they said they would gladly move us. The only real problem I had here was when I had an early departure and was to be collected by the Speedishuttle. I called ahead to inform reception that I was expecting them and to make sure they knew my name as I wasn't down on the booking, in case they arrived early. As predicted speedishuttle came early and the hotel did not inform me so when I cam down I had missed the bus and had to wait 40 minutes for another one. This was partly because the manager was very relaxed and said they would arrive and i should just relax and wait, it was only when I spoke to another member of staff that the mistake was realised. I have to say though, once they realised the mistake he was very quick at calling the driver and they came over within 5 minutes to collect me.

Why pay $400+ for LESS options at another hotel? This hotel is totally remodeled, has an OUTSTANDING breakfast and free wifi for a fraction of the cost of "nicer" hotels closer to the beach. The extra 5 minute walk off the beach will not bother you one bit and you will save hundreds during a multiple day trip.

We've been here for almost a week, leaving tomorrow. I did a last-minute switch from the Hyatt Regency to this newly remodeled Hyatt Place because of price/Hyatt Gold Passport Points, free internet, free breakfast & cheaper parking. Glad I did! We really have enjoyed the hotel & staff. Stayed in a "City View/Deluxe" room #1739. The view isn't great (opposite side of the ocean), so all we see are other hotels & apartments & an elementary school. It's sup rising how, on the 17th floor, the noise just echoes. Not faulting the hotel at all, but boy is it noisy in the late hours (delivery trucks, people talking on the streets, sirens). I'm sure Hyatt Regency is noisier with the police station across the street, which is one reason I changed my mind. Breakfast choices here are multiple......2 kinds of hot sandwiches each day (biscuit, egg, bacon, cheese, bagels), french toast or waffles, mixed fruit, cottage cheese & berries, various cereals, granola, yogurt, breads & toasts, muffins, pastries, every juice you can imagine, coffee, tea. If you can't find something to your liking, you've got a problem! Never had a problem finding a seat, but choose close to a wall or it's windy....or use the tray provided in your room to carry breakfast back to your room to eat it at the small table or desk. Small pool and we didn't use it. Walked across to the beach instead. It's just a block. Bought meals often at the Hyatt for about $9 a meal. Very helpful & friendly staff. Always willing to take us to our room when we couldn't get the key to work (need to scan your key to move the elevator or get into guest laundry, workout room, etc). Everything is brand new in this hotel. Comfortable for the 3 of us (2 adults & a 13 year old boy). Shower (no tub) with sink outside toilet area is helpful. Large desk for schoolwork. Hide-a-bed. $12 nightly parking at the Banyan Hotel across the street from Hyatt (diagonally). Cheeseburger in Paradise a block away, Wolfgang Puck's on the corner (all about $10 a meal), ABC store right next door. We made a great hotel pick!

I stayed here over the weekend 21-23 April. Arrived on a morning flight and went to the hotel hoping to be able to drop my bags. I was pleasantly surprised when I was told that as my room was clean and I could go up (this was around 11am, maybe earlier). After an overnight flight it was great to be able to freshen up before heading out for the day. The room was lovely, on the lowest floor but I didn't really notice any noise outside. Nice comfortable king bed with gorgeous feather pillows, which are great because you can mould them to your needs. Yes there is beach construction, it apparently happens about every 5 years right along the beach. There is plenty of beach either side of it a very short walk away so I certainly did not find it to be an issue. The staff were all really nice and friendly, I asked one of the cleaning staff how to use the shower (you turn it to adjust the temperature rather than pressure, it's either on or off - something we don't have in Australia) he was more than happy to explain it to me and was really nice about it (I was half expecting a 'what are you an idiot' look after I realised how simple it was). The air conditioner was great, nice and new like everything in the room and worked really well to keep the room comfortable. There was a huge 42" flatscreen TV, which to be honest I didn't even turn on, but nice to know it was there. The breakfast was nice, good range of items to choose from, only thing I'd suggest is not getting there too late as it really does finish at 10am.I would definitely recommend this place, the staff, rooms, atmosphere are all really nice - I couldn't fault it.

Of the many hotels I have stayed in Waikiki the Hyatt Place appears to be an extremely good deal. The included breakfast is a little limited in choices but still good and enjoyable by the pool on the third floor deck. The room was clean and full of light. Nice size TV, comfortable desk and corner reading chair. Very small balcony. Nice large shower and free wifi.In the lobby there is a bar with a limited selection of beverages but perfect for a night cap, if needed. The hotel is one block from Waikiki beach, the Zoo, and endless stores and restaurants.Staff was friendly and helpful when needed

We were there for an eight night stay. Rooms are large, very clean with balconies- over city streets. We were on the Penthouse floor and traffic noise still was easily heard when the door to the balcony was open. The beds were superior in cleanliness and comfort. Lovely lobby area and very friendly staff at desk and elsewhere. Breakfast was a nice surprise, however not enough staff on some busier mornings to keep up with refreshing the food and coffees. One block easy walk to the beach and shoppes. If you are looking for a regular 'Hyatt experince' then stay there, and not at Hyatt Place. However, if you are looking for a clean, very up to date, stylish hotel with good amenities at a good price then stay here.

The last time I stayed in Hawaii was at the Fairmount on the big Island. So I was unsure of what to expect staying in the city and a 3 star hotel. I traveled with my boyfriend and we are both in out 30's. We stayed April 23-28.Before traveling I called with several questions and the front desk staff was able to provide an answer for everything.Check-in was very easy and I enjoyed the added security provided by needing your key to get up the elevator. You may think this is a bother at first because its not routine to have to do this in an elevator, but after you realize how many people could come and go especially with the open lobby its a nice feature. There are apples in the lobby when you check in which is nice if you've been traveling. We requested a room on a high floor which we got. We came to do some photography, and although the view wasn't great, we could see Diamond Head from the side balcony. The room was spacious enough for our needs, especially considering we weren't there to lounge in the room. The bathroom was small but I was glad that the sink was separated from the shower and toilet; it would have made it very difficult to get ready if everything occupied one space. There is a fridge in the room which was great, along with a safe, and iron. We were on the 19th floor and there was a lot of wind whistling through the room. This was easily solved by putting a towel on the floor next to the door to act as a damper. Beds and pillows were comfortable; we got 2 queen beds and preferred a king, but not a big deal. I can see how the room could be a little noisy if you're not used to a city, but you are in a city, so I don't think you can complain. If you are going to get a hotel on the MAIN strip be prepared for more noise, as there are people playing instruments, etc. until at least 10:30 pm. Air conditioning worked very well. The lobby has computer access which is nice. We brought a portable hard drive to dump our memory cards and it worked well but took a long time. There is a bar in the lobby and food available "24/7" which was a little misleading, since we got in at 11 pm one night expecting to get a pizza or something else from their menu and was told there was only sandwiches to have. Then the bar tender didn't have change. There is no room service here, which is a draw back in these instances. Breakfast in the morning was great and a huge money saver as far as I'm concerned. There were sandwiches which they did make custom for a us because we don’t eat ham. There were waffles and pancakes on alternating days, fruit, bagels, toast, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, and pretty good coffee. The only grip about the coffee was that they only had single serve creamers, and it would have been nice to have cream fresh. The breakfast area is VERY WINDY! Unless you are sitting in the alcove area. There are birds flying around, but if people didn't insist on feeding them, they probably wouldn’t be such a bother. There are towel available to take to the beach and you can park for $10 a day across the street at the Waikiki Banyan Hotel (going up to $12/day May 1) although still quite a bargain in Waikiki. Pool is small, but we weren't there to lounge at the pool. I found the hotel centrally located to the zoo, aquarium, and all the shopping. We walked the whole strip every night and was within 1 mile. GREAT SHOPPING!! I couldn't believe how many high end designers are in that area! Also a lot of great local stuff and ABC's on every corner. There are also places to go at the international market every night for a free Hawaiian show.The Hotel is a block from the beach, and there is construction going on but in no way does it interfere with you enjoying the water or sight seeing. There are plenty of other areas, you just need to walk 50 yards. Check-out was a breeze, and you can stay until 12pm which is a huge bonus if you have a late flight.I would definitly stay here again. If you have kids seems kid friendly as well.

We stayed only a few months after they've renovated. The rooms are spacious and the breakfast in the morning by the pool offers everything from eggs to fresh fruit/yogurt. The poolside breakfast was lovely, but be prepared to jump in if you have kids with you (it is small). The location is pretty far from the shops and is closer to the zoo, aquarium and park. The beach is close by. I would say the only draw back would be distance. If you don't mind the walk, everything is great. I gave them a 'very good,' as the reception desk and bell hop were not too responsive.
user_name:
isletripper
New York City, New York

review_body: I like everything about this place except the breakfast area... Breakfast is served on an open deck on the third floor...it would be great but for all birds constantly flying around trying to get scraps from all the diners... It seems that each day the birds get bolder landing on the tables and this morning directly on a diner. Isn't this a health hazard? At the very least it's disgusting. I am 3 days into a 6 day stay and I think i'm just gonna go out for the rest of the stay.

We stayed here as a quick, low cost room for one night and were we pleasantly suprised on April 20, 2012!!!! Our room was newly renovated and it was wonderful. We flew in on a late flight and were leaving the next morning for Kauai. The front desk staff were extremely pleasant and courteous. They assisted us with our bags and gave us a quick tour as we were escorted to the elevator. We were told our room was just renovated, so we thought this may have happened like in the last few months. However, to our suprise the room was brand new. The room was so new it smelled new. Not like paint and nauseating fumes, but clean and well, new. The bar downstairs had some quick foods to order and they were yummy. We had a mountain view, that I must say was not that mesmorizing, but it was on the 12th floor and not too much street noise penetrated the room. Our room had a sleeper sofa, sleeper chair, and two doubles. The beds were SUPER COMFORTABLE!!!The television was huge and the bathroom has a walk-in shower and no tub. The sink and vanity is separate from the toilet and shower. We had breakfast included the next morning and it was wonderful to say it was supposed to be a continental breakfast. There was fresh fruit, pancakes, buscuits with cheese and ham already made, rice with asian toppings and various juices. I would definitely stay here again as they were a much better quality than I expected reading earlier reviews.

We stayed from April 14-18th with our two children, 5 and 2 years old. The breakfast was great, especially with two growing, always hungry kids. We had a room with a Diamond Head view, and directly above the construction. My 5 year old ended up getting very sick, so we spent 90 % of our time in the room Sat-Mon, and the noise was not bad. I was able to spend time reading out on the balcony during the day. The pool/breakfast area was extremely windy, but there is not much you can do about that. The rooms were very nice and clean.The beach is a short walk, my 2 year old did it without a problem every day. Sat and Sun most the beach is open, but on Mon the beach was over crowded and small due to the construction. Also just FYI...8-10 days after a full moon box jelly fish show up in the water off Waikiki Beach (they were there 3 of the 4 days we went to the beach)

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Waikiki April 5-10, 2012. This hotel is ideal for families, with breakfast and in room wifi complimentary, large refurbished rooms with pullout couches, lanais [views of apartments and hotels; with a tiny glimpse of ocean] with table & chairs and 42 inch flat panel tvs, as well as laundry facilities on 3rd floor. However, the beach which is one block away is under construction (yes the beach is under construction - with huge equipment, barricades, etc) and the closest usable beach is a 5/10 minute walk. The hotel is also under construction. The construction is in a separate building, but the noise is constant during the day. The street is also very loud with tours bus and trolleys honking and beeping day and night. We heard Hawaiian music all night long, every night. It was softly playing so we think the hotel intentionally has it on the lanais or perhaps the pool area? The front desk didn't know.The staff is super friendly, helpful and always available. The lobby and full bar area, which has to-go style food choices, have plenty of places to relax. Waikiki is bustling and feels like NYC set along a stunning stretch of ocean. There are plenty of homeless people and religious fanatics along the main street that runs parallel to the ocean. This is not the place for peace and quiet.We are a family of four, 2 adults and 2 teens. These are the activities we did:We hiked to top of Diamond Head [entrance fee even when walking in], allow about 1-2 hours roundtrip from hotel depending on your fitness. We took a cab back; $15 to hotel from Diamond Head one way.Toured Pearl Harbor [audio was worth the extra fee and we booked our time online in advance]. Tickets must be picked up one hour before your boat ride to the Arizona. There is alot to see and hear and the one hour was perfect amount of time to explore all the exhibits before the boat ride - you won't be standing around waiting for an hour, you will be exploring the excellent exhibits.Rented car and snorkeled Hanauma Bay; $7.50 per person, plus parking. You can rent snorkel equipment there or bring your own. There is a snack bar, but it is very slow. Plenty of facilities.Surfed at the beach in front of the Hyatt Regency. Surfboard rental $10/hour, umbrella and chairs, $50 all day or by the hour. Public restrooms are not pleasant.Aquarium is about 5-10 minute walk from hotel with wonderful exhibits. Two monk seals; tide pool area to hold sea urchins, hermet crabs; lots of different jelly fish exhibits; clam growing exhibit. We spent about an hour.Scuba Diving. Acquazone is one block away in the Marriott hotel. They have at least two dives per day. 8 people in our group with two guides and two tank dive: one deep and one sunken ship. Saw lots of turtles, octopus and tons of fish.Dining out can be expensive. Within one block is casual Wolfgang Puck Pizza and Starbucks. We had expensive meals at Hua Tree Restaurant (huge portions, outside tables on beach under banyan trees), Taormina Restaurant, Italian/Japanese fusion, and Orchid's in the Halekalani Hotel. Tons of chains: Roy's, Duke's (reservations needed at least few weeks in advance), Subways, California Pizza Kitchen are nearby. We didn't catch the name, but walking along the beach toward the aquarium -- make sure you are along the beach, not the street -- there was an outdoor grill/restaurant/snack bar that looked like it had good food. Amazing location right at the beach, plenty of tables and umbrellas. Wished we had stopped there.

I stayed here as part of a group (i.e. I did not select the hotel). The hotel seemed to be newly refurbished. The rooms were very clean and well designed. The room I had (8th floor) had a small lanai with two chairs. The bathroom was a bit small but sufficient. The beds were very comfortable with large pillows. Amenities included in-room coffee, extra towels and free wireless internet. The included breakfast was great with plenty of fresh fruit and a wide variety of breakfast entree options (western and eastern types). The open-air breakfast area was nice, but sometimes a bit too windy in the morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent. Although not on the ocean, it is a block from Waikiki Beach. You could use a hotel pool towels to take to the beach. There are many nearby restaurants, bars, and of course, ABC Stores. I would stay here again. I recommend the Hyatt Place without reservation.
resllyhotel really enjoyed our stay hereLoveley roomvery spacious and great breakfasts

only stayed one night but the staff was super friendly at check in and the room was spacious enough for our family of four. Our corner room had great ocean views and it was a quick walk to the beach. Would stay there again. Got a great rate on bookit.com.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March. The hotel was very clean, had up-to-date decor, and a good, comfortable bed. Looking out our balcony view we could see Diamond Head. The one down side to the room (#1840) is it is in a corner and sounded like a loud wind tunnel. So, the first night it was hard to sleep as the wind was so loud (also heard 4 ambulances but it was St. Patty's night so that is probably why). The wind tunnel noise was not quite as loud the 2nd night or maybe we were just more tired. The first day my husband spent a long time on the phone as our free room internet service was not working (he was transferred 3 times and they explained that they only had so many numbers available and they had to create a new one for him--we went downstairs to the lobby to use their computers as they couldn't get us set up for at least an hour.) There is a free continental breakfast which is about average for offerings and taste. There is a small pool but no hot tub. There is also an exercise room. The only parking available is valet at $25.00/day. Hotel checkout is at noon and they do not have a separate room you can shower and change in if you have a late flight. We had a 9 p.m. flight so they held our luggage from noon until 5 p.m.; however, we couldn't change or shower there after spending the day at the beach. This aspect was a little unsettling since we are Hyatt Gold Passport members.

This newly renovated room was specious and well appointed. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Great location, walking distance to beaches, shopping, restaurants, night life. Would definitely stay there again.

Room 1731 March 21-25, 2012 AND ENJOYED IT VERY MUCH! Spacious, clean and very comfortable at a fair price, what more can one ask for? Especially enjoyed the good breakfast each morning; that even on very busy days was replenished often so food always fresh and hot.Starbuck's coffee and nice selection of Tazo tea available in the lobby from very early AM and also avail in the breakfast area during service hours. As stated elsewhere Aloha's and greetings were in abundance. Mahalo, Hyatt Place for a wonderful stay and 30TH wedding anniversary celebration. LO Sherwood,Oregon

Stayed here March 17 – 22. I have two kids ages 5 and 8. Nice location: 5 minute walk to the beach, Zoo and Aquarium. Rooms are spacious for the kids to move around in and there is a mini fridge in the room. We had two queen beds and the sofa is a pull out. First day we had a room on the 7th floor next to the elevators. Very noisy due to construction next door so we asked for a room change. Front end staff moved us right away. The front end staff is great; Thomas and Kim are very helpful. Let them know where you’re going and they will give you some great pointers and good local places to eat that where inexpensive and good eats. The complimentary breakfast was really good, breakfast sandwiches where tasty, juices and milk are on a cold plate to keep them nice and cool. Food staff are always replenishing the food and keeping the place clean. This hotel also has no resort fee and gives you at no charge beach towels to use everyday.I’m a electronics junky and this hotel has lots of plugs in the room. I have the kids ds games, camcorder, camera, tablets and phones to plug in and there was no problem finding a plugin. The free WiFi was the best I have seen in a hotel. Very fast. They also have computers for you to use in the lounge and printers so you can print out your boarding pass. I had problems printing my boarding passes and Thomas was nice enough to let me use his computer at the front desk. I rented the car for the week and was lucky enough to find free parking around the hotel. Best time to find parking is around 4:30 – 5:30pm. Staff are finishing work and you might be lucky to find a spot. Only negative things I can say is the cleaning staff could be better, elevators are slow and very windy at the pool and breakfast eating area. Our room that we changed into had hair in the bathtub strainer and you could feel sand on the floor. I understand that everyone must bring a ton of sand back from the beach so it didn’t bother me that much. The pool and breakfast area are together outside on the 3rd Floor. Very windy when eating breakfast. Try to get the seats closest to the breakfast food area. It’s a shame that they have a pool and its so windy and cold that hardly anyone uses this area. It looks nice and relaxing for the have a fireplace set up and lounge chairs to relax in. Maybe it’s the time of year we went that it’s not used.Overall it a nice hotel close enough to the shops and beaches but far enough that it’s not so noisy from the crowds. I would definitely stay here again. In two weeks I’m staying at the Hyatt Place in Bellvue Washington because I enjoyed the Hyatt in Waikiki so much. Thanks to all the staff that made our holiday fun!

I booked here on a hotwire deal for $100/night total during Pro Bowl weekend. The hotel is spacious and the staff is amazingly friendly. When I first checked in, I had a room facing Kuhio that was wheelchair accessible. Even though I didn't require it, It gave me more space so I figured it would be great! I showered quickly before heading out for the day and was horrified to see water EVERYWHERE! All the way into the carpet by the wardrobe outside the bathroom. I felt so bad and called the front desk to let them know what happened. I'm not a crazy extreme shower-taker, I didn't spray water everywhere, I swear! lol. Apparently they had had another issue similar to this and did not place any blame on myself, which I was very thankful for. The wheelchair accessible rooms have very different bathrooms with an open concept, and the water wasn't going into the drain in the center of the bathroom and instead had gone around and out the door. If you don't need it, make sure you don't get it! They moved me up to another room a few floors up facing the ocean. My room looked over the outdoor seating area and I had a nice view of the beach. There were no more shower mishaps from then on:). I was nicely surprised by how spacious my room was. The couch/seating area is very nice, but then again the whole room was. The rooms somehow remind me of the Mirage in Las Vegas. Same decor I guess? The bed was soft and comfy, and I enjoyed how the wifi was fast and easy to get onto. Other guests were a little loud at night, it was like everyone on my floor had to slam their doors at least twice before settling in. Outside noise wasn't much of an issue other than that one typical drunk guy yelling into the night out on the street. At least he sounded happy.The breakfast was another welcome surprise. I loved the hot breakfast sandwiches, and there was so much to choose from. Fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, cottage cheese, muffins, danishes. bagels, oatmeal.... and Starbucks coffee and I think it was Tazo tea. There was also a little area with rice and toppings for those guests visiting from Japan. Considering this is included in the price, this was wayyy better than what I've had in other hotels. The whole breakfast spot is very well kept... actually the whole hotel is. The pool is in the same area. I only went in it once, and I had it all to myself for an hour!The whole staff make this hotel even better. I never once walked through the lobby without one of them saying "hi" or "aloha" with a big smile on their face. Oh, I also left an article of clothing in my old room and only discovered this late at night. Went down to the front desk, and they helped me go back up to get it, no hassle whatsoever. Location is also great, I prefer staying on this side of Waikiki as I spend lots of time in the Diamond Head/Kaimana beach area. Parking on the other side of Kuhio in the Waikiki Banyan lot was $10/day with in and out, half the price of everywhere else I've stayed at. 5 mins to the beach and 10 to get to my other fave beach spot infront of the pink palace. I don't know if I could afford the normal "rack rate" for this hotel if staying by myself again, but I've already told tons of friends and family that they need to stay here if they find a good rate.

great location for walking to attractions, rooms were clean but the housekeeping staff tended to start extremely early and were unconcerned about the noise level. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only other negative would be the internet service we paid for was terrible in the room. Would would definitely recommend a stay.

Minuses: Don't think any rooms have a view of the beach. Far end (Zoo end) of Waikiki beach.Breakfast was hardly worth having and finished early at 10AM'Fitness Centre (not a 'Gym') had no cables, and only 1 bench with weights, plus some cardio equipmentPluses:Spacious and clean roomMuch lower in price as compared with hotels at the other end of Waikiki beachBreakfast and gym included in rateWifi included in the rate. Wifi was fast, trouble free and allowed for handheld and mobile devices to be connectedOne of the more helpful concierge/reception members of staff assisted in finding a good restaurantMost front desk members of staff were helpful, only one lady was rude and unhelpful

Stayed here in Feb. 12, 2012 for 7 nights, really great location: near trolly stop and a short walk to beach. Got a great deal on their site and gave us upgraded room at check-in, paid $150/night. Family of 4 enjoyed breakfast every morning, housekeeping was good and room size was HUGE. Staff was very friendly. The only thing I find lacking was the water pressure, it took forever to fill a small bath tub to bath my two small children. Overall it was a great value for the price and location, I would stay here again!

Check out www.allabouthawaii.com or google Waikiki Beach Maintenance Project Update to get the latest on the status of the beach that is 1 and 1/2 blocks from this hotel. The beach is closed and will be at least through April 2012. The Average rating for now is due to that fact. The pluses of this hotel are the good sized rooms. Perfect for families of any type. The beds in the two bed rooms are queen size, not double size. The free breakfast can be a time and expense saver. The 2 elevators are very busy during breakfast hours. Of course, many come to Hawaii for the beautiful warm weather, but there are downsides to having the breakfast area outside. When it rained, there was not enough covered space for all and getting breakfast was a chore. Other mornings, the wind could be unpleasant. Still other mornings it was lovely to be outside in the morning. The very spacious lobby was usually empty and I think it would make a perfect breakfast area. I wonder what it will be like when the 2nd tower opens. Will the current breakfast area be big enough to accommodate all? Views are best on higher floors but it is a gamble as to whether a room on a high floor will be available when you check in. We did request one when we booked the room pretty far ahead of time, but they could only give us what was available of course. We were on the 11th floor mountain side and our view was similar to other posted pictures. Views are partial due to the obvious fact that this hotel is 1 and 1/2 blocks from the beach and surrounded by other buildings. Lots of dining options are within walking distance. Parking garage on northwest corner of Kuhio and PaoaKalani is $10 a day with in and out privileges - quite a bargain in Waikiki. This hotel is on the southeast corner of that intersection, so it was very convenient.
Beautiful hotel on Waikiki Beach. Shops, restaurants, everything you want just steps away. Full breakfast included, beautiful rooms w/great views.

We only stayed at this fantastic hotel for 3 nights, but would stay here again and again. All the staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful.The room was new, modern, large and super clean. The full breakfast (included in price of the room) was hot and very good. I would recommend this hotel and will be sure to stay here again should we return to Oahu!!

we spent 5nights in Hyatt place, we had allround good experience. We were happy with the service and amenitites. its in waikiki beach area and it is 2min walk from Waikiki beach and walkable distance to all the waikiki beach stuff. Their breakfast is delicious. The only reason i gave 4 rating is they charged for water bottles that they provided in the room and not been intimated in advance, i only came to know on the final bill. Apart from that i was happy with the stay.

This Hyatt Place is the old Ocean Resorts completely remodeled. Located about three short blocks from Waikiki on Kuhio, it is a good option for family travel with its large rooms and sofabeds so that 3 or 4 adults could sleep comfortably (smaller kids provide even more flexibility). Views are obstructed, with rooms facing Waikiki just getting small parts of the ocean view, while the Diamondhead view was not quite as obstructed but still not a clear view. Self-parking available across the street for $10 in-and-out for 24 hours at Waikiki Banyon hotel. Valet parking also available,which i did not use. There is also a food gallery open 24 hours. Pros: Free Wi-Fi, real tub and not just a shower, heated toilet with cleaning mechanism, two queen beds (upon request/reservation) with space to spare, 42" TV, complimentary breakfast that included warm prepared foods such as french toast and an egg muffin combination in addition to fresh fruits, oatmeal, and pastries, six computer terminals for internet access including printing of boarding passes, fitness center about twice the size of the usual hyatt place fitness centers, refrigerator, small balcony with two chairs tho there is nothing to look at except the balconies of the buildings across the way, and very nice staff (Terrance and Lyn). Cons: SIngle sink cramped in small space; just two elevators for the current facility of about 20(?) floors could make for slow service. small pool, Good value for money, around $200 for two and $280 for 4, At 2/3's or less than the price for a room at the Hyatt Regency Waikiiki, it is not as luxurious or convenient; nor does it offer the same quality of amenities and entertainment and food options at HRW, However, it is highly recommended as a cheaper option for family travel where the hotel is as a jumping off point for activities on the island.

My wife and I spent three nights in the Hyatt Place and would definitely consider staying there again. It is very conveniently located for the beach, the zoo, and running/walking/etc. in the great Kapiolani Park. It is also at the right end of Waikiki Beach for your hike up Diamond Head.Free wi-fi, and the included breakfast is one of the best free breakfast deals we have experienced in our travels. The views of the sun coming up over the mountains as we sat at our breakfast table were fabulous, and the food was excellent.

We stayed four nights at the end of February. We had asked for a room with ocean views and that is what we were given. Big, beautiful room with balcony. This is not a hotel right on the beach but set back but we still had views of the ocean. All new and refurbished. Breakfast was included and was served outside on the third floor. Very good hot and cold choices. Coffee was superior!! Only problem is that breakfast is served from 6:30 am until 9:am. We were on holiday and barley made it down on time although there was always plenty of food - they closed the doors promptly at 9 am. We loved the hotel but found that construction work nearby was quite loud...they need better windows.

Stayed here for 1 week at this newly renovated Hyatt Place. Spacious rooms and modern decore. Free WiFi in rooms, Large Plasma TV. Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly, Maid service avg. Breakfast incl. A/C is a little noisy but blows nice cold air. Ocean view is limited due to this hotel being 1 block in from the main strip - blocked by another bldg. ABC store just outside this hotel. Self park $10 just across the strt. Valet Park is $25. Small pool and fitness centre. Hyatt Place doesn't have the fancy restaurants and shops like the other high-end hotels so if you are looking at being pampered then go stay at the Regency or Westin. Convenient location and great value. This hotel is definitely worthy of 3.5star rating and I highly recommend this.

Great Hotel! Very spacious and newly redone. Beds were comfy!! The pool was a little dissapointing, I fell at the pool, the painted spots are very slippery when they are wet!! A little dissapointed in parking, the hotel lot was full and had to self park, at least it was just across the street.

This Hyatt is surrounded by high rises so it doesn't have the greatest of views--but you can see the ocean on both sides of the building my room on the 9th floor faces. The staff here is mostly young, all ages very energetic. The room rates are great for the area. My AAA rate included a hot breakfast that included the normal American staples plus miso soup, rice, and the normal vinegared veggies you'd find in a Japanese restaurant (including kaiso salad--one of my favorites). The bartender at the small bar in the lobby is friendly and helpful. The rooms are so comfortable--pillow top mattresses, four pillows, white duvets; sofa; work area with desk and chair behind a half screen; in-room coffeemakers; showers with the typical hyatt Portico bath amenities. The hotel is not the best insulated as you hear lots of city noise. But I would stay here again.

I normally don't stay at Hyatts since I have no status with them, but based on the excellent reviews here and that it was a brand-new renovated property, I decided to check it out. Stayed 3 nights and was quite impressed and would absolutely stay here again if the price is competitive with the Doubletree, my usual choice in Waikiki.PROS:-room: probably the most spacious hotel room in Waikiki I've ever stayed in. The room had a king-size bed and a sitting area with a full sectional sofa + ottoman.-TV: 50 inch flat-screen with HD programming! Good # of channels-bathroom: large shower (no tub) and toilet in one room; large sink outside-room amenities: cordless phone, small fridge, large safe in closet, nice spacious shelf. free wireless HSIA, free local calls (charged but removed at checkout)-free extended continental breakfast: choice of 2 hot sandwiches, slow-cooked oatmeal, triple-berry bowl (defrosted). fresh-cut fruits, cereal, steamed rice, miso soup--with attentive service, in an open-air terrace next to the small pool.-fitness center: one of the largest, best-equipped one I've seen. The latest LifeFitness treadmills, ellipticals, and bikes. Good temp control. Rarely crowded.-free computers with printer in lobby areaCONS:-A/C: very loud air-conditioner; I finally got used to it but can be extremely irritating initially-loud doors: there is no way to gently closed the room door without waking the dead or your neighbor. Luckily, our neighbor did not come and go often.-no wired HSIA: wireless was out of order on the last night. I thought it was quite funny that when you signed on initially, the home page T&C warned you that wireless HSIA is not secured and you could have sensitive info intercepted--so why don't you offer wired (safer) HSIA in the first place?-fan in bathroom: there is a switch which turns on the "fan" but you can't turn it off--I think it's preset for a fixed time and then automatically turns off

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Place from Feb 10th to the 15th 2012. After a flight cancellation and lots of mess getting there, we were happy to find that our hotel was very nice, despite the star rating. I guess we expected it to be a little old or find bed bugs or something- we were pleasantly surprised! Our check in was a little difficult because we had booked ahead and as I said our flight was cancelled so we extended our stay but the hotel was full and unable to accomodate our extra three nights. After hearing our about our rough start, the check in staff gave us a very nice upgrade. We ended up in a King Suite on the 18th floor with a very nice mix of views. We could see Diamond Head, the city lights and the ocean from our balcony.(I am told that every room has its own balcony) The room was clean and spacious and updated nicely. The bathroom had a glass doored walk in shower. The sink and mirror are separated from the shower and toilet by a locking door. The mirror was large and awesomely lighted. As I said this was a king suite so it had a sectional sleeper sofa that was separated by a partial wall from the king bed. The bed was comfortable and had very cozy bedding (I truely appreciated this as I was layed up in it for the two days following our arrival due to a fire alarm.) I can't blame the hotel staff or owners for the misfortune we had on our 1st night. We were very excited to have the 18th floor upgrade until......At 4am we were sent running down 18 flights of stairs due to an alarm sounding telling us to there was an emergency and we must evacuate! My daughter had forgotten that we were in a different time zone and had already woke us up (thankfully) so it was easy for us to head to the stairs in a hurry. After running all the way to the lobby, we were informed that the alarm had been triggered by someone breaking into the other tower on the propery that was being renovated. This caused my legs to ache for two or three days, as I am not in very good condition, physically. My husband thought the hotel should have offered some kind of compensation for our trouble, but I reminded him that we had already been upgraded to a very great room, so he let it go. Another high point to the property was their all you can eat breakfast. The sandwiches were good, as was the fruit and rice, but my favorite things were the danish that they made fresh every morning. The main downfalls were the pool -small with no hot tub, but hey, there is an ocean close. The other thing was the walk to the beach, not too bad but it is a good two blocks and the closest beach area was being renovated so we had to walk even farther, so we spent alot of time walking. Overall, I give this place a good review because it was new and clean and the staff was friendly.
user_name:
MommaT5676
Fair Play, Missouri, United States

review_body: Since the night I checked in I have been itching all over, not a good sign. But since I was the only one complaining I thought maybe my skin was just dry. On my last night here I found a bed bug in my room. I called the front desk and was laughed at and told that Hyatt is a clean hotel and they don't have any bed bugs. If there was a bed bug, it must have been carried in by me. Wow, are you kidding me right now?!? Then I'm told the manager will come look at my room. The manager tells me that it's not a bed bug, he has had bed bugs in his house before so he knows what they look like. I tell him that's funny cause I just googled images of bed bugs and the bug looks dead on. Then he says it looks more like a flea and he's had fleas at his house too. Beyond disgusted! So we are moved to another room and it's past 3 am and I can't sleep because I'm creeped out that I've been sleeping 5 nights in a room with bed bugs. After inspecting my body I found several bumps. I'm very disappointed in the way this was handled. I've stayed at plenty of nice hotels and this has been the worst experience I've ever had. Not to mention the lack of customer service by the front desk.
The room I stayed in was a very large with 2 nicely appointed queen beds. The room was very clean and nice. The elevator was super slow and there is no room service, but other than that it was good.

I stayed at this property many times when it was known as the Ocean Resort Hotel. My first time here under the remodeled Hyatt Place brand was in mid-February. WOW, what a difference!! Everything is new, everything is nice! Free in-room Internet was much appreciated, and it worked well. Clean, large rooms with nice decor. Trendy, nice. Super staff; friendly, attentive and professional, particularly Lynn. Actually, there were others at the front-desk who were nice & helpful, but I don't remember their names. Breakfast was exceptional, much better than I was expecting! Two negatives from my stay: I had to call 3 times over 2 days to have the air conditioning checked; it was repaired such that it was not rattling or making a loud noise, but it truly never cooled the room. Also, with only 2 elevators, they can be slow. Will return!

I just returned from a stay at Hyatt place.My room was clean and the beds were comfy. Shower was great and I really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and beach towels. My only complaint is the unexpected extra fees. You r required to valet park for an additional $25 per day plus tip. My 3 day stay somehow came to over $800. I was quoted $210 a night.

First of all, I'd like give a big Mahalo to Lynn who checked us in at the front desk. She was very friendly, helpful, and welcomed us like professionals. Check in supposed to be at 3pm but our room was not ready until 430pm because of the hotels first day opening and the hotels WiFi service was down making check-in difficult. So the lobby entertained us which included a bar, 3 hdtv's, and an internet cafe. The room was awesome. Comfortable from top to bottom that included a balcony with a beautiful view of Waikiki Beach. Definitely well worth the extra wait and I recommend everyone to stay here. 5 STARS!!!

Got a good deal for our seven rooms from joining a preferred member club. The rooms were brand new and most rooms got bumped up to ocean or mountain view. Wasn't expecting much from the free breakfast, but loved the made to order breakfast sandwiches, fruits and other breakfast items. We appreciated the free internet cafe with free printing. Somehow parking fees got added to our bill, but a desk clerk took the time to pull up the actual parking records, noticed the names didn't match, and took the fees off. A final wow was the lobby staff greeting us by name on only the second day. We're coming back!

Really nice remodel job is now complete in the first tower. Second is to be finished soon, we were told. Our room had a shower with 8-foot sliding glass doors. Furnishings were very nice; Internet access was free. Got a great price through Hotwire and will recommend this to everyone. Location is excellent, just a block from the beach and towards our favorite end of Waikiki (towards Kapiolani Park). The free breakfast buffet offered many tasty options including excellent muffin/egg/sausage sandwiches that were prepared fresh throughout the morning. Nice small lanais.

Just came back from Waikiki,stayed at Hyatt Place and have nothing but great things to say about it. Great location 2 blocks to the Honolulu Zoo and 1.5 block from Waikiki Beach. Clean,safe,newly remodeled. The complimentary breakfast is fabulous! Staff super friendly :) Accomadated 3 adults & 3 kids with no problem 2 queen beds and a pullout couch we all slept very comfortable. Aloha & Mahalo to the staff @ Hyatt Place.

Stayed there for three nights. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite fornour honeymoon. All the hotel employees were so friendly and helpful. The restaurants in the hotel were just okay, but since there were so many options right in Honolulu, it wasn't a big deal. The hotel is right on the beach in the center of it, tons of shopping, etc. It's in a pretty busy part of the city so if you don't mind that then you should be happy at this hotel.

We stayed here at the end of our honeymoon for 2 nights and were blown away by the customer service. Complimentary champagne, upgrade to FULL ocean view room and extremely helpful when it came to booking a hospitality suite the day we left. The hotel is in a great location, had a convenient shuttle that took us to airport and Pearl Harbor for much cheaper than a cab. Would definitely recommend!

Got a room at this hotel from an on-line "you won't know what you're getting 'til you pay up front" site. The price was more than reasonable so I didn't expect much. But I'd have been happy even if I'd paid quite a bit more. It's not beachfront. A couple of blocks off the main drag in Waikiki. The benefit is peace and economy with proximity to the action. Lobby inviting, designed with a Zen-ish feel. There's an appealing "galley" with snacks and drinks, open 24 hours. Business center equipped with good computers and offers free printing. Staff attentive, genial, professional. Room big, clean and stylishly furnished and decorated. Exceptionally nice bathroom. Seemed newly renovated. Street view from second floor window, but who cares with such a lovely room in which to luxuriate. And the best part: the full-length mirror was elongating! It's hard not to fall in love with a room that makes you taller and thinner. Beware $25 valet parking. I was lucky. Valet area was full and the very nice attendant directed me across the street to a $10/day garage. Would recommend this option to all guests with rental cars. Had to leave early and missed the COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST. Would book here again in a heartbeat.

I captured a great deal via Hotwire and had received Hyatt Place. I was very pleased as the hotel is newly renovated and has that new fresh smell. The rooms are huge, love the complimentary breakfast, the 24 hour fitness center and everything in walking distance. The staff are also wonderful.

As much as I'd like to keep the Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach a secrect, it's too good not to write about. From the minute I arrived, I was greeted with the Aloha Spirit. The Bell person took my luggage, the valet took my car and when I got the front desk the Bell person had already told the Front Desk person who I was. Needless to say, the treatment was First Class. The hotel is renovated from a long standing hotel I'd even stayed at many years ago, however, you'd never know it after the full renovation Hyatt Place did. The facilities are airy, well done and modern. Unlike Hyatt Place properties on the mainland USA, this one is much bigger and much nicer. The rooms are spacious, the gym very goof for a Waikiki Beach hotel and the location (on the east side of Waikiki near the Honolulu Zoo) is convenient if you drive. It is not right on the beach, but only one block away. It is not a full-service hotel (meaning multiple restaurants, bars, etc), but it does serve breakfast, has a bar and lighter fare selections. The pool is small, but who goes to Hawaii to swim in a pool when the beach is a 3 minute walk away?Best of all, the service is very Hawaiian! I'd recommend this hotel to all.

We are loyal Hyatt guests and had a last minute opportunity to spend the week after Christmas in Hawaii. All the Hyatt properties were booked so we were happy to find the newly opened Hyatt Place. We knew it would not have the amenities of a resort and are familiar with the Hyatt Place format. The service was the same Hyatt standard we know and love, however, this Hyatt place is in an urban location with construction, cars and trucks beginning in the early morning hours.
